review: Went here with a group of friends and had a delicious meal.  Everyone had a steak and some also had lobster. Atmosphere was nice and we could hear pianos from the other end. Waitress very attentive and the wine list was very good. Would happily come back again. Only downside was we didn't have room for dessert ;-)

This was my first time to Harris Steakhouse and was recommended by friends.  All entrees were perfectly cooked.  All meat was tender and flavorful.  The salmon was 'melt in your mouth' good.

I was disappointed in the service.  I made reservations 2 months ahead of time for 5 pm for a party of 6.  They sent us to the 'back room' which consisted of 8 large round tables and the room lacked the ambiance that I wanted when I originally chose this restaurant.  I felt I was being seated at the children's table. I could have selected any restaurant to have eaten in a large back room but the reason I selected this one was for the experience in the main dining room.

Then upon entering the back room, the hostess and waitress debated which table we were to be seated at while we stood there for 5 minutes.  It was very unprofessional and embarrassing, especially since all of the tables were empty.
review_title: Harris Steakhouse. Good food, bad service.

review: I have been doing at Harris only couple of times with my wife As we are from outboard. The place is the same which we liked however the attitude was different and in somehow we felt that the steaks even the meat was exellent was over seasoned. The texture of the meant was exellent.
We had a very nice dinner, the service was professional and friendly. We really enjoyed ourselves, thank you

The service was not up to the standards of the restaurant. Service should be impeccable when you're ordering a 50-75 dollar steak per person. We were a group of 6 people, and they added a two-top table to the end of a banquet which was uncomfortable for the two people that had to sit on the chairs in the aisle..

If you like a real good Steak then you are wright here. Service is excellent, a lil bit dark inside, but every Penny is worth there.
Chocolade Cake is great for the finish. We will come back for sure.

We just love dinner at Harris'.  It's old world elegance with great food and great service.  There's a little feeling of Mad Men about it.

It's everything a steak house should be.

I highly recommend this place for the amazing taste of their steaks. I liked their service, these guys are pros when it comes to service. The ambience is nice and quite the interior decorations are classic type where the richness of the place.

After waiting for 20 years, finally had dinner with wife on a Thursday night, heard so much about Harris. We shared one bone in ribeye steak, and very pricey at $56, ordered medium rare minus (between rare and med. rare), and steak came out perfect. Very nice steak but as many reviewers stated, not outstanding, just very good. However the scalloped potatoes were outstanding. Ceasar salad and baked Alaska were just average, nothing special. But the sweetbreads appetier was terrific. Overall a nice experience for a special occasion. Service was excellent. Harris was packed on a weekday. and many parties very noisy.
The Service was outstanding. Great warm crusty bread, and the filet was exactly what I wanted. It is a bit like a scene out of Mad Men. Nice for a booths for a group of four.

My husband and I have been going to this restaurant for over a decade. It is our favorite for a romantic dinner, special occasion, a drink at the bar while listening to the jazz trio, and Christmas Parties. Over the past 10+ years, the food, ambiance, and service has been consistently wonderful.
review_title: Best Steak Anywhere In Bay Area

review: Steaks were wonderful and service outstanding. Dined with my two grandkids and the presentation of the split entree was impressive.

This was our first visit to San Francisco. As avid meat eaters the chance to eat some 45 day old dry cured prime rib was a mouth watering thought. We arrived on time for our reservation and was offered the chance to dine in either the dining room or the bar dining area. We chose the dining room. The lighting was very atmospheric, the noise level was perfect busy with hubbub rather than disturbing noise.

The very next evening we returned and this time opted for the bar dining area with live music (easy piano jazz this evening) again service was superb and wait staff attentive. The same staff were on duty but different staff in each dining area. The meat was again absolutely incredible cooked exactly as ordered and oh so tender.
review_title: We went back the very next evening

review:
GREAT STEAKS AND PRIME RIB .VERY GOOD SALADS TOO,

EVERYTHING WAS VERY GOOD,WE CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK AGAIN...........
The steak was juicy and met my expectations but the sides, appetizers, and crackers/cheese didn't wow me. There wasn't a great selection to choose from.
review_title: The steak was juicy and met

review: First time at a nice steak house & I must say we are very pleased. For the price, it should come with a side salad at least. The waiter was very friendly and came to check on us often. The steak was divine and has raised the bar for what steak should taste like. The potato of the night, potato au gratin was delicious! Better than my baked potato! We had the baked Alaska which was decent, nothing special. Overall, I'd come back but prime rib a few blocks away does give it a run for it's money with the portions and alcohol portions of sweet drinks like the lemon drop.
review_title: First time at a nice steak

review: Chef Michael is tremendous. Best beef, great seafood, awesome service! Whisper dry martini is a must try.
I have love Harris's for years, but recently service has become much worse.
review_title: I have love Harris's for years,

review: This is the fifth time I have had dinner there, not my favorite spot but my grandfather enjoys this place so I humor him. We had dinner there past Friday and my cousins steak was not cooked properly. The steak was sent back, a medium rare steak should take roughly 10 minutes-25 minutes later his steak finally arrived-we were all finished with our dinner. I jsut feel this lace does not hold a candle to Ruth's ChrisI have had one good meal there-the other times everything from the food, to the service was less then mediocre.
review_title: This is the fifth time I have

review:
They cwetainly serve special aged beef which tastes rather heavenly.
General attitude of the service crew was a turn off.
They act like they are superior beings and would not come and even greet you when you go inside. At one point,after having waited around 15 minutes since nobody said hello to us, we asked the location of the bar. One man showed us the direction to the bar with his chin. Yes it was that bad. The food was surprisingly good but we just wanted to try it once. So we have no plan to go back and re-experience unnecessary arrogance.
Our waiter was a decently friendly guy which helped us enjoy the evening.
Just a simple hello or acknowlegement of our arrival would have been appreciated. Do we have to bring a celebrity with us

We have been wanting to try Harris' for a while and finally went on our recent trip to San Francisco. Overall, we were a bit disappointed. The two salads we ordered were extremely bland and we did not finish them. You wouldn't expect a spinach and bacon salad to be bland but the dressing was not even noticeable. The steaks were cooked to perfection however they were not seasoned properly and needed extra salt. Service was very good but given the high prices of the food we would not return.
review_title: We have been wanting to try

review: We went to Harris' after our City Hall wedding. We reserved the Library and were able to have an enjoyable dinner. The cocktails were creative and yummy, the food was absolutely delicious, and the service was excellent! I highly recommend this restaurant!
review_title: We went to Harris' after our

review: This place is just perfect. The perfect martini. The perfect steak. Fabulous accompaniments--potatoes, fresh vegetables, salad, bread. And the service was outstanding. Just try it some time when you want to spend a little extra for a really terrific meal in a beautiful restaurant and to get pampered by the staff. I can't say enough nice things about Harris'. It is well worth a visit.

My Fiance and I have been to Harris for the first time about 1-1/2 years ago and were so delighted with the food that we couldn't wait to go back. I fell in love with the Bar, very comfortable. The bartenders are the best in the whole area, enjoyed talking to Robert. I loved the way they serve martinis, very posh. Anyway, we were slightly disapointed with our steak's this time, too much fat on them and what's up with the pad of butter on top of the steak? The scalloped potatoes have always knocked my socks off however, the steak and potatoes were way too salty for both of us. I think we will try someplace else the next time we are in S.F.

Everything was good except I ordered my $54 steak med rare minus and it arrived med rare plus. Thought about sending it back but it wasn't bad enough to warrant inturpting the flo of the evening. That said a steak house in this price category should be able to get this right the first time. should
Their steaks are always amazing (and huge). The porterhouse and Harris' new york are both dry-aged in-house, but all the cuts are amazing.
The food was great, the server was very knowledgeable about table fare, wine, etc.
review_title: The food was great, the server

review: This is a typical high-end steak house; no more, no less. Great ambiance, but the food was slightly disappointing. The Pepper Steak was "over-peppered" and a little north of the requested medium rare, making for a difficult piece of meat to get excited about. My wife's medium rare veal chop was excellent. The service was nice. I am glad we went but would not go back.

A great steak dinner!

Old School Steak House that never disappoints.
review_title: A Great Old School Steak House.

review: The best steak I ever had. I got to come back and try the prime rob next.

We had a really pleasant Xmas eve at Harris, the resptaurant was very comfortable, very good ambiance, food was excelent, all special requests were fulfilled, the service was amazing, always smiling, patience, kind personnel.
Thanks for a great dinner.
review_title: We had a really pleasant Xmas

review: Outstanding! Great music, food and service. Beautiful bar area.

Harris' delivers the goods. Top notch food, wine and service. Comfortable, relaxing
ambiance and well-trained staff anticipate diner's needs and make for an enjoyable
experience second to none in San Francisco. We've been there many times and have
never been disappointed. Live music in the bar many nights, piano stylings by
George Khouri and accompanists. Excellent martinis as well. Oh and don't forget
the butcher case by the front door for fresh cuts to take home for your grilling pleasure.

This was a great place to celebrate our anniversary. The food was great, the staff was very helpful and courteous, and the wine list was extensive. Our waitress knew we were celebrating our anniversary and was not intrusive but miraculously appeared when we were in need of something. Amazing. Would highly recommend this restaurant to any of my friends.
review_title: This was a great place to

review: The service was good but the food left a lot to be desired. We had been told that it was one of the best steaks in town. I have definitely had better. The steak was overcooked. The salad; we ordered the wedge, was horrendous. It was drendged in dressing and was not very presentable. The best part of our meal were the mashed potatoes. We were extremely disappointed with the steak. We were also extremely disappointed because there are so many steakhouses in SF to choose from and we ended up making the wrong choice. We had also mentioned on our reservation that we were celebrating our anniversary and no mention was made of it. We did not feel special.
review_title: The service was good but the

review: As always, it was terrific. Birthday dinner was very special.

Service could of been a little better. Staff forgot one of our drinks and the two wines we ordered were brought to the wrong table and then was given a Pinot my wife ordered while she was given my cabernet.  We were brought the dessert menus and were going to order something but the waitress took too long to come back and so we decided not to order because of the delay in time.

My rib eye also was not as tender and flavorful as I would have liked although I ordered it medium rare. The other person in our party who ordered it med rare said his was fine, but we noticed his was a tiny bit bigger and may have been cooked more rare.
review_title: Service could of been a little

review: We had an excellent and very enjoyable experience at Harris'. I will definitely return.
review_title: We had an excellent and very

review: Always excellent-- wonderful view and a menu that features traditional items that many other restaurants have dropped. Fish is fresh and something for everyone on the menu.
Outstanding service, amazing food and we were suprised with a birthday dessert for my girlfriend. It was a wonderful experience.
Their beef, from prime rib, new york, sirloin, filet mignon is the best, far better than any of the steak chains I have visited. Our friends from all over the world can hardly wait to return.
All aspects of dinner excellent as usual at this fine dining spot.

If you like really good steak with well prepared sides, you'll enjoy this traditional steak house. Service was friendly and professional and the restaurant has a lovely bar with live music and great cocktails. The steaks were perfectly prepared and were of the highest quality aged beef. Sides of potato and fresh vegetables were standard fare, but still a tasty addition to the meat. Sugar snap peas (the fresh vegetable selection for the evening) were cooked to perfection and not overly seasoned or buttered. The fresh whipped butter and cream cheese/cheddar spread served with crispy toasted baguette slices were a nice beginner. Overall a good dining experience-definitely not for those looking for cutting edge or trendy.
review_title: If you like really good steak

review: Truly excellent food and great service. Noise level a bit high and a little to energetic staff distracted from the dining experience.
Food and service outstanding. never disappointed when dining here.
Food is OK, but this restaurant badly need innovation!
review_title: Food is OK, but this restaurant

review: Dining this past Saturday night was a "first date" for my friend and me. We couldn't have picked a better restaurant in the city. It was romantic and cozy and just the best food we had ever tasted. After dinner we adjourned to the cocktail lounge and enjoyed a little jazz.
great resturaunt for the meat and an old fashioned favorite...with plenty of room to enjoy your meal.
Old world.  Not as exciting as most hip SF restaurants.  Reminds me of something I'd find in the Midwest.

This was one of the best dining experiences I've had in San Francisco. Our server, Maya was knowledgeable and friendly. She picked out great wines for us that paired perfectly with the food. Everything we ate was divine and the crowd was lively but not loud. The ambiance is lovely. I'll go back again! Thanks for a great night!
review_title: This was one of the best dining experien...

review:
We had a reservation and arrived right on time (fairly early in the evening), but the host couldn't manage much of a welcome. He then fumbled through the menus, said nothing, didn't look at us, turned, and and walked away. Apparently, we were to follow him.

Food was delicious, but the timing was off. We were still eating our salads (quickly) and the pizzas were put down. We weren't offered a second glass of wine. Nobody checked how our meal was. We got the message: they wanted us out or simply didn't care.

It was surprising to see these issues in an established restaurant. It wasn't full and nobody was waiting. I would have expected a better host (perhaps he needed a smaller house) and better timing. Terrific food, though.

We enjoyed our experience overall. Loved the pizzas, felt the primi were a bit small for sharing. One member of the party left hungry. Meatballs excellent. Not so keen on the dandelion and bean salad. Nice wines. Fun meal out to celebrate a birthday.
review_title: We enjoyed our experience overall. Loved...

review: The selection of the food was extremely interesting. Pizzas looked fantastic. We had several dishes which were not your traditional italian courses, all very interesting and deserving a return visit. Wine section was exceptional.

because they are starting to treat me quite nice!
seems like more times than not, get my little corner table with my bff.

everything is good on the menu, but we always get the margerita pizza and zeppole.

yum!

Everything was done well but nothing stood out as spectacular, and lunch was pricey for what we got. Parking was difficult. It's a nice spot if you're in the neighborhood, but I'm not sure it's worth the drive over the bridge.

The host was difficult. I was on time for my reservation. I asked if my friend were already seated.the
Host shrugged in a "I don't know" sort of way. So I parked my bike and went out to look for her.
Turns out that she was seated already! No mention of it. Grrr!
Every item was amazingly tasty! Can't wait to return.

Have always loved this neighborhood gem but a change of chef and staff in the kitchen has resulted in a change in atmosphere. Our last visit did not seem as satisfactory as previous ones. Indifferent staff, some unmemorable dishes and a general unfriendly feel, none of which existed in the past, lessen the charm of this place. Will give it another shot as it is in our neighborhood, and will hope for a better experience in the future.
I don't repeat many restaurants, but I've been to Cafe Piccino several times with both small and larger parties. Always delightful, the food and the service are excellent.

Overall a good experience, but the couple marks that it missed were too much to give this spot a high rating.  We ordered the turnips as an appetizer.  Nowhere on the menu or description did it mention that half of the dish was meat, and that the turnips were more of an accompaniment.  This was particularly unfortunate because my guest didnt eat meat.  Also, when we ordered our dinner we also ordered a small pizza to go.  We made the order at that time to ensure it would be ready when we were ready to leave.  When our check came, the pizza to go was not listed, nor was it ready.  The waiter blamed the timing on the new chef, but it seemed to me that the error was likely on his end since it wasnt on the check originally, and also for the fact that the restaurant was only half full at the peak of the evening.  So, we were left waiting for our pizza to go for another ten minutes after paying the check.  Not going to be rushing back

Great spot for an informal but unique dining experience. Food was different but very well presented and had great flavor. Would definitely go back as the menu was varied and offered choices for all tastes and restrictions.

I have liked Gioia since it opened. They have mastered the thin-crust pizza and the crust is never soggy. They have a new pork belly dish that is to die for. Pork Belly, arugula, cherries, and hazelnuts... what more could you ask for? It's delicious! I miss the original arugula salad they had, but this blew it away. Did I mention Pork Belly?

The chick-pea fritters are also very good and the sausage pizza is always yummy.
Never need to read the Menu, Mario can read my mind as to what I want.

As a native San Franciscan, we've known about Caffe Macaroni for decades. This place never fails to deliver service, ambiance and great food.
You have to eat upstairs for a very special treat. The stairs are pretty narrow to get up there, and if you're tall, you will have to duck ;)

Caffe Macaroni is one of those restaurants I pass twice a day and never think twice about. But boy, was I wrong. This place not only had the cutest ambiance ever, but we had the whole upstairs to ourselves. The owner, who is Italian, came up personally to discuss the menu with us, and he addressed all questions and concerns we had. Honestly, I will be back. I will be back here for birthdays, normal days, special days...the al dente was cooked to perfection.

Didn't realize a rib eye steak with a massive pile of French fries was $98 since the rest of the menu has entrees for $25-$30. Beware of "market price". The server was very friendly and attentive but we couldn't help but gawk at our bill and leave with a bit of a sour taste in our mouths. Had we known we probably would have gone to a really nice steakhouse instead.
Very good food and excellent service made this a very special luncheon for a friend! I have been many times to this restaurant, and always am happy with the results.
review_title: Very good food and excellent service mad...

review: Excellent compoft food+. Serves throughout the day. Easy parking. We come in from Marin and it's easy in and out before a show downtown.
Had a great dinner there but lunch was a disappointment.  The liver was grilled which was all wrong

I have been here several times and have found the food to be just ok and the service to be medicore.  This time we were seated at a table that was not even in the dining area- it was directly next to the kitchen at an odd metal table that was obviously hastely put there and covered in place mats to disguise the fact that it was a metal table.  Being in the back corner of the restaurant by ourselves almost at the back of the bar next to the kitchen was so uncomfortable that I couldn't wait to leave.  The ambiance was that of the din and smells from the kitchen and the constant back and forth of the wait staff.  I had a better view of the expeditor preparing the dishes than any of the restaurant.  Was unimpressed before & now will not return
review_title: I have been here several times

review: The food is good enough. My friends and I love the setting in the Presidio and the vintage, historic, simple feel of the building, enhanced by heavy cotton napkins and solid tables and chairs. We go early and order from the appetizer menu to make it affordable. The full dinner entrees are a bit pricey with many options over $30. Our waitress was delightful: pleasant, prompt and accommodating, even when it was clear we wouldn't order dinner entrees. (We do leave a large tip, usually over 20%.) Especially good are the chicken soup and the kale salad as well as the grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup (listed as appetizers) and great fries. The ample free, nearby parking is another plus.
Food was nothing remarkable at all. Especially for that price.

I don't like giving bad reviews. If the place is just so-so, I don't write a review. Our server just genuinely seemed to not like us, or really want to have anything to do with us. I've lived in the City 19 years and this place is within walking distance of my apartment. A friend from LA recently went on a date here and told me he really liked the deviled eggs with caviar, fois gras and lamb. I had a friend and his date visiting from out of town so we went here. It is slightly embarrassing to pick a restaurant then have such unpleasant service. Everyone has a bad night, but we weren't looking to make a new BFF; just competent service from a remotely personable human being.
review_title: I don't like giving bad reviews.

review: We had a nice brunch at the Presidio Social Club. There were four of us and we tried the poke (marinated tuna), bacon and eggs, macaroni and french toast. All were good, especially the french toast. Regarding the eggs and bacon, it seems odd that you have to order everything (eggs, bacon and toast) a la carte. Our server was friendly but forgot parts of our order. Food was very slow to come out of the kitchen.
Good spot- ESP for people with young children. Service can be pretty slow but if you're not in a hurry, no big deal!
review_title: Good spot- esp for larger parties

review: I wanted to like this place more than I ultimately did. Everything was set up to be an interesting and savory experience but nothing made it to a level better than mid way on my wow meter. There is a back-to-basics, farm-to-table ethic in the menu that had me anticipating great things but the execution fell short. It was uniformly OK but never great. As if a talented chef and manager set the ideas in motion and left it to a less talented staff to carry out the plan. I think the promise of the original plan is recoverable but it ain't there now. Perhaps we'll be back at some time with lowered expectations but not any time soon. There are too many promising alternatives to try or favorites to return to.
Excellent food and service. A satisfying and enjoyable dining experience.

Great burger, busy treasure of a spot. Service was spotty and ordered items came out at different times, but I believe short tacked for busy lunch service. Nice outdoor deck. Would definitely go again.
Good service at the bar before dining. Explanation of specials by the waiter offered good choices. Excellent food and service.
review_title: Good service at the bar before

review: The staff is knowledgeable and very helpful. This was my second experience and I plan to return often!

Enjoyed the Pre fixe menu. However, the menu had many options as well to choose from. However I took my sister there for her birthday and I was hoping that the restaurant could put a candle on her cake,asked via email as well as the front desk to ask the waiter. It didn't happened. A little disappointed in the constant reminders and it still didn't get the chance to follow through. Thank goodness I had a plan B and brought my own candle. Besides that let down, food was excellent and Ambiance was nice.
My aunt and parents particularly liked the ambiance and the old time cocktails as well as the excellent food and service.

I love this place. Took an out of town guest and she loved it as well. She thought it looked like a private British Club. We all three had fish(salmon) which was perfectly cooked and beautifully displayed. Also, the portion was the right amount. Our waiter was cordial and very knowledgeable. He suggested the pork belly to share and it was awesome.

TO OPEN TABLE:I HAVEN'T RECEIVED MY CREDIT FOR THIS DINING OUT. THANKS. HUNTER
review_title: I love this place. Took an

review: Always an enjoyable experience. It is in one of the old buildings in the Presidio, with interesting historical aspects.
Went for brunch, had only been for dinner before. I would say my breakfast was pretty good, my mom had the french toast which was amazing. Good coffee and service.

Vibrant...noisy...no attention to detail or follow thru. Our goat cheese fritters were forgotten until we reminded him. Then they arrived after salads and delivered with main course, though we told him to cancel that order. Still charged us for them. Fish was delicious and fresh! Beignets were like churros, or long donuts. Not what I was expecting.

Really cool ambiance in an old army building. The food was fantastic. The house cocktails are twists on the classics, try the "Gunpowder" it is essecialy a gimlet with sugar and Cayenne Pepper served up.

I went with my husband for our anniversary and had a nice time. We had crab fondue and grilled sardines for the app and thought they were very good. Also, the desserts were yummy (apple crumble and beignets). We shared the bone-in rib eye and thought it was just okay. And, the ambiance and service were also top-notch.
review_title: I went with my husband for

review: My only complaint is that the chicken salad had very little chicken in it...just a few shreds.
PSC is very quiet during the week. Weekends very noisy.
review_title: PSC is very quiet during the

review: This was our second visit, and it was every bit as enjoyable as the first--which is why we returned. The staff are exceptional--excellent service, knowledgable, and not intrusive.

Charming location in a refurbished barracks house on the Presidio. Fine small plates, lunch and brunch food with a good drink selection. A perfect preamble or prolog to weekend recreation at Crissy Field.

Great food and environment! It's contemporary, but cozy at the same time. The Crab Cake Sliders were a yummy appetizer. The seared ahi was served with white beans and big crispy pieces of pancetta which were delicious. Be sure to make reservations...this place is always packed!

This was the first time I went to the Presidio Social Club for brunch/lunch (having gone several times for dinner). While it's a great place for dinner and drinks, the lunch menu may beat the dinner menu in my opinion. It's not a vast selection, but every single item looked and sounded delicious. I 'settled' on a simple chicken and pancetta sandwich on sourdough, with a cup of soup, and it was fantastic (though I came very close to trying the rum soaked challah french toast - sounds amazing!). It wasn't terribly crowded, which was nice, and it's a great casual atmosphere.
review_title: This was the first time I

review: I really like brunch at Presidio Social Club, but the service we received was horrible. They should really hire some experienced staff that know what they're doing. Our server was a bit rude and had no presonality and the hostess messed up a simple birthday request I made for the birthday girl at our table. It's really too bad because the food is very good. I would recommend brunch there but wouldn't count on the service.
review_title: I really like brunch at Presidio

review: This is a great place for food, service, and atmosphere! Loved everything about it and wished we lived closer. We especially highly recommend the brisket, beignets, and coffee.
review_title: This is a great place for

review: Food was good, fun place to go. We live near restaurant. Noise level is very bad.
review_title: Food was good, fun place to

review: The Pork Shoulder marinade of what tasted like savory, perfectly salted, sweet and sour orange rind was to die for over the white beans....my partners flank steak had the most delicious char-broiled flavor a good flank steak should....the crab cake sliders make your mouth water....go to this place for dinner - you will enjoy it....
The restaurant is quite noisey. We were seated close to some young men who's language was an issue.
Need to review and upgrade wine list by the glass.
Presidio Social Club is a very fun, upbeat place. Great for parties!!
great fresh American food. drinks, wine, appetizers, entrees and desserts are always fresh and well prepared

A very solid, consistent, spot. The food is nothing fancy, but is always high quality and thoughtfully done. The varied seating options is nice....you get a different experience depending on where you site (bar, private table, communal long table). Great place we go to often.
Great informal atmosphere with easy, free parking.

The restaurant has a nostalgic feel that seems to take diners back to the era of the Rat Pack. The reinvention of comfort food is an excellent fit for the physical style of the restaurant.

The desserts are great.

The bar is one of the best in the city.
children next to us were up and down, out of seats, under our table. No help from waitstaff. Hard to get waiters attention for second glass of wine. Excellent sea scallops
review_title: children next to us were up

review: Really appreciated the appetizer that arrived due to the reservation running behind!!
amazing.  fine dining without the attitude. service is friendly, attentive, but not so much so that you're uncomfortable.  great setting, great menu, great food.
great food and drinks. causual but classy atmosphere.

Pizza A: If your into thin crust pizza this is the place. Homemade pasta, meat sauce, and pesto are also great. 

Service D- go early because they will ignore you and you will wait for an annoying long time. And will get no service in between ordering food and along for the ticket 1.5 hours later,

 The lasagna C: meh, very greasy and unfavorable

This was our 1st time here (tried to go back again on Sunday, but they were closed).  The homemade pasta was great, as well as the eggplant parmigiana.  This is a family business & everyone was wonderful.  Definitely recommend this.

The atmosphere transported me back to Italy. You felt as though instead of Thank you , you should be saying Grazie. We got a pizza and it was delicious! The location is just off the main strip, easy to get to and some shops to visit while you are in the area. I would definitely return.
The best Italian experience and food in North Beach. Spent 2 hours enjoying a wonderful relaxed lunch in this quaint unassuming cafe. The Italian mother rocks.... Italy's loss, San Francisco's gain!

Reserved a table for two, more than an hour ahead of time.  We showed up, and we weren't on the hand-written list at the front desk, nor on the blurry cell phone picture of some computer screen. Their food is pretty good, based on my last visit, but not sure why they bother to use OpenTable if they can't handle the system.
review_title: Good food but disorganized front of house

review: The meat and beans were way undercooked. Hush puppies were dry and inedible. It was very disappointing meal!

I've eaten at Southpaw a few times now. I've also been to most of the BBQ places in the City. Southpaw is my favorite do far. There are great Happy Hour drink and food choices, a full bar with an emphasis on good whiskies (and knowledgable bartenders to support it) and good BBQ and sides. This is just a well rounded place that I keep returning to for the service, the food, and the classes on brewing, pickle, and sausage making.

Absolutely delicious food, great list of Italian wines, very professional and knowledgable servers, and chef-owner Bruno Quercini a masterful chef and host. Every visit to San Francisco includes a meal at Pane e Vino. Make a reservation so you do not miss out.
2nd time there.  What a great find.  Fantastic dinner. Fortunate enough to have met the owner/chef Bruno.  Great service, great food.
review_title: 2nd time there.  What a great find.  Fan...

review: With such a variety on the menu, it is always a treat to visit and dine at this casual, neighborhood trattoria! It is a bit of Italy and family combined! ALWAYS a pleasure to be there.

We reserved a table somewhat last minute on a Thursday and were very glad to have the reservation -we got a great table right by the window. The service was incredibly friendly and the pizza was very good. It is a small, neighborhood find - and I'm happy it just happens to me in mine!

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: The Food was great and our Waited Sean was excellent.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: We come to San Francisco each year and returning to Scoma's is one of our must eat at restaurants.  Always great service with creative dishes that always please.  They also have a good choice of wines.  Not inexpensive, but you're always guaranteed a wonderful dining experience.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Amazing ambiance and great service. Food was excellent
review_title: Amazing ambiance and great service. Food...

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review:
Have eaten here several times in the last 23 years and it is always a pleasure - great location, great food and great service.
If you like seafood then there are many places to eat on the Wharf and most are good or very good.
We found Scoma's a long time ago and it has just stuck as our favourite balancing all aspects of a good meal out.
Certainly recommend it and we will be back again.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: You definitely need to have reservations. This is a popular place. The food and service were excellent. We will visit again when we are in San Francisco

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Great view, great service, and great food.  Would go back again for sure

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: I had been at Scoma's many years ago and when I saw it was still rated highly, decided it would be a nice place to take my son. Luckily we had eaten our appetizer and dessert earlier in Little Italy, so we werent starving, even though we had late reservations (8:45 pm) at Scoma's.  Thank goodness we did, because the portions were very small. The lobster ravioli and king salmon dinner was 3 raviolis and a tiny piece of salmon for $37.  The caesar salad dressing had so much vinegar that I couldnt finish it. The wasabi fried oysters (6 pieces) were not nearly as good or plentiful as what you get in New Orleans or Charleston. I think we could have had a much better meal for less money somewhere else in San Fran.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Scoma's is always the best seafood around it is a must for any visitors to the SF bay area, always an assortment of freshly caught seafood with there own boats.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Excellent - pricey - but worth it - go and create a memory!

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Our waiter was great. Made us feel like we were regulars. Gives you a real feel for eating on the Pier.
review_title: Our waiter was great. Made us feel like ...

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review:
We decided to go to Scoma's for our 36th wedding anniversary.  We notified the restaurant about out anniversary (they ask when you make a reservation)  and thought they would do something, but did not even mention our anniversary.

If you are looking for a romantic place to eat, DON'T go to Scoma's.  You will be disappointed.  If you are looking for some great food, you will be impressed.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: I 've lived on the Gulf Coast, Europe and traveled the Mediterranean.  Spent a lot of time in the Caribbean and the Virgin Islands. Now I call New England home.All with great seafood. Scoma had one of the freshest and delicious plates of seafood I have ever had Absolutely. From the reservation process to the service and best of all the food all outstanding. ..

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Funky, old world dining spot right on the pier at Fisherman's wharf, the biggest tourist trap in our lovely city.  Food was good with prices fit for tourists.  I would have given 3 stars if our server had been even the slightest bit accommodating. Being the people watcher I am, our waiter's bad attitude seemed to extend to the rest of the service staff. They do have valet parking.  If you want fabulous food, with a fabulous view, and fabulous service, go to McCormick and Kuleto's on the other side of the street.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review:
Unless you have hear or read about Scoma's, you are not likely to see it while you are taking a casual stroll in the Fisherman's Warf. It is hidden in the back of a couple other San Francisco classics. 

When you go there, you are likely to get served by one of the personable longtime servers at your table. Engage them in short conversations if you can. You may just get a few interesting tips about the restaurant or the neighborhood. 

For starters, try a cup on their soup. You can't go wrong. For the main dish, try any of their broiled fish dishes; they are all good. I've never tried their deserts, so you are on your own there! :-)

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: I was very happy to find that Scoma's has remained one of the best restaurants in SF, and at the wharf. As a native San Franciscan, this is still one of my go-to places to take visitors. The food is delicious and the service is excellent. You aren't rushed, or unnecessarily interrupted, they go out of their way to make your visit memorable. You can tell Scoma's cares about their guests.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: We ordered the lazy man's crab chioppingo and the swordfish.. My nephew said he had never tasted better swordfish... and I've been going here just for this chioppino. I don't even bother trying to get it elsewhere anymore, as nothing measures up to Scoma's.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: From the moment we arrived, we were treated as honored guests. Scoma's has a great bar. Our waiter, Sean, is on top of his game. And the food, out of this world.. Every dish was perfection. Scoma's is a long standing family tradition which I intend to continue.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Awesome food. Fresh and we'll prepared. Amazing service. Wonderful atmosphere. Great for private or social gatherings.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Great seafood. Recommended by tour guide from wine tour.wanted to have good seafood on our last night in San Francisco.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: You might want to check the spelling on your confirmation letter...the word is gUaranteed not garanteed. Nancy Maxwell
review_title: You might want to check the

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: This is an old San Francisco favorite. It's a bit crowded and touristy but the seafood is always fresh. It is definitely a good choice if you're in the Fisherman's Wharf area.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: We had a friend we'd never actually met coming into town from the East coast, and wanted to show him a good time at a San Francisco restaurant. The reservation process couldn't have gone smoother, it was easy for him to find and our meal was great, with the added bonus of a big, ruddy-complected waiter who really hit it off with our Boston guest! Just a fun evening at a wonderful place!

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Scoma's restaurant was suggested to us by a friend who used to live in SF. We probably would not have found this on our own because it is out of the way. We have had several meals here and have always had a fantastic experience. The service is always exceptional and the food could not be better. Although I have never come with small children but each time we are seated next to a family, I am impressed with the servers ability to keep them happy during the meal. All trips to SF have to include a meal here!
review_title: Can't Visit SF without a meal here!

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Scoma's is without a doubt the friendliest, most service and great food focused restaurant in North America. We have visited many times over the years and it just keeps getting better. The wine selection is very high quality and reasonably priced. and the food is without parallel. Add to this the services such as flower arrangements delivered on time and the result is experiencing the "Best" dining - anywhere.
review_title: The Best Restaurant in North Americ

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: After having researched Fisherman's Wharf restaurants and getting positive recommendations from travelers we met in Napa Valley, my family was looking forward to our Saturday night, Aug.24th dinner reservation at Scoma's. Unfortunately we were very disappointed. The quality of the food was not as expected and especially for the price. This was the most expensive but not the most enjoyable meal we had in San Francisco. My husband and I were there on our honey moon 32 years ago, and we feel that they have not updated at all in years. Also, an unusual smell when walking into the restaurant. Over rated and over priced.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Came in for lunch after viewing an art exhibit. Very relaxed and enjoyable visit, as always. We had a wonderful lunch, especially the Petrale Dore, and wait staff was attentive as always! It is a pleasure to come back for the delicious food and atmosphere!

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Second time dining at Scoma's in the 4 days we were in Sanfrancisco. Best seafood restaurant in fishermans wharf without a doubt!

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: We have been coming here for years. A favorite of my parents and now ours too. A wonderful dining experience for the whole family.
review_title: We have been coming here for

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: We had a wonderful Mother's Day lunch. The Crab Louie is always exceptional and the service was excellent.

address: 1 Al Scoma WayPier 47, Fisherman's WharfSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: We love Scoma's. It is such a treat to go there since it is pretty pricey. The food was delicious. I really appreciate the professionalism of the waiters. They are working at a career instead of working their way through school.
review_title: We love Scoma's. It is such

review: The menu is changing all the time! We enjoy going every few months to see what is new and exciting on the menu, and the food is always delicious!!

Really cool restaurant. Hidden secret. Superb food. Excellent service and atmosphere. San Francisco restaurants are good but not many have the WOW factor and this does. You have to be patient with booking but it pays off. It is an all day restaurant and at lunch time it is worth just dropping in. South of Market is getting a bit old hat so it is pleasant to find this place.

Ian Paget

I think I dreamt about the sunchokes, they were that good. The soup was also a winner - a good-size portion, amazing flavors and warm on a cold outer sunset night. The bread is a must - try it with one of the cheese. The only downside to Outerlands is that the wines by the glass are mediocre at best. Opt for beer or cocktails, though and you'll have an incredible experience overall.
I wish they didn't ask for a credit card to hold the a reservation.
Parking is sometimes a bit tough but we've always had good luck one block over on Kirkham.
We'll definitely be back.

I had heard and read nothing but great things about Outerlands, so I was delighted to try it. I think the restaurant will benefit from expanding into the space next door. Maybe it's just me, but I thought the tables were kind of cramped (hobbit-like). Someone taller than 6 feet would probably feel like they were sitting at the kids' table. That quibble aside, our waitress was very professional and helpful. I liked that she gave us plenty of time to settle in and look at the menu. My entree, local King salmon, arrived as a beautiful tableau and tasted as good as it looked. My cousin had the soup (sweet potato) and two vegetable sides. Fabulous parsnips, an under-appreciated vegetable. Someone should rethink herbs in every dessert.
review_title: I had heard and read nothing

review: A friend suggested this restaurant and after viewing the menu, we decided it was a must.  It's a small place, but it's a cozy, atmosphere. The food lived up to our expectations, and the service was friendly and attentive.   We particularly loved the champignons farcis and the rillettes de canard as appetizers and shared the delicious pork shoulder stuffed in cabbage leaf as a main course.  The lemon tart was a perfect finish.
Delicious, authentic food, great bellini, dessert and fantastic service.
review_title: A slice of Basque in NYC

review: Gato, Boqueria Soho, and Colcotte were fabulous....not necessarily in that ordery
review_title: Gato, Boqueria Soho, and Colcotte were f...

review:
Le charme  la franaise....avec ses plus et ses moins.  Nous avons manger divinement, les petits plats basques  partager taient vraiment trs bon, le vin aussi.

Le services en franais tait super jusqu'au moment ou ont nous a fait comprendre qu'il fallait s'en aller car des gens attendaient  l'entre.  Et ce mme si nous avions rserv, pour 20H. Une tel impolitesse, nous  beaucoup du, surtout que nous aurions pris un autre verre de vin avec plateau de fromage car nous y tions trs bien pour y passer la soire.

La facture trs sale, par contre, plus cher qu'au Balthazar..

Walking into Cocotte was the start of a fantastic experience. The Basque restaurant serves food tapas style, and it is easy to find something tempting on the menu. The wine menu is also extremely good, and I fell in love with the Basque sparkling wine they were serving by the glass.

The athmosphere and the service was however almost topping both food and wine. Nice, smiling, charming staff made the this a place I will return to many times.

The food options were all great, with deep, rich flavors. We had five plates between the two of us. The food was only outdone by the service. Very attentive, but not overbearing staff from the moment you enter until you leave. Great spot!

Made a reservation for myself, husband and work colleagues from Europe. Everyone enjoyed the atmosphere, the wine, and the food which was of an excellent standard. I was a little nervous as both colleagues live/ have lived in France! They both agreed that the food was authentic, they could converse in French to the waiter and one waiter was Romanian the same nationality at one of the colleagues so they enjoyed a conversation in Romanian! A big hit with all of the group. Looking forward to a return visit in the not to distant future.

rest_name: Mission Street Oyster Bar & Seafood Restaurant
review: Oysters tasted incredibly fresh, cioppino and whole dungeness crab were delicious. We're always surprised this place isn't packed though, since the food is excellent. Pleasant, fast and professional service. Can't wait to go back!

rest_name: Mission Street Oyster Bar & Seafood Restaurant
review: I'm glad to have a good seafood option in the Mission! And, I have to admit...we'd had a few beers before coming to dinner here. But, that didn't stop us from enjoying our meal (cioppino & garlic crab). The only complaint I had relates more to the fact that we chose to come here on Valentine's Day - everybody wants to be out this night & as a result service (slightly) and seating suffered. I'd definitely come here again, esp on a night that wasn't so popular.
Tal-Y-Tara is a wonderfully unique place to enjoy a pot of tea, sandwiches on their own special bread, delicious scones with preserves. My go to place for a relaxing chat a friend.

It was like traveling back in time and to a different place. I live nearby and always thought it was a store selling equipment for horse riding. Instead it has a quite cosy and very romantic tea room in the back.
The waitress was the most helpful and knowledgeable about different teas, which was very helpful. She was able to explain the difference between teas to help us with placing the order, going as far as offering to smell the tea before placing the order.
I'll definitely be back again.
We love this place and this time the food was outstanding and the service is always really personal and friendly.  We will keep coming back.
Great experience overall!! Would definitely go back there for their Wine collection..
Come early for the wine flight specials such a good deal.

Everything is good on the menu!! We also took Kyle, our lovely server's advice on how and what to order!  All the Tapas and Pinchos are outstanding!!! It's like party in your mouth :). Also must preorder the Paella!! It's worth the wait time!!  Definetly will go back and bring lots people and order a lot!!!
review_title: Just try everything on the menu !

review: The small plates we ordered were all delicious, including dessert.  The service was excellent, starting with the reservation person who assured me that we could, per my request, have an individual table rather than a communal table, as I was meeting old friends for conversation.  The servers were also helpful and the right degree of friendly.
review_title: The small plates we ordered were all del...

review: We enjoyed this visit even more than our last one because we were a party of 4 this time.  That allowed us to order more things and share them.  We concentrated on the hot tapas, and ordered nearly all of them.  Our favorites were the chicken croquettes, the 3 shrimp plates, and the octopus.  We added one open faced sandwich (the salmon this time) and one salad (the watermelon), and a few small desserts.  We had a nice light red wine (a good recommendation from our server, who was great).  It was a great combination of food, and we left happy.

If you're walking along the Embarcadero, but feel like taking a short trip to Spain for some tapas, you can't go wrong with the plates at Coqueta. The service was impeccable, with no stall whatsoever as we moved from plate to plate and they have the best patatas bravas I've ever tried (seriously, you'll growl at the servers if they try to take away the spicy, smoky sauce too early).

I have enjoyed two separate dining experiences at Coqueta over the last 5 weeks. the last one from July 10th that included one newly relocated So Cal refugee and an out of towner from La-La land...the best grilled octopus and paella they have EVER eaten...the out of towner was also impressed that he could enjoy a beer that was imported from Barcelona...I think we needs to get out more...but If he can get the Barcelona Beer here in SF more power to you guys!...Keep up the fabulous food and beverages. I will be returning soon!

My son was returning from overseas and we planned a late lunch at Coqueta. As luck would have it, customs took longer than anticipated and we were over 30 min. late to our appointment. The server and staff were very welcoming and we proceeded to have a terrific lunch. Each selection was terrific...Sadly due to the late time we couldnt choose the paella (takes 30-40 lead time) but will certainly choose that next time.

After trying a few times to make a reservation on Open Table, we finally found a 5:30 reservation that worked for us. We had the octopus, pork & duck meatballs, piquillos peppers, anchovies bite and paella. Everything was good. The paella is cooked in the oven. The octopus had a nice smokey flavor. Everything was good. Only wishes I had saved room for dessert. They looked great. Can't wait to try other items on the menu.

Tiny, but a great restaurant! The food is pure perfection in both presentation, and taste. You'll remember every delicious bite. Michael Chiarello was there, supervising and checking to make sure each dish was up to his standard prior to delivery to your table! Our favorite was the Arroz cremosa. It was so good that we savored it in little bites, and took an order "to go" with us! You will not be disappointed with your meal.

Celebrated my birthday here & found everything was just wonderful. Started with cocktails at the bar which was packed & fun. The drinks are great! We went through a # of meat dishes that were all great. I must go back to try more.
Tapas were delicious! Service was exceptional. The ambiance gave off a special vibe that added to the overall experience. Overall I highly recommend this restaurant and can't wait to return.
Excellent food with excellent service in a beautiful spot! Shelby was our server. She was professional and knowledgeable. Our food was wonderful. Highly recommend the whole fish!
A good place for tapas with very good food quality...
They've done a great job with the spaces, the menu, and the food. Service was really excellent

I loved the food- beet salad, paella, apricot tart,, chicken and pea croquetas, and especially the secret pork. Didn't are much for the duck and pork meatballs but my companions loved it. My least favorite was the cheesecake pop.

I will be back as often as I can.

Everything about Coqueta is self-conscious and pretentious -- from the snooty host to the great looking "chef's bar" stools which are designed to inspire one to have quick small bites and then find another restaurant for dinner. Apparently, booking less than 3 weeks in advance lands one on a very uncomfortable stool. When they say "small plates" they mean it. Well presented but bland, and over priced. I was excited about Coqueta because I've been to Bottega several times and loved it -- great food, great service and great vibe. Coqueta would do well to lose the odious attitude and pay more attention to the quality of the food, the service and the atmosphere.
review_title: So Hip As To Be Very Unhip

review: Great job Chef Michael! I went here twice in the same week. The wood grilled octopus is a must!
The wait staff is great. The management team goes out of the way to provide a great product. The chief and team make the best bone in fillet I have ever had.
review_title: Maybe the best steak in the city

review:
Having tried both the Big bone-in and the smaller steaks on multiple occasions, there is no contest -- the Big bone -in filet is one of, if not the, finest steaks you will ever have. It is large, so be prepared to take a size able portion home with you to warm up in a covered skillet the next day for another wonderful meal.  The smaller steaks are what you would find in most good high-end steakhouses, but why waste your time with them when you are in the presence of excellences?

The oysters are also superb, and the crispy roast potatoes are my favorite side.

Everything was perfect!  What more can I say.  The crab and spinach fondue was perfect.  The beet salad was perfect.  The bone in fillet was perfect.  The waiter was perfect.  One of our first truly perfect dinners.

Who knew this place was here?? Menu has a similar feel and quality to Bobos and decor has an Art Deco old school feel that works somehow. Unpretentious. Would definitely go back, great find for a change of pace...

We reserved the private dining room for a dinner during the annual JPM Healthcare Conf in Jan. Charlie and Kevin were wonderful and accommodating, and did everything in their power to help make the dinner the success that it was. I would recommend to anyone who needs private dining in San Fran. Osso is laso conveniently located across from Grace Cathedral.
Went before a Chris Cornell concert with friends. Excellent steaks and drinks. Highly recommended for anyone going to the Masonic Center.

I live nearby. It is a neighborhood gem of the first order!! Perfectly cooked, incredibly delicious steaks. The chorizo cheese bread is to die for!! I will come back to try something other than the steak as the crab sounds wonderful and the other seafood options looked good. We had several side dishes that were outstanding and I thought the wine list was very reasonably priced. I love this place!!
1st time here - long overdue.  It was a very pleasant and enjoyable visit with good food, good service and good ambience.
Great food, but very noisy.  The service was excellent.  Unfortunately, we couldn't hear each other talk because of the noise level.
Great experience from the minute you walk in the door. Wonderful, friendly staff - from greeter to bus boys. Food was excellent, really fresh & beautifully presented.

Not into duck dishes, requested twice the server if the burrito duck carnitas can be substituted with pork carnitas and twice was declined.
Staff and bar servers were not that friendly

The food was excellent, the service polite and attentive, but the noise level, especially up in the loft, was deafening. The tables are small. They reserve half the space for walk-ins, so it is very hard to plan.

This is a very welcome new addition to our neighborhood. Padrecito serves delicious upscale Mexican food. The menu is small, but the quality is excellent. We had the goat barbacoa tacos and duck chilaquiles. Guacamole is smooth, not chunky and very tasty. Home made tortilla chips are just perfect. The arroz verde (green rice) is a must to go with the chilaquiles. Delicious!

We did not try dessert...we were just too full of good food to go for it. The Padrecito margarita is super. The Mezcal gives it a different flavor. Compared to the cocktails their wine seems very pricey.
review_title: Upscale Mexican food in Cole Valley

review:
Despite being out of the beer we wanted, our servers were so great. They had recommendations for other alternatives and were just the greatest. We had a 10 star experience. Shout out to the toe best servers! 

The food was also excellent! We just walked in after being at the ballet, not knowing what to expect. We will definitely be back!

In a nutshell, we were very disappointed with the food and service.

The sushi just wasn't flavorful. For example, the hamachi was surprisingly, well, bland.  And the hamachi sushi pieces were unusually large and required 2-3 bites each.  We wondered what was up with the rice - most of the time, the rice kept falling apart.

The service was perfunctory at best.  We felt our server just didn't want to work Valentine's Day night.  Slowwww ... we recognize that they were very busy BUT at least our server could've given us a heads up on the delays through our meal.

Sakesan has many good reviews and we probably just hit them on a very bad night.
review_title: Valentine's Day, must have been an off night ...

review: The patio dining is the best, very pleasant and quiet.  Excellent friendly service.  The food was good although portions are a bit small.  A nice wine list.  A very pleasant neighborhood dining spot, I would recommend to friends.
review_title: Great Outdoor dining in the Castro

review: I had made reservations for 6 and still had a 30 minute wait to be seated  The service was super slow but accurate and friendly. I don't know what happened but it was apparent that they were understaffed for the night.
review_title: Slow service long wait with Rez

review: Booked a table here reading previous reviews - was not disappointed. Excellent choice of food, both my partners and I three courses were superb. Really nice restaurant with great, attentive staff.
Wonderful food and service. Always crowdid and a bit hard to get in. Can't wait until the back patio fully opens!

Definitely need reservations before you go.
Charming, cozy and beautifully decorated!
Reasonable price, great value and service.

We have eaten there often, food is always excellent and interesting, service can get backed up close to show times, and it can get noisy if seated close to big tables. If you have tickets for anything at the Jazz Center it can't be beat.
review_title: We have eaten there often, food is alway...

review: Menu is tapas style, small items that are reasonably priced.  Food is deliciously seasoned.  Ingredients are fresh.  The wine list is dismal so had to have a beer.  They don't serve bread or tortillas unless you request and pay for them (need something to soak up those great sauces).  A gesture that is unworthy of the otherwise wonderful meal.
review_title: Menu is tapas style, small items that ar...

review:
The new menu is really interesting with a lot of small plates to choose from you and your guests can taste the various menu items. I really liked the creative take on Mex/Southwest. the presentations were great. The service is a little slow but getting to know the new menu items. Loved the Mole Sauce with the Rabbit. 

Its a wonderful place to enjoy the combo of great food and incredible entertainment/jazz shows. Love the combo
review_title: Great ReBoot to South at SFJazz

review: The food was a 3 and 4 star mix. The Jambalaya was too bland and dry, but the fried chicken was good. The roasted corn salad was very good. Service could have been more efficient, but it is difficult for the waitpeople to get past the backup at the bar. They also have trouble seeing tables when they are prepping. Such a long wait for a dessert order that we could not fit it in before the show.
Very much enjoy the small plates part of the menu as well as the wonderful fried chicken. So pleasant to have a leisurely meal at a great concert venue.

There are no authentic New Orleans restaurants in San Francisco, although South and Boxing Room would have you think so. The gumbo at South, for example, is dark but a bit on the oily side. It's tasty, but it's far too rich to be an entree; half that amount would be more than enough for an appetizer. Similarly, the rosemary-infused bread is a nice idea, but this appetizer includes 3 large rolls, more than one person should eat. The lettuce-wedge salad was the best part of my meal. Next time, I'll have that and a smaller appetizer and call it a meal.

The Derby cocktail was fun: bourbon, lemon, honey, bitters, and a large helping of cinnamon. The bitters kept it from being a total sweet-tooth overdose.
review_title: You won't be late for the concert.

review: A new small restaurant with clean open feeling in SF Jazz Center has southern dishes with the fine art of Charles Fan leadership. Make your reservations early if you want to enjoy your meal before a performance. It would be a great place to dine after the performance crowd leaves for the theaters. Service was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Menu was broad enough to satisfy a variety of tastes from fish to fowl to beef; including a variety of small plates and a main courses. Deserts was well done and nicely presented.

This place is in the performing arts district, so I intentionally made a reservation for 8:15pm when the concert goers would be out.  However, we arrived early, about 7:15.  There were hardly any customers in the place, and there were no tables set up.  We had to wait a few minutes for a table.  The table water was house-made sparkling water that reeked of chlorine.  They had no bottled water at all.  The water glasses and wine glasses were hot out of the dishwasher.  One of the glasses was also cracked.  The wine and beer selections were vary narrow and not good.  The menus were dirty.  We left without ordering.
Great food, service, and ambience. Not too expensive either.

I had been here before but my best friend had not. We are both vegetarians, so thats definitely something that we always have to consider when choosing a restaurant. Our waiter was super friendly and very helpful right from the start letting us know what dishes were vegetarian and what dishes had the option to be made vegetarian. Sometimes it's hard to leave nicer places feeling full and satisfied when you do not eat meat - not this place! Our dishes were rich, fresh, delicious and there was more than one option! Also worth noting, the bar is fantastic. My advice, if you have not been there - go, if you have already been - keep going back and bring all your friends!!

We were pleasantly surprised with our experience at 1760.  The small plates were perfectly coursed by our server, and every single one was delicious- which is hard to achieve when you order as much food as we did!  I also appreciated the creativity that went into each dish, including the desserts.
The cocktails were inventive and well balanced, and the wine list offered some really nice low priced options.
All in all an excellent experience!

Celebrated my wife'birthday and the restaurant was just great.    A great variety on the menu with very interesting ingredients.  Everything prepared perfectly.  Our waitress was so helpful and attentive and engaging.  The wine list is large but not overwhelming.  It is grouped into helpful and fun sections.  The experiece was seamless, the ambiance simple, with modern elegance.  Overall just high quality every  where without pretention.

We had a nice dinner at s1760 on Wednesday night. We shared 2 vegetable plates and 2 meat plates, which was plenty. The flavors were good and varied, the pasta was house made and delicious. The restaurant was busy, fairly noisy, a youngish scene. The wine list featured an Italian vintner who was present to speak to diners on this evening, a really nice feature.

Everything we had was amazing and memorable! The lobster ceviche and the cavatelli with pork cheeks were highlights. I wish we had gone with more people so we could have tried more dishes, as the set-up is small plates to be shared. We went early (5PM), and the service was very attentive. They only offered us bread midway through the meal though; I wish they had brought it earlier because it was really good!

This new offshoot of Acquerello is easy to review: very good food; helpful and spot on service; and a lovely venue. The dungeness crab with watermelon gazpacho was very good. Bucatini with uni was wonderful and the reason is really quite simple. The uni was pristine and sweet. I finished a very good meal with a fried duck sandwich that came with slaw and a spicy aioli. Good stuff.

We were surprised how wonderful the experience was at Caf at the Opera.  The buffet was very good, well-stocked and obviously fresh plus a free glass of decent Champagne. All this with an arrival at 6:45 and wandering upstairs for the program at 7:45 -- at any other venue you'd be panicked to get t the show on time.  Would not drive here for dinner, but will definitely eat here again for the next ballet--it's just too easy-going with decent food.
review_title: A winner before opera or ballet

review: Everything was great except I think dessert should be included with the meal. Loved the service and food. Had a great time.

Whenever I have the time to enjoy a beautiful meal before the opera,  my number one choice is Caf At The Opera.  The buffet is simply grand! The quality and presentation are first rate.
I love having dessert at intermission.  Putting everything together,  one couldn't ask for a lovlier way to spend an evening.

worked out perfectly... we got just what we wanted... easy dining, right there at the opera house, such good food, no rush, very comfortable, service very good. all very tasty and satisfying...nice way to start the evening... we'll be back.
You can't beat the view--it's a shame the windows don't open.   The food was very good, and a nice wine list with enough selections by the glass.

If you're going to the opera this is definitely the place for your pre-show dinner.  Food is excellent.  Service is great for a Buffett.  Convenience can't be beat!  Have your dessert, drinks or coffee during the intermission.  It's a total evening.
Patina Catering provides a selection of almost 50 dinner items, all of them of high quality and absolutely delicious. A splendid experience to go with an evening's performance.

Caf at the Opera offers a convenient buffet for ballet-goers. Dining here means we will have a delicious meal and easily get to our seats on time. We found our last visit (for a performance of Cinderella) offered an interesting variety of cold salads, plus pork roast with a lovely fig sauce, salmon on a bed of greens and a mustard sauce, and chicken on a vegetable ragout as the main entrees. Desserts are extra at $10 each. Coffee or tea come with the meal. We read the fine print on our tickets and found that a free glass of sparkling wine is also included. The basement of the Opera House is not the most glamorous locale, but on our two visits we have found the food a cut above most buffets. We'll be back!

Great way to have a nice meal before the show.
And dining there allows you to pre-order drinks and dessert which will be waiting at your table when intermission lets out.
A very nice experience overall!

Four of us dined at the Cafe at the Opera. The buffet seemed lacking in variety this time; no meat dish either. So the four of us decided to try the a la carte menu instead. Two of us had the Seafood Salad with the dressing on the side which was excellent . The third had an unappetizing chicken dish which was a small dry chicken leg on a bed of 'weeds'. Our fourth had a very good cheese plate. The bread was delicious. We shared a tasty plate of cookies. The waiter although friendly was slow and did not check on us. We had to grab others for refills of water and to get our check.
We will try The Cafe again because we have had better service and good food on previous occasions. Also, it is convenient to attend the Opera.

Although the buffet at the Opera House is pricey, it is my special treat for people I bring to the opera for the first time. On October 1st, the buffet was really good with its selection of salads, fruits breads, cheeses, prime rib, chicken fish, vegetables and dessert served at intermission. Coffee is included in the price. The service can be a bit slow when you need a clean plate or a coffee refill but the servers were very pleasant. We found the hostess who seated us a bit aloof and, after being seated, we had to request menus. Water glasses were kept full by an assistant server. The primary server took orders for food and drink and was very personable.

We dined on a Saturday evening when the restaurant was about half filled.  There was only one hostess-server on duty who did her best to keep things moving, but the food arrived in reverse order from what we expected (main dishes first, then pot sticker appetizers; the soup orders were forgotten completely).  The food quality was good, but we are unlikely to return.

I had made reservations which I had to make a week ahead (i.e. all early evening 5:30-7:30 times booked up until then) so I was surprised to find the restaurant so empty when we arrived. Server/owner was very enthusiastic and chatty but not necessarily attentive. We ordered the tongue appetizer, which tasted better than it looked, and the pierogi (I especially liked the lightness of the potato filled ones).  We also had the schnitzel which was perfectly cooked--crispy outside, juicy inside, and the stuffed cabbage rolls with mushroom sauce. Definitely comfort food, though not ridiculously heavy. Good for a Richmond evening, though. I would be happy to return, though I found the ambiance a bit cold and uninviting.

This was our fourth visit to Mason Pacific; it just keeps getting better and better. Service, food and ambiance all meld together to deliver a consistently superb dining experience. Just wish it was easier to grab a table on short notice.
Every dish was splendid.  Service was superb.  I greatly enjoyed my visit and plan to return.

It was our last night in San Francisco after spending 10 days in the city and trying many restaurants in the area, and this one was the best we could have chosen to end a perfect vacation!  The food was phenomenal!  We started with a beet salad which was fantastic and perfectly spiced and then continued with a shared steak served with a series of sauces - sort of Beef Fondue meets mid-west barbecue.
Great idea and phenomenal taste sensation.  Their wine list was extensive and the knowledgeable staff helped us chose the best in terms of pairing.  Our 12 year old also enjoyed his burger on a bagel bun, as well as his Mexican cola - made with real sugar rather than corn sugar.  It was an amazing evening!!!

This little restaurant is only three or four blocks from Nob Hill, but feels a world away as the buses and cable cars pass the large viewing windows. The kitchen tries, and seems especially hard working, but the best dishes are those that are fresh and generally starters. The beet salad is unusual and healthy, with a tart yougurty dressing and a puffy lemon curd. Also tried the fried feta on a winter squash base which was unusual. The saltiness of the feta was cut by the sweetness of the kabocha and the bitter of a few brown chestnuts. Have had two of the seasonal Dungeness dishes, the first just plain crab removed from its shell-- expensive but delicious-- and the second a crab pasta which was a waste of both ingredients. ServiceFair
This is one of my favorite restaurants. Love the imaginative menu, great wine selections and the service is friendly and very knowledgeable.

Came here for my birthday dinner with my family, and had a lovely evening. We were sat in the 'front'/'private' booth in the main dining room, which was lovely for people-watching (and a treat for my 90-year old grandmother to see the cable cars go by). Wines were excellent and the food was great. The salads were a little heavy on the cheese... but who can really complain about a little extra? Definitely ask for the bread & butter. Their butter is made from goat's milk and you can really taste the difference. All in all a lovely meal.
The Peking Duck was amazing!  We shared the sea bass and it was delicious.  Fabulous favors...thanks!
review_title: The Peking Duck was amazing!  We shared ...

review: Great food & service. Been going here since it opened. Never been disappointed.

Some items we had were very good and others were only okay. If you haven't had good dim sum before, then you'll think this is very good.
We went in the evening, and perhaps it's because there are few dim sum places open at night, but the place was packed, people waiting to be seated and the dinner service was awful. We are just accustomed to a faster more efficient pace at Asian restaurants.
We love this neighborhood restaurant. We take our granddaughters and they are treated so nicely. Service is great. Dumplings wonderful. Love the Mongolian beef dish. All around a dining pleasure!
What a great staff everyone was so nice and frendly. The food was so tasty. The vibe in this place was spot on.

First I was able to make reservations Saturday afternoon for that night which is a feat unto itself. The drink menu is very orginal. I had the mezcal martini & it was delish. The waiter explained to us that dishes were sharable and that they come out of the kitchen at different times so we were prepared for a casual eating experience. First we had mussels & fries. The muscels were great but maybe a smidge too much Pernod in the sauce. Fries were plentiful. This was followed by the meatballs which I had read were good. They did not disappoint & were my favorite of the night. Finally we had the kale faltbread which was new to the menu. It was just ok but the flatbread had a nice crust which we used to sop up the meatball sauce
review_title: Not bad for a last minute reserve

review:
Was hoping for a good experience given past valentines day at other places 
This place beautifully hit all marks !
Majestic location , charming interior, genuinely friendly efficient service! And the kicker was the 5 course dinner was not just a token valentines day rollout but rather a considered and composed menu that satisfied on all levels. Creative ample portions served smartly . Attentive service on all levels. Wine accompaniment was both of higher quality and fuller pours than I would have expected. 
Will most definetly return on a non holiday to enjoy full menu 
Almost cliched location high on a hill on Taylor with cable car passing by every so often is just about magical 
A+ experience
