Allegro Romano is one of my favorite restaurants in SFO. But I have avoided coming there due to difficulty of parking and getting a reservation. Parking at Ala Romano is far more difficult than at Allegro Romano, and the food is pretty awful. The pasta was too salty and the pork chop very ordinary. The staff friendliness and professionalism was incredible. But given the many better choices for Italian in SFO and the fact that parking is downright annoying, I don't think this restaurant will pull through. I will go back to Allegro Romano, but only if I don't have to drive.
not recommended. too expensive and the food is not that good.
review_title: extremetely expensive for the food that served.

review: This is a prix fix menu with an exorbitant price.  Unlike some restaurants that "perform," this place is all about the food.  It comes in small bites and regularly.  It's not overwhelming -  but you never feel like you're waiting for the next course.  In addition to the courses we expected several other tidbits, palate cleansers, and treats were served.  We were seated at our table on a U-shaped sofa (it accommodated 2 tables seating 2 couples.)  Even with pillows, you aren't comfortably close to the table.  Serving plates were of a rustic sort and didn't go with the rest of the restaurant decor.  Waiters all wear the same ill-fitting charcoal jackets, as if selected from a closet - the first to get there, get the ones that fit.

Okay so first off the price is a bit on the out-there scale for me.  Roughly $700 for two!  However, it really was worth it, I mean every dish was outstanding!  It is a place that will remain in my memories for a long time.  Not many great restaurants in "The City" can do that for me.  Places like Gary Danko did not come close to this place in the food experience.  Honestly,  the worst part of the dinner for me was the coffee which I ordered with dessert, defiantly not worth the $8.  Yet, every other part of the service and food presented was top notch and handled with care.      If I had the income I would be back again.  However, it will be a place reserved for resetting the high bar of food experience that all others continue to miss.

Coi invites you to pay attention to the wonders of what can happen inside your mouth. A series of small plates play with contrasts, texture, and color---sweet and salty, pungent and airy, citrus and smooth---so one slows down---to enter a mindful eating zone, to explore nuance and try to figure out origins.

The service is attentive but not pretentious. Coi will close in January to freshen its decor. A good idea. The food, the intimacy, the informality make Coi a unique pleasure.

We loved our experience at Coi. From the moment we walked in, we felt warmly welcomed, and the exceptional service continued throughout the evening. Each dish was prepared to perfection. Highly recommended!

From a service perspective, Coi really earns its Michelin stars...and most dishes are really great...i can't give it 5 stars though, because it missed the mark on the main course, the Lamb. Most of the other dishes were really excellent, but I found myself fighting with the lamb...trying to cut it, trying to separate it from the mass of fat it had on it.

The wine pairing were quite good; almost all of them were perfect. I'd recommend it, and really did enjoy it, but it wasn't amazing.
incredible evening and perfect for the special occasion we were celebrating

Lots of trendy places offer fixed price 7+ course meals. Coi is unique. The menu fit together in a way even Paris three-star places like Le Meurice do not achieve. Not every dish is a "wow" dish, but they have character. Only room for provement is the wine pairing. The two Hungarian wines don't make the grade.

I really, really wanted to love Coi.  I have heard such amazing things about it.  But it just didn't really live up to the praise.  The food was fairly uninventive, but well-executed.  Service was exceptional.  I came with my son, and we were treated very nicely.  Ultimately, the food must be exciting, and i just didnt see it.  I feel sacrilegious saying it, but I need to be honest about my view.  I would return eventually because it had promise, but at the price point they were charging, it warrants a special (truly special) occasion.  I prefer other restaurants that are taking massive risks to present great food like atelier crenn and commonwealth.  Coi has a good reputation, but needs to put out food that is better.

Food was good, but not as good as Benu or La Folie. All dishes were good, with some interesting ideas/combinations, but just not there in the end. For example, the asparagus soup was an excellent replicant of the thai soup, tom yung goong. Didn't come here to eat something I can get somewhere else.
review_title: Food was good, but not as

review: Coi is without peer when it comes to creativity. We had the Christmas Eve pre-fix dinner; nine courses. We have dined out approximately twice per week for the past 25 years and have encountered many unique combinations. But virtually every course at Coi had one or more ingredients that we had not previously experienced. We like to try different things, so this was a strong favorable point. For those who are highly knowledgeable about foods and cooking, Coi will be unbeatable. For less sophisticated tastes, however, the ultimate question is whether the chef, however creative, leaves the patron feeling as though they had a good satisfying meal. Here Coi falls short. Its portions are very small. Triple two of the courses, please.

My dinner partner and I went to Qui and were extremely diappointed. By the by, the tasting bill was $700. Never the cost of dining at Gary Danko's or La Folie. The portions were miniscule. I giess we didn't realize we were stuck with a tasting menu and no opportunity to order of the menu..which didn't exist. We were advised that "chef likes to surprise you". When I'm going to what is billed as a top-notch resaurant, I don't want to be surprised. As to the service, one had to beg them for some bread..a slice at a time...and beg for a glasd of red wine for my partner who didn't want all the whites that came with the tasting menu. I would never, ever go back here again. I tought it was the Emperors New Clothes.
review_title: My dinner partner and I went

review: Our second time there. A fabulous splurge. Perfect food (although I'd ditch the buttered popcorn in the one dish). Open your wallet and put yourselves in their hands, wine and all.

Went there as a couple. Amazing eleven course meal that took my taste buds on a rollercoaster ride. Great service and great wine pairings for the meal. This is a really different experience with high quality preparation, ingredients and great service.
review_title: Went there as a couple. Amazing

review:
The food is clearly the star at Coi. The list of local ingredients on the inside of the menu next to the list of courses speaks volumes about what makes Coi exceptional. Add to that unique palate experiences with temperature (who knew?) and each dish is a delightful surprise.
I haven't had my mind blown like this since dining in Paris. If you're a foodie, do not miss this fantastic opportunity.
review_title: The food is clearly the star

review: Wonderful meal, great service. Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

Coi is pronounced "cwah" as we discovered after our puzzled San Franciscan friends couldn't remember a local restautant called "coy." Regardless of its name, this restaurant is nothing less than impeccable. A multi-course, fixed menu treats the diners to only the freshest, simpliest ingredients executed cleanly and beautifully.
Coi is the type of restaurant that is best appreciated by the hard-core foodie, specifically the types who are willing to ask few questions, spend big dollars and sit back and let the chef dazzle them. If you insist on altering the menu to meet your own personal preferences, you will be certainly missing out on the culinary portrait that the chef is painting for you. Just go. Just eat. And be wowed!

I was very disappointed with Coi. The food was average at best. Our waiter was one of the worst I've had in San Francisco - ever. It is WAY over priced for what you get. Nothing special at all and I would not go again.

Of all the high end restaurants I've been to, this gets the lowest on my scale. The food was salty and unmemorable. If you'd like to spend a load of cash hoping for a good dinner, skip this restaurants...instead go to Quince or the many other restaurants in the city.
review_title: Of all the high end restaurants

review: The meal was VERY interesting but in some ways not satisfying. The portions were perfect through the 10-13 course meal. The ingredients were fresh and obviously well selected. The cuisine itself was inspiring but I felt less than satisfied with the mix of flavours and textures in the end. I need to try it again perhaps.

Amazing food and impeccable service. The food/ flavors, and presentation were unbelievable. A true dining experience. But I was not a big fan of the dining room setup and ambiance. The style and the two rows of tables was flat, but I guess they needed to maximize the space. I would have rather eaten in the lounge.
There seems to be no end to Daniel Patterson's creativity. Every dish was an explosion of taste, color and texture. This restaurant is not to be missed.
review_title: There seems to be no end to

review:
If you want to spend a lot of money for very small portions of eclectic, meticulously presented food, this is the place to go. We are huge food and wine lovers and eat out multiple times a week. There was not a single dish that we could call outstanding in taste-interesting, yes, outstanding (like "I want some more")-no!

Also, beware of the corkage fees. First bottle $25, 2nd bottle $50. Wine list is limited.

We had high expectations and were very disppointed.
review_title: If you want to spend a lot

review: Fabulous adventurous fare for foodies. Definitely opt for the wine+ pairings.

Our party of four avid 'foodies' appreciated the extreme thoughtfulness and care taken with each dish. The staff was very knowledgeable about the intricate ingredients and the preparation. This is a place for people who are serious about food, quality ingredients and beautiful preparation. Excellent!

This is the best restaurant in San Francisco. End of story. 

We have been to Coi several times, and as we told the chef, after each visit we think the food can't get better, but it does. Paul is a wonderful sommelier, also. 

Thanks very much for creating this extraordinary dining experience. We are most appreciative. We also really appreciate that you give us the private dining room. My husband is hard of hearing and the room is perfect for him, since the walls damp out the sound.
Pera was recommended by a friend and what a find it is!  Amazing flavors and presentation.  We will become regulars!
We have had dinner here many times & always enjoy the food. Everytime we bring a new group here they are hooked on Pera

Wow! What a treat! I took a group for lunch here  after a volunteer event and we had a blast. The food was very fresh, delicately spiced with generous servings, the menu suited a broad range of taste preferences, dietary styles. The service was quite quick. The wait staff were friendly and helpful - one of our group had a disability that needed special accommodation that was graciously taken care of without asking. There were cushy pillows on the end lining the wall, , music add to the ambience. We had such a good time that we sat and chatted after the meal without feeling hustled to leave. Definitely worthy of many repeat visits and I was pleased to note that they offer catering services. My only regret was not sampling the desserts.

A gem mediterranean on Townsend, I was invited to a birthday party last Saturday night and came today for a quick lunch as I work close by, they have so many appetizers and I love the mint lemonade freshly made in the house.

Food was good, but not dynamite. The noise level was way too high. I enjoy a lively atmosphere, and it wasn't the noise of other patrons in the open area that was bothersome. The music was ridiculously loud,
review_title: Good food but way too loud

review: This was a great find. Brunch was awesome and you can never go wrong with bottomless mimosas. The atmosphere was really awesome as well.
review_title: This was a great find. Brunch was awesom...

review: We dined as a party of 4 on a Friday night and the music was so loud I could not hear a single person at our table, it was embarrassing as I selected the restaurant. The service was nice, Sea Bass very good, just the wrong setting for us to have a nice meal with friends. Caramel, Bacon popcorn was very good though, as was the Mac & Cheese.

This is the not the first time Ive been here and every time Im more satisfied than the previous visit. 

The service is always friendly and fast! The servers never hover but are always available when you need them for whatever reason. 

The crab is superb! Super fresh and sweet! I always get it piping hot with the cajun sauce and a mild heat. Be warned, their "mild" is pretty hot. And one must always get a basket or 2 of bread to soak up all that awesome sauce! For extra flavour, you can add sausage as well!
Addicting!! Crawfish is in season and they are delicious. The staff is very friendly. Sometimes the food takes a bit, but it's worth it!

Yuzu had an interesting menu, with choices not seen in most suburban Japanese restaurants. The corn tempura appetizer was unusual and tasty. The sushi and sashimi was fresh and nicely prepared. And the special lobster roll was delicious. Enjoyable meal. We will be back!

The lightly grilled yellowtail cheek was fabulous. And you simply must get the eggplant with chicken.

Yuzu also pleases by having a relatively low noise level and really nice jazz in the background. Love this place.
We had a reservation for 3:45, but when we entered the restaurant we were impolitely informed that the service starts at 4:30.
review_title: Didn't get food, much hunger, very sad

review:
Unfortunately this wasn't it. The food was made spicy with chili oil rather than spicy ingredients. The secret to good Szechuan food is that the chilis are usually burned to drive off the harsh spiciness and results in a hearty spiciness that doesn't burn the lips. They don't know that secret. Uncooked red chilis and chili flakes abound. The spice was harsh and not flavorful. 

Go find a PF Chang's. It is much closer to authentic Szechuan food.
review_title: I wanted a good Szechuan restaurant.

review: Off the beaten track, but located next to two very good restaurants. Staff was very friendly, and the upstairs decor was very inviting. However, the kitchen needs to up its game. Portions were unecessarily huge, making the prospect of eating an appetizer followed by a main course intimidating. The food needs more seasoning. Mac and cheese starter and meatloaf main course were both bland, and the gumbo needs more than just heat to make it into a great dish.  Pick it up and the restaurant will be full.

My husband and I chose this restaurant for our two-year anniversary dinner after reading all the recommendations on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed - the food was delicious and the staff made us feel special. Even though seating on the upstairs balcony that I had requested was not available, they gave us a beautiful candle-lit table on the ground floor that was so romantic. And the food - wow! I have lived in the South all of my life and never eaten better cheese grits and fried chicken. Amazing.

Firefly offers diversity on a Fresh Fish Island! From South Georgia bbq to New Orleans catfish platters to a Charleston-Savannah shrimp and grits feast....Fire Fly has you covered.

Enjoy Southern cooking from grandma's cabin in a Caribbean Island Community with deep historic Spanish roots.

Opening weeks are challenging for any new restauarant, but Firefly exceeded expectations on all counts....delectable gumbo (consistent at both experiences), oyster po boy (only at brunch) wonderfully presented with bacon aoili, heirloom tomato salad with thin shavings of watermelon radishes (yum!); delightful and attentive service, and an interesting and affordable wine program. A definite addition to my list of Key West favorites....congratulations to Tricia and Chef Michael. You've achieved that illusive goal of Southern hospitality......you made my welcome warm, my stay nurturing, and my desire to return again and again, compelling.
The place was empty on Saturday noon; sketchy neighborhood. Decent food but it seemed everyone came there just for us and were surprised to see customers. Not a place I'd go back to,
Mario was a fabulous waiter, giving us just the right amount of attention (there when needed, but not overbearing). He was altogether professional, friendly, affable, and knowledgable.
Excellent service from Aaron!  He is worth the trip to Fog City.

Fog City Diner was one of my favorite spots when I lived in SF years ago.  Returned this week with friends on their first trip to SF...and her birthday.  I wanted something iconically SF and fun...so, I was hoping that Fog City would come through for me again.  And how!!!  We had a fabulous dinner there...in no small part to our waiter, Perry, who took charge of a "family style" meal for us of a selection of wonderful dishes he combined to celebrate my friend's birthday...along with a perfect wine selection and finished off by an exquisite port.  The dishes were classics but with the Fog City extras..perfect ingredients from the local blue cheese in the radicchio and frisee salad to a ribeye steak that was melt in your mouth fantastic.
Wonderful updated menu form Fog City Diner days. Crab cakes and lamb were fabulous. Burger a bit overdresses and soggy, but good quality beef and cheese. Nice casual ambiance, convenient location
Friendly staff, great drinks menu and amazing food. Seems very popular, glad I booked in advance.

The Taxi driver misheard and was more concerned with his ongoing phone conversation such that he dropped us off at Fog City rather than Fog Harbor-Pier39 where we told him. I hadn't been here since the late 80's when it was Fog City Diner and we decided to stop in and have a drink before hiking .7m down the Embarcadero.
The Wines on Tap are novel and I love my Reds slightly chilled. We started looking at the menu and the items were exactly what we had been looking for in our San Francisco experience so we decided to stay. We weren't disappointed in the least and my wife just kept saying Yummy! Try the Wild Boar Ribs and Slaw. Wow!
The service was outstanding and not intrusive.

I've always loved this location, but the food had declined over the years. So I'm really delighted that they have reworked the menu and bar options to better display the best of the Bay Area. We started with two incredible vegetable dishes - Brussel sprouts and cauliflower - and then shared a huge tender pork chop and perfectly cooked fish. We also enjoyed our cocktails which were slight twists on classics. And of course there was the incredible view. The only false note was at the end when the waiter brought us a "birthday dessert" and never offered us the full dessert menu, coffee or after dinner drinks. Management should review this policy since the outcome doesn't match the intention.

We were recommended to Fog City from a friend when we traveled from out of town to visit San Francisco. Wow, this was by far the best meal of our trip. Clean, fresh cocktails, delicious and unique food -- A+++. Jose' was our server and did a great job. I suggest making a reservation for dinner, the crowd was popping at 8:00 on a Thursday night. Thank you for such a wonderful experience that made our vacation that much better!

Updated menu is really good, while still having old standards from the original menu. Brought the kids and food appeals to grown ups as well as the kids. The new menu is for family style, which is great, but the menu is confusing as to portion size, and our waiter was no help at all. When asked how many people the dishes served, his reply was "it depends on how hungry you are"... Not very helpful. Sure, the "whole chicken" was obvious, but to figure out how many appetizers and sides and mains for a group of 10 was quite challenging. Items were listed in order from smaller to larger, but without guides for how many they serve. Nonetheless, excellent updated comfort food. Loved it, clueless servers aside.

I love the recreated Fog City. Food was incredible and service was really good at the table. Every thing we ordered was really tasty and had good favors. The restaurant was hopping too. I am glad we had a reservation. I love this sf institution. I thought the expansion might take away from the ambiance but it still felt cozy. Hostess could work a little harder. She had to ask my name three times over the period of fifteen minutes.
service from waited was fine but the maitre d a bit difficult Food excellent

Excellent revamped menu. Everything we had was outstanding, peppers exploded with flavor, crispy Brussels sprouts, clams with a sauce that requires extra bread, planked trout which I would walk a plank for, juicy lamb skewers in lettuce wraps followed by a apple crisp with crispy heat.

The revamped restaurant has a warmer atmosphere. The interior was done very nicely. Service was superb, thanks to Brandon. The food was good; all plates are meant to be shared family-style which gave us the opportunity to sample a number of dishes. Deviled eggs, fig salad and baked clams were delicious. The hazelnuts with smoked paprika were very tasty, but just a bit too much for a table for two. The lamb skewers were not what we expected; it reminded me of lettuce-wrapped chicken from the Cheesecake Factory; we'll stay away from those next time. My husband thought the cocktail menu was creative and he plans on trying more the next time we're there. We'll definitely be back.

Went here on a double-date.  Big mistake - although we all got a good laugh out of it.  The ambiance isn't that nice - which is a shame because the food is actually pretty good.  They also had a very limited selection of alcohol.  A few wines and beers - that's it.
Really nice space, menu and dishes, and an overall great experience. Would recommend this to friends and colleagues visiting San Francisco. Get the ribs!
review_title: Great spot. Would definitely go back.

review: I came here with some foodie colleagues from out of town. Our meal was just stunning. All dishes were unique and perfectly crafted. I loved the wide range of flavores and ingredients. Our cocktails were some of the very best I have had and service was immaculate. I will be back as often as possible.
review_title: My new favorite restauant in sf

review: We were very excited to try out this restaurant and came for dinner. The place looks nice and intimate. And the service was very lovely. The only thing negative was the food. My husband had the chicken, it was undercooked. I had the air dried beef; i found many pips. Then we ordered the fig & chocolate dessert (with peanut butter). It was way too salty! It's unlikely we would come back
Carnivore husband was delighted by marvelous flavors of vegetarian dishes - cleaned his plate!

Beautiful space. Delicious food. Excellent service. Friendly staff. Great ambiance. Overall, a wonderful dining experience. Would definitely come back! Make sure to get the Koji Quail, Beef Rib in broth, Meatballs in black mole, Swordfish and the beets!!

Love your new restaurant! Having enjoyed Gather (all the way over there in Berkeley!!!) a few times, I was delighted to find Verbena of similar excellence and tasty, healthy delight. Good dining ahead for those who try Verbena. Soon it will be over run with enthusiastic repeat diners like myself!

Took a pretty girl here for a first date. We walked out hand in hand, kissing, so I'd say it was a success. Great service, mediocre food (the kale pizza was so-so, the empanadas were better), good wine, comfortable couches with plenty of room to tease and flirt and get cozy. It was dead on a Sunday night, maybe 5 other couples in the whole place. So it was nice and quiet and we could relax, take our shoes off and be ourselves.
The food was excellent.  We will be back again very soon.

From the initial booking to closing out the bill, the customer service was excellent. Hostess and manager onsite were extremely accommodating for SuperBowl Sunday -giving us opportunity to sit directly below the TVs and turning up the volume w/out turning it into sports bar craziness. Bartender was authentic -based on where he was from, his excitement to create and offer unique and spot on margaritas for the group and engagement and excitement for what he specialized in. Love the decor/ambiance/vibe/energy of the place/staff/offering. Excited for Sanbrosa and what it is offering /bringing to the old Marina.
We had the chef's five course dinner along with the wine pairing.   The choices and pairings were awesome.   Great dining experience.

We came to found out they only had a tasting menu of 4 options and 1 dessert.. blackberries and beets, trout, veal and sunchokes with a poorly cooked store bought egg. strawberry and basil ice cream. sounds good right? Not at all. had to ask for salt. couldn't really eat it at all and all those chefs looking pretty for all that. ? please.. they comped my meal because I did not like but I was hoping to pay and like it better.
Nico was a treat. It was super good. A lot of fun with the food and the ambiance and everything - it was my girlfriend's birthday, fun times.
review_title: Nico was a treat. It was super good. A l...

review: This place is already a neighborhood gem, and lives up to the lofty SFChron review.  The food is exceptional, and the setting is very charming. I wasn't sure what to expect since the chef is French trained, but think more California in terms of his cuisine (likely reflecting his stints at restaurants such as Manresa).  Flavors were very balanced, and none of the dishes that we had were overly rich, so no food coma despite a number of courses.  The wine pairings are very good as well, and the cost of our meal, considering that we had wine pairings, was reasonable considering the high quality of the food.
review_title: This place is already a neighborhood gem...

review:
Now 4 months since opening, with lots of praise from all directions, we had a mixed experience. Outstanding service and great wine choice. Food was imaginative and beautifully presented but "what were they thinking?" in a few places. Raw asparagus with crab made both the crab and the wine taste off. Same idea in artichoke with lamb tongue.
We still had a great time, and suspect that the wild ideas will be toned down a bit as time goes on.

Asked for chef's choice of nigiri. They brought out some appetisers anyway (confusing, but don't think we were charged). Pumpkin soup (decent) and some carrot and overcooked fish (not decent). First 6 pieces of nigiri had so much wasabi in it we couldn't even taste the fish. It was a challenge just trying to eat it. The amount of wasabi was toned down after (maybe the waiter saw us all cringing? Maybe they changed the chef?) The best pieces were the ones we picked ourselves after, and those were good but not great. Priced like Sushi Sasabune but totally lacking the quality. Our waiter told us the names of the fish we were eating but didn't explain anything about them. Would not recommend, total waste of time and money.
The best sushi establishment I can every hope for... delicious, thought, masterful, creative and fresh as it gets!!!
Food was excellent, wine list is interesting and well-priced, staff was incredibly nice.
review_title: Food was excellent, wine list is interes...

review: portions were smaller than expected, but food was scrumptious!!
My girlfriend and I went in there to celebrate our one year anniversary last sunday and had an amazing experience with the best server

Literally the first time I came here everyone was so freindly and amazing. The food was fantasitic. Honestly I feel everyone should eat here. The atmosphere was great as well. The food will bring you to a whole different world. Hands down one of my favorite places and I've went back ever since!! I just can't get enough!
What a surprise! Excellent food, despite a limited menu. The service is excellent!!
A flawless dining experience. Thoughtful design executed perfectly, start to finish.

place is decent, with some reservations. wines we tried were good not great. draft beer list was small and odd [lots of bottles]. waiter was GREAT. but busboys kept trying to clear 1/2 finished plates of food.. back off! portions are VERY small. im not looking to get gut bombed but guys.. serve up a little food. my very petite female date agreed. presentations were lovely if a bit overly done. i prefer rustic, honest to manicured. flavors were nice but all dishes seemed to need something else / more. duck, salmon, octopus, beet salad were all ok but not great. small portions, fussy presentations and dishes all seemed to need another element. room is sparsely decorated, needs more to break it up, give it character and warmth. tile floor fail

So glad to have found this pop-up on Open Table.  The dinner party set-up worked really well, whether or not you chose to socialize.

The tasting menu was outstanding and the wine pairing was a great way to enjoy it.  You can BYOB or purchase from their wine list.  Although
we had none, they do ask about any dietary issues.

Before they move to their permanent space, don't miss this intimate opportunity to experience some great food!
review_title: So glad to have found this pop-up on Ope...

review: Place is very small and cute, food is pretty good and wine is fine. Just a tad pricey but worth the trip.

The location and ambience of the restaurant is great.  The food was strange combinations (pork and clams) and not at all appetizing. We had trout (that looked like salmon), a fatty tasteless piece of pork, and mushrooms in some sort of gruel. The only menu item I can recommend is a cocktail, their version of the moscow mule.
One should be created for Alta. Names escape me, but the ingredients never shall? Truly chef-like creations! Will try Barrel-aged cocktails next time!
The service was great and we had a good time. The food was really tasty, but too rich for me. If you like really strong flavors, and plenty of salt and butter, then you'll love it.

The dcor is very interesting and fun. Their menu is meant to share, which is a great way to try a variety of different dishes. We were underwhelmed by the food, though. Only one of the more than ten dishes we ordered was memorable. Also, the service was extremely slow.  It was worth trying once but I dont need to return.
It's wonderful to find a neighborhood gem that delivers on all counts: outstanding food, service, ambiance and value. Will be returning here many times in the future!
Friendly, fun, and excellent! food!  authentic Italian food. Parking can be a challenge so take public transportation.
review_title: Friendly, fun, and excellent! food!  aut...

review: They don't accept (like?) credit cards. Otherwise an ok place with ok pasta and pizzas. Reasonable prized.

My husband and I dined here before the symphony. It is not right on Hayes Street so I think it gets less foot traffic so many people don't know it is here (we didn't), but we found this to be a wonderful experience! I am Italian and was raised eating handmade pastas and my mother's delicious cooking, so I know Italian food! At Il Borgo, I had the most delicious homemade gnocci! My husband enjoyed penne with an excellent sausage and mushroom sauce. We loved our arugula salad and the tiramisu was the best we've ever had! I am looking forward to trying more things on their menu next time we are in the Hayes Valley area. I have been to both Cafe Delle Stelle and Stelline and neither of those restaurants can compare with Il Borgo. It's the best!

We made reservations for 5:30 but when we arrived the restaurant was dark and locked. There was another woman waiting outside who seemed to be associated wih the restaurant, but not sure how. Finally after several minutes a waitress showed up, but gave us attitude about being there before they opened. When we pointed out that the posted hours stated that they opened at 5, she shrugged us off without an explanation. I can't imagine this place will be around too much longer if this is how they run it.
Food was great, beer & wine selection was great, service was a kinda slow
review_title: Food was great, beer & wine selection wa...

review: Dollar oyster happy hour! Great ambiance and good group seating options.
review_title: Dollar oyster happy hour! Great ambiance...

review: We ate here before going to the Orpheum Theater. Good option since not much else in the area. Waitress was nice and helpful. Food was generally quite interesting and tasty. We didn't love the egg hopper, which was recommended, but the kale salad, octopus, okra, cod and duck dishes were all good. The chocolate dessert was also excellent and my husband loved the black lager beer. We got there early, because we were going to the theater, so it was empty when we arrived. A very large party arrived while we were there, but we were in a back room that can be screened off to block out some of the noise. Seems like it can become a very lively place and the decor is nice.

Expand your repertoire of dining experiences.  Sri Lankan food is wonderful and 1601 Bar & Kitchen certainly does it justice.  We enjoyed a delightfully tasty meal, artfully presented, and with excellent service.  I'll be going back for sure.  Make this your next gastronomic discovery.  This restaurant deserves SF prominence. To make things even better, there was ample parking nearby.

rest_name: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
review:
The Good:

As the title says, the food here is great.  We had escargot and a lobster tail as an appetizer, which were perfectly prepared.  For our meals, we had the stuffed prawns and the salmon.  The salmon was phenomenal and was prepared perfectly.  You could cut it like butter.  The prawns were a little over seasoned with garlic for my taste, but still a very good option.  If you are just wanting an honest food review, I would tell you that it is great seafood, but now for what should give you pause ...

The Bad:

We arrived at 7 pm for our reservation on a Saturday night and were immediately seated.  The restaurant was about 3/4 full at best and the bar was empty.  The table we were sat at was in the front of the restaurant between the window and the door so we were forced us to sit next to each other rather than across from one another.  This was not a big deal as it just made for an interesting dining experience.  We were immediately asked if we wanted water.  However, it took 15 minutes for the water to arrive.  When it did arrive, we put in our order and asked for bread, since we had no idea how long it would take as we overheard others joking about how long it was taking to receive their food.  

Could it really be that bad? Yes. Despite putting in our appetizer and food order in at approximately 7:15, the appetizers did not arrive until 8:15 (we checked our watches) and the food until after 8:40. Yes, that was an hour wait for the apps and nearly an hour and a half wait for our food.  In that time, we witnessed one other table get their complete meal (including dessert) despite being sat after us and another table that was sat before us still waiting on their meals.  We also witnessed three couples get up and leave before their orders were ever taken because they waited so long.  It was so bad that the tables were joking with one another about the poor service.  

So, if you can stand bad service, then I would recommend this place for their food.

rest_name: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
review: Needed to change our reservation twice. Once because our schedule changed and once because we could not find any parking. Ended up taking a cab and the restaurant called us one upon leaving. They were very accommodating.
review_title: Small but good food and service

rest_name: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
review: This restaurant gave off a very New York neighborhood place vibe. It was very small but the food quality and service were great. One slight disappointment was the lobster bisque. Everyone raves about it and while it wasnt bad - it was not the "to die for" experience that others have raved about. It was thin and not amazingly flavorful. The fish main courses were super.

rest_name: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
review: I am not really sure what to make of Hyde Street Seafood. Their signature dish is a parchment cooked fish selections. It sounded great when I reviewed their menu but the execution left a lot to be desired. It was not bad by any means but it was just fair, nothing more, nothing less. The server was nice and I must say the bread was very good. You need more though than good bread to be worth a return trip in SF. We actually found a great hole in the wall Chinese place across the street - U Lee. The kids were still starving after dining at Hyde Street so we popped over to U Lee and got take out. It was fabulous! So not totally a wasted trip.....
review_title: I am not really sure what

rest_name: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
review: For starters, the service is outstanding. Employees were kind, attentive and helpful. Our party of four was seated in front of the window and enjoyed the trolley cars and traffic passing by. I enjoyed the halibut in parchment, a house specialty. It was very flavorful, with a slight asian seasoning, cooked perfectly, with assorted vegetables in the "parchment". I did find it unusual to have potatoes included in the mix! The other entrees all looked good and I was told they were tasty as well, along with the lobster bisque as a starter. The only negative here - and it is a big one - the lack of parking. Open Table indicated "street parking". Not being a local, I did not realize this was near impossible. Opt for public transport!!

rest_name: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
review: Good value restaurant with nice ambiance, try the specialty 'en papiotte' dishes

rest_name: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
review:
The decor is truly nautical. Service was fine - a bit slow at times, but they were very nice. The real reason to go to Hyde's is for the En Papillote dishes - absolutely fabulous flavors and large servings.

I'd go back just to try each one they offer.

rest_name: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
review: We love exploring neighborhood eateries in SF. This was one of those excursions. The oysters were great, and the family had a good time. We'd come back!

rest_name: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
review: Great food at lower prices, what else can I say? We were late to our reservation because we rode the cable car there, which was a time consuming novelty. As a result, we were forgotten about for a period, but it was certainly worth the wait.

rest_name: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
review: We had an excellent meal on Christmas eve. Delicious Lobster Bisque and perfectly cooked Sea Bass with fresh veggies and an excellent Honig Sauvignon Blanc. Great attentive service by Brian completed an outstanding experience.
review_title: We had an excellent meal on

rest_name: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
review: Delicious food. Wouldn't mind returning back for more.

rest_name: Hyde Street Seafood House & Raw Bar
review: We went specifically for the oyster happy hour on weekdays 5 to 7PM when raw oysters are only $1 each. There are only 2 of us, we sat down for 4 dozen, does that say enough? I can't wait until we get to the city and return for more!!!! We went in the dead of winter right at the opening hour, it was very cold inside the restaurant so dining was quite uncomfortable. There were 2 heating lamps, but these would hardly cover the entire restaurant. I ordered coffee when we first sat down to try and warm up, our waitress kept saying she'd be back to refill my cup, unfortunately the only cup I received was the first. Normally, I would expect this if they were busy, but we were only one of two couples dining.

Since this is a highly-rated hotel, I expected to dining room to be expensive, but $5 for a cup of Peet's coffee seemed excessive.  The servings were small and the food mediocre.  An appetizer of beets and burrata had a few tiny pieces of beets spread over the plate and a blob of burrata.  It was very disappointing and I won't return.  The best thing about the room was that it was quiet.
review_title: Since this is a highly-rated hotel, I ex...

review: Not bad. Good place for a drink after work, but definitely an older crowd - not a "hot spot." Food was OK (NE clam chowder excellent). With near infinite SF choices, I wouldn't make a return visit a high priority.

It was a birthday gift to my daughter Maia and she brought her hubbie Jason. Fabulous. They actually gave her a dessert of truffles with happy birthday written, she could not have been more pleased. He loves Gin and Tonic and they have a special menu for that. They thought it was terrific: food, ambiance, special venue, what a nice choice and success. Thank you for responding to my call to make her birthday special special as I think she is real special. Helene Winkler (mom)
Great place for a quiet meeting. Food is solid- with some interesting asian takes like the asian style ceasar salad.
review_title: Great place for a quiet meeting.

review: Sloppy sushi eaters will be disappointed, as they do not give you the typical mountain of wasabi or deep dish of soy.  The chef handles this himself, and uses salt crystals instead of soy most of the time.  The fish is very high quality, and priced well.
review_title: Excellent fish, served without wasabi or soy.

review: Awesome awesome! Food. Awesome awesome! service. Awesome awesome! looking place. This is my new spot!

address: 1096 South Van Ness AvenueSan Francisco, CA  94110
review: We had a group of 10 people for a birthday on a Friday night and had an overall fun experience. The food was well prepared, very tasty and be aware of the deep dish pizza as it is massive. However, there were a few issues with the service that made the experience a bit less than exceptional. Nothing major but just a bit of attitude adjustments that will hopefully be worked out as the restaurant works out its kinks (less than a year old). The mini golf was great and very well designed/produced.
review_title: Overall fun experience but some service issues

address: 1096 South Van Ness AvenueSan Francisco, CA  94110
review:
Went here on a Monday night with a group of five. The hostess seated us quickly, but didn't initially acknowledge the OpenTable res. the waitress came by and it was clear she was new and a bit of a deer in the headlights. Not very knowledgeable and nervous.

We ordered our food, a pizza, jambalaya, a squash dish and several beers. Everything came out in a timely manner. The jambalaya was tasty, the pizza a bit bland and a poor representation of Chicago-style deep dish. 

The atmosphere was nice though, and the mini golf downstairs was a lot of fun.

It seems that there are some early kinks that need to be worked out, but I'll probably be back.
review_title: Fun, ok food, new venue issues

review: The food tasted good but it took very long to get to our table. We planned to order more food but it took almost an hour to get 3-4 riolls. It almost an hour and a half to get a sashimi platter. I literally had to ask 2-3 times for each. It was not overly busy. It was simply poorly managed. The waitress was nice but didn't seem too concerned. Maybe they need more chefs. Food was good but overall Bad experience.

It was our first time eating here and we didn't really know what to expect. Our reservation was for 530 so we were the first people in the restaurant when it opened. The restaurant began to fill up incredibly quickly, but our server remained extremely attentive throughout the whole dinner. The food exceeded our expectations, and I would go so far as to say that this was some of the best Japanese food I have had in San Francisco, especially considering the price. Overall this was a great experience, and we most certainly will be returning patrons.
review_title: It was our first time eating here and we...

review:
I was in SF for business on my own and really wanted a relaxed Japanese meal. I found this place on Opentable and figured I'd give it a go. I was really impressed. Its not too easy to find somewhere with a really good izakaya style menu, but they had all my faves. The okonomiyaki was fantastic, as was the tako wasabi and the hamachi kama. Also they have a happy hour until 7pm.

Highly recommended.

We have wanted to go to Saison for a long time and had heard great things about their food.  We finally went this weekend and it lives up to everything we've heard.  It was one of the best meals we've had!  The beverage choices are super.  A big list of drafts but decided to get some of their special cocktails.  One was like an old fashion and I got the gin and tonic with their homemade tonic.  So good we had to have a second.  My wife got the pork chop which was so tender and delicious.  I got the duck confit which was excellent.  Best ever!  Can't wait to go back.  Some truly unique dishes.  Wait staff knowledgable and friendly.  Thanks!

After two failed beer ordering attempts bc they were out of both at 7 on a Friday. My meal started off less than great.  Food was great but a little pricey for the portion size. Tables are very close together so I had to move my chair a couple of times to let someone to get to their table bc my chair and their table practically touched.  Everyone liked their meals. Probably would go back and just sit at the bar for more room.

Came with a party of three for drinks and dinner and was underwhelmed. Simply put: not accommodating! Food was decent, but was unable to make any substitutions to my meal. Came at the end of happy hour and b/c the place is so small and the happy hour crowd was in full effect, my party and I had a hard time having a conversation due to the noise. Was surprised that they we're not able to handle basic drink requests (no olives for a martini, no Tanqueray for a gin & tonic, and their homemade tonic tasted like "fizzy OJ", which made my GT taste very different than I am used to. Maybe my underwhelming experience was due to my expectation for the place; however, I don't plan on going back. Only one member of my party rated it highly.
Bartlett Hall has great options for food and drinks, and is especially good for groups! I highly recommend this venue for birthdays, special occasions, going away parties, etc.
review_title: Great food and drink for groups!

review: This place makes every effort to be cool and very proud of their menu.  After telling us about all the good things they have, he proceeded to tell us about all the items they were out of.  It took an hour for us to get our food and the waiter disappeared in between.  The $22 personal pizzas seemed a bit over priced and a bit below the skill of their highly touted chef.

We were a bit disappointed.  The food was good, but not good enough to come back.  The staff was actually the best part of the experience.  Very nice and cordial.  The belly dancer was less than enthusiastic.  She did not know how to draw the crowd in. Most people in the audience paid little or no attention to her.  I understand that belly dancers quite often carry a little weight around the middle.  That is expected.  This dancer however was very heavy and lacked fluid body movements that you would expect.
Found this restaurant within a short walk from the theater. Service was ok. Food was great. Belly dancer was enchanting. I'll return soon. :)
Two of our three dishes were very good and the third one which is the halibut could have been better. Good wine by the glass.

The food was fantastic.  I had the pork belly upon the recommendation of our server and it did not disappoint.  I also ordered the pork chop which was cooked to perfection.  The portion was humongous and I was able to make a very tasty pork chop breakfast scramble with my leftovers.  Our server was also really attentive and helpful with her suggestions.  A neighborhood gem and I will surely be back.
Food was good, wine was good, service was good. Just good. The acoustics are terrible, and there was worthless music(?) blaring during our entire stay.

Hits all the high marks if you want to dine with friends and share great food, enjoy conversation, and be well attended to. We had one waitperson who was grumpy, but she dropped out fast and all the rest were superior! Let's hope the grump was just having a bad night, like we all do. I can't say enough good things about the guy managing the front door: he made us feel at home, and seemed most appreciative that we were there. We liked that! All good. Give this place a shot!
review_title: A gem. Reasonably quiet, great food, intimate.

review: Good wines, great apps, and I had the roasted chicken... wow.  The GF had the pasta and sausage, strong work there too!
We had an amazing dinner and the staff were so accommodating to us. Would definitely go back next time I  am in San Francisco.

This was my third time here. Very good food. The bruschetta was amazing. I had the halibut which was very very good. My daughter had the duck salad which she loved. She also had the prime rib which was very good.
We were seated next to a small very loud table.
Service was very good until they changed our waitress. Waitress number two was not that attentive.
Would definetly recommend.

Food very good.
Bizarre service.
Even kinda nice waitress left after entree,
couldn't find, with dessert offer was told she
"Was sent home", with other unknown server
"finishing up" services. I guess they wanted to save $$$,
Original server never even told us she was leaving...not best practice :(
Wonderful restaurant. Great staff. Just a great treat to come to and have a meal.

My fiancee and I enjoyed this quiet & quaint little mediterranean restaurant in San Francisco. It was in a nice neighborhood setting on Nob Hill with lots of trees surrounding it. The view was pleasant. Service was great; my swordfish was fantastic! After telling the waitres that she liked her fish flaky, my fiancee's halibut was a little undercooked in one area but otherwise tasty.

We think Frascati is one of the best restaurants in San Francisco. It was our old neighborhood gem, and we recently returned for a special night out. It was just as good as we remembered, and we were so happy to make it back and sit at our favorite seats at the bar! The food is always consistent and delicious - tasty and perfectly cooked meats with delicious glazes, vegetables, etc. We never have room for dessert because between our mains and our wine - we leave superbly sated and jolly.
We had a terrific experience at this wonderful restaurant. Most of us ordered fish that night and it was all excellent. Definitely returning when we return to the city.
Book an upstairs table if you want a romantic evening. Otherwise, get a front window table for a more lively ambiance.
excellent food plus great service made this a very special dinner. first time at restaurant but will continue to recommend and to return for dinner often!!

Lovely neighborhood restaurant. Must have a reservation as it's packed and understandably. Good food and service. Good house wine makes the price for dinner quite reasonable. Will return whenever we're in SF.

Excellent food and service. Filet Mignon and Monkfish Piccata were particularly good. Dessert selection was terrific, notably the bread pudding. Only slight issue was the temperature that evening, really warm, forced you to rush through the meal a bit.

This was our only meal in SF in our vacation. It wasn't over the top amazing, but it was good.
We had the steak and duck, both were delicious. We also had the peach and blueberry gobbled. The hubs said it was the best dessert he's ever had.
review_title: This was our only meal in

review: Excellent food - fresh flavorful ingredients expertly prepared. Best duck breast I've had in many years. Limited but good wine list. Knowledgeable waiter but had to apologize a few times about "being right back as soon as I've taken care of another table". She managed it well and we didn't feel we had to wait too long. A little noisy but conversation among 4 people was easy. Will definitely be back again and again.

The food was good but the atmosphere was lacking. Many business travelers eat here so this resturaunt is not for a nice quiet romantic dinner. The service was good but it was fast paced. There are better places to go in this area if you are looking for a somwhere romantic.
review_title: The food was good but the

review: Frascati has it all - a knowledgeable and solicitous staff, wonderful combinations of fresh ingredients, and perfect ambiance. We found the restaurant a few years ago on a walk. Since our discovery we have brought several serious foodies here - from Portland, Santa Barbara, Orinda and Lafayette. A measure of these visits is that ALL of our guests have taken OTHER friends to Frascati. Thank you, Frascati. Sincerely, Tom and Nancy Brown, Santa Barbara
review_title: Frascati has it all - a knowledgeab

review: Good food but not great. However ambiance and location are superb. Overall a good night out and better than decent food.
review_title: Good food but not great. However

review: Great dinner. Wonderful desert. Friendly, knowledgeable staff.

We had a great meal, the food was fresh & very well prepared. It was a most enjoyable evening out. I will return to this retaurant on future visits to S.F. & would highly recommend it to people looking for a small, intimate restaurant delivering high quality Italin dishes.
review_title: We had a great meal, the food

review: My wife and I did not feel the entres were great... Just ok. The appetizers and desert were amazing.
review_title: My wife and I did not feel

review: We were visiting the city for three nights over New Year's and wanted an excellent and reasonably priced dinner. We got that and then some! I feel certain that Frascati's foie gras torchon is on the menu in heaven. It was a super fine dinner from start to finish.
We really enjoyed the meal and the service by the wait staff. Everyone attended to our needs, from the bread to refilling the water.

I booked Franscati through Open Table based on reviews from others. My wife and I thought that this place was just wonderful. The waiter was knowledgeable about both the food and the wine choices and I felt we had an instant friend guiding us through our dining experience. The food was perfect and the setting was cozy and inviting. If you want a wonderful meal with great ambiance without needing to go to a "big name" place make your reservation with Franscati you will not be disappointed.

I took my husband to Frascati for his birthday and I was generally pleased... one thing that I was very disappointed about was that we did not receive the glasses of champagne that I had pre-ordered. After making my reservation on OpenTable, I called the restaurant and requested that 2 glasses of champagne be brought to the table when we arrived so that we could have a birthday toast. I also reminded the restaurant of my request when they called me to confirm the reservation on the day-of. But, when we arrived at the restaurant... no champagne. This was going to be a surprise for my husband, so he didn't miss it, but I was disappointed that a restaurant with supposedly such great service could not follow-through with this request.
review_title: I took my husband to Frascati

review: This is the one of the nicest restaurants with very high quality meals, service and ambience.
review_title: This is the one of the nicest

review: Some outstanding dishes: the duck confit salad is fabulous; so also the herb crusted rack of lamb or, when they have it, the venison. The chocolate bread pudding with hazelnut ice cream is not to be missed. Neighborhood parking, which is difficult, or a not cheap garage almost next door on Hyde.

This restaurant is located in an inner-city townhouse that looks like it used to be a residential property. As a result, the ambience is very welcoming and warm, but the space is cramped, people sit too close to each other and on a busy night it gets very noisy, just as it was when we dined there. The food is excellent and the amount of it is right - enough to get a good taste, but not enough to get too stuffed if you get carried away with your meal. The service is nothing short of excellent and the speed at which food arrives is very good, too. But I would not use the word "outstanding" to describe the experience. Just good food, good service, good quality - look elsewhere for a venue for your special event.
This place had great food and superb service. I will be coming back in the future!

Food was very good and service was excellent.  Gnocci appetizer excellent. Rack of lamb was just right and the bass was good, although I thought it was a bit bland my husband liked it.  Chocolate bread pudding dessert was fabulous.  The table we requested (on the balcony overlooking everything) was private and quiet. We shared the balcony with two other tables for 2 and one table for 4-6.  There was also an upstairs back room with several tables that looked secluded. It was fun seeing the chefs at work from above as well as previewing all the different entrees.  There were a couple of outdoor tables on the sidewalk but didn't see anyone using them - maybe a little too chilly out.  Right on the Hyde cable car line at Green.
review_title: Food was very good and service

review: One of our all time favorites - we have sent lots of friends here - it simply fabulous.
review_title: One of our all time favorites

review: Had a locals group brunch at Pescatore and the restaurant worked out well for us.  The service was friendly and prompt.  We enjoyed the brunch which worked for vegetarians, pescatarians and carnivores and was reasonably priced.

We found Pescatore using the OpenTable app. We had a great experience. Food was of high quality and nicely presented. Service was okay, but not outstanding. I think they were a little understaffed at the moment we arrived, but it certainly didn't detract from our meal.
review_title: Nice place in a good location

review:
I was expecting a bit nicer place as I booked for Mothers Day Brunch. Felt like a diner but without a counter. Not exactly a "date night" restaurant.
We waited a good 5 minutes for anyone to come to our table. Our drinks and food arrived quickly (except that he brought the salad after all the other food). But our water glasses were empty and no one refilled them without our asking - a cardinal sin! Food was good. Eggs Florentine was delicious, as was the French toast and the chicken panini sandwich. Champagne above average. Would I go here again? Yes, but not for a special occasion.

It was very hyped by Frommer's guide to SF, but the service was so slow that it detracted a great deal from the experience. Difficulty with some obvious things, like getting the drink menu. Crab cake sliders were delicious, though.

We had dinner for dec 24th evening, arriving from Europe after a 12h flight. Very friendly and efficient staff. Excellent food (fettucini di mare). the tiramisu was not fitting our expectation, we are certainly too used to the italian home-made one!

We were surprised at the wonderful organic nature of the menu. I had the specialty priced fixed menu. The caprese salad was very good with route tomatoes and fresh mozarella. My halibut was perfectly done over a bed if tasty greens and fingerling potatoes. Thestar however was the yellow squash cobbler. I was not sure what to expect but I would have not predicted that squash would be so fruity. My wife had the chicken marsala and the breast was moist and well cooked and the marsala sauce was not overwhelming. Service and wine were friendly.
review_title: We were surprised at the wonderful

review: Great location, but only acceptable food (how do you mess up Italian?), service was poor.

Cafe Pescatore was a totally adequate spot for a dinner in Fisherman's Wharf. We wanted to be in the neighborhood and eat something sort of locally appropriate, but not spend too much. The total bill was maybe a little more than we'd hoped for, and the food was not spectacular, but overall we enjoyed our meal.
Food quality has declined and we hope it improves.

we had to ask for suger and creamer and straws 3 times if not more.  My mother asked for ice water he brings her hot water.  never brought bread had to ask for it then he only gave 5 butter for 20 people.  had to ask for the dipping stuff for the bread by the time he gave it to us the bread was gone never brought more even after requesting for more.  never refilled drinks unlessed we asked over and over.  I was just very disappointed in the service I have never had bad service here that's why we went there for 2 big birthdays.  I had people who never been there before and seeing this service was embrassing.

This was a great place to dine.  Thanksgiving is a time to be with family.  Fortunately, Buca was open during this holiday.  Living in southern California and spending time with my college daughter in San Francisco was hard.  Having Buca open during Thanksgiving was awesome.  Not only did Buca have a traditional turkey dinner but they also had their full menu.  The staff made my family feel at home.  I really appreciate this restaurant.  It was my first time attending and will not be my last.  I plan on going to our local restaurant as soon as possible.
review_title: This was a great place to dine.  Thanksg...

review: Took my daughter for her birthday , we had a great time, service was great, food was ok

Went there for lunch at noon on Wed, got seated immediately, restaurant was not full at all.  Ordered appetizer and then ordered entrees off the lunch menu when the waitress came back.  Appetizers came out, but there was a long gap to get our meals.  Asked several times about the entrees, told it was on its way, once waitress said it was "being plated", but still waited awhile.  Probably took almost an hour to get our entrees.  Ate quickly and asked for the check.  Took the check to the waitress because by then we'd been there 90 minutes, I mentioned the slow service and she said I should've told in the beginning we were in a rush and that was their normal serving pace. I was surprised by her attitude, she acted like it was my fault!

Great food and service. There was a small mixup in our order but the delayed item was struck from our bill. Only thing that irritated me is that my wife's pasta dish arrived with sauce dripping from the bottom of the bowl all over our table with a second waiter chasing it from the kitchen trying to wipe it all off but failing before it arrived. It was odd. I also prefer bread served hot with a crunchy rather than chewy crust but you can't have everything.

The entrees were delicious!
Cheap food, big portion but not tastewisely remarkable.
A solid choice for Italian comfort food, large portions that mean lunch tomorrow, and a fun environment.

This was my first time and was greeted immediately, my reservation confirmed for six, and checked to see if our table was ready. Upon his return, I was informed that my waiter was not there yet and when he comes in then we will be seated which we were about 10 minutes after our reservation time. The waiter came over and was informed that we were celebrating my birthday. I received no acknowledgement for my birthday and since it was my first time I was sure to feel more energy from my waiter. I would give it another chance simply not with the same waiter.
Service can sometimes be a little slow, varies widely depending on who your server is. Fun place to eat with consistently great food!

Huge portions, tasty food. Service was at best, just "ok". Waiter had to be asked several times for items such as extra napkins, drinks, etc. Waiter was also not very friendly nor was he helpful to our group of 10 in recommending any food or portion sizes. Unless our waiter was new, the atmosphere of Buca is constant and should not be an indicator of what he can handle. However, food is delicious and service that was recently experienced is not an indicator of the usual.
The meals here are always delicious and plentiful!

The food and service was great!!!

The only thing that was annoying us the whole night was this 3 year old screaming and throwing a tantrum and running around in his diapers...as great as this place is, if people decide to bring their kids out please be considerate of those around you. I understand the family vibe but this is not your house.

My kids and I tried to enjoy our dinner, however, we lost our appetite because this child came to our table and put his hand in our food and thought it was funny...he had no manners.
review_title: The food and service was great!!!

review:
Two coworkers bought me here yesterday during the lunch hour to celebrate my birthday. The drinks and order was taken within five minutes after we were seated and we informed the waiter it was my birthday. After waiting for 20 minutes, the entree came and we asked where was the bread and the salad (we ordered as an appetizer)? Five minutes after asking about the salad, it arrived, which should of been the first item.

I choose this restaurant because I remembered the service and food in the past was pretty good and I dined with a much larger group during a dinner rush on several occasions. I guess they do not provide a treat anymore on birthdays. Not sure if I will return
The food was delicious, service friendly and prompt, and the portions were generous. Great neighborhood restaurant!

Have been wanting to go here for a long time and we will definitely be back. The food reminded me of dinners at my Uncle's house on Sundays growing up. Brought back some great memories. The food was exceptional and that is great coming from an Italian cook! I would highly recommend this restaurant for small or large parties. Mangia! Mangia!
The food was mediocre and the experience was noisy. I did enjoy the pictures on the walls.
Reservations were honored promptly. Waiter was professional but lack a bit of attention. Food was good but typical of restaurant of this type. Overall, a positive experience.

This was my 2nd time here in years and the food was just as great as the first. The service was amazing. We ordered the seafood platter and in the end, I noticed 2 mussels were missing the meat so I told the waiter after he asked how everything was and not expecting him to do anything about it, he came back and brought us 4 more. Wine was delicious, I had forgotten my credit card at the restaurant and called to let them know and they had kept it in the safe and did not use it. Great meal!

The service was fair. When our regular server (who was very pleasant) went on a break, we rarely saw the relief server. We had to ask for things, most particularly the ice teas and water. We will continue to dine with you, but mediocre service can eventually drive good customers away.
Good food and good fun. Buca is becoming one of my Saturday Night favorites with hubby. Very affordable and extremely large portions of food.
review_title: Good food and good fun. Buca

review: They serve huge portions of mediocre food. The noise level was deafening but then it is full of families with many screaming children. Waiting to be seated,even with a confirmed reservation, can take an hour or so.

You can't go wrong for large groups since they seem to specialize in small or large group portions. And the food was quite consistent. Everybody seemed happy and also the place was packed so you can't go wrong.
review_title: You can't go wrong for large

review: Great place for kids and family. Enjoyable and helpful wait staff and good family style food to boot. It's always a pleasure to dine there
review_title: Great place for kids and family.

review: Normally this place is noisey when you're sitting upstairs. But if you request for a quieter table, they can accommodate and let you sit downstairs or in the main dining area.
Waitress was very unpleasent. Had no energy. Set the tone for the whole meal. Very dissatisfied.

This was a firm lunch. The food was amazing and the service was pretty good. Although, one tray of food fell before we got it, the server took it off our order and we were given lunch on the house. Will come again for sure!
review_title: This was a firm lunch. The

review: The food and service were great! It's a fun place to have a large size party!!
This place always needs to have a reservation as many are waiting at the door, even those with reservations! Food is good though, and it's a fun place for groups.
Great service! Very accommodating to the large group that dined (14 ppl). Would definitely come back. Food was great! The recommendations from the host and waiter were great too.
My kids and I have been to Bucca a number of times and immediately noticed the menu change, price increase, and Caesar salad recipe had changed. Still good but not like in the past.
review_title: My kids and I have been to

review: We had a group of 10 and the staff took great care of us. The family-stlye dinning experience at Buca di Beppo is perfect for a group to share a lot of different appetizers, salads and entrees. The prices were reasonable, the food was great and the staff was exceptional. I would definitely recommend Buca di Beppo for group dinning.
review_title: We had a group of 10 and the

review: It was great! However, they've discontinued the anchovies with their Cesar Salad. It was a favorite of mine. Still, the food was fabulous and the service was great! I can't wait to go back.
The food was amazing and the Drinks were well served, our party of 11 had a good time!!!
review_title: The food was amazing and the

review: We had a great experience at Buca. The food was great, excellent service and we were seated on time. This is a great family place for a meal any time.

Overall this restaurant is a good place for dinner for more than one person. The food is great and the place is full of good energy. Make reservations in advance because if you want to go there last minute Good Luck it gets full fast during the weekends.

Always an affordable Italian restaurant to go to when you're on the budget. Perfect for groups since like I have said it is affordable. The food was definitely appetizing and comes in huge servings, the small can feed up to 4 by my standards, even though it is advertised as only for 2.

The service was horrible, however the food was great.

It took 45 minutes to receive our Cheesy Garlic Bread. The waiter did not attend to our table on a regular basis. We had to keep on asking for him.
This is a great place for family-style dining. Order an array of dishes to share for variety. The pistachio gelato is fabulous!
review_title: This is a great place for

review:
It's gone downhill since my last visit in 2007.  We dined at 6:00pm. They did not have any martini glasses (my cosmo was served in a whisky glass) or teaspoons to stir coffee with. All they had were giant serving spoons (and I don't mean tablespoons).

Waiter/Waitress turned over 3 times during our short visit -- we arrived during shift turnover???

Disappointing overall.

When I checked in, they said I didn't have a reservation, I showed him my confirmation on my blackberry.  It was hot (no fresh air) where we dined downstairs.  My kids were not impressed, I guess we live in SF and set the bar high!
review_title: When I checked in, they said

review: We had a wonderful time, our server Edgar was very attentive and the food was amazing!

This review is on behalf of my parents. I made reservations here for their 35th Wedding Anniversary. For one I was happy they had reservations for the same day and a great time. They were unclear of where they wanted to go. It was a busy day for all of us. 

The clam chowder was delicious, the combo Louie was extremely fresh, the cioppino was perfectly delicious. The service was just as equally excellent. We will dine there again.

We first went there January 2014. I had their signature dish (Cioppino) the last time. It was good, but not that outstanding. So I tried the seafood saute (lots of seafood plus Dungeness crab) while she had the seafood risotto. Both had lots of seafood: mine in a pesto cream sauce which masked the flavors a bit, and hers in a yummy risotto cooked just right, nice and creamy. The last time we went she got the same dish and asked for no calamari (as she did this time also). The waitress the last time told her she could have extra of what ever other meat was in it so she go extra mussels. This time she asked the waiter if she could have extra mussels to which he said yes. However she did not get the extra. That was disappointing. Good overall.

Mario Batali apparently has called their Cioppino the best in SF. Although I'm not an expert, it was very good. Interesting however, that the calamari in the appetizer was more tender than that in the Cioppino. I would say that the clams & mussels were average. The crab salad sandwich was very good, but not the best I've had in the Wharf. A group of 9 of us ended with a $250 lunch bill (incl gratuity), & that was without any alcohol and with a 10% discount courtesy of the gift shop across the street. Our group consisted of 4 kids under 12, 4 adults & a 15-year old. There was one full-size Cioppino order (~$35) & 1 small size. Bottom line: it's not cheap, doesn't have a view & is not quite what I would call "fit for foodies". Great service.
I had lunch here while exploring fishermans wharf. The food was delicious and the staff lovely.
review_title: I had lunch here while exploring

review: Excellent cioppino and the kids enjoyed pizza and salad
Fisherman's Warf location, very good food, waiter was attentive, casual atmosphere. Overall a good experience!

I had the Linguini Aurora and it was amazing. The shrimp was tender and delicious. The sauce and such was also great. The service was awesome. Our server went out of his way to make our experience great. It was my birthday and my mom told the server. He brought over a piece of pie at the end of our meal. It was decorated beautifully with a golden gate bridge drawn in chocolate on the plate. I didn't know what it was at first but it turns out it was keylime pie. Mmm...

The service was great, our server was very attentive. As for the food, their clams were okay, it's not something I would recommend on the menu, it tasted a little too much like it just came out of the sea water, and not in a "fresh" sense of way. I also ordered the Fisherman's platter which was good but the calamari had a funny taste to it, almost sour-like. We also got the wine flights which you get 2oz. of 3 different selections of wine, I thought that this was a pretty nifty idea, especially since the price was more than reasonable ($9). If you're a wine connosieur though their wine list will probably not be to your liking. Overall though, the place was good but it didnt make a good enough impression to return to for some good seafood.
The person who checked us in (I forgot her name) was superior to any other maitre d'. She knew our names when we walked in and had our table waiting. The whole experience was wonderful. Thank you!
We love Cioppinos. The hostess is the best, and the food is great. On a nice warm day, to sit outside with a beer or wine and listen to the music is great. And people watching here is the best.

I had a very nice dinner with the best table in the house. The Hostess was very nice and pleasant. We have made this place our new spot for a great dinner. I have recommended this place to everyone I know. Look forward to going back. The best Valentine's Dinner ever!
review_title: I had a very nice dinner with

review: This older sf standard works for pre theater lunch because of its location. It's dated, menu is limited, service poor, but food is good.
great spot before going to the Orpheum Theatre. The service is very good and the food is delivered in a timely manner.
Five senior ladies rode Bart into SF. Made lunch reservations as this restaurant was directly across the street from production. We all had a wonderful dining experience.

We were headed to an 8:00 o'clock performance at the Orpheum. We arrived an hour early but they were able to seat us. The service was fantastic and the food was great. The restaurant is great but it's proximity to the theater and parking makes it spectacular. Highly recommended.
Perfect location for pre-theater dinner when going to The Orpheum.
We were totally surprised at the quality of the food, the excellent service and the upscale atmosphere. I had the ahi salad which was fabulous. We will be back!

There was no waiting as we had our reservation. It was a pre-theater lunch and service was excellent so that we did not have to rush through the meal and then rush to the theater. We always feel welcome when we are there.
review_title: There was no waiting as we

review: We were so pleased to find Market Street Grill on Open Table. It was close to the War Memorial Opera House, an so very convenient to have a leisurely lunch and then walk over there. It was wonderful to be able to have a conversation in a quiet atmosphere. the fireplace was a great plus too! My salad was excellent, as was the chocolate dessert. Sandwich was very good. Next time, though, I'll order something else. nice variety of dishes.
We had diner here because it is only a couple of minutes walk from the Orpheum Theater. Food and service is acceptable.
Generally, the food and service were good but my salad was sandy. Mentioned it the waiter but she just shrugged.

We had lunch at Market Street Grill before a matinee at the Orpheum. The food was excellent and the ambiance very nice. We agreed that, in the future, it is a great option for a meal before or after the theatre.
review_title: We had lunch at Market Street

review: Others seem to mince words; I won't. This place serves terrible food. The butternut swash was reminiscent of Gerber baby food. The chicken was ocessed. The sauces seemed to be made with corn starch. Most dishes were either over seasoned (with black pepper) or bland. The bread & butter were good - as was the wine - but that's all. Service was slow. (sigh). Don't waste your time or money - find someplace else (or pack a sandwich).

This was one of the few dining options near the Orpheum theater. Needless to say, it was jam packed before the show. Waiter forgot to serve our drinks and salads, and showed up with our entrees abour 30 minutes after we ordered. Had to ask for drinks three times. Food was good and hot. Probably will not go back based on this experience.

Was pleasantly surprised at what a great restaurant this is. It's so convenient to the Orpheum adjacent to the beautiful Whitcomb Hotel lobby. Will definitely go again. The presentation of the selected menu items was wonderful. I'm excited I found this restaurant.
