Big burgers and sweet potato fries to die for. The waiter was incredibly attentive. Nice quiet atmosphere where we both enjoyed lunch and got some business done.

We've been here before. Menu is somewhat limited, but still offers choices to ponder. My wife lusts for the wild mushroom ravioli. Wine menu is appropriate for the venue. Service is always outstanding. A great place to eat when downtown for a show or concert.

The restaurant staff was kind enough to seat us early at our table rather than in the bar while we waited for the rest of our party. The waiter, however, was less than friendly during the whole meal. A small water spill was never addressed. The bread arrived 15 minutes after we ordered and small things, like a requested extra napkin, were never received. Service was lacking, but the food and drinks were good. Could have just been a bad day for the waiter.

A perfect spot for dinning before the theater. The location was perfect for this.
We had a lovely table at the window, with a street view, in this neighborhood not always the best of views. The service was outstanding! We were a party of 3, myself, my sister and my mother. My mother is not the easiest person to please, and the waitress bent over backwards for her, and made her dining an amazing experience. My sister and I had ordered Cosmo Martini's, they were to sweet for my liking, the waitress did not have a problem with taking them back and having them made exactly how I like them. The food was not the best best I have ever had, but it was very good, the presentation was beautiful.
Very nice lunch experience and perfect timing before seeing Wicked at the Orpheum across the street.

Good service and great location
before and after the theater experience.
If there is a brunch, i think it will do well.
review_title:
Good service and great location
bef

review: Excellent spot for dinner before Wicked at the Orpheum. Parking was free in one of the off street lots behind the hotel and you can walk across the street to the show.
Great food and Ambiance. Conviently close to the Orpheum Theater!

The food was decent enough, but the service was really terrible. After we ordered, it took over 1/2 hour for our food to arrive, and we only ordered a couple of BLTs and a salad. The wait time was ridiculously long. The servers were also very unattentive. I would not eat here again.

I was completely disappointed in the service and food at this Market Street Grill. A steak ordered medium came back RARE. A seared ahi tuna came out with a canjun seasoning to make up for the taste-less sauce. Waiter was too busy running from table to table to introduce himself, ask if we'd like an appetizer with out drink order, ask if we'd like salad with our meal. The one shining moment was that in my online order I had mentioned it was a special occassion. With the desert, they remembered.
The food was excellent We had to be at the theater in an hour, and they were quick to serve us, and get us the bill so we could make the show. They were very busy, but service was excellent.

We went for a preconcert dinner and had time constraints. The service was prompt and got us finished on time. The waiter was attentive. Food was very good, considering that the chef has to turn out a large number of meals all about the same time due to the pre-concert/ pre-theater crowd. Overall I am very happy with the experience and will repeat. One suggestion: a prix fix pre-theater manu would be nice.
review_title: We went for a preconcert dinner

review: I love having a wonderful lunch here prior to attending a show on Wednesday afternoons. The piano playing is relaxing and puts you in the mood for a broadway show. Everything i have had at this restaurant has been wonderful. Very attentive staff, great desserts and beautifully prepared main courses. Simply love it!

While extremely well located if you're going to a show at the Orpheum, I found the restaurant to be a poor choice. There was no hostess at the front desk, requiring that you flag down a waiter to be seated. But good luck getting their attention. We were seated in an add-on section with cafeteria style tables and chairs, next to the kitchen. I insisted that we be moved to a better table. The food was over-priced and marginal at best. I'd never eat there again.

The food was really not good, the crab cake was soaked with grease and oil, the branzino dish I still try to figure out (fish was good, but the asian style broth with the vegetables was disgusting and did not go with the fish at all), my wife has the blue cheese ravioli with ginger-lemon grass sauce, which also does not pair at all, plus the sauce and vegetables seemed to be exactly the same as for the fish. with one word we were very disappointed.
The service was lousy, the waiter was unattentive and seemed to be careless. He just dropped the dishes on the table which even made the cutlery clanging. During the meal the waiter asked us "how is everything", but did not even wait for an answer, but just walked away.
review_title: The food was really not good,

review: Our experience was wonderful. We were shown to our table immediately. The food was sumptuous and the seating was comfortable. It was quiet and romantic and truly enjoyable for a Valentine's Dinner. It's proximity to the Orpheum theater (less than a block) was fabulous since we had just seen Wicked at the theater.

If you're going to The Orpheum for a show, check out the Market Street Grill. My crab-cake appetizer was excellent. The scallops, shrimp and fettuccini were cooked perfectly but the dish had just a little too much salt for my taste. My dining companion had the molasses chicken, which had good flavor but was in danger of being overcooked (approaching dry). The vegetables and noodle gallette that accompanied the chicken were very good though. Not the best food to be found in S.F. but if you a restaurant very near the theatre it's a good choice.
review_title: If you're going to The Orpheum

review: Loved the ambiance with a table in the corner by the fireplace, looking out onto Market Street. Beautiful presentation of food, and excellent service with our waiter accommodating our needs to leave at a certain time in order to get to the theater.

the food was not distinguished- my smoked chicken salad had a good chunk of gristle, and the chicken didn't taste very smoked. The spinach was uncooked- would have been better wilted. The dressing was hard to taste. My friend's ravioli dish had several ingredients that didn't go well with the raviolis. The apple tart dessert was disappointing- the tart crust was soft and wet, the apples kind of dry.

I wouldn't go back. The price was too high for the quality of the food.

This was the first time we've made a special request with an Open Table reservation.   Not sure of the situation with public transportation that day (Spare the Air day), we made the reservation just in time to reach the concert lecture on time and would have been on time had the waiter been more responsive in taking our order.  We mentioned our wish to be there at 1, in the reservation.  Otherwise, it was delicious;  we loved the special "treat" ( cold celery soup) we were given and it was so easy to locate from Bart and then to proceed to Davies.
review_title: This was the first time we've

review: As others have said, the dining room doesn't currently suit the type of restaurant it is, and the food that's served, but apparently there is plan to update it soon. Regardless of the decor, the experience was wonderful! The Hostess Wilma and our waiter Sol were not only talented and efficient, they were so fun! They made our meal experience very entertaining! And then the food came. Wow! Every person in our group of 6 raved about their meal. I had the seared branzini. I savored every bite! This isn't a cheap restaurant but it was well worth the price! I would definitely go again and will recommend it to all my friends.
review_title: As others have said, the dining

review: I'm sure I just went in on an off night but I wasn't impressed. They were out of most of the items I was interested in and the restaurant was freezing cold. Despite being fairly empty, the food took a while and I when it came it didn't blow my mind. It wasn't bad, just wasn't interesting. I got the smoked chicken and it just tasted like fried chicken. No smoke on it at all. The margarita was awesome and so were the deviled eggs.

rest_name: Nob Hill Club at the Mark Hopkins
review: Fabulous place, great service & delicious food.  The view is breathless.

The beef was so tough that the steak knife wouldn't cut it let alone my teeth! The GM asked me if I would like some soup instead?! I told him I didn't want a replacement but we would like the dessert menu. He brought it but nothing was discounted from my bill. The waiter was not knowledgeable re the food, and didn't care, as also the GM apparently.! I will not return or recommend the restaurant. Several years ago I was there and it was good. What has happened.?

First time at Boulevard.  The food was beautiful, delicious, and 5-star quality. The service was impeccable. Our server knew the  selections on the menu inside and out and did not blink an eye when asked particular questions about some of the dishes. The cocktails we ordered were very flavorful and had lots of alcohol, but did not taste as such. 

The restaurant was clean and warm, perfectly lit, and the view out of the back window was gorgeous. We could see the full length of the Bay Bridge. 

The bill was expensive for a dinner and drink for two, but worth every penny because the food and service were exquisite. 

I highly recommend Boulevard to anyone visiting from out of town, for a special occasion, or simply a top-notch food and service experience.

This place was jammed on a weeknight, but we were not crowded, were able to converse and got quite god service.  The fish was perfectly prepared.  I am amazed at how high the quality is in a restaurant that is doing fine food on such a large scale.  It's also a pretty restaurant, with lots to watch while you wait or dine.
review_title: A big, busy restaurant that gets everything right

review: our visits to San Francisco are never frequent enough, but each trip includes dinner at Boulevard. The food, staff, and atmosphere never disappoint.

Friendly service in an extremely lively environment.  As others note,food is generally  well-prepared though there is not much choice. Appetizers,truffle/avocado salad and raviolo with mushrooms imaginative and good.  Quail was delicious.  No effort at all on sides-a smear of potato,a flower,totally undercooked squash.  One in our party had sole,a tiny raft of fish on pilings of fingerling potatoes.  It seemed meager for a man.  Dessert of butterscotch pudding was good-sized but lacked strong  flavors/a side of chocolate pudding,whipped cream,nuts. Accompanying shortbread was stale. Desserts may be a weak spot.  Still,it is a fun place for pricey but good food.

If you are looking for a quality experience, this is the place for you. Even the busboy asked us how everything was and if we needed anything. Great service. The food was better than I expected. The calamari, the lamb, even the desserts, all FANTASTIC!!

Boulevard is a wonderful place to spoil yourself. On this particular occasion, a birthday celebration, they achieved the perfect balance between noticing the occasion (a chocolate happy birthday banner and candle on the birthday woman's dessert) and making an embarrassing fuss (we would have gone elsewhere for that).

Shared the ahi tuna appetizer-perfect.Husbands had pork chops & loved them.Wives had quail=divine.Ordered several desserts.All were good,but the butterscotch was crazy delicious.Waiter, Dennis M., deserves A+ credit.He was, in every way, perfect.A good deal of our positive experience is due to his guidance.2 reasons we're not rating 5 stars:1.OpenTable rez was very specific about req a window table, & I followed-up with a phone call to reiterate.When we arrived,we were seated on the upper section as far away from the windows as possible.This was irksome given our rez was at 5:45 p.m. & most of the tables were empty, yet we were sat far away from the window.2.A large group of people with screaming babies & children were seated right by us.

The food here is very serviceable, very expensive, and all carefully prepared. But, I have been here a couple of times and it is boring. The vibe is very stuffy, old school, calm, and boring. The food is not exciting or unusual. However this would be a great place for a business dinner. No surprises and everything will be prepared very appropriately.

Beautiful Restaurant 
Excellent presentation of food
Great service
There were 5 in our party and we all thoroughly enjoyed our meals and wine. The ambiance of this restaurant is so cool and the service was beyond attentive without being intrusive. Highly recommend.

Boulevard is a special treat for my sister and me due to the price, and you did not disappoint. The excellent service (very important for middle-aged women!) puts the experience over the top. Impeccable food, timing just right between courses.

I have been to this restaurant a couple times and have NEVER been disappointed. The food is melt-in-your-mouth delicious, service is impeccable and the ambiance feels like a setting from a old classic movie. The last visit, I had the pleasure of trying their Ahi appetizer and was beyond impressed. My boyfriend (who despises fish) tried some and ended up helping me eat the whole thing it was THAT good!!! Major compliments to the chefs. 
Prime time evening reservations are hard to come by, so plan ahead (probably about a month or more ahead) if you're hoping to come here for a special evening or occasion. You will be glad you did!
Visiting from Chicago and my wife and I loved Boulevard!

Well, I had looked forward to a really nice expensive dinner for weeks. It was double date night with 2 of our other friends, 4 total so it was certainly a good place for that BUT the food was so-so. We got steak, bass, lamb and porkchop. Tasted them all and they were nothing out of the ordinary. So, with the entrees costing about $40 each, I felt the entree part was not at all worth it. Awesome desserts though! Dessert chef Lisa really did an awesome job on the rocky road brownie. That was a gift from heaven and made up for the average entrees. So, overall, I think I'd go back but not get an entree and maybe meet friends there for dessert and drinks.
the interiors are very similar to the mansard style with revolving doors etc. The food also is very good with the right balance of flavors with no dish being too overwhelming.
review_title: A place with good food and ambience

review: Found this restaurant on Yelp and asked a couple friends who have been here and they all recommended it so we decided to go. It was awesome! Our server was great and the food was even better. Good choice of wines and a full bar. It's a little pricey but well worth every penny. I will definitely be coming back here next special occasion.
review_title: Great place in a great location

review: We have been at Boulevard 10 years in a row the weekend after Thanksgivingg. It is our favorite place. When Ethan is there he makes it an experience worth remembering. This year we went Subday night and missed him. Will be back next year on Saturday night of Thanksgiving weekend to be served , pleased and entertained by him. Meals are always fabulous.

As a visitor to San Francisco I thoroughly enjoyed my dining experience
We arrived early for our dinner and were served immediately at the bar and shown promptly to our table at the booked time
The food and service were excellent. Go if you get a chance

My favorite restaurant in the whole world. The food is fabulous, and the combination of flavors and textures in each dish is unbelievable. Each time we've gone there, I come away thinking that I've just had the best meal I've ever eaten.
I am never disappointed in my dining experience at The Boulevard. It has been consistently delicious and delightful for 20 years.
Went here with my girlfriend, and had an amazing dinner. Could not fault anything.

Went here with the family while on vacation in SF. A friend recommended this place and it did not disappoint. Food was very good. Wife's sea bass dish was good, but not great - had much better elsewhere. my rib pork chop was exceptional and the kids had the quail which was excellent. Dessert was ordinary.
have dined in many a fine restaurant - boulevard one of the best - outstanding!!!!
Although very crowed everything was well, excellent soups, very good entrees options. The place has a great ambiance.

Have had several enjoyable visits in the past. For whatever reason the staff effort was under par this night. Felt like I was being treated as if I had never been at the restaurant before by our waiter. I needed to personally push for a change in seat to the hostess after a complaint to the waiter. I was reminded that there was a corkage fee, although I had a $100+ bottle of wine to be opened. The waiter was unable to explain various desert menu options, but rather listed them from the menu. And finally we had to single to the busboy to get our check. It was very surprising given what I have come to expect from this restaurant.
Great Food and the best example of a great San Francisco Restaurant restaurant. Location, Ambiance, and the scene.

We were seated in a romantic loveseat with a view of the bustling kitchen to the front and a window to the street at our backs and a view of the Bay from the side. Busy Friday evening - the restaurant was full by the time we left. Service was a bit slow, it would have been ok if we weren't starving but we were ready to snack on bread again after our starter because the wait was so long for the entre. Presentation was gorgeous, portions were on the smallish side, seasoning on the pork was minimal, on my guinea hen, a bit over-salted. Hmmm. My husband had the crispy sweetbreads for his starter and is still dreaming of them. I had the buffalo salad and was disappointed due to its blandness. A disappointment overall for the price.

Everything was very tasty and light. My daughter had a vegeterian dish and it was very creative and tasty. Appetizer--scallops and LOCAL SANDDAB STUFFED with ROCK SHRIMP & CRAB
Baby Fava were excellent. I had redsnapper--very good. and my husband had Kurobuta.
dessert was also good,and of course service was outstanding and professional

Boulevard's service was a true disappointment. At a table for four, two meals were brought out at one time, and the other two only after a wait of about 5 minutes, rendering the first two entrees cold. Waiters were inattentive (though water was filled regularly). The filet mignon was excellent, and the pork prime rib chop very good, though vegetables (though good) were paltry making the meal primarily about eating meat. Come on boulevard, you can do better.

Food well prepared and presentation excellent. My major complaint is that portions have dwindled to miniscule--in inverse proportion to prices. Guess now that the restaurant is so popular, they can afford to serve "precious food". Value way diminished and we will unlikely return.
I didn't really grow up eating out at these fine dining spots, but the food was good. However, I would never go again unless the significant other wanted to.

One of the best in the City! We had a wonderful Christmas Eve dinner here and enjoyed every minute of our evening. The food never disappoints, the ambiance is unbeatable... and then there's the service. We felt welcomed by everyone, and were delighted with the festive decor and the holiday spirit filling the dining room. A visit to Boulevard is a treat anytime of year, a must at the holidays!
review_title: A treat any time of year!

review: Popular downtown favorite. Can be crowded and quite noisy at lunch. Food creative, portions ample, service professional but friendly. $15 flat rate valet parking necessary as very few places to park in nearby area. Use public transit or ferry to nearby Ferry Building, then short walk.
My favorite restaurant in the city. I often find myself coming here even though I really should try some of the more trendy spots. I know what I like and this place hits the mark time after time.

expected better for this price. Food took forever to come out and my dish was half cold. Flavor was just ok. You can get much better food for your dollar in this town. The atmosphere is fun - very festive!

Always enjoyed Boulevard in the past several years.
This time service was mediocre and overshadowed the great food.
Will think twice before going back again.

Simply, the BEST!
Wonderful ambiance, spectacular decor, amiable and gracious service, great bar, delicious and finely crafted food, deep and thoughtfully selected wine list. A not to be missed dining experience in San Francisco.

It was a special birthday for my partner, and Boulevard did not fail. Food was incredible - perfect portions. Quail was the best I'd ever had, and the lamb my partner got was also fantastic. Love the nettle gnocchi, and other interesting things that came on the plate! Thanks again - we will def return again in the future!

We visited Boulevard for the first time to celebrate a wedding anniversary and came away extremely impressed. In particular, the service was outstanding -- attentive, generous and unobtrusive (our dessert even came with a hand-written chocolate "Happy Anniversary" message). The food was as great as we had expected (we had the Haibut and Quail, both cooked perfectly), the ambiance was good, and Boulevard also has an excellent wine and cocktail menu.
Great San Francisco experience. Recommended to us by a Chef in Dallas, Tx. The food and service were excellent. Highly recommend.

The food was very good. My duck was cooked perfectly, but my bf's pork chop was overcooked, although he said the flavor was fine. Energetic, fun, lovely place. But there was a loooooong gap between our appetizers and main course. Very unusual, since the appetizers came out so quickly. Service was rather slow, but the place was busy. By the end of the evening, we were one of the last tables there. Waited for the main course, waited to order dessert, waited for the bill ... I'd much rather go to Gary Danko's for impeccable service and food.
review_title: The food was very good. My

review:
Previous reviews had us hopeful for a premium experience. Unfortunately, too much hype raised our expectations so that we were disappointed in the overall experience. My sea bass was nicely flavored, but on the dry side... which was surprising for sea bass. My husband's halibut was unremarkable. The price point to quality equation just did not balance.
One thing we have to comment on (beause the rating does not provide an option for this) is that this restaurant is way too loud. It was impossible to have a conversation at normal volume. Be prepared to have to speak loudly in order to be heard by the person across the table from you. For some, this might be good ambiance, not so much for us.

Was everything promised and more. We are in the food business so while in the city we treated ourselves to some amazing dining options. Boulevard was the best of the best. Prices were not pretentious - some great wines also at very fair prices (maybe too fair) or maybe that's another reason they are so busy. At some restaurants, we find dining from the "left side" of the menu to be more creative and enjoyable. There were 9 fantastic offerings on the appetizer page - we enjoyed 6 of them as our "dinner" along with 2 bottles of wine, a shared dessert, port and coffee. I tipped 30% and still felt I got a bargain compared to some of our less memorable outings. I'll be back! Thanks Mary and staff for a great culinary experience.
Great food, ambiance, service. Well deserved michelin star. Should have got two!

meals were outstanding. Taste and presentation crisp. the Quail was the best I have ever had. Scallop starter was outstanding. Abalone was a first and was outstanding. Was not able to nit pick anything on the presentation, flavors or texture. Great meal. Server was pleasant but was not crisp in delivery for the quality of the restaurant. timing of service was good.

The food was wonderful, although the abalone in the appetizer, was both delicious and miniscule. It was almost funny if it hadn't been over twenty dollars. Everything else was great.

The waiter however, was rushed and marginally unfriendly. I would not call him rude, but he looked like he had way too much to do, and although it was my birthday he didn't try in any way to make the meal special. We were surprised, just what one would hope for at such an outstanding restaurant.
review_title: Wonderful food, the service just ok

review: I eat out about 3 times per week for work and have been doing that for about a decade. I don't think i've have been out at a high end restaurant where the front of the house was SO bad and the back of the house was spot on. Would not go back nor recommend to anyone i wanted to still value my opinion on food.
review_title: I remember when it was a good place

review: We had forgotten what a lovely and large setting Boulevard was --- memorable meal, in a fantastic space, with great services, and old friends from Chicago.
review_title: We had forgotten what a lovely

review: We have been going to Boulevard for special occasions and it has been consistent with their good food over the years.
review_title: We have been going to Boulevard

review: Excellent in every detail - went beyond our expectations in our dining experiences. Wonderful!
The Boulevard is consistently solid over the past 11 years I've had the opportunity to dine there a few times a year.

I called in advance to find out if they can serve vegan and I was told they do. When we got there, our waitress said they don't serve vegan dishes but she offered to get the chef to prepare something for me. That was nice but the the food was tasteless. However, considering the pricing for their food, I asked our waitress to box it up "to go". She did not. It was also disappointing that a restaurant of this caliber does not even have soy or almond milk for their coffee. Not a pleasant experience at all and we left. Two customers they have lost.
review_title: I called in advance to find

review: My husband had the pork chops and said it was best ever including the sides. Salmon with set up was good but not "foodies" great. Lamb was good but set up quite soso. Ambience however was worth it!
we had a wonderful lunch. My very favorite lunch place.

was really looking forward to this meal because I had heard such wonderful things. My husband and I went for our wedding anniversary last week. We had reservations but it still took them over half an hour to seat us which was quite annoying. This restaurant was packed and super duper loud. We got sat all the way in the back which was nice and a little quieter. Our server took quite sometime to even take our drink order. We sat at our table for over 15 minutes with just the menus. Our server took our order at 9:15 and our salad and scallops finally around at 9:45. Our server was pretty apologetic about our food taking so long and ended up giving me a glass of wine "on the house". That was nice and all but getting there at 8:30 and not eatin

Boulevard consistently provides an outstanding dining experience. We always try new restaurants in the city when they open and they always disappoint when compared to our dining experience at Boulevard.

I always refer out of towners to this restaurant and they come away with rave reviews.
The decor is unique (and I never use that word) in a good way and the desserts are downright illicit!

We had a terrific experience at Boulevard. My family and I have eaten at many Michelin rated restaurants throughout the world; some of them have been up to the ratings while others have not. As soon as we entered the restaurant they took us to the table which was quiet and along the window . We had requested this as one of us has a hearing disability and find noisy restaurant uncomfortable. The sommelier was good and our waiter was terrific. We had a small problem with the filet mignon but the service to rectify it was tremendous. Not only did the waiter come and apologize for the communication breakdown between the kitchen and him but so did the manager. The food was first class, the service even better and I give it a hearty endorsement.

Took my wife here for her birthday yesterday and was very disappointed. Service was sub par. Even though I specifically informed them we were celebrating my wife's birthday, both when making my reservation and after confirming it over the phone, there was not a single acknowledgement about it from either the host or the waitress. When splurging for a special event at a fine dining restaurant, my expectation is to be treated likewise.

Regarding the food, I ordered the lamb and my wife the king salmon. The lamb was very tasty, but the salmon not really special. The only problem is, the portions are SUPER small! My shellfish salad had an index finger worth of lobster, 1 shrimp, 2 pieces of squid, a donut hole worth of crab and a few pieces
review_title: Took my wife here for her

review: Boulevard is our favorite San Francisco restaurant and once again we weren't disappointed - everything was perfect. The halibut was fabulous, the service amazing, and the wine list top notch. Another memorable experience!!

Boulevard has become our anniversary repast.  It gets better with each year and I am not sure how it is done, but the wait staff is charming, never hurrying, and the food is off the charts for options (vegetarian), and quality.
The food was fantastic, but very expensive and portions are really small! . A little noisy but do like coming here for special occasions.
Classic San Francisco fare at it's best.  Always consistent.  Pork chop is so delicious. They always have some amazing drinks from the bar, creative but classic.
One of the best overall restaurants in an area with lots of great restaurants. Excellent for friends or business lunch.
review_title: One of the best overall restaurants

review: reservation follow-up was outstanding. Had to add additional people and did so in advance. We were accomodated even though reservations were full for the evening. Food selection was limited but outstanding. Service was excellent. Super experience.

Although I used to go to Boulevard relatively frequently, I hadn't been there for probably eight years because of so many new places in the area. It was wonderful. Imaginative menu, wonderful small plates, lovely presentation. It's back at the top of my list.
review_title: Although I used to go to Boulevard

review: Food was terrific. Service was not as good. Waitress was not very attentive and when a problem arose, she did not intervene to address the problem.

Charles was our waiter and he was excellent. We enjoye the experience of a good waiter.
Food was also excellent. We will be back.
Noisy but fabulous! Delicious food, wide variety and interesting selections!
I can cook the same basics at home. Not overly impressed. Wanted to get into French Laundry but did not hold it against this place. Not good service. We went to Greystone and Chandon also.
review_title: I can cook the same basics

review: The service was slow, but they did apologize. The food was outstanding.

Boulevard was every bit as good as I'd read/heard about, and more. This is a really special place. The server we had was so knowledgable about the food and wine. He also anticipated and truly went out of his way to make our evening a hit. The food was also incredibly good. A good example was the fois gras served with pluot/plum, nuts, and other goodies that complemented and enhanced the fois gras. Same with the wonderful pork chop I had. It was cooked perfectly, still juicy. Served with Agnalotti and some greens. While this place can be very expensive, even for San Francisco, it was worth it. The food, service, and ambience all exceeded my expectations.
Food was great, waiter disappeared for long time periods.

Don't write off Boulevard just because it's been around a while. We had a superb meal--with one of the most attentive and efficient waiters imaginable. Our pork chop was perfect, and the mojitos were The Best in Town. The evening felt "classy" and festive, with a sprinkling of every type of San Franciscan--corporate types on expense accounts as well as single women enjoying gabfests with their adventurous, half-silly desserts of fried donuts with raspberry granita and buttery ice cream.

My sister and I looked to find a great restaurant to celebrate her 69th birthday. We
chose Boulevard and it was a great choice. The food was delicious, the only thing we
weren't crazy about was the Dungness crab sald. The other two starters and the main
course were excellent, as was dessert. Noise level low, our waiter was the best.
Great place to have a meal. Highly recommend it.
review_title: My sister and I looked to

review: The food just wasn't that great. Not as great as we remembered.
food and waiter were excellent. the sommelier was vaguely out of sorts. haven't had this issue in the past at boulevard. possibly, he was harried (the restaurant was very busy) or i misread his mien.
Not as good as I had hoped it would be but a 'solid' dining experience. Beautiful dining room, very good attentive service but the food -which should be the star- wasn't that memorable.
review_title: Not as good as I had hoped

review: I still feel that Boulevard is the best restaurant in San Francisco.  The food is exquisite, the decor is gorgeous and the service is unbeatable!
This was our first time at Boulevard, and we were delighted with the cuisine and service. Also pleasing is that the wines by the glass are good value.
review_title: This was our first time at

review: The chef created an interesting and delicious vegetarian plate for me. And my companion's filet mignon was perfectly cooked. Boulevard is always reliably excellent. This restaurant is a San Francisco tradition that does not rest on it's laurels.

I had the salmon entree on this date, however the entree was so small, I had to order a side vegetable (sauteed kale which was chewy and tuff) to go with it. I was attempting to eat healthy (low carb) but ending up eating more bread because I was not satisfied with the amount of food in the entree and side veggie.
review_title: I had the salmon entree on

review: Great, great food and service. Pricey but worth it.

The food and service was outstanding and the ambiance was terrific. I was a little disappointed in that this was a special birthday celebration and I had requested a window seat with a view of the bay. I made this request when I made my reservation, but was seated at a small table that looked into the restaurant and not outside as I had requested.
review_title: The food and service was outstandin

review: The dinner at Boulevard was extraordinary. Every course was made and displayed perfectly, the combinations of ingredients fresh and interesting but not crossing over into the bizarre as found in many "new" restaurants. The service was knowledgeable, cordial and unobtrusive. I would not hestitate to recommend this restaurant to anyone and look forward to returning.

Rush, rush, rush. That's how we felt with our waiter. I would recommend losing him because I would walk out next time if I was served by this guy.
I was dining with a couple who are as easy to please as anyone I know, yet even they were ready to complain. First we had to stop him from filling our wine glass to the brim each time he passed the table. Attentive service is one thing, obviously forcing us to drink is another. After we finished dinner and were sipping our coffee, this waiter stopped by no less than three times either tapping our table, saying how he looks forward to seeing us again, or saying how he looks forward to seeing us again real soon. The green salad was average but we all agreed that the Sea Bass was the best ever.

Our food was not hot when it came out (it was just a little warm). We were going to tell our waiter, but he didn't come back to check on us until we were half way done with our meal. It tasted good, but it was probably sitting there for a while before it came out. We were hoping for the same great meal we had here 2 years ago, but it didn't happen. For the amount of money you spend here and the amount of cooks, food runners and waiters they have, the food should be served hot.
review_title: Our food was not hot when

review: Always a wonderful experience, never disappointing and our most favorite of all the restaurants of the highest calibre in San Francisco. We return again and again because we know it will be memorable in all ways.
Outstanding dining experience. Creative preparation that will never disappoint a discerning diner.

for a california restaurant, the wine list was not a notable one, for california wines.
fun atmosphere. not the best section of town. do not intend to walk around here.

I had the Halibut, and it was over cooked. It looked beautiful, but when I cut into it it was hard! How can you ruin Halibut? I sould have sent it back, but managed to eat about half of it. We also ordered the Lamb T-bone. It was wonderful. The Scallops and Tuna appetizers were good. I guess when I go to a restaurant of this caliber, I expect everything be "Melt in my mouth" good. I'm sorry to say, my expectations just were not met. I don't think we'll be back.
review_title: I had the Halibut, and it

review: Boulevard provided a high-class dining experience as usual. This is the place to go when you are need to impress a date or some visiting relatives. The service is relaxed and professional, the food ranges from just great to simply astounding, and you are very unlikely to leave hungry. While the ingredients and preparation are top flight, you won't find the minuscule portions typical at some other fine dining destination. Boulevard remains a class act and San Francisco standout.

There are only a few tables with a view of the bay bridge, but if you can get one it is stunning! The interior design is reminiscent of a Parisian bistro, absolutely romantic and gorgeous! Save this for a special occasion.
review_title: There are only a few tables

review: Great food. Amazing fish and seafood; OK meat; OK dessert;

My Grandson & I enjoyed our dinner very much. We were very impressed.

Service was outstanding.

A major disappointment! I read great reviews and expected an exceptional dining experience. The food was mediocre at best. We ate at two other San Francisco Restuarants and both were better. Gary Danko was one of the best dining expewrience of my life. We had luch at slanted Door twice and both times far surpassed Boulevard.

A San Francisco staple. They have it down to a science. If you didn't like an item, check your taste buds.

The only downside, we felt a little rushed to move on, but otherwise we'll certainly return and recommend.

Went to Boulevard before going to Wicked and they were extremely accommodating. We arrived 30 minutes late which only gave us 45 min. to eat which was cutting it close. I recommend having at least and hour, hour and a half to really enjoy the dining experience. The food is amazing and I had the California sea bass and the portions were perfect! If they have the artichoke ravioli on the app list when you are there you MUST order it. It's to die for. Enjoy!

Excellent food and great wine list. Not an extensive menu but a nice selection with everything done to perfection. Place was jammed on a Tuesday evening during the downturn as evidence of its popularity. Reserve early.
As usual our dining experience at Boulevard was super!
Salads and entrees were great, the dessert menu left a lot to be desired. I could make everything on there at home. If you need an entree modified, they were very acommadating.
The wine room is fabulous - but skip the swordfish - go for the filet instead.

The archtecture of the building inside was beautiful. The food was very good but I felt portions left you wanting more. Service was excellent with a water glass never empty. Valet service offered as well as coats checked.
Very disappointed - got a marginal table and the entree was weak - but it only ran me $500 for the 4 of us so I guess I should be happy

We were very impressed-the restaurant was even better than we'd expected,
although it has been open for such a long time. We were seated in the
back with a view of the Bay Bridge and the Embarcadero,all lit up, which
made it even more special. We would not have felt the same if we had
been seated along the side of the restaurant. We also felt that the waiter
who served us explained the menu in great detail, and even answered
our question about the bread (from Acme, baked right down the street.)
I have been to Boulevard several times and have never been disappointed. The food was phenomonal as was the service.
review_title: I have been to Boulevard several

review: Loved it. One of the most memorable dinner experiences I've ever had. Price was more than fair for the quality of food and wine.
review_title: Loved it. One of the most

review: Menu looked great but unfortunately had a table booked for 9 but seated at 10 which meant while eating our starters we could see our mains had been cooked & was sitting on the pass getting cold while the kitchen cleaned down. So when we were ready for our mains not only was it cold but the fish was overcooked. Great atmosphere at the before 10 but then rushed to leave unfortunately we were on a 5 day visit from london so rushed out the door at 11ish  was unfortunate especially for 3 course meal and wine when seated at 10.
I liked it, my wife thought the meat was less than stellar (we both had the filet mignon).  I would suggest bringing back the lobster bisque.  My wife would suggest offering a prime cut of meat.
review_title: I liked it, my wife thought

review:
Boulevard is a lovely restaurant with consistently delicious, fresh & well prepared food.  We have designated it as our restaurant of choice for lunch!  Staff is helpful, knowledgeable & gracious, but not overbearing.  Valet parking is a delight!  Thanks for remaining consistent in what you do so well.  
Suggestions - Sometimes there is a little too much chili or hot spices in the appetizers & the wait staff has inquired if it can be toned down or not for us.  
            - Offering more earlier options for at lunch(11:45 & noon), would be nice for Open Table customers.
We had a wonderful experience at Boulevard.  Great, very interesting, food nd even better service.
Pork was fine but I went here for the rib-eye steak and potatoes--but both were unavailable. Major bummer.
We had not been here in years even though we'd always like this place. It did not disappoint & I look forward to our next visit. Trust me it will be soon!!!
review_title: After all these years still a gem

review: Globe provides an excellent balance of rustic charm and modern features while still keep the noise level down enough to have an intimate conversation. The food was unique but not outlandish and was proportioned well for multiple courses.
Wonderful food and excellent service. Had the T-Bone Steak for two. Cooked to perfection. But then as a regular customer at The Globe, I am used to excellence. Their kitchen
Globe is our must do when we arrive late in SFO. Plane lands, check in at the hotel, head to Globe. Open late, great food, romantic - we love it!
review_title: Globe is our must do when

review:
Outside looks austere but inside the restaurant is warm and pleasant. The food is delicious. Service was a bit slow especially since we were
the first ones there when they opened at 6:00pm.

All in all an enjoyable dining experience.

I've been to Globe before but our dinner a few nights ago was really exceptional.

I had the arugula salad to start: the sweetness of the strawberries, the creaminess of the ricotta, the crunchiness of the toasted almonds, the pepperiness of the arugula and the tartness of the balsamic ... what a lovely symphony of perfectly in-tuned flavors. I then had the cod which was also fantastic, paired with snap peas, mushrooms and gnocchi. Hmmmm...

My husband had the ribs (starter) and duck (main). He was also incredibly pleased with his meal, particularly the thinly sliced ribs and perfectly matched watercress.
It took a long time for the food to arrive. The waiter/waitress was not happy or eager to serve you. We didn't feel welcome. The food was just warm.
review_title: It took a long time for the

review: The food was very good and presented well. We especially like the tuna tartare appetizer and the brussle sprout side. I thought the sturgeon was very good and had a bite of my partners salmon which I felt wasn't very flavorful(farm raised salmon). Our waiter left us rather cold, never welcomed us, was not available when we needed anything and failed to thank us as we were leaving. The rest of the wait staff filled in nicely for him and our busboy was very cordial and polite.
review_title: The food was very good and

review:
Have been here three other times in the past two years and the food was much better. Heirloom tomato salad was not very good. In fact, the cherry tomatoes were a bit off. The dessert was not special and wasn't actually what the server described to us. We expected an apple tart with pastry cream on top with gelato. It was actually apples on teh side of a puff pastry with a dollop of pastry cream and the gelato was grainy.
Just a bit disappointed in the quality of the food compared to prior experience.

We were there on a Sunday evening. The food was okay but I was disappointed in the entrees - seasoning just a little off. The first courses were very good and definitely the highlight. The service was okay but the staff was not well trained. One server leaned over my right shoulder to deliver a plate to someone on the opposite side of the table. This was a table that was open in the center of the restaurant, there was plenty of room behind the other person to serve the plate properly.
review_title: We were there on a Sunday

review: Globe was amazing. I had been here once before for a early Mother's Day dinner. I enjoyed it so much that I brought my girlfriend here for our first date. We were given a very romantic booth which definitely scored me some points. The service was perfect, the waitress offered us suggestions on the menu items and on our wine selection. We lingered around long after our meal was completed enjoying more dessert and more wine without ever feeling pressured to leave. We will be returning often.
review_title: Globe was amazing. I had been

review: It was awesome!! I took my girlfriend there for her 21st birthday. When I made the reservations 2 days prior, i mentioned that fact. They made note and wished her happy birthday when we sat down!! Our server was outstanding... She was very friendly and gave us the perfect amount of attention. I cant wait to go back.
review_title: It was awesome!! I took my

review: The food was OK; the service pretty bad. Our waitress kept rushing us through our courses: she brought entree silverware before we had a chance to finish our starters, presented the bill without our asking for it, and came back just a few minutes later saying she had finished her service and wanted to close our check. We had the impression of being in a diner, only prices were a lot higher. And the place was freezing cold.
review_title: The food was OK; the service

review: Very limited menu incredibly incompetent and uninspiring waitress. Busboy was far more competent and gracious. food choices very limited and quality lacking. bread tasted like i thad been refrigerated. i would NEVER return and never refer anyone there .
As always, fantastic food and service. The steak for two is exceptional.

I had a salmon dish, which as such was good; the problem was that the fish itself was pretty rich, and then an enormous amount of pure butter or cream was added in the kitchen, so by the time I was almost done with it, I was near sick with fat in my tummy. But I loved the spigariello.
review_title: I had a salmon dish, which

review: We ended up having several appetizers all of which were excellent. They do very good salads and the dresings were delicate and tasty.Lamb on a squewer was fabulous. Good wine list.Hard to hear dining partner as the high ceiling made the acoustics noisy and stressful.service was okay.....I felt they took too long to get our order, but once the order was in, it all arrived very fast.We both felt hard pressed to find an entree that appealed because the combination choices were a little 'out there' for our tastes.I think it's always a good idea to have a couple of 'safe' items for those who don't want to eat unchartered territory.We were made to feel welcome immediatly upon arrival and seated immediatly.Lots of energy in the place.

the staff, the food, the wine = the best!
we get to this gem whenever we're back in our old neighborhood.
authentic italian experience.
happy to give this place props, even at the risk of it getting overrun :O/

When visiting San Francisco which we do two to three times a year we always make the trip to Russian Hill for dinner; the food at Amarena is fresh from garden to table, well prepared, and innovative, along with an amazing waitstaff.  Don't be dissuaded by the off the beaten path location it clearly is a GEM within the city.
Eggplant is always outstanding for a starter, super tasty salads, and the marsala is outstanding; ENJOY!

We walked down for dinner after drinks at home. This isn't the first time this has been our modus operandi. We are always remembered, the wines are good and well-priced, and the food is like Italian comfort food. It will continue to be our go to place when we don't have the energy to organize a full-fledged dinner party at home.
review_title: Great night with out of towners

review: Loved the food & they were excellent at the pacing. Cozy & quiet.
An absolutely wonderful experience. The food was incredible and the service was perfect.

I had been here before for drinks and aps at the bar, but this is the first time I'd been here for dinner. My review is for this particular dining experience. The first thing we noticed when we walked in is how warm/hot it was. I remember this the last time. They may need to regulate the temperature in their restaurant better. We started with a cucumber salad which was basic and nothing special. We then shared the lasagna (which was perfect comfort food) and also the tagliatelle with mushrooms and truffle oil (a nice light pasta not but lacking in a bit of flavor). We did not have any dessert. Overall our experience was just okay. This would not be one of my top places to go to especially since there are so many other options in the city.
review_title: I had been here before for

review:
NOT ONLY WAS OUR TABLE READY WHEN WE ARRIVED BUT THE RESTAURANT CALLED TO CONFIRM IF WE WERE COMING A FEW MINUTES BEFORE OUR ARRIVAL.

OUR WAITRESS WAS EFFICIENT AND GOOD HUMORED, THE FOOD WAS DELICIOUS,THE ENERGY WAS GREAT AND THE PRICES WERE MODERATE.

I HAD THE BEET SALAD AND OSSO BUCCO BOTH OF WHICH I WOULD RECOMMEND.
review_title: NOT ONLY WAS OUR TABLE READY

review: My favorite restaurant in San Francisco hands down!
Yet another restaurant blessing in the 49 square miles surrounded by reality...
nice neighborhood place, good food, a bit salty for my taste, but very good, service was good, place was very noisy will go back in a year or so

What a treat. This was a great find, recommended by the concierge at the hotel. Local spot on Russian Hill, away from the tourists and crowds in the financial district. Amazing good, great wine and very reasonable prices. Small and romantic you will love this place.
review_title: What a treat. This was a great

review: We found the food to be very, very good. Well prepared and presented. The wine list though not extensive had the right selections for the menu. Service was attentive and timely.
review_title: We found the food to be very,

review: Noise and service were the main issues with Amarena. The noise was mostly due to one particularly loud group, so could be forgiven. However the service lacked in several areas, it was unclear who our server was (multiple folks acted in this role), our silverware was bussed after the salad/appetizer course but not replaced until after our dinners had been on the table for a few minutes. After dinner had been bussed, we sat for 30-45 minutes before an insincere offer of the dessert menu (which we had wanted 30 minutes before) prompted us to ask for the check.

My party and I were in San Francisco for the holidays. We were staying at a nearby hotel. We did not want an expensive meal. I read the reviews and also solicited help from the concierge at the hotel where we were staying. It was difficult to discern what restaurants were open on Christmas. The reviews for MaSo were decent and it was walking distance from our hotel. The service was great but the food was meh. We had salads first - the romaine on my Caesar was very bitter and the other salad had slimy greens for a portion of the salad. I had the Christmas special which featured a filet and lobster tail. This entree was fine but not remarkable. Our other entree was the blackened flounder which was so-so. My special came with a special chocolate chestnut dessert. The cake was dry on my first bite but it did improve after that.

We were fortunate enough to eat at the Chef's Table and received fantastic service. The ambiance and service really made our visit to Ducca memorable. The food was a little hit and miss. I had the risotto with rabbit and black truffle and it was just wonderful. The layers of flavors were just amazing. Others at my table had the osso bucco and found it to be a little tough and dry, two qualities one doesn't expect in a slow braised dish. The wine list was complete, if not extensive. We enjoyed an unfiltered Newton Chard with our first course. For a special occasion, I would highly recommend the chef's table at Ducca. We will definitely be back.
Ducca is an excellent restaurant - I've only eaten there for lunch, but have enjoyed it each time.
the noise from the bar into the dinig room is too much, i would like to see some type of doors to keep the bar noise down.
review_title: the noise from the bar into

review:
We were looking for a place to have a late lunch on Friday, that wasn't downtown. The reviews for Bella Trattoria were great, both on Open Table and Yelp, so we made a reservation. From the outside, it would be easy to overlook Bella Tratoria, but don't! The food and the service was amazing! Too start with, they don't serve iced tea, but our server offered to make some using teabags, which was nice. We shared their version of a ceasar salad, which was done exactly right, nice and crisp with a tangy dressing. We then had the pasta with fennel sauge, which was perfectly cooked. The server comped us a dessert, which was very nice.

They are only open for lunch on Fridays, but are open for dinner all week. Definitely make a reservation if you are going for dinner, I am sure it is quite busy in the evenings.

Bella is one of my favorite go to Italian restaurant in SF that I've been going to for over 10yrs.  Easy to get to on the 38 bus (stops right at the front door!), great service, extensive wine list and you never leave there feeling hungry still.
review_title: Bella is one of my favorite go to Italia...

review: The food was well seasoned and creatively presented.  From the outside of the place I expected to be able to have easy conversation.  But, with the bar in the back and a large-screen TV in the front (soccer game on!), conversation was difficult.  This is a great place for young folks to see and be seen.
review_title: Lively, but noisier than I like

review: Bella is more than a great neighborhood place. Its the kind of simple but yummy Italian cooking that they used to have in North Beach, cooked by Italians and served by Italians. Elegant ambiance, reasonably priced too

We went here for a birthday dinner, not knowing anything about this place but seeing that it had gotten pretty good reviews on Yelp. We arrived about 45 minutes early, but the host seated us right away anyway, saying our table was waiting for us. The burrata special appetizer we ordered was creamy and delicious. My son likes carpaccio, so we also ordered that as an appetizer and loved every bite. Between us, we ordered the trout, the amatraciani, the gnocchi and another pasta dish with fettucini. All were delicious and well prepared. The service was great also. The waitress we had was there when we wanted her but did not hover. Overall, a very good experience. We will definitely be back!
Go with an empty stomach, portions are generous. We've gone twice now and haven't been able to order dessert.
Hey! Took a friend from out of town here and we had a great time. The service was friendly and attentive, and the food was very delicious. I will take more friends here!
review_title: Hey! Took a friend from out

review:
THIS WAS OUR SECOND VISIT TO BELLA AND WE REALLY ENJOY THE FLAVORS THEY CREATE ESPECIALLY WITH THEIR PASTAS. EXCELLENT RAGU THIS TIME BUT THE GNOCCHI WAS EVEN BETTER. SO SOFT AND FLAVORFUL SERVED WITH A PERFECT COMPLIMENTARY SUASAGE. THE VERDURE VEGETABLE SOUP IS TOP NOTCH AND WE AGAIN HAD THE TUNA CARPACCIO....DON'T MISS IT. THE STAFF IS VERY FRIENDLY TOO WHICH IS A BIG PLUS.

THIS IS A TERRIFIC FIND IN AN UNLIKELY SPOT ON GEARY BLVD. WORTH THE VISIT FOR SURE.
Bella is consistently good. Great neighborhood spot.
The food was amazing. I may become a regular here!
review_title: The food was amazing. I may

review: Great Italian food! One of the best Italian restaurants in the city.
Totally enjoyed the food on this very straight forward, well executed menu.
The food was simply delicious and divine. The waiters were very attentive and helpful.

I've been frequenting Bella Tratoria restaurant for over 10 years now.
The food, service, and ambience are consistently great and overall this is one of my favorite restaurants. Make the short trip out to the Avenues (SF Richmond district) and enjoy this unknown gem!
Food was awesome. Gnocchi was delicious. Stuffed eggplant appetizer was phenomenal. Great italian spot.

A gem, hidden in the Richmond District. Outstanding Italian pastas, taste like food you would have in Naples. Very reasonably priced, bit as good as some of the more famous Italian food joints. Wine list limited but very adequate. Very highly recommend.
review_title: A gem, hidden in the Richmond

review: The food was very good, the service excellent, the prices were very reasonable. The place is cozy and probably good for intimate dinners. Will try dinner the next time
review_title: The food was very good, the

review: Our waiter was outstanding. He was attentive and polite. He brought us a complimentary dessert while we sat chatting, waiting for our bill. Having overheard that we were there to celebrate a graduation, he brought the guest of honor some ice cream with a candle in it. We will return to this place because of this outstanding service. The food was good, too.
Love this place. Quite a gem in the Richmond - one of the best romantic spots for the Richmond, but also has a fun vibe. Great atmosphere, always enjoy the food.
review_title: Love this place. Quite a gem

review: The food was fresh and wonderfully flavored and the service impeccable. Great dining experience.
review_title: The food was fresh and wonderfully

review: Great service! Friendly atmosphere! Great staff/owner! Great overall! :D
Boring atmosphere. Stiff service. Not a place to go for a hip location.
review_title: Boring atmosphere. Stiff service. Not a ...

review:
The atmosphere was very plesant and the food was superb: fresh, very tasty, healthy portions, and creative.

The service was attentive and enthusiastic.
Didn't realize the restaurant was in the JW Marriot Hotel. Felt more like a lobby bar/restaurant. The food was decent, but the atmosphere was disappointing.

Located in the JW Marriott San Francisco Union Square, Level III is a hidden gem. Ben Mattman and his staff created a culinary feast that we both enjoyed. The service was exceptional and the restaurant build out is beautiful. The bar also offers great drink specialties. I will be back and expect this fine dining spot in Union Square to become popular.

The food was uniformly good to great (the short ribs were special as were the scallops). Prices are reasonable, especially the 3 course option for $39. And you can hear yourself talk. What a change from the head banging noise ofter present in many of the trendy restaurants.

we had a lovely time at Level III. The staff was very accommodating, seating us next to a roaring fire. It was Christmas dinner with a set menu, so we had delicious holiday drinks while we waited for our three courses to arrive. First course, yummy ahi tartare for the hubby and flavorful crab bisque for me. Then the hubs had a tender steak with frites that he thoroughly enjoyed. I opted for the lobster risotto and salmon, which was nice, but the steak was better. The last course was fabulous fondue with homemade marshmallows and a big carafe of piping hot coffee. The service was exceptional. The prices reasonable. I would recommend this place for a quiet dinner with friendly service.
review_title: we had a lovely time at Level

review: Some might consider it being in the Marriot to be a draw back, but the the restaurant is set up in a way that really works. If you're trying to catch a show, go there. The service was outstanding, in fact our server even gave us time checks. The happy hour lasts until 7PM, and they have a good wine list. The salad was very good and the pasta and 3 soft tacos were good. Not off the charts, but good. I'd definitely go back.

This was a great looking place with phenomenal food. Still can't figure out why there was NO ONE THERE!!! A couple people sitting at the bar and only one other couple eating dinner while we were there. It was 8pm on a Tuesday during a recession...maybe that's why. Anyway, this was the best food out of anywhere we ate while in the Napa Valley and Union Square and they just need to figure out how to get more people in there.
review_title: This was a great looking place

review: Brunch here on a sunny Sunday was the best decision I made. It was an awesome experience with really friend staff who tried to help despite it being super busy. The food was so delicious I couldn't have time to take a photo before it was eaten up!

Spruce is set up to be an upscale restaurant and it certainly achieves this vision with ambiance, but the food and service were not up to par with what they were trying to present the restaurant to be. For one, our server never checked in once throughout our three courses to ask how the food was. He showed up to take orders (never asked if I had any questions) and to see if he could take the plates away. I particularly didn't like his recommendation of the sturgeon, but because he didn't inquire about the significant amount left on my plate, I didn't really get a chance to let him know. My boyfriend sat the whole meal without a napkin and he had something floating about in his port. For the price that we were paying, I was expecting something up to the caliber of some of San Francisco's best restaurants (and there are plenty!), but my experience was lackluster. I don't particularly mind a  stuffy atmosphere if it can deliver, but Spruce missed the mark for me.

I've never heard of a corkage fee as high and escalated as Spruce's:  $35 for the first bottle, $30 for the second and $75 for the third.  Ridiculous!  And it felt as if the waiter was trying to upcharge us the whole night -- with some kind of fabulous steak for two starting at $145 -- seriously?? Lobster for $75.  Add truffles here, there, everywhere.  What's wrong with the regular menu?  Not much, except that the whole experience left our whole party with a bad taste in the mouth.  They charge high prices because they can, not because it was worth it.

Was a lovely evening as always, but should have gone with the recommendation by the waiter of the pork - which my husband had and was delicious. I had the cod and loved the sublte truffle flavor but I am not a fan of yellow and green wax beans - especially when they are squeaking against my teeth.  So nothing wrong with dish - just not a personal favorite of  mine.   Where some people hate broccoli - I dislike beans!  They forgot to add the $100 bottle of wine to our bill - which we brought to their attention and they were shocked and appreciative that we did.
review_title: Was a lovely evening as always, but shou...

review: I was on vacation at San Francisco and trying new restaurants. Despite the amazing food this restaurant had one of the best desserts I had in my life. Try the devil's food cake with banana icecream and caramel sauce.

Three of us celebrate our birthdays together every year. We chose Spruce this year. It was excellent..we sat in the small front room where it was quiet so we could even hear one another.  One celebrant is 93 years old.

Had a most memorable evening celebrating a special occasion. Our dinner companions are major foodies and were raving at each course. Highly recommend the scallops to start and the gem salad was quite nice. All the entrees were exceptionally balanced and delicious. Service was excellent and ambience lovely with a mature crowd. Can't wait to go back!
Food was delicious, service was great. Dinner portions were small, but well prepared.

We have been to Spruce a number of times. The service and the wines and ambience have been notable for their quality and consistency. However, the food has somewhat diminished in quality.

The pasta -- simple as it is -- was overcooked and lumpy. The sauce was not as great as previous visits. The deserts were good but not as great.
review_title: Quality of the food has diminished

review: The staff was terrific. I do not go to nice restaurants very often so I usually have a lot of questions with the menu as there are a lot of terms I am not familiar with. The waiter was terrific in explaining all of the answers to the questions I had. The vegetables were not what I was used to having and although prepared in a fancy way, were not that tasty. The restaurant is so dark, it is difficult to read the menu even with my glasses on and also difficult to tell what it is exactly you are eating from your plate. I had the pork dish and it was prepared well, but not a lot of food. Bread, cheese roll and peanut butter/chocolate desert candy were terrific. It was a wonderful night out, but portions were small.
Nice place. Great food but those bottles of water (!) and glasses of wine really add to the bill.
Fabulous food, service and ambiance . I don't see how anyone could be unhappy dining here .
Second visit within a week. Excellent Food, great but very expensive wine list, and terrific service. Atmosphere very enjoyable yet sophisticated.
review_title: One of San Francisco's very best

review: Everything was as I expected, having been here before. It was nice to go one a weekday where it was less busy than usual though. The only tiny annoying thing was that I was particularly looking for an interesting Cabernet Franc and didn't find anything under $200 on the menu. The Sommelier did have one that wasn't under the Cabernet Franc area of the menu, but it was only a half bottle, so we then had to find another wine to go with the first half of the meal. This turned out to be convenient though, as it allowed us to pair a white with the appetizers and a red with the entrees.
Very good food. The tuna was truly special. Duck confit a bit dry. Excellent, but outrageously overpriced wines. Four times wholesale is unreasonable.
review_title: Very good food. The tuna was

review: Spruce was wonderful. We were confused about the time of our reservation, but they took it in stride and sat us as soon as they could. The service and the food were both beautifully executed. It was a night that could have been a disaster due to our errors, but was wonderful due to their flawless execution.

We were seated in the back room away from the din of the restaurant. We arrived late for our reservation after calling to let them know. It felt like we were being banished. The food was delicious and service was very good. I don't think I would return.
review_title: We were seated in the back

review: Odd and disappointing. Spruce has been a favorite for a while. We signed up for the Clos du Val winemaker's dinner weeks ago and it was set for Monday August 27th.The sommelier, "Chris" called to say the dinner was cancelled, but urged us to still come to dinner and promised to provide 'free wine parings,' I mentioned I might bring a bottle and he said no problem as long as he can taste it,as he "gives as good as he gets." So we went for dinner and guess what? Chris doesn't work on Monday nights. No worries, we told those on duty what he had said and they said no problem.We had cocktails and wine (paid for) but they charged $30 corkage for a 1/2 bottle of 2004 Chateau Margaux I brought to share with Chris...the wine pairings are inexpensive

As usual spruce was lovely. Our waiter was both humorous and filled with information about the food, cocktail and wine list. Always fun to leave knowing more than you did before sitting down to dinner. The food is excellent, make sure not to miss the french fries. Stop by for either a fabulous martini and burger in the bar or a gourmet meal served in plush dining room.

We came to Spruce on Friday night and it was all of our first time. Highly recommended the restaurant lived up and surpassed all of our expectations. Glamorous setting, interesting food options presented beautifully and an impressive wine selection (Have Chris help you, he is extremely knowledgeable and personable, he recommended three fabulous bottles we would have again) The three entrees were perfection and the foie gras appetizer is a must. My partner and I brought my mom for her Birthday dinner and it couldn't have gone better. Cant wait to come back.

the service was superb. the waiter really helped us out when picking what to eat as well as the wines (the list was 100pages long!!).. we arrived late (called of course) and they were really accommodating. the ambiance was great - not too snobby or anything, that you might feel at some higher end restaurants. the food was delish! the charcuterie is a great sampler dish!

The service was impeccable and the breads and appetizers were very good, but the entrees were disappointing. The folks at the table who had the chicken cordon bleu said it was flavorless. My fish was fine, but nothing to rave about. Not good enough for the price. It has a nice ambiance, but is more the wealthy older folks than the young professionals crowd.
Fabulous! It just keeps getting better. My all-time favorite lunch spot!
The staff is well trained and can accommodate almost any request.  I have to say, the burger may be the best in San Francisco.
For the price, we expected more.  The food was good but not great and not particularly memorable.

Food was delicious and well-prepared. The vibe of the place was off-putting and inconsistent, however. The owners are clearly shooting for a high-end, high-touch experience - evidenced by the pretty high-end prices (for instance, their wines per glass were stratospheric - many in the $15-24 range). Yet the service was dodgy- slow, no water refills, a number of items missing on the menu on a mid-service Fri. Lunch. Good food, but I frankly expect more for $60/person.
Food was good. Too expensive for what it is. Environment too masculine.

Food was excellent. Entire dinner was diminshed by slow wine service. The wait staff took 40 minutes to deliver us a warm bottle of Chardonnay. The waiter seemed more concerned about elaborate descriptions of the food and not about waiting the table.
Ate at bat food was very very good and service was so much better than our last visit for dinner 18 months before.
review_title: Ate at bat food was very very

review: Had a great lunch - very good food and wonderful atmosphere. One of our favorite San Francisco eateries.
review_title: Had a great lunch - very good

review: The food was delicious, the cocktails were fantastic, ambiance was stellar, staff was friendly & knowledgable ... we will most definitely be back and soon!

For the price you pay, i feel that the food should have had more depth and more thought put into it. The Dine About Town Menu was pretty weak compared to other participating restaurants, and despite the many good reviews, I don't know if we should give spruce another chance to redeem themselves. For supposedly having a great burger, it wasn't as creative and tasty as we thought it would be, and it came with cold, greasy, overfried french fries. Hopefully this doesn't happen to other diners.
review_title: For the price you pay, i feel

review: Classy, tucked-away location in Laurel Heights. Exterior is very nondescript and you would not know it was there. Once inside it is very calm and open (a former old-timey garage I think it was). Calm and dark, but in a good way, and there is indirect light that comes in from the overhead skylights, so it's not a cave. Just cozy. Service is great, and staff are uniformed. Linen service. Food is very good and there are prix-fixe options (also at lunch) that take the guesswork out of a meal (sometimes a good thing). Great wine selection and choices by the glass. If you mention you don't have a lot of time they will accommodate. Overall, if I could spend an hour and a half to two hours every day there, I would. It CAN be expensive but worth it.
Food and service were excellent. I find the wine list pricey. Not enough choice for glasses of wine. Only one glass of wine in the single digits. All others 12-18 or more per glass.
Really very nice. I'm a fan of the Pub in Woodside as well, but overall a unusually nice experience.
review_title: Really very nice. I'm a fan

review: We had a wonderful experience. The price fix lunch menu is a real bargin for the quality of food. We can not wait until we dine there for dinner.
Fun evening, but wine list is overwhelming....1600 wines...would take you 2 hours to review the list, fortunately the server had some suggestions, but limited amount of wines under $60.

The food was outstanding, and their wine list is pretty impressive.
The service was good in the beginning, but as the restaurant got very busy, we had to wait for our waiter forever. I noticed that there were mostly groups of people, and not so many couples.
I wouldnt consider this place as romantic, as we felt like the only couple there. Plus it was extremely noisy. The room dcor is very beautiful, with high ceiling and cool art. People are fancy and dressed up. Over all, definitely worth to try, though reservations are hard to get.
The greens in the salad were not as fresh and crisp as they might have been and the entre was so-so. It was a disappointing experience since I was expecting an outstanding meal.
review_title: The greens in the salad were

review: Great experience - one thing that did concern me was the sommelier turned up at our table and did not introduce himself- or even say a word - he just looked down at us in a very snooty way and assumed we knew who he was- I even had to ask him if he was the sommelier.Apart from that one small concern a pleasant evening. graham

Our first trip to Spruce and certainly no dissappointment. The pork loin with pork belly was to die for. The restaurant was just voted one of the top-10 in the United States by Esquire magazine and the restuarant offered us a complimentary glass of champagne in celebration. A very nice treat.
review_title: Our first trip to Spruce and

review: Ordered the prix fixe lunch and waitress and kitchen were very accomodating in adjustments to meed dietary needs.  Conclusion: Good place for a special lunch, but a bit pricey for every day.

Overall we had a great dinner at Spruce.  I've lived in the city for over 5 yrs now and am moving to Seattle so I wanted to get in all the restaurants I wanted to try before we left.  Spruce was the last one and i'm glad we went.  The food was delicious, the dessert especially was amazing!!!  I really loved the decor and ambiance.  They've done an amazing job with the space and I know this restaurant will be a hit for a long time!
review_title: Overall we had a great dinner

review: The food was aas good as the hype.  The decor was very attractive.  Very much enjoyed the lunch. Plan to return soon.
review_title: The food was aas good as the

review:
The service was very poor and inattentive. Our  wait person was dismissive and  we had to eventually approacha head wit person maitre de to inquire about our lunch.
Service was a real turn-off although the food was quite good.

The food, service, and wait-person were absolutely wonderful!  This was my second dining experience, but the first for my family.  Each occasion was delightful!

Please keep up the good work.

Philip M. Smith
What a great surprise...an unimposing corner restaurant with delicious, inventive food, good service and "over the top" pie for dessert...we'll be back!

These burgers will take you to another place. I keep coming back for more. The ingredients in all the food is fresh and interesting. I particularly liked the fried capers in the hamachi appetizer for a salty crunch. As well as the parsnip chip topped Brussel sprouts. YUMMM YUMMM

The fun small restaurant was recommended to us. We had a great meal, lots of fun and enjoyed checking out this neighborhood.
I highly recommend it. We almost stopped back later for dessert when we saw it was still open - but still happily full from the main meal.

I had the most wonderful birthday dinner experience here. I don't usually stay at any restaurant for more than an hour and a half max, but my party stayed for over 2 hours because we were having such a lovely time.
The staff paid the perfect amount of attention and I can't even begin to explain how delicious the food was.
One of the best dinners I have had in a really long time!
review_title: I had the most wonderful birthday

review: I can't believe we've lived a few blocks away for nearly 2 years and haven't been here before! The place has a nice open architecture with really high ceilings and windows. The food is very nicely prepared by chefs who clearly know what they are doing. The pork dish was absolutely delightful, each bite melting in my mouth. When we arrived at 7, less than half the seats were taken. By the middle of our meal, I think every seat had a happy diner seated there. The only reason I gave 4 stars for service is that when the place was full, the always friendly staff could have used some more help. But everyone was helping out, I think we had 4 different people serve us throughout the evening.
review_title: How did we miss this place?

review: My biggest comment is the menu on their website was very different than the one currently in use....Otherwise it was an OK experience.

Seriously, I had such a bad experience here for dinner. Have gone here multiple times for breakfast and brunch but, wow, dinner was terrible.
