We were maybe the 5th table seated for dinner service with another 5-6 tables that came in after us. Not sure what was going on with the kitchen and the food expediting but people's apps and entrees took FOREVER to be served. Not only that, they came out in the most random order, the people who came in after us were served before the people who came in before us. We were actually served last!! The server was hardly apologetic and didn't check in on us often enough to make us feel like there was a legitimate delay with the food, nor did he try to get our food to us quickly. NO TIP FOR YOU!
Amazing food. Innovative but still with neighborhoody feel to the place.

This is a great neighborhood spot, but unfortunately their wine list is really bad. It's really almost inexcusable considering the price point on the food, and the extensive amount of good wine available here in Northern California. The biggest problem is that not only is the wine list bad, all the wines are overpriced for the quality offered. I'd gladly pay $12 for a glass of decent wine, but it needs to be decent. Their wine choices are poor, and have been since they opened. If they're going to serve subpar wines, at least offer it at cheap prices. OR better yet, get a GOOD wine program. We live near enough to the restaurant, that if we invite friends to join us for dinner there, we start at our place with GOOD wine first.

Warm, attentive server, able to accomodate late arriving members of our party. Creative and flavorful entrees, superb salads and excellent wine recommendations. We appreciated the friendly, attitude-free service and loved that the noise level was low enogh that we could converse comfortable. Liked the cozy decor and lighting and the seasonally based menu. Highly recommend!
Best service that I've had in San Francisco. Our server was amazing - he went through the menu with us and let us try a wine before we purchased a bottle.
The food was great. It was best service we have had in a long time. A very memorable meal! Anthony was our waiter. Also, met the owner. He was very nice.
review_title: The food was great. It was

review:
Mission Beach Cafe is a beautiful, new restaurant with a changing menu full of unique and delicious flavors. It has a small, intimate feel and a quiet atmosphere that was the perfect backdrop for a pre-Valentines dinner for two.

Pastry chef and co-owner Alan Carter is a genius with his desserts, pies, and collection of pastries. His Manhattan Blackout Cake was unbelievable and his pie is to die for. Mission Beach Cafe is highly recommended.
review_title: Mission Beach Cafe is a beautiful,

review: Good neighborhood restaurant for a casual dinner out, but a Saturday night date spot this is not
Service was superior. We had a stroller which they were able to accommodate. The food was excellent. We've never had anything but great food and service at Mission Beach Cafe.
Menu included strange items like head cheese and cocoa infused pasta. Not a lot of incredibly appealing options IMHO.
Love this place for it's great combination of local food, relaxed but attentive service and great atmosphere, tucked into a residential neighborhood in Bernal Heights
Had a fantastic experience! Great, out-of-the-way SF gem.
I was looking for Indian food and this place was great. Chicken tikka was perfect, and their naan was amazing

Having visited their first restaurant, Allspice in San Mateo, numerous times, we looked forward to dinner at Game. Other than the fact that there were few other people there, it did not disappoint.  Sachin continues to concentrate on unique combinations of flavors and textures, this time with game as the centerpiece and the presentations are all beautiful.  I have no doubt it will soon be as difficult to secure a table as it is at Allspice!
review_title: Another winner for Sachin and Shoshana

review: Love to come here to share the great small plates. Favorites are the scallops.
The restaurant was too loud but the food and service were great.  Lots of interesting small plates.  Desserts were exceptional.
The food was great and reminded me of some of many great meals I've had in Venice.  The spicy Tuna Bolognese we excellent.  Nice Italian wine selection also.

This is a fine restaurant - just tried the brunch and it was great and under-busy so noise level was no problem.  The lighting at night can be quite dim so those with aging eyes might have trouble reading the menu.  The array of offerings are excellent and delicious, though, so just use your iPhone if you're having trouble.  A high quality restaurant to have in the Castro.
review_title: Nice to have in the Castro

review: Very pretty little place.  We received a warm greeting and were seated at a booth.  The Love Letter cocktail was fabulous and I plowed through two.  The Crab Macarons were very nice, generous in size and you receive three.  It had lovely lumps of crab and the toasts on either side made for a lovely crunch.  The Breads & Spreads left a lot to be desired.  Ours had "nan" bread (but was obviously not made in a tandoor as there was no lovely char to it and it was too uniformly puffy.  The mini chala were just cakey and dry.  If breads are not your strong point, buy in some good stuff or don't feature it as a menu item at least.  The spread portion was Plugra butter with some apricot olivey tapenade like item.  Again, not floating our boats.  The mains went down a treat though.  My sea bass was the perfect size and the flavors on the plate were lovely.  I enjoyed how they had the separate components of the dish kept separate so that I was able to avoid the bits I don't like which were capers & eggplant.  The lamb shank went down a treat with the boys.  We were so full that we didn't really have any room for dessert so will have to come back again for that.
They have many interesting dishes on the menu; it was fun to try some of them.

A great experience. An easy walk from our hotel in the Union Square area., we were seated immediately even though we were a few minutes early. Dining area was nice if a bit noisy.
Our waiter, John, was attentive and professional, answering all our questions.
We started with the Crab Macarons, which were delightful. I had the Wagyu beef with charred onions and scallop mousse for my main (paired with Montecillo Gran Reserva 2006), and my wife had the Fried chicken (with kimchi powder, pickled vegetables, red pepper). Both dishes were excellently prepared and quite tasty. Dessert was a deconstructed nectarine parfait-y creation. Overall a wonderful meal. Kudos to Chef Thompson and the staff.

The food was delicious, creative, and beautifully presented! The service was attentive and very pleasant. I already ate there twice, once with a big group and the second time just 2 people, and both times the food and service were outstanding.
First visit since remodel and it was absolutely fantastic. Great food, beer and vibe. Sam, our waitress was knowledgeable and hospitable. Erick the manager was the same. Can't wait to go again.

While it was a great overall experience, the menu selection was very limited; i.e. Brats only one option, for a German restaurant there should be at a minimum three (3) options.  The portions were satisfying for lunch, but the salmon did not state beets were part of the items that came with the dish.  Just little items that need to be worked out but I would definitely go again.
review_title: While it was a great overall experience,...

review: Anzu has a nice quiet room and a present while inconspicuous staff, but the food was relatively unimpressive. "The Rock" was an appetizer with a fun approach to "cook your own beef", but the portion was smaller than it could have been. A roasted chicken was a little dry and not so interesting. The duck was a small portion and the taste was not as appealing as the same preparation I've had elsewhere. I think that if one knows their way around this menu, they might put together an overall better food experience than we had. Not bad, just not special.

The Anzu buffet is widely varied so everyone in your group can find things that appeal to them. The only complaint I had was that the gravy was the first thing in the buffet line so you had to go through the line and make your plate and then go back to the beginning to put gravy on your turkey, dressing and potatoes... I told them a few times and they did nothing. They did however assume that I was a lot older and crankier than I looked whereby they responded by giving my group the senior discount... 10 years early.  ;-)

We went there with our family and were 6 people.  The service to begin was extremely slow.  The person serving us had his mind somewhere else.  Also, noticed since we were 6 and gratuity was automatically included, the service got poorer as the night progressed.  We witnessed other tables of smaller size getting much better service including our waiter who would skip our table even though we needed stuff.

Food on the other hand was very good.  The Salmon and Cod in the main course are delicious, so are the various sushi rolls. Finished with desert which was also very good.  Recommend going in smaller groups to have a decent experience.

The Hamachi Nigiri was great, but my steak was undercooked (and sent back), and the other food (sushi rolls) was average. Our server was very attentive and thoughtful when *around*, but was fairly scarce and did not check up on us within a reasonable time after we were given our food. Service was slow: our main courses took an hour to get to us which is ridiculous, and their menu was overpriced. Another server who approached me when I couldn't find our waiter, was aloof and spoke with a tone of indifferent annoyance when asking what I needed (white female, top knot'd hair). So overall, we loved the "look and feel" of Anzu, but everything else was disappointing. With all of the choices in the SF, we are sad to say we wouldn't return here.
Crazy overpriced for brunch. Bill was $200+ for 3 people!
review_title: Crazy overpriced for brunch. Bill was $2...

review: Anzu's Dine-about-town offering was beautifully presented as well as being delicious. Good value for the money. Would definitely return, whether for lunch, dinner, or cocktails and appetizers.

I had a great evening here. I have been here several times. The service is always excellent. The server Chris and the busser David were a highly effective combo effectively taking care of my party and I. I enjoy this place. The meat is excellent. The fish is filled with flavor and the vibe is happy and joyous. Ten Stars.

I started by ordering the 2012 Seaglass, a light white Pinot Gris from Santa Barbara. The heirloom tomato salad was very good and started the meal off nicely. The excellent Misoyaki Black Cod was accompanied by okra, cherry tomato concasse, yamaimo and ginger truffle dashi. I finished with 'The Fog a dessert of dark chocolate cake, banana cream and butterscotch sauce. The presentation was great, with supercooled liquid creating a cloud surrounding the dish.

First time my girlfriend and I dined in a classy restaurant. Hostess directed us to a nice intimate space. And the server Chris has been very attentive. He has recommended sake and soup, and his suggestions did not disappoint. Overall service was outstanding alongside the Steve Tyrell performance that followed. I would definitely like to go back for a nice dinner and performance again!

I needed to attange a dinner for 12 people on short notice and Anzu was able to accomodate us. We were seated promptly and the service was excellent. The wine list was good with a reasonable markup. Our group had a mix of the sushi dishes and the western dishes. Everyone seemed pleased but not overwelmed. My husband had sushi and thought the portions were small. I had the filet which was cooked appropriately and seasoned well. The setting was very attractive and there was not a lot of background noise so we were able to converse which we enjoyed.
review_title: I needed to attange a dinner

review: a bit spooky -- emptyish -- for the first 45 mins then it began to fill in. Inconvenient for wheelchair and walker access
Felt the menu was uninspired, and it was a ghost town at lunch.
I ordered fish and got a portion that must have been 2 ounces. The vegetables described in the menu were miniscule. I thought it was an appetizer when I first saw it. I was starving.
review_title: I ordered fish and got a portion

review: The "Express Lunch" was a great combo of soup, ahi, etc. It was very delicious and worthwhile! I highly recommend this for lunch.

The food didnt match the beautiful decor. My fish of Mahi Mahi was so overcooked and tasted like a shoe. They need a new chef. Had to chase down the wait staff for items. Very disappointing. Had breakfast there the next morning and the service was excellent and timely food to table.
review_title: The food didnt match the beautiful

review: This place was quite tasty. Filet was excellent, as was the blue cheese butter, scallion potatoes. Excellent service, and the executive chef came to our table to make sure all was well. And it's right off Union Square.
anzu was excellent. your reservation was not in their system, though
I love Anzu! The service was outstanding and they were very accommodating to my special diet request. Food was delicious. I can't wait to go back.

Went for the brunch hosted by KBLX. Wasn't what I expected. Thought there would be live music. Not worth it for the money. I usually go to HS Lordships in Berkeley and will probably not return to Anzu for their brunch. The ambiance and atmosphere was nice, but the food, while good, wasn't spectacular. $50 not well spent.

We went for Dine About Town and for a little office lunch. They screwed up my co-worker and I orders; we ordered the halibut sandwich with fries and received the salads instead. And for a restaurant of that caliber, the service can be better; it's fair, not great. I know, I'm a hard grader.
review_title: We went for Dine About Town

review: ANZU is an excellent restaurant...a very comfortable lounge, nice bar, sushi bar and main dining room. Always reliable and one of my favorite places.
Wonderful food... beautiful restaurant.... excellent service.
Everything was excellent. Not for a quick business lunch. More relaxed dining required. Very attentive staff.

We went to the Sunday brunch for our wedding anniversary. It wasn't romantic but the food was excellent. It is a bit pricy but I would do it again only for a very special occasion. Best tasting desserts!
review_title: We went to the Sunday brunch

review: I went for their Sunday Brunch. Overall, the food is good, but it is your average brunch entrees, and not too many selections. I expected more being that it was a special occasion, Father's Day. I was also quite disappointed with the small sushi selection, and the quality was not great either, considering that Anzu is a Japanese restaurant. The dimsum selection was also very ordinary and disappointing. I'd say the best part was the flowing champagne and mimosas of which the servers always refilled. Other than that, I was not impressed and would not care to come back for the sunday brunch.
review_title: I went for their Sunday Brunch.

review: It was expensive but food was good. My husband and I did not like the duck.

It was good; however, when I made the reservation it ask if there is something special or comment. I wrote- It was my birthday and my mother's belated birthday. Now since I wrote that I was expecting a little happy birthday acknowledgement or even a balloon. I didn't get anything and plus my mother mentioned it again when we was being seated still no acknowledgements were given... Not birthday friendly.....

The price should be more clearly stated what is $31 to 50? How do you know what you will be charged. What is the prices basic on?

My bill was $155.00 plus parking stated one price and it was a few dollars more, but I guess my biggest down fall was expecting a birthday song, or a word of acknowledgement for my mom and myself.

The wagu beef on hot stone was very good and entertaining as well. The black cod with pork belly was melt in your mouth. Last but not least, the apricot creme brulee was heavenly and one of the best I've had in a long time. Notable saki list and if it hadn't been for the show we had to make we would have tried more.
review_title: The wagu beef on hot stone

review: Consistently awesome sushi at a reasonable price. Upscale restaurant in Hotel Nikko. Service is OK: sometimes great, sometimes dopey.

The restaurant was well located for the Golden Gate Theatre. The setting was lovely and peaceful. We were able to talk without shouting. The servers were efficient and attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu. The food was creative, attractive and very tasty, although my husband remarked that his salmon was a bit overcooked. My lamb was delicious and cooked just right, but another diner thought hers wasn't rare enough. The broccoli rabe was a hit, with lots of garlic and a spicy kick. The side of corn was luscious, and pretty much hoarded by the person who was smart enough to order it. We had a relaxed dinner and didn't feel at all rushed, while still leaving in plenty of time to get to the theatre. We would definitely go back.
You need to work on this page. As to noise factor, when I place the cursor over a dot, the "hand" covers the meaning and I can't reqad it, so I can't rate it!!!!
review_title: You need to work on this page.

review: I went there with very high hopes but was quite dissappointed. The food was good not great. The waiter had no personality and the services was below average. The restaurant overall had no ambiance, it was a very cold environment and just the typical hotel restaurant.
review_title: I went there with very high

review: Definitely too pricy, ven if the food was good and well-presented.

Anzu is consistently excellent.  For a special holiday (Mother's Day, Easter, Christmas, etc.) their champagne brunch is to die for! They have a wide variety of buffet items including sushi, dim sum, fresh seafood, a carving station and an assortment of desserts.  

Anzu is also a great place for an evening out. Their dinner menu is excellent and very creative.  We often have dinner at Anzu, park at the hotel (up to 3 hours free parking) and then go see a show.

Anzu is excellent for out-of-town guests, couples, friends and family.  Don't miss it!

Some fun, interesting cocktails and delicious food. Extremely slow service without good management. When my husband was served the wrong drink, his order went back in the queue, not at the head of the line. As a result, everyone else was finished with cocktails before he got his.

Truly delicious food.  Heavenly charcuterie, like being in Europe.  Wonderful bread.  But awful service.  Lots of staff wandering around - but not making eye contact.  They don't look to see what each table is needing or how your meal is progressing.  You wait FOREVER to place your order or to get your cocktail. We'd have had another drink, but no one noticed our glasses were empty.  Poor staff training. Really high level of noise - probably due to all the hard surfaces in the design of the room.  We'd like to go back for the food, but.....

Love the ambiance and feel of this place. The concrete and brick walls, modern art, high ceilings, candle lit tables. Each and everything we ordered was so tasty, so much flavor in every bite. The service was great, we don't eat pork and they were able to vegetarian-ize the entree options for us. We were celebrating a promotion and our first home together, and even got complimentary bubbly, great experience and will definitely be back soon :)
review_title: Love the ambiance and feel of this place...

review: Amazing food, incredible cocktails, and awesome design.  Try it out!

Very solicitous.  One of the guests had fallen  and need to sit down.  Folks at restaurant let us in and started serving us despite the fact that we were VERY early.  Good job!  Appreciated their concern.
review_title: Very solicitous.  One of the guests had ...

review: The pork loin I order was dry and cver cooked. Chicken my partner order was borning with no taste. The service was terrible. They forgot our salad.

We were offered a booth in the back corner (seats <6 comfortably and offers some noise protection). Range of menu choices: salmon, swordfish, chicken, pork or beef tenderloin & more, with delicious-sounding accompaniments; tempted by prix fixe dinner @$30. No corkage on 1st bottle. Opted for roast chicken w/cannellini beans & the beef tenderloin, seared, served medium rare w/flavorful creamy mashed potatoes & fresh green beans. Started w/roasted asparagus/ arugula salad & shaved parmesan. Shared the apple crostada w/dulce de leche ice cream & the dark chocolate cake w/minted strawberries & vanilla bean ice cream. The place empties before theater/opera; go sometime when you're not hurrying off; enjoy the good service and the quiet.

Perfect location for a nice meal prior to the opera or any other event near City Hall.  My salmon was  cooked perfectly and they were flexible about changing out the potatoes on the dish for the white beans, which was nice.  I was also sharing an asparagus salad with another diner; the kitchen split it for us at no extra charge.  My husband had the 3 course prix fixed meal (pork tenderloin), also well prepared.  Our server was not attentive though - we had to ask again for our wine and also dessert after ordering.  Ask for a table in the main dining room when you make your reservation as tables close to the door on the bar side are less desireable.  Corkage on the 1st bottle of wine is free and only $10 per bottle after that - a nice bonus.

Dependable good food close to Davies Symphony Hall and Opera House.  Due to traffic problems, our group arrived at different times, but the staff was able to accomodate everyone, get us fed, and off to ballet without a hitch.  Highlights were the aspargus salad as a starter and the salmon as a entree.  When stages are dark or after the theater crowd has rushed off, Indigo can also be a quiet, spur of the moment romantic dining spot.
review_title: Dependable good food close to Davies Sym...

review: Saw this restaurant on Check Please Bay Area, food is very good, well thought out for tastes and textures, the desserts are excellent, and the Fixed Price menu is a great value. The Chef has a real interest in creating very good dishes for reasonable prices. The corkage policy is very generous, free if you spend a certain amount of money, $15 dollars if you have to pay. It is very convenient if you are going to Davies Symphony Hall and the staff caters to symphony patrons. Parking could be an issue but we got lucky and were able to park just down the street. The atmosphere was good but not exceptional. I would call Indigo a great local eatery at great pricing for what you get.
review_title: Very Good Food for Reasonable Price

review: Indigo is a great place to have a meal before the opera or symphony. I had the fixed pice meal which was only $35 for soup or salad, an entree of pork or chicken and dessert. There is a vegetarian option as well. The restaurant is located around the block from Davies Symphony Hall and the Opera House.
Ideal for before an event at Davis, the Opera House or the Herbst. Great food!

As usual this restaurant delivers....from the wonderful cocktails to the divine deserts. Ale, our server was especially fantastic. Great personality and extremely knowledgeable about the food...This restaurant has the freshest greens and flavor delivery. Meat temperature is always perfect. We never come to San Francisco without visiting..
P.s. if you are patrons of the performing arts they will always have you out the door in time...
Thank you Indigo for you constancy...we know we can count on you for a really good meal in a beautiful environment.

Very nice menu, tasty food and nicely presented. Very good service. We shared our dishes and the server was very accommodating and split the orders into separate dishes for each of us, so that was very nice. We ordered the beef tenderloin but it was too well done and rather tough. Other than that, it was a very nice experience. The desserts were excellent.
Thank you.

Our dinner was excellent from the seared scallops right down to the dessert. I couldn't decide on a wine, and our waitress nailed it with the Pinot! Wonderful all the way around, and I'll certainly be back!

At a pre-concert dinner visit, where the restaurant was full at around 6:30 PM, Indigo was overwhelmed in both the kitchen and in the service delivered.
Entrees were delayed in delivery with a Sea Bass entree still smoking (from a microwave?) and somewhat dried out with a price tag of almost $30.
While away from our table, my 60+ year old female dining companion was asked..."more water, sweetie?... by a male waitperson who later in the meal was asked for a knife and delivered a steak knife for the Sea Bass which was probably warranted considering the quality of the dish. Where do they find these people?
Simply stated, after patronizing the restaurant for several years, we find the restaurant uneven and, even on a good day, overpriced.
Excellent food. Great Service. Will definitely go back.
We had reservations before the opera and had good service and plenty of time. We had the fixed price dinner. Very good and generous. Couldn't finish it all. we will go back again Pleasant evening

Indigo is the best restaurant in the Civic Center area.  Absinthe is all about cocktails and Jardinere lets you get your "thin man" thing going but Indigo is about consistently well prepared, delicious food and delightful ambiance at a fair price.
We were pleasantly surprised by Indigo. The food was not great but above average and prices were in line with quality. No corkage--keep that in mind.

Enjoyed an excellent meal -- started with grilled asparagus with roasted garlic, goat cheese "fondue", candied walnuts and wilted treviso radicchio. Main course was pan seared corvina bass served on buckwheat soba noodles and garnished with organic moro blood oranges, sauted bok choy, brown butter cilantro sauce and topped with crispy fennel. Paired the meal with a glass of Mark West '09 Pinot Noir. Perfection!

Good value. Meals were tasty, but not over the moon. Portions could have been smaller. Good value, especially the prix fixe. We loved our server. The meal was timely paced (especially pre-show). Great place before symphony. We definitely will return. One great feature is that the restaurant has a no corkage policy.

we had a great dinner after attending a play at the Herbst. It was close by and excellent. Food was plentiful and was great. Really nice waitress - very attentive and friendly. Nice to be able to bring our wine without corkage. Really didn't think the food was over priced either. Will definitely be back when we are in SF.
review_title: we had a great dinner after

review: Service was very professional and understated. Very convenient to Opera and Symphony Hall.
What more can I say, other than the food was OK. The only exceptions were the service and the Expresso Panna Cotta, both of which were great! Will I ever go back? Mmmmmmmmmm....
Always consistenly good. Great place for pre-opera or sympohony

we were very disappointed by our experience at Indigo this visit. it seems like the food was cooked by amateurs - our entrees were overly sweet and the meat over cooked. the crisp that we got with our Pris fix was horrible - burned on the top and mushy and under done inside. we use to love this place. what has happened? there were also very few wines under $100 a bottle - there is no corkage fee so if you do decide to try this place, bring your own wine.

We often dine out in this area before Symphony, but for the past several years, we have overlooked Indigo. We do not intend to repeat that mistake. Everything we ordered (food and wine) turned out to be not just good but exquisite. We were so impressed that we asked our server to communicate our appreciation to the chef (something we do only very rarely). He responded by coming to our table, whereon we learned that he is in process of becoming the owner of the restaurant. We wish him all the success he abundantly deserves and plan to renew our acquaintance with his menu very soon.

I have been going to Indigo back to the days when the servers still wore indigo shirts. It is only about a 10 minute walk from the SF Opera, a perfect choice that never fails to please. Always an intersting menu.
review_title: I have been going to Indigo

review: The salad has a great subtle seasoning that didn't drown out the greens. My lamb meatballs were fabulous, but the description said it was served over couscus and it wasn't. My husband's pork dish was overcooked and a little tough to eat. Service was scrappy. At one point we had a guy in a flannel shirt and jeans serve our salads...they must have been too busy. Would go there again...but not as a first pick.
review_title: The salad has a great subtle

review: The food was excellent as was the lack of corkage fee and the proximity to all the major performance spaces.

the restaurant was fine,
when we walked in it our table was right by the door and we anticipated it getting cold,
so we asked to have a warmer table, but we weren't offered one,
so we ate in our coats and ordered soup and tea.
Minor service issue.
was really quite pleased - sort of a chance place that turned out well

David D was our waiter, and he was so rude from the first that we were about to walk out. His comments continually focused on how busy he was or would be. Ironically we had a 5:00 seating and were one of the first parties in the restaurant. When we spoke to the hostess about it, she told us that she was surprised, as he was one of their better waiters! We will not go back.
review_title: David D was our waiter, and

review: Indigo has been one of our standbys before opera or ballet. Sat they stuck us in their back room--more likie a storage closet with a few tables. We had out of town guests so particularly unfortunate. The whole meal seemed like an afterthought to the restaurant and staff. We might try it again but will be sure to request a table in the "front of the house".
review_title: Indigo has been one of our

review: We enjoy this restaurant. Have eaten there frequently. Atmosphere and service superb. Food this time was less than outstanding---chicken was dry (they comped us on a glass of wine for that). My pork loin was not tender. Dessert was yummy but the apple crisp tartin was almost too hot. Would recommend it to others.

Casual, friendly, and very efficent service. Here's a place that offers a relatively small, but top flight menu and promotes a no-corkage fee feature! How amazing. Happily have been doing volunteer PR for Indigo since last Friday night. A perfect choice especially when attending events in Civic Center venues. (I hope my raves don't result in me being crowded out next time I want to make a reservation.)
We had the prix fix menu items. Food was very good. We will go back again. Close to Davies Symphony Hall.
review_title: We had the prix fix menu items.

review: It is always great! Michael Wang, executive chef, has done wonders with his pasta and salmon dishes. The staff cannot be friendlier...they make you feel like family. :)
First time there and I will definitely be back! Good wine list without being overwhelming. Food was excellent, and the wine & food pairing suggestions were spot on. Service was fantastic!
review_title: First time there and I will

review: This is a very nice restaurant to go to before performances at Davies or the Opera. The food is very good, the service attentive and the fixed price dinner, a bargain.
review_title: This is a very nice restaurant

review: I've always had very good service in the past when I've gone to Indigo before the ballet or symphony. However, we had reservations and had to wait for 25 minutes before being seated. We then had to rush to make it on time to the ballet.
Great foiod with good service. I would recommend sitting in the front if possible. We were seated in the back and felt somewhat removed.....

Went to Indigo on a last minute decision.  The place was a little empty when we arrived, but that didn't matter to us since we had 10 people with us!  The food was great and the service was superb.  The restaurant filled up as we dined and in the end we were the last people to leave Indigo.  What a great wine friendly restaurant.  We'll be back!
review_title: Went to Indigo on a last minute

review: Good food. We had the Arugula Salad which was excellent and the Chicken and Polenta which was also very tasty. Both were well presented. The dessert wasn't very impressive and the tables and chairs were uncomfortable. However, the service was wonderful - best that I have had in a long time. I would go back again.
review_title: Good food. We had the Arugula

review: The food here is just okay. It is certainly not worth the charge. Were it not for the Symphony, Ballet, and Opera, this place would go out of business. Barely average food for these prices wouldn't survive in a City like this were it not for these venues nearby.
review_title: The food here is just okay.

review: Restaurant was slow the night we were there. Very good prix fixe dinner value. Good service. Overall enjoyable experience. We will go back.
A great place for a meal before heading to Davies or the Opera House. Highly recommended.
review_title: A great place for a meal before

review: The food and the service was excellent. We will return often.
review_title: The food and the service was

review: We were late for our reservation . Waiter made 110% effort to make us comfortable , expedited our food , took care of a problem and got us on our way in good time . Fish main course was excellent . Great for theater goers on a schedule and still seeking a good dining experience.
review_title: We were late for our reservation

review: We had a great time. We started close to 8pm and before we knew it, it was 11pm. Staff was very attentive but relaxed. Everyone loved their entrees. The final plus was no corkage fee. We will definitely go back.
review_title: We had a great time. We started

review: We very very impressed. I have eaten there before, but the Valentine dinner was wonderful, the appetizers in particular (hamachi sashimi and fried oysters) were excellent, and the matched wines were great and the service was fabulous and it was very inexpensive relative to other first class restaurants. We were very pleased.
Dining Room was too cold... entrance door was open when arrived on a cold evening.

Nothing to look at from the outside and when you enter the ambiance doesn't grab you as anything to take notice of. After settling down to a couple of drinks the place starts to grow on you as the restaurant starts to fill with an eclectic mix of mostly locals. The service was friendly, informative and efficient. Meal presentation was very nice and the everything was beyond expectation. The price is medium for the fare, but the overall experience is well worth the trip. Have a Marina (Vodka and Blueberry) when you come - great way to start!
review_title: Nothing to look at from the

review:
Very good food that was inventive, well presented and delicious. Caters well to the opera/symphony crowd in getting things out quickly, staff provides good service.

The one thing that hurt our experience was the computer system. It would not let a server close a ticket and no one else could use it until the person could close it out. This when we had 15 minutes left to eat. The problem took 10 minutes to fix so we only had time for a few bites of dessert before we had to leave. I hope Indigo invests in upgrading their technology as I am sure it is frustrating for the staff and even more so for customers when problems occur.
review_title: Very good food that was inventive,

review: The service was very good. There were 4 of us, 3 ordered steaks and one ordered the salmon. The cut of the steak were perfect, very tender and lean. However, our orders were all over cooked and there was way too much sauce on the steaks which was too sweet. The salmon was perfectly cooked with a unique and tasty combination of sweet corn and black bean. The place was very clean and nicely decorated. It was cool that there is a no corkage fee and also the tasting menu was very reasonably priced and good selections. Overall, we would recommend it.
Having dined there twice on busy nights at 6pm, I had the same experience each time with the entire dining room becomming too hot and uncomfortable by the time our desert arrived at 7:15 pm
Indigo is so reliable & great for dinner before the Opera or Symphony. Nice people & wonderful wines!!

Great food! The Mahi-Mahi special was very unique and tasty. The service was the best! Our server was helpful, informative and kept our food on-pace so that we could make the Symphony. You have to love the "no corkage fee"! The server didn't bat an eye that we brought our own wine and right away changed the wine glasses to accommodate the wine we brought in. We will be back - no question!

Functional for a night at the Opera house.  Convenient.  Not noteable.  For the same price, you can get a meal to actually talk about somewhere else.  Mahi Mahi special noteably too salty.  Too much soy sauce.  The recommended wine was the best part of the evening.
We have been to Indigo about 3 times and have enjoyed it very much each time.  The food is wonderful and is moderately priced.  The service has always been excellent.
review_title: We have been to Indigo about

review: We have been going to Indigo for several years prior to symphony and it has gone downhill in the last few times.  They try to be imaginative with their limited menu, but things don't quite gel.  My salmon was a bit overdone and the vegetables were a bit undercooked.  The wine list still tends to be excellent.  The service is up and down and the interior needs some upgrades.
review_title: We have been going to Indigo

review: Indigo is a very well run restaurant.   The food is outstanding and the service is personable.  However, there are lots of excellent restaurants in San Francisco.  What makes Indigo stand out is that it is not only an excellent restaurant, but an great value!  Isn't it nice to go to a restaurant with an extensive and WELL PRICED wine list?   We are Californians....we know what these wines cost and we don't appreciate excessive markups.  Thanks for the great food and wine at reasonable prices!   Keep it up!
review_title: Indigo is a very well run

review: The sushi was good but not good enough to justify the price, unless you take into account that one side of the restaurant has a view of the bay bridge (if you like that sort of thing).  They have a different selection of nigiri/sashimi than some other places, e.g. several different kinds of tuna and mackerel and that was nice.  I sat at the sushi bar, and like every other place, the seats and bar were a little too low to actually watch what they are doing, which is always a bit disappointing (but again every place is like this).  The age-dashi-dofu was very good, perfectly cooked, but the miso soup was only average.  The nigiri is $4.50-$7.00 per small piece, so pretty pricy.  The Ozumo roll was very good, but would have been better if cut into one or two more piece (i.e. they were a little large for one bite each).  A bit more pickled ginger with each dish would have been good  Service was a little slow, but I was in no hurry so that wasn't an issue.  They have a very large drink/sake selection, but I just had a Sapporo draft.  Total for miso soup, age-dashi-dofu, 2 small pieces maguro, 2 small pieces hamachi, Ozumo roll and 2 draft Sapporo's + tax & tip was $75.  So what you expect from a nice place near/on the Embarcadero.  I can walk there from work and walk to the ferry to get home so very convenient for me, so I likely will be back, but rarely.
review_title: Good, but you are paying for the view.

review: but the food is delicious. Will definitely recommend.

In terms of business lunch places, this is certainly one to try.  The sushi was fresh, and deliciously prepared, but the pricing was overboard.  You can find excellent sushi matching the quality of Ozumo at several places in the Richmond.  Nonetheless, we enjoyed our lunch and enjoyed the pleasant service from our waiter.

Wow. The special Japanese Uni was so delicious. It was so good that we had to order seconds. The octopus appetizer was so beautiful, creative and full of flavor. Those were the 2 dishes that were just amazing! Dohyo and the Ozumo Roll were also very tasty. Our server was very helpful and gave us great recommendations.

Loved the food. Everything was amazing save for some very burnt veggies. The rolls are only a few pieces instead of your standard 6 or 8 pieces. But that's more about managing your expectations. The nigiri was fantastic and fresh.

I used to love Ozumo but I think it's become a shell of its former self. Very, very expensive for the quality of food and experience relative to what else can be had in sf. Loud, overly bright dining room, cursory service, nothing bad but nothing inspiring about the food. I wouldn't bother, there's better to be had for the money elsewhere.

Great place to dine, and I suggest that you get there before 22:30 in order to be able to sit in the restaurant. If you want to sit around the bar, which has a nice atmosphere, it is also worth the trip !
The food is excellent. It is pricey, but worth the experience.
Great food quality and service! They also have a great sake Sake selection
We have dined at Ozumo before and loved it. The service was off a bit this time. Food was tasty. View is hard to beat!
review_title: We have dined at Ozumo before

review: Overall, the food was great but everything was on the salty side. Not good for a woman my age (56 years) who needs to watch salt intake.

Being slightly jaded as the Reno/Tahoe area has numerous all-you-can-eat sushi bars with similar or better quality fish, I am always amazed at how much people overpay for this cuisine. Ozumo has a great location off the Embarcadero and never seems to be at a loss for patronage. They have a excellent selection of Sake as well as some exotic favorites such as Monk Fish Liver (don't knock it until you've tried it!).

The rolls are sparse and unimaginative, the nigiri just OK. Our party of 3 with a bottle of sake came to over $400! Further proof, the recession is long over in SF!
Excellent food and a great place for a client dinner. You can also dine alone at the sushi bar.

I came hear with 5 others while staying downtown. The service straight away was fantastic, so friendly and professional. We sat right at the back on a lovely big oak table, lots of space.
The food was phenomenal, from start to finish, everything was perfect and an amazing place to sit and enjoy with friends.
Our waiter Elliott was really attentive but not intrusive, and very knowledgable on the food and wine.
I'd recommend to everyone.
review_title: Some of the best Sushi in the world

review: My wife and I enjoyed Ozumo again to recreate one our most memorable meals. They did not disappoint. Michael was our sushi chef and created an all sushi omakase meal for us to remember.
We always enjoy the food and service here, it becomes one of our favor restaurants in our neighborhood.

First time visit on New Years Eve late dinner. Food exceptional, server staff did not miss a beat and we never felt rushed. Ordered a saki flight so we mightexperience before ordering more. Extensive wine and saki list. What's not to like, great service, great food and a wonderful view of the Oakland Bay Bridge on New Year's Eve!
review_title: First time visit on New Years

review: first time diner...fantastic...great service...!!!

We booked the night before arriving in SFO, we had a 12:30 boooking but were running late and ended up being 1:30 PM, no issue, the restaurant staff greeted us warmly as did the traditonal chefs. Ken our waiter was a delight, he walked us through the menu, went out of his way to explain the dishes and to choose a great Saki, our friends joing us got lost but the kitchen staff went overtime to accommodate us. The food was spectacular. Thanks again Ken for being usch a great freindly hoste. We will be back and happy to recomend Maya as a great restaurant for lunch or dinner.
Ozumo has great food. Fresh and tasty BUT the SF menu is Ridiculously expensive. I prefer the Oakland menu.

Their lobster sushi roll was wayy over-priced at $25 for a 4 piece roll, the lobster was over-cooked & it was just average. The other rolls we were ordered were tasty, fresh, the yellowtail appy was great. We asked for a bridge view table but seated at a wall between windows, even though there was an open 4 top right where we wanted to sit. They said no because there was only2 of us - cheesy, it was only 7pm and the restaurant was not full. Not sure I will go back there for sushi (that was our intent that night) as the quality price was equal (overpriced) and the staff was fairly inflexible with our seating request.

It was a great experience to come from Montreal to celebrate my birthday at Ozumo! Our waitress, Jena was very friendly and took good care of us.
It was a sushi-chef from the excellent Niji sushi restaurant in South Shore of Montreal who refered us to this restaurant. If you go to Montreal, go to Niji!

Food was fantastic. The server was too full of himself to the point of being annoying. The place was hot and seating was so close to eachother, that neighboring tables decided to join in on our private conversation. Sushi again was fantastic.
have dined here several times before. always consistent. great food and service.

This Japanese restaurant is for someone who would like to dress up and wouldn't mind paying more for food and drinks. The ambiance is fantastic and classy. It's a great place to take someone important on a special occasion. Their service is excellent as well as food except nigiri sushi, which is a shame. I'm from Japan and I found that their nigiri sushi was ordinary.
The food is very good, but this restaurant needs to get over itself. Snobbery is not appealing, and there's tons of other places to dine at.
review_title: The food is very good, but

review: Fabulous Japanese food. The restaurant decor is strangely bright and cold in comparison with the super cool bar, but given the food is so terrific, it only slightly detracts.

Without question, Ozumo delivers the best sushi and Japanese cuisine in San Francisco. The Hanabi with avocado, ginger, and jalapeno-one of their signature dishes-is a must. Service is great. And the library of sakis, coupled with a pretty sharp staff, are quite nice. And, pretty awesome deserts on top of it.

This was the first time that I tried Ozumo and I was very pleased. A friend and I went for my birthday. The staff was very friendly and prompt with service and the food was awesome. Half of what I ate I had never tried before and now love, such as the sweet potatoes and the grilled eggplant. It was a little pricey, but I was aware of that in the beginning. I will definitely be going back.
review_title: This was the first time that

review: Just OK in my opinion. We are from Chicago and eat sushi all the time. Obviously San Francisco is more expensive and for the price of the food, you don't get too much. However, the tastes were good and clean, but just overall a good place to go.
review_title: Just OK in my opinion. We

review: You pay for the scene and location, don't come for the food, sake prices by the shot glass are outrageously unbelievable. Sushi/sashimi prices also extremely high and just average quality. Service for what you are paying, ridiculously unprofessional and untrained. But if you like that hot and heavy, jumping atmosphere and want to be seen with the in crowd, not a bad place after all.
review_title: You pay for the scene and

review: Excellent sushi and sashimi. High quality service from waitress and sushi chefs. This is a must if you are going to San Francisco and like sushi!!
Loved this place! Will definitley go back when I return to San Fran and will recommend to friends!
Wonderfully creative plates and good service combine to make this one of the top Japanese restaurants on the west coast. Prices may be a little high, but I still have no regrets. A must when in SF.
We spent 45 Minutes waiting for our food and it's not acceptable. The food was good but this kind of wait was frustrating
Loved this place the food was excellent and the waiter one of the best I've had!

We would not go to Ozumo again.  The staff and atmosphere were good, but the uni with quail egg was served warm and the spicy tuna roll presentation made tuna look like chopped up dog food.  The quality of rice used was also poor as it did not hold the pieces together very well.  Maguro was good as nigeri.  (to top it off, we believe my husband contracted food poisoning from the meal)
review_title: We would not go to Ozumo again.

review: I've been going to Ozumo for years and have always enjoyed the sake list and sushi. This time, the fish was notably "fishy" and the entire dining experience was a just plain disappointment.
review_title: I've been going to Ozumo for

review: Creative sushi menu and vast sake selection!  Terrific view of the Bay Bridge!

Our second time here. Brought a friend from Hawaii counting on impressing her with good food, attentive service, and an ambiance that is very difficult to find where she lives. We felt lucky to have the restaurant quite quiet that evening, but our first meal here was in a full dining room with lots of conversation which made it quite lively. Bottom line is that one should come for the great cuisine and drink up the atmosphere. You won't be disappointed.
review_title: Even on a very quiet night, a great evening

review:
We had a business dinner to book during the craziness that is Dreamforce in SF. My original goal was to just find a not-to-popular spot that could get a reservation. Given that low bar, I couldn't have been happier with the overall experience. Our table was perfect, our waiter attentive and the food excellent. Our guests were New Orleans natives and I feared a French bistro was a dangerous choice. They were overwhelmed with the creative menu and presentation.
The bar scene was hopping but not part of or plans.
I look forward to returning for a more intimate dinner with my bride.

The menu was compelling. The execution was bad. I am sure that  there was no French coordination in the kitchen. Having spent a ton of time in France I was hoping to find an other local restaurant with descent French food... to no avail. Sweetbreads disgustingly over cooked, so called crepe was not an also overcooked. Soup OK tomato/watermelon salad OK, wine list way overpriced with a few good hits (found one). Server very friendly but not aware of the details. All in all while I usually give a restaurant a second chance Gaspar there is not a chance that Gaspar will not be given one. Too many good restaurant in the Bay Area. Another example of too many venues for the owners to be able to control quality.

I believe they opened recently but felt like it has been around a long time.  You are transported the moment you walk in the door, the place is stunning.  Love the upstairs bar, it has a "club" like feel and and amazing cocktails and wine by the glass and carafe is something special.  The food is truly spot on we tried a bunch of items especially liked the Pistou and roasted squash.  YOU must save room for desserts they are to die for Chocolate dessert was amazing along with the Fraisier their strawberry creation.

rest_name: Capo's Chicago Pizza & Fine Italian Dinners
review: We had a fine, but not great experience.  Parking was almost impossible, to be expected in north beach, and they were very patient with our late arrival.  Pork lard in the pizza crust was a surprise and eliminated 90% of the pizzas for the vegetarian. Everything else was good. Artichokes in provolone create sauce were amazing. Portions were too large and everything had cream in it, which was too much. Waiter was excellent. We'd only go back with a group. Feels just a bit kitschy.

rest_name: Capo's Chicago Pizza & Fine Italian Dinners
review: The whole experience was excellent. Staff is friendly and knowledgable. The food was so good. And the portions are very large. Excellent value. Will share things next time and we are definitely going back

I would recommend requesting a table in the patio area in front or in the area around the bar. We were seated in a back room that was kind of dark and not as lively. Food was ok. The bloody mary was really good.
review_title: Pretty but doesn't quite meet the bar

review: Our friend chose The Palm House for his birthday dinner. Being a Birthday, we purchased a great cake from Chile Pies and brought it with us. Upon entry they let us know a cake would be $5 per plate and the cake was $100, so we are already talking $160 or so for the cake after this crazy charge. We were very upset, did not win in our efforts to relieve the charge and tried to go on with our night. It would have been fine if the service wasn't terrible, one of our friends order was never taken. The icing on the cake was our Bday celebrator wanted the duck tacos, but they replaced that with pork. There was duck on the menu and the kitchen refused to throw that on the tacos. I will not go back.

We opted for the pre fix. I had the Calliflower with scallops which had nice flavor, Carrot salad which was nice roasted flavor, the risotto with truffle which was excellent--creamy and rich and the chocolate tart which was just ok. the crust was kind of soggy and the chocolate a bit runny. My Husband had the sun choke soup with mushrooms which was excellent, crispy sole--nice flavor; the boar chop which was cooked perfectly and the floating vanilla island which was good flavor and texture of panna cotta. the wine pairing perfection and they also made very creative non alcoholic drinks as well--lime, grapefruit and ginger--very refreshing. the service was very good. oh and rolls are a must get. very light and crisp and soft butter. a+ on that. only glitch was one of the wine pairing came a bit after the food was delivered. we were seated by the front window. I would ask to not sit there, people stand in front of the window talking on their phones and looking so close to their back sides was annoying.
Highly recommend this great spot in San Francisco.  Had the Chef's tasting menu which did not disappoint.  Great spot.

I went there with my family. We where in front of the kitchen as it's an open kitchen. The food was AWESOME, I was in heaven!!! Every single dish was different but soooooo good, with different flavors and sensations! Guys, you should go there, that one was the best restaurant I've ever tried. The only negative thing is that there were too much noise.
We had a great dinner before seeing a show at the Orpheum. Waitress was aware of our schedule and made sure our dinner was timely. We ordered the prix fix menu and it was excellent.

It showed up on open table as "$$" for me. That's because it's essentially a tapas place (they say they're "family style") with $20 dishes. The waitress recommended my petite gf and I (I'm not a huge guy) get 5-6 dishes at least. 

We spent about $140 all in, including $10 8 oz. beers.

The food itself was good. Overpriced but good. 

There is a huge wood burning oven. My athsma was acting up and my clothes still reek of smoke and it's been 24 hours. We both had to take a shower before bed to get the smoke out of our hair. 

Id be surprised if this place stays open another 6-12 months. So many other places in the city you could go for $140 for 2.

Again though the biggest problem was the $$ rating, get your sh*t together open table!

Mixing cuisines is not new but it takes a special broad vision to make it seamless. You'll find that at Manos Nouveau where the owners, all of whom work in the kitchen or on the floor, have put together a compelling French-South American menu. Small plates are easily shared by two people and, while I did not try any large plates, should also be more than share-able. It all holds together and  consistently provides interesting flavors and textures. The wine list is on the smallish side but sufficient to satisfy most palates with some very good selections. Service is attentive and very helpful. The two story space is visually interesting and thoughtfully uplifting making a romantic evening a real delight. Tucked away on 17th  Street between Hartford and Castro just adds to that experience. One would never have expected such a fresh well executed concept in the neighborhood. Highly recommended.
review_title: Unconventional In A Very Good Way

review: Our flight was late on arrival so we were in a mad panic to make out 8pm reservations. When the taxi cab dropped us off at the Parc55 hotel we were a bit confused, but eventually mad our way through the hotel and smelled our way to find the restaurant. Our meal was lovely. The green curry rabbit was perfect. The pork belly was the best I've ever had. The clams were nice but the sauce that they came is was so nice that we didn't let them take away the bowl so we could have it with rice. Rice was perfect (I like my rice a bit wet so it was perfect to me). My drink from the bar had to be custom made as there was nothing I the menu that tickled my fancy. I just told the waiter what flavors I liked, my preferred spirit and back came a well balanced, interesting cocktail. All in all a good experience, if not a lot loud in there.
Really good and interesting dishes Thai food very tasty

Every bite of our meal was full of flavor, spicy but not tongue-numbing and just delicious.  We were greeted warmly, the servers  are quick, efficient, and most of all friendly and clearly proud of what they do and are serving.  We'll keep coming back.

The menu is very creative and extraordinary. Khan Khao management needs to focus on service. If you do not mind a frenetic, chaotic, inconsistent approach to service it's all worth it. The  selection on the menu and the quality overcomes the service for us but if service is not more orderly and  predictable it will cost them in the long run. The tables all around us experienced the same issues to the degree.  Although  all strangers between tables,  it was so bad we were commenting between us that it was continually necessary to remind the servers of drink orders, food orders and other needs.  One of our party described it upon our departure as superb food served  by the Marx brothers.

Great experience at Kin Khao... Food is fresh and delicious.. Service is knowledgeable and attentive without the formality... The vibe is youthful and stylish and fun... but the food is the reason I am recommending this restaurant. I have always looked askance at Thai food.. but not anymore! Get here... Eat here... Now.

We went to Bodega before the ballet. It is only about 6 blocks from the Opera house. It is on Larkin 3 blocks up from the Asian museum.
The Bodega serves Viet Namese food and it is the best I have had in years. Everything was great but the Pancake with salad and chicken was a new taste treat. All with a French flare and wonderful. It is a 5 of 5 on the taste scale, fresh and tasty. Curry was great as well as the soup.
horrible service. food came out fast but rest of sevice was horrible. have had good service at other locations but this place is a disaster
Service was a bit slow, one order of food was lukewarm on arrival.  Not the best experience, but will give them another chance.
Lovely people, buzzy and fun. The food was well priced and delicious.

Wonderful Tapas. The heirloom tomatos, potatos, mushrooms and sangria were fantastic. The servers were all knowledgable and delightful although spotty service in the beginning of meal. Totally recommend this restaurant.
review_title: Felt like we were in Spain

review: The food was out of this world.  I loved every dish we ordered.  The paella was soooooo good.  We actually ended up ordering everything twice b/c it was so good that it was gone very fast.  I can't wait to go back.
The omkase special menu was a special experience. Outstanding service with the sake pairing which combined with the sushi selections.

Food and service are good and the ambiance is nice.  I happen to be prejudiced about sushi chefs (they should be Japan trained).  Rather disappointing to see so many non Japanese chefs at such a high-end restaurant.

OK, I thought, another Japanese restaurant. How good could it be? Well, one bite in I had my answer: great! The seaweed salad was extraordinary and the black cod was one of the best pieces of fish I've ever eaten. The source was minimal but potent, a perfect complement to the perfectly prepared fish. I can't wait to go again.
After dining in Sydney at Tetsuya's we felt we had to come here. Outstanding quality, great wine list. Just perhaps a bit noisy on a Friday night.
Very loud with after work crowd but get the omakase
review_title: Very loud with after work crowd but get ...

review: Marla Bakery is tucked way out in the Richmond District but so good it is worth a destination meal. The menu is always fresh, local and changes daily. I recently went there for brunch and a better sticky bun I have never had. Make sure you buy a loaf of bread or two to take home.
We are always looking for new places to dine after the ballet on Saturday night, and we were delighted by Monsieur Benjamin.  Excellent service and food; we'll be back. Only downside: very noisy.

Rabbit rillettes very salty, quail undercooked/red had to send it back which I rarely do, steak and fries a piece of tasteless/tough meat with a huge pile of fries. The best part was the bread and delicious butter. We were looking forward to dining at this place but were extremely disappointed. I guess we'll stick to Benu which I love. 
The service was very attentive though. I will give it another try, maybe they were having an off evening. Hopefully next time we'll have chef Corey Lee actually in the kitchen. He was having dinner at the next table.
review_title: Rabbit rillettes very salty, quail under...

review:
i had read so many mixed reviews and did not know what to expect. I am a fan from here on out.
the service the cocktails, the wine selection were great. I have traveled all over france every year and the food
 reminded me of the regional flavors
review_title: i had read so many mixed reviews and did...

review: Monsieur Benjamin upgraded the simple brasserie to a high new level. Food is fresh, a clever mix of classical and creative and service is simply outstanding!

We came in 20 minutes early for our 9:30 reservation and the just seat us right away. Our server was fast, efficient and very knowledgable about his job. Food was really good. Tasty, fresh and nice presented. Service was impeccable although it felt like there's way too many people working but I guess they are still new and is not want to risk being shirt on people in case it get to busy. Timing was a little off as our food came out a little late but they made it up by giving us items we didn't order like the patte. It seriously wasn't a big deal at all but it shows that this people care in how people perceive their new business. Overall 5 Food, sanitation and service. 4 star on speed. I can't wait to come back and try their brunch.

Came here for a pre-Symphony dinner. The restaurant has only been open for a couple of weeks and the newness shows. The food is top notch and our server was attentive and knowledgeable, but the time between our pate and our main courses was VERY long and our server said nothing to us during the lag. When our entrees did finally come out of the kitchen, it seems that everyone in the restaurant got their entrees at the same time.
review_title: Come here, but wait a few weeks

review: Food is decent except for the fried chicken cutlet
review_title: Food is decent except for the fried chic...

review:
We had booked a reservation at 9PM on a Saturday night to celebrate my wife new career.  We entered an extremely noisy (I cannot use your description of "Vibrant") room that was very crowed and were seated at a two top.  After water was served and I had to repeatedly ask the waitperson to speak up, we found that we could not even have a conversation with one another without shouting.  So, we never ordered, got up and left, and went to Boulevard for a great meal and a noise level that would allow us to converse in a normal voice.

This restaurant was on a list of the 18 best date places for dinner on Thrill List.  I can think of dozens of places in the city more conducive to a date than Cocotte.
Enjoyed everything! Maybe take the cable car to get there for dinner.
Loves the food. Ambiance and service was good too.  The only problem we have is finding a parking spot. We had to park all the way to Polk street.. 4 blocks away from cocotte.
We ordered the butcher's cut and filet w/ marrow.  Looking forward to coming back and trying their roasted chicken! The sides were delicious.
The food is good, average price, and it's got a nice feel. I like how the portions we're normal size. I'd eat there again.

A perfect addition to the Hyde Street food scene. Everything feels like a typical Parisian neighborhood bistro - with cable cars. The food is consistently tasty and the service is friendly. A solid "go to" restaurant.

We came close to opening time for the dinner service at Cocotte and we were seated in this adorable nook space. The atmosphere was perfectly romantic and the interior beautiful. The waiter was extremely helpful and friendly and the food was AMAZING. I would definitely return here for special occasions.
Good food; good service; good value. Can you ask for much more?
The food was delicious and reasonably priced; service was great; only downside is horrible parking.
No complaints but no praise either. Ok for a weeknight meal.

I am very surprised that the place was not crowded.  The food was delicious and the service was exceptional. Philip our server was very attentive. I will highly recommend this place to friends and families.
review_title: I am very surprised that the

review: It has pretty good food but one feels shoe-horned into a small shop...While the food is good, it is certainly not very good or excellent. The environment detracts a bit from the food and the overall experience was a little less than I had expected...
review_title: It has pretty good food but

review: We loved Mina's!  We loved the food, the ambience, and the service was terrific.  My dining companion, who is not really an adventurous eater, had the ribs and loved them, but she couldn't even finish.  I had the ceviche and mussels - both were delectable.  We also tried the yucca fries and were converted.  We will definitely go again ... and again ...
review_title: We loved Mina's!  We loved the food, the...

review: GREAT food!  Hard to decide, everything on the menu looked so good, and everything that everyone had around me looked delicious.  Will be hard to decide what to have when I go back.  I had the Frutas del Mar - excellent!
review_title: GREAT food!  Hard to decide, everything ...

review: I love this unassuming little restaurant.  The seafood is always perfectly cooked/  They always have a good selection of salads topped with seasonal sea food.

I'm a big foodie and Chef Taylor Pedersen and our server Amy made for a memorable dining experience.  The space was super cute (beautiful hand carved benches that were surprisingly comfortable)  tho kind of loud..in a buzzy way. The Caesar salad was dynamite. We shared the mussels which were super plump. Our baked cod was PERFECTLY cooked and beautifully presented. Braised short ribs were awesome.  My friend has a sweet tooth so we couldn't make up our minds so we ordered both!  Ha!  The lace cookies and cream was a great texture and flavor combination. I normally would not have ordered the chocolate pot de creme because everyone does it but boy!  So wrong!!  Wow chocolate!!!  Perfect ending to a memorable meal.
review_title: Little Red Hill Station that Could

review: I've been here twice the both times the food has been stellar. The caesar salad is unparalleled - it rivals Zuni cafe; the linguine with seafood and tuna or sausage is also amazing. and the oysters are nothing to shake a fist at.
Limited menu leaves this place sort of flat.  I always love it when a place feels like you could come back often, but the menu is too limited and nothing is drawing me back.

food was killer, service was great, no one was asked  "who gets the chicken" , we didn't have to shout to be heard, special requests were handled without a bat of an eye, definitely a place to return to and soon.  And this was from a table with two professional chefs in attendance.
lots of places to eat on valencia, this one like many others is amid the hubub.  but good food here, and not necessarily way crowded. design makes it feel spacious which is a big help.  give it a go!

My friend and I both had the "Urchin Fixe" (an amuse bouche plus 4 courses for $50).   It was an excellent value.  The amuse was light and delicious (a protein on a toast point), the white bean soup with lamb sausage and truffles was satisfying (though it needed some acid or texture variation I think), the scallops were tender and flavorful (and seared to perfection in a yummy beurre blanc), and the quail was FABULOUS.  They cook the quail quite rare, which (it turns out) was the right decision, and the chanterelle mushrooms were packed with flavor and set off by a gorgeous jus.  My dessert was the chocolate bete noire cake with toffee coffee ice cream; it was excellent, and the portion was HUGE.  Service was very attentive & knowledgeable.
review_title: What a Great Start for a new spot!

review: The food here was terrific- and it is a fun scene.  The service was also very good. The staff have an upbeat, friendly attitude.  This restaurant reflects the best of San Francisco- great food and people.

This is one of our favorite restaurants, and a spot where we love to take out of town guests because, for the most part, none of them has eaten food like this.  The food is always excquisitely prepared, creative and delicious.  The staff is consistently well informed and welcoming.  Our only "beef" (pardon the pun) is that the tongue we had on our very first visit was one of the most memorable dishes we've eaten in our long SF foodie history.  But although we order it every time we go to Namu Gaji, hoping to repeat that first experience, it's never quite as tender, luscious, or tasty as that first time (crispy on the outside, soft and moist inside).  I don't attribute this to a memory that changed over time...it's just not the same, really.  Another negative are those uncomfortable stools.  Is it really the best they do due to the small space?

Still, despite these minor shortcomings, we keep coming back....in a City where there are so many exceptional offerings.

My friend and I ordered the bibimbap ($23, w/beef) and okonomiyaki ($18, w/o egg) for dinner; both were delicious and enough food for two people. The inside is gently lit with candles and dim lighting, and it was half-full with patrons when we got there (6:30 pm, Wed) and totally full with patrons by 7 pm. Gem location and great Japanese-Korean style food and decor. It's a bit above my price point so I don't plan on going back just for the sake of it, but I'd love to return for a special occasion, a date or workplace dinner. There is communal seating in the center and then higher-up seating next the windows (along 18th st, I believe) and lower seating by the register/kitchen. Didn't really look at the drinks menu but it seemed extensive.

address: 4 Embarcadero Center, Street LevelSan Francisco, CA  94111
review:
Nothing interesting or inspiring here.

Service was good but average.

Appetizers (marinated olives, bean minestra soup) were basic.

Entrees (farrotta mushroom risotto, chitarra hand cut pasta) were just way too salty.

Many better choices for the same money or less.

address: 4 Embarcadero Center, Street LevelSan Francisco, CA  94111
review:
First, just an FYI - the map on Open Table to the restaraunt isn't really the right location. After roaming around for about 30 minutes we finally found it. 

The food was okay. Definitely not overly impressed. 

The service was extremely rushed. The place wasn't even half full so there was no need to speed up the service. I barely chewed our appetizer and she was taking the plate away. 

Won't be going back.
The changes made to this establishment were so worth it.   I would recommend Tosca Cafe to anyone.
I was excited to go to Tosca based upon the Bon App review.  The food was very good.

Was excited to check out Tosca and organized a group dinner, which unless you know everyone in your group will be punctual - don't recommend Tosca.  They have policy of seating only when whole party is there and order for all courses must be taken at once.  A bit of a challenge with a group and ideas for ordering multiple rounds of food does not work.  

That said, team tried to be accommodating and food was decent - not the best Italian and wasn't overly unique, but the atmosphere and decor was good so fun enough for an evening out.
review_title: Was excited to check out Tosca and organ...

review: We celebrated my boyfriend's birthday here and the food and cocktails were amazing. The noise level was a bit loud for his parents, but all in all, a great evening. Thank you!

The hostess was not pleasant at all - and this is at 6pm before the restaurant got busy and there is a rush. the place was practically empty other than 1 table that was seated and our group. She didn't smile, communicated rudely and just made us feel so unwanted even though we had a reservation, showed up on time, and the place was empty. 

Overall food was delicious so I will definitely try to go back again. Hopefully they will have a different host then.
review_title: Great food, not as great service

review: We ate at Cafe Sport years ago, and had consistently wonderful experiences. We've since moved to the East Bay hills, and don't come into North Beach that much anymore for dinner. We had a visitor who'd spent a few years in Italy come to town and we thought it would be great to go back there with him. We had a fabulous meal, with fabulous service. Delicious and delightful!
Great addition to the Marina. Good for a dinner before a movie or a night out. Their food is all good and the burger is rated one of the best in SF.

I will admit i am snobby when it comes to food.  I want the food i eat to have dimension and creativity.  This place wasn't bad.  it just seemed to be lacking in flavor.  I kept grabbing the condiments to amp up the taste.  The best thing there is their signature pork dumplings. Those were good, the rest was just okay.
The food is not too bad but don't expect it to be cheap. We ended up paying $80 and just had 5 small plates and no drinks

It's a great dim sum place. Food is consistently good. As soon as you sit down, the cart loads of food choices are displayed. I have been here many times and today was my first time coming an hour and 15min. before their closing on Sunday. I was worry about not too many choices of dim sum but nope, they still had many variety just like the normal early hours and more food were being loaded on to the cart. I can trust their food quality and fast service. They made sure that our hot tea had plenty of hot water multiple times. Will come back soon.

I enjoyed Yank Sing years ago when it was less busy.  Now, even with a reservation, you can wait 20+ minutes.  The food is good but you can easily wait over an hour at the table to get a decent variety of dishes.  In our last visit, we asked a staff member asked for Chinese broccoli.  She returned about 20 min later to tell us they were sold out.  We ordered steamed custard buns and it took about 30 min to arrive.  While I enjoy good food, there was simply too much waiting between dishes to enjoy our meal
review_title: Too much time waiting for not enough items

review: We have tried many of the dim sum spots in SF, including all the tiny places in Chinatown. Yank Sing consistently has the quality and the variety of dim sum to make your meal interesting. The steamed ones are our favorites, although try some of the specials offered every day. Reservation necessary on weekends.

Everything was perfect. Everything was what was expected at such a high caliber sushi restaurant. Service was excellent and very attentive. The sushi was presented simple as it is but the freshness was amazing. Other dishes part of the omakaese were simple as sushi should be but again very fresh and well put together. After finishing the omakaese you have an option of ordering from the a'la carte menu which had some pretty amazing fish on there flown in from Japan. The climax for my dinner was having the Hokkido Uni which was packed in sea water and flown in from Japan according to the waitress which was true as it was some of the best uni I've had comparing to uni I've had it Japan (So sweet and creamy). Overall dining experience was awesome. Street parking was easy as most of the FiDi has got home for the day during dinner time.

I wanted to eat here because of the review in the chronicle.  The food was ok, but was very uneven in the presentation and the order it flowed to us.  we had the 7 course meal, but my partner and I left hungry and needed to have a "snack" to feel satisfied.  I would not go back.

It is a great restaurant in the corner. The service was great. We liked the five course dinner.

Was n't crowded. Not much of noise. I liked it and along with the food. it makes this place a great combination.
review_title: Nice place in the corner. great service.

review: Our group of five had trouble hearing each other. The food was good, but the timing was off. Our desert and one of our courses arrived at the same time.
review_title: A bit more noise that I would have liked Good food

review: Well presented food all ingredients top notch.  Really pick up on the fact all members either worked together  previously or have been waiting  for the opportunity to wk together.  Will return and sit outside
review_title: Excellent prepared food.  tightly knit team.

review: The changes made to this establishment were so worth it.   I would recommend Tosca Cafe to anyone.
I was excited to go to Tosca based upon the Bon App review.  The food was very good.

Was excited to check out Tosca and organized a group dinner, which unless you know everyone in your group will be punctual - don't recommend Tosca.  They have policy of seating only when whole party is there and order for all courses must be taken at once.  A bit of a challenge with a group and ideas for ordering multiple rounds of food does not work.  

That said, team tried to be accommodating and food was decent - not the best Italian and wasn't overly unique, but the atmosphere and decor was good so fun enough for an evening out.
