The hostess was not pleasant at all - and this is at 6pm before the restaurant got busy and there is a rush. the place was practically empty other than 1 table that was seated and our group. She didn't smile, communicated rudely and just made us feel so unwanted even though we had a reservation, showed up on time, and the place was empty. 

Overall food was delicious so I will definitely try to go back again. Hopefully they will have a different host then.
review_title: Great food, not as great service

review: Our group of five had trouble hearing each other. The food was good, but the timing was off. Our desert and one of our courses arrived at the same time.
review_title: A bit more noise that I would have liked Good food

review: Well presented food all ingredients top notch.  Really pick up on the fact all members either worked together  previously or have been waiting  for the opportunity to wk together.  Will return and sit outside
review_title: Excellent prepared food.  tightly knit team.

review: So close to the theaters and especially across our hotel, the Handlery, made it very convienient to dine then theatre. Great food, great service. Very enjoyable .

You can rarely find this type of traditional Japanese food outside of Japan.  Yuzuki  strives to provide the artistic food presentation, excellent service and authentic ingredients of Japan.  When I bring Japanese guests here they are surprised (and happy)  to find this  type of resturant in the US.
Always ask for the Waitress Emily - she is terrific.  Good sense of humor and great smile.  It's so convenient that they serve food all afternoon.  Long time social and good place.

Just an outstanding restaurant.  The food is amazing:  pasta's , pizza, salumi, salads---all great.
Excellent wine list w/ reasonable prices.  Service is perfection.

Not much more to say except if you are going to make a menu focused on tacos, you'd better get it right. Hecho simply doesn't get it right-and they charge you for there mistakes. If you want good tacos go to a taqueria in the mission.
review_title: Bad Food with a Modern Vibe

review:
Just an outstanding restaurant.  The food is amazing:  pasta's , pizza, salumi, salads---all great.
Excellent wine list w/ reasonable prices.  Service is perfection.

Not much more to say except if you are going to make a menu focused on tacos, you'd better get it right. Hecho simply doesn't get it right-and they charge you for there mistakes. If you want good tacos go to a taqueria in the mission.
review_title: Bad Food with a Modern Vibe

review:
This is a must for San Francisco!  We love this restaurant!  I can't tell you if I have a favorite dish, because all their dishes are my favorite!  
The fish is always superb!  The steaks are crazy good, the pate out of this world.  I tried for the first time the clams as my starter for dinner, I will have them again and again....need I go on?  TRY THIS PLACE!

While the atmosphere was not exactly 5 star (especially the tables by the kitchen), the food more than made up for it. We had a party of five and while everyone ordered something different, we all agreed that our starters and mains were 5 star quality. Highlighting the list was the herb crusted halibut and my cassoulet which was frankly better than any cassoulet I've had in my three visits to Paris. We also found the prices to be very reasonable. Two nice bottles of cabernet sauvignon, a couple of cocktails, 5 starters and 5 mains for $400.  We will definitely come back on our next visit to San Francisco.

Unpretentious french bistro experience that retains a ton of old world charm. The staff is attentive, but not hovering. The food is glorious. Perfectly prepared and seasoned. AND do not miss dessert! The cold lemon souffle is like a sweet cloud. The chocolate mousse add years to your life...

Enjoyable French bistro atmosphere. Limited menu but very good. Cassoulet was superb . Loved the classic way they served my well made Manhattan with a reserve vial on ice. Noise level was okay. Wait staff friendly and just attentive enough. Will return.

We celebrated our son's birthday recently. We were in a festive mood, so was our waiter! He was terrific. Te food is classic French, something or whole family will eat. The food was very good. My French Martini was also really good. The restaurant is not a late night dining spot, but it has a really comfortable, warm vibe.
Classic menu, but with some extra , appropriate, updates without sacrificing the traditional dishes. Lovely attitude among staff we will go again for sure.

I love Le Central. It's an old-fashioned bistro with truly good food. Reminds me of French bistros in NYC in the sixties and seventies. It's trend-proof; it has integrity. One of my favorite spots for important yet unpretentious business lunches.
review_title: I love Le Central. It's an

review: My wife and I have dined here several times and will do so again in the future.
review_title: My wife and I have dined here

review: Le Central is a traditional old style French restaurant, where service is discreet and quiet, just like being back in France. The atmosphere is very pleasant and the quality of the food and presentations are first rate. The frites compare with the best, and the rest of the menu follows suit. Try the cassoulet or blood sausage, as well as any of the daily specials.
Took a little long for the waiter to come our way. Overall, it was a nice experience. Make sure you reserve the mayor table.
review_title: Took a little long for the

review: Went to celebrate a birthday and they enjoyed it very much. Interesting appetizers, and desserts to share.
Friendly staff. The food was definitely not worth the price, however. My chicken was super overcooked and dried. My escargot appetizer and crme brle was nothing memorable.

I was so shocked how unwelcoming by the greeter , same Chinese male as my last visit and did it again. Later on I found out he is the owner of the restaurant.
I certainly will not go back to this restaurant. My husband and I often travel to France and love the French food and this restaurant serves OK food but location is good for us after my work. but I don't need to spend my money anymore at this place welcomed by shockingly COLD AND BAD TREAT FROM THE OWNER. What puzzled me by watching him, he almost appeared not wanting people come in to the restaurant. Very Sad!!
He will greet well ex- SF Mayor though. There are plenty more nicer restaurants in the city than Le Central,
review_title: I was so shocked how unwelcoming

review: Absolutely bloody marvelous! Super escargot, fresh & delicious salmon (not to salty)and wonderfully roasted prawns with a great flavoured sauce. I'll most definately be back.

I haven't had service this good since I last dined at the Ritz. Before I could reach for the pepper shaker on the table, Louis appeared with a grinder instead. If I wanted to add an appetizer, I merely needed to look up, and bam: he was there. He even enlarged the table space when he realized we had two stomachs apiece! The food was superior on top of all of that.
You must try their Cossoulet - the best in San Francisco!

This is a SAn Francisco Restaurant gem just as good as when I first ate there 20 years ago. Willie brown is still sitting at his table holding forth. The ontion soup a gratin is wonderful and the asparagas vinegrette deliscious. The special dessert buch de noel was great too. The tables are very close together but that is part of the scene. The menu is a delightful listin gof French dishes and some day I will try the cassoulet which as now been cooking 13,000 days or more by now. I will go back any time.
review_title: This is a SAn Francisco Restaurant

review: It is what it is...old school, reliable restaurant; hangout for San Franciscans of a certain age and class. The bar is lively and frquented by regulars. The menu never changes, but there are daily specials. Was disappointed by a recent visit though, because when I crossed my legs under the table, was surprised to find that my pant leg had gotten stuck to piece of gum some inconsiderate dweeb had parked there. I let the waiter know, so that he could have someone remove it after we left, but was surprised that instead of expressing his regret, the first words out of his mouth were, "Well, that's not our fault." I understand that, but feel the waiter could have been more sypathetic and asked the mgr to reimburse me for dry cleaning, at least.
review_title: It is what it is...old school,

review: My favorite restaurant in SF. The cassoulet is unbeatable. If you can remember what a French Tabac is/was, this is it. The restaurant is consistantly good, serving French comfort food.

Fantastic, as always. Meal was delightful.
Best service in town.

I've eaten wonderful meals at Le Central many times, but not for about 3 years. It was great to find they are still on top of their game! All the dishes we ordered were tasty and presented well. Our waiter was friendly and helpful. The usual nice selection of wines and our after dinner coffees/espressos were top notch.

My wife and I have been dining at Le Central for many years. Despite a change of ownership and the present economy, the food quality is still consistent and our favorites: the New York steak and the escargots, are still holding up. However, the bloody mary drink is getting a bit diluted and disappointing. No complaints on the service and the wait staff.
review_title: My wife and I have been dining

review: If you're looking for an overpriced bistro with so-so food in the financial district and enjoy yell to communicate - Le Central is your spot!
review_title: If you're looking for an overpriced

review: A formerly good restaurant with an active bar scene 5+ years ago now seems old and tired. The service was casual and the menu needs updating. I had remembered and expected more.

Haven't been here is quite awhile and it was terrific. I asked for something not on the menu and they accommodated that request immediately. It's loud, about as loud a local restaurant as I can think of, but it continues to be fun with food at a high level just as it always has been.
review_title: Still great after all these years

review: I use to dine here 15 years ago, and then haven't till recently.  Have gone a handful of times this past year, and every visit has been excellent.  Love the neighborhood feel and service is always warm.  All guests are welcomed warmly and feel like a part of the big JF family.  Can't go wrong starting with the zucchini carpaccio, and the salad verdure is spot on.  Carbonara is excellent.  Highly recommend it, just don't expect a quiet intimate tetatet.
review_title: Like a big hug from grandma

review: We got late evening (9:30pm) reservations on Friday night. We were a group of 4 - the restaurant was alive - perfect for a fun evening. Not ideal for a more intimate dinner on Friday's

The baked tortellini dish was a show-stopper, and we are still talking about it. The other dishes were great, but couldn't hold a candle to that tortellini. Our service was sadly not good. Our waiter essentially disregarded us from the moment we said we wouldn't be ordering any wine/drinks. From that moment on, it was as if we were invisible. He didn't tell us about the specials - when we were putting our coats on and getting ready to leave, I turned around and saw them listed on the wall, I felt disappointed because I think I would have ordered some of them! When we stopped him from handing us the check to tell him we wanted dessert, he looked shocked. We felt very ignored and mistreated. Otherwise, the food was awesome.
Great food and great service in a nice, informal setting.
This is a great neighborhood restaurant! It's very quaint, the staff is great and very friendly and the food is very good! I will continue to eat here!
One of my favorite places in the city. Sit at the bar and have access to the menu and to a great small bites list.

The food was sensational. At the bottom of the menu it reads that if you don't see it on the menu - ask. They are very willing to alter their dishes for individual preference. I didn't taste anything I would want to alter! The service is outstanding as well. They all appear to be enthusiastic about letting customers see what a restaurant can be!

The food was excellent. Too bad wait staff didn't mention the specials for the night. Environment was on the warm side (mentioned to waiter) but they never turned on the ceiling fans. Host was able to accommodate our very early arrival at 7p for our 8p reservation.
The greatest ! We loved it. The food was great, the wine list magnificent. We now have a new favorite restaurant.

We had a birthday dinner with 11 people. Although the restaurant is smallish the staff was terrific and flexible and worked it out. We, of course, had our party and then respectfully moved on after a couple of hours so the many waiting diners could have their turn. The food and wine were amazingly delicious as always at Jackson/Fillmore. We have been coming here for 20+ years and still love it!
review_title: We had a birthday dinner with

review: Finally-real chicken parm in the city!!!!!!!!!!!!! Breaded, fried & served over pasta with delicious red sauce too!!!

I've been to Jackson Fillmore 3 times now, and have really enjoyed my experience there. However, this was the first time I tried a pasta dish outside of risotto, and I strongly disliked it. Not only was it overpriced for a pasta with meat sauce (almost $20), it was nothing that I couldn't have made at home for myself. My friend had a baked pasta dish that had too much cream and he could hardly eat it.

The appetizer I had, on the other hand, was delicious. It had steamed clams, garlic, tomato sauce, and a delicious sausage mixed together. Every time I've had an appetizer at this restaurant I have loved it.

All in all, I'd recommend sticking to the appetizers and to the meat dishes (ie. fish and chicken).

Kids, babies, adults, all screaming.  Small place without room to move.  Maitre'd seemed uninterested in the fact that we wanted to dine in his restaurant, as if we weren't good enough as 30-something single women who earn high salaries.  Would they prefer all the screaming kids and aging neighborhood couples?  Fine.  They brought a piece of nice and fresh bruschetta for each of us which was tasty.  We ordered a caponata appetizer which was extremely bland and clearly not prepared fresh, since it came so fast, almost before we even ordered it.  My friend's pasta was alright, my baked shrimp was much better.  Not memorable.  People probably go nuts over this place because they are too lazy to go down the Fillmore St. hill for better food.

rest_name: Unicorn Pan Asian Cuisine - San Francisco
review: The food is great with reasonable prices. The staff was friendly and I loved the atmosphere. The calamari with the green sauce was the best!!! I still can't get over how good that was. I'd definitely go back to dine here again.

rest_name: Unicorn Pan Asian Cuisine - San Francisco
review: When you walk in to the bar and see the fake Chihuly sculptures in the window, and the glass/resin oversize flowers above the bar, you wonder how good the food actually is. We were pleasantly surprised with our dinner experience. The braised short rib appetizer, seafood fried rice, pork chops were all excellent. The service was good, even though only two servers seemed to be servicing the dinning room, and they were quite busy. Excellent choice in Financial District and two parking garages a block away.

rest_name: Unicorn Pan Asian Cuisine - San Francisco
review:
As long as you avoid the large jalapeno slices, the tuna ceviche with julienned green mango, jicama, and lotus root is wonderful.
The mango bean curd with eggplant is living proof that vegetarian entrees do not have to be an after- thought for your sole vegan friend. The textures and multiple flavor notes would please any omnivore. If it were located in a less desolate location, Unicorn would be filled every night.
review_title: As long as you avoid the large

rest_name: Unicorn Pan Asian Cuisine - San Francisco
review: What makes me go back: (1) Reliable quality on all items on the menu, (2) Reasonable prices for the quality.  However, prices have gone up to the point where I don't think it's a "deal" anymore.  I still enjoy dining at Unicorn because good food and pleasant service.
review_title: Good food and service, okay price

rest_name: Unicorn Pan Asian Cuisine - San Francisco
review: Very good food for the price, menu is pretty reliable overall.
review_title: Very good food for the price,

rest_name: Unicorn Pan Asian Cuisine - San Francisco
review: We went early so the restaurant was quiet and the service attentive! We were celebrating my boyfriend's birthday and he really enjoyed it -- saying that he'd like to go back there acouple times! He had the cubed filet which was tasty but the portion was a tad small. I had the butter fish which was quite moist. Again the portion was alittle on the small side but perfect for a 3 course meal. I thought the prices for the entrees were also quite good (ours were both $18-19 each). Our total bill was $128 and that included a 3 course meal for each of us, a bottle of champagne and tip.
review_title: We went early so the restaurant

rest_name: Unicorn Pan Asian Cuisine - San Francisco
review:
We went to Unicorn looking for a dining experience unique to San Francisco.  Not so much. IMO, Unicorn has the distinct feel of a concept restaurant tailored specifically to business meetings.  The restaurant just felt flat and tired.  Nothing on the menu jumped out and the food was questionable quality generic "pan asian" fare.  And my dessert, the chocolate cake, tasted suspiciously like something you would by at the local grocery store.  I would be amazed if it actually was made at the restaurant.

To me, Unicorn was just boring - both the food and the ambience.  Honestly, a place like Penang which is a much larger chain has more character to me than Unicorn and that is saying something.

The burger was good, at least on par with my favorite burger in SF at Serpentine. So too was the Poulet Vert. The fried brussels spouts chips were fantastic, though we were disappointed to learn upon being seated at 8:30p for our 8:30p reservation that they were out of the chicken-fried okra. Cocktails were good, though the second round we ordered sat at the bar for quite some time before another server (not our table's) handled the delivery (but without acknowledging the wait). So the second cocktail arrived after entrees were finished. Strangely, Marlowe has no coffee, only espresso, so I had to settle for an Americano as an approximation. While my dining companion enjoyed the Chocolate Cream Pie (more like a pot de creme) for dessert, my Meyer Lemon Creme Brulee was truly not right. The crust was solid, but the consistency of the custard was much too thin (sort of gloppy in texture, the look of curdled milk, certainly not smooth). More disappointingly, our server didn't even take note of the fact that it went largely uneaten, never asking whether we enjoyed dessert, just unceremoniously dropping off the check later.

We are already fans of Cavalier and Park Tavern so we had no concerns when we decided to try Marlowe for a special occasion. They did not disappoint. Other than a slight wait for our booked table, the whole experience was fantastic. Luckily, as I was wearing my 'date night heels', the lovely maitre d' located a bar stool for me in the corner. The new location on Brannan has a bit of a bustling NYC brasserie feel to it (including the noise level). 

While we waited, a waiter brought us our drinks and some of their heavenly brussels sprouts chips. Even if you think you don't like brussels sprouts, do yourself a favor and try these crisp lemony delights. You will thank me.

We were seated in a short time and our server was friendly and efficient. The kitchen split our dishes onto separate plates without asking (I never ask so it was a nice surprise - no jockeying with hubby for that last bite). 

We started with the mushroom soup which was one of the best I have had. Very earthy and rich, with a dollop of creme fraiche on top and a gougere on each plate. I wanted to lick my bowl...(but I didn't). Next, we had the little gem salad with a citrusy dressing and crisp vegetables beautifully arranged on the plate. Definitely not your average green salad. For our main, we split the smoked black cod. The fish was flaky and moist and was accompanied by grilled vegetables, wild rice and artichoke something. Great blend of textures and flavors. And the folks sitting at the next table took one look at our side dish of the smoky baked cauliflower (which is covered in provolone and smoked cheddar) and ordered it. 

The wines by the glass and beer list offers a nice assortment of wines for the cuisine. The sommelier was attentive and helpful. Overall, a really solid dining experience. We will be back. 

p.s. Street parking was easy on a Friday night but there is also parking at the Bank of America parking lot. Big plus if you are driving to this South of Market location.

Turns out this was the first day open in their new location on Brannan St.  But the food was as excellent as before, and the service was a bit faster.  We had the crispy fried chicken sandwich and the shrimp roll, both fantastic.  But to call the noise level "energetic" is a gross understatement--we joked that we needed to get someplace quiet, like AT&T Park.  (In fairness, this WAS just before a playoff game, and patrons were more than a little boisterous.)
The food and service are always reliably good. If I lived in the neighborhood I'd eat here at least once a week!
my husband & I love marlowe - such a gem & solid food!

Had the Brussels sprout chips, potato leek soup, sole and pork chop for main dishes.
Everything was delightful. We will is it again!

Stuck to the basics: brussel sprout chips, burger and fries, a couple of pilsners. Outstanding food, and as always, more-than-competent service. The only drawbacks are the prics (a little steep) and the crowd (always a good sign for good food); but I can afford a little more for such tasty eats, and you can't blame a restaurant for being popular.

Make a reservation and don't even worry about the crowd. Next time: the chicken instead :)
Delicious food. Loved the poulet vert and Saturday evening's special cocktail.

great to have them as part of the neighborhood, just make a reservation if you have your heart set on eating there or go early for lunch. A must have is the flash fried Brussels Sprout, baked cauliflower, burger, fries, huge pork chop perfectly grilled.... great salad with an interesting avocado twist!
review_title: great to have them as part

review: Marlowe is a great small restaurant. All of our food was delicious, kind of gourmet comfort food. Beer and wine only, but creative champagne cocktail and good wine by glass selection. Good service and the price is right. I would go back.
review_title: Marlowe is a great small restaurant

review:
My new favorite restaurant in the city!
Deviled eggs are to die for, and their pork chop is amazing!
Panna Cotta for dessert is the right way to go!

Small intimate place with minimal decor but with still plenty of personality. Food is uniquely prepared and is truly worth going to again. The portions were generous and the flavors were delicious. The staff were professional but down to earth. Two thumbs up!

Loud, boisterous, energetic place to let off steam after work. Free parking on Townsend from 6p.m. helped and the smallish place filled up fast by 6 p.m. Good casual bistro food fairly priced. Had to shout to tablemates to be heard and hear. Masculine, clubby feel with black banquettes and metal I-beams. If you're looking for an informal, fun place SOMA, great.

very tasty food but quite rich (delicious brussel sprout chips and deviled eggs, like everyone else has said). everything tastes so good and then you feel the food sitting like a stone. I had the "green chicken" which was wonderful and heavy.

We were the first diners and really enjoyed the food and experience --until the place filled and we found conversation to be a shouting affair. Lunch has the same menu and lower decibels-- if we return it will be then.
review_title: We were the first diners and

review: Appetizer and salad were excellent, but pork chop entree was too fatty and stuffed sole was soggy.

All the food was great; fresh, interesting and tasty. The chicken--which could have been pretty boring--was cooked perfectly and delicious. Terrific service, with a friendly but professional attitude. My only reservation--and it could keep me from going there when I want to have a conversation, is that it is very noisy. Not from a rowdy crowd, but because it's small and acoustics are bad.
review_title: All the food was great; fresh,

review:
AMAZING! Wonderful (best restaurant experience) Very friendly and hospitable staff. Staff very knowledgeable in wine and description of menue items.
Wine was really great,reasonable and great selection.
Great people watching from the neighborhood and train station.

From start to finish a wonderful experience. A new favorite! Service was phenomenal from the hostess and on throughout the night. Food was wonderful (Deviled Eggs are a must). Everything we ordered was just the right touch of familiar flavors, with an interesting and unique twist, without seeming like they were trying to hard. I had the chicken which I devoured, and am not the slightest bit embarrassed to say so. In fact, can't wait to devour it again.
I can't say enough great things about Marlowe. Eat here. Err, don't! Pretty soon it will be too tough to get a spot.
review_title: I can't say enough great things

review: Marlowe has been consistently very good to excellent on the three occasions we have eaten there (twice for lunch and once for an early dinner. I would highly recommend eating there for any occasion. Marlowe has a casual atmosphere so you don't have to dress up, but the food is definitely of a very high quality and the service is very attentive without hovering.

Phenomenal menu + Phenomenal service=asking the waiter to come back because you just can't decide! Going with his recommendation we went with the brussel sprout chips (you can't have just one), steak tartare, truffled wild mushroom polenta and the pork chop. He instinctively knew that we were going to share the polenta and the pork chop and offered to split it for us. Extra points! The polenta so rich, so truffly. As for pork chop, I think it's the hardest cut of meat to cook, you don't want it raw and it's so easy to over cook. Let's just say it was "Pork chop-perfect".
Fantastic burger and an even better salad. Overall, very satisfying. Server slighly on the slow side.

This was my second trip to Marlowe and I was even more impressed. The moderately priced wine was excellent, the brussel sprouts unique and delicious, the hamburger excellent. The only negative was the fish. The tables are close so you are dining with others not in your group, but that added to the fun for the evening. The waiter couldn't have been more accommodating.
review_title: This was my second trip to

review: Nice ambience and cozy seating. The food is well prepared and presented. French fries are a must have. Limited menu but everything at our table not only looked good but was flavorful and well executed. Loved this restaurant and will return.
Fantastic food and service! This is my favorite neighborhood restaurant.

Marlowe was just OK. We made reservations, and were seated 20 minutes later. No menus appeared until our server came over to take our orders and realized we didn't have menus. The food wasn't spectacular. We ordered 6 dishes, 2 of which were sides and overly buttered and salted. Overall, it was a disappointing encore to Chef Puccio's stint at Cortez.
review_title: Marlowe was just OK. We made

review: We had the brussel spout chips which were delicious, and the hamburger and fries which were good..but not the best burger ever, as advertised. I'd say take away the advertisement and the expectation of a regular decent burger will be met. Loud crowd made it hard to hear people at my own table. Service was very good.
review_title: We had the brussel spout chips

review: Server kept serving us from the wrong side of the table, not sure why he wanted to make it more difficult for himself. Menu was too small, felt limited in selection. Could be A LOT better if they had more selections.
Great food and they had Coopers! Loved the smoked salmon/egg/truffled hollandaise dish.
review_title: Great food and they had Coopers!

review: Nice winelist, fairly reasonably priced. My appetizer was good, but unfortunately my entree was disappointing. I ordered the steak and I guess the cut of beef they used or that particular order from the butcher was not very good. I did taste my friend's lamb which was delicious. So it was okay, but given the location (across the street from train station) and the mediocre entree, I doubt I'll go back. There are other places in the same price range that are easier to get to, more enjoyable neighborhoods and have more consistent quality of food.

Terrific home made pasta dishes but if you don't like rich heavy sauces with lots of butter and cheese, be choosy and pass on the price fix tasting menu.  The price fix tasting menu offers 6 different pasta dishes enough to share for 2 then add two apps. Grilled octopus was disappointing seemed fatty and rubbery. Boneless ribs app were excellent and Grandpa's spaghetti with sausage was the best.
review_title: Terrific home made pasta dishes but if y...

review:
Great steaks and amazing view. Classic San Francisco...
There is a life piano.
review_title: Great steaks and amazing view. Classic S...

address: Four Embarcadero CenterSuite One, Lobby LevelSan Francisco, CA  94111
review:
Very noisy. Fodd is good though a little overpriced and it can be a little bland compared to what you might find in asia. The food seems to be better than when we first went when it first opened. 

The service is still VERY slow and the restaurant is incredibly loud and it wasn't even full. the restaurant is also very dark in parts of the room depending on where you are. 

Still one of the best chinese in SF, even if the price is a little more than you should be spending.
review_title: Very noisy. Fodd is good though a little...

address: Four Embarcadero CenterSuite One, Lobby LevelSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: Crystal Jade propels Fine Chinese Cuisine to another level.  The quality of the food and the expertise of its Chef is perhaps the best in the Bay Area.  I look forward to the restaurant improving its service, response time, and attention to detail.  Crystal Jade is a great addition to the Fine Dining scene in San Francisco!
Good food; good service but the noise level is way too high. Won't go back because of the loudness.
review_title: Good food; good service but the noise le...

review: Our first time at Cassava will not be our last.  What a great find in the Outer Richmond. Creative and delicious food, unusual combinations, wonderful staff.  We were there for a (fabulous) dinner and look forward to trying the brunch menu as well.
We love this little neighborhood spot.  Always friendly, good service, delicious food, family friendly and well stocked bar.  what more could you ask for?

Unfortunately we left without eating. When we arrived there was a line out the door and all of them had reservations just like us, some 45 minutes prior. And we waited for a while but there was no hostess in sight. We left.  I chalk that experience up to poor management.
review_title: people with reservations wait for a long time

review: I elected to get the home made pasta with spicy sausage.  They were out of their homemade pasta and recommended tagliatelle which was good but i was really really disappointed to find that the sausage was just slices of what was a hard salami or pepperoni and not the sausage I expected.  I ate it and it was fine but was truly disappointed. My boyfriend got the lasagna and loved it and the service was really outstanding.

My requirement was to have some home made pasta, which every one of their pastas is. The Tagliatelle Fungi with truffle oil was delicious...the mushroom are so savory that you don't miss the meat, and the truffle oil gives off the perfect luxurious aroma.

With all of the great Italian restaurant choices in the North Beach area of San Francisco, it can be difficult to make a final decision on which to choose. My son and daughter-in-law and I selected Vicoletto based on a couple of menu items we were drawn to, and were delighted with the experience! My pasta with fresh crab meat was perfect - fresh succulent crab meat, and much more of it than I had received in a more well-known restaurant on the embarcadero. My son's gnocchi and sausage - both made in house - was the best example of that dish that I have tasted in years. Service was superb - two friendly and professional Italian speaking waiters anticipated our needs.
This was the best Italian food experienace we've had in years. The picata was wonderful. Their pasta (home made perfect al dente tube pasta) was terrific. We're coming back!

While I would not say this restaurant is a great place to take kids, we did. There is no kids menu but the staff was happy to suggest some alternative dishes for our kids. The food is excellent and I think it's likely a lovely place for a romantic meal. While the staff welcomed us, if you take kids, take them early since most patrons are probably expecting a quiet, chaos-free meal.
review_title: While I would not say this

review: Having lived and extensively travelled to Italy, I and my husband have a very high standard in terms of Italian restaurants. Vicoletto was exceeding our expectation with great dishes with a pleasant surprise. The servers were also very professional and kind. This is not a super fancy place but cozy, small and comfortable to dine with reasonable price.
Great new spot for date night!! Great food and service. Nice wine list... Only was they had a full bar. Definitely will return.

The baratta was delicious! Amazing in fact! The tiramisu also - the best we've had in years! Unfortunately, our main dishes were only OK/good - not as amazing as what we started or ended the meal with. We still really enjoy this little restaurant - away from the hustle and bustle of Columbus.

Went for Turkey day Italian style. Service was really good
Considering one of the waiters left around 7pm then it filled up!
He was really good and didn't act overwhelmed. Food was very
Delicious! Panna cotta best ever!

We had a great dinner for 10 in the downstairs banquet room. Absolutely memorable with Roman Holiday playing on the pull-down screen, the AMAZING food, and wonderful friendly staff. Highly recommended!
review_title: We had a great dinner for

review: Accommodated our group of 11 for dinner. Food was very tasty - from salmon to pasta. We were celebrating my son's 21st birthday - they did bring him dessert with a candle:-)

This is some of the best Italian food we have had in a long time. Everything is homemade and the burrata is amazing. We will go there everytime we are in SF. The service was wonderful. We enjoyed it so much we went there twice while we were in SF for a week on vacation.
review_title: This is some of the best Italian

review: The food and wine were terrific. The server was extremely helpful with the wine selection. Menu is unique and therefore may be limited for some, but everything was fabulous.
review_title: The food and wine were terrific.

review: Our party of 8 was seated promptly at 8:30 after our visit to the Beach Blanket Babylon Christmas show just a few blocks away on Green Street across Columbus Avenue. The restaurant wasn't full, but I could tell that if there were more diners the noise would have been intolerable. We were famished and the wait staff brought the bread and olive oil/balsamic vinegar promptly and we dug in. The menu is small but offers plenty of good choices. 4 of us had veal piccata and loved it. Others had various pastas and raved about them. Wine list was varied and our choices were delivered promptly. A nice full bar which we did not partake of. I will definitely keep this on my list of places to dine in North Beach.

This was our second visit in a week. We heartily recommend the incredible mozzarella shipped in directly from Italy, and the gnocchi was the best we've ever had. In fact, everything including the service and ambiance was over the top good!

We had a great dinner the other day. We had guests visiting and we were saving them from there request of The Stinking Rose. We gave them great Italian food and wine at this restaurant. Everything we had we really enjoyed. The roasted cauliflower, proscuitto, and blood orange salad were all delicous as appteizers. For a mid course we split the the Tagliatelle with mushrooms. For main courses we had the Chicken, Quail, Steak, and Crab cioppino. On all accounts everything was great. the service was great and the owner and the waiter were gracious and timely. It is our second time there and we will be back. Also this is a great place to relax and have a saturday glass of wine and share an appetizer or two outside as well. it's a great location
review_title: We had a great dinner the

review:
A great new Italian place in North Beach.
The waiters were very efficient and friendly. The food was great, even though I noticed that the portions varied significantly depending on what you get. I had a nice carpaccio to start with, then delicious pasta with sausage. My friends also like what they got. It's not fancy food, just fresh and simple food, honestly priced.
A very special experience.  Chef Finn and staff provide delightful experiences

This is a nice place for lunch. The cuisine is good, but they could do with a few more vegetarian options. Our waiter was most accommodating, even checking to see if there was an option to the soup du jour. The garlic chips are reeeeeeally good...you'll have both seats on the bus.

A warm and relaxing environment. Pleasant staff. Good cocktails and wine list. Food is very inconsistent with a bland quince and arugula salad, tasteless parmesan fries and mushroom sandwich but excellent pasta with clams. I come here for the ambience rather than for a fine dining experience.
The food was outstanding from start to finish and the staff were very friendly and took care of our ever request.

Scala's Bistro is a beautiful place; food and service are great, but when it's full, the sound is deafening. We skipped dessert just to get back to the relative silence of the busy sidewalk outside. If you're looking for a pre-theater restaurant near Union Square, it is in just the right location. We only had a short walk to it from the Sutter/Stockton garage and after dinner another few blocks to the ACT theater on Geary. Traffic made us late for our reservation but we were seated right away anyway. The menu has variety. The mussels (in a sauce of preserved lemons, pernod and fennel) were absolutely wonderful. Noise was the only drawback.

My group was in SFO for a week and we had the best service and food that i have tasted. The ambiance was great and while they have rained at the greatest service level ever. I was here beforetwo years ago. So next time in SFO it will scala again for a meal and great time.
review_title: Scala Scales the top of list again

review:
Good things are foods such pizza and pastas, wines and service.
As the restaurant is dark and noisy, it might be not suitable for family but for friends.
review_title: Good food and service but noisy

review:
Had a wonderful solo dinner here. Great orecchietti pasta dish. Yumm.
A busy, friendly place to eat overlooking a characteristic San Francisco
street.

We celebrated a birthday and Mother's day for a relative from AZ. Scala's was the designated meeting place and what a treat it was.
Our server Bill was a true professional and impressed all of us with his attentive service and good humor. When in SF, you must go to Scala's.

Food was very good, creative and well presented.
The wait staff was excellent!!!! Our server was very attentive and helpful! We had a couple of 'high-maintenance' people in our group and our server was patient, respectful, curtious and knowledgeable about both the wines and the menu.
Only draw back, as late afternoon became evening, the noise level rose and it became difficult to converse with the person across the table.

Seated within 5 minutes of our reservation time. Hostess was extremely gracious and accommodating. Food and service provided by Alex and her assistants was excellent; attentive but not rushed. Alex was very knowledgeable about wine selections and made several food selection suggestions to pair with the wine. Would highly recommend Scala's Bistro for a truly enjoyable experience.

I just love the food here...no matter what I have ordered I have enjoyed it and so have my dining guests.
Service is spotty at times, really depends on who you get but I have yet to be disappointed with the food.
As always, our dining experience was fabulous, The pork loin in mustard sauce and sauerkraut was delicious!

after a play, we made our 3 trip to Scala's in as many years. the service was terrific (i dont recall her name), but the food was un-inspiring this time. mahi mahi was good, pasta raviolis were ok. our other choice was Farrilon across the street, wish we had tried them this time.

A small birthday dinner at Scala's was a perfect choice. The staff was kind and cooperative with the special preparations, the ambiance lively, the wine list great and the food absolutely delicious! We were absolutely delighted with our evening.

Scala's was recommended by my cousin, who has lived in SF for many years. The food was great!!! And our server was the best we have had anywhere in as long as I can remember. He was helpful in recommending dishes, and he knew quite a bit about the wines we were trying to decide between. He has been working at Scala's for years, and it showed. We would definitely recommend Scala's.
Good top notch looking place for dinner or lunch. Service is usually good to very good.
Superb service, great food, but noise level unacceptable -- had to shout across the table just to be heard.
unfriendly service, rushed, no inter reaction with waiter. Bartender was nice. Limited menu.

Been here dozens of times over the last few years. The hostess and bartenders were more than fantastic.
Once we finally got our table it became a real mess. Our server was totally overwhelmed and barely keep her composure at times. We finally ordered. I hated having to basically flag/hail her for basic procedures. Maybe I could have made it through the night but the mussels and fries were room temperature, the grits with my duck was barely warm, steak was dry with cold fries, salmon was good and linguine with clams had definitely been sitting for a bit(not hot). Of course Bostini chocolate cream dessert thing was awesome. I've been here many times and this was unacceptable for $350
Love this place been going here 2 sometime 3 times a week. Great staff Consultanty great food with head turning specials
Scala's continues to have great ambiance, great food and an excellent staff. A terrific place to make a shopping expedition or night at the theatre even more special.
The food was excellent, the service impeccable. While is was a little loud, it was not awful where we were sitting. We would go back again and again. Just perfect,really.
Great food & service. And appreciated the discount associated with attending the SHN production of Anything Goes at the Golden Gate Theater.

I would give Scala a higher rating as the food is quite good but the service was very slow at lunch. They also brought me the completely wrong order and although they said I could nibble on that while I waited for my real order if I had had to be somewhere at a certain time I would have been out of luck...Both sandwiches were quite tasty so again no complaints about the food...
review_title: I would give Scala a higher

review: They have always made me feel like a special guest, even at their busiest. I've felt that most of the best restaurants in the Union Square area are doing me a big favor- not so, at Scala's. always a great table, always a great waiter, and always a great meal.
review_title: They have always made me feel

review: Have been at Scalas many times in the past.  Have always had an accomodating server.  This week enjoyed meeting the waitress, can't remember her name but she is from Italy.  Food was very good.  My wife was impressed with the amount of clams in her linguine.
review_title: Have been at Scalas many times

review: We enjoyed dinner for my husband's birthday, which began with the printing of "Happy Birthday Dennis" on our menus. It was a simple touch that went a long way! This was one of the most delicious, creative, seasonal dinners we had ever had in San Franciso only to be complimented with wonderful service and a fabulous wine. The fuyu persimmon, bleu cheese and pine nut pizza was an appetizer ~ gone in 10 minutes! My swordfish with ceci beans and kale chips (OMG!) was amazing... dessert came with a birthday flair. I am ready to go back again tonight!
Love this place! Have been going there for years and have never had a bad service or food! It's GREAT!

-Extremely noisy atmosphere
-excellent pizza and risotto
-waiter was friendly but staff bringing out the food was not

This was my fourth visit and again it did not disappoint. Busy Saturday evening atmosphere,
good Italian food, served by caring, helpful waitress. Extremely pleasant evening.
review_title: This was my fourth visit and

review: From the moment we were greeted by our elegant hostess, my husband and I were made to feel like we were the most important guests of the restaurant. We were in San Francisco to celebrate our thirtieth wedding anniversary, and I selected Scala's based on the menu and Trip Advisor reviews. The staff was friendly, attentive, but not obtrusive. The food was delicious from the salads to the entree to the dessert to the perfectly recommended wine pairings. We felt so comfortable at the restaurant that we went to the bar after our meal for a nightcap and were, again, made to feel like regulars and treated to a complimentary glass of port. I've recommended Scala's Bistro to everyone, and I'll make it a point to return.

It was difficult to find an excellent meal in San Francisco, because there are so many places - this place is truly excellent. The food and service were amongst the best I have experienced in the USA and it is a beautiful venue. I would say it was one of the more expensive meals we had, which wasn't obvious from the OpenTable listing, so save it for a special occasion!
My second time to this restaurant.  First time was a large group, which was handled flawlessly.  This time, two of us and excellent again.  The food was delicious and the service impeccable.
review_title: My second time to this restaurant.

review:
Scalas is consistently one of Sf's most popular restaurants
Everything about this restaurant works. It's great looking , has delicious uncomplicated food and the service is friendly and efficient
The location at Union Square is so convenient and parking is easy at union sq garage
One of my all time favorites.
Great Dinner with wonderful service. Really a romantic night out.

We had a wonderful time at Scala's after having a less than wonderful time at a highly popular place the night before. We were given a comfortable and well placed mini-banquette, and our waiter set the pace with an attentive yet leisurely pace. Our dishes were delicious and nicely portioned, and the wine choices excellent with many well priced. We will go back the next time we are in San Francisco!
review_title: We had a wonderful time at

review: Great location, good food, nice atmosphere. Not outstanding Italian food, but all in all a pleasant place to have dinner or lunch in the union square neighborhood. I've eaten here happily a number of times when traveling alone- dinner in the bar area is very casual.
Business lunch; gave us a private corner table; waiter was there as needed; the food was great; made the deal!

Whenever we visit San Francisco, we try to include Scala's as part of our dining experience. The quality of the food is top notch, and the service is relaxed and professional. Some tables can be noisy, but this time, we were seated in a small booth for two. Great spot! I'm sure we'll eat there again.
Food has always been good here but the prices have crept up to the level of gourmet restaurants which this is not.
My friend and I split our lunch. We shared the cobb salad and the clam linguine (generous serving of fresh clams).
review_title: My friend and I split our

review: The pasta was undercooked. The waiter we had was absolutely horrible. All that was really good was dessert. Not worth the price.

I like coming here for the menu-food-service-the "vibe". Our server Sat. night was great! Our good time started at the reception counter and went all the way thru the night, including our re-visit after the show for dessert.

Overall, I would say that La Scala is a good dinner, but certainly not great. It is in a perfect location if you are shopping downtown, has a comfortable interior and lovely service (we loved our waiter). But the food can only fairly be described as average and much more expensive than expected (not an entree below 25). With so much competition for your foodie dollars in this town, you can do better.
A little loud in the restaurant, but the food was unique and very good. We were tourists and it was definitely a place we'd recommend others visit.
review_title: A little loud in the restaurant,

review: Great food and great service and great location to walk to ACT/theater. Prices do seem high, though.
This is a favorite! Right in Union Square in the middle of San Francisco, you always get a great dinner, great drinks, great service and then great theatre. Go if you haven't!!!
We had of town friends and they loved it. They could walk from their hotel.
review_title: We had of town friends and

review: loved this place. high energy and wonderful room. the menu never disappoints. everything we order is luscious. this time we had a server who was having a bad night. spotty service, but good backup from others made it still a great experience. door greeting is always amazing!

The food was amazing - we had the salmon - delish; perfectly prepared. The restaurant was packed as usual - so energetic. We try to eat at Scala's whenever we visit SF and the food and service never disappoints. Everyone made us feel special. A wonderful dinner.

Bustling with holiday shoppers and kids with strollers. At least on the day we went it seemed more like a family place than an upscale Italian restaurant. Waiter took our order without mentioning any specials. We were surprised later to hear another waiter recite some tempting specials to another party.

Sunday early dinner after a performance 3 adults, 2 children. Table was great in a quiet corner of the bar. Children's menu is amazing. Looks very standard but preparation was very well done. Adults dined on salads and pastas. Would eat there again this week if in the neighborhood.

Both entrees (linguine with clams and the chicken) were so extremely salty as to detract significantly from the flavors. We sent the chicken back and requested one with much less salt. Management was gracious about the return, however. The linguine was cooked perfectly al dente - and the requested scallops were perfect - but the salt in the pasta sauce was relentless.

If I go again, I will request no or little salt at the time of ordering.
Had a wonderful family birthday there. So close to everything, but it doesn't feel too touristy or crowded. The service was outstanding. Truly attentive and conscientious waitress!

This is one of my favorites in the city. We had osso buco risoto. Very tender meat, tasty risoto. An excellent dish. Side of spinach was well prepared - simple but flavorful. We always get an order of pommes frites - so good. Had the boston creme pie for dessert. Prepared in unique way and very good.
review_title: This is one of my favorites

review:
Our waiter was quite a character and we enjoyed interacting with him. Service was exceptional and we were well treated the whole meal.
The food was delicious...tomato salad was Wonderful!
Thank you.
review_title: Our waiter was quite a character

review: We have enjoyed Scala Bistro for years, but our last visit was not as enjoyable. Our server seemed to be missing in action, perhaps too busy, When we did see her, she could not hear us, over the internal noise, to know what we were asking for, or ordering. We asked for a dessert menu, and coffee, and she brought us the check instead. We finally asked a gentleman, by the desk, in a suit, if we could get a dessert menu. Food prices seemed to also have gone up, on the menu, in this economy. We have been theatre goers for 30 years, and love to try the restaurants in walking distance of the theatre. Our guests and I decided we would have to try some other choices, after our last experience at Scala Bistro.
Good food, well prepared, the server was helpful, but the noise lever was very loud. Have been before, and we'll go again.

Great experience from food to service, our server Dee Dee was attentive, friendly and knowledgeable. Really enjoyed the linguine with clams and the desserts were terrific. Looking forward to going back.
AS always, food was excellent and the service was outstanding. Wait staff friendly and alert.
Best to call ahead for reservations. We do a special holiday dinner with friends here every year the Saturday before Christmas. This year, as in year's past, was lots of fun.
review_title: Best to call ahead for reservations

review: Braised Pork Shoulder Risotto was to die for and paired perfectly with the wine our server recommended. Definitely try whatever the specials are of the night. Sooooo good!

It has been several years since my last lunch at Scala's. One of the pesto dishes that I really enjoyed is not on the menu anymore. I think the pasta was call the Pope nose. I got over my disappointment and had am execellant ravoli and very good wine.
We come here often. Food is always great, high noise level actually gives ou privacy, service is spot-on. Moules frites is outstanding.
review_title: We come here often. Food is

review: We arrived 30 minutes late for a pre-theater dinner and were seated immediately (we did phone ahead to warn them). Service was attentive but not intrusive. Bread and olive oil were excellent - fresh artisan bread with wonderful texture and a delicious olive oil, unadorned. Cocktails were tasty and attractive. Frito mixto was tasty as were the organic greens with a light, citrus dressing. The gnocci with crayfish were almost creamy in texture and dense as i prefer them. The orchiette with sausage was well flavored, a little spicy, and nicely al dente. The restaurant is loud enough that I would not take my hard-of-hearing parents to dine there.
Good personal fast service. Breakfast was delicous. Worked well for a business meeting meal.
Our lunch was very good. Everyone ordered a pasta entree and agreed that we would come back again. The kitchen couldnt get our side order of Brussel Sprouts out, so they took it off the order.
review_title: Our lunch was very good. Everyone

review: We're disappointed with the change with the new chef. We enjoyed how consistent the food was in the past.

We are always very happy with our experience at Scala's Bistro. In addition to visiting throughout the year, my husband and I have an annual holiday tradition that includes Sunday lunch at Scala's and we are always pleased with our experience. The host has been consistent over the past several years -- she is charming, efficient, and a joy to deal with! The food is lovely, including the truffle-oil infused pizza as a starter, and the bar scene and lovely holiday decorations add to the ambiance. We expect to enjoy the same holiday ritual for years to come -- a romantic lunch at a wonderful Union Square establishment.
review_title: We are always very happy with

review: Scala's has changed its menu.  We were quite the fans of the restaurant but on this visit have found it less interesting in taste, plating, and food combinations.
We had a wonderful dinner at Scala's Bistro on 9/23/09. Food and service were excellent. Don't miss the Bostini Creme Pie for dessert!
The food was good. The salads, in particular, were outstanding. The service was kind of indifferent. Overall, it was fine.
review_title: The food was good. The salads,

review: They were so polite even though I was late for my reservation and showed up all wind-blown.  I love this restaurant and it makes me nostalgic as a San Francisco native who now lives an hour away from the city.  The food is very delicious, the service is wonderful, and the ambiance is very much appreciated.
review_title: They were so polite even though

review: Beautiful room and excellent service, you could actually carry on a conversation comfortably in a full restaurant. We tried the yellow tail and grilled octopus appetisers, both good and beautifully presented. For a main course we shared the roasted chicken "Moroccan" style - served to be shared by two people with small side dishes (kale, cabbage, potatoes) and 3 charmoulas. There were three of us and the waitress told us it was too light, so we added a branzino main course. The chicken was more than enough for 4 people - when we asked afterwards we were told it a 3lb chicken. While the branzino was cooked to perfection, we ended up taking bags of extra food home. We split a chocolate dessert with a hint of ginger, excellent.

The space was big and the hostess was friendly, but the waitress was not very inviting. Don't try to order the "whiskey" table service if you have less than three drinkers, although there is no mention of the minimum on the menu. The squid salad was too salty but good because it was Thai-spicy. This was random as we didn't ask any dishes to be any particular spiciness level. Since we like Thai-spicy, the squid salad was a pleasant surprise. The other dishes were mildly made for american taste. We also ordered the fried egg salad, grilled pork, grilled chicken, lao sausage, thai som tum and sticky rice. We were not asked how many sticky rices we wanted or how small the portions were for five people, so we had to add on to our order after the fact. A good location and a nice bar upstairs, but the restaurant is good as long as you go in expecting overpriced dishes and an attitude from the staff.

Good effort, and there *is* talent there, but it's drowned out by inexperience.  Nearly all the dishes are extremely busy -- they need at least two ingredients removed, and in some cases four.  None of the flavors come through, as a result; it's just a big mix of savory (and that means that dishes have a tendency to taste roughly the same).  And plating!  Everything we ordered looked like a compost heap.

There's only one dessert on offer, which is a missed opportunity.  Because one of our party doesn't like dates (it was date pudding), we went elsewhere for dessert, and the table next to us decided to forego dessert for the same reason.  I know it's an intimate neighborhood venue, but having no choices at all for dessert means not selling more drinks too.

Service wanted to be good, but the servers seemed untrained.

Wine list is excellent .  It's worth going for drinks, and maybe their "fries" (which are potato wedges -- that ticked off one of our party).  But I'd let the kitchen get over their tendency to throw in every ingredient in the walk-in.
Excellent service and food.  The music was also excellent but  a bit loud.

Going to 1300 Filmore for the Gospel Brunch is a special treat for me - I only go 2-3 times a year. So I was disappointed on Sunday when a different band was playing and instead of gospel music, played old R&B hits like "Higher Ground" and "Just the Two of Us." I kept waiting for them to do a gospel number, but they never did. This is supposed to be gospel music brunch. If the regular band is not available they should find a replacement that plays gospel music. If they can't, they should let the patrons know. 1300 Filmore called to confirm my reservation on Friday - they should have told me that it would not be gospel music brunch afterall so I could go another weekend. VERY DISAPPOINTING.

On vacation with hubby and 2 teenagers.  Beautiful interior & atmosphere.  Attentive service. Waiter happily accommodated our request for our son of an unadorned rib-eye and a side of mashed potatoes.  Daughter who likes spicy food, ordered the signature chicken dish.  The waiter said the coating is spicy.  She was underwhelmed.  I even thought it was underwhelming and I'm a spice wimp.  We are from the north & maybe we don't have a handle on southern fried chicken--we'd never had it before.  I ordered the beef short rib and loved every bite.  Hubby got the mussels and the catfish and loved them both.
Could not have asked for a better mothers day! What a great place, food was amazing, and the staff was on point!

My wife and I had two great dishes I had the fish, and my wife had lamb chops. She had this cuscus side and these potatoes that I could not tell if they were mash potatoes but they were great. As well my dish was excellent we will be back.

The food here is amazing, I ordered short ribs that literally fell off of the bone. The overall ambiance and service level at the restaurant was 5 stars. Whenever I visit San Francisco again, this restaurant will definitely be on my list of must-do's.

My husband and I have been here before and had an amazing experience. We were excited to try the Gospel Brunch we'd been hearing so much about. I am by no means an expert on Gospel music, but this was not what I was expecting. It seemed more like something you'd hear in an after-hours cocktail lounge...and there was only one singer, not a choir. The highlight of the day was a zippy rendition of "When the Saints Come Marching In" that had the crowd engaged and clapping along. Other than that, the music was pretty sleepy. Food was ok, but I highly recommend skipping brunch in favor of dinner. That is the area that this restaurant seems to shine.
review_title: Brunch - not what I was expecting

review: The Food Was Great And The Service Was Excellent! It Was A Surprise Birthday Dinner For My Daughter's Birthday And The Hostess And Server Was Very Helpful!
Very enjoyable Mother's Day brunch. Great music and delicious food. Best brunch dish was the Shrimp and Grits!
Excellent service! The food was very yummy as was the dessert. Stopped in before a show at Yoshi's...we will return!

When i first walked in, i was greeted by a very polite hostess. What impressed me is that she remembered my name the moment i told her that i have a reservation at 6:45pm, she straight away mentioned my name. I like the way she smiles. i feel that this is important because not every restaurant i went, they have a hostess like this. And the whole experience is just better than other restaurant i went to because the waiter who served me recommended me all the best food that i was expecting on that night. I ordered Bourbon-Hickory House Smoked Pork Belly & Egg, Braised Cranberry Beans, Black Skillet Roasted Catfish,Warm Chocolate Beignets & Bourbon cocktail - Jim Beam w Coke. Everything is superb that night and i left w a smile a big tips :)
review_title: I will definitely go back again!

review: It was even better than the hype! We're already planning our next meal there.
review_title: We were WOWed in every way

review: I loved this place, the staff was inviting, friendly, all smiles and so accomodating. The food was delicious. We will be back soon!

The service was outstanding as was the food. I haven't had such good food in a long time.

I can't think of a negative thing to say. We enjoyed it immensely.

The Dine About Town menu drew me in and I'm glad that it did! The fried green tomato salad, pork ribs and strawberry/rhubarb dessert were perfect! Yes, it is very hearty food but it will make your heart sing! The staff was friendly and expressed genuine happiness which made for a very pleasant experience overall. Definitely figure in 1300 on Fillmore into your date night plans!
review_title: The Dine About Town menu drew

review:
The food was above average though we were not impressed with the mashed potatoes as some others have reviewed.

1300 is a nice sit down for intimate dates or a group for a special occasions.

very nice ambiance and interior decor but food was incredibly subpar, mediocre, and far below the average fair at most restaurants, or even what I could make at home. Completely not worth the price. A lot of the dishes just didn't even taste good. Or the taste was slightly off. Very disappointing.
My second time there...great setting, but I was very dissatisfied with the food both times.
My fish was a little tasteless, but the meat dish was out standing
review_title: My fish was a little tasteless,

review: 1300 on Fillmore is delicious. We had a very romantic meal with delicious food! Will definitely be going back.

The food was pretty good. The fried chicken has a special taste which I couldn't quite figure out but unlike other fried chicken it was not too oily. Overall the restaurant has a great romantic vibe and had a live band playing. I was a little upset with the service since they first brought us the wrong appetizer and we realized after leaving they never gave us our leftovers that we asked to take home.

Service and ambiance were great. The smells from the kitchen were awesome and really had me craving something good. Unfortunately we found that the Gem salad was very bland and tasteless and the rib special also lacked an abundance of flavor. I like this place but the food the night me and my girlfriend were there was only so so. Hopefully we just hit it on an off night. I will give it a second try in the future.
Amazing Food! I big surprize to all of us...it was very very very good..
The lounge is great for a drink, but live music would take it up a star.
review_title: The lounge is great for a

review: My wife and I had the baby back ribs and the short rib dinners. I can't say that either of these entree's were worth a return visit. Food is Bland, very bland. This Chef needs to hire taste testers for his entire menu and hopefully with the appropriate feedback the flavor of the product will be improved. On a positive note the live R&B band had everyone up and dancing for hours. Best part of the visit.
review_title: My wife and I had the baby

review:
I was disappointed on the timing of when we were seated. We got to the restaurant 15 minutes before our 8:30pm reservations. Around 8:25, we asked the host the progress of our seating since there were 6 empty tables. The restaurant was NOT packed to capacity. The host told us it would take approximately ANOTHER 15-20 minutes to be seated. I had to ask another employee who may have been the manager (unsure) and finally, was seated at 8:40pm. This is unacceptable.

However, our server was FANTASTIC! He mentioned he was also working on a 30 person party... but, he made sure to come by our table, was quick with refills, made sure to be prompt and attentive. I really appreciated his service and left happily after enjoying my meal.
appetizers, soup and salads were very good. Main courses (fired chicken, short ribs, spare ribs, while they sound interesting were dry and kinda boring. but the ambiance and decor were really nice.

1300 on Fillmore, always meets my every expectation! I'm a home girl from Chicago. 1300 on Fillmore does it all... The food (hominy, pork, chicken, sea bass, cat fish, short rib), ambiance & music are spectacular. I can't wait for Jazz Brunch Sunday!!!! My 90 year old Mom promises to bring her friends from Chi-Town, next year to celebrate her 91st! Monetta was fabulous and beautiful as she walked the room making sure all was well. The best part of the evening was when Monetta came to Laura Fleming's table. Monetta paused, looked at Laura and knew she had spotted someone important in life. They chatted, bonded, discussed food and all was well for the rest of evening.

Another pleasant dining experience a this very fun restaurant. The baby back ribs and fried chicken specials were superb. We intend to add 1300 on Fillmore to our list of restaurants we plan to visit often.
Went for an early special dinner. The environment was perfect - quiet, beautiful and comfortable. The food was more unique and special in presentation than in taste.
The staff was wonderful. They were very friendly and professional. The food was excellent and came to the table quickly.

Food was not good and very expensive. My fried chicken was so overflavored with cumin that it tasted like way overpriced indian food. The slow cooked beef was just tastless and mushy. We will not go back
review_title: Food was not good and very

review: David Lawrence has done a fantastic job with the entire experience! The bar, lounge, and restaurant areas are very inviting and comfortable. The food is outstanding and the portions are generous. Good comfort-food with great flavors!! Great decor and the service is outstanding. Nice wine list with bargains, especially compared to what other SF restaurants charge. If you get a chance to meet David, do it. You won't find a more friendly and appreciative man in the SF restaturant business.

Food was delicious and the portions were large. We shared the banana cream pie for dessert and it was light, yet yummy! We noted on Open Table's special requests that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and our waitress added "Happy Anniversary" to our dessert plate which was a sweet surprise! The staff was awesome!
Enjoyed, service was good and pleasant. Food, what we ordered was excellent, interesting and good presentation. Had trouble finding as the outside is nondescript and no name.

This restaurant is one of the best kept secrets in the city, I learned of it on Vh1's soul cities hosted by Nelson George, the food at this restaurant was both beautiful and oh so delicious, one of the owners even came out to talk with us, if your in San Francisco, you have to give this place a try...
Excellent! Great venue and good food along with good people. Will recommend to friends.

1300 on Fillmore is an experience that should not be missed. We had the most amazing appetizers, main course and dessert (The chocolate beignets were heavenly! The coffee soda just seals the deal). The wait staff was friendly, accommodating and on the ball (we had our table wiped after appetizers and again after dinner). Every dish was a home run! Also, the Owner/Chef stopped by our table; he was very gracious and friendly. This place became my instant favorite hands down.

The ambiance was nice, quite and romantic. I went with a good friend and we enjoyed ourselves, the service and the food. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a nice dinner. Parking was also available which is very difficult at times in San Francisco.

We were seated in a nice, central area, away from the kitchen as I requested. We were well looked after. I was disappointed there weren't any specials, at least the waiter didn't mentioned any. This was my second dinner here (I've also once done brunch and several times done drinks). The food was really good. Two things could be improved. The sizes of the appetizers were quite small. I'd classify them as tapas. Generally I think of an appetizer as being able to sustain a group of 4-5 people. The meals were also small. I don't think the prices reflect how small the meals are. My meal, the pork entree was luke warm. I would recommend a steak knife be given to those ordering the pork as the normal knife was a bit hard to use.
review_title: We were seated in a nice,

review: Everything about 1300 was enjoyable. A friend recommended the place and I was not disappointed. The food was delicious, the live music gave it a warm feel, and the excellent service made it a place I would definitely go back to.
The Southern American menu (reinterpreted) is very distinctive. The mark-ups on the wine list are much too high.

Our group had heard that the fried chicken was excellent but the 3 (out of 4) of us that ordered it found that it was just slightly above average. On the other hand the creamy grits with shrimp & the halibut dish were incredible. All of us would definitely return to try other dishes and give the chicken a 2nd try.
review_title: Our group had heard that the

review:
I LOVED the food! Compliments to the Chef. My mouth salivates at the memory.  
There is a live Jazz band on Sunday's and Monday's. The surrounding influence and environment was a pervading atmosphere.
 All of the staff was helpful, kind, polite and courteous.
This was my first time there and I can guarantee it won't be my last!
I definantly recommend this restaurant.
I love this restaurant.  I have been there 3 times and I find the food delicious, sevice sublime and a wonderful atmosphere.

A++.  Our entire evening was enjoyable and quite memorable.  The food was great as expected, but coupled with the exceptional service, it was unmatched.  A glance around the room and you knew that this same quality was being enjoyed by all.  We will be visiting 1300 on Fillmore in the very near future, even though we live in Central Valley.

I like the fact that the owner, Mr. David Lawrence makes time to meet and greet his guest.  He is always hospitable.
The servants are well trained and suitable for their positions and make the guest feel welcomed.  I would definitely recommend 1300
on Fillmore to any and everyone looking for outstanding food and service.  In my opinion, you can't get any better than 1300 on Fillmore.
review_title: I like the fact that the owner,

rest_name: Vitrine - St Regis Hotel San Francisco
review:
Everything at Vitrine was fantastic!  From the delicious food to the great service, very friendly staff.  You couldn't have asked for more.   I was there with friends for our AAA 25th anniversary and it was a wonderful way to end our weekend there at the St. Regis.  Keep up the great work and delicious food.  Give your staff a raise as they deserve it.  Our waiter was named "Carlos" and he was great.
THANK YOU !!

rest_name: Vitrine - St Regis Hotel San Francisco
review: I love the ambiance: so peaceful, quiet, serene above the chaos of 3rd Street. We just enter and immediately feel our pulse rate slow down causing us to enjoy the food and wine just that much more. Very sophisticated but still friendly.
review_title: I love the ambiance: so peaceful,

rest_name: Vitrine - St Regis Hotel San Francisco
review: Decor and service are very good. Food is somehow disappointing for the price. People expect more classic and still enjoyable food.

rest_name: Vitrine - St Regis Hotel San Francisco
review: The selection was below my expectations, and we were only one of two couples present at 1pm on New Year's Day. The food itself exceeded expectations. My eggs benedict was beautifully presented with three perfectly poached eggs and three handmade, soft, delicious biscuits.

For years, Cafe Tiramisu was our "go to" San Francisco mid-priced Italian restaurant but our last two visits have been disappointing.  While the service and food still deserve good ratings, the quality of the dishes and attention to detail (e.g., fish and pasta cooking times and the flavor of the sauces) are clearly not up to past preparation.  Doubt if we'll be returning anytime soon.

One of the better San Francisco Italian restaurants - maybe even the best one not located in "Little Italy".  We make it a must whenever we are in SF downtown shopping. Food is uniformly good and portion sizes are sufficient for sharing. Wine list is extensive and they have lots of good wines by the glass and in half bottle sizes which is just right for lunch.
Food was yummy. Patio is very fun. We really enjoyed it!
The decor and service were a bit lackluster but the food was really good.

Nice Environment with cute little stone like decorations. Ample outdoor seating available with patio heaters to keep your toasty. Started with an appetizer of bruschetta with cheese and stuff and was fantastic.
The meal was delicious, the new York steak plentiful, potatoes were a little greasy but good.
Wine list is extensive. Desert(s) were free for moms 75th which was nice.
Finished meal with a limoncello and a cappuccino just like in Italy.
Service was fantastic and personable.

The mussels were fantastic and I loved that they have the 3 vegetable side dish option. This was perfect for my mother and me to share. We had the spinach, broccoli, and parmesan fries. It was the perfect amount for two. The only disappointment was the salad. We both had the salad with apple, walnuts, and gorgonzola but the apple had no flavor and the dressing could barely be detected. The salad lacked flavor.
Otherwise it was a wonderful meal with exceptional service and at a reasonable price.
Food & waiter superb. My husband and I were very pleased. Really enjoyed our evening.
The food was quite nice, but quite fatty too. The staff was nice, but nothing more. Nothing special about the ambiance. I don't think we'll go back, there are plenty of Italian restaurants in SF.
review_title: The food was quite nice, but

review: As always, Cafe Tiramisu provided a wonderful experience for my birthday party! The personal attention and friendliness of the staff were very welcoming and added to the occasion. The extremely knowledgeable service was a delight and added to the enjoyment of the food and wine.
Excellent Food and Service. Will be returning soon!!

Holy Moses! I think I just found the ultimate lunch spot. Cafe tiramisu in the alley (BeldinPlace) is fantastic. Plan on spending a couple hours for lunch to enjoy the ambience & food. NY steak. Seafood cioppino. Black risotto. Potato ravioli. Simply fantastic. Highly recommend.
review_title: Holy Moses! I think I just

review: I've been going to Tiramisu for 8 years.  It's consistently of high quality and very well prepared.  Never a bad meal.
Everything we tasted was wonderful, service was first rate - the only regret was we couldn't taste everything else on the menu!
We truly had a wonderful experience at your restaurant. It was recommended to me and I'm glad we went. Perfect setting, great energy.
review_title: We truly had a wonderful experience

review: Consistently excellent Italian food - never disappoints. Wonderful wine list. Intimate location. Love to eat at Cafe Tiramisu!

The food and ambiance are outstanding, especially when combined. The mussels in saffron broth is a must have and a generous portion. If you like salad, the caesar with crab meat is to die for. Also, the salmon over asparagus and sliced potatoes is perfectly done everytime. Great people watching when sitting outside...I highly recommend it, both the restaurant and sitting outdoors!
Food is creatively prepared, always quite consistent.  It's a great outdoor venue for dining with that touch of European flair.
