We were looking for a Union Square restaurant that actually served great food, not just filling the bellies of tourists. Kuleto's was not our first choice but it will be in the future! Everything from service to menu to ambiance was excellent! Every person in our party of four thoroughly enjoyed their selections for dinner. Kuleto's will be our "go to" place pre-and post theater in Union Square from now on!
Food was good.  Too noisy for me.  In by 6 pm had us out in time to see a show at 8 with no problem.  Service was attentive
review_title: Food was good.  Too noisy for me.  In by...

review: Great dinner! Great waitstaff! Except they forgot to order my dinner.It came late after my friends ate.Besides that will be back!Too bad they did not take off my dinner from the bill.Bettina
Food was just ok. Service was fantastic.Perhaps we were there on an off night...

We ate there before the Nike Women's Marathon. The food was good. Nothing exceptional. The waiter was somewhat apathetic. It was close by and convenient; which is why we come back. For really good Italian head to North Beach

Had reservations on Sat night and was told to wait at the bar . Was ignored by the server who finally showed up to take our drink orders and she was crabby and unpleasant- as if she was over-worked and we were an imposition. When eventually seated in the dining area adjacent to the hotel lobby were were greeted by a pleasant young woman, who was clearly overly busy with too many tables to serve. There were 2 medium size groups who were most likely convention people. She spent way more time with them (perhaps expecting a better tip?) Beyond the service the food was "meh". I wouldn't recommend or go back.

This is an excellent upscale California/Italian downtown restaurant. The physical aspect of the restaurant is good, the food is flavorful and rich. The service as the first two diners for lunch, was excellent. On the basis of a  business lunch, I'm going back. The wife looked at the menu and said, " A little too California/Italian fusion and we went elsewhere that evening,  but we'll go back again on my call. Especially if they remove the snivel about the surcharge for providing employee benefits to the staff. Expensive, but totally appropriate given the neighborhood.

I ordered a scallop risotto. The first and second time they tried the scallops were under cooked. The third time they were perfect on one side, cooked through, but white on the other side. They did comp the dinner.
review_title: Tried 3 times to get my dinner.

review: We had been here before and had good food, but we were very diappointed in the service by both the bartender and our waiter.  Neither were particularly attentive.  The waiter did not stop back and ever even ask how our food was, and the bartender was quite unfriendly...not a good feature for a bartender.  The food was good but we will not go back...too many other restaurants we can chose offer both food quality and friendly, good service.
review_title: We had been here before and had good foo...

review: On a recent trip to SF I visited Kuleto's for the first time in a couple of years, and I was happy that I returned.  I had forgotten that the restaurant had expanded (some years ago) toward the hotel next door, giving a nice blend of small and large tables so diners don't feel crowded.  I started my meal with some excellent raw tuna on crostini with mascarpone, continued with a nice selection of salumi, and ended with a pine nut crusted halibut topped with sun dried tomatoes, sitting on a while bean puree and broccoli raab.  My server Tregg was helpful and attentive, and overall I was happy to have returned to Kuleto's.
review_title: around for years for good reason

review: I have been to Kuleto's many times in the past so thought it would be a great spot for dinner on my recent visit to SF.  I was wrong.  The waiter started out with great enthusiasm but seemed flustered by a simple request for a kid's pasta.  After he served our appetizer, we did not seem him for the rest of the evening.  Had he come by to check on us, I would have let him know that the hearts of romaine salad was missing cheese, the halibut special was flavorless, and that we would have liked to order another drink.  After about 15 minutes of waiting after our plates were cleared, I finally caught his eye and asked for the check.  No apologies, no how was your dinner, no have a good evening--he dropped the check without even stopping.

We've always enjoyed this restaurant. This time we invited two guests for a celebratory lunch. We had such a wonderful time that we were at the restaurant for two hours, and no one asked us to leave. The food was delicious, and the service excellent.

To loud,cigarette smoke was bad where we sat. Waitress was way to loud and chatty about things that were not necessary.The food was ok nothing that really stood out.It is in an area that is so busy and tourist that it makes this restaurant a tourist place and not a one of a kind SF place. Ex: Abbots Cellar or Firefly. I went at a friends suggestion. When I go to SF I look for one of a kind original neighborhood restaurants. Quiet, less crowded.

My wife and I took 4 days in San Francisco to get away from LA and enjoy the cosmopolitan atmosphere that only New York, Chicago & San Francisco offer at Christmas. Union Square and a culinary paradise. Kuleto's was the highlight dinner of the trip. Food, wine, dessert, all perfect and in a comfortable Yule Tide setting of old wood and new ideas. It was fun to watch the kitchen artists perform their magic ( Kuleto's has exhibition cooking ). Wait staff, bus people moving like well oiled machines in perfect concert. Cant wait to back to the City by the Bay for another fix of Kuleto's.

The tradition is for my friends & I to go to Kuleto's when we go Christmas shopping. We are never disapointed & this year was no exception. Our waiter was very attentive. We shared the tuna krudo, the papperelle with duck bolognese, & the Tagliatelle with Dungeness crab, lemon, garlic, scallions, butter. The tuna was outstanding as it always is; fresh & just lovely to the taste. Both pastas were delicious & hard to say which was better. The pasta was cooked perfectly. The portions were plentiful for 3 of us to share leaving no room for dessert for us that day. We are looking forward to our next time at Kuleto's & we will be trying to go sooner than next Christmas because we enjoyed the whole package of our wonderful lunch experience.
It was very cold In the restaurant. They left the door open and I had to ask the waiter to have it closed. The waiter was a bit over attentive and distracting but the food was excellent.
review_title: It was very cold In the restaurant.

review: Jane is definitely a foodie and choosing just one restaurant to take her to was hard. Kuletos was convenient to her hotel, BART and 5th and Mission Parking garage, as all three of us were arriving separately. She was the first to arrive and was happily drinking a martini when I made it. The bar was lively and an easy place for a single person to hang out without feeling conspicuous. We had a booth near the front and a lovely, attentive, dark haired server. She deserves praise by name, but alas, I can't recall it. We were indecisive, she came back patiently until we were ready and recommended the roasted raddichio for our appetizer. They were superb! We all had pasta and were full and happy by the end of the meal. Jane was impressed!
I have been a regular here - several times a year. Was disappointed in the quality of the food - both the salad and the entrees for the two of us.
It's our favorite pre theater dinner. Union square location is great for shopping too. Food is a step above standard Italian without being precious.
The atmosphere and food are great but the noise level was distracting for our party of five seated at a round table at the center of the restaurant.

Our 31st anniversary - We reserved for a nice meal & to people watch. We were in & out of there isn 50 minutes! Our waiter was like a Cheshire Cat... big smile & agreed with everything & then did whatever he wanted. No prices given with the specials & condescending attitude when I asked. We specifically asked him to hold our dinner order until our appy & beer were done but dinner arrived (not with our server) the second our appy was done so we ate our lovely meal with beer because he didn't come back until it was dessert time. No people watching table, no wine ($16 a glass), a snobby waiter & $100 lighter in the wallet. We will never go back to Kuleto's (by Union Square). Such a dissappointment as it was recommended by a coworker
Friendly, attentive waiter. Delicious, fresh food. Seasonal specials. Appropriately sized portions.
Outstanding food as always. Veal was great as was the Salmon Special
This time the food was a bit too salty. We will certainly go back again, however. Our other dinners were great.
review_title: This time the food was a bit

review: The food and the service were excellent. The restaurant ambience is very nice and we are looking forward to returning.
review_title: The food and the service were

review: Our food was fine, but the waiter forgot to place our entree orders, so we didn't receive them until 1 1/4 hours after arriving. We had theatre tickets, so this was somewhat of a problem. Because of the late arrival of our entrees, we didn't have time for coffee or dessert. The restaurant, however, did make an adjustment on our bill.
review_title: Our food was fine, but the

review: We were a group of six people. Two people were very disappointed in their food. The calamari tasted as if it was frozen previously -- very mushy. One appetizer had no flavor, at all, and the dressing on the spinach salad mediocre. We were at the back of the restaurant, near the waiters station, and not once but twice did plates crash to the ground. All in all, not a very good experience.
review_title: We were a group of six people.

review: Had great service and conversation at the bar as I waited for the rest of my party to arrive. Good bartenders and the waiter was very enthusiastic about the menu. We enjoyed or Thanksgiving eve dinner.

This is one of my favorite SF restaurants! Co-workers from out of state were in town for a meeting and I offered this as a dinner choice. Everyone truly enjoyed it! Great food, atmosphere and not too expensive.
review_title: This is one of my favorite

review: Very good food, extensive wine list, exceptional wait staff. I had a group dinner here with my co-workers. We had a great time and ate like kings.
" Hi folks, have we ordered?".... that's not quite what I would expect from a waiter at Kuletos when he comes to take our menue choices.

The tagliatelle with crab was good. Mussels with pancetta was ok. Beet salad was pretty decent, though I would have liked more goat cheese as the beets were not balanced with the arugula. A bit on the property side as the noodles only had butter for their flavor. Not many tourists, seems to appeal more to older folks. Wine selection was adequate.
Table near the fire is great ambiance. Lots of Sf energy moving about the restaurant. The location is great and onvenient to meeteople after a day of shopping. Food is fantastic.

We enjoyed lunch here on our trip. By reading their website I knew to ask for the 25% off and got it on the entire check, including wine. The grilled radicchio is so rich and yummy. Be sure and try it.
review_title: We enjoyed lunch here on our

review: I have been going to Kuletos for years and it never disappoints.
review_title: I have been going to Kuletos

review: Excellent service and food. Loud for business meetings...That's the only 'negative' comment. I would highly recommend this restaurant for a great meal.
Great bread offerings and salami menu selections. Pasta was just OK. Restaurant is very noisy no matter where you were but especially the bar. Server was very nice but a little slow.
Pasta mains were fresh and flavorful. Unfortunately the service of this restaurant was poor.
This is the second year in a row we have chosen Kuleto's as the site for our family holiday celebration. Both times it has been an excellent experience.
review_title: This is the second year in

review: Staff was waiting for us promptly at our reservation time (the restaurant was packed.). We had a lovely dinner with great service.

This has been a San Francisco favorite of ours for years. We always manage to have dinner or lunch on our visits. Food is still outstanding and there is always something new to try. Wonderful restaurant!
review_title: This has been a San Francisco

review: The food had a lackluster flavor. With a group of 7 I tried a variety of items and most were lacking any real flavor.

I have been going to Kuleto's for several years - in SF and its Peninsula location, which doesn't seem to exist any longer. Food and wine list are always excellent. However, we asked for a "quiet" table and were led to the adjoining room which was only "less noisy." I had difficulty hearing my friend across the table and she, me. It's unfortunate that in a classy restaurant these days one can't have a relaxed meal with good conversation. Kuleto's is less chaotic than most chic restaurants, and I look forward to another meal there. However, I'll remember not to go if I or my dinner partners have laryngitis or hearing impairment. Our waiter Eric enhanced our enjoyment greatly: he was gracious, knowledgeable and personable - excellent waiter!
review_title: I have been going to Kuleto's

review: Kuletto's is consistently good - from the food to the service.
Had a great meal. Love the look and atmosphere. Beautiful bar. Had the salmon with a basil pesto sauce. Was fantastic!
review_title: Had a great meal. Love the

review: Great food, very busy. Larger than expected. The tuna was amazing.
We ate on a Dine-1-1 coupon, so we probably didn't get as good an experience as we'd have gotten ordering from the whole menu.
review_title: We ate on a Dine-1-1 coupon,

review: We were late for our reservation and they were booked full. We were told we would only have an hour at our table, but they would do what they could to accommodate us. We stayed over two hours and they never said a peep. The food was outstanding, perfect sized portions to allow for a three-course enjoyable meal (salad, entree, dessert). A great spot for visiting the City. We were more than pleased.
review_title: We were late for our reservation

review: Good spot in Union Square. We ate with kids and it was great.

We had an overall positive lunch experience. The one area that was a bit bothersome was that they obviously wanted to 'turn' the table. Twice the waiter came to pick up the check but we'd not yet put out our credit card (we were there just under 1 1/2 hours - so it was not a LONG lunch!) And I was conscious of his hovering.

We arrived on time and were seated right away - nice! The food was excellent; I had the veal scallopini and my partner had risotto with shrimp. We tried the two different Pinot Grigios on the wine list, and both were good. Our waiter was attentive, but not excessively so, and provided excellent advice. We enjoyed our dining experience here very much.
review_title: We arrived on time and were

review:
I had not had the occasion to eat in San Francisco at Kuleto's since 1997. I was thrilled to find that some things do not change. It was every bit as wonderful as I remembered after 13 years!

We were fortunate enough to eat in a quiet corner near the fireplace and had the most wonderful evening. The service was exceptional!! Our water glasses were never below half full. The waiters were attentive yet not intrusive. The grilled radiccio is amazing. The sea bass was also exceptional.

Overall, it was a truly wonderful evening. The ambiance, food and service were all exemplary. I cannot say enough positive things about this restaurant!
review_title: I had not had the occasion

review: Excellent visit to one of our favorite San Francisco restaurants. Food was excellent. Had the special consisting of alaskan halibut on risotto cake. My wife had the capellini which we've found to be consistently good. They were providing a "free" salumi plate courtesy of our hotel (but we never told them which hotel and we booked through Open Table, not the hotel concierge). Salumi plate had the variety of meats to sample and was an excellent way to start the meal. We recommend this restaurant to friends and relatives looking for good food, friendly atmosphere, and ideal Union Square location.

We've been to Kulato's on several occasions and have always enjoyed the experience. Our server could have been more "on the ball," especially since it wasn't particularly busy. Otherwise, the evening was quite enjoyable.

This restaurant was recommended by a local when my wife and I were visiting San Francisco. Wonderful Italian fare and great service for a very fair price. Highly recommend to anyone visiting San Fran to make this one of your places to eat your evening meal!
4th time in the past 10 years. Remains as good as always. The Duck Bolenese was outstanding. kudos to the chef!!!!!
Great spot if you are shopping in Union Square or going to theater on Geary.
review_title: Great spot if you are shopping

review: Food was quite good and the atmosphere was fun. Our waiter was a bit intense and would do wellto switch to decaf. Recommended.
review_title: Food was quite good and the

review: Despite the very touristy location, Kuleto's serve high quality food. Service is good also, courteous and efficient. Pasta is especially good, always cooked al dente and sauce is done just right. Other dishes, salad, fish, meat and desert are also high quality and delicious. Wine selection is also good. Overall, I'm very much satisfied and will visit again.

We had good service at out table. Other tables were served slower than ours. I'd forgotten how loud the restaurant can get. The food was very good. My filet was excellent. Unfortunately, the tortelini was under cooked. My wife's chicken dish was also excellent. The tiramisu is always great. I just remember the food and service being outstanding, not just very good.
review_title: We had good service at out

review: While the food was great, the service was terrible on our recent visit to Kuleto's - we had a 7:00 reservation and didn't even get our drinks until 7:45. Not sure what was up but it was excrutiatingly slow, and the waiter never seemed to to notice nor apologize. It put a real damper on a holiday evening out with our kids. It was busy, to be sure, but no excuse for inattention.
I eat at Kuleto's at least twice a year and I am never disappointed. It's always a great experience.
review_title: I eat at Kuleto's at least

review: Absolutely one of my new favorite restaurants in San Francisco! The food was incredible and the service was A+. The veal picatta is a must have. Great place for business dinners. It was packed on a Weds night at 8pm, always a good sign you made a good choice.
review_title: Absolutely one of my new favorite

review: Delicious food. Great atmosphere. Delightful service. We were there for a special quarterly lunch and were allowed to dine and take our time. A place to return to.

Good dinner with friends before we attended a theater production.
Food prepared well.
The salads were great, fresh and crisp.
The Duck was excellent, not greasy.
Good wine list with many choices.

Service was excellent.

I have thoroughly enjoyed my dinner courses and hospitable service at your premises. Bruce and the staffs are cordial and accommodating. I had a wonderful time along with my guests. Thank you very much for having me and took such a good care of us. I hope to visit you next time when I'm in town. Take care.
We had a wonderful time. We were celebrating an anniversary, and we feel like we chose the right restaurant. Yummy food and great service.
review_title: We had a wonderful time. We

review: Service was excellent but the food had too much oil
A stand-out dining experience within steps of the theaters.

Always a treat to dine at Kuleto's, our favorite restaurant when visiting San Francisco. Conveniently located just off Union Square, the food is superb, the service friendly, professional and timely. The ambience is pleasing, and while always very busy, is quite relaxing.
review_title: Always a treat to dine at

review: Service was good. The main dish was too salty and heavy. I would have chosen some other restaurant if I had known that the entree choice was different from the sample menu entree (saffrran risotto).

Always an enjoyable experience. Menu is somewhat odd for an Italian restaurant in that many of the more standard items do not appear: example - Caprese salad. Shortrib stuffed ravioli was very rich and so highly drenched in wine sauce that one couldn't eat more than a small portion of the serving. Outstanding service by the waiter.
The restaurant was busy at the holiday time yet service was prompt and attentive. Food excellent as always and prices reasonable.

It was so smart to make a reservation through your website. San Francisco was mobbed with women in the city for the Nike Women's Marathon and the wait at Kuleto's and many other area restaurants was two hours+. We walked right in and were seated immediately. We were still operating on east coast time, and wanted to get back to the hotel and sleep before the early race. Kuleto's was crowded but we were served in a timely manner by a very helpful and courteous waiter. He steered me away from a "special" and back to the squash ravioli I was also considering...good choice (except it swims in a little too much butter sauce...less is more) The risotto with chantrelle(?) mushrooms was amazing as an appetizer. Nice dining experience!
review_title: It was so smart to make a

review: Had some friends from out of town who were yearning an "authentic Italian dinner".  Kuleto's was a perfect pick.  Despite the noise level always present, the service and food outshine all

Kuleto's was a disaster!  We were shown to a table that was in the lobby of the building next door, a hotel that had its doors open.  We had to move because it was so cold. The noise was so deafening that my guest and I stopped talking because we couldn't hear each other. The next table had two children about 4 and 2 years old whose mother gave them the cosmetics she purchased that day to play with on the floor!  This was bedlam with waiters and hot dishes going by. All this and my check was over $100. Needless to say dinner at Kuleto's was one of the worst "dining" experiences I've ever had! I can't comment on the food because under the circumstances it was not memorable!

Kuleto's is a wonderful treat.  They have lovely combinations of food ingredients.  While some of the dishes seem simple, they are masterfully assembled and the flavor is wonderul.  This is an excellent place that keeps me coming back.

We have been to Kuleto's often and have always found it outstanding.  We seclected it to celebrate my birthday with our daughter and son-in-law.  We were, again, immensely pleased and Kueto's won over our offspring in a big way.
Mike and Anne Nicolson
review_title: We have been to Kuleto's often

review: This restaurant was NOT what I was expecting. The food was TERRIBLE. My customer ordered the chef's "best selling dish" that was the Cod, and it came undercooked. I ordered the butternut squash kale salad, which honestly looked like a 5th grader prepared it. It had no flavor, maybe one piece of squash at best, and was literally a bowl of dry kales leaves that I could have chopped up and threw on a plate myself. Not to mention the hostess was incredibly rude. I was bringing a customer there for dinner (it was the first time either of us had been to the restaurant). I specifically asked for a more private table since it was a business dinner. When I arrived and asked her how the table was, she responded "it's tabley". I then asked her to show me to it and she literally stomped to the table, threw down some menus and walked away. NOT the service I was expecting at a "up-scale" restaurant. In short, I would NOT recommend this restaurant to anyone. It was a waste of money and time,
review_title: Food was horrible. Hostess was very rude.

review: Food was decent but not great.   Service pretty poor.  I don't think they had enough waiters/bar staff working which is pretty bad for 8PM on a Saturday.   Would definitely choose somewhere else next time.
We eat here at least three or four times a year.  We often bring out-of-town visitors who are interested in experiencing an example of Asian fusion food.

This was my third visit, and my experience has been so consistent, E & O Asian Kitchen has become a dependable favorite of mine. The food is so well prepared and artistically served, and the portions are perfectly sized (except for the ice cream dessert - I would have loved twice as much as they gave you, LOL). Victor, our server, was awesome. Just GO.
Love the food at this restaurant. Always excited to come back. Only problem was they charged me for a bottle of wine when I only ordered a glass. They did change the check after I pointed it out.
review_title: Love the food at this restaurant.

review: The food was great, the service was spot on...I really enjoyed our meal there.

Went there with great hopes on Asian fusion which we love. The food was as expected but there was no own peace because of too loud people. And as a crown on top of that all the waiter fell my wifes wine class towards me on the table and my lap and gave nothing to compensate the wine nor the enconvenience. Well , she was onviously not tipped!
E&O was top drawer in every way. They were ready for us, gave us a great table, and had excellent service. The food was unusual and tasty. We plan to go back often.
review_title: E&O was top drawer in every

review: Great evening out! Great food and very friendly service!

I have eaten here a number of times, and always return. This time I was a bit worried since they had remodeled and changed the restaurant's name. No problem - much of the food remains the same, and it was a delightful experience. I like to come here because they feature many small plates, and the menu is designed for sharing. Two of us shared about 5 dishes, and they were all wonderful. This place does not disappoint.
review_title: Continue to be a Great Place to Eat

review: Loved the assortment of small plates - diverse and all delicious! Great value.

This has become one of our favorite restaurants in San Francisco. We live in San Jose but have eaten there three times in the past month and a half. We're trying to stock up before they close for renovation on May 28!
review_title: This has become one of our

review: Great and varied flavors and a great location for meeting friends from out of town. The service is always excellent.

above average
2/4 dishes were good, other 2 were not
Great atmosphere and service, but I wasn't very impressed by the food. Some dishes were overcooked and others tasted like they had been reheated multiple times (ribs).

Met friends after work for a cocktail and appetizers. Our waiter was very nice, but she was a bit slow in getting our cocktails she forgot one of our orders. The food was very good and the atmosphere is pleasant and not too noisy. Nothing to keep me from returning.
Great food, but the place go so noisy we had to yell to have conversation.

The food was very good at this place and the service was excellent!!! We will definitely be returning. We came with a group of 5 picky eaters. There was something on the menu to satisfy everyone. Also, the waiter (Peter) was so nice and accomodating that it truly added to the overall great dining experience. I highly recommend this restaurant.
review_title: The food was very good at

review: Repeat visitor to E & O; I have to eat here every time I come to the city!! Consistently good; I like that they have regular items mixed with new things every time I come in! Keep it up, E &O!!
review_title: Repeat visitor to E & O; I

review: Good food, good service, significantly overpriced.

The staff was off their game this night. Hostess apparently lost us and 15 minutes after our reservation time when I checked back in, I was told "she should have seated you by now" by a harried young woman who then seated us. It took 10 minutes to get greeted by our server and 10 more minutes to see the server again. After the food started coming, it was OK, other than the fact that the corn fritters were not hot. We should have sent them back but did not. This is my 4th or 5th time to E&O and my first time to have complaints.
review_title: The staff was off their game

review: We had a very nice, enjoyable, tasty (not outstanding) meal. Waiter was very pleasant and attentive. Only downside was the length of time to get drinks served. The one bartender seemed overwhelmed.
review_title: We had a very nice, enjoyable,

review: We just dropped in at 930PM. We had a great time. Just ordered some small plates. Food and service were good.
Food was excellent - unusual and delicious! I love taking clients to lunch here.

It's big but otherwise not that memorable. Food was interesting but has been presented elsewhere. Open kitchen adds to the noise. Nice servers. Lots of singles up front at the windows but otherwise groups of diners in back. Recommended.
We love this restaurant and come here as often as we can. Corn fritters, shaking beef, butternut squash dumplings are the best.

Everything we ordered was delicious. Very fresh and flavorful. The server was very slow to bring the tab to our table and a neighboring table but the service was excellent up to that point. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone, whether it's a couple out on a date or a family or large group.

Ambience is very welcoming...feels like you've been swept out of the City's
busy hub-bub and into a charming, cozy, intimate South Seas island escape!
Food selection includes a nice variety of dishes/options - vegetables/chicken/
fish/seafood...full bar - nice selection of wines/beers/champagne, etc.

Everything as excellent - food, drinks, and service!

We are not residents of SF so only get here occasionally.

We were surprised by the significant change to the menu.

Food was good, but we miss our staples like lettuce wraps which we had so looked forward to eating.

Hopefully the new menu will be a success, and we will adapt to the change.
review_title: We are not residents of SF

review: My husband and I were in town for one day so this is a once in a while review. The food was fabulous; the ambience not as cool as the website makes it appear but everything was clean and the staff very friendly. The food is fresh both in preparation and in concept. We will keep E&O on our list of great places to dine while in town.
review_title: My husband and I were in town

review: There were four of us for dinner on a mid-week evening after work. Although busy when we arrived, our table was ready and we were graciously greeted and seated immediately. The service from beginning to end was excellent. Order taking, pacing of food delivery, clearing of plates etc. was well managed and we never felt rushed, even though the restaurant was packed. We've been to E&O many times and we continue to find the food and stylish cocktails terrific. We always order multi-plates rather than entrees and although slightly more expensive, it is a great way to sample many offerings. Lastly, be sure to save room for the yummy desserts!
review_title: There were four of us for

review: We have been going to E&O for about 10 years and have seen the menu change a little but the food has always remained good! We live outside of SF so we should really visit other restaurants but we are always drawn back to E&O. Even my children now go there as teenagers and love it too!
review_title: We have been going to E&O

review: Food was excellent.  Very reasonably priced.  I was in SF but had to cut the trip short to return home to New Orleans to pack my home to evacuate for the hurricaine.  I had hoped to return there for cocktails before leaving the area but was not able to. Hopefully I will return to SF soon.  It was a wonderful dining experince.
Nice variety of plates, large and small.  Love the corn fritters!

I live in San Jose and love the E&O here.  I had friends staying in SF so made a reservation at E&O expecting the same ambience.  I was very disappointed -- it was more like a TGIFridays.  I don't like the tables and chairs -- like a Denny's.  SF needs to upgrade the seating to something more sophisticated and chic.  SF has none of the elegance of the San Jose restaurant.  I requested a booth but was told those were for parties of 5, not parties of 3.
review_title: I live in San Jose and love

review:
The experience was amazing. Had to wait a little bit even with a reservation but I guess it's somewhat understandable given it was Valentines Day. The food was great & the matre d picked out a great bottle of wine.

We had Uhmer (spelling) as our waiter & he was great. Funny & everyone of his suggestions was spot on.

This is a wonderful Italian restaurant and a treat outside of North Beach.  It is within a couple of blocks of the Geary St. theatres.  The food we ordered was outstanding - don't miss the Pappardelle della Nonna, one of their signature dishes.  The service was great - our server was attentive, not overbearing, and wine list knowledgeable.  When we wondered about one wine vs. another, he offered us a taste of each.  We will definitely be back

You can't beat the location - right off Union Square in San Francisco. Food is excellent! Love the Penne with Chicken, the ravioli, and the Risotto. Service is Old World impeccable. If you can get a reservation in the Jazz Lounge, have dinner there. Or go in for a cocktail or a late night coffee. They have great live music six nights a week, and not so loud that you can't have a conversation. Very classy place.

We were late for our reservation and they seated us right away. We had a play to go to and they also delivered our food right away and we had time to relax. The food was wonderful and the service was great.
review_title: We were late for our reservation

review: We were a group of 15 and were given a table in an area that was fairly secluded, which worked well. The waiter was overbearing and ensured his presence was felt whenever in the room. He also gave another member of staff a severe talking to in a public area, so not terribly professional. We ordered 4 bottles of wine, but it appeared that a subsequent 3 were opened without us being asked for the approval to do so. This added substantially to the bill, so diners beware. One of our group had a special and said that it was "rather unpleasant" as it contained chunks of raw garlic. Some others had fish and said it was very good, so it wasn't all bad. But overall, the experience was not worth the rather hefty bill.
Just had dinner there with a group of 6 for a bachelorette party. The food was good & so was the service. Would definitely go back!

I took my wife and two children in December. My children are aged 7 and 10. The staff was very accommodating and friendly towards them. I did see other children at the restaurant also. At first, the service was very slow, but after the initial order taking, everything came on time. I would go back there again.
review_title: I took my wife and two children

review: Food mediocre. Service mediocre. A hotel restaurant where they aren't trying very hard.

This was our first time and it was very enjoyable. Excellent food/wine. Wonderful lounge in adjacent room which we took our wine and enjoyed some great live entertainment. Would certainly return in the future.
review_title: This was our first time and

review: We had a wonderful time! Our service was wonderful and they made us feel very special
review_title: We had a wonderful time! Our

review: Quiet spot with some good appetizers; main courses were over-priced and under-cooked. Wine prices were high. Service was good and attentive, however.

Nice setting and good location. The food was fine, but the service seemed very distracted. We waited a veeeery long time to have the opportunity to order wine or food, then waited a very long time for our drinks to come. Then salads and appetizers appeared for the half of our group that had ordered a first course, and entrees arrived for the other half of the group at the very same time, with no explanation as if they hoped we wouldn't notice. Those of us who ordered a first course received our entrees the instant we were done with our first course, and it was clear (from the cold temperature of my ravioli) that our entrees had been sitting and waiting for us while we ate our salads. Not okay for a place with $25-30 entrees.
Great food, with some interesting menu items, very attentive, professional service and a lovely table by the window. A good find for theater goers or others dining in the Union Sq area

Meh. Food was decent but overpriced, service was very slow.

Was essentially a fancy Olive Garden.
Amazing Prince Edward Island mussels and wild boar Osso Bucco!
Only issue was the food took a really long time (and there were very few eating at the time), and when we mentioned it, the staff were more defensive than they were helpful.
review_title: Only issue was the food took

review: For a small, intimate setting with great food and wine, you won't find anything in the neighborhood as wonderful as Zingari. The night we were there we had an early dinner and there was only one other couple in the entire restaurant. Indeed, I believe there were only ten tables in the entire venue, which created the wonderfully intimate setting. The food was great and very moderately priced considering the quality. When in San Francisco, check it out.

Excellent. Waiter was very helpful and friendly. Our meal exceeded our expectations - just a great Italian Restaurant. Would definitely recommend it. We also enjoyed a drink afterwords in the adjoining jazz lounge. Close to Union Square and across the street from the JW Marriott.

This was a 20 year wedding anniversary dinner for my wife and I. We stayed at the Donnatello hotel resort which was fabulous and the restaurant is part of the hotel. We told the watier that it was our anniversary and they took extra good care of us. Our waiter was absolutely wonderful, very friendly, courteous and prompt. The service and the food were both beyond reproach. The Veal Scallopini is to die for. The restaurant is warm, cozy and intimate. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone for any occasion while you are in San Francisco.

The food was good and our waitor was good. My only issue is that I knew there was a $25 corking fee and was willing to pay for it (3 bottles) but was not expecting a service charge to be added automatically to this plus a service charge added to another bottle of wine that we bought. Service charges should only be applied to food!
review_title: The food was good and our

review: Excellent service! Zingari REALLY makes sure their customers are satisfied and if the customers are not, they gladly accommodate them. I was extremely pleased with this restaurant. The pasta was amazing. My boyfriend would not stop raving about the pasta sauce and said it was the best he ever tasted. The jazz music was very entertaining, and so were the energetic dancing customers. The overall warm friendly atmosphere was spectacular. It was just an overall enjoyable place. I was so happy to have experience such a fantastic restaurant.

We were happy with the food and drinks we ordered in this Restaurant. Live jazz entertainment in the lounge was plus. Minuses I can think of for this place is that the dining area is split and each separated area is a room with two columns of separate dining tables -- the arrangement was weird. We opted to dine in the lounge area where the bartender took care of us. Espressotini was a good after dinner drink.
review_title: We were happy with the food

review: The food was at a good portion, reasonably priced. However, I found it a little salty for the dishes I ordered.
review_title: The food was at a good portion,

review: We were in town for some meetings and one of our customers recommended the place. Fantastic food and view of the bay bridge. Best prime rib I've had in a long while. Our waiter, Paul, was also top notch.
Great location.  Food was disappointing at best.  Probably the worst (and most expensive) prime rib I've ever been served.

We celebrated my husband's birthday at this wonderful restaurant.  We were very impressed with the food, it's preparation and the service.  Our server, Paul was amazing!  Two other managers stopped by to greet us, wish my husband a happy birthday, but stopped by our table numerous times to inquire if we needed anything and if everything was to our satisfaction.  The view is amazing!  I highly recommend this restaurant!

we are spoiled we live so close and can afford epic!
the view, the food and service are always outstanding!
pricey but doesn't disappoint! love love the crab Benedict
with spaetzle instead of bread and prepared perfect
to order! our friends only issue was that there was no bacon
on the brunch menu but the waitress offered the
bacon side from the burger ! they even tried to
put the lions game on for us that Sunday am! 
love sitting outside there for brunch!!!

Wish we would have stayed up in the bar to start with OR made sure we were actually IN the restaurantwas sat outside & that really takes away from the whole restaurants charmthe atmosphere isn't anywhere near the same..I mean if you like to sit in a tent & look at the water it was okAdditionally although the food was goodthe recommended Duck app was dull and drythe charcuterie plate was ok..but just meet? no toast tips..no olives or anything to accompany it & it isn't inexpensiveDinner was lovely however my steak was undercooked ( it was definitely rare to med rare) I asked for Medium.so there my poor hubby satwaiting for my filet to be returnedmight go back for drinks and a steak at the bar because the view is really beautiful!!

Overall Epic is a great spot to dine. The food was delicious (I had the filet mignon-cooked to perfection and so tender! My boyfriend had the corte de boeuf which he said was amazing!) and the restaurant has great decor and a beautiful view! The drinks were great as well! I'd like to go back to try their breakfast!
review_title: Overall Epic is a great spot to dine. Th...

review: Ordered the steak with lobster on the side.  Dish was wonderful!  Had to ask the waiter 3 times for a ice tea refill and the food runner brought every single course to the wrong person each time.  Sigh.  But the view is amazing....

The views are great, the food is pedestrian, the service is uninspired.  Precious beverages like water and tea appear to be rationed as it took no less than four separate attempts with three different servers to acquire a glass, and this was never refilled or replaced despite repeated requests for the same.  They could learn a thing or two about how to run a restaurant from Lark Creek.

Epic and worth the bucks if you are able to spend it on good steaks and great options.
Steak is a la carte so get some sides :) and WINEEE

<3
review_title: Epic and worth the bucks if

review: The server was professional, but not particularly interested in us. No one checked with us after the food arrived. Sadly, the eggs were badly undercooked - raw egg whites are not to my taste. We finally got the dish replaced, but the server acted like it was our fault. Hot water for tea and coffee refills were slow. Despite that, the place is comfortable, the view perfect - we'll try again.

Had booked Epic Roasthouse out of the blue for one of the nights we were in town. Definitely the best restaurant we ate at during a 6 day stay. Food was excellent! No complaints on any course or dish we ordered. Service was great as well as the drink selection. Highly recommend! Would definitely eat there again.

My parents and I stumbled upon this restaurant a few years ago when we were wandering around the city. It made a big impression on us then and it did as well the other night. I think that was the best steak I have ever had. The dry aged rib-eye is incredible. It almost melts in your mouth, and the truffle-miso butter is out of this world. All of the food that we ordered was amazing. The server was extremely attentive, and we did not feel rushed at all, even though we came in as their last seating. They also have mead on their wine list! It was really unusual to see, but they were really incredible and unique. I definitely recommend this restaurant.
review_title: Beautiful View and Even better food

review:
This is one of our favorite restaurants in the city. The steak is awesome! And the mashed potato sides as well as grilled squash are delightful. Unfortunately they removed their spinach salad from the menu which is unfortunate. That was always very tasty. The little gem salad was nothing spectacular.
Deserts where fabulous as always! Great restaurant for a romantic date. We always get the table by the window for our anniversary diner and watch the sun set over the bay. Always excellent!
One of the great steakhouses! Up there with Bobo's and Ruth Chris.
Fantastic views not on the usual tourist path. Best menu item is the Heirloom tomato salad- worth going just for this!

Steaks were prepared just as ordered. Excellent steaks. Little Gem Salad was excellent. Beef tartar was spicy and perfect.
Dessert was very, very, very good - beignets ( different than New Orleans - yet similar ).
Chef Jan from Louisiana, as are we, he introduced himself to us at the table. We talked about LA and high schools and other restaurants in LA. Very pleasant, humble man.
Great night with great view of Bay Bridge lit up!
Definitely recommend to anyone who is NOT a vegetarian. Then again, this might get a vegetarian to switch back to meat!

Amazing view of the Bay Bridge, Treasure Island, and Bay. I definitely recommend sitting outside, because the scenery is unbelievable and the vibe is so relaxing and intimate. The service is spectacular and food delicious.
review_title: What a view of the Bay Bridge!

review: My brunch was served tepid. I would only return for happy hour drinks.

Used to be one of my favorite places in San Francisco, but has gone downhill. Disinterested service, uninspired cooking, ridiculously expensive wine. It's ok, just not the cool place it used to be. :(
review_title: Epic's time has come and gone

review: The roasted chicken and the swordfish were amazingly delicious!

Food wasn't as great as expected. I paid more for the view, not the food.I ordered a steak which was pretty stiff and pretty expensive for that quality.French fries were good. Before ordering, I was informed that the steak will come by itself, so ordered Fries as a side. When orders arrived at my table, steak came with veggies and potatoes - i.e. I didn't really need to order Fries. I wish the waiter was clearer, or just knew about it.
The best service, food and views in SF. LOVE this restaurant. It's my favorite in the city. VERY personable staff and food is always consistently good.

Unfortunately, wood burning stove was not venting properly and smoke was awful in the restaurant. We all left with clothes saturated w/smoke and next day smelt like we sat around a campfire for hours. Clients eyes were watering and we had to leave - it was that bad. Would have rated outstanding but this was not acceptable.

The food was top notch, the wine list was extensive, the dining room just beautiful and cozy - high ceiling so the ambient noise wasn't competing with our conversation. Very service oriented and the menu had something for all of us.
review_title: The food was top notch, the

review: We had our Sunday brunch at this restaurant. The service was great, sat us immediately and very attentive. The food was superb for a Sunday brunch. There was a prefix menu for Sunday brunch, but you could also pick from their original lunch menu. They did have a full bar, so mamosa was a must! ... they did have a bar on the 2nd level with a lanai. What really stood out was it's huge windows of the bay and the Bay Bridge. Fantastic view during a nice sunny, clear day but I bet it would even be a great place for a romantic evening with your other half. Must check out!
Very good food and beautiful view- ask for a window table. It's a steak place and I would only order steak even though the menu has many options.

The Bay Bridge was the star of the show, as we sat in front of the spectacular waterfront windows. Co-star of the show was waiter Davide with is charm and Italian accent. We were so impressed with the menu choices that we ordered multiple selections for sharing - and eight of us managed to eat for twelve. There were no disappointments. Clearly the pastry chef is a keeper. Breadbasket to desert plates were filled with treats.
Excellent restaurant. The food was fantastic. Loved the decor. It was very loud and really hard to hear our server, but otherwise it was great.

Took eight family and friends here for special Birthday celebration. We enjoyed drinks upstairs before the dinner, and were called to dinner right on time. I had requested a view table, which we got (beautiful Bay Bridge/water view) but the table was small for eight adults. The dinner was great,food was warm and pleasing. No complaints from eight different taste buds. Great wine selection. The service staff was great, moving around the large group with ease, and no interruptions. The highlight of the evening was the "special dessert" for the Birthday girl!!

We went here for a birthday celebration, used open table and had a very nice window seat. It was a Sunday night and was quiet.

First, the food. We both ordered steaks cooked over flame (well done for my wife, med rare for me). The waiter suggested to 'butterfly' her steak, which meant cutting it in half to create a more even cook. Unfortunately it turned out to be somewhat stringy and slightly dry. It might have been the 'butterfly' cut that caused the problem. Mine was delicious, and evenly cooked.

Second issue was we ordered sauteed spinach, which was a side order. It was not washed well, and had a lot of sand/grit which we showed the waiter.

Finally, the restaurant is chilly, but is a large room. Overall a nice pla
The halibut was mediocre. The warm spinach salad was cold. The bread pudding was outstanding.

I was disappointed my the noise level. It was really hard to hear my husband at the first table we were seated at and I had to request to be reseated twice before we were actually moved.
We ordered Oysters, Calamari with Fried Green Tomatoes, and Peppers with Prosciutto for appetizers. The Calamari was chared and I had to send it back. The remade dish was delicious but I am really surpised they would even send out the first dish.
This is a steak house so we both ordered steaks and both our steaks were over cooked. We are pretty easy going but when your paying top dollar for steaks at a steak resturant we expect perfection. Mine I could not eat.
They do have an excellent wine list and sommelier who was very helpful.
The steaks and prime rib were delicious! The portions were generous and everyone was satisfied with their dinner. All in all a great experience and will definitely be back again.

I've eaten here 3 times and have been very disappointed each time. Given that this restaurant considers itself a "Roasthouse", I would think that they would know how to properly cook a steak. All 3 times that I've eaten here, I and members of my party received over-cooked steak. Even after I specified that "medium" means that it should be pink in the middle, I received a well-done steak. While the restaurant was accomodating in attempting to right their wrong, I just think that 3 strikes is enough for me. If you are a steak lover, you will be disappointed.
This place never disappoints! I was able to impress another friend w/ the view, food and service.
A great place for a brunch option - items include eggs, pancakes and burgers.
review_title: A great place for a brunch

review: The view is the best thing at Epic.  The food is pretty good for a steak place, but the noise is unbearable.  Ruins the meal.  Service is ok...noting special, but then again, can hardly hear them.
review_title: The view is the best thing

review: My wife and I were very pleased, although, the soup was in a miniature cup with two sips! Maybe a beverage included in the price would be nice, but overall it was an A1 experience, thanks!
review_title: My wife and I were very pleased,

review:
It was horribly noisy. I asked to be seated somewhere quieter when my guests and I realized that we could neither hear each other across the table more speak to each other without shouting. Even our waiter said he found himself shouting. To place our dinner order he had to move around the table, lean down and stand uncomfortably close to each our faces to hear our order. I was entertaining guests from Australia who live near the Harbor Bridge and Sydney Opera house. Your setting was perfect in that regard but we left earlier than we really wanted to because our heads were pounding and we tired of yelling at each other all evening.

I will hesitate to return and I really like the food ~~ some of the best in San Francisco.
review_title: It was horribly noisy. I asked

review: Great service and spectacular view. However, as with many restaurants that have a terrific location, the food suffered greatly. The prime rib, which is their featured item, was lukewarm, overcooked and lacked flavor. The pork chop was overly salty, the duck breast was like shoe leather, and the au gratin potatoes were mushy and not very tasty. I would return for drinks and the view, but definitely not for the food.
Great view, good steaks, not much else. Service was particularly mediocre.

The food was over priced, but I guess you are paying for the view. The service was extremely slow especially since the place was half empty you would think that they would be more attentative. I ordered the burger and it was good but not for $20. My husband ordered the steak medium rare and eggs. The steak was sent back twice because it was obviously over cooked. Then the third time it was under cooked (purple). He was starving at that point so he ate it anyway. I would not come back here. I had a better experience next door at the Waterbar.

Food was good, not great. Noise level was so loud, it made it impossible to talk.
If you want someplace, very expensive, to just eat and not share a meal with conversation, Epic is your place.

Everything was excellent, food, service, and surroundings. The staff took special care to ensure all of our needs were taken care of...very attentive. Definitely a do-again, A bit pricey, but worth it for special occasions.
Dinner was good, but not great. We had a nice time, but I do not think that I wll dine there again. It was not that special.
review_title: Dinner was good, but not great.

review: One of the best dining experiences I've had in a long time.
review_title: One of the best dining experiences

review:
Food was average at best. Lamb chops were of a less than expected quality and the vegetables were served cold.
Wine list had a few nice surpirses, but overall the prices were too high. $55 for a New Zealand SB.....
Staff was very welcoming when we showed up early for our reservation. Side dishes were wonderful. Pricey, but excellent.

After reading some of the reviews on this restaurant, I admit I was a little leary. I was taking my boyfriend for a romantic Father's Day dinner and we had a Great time! We got to sit outside and enjoy the beautiful weather and the amazing views of the Bay bridge. Our waiter was very attentive and our service was excellent. The food was great with large portions. It is expensive, so I wouldn't dine there every weekend. For special occasions or Romantic dinners, it is perfect!

The ambiance and service were great, but you go to a restaurant for the food, right? Well, the food was good, but just good. Given the prices, I expected more. I asked for my filet rare and added the coffee rub. The steak was overcooked to medium rare, but the coffee rub was good. For sides, we had the grilled broccolini and the scalloped potatoes, both of which were, again, good. The waitstaff was extremely nice and talkative, even though the place was fairly busy.

I'd recommend Epic for the fantastic view and nice ambiance, and the food is good. Just don't expect your meal to be memorable.

I would have to say I was completely under-whelemed with the experience at Epic Roasthouse. I took my girlfriend there for her birthday and started the night in the bar. I would have to say this was one of the highlights of the evening, two of their signature drinks which were very well made by a very friendly waitress.

We moved downstairs for our reservations and the restaurant was fairly empty. However as the restaurant filled up we became less and less important as the restaurant began to fill up. I felt that the larger parties received the lion's share of the attention and I even had trouble flagging down the waiter on one occasion.

The food was excellent however I would recommend BoBo's on Lombard for a better steak experienc
review_title: I would have to say I was

review: Recession? What recession? You would never know it at the Epic Roadhouse this past Friday night. The place was jumping. The standout this night was the excellent service. The sommelier provided wonderful advice and picked out a fabulous wine. Our waiter was attentive and gracious. When one of our entrees was inadvertently forgotten, he very quickly provided a plate to allow me to start on the sides, brought over a cup of their delicious butternut squash soup so that I could join my companions while the kitchen caught up. Then at the end he thanked us with a dessert plate with his compliments.

I came here with coworkers for Dine About Town. I had the swordfish with potato pancake and roasted spaghetti squash and it was all so delicious. It was a beautiful day and the decor in the restaurant was very nice. The service was quite good also. I would definitely come back.
The food was fantastic! We'll try the beef next time & expect it to be great too! Will definitely go back, especially in the evening with the killer view of Bay Bridge.
I was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was based on the so-so reviews on Yelp! Winners were the trout entree and skirt steak salad. Willie Brown was sitting right behind our group.
Very nice experience tonight. My steak was cooked perfectly. Lots of lively activity in the place without a stuffy vibe. Overall I would definitley go back again

Brunch menu was good and nice venu but service was terrible. The waitress couldn't remember the special (only one) and she didn't bring one of the desserts we ordered (we didn't even bother reminding her as the service was pretty slow).
review_title: Brunch menu was good and nice

review:
Great Location, on the water side of the Embaradero, right under the Bay Bridge.
Even a very nice and comfortable outdoor area. A rarity in SF.
Not the place to go for the latest "foodie" experience
but it's solid, from spacious chairs and tables, to good food, good ingredients, healthy portions. nicely presented, and some of the little things that one expects from a finer restaurant are handled beautifully, from the salt and pepper to the choice of silver.
Very Attentive staff. Doesn't appear that the restaurant would ever feel crowded,
I was there for Sunday brunch and it was 100% relaxing. A lot of brunch places feel like a zoo. This didn't at all.
we always love JAa Birnbaum's food - waiting for gumbo and jumbalaya! Kuleto has scored again.

The short ribs were delicious! The pork chop however was a little tough and not a juicy.  Service was very good.  Our waiter was very soft spoken and well mannered.  Overall we will definitely return.

The food was amazing, the service absolutely outstanding, and the wine was fabulous - carefully selected and recommended by the sommolier!  This was our first visit to San Fran, our first dining experience out & I has reserved this restaurant based on the online reviews. We have dined at many fabulous & fine restaurants & the Epic Roasthouse was truly impressive and an absolute must do!

Jo-Ann
i thought the food would of been better. I love the location and thought it was just going to be better - especially for the price ($200+ for 2). I'll try waterbar next.
review_title: i thought the food would of

review:
Expensive. Service spotty. Seats isolated. Steak served completely cold. Forgot butter with bread, had to ask 3 times. Waiter couldn't hear our order, got it wrong several times. We had to wait 20 mins after our reservations to be seated (ie we were seated at 9.40 for a 9.15 reservation made 3 weeks in advance)...
Food in general very very lack lustre. Big disappointment.

By the way they lost our doggie bag (just another example of not caring)
The high cost of dining was not reflected in the meal and service.... A great deal of tweaking is need in both areas.
review_title: The high cost of dining was

review: We cannot wait to return! And we were saying that if lunch was that good, we are really looking forward to having dinner there. A great experience.

I love Waterbar. Great food, great service. My husband and I had our wedding lunch there almost four years ago. We go back for our anniversary sometimes or for a special occasion. We are never disappointed and are treated so well even though no one knows us. It is a tip top restaurant.

Located right by the water, the view sets the atmosphere for the seafood restaurant.  They have fresh shellfish and fish.  I tried dungeness crab and cocktail shrimp.  Both were so fresh that the cocktail sauce was not needed at all.  Also tried a whole fish that was absolutely lovely.

We've been to Waterbar several times and are always happy and well-fed when we leave. The food is fabulous and the wait staff is the one of the best in SF. The oysters are to die for and the view is fantastic!
Views, aquariums, oysters!  Great date night spot, multiple rooms and levels. Salt water aquariums are beautiful.

Have been here many times. This last time the service was spotty. Served an appetizer and 20 minutes after they cleared the plate we were asking where our entrees were. Began by sitting in the bar enjoying catching up with an old friend. Was 1.5 hours early for a reservation but told them we'd be at the bar. Instead of grabbing us when a table opened in the main dinning area we were seated in the "dungeon" back room area. When asked to be reseated they told me it would be another 25 minutes. Crazy! Really poor attention by hostesses and waiters. I bring a lot of guest from out of town here and it is one of my favorite spots to go. Unfortunate.

We celebrated our Anniversary at the Waterbar and found everything was tasty and elegantly served. With a view of the water and a relaxed and comfortable setting we noted we could converse easily even in a fairly crowded restaurant. It is expensive inside and also has a patio with a bar menu that is musch less pricy. I noted families, singles and groups of people all enjoying themselves at this very busy place. Make sure you have reservation if you want to eat inside. We went on Thursday at 5:45 and it was crowded.

I've dined here dozens of times over the last few years and sad to report that my last visit was lackluster with only a couple of highlights. First the good news: great service, wine list and cocktails. Oysters are fresh and many varieties are available though a bit pricey. Bad news: starters were ordinary: softshell crab in a wrap of some sort? Ribs and octopus? Overly seasoned and worthy of the Wharf...not Pat Kuleto. Main course: we all had fish...over-salted and the dumplings that accompanied were tough to chew and undercooked. Will think again before I revisit.
review_title: Water Bar may be losing its touch

review: Unfortunately I did not get his name - a tall African American man - he was EXCELLENT.

The Oyster Happy Hour that lasts all afternoon is great. We had a dozen creamy large Elkhorn oysters that were a meal in themselves.
 The tombo tuna was rubbery, tasteless, and served barely lukewarm, had to send it back, but the staff graciously replaced it with another entree.
 Loved having a table in the window, I always take out of town guests here!

Impressing friends from Manhattan with the freshest and most comprehensive oyster bar around. Know that this place is popular and even with reservations we waited to be seated.  Cocktails were excellent and bartenders knowledgeable. We started outdoors on the patio with oysters, apps and cocktails, and moved indoors for dinner. Our servers were super-helpful without hovering. The food was FRESH and portions reasonable. Creative without being precious. Everything had a provenance, so you know where the foods come from (as in France with Appelation contrle.) the prices are high but you get what you pay for. The quality is top notch and for a special evening it's worth every dollar. Glorious.
A longtime Farallon fan for seafood in San Francisco, I may have to shift my flag to Waterbar. Just sensational!

I love this restaurant.  The staff is super friendly and accommodating.  Our waiter Chris was exceptional - so personable and very knowledgeable about the menu offerings.  This was my second time dining here, and the chef once again surprised me with the most delicious vegan dish that he created on the spot.  I was skeptical when Chris recommended the rhubarb salad.  The only other time i had tasted rhubarb was a strawberry rhubarb pie, which i detested.  Chris convinced me to go for the salad, and he was absolutely right.  Now rhubarb is my new favorite food.  This restaurant has a beautiful view of the Bay Bridge, but it's the friendly staff and creative vegan dishes that keep me coming back!  Don't miss this great find!
review_title: A Truly Amazing Place to Dine

review: We have been here for brunch on all of our recent trips to San Francisco.  The outdoor seating on a sunny day can't be beaten.  The $20 Bloody Mary with shrimp and bacon is great.  I think the bacon has gotten thinner of late.  I loved the bacon I had there in November 2013 better than this trip April 2014.  I am a bacon addict.

Yes, with the Bay Bridge lit, along with warmer weather, Waterbar is wonderful for a romantic dinner. Everyone is friendly and accommodating and I think the food rocks. One can spend a lot of money but it's not necessary to enjoy a very good meal and have a wonderful time.

It's difficult to give a comprehensive review here since I only went at the Waterbar once. Besides I only sampled their brunch menu (not a huge fan of brunch) so I need to go back to check their regular one.
But with that experience I can tell that the food was very good. The service was excellent. I asked for a window table with room to add a high chair and a stroller. I got a table for 4 with ample room for my family. Finally a restaurant that listen to their customer request. And lastly my wife and I really much enjoyed the layout of this restaurant as well as the food.
I am looking forward to coming back and testing other menu.

Many thanks to everyone at Waterbar for making our anniversary dinner very special. Food, service, ambience and location all made for a perfect evening. I would recommend this restaurant and their staff to anyone looking for a great seafood restaurant in San Francisco.
Artisan Bistro is good for any occasion, or no occasion. It's small and not a good choice for people with children. The service is great and the food is spectacular

I have lunched here many times but never dined. My first dining experience the other day was superior. What a great meal, service, view, quiet even though it was full. Tables are far enough apart to be comfortable and the view untouchable! The rabbit was unbelievable.....beautifully browned, yet moist and the black truffle and bacon base was superb.

It was my birthday and my friends know my taste in dining. It was a wonderful place with a very romantic setting. TO bad I had to be with the girls and not my gentleman friend. I will be back! Sorry but I can't remember the waiters name, but tell her that she was a wonderful assistant and thanks for helping me out with the tipsy one in my party. Thanks again for the tasty warm lobster dish and for your hospitality.

See you soon!

I ordered the mussels which came with polenta. The mussels and the strip of pork/fat were wonderful - I am trying to not eat meat but after tasting the pork, I couldn't stop eating it. Very fatty and not healthy but oh so yummy. The polenta was inedible; pure salt. I told the waitress so. Then our spinach and brussels sprouts also came out very salty. If our blood pressure didn't go through the roof, it would have been unusual. Whoever is in the kitchen trying to give us high blood pressure and giving ambulances job security, please lay off the salt. The service was great, however, and if everything wasn't so salty, I would have given the food at least a 4.5.
review_title: Less Salt Would Have Been Nice

review: Overall, great food, good service. Portions were quite small, and entrees were a bit overpriced.

The Waterbar is our go-to place when we have out-of-town guests. Great views, warm service, great oysters and delicious other food -- it's always fun to drive in from Marin and soak up San Francisco's vibrant waterfront. The host always accommodates my table requests and always gives a warm welcome, and the wait staff are warm and attentive.

Very disappointing! Asked for a table outside and we were inside by the window-nice but not what I asked for. It took one hour to get the appetizers. I had said it was my mother's birthday and we wanted a special dessert; they said they would let the chef know. They forgot! But our meal had taken so long, they brought out 5 little chocolates and we left. I was really disappointed....
Both the service and the food were exceptional. We were treated like royalty!
review_title: Both the service and the food

review: Everything about this place was top notch; the food, the service and, the price. The only complaint I have is it was hard to hear. The noise was very loud.
Good views but very noisy. Food was ok. Service was a bit slow. Oysters were good.

Fantastic view of the SF-Oakland Bay Bridge. The good review stops there. I hear the oyster bar offering is well-received, but we went for dinner. The server was somewhat friendly, the service was extremely slow. We ordered just a couple of appetizers and an entree. Our entree arrived 1.5 hours to arrive. The food was entirely uninspired, especially for the price-point. Everything created in the kitchen was missing the mark every step of the way. The only thing good was the crab cocktail. But the kitchen and operation of the restaurant was too far below par to ever return for a meal. You are paying for the view, not the cuisine. The manager blamed the server, was not gracious, and proceeded to plop the full bill down in front of me.

Service and food are always excellent here.
We love the fact that they are running specials on oysters and tasting menu.
Thanks!
All in all, it was excellent and I would definitely return.
review_title: All in all, it was excellent

review:
The Waterbar is visually stunning. The service was outstanding. Completely attentive without being intrusive. The food is good. Fresh, and well prepared. Flavors could have more pop. It was a little bland. Also it's really pricey. The wine list is outrageously expensive. It's a good place if you want to splurge for a special occasion.
And of course for the next two years the lights on the Bay Bridge are the show.
Service slow and they forgot to bring out a dish we ordered. They were also out of the type of oysters we ordered and the waiter decided to make his own selection without informing us!
Went for Dine About. Only one item offered. Only one of four people ordered it. Need more choice. Food was very good.

Freshest, chilliest oysters ever. All the seafood is amazing...Foodie worthy but not so infused with the propensity for odd combinations and startling ingredients that one can't appreciate the clean flavors of the freshest food around. Always our favorite.
Excellent, my only dissapointment was the brunch menu for noon on Saturday, we had expected lunch, but still a real treat.
The bartenders knew how to make excellent drinks the food was wonderful and the restaurant kept with all of our request for table and make our anniversary special
The food was very good and the service was prompt and observant without being overbearing. Wonderful views.
review_title: The food was very good and

review: EXCELLENT FOOD. BIG DIFFERENCE IN THE ROOMS YOU DINE IN. PUT THE MONEY IN THE FIRST ONE WITH THE OYSTER BAR. OTHER IS NICE, WITH A VIEW, BUT FEELS LIKE AN AFTER THOUGHT. GREAT WAITER.

WONDERFUL OYSTERS and excellent service!
The foie gras to die for...and the grits, the best I have ever tried.
5 star
For the price, the food was just okay and to our party very bland.
review_title: For the price, the food was

review: The hostess was too busy with who knows what to even be cordial to seat us, never asked us if we wanted to sit outside, put us at an extremely small table ( my guest was 6' 9) and was annoyed when I told her we needed another table and put us in the back.
review_title: The hostess was too busy with

review: Went here for Easter Brunch. The fixed menu was excellent and still gave you some choices. Wonderful!!!

Although the particular dish I ordered wasn't up to par (too much lime juice perhaps, so too tart) the rest of the selections were great. Can't beat the raw oyster selection and appetizers were superb. What a view to enjoy!
A friend recommended Waterbar on a recent trip to SF. Spectacular food, cocktails and service, I would highly recommend it.

The water bar is a true delight. Everything about this place is special. This is the only place on the water front that has the best view
in the city and the food is fabulous! I would recommend this place to my friends and co-workers as the best place in town!
review_title: The water bar is a true delight.

review: We had the absolute best service (Lowell) and the greatest time on New Year's Eve. Absolutely incredible food, wine pairings, and a great vibe in the restaurant. I'd been here before, and will now be sure to return more frequently.
We enjoyed the food very much. The pan fried lobster was exceptional and the oyster selections kept us very busy. Great views and friendly servers. Loved it!
review_title: We enjoyed the food very much.

review: Overall a nice place with a phenomenal view and great ambiance. Our group ate more than 2/3rds of the items on the menu. Although certain dishes were wonderfully prepared and executed, there were quite a few dished that left us underwhelmed.

Waterbar is a recommended dining choice. The menu is all about fish. Its preparation and presentation makes any fish selection a right one. We ordered four different fish entres and we were all well beyond happy with our selections. Be sure to share a desert or two or three as they are just that good. Service was a display of effortless efficiency; coffee, water, bread and butter were continually replenished; plates, new forks and knives came and went silently; all this occurring timely, without any need for action on our part. If you make a reservation, know where you want to be seated so you can make your wishes known. There is outdoor dining (think about what you will be eating); there is a well lit indoor main dining room with big vi
excellent food and service under the Bay Bridge, right at Muni stop, all courses were great.  The fish tanks are impressive and central to the diners.

Rarely does one find a restaurant that meets all criteria for excellence. Waterbar staff
are friendly and work with customer so that they are comfortable. Service staff are attentive without being intrusive.The food was cooked to perfection and served with an artistic flair. The ambiance is dramatic looking out at bay and bay bridge.
5 stars/cost moderate. Very worth the cost.

Excellent sea food, waitress and incredible views.

Wine list was extremely pricey but we found a decent Chardonnay for $58.

I will go back again for a special occasion since it is a pricey place!

This exudes everything about a San Francisco view that will cover the most discerning! tHE FOOD IS EXCELLENT AND the view is one of the best along the Bay. Upscale crowd . If you like Oysters this will not dissapoint. I had Walleye and the fish was cooked to a perfect texture . Service was great and reccommend tis one highly.

Usually a beautiful view means lesser emphasis on food prep n my book. Not the case at WB. This place was scary good. Four of us went and we kept waiting for the next dish to be not as fantastic as the last. Go here for oysters, fish, stylistically prepared and just fabulous tasting meal. We had the scallops, tuna tartar, sturgeon, soft shell crab and would recommend all. Thinking that "no way the pastry chef could be as good," we were so wrong. The rhubarb/apple pie with ice cream and strawberry cheesecake was a delight.
The main entree is so so, the raw oysters are fresh and good, the fish was a little over cooked the steak was a little tough. Great atmosphere and service. Appetizer and dessert was good.
review_title: The main entree is so so,

review: It's pretty expensive. Main courses are good, sides need work.
We had a terrific lunch with all the part coming together - food and service, even the weather - to make for a wonderful experience.
The food was wonderful, the service excellent though a bit slow. If you're dining before a show or movie - be sure to let your waiter know ahead of time.

This restaurant is far too expensive particularly when they add a 4% surcharge to pay for employee benefits. It was $193.00 for two of us; one glass of wine each, an appetizer for each, dinner and a cup of tea. With all the equally great restaurants in this city at more reasonable prices there are no reasons to go back.
review_title: Premium food but at a premium price

review: A truly terrific experience. The Dine About Town menu was outstanding. A great deal! Service was terrific. No one's water glass or wine glass ever was empty. Just a terrific experience with such a great view of the Bay and Bay Bridge.
Nice view, good food, service and ambience.  We had a fun and delicious holiday party with spouses and colleagues - perfect.
My hands down favorite brunch spot. Mimosas, oysters and the lobster roll.... absolutely amazing!

Overpriced wine list
Terrible service
Entre was quite good
Very hard to recommend at these prices for the terrible service.

Not a good option for a business lunch. The setting outside was lovely, but we waited for over 45 minutes for our entrees. Bread basket and beverages were left empty until we got up to go over to a busser to ask for more (twice). The server seemed to be avoiding our table and our eyes, we couldn't even wave him down. The menu offers good options at reasonable prices for lunch, but for the lack of service I would not recommend it.
review_title: Not a good option for a business
