review: The food and service were excellent, however the background music was a constant pounding of drums that detracted from the overall expereince. It was annoying enough that I would not return because of it.
Love this place.  Always a good time had and love the oysters
I asked for the best tablae and I had it!... so, everything was great!
review_title: I asked for the best tablae

review:
I treated a friend of mine from NYC and this is hard to do as there are so many too many restaurants that I love there and would expect her to not like here.

She had the Salmon which was divine. I had the Bass which was not divine. We had the salad which was divine. We had the fried green tomatoes which were divine.
My Sea bass was awfull, up steps up Lowell to the rescue. He brings us a plate of greens and a wondeful dessert on the house that just made it too special and typical of SF Rest. that people outside or our area do not understand or appreciate. Needless to say, the view was just the right appetite for her as Manhattan is pretty darn special.

Hats off to all the staff. Love YA especially Lowell
review_title: I treated a friend of mine

review: It is hard to make cod dry but they did it. The fish tasted frozen.
review_title: It is hard to make cod dry

review: Excellent space. Food was not great though. Would recommend the shellfish platter since they don't have to do much to it. Very expensive wine list. Go for the view.
Brunch was amazing! Food was impeccable, delicious, different and the bloody Mary was fantastic. The view is just great, I would recommend this restaurant to anyone. Will definitely return.
Outstanding food, great setting. Our server missed a few things but it wasn't so bad to distract us from a very good experience.
We were there for Dine Around Town event. The 2 courses prix is delicious. We also added desert(Bread Pudding) and found it kind of expensive for what we got. Besides that, everything was great.
review_title: We were there for Dine Around

review: I took work colleagues from out of town. Two of them ordered the "house wine" - expecting that to be a moderately to less expensive wine. Instead, when the bill showed up the amount was $22 a glass! We were all shocked. The rest of the service was fantastic, but the server should have given us a heads up that the "house" was one of the most expensive wines by the glass on the menu.

First, the hostess had a difficult time finding my reservation despite the fact that my guest had already checked in and been seated. After 5 minutes and a call to Open Table, she finally seated me along side my guest. I thoroughly enjoyed my beat salad starter which was served with pistachios and goat cheese, a lovely combination. The snapper was fresh and well cooked, but the bed of lentils it was served over was a tad flavorless. The apple crisp we finished with was tasty, though perhaps a bit over sweet. Generally a nice meal, reasonably priced, but nothing that caused me to pause from my business conversation to take special note. I would characterize Waterbar as a safe but not remarkable choice.
review_title: First, the hostess had a difficult

review: Had a terrific time at Waterbar. Very cool atmosphere. Awesome views. Romantic. Foodies and hipsters alike will enjoy. Highly recommend. Come prepared to open your wallet wide.
review_title: Had a terrific time at Waterbar.

review: The service was outstanding! We were well taken care of. Food was wonderful, cocktails were great, wine selection was ample -- it all went very well together. This was our first tmie at Waterbar, and we would definitely dine here again.

The food was excellent and the view superb as always. However our waiter was not.
1. When he came by to ask us how the food was he had already turned his head and was walking away when we responded..he was obviously just going through the motions and didn't really care.
2. He removed the dinner plate of my companion before I finished eating.
3. He kept trying to rush us although the restaurant was half empty--"Are you still working on this" several times.
3. He rushed the bill before we had finished coffee. He then grabbed the signed credit card slips also before we had even finished coffee.
4. I was careful to note if he had changed shift but no, even when we left he was still there. I wouldn't want that waiter again.

Several months ago we had an absolutely fabulous meal here. Now, unfortunately, the fresh littleneck clams and mussels are off the menu. The prix fixe menu had razor clams for an appetizer, a grave disappointment. This restaurant doesn't do reasonably priced meals well.
Food, Service, and Ambiance was wonderful,(a bit noisy, but that seems to be endemic of the whole bay area scene). The food was masterfully prepared, and flavorful beyond our expectations.

The attention to requests in the reservation were met perfectly. Good to actually speak with the Hostess before your go in if you have special requests. I find that simple is best at the Water Bar. The salads, oysters, wine and ambiance are hard to beat anywhere in the world. I have eaten there a number of times and with the exception of the first week, this is a great restaurant for lunch with out of town visitors, special lunches with clients and a real treat for someone special.

It was a wonderful experience, from arrival to departure. A bit noisy perhaps but the food was exceptional ( I had the cod);
our server was very personable, attentive and efficient. It was a special evening for us and we never felt hurried. The view was spectacular!
Its definitely not cheap, but really cool and romantic date place. I would def recommend heading there for a drink, some munchies, and enjoy the amazing view, inside and out!

The view of the Bay Bridge from Waterbar is spectacular! Unfortunately the food was not up to par with the view. I had the Wild Striped Bass as my entree; it was completely dry and flavorless. The description on the menu said it was "curry crusted", but there was not the slightest hint of spice. Emma's Favorite Salad was the best part of the meal, but nothing to write home about. Dessert was much the same-not memorable. The food was entirely overpriced, & the chairs looked cheap & gave it a Chinese Buffet feel. The bar is beautiful, but it was frustrating when our server put several drinks on one tab that should not have been. It was a nightmare getting the charges sorted. I was disappointed and would not recommend this restaurant.
review_title: The view of the Bay Bridge

review: Great view of the SF waterfront. Hip place. Great decor with large floor to ceiling circular fish takes. Great food.
review_title: Great view of the SF waterfront.

review: Very noisy, food and cocktails are just okay, rather disappointing. Great wine list. Fish was good, but the potatoes were on the greasy side. Good service. Don't think we'll go back for dinner, but perhaps cocktails and an appetizer at the bar. Beautiful views, full moon over the bay bridge and a stroll along the pier after dinner was very nice.
Had a wonderful dining experience. The meal was memorable.
This is a perfect restaurant with the best atmosphere for a business lunch.
Quite over-priced for the food, but I guess you're paying for the view. Service was very good.

Outstanding.  We took our newlywed friends there for dinner to celebrate.  The food was wonderful as was the presentation.  The wait staff was terrific and even brought a "congratulations" dessert for the whole table.  It was a lovely evening!  We will definitely be back!
Very good desert menu; great place for oyster bar lovers; unique water-side location

The food at my lunch at Waterbar were mostly "misses":
Parts of a half-crab were undercooked.
The fish tacos were way off: the corn tortillas were thick and bulky, there a large bone in the fish (without a warning from the server that there might be bones) and the beans were undercooked.
The lobster in the lobster roll was cooked perfectly but had nothing binding it together and the roll was cut in two pieces making it difficult to eat.

The wine list was impressive and had a variety of choices and price points. The wait staff were all knowledgable and accommodating.
review_title: The food at my lunch at Waterbar

review: 2/3 of us had entrees that were less than satisfying.  The 1/2 crab (oven baked) was dry.  The cod plus fries was average.  California sea bass was delicious.  We sat in the small dining section and the noise level was high so it was difficult to talk to each other.  The restaurant design is cool including the 2 aquariums.  I think it would be better to go here for a drink later at night rather than spend lots of money on the over-priced dinners.
It was a wonderful experience.  Loved the decor and the view was phenomenal.  We LOVED our waiter.  He was fun, knowledgeable and friendly.
I was originally angry that a restaurant was being built on the bay side of the Embarcadero but it is tastefully designed and really fits in nicely. The food was superb.

We were seated in the dining room off the main dining room.  While it was quiter, the low ceiling was off putting.  We would have preferred seating in the main dining room where we could see the aquarium.  The food was good.  The grilled sea scollops served over puree of celery root with sliced fennel and pink gratefruit was lovely.  French fries were limp and soggy.  Ice cream sandwich dessert was almost too rich - the cookie part anyway.  Service was a little rough -- had to ask twice for catsup for the french fries and coffee service was slow.  We would give it another try but this time be sure to get seated in the main dining room.
review_title: We were seated in the dining

review: I never write reviews but since you asked...thought i share what a huge disappointment Waterbar was.  They only "pretend" to know good food!  It's a shame in a city of wonderful places to eat that this one would even be in business.  The meal - Bad stone crab (watery like it was frozen) it wasn't cracked properly (Joe's stone crab in Miami sets the bar on how to serve it) and it was overpriced.  The halibut was raw (not rare - RAW) and had to be sent back.  The wine took 20 minutes to be delivered to the table.  The dining room was so loud that we couldn't talk.  Now i know why i hate to go to corporate owned restaurants.  Very disappointing.
Excellent food, if a bit expensive.  The view is amazing and the service perfect.
review_title: Excellent food, if a bit expensive.

review: We had qualms with the service because the oysters we ordered as an appetizer didn't come first. Management smoothed things over and we'll try again soon. Also, a lot of the food is flown in from the east. So, let's see, we'll have an organic menu but do our best to increase global warming...
review_title: We had qualms with the service

review: We loved a few dishes--the salmon kebobs were perfectly cooked. The roasted cauliflower is so special, I'm dreaming of it now!
The dinner was delicious but their portions are quite small. The restroom was a mess.

We love Troya on Fillmore. This Clement location has the same menu, but somehow misses the beat. The food is kind of bland, our favorite dishes from Fillmore didn't measure up. Don't understand how that could be, but we will stick to the Fillmore location.
We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner --food was delicious, and it's a relaxed, lively atmosphere. Though energetic, there was no problem hearing each other, friendly attentive service.

The food was beyond expectations. Every dish was well seasoned with different flavours. I particularly enjoyed the halloumi cheese starter, the lahmuncun and the Kunefe dessert. The salad greens accompanying the rises were without dressing as I think was appropriate for the overall taste. I will definitely revisit and recommend others to a new and satisfying experience.
The appetizers we really good. I like the lamb chops very much. Would definitely go again.
Loved it. And with a groupon to boot. Everything was spot-on and deelish.
review_title: Loved it. And with a groupon

review:
Troya continues to serve very good food with fresh ingredients at bargain prices. We take
advantage of the $5 appetizers and wines served until 7:00 except Friday and Saturday.
Service was not up to usual standards. Appetizers could have been served in a better order.
Falafel served without pita and server never came back with pita requested and promised.
I finally had to speak to the owner and did receive very hot, fresh pita that went well
with the falafel. The restaurant is a bargain even without the $5 appetizers and wine.
Good portions on most items and can easily be split.
amazing! They might just want to make it more cozy. Great place. Great food and service.
Great change of dining pace. Interesting food, and some unusual wines and all in my neighborhood!

This a very pleasant surprise. Wonderful Turkish food at reasonable prices. Everything we had was very good. We are not that up on Turkish food but have been pleased with a couple of places in Redwood City. This was much better

The sushi tasted fine/fresh/good but wow, the wait for the rolls was just absurd (pushing 45 minutes). The bento boxes arrived in a normal time frame. The waitress was sorry for such a long wait and brought us extra edamame but it really was beyond a reasonable time frame plus the rolls were pretty small.  I definitely expected to be more wowed by the place than I was. The atmosphere is modern but not anything special.

We were seated at the sushi counter which I actually like so you can see the food being prepared. Took a while for the waiter to come over and take our drink and food order. We ordered two more rounds of drinks from other random staff because we never saw our waiter until it was time to get the bill. Oh well.
I love this place. Energetic DJ'ed music, great food, wonderful ambiance. Looking forward to my next visit.
Food was mediocre. Catered to YUPPIEs' taste buds. Too pricey for the mediocre food. Too loud. Could barely hear myself or my companion speak. Service was not attentive enough.
Only possible "glitch" was the sushi was very slow to come out b/c the chefs were slammed. The waitress was exceptional though.
Really lost it's edge ... Plays te sports channel instead of the cool anime. Food not as well presented as it was in the past. Menu much less engaging. No longer an iconic restaurant for me.

I love this restaurant but our server was terrible. We were at our table for 15 minutes
before anyone ever came over, and 30 minutes before we got our drinks.
We told our waitress that we were celebrating both of our
birthdays, and she did absolutely nothing.

Food was stellar at blowfish. By far some of the beat sushi I've ever had. Service was a bit slow but excusable with the artful rolls they presented. Overall it was a 1.5 hour experience for 4 rolls, some gyoza, and a Kirin.

I dined here for lunch and it was the lamest dining experience ever. I heard all these great things about this place only to be underwhelmed. The food was just fair. None of the specials on the boards were available. Our sever was pretty distant and unhelpful, partially because she was also the bartender. Anyway, I'm not sure if I'm going to try it again.
review_title: I dined here for lunch and

review: This restaurant gives out customer info to anybody who asks for it.
Outstanding quality of food, service, and presentation. My guests had not been there before and absolutely loved it.

Great sushi in a funky space with a Japanese manga vibe. We were there at 7:00 which was definitely on the early side for the young clientele this restaurant draws. Our waitperson was very friendly and helpful and didn't seem fazed that we were twice the age of the typical diner.
review_title: Great sushi in a funky space

review: Wonderful, as always. The sushi chef loved his work, very knowledgeable (and very western), had some great suggestions. The drink was a Bourbon / Merlot blend, a treat.

The sushi was good but not extraordinary. It was too noisy to have a normal conversation at one of the smaller tables - they were blasting loud dance music the whole evening - so we moved to the sushi bar, which was great. Fresh, tasty ingredients and extensive sake list.
review_title: The sushi was good but not

review: blowfish has always been my favorite sushi place. i have not been is some time, so i was unfamiliar with the latest staff. my only complaint was that the drink service was a bit slow, and the waiter had to be reminded of or second drink request. a frivolous complaint compared to the overall experience. as usual the food was top rate.
very very good food - never had better japanese food but music much much too loud and irritating and too many television sets going for anyone over 60
A great place for sushi lovers. Awesome mojitos. Staff is quick, efficient, and friendly. Most definitely will be coming back.
review_title: A great place for sushi lovers.

review: we got a bad oyster in our half-dozen (and I LOVE oysters) so the waiter brought us dessert on-the-house to compensate. that was nice. I've been going to Blowfish since they opened, so it's nice to see they're still doing well.
review_title: we got a bad oyster in our

review:
I had such a great dinner experience here. Went with my boyfriend for a late night bite and we were so surprised by the wonderful food and ambiance. The server did a great job by giving us just the right amount of attention so it still felt like we were having an intimate dinner without being interrupted every 10 minutes to see if we needed anything. 
We both had the salmon and spinach. Tasted perfect! 
We will definitely return.
review_title: Lovely little gem of a place

review:
Fish & Farm,

Thanks for the quick service. My wife and I arrive about 30 min early, our reservation was not until 8:15pm, and Fish & Farm seated us right away. My wife had the Cod fish plate, and I had the New York strip, and both were cooked to perfection. The restaurant was very cozy, and the music was great. I want to thank Fish & Farm for a great dinner, the food was delicious.
This place has potential and I guess once it was good, but the food was really quite bad. I don't want to be mean as the staff were lovely. Maybe it was a bad night....

Tucked into the Mark Twain hotel in the theater district, Fish & Farm specializes in providing local sustenance, with great fish dishes, fried chicken to die for and some wonderful salads. The room is a long lean room and it can get busy. Service is pleasant and efficient. Interesting wine list. Portions on some of the dishes can be small, so if you're really hungry, order the fried chicken. The root beer float with Southern Comfort will put a buzz on, so be careful. We have found this a pleasant alternative for pre and post theater dining.

We enjoyed an early supper at Fish & Farm this past weekend. We tried the cioppino, crab ravioli and the burger. All were delicious and perfectly prepared. The wines by the glass offerings were plentiful and varied. Service was terrific. Our only slight disappointment was the profiteroles dessert. Something was lacking, but no big deal, given how flavorful the rest of the meal was. Ask for a seat away from the outside door to avoid a chilly draft.

Dinner was great the other night at Farm & Fish. After figuring out that the restaurant was tucked away in the corner of the Mark Twain Hotel, we were quickly led to our awaiting table.

The ambiance was simple and clean with a hint of rustic fanfare. Most dinner parties looked to be in their late 40s or older.

Music was top 40 hits with some hip hop, which I found a bit odd for a place catering to upper middle class white people.

Our food was excellent. We started with six oysters, which were raw and tasty.

My main course of Pork Chop was dynamic and a treat, it was served up with fingerling potatoes and I believe sauteed spinach.

Dessert was yummy too.

I've been to F&F before and had a really good experience. I made a reservation for 8:30 for two, was sat at 9 and order wasn't taken until 9:30. The service was completely out of sync and our waiter change twice. The food wasn't as good as I remembered it to be but it wasn't bad.
review_title: I've been to F&F before and

review: Very nice food, well prepared. The winter salad was refreshingly light, tasty dressing, the farm fresh salad had a tangy vinaigrette, which could have been toned down with a touch less vinaiger but nice nonetheless. My double cut pork chop was terrific, and they ask how done you want it. I asked for just under medium, and it was very nicely pink and juicy. I will ask for medium rare next time. Very nicely done, though the cabbage was too salty, not in line with the seasoning of the pork. My wife had the crab cakes special as a main course, again a touch salty, with a side of the hybrid broccoli which was very well done, cooked to the right doness, and seasoned just right. The service was on the ball, just right. Very much worth a return!

I looked forward to eating their burger with everything on it, including the fried egg. I ordered the burger medium rare but I found the meat to be dry even with everything on it. I think great burgers should be larger nd juicy so I was a little disappointed.

Our meals were delicious. I had the pork chop which was seasoned and cooked to perfection and my husbands rib eye (the special) was to die for. I had read other reviews that were not complimentary regarding the service but we had a wonderful service

I took two important clients there for dinner (it was my first time) and all of us were blown away by how incredible the food was. Needless to say, we will all be making a point to return on our next trip to San Francisco.

Went here for proximity to GG Theater and the winning cheeseburgers. I had read a few reviews about poor service. Our server was EXCELLENT. We were seated on time, she checked in on us frequently (but not too frequently) - even our bus service was great. The cheeseburgers were fantastic, the fish and chips not quite as good. Overall, a very nice experience. Neighborhood was a little sketchy - not sure I'd go for a late dinner, but definitely would go back. Very fresh!

Fish and Farm uses the freshest of the ingredients for all their food. The fish is fresh, the meat is grass fed and organic and all the food is awesome. I ate with 3 foodies and they raved about the food preparation and taste. The restaurant is small and intimate. It is attached to Mark Twain Hotel and door is at the entrance to the hotel.

The only reason I gave them a 3 star for food was that I bit into a cherry pit in my dessert. Thank goodness I didn't chip or break my tooth. Also, service was a bit slow, even though they didn't seem that busy the night we went there.
review_title: The only reason I gave them

review: For those not in a hurry, this is a great place. Food was excellent, wine was priced moderately and the server knowledge was very good. My only complaint was with the long delay between the appetizers and main course; however the quality of the main course was worth the wait.
review_title: Great food was worth the wait

review: all around well executed menu with local items, they were running a special of a 24 oz porterhouse steak for 2, it was exceptionally good with chanterelles, carmelized onions, and fingerlings. Beet sald for starter was generous and tasty. Service was unobtrusive but attentive, wine list small but good finds for reasonable prices. Was full on a Sunday nite, but a relatively quiet crowd with a good, contemplative atmo

Fresh and varied menu--perfectly seared tuna with crunchy pole bean/creme fraiche salad--yum! Excellent service, staff couldn't have been nicer or more attentive. Sophisticated but comfortable ambiance. Location is perfectly located for pre-theater dining.
Awesome burger, great fried chicken and very friendly service. Definitely will be back for more!

Keith is definitely the best waiter in town, as described by the famous Mr. Mike. The only downside to the place, since it is small and cozy, is a lack of privacy, and perhaps the lively noice of diners. But the food is excellent.

Home style food with an upscale feel. We started with cocktails (try the julep!) and had the pork chop and Southern Fried chicken, both cooked to perfection. The portions were extremely generous so we ended up taking half of it to go. The setting was intimate and the service was impeccable. I would highly recommend Fish & Farm.
review_title: Home style food with an upscale

review: Very pleasantly surprised--best place around in the neighborhood. Great food and wine.

Once I heard about their #1 burger status I knew I had to go and try it. The fact that it's right around the corner from my new place is just an added bonus. Located in the Mark Twain Hotel, this cozy restaurant gets high praise in my book. 

The appetizers we ordered were top notch: lamb meatballs, cauliflower soup and brussel sprouts were phenom. The lamb meatballs were tender with a little spice and the cauliflower soup was creamy, frothy and flavorful. They topped it off with some grapes was an interesting and creative touch.

For my entree, I couldn't NOT order the hamburger and most certainly didn't regret it. I can see why it's so well known. My only complaint is that I ordered it to be cooked medium and they served it to me pret
Everything was superb, and the servers were fantastic.  I'd go back anytime!

In the historic Mark Twain hotel...a bit of a dicey neighborhood, but that shouldn't be a problem for experienced urbanites.  A few unusual and well prepared dishes, such as beef marrow, added a touch of discovery to a well prepared and served standard meal.

Service was lacking
I like the idea that everything on the menu was "california"
Food was good
Will I go back, probably not

We had to wait about 15-20 minutes after our reservation time for our table but my date and I just had them open the bottle of wine we brought (great $5 corkage fee) and chatted in the bar. The cute little two person booth we got made up for the wait for the table. I would definitely come back again.
I made this reservation for a friend and they thought it was basically mediocre, disappointing. I will nmot go back and certainly will not receommend it. i think they won't make it ....

We love sushi and are fortunate to have so many amazing sushi restaurants in San Francisco bay area. When we move to Potrero Hill 5 years ago we were thrilled that Live Sushi was a few blocks away from our home. We tried it but the sushi was good but service was terrible and we never went back because we have so many choices. For years we had our weekly neighborhood "go-to" sushi place RocketFish which was awesome! 

We received a birthday roll promotion in the mail a few weeks ago and decide to give Live Sushi another chance especially since RocketFish closed. Well, we were so glad we did! Our lunch sushi was excellent and service great. We decide to go back this week and again the sushi was incredible, creative and fresh! Our services was impeccable for a local sushi restaurant and our server attentive, professional and apologized for a delay in our order (we ordered 8+ rolls) over the course of our meal on a busy Friday evening.

We are thrilled to have Live Sushi back on our "go to" sushi place!
review_title: We are sushi-holics & Live Sushi rocks!

review: I live very close to Japantown, so have often ended up in there, wandering around and hoping that the next place I try will have good food. Unfortunately, I've been disappointed a lot lately, so thought I'd venture further afield. Live Sushi Bar turned out to be a GREAT choice! The fish was very fresh, well prepared, and the service was excellent. There isn't much ambiance, but with ample parking available, it was fine for a casual dinner. I'll be going back soon!

Fish is oh so fresh! Love the hou hou shu bubbly sake and the nigiri here (also recommend the Island Poki).

Expensive - but worth it, for the quality of the fish!
review_title: Fish is oh so fresh! Love

review: All the food and other stuff are fine. They charge extra service for cake cutting which is normal. However, 2 dollars per slice for cutting, is not fair enough. The point is not because of the money. If you had a birthday party there, the atmosphere between friends would suddenly dropping from the highest to the lowest by seeing this unexpectedness on the bill. Well, if no cake for cutting, this place is good to go.
review_title: All the food and other stuff

review:
Probably the best sushi I've ever had in my life. We asked to have an Omakase (chef's choice) and it couldn't have been more amazing. Oysters with quail eggs, Kobe Beef roll, citrus scallops...the list of amazing dishes goes on and on.

The only POSSIBLE downside of the place is the very casual setting. Its almost like walking into a neighborhood diner. That's great when you want something lowkey, but given the quality of the food I'd almost like to see it a bit fancier so that it was really a "hot date" worth place.

been here a few times, as i live up the street.
Great sushi, they also have an awsome ramen soups.
review_title: been here a few times, as

review: Every time we are in San Francisco, this restaurant Is on the "must see" list. The food is superb, flavors are so good. Unique, intense and varied, the dishes are sure to satisfy! Service is always quite attentive. This has been our favorite restaurant for years.

Food offerings for renamed Betelnut are inconsistent and not what they used to be with the original Betelnut of several years back. Menu changes have been a disappointment. While the chicken tikka masala was tasty, the mango and jicama salad with chili sauce was BAD with no flavor or substance. We immediately returned the dish and the replacement papaya salad was OK but not great. The beef and broccoli stir fry was ordinary and somewhat greasy. Our small table got so jammed with serving plates we could barely eat. The waitress did her best to accommodate our concerns but seemed a bit impatient. We are not anxious to return to Betelnut.
Great service and food. I will definitely be back.

We were a big group on Sat night. The service was awful. the waiter was totally overwhelmed, and kept missing things. It took him an hour to bring out some drinks and many times I had to go to the cash register area to find him since he was not attentive to the table. We should have had at least 2 servers given the size of the group. At the end, when we were in a hurry to leave, he messed up the check, putting the wrong amount on credit cards. That delayed our night by another 20 min.

In general, the staff is rude and obnoxious.
The soup was full bodied flavor. Delicious taste with a kick of spicy curry. The salmon skewers were cooked just right; and the peanut sauce was awesome. The wild boar was tender and delicious.
review_title: Yellow curry soup to die for

review: First visit to Hutong since the change. We've seen the negative reviews but we found the food to be creative with exciting flavors and good portions for the money. Congratulations. Kale salad, mushroom skewers, chicken skewers, and flatiron steak. Four dishes and drinks for under $60. We'll tell our friends and we will be back often.

We sat in the front window looking out onto the street and back to the bar. Great location which I would prefer over the side by side tables which are up a few steps. Food is innovative and delicious. Waitstaff was attentive but let us take our time.

We will be back!
review_title: We sat in the front window

review: Highly overated. Mediocre Asian (Chinese) food. Way too much seasoning covering up every dish.
FOOD WAS BETTER THEN AVERAGE BUT NOT AS GOOD AS IT HAS BEEN IN THE PAST. NOISE LEVEL IS VERY HIGH. DO NOT GO THERE IF YOU WANT TO TALK TO PEOPLE IN YOUR PARTY. GOOD PEOPLE WATCHING

Great food and table service. We ordered the malaysian curry and some pork potstickers. Both were delicious. The paratta we ordered was too oily though.

We were kind of frustrated by having to wait over 30 mins, despite having a reservation. We were there about 10 mins early so I would expect us to be seated at least on time. They kept giving us excuses like the previous guests are having dessert, they are paying, leaving, cleaning etc. which didn't seem too honest to me.

I've been to this restaurant about 20x over 20 yrs and I always thought the food was creative and above average (w/a fun environment) Last Monday night it was just ok but I think partly it was because of what we ordered. The mango salad (I think there was some fish in there) was quite good; the noodle dish with tofu and I think there was supposed to be some meat in there: it was really average....I think it was warmed up and not prepared fresh. The pork collar was sub-par. Service was ok....he would rush up to our table as if we were in a fast food restaurant....only after 2 minutes of standing would he acknowledge we were knee-deep in convo and leave...shouldn't that be the first thing waiters understand about service?
Been coming here for 15 years and still haven't gotten tired of their green beans and short ribs!!

The staff -- from the hostess to the wait staff -- did a great job of accomodating a vegan in our party. They were able to identify the menu items that were already vegan; or couldbe easily made so. Thanks!
We always love Betelnut. The food is fabulous, and the staff are very kind and helpful
Authentic SE Asia tastes. Go with a group so that you can share multiple dishes from different regions.
Even with an open table reservation I had to wait for 45 minites. We had a party of 8 and the staff was rude and kept us waiting for way too long!!!
review_title: Even with an open table reservation

review: Fun, great Asian food. Go with a group to order a number of dishes to sample.

Great food, great service. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for great Pan-Asian. Get the calamari and ask for extra dipping sauces. Also, don't miss the side of green beans (they seemed to be on every table). I would go the route of choosing a bunch of the appetizers rather than opting for a main dish. Will definitely be back!
we love this place and we always bring friends too.
review_title: we love this place and we

review:
Betelnut came highly recommended and decided to try for a relatively important business dinner with visiting overseas employer and a substantial customer.

A nice place for friends and family however too loud for an effective business dinner. To our disappointment, our table of four was placed in the busiest part of the dining area and this with reservations about five days in advance. The serving staff was above average and are to be commended. The food was enjoyable but, quite lacking in portion size with the exception of the starter calamari that was ample. There were two starters and four entres ordered and the question in leaving was where we going to go next for dinner.
The scene was energetic and vibrant with mostly a young and hip crowd. The service was great and the food was fantastic!

We enjoyed Betelnut. It's a higher quality version of PF Changs -- better ingredients, more creative but also a slightly random survey of flavors from all over Asia. I'd personally say its a great place for people who are getting into Asian food, want to try some new things they probably haven't had before or have a spouse/date/whatever that they can't come to agreement on in terms of food style (Hmmm, dim sum or Singaporean or Chinese tonite? Let's do them all!).

Our waiter was superb and our food was amazingly quick. I will say that we were in the back part of the restaurant and it was almost overwhelmingly loud. There was a group back there and it was a bit much at times. Our front seemed much more tolerable.

My husband and I have explored a lot of restaurants around the Bay Area as we are avid foodies and he is a chef. We keep coming back to Betelnut as our Favorite. And this time didn't disappoint. We tried a couple new items and they were FABULOUS! My husband is still thinking about the "Cha Cha la vong" fish three days later and the Szechwan Greenbeans are a standard Favorite. The service is great and we will be going back again and again as long as they are around.
review_title: My husband and I have explored

review: Great evening and we had " requested" a booth and it was available which we REALLY enjoyed. Thank you for another flavorful dining experience at Betlenut with perfect and gracious service.
The food was not like I remembered it to be. Seems like the flavors have changed. Particularly the green beans and sea bass.
review_title: The food was not like I remembered

review: I have been dining here a long time and each time I go I am a bit more disappointed than the last time. The food is still good, but the proportions are getting ridiculously small while the prices are getting ridiculously big for what you get. I think this may have been my last time here. I work way too hard to spend $60 bucks and leave hungry.
review_title: I have been dining here a

review: The sea bass dish was off the charts excellent. The green bean starter was very very good.
review_title: The sea bass dish was off

review: Beggar's chicken (wrapped in lotus leaf and then clay, slow roasted for 3 hours) was wonderful, amazingly tender - great presentation (break open the clay at the table).
It seems like the restaurant is not trying anymore and has had its heyday. It is now is more of a bar scene, with nothing innovative or well-executed on the menu anymore.

This is one of our favorites - so much so, that we bought the green bean sauce to try to reproduce the famous dish at home! They set lovely flowers for my wife's birthday and she felt amazing! She even battled through the szechwan dumplings (firey!!!) without downing my water too!

Amazing, as always.
review_title: This is one of our favorites

review: This restaurant never disappoints. The food and cocktails are excellent. The wait staff is friendly and efficient. I recommend Betelnut to anyone who enjoys Thai/Vietnamese/Korean influences, the "small plate" approach to dining, and a bustling, non-pretentious environment. The Korean style spareribs, Emerald Fire Noodles, Crab and Egg Noodles, Dragon dumplings, Chili Rubbed Calamari, & Pulled Pork Hoisin Pancakes are my favorites. The Pomegranate Martinis and the Bloody Mary's are fabulous.
Always enjoy Betelnut and on Friday, their service and food contributed to a fun and special night. Thanks!
This is one of my favorite restaurants.  Great for out of towners.
review_title: This is one of my favorite

review: I like to take guests from out of town to Betelnut because it's a unique-to-most experience.  It has also been consistently good since the day it opened!  I was especially pleased this time to have my seating request honored - I had two people in from out of town and wanted to be able to sit in the bar area so we could look out the window onto Union Street. Perfect!
review_title: I like to take guests from

review:
I love The House and it's old school charm and having been born and raised in the City I always come back when in California.
At this point these days a wine list denotes a certain pride point for an establishment  and with the discombobulated and tattered list that was handed me I tried to keep an open mind. No Burgundy no Barolo no CNP, not even a token representative of these regions... I settled for the Sea Smoke Pinot Noir which by the way was very nice...
With the high volume The House is still doing it's time to invest in a Sommelier and after all if there is a full bar there should be a full wine list.
Prime Rib is a tricky match for wine and those big California Cabs just overwhelm the Rib.
Like MacArthur " I shall return" but hopefully to a more varied wine list.
Had never been to the House of prime rib and treated aunts and uncle, and a good time was had by all.  service and food were great, look forward to coming back!
Everything was wonderful about our service and our meal.  Both the prime rib dinner and the salmon dinner were excellent choices.  Lots of flavor and good portion size.
lots of food. Definitely worth the price. Very interesting serving style than other steak house.
The prime rib is always amazing, and free seconds are great. But I was a little surprised they served Lipton Tea. Oh well... I don't go for the tea!
review_title: The prime rib is always amazing, and fre...

review: House of Prime a perennial favorite of mine and friends on this night however, the quality of the primals were a smidgeon off the mark. Now, mind you, there are few who can roast a Prime Rib as well as HoPR. So, yes the cut was roasted to the proper temperature and was a beautiful sight to behold. Tonight's issue was perhaps the quality of the joint itself and a first for me compared to past visits. The meat was decidedly firm, not tender indicative of a cut towards the larger Chuck end of the roast but hey, I've had multiple experiences with this cut... At any rate, I know I'm being picky at this point; I will say overall the dining experience was as always, very enjoyable. Of course I'll be back better believe it !!!
review_title: Prime is the way to go

review: Took my 16 year old daughter here for the first time.  She enjoyed the meal very much, she asked if we can come back soon. This says a lot because we really don't eat often.  The wait staff was very attentive and friendly.  The prime rib  was very  tender, we both ordered the medium English cut (you get three thin slices ) . This is the only place to get Prime Rib in the Bay Area.

Prime rib is all anyone wants to eat here.  The wait staff is super busy and do rush you a bit. Our carver chef was not particularly friendly.  For what you pay, it is quite filling but expensive.  Definitely for special occasions.  Our waiter told us they easily serve 800 lbs of beef weekly and even more during the holidays.  I prefer to make reservations earlier in the evening than later, the wait appears to be longer as the evening wears on during the weekends.
The gem of SF dining. Consistent, classy, delicious.  Helpful, freindly staff without being over bearing, borish or attitude-y. I just LOVE IT there!
My husband and I had an amazing evening here. Great service, lively ambience, amazing steak - some of the best we have had which is saying something! Definitely recommend it, a must go to.
Never a dull moment and any carnivore's delight. Reservations are mandatory. We came from three valleys and a bridge away and it was definitely well worth the trip.

The House of Priime Rib never fails to please.  We look forward to dining there ever since our first time back in 1958.  The price is much different but the dinner has always, consisrently been excellent.  My only objections is the difficultlly in getting a reservation.  My family threatens to bury my ashes there.

I have been coming to the restaurant for years. I was at first very disappointed with the room they put my party in. It was so noisy. Once we told them, they moved us. The rest of the experience was fantastic. The food is always amazing there. Also the service can't be beat!

This is your classic restaurant that everyone should experience.  Prime rib is wonderful, melts in your mouth, the mashed potatoes and gravy are to die for.  Save room for the desserts!  Waiters are amazing!  Very attentive.  Great experience.
Using very fine rib, service good, a little bit expensive.
Food was good.  Very pricey. It was very warm back in the corner where we were sat.  Also, a lot of noisy children.

House of Prime Rib has been a favorite for me since I can remember. When compared to other prime rib spots, this place always takes the cake for me. One of the go-to spots for me when visitors come into town, to celebrate a special occasion, or just if I feel like prime rib. Highly recommended. The only thing I'd change is to not have the tables so close together. I realize with how many patrons they get on the daily basis that they are just trying to accommodate as much as possible, but it'd be nice to have some room in between tables. Not really a big issue since their food and service make up for it. If you haven't tried House of Prime Rib, I'd highly recommend you do!

The House of Prime Rib remains one of our favorite restaurants.  The service is al ways professional and friendly. The Prime Rib is outstanding! They do have a fish selection on the menu but every one is really there for the prime rib.  When we have company from out of town we always make sure this is one of restaurants that we visit.  This remains a San Francisco institution.
review_title: The House of Prime Rib remains one of ou...

review: Make your reservations No matter what! I was surprised to see the place completely packed at 5:30 on a Tuesday.  WOW! and now I know! So incredibly good!The service impecable. I noticed so many groups of people. Families, business, everyone!

My visit to the House of Prime Rib was absolutely spectacular. The food was abundant and delicious and the service was impeccable. Would highly recommend to any visitors to the city.

There is a bit of a wait for a table (despite having reservations) but once seated, the magic begins. The menu is rather simple, with only offerings of various prime rib cuts. However, practically all choices come with a full ensemble of tasty sides.

For wine enthusiasts, there is a lengthy wine list available at reasonable prices.

Would definitely go again on my next visit to the city.
If you want a good prime rib the house of prime is the place to go.
Great food with minimal needed options! Salad is fabulous and there's always a memorable experience with the wait staff.
We're big meat eaters & we LOVE this place, it never disappoints!
We had a great time at House of Prime Rib and plan on going back. The food was delicious! I would recommend it to everyone.
review_title: We had a great time at House

review: I've been going to the House of Prime Rib since 1969. This was my second visit on New Year's Day. The reservation was made a year ago for the earliest time available at 5:30. We arrived an hour early so we could enjoy a cocktail only to discover the restaurant had been opened since 3:00 and was so busy there were tables set up in the lounge area. Tables were just way too close and there were way too many people. The bartender was not friendly, the place was a mess and our waitress was lacking in skill. However, the food was fabulous, as usual, but that did not make up for the environment. I will continue to go to this restaurant but never again on a holiday!
The prime rib is the best we've ever had. Our only complaint is that we had to wait for a little over an hour for a table.
review_title: Great food/Long wait for a table

review: I have been coming here for years with really no complaints. Took my son for his 13th Birthday dinner in late November, 2013. Got the WRONG waiter. Avoid the back far right section after you enter if you don't ever want the same. This guy was so out of it and so non-attentive that I called the manager who really did nothing. Salad was limp, like over-cooked noodles. Presentation set-up 3 months ahead for my son and his Grandmother (reconfirmed by phone the night before) forgot Granny when it came time. Not offered standard choices of water (plain or sparkling). My son actually had tears in eyes when we got home and said the resturant ruined his birthday!
review_title: Poor service at House of Prime Rib

review: This might have been the best Prime Rib I've ever had. So tender and juicy. Their salad was amazing as well. One of the best meals I've had in the city since moving here 9 months ago.

Reservation was for 8PM on a Friday night, didn't get seated until 8:30, dining room was very noisy, server very distracted but friendly and was attentive. The prime rib was outstanding, and the creamed spinach, brown gravy on the mashed potatoes, and spinning bowl salad were also memorable. Really good place for a celebration.
review_title: Noisy and crowded, great prime rib

review: This is definitely a go to place in SF if you are a meat-eater. Reservations are highly recommended.

Love this place, it's my annual spot to take the folks and the boyfriend. I have no complaints at all about the food or service, but I'm not sure it's a place I'll take my now elderly parents back, as the noise level is very high (everyone is very happy to be there and excited!). They had a very hard time hearing the conversation (we were in a booth at the side towards the back). But really, overall, this place is a true gem. I will be back again and again (and again!).

Everything was as advertised Prime rib was exactly as ordered. Delicious and tender. Limited choices but they tell you that up front. Our waiter Josh was friendly and attentive, and professional. Helpful with wine list, and my companion enjoyed her martini made just as she wanted. Busy and somewhat boisterous not exactly a romantic ambiance, but if your date is a carnivore she'll appreciate you forever. Wish I could afford this more often but the family and other diverse groups seemed to be enjoying themselves greatly. .
review_title: Just what they said it would be.

review:
This had been recommended by friends, who used to live in San Francisco. This was definitely NOT a disappointment.
The place was buzzing and the food fantastic. It was great having the food prepared right in front of you. We have never had meat so tender and good tasting as this. We forgot to take our camera and even this was no problem, as they took a picture for us.
A great night and I will be recommending this to my friends.

Our prime rib consisted of big globs of cold fat. I think the lighting at this restaurant is kept so ridiculously low to hide the poor quality of meat. Not even enough light to read the menu with. I had no idea what was in the salad (because I couldn't see it) but that was the only thing worth eating. I had actually planned a three day vacation in San Francisco around my House of Prime Rib reservation. I was so disappointed.

it was great Sunday.
great food , great service , great atmosphere , great drinks .
Steak is huge and juice, service is awesome, salute to our waiter Federick. Fun to eat there if you don't mind the noise.

There is no doubt this place serves fantastic beef, even if the portions are far too large. There is limited choice on the menu, the service was far from great, the seats need urgent reupholstering as they were VERY uncomfortable and the noise levels were high. Dcor is good and felt more authentic than large chain restaurants.

Usually our meal at HPR is outstanding but our experience last Tuesday was a huge disappointment. Not only did we have to wait more than a half hour beyond our 8:30 pm reservation time, a young host at the reservation desk insulted one of my dining partners. By 9:00 pm we had been in the cocktail lounge for an hour and fifteen minutes. He told my dining partner that the wait was our fault because we had requested a table with chairs and that he was unable to monitor the restaurant to determine when tables with chairs were available. Isn't that his job? We had reminded him when we arrived of this request and he said it would be "no problem." What's happened to the management of this formerly excellent restaurant?
review_title: Not as good as it used to be

review: The House of Prime was very good and we'd would recommend it, though not sure it's in the outstanding category. The cost actually came in lower than we would have expected, given the hype put on this restaurant. Wait staff was fine. Salad was yummy (huge though), meat was excellent but creamed spinach - whew - way too salty. We did see some tables getting corn bread and sour dough, though we just received the sour dough. Even so, It all came across as almost being WAY too much food. That's part of its M.O. we guess.

Have been coming here for many...many..years....Since the 50's....Giving away my age..
If you are looking for a prime rib house, this is the place to come..
The main course is served from a silver food cart...These thing date back to their opening in the late 40's...I remember one of the carts lost it's wheel..Was set up in the main dining room as a stationbary serving station.
Salad is mixed at the table by your waiter..Great yorkshire pudding..This menu has not changed since opening..Only the prices..AND..They have added a non-meat choice (fish).
The place is packed nightly..Must have a reservation, or you will be hanging around the bar for a while.
As they are on Van Ness Ave., parking is difficult. Valet service is avail.

This is one of my favorite dining spots in San Francisco. They are the best at Prime Rib and know every detail of how to serve it exactly as you want it. The sides are generous and very tasty. They have one of the most extensive wine lists that I've ever seen.
review_title: This is one of my favorite

review:
Twenty minutes after confirmed reservation. Got salad right away then had to wait forever for main meal.

tables cramped - meet cart could not get to our table - that is part of the experience, so very loud
Great place for a special dinner! Book in advance and don't eat ALL day beforehand.
We had a great time, celebrating my son's 30th birthday..

I love this place but it's nearly impossible to get a good reservation time on dates you want. Again, we had to settle for a 5:30pm dinner time and the drawback to this is the number of little kids and babies during that time. We had a great table but our dinner conversation was drowned out by the table of 7 little girls and one harried mother next to us. Next to join our dining area was the table for 20 with 4 unhappy babies and 4 restless 8-10 year olds! Beware of accepting this reservation time because this is what you likely be dining with. The food is very very good and service is superb but sometimes the surrounding company outweighs the food.
Great food. Been going since my early twenties, close to 35 years. Love, love the salad and yorkshire pudding.

As always, the prime rib was excellent. The baked potatoe was excellent, large and freshly baked. The creamed spinish was not very enticing. On previous visits the cream spinich was excellent. This time it was saturated with nuts and some sort of unknown flavor that made the spinich not very tastefull. Th salad dressing tasted like pickled beet juice saturated with vinigar, not very good. The service was also excellent and very accomidating. All in all it was a very god evening.
review_title: As always, the prime rib was

review: Service was excellent and accomodating. The food, as always, was well presented and of excellent quality and flavor and served hot. Atmosphere was noisy but that was expected given there didn't appear to be an empty seat in the house. Appreciated the amount of management involvement/supervision--kept everybody hopping. Loved the decor and warm, holiday, decorations. We had a table in the room with a fireplace and Christmas wreaths and lanterns coupled with the dark wood paneling and lower light level created an image of a previous century in England or the US.Good job, House of Prime Rib.
New server 2-weeks and understood the routine. Great food, best prime rib, with a great bar before dinner. Good wine list and excellent service.

My first experience with The House of Prime Rib was beyond excellent. This restaurant is a real find. The prime rib is priced slightly above other fine steakhouses, including ala carte, but well worth it. The staff is friendly and very attentive.

While the food was tasty, our waitress was extraordinarily inattentive, forgetful, rushed, and impatient to even listen to us finish our questions/statements. In addition, the valet personnel outside were rude as well. On the other hand, I was absolutely captivated and impressed by the service of the Asian man who consciously kept refilling our water glasses. He was very sweet. I personally tipped him.

WoW portions here are huge! Our server was amazing. We were seated promptly after arriving for our 7 pm reservation. The atmosphere was great not pretentious at all. At first, I must admit that I was a little intimidated by the fact that I was the only one in our party that liked my cut well done (an outrage apparently for true Prime Rib lovers) but in the end it was no big deal. I got the end cut which was well done but still so soft that my knife cut through it like butter. I would recommend this restaurant for special occasions or anytime you want to get your money's worth of delicious prime rib.
Food was excellent as it has been before, but the service wasn't quite as good as I was hoping, but it was likely just this one waiter that we had.
review_title: Food was excellent as it has

review: Overall excellent service, promptly greeted and reservation acknowledged. Bar service was great, we felt welcomed and not rushed. Service at the table was a definite A++
The House of Prime Rib is a must when I visit San Francisco. Delicious prime rib, excellent service and an energetic surroundings.  I never miss a chance to dine at this fine restaurant.
review_title: House of Prime Rib a Must Destinati

review: Excellent service and excellent food! Definitely a must-do! I will be back!
Excellent meal with outstanding quality. Felt a bit rushed by our server

I've been going here for years and they never disappoint. This is the best place for prime Rib. We went for a birthday - a lot of people do. And you are made to feel special even in a very polar place.
review_title: I've been going here for years

review: While the menu at the House of Prime Rib is rather limited (to prime rib and fish) They really do what they do the best, one of the best steaks I ever had. Sides were great too.
review_title: While the menu at the House

review: Great Old School feel to House of Prime Rib. Cocktail was fair but dinner was great! Pleasant staff.
review_title: Great Old School feel to House

review: My wife and I were talked into the City Cut of Prime Rib. We wanted to split a big cut, but were told that wouldn't work, so we each had a smaller cut, served with Baked Potato and spinach (included). It was OK. Not the best, but not the worst. The place was packed on a Sunday night, so obviously it's popular. I wouldn't go again. We like Mortons (a national chain better)
Always more than enough to eat. Food was delicious and service was excellent!

If you're a fan of just great food and a an outright great SF experience, House of Prime Rib is tops on the list. Service at House is top notch (Scott & David are my high reccomendations, but I'm sure they're all great as I haven't had all Waiters . . .yet). From doing Valet (For $8.00, it's the same as the Public Self Park lot and they park your car for you!) to checking in (treated with respect even when your party is not there yet), to being seated with Bread being brought (steaming hot upon arrival) to the Main Course . . . there's just not one complaint I can come up with . . . okay, maybe the traffic getting to SF, but House has no control of that . . . yet. Give it time, House will probably build a Bridge straight from Newark.
review_title: If someone gave neg, theyre stupid.

review: Incredible as always! Best meat, and best deal in town. Properly ranked as one of the Bay Area's top 100 restaurants by Michael Bauer (SF Chronicle).

Service was somewhat "pushy", i.e. we felt like they wanted to get rid of us as fast as possible. No nice preparation show of the salad anymore, just quickly and half absent. Prime Rib still good, but size seems to become smaller and thiner every time we come back. Additionally I got the first piece of a new junk of meat and it was not medium-rare as ordered, but well done half way through.
If you want beef and that's all, this is the place. Looks and feels like it has been here forever but clean and well appointed.
review_title: If you want beef and that's

review: Food was great and unlike most nicer restaurants it's a great value!
I lived in the City for 40 years and I finally to the HoPR and it was worth it. Good setting, food and price.
review_title: I lived in the City for 40

review: Still a classic spot in the city for a great prime rib dinner. Disappointed to have to wait 30 minutes even with a reservation, but still highly recommended. The House Cut has definitely grown smaller over the years.
review_title: Still a classic spot in the

review: I had one of the best Prime Rib in my life!...I would definitely go back if I ever come back to San Francisco!! Awesome experience!!!
House Of Prime Rib of S.F. is the only place to go. Very impressed with your style of food preparation service to table, outstanding.....
review_title: House Of Prime Rib of S.F.

review: Excellent Prime Rib. This is a perfect spot for meat eaters. Very generous with their serving.
A San Francisco Highlight. Our family has come here for 40 years!

A great place to enjoy the best Prime Rib. Service was excellent. Staff helped out each other making sure all of our request were taken care of. They explained the menu items in detail, size of cuts, side dishes etc, and were very friendly. Restaurant is very busy and crowded but the noise does not drown out your conversations. All the sides come with the dinner so you won't go home hungry and it is a great value.
Our service and food were excellent! We could not have asked for a better place to celebrate my Father-in-laws 95th Birthday.
IT IS A GREAT PLACE FOR SPECIAL OCCASIONS... ALWAYS VERY GOOD...
review_title: IT IS A GREAT PLACE FOR SPECIAL

review:
The best prime rib you will ever eat, ever! Make reservations at least c
A couple of weeks in advance. A truly memorable experience. My mother came here 50 yrs ago and it hasnt changed. GO!
Everything was great except we had to wait 45 minutes after our reservation time to get seated.
Excellent prime rib.  I made reservations and still had to wait 45 to be seated.

couldn't be any better. we came back after a few years of living far from s.f.
the only real problem was the noise. it sure seemed louder then the last time we where there.

over all you can't get better food or drinks in the placerville or sacramento areas.

we'll be back for my wife's birthday on aug 31.

The food here is amazing, very specific for prime rib only, but it is the best prime rib anywhere! The service was amazing and our server was extremely energetic. They will even serve you seconds free of charge...can't beat that.

Our waitress was great... Pete at the bar was wonderful... and Gus is outstanding!
Thank you for a perfect night!

I love our experience at the house of prime rib, it was our first time as we don't live in the USA. We are foodies and the rips are excellent, the meat melt in the mouth, the term that we requested was as it should be, the side dishes are a mouth watering, the corn bread and the salad. Everything was a super great experience.
The best cosmopolitan I ever had in all the countries I been.
review_title: I love our experience at the

review: HoPR is always a favorite. And its one of the best deals in town. A perfect meal every time.
Valet Parking must be paid before the dinner, that is a mistake and no corresponds to a good restaurant.

I have been to this place plenty of times to know what to expect. People come back to HOPR because they know what to expect in terms of food, service, and overall experience. Unfortunately I had a horrible experience on this trip. I took work colleagues from out of town and we had a 7:30 reservation. We were not seated at our table until 8pm! At any other restaurant, if you are forced to wait 30 minutes for your table, you should be comped a drink at the bar to hold you over... NOTHING! I was thoroughly embarrased by the staff at the front desk because they made me feel like I was at fault for asking what was going on with my table. When we did sit down we were stuck at a small corner booth and not the most ideal table for four men.
review_title: I have been to this place

review:
This is not a new adventure for me, I have been going to the House of Prime Rib for over 40 years, so you can be assured they be providing an excellent meal.
The menu hasn't changed but here that isn't a bad thing. The quality and the quantity of the prime rib is excellent, and if that is what you crave, this is the place.
Great spot! Delicious food, great wine, and excellent service! We'll be back!
English Cut was superb! Nice, tender & juicy and great having the Yorkshire pudding with it, too! Now if only you had a nice Sangiovese on the wine list, the would've been perfect!!

We have been going to the House of Prime Rib since 1982. The price has gone up quite substantially. The Henry the 8th cut has shrunk down to the city cut. The meal is still great but not for the price.
review_title: We have been going to the

review: A tradional Gem for my family and friends. Have been going to this restaurant for 3 decades. It is fabulous. Great food, service, and beautiful.
review_title: A tradional Gem for my family

review: All 6 of us are native San Franciscans and have eaten there many times. I will not go back. It was way oversold, the bartenders were way backed up and it took almost an hour after our reservation time to get sitted only to be seated at a table meant for four. We complained and they moved us to a booth that with an end chair that was maybe OK for 5 but not six. Anyway, at that point we just wanted to eat and get out of there. They should be dumped from the Chronicle 100 and they should have at least comped a drink or desert. The noise level was painful.
review_title: All 6 of us are native San

review: The HPR has been a place to go for good food and a place for me to entertain as I know what my costs will be due to limited menu. However, the salad and vegetables should be updated. They have added creamed corn and sauted spinach but when I had it a few evenings ago, both veggie servings were barely warm. Plus the amount of spinach served is huge. However, it is my nephew's favorite place to eat - he is from So Cal and a visit to SF is not successful until he has eaten at the HRP.
review_title: The HPR has been a place to

review: Food was incredible.......Minor complaint that the prime rib could have been a bit warmer....Great service...Awesome wine selection.

Celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary here...with our 2 kids! We don't get to spend our $$$ and eat out often, so House of Prime Rib is where we would turn to for consistency in good food, service,and ambiance. It was a treat for all of us!
Great presentation and food! Can"t wait to go back!

I had a chance to vist on the night of 8/16/10.
I found T.H.O.P.R. nice spot to drop a load of cash. The prime rib does not meet Bourdain's hype, or my expectation. I odered the king cut and it arrived prepaired to perfection. However, the two bone slab was only one bone thick!... What the heck! Needless to say I'm not too taken on the house of prime rib. Frankly, I've had much better at the midwest chain "Timber Lodge".

Would I come back?...No

Thanks
Bob from Minnesota
review_title: I had a chance to vist on

review: Prime rib could have used a little bit more flavor or salt. Very good but can't say it is the best I have ever had. Sides were really delicious. Our server was super friendly and professional. The ambiance was great. This restaurant is on target with the ambiance. Definitely will return.
The food was excellent - prime rib cooked just as ordered.
I LOVE this place!!!! I would come here every day if i could afford to. Outstanding!!!!
review_title: I LOVE this place!!!! I would

review: It was the best! My Husband and I are still talking about our first Dinner we had with you. We can not wait to come back, we will be taking my Mother there for her Birthday she will die it was unreal how amazing the food/service experience was!!! Thank you for it all I was so so impressed! I would eat there everyday it was so good!
review_title: It was the best! My Husband

review: Prime Rib is excellent as always. Great place for guests from out of town -- they loved it.

We had been looking forward to going to eat here and came on Easter. The restaurant was very busy and seemed chaotic. We were looking for an elegant vibe, but we didn't see that. Our waiter was great and very nice, but it was too expensive and the food was really just OK.

the service was great! and the food was so good the drinks hit the spot they do few things and they do them extermly well, would go back over and over again if I could...try it you will love it! we had a baby with us and they accommodated us

Great Prime Rib and great service.
If you are a prime rib purist, then the House of Prime Rib is definitely a must try.

This experience at this restaurant was excellent! My group of seven were seated immediatly as per our reservation. As always, the food was superb, without question. I did make this reservation thru the restaurant's own web site,= Very happy!!
thru "open table's site,= One hour wait.

Loved this place the first 2 times i came. This time was less memorable unfortunately due to a very large and obnoxious group that we were seated next to. They were so loud and belligerent that we could not even hear our own conversation. There must have been alcohol involved because everyone at the table just talked over each other louder and louder until the whole table was literally in a shouting match.(Wish the rating scale for noise went past energetic to uncomfortable) To the credit of the restaurant its hard to predict how the customers will act. It would have been nice to have had a table in the back were the lighting wasn't so bright and the patrons weren't so rude.

i think the prime rib was superb, but the sides/rest of the food could have been better. mayhe try offering a Caesar vs an iceberg lettuce salad with way too much dressing, or just sauteed spinach instead of creamed. I know it's an old fashioned menu, but the food still needs an update and a bit more refinement, if the bill for 2 is going to be around $200. i could eat a million other better plances in SF for $200.
review_title: i think the prime rib was

review: NOT THE BEST PRIME RIB I HAVE EVER HAD. WE HAD THE LARGE CUT AND IT WAS ONLY 1/1 " TO 3/4" AT BEST NO WHERE NEAR THE 16 TO 17 OZ THE WAITER SAID. lAWERYS IS MUCH BETTER. THEY PUT A EXTRA TABLE SO CLOSE TO OUR BOOTH THEY COULD NOT GET THE CARVING CART ANY WHERE NEAR US
review_title: NOT THE BEST PRIME RIB I HAVE

review: What a disappointment! We made reservations well in advance of arriving to San Francisco at a friends recommendation (10 days in advance). After running 20 Minutes behind on seating us, they tried to seat us right next to the kitchen doors in a back dining room rather than the front dining room. To their credit, when I told the hostess that this was unacceptable, they did move us to another table. Service from waiter was rushed like a cattle drive, wanting to turn the table as quickly as possible for the highest amount of tip opportunity........not about customer experience at all. Would not recommend! There are plenty of much better places with far superior interior ambience and decor: Try the Farralon in Union Square instead.....

House of Prime Rib is Awesome! It is pricey but the food is incredible! The atmosphere is great and energetic. The only bad thing I can think of is that there is always a wait time, even if you have a reservation, but it is worth the wait!
review_title: House of Prime Rib is Awesome!

review: Dine here several times a year and always a winner with everyone in the group. Food was fantastic, service was great. Overall experience was outstanding. Make reservations!

A party of 4 celebrating a birthday. Waitress was not sensitive to needs of the diner with vision difficulty in the dark restaurant. Food was good but not hot nor was the coffee in the first pot delivered to the table. The birthday girl was happy and they did make a fuss for her which was the point.
If you like prime rib then this is your place. Quick service, great cosmopolitan!!
review_title: If you like prime rib then

review: It was really, really noisy at the table we got near the fireplace. It was so hard to have a conversation we were practically yelling. we gave up trying to say much after a while. The food was very good. We have been going to this restaurant for many years. The prices have crept up but the food has been good over the years.

Dining at the house of prime rib was fantastic. For a constantly busy place, it was surprisingly quiet and quaint- easy to talk to those around you. Seating was comfortable and the service was top notch. Go hungry they serve a lot of food! Desserts looked amazing too but there was no room for them. As a side note, there aren't too many options beyond Prime Rib- they do have the catch of the day but this may not be the place to bring those that don't enjoy a good steak.
review_title: Dining at the house of prime

review: This restaurant always serves excellent food......mouth-watering beef.....with attentive waiters....always crowded, but the noise level is tolerable.
Always a good spot for a celebration. The food (prime rib) is predictable and tasty. We always have a good time in this lively, energetic restaurant.
review_title: Always a good spot for a celebratio

review: Went there for my birthday, waiter was nice but chef seemed indifferent. Other waiters must have been busy, only our waiter sang with my wife and kids and dessert for the birthday boy didnt get comp.
Only prime rib but it's a great value...even the martini's!
review_title: Only prime rib but it's a

review:
I love it here, great beef and a phenomenal salad.

Above average steak house.
review_title: I love it here, great beef

review: The food is delicious and atmosphere charming. The fixed price is a great deal and you won't leave hungry!
Houe of Prime Rib has been our favorite restaurant for 20 years. We will continue to go as they have great food, service and a warm atmosphere.
review_title: Houe of Prime Rib has been

review:
An excellent place for food and drink, as long as you're looking for prime rib! We received excellent service, on a busy Saturday night. Very traditional prime rib dinners, starting with the house salad (standard content, but the dressing is fantastic!), through the dinner with baked or mashed potato, Yorkshire pudding, cream spinach or corn. The spinach was surprisingly good. Prime rib was excellent, and we were offered seconds! On the dessert menu, the tiramisu was excellent, rivaling the very good one at Kuleto's.

The valet parking service was fast and efficient ($8).
We have always love having our special occasions at the House of Prime Rib; our wedding day was no exception. The food, ambiance, service was perfect making our dinner delightful and unforgettable.
The House of Prime Rib is a nice place to go for a special occasion. The decor and atmposphere are warm and enviting and help to make the dining experience truely enjoyable.
review_title: The House of Prime Rib is

review: House of Prime Rib exceeded my expectations (which were high to begin with). The Prime Rib was perfect and the service was excellent! We will definitely make a return visit.

I took my girlfriend here for her birthday thinking I would have a special night out. She ended up getting food poisoning and I felt I was cheated out of 145$!!!!!!!!I was embarrassed and so very disappointed . I will never go here again.
Our server, Dennis, was absolutely terrific (engaging, attentive and all-around enjoyable)!

Although we waited around 30-45 after our reserved time, we really enjoyed the interiors and the friendliness of the wait staff. Our food was very delicious and we had much more than we could stomach. Our server was not very skilled in assisting us with our wine selection, but he was friendly and our food arrived very quickly. Overall, we had a great time and would definitely recommend it to others.

Great food and service.  Can't wait to go back.  I will
be taking my whole family there.  Great service also at
the cocktail bar.

It's okay. But for what you pay, it was not a good value or experience. Service is harried. Food is decent enough. Crowd is generally nice. Nothing terrible. But nothing extraordinary either. I don't plan on coming back so it's good if you have never been. Otherwise, better value exists in the area if you want to look for them.
review_title: Only Need To Be Here Once

review:
It was Father's Day and I went under open table to see what could possibly be available for dinner.  It was close by and there was easy parking at the park even though I read there was a private lot which is another great thing to have.  The Asian bowl was fantastic and with the brown rice with half rice/half veggies, I felt I ate something very healthy. The one piece coffee mochi I had was just enough.  The server was very nice.  The only downside as reported by my son was that there is very limited bathroom space and it was a bit of a line when he even attempted to go by.
Thanks for asking!
This restaurant was more casual than we expected - definitely not romantic or elegant. But the food and service were good.
I come here often. Love the wasabi bowl, love the menu as a whole. Great place to take friends for lunch. I can also sit outside when I have my dog.

I ordered a new Hawaiian menu item, Poki(?) that contained mahi mahi and shrimp and other things. It had been melanged and the tastes were lost in a mush. Something called California Style or something. Not enjoyable at all. It was a birthday party and the other guests were satisfied with their orders. The calamari appetizer was a hit.
review_title: I ordered a new Hawaiian menu

review: Our first visit to Pacific Catch; our only concern that it might be a burgeoning chain going for quantity rather than quality. We decided to order multiple starters and share them to get a real taste of the place. Hawaiian Poke was decidedly a good start; good marinade and firm flavorful tuna. Korean Sticky ribs were also a winner. Edamame could have been a little warmer (bordered on cold). Thai Coconut Shrimp were sweet and firm. Fish & Chips was perfectly prepared although seemed a bit under-seasoned. Crab dumplings were excellent. Crab Louie Salad entree could use more dressing but flavors and prep were right. The Taco Platter was another solid choice. Wine from Claudia Springs was solid but pricey at $40. Server Ashley was outstanding.

I love the various ways fish is done here - Asian style, Mexican style, and more. I like my fish with interesting vegetables - not just potatoes or salad, so this is perfect for me. I didn't check scenic view, but the scenery is just across the steet in Golden Gate Park, and a walk in the park is perfect after a bigger than usual lunch.
review_title: I love the various ways fish

review: We love this place. The food is great, the service friendly and efficient, and the vibe positive and fun. We keep coming back, lured in part by the delicious ahi tuna salad.
review_title: We love this place. The food

review:
There were 5 in our party, one child included. Service was great, our cocktails were excellent especially the pear margaritas. I also liked that when I ordered the rice bowl the server told me about the option to add a little more salad and less rice for a lighter meal.
I have been here numerous times and always find the food well prepared and service fast.
