Isn't that his job? We had reminded him when we arrived of this request and he said it would be "no problem." What's happened to the management of this formerly excellent restaurant?
review_title: Not as good as it used to be

review: The House of Prime was very good and we'd would recommend it, though not sure it's in the outstanding category. The cost actually came in lower than we would have expected, given the hype put on this restaurant. Wait staff was fine. Salad was yummy (huge though), meat was excellent but creamed spinach - whew - way too salty. We did see some tables getting corn bread and sour dough, though we just received the sour dough. Even so, It all came across as almost being WAY too much food. That's part of its M.O. we guess.

Have been coming here for many...many..years....Since the 50's....Giving away my age..
If you are looking for a prime rib house, this is the place to come..
The main course is served from a silver food cart...These thing date back to their opening in the late 40's...I remember one of the carts lost it's wheel..Was set up in the main dining room as a stationbary serving station.
Salad is mixed at the table by your waiter..Great yorkshire pudding..This menu has not changed since opening..Only the prices..AND..They have added a non-meat choice (fish).
The place is packed nightly..Must have a reservation, or you will be hanging around the bar for a while.
As they are on Van Ness Ave., parking is difficult. Valet service is avail.

This is one of my favorite dining spots in San Francisco. They are the best at Prime Rib and know every detail of how to serve it exactly as you want it. The sides are generous and very tasty. They have one of the most extensive wine lists that I've ever seen.
review_title: This is one of my favorite

review:
Twenty minutes after confirmed reservation. Got salad right away then had to wait forever for main meal.

tables cramped - meet cart could not get to our table - that is part of the experience, so very loud
Great place for a special dinner! Book in advance and don't eat ALL day beforehand.
We had a great time, celebrating my son's 30th birthday..

I love this place but it's nearly impossible to get a good reservation time on dates you want. Again, we had to settle for a 5:30pm dinner time and the drawback to this is the number of little kids and babies during that time. We had a great table but our dinner conversation was drowned out by the table of 7 little girls and one harried mother next to us. Next to join our dining area was the table for 20 with 4 unhappy babies and 4 restless 8-10 year olds! Beware of accepting this reservation time because this is what you likely be dining with. The food is very very good and service is superb but sometimes the surrounding company outweighs the food.
Great food. Been going since my early twenties, close to 35 years. Love, love the salad and yorkshire pudding.

As always, the prime rib was excellent. The baked potatoe was excellent, large and freshly baked. The creamed spinish was not very enticing. On previous visits the cream spinich was excellent. This time it was saturated with nuts and some sort of unknown flavor that made the spinich not very tastefull. Th salad dressing tasted like pickled beet juice saturated with vinigar, not very good. The service was also excellent and very accomidating. All in all it was a very god evening.
review_title: As always, the prime rib was

review: Service was excellent and accomodating. The food, as always, was well presented and of excellent quality and flavor and served hot. Atmosphere was noisy but that was expected given there didn't appear to be an empty seat in the house. Appreciated the amount of management involvement/supervision--kept everybody hopping. Loved the decor and warm, holiday, decorations. We had a table in the room with a fireplace and Christmas wreaths and lanterns coupled with the dark wood paneling and lower light level created an image of a previous century in England or the US.Good job, House of Prime Rib.
New server 2-weeks and understood the routine. Great food, best prime rib, with a great bar before dinner. Good wine list and excellent service.

My first experience with The House of Prime Rib was beyond excellent. This restaurant is a real find. The prime rib is priced slightly above other fine steakhouses, including ala carte, but well worth it. The staff is friendly and very attentive.

While the food was tasty, our waitress was extraordinarily inattentive, forgetful, rushed, and impatient to even listen to us finish our questions/statements. In addition, the valet personnel outside were rude as well. On the other hand, I was absolutely captivated and impressed by the service of the Asian man who consciously kept refilling our water glasses. He was very sweet. I personally tipped him.

WoW portions here are huge! Our server was amazing. We were seated promptly after arriving for our 7 pm reservation. The atmosphere was great not pretentious at all. At first, I must admit that I was a little intimidated by the fact that I was the only one in our party that liked my cut well done (an outrage apparently for true Prime Rib lovers) but in the end it was no big deal. I got the end cut which was well done but still so soft that my knife cut through it like butter. I would recommend this restaurant for special occasions or anytime you want to get your money's worth of delicious prime rib.
Food was excellent as it has been before, but the service wasn't quite as good as I was hoping, but it was likely just this one waiter that we had.
review_title: Food was excellent as it has

review: Overall excellent service, promptly greeted and reservation acknowledged. Bar service was great, we felt welcomed and not rushed. Service at the table was a definite A++
The House of Prime Rib is a must when I visit San Francisco. Delicious prime rib, excellent service and an energetic surroundings.  I never miss a chance to dine at this fine restaurant.
review_title: House of Prime Rib a Must Destinati

review: Excellent service and excellent food! Definitely a must-do! I will be back!
Excellent meal with outstanding quality. Felt a bit rushed by our server

I've been going here for years and they never disappoint. This is the best place for prime Rib. We went for a birthday - a lot of people do. And you are made to feel special even in a very polar place.
review_title: I've been going here for years

review: While the menu at the House of Prime Rib is rather limited (to prime rib and fish) They really do what they do the best, one of the best steaks I ever had. Sides were great too.
review_title: While the menu at the House

review: Great Old School feel to House of Prime Rib. Cocktail was fair but dinner was great! Pleasant staff.
review_title: Great Old School feel to House

review: My wife and I were talked into the City Cut of Prime Rib. We wanted to split a big cut, but were told that wouldn't work, so we each had a smaller cut, served with Baked Potato and spinach (included). It was OK. Not the best, but not the worst. The place was packed on a Sunday night, so obviously it's popular. I wouldn't go again. We like Mortons (a national chain better)
Always more than enough to eat. Food was delicious and service was excellent!

If you're a fan of just great food and a an outright great SF experience, House of Prime Rib is tops on the list. Service at House is top notch (Scott & David are my high reccomendations, but I'm sure they're all great as I haven't had all Waiters . . .yet). From doing Valet (For $8.00, it's the same as the Public Self Park lot and they park your car for you!) to checking in (treated with respect even when your party is not there yet), to being seated with Bread being brought (steaming hot upon arrival) to the Main Course . . . there's just not one complaint I can come up with . . . okay, maybe the traffic getting to SF, but House has no control of that . . . yet. Give it time, House will probably build a Bridge straight from Newark.
review_title: If someone gave neg, theyre stupid.

review: Incredible as always! Best meat, and best deal in town. Properly ranked as one of the Bay Area's top 100 restaurants by Michael Bauer (SF Chronicle).

Service was somewhat "pushy", i.e. we felt like they wanted to get rid of us as fast as possible. No nice preparation show of the salad anymore, just quickly and half absent. Prime Rib still good, but size seems to become smaller and thiner every time we come back. Additionally I got the first piece of a new junk of meat and it was not medium-rare as ordered, but well done half way through.
If you want beef and that's all, this is the place. Looks and feels like it has been here forever but clean and well appointed.
review_title: If you want beef and that's

review: Food was great and unlike most nicer restaurants it's a great value!
I lived in the City for 40 years and I finally to the HoPR and it was worth it. Good setting, food and price.
review_title: I lived in the City for 40

review: Still a classic spot in the city for a great prime rib dinner. Disappointed to have to wait 30 minutes even with a reservation, but still highly recommended. The House Cut has definitely grown smaller over the years.
review_title: Still a classic spot in the

review: I had one of the best Prime Rib in my life!...I would definitely go back if I ever come back to San Francisco!! Awesome experience!!!
House Of Prime Rib of S.F. is the only place to go. Very impressed with your style of food preparation service to table, outstanding.....
review_title: House Of Prime Rib of S.F.

review: Excellent Prime Rib. This is a perfect spot for meat eaters. Very generous with their serving.
A San Francisco Highlight. Our family has come here for 40 years!

A great place to enjoy the best Prime Rib. Service was excellent. Staff helped out each other making sure all of our request were taken care of. They explained the menu items in detail, size of cuts, side dishes etc, and were very friendly. Restaurant is very busy and crowded but the noise does not drown out your conversations. All the sides come with the dinner so you won't go home hungry and it is a great value.
Our service and food were excellent! We could not have asked for a better place to celebrate my Father-in-laws 95th Birthday.
IT IS A GREAT PLACE FOR SPECIAL OCCASIONS... ALWAYS VERY GOOD...
review_title: IT IS A GREAT PLACE FOR SPECIAL

review:
The best prime rib you will ever eat, ever! Make reservations at least c
A couple of weeks in advance. A truly memorable experience. My mother came here 50 yrs ago and it hasnt changed. GO!
Everything was great except we had to wait 45 minutes after our reservation time to get seated.
Excellent prime rib.  I made reservations and still had to wait 45 to be seated.

couldn't be any better. we came back after a few years of living far from s.f.
the only real problem was the noise. it sure seemed louder then the last time we where there.

over all you can't get better food or drinks in the placerville or sacramento areas.

we'll be back for my wife's birthday on aug 31.

The food here is amazing, very specific for prime rib only, but it is the best prime rib anywhere! The service was amazing and our server was extremely energetic. They will even serve you seconds free of charge...can't beat that.

Our waitress was great... Pete at the bar was wonderful... and Gus is outstanding!
Thank you for a perfect night!

I love our experience at the house of prime rib, it was our first time as we don't live in the USA. We are foodies and the rips are excellent, the meat melt in the mouth, the term that we requested was as it should be, the side dishes are a mouth watering, the corn bread and the salad. Everything was a super great experience.
The best cosmopolitan I ever had in all the countries I been.
review_title: I love our experience at the

review: HoPR is always a favorite. And its one of the best deals in town. A perfect meal every time.
Valet Parking must be paid before the dinner, that is a mistake and no corresponds to a good restaurant.

I have been to this place plenty of times to know what to expect. People come back to HOPR because they know what to expect in terms of food, service, and overall experience. Unfortunately I had a horrible experience on this trip. I took work colleagues from out of town and we had a 7:30 reservation. We were not seated at our table until 8pm! At any other restaurant, if you are forced to wait 30 minutes for your table, you should be comped a drink at the bar to hold you over... NOTHING! I was thoroughly embarrased by the staff at the front desk because they made me feel like I was at fault for asking what was going on with my table. When we did sit down we were stuck at a small corner booth and not the most ideal table for four men.
review_title: I have been to this place

review:
This is not a new adventure for me, I have been going to the House of Prime Rib for over 40 years, so you can be assured they be providing an excellent meal.
The menu hasn't changed but here that isn't a bad thing. The quality and the quantity of the prime rib is excellent, and if that is what you crave, this is the place.
Great spot! Delicious food, great wine, and excellent service! We'll be back!
English Cut was superb! Nice, tender & juicy and great having the Yorkshire pudding with it, too! Now if only you had a nice Sangiovese on the wine list, the would've been perfect!!

We have been going to the House of Prime Rib since 1982. The price has gone up quite substantially. The Henry the 8th cut has shrunk down to the city cut. The meal is still great but not for the price.
review_title: We have been going to the

review: A tradional Gem for my family and friends. Have been going to this restaurant for 3 decades. It is fabulous. Great food, service, and beautiful.
review_title: A tradional Gem for my family

review: All 6 of us are native San Franciscans and have eaten there many times. I will not go back. It was way oversold, the bartenders were way backed up and it took almost an hour after our reservation time to get sitted only to be seated at a table meant for four. We complained and they moved us to a booth that with an end chair that was maybe OK for 5 but not six. Anyway, at that point we just wanted to eat and get out of there. They should be dumped from the Chronicle 100 and they should have at least comped a drink or desert. The noise level was painful.
review_title: All 6 of us are native San

review: The HPR has been a place to go for good food and a place for me to entertain as I know what my costs will be due to limited menu. However, the salad and vegetables should be updated. They have added creamed corn and sauted spinach but when I had it a few evenings ago, both veggie servings were barely warm. Plus the amount of spinach served is huge. However, it is my nephew's favorite place to eat - he is from So Cal and a visit to SF is not successful until he has eaten at the HRP.
review_title: The HPR has been a place to

review: Food was incredible.......Minor complaint that the prime rib could have been a bit warmer....Great service...Awesome wine selection.

Celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary here...with our 2 kids! We don't get to spend our $$$ and eat out often, so House of Prime Rib is where we would turn to for consistency in good food, service,and ambiance. It was a treat for all of us!
Great presentation and food! Can"t wait to go back!

I had a chance to vist on the night of 8/16/10.
I found T.H.O.P.R. nice spot to drop a load of cash. The prime rib does not meet Bourdain's hype, or my expectation. I odered the king cut and it arrived prepaired to perfection. However, the two bone slab was only one bone thick!... What the heck! Needless to say I'm not too taken on the house of prime rib. Frankly, I've had much better at the midwest chain "Timber Lodge".

Would I come back?...No

Thanks
Bob from Minnesota
review_title: I had a chance to vist on

review: Prime rib could have used a little bit more flavor or salt. Very good but can't say it is the best I have ever had. Sides were really delicious. Our server was super friendly and professional. The ambiance was great. This restaurant is on target with the ambiance. Definitely will return.
The food was excellent - prime rib cooked just as ordered.
I LOVE this place!!!! I would come here every day if i could afford to. Outstanding!!!!
review_title: I LOVE this place!!!! I would

review: It was the best! My Husband and I are still talking about our first Dinner we had with you. We can not wait to come back, we will be taking my Mother there for her Birthday she will die it was unreal how amazing the food/service experience was!!! Thank you for it all I was so so impressed! I would eat there everyday it was so good!
review_title: It was the best! My Husband

review: Prime Rib is excellent as always. Great place for guests from out of town -- they loved it.

We had been looking forward to going to eat here and came on Easter. The restaurant was very busy and seemed chaotic. We were looking for an elegant vibe, but we didn't see that. Our waiter was great and very nice, but it was too expensive and the food was really just OK.

the service was great! and the food was so good the drinks hit the spot they do few things and they do them extermly well, would go back over and over again if I could...try it you will love it! we had a baby with us and they accommodated us

Great Prime Rib and great service.
If you are a prime rib purist, then the House of Prime Rib is definitely a must try.

This experience at this restaurant was excellent! My group of seven were seated immediatly as per our reservation. As always, the food was superb, without question. I did make this reservation thru the restaurant's own web site,= Very happy!!
thru "open table's site,= One hour wait.

Loved this place the first 2 times i came. This time was less memorable unfortunately due to a very large and obnoxious group that we were seated next to. They were so loud and belligerent that we could not even hear our own conversation. There must have been alcohol involved because everyone at the table just talked over each other louder and louder until the whole table was literally in a shouting match.(Wish the rating scale for noise went past energetic to uncomfortable) To the credit of the restaurant its hard to predict how the customers will act. It would have been nice to have had a table in the back were the lighting wasn't so bright and the patrons weren't so rude.

i think the prime rib was superb, but the sides/rest of the food could have been better. mayhe try offering a Caesar vs an iceberg lettuce salad with way too much dressing, or just sauteed spinach instead of creamed. I know it's an old fashioned menu, but the food still needs an update and a bit more refinement, if the bill for 2 is going to be around $200. i could eat a million other better plances in SF for $200.
review_title: i think the prime rib was

review: NOT THE BEST PRIME RIB I HAVE EVER HAD. WE HAD THE LARGE CUT AND IT WAS ONLY 1/1 " TO 3/4" AT BEST NO WHERE NEAR THE 16 TO 17 OZ THE WAITER SAID. lAWERYS IS MUCH BETTER. THEY PUT A EXTRA TABLE SO CLOSE TO OUR BOOTH THEY COULD NOT GET THE CARVING CART ANY WHERE NEAR US
review_title: NOT THE BEST PRIME RIB I HAVE

review: What a disappointment! We made reservations well in advance of arriving to San Francisco at a friends recommendation (10 days in advance). After running 20 Minutes behind on seating us, they tried to seat us right next to the kitchen doors in a back dining room rather than the front dining room. To their credit, when I told the hostess that this was unacceptable, they did move us to another table. Service from waiter was rushed like a cattle drive, wanting to turn the table as quickly as possible for the highest amount of tip opportunity........not about customer experience at all. Would not recommend! There are plenty of much better places with far superior interior ambience and decor: Try the Farralon in Union Square instead.....

House of Prime Rib is Awesome! It is pricey but the food is incredible! The atmosphere is great and energetic. The only bad thing I can think of is that there is always a wait time, even if you have a reservation, but it is worth the wait!
review_title: House of Prime Rib is Awesome!

review: Dine here several times a year and always a winner with everyone in the group. Food was fantastic, service was great. Overall experience was outstanding. Make reservations!

A party of 4 celebrating a birthday. Waitress was not sensitive to needs of the diner with vision difficulty in the dark restaurant. Food was good but not hot nor was the coffee in the first pot delivered to the table. The birthday girl was happy and they did make a fuss for her which was the point.
If you like prime rib then this is your place. Quick service, great cosmopolitan!!
review_title: If you like prime rib then

review: It was really, really noisy at the table we got near the fireplace. It was so hard to have a conversation we were practically yelling. we gave up trying to say much after a while. The food was very good. We have been going to this restaurant for many years. The prices have crept up but the food has been good over the years.

Dining at the house of prime rib was fantastic. For a constantly busy place, it was surprisingly quiet and quaint- easy to talk to those around you. Seating was comfortable and the service was top notch. Go hungry they serve a lot of food! Desserts looked amazing too but there was no room for them. As a side note, there aren't too many options beyond Prime Rib- they do have the catch of the day but this may not be the place to bring those that don't enjoy a good steak.
review_title: Dining at the house of prime

review: This restaurant always serves excellent food......mouth-watering beef.....with attentive waiters....always crowded, but the noise level is tolerable.
Always a good spot for a celebration. The food (prime rib) is predictable and tasty. We always have a good time in this lively, energetic restaurant.
review_title: Always a good spot for a celebratio

review: Went there for my birthday, waiter was nice but chef seemed indifferent. Other waiters must have been busy, only our waiter sang with my wife and kids and dessert for the birthday boy didnt get comp.
Only prime rib but it's a great value...even the martini's!
review_title: Only prime rib but it's a

review:
I love it here, great beef and a phenomenal salad.

Above average steak house.
review_title: I love it here, great beef

review: The food is delicious and atmosphere charming. The fixed price is a great deal and you won't leave hungry!
Houe of Prime Rib has been our favorite restaurant for 20 years. We will continue to go as they have great food, service and a warm atmosphere.
review_title: Houe of Prime Rib has been

review:
An excellent place for food and drink, as long as you're looking for prime rib! We received excellent service, on a busy Saturday night. Very traditional prime rib dinners, starting with the house salad (standard content, but the dressing is fantastic!), through the dinner with baked or mashed potato, Yorkshire pudding, cream spinach or corn. The spinach was surprisingly good. Prime rib was excellent, and we were offered seconds! On the dessert menu, the tiramisu was excellent, rivaling the very good one at Kuleto's.

The valet parking service was fast and efficient ($8).
We have always love having our special occasions at the House of Prime Rib; our wedding day was no exception. The food, ambiance, service was perfect making our dinner delightful and unforgettable.
The House of Prime Rib is a nice place to go for a special occasion. The decor and atmposphere are warm and enviting and help to make the dining experience truely enjoyable.
review_title: The House of Prime Rib is

review: House of Prime Rib exceeded my expectations (which were high to begin with). The Prime Rib was perfect and the service was excellent! We will definitely make a return visit.

I took my girlfriend here for her birthday thinking I would have a special night out. She ended up getting food poisoning and I felt I was cheated out of 145$!!!!!!!!I was embarrassed and so very disappointed . I will never go here again.
Our server, Dennis, was absolutely terrific (engaging, attentive and all-around enjoyable)!

Although we waited around 30-45 after our reserved time, we really enjoyed the interiors and the friendliness of the wait staff. Our food was very delicious and we had much more than we could stomach. Our server was not very skilled in assisting us with our wine selection, but he was friendly and our food arrived very quickly. Overall, we had a great time and would definitely recommend it to others.

Great food and service.  Can't wait to go back.  I will
be taking my whole family there.  Great service also at
the cocktail bar.

It's okay. But for what you pay, it was not a good value or experience. Service is harried. Food is decent enough. Crowd is generally nice. Nothing terrible. But nothing extraordinary either. I don't plan on coming back so it's good if you have never been. Otherwise, better value exists in the area if you want to look for them.
review_title: Only Need To Be Here Once

review:
It was Father's Day and I went under open table to see what could possibly be available for dinner.  It was close by and there was easy parking at the park even though I read there was a private lot which is another great thing to have.  The Asian bowl was fantastic and with the brown rice with half rice/half veggies, I felt I ate something very healthy. The one piece coffee mochi I had was just enough.  The server was very nice.  The only downside as reported by my son was that there is very limited bathroom space and it was a bit of a line when he even attempted to go by.
Thanks for asking!
This restaurant was more casual than we expected - definitely not romantic or elegant. But the food and service were good.
I come here often. Love the wasabi bowl, love the menu as a whole. Great place to take friends for lunch. I can also sit outside when I have my dog.

I ordered a new Hawaiian menu item, Poki(?) that contained mahi mahi and shrimp and other things. It had been melanged and the tastes were lost in a mush. Something called California Style or something. Not enjoyable at all. It was a birthday party and the other guests were satisfied with their orders. The calamari appetizer was a hit.
review_title: I ordered a new Hawaiian menu

review: Our first visit to Pacific Catch; our only concern that it might be a burgeoning chain going for quantity rather than quality. We decided to order multiple starters and share them to get a real taste of the place. Hawaiian Poke was decidedly a good start; good marinade and firm flavorful tuna. Korean Sticky ribs were also a winner. Edamame could have been a little warmer (bordered on cold). Thai Coconut Shrimp were sweet and firm. Fish & Chips was perfectly prepared although seemed a bit under-seasoned. Crab dumplings were excellent. Crab Louie Salad entree could use more dressing but flavors and prep were right. The Taco Platter was another solid choice. Wine from Claudia Springs was solid but pricey at $40. Server Ashley was outstanding.

I love the various ways fish is done here - Asian style, Mexican style, and more. I like my fish with interesting vegetables - not just potatoes or salad, so this is perfect for me. I didn't check scenic view, but the scenery is just across the steet in Golden Gate Park, and a walk in the park is perfect after a bigger than usual lunch.
review_title: I love the various ways fish

review: We love this place. The food is great, the service friendly and efficient, and the vibe positive and fun. We keep coming back, lured in part by the delicious ahi tuna salad.
review_title: We love this place. The food

review:
There were 5 in our party, one child included. Service was great, our cocktails were excellent especially the pear margaritas. I also liked that when I ordered the rice bowl the server told me about the option to add a little more salad and less rice for a lighter meal.
I have been here numerous times and always find the food well prepared and service fast.

Pacific Catch serves food that is OK "California" style. My fish was fresh and adequately prepared. Service was pleasant.
There was too much food on the plate.

Pacific Catch has the best drink menu!!! I have tried everything on the menu and it's hard to pick a favorite because they are so good. The entire staff were very friendly and accommodating. Also, the food was delicious and the portions were perfect!!!

Our first trip to Pacific Catch certainly won't be our last! We were thoroughly impressed with the ambiance, service and especially the food. It was a perfect dining experience that we hope to recreate again and again!
Food and ambiance were great. We had a female server who was not attentive and responded to our requests like we were the boogieman.
Very nice for a small business lunch meeting - wonderful, attentive yet quiet and discrete server.
review_title: Very nice for a small business

review: fabulous food! delicious! i'm a repeated costumer!

Very noisy restaurant with rather uninterested service. Food is confused - Is it Asian, Latino, seafood, comfort food? None of them were done well. All of the salsas were bland, but colorful. No bread or tortillas with the meal. Very stingy wine pours.

The food is tasty. The menu focuses on fish and seafood and there is obvious attention paid to freshness and taste. The restaurant's interior is modern and cool-looking, but at the same time homey and comfy. Very nice for dinner for two or a dinner party for eight.
review_title: The food is tasty. The menu

review: Great location. Easy parking in Golden Gate Park. Food was good, fish was fresh. Restaurant has a little bit of a coffee shop ambience.  Wine list reasonably priced. I enjoyed the unfiltered cold sake.

Didn't appreciate the "attitude" of front desk hostess when we asked to be seated at a two-person booth, rather than a table in the middle of floor.  She informed us those were for reservations -- but we had a  reservation, too!
it was not a Michelin star standard in service or food presentation and overall experience.very disappointed
review_title: it was not a Michelin star standard in s...

review: We had a group of 11 people for a business lunch at Luce this week and I could not have been more pleased.  The private dining room was fantastic, the food very interesting and delicious and the service was superior.  I will certainly recommend and use this restaurant for business functions in the future.

Tasting menu with wine pairings - extremely underwhelmed. Not a Michelin Star quality restaurant - wine pairings were of poor quality - tops $15/glass category and considering that the tasting pour is lesser, very poor choices. One pour was a$10 beer! Nope did not work. The lobster course was a flop - undercooked lobster and it was at best 1/4th of a lobster. The lamb loin was strictly Ok - poor pairing of a chianti - no big California top name wines. Dessert was a joke - a small tart. Same wine glass used for Red, white and beer!We had informed the restaurant that we were staying at the hotel and celebrating our anniversary. We were treated to a table by the server station. Kindly asked to be moved. No acknowledgement of our celebration.

Spectacular yet reasonably priced holiday menu. Excellent wine pairing, well worth the extra cost. Knowledgeable and approachable sommelier. Service was friendly, informed, and efficient, as expected for a restaurant of this caliber. Will definitely return.

Minor critiques: asked for a quiet table, but were seated next to the "bistro" section, outside of kitchen entrances, so a bit noisy for our senior diners; for holiday dinner at Michelin restaurant, expected a second more substantial amuse bouche, beyond the yummy but tiny parmesan chive madeleines, especially since we were asked twice about lobster allergies.

The lobster was the best I have ever eaten - it was fantastic. My wife had the rib-eye and was just as pleased. The service was outstanding throughout the evening. Our meal was delayed and a complementary appetizer was brought to us with an apology. The only downside was that our table was not too far from the bar which was very noisy. Overall a great experience.

The service was excellent and the staff was attentive and very friendly. The staff explained each of the dishes that we ordered and explain the preparation of each dish.
The chef was excellent with fantastic flavoring and the presentation was beautiful. Excellent for special occasions and the ambiance is superb. Highly recommend and a gem in San Francisco.
We had lunch and the place was very quiet. I know that when something is on at Moscone the place is packed. Service was very good.
review_title: We had lunch and the place

review: Our waiter was a little too eager for us to place our order, returning to our table three times in 10 mins. The food was OK. It was good but didn't blow me away.
review_title: Our waiter was a little too

review: The food was exquisite. Our party of 4 had such a wonderful time that we were one of the last tables to leave. The staff was attentive but unobtrusive.

We have dined at Luce before and have always had a good experience. The sommelier was very helpful, service was attentive and the food was interesting--in a good way. Both of our mains were terrific. Although Luce's potential dining area is large, they do a good job of grouping diners in a smaller section, making it appear more intimate. The noise was "energetic" only because there was a large group, and they were removed from the primary dining area.
review_title: We have dined at Luce before

review: Went there for breakfast.  Outstanding.  A bit pricey but loved the service and the food.
We had the chef's menu. The wine pairings were the favorite portion of the evening. It would have been nice to have a list of the wines as a take away.
review_title: We had the chef's menu. The

review: Excellent meal in every respect -- cuisine, food, ambiance. The dishes are imaginative and well executed. The heirloom tomato and melon salad was both beautiful and toothsome; the sweetbread ravioli with truffles was subtle yet full of flavor; and the goat cheese cheesecake with honey was a superb ending to our meal

The menu is short, but the beautifully presented dishes linger in your memory. I do wish the chef would believe us when we ask for "very rare" beef and lamb--the meat was medium rare, but tender and tasty. The sommelier is personable and knowledgeable, and he was assiduous about keeping our glasses replenished; given his care, we wondered why the busboy never offered us a second roll. Desserts are spectacularly good. Diners seem to be mostly executives staying at the hotel on expense accounts that can absorb the high prices.
review_title: The menu is short, but the

review: We waited over one hour for our breakfast. It was then over cooked and had obviously been sitting under a heat lamp. Our server was nice but completly overwhelmed. There were two managers helping but I still sat with an empty water glass for 30 minutes and never received a refill of hot water for my tea. Go to Dottie's or some other diner downtown. This overpriced hotel restaurant was a mess.
Venison and beef tenderloin were outstanding. Charmed by the amusing touches to the meal.

Creative menu from Iron Chef America. Incredibly fresh and local ingredients and beautiful presentation. Excellent service and attention to every detail. Would definitely go back. The ambiance was a bit cold, much like a restaurant in a business hotel. Would have preferred something a bit more warm and intimate, but the food and service blew it away.

Eating anywhere for brunch may not capture what eating there for dinner might be like.  That probably should not be the case.  A restaurant should offer the same basic experience regardless of the time of day.  But we'll cut them a break - but for brunch Luce felt like a hotel restaurant (it's in the Renaissance Hotel) that was just going through the motions.  The service was probably somewhere between fair and poor, the food somewhere between good and very good. So overall it was not a bad experience but clearly the people from Michelin either let the staff know they were coming or came for a meal other than brunch.

Great food - the best ennocis I have ever eaten. The venison was also excellent. Sparse on the vegetables. Service good but not up to the highest standards. Tables too close together. Noise from the attached bar was too loud and spoiled the meal. Bars that are co-located with the restaurant are not a good mix.

Food was excellent but our server was truly a disappointment, & definitely affected our overall experience. He was not knowledgeable about the dishes served, e.g., when I asked what was in the winter vegetable dish, his response was "Oh, you know, potatoes & things; whatever winter vegetables we get." He told the table next to us that the goat cheese was brie, he told us the ice cream was coconut (which it was not); then I overheard another server describe it as passion fruit (which it was). We asked about the wine pairings & were told that what they "might be", unless he decided to override the wine director's selections, "just because he could". This restaurant would have never received the Michelin star if served by this person.
The food was great and not overpriced. I've eaten much worse food for a lot more money. Luce was excellent, and didn't cost an arm and a leg.
review_title: The food was great and not

review: I was very disappointed in the experience at Luce. From arrival things were off. The hostess, although nice, was WAY to familiar with someone she didn't know. Water arrived over 10 minutes after we sat down and it was over 20 for the server to even discuss the menu and longer to order. A very high ceiling and no acoustics as well as tables that are close together (some in cafeteria style), means there is little privacy or separation. The food, albeit imaginative, was over-thought and too creative. A salad that didn't have tomatoes according to the server actually had tomatoes. Descriptions of wines was "I really like that one" and "it's really good" - overall beautiful food that tries too hard and lack of service. No need to go back.
a beautiful space and friendly service but the food was only average

Very impressed with the food. Dominique Crenn, the chef, is very creative and pays a lot of attention to detail in the flavors and presentation of the dishes. The surf and turf carpaccio is amazing, and I also really enjoyed the baby root vegetables with black olive soil. On all of the dishes, I liked the way the flavors and textures of the ingredients came through in a clear way and complemented each other on the plate, without being heavy and muddled.

It was OK, but not great considering the price and reputation. The use of exotic ingredients and techniques (eg. Foam and "soil") was overdone and did not add much. The dessert was very mediocre (a gourmet, deconstructed "S'more")--looked cool, sounded good, but wasn't actually very delicious.
review_title: It was OK, but not great considerin

review:
Air-conditioning at full blast.

Food excellent.

Need more attention to details in general. 

Good service from Ron. Thank you.

I was pleasantly surprised - the food was top-notch; and our waiter exceptional.  I hope more people hear about this place.  My only reco would be to make the desserts a bit more approachable -- it's tough after having apps and entrees that are so complex and layered with so many tantalizing flavors to have to go thru the same thing for dessert.  The biscotti dessert had some off flavors that didn't quite work -- the semifreddo on the other hand was sublime.  An "easier" assortment would have been welcomed (eg. fruit crisp, pot de creme, something caramel based, etc.).  Just a nit!
Nicely varied menu, great food and service.  The specialty cocktails are unusual (at least to us) but yummy good.  Great location too.  We will visit there again-

We had a large group of 12 for my graduation dinner and they were extremely accommodating, considering we got there pretty late in the evening. The food was delicious and the overall feel was very warm and romantic. Great place for special occasion dinners or dates. I will be coming here again for my next graduation dinner.
Our server was very friendly and upbeat, knowledgeable about the menu.
Exceeded my expectations. Food was served quickly, hot and fresh.
A very good neighborhood place with a full bar and nice people. We were too late for it this time, but there are also great happy hour specials.
food and service were very good but prices are too high for what is essentially a pleasant neighborhood spot.
The waitress was very kind in replacing my meal when it came out different than I thought I had ordered.

This is my third time to La Folie and it is consistently one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Moreover, I'm not even usually into French food, but the flavors and presentation here are impeccable. My recs: seared foie gras, warm dungeness crab, lobster risotto (again I usually don't event like risotto, but this one is amazing). Only minor criticism- I have yet to find a dessert that I enjoy as much as the rest of the meal Do yourself a favor and go here now!

First time dining here and I wish I could afford to eat here more often. Our server, Mandy, was amazing and the food was incredible. The chef made a point to stop at every table and make sure the food was to everyone's liking. Next special occasion we'll be making reservations here.

This is as good as it gets for the overall Old School French Dining. Be sure to start with the caviar, it was the highlight of our meal. Everything was beautiful. Our only letdown course was a trio of oyster, scallop ceviche and hamachi. Everything was covered in TONS of orange roe, masking the favors of everything else. The scallop ceviche was in a creamy sauce, not acidic as I expected. Soft on soft, couldn't taste the scallop. That being said, everything else was really good . Love the bearnaise croquette and the tendon chip. The baked Alaska was gorgeous.

Amazing food! Every bite was so delicious.  Each course is presented so beautifully like a work of art.  It was so difficult to decide which dishes to order since there are so many wonderful dishes to choose from.  Great service from beginning to end.
review_title: Food tastes as good as it looks!

review:
I took my husband for his 65th birthday celebration - Roland met us at the door - The waitstaff made us feel special and gave us a corner table with a view of the entire restaurant. Trey, our waiter, was attentive and yet not pushy and full of great information about food and wine in the restaurant! 
Highly recommend La Folie for your special occasion!

We enjoyed the food but ended up feeling to full after taking the four course prix fixe. I would probably rate it higher if I had three courses. The fish was very good, and duck main course was nice but on the heavy side.
This was a pricey night, but the flavors and textures of the food were worth it. The service was attentive, ambisnce appropriate for the type and price of the dinner.
We enjoyed our experience at La Folie. Service was impeccable and food was very good.

This is a long multiple courses kind of place and I was not prepare for it.
The seafood and desert dishes stood out better than the poultry dishes.
Or was it the wao factor disapated when the poultry entrees arrived?!
Was a little disappointed after the hype of the place.
Or maybe I am just a more simple tapas kind of gal...?!

Everyone needs to go here. Crazy fantastic good. We were a table of 3 and shared everything ( you have to, its so damn delicious).
All staff were very polite, even got to check out the awesome kitchen. Our server was extremely kind and knew the menu like the back of her hand and detailed every dish that came out. really just fantastic. We even got to meet the chef before he left for his trip back home. I wish you guys all the best, cant wait to come back and bring more people with me to this rare experience. thanks. And everyone have the baked Alaska : ))))))
review_title: What have you done to me!!!!

review: Great service, great chef, beautiful and very tasty food, a mix of emotions and flavours...

An absolutely perfect dinner, a perfect evening. The five course tasting menu was served without pressure - no rushing to finish a course. The wine pairings were wonderful and generous. Our waitress was delightful, well-versed in the menu and a fun partner in the whole experience. The chef's small touches - the palette cleansers and the special treats make you feel cared for and make you want to return. He often visits the tables and seems genuinely interested in his customers and in their dining experience.
Another wonderful meal at La Folie. Everything we had was so delicious and well prepared. Service is efficent and friendly. This is our favorite San Francisco restaurant.

I had not been in San Francisco in a while and decided to try La Folie. I dont know how it compares to others, but I do know it is a restaurant that would stand on its own anywhere. Creative, delicious, spectacular food. Every course we had was simply outstanding and had some unique aspect to it. Service was also excellent, I particularly liked the guidance of our waiter on the meal and the sommelier which allowed me to decide on the wine with easily. If you go to San Francisco, please don't miss it. Portions are on the large side, but the whole experience truly outstanding.
review_title: I had not been in San Francisco

review: Service was excellent! Nice variety on menu, I like seafood, my spouse likes meat. Caviar was outstanding but my beet salad was too sour. The vinaigrette ruins it but its still ok. Fall vegetable and Asian pear salad was 3 out of 5 stars. Duck egg salad was 3 out of 5. Scallop main course was a winner and the Le Boeuf with Australian Wagyu was out of this world! We paired this with a 2007 Opus One. Baked Alaska 5/5 and Edam Cheese Souffl was for a savory pallet only 4/5. If you prefer sweet desserts steer clear. Our server was knowledgeable and friendly. She even haled a cab for us. I would recommend and return.
Food was really good, not mind blowing but tasty. Service was excellent and ambiance was classy and tasteful.

Went there for a friend's birthday.Can't believe how great the food there from the layers of taste of the food to the details of the presentation.I will recommend this restaurant to anyone who is visiting San Francisco as a MUST try.The quality of the food & the service for the price is not something we often find.
review_title: One of my best dining experience

review: My wife and I were looking forward to an exquisite dining experience since the restaurant has one Michelin star. We enjoyed the service and our waiter was very knowledgeable. The wine list had many reasonably priced elections. Unfortunately, the food did not live up to our expectations. Perhaps we were there on an "off" night, but I would not rush to go back.
review_title: My wife and I were looking

review: Fantastic French restaurant that greatly exceeded expectations. A truly fine dining experience. The service was impeccable, and the food was amazing. My only constructive criticism was that the portion sizes were a bit large for a course menu, so stick to 3, and you will be more than satisfied.

We had a good food experience but our dinner experience was horrifickly interrupted as the gentleman sitting two tables down from us had some sort of a seizure or health problems after having his second course. We had to assist the poor gentleman with his panicking wife to lay him down on the floor in order for him to be comfortable. The waitress helped and ended up calling 911 immediately and took the man to an emergency rooom.
review_title: We had a good food experience

review: One of the best meals we have had in a long time. The service was excellent: Friendly, unobtrusive and expert advice. The combinations of flavor and texture were amazing. We found ourselves eating slowly so as to savor every bite. Excellent wines topped off the meal.
review_title: One of the best meals we have

review: my only gripe is that our neighboring table was given an amuse bouche that looked amazing and that we were not (salmon popsicles). grasping for straws there though, everything was really fantastic.
review_title: my only gripe is that our

review: Absolutely spectacular. There is a reason that La Folie has a Michelin Star. From the cocktails to the amuse bouche to dinner to dessert, La Folie knows exactly what it's doing and it does it unerringly. If I had a complaint, it would be that the main menu was far too enticing for me to take a stab at the tasting menu. Even though they allow you to substitute back and forth, there was just too much to choose from.

Still one of my favorites in the city and has yet still ceases to amaze me. Waiters and staff are professional yet friendly. The food was great as usual, delicious French flavors paired with just a twist of Californian flare. Chef Roland Passot is still there nightly cooking and checking everything so you know what is being served has a bit of his passion and flavor. For the level of restaurant and price, I think La Folie is the best in it's class.
Food was exceptional and service was attentive yet respectful
The food was amazing and is now one of our favorite places to go.
review_title: The food was amazing and is

review: Excellent, but other restaurants at this level surpass it still. Anything with lobster was stupendous.

This is the BEST French restaurant I have EVER been to!! The food was BETTER than anything I have had in PARIS!! The service was OUTSTANDING! Chef Roland even comes out and speaks with each table and makes everyone feel special. The menu was amazing, as was the wine list! Totally worth EVERY PENNY! If you are celebrating a special occasion or just a wonderful night out THIS is the place! I am a TOTAL "foodie" and recently returned from a cooking school in Tuscany. The people I met there told me I MUST visit this restaurant the next time I went to SF. I am SO glad they did!!! WOW!!! I just can't say enough about this place!! p.s. BEN was our waiter and he was AWESOME!!!
review_title: This is the BEST French restaurant

review: Simply epic. One of the best dining experiences I've ever had.
review_title: Simply epic. One of the best

review: I loved this place! I did recommend to friends and would LOVE-LOVE-LOVE to dine in here again... Service is great, and the chef himself came out after dinner to see how everything was. Excellent!
review_title: I loved this place! I did

review: The food and service was excellent! We had the 5 course meal (custom menu) with wine pairing. All the food was perfection while most of the wine pairing were a little hit and mis. But over all the food and atmosphere was extremely enjoyable.
review_title: The food and service was excellent!

review: Food was a disappointment in general. Paid for the 5 courses and although the portions were OK, the flavors were not there. The food was over-salted in general with that being the dominant flavor. Otherwise, the flavors were not very complex as I would have expected for spending $100 each for the food alone. Wine list was also fairly short for this caliber of restaurant. Luckily, I brought my own wines from my cellar which were the best part of the meal. Pretty sad. Service and ambiance were very good but the food should be far better than this.

I'm speaking for both myself and my dinner partner. We both ordered 5-course dinners and had different selections. I was able to taste 10 different dishes as I had a few bites from his plate as well. My dishes were very pleasing. The most memorable ones of the night were the frog legs, seared scallop and the roti of quail and squab. Each of those dishes were cooked to perfection and had just the right amount of seasoning. However, the trio of rabbit dish was the low dish of the night. The serving was much too large, and as the 4th dish off the 5-course menu (also after a couple of amuse-bouches) it was hard for him to finish. I had a bite of the loin, and it was much too dry and bland. Chef Passot came out himself and greeted us! So sweet!

My husband and I went to La Folie on Valentine's Day. The food was exquisite and the atmosphere lovely. I don't think that we'll be returning for quite some time, however, $520 for 2 people with only one cocktail is a bit pricey for my sweetheart and me....
review_title: My husband and I went to La

review: As always, the food was presented with style and it tasted outstanding. Black truffles are in season and on the menu!
review_title: As always, the food was presented

review: The service at this special occasion restaurant was absolutely perfect. The food was excellent, although the meat course was not my favorite. I would say the inventive appetizers and seafood dishes were the highlight of the evening. The escargot cooked in veal bone with marrow gratin was amazing. Great experience. Well worth the price for a special occasion.

Exquisitely prepared dishes, attentive and knowledgeable service. The wine pairings complemented the dishes beautifully. Splurge and try the caviar... the combination of arctic char in the bellini with the sour cream and caviar was wonderful!

Perfect place for our anniversary celebration. The food and service were fantastic. Always nice to meet the chef at the end of the evening, according to classic French culinary tradition. Highly recommended.

Classic French cuisine just doesn't do it for us who prefer lighter contempoarary dishes such as offered at restaurants like the Slanted Door. La Folie is qite expensive and the wine list is just terribly overpriced. Ordered by the glass--a mediocre Bordeaux for $16??? Just not fair.

A great special occasion and/or romantic restaurant with attentive staff, creative and fresh menus, and a varied wine list. A great choice of restaurants that benefits from the fresh ingredients and food/wine culture in northern california. We will go back again soon, and enjoy the seasonal menu.

Christmas Eve provided a fixed price menu that was value oriented but did not live up to quality expectations. Nothing was poorly executed or deficient, and the menu was well constructed around deep flavorings. Far too much of the food seemed seriously pre-prepared, which to an extent it had to be. But it shouldn't be so obvious. The pumpkin soup lacked depth of flavor, and the texture and was quite watery. A second course of squab with foie gras disappointed, too. The squab was clearly very pre-cooked and barely warm, and the brioche that accompanied the foie gras was just plain bad. Duck breast with a duck confit was superb, as was the interesting dessert. Wine pairings were largely uninteresting and very sparingly poured.

The most expensive meal I've ever had, but everything was perfect.  Just don't get greedy and order the prix fixe with too many courses.  You'll get too full to actually really love and enjoy the food!

As others have commented, the ambiance is neither modern nor edgy - and that's the way it should be.  It's entirely appropriate to the venue.  The food is creative and RICH.  This is haute couture... a place for a special occasion and a meal you'll talk about for the rest of your life (unless you enjoy this type of thing far too often).  We felt very special; the service was impeccable.  Thank you Roland!

Great and creative menu. The multiple pre and between course "palette cleansers" were unique and outstanding. The service was very professional but at the same time friendly and attentive. A great experience with the food comparable to places at the level of the Inn art Little Washington on VA.
Fantastic. Have visited La Folie since the 80's. Great then, fantastic now!

The food is good but not exciting. It is pretty boring. When they just opened, there was a kick to most of their dishes. Now it is gone. Plus their prices have gone up. In short, not as good as it used to be
review_title: I think they have become stagnant

review: And a great wine list.  Have never been disappointed here.
First time at Local and was pleasantly surprised. Everything tasted fresh, large portions, great service. I would definitely go back.
review_title: First time at Local and was

review: I've been to this spot for dinner and brunch, and would recommend for dinner, but probably forego for brunch. Their botttomless mimosas were a bit on the weak side and the coffee is excessively priced.

Food wise, we didn't have a very good experience at all. However, I wrote the owner directly and he addressed my complaints and offered us dinner there on him to make it right. When you hear back immediately from the owner, that is what makes a restaurant worth supporting.
Worked great for a business dinner earlier in the evening. The wine nook looks cool, but we didn't enter it.
Our waitress was really wonderful - we were in a bit of a hurry and she did a great job of accomodating us.
Always a pleasure to eat here. Don't get here nearly enough. Very out of the way, but vibrant once you get inside.
review_title: Always a pleasure to eat here.

review: Very good vibe everytime I have dined at the Local.

Both the bar and table service were just fantastic, very friendly and attentive staff. The food as great from the Happy hour bites the the roasted chicken. I will def be back to this tasty establishment.
review_title: Both the bar and table service

review: I am glad I did not pay too much attention to some of the reviews.some of the writers sounded like they frequent Marie Calendars. I ate the grill tunaw/ petite potatoeswonderful the chopped salad (should have been chopped more) w/ cumbers and strawberries was delicious. My foodie sister had the pork chopped and she said it was very good. Wine selections is very good. Locals should hit this place.
review_title: I am glad I did not pay too

review: The restaurant was nice and ambiance was very good, but I was actually very disappointed in the food. I had the rotisserie chicken, which looked just like a Whole Foods chicken, but overcooked and not as good. The menu said it came with vegetables, but was just salad greens. The beet salad was pretty good. My friends had the butternut squash risotto, which was completely flavorless. The pizzas looked good, so maybe I just misordered. I'd be willing to try it again, but certainly wouldn't rush back.
This is my favorite restaurant....Santos always takes very good care of us.

I go to Locals quite often for lunch. It is always excellent, both food and service. Wines by the glass vary from time to time and it is always something interesting. The best dessert they ever had was the beignettes and for some reason they took it off the menu. They should bring it back! Good place for business or casual lunch; you can talk without a lot of background noise.
review_title: I go to Locals quite often

review: I thought the food was rather bland and the wine list still could improve
review_title: I thought the food was rather

review:
The pizza was a big disappointment.  Very chewy and the cheese congealed within a few minutes. the complimentary bread was chewy and did not taste fresh.

The wine was nice but for a wine bar it was too expensive for 12$ a glass. there are so many wine bar in the SOMA area that I would prefer to spend my money.  not sure i will recommend this place to anyone.
review_title: The pizza was a big disappointment.

review: I was very pleasantly surprised about the quality of the food and service.  Overall I would give them a 4 of 5 stars.  They executed everything quite well.

The drinks were so so. Good guacamole. Don't order the taco sampler the steak is flavorless and the shrimp taste like they were frozen bland. Our server was very nice but this will definitely be my first and last time there
review_title: I definitely expected more from this place.

review: They have free parking for Pantages ticket holders.  Our tickets are on Wednesday when they have a great special.  It's just perfect to go to the Theater.

This is the second time at Beso. The place is just spectacular. The food is some of the best anywhere. The staff are very friendly and available whenever needed without being intrusive. Will definately make this a place on my return list.
Great dim lighting, cool vibe.  Romantic, and it feels like a celebrity could walk in at any time.  The VIP lounge very chic.

Beso is an absolutely beautiful restaurant, but it's in a terrible neighborhood. The food was outstanding, but the service was a little slow. I received my entree about 5 minutes before my boyfriend got his. This is unacceptable. The server said it was coming from the other kitchen.

I bought a restaurant.com certificate having previously heard great things.  I read reviews before booking a table here for date night with my husband.  If I hadn't had the certificate to use, I never would have gone here based on the recent reviews.  We were extremely disappointed.  We were asked as we checked in if we were "dining with any vouchers" (NEVER a good sign), our waiter couldn't open the bottle of wine we had brought, he NEVER ONCE poured our wine during our meal.  The lobster quesadilla had no discernible lobster in it and the cheese wasn't melted, the scallops were so salty that they were barely edible. At this price point, food and service should be exceptional.  It wasn't even decent.  Ambience was nice.  That's about all.
review_title: Other negative reviews were spot on

review: Sorry to say, the experience was disappointing at best. My daughter, granddaughter & I had reservations on 4/15. The restaurant was beautiful but that's the only positive thing I can say. The place was packed w/ one waiter. He was trying his best but many people were upset. Needless to say, service was very slow, we were finally servered at 8pm w/ 6:30 dinner reservations. The food was bland & tasteless and auite pricey. I don't mind paying if the food is worth it. Sorry, will never go back.

On Hollywood Boulevard. We were going to a movie at the Egyptian Theater and enjoyed walking in the warm, spring-like weather, the 7 blocks over to Beso for dinner. The menu was not what we expected; evidently it is changed periodically. The decor was beautiful, with high, warehouse-like, interestingly appointed ceilings, and curtains on the outer walls. The service and food were both excellent. Bone-in rib-eye steak was one of the best in the city. Mac-n-cheese was very good. Small dishes we enjoyed and shared included 4 different tacos and a chicken enchilada. We'd go back to try other dishes.

Service was good, food was excellent. We ordered Starters and Small Plates to share so we could try a variety of items. Everything was delicious. Ambiance was nice, great for date night or a romantic evening out.
We went before going to the Pantages and it was perfect.
Service was very slow. The food was not that good. Price wise it was okay. Would not go there again.

Beso should consider getting new employees. The male and female hosts in the front looked like they hated their job and were not friendly at all. They acted like they were better and treated us like we were beneath them. Our server was also pretty bad, where he gave us the "stupid" look when we told him we haven't had the chance to look at the wine menu. When he took our order, he kept throwing this attitude "yeah" and rolled his eyes. REALLY?!? pretty unprofessional. He left immediately after taking our order and usually servers would repeat the order or ask if there's anything else, etc, but not this dude. HORRIBLE SERVICE.

The restaurant and the scene of it was very nice. But, $14 for 2 freaking pieces of lobster quesadilla?? NO!

Food was pretty good. Ambiance and decor were great. We came Sat night and staff was noticeably tense and not as warm as is typical in similar restaurants, for instance greeter barely noticed us and we stood for a couple min at the entrance before we even got a hello. Not complaining, I'd still recommend the place.

I visited with a Travelzoo coupon. They had a separate menu when using Travelzoo. I was expecting subpar food. I had the scallops that were a little undercooked ( this is a personal preference for me that I like them very firm which is probably overcooked!). The chicken was also excellent with blue potatoes. The appetizers of the flatbread (size of a small pizza!) and chicken enchilada (only one) were both excellent. We had the chocolate flan and churros. I will return for the churros! They tasted freshly made and they brought caramel sauce and whipping cream on the side. They were delicious! Also had a VERY strong red Sangria.

Overall a great dinner and experience. Will return again. Great place to entertain out of town guests.
Bartender was awesome, made good suggestions and was obviously an accomplished Mixologist; Waiter and all service was prompt and timed apps and meal perfectly.

Food was good and interesting, but over-priced. Very loud and dark at 6 pm at night -- big parties and lots of screaming. Could NOT carry on a conversation, which is what I go to dinner for. Even music over PA was very loud. Perhaps it is my age -- but I think that at 6 pm, before the night crowd , they could have a decent ambiance level. Very attractive place.
I received a great services and delicious Steak and Shrimp. You won't be disappointed.
Great place to dine in Hollywood. The food was great and the service was superb. The restaurant was large but still felt intimate if you're on a date. The Taqueria Tacos are my favorite dish.

Our experience at Beso was amazing! I can't wait to return. From the valet to all the waiters to the food everything was perfect! Customer service was immaculate! Our waitress was Lily and she was the best, made me to feel at home and we really didn't want to leave. Great job to all the staff. Eva Longoria you have an amazing restaurant and your good and service is impeccable!
Our second time at Beso, its is amazing! Incredible food, Flat Bread to die for! The best service! Love it!
Great food and a lovely restaurant. Bar got a little rowdy later on which was distracting from our romantic dinner.
review_title: Great food and a lovely restaurant.

review: Good place to go for a special occasion. I went on the travelzoo deal and it was a decent selection. Get the chile-rubbed steak with tortilla fattoush.
review_title: Good place to go for a special

review: Of particular note is the fact that the waiter never came back to the table after the food was served, though we saw him watching the person who delivered the food and saw him scold that person afterward for handing food to the wrong people. Our waiter never checked to see if everything was okay (which it wasn't) and we had to seek him out to get the check to pay the bill. We had a couple of concerns and empty drinks throughout the meal because he never returned. The Halibut was delicious but the lamb was under-cooked. I will not return to this restaurant.
Steak was well done, I oredered medium rare, the watress was polite but over streched by too many tables at pre theater hour. Staff was friendly and apolegized.
review_title: Steak was well done, I oredered

review: We actually never met who was supposed to be our waiter/waitress. We had to flag down the manager to take our order. All the other servers (water, drinks, food) were great, but no one actually came to check on us once while we were there almost 2 hours. After another 15 minutes for no one asking if we wanted dessert or coffee, we gave up and just flagged down any server to get our check. We also saw other tables who had to get the manager to take the food order and no one came by their table to check on the food or take the dessert order. The ambience is great, but the service is non existent.

There was a lot of waiting. We made reservations and arrived on time, but we still had to wait a long time for a table. Once we ordered, the food took a long time to arrive at our table and it was also not brought out at the same time. Had to wait for several minutes. The food was OK, not the best I have ever had.
review_title: There was a lot of waiting.

review: The food and service was amazing. It was fast but you didn't feel rushed.
review_title: The food and service was amazing.

review: Service was excellent! We had the tomahawk steak, was a little disappointed, it lacked flavor. Side dishes were delicious

The food was not properly cooked. The bread is great, as is the roasted red pepper dip with the bread. The rest of the food is bland and needs the various sauces they serve with each dish, and even then is nothing special. My food was re-done three times. They were very apologetic for the mishaps from the kitchen, but I would not go back.
The ambience is beautiful, the staff friendly and courteous and the food was good, but think the cost is too pricey for what you get.

The restaurant is beautiful and the service amazing, but it was a bit slow between courses. Tables for two are VERY close together, so you will hear everyone's conversation next to you AND smell their food...some of it was VERY overpowering and not pleasant. The servers, waitstaff and bartender were awesome. Great place in Hollywood to hang out for amazing cocktails.

I was very disappointed with our experience at Beso. The food was almost unbelievably bad - so much so that we declined to try anything else after sending back our entrees. The guacamole and Caesar salad were so poorly seasoned as to be almost flavorless. The yellowtail entree was overcooked and fishy-smelling, while the skirt steak was as tough as shoe leather - a cut of meat that should never have seen a plate. The only high point was the desserts (which we took to go). Overall, far below any reasonable standard of quality at this price point.

The place was adorable. Very intimate setting inside and the waiters are very diligent in making sure you are ok and your glass of water is full. The food was delicious and of course a bit pricey but that's the norm in Hollywood. The paella plate, pork chop and roasted chicken were all delicious. A little disappointed about the dessert menu, nothing to fancy about it. But overall an experience to have at least once in your life.

Food was excellent, had the Guacamole (chunky), Tortilla soup(different take on what you might have had), the Scallops were perfect, and the Churros, best I've had. Portions were perfect, satisfied, but not stuffed.
My birthday dinner was amazing with you all at BESO i LOVE it there. Will have my birthday there again next year :)

We came here based on the Travelzoo deal, we were still hungry by the time all the food came out. There tortilla soup was nicely presented, but tasted like muddy water...just plain gross!! The entree that was purchased with the entree for the travelzoo voucher was suppose to be halibut, they didn't have it so offered scallops with some type of jammy sauce...terrible. You only got 2 pieces of scallops as an entree which was a joke! Service was terrible, the server came to our table 3 times the whole night never did she even smiled. Our bill came and they automatically charged us 20% gratuity for 2 people. Seriously, go somewhere else!!!

The food was exceptional! The scallops, pork, and corn were especially memorable...the best pork dish I have ever had! The guacamole was very fresh and flavorful. The service was awful. Our waiter dropped our menus on the table and came back only to ask if we were ready. Our glasses sat empty in the interim and we had to prompt him to tell us about featured dishes on the menu and specials. Since none of us had been to Beso, this was a huge miss. He did approach the table once and saw that we were in conversation so he crept away. For the first time in my dining experience we actually requested a new server. Our new server did an excellent job of picking up the slack and redeemed the night, but what a shame with a poor 1st impression.
Amazing ambience and just an overall good atmosphere
Interesting people watching. The food was good, but not great. The churros for dessert were excellent.

This was my second trip to Beso. The food,atmosphere and overall service was excellent! I'm from sandiego and it's well worth the drive. I also like the online reservation as it makes things convenient.
review_title: This was my second trip to

review: Beso was a wonderful experience!! The food, Ambiance & Service is Outstanding. This is a place I will return to several times and will recommend to my family and friends. The only problem - the Ladies room was not up to standard - it needs serious attention such as a complete tear down and redo!!

It was a very pleasant moment. With very, nice, available and express service. Sorry not to have seen a star... :-)
Really great dinner
review_title: It was a very pleasant moment.

review: Wouldn't go there again. Very poor service and dissapointing food.
Just not a very good place with just OK steaks, actually poor and overpriced steaks.
review_title: Just not a very good place

review:
Food was actually 2.5 stars. Had the paella and though the seafood was cooked perfectly - mussels, clams, shrimp and lobster were sweet and tender, the rice was undercooked; was that supposed to be chorizo? Also disappointed in the overcooked chicken breast which should have been sliced, or presented other than a whole piece. For dessert, the churro was great with a fantastic salted caramel sauce, the banana split was disappointing. Especially the cinnamon ice cream was not as flavorful as expected and very small spoonfuls of ice cream - which were both almost fully melted.

Beautiful restaurant which was a tad too dark to discern what was on the plate. But music level was perfect and service was great. $10 pre charge for valet??
The food is absolutely amazing; there was nothing that we did not like.My only complaint would be that the room was too dark

Hip and fun, but food was interesting and varied from very good to so..so.... 
People watching made up for that easily...
review_title: Hip and fun, but food was

review: I would have given a higher score if the prices wern't quite so high. The food is very good but expensive. I've been to Rick Bayliss' Frontera Grill in Chicago and the prices are a bit lower for simply amazing Mexican food. Beso is more of a celebrity driven restaurant.
review_title: I would have given a higher

review: As people had previously reported, the drinks were really good and unique. Our food was excellent as was the service. Great for a very nice pre-show dinner.

Not impressed with food or service!
Service-Ordered appetizer which was never received, and then entrees were brought to the table way too quickly! Waited for server to take dessert order apprx. 30 minutes after entrees has been cleared.
Food-Overall, food was mediocre . . steak and tuna entrees both lacked flavor/seasoning. . didn't live up to menu descriptions. Cherry tart was best part of meal.
Definitely will not be going back to Beso!

Very friendly staff despite the "exclusive" vibe...
Not overly pricey for this area, and our food was pretty good, and my husband said his steak was one of the best he's ever had. We would come back here.

I was looking forward to going to Beso as I had a friend in from out of town and we were choosing between Beso and Asia de Cuba. I was VERY disappointed. While the atmosphere and service were great, the food was VERY mediocre and when I am paying those sorts of prices, I expect the food to be fantastic. I ordered the spicy lamb ribs as an appetizer, the paella for an entree, and chocolate souffle for dessert. I have lived in LA for 10+ years and frequent some of the best restaurants around town. I wish we went to Asia de Cuba whose food far surpasses Beso.
review_title: I was looking forward to going

review: All and all this was a pretty decent experience. The food was good, but of course not really worth the steep prices, and extra small portions. The waitress was very mediocre and at one point I think we ended up with another waiter in the middle, in which he said it was okay because that was his girlfriend. I would go back for sure, but maybe sit at the bar this time. The bartender was nice and friendly.
review_title: All and all this was a pretty

review: OUTSTANDING SERVICE...ASSISTED BY @ LEAST 5 EMPLOYEES. BEAUTIFUL DECOR AND DELICIOUS FOOD. A REAL TREAT.

We found Beso to be much better than the average reviews we read.  Glad we took a chance on it.  We had some company from out of state and they were equally impressed with food, service and ambience.  Great for groups or a hot date!  I believe they turn it over to more of a club after 9pm or so.
review_title: We found Beso to be much better

review: I have been 3 times in 2 weeks. I'm so impressed with this spot!
review_title: I have been 3 times in 2 weeks.

review: This restaurant is fabulous!! The food was creative and delicious. I would highly recommend going.

We had a very pleasurable time -the restaurant's decor was really nice and the food was great!  The only down side was the feeling of being pressured about the arrival time of the last few members of our party. They will not seat you until all of your party has arrived.  Suggestion -if your having more than 4 people (one car full) meeting there for a reservation, be sure to tell everyone your reservation time is 1/2 hour before its actual time otherwise you will be asked.  I do realize they're intent is to not get service backed up but hey we live in LA and its almost impossible not to be atleast 15 mintutes late anywhere due to traffic especially at night on weekends in the heart of Hollywood.
We had an amazing time! Everything was absolute perfection!
review_title: We had an amazing time! Everything

review:
Surprisingly good visit!  You can be wary sometimes with celebrity-partnered restaurants (that may favor style over substance), but Beso made a great first impression and a great meal.  All the food and drinks weres terrific.

That said, the service needs some refining.  Our group of four was first presented a table in the middle of the dining room, so we asked for a booth nearby instead.  It took five minutes to get this okayed, leaving us milling about in the middle of the restaurant for longer than necessary.  (And, to note: There were empty booths remaining when we left two hours later).  Moreover, our waiter could only provide basic information; when asked what an ingredient was in a dish, we were told "it's a spice" -- nothing more.
Foreign Cinema is a staple in the fluctuating Mission scene.  Food and service is always excellent  and never disappoints .  Noise level was pretty high for a Monday night, though.
Foreign Cinemas space is beautiful and relaxing and the brunch was delicious.  I drank a cocktail called the beautiful ones.  It was lovely.

A neighborhood gem. I used to live in SF and would come here on special occasions. Now that I live in NYC, I come back to visit and never forget to make a reservation at Foreign Cinema.
