The carpaccio is spot on, and cocktails are amazing. The dining area in the patio is perfect for a romantic evening, and you can listen to the movie that's playing if you use the speaker provided. The entire dining experience is perfect, and food comes out at the correct times. The service is excellent and I always recommend this spot to my friends, and anyone visiting SF.
review_title: Has always been one of my favorite places to dine!

review: Half way thru the meal"Why don't we eat here more often"!  Just can't beat it!  Thank you Team Foreign Cinema for a great night!

We really enjoyed all the dishes we were served and our wine was fantastic as well. I love finding a restaurant where you can become absorbed in the food and atmosphere and not feel rushed. Worth every penny!
Great outdoor dining and perfect for a date night or dining with friends. Goat cheese, charcuterie board and pork dishes were all fabulous.
Great and creative menu.  Food is delicious, wait staff has a bit of an attitude.
review_title: Great Food but area is in decline

review: I am going to say that Foreign Cinema is now at the top of my list for when I am taking out friends and family (especially out of town guests). The outdoor patio is urban chic and the service was very attentive.  The fried chicken dish was one of my favorite meals I've had in the city and exceeds that of Wayfare Tavern in my opinion! The prices are a bit high but it is worth it - and the food exceeded my expectations.  Oysters were fresh and delicious, main courses combined unlikely flavors and were memorable, and the desserts were simply divine! I will be back and I stand by my endorsement of this great dining experience! Encore!
The staff could not have been more attentive and helpful. The food was delicious! This place is a must in San Francisco

Our visit to Foreign Cinema was one of the highlights of a recent trip to San Francisco. We had the best spot on the patio, with a great view of the movie and perfect weather. Our server was knowledgeable and helpful with his recommendations, on both food and wine. The food was delicious and unique, and the portions were generous. The wine list had a lovely selection of California wines. All in all, a night to remember. Thank you, Foreign Cinema!
LOVED everything about this place. Justin was our server and a fantastic one at that. The food is delicious. The patio for movie watching is romantic and so unique. The food was also outstanding.
Very well done food, though pricey for what it is..
Had a Birthday dinner!  Love this restaurant especially the outdoor movies!

Fantastic ! Everytime
Our wait gentleman was over the top fantastic. The newly additioned bar in the back sublime.

I opened up this gem of restaurant to new eyes and he was pleasantly surprised.
This was a great spot for an afternoon brunch outdoors, with plenty of good people watching. Enjoyed the bloody marys and hangover soup!

Always accommodating service and the food is just as awesome as everyone describes here. You can't go wrong! Check back for reservations or call if you are having a hard time getting one, don't give up! After living here for 4 years, I am pretty sure Foreign Cinema is my favorite restaurant in the city.

We had a gift certificate for $75 which got us 1 drink, 1 starter, 1 main & 1 dessert... between 2. So this is a special occasion spot where you're probably gonna blow your wad but the food is terrific and the ambiance is lovely. It's very large so it's not quite the personal service you may be looking for but it's very efficient and hip! We arrived 10 mins early and our table was not available until our exact booking time. There are probably other places downtown that I think you'll get more bang for your buck, but it was certainly a treat to go here! We were unable to see the screening of the film where we were sitting and there's no audio and just subtitles (just so you know!), so don't go looking for a night at the movies too!
What a fun time. The neighborhood might throw you off but once inside and eat the food you won't be thinking of anything else.

The food is fantastic. The ambiance is just perfect for a romantic dinner. I hear the brunch is fantastic as well. Service is 5 star quality. Extensive and impressive wine list. It is expensive, particularly the wine. But one of the better dining experiences I've had in a while. Great place for a "special occasion."
Beautiful place but you can't hear the waiter your guests great place to take someone your not interested in speaking with

Maybe I was spoiled by other restaurants I went to, but the food was somewhat disappointing. My starter the beef carpaccio was lacking flavour. The chips it came with were bland and the sour cream/creme fraiche was no better.
The fried chicken was ok but lacking a side dish/pairing. Dessert I shared the pavlova and thought it was ok, but for the price of everything I was hoping for an unforgettable meal.
Our party of four shared two appetizers and each had a different entree. All of it was delicious. I had the risotto and it was the best I have ever had.
review_title: Our party of four shared two

review: It was very easy to make a reservation online for the time I wanted.The hostess seemed indifferent when gettng seated.I did not get the request for a courtyard table but still seated in a decent location. The atmosphere was great but with everyones conversations bouncing off the walls it maybe difficult to hear. I still like the energy of the place. The food was unique and well balanced and looked beautiful too. I can see how guests that are used to Applebees sized portions would complain about cost versus portion size, but ya know let them keep going to Applebees. But a 3 course dinner with wine is certainly going cost more than a bill. Service was friendly and genuine. Thank you Foreign Cinema.
review_title: It was very easy to make a

review: Overall everything was good. Only thing I can think of which limited my dining experience to good instead of exceptional, was too much salt in my food. Server was good and very polite. They had very good selection for desserts, food and drinks.

Lately my visits to Foreign Cinema have been less frequent. Our last was recently on a Monday evening, and since then I have been wondering why we stayed away so long. My spouse and I were blown away. I believe our Parisian guests enjoyed their meals as much as we did. Each dish was outstanding -- the colors, textures and flavor combinations were superb. Service was excellent, as always. The wines were priced fairly, and the two bottles that we chose turned out to be excellent values.
Terrific all around. Fantastic drinks, great setting. Food was a notch or two above expected. Fully satisfied with dining experience.

While the food was quite tasty, the portions were horribly small and not worth the price. Have eaten at Foreign Cinema many times and was extremely dissapointed at my last visit. Will not plan to go back again. It's a shame because the food is good but not for the high prices and small portions
review_title: While the food was quite tasty,

review: One of my fav places in the city now. I have never tried their brunch, which is what they are known for. But if our dinner last night was any indication, it's a fantastic spot. We got the soup as a starter followed by lamb and chicken entrees, and a cocktail. The soup was alright, but everything else was exceptional. The ambiance is charming as well.
review_title: Really enjoyed the food and feel

review: Everything was amazing, food was out of this world, very romantic, I would give more stars if I could. Thanks!
Spectacular! Great for an 8 year old and teenager too!
I did not care for the green omelet it came soggy and it tasted eggy.
review_title: I did not care for the green

review: We sat in the art gallery part with white table cloths! Easy, quiet atmosphere. (other parts of the restaurant are lively and a bit loud) Breakfast at Tiffany playing on the wall...just the right touch! The food, service and wine were all outstanding.
review_title: We sat in the art gallery

review:
We had such a great dinner here the other night -- gorgeous weather and we were seated outside, DELICIOUS (and beautiful) food, and good service.

Particular favorites were the duck breast and smoked salmon.

WOW, what a concept. Very interesting experience. Off the beaten track although well worth the short drive, especially for us coming all the way from Toronto.
Oh did I mention that the food was very tasty and our service was second to none. Well priced and the place was hopping for a Thursday night.
outstanding food, and great service. I especially love being able to sit outside and eat and still be cosy- great restaurant!

Foreign Cinema is fantastic. Every time I visit San Francisco, I dine at least once at Foreign Cinema. The space is beautiful. They converted an industrial loft space with 20 ft. ceilings into a remarkable indoor/outdoor restaurant with beautiful lighting, terrific (farm fresh) food and great service.
Great meal, too noisy for my comfort and we were there on a Tuesday. They could do something about this by hanging some fabrics on the cavernous ceilings to buffer the sound.
Was just not impressed with any of the four dishes we had, everybody felt the same, what's the big deal about this place? Food was OK, nothing more.
what a great night. we both felt like it was a mini vacation!! food was perfect.
review_title: what a great night. we both

review: We enjoyed our brunch very much and like that we were still able to order items off the dinner menu per request. Like the lively atomosphere and attentive service. It was a birthday event, and the restaurant served a complimentary desert with a candle. Nice touch.
Food was very okay. But fairly expensive. Good, but not a good value and not great. The standout was that I had a very good cocktail.
review_title: Food was very okay. But fairly

review: We went for my daughter's 26th Birthday! Everything we ordered was superb!

Took too long and the risotto was horrible. I had to have it taken back it was so un-edible. One of the chef's came out to tell me that it is risotto from a certain area and I thought, who cares? I just want something that tastes good and I can eat.
review_title: Took too long and the risotto

review: Great food in an informal, very interesting space.

I hadn't been to Foreign Cinema in a long time. Even though I didn't think of this restaurant as kid friendly, I was pleasantly surprised to find that they had a prix fixe menu for kids. It was a coloring book and they provided crayons.

The food was for the most part excellent although my fish was saltier than I would have liked. The service was excellent.

I will definitely come back.
review_title: I hadn't been to Foreign Cinema

review: The food was excellent. The only thing is that has very small portions and after 120.00 we were still hungry. We had one glass of wine each so 20 of it was wine and the rest appetizers and dinner and still walked away hungry. Will go back to eat outdoors to watch the movie but will probably eat something before we come.
What a great restaurant. Super cool vibe here.... great place to impress.

I love brunch at Foreign Cinema. The food is simply the best. That being siad, because we changed our party size last minute, they made us move tables three times! After that, our meal was perfect. Our server was adorable, and made the best recommendations. No complaints- get the black truffle omelet!
review_title: I love brunch at Foreign Cinema.

review: Superb food and ambiance!! But don't expect to be able to follow the movie. Better for classic films you know very well.

Very cool ambience. A lovely fireplace in the middle of the dining room, and a fun outdoor seating area where you can watch the latest film they are showing. Unfortunately, the food didn't hold up to the surroundings. Our chicken was soggy and the steak was chewy. I believe they tried to be innovative in their dishes, but it just came off as a weird mess. Who puts lettuce in the oven?
I remembered this restaurant form my last visit to SF, about 5 years ago. We had a great experience then and an even better one this time.
Outstanding food and wonderful ambience. Highly recommend the restaurant.
The food is consitently excellent! We always have an incredible experience. This is the place we love to take out of town guests.
Really great experience. Service was top-notch and the food was delicious. The immediate area surrounding the restaurant is a bit sketchy though.

This was my second visit to Foreign Cinema and the experience was even better this time. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, even though the restaurant is on the large size. The roaring fireplace really helps with that as does the lighting and rustic chic decor. I had tuna nicoise and it was amazing - like none I've ever had before! Also, a soft cheese melted in a fig leaf with toasted bread - yummy appetizer! And peach cobbler for dessert -- decadent. One of my dining companions literally wiped her plate with bread to not miss any of the juices from the petrale sole, and she reluctantly let us taste her chocolate pot de creme. After tasting it, I don't blame her for not wanting to share. This is now my favorite dining place in the City!
review_title: This was my second visit to

review: The heat lamps make outdoor dining possible in SF!

We had a delightful brunch. The server was very helpful in explaining the options and his recommendations were perfect for what we wanted. Met some delightful people who directed us to a roof top bar with fabulous views just two doors down. We would definately go back.
Had a great time at Foreign Cinema. Walking down on Mission one would never guess that this fine restaurant would be amongst all the tacaquerias.
review_title: Had a great time at Foreign

review: It had a nice surprise element walking from mission st into the open industrial spaces. My wife and I both enjoyed our brunch selections and the service. We just suggested Foreign Cinima to a dinner group for next month.
review_title: It had a nice surprise element

review: This was my first time back in several years. Foreign Cinema has gotten much better--I now consider it in the first rank of San Francisco restaurants. In addition to the great menu and staff attitude, I appreciated that the wine list included many excellent but moderately priced options.
review_title: This was my first time back

review: It's my new favorite restaurant. Great menu and great food, excellent service, outstanding wine list. Couldn't sit on patio to watch movie due to rain, but the ambience inside was the perfect place to spend a cold and rainy late afternoon in San Francisco. We live in LA but will be frequenting FC when we come up to San Francisco

We dined at Foreign Cinema many, many times before we moved to Canada 18 months ago. When we returned for a visit one of the first things I did was make a reservation and we brought 2 friends along. We were not disappointed. Everyone had something different and enjoyed their meal very much. The service was great - not overbearing, but always right there when needed. I would not hesitate to recommend it, and will always make a point of dining there when we return for visits.
ecclectic atmosphere, excellent service, wonderful food

The food was great. The wine was awesome. The server was able to make excellent recommendations. I will go back for sure. They have out door seating with a movie projected on a building wall. I will request a table out there next time.
review_title: The food was great. The wine

review:
I've got to give credit where credit is due...this place was as good as it gets!

Decor: Love the silent film playing in the background. The lighting was perfect for dinner time but light enough to take in the crowd. Table settings were up to par and all utensils were perfectly clean (yo'd be surprised how many nice restaurants get this wrong)

Service: Waitress was always available, never imposing and very knowledgeable of the menu and wine listings.

Food: Omg, the food! I know you can never really spoil chicken but this was chicken done impeccably well. I ordered the lamb and oyster salad appetizers as a meal. It came out looking really tiny but it was actually pretty filling.

Price: Priced very well for the quality of food and
review_title: I've got to give credit where

review:
I have dined at Foreign cinema for years. It has worked for dinner with friends or a business dinner. The quality of the cooking is ver high and extremely consistent.

In short this restaurant is a gem.
review_title: I have dined at Foreign cinema

review: Really enjoyed my dinner at Foreign Cinema. It was not my first visit. I have also had brunch a number of times and that was great too. Had the pork, well prepared, inventive dish, delicious. We had a wonderful waitress who knew alot about the menu and was appropriately attentive. Highly recommend.
We had a wonderful family dinner at Foreign Cinema...love the setting with a movie coming on at dusk and the food was great.
Great setting, but food could be better for the price. Winelist is good and fairly priced.

Each dish we had at Foreign Cinema was truly exquisite, from grilled calamari, to duck, halibut, and finally a lemon tart with strawberries. It's hard to describe when each flavor is perfected while the dish is balanced overall. And the food is uncomplicated but interesting. This is the most memorable dining experience I've had in years ... Wow!
review_title: Each dish we had at Foreign

review: Fantastic. I can't wait to go again. The service was superb. The wine list is very unique!!
I think this is a great restaurant, I always have a good meal and a good time here.
review_title: I think this is a great restaurant,

review:
First timer to Foreign Cinema. Had oysters (great) carpaccio (very scant serving)a nd risotto (very scant serving), before and during meal cocktails were well done, quickly served. The service was just about as good as it gets.

So, not thrilled about the food, drinks and food great. People watching was prety good but not as good as it is built up to be.
sub-par food for the price. overly attentive service...did they want us out?

The hostess was pretty rude and arrogant last Thursday night. Despite the fact that we had reserved, she made us feel like we didn't have any reservation and had to accept a choice between a table located on the door step at the entrance of the restaurant or a table in a windy and freezing area outside.
The other empty tables were reserved by some other privileged absent customers. This made us feel undeserving and we had to wait until 8:30pm at the bar to get a descent table. Our reservation was at 8:00pm.

Benjamin.
It was my first time at Foreign Cinema and it exceeded what I was expecting. We came during Vday weekend and I am definitely coming back. I had the tasting plate and it was excellent!!!!
review_title: It was my first time at Foreign

review: loved it. nice setting...nice entrance...nice ambiance...

Foreign Cinema continues to more than hold its own -- the food, setting, and service were all superb and made the evening very special and memorable. It didn't hurt that Saturday night's full moon was shining through into the courtyard! Bravo.
Excellent in mostly every way. A little on the noisy side because of all the cement in the building.

I've been to FC many times - but this last time was unimpressive.

As I have always found, the oysters at FC are terrific - but that was about it.

On this evening, service was bad - out waitress was just insincere, slow to take orders, inattentive and at times bordered on ignoring us. The pork chops were dry and sides were awful, the halibut was bland. The calamari we ordered was such a small order - big waste of money.

It was a disappointment because at FC in the past, I have found GREAT service, and food much better than this. It was my first time sitting in the restaurant instead of the patio - - I much prefer the patio.
review_title: I've been to FC many times

review: What a surprise to find such a gem in the Mission neighborhood! Interesting settings. I will sit in the court yard instead and enjoy the movie next time!!
review_title: What a surprise to find such

review: This is still a HOT spot, and for so many reasons! The vibe is good, the food is special - try the Madras Fried Chicken, for instance - and the bar scene is lively.
review_title: This is still a HOT spot,

review: Yummy food. Small portions for the money. Located in a seedy neighborhood.
Always a treat to dine here.  One of my favorites in San Francisco.
review_title: Always a treat to dine here.

review: Very exellent ambience, good service.  Food is a little overpriced for what it is.  Great for groups - nice big tables and outdoor seating with heat lamps.  Would be good for a date.

One of the best evenings we've spent! Fantastic food, quality was superb, awesome service (Eloise was tops!!)Totally all around wonderful expereince. We live in Napa and have access to amazing places to dine...Foreign Cinema stood out, head and shoulders. We WILL be back and tell others about this gem!
Ciao
review_title: One of the best evenings we've

review: The neighborhood that Foreign Cinema is in does not invoke a lot of confidence.  But once you open the doors to the restaurant you are surprised by this oasis.  The food was amazing the service wonderful.  The outside dinning was great and it was a rare sunny evening in San Francisco.  The only complaint was the VERY hard wooden benches that serve as seating.  My behind is still a bit numb.
The food was spectacular.  Definitely on the top list of restaurants.

After an absence of five years (I moved away from SF), one might expect a restaurant to falter.  Not so for Foreign Cinema-- just as wondeful, vibrant and unique as ever.  The Belon oysters were TO DIE.

David and Andrew Stapelkamp-Lnae
review_title: After an absence of five years

review: atmosphere is key.  You must sit outside when you dine there
Excellent all around. Would, and have definitely recommended to friends.
Excellent wine list...food was wonderfully prepared and just right for the price. "You get what you pay for" and this place does that quote justice!

This was my third visit to Lulu over 5 visits to San Fran in 8 years.  Our food was excellent: mussels and wild mushroom bruschetta for applies.  Mains included Salmon a la Plancha, Rotisserie Rosemary Chicken and Prawn (pesto) Linguini-> if I'd had the room, I would have ordered and eaten them all.  Lulu is a very energetic dining experience and the smells of the rotisserie and pizza oven keep you salivating all night.

The two of us decided to share everything "family style" as suggested. We started with the appetizer plate, choosing the melon/feta salad, the goat cheese/bacon tart and the pistachio nut pate. Good portion sizes. The tart was excellent, the pate good, but the salad was less than fresh--melon was watery and tasteless. For our entree we shared the evening special of roasted  quartered duck with potatoes and loquats. It was pretty good, though very hard to eat/get off the bone. Could have been more tender and flavorful. Dessert was the plum cake/ice cream sandwich combo. Would have preferred a traditional plum cake with the creme fraiche ice cream (delicious) on the side. The icecream sandwich was hard to eat and silly.

LuLU has been my favorite restaurant for years, but not this time.   We got the halibut and it was over cooked and not by a little. The salad was all vinegar you could tell very little effort was put into it.

I was searching for places to celebrate my birthday and found Lulu on Yelp. It had good ratings and allowed me to reserve a table for 8. I was not disappointed. Walking in the first thing I noticed was the smell of deliciousness coming from the rotisserie and wood burning stove. I started with oysters, which were delicious, and had the pork and potatos for dinner. OMG it was so yummy! I nearly licked my plate clean. I finished with the chocolate cake, which was a little dry for my preference, and very rich, but still good. The service was good and there appeared to be a wide selection of alcohol from the bar. I would definitely recommend this place and intend to go back myself.

As usual, Lulu's was wonderful! The food was amazing! The staff was friendly and the wait staff was amazing. I have dietary restrictions that cannot be ignored, my server worked with me to find something that I could eat and I was very grateful for his attention to my meal and also the fact that he gave me several suggestions for things I could and couldn't eat.

We made a reservation for 4 for lunch on Labor Day at 12:30 p.m., and when we called to expand it to 6 the reservationist said they couldn't possibly do it at that time, but could take us at 12:00 p.m. We went, and during the entire time we were there only two other tables were occupied. We've had similar problems with LuLu before, being told they were too crowded when we wanted to go, but could take us at a less favorable time, only to find the place half empty. Perhaps they think this approach gives the impression they're very busy, even when they're not, but it's an attitude that is unacceptable.

LuLu is the perfect spot for pre-theatre dinner if you are attending a performance at Yerba Buena Center. Their pizzas are always consistently good as is the delicious chicken from the wood ovens. In fact all of their meats from the ovens are excellent - this time we had roast suckling pig! Good cocktails and great service. Can't go wrong.
review_title: LuLu is the perfect spot for

review: Great food in a really big restaurant. Service and food were really excellent.
review_title: Great food in a really big

review: Took my wife there to celebrate her 40th birthday last saturday night. Very pleased with the food, ambiance and service. My wife saud that the chocolate chip croissant bread pudding was the best desert she's ever had! Thank you. And thanks for not singing happy birthday to her :)
review_title: Took my wife there to celebrate

review: Been coming to this restauarant since 1994. It still has it.

I was recommended to try restautant lulu from a co-worked while visiting Northern California for work. The recommendation was to try the pizza and the goat, leek and bacon tart. My group of 3 tried the tart but not the pizza. ALL OF THE FOOD was tuly delicious and exceeded the group's expectations. I love the ambiance with the exposed burning wood in the open oven and the roasting chickens.
review_title: I was recommended to try restautant

review: Excellent food and service and the price was reasonable especially for downtown San Francisco. Be aware that portions are quite large and served family style so the tables can get cramped. They really should not put four on a small table.

This was my first time at LuLu, but it is now one of my new favorite places. What took me so long to get there? Our entire meal was amazing, from the cocktails (Lavender Fizz = YUM!)to Antipasti, from soup to entrees and sides; but the thing that blew my mind most was the chocolate chip croissant bread pudding. It was transcendant! The service was attentive and friendly without being overbearing or fussy, just the way I like it.
review_title: This was my first time at

review: We and 5 grandchildren (ages 10-15) had a terrific dinner, with great, attentive, service. The oak oven chicken has not been their signature dish for nothing! It and all we ordered were wonderful.
Amazing! Food was delicious! Service was excellent! We will definitely return next time we're in San Francisco!
More people need to check out Lulu for lunch! Ours was a very good meal, and I like the space even more in the day time, with the high ceilings, and other decor.

I was not that impressed with the menu and the food was a little bland. The service was okay but could have been better as well. Not a great place for a first date. More of a family place. There also didn't seem the need to serve the food family style since the portions are so moderate.
review_title: I was not that impressed with

review: Had a very excited experience. We will recommend to all of our friends.
Excellent variety of food. Preparation and taste of the food had a high delicious factor. Fab selection of wines by the glass. We will definitely return.
Very good food. Good wine list. The roasted ribeye was fantastic and so was wild mushroom pizza.
Place was awful. Specifically the service! Will not return.
I picked out Lulu from your online review. Although a few blocks south of the activity on Market St, it was a safe, convenient location. The restaurant exceeded my expectations in all regards.
review_title: I picked out Lulu from your

review: A wonderful find while visiting San Francisco. Will definitely go back. Superb food, wines and service.

Hadn't been in years but was impressed by the innovative menu and high quality of the food and preparation. Amazing that after all these years the large room still is impressive and not really dated.

It's still a very convenient place to eat if you're visiting any of the nearby museums.
review_title: Hadn't been in years but was

review: Lulu's never dissapoints. Everytime my family is in town we go. The food is excellent and the ambience is great. It is definetely kid friendly and accomodates bigger groups. It is also very reasonably priced for the wonderful quality of food. Service was great as well. I definitely recommend this restaurant.

Overall we had a very nice time and the food was very good and "approachable." Only minor complaint is that I was with a large group and we ordered a lot of dishes to share. The server did ask if we wanted them to arrive in a particular order and we did say no...which was a mistake because everything arrived at about the same time and we had a hard time keeping up. Aside from that, a very nice dinner out.
review_title: Overall we had a very nice

review: LuLu is a classic SF gem -- near the Metreon and South of Market. I work nearby and eat there often with clients, who are always wowed by its superior food and service.
review_title: LuLu is a classic SF gem --

review: The Friday specialty of roast suckling pig is very good. It could use a little of more of the crackling skin, still quite delicious. Drink prices are only nuts, not completely crazy as they are at many comparable SF places. Our party of three had first courses, entrees, 4 cocktails and 3 pichets (glass and a half) of wine for about $200 before tip. Everyone was happy with their dinner.
LuLu is always a reliable place to take friends and business colleagues. Its upbeat atmosphere and good food make it an enjoyable destination.
A great place if you live in the neighborhood or are going to something at Yerba Buena or the Metreon. The roast chicken is fabulous.
review_title: A great place if you live

review: As usual, the food was very good. The wine list is extensive, although the cost of the wines seems to be going up. Excellent service.
review_title: As usual, the food was very

review: Our experience was less than stellar. Our waiter forgot my wine order (though fortunately we weren't charged). The tables are right up next to each other. I can see where it'd be fun if you're in a large group, but if you're just a couple it's like you're eating with the people who are sitting next to you. In our case, the woman next to us seemed more interested in talking to us than her dinner partner. It'd be nice if they had some more private seating for those who wished it. Finally, to top it off, the food was SO salty. It was liked they had accidentally spilled the salt shaker on it. I couldn't even eat the short ribs though my husband said they were okay with enough mashed potatoes. Otherwise the food was rather unremarkable.
Great lunch for 6 of us. Family-style ordering was a definite plus. Imaginative menu, lots of good choices. Excellent service.
review_title: Great lunch for 6 of us. Family-sty

review:
Thank you for arranging our dinner resevation at Lulu. We have dine at Lulu for at least 12years. One of the reason we alway's have dinner there when we're in town is,
we can alway's count on the food and service.

Thank you once a gain Lulu, keep up the good work!.

Take care all!

Michele

Nothing special about the sandwiches. Salmon was fishy. Prix fix menu fun, but change entree to pasta dish other than sandwiches. too many potatoes, throw in a few grapes or apples with the potatoes, color and completion

Excellent torte.

thanks best service and ambiance

Ate and drank like piggies, had a terrific waitress (Tyler), and came early enough to watch the place go from quiet to bustling. Alas for her (and us), my order came late and then was not warm enough, which was inexcusable--obviously there had been a screwup in the kitchen. Tyler scrambled to make up for it, but the kitchen really let her down. She was sharp, pleasant, sassy, and offered excellent recommendations, but if the food doesn't come on time and prepared properly...

Still, I will come back and give Lulu another chance, as it has the makings of a place that could be top of my list.

always consistently high quality of food, and ALWAYS consistently professional service, all at reasonable prices

a pleasure to visit and rely upon when entertaining

The host was very welcoming, especially to my older mother. He sat us near the ovens so she would be warm. Our waiter was professional and personable and we received excellent service. There were five of us celebrating a birthday and we sampled the appetizer plate, a pizza, salad and several entries - Mom loved the pork chop with olive oil mashed potatoes. All of us were more than pleased with the wait staff and the meal. Three of them had never been to your restaurant and we all agree we would definately come again. The only complaint is the wine menu. It is so convoluted that after fifteen minutes of reading, we were ready to settle for water. But our gracious waiter came to the rescue with a delicious Pinot Nior suggestion.
Good food and portion size - came quickly - we all enjoyed it and will go back.

If you are looking for a great place in a great location and with amazing Mediterranean/Greek food Kokkari is the best place you can find. Their menu is great offering several dishes from lamb, fish, vegetables, etc Their desert options are awesome and their wine list is huge.
review_title: Great spot in SF. Food is amazing.

review: O garom no era atencioso, no entendiamos muito bem o que ele falava e ele no fazia questo alguma de se fazer entender. A comida  bem condimentada. O que mais gostei foi a entrada que meu marido pediu, eram pequenos carrs de cordeiro. Eu pedi uma entradinha que era gigante, tipo uma pizza no prato, mas no cardpio no dava para entender que era isso. Como 70% dos pratos principais era cordeiro. Pedimos dois pratos com cordeiro, um espeto com tomate e cebola; o outro prato foi carr com batatas assadas, que estavam boas e ponto final. Os pratos so grandes, timos para serem divididos, mas no fomos alertados quanto a isso e olha que pedimos entrada, salada (que tambm no nos foi explicado, quatro rodelas de laranja e nozes e o cardpio no deixa claro), prato principal e sobremesa (grande taa de soverte e calda industrializada, nada demais). Altssimo custo.

The restaurant has a lively warm rustic ambiance. The staff are friendly and attentive. The food is absolutely, mouth-watering, delicious  from appetizers, to main courses, and desserts. They have a great wine selection too. It's a great place to come with a group to celebrate a special occasion or even for a business dinner or lunch, as well as coming for an intimate romantic evening. I highly recommend this place for your next dinner out on the town. Kali Orexi!
review_title: The restaurant has a lively warm rustic ...

review: The food was excellent. Well prepared and delicious. The service was bad though. Our waiter couldn't have cared less about us, and constantly made it seem as though we were wasting his time.

Romantic but a bit pricy.
Necessary to wear suitable clothes
review_title:
Romantic but a bit pricy.
Necessary to w...

review: From start to finish it was a first class experience. Our server was warm and knowledgeable and very professional. The quality the food was outstanding. The positive energy in the place was contagious. We can not wait to get back up to San Fran to visit again.
What a great night . Took my son to Kokkari for his 18th birthday and we were both very impressed with the food, service and atmosphere. top to bottom a great experience. We will definitely be back
review_title: What a great night . Took my son to Kok...

review: My wife and I went here for my birthday and I can honestly say that this is one of the best restaurant that we have been to. The service was great and the server was very informative about the menu items. The food was absolutely life changing. I won't go through every dish we had, but I will give you all one tip: Save room for the ice cream sundae dessert!! It's enough for 2 and it's great. They make the ice cream in-house, so you can definitely made freshness. Trust me, you'll thank me for it.
Fantastic food and good ambience as always.  Had trouble with my reservation and was treated as an outsider until I proved it.  Lunch service was excellent.
review_title: Fantastic food and good ambience as alwa...

review: Superb Greek food, particularly the lamb, whole fish, and starter courses. Superb desserts. Very friendly and attentive service. Even the valet service out front works well. A seamless and completely satisfying dining experience.

Delicious food, wonderful atmosphere, and outstanding service. All things that make a wonderful dining experience. 

Food full of flavor with great selection of food items.

Have visited Kokkari several times and have never been disappointed.  Took a co-worker out for a thank you lunch and she was thrilled.  Not only was the food excellent, but the service was professional and we were able to hear each other talk!  Definitely make reservations.

Kokkari is one of those rare places that is invariably very busy yet somehow always manages to provide superb Mediterranean food (far better than any meal we've had in Greece) served in the most efficient and cordial yet unobtrusive way by a very professional staff. Fabulous how our matre d' entertained our 3.5 year old granddaughter. Kokkari's wine list, while not huge, is ample and includes many fine "reserve" bottles.
Offers what's probably the best value of any high end restaurant in the Bay Area.
Top restaurant on my list of best restaurants ever. All I can say is, 5 stars all the way!

On a trip to SF in 2012 I was taken to Kokkari for dinner. I promised myself I would go back next trip out.
I must admit I was a bit nervous going there again because I brought 3 friends with me. I had raved about my prior dinner so much they started teasing me and putting the pressure on that it better live up to what I had built it up to be.
Kokkari did not disappoint. It was fantastic just as I remembered.
Great service. Great food. Great Wine. Already planning another trip just to come for dinner

This may very well be the best restaurant meal I have ever eaten. And I've eaten a LOT of restaurant meals! Our party of four ordered 8 appetizers, 2 main courses and 2 desserts. Our server did an excellent job of pacing the dishes. Everything was excellent!

Getting stuck in a hole, i.e., the worst table in the place (right next to the waiter station in the corner right of the fireplace) changed the entire experience. I was previously pretty excited about this place, but will skip it in the future.

i tried the lamb they roast in the front of the restaurant - it was great! some pieces were melting in my mouth and some were chewy.
the seabass was very tender without dryness,and very well cleaned from bones.
I particularly was delighted with my desert - a baked apple! it turned our a very substantial portion and very delicious too, with walnuts in the middle. Like the place and will try to get the table in the nearest future again!

We'd heard that Kokkari was THE hot place to eat but couldn't work out dinner so we dropped in for lunch and after a short wait were seated in the spacious rear dining room.  Somehow they manage to make a generic old business district building feel like you were dining somewhere in Greece - not all blue-and-white but rather subdued with rustic elegance.  Every dish was prepared perfectly and every bite was a pleasure.  This is Greek (and related Mediterranean) cuisine raised to a whole 'nother level - and I've eaten in some truly wonderful traditional Greek restaurants.  Worth seeking out.
Always a great job done in hospitality, and quality of the food.
review_title: Always a great job done in

review:
Kokkari was amazing! It is usually hard to say that you enjoyed everything about a dining experience...but this time I did.
Hostess: Sweet and "on the ball"
Server: Made you feel special, new her menu, timely but never rushed
Atmosphere: Loved it! It was a beautiful evening. All windows were open and the fireplace was on. Great chairs. Rustic elegance.
Food: Everything was exceptional

Cant wait to go back!
Great attention to detail. We felt very well taken care of by the waiter, bartender and the bus staff

Lunch here may have been our best meal of the trip. We pigged out on multiple tasty appetizers main courses desserts and well priced wines and were too full for dinner. Will head back the next time we are in city.
Went to Kokkari for an anniversary dinner and was blown away by the amazing food, great wine list, and great service. Definitely a must for those who enjoy Mediterranean food.
Kokkari has everything I like in a restaurant! Delicious food, personal service and comfortable, happy ambience!

Service was perfect. Ambiance was perfect. It was our first time dining at Kokkari and we look forwatd to going back. There is something to be said for a restaurant that is still seating and in demand at 10:30pm, including a group of 16 at a communal table near the open kitchen.

It is across the street from a park on Jackson. We sat overlooking the park for lunch. The first thing that strikes you aside from the friendly people is the interior decorating which might be called "old world Greek". Free from normal budgetary constraints because of a generous gift certificate, we ordered sundry appetizers for the four of us and found them all beautifully presented, perfectly prepared and most important... delicious. We weren't sure if we would want to order lunch before we ordered the appetizers so we waited until we were almost through with them and there was never any sense of trying to rush us. Our waiter found out for my wife how the special beets were prepared and enjoyed talking about it with her.
review_title: It is across the street from

review: This remains our Number One favorite restaurant in all of San Francisco!

I never write reviews, but my experience here truly was exceptional. When I reserved, I requested a quiet table because one of the party is hearing impaired. It was obvious when we arrived that care had been taken to comply with our request - it was gracefully handled. Our server, Katy, knew the specials and explained them expertly. She was attentive and excellent. We all shared many small plates - the food was creative and delicious!

We were so impressed with the service and special attention we received at Kokkari. We mentioned it was out anniversary on the Open Table reservation and the staff took it upon themselves to present us with each a glass of champagne and a complimentary dessert. The service was amazing and the food was so delicious. Great ambiance for a special evening. I have mentioned other special events and requests in the Open Table comment window before and have had not response from the resturant. Kokkari really personalized our dining experience.
Everything was wonderful. The food was perfect. The service was perfect. We will definitely go back on our next trip to San Francisco.
Visitors to SF, we were deighted with our Kokkari experience. Always good to find a menu with excellent offerings that makes choosing difficult. Save room for the baklava!
review_title: Visitors to SF, we were deighted

review: Delicious! Great food and wine. Service is excellent and the restaurant is beautiful!!
Great food, friendly service and pleasant interior - what more can one hope for?

Over hyped and crowded and loud. Our table was 5 inches from the table next to us near the entrance. I guess we weren't "regulars". It was a 4 turned into 2 two's.

The food was unexceptional, as was the service. In fact my whole fish was deboned and the carcass, skin and bones were left on the plate Huh? It was gross. A pile of debris.

I will not go again and I will not recommend this restaurant.

Very crowded and active, also well reviewed. Was disappointed in the food.

We had three appetizers, the special entrees and desert and while there were no complaints, nothing stood out. Was expecting more wow factor for the prices.

Have had much better greek food in the little neighborhood spots. The food here was more Greek themed than Greek- just not what we were expecting.

Small portions, high prices, uninspired dishes. Not a bad experience in any way, just a blah one.

Go hungry! The portions are large. Everything tastes so good it is hard not to clean your plate. The waiter and bus boy were friendly and helpful even though the restaurant was packed and they were busy.

We enjoyed our lunch very much. I especially liked the octopus appetizer. I was a bit disappointed in the quail. I have had it there before for lunch, and it used to be served like a salad. This time the quail was served with hot, oily vegetables. It was not a very good summer dish. The berry dessert was great. It reminded me of an English summer pudding.
Food was excellent get zucchini for apps and lamb shank for entree
Kokari never ceases to amaze me. Superb food and service every time.
pleasantly surprised by the full flavorful choices; we had a group of 5 with all ordering unique items. The wine list was extensive and very reasonably priced. We'll plan to return

Forget everything you ever thought about Greek... or Lamb...

Get schooled!
great place to go eat! the only issue was tables were a bit too close for me
review_title: great place to go eat! the

review: The food and service were top notch, as always. We had one person with dietary restrictions and our server had a special menu preprinted with selected appetizers and main dishes to meet that individual's cumbersome requirements. It was the most tasteful and elegant solutions to what could have been an awkward situation. The goat stew was amazing. The lamb chops are legendary for a reason. The desserts are sinfully wonderful and the house made ice cream is the best.

Our visit was quite an enjoyable experience. The food exceeded all expectations, especially the lamb meatball appetiser and the Greek yoghurt dessert. We had an overly-enthusiastic waiter (Read: Talkative) who could not read our body language when we started to ignore him. Sometimes guests need space. I think the guest at the next table was equally turned off. The quality of service was made up for by the most hardworking busser we have seen ever - he was polite, efficient and helpful. Furthermore we were quite upset that we were assigned a table in the middle of a crowded room, despite the request for a corner. We arrived very early and there were many, many empty tables.
review_title: Our visit was quite an enjoyable

review: I really like Kokkari both for the ambience and the food. This is also a great place for vegetarians. The service is wonderful and they even comped us dessert for my friend's Birthday!

Still serving some of the best food in town, this restaurant continues to impress. The starters, whole fish, lamb dishes, desserts, are all excellent. Service is quite good, if a little too enthusiastic and personal at times.

Had an epic evening at Kokkari. The entrees are to die for. My lamb shank was falling off the bone... succulent. What else can I say. On top of the exquisite food, the service was unreal. Our waiter was friendly, polite, knowledgeable... made us feel right at home. I can't forget to mention their wonderful Sommelier who recommended an absolutely dreamy bottle of red wine to pair our meal. Her recommendation was spot on, bravo! An excellent evening. I will go back next time I'm in San Francisco.

It is always a treat to dine at this fine restaurant. The food is excellent and the wait staff
could not be warmer and more accomodating.
review_title: It is always a treat to dine

review:
I am generally not a fan of lamb because of the usually gamey taste, but having read the reviews of the lamb chops and the lamb shank, I decided to take the plunge. The lamb chops were excellent. I had the medium well, which came out excellent. For starters, I had the Horiatiki salad and the Dolmathes. Both were refreshing and excellent. The use of persian cucumbers really set the dishes apart. Had the lamb paired with a greek red wine. It was excellent as well. The lamb skewers were solid, but I have been to other casual restaurants that have tasted similar. So definitely go for the lamb chops.

Absolutely excellent service as well. The waiter was Greek, which gave the restaurant an even more authentic feel. Will be back!
review_title: Greek food fit for a king!

review:
We were informed of the Kokkari experience by a couple from Marin. They felt this establishment is one of the better places for the dollar and I must agree. We ordered one item off the menu (chicken...Kotopoulo Souvlas) and a fish special (Sole). It is rather unfair to compare the two as the chicken would have been a winner in most restaurants, but the sole was so fresh and prepared so well, that the chicken didn't stand a chance.
I'm not sure I agree that the olives and bread should have a $7 charge (nice, but should only be half the price). Ambience was nice but very busy. Try to request a table in the back, as tables around the bar are way too noisy.
review_title: We were informed of the Kokkari

review: This restuarant has always been one of my favorites in the city.
Great food. Stopped by to celebrate a birthday. The peas with feta were great. Loved the fireplace roasted pork giro.

Kokkari Estiatorio is my favorite restaurant in the city. Right from the moment you enter the restaurant, you feel that you are traveling... The fireplace, the coffee place, the bar, the lighting, you are not in San Francisco anymore.
The service is solid but not too much, and people don't make you feel awkward here as it can happen in fancy restaurants in the city.
As the food, it is really Mediterranean/Greek restaurant at its best: full of flavors, quantities are good, and with a lot of consistency across the menu.

I would definitely recommend Kokkari to anybody!
We were visiting San Francisco from NYC and a client of my husbands recommended we try Kokkari - it was Excellent! GREAT wine list and outstanding Mediterranean food!
Great dinner. Interesting takes on classic Greek dishes and new gems to boot.

My wife and I have always been impressed with Kokkari. On our last visit, however, they went above and beyond. We had reservations for 6:45PM and because our toddler son was still sleeping we had to move around our reservation and they were very nice about it. Our server, Majid, is probably the best there. He is super nice and courteous and answered all our questions and recommended some awesome things to us.
You can never go wrong eating at Kokkari. The food and ambiance have never disappointed.
review_title: You can never go wrong eating

review: Great food, incredibly friendly and helpful wait staff!
I took my wife here for our engagement dinner and recently returned for our second anniversary. They did a great job making us feel special and the food was very good for the price.
review_title: I took my wife here for our

review: This is the most expensive lunch for two I have ever had. It was a business lunch, but I still feel it was extremely expensive. The service was impeccable. I had a lot higher expectations for the food. It was good, but for the price, it wasn't mind-blowing.
Great place....we loved it!! Our wait person, Brett, was an added bonus.
Fantastic food and service...I'll definitely be back and be sure to recommend the restaurant to my friends and family as well. Thanks for the great dining experience!
Outstanding food, excellent service and a great location. I recommend to anyone for a casual lunch.

Simply the worse service ever. Managers walking around were clueless as to the poor service that is being given. Our waiter never filled our wine, never cleared soiled plates we ate with the same utensils for muliple courses and every course was auctioned off. We could not believe that the managers would not walk by a table and notice that wine glasses were empty, crumbs were all over the table and empty plates from previous course were still on table. The poor service made our experience less than a memorable fair dining experience. We noticed employees training new ones and I think this is the first sign along with the recent Bauer negative review that the days of glory will be history soon and a for lease sign will be on display soon.
Excellent service and gracious staff. Delicious food.
I was happy to bring a friend from out of town for a delightful lunch.
review_title: I was happy to bring a friend

review: I wasn't as impressed as in previous visits... the food was good, not great. Very expensive now, and nothing really special, some very tasty but some very dry and bland. The ambiance and service were nice, but for the price, I will go elsewhere next time.
review_title: I wasn't as impressed as in

review: We've been going to Kokkari since shortly after they opened, I think that's over 12 years now, and it never dissappoints. The Lamb is the best is the City, the service is impeccable and the space is gorgeous. It remains one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. I went with a friend who is diabetic and he ordered the greek yogurt with walnuts, dates and honey for dessert. It was delicous. Not as good as my Baklava, but good to know it's there for folks who want to behave after dinner. My only disappointment this visit was that the Watermelon and Feta salad wasn't on the menu but I since the chef can't control the seasons I won't hold that against them. We'll go back in the summer.
I did not like my dinner but that was because I ordered the wrong meal for me. All the appetizers and the desserts were delicious.
review_title: I did not like my dinner but

review:
We ate here about a year ago and we were extremely pleased. This time the food (lamb shank and moussaka), by comparison,
was not good. It had a certain steam-table quality.
review_title: We ate here about a year ago

review: I asked for a somewhat private table, and was happy to see that they made an effort to accomodate this with a table away from other diners. It was a first date and I don't like sitting shoulder to shoulder with other patrons while I'm trying to get to know someone. The food and the service was impeccable, and I will definitely be back!
review_title: I asked for a somewhat private

review: We had a great time at Kokkari~ The food was delicious! We ordered appetizers to share and entrees after. Next time, we'd order only appetizers and eat tapas style in order to try more things. Our server was having an off night, but that can happen. We'll definitely be going back again. I'd request to sit in the "front room" where the fireplace/bar are. The ambiance was very cozy and the fireplace warm on such a cold night.
review_title: We had a great time at Kokkari~

review: A true find. One of the best meals I've had in San Fran
review_title: A true find. One of the best

review: Greek food like you've never had it. The best Ouzo tasting in SF.
standards remain high and always a dining pleasure at Kokkari.
The food was fabulous and the atmosphere lively and fun. I would go back again tomorrow!

I've been here a number of times -- my selection was simple, salad & some spreads. Both were under par with little flavor or flare. The heirloom tomatoes were forced, and lacked flavor. The spreads were under spiced and in need of flavor. Just a so so meal. The space is beautiful.
review_title: I've been here a number of

review: Last there a few years ago, we are out of town visitors. Food is still great, and still great ambiance.
review_title: Last there a few years ago,

review: I truly challenge you to try and have a bad dinner at Kokkari!!! it is impossible. Every thing is very well thought-out and implemented successfully. I chose Kokkari to celebrate our 10th anniversary because I really wanted a great experience and I got it. The food was fantastic, the service very friendly and very competent, and the atmosphere and the lighting beautiful and romantic.
review_title: I truly challenge you to try

review: Kokkari rules. Great Mediterranean cuisine. Dishes are simple, but tasty. If you like pork, sometimes they do a rotisserie special that is to die for. I had the lamb rotisserie on this occasion and it is also very tasty. Don't miss the octopus appetizer. My favorite dessert is the yogurt and honey, but we had the baklava ice cream and were not disappointed. Go once, go often.

I work in the food sector (top restaurant) in Madrid. Kokkari was a really good experience. Food, ambiance and service were great and in the end i fount it as a very good relation price-quality (120 USD total, tip incl., without wine, two people). Make sure you seat in the main area (salon). The private area (chef's table) could be a bit claustrophobic and the kitchen area is not as pleasant as the salon, but any option will be fine. Will definitely visit Kokkari again.
review_title: I work in the food sector

review: The food was outstanding and the service was truly something special. Both wine recommendations were absolutely perfect for the dish. I can't wait for my next meal at Kokkari.
This has been one of my top 3 for years. It never disappoints me.
review_title: This has been one of my top

review:
This was a wonderful dining experience! The food was terrific, complex, interesting and perfectly prepared. The service, impeccable. It's loud, but we were able to have a conversation throughout the evening without having to yell at each other.
Kokkari is definitely on the list for a return visit. And we've already recommended it to friends.

I can't believe this restaurant is 10 years old. I haven't dined here in years. Had a wonderful time. The service was excellent. We weren't rushed out the door after desert. The food was very good. It was quite packed for recessionary times!
The sommelier was exceptionally knowledgeable, attentive & unpretentious.
Kokkari is simple one of the best restaurants I have been at. Thank you for making my partner's birthday an special day. Kokkari has never disappointed us.
review_title: Kokkari is simple one of the

review: Greek food, all good -- great desserts too. Ask for a quiet section.
We sat in the downstairs room.  It was perfect for our group.
review_title: We sat in the downstairs room.

review:
We've been dining regularly at Kokkari for four years and are never disappointed.

Great food, great service. The room(s) transport you to your favorite European vacation. Love the decor. And no matter how busy it is, there is always enough staff to take care of everyone - you can sit back and relax and know you will be well looked-after.

I recommend it to everyone who asks "where's a great place for dinner in San Francisco?" 

And of course, it's our favorite!
Very nice restaurant. I would definitely go back again. Love the grill fish!
Always great food in a warm, cozy atmosphere. love this place!
review_title: Always great food in a warm,

review: We live in the South Bay and don't get to San Francisco as often as we like.  We had occasion to meet our niece in Union Square for dinner and chose Daily Grill based on past consistencies in food, service and hospitality.  We weren't disappointed.  Food was very good, service spot on and everyone had smiles and a welcoming attitude.  This restaurant never disappoints:  it has been a trustworthy "go-to" dining spot for decades.

A great meal, start to finish!  They graciously accommodated an eleventh hour request to change the reservation time, and seated us on arrival.  Setting was comfortable, with photos of notables past.  Service was professional and very thoughtful.  Menu is huge and varied.  Salads were fresh and well-dressed.  The chicken pot pie lived up to the hype--rich, creamy sauce, perfect, flaky crust, and tons of chicken.  Would definitely recommend, and look forward to trying their venues in other cities.
Great menu, something for everybody, even a gluetten free menu. Good prices, good service, Not a regular, but go there 1-2 times a year, never disappoints. Close to Union Square

Going to ACT, the Curran, or Geary? A wonderful place for an early dinner with a French bistro atmosphere. Delicious light dinners (try 600) such as seared salmon and asparagus, special treats, such as crab cakes and french fries, or for those with hearty appetites try the chicken pot pie. They're all yummy! Waiters are attentive, will get you out in plenty of time for the theatre. Just be sure to tell them where you're going and when, or they'll let you relax and enjoy the evening if dining is your evening entertainment. Perfect dinner spot close to Union Square without the fancy SF prices!
review_title: Best way to start a theatre night!

review: My wife had the tuscan chicken, and if she had three bites of it I would be surprised. When our waiter came by and asked how the food was, she told him that it was tasteless and that she didn't like it. He said he was sorry , but did not offer her anything else nor did he offer to take it off the bill. We also had a bottle of wine with dinner and although he had opportunity to pour us more on several occasions he did not. Although I did not stiff him in his tip I didn't leave much as we were leaving, he took a short cut through the kitchen to stand close to the front door as to embarrass us.
Lovely ambience, soft lighting, excellent device. Food very good, delicious dessert. Conducive for conversation, excellent location before going to the theatre.

Loved the old San Francisco decor, dark wood and roomy booths. We were asked if we were headed to a show (which we were) and assured we would make it comfortably on time. Service was attentive, but not rushed. On my first visit, enjoyed the ahi tuna salad off the 600 calorie menu with enough room to share a decadent banana cream pie for dessert! My friends raved about their blackened tilapia so that's what I ordered on my next visit. Gently spicy and delicious! My finicky friend said he'd order the chicken marsala again, tender and not overcooked, but wanted more sauce with capers. Everything's been a winner so far! Looking forward to trying out their other entrees, and recommending Daily Grill to my friends! Bravo!

Hamburger is outstanding.
Cobb salad did not have enough chicken, avocado, blue cheese, bacon, etc
Kids' dinners are a bargain.

We have been to Daily Grill many times. Usually I would rate everything higher than I have today, but they were very busy and we waited for several things. We heard many excuses, but that doesn't help. Our waiter was very good and personable. Very noisy table of young men next to us.
A pleasant, traditional restaurant with a great ambience in the SF theater district. Our family of six had an excellent pre-theater dinner experience.

REally appreciated the 600 calorie menu choices. The ones we had (seared ahi tuna salad and salmon burger) were excellent and just the right size portion. The kids had pasta and loved both dishes. Service was friendly and attentive. Water glasses were constantly refilled without asking. We were on our way to the theatre and the waiter was very accommodating to our schedule. Would definitely recommend this restaurant to others. Great location as well!

We ordered a side of potato pancake and got one little pancake for $2.50. Very disappointing. We split an eggs benedict which was simply placed on a plate next to the tiny pancake. Not impressive. My son had the belgium waffle which looked and tasted very good and was an ample serving. My daughter tried the frittata and said it good. The amount of food was light, and we are not big eaters. The atmosphere was very nice.
review_title: We ordered a side of potato

review: This was a very disappointing visit to the Daily Grill. We ordered Caesar Salad with grilled chicken and the Salad with Flank Steak. The Caesar Salad was bland and the chicken was dry. The Salad with Flank Steak was boring--I recommend the same salad at B.J.'s over this one by a mile. The steak was prepared well, and seems to have been marinated in wine. However, the salad was all romaine and might have been better had it been mixed greens. The thin onion rings were unnecessary and only contributed calories and fat to the meal. The ranch dressing was uninspiring and a balsamic vinaigrette might have been better, like the one at B.J.'s. Oh, and the price was much higher than B.J. I spent $63 on two salads and one appetizer-ridiculous.

My wife and I make it a habit to have appetizers and wine every time we attend theater. We like to sit in the bar area next to the street. On occasion we have had dinner there too. The menu is very eclectic and fairly well captures the San Francisco food taste. We usually share an order of seared ahi and a crab cake along with a couple glasses of the Markham Chardonnay. The deep fried kale served with the seared ahi is an excellent addition and along with the fresh ginger provides a superb taste. The crab cakes are delicious, well seasoned and cooked to perfection. Our food server is usually Paul who is excellent at his duties.
review_title: Theatre Dining at the Daily Grill

review: We really enjoyed the evening. There were may selections available for us. Everyone around us seemed to be having a good time.

This was our first time at the DG and really enjoyed it. The location was perfect as we were going to see Earl Thomas and the Blues Ambassadors (great music!) at Biscuits and Blues afterwards. The homemade bread was great, the cocktail list is pricey but excellent.
Our service was top notch. Larry and I shared the chopped salad, he had the Trout Almondine, very good. My grilled shrimp/pasta dish was ok, but I wouldn't order it again next time. Our friends had the steak and the salmon, very good. We really liked the ambiance, a busy place but the noise level was not so high that we couldn't talk. We'll be back.
review_title: This was our first time at

review: Excellant pre theatre restaurant. Food good and the service is efficient and timely.

"The Daily Grill" was the perfect place for our New Years Eve celebration...the atmosphere was great, the food was delicious, and "Andre" our waiter was outstanding! Great location near Union Square and many small theater's that are walking distance. There is a private "glassed in room" in the back that would be perfect for a large group or special occasion. Definitely a great all around restaurant!
Restaurant was cold and wait staff was inattentive. One of the most lacklust Ceasar Salads that I have ever had.

A good place to grab a decent meal at a reasonable price when you are not out for a really special dinner. If you want a high end dining experience the Daily Grill would not be your choice. If you want to top off the tank with some decent food at Union Square and save your extra pennies for shopping then Daily Grill is a good choice. One word of caution - the host is not good at punching the button to recognize your Open Table reservation. Fortunately the good Open Table folks fixed that problem (after the fact).
review_title: A good place to grab a decent

review: I used to like this place, alot. I've been going here for years, and always saw Daily Grill as a great find. Lately, the grill and the food has taken a turn for the worse. Gone are the big beefy burgers with the onion rings on top. Gone are the large portions that satisfied every appetite. Gone is the amazing cooked-to-order fresh food. Gone is the ambience of a grill that had the opportunity to appeal to locals and to tourists. This place now seems to be a hodge-podge of food, service, and has obviously started catering to tourists by serving the same food any tourist can find on the wharf. Very disappointing.

I have dined at the Daily Grill several times and am so impressed with the consistency of the excellent service and quality of the food. The location is convenient to Union Square and we had lunch here on our way to the Curran Theater. So many wonderful dishes on the menu, it's hard to just pick one, but the skirt steak salad was excellent! We got the Chef's Special Dessert - Strawberry Shortcake - and it was wonderful! Can't wait to go back!
review_title: I have dined at the Daily

review: Great place for a before-the-show meal. Food is good and they will accomodate diners splitting meals... they'll even divide it in the kitchen for you! The portions are large and tasty.
I always love the experience I get at the Daily Grill and this time was no exception. They got us right in and were extremely attentive to us. Our server was great.

Had booked way in advance, only to get to the restaurant and the first thing the waiter said was they were out of Turkey. How could that be on Thanksgiving day. So had to eat something else with my whole family. Aweful experience. Then the waiter literally messed up each order, especially my son who ordered pasta and ended up with chicken fingers instead. We didnt even mention it to the waiter, as he certainly didnt look like he wanted to work that day. To say the least we just wanted to get out of their as quickly as possible. We spent a week in Frisco for the first time and every thing was perfect, except our most important dinner, which was Thanksgiving.

The food is consistently good. The portions are HUGE - may be great for some, but recommend that you share almost any dish. I had a lime chicken salad that was very good, my husband was less excited about the steak quesadillas.
Not once was my water glass refilled and my watress was so busy that no one offfered to help even though there were lots of employees just standing around
review_title: Not once was my water glass

review: We eat here very often before going to the theater. The food is always delicious and well prepared, served hot. Portions are generous although they used to be unnecessarily larger. Service is outstanding; if you tell them you have to be out by a certain time, they always meet the deadline. That's important when you go before the theater.
review_title: We eat here very often before

review: The Daily Grill is awesome!!! They give you hugeeeee portions.. I went to the one in San Francisco and our waiter was from New York or something and he was so friendly and down to earth, will definitly go to the ones down in SoCal..

We have had many disappointing Christmas dinners; usually at very high prices. So this year we turned to dependable Daily Grill and were rewarded with a fabulous evening. Their Christmas menu had five wonderful choices at a reasonable $37 for three courses. We tried the prime rib and the turkey. Both were excellent with terrific side dishes. They also had their entire regular menu available, so you could tailor your options to fit your budget and appetite. All the servers were helpful, friendly and upbeat. They kept things moving without making anyone feel rushed. I believe holiday dinners here will be our new tradition.
Our server disappeared and we were waiting for our bill. Had to have the Host look for him to get our bill. Miss the turkey sausage. Will not be back for breakfast anytime soon.

Great pre-theatre dining. Comfortable atmosphere, dark wood, booths, plus
well prepared comfort food at an affordable price and friendly service.
I recommend Daily Grill for "just a good meal" when downtown for theatre,
shopping or just enjoying San Francisco.

We had a wonderful experience at The Daily Grill, we made our reservations six and noted that it was a Birthday Celebration and when we went in for dinner we were seated in a private room in the restaurant that was just fantastic. Our server Eric was great and the food was excellent. This is our third timr dining here and will definetly be back.
We felt the food and service were extremely good considering the moderate prices. A great value! We will all be back again for sure.
review_title: We felt the food and service

review: The Daily Grill is excellent! This is my fourth time to this restaurant and the service and the food is amazing each time. Anyone who wants to find an amazing restaurant in Union Square, this is the place to go. I have recommended this place to friends and family.

We booked from the UK for Christmas Night and had lunch at the bar on our arrival in SF to 'check the place out'. All seemed fine and the ambience is good, however, dining on the night was nothing special and we would not return. Some of our 'problems' were acknowledged by the manager but not actually resolved.
That being said the place was packed with people queuing for some time to get a table so it is obviously a popular location and our experience might have been less than the norm.
review_title: We booked from the UK for

review: I was very pleased with this restaurant. It is attached to the Haderly Hotel and a bit hard to find, but the interior was very well done, service was exemplary and the food was a good value for the money.
review_title: I was very pleased with this

review: Daily Grill is one of our favorite "pre-theatre" dining spots. They are very aware of time contraints and get you in and out, without feeling rushed, in plenty of time. They are also very accomodating about splitting entrees, generally done in the kitchen, and nicely presented at the table. They also currently have a great pre-fix three course menu. There is nothing "chain-like" about this location. Walking distance to Curran and ACT as well as Union Square.
review_title: Daily Grill is one of our

review: Great spot for lunch and dinner. The lunch menu is varied and the food is terrific.

I've been going to Garibaldi's for about 5 years now. Every once and a while they seem to have an off night and this past Sunday was such an occasion. The food was not up to the usual standard. Salmon was small and quinoa was bland. The dish was described as containing fennel and olives. We found no hint of fennel and 3 half olives. The food also took forever and when we finally found someone to ask they apologized that they were "turning over the kitchen". The worst though was the service. We've had great servers in the past at Garibaldi's - true professional servers. Our server this time was very young didn't know the menu and was basically absent for the entire dinner. Water glasses ran empty, I was served my dish but had no fork.

the calamari appetizer was really good. The salads were too big, and just OK. The steak was OK. 
It was a last minute booking, so we were happy, but wouldn't book again for nice dinner out.

A locals favorite with guaranteed good food and a menu that changes up the appetizers from time to time. Regulars come back for the entree classics so wouldn't want them to change. Up in the back a separate area that works well for small groups. We do our invited lecturer dinners here on a regular basis and restaurant is very accommodating. Having a quick bite at the bar works but you have to come very early or later to get a seat. Valet parking available which is nice since parking in this area can be a pain.

Anniversary meal with my wonderful wife. Asked for a special table in the open table notes and was seated in a very crowded section with a pole next to the table - I asked the waiter if we could move to a more quite spot and he quickly ushered us upstairs where we had a much nicer dining experience - food, atmosphere, service, all was delightful.
I keep coming back here year after year. Always great fod and service.

We had the reservations for some time but unfortunately was not impressed. We were sitting on top of each other and it seemed that even the wait staff (when we saw our waiter) had a hard time navigating as well. We were expecting more from the previous reviews, but other than for the occasional drink, would not recommend.

All in all the food was creative, but the lack of attention from the staff (almost 30 minutes just to place a drink order?!?) has turned us away from visiting again.
The ONLY downside, is that it is so loud you cannot talk to the people at the same table with you unless you yell.

A recent visit to Garabaldi disclosed a smart and lively restaurant and bar very popular with urbans young and mature. The menu is continental, and the food is generous, delicious, and reasonably priced.

We had a very positive experience, especially the food and service. We had always been there for lunch when visiting San Francisco for the day. The only downside was the level of noise when the restaurant was completely full.
review_title: We had a very positive experience,

review: Great food and great service in stylish surroundings. A definite winner!
I've had many delicious meals here, however, this evening our pumpkin humus appetizer and chopped salad courses were mediocre, while our main dishes were wonderful.
Great dining experience. Attentive waitstaff, amazing food, can't wait to go back.

All three members of our party greatly enjoyed our dinner at Garibaldi's. The antipasti were tempting (particularly the prosciutto and figs), the Garibaldi's salad with fresh nectarines was my idea of a perfect salad, and while I think we disappointed our waiter in all ordering the same entree, all of us fully enjoyed the beautifully prepared pork tenderloin with its side dishes. Our waiter was both friendly and just attentive enough, and the bartender deserves a medal for getting the blend exactly right in both the pear tree and the margarita. We are recommending this to our friends, and we will be back soon.
review_title: All three members of our party

review: Excellent local place - Nicest staff in the city. Comfort food, lovely dining room. Not loud. Gorgeous 8 top in corner. Great for sun dinner with the fam.

I went for the Dine About Town menu. Great service, and the DAT menu offered some good choices from their regular menu. The risotto crevettes were tasty, but probably better shared as a little heavy to eat all of them yourself ;) The salmon was cooked perfectly on a bed of hidden rice and greens, but these were entirely too sweet to be enjoyed. The chocolate budino was tasty for dessert, and is essentially a molten chocolate cake. It really is a great neighborhood choice, and I could guess that many of those present were from the area.
I love Garibaldi's! I've gone there for years and the food and service is always wonderful.
This is my favorite neighborhood restaurant and my place to have Thanksgiving dinner every year. It doesn't matter if I am alone or with others, the food and the service is great!!
