Superb service. Quiet enough to talk without straining voice.

This restaurant never lets me down. With a location right down the road, it's tempting to make this a weekly event -- not sure if my wallet could handle it, though! Don't know what to order? Start with a Garibaldi's Manhattan, then munch away on the chopped salad while debating over whether or not to order the chicken, the lamb, or the off-the-menu burger. You can't go wrong with any option. The "new" pastry chef is a welcome addition as well, though I was sadly disappointed with the quality of the single profiterole. Too dense for my liking, and surprising given the lightness and quality of the fruit cobbler crust (that we had during our last visit).

Garibaldi's was the choice for that my daughter made for her Birthday dinner. We have dined at Garibaldi's many times for various reasons for both lunch and dinners. Garibaldi's continues to be one of our favorite restaurants.
Knowledgable, attentive, professional wait staff. Fresh fare with an occasional flare. We look forward to returning often.

The scallops were some of the best I've had - each scallop served atop a portion of delicious lentils, with tiny grapefruit segments and cipollini onions - and a very generous serving. The service is notably gracious as well.
Had the tour of italy prixe fixe. Items change, but that night it was exactly what i wanted--perfect!
review_title: Had the tour of italy prixe

review: extremely loud, very small portions, only one choice for entree, many better choices I could have spent $100+ when I decided to take an out of town guest out to dinner in san francisco
we really enjoyed our meal and the service was great. the wine list could use a little more work, but overall we were all happy with the choice.

We were a group of 5 having something of a reunion and needless to say, we were distracted. Our server, Zach who was very attentive and knowledgeable, graciously kept us on track.  We had a marvelous time.
review_title: We were a group of 5 having

review: Their creations are delicious, surprising and honest. The service is relaxed yet nearly always impeccable. On this occasion, letting them know that we had two diners with sever gluten allergies resulted in our server going above and beyond what we may have expected to ensure that everything we ordered was just right. This gem in the neighborhood just keeps delivering.
Never disappoints with its delicate flavor combos and big big tastes. Plus, you get tartine bread without the long wait in line :)

Service - 2 stars -- I had to ask the waiter to come back and serve me coffee. The waiter did not come often to check on our food/drinks.

We ordered coffee and the pound cake to start our brunch. The pound cake was really nothing, and it costed $9.  I expected something better as I knew the dessert from the Tartine bakery was champ.  That was really disappointing.

We then ordered shared food (eggs and crackers with caviar). IT was OK-OK. Nothing breathtaking and overpriced.  Kind of disappointing.

Phenomenal food - creative, extremely flavorful and inventive but not snobby!  Very accommodating and down to earth service .  We were running late and called, they saved our table, accommodated a stroller and were totally low key about it!  I also requested a dairy free dinner and they were remarkable with that as well. This is what a great SF restaurant should be like, in my opinion. Looking forward to going back.

The weekend brunch menu is limited but executed well. The yogurt with fruit balanced fruit, crunch and tartness. I was disappointed that there were no Bloody Mary's and the iced tea was, well, horrible.

Food was delicious and well presented. Portions were good for 2 people to share (family style). Ambiance was great for catching up with a friend or a date, enough buzz to not feel too silent, but not crazy load and annoying to talk over.

We came here as it was recommended by a friend. We ordered our food before any of the 4 tables next to us and we were the last to get our food. We had only ordered two dishes vs. the other tables who had ordered a lot of variety of dishes and yet we got served last. The waitress never apologized to us or recognized that we were not getting our food. So, I'm two hearted as I would like to go back because the food was excellent but do I want such bad service? She hardly checked on us and she totally ignored us while we were waiting for our food.
review_title: The food is excellent, the srvc not

review: We went back because it was soooo good and were equally impressed again, gonna make this the regular date night spot. Don't tell anyone.
Somethings are hit or miss. Really liked the smoked potatoes. Did not care for the beets in yogurt and dill or the beef tartar. Dessert was a complete miss. Would come back for lunch and skip dinner.
The potato flatbread with apricot jam and cream is incredible!

We shared small plates and two entrees among three people, thereby sampling much of the menu. The food was creative, delicious, but extremely rich--despite small portions given the fact we split everything three ways, one felt quite overfull quite quickly. We also filled up on the bread which was as expected sublime. The poundcake desert was disappointing--rhubarb jam much better than the cake itself.
I cannot fault the food, or the service--but I have to say that this is not the way I prefer to eat--too much cream, yogurt sauces, too rich for my taste.

Sadly for us, too noisy for conversation. We will visit at dinner to judge whether it is any better then before we make a reservation. We are fans of Nick Bella's cuisine but maybe we will have to settle for take out.

Wonderful dining experience. Menu is conducive to sharing which gives you a lot of variety. Highlights were the fishernan's stew and the beet salad. Incredible assembly of flavours that are beautifully balanced. The tyro cheesecake for dessert was the best was to end...not overly sweet with the right level of refreshing citrus to round out an very worthwhile trip to the Mission.

Amazing New Year's Eve dinner with taste and measure. Each course is a discovery of flavours, a surprize for eyes and taste. We loved every one and the combination with fantastic wines. Wonderful homemade bread, elegant ambience, unforgettable supper!

The dinner menu is limited and the portions are small. The food is high quality and full of flavor. It's a good place for conversation and drinks.
I had to change my reservation twice because my party kept changing sizes - they were very accommodating.
Absolutely love this place. Nick, the chef, has really upped the ante with Eastern European influences in the food. Outstanding place.

The five of us thought the waitress was less than enthusiastic. Not rude but just too flat. She didn't seem to smile at all, as if she was distracted by something on her mind.
The food was really delicious and we would definitely return.
review_title: The five of us thought the

review: This is the best restaurant ive been in so far as far as everything. Service was over the top. Friendly and caring. The pork blood sausage was superb. Just recommend to make a reservation Its really packed at nights.

The food was amazing! Our waight staff was just okay at the beginning and then once he realized we were in the industry the chef sent something out. After that they were great. We got a bottle of wine which was poored wrong but it's okay because they made up for it in service. It was a great night and I would recommend it to anyone who loves food.

We had a fabulous meal (Pickled Watermelon Rind, Roasted Brussel Sprouts, Chicory Salad, Mullet Roe and two soups). Everything was wonderful as always.

The Brussel Sprouts might have been the best sprouts I've ever had. They were perfectly roasted and then tossed in a dressing made from orange and lime. They ended up rich, crispy, soft, sour, citrusy, fabulous. There was just the slightest hint of sweetness from the orange that brought out the natural sweetness from the sprouts.

They were quite late in seating us for our reservation but more than made up for it with the outstanding service. Great info on the wines we tried and pairing suggestions with our food made it a very fun and memorable dinner.
review_title: They were quite late in seating

review: Service was great: helpful, knowledgeable, attentive but not hovering. I looked up the menu online after making the reso, and was like "huh," because I didn't see the food I'd had there before and a lot of the items I wasn't familiar with. But I trusted it was great on previous occasions and went with it. The food has an eastern European flair now and is very hearty. Everything was absolutely delicious and a unique food selection with excellent baked staples. Buttermilk ice cream with raspberry sorbet was outstanding and don't miss the bone marrow butter/cream on toasted rustic bread, served alongside the brisket goulash. Also good was the sour cherry chilled soup with creme fraise.
The bread was fabulous. Everything else was bland, greasy, and salty. Blech.

Bar Tartine was wonderful! It took a little long to get a table, I had a reservation for two at a separate table (they do communal seating as well), and it still took about 25 minutes to get seated. When we arrived the host told us there was a couple "leaving" right then. I would not let this story scare you away from Bar Tartine, for the service and food were very good, and our food came in less than 10 minutes. GREAT PLACE!

This is a lively and atmospheric neighborhood spot (a bit loud for those who are sensitive.) We started with fried chicken skins: not too greasy, but bland in flavor. Next, brussels sprouts: these were the standout of the entire meal. They had lemon zesty tang and carmelized texture and were all around delicious (this was a consensus among our party of four.) The 'highly recommended' paprika chicken was greasy, rich and lacked flavor. My husband, who usually finishes my plate, also avoided it after a few bites. He had the burger: juicy and the rosemary flecked french fries were tasty. The choc. souffle did not resemble a souffle. Instead, it resembled a rich, dense, flourless (delicious) chocolate cake with a ganache. Not souffle.
The appetizers were amazing and love the mackerel one. Burger was good too!
Food was good. The atmosphere was very compelling. The service could not have been better. The tartine bread unforgettable as well as their chocolate cream pie. I give them a 7 out of 10.

A favorite.
2 appetizers and wine at the bar makes for a perfect weeknight dinner
My wife and I had a great meal. I especially enjoyed the Hog Jowls.
review_title: My wife and I had a great

review: Had heard so many recommendations, so tried it. Food good but not exceptional, including all four courses we had. Both of us felt dissapointed. Maybe because there are so many restaurants in SF with outstanding food.

Totally delicious! We split the charcuterie plate, the burger & the linguica dish, with coconut rice pudding for dessert. Everything was super fantastic, great for the birthday dinner we had. The bottom bun of the burger was soaked with grease, so neither of us ate it, but it was still pretty much the best burger I've had.

The pickled vegetables on the charcuterie plate were incredible, too, especially the shallots.

Based on the incredible creations served at Tartine Bakery, I had high expectations of Bar Tartine that, unfortunately, their brunch just did not meet. Food was decent, just not over-the-top good one might expect. I mean, if you have the pedigree Tartine does, then at least make sure you dont overcook your poached eggs, mmmkay?

bar tartine has a wonderful seasonal menu that rarely disappoints. however, on this particular visit i felt that the black cod was possibly too rich. maybe just my taste buds that evening? always good service. be prepared to sit very close to other diners.

All the food, two salads and two mains were too salty. Salty and garnished with salt. Way, way too much salt. And, there was not a/c and not enough air movement. We were sitting in the back and it was about 85 degrees, no kidding! We had to go someplace else for dessert. Hopefully, this experience was an anomaly, as Bar Tartine, is a favorite of mine, and usually doesn't disappoint.
review_title: All the food, two salads and

review: We were excited about brunch at Bar Tartine...but were disappointed with the very unhealthy high fat no alternative menu. Certainly a haven for individuals wishing to splurge on calories and cholesterol...just not our preference.
Food wonderful, wait staff prompt and charming. Our only complaint was that it is very noisy. We had a lovely evening nonetheless.
It may be the French way to serve it (?), but Pork was served lightly seared on the edges and completely raw as if it were Ahi. They gladly heated it more.
review_title: It may be the French way to

review: The black cod/squid/pork belly entree was great, but the fois gras mousse appetizer wasn't worth it. The 4% health care fee put a damper on the evening.

We've dined at Bar Tartine three times and every time we had the same great experience: oustanding cuisine, well informed staff, interesting drinks ( we love the Belinni with Navarro Pinot Noir juice). The space is not very big and it gets crowded. If they could spread the tables around, so the guests have a bit of privacy that would be awsome.

Service was pleasant/cooperative but not intuitive.  My wife and I said we wanted to share the apps.  We ordered soup first, then sashimi and bone marrow together.  They brought one cup of soup and put it in the middle of the table.  We asked them to split it and they were happy to do it.  The bone marrow came with one small spoon.  Again, not a big deal but just bring two small spoons if we're sharing.  Food was very good other than the hamachi, which was attractive but missed the mark, and the chocolate tart (I think) which had mediocre chocolate flavor.  Tables were a little too close.  We live in the city so we understand space is difficult but one loud talker really effects the experience with tight tables.
Since I was alone, I was placed completely at the end of the restaurant right next to the cuisine. My experience would have been probably better sitting at the front.
review_title: Since I was alone, I was placed complete...

review: My recent visit to Thirsty Bear was less than I expected.  For some reason the server appeared to be in a hurry.  When my friend asked what was the specials the server pointed to the menu to indicate "read it".  My other friend had to flag him down to order a drink.  The service just wasn't acceptable.  The food was good but the service was a bit to be desired.

Go for Flemenco on Sunday nights, it's a great date! We sat right next to the stage, and having lived in Spain we can say that the Flemenco is good quality and very authentic. The food is slightly updated spanish, but all the basics are there and compare favorably to a good tapas bar in Barcelona: Gambas, Tortilla, Bravas, Butifara... all that was missing was some good jamon!
Love going to Thirsty Bear on a Sunday evening. The Flamenco dancers are always top notch, beer is always cold and delicious and the tapas can't be beat!
review_title: A Sunday evening at Thirsty Bear

review: Thirsty Bear has some tasty house beers (I had the porter, which may not be available at all times) and numerous satisfying tapas choices. Tapas lovers who have been to Spain may find some of the dishes unauthentic (e.g. the Patatas Bravas), but I liked our selections, which covered about half of the available tapas and the paella of the day. TB has traditional paellas, but the PotD was definitely Californian (bacon, broccolini, etc. with no seafood... still good though!) There are a number of menu items which are gluten-free, which was a relevant point for our group. The $30 per person estimate given by OpenTable is accurate, and our group of 4 felt like we ate our fill. Our waiter was very courteous and service in general was great.
Been here several times...Never disappointed. Very good sangria. Gambas excellent - ask for extra bread for the garlic sauce...

This was our second visit to Thirsty Bear and we were thrilled that the food and experience were as good as we remembered from our first visit. We had the added bonus of dining on a Sunday evening and enjoying the flamenco show. The pace of the evening was relaxed and the delivery of the various tapas dishes allowed us to savor every bit without being overwhelmed with a pile of dishes to try all at once. The wait staff was attentive without hovering. We have recommended Thirsty Bear to our friends and will continue to do so. The food is amazing with wonderful combinations of flavors and fresh ingredients.
We have visited Thirsty Bear quite frequently over the last five years and have always been well received and never had a mediocre meal, it was always very good/excellent
Solid place. EXCELLENT beer and bar....One of my favorites!!

We dined early (5:30)before a performance at Yerba Buena Center, so the crowd was still light. Our waiter was very helpful in explaining the menu, the specials, the beer choices, and the interesting wine list. We had three tapas for two people, and it was a perfect light dinner. The special crab cakes were yummy with a brilliant carrot puree. The tortilla espanol featured smoky pimenton and was rich and filling. The bocadillos, here 3 sliders with house-made little buns and Spanish chorizo filling, were excellent: and the golden beet salad on the side was a perfect sweet contrast to the spicy meat.

Next time we will allow a bit more time and sample a paella, which looked very interesting. And there will definitely be a next time.
Great tapas! Love the sangria. With a reservation, our party of 4 sat down right away on a Friday night -- not bad!

We enjoyed the flamenco performance during dinner as well as the food. We ordered the Valenciana Paella, which was delicious and 2 Tapas (1 beef & 1 seafood),both were okay. For dessert we ordered churros w/ Spanish Chocolate, enjoyable. Our waitress was not attentive until we were almost done. Overall, I'd recommend this restaurant to friends.

I hate to sound like a snob, but I know what good 'Spanish Tapas' taste like and Thirsty Bear made an attempt but unfortunately fell a little short. There are a few dishes that a restaurant should get right like 'gambas al allijo' what they served me couldn't have been worse. Also, living in Boston for 11 years, a city of micro-brews the two that we tested reminded me of 'Budweiser'.
review_title: I hate to sound like a snob,

review:
Tell the hostess to do better with loyal OpenTable members - she gave us a hard time about seating 2 of us at a 4-top as one of the first customers for lunch. We knew we wanted to spread out with a lot of tasting dishes - she was obviously a rookie or didn't know when to make exception to the rule. Most OpenTable restaurants do a great job of making me feel like a VIP - this one got off to a bad start due to surly hostess. Fix it.
Everything else was perfect - the rest of the staff was wonderful, and the food as always was fabulous.
review_title: Tell the hostess to do better

review: This place surprised me at the number of Craft Beers and fun Cocktails. Really good mashed potatoes with the Balsamic Chicken!
review_title: Good Food, Reasonable Prices for Union Square Area

review: We went to a show at Orpheum and wanted a place within walking distance that had good food. Jasper's met that goal for sure. Food was great. Service great. booth fantastic. Will be back for sure.
Lively atmosphere, great burgers with interesting toppings, and good drinks.

Went to Jasper's Corner Tap and Kitchen. We ordered a variety of small share plates for the table. Everything that came out of the kitchen was tender and had great taste. The beer selection was good but they had some beers I wanted to try on the menu but they ran out. It was a bit noisy but it was a saturday night during the holiday shopping spree so I guess it is to be expected. The best thing on the menu was the house made ice cream sandwich with tres leches sauce. It's presented like a grilled cheese and tomato soup. It's so cute and delicious. The ice cream sandwich was too frozen but let that baby sit in that awesome tres leches bowl and it's on!
review_title: small bites not to be missed

review: The food is AMAZING! The crispy piggy and their fries were my favorite part of the meal. I will definitely be back and hopefully soon! The service was a little slow but good I have no conplaints about the server. It is a little loud I asked my husband to repeat things several times. The noise level hopefully will not deter you because once the food arrives you will not want to talk or care about what anyone says becuase you be too busy enjoying the damn good cooking. Cheers!
review_title: The food is AMAZING! The crispy

review: Great food and beer selection, affordable prices, good meeting spot. Lovely evening.
Hidden Gem in Tenderloin. Good cocktail & food selection.
Spent three hours catching up with an old friend over a medley of appetizers, whiskey and dessert -- the latter two combined: Maker's Mark ice cream! Attentive service, good times.
Very friendly and quick service. Grilled cheese sandwiches were excellent. Great for lunch. We went for brunch and the menu is a bit lacking in that department.

I loved the waitresses, the bar and the hosts.
The food was great too!
We felt like our waitress avoided us the entire time. Also, they brought us the wrong food. She never checked on us, so we didn't ever get what we ordered.
Jasper's service was impeccable. Great staff, nice beer list (if a little overpriced), and good food. I had the J Burger, and it was cooked perfectly to my order (medium). Nice ambience as well.

Booked a table for two, but decided to sit at the bar so we could watch the game. Friendly bar staff offered tastes of all the beers on tap. Selection is fair, but nothing to write home about. Especially compared to gastropubs like Monk's Kettle or the Yard House. Ordered the wedge salad, a flight of deviled eggs & riblettes to start. The riblettes were awesome and I'd definitely recommend. A cheeseburger, medium rare, followed. It was okay, but not $15 worth. I'd probably choose the Daily Grill over Jasper's if I had to do it over and was in the neighborhood. It wasn't a negative experience, but it was pricey for something unmemorable.

The food was very tasty. We really enjoyed the Calamari because it wasn't dipped in a ton of batter where all you taste is the outside. And, the spring rolls where you wrap them in the butter lettuce, mint and cilantro were fabulous. 

It took our server a little while to get back to us once we sat down because she took note that we were waiting on an additional guest. But, we wanted to order wine and thought it was strange that she didn't come back to take the order, so we had to track her down. Also, they were having issues with their credit card machines which made checking out a bit longer than anticipated and we had a show to get to. 
On the positive side, they brought out our orders quickly and all of the servers were friendly.
review_title: The food was very tasty. We

review: Though the menu looked promising, the food did not live up to it at all.  Salad was drenched in olive oil based dressing and had welted completely by the time it came to the table.  The "goat cheese" in the salad was a glob of diluted goat cheese with a spread.  The pizza was a sore excuse for a pie in an Italian restaurant.  Looks like only the seafood pasta passed the test during our visit.  The wait staff though nice enough was not attentive to the table and simple requests, such as pepper were completely ignored.

There are loads of great Italian restaurants in San Francisco and tons of them in North Beach. I just found the food to be very mediocre and overpriced, and our server had way too many tables. Try somewhere else!
I would definitely recommend Panta Rei to anyone! The food and wine were wonderful.

The food is excellent, but the noise level is so loud you can't even hear yourself think. We didn't stay for dessert because our eardrums were sore and we had lost our voice from shouting. The server said the room we were in was actually the quiet room!
review_title: Excellent food, but bring ear plugs

review: Great homemade pasta, good service (imported from Italy!) good Italian wine choices, a great evening was had by all

food was delicious. service outstanding! had the special of the day pastas: gnocchi with lamb meat and risotto with osso buco. amazing. tiramasu was also fabulous. will definitely be back and highly recommend!

There are so many restaurants on Columbus that I would have never found this one without it being on the 1000 point bonus list. It was great. A great place to stop for a glass of wine and tiramisu also.

I had a wonderful dining experience at Panta Rei. The wait staff was great and attentive. The food was very authentic and fresh. If you want authentic Italian food with an up to date twist. I highly recommend Panta Rei.
review_title: I had a wonderful dining experience

review: Great food and service, good variety. Good Cocktails.

I have tried to get a Saturday night reservation at La Ciccia for quite some time, and I am so glad I kept on it!  We were a table of 4 and decided on family style dining so we could sample more dishes.  Every single dish (all 7!) was as good or better than the last.  I will go back as often as I can!  Phillip did a great job pairing wine for us with the meal as well, so if you want to leave the wine selection to him you will be very satisfied!

Note - parking is very difficult so take public or at least give yourself time to find something

LaCiccia is a near perfect restaurant.  The only negative is that it's an expensive cab ride for me.  Food and selection was fabulous.  The lamb dish is a must.  The wine choice can be left in the hands of the very competent staff.  This place quickly made it to my top 10 list in the city.  My list is void of the really high end (Danko, Saison, Coi, Spruce, etc.) places.  Quite frankly, no need to spend that much when you can get such unique and well-prepared food like you get at LaCiccia. The food is the event.

This spot has been a favorite of my husband & me ever since the first time we visited over 2 years ago. We try to go at least once every 1-2 months because we simply can't stay away. Service is top notch, warm, unpretentious, professional, but as if you were part of the La Ciccia family. Food is prepared with such care & attention to detail. Bottarga pasta is a fave, I'm absolutely addicted. Thank you La Ciccia... you never disappoint!

One of the best meals I've had! Reservations seem to be a must. I made them in their website. The only time I could get was 945 but made note to call if they could get us in earlier. I got a gracious call that they could get us in an hour and half earlier. The staff and owners were so kind. Fantastic food and service!! I will be back!

The food and wine at La Ciccia are amazing. We are always on the look out for authentic Italian and although we haven't been to Sardegna, the food definitely follows the same philosophies as food we've eaten in Liguria and the Campania coastal areas. The wine list is mind blowing with a focus on Sardegna wines with additional wines from other parts of Italy. There were more than a dozen options for Vermentino. It's definitely worth the trip but it's tiny so be sure to make a reservation well in advance.
review_title: Well worth a trip to Noe Valley

review: We had a wonderful dinner. The service was stellar. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about wine and recommended three different choices that complemented the food perfectly. I can't recommend the restaurant more heartily and I cannot wait to go back!
My favorite restaurant. Always amazing on all fronts!

This restaurant is something special. Outstanding Sardinian food (where else can you find that), every bite of every dish a taste treat. Don't miss the house-specialty octopus stew. The wine list is all Italian, but the waiter easily made suggestions based on what we said we liked. A neighborhood institution, the owners seemed to know most of the customers.

This restaurant would fit right at home in a small town in Italy. I can't think of another restaurant that delivers as authentic a meal and experience as La Ciccia. This is Italian food done properly and I don't say that easily. Semi-casual but top-notch everything. There are still a few I have yet to try, but this is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.
My entire family loved it. Great for a esoteric tase, but I could eat there every night.
Everything about La Ciccia was excellenmt. Can't wait to return.
This restaurant always continues to please. Food was outstanding.

Food was good but overpriced for what you got. There were 6 of us dining and we tried a variety of main courses. The best were the ravioli and octopus stew,everything else was just okay at a high end price.
Fantastic food and a great wine list with decent prices.
Best meal we've had in San Francisco in the last year. Tried 1 or 2 items from each menu category and all were excellent. Highly recommend.
Great Sardinia Food, unique choices, fresh seafood, good portions.

Great service and the food was top notch. there were 4 of us and we had the grilled calamari and the trippa for appetizers. Then we had 2 serving of the rigatoni in ragu sauce--excellent ; almost better than my mother's!!! Then we had the seared scallops and the sea bream-very good and tasty. And of course, the dessert was fantastic. One of the best dining experiences. Since I am a native San Franciscan and am exposed to the City's varied dining scene-- La Ciccia is right up there at the top!!
Paul

Salads are quite good, fresh greens and excellent pecorrino make them one of the best parts of the meal. An excellent wine selection. Lamb was exceptional. A larger selection of main courses would be great but all were v. good. Salt and pepper are missing from tableside and are needed for seasoning to preference. Not the most accommodating place.

There were four of us and all agreed on "why did we wait so long to come"...the food was truly outstanding as was the service. Being familiar with Sardenian food, I found it very authentic and the wine selection also excellent. We ordered quite a few dishes and all were delicious. The calamari were the best that any of the four ever had. Molto Deliizioso and cannot wait to go back. Should be on the Top 100!
review_title: There were four of us and

review: I love La Ciccia!! It is one of my favorite restaurants in the whole city and I feel amazing lucky to live only 6 blocks away.
review_title: I love La Ciccia!! It is

review: The food was even better than we remembered. The tripe appetizer was awesome. My wife literally took my spagheti with mullet roe and made me "settle" for her rigatoni with lamb ragu. As we left, my wife asked, "why don't we come here more often?" Indeed.

Late night reservations due to popularity, we decided to wait and so glad! Treated like regulars, friendly service and delicious food- our new Italian favorite! Also, there was a famous actor at the bar. Very relaxed and easy environment.

Everyone agreed that the food was good, but portions were SMALL for the high price.  Owner was affable, but waitress was not.  If the service could be improved and the portions were larger, this would be a good find.
My favorite restaurant in San Francisco. Rare honest food.

This is a fine, non-pretentious restaurant specializing in food from the large island of Sardinia, off of Italy's Western Coast, near the large French island of Corsica. The menu is not extensive -- although there are ample choices -- and the food is far more interesting than the basic "same old, same old" Italian, yet one can sense it is still basically Italian, but it just tastes better. The wine selection includes interesting yet decently priced wines from Sardinia and other less frequented areas in Italy. Service is wonderful.

The food was very well-prepared and truly authentically Sardinian. Based on the tastes, the ingredients were very high quality and fresh. The restaurant was very busy, and success does have a downside, I suppose. The wait staff was performing at a very clipped pace but did its best to be attentive. However, all were gracious and friendly. One critique? One of us asked for Parmesan on his pasta dish, and the server refused to accommodate that request stating that Sardinians frowned on this addition to this primi piatti. It's not nice to be a snobby server. Let the diner have his/her way. It was very noisy. We had to speak loudly at our little table for two to be heard. The cuisine, however, was expertly prepared and delicious!

We tried it based on the reviews in Yelp and were very pleased. Everything, starting with their homemade bread was excellent. We tried both vegetable dishes and found both to be unusual and very tasty. The swordfish dish came beautifully presented and was excellent, though I might have preferred it just a bit less cooked. Our test is always would we come back and both agree - a definite "Yes". We might just come for pizza and salad to have a very inexpensive treat! Their pizza rivals some of the best SF has to offer!
review_title: We tried it based on the reviews

review: Not a large menu but everything is delicious Sardinian specialty dishes. Long wine list of Sardinian wines, but wait staff is very helpful at helping you select something nice and there are many reasonably priced wines. Not an inexpensive dinner but well worth it IMO.
review_title: Not a large menu but everything

review:
The food was AWESOME. so unique and quintessentially Sardinian. Loved every dish and can't wait to go back. Everything was so authentic, yet new.
Love, love, loved it.
review_title: The food was AWESOME. so unique

review:
La Ciccia is one of our favorite restaurants in the City. Lorella (co-owner and hostess) gives us a warm welcome every time we dine there. Massimiliano (chef and co-owner) prepares delicious meals from Sardegna, Italy. The waiting staff are attentive and are knowledgeable about the dishes; and make good suggestions on which wines go best with each dish.

The fish dishes are simple yet superb. We also enjoy their pastas. Our Italian friends claim that their pizzas are the "real McCoy".

We congratulate Lorella and Massimiliano on their growing clientele; and at the same time we bemoan the fact that it is becoming more difficult to get a reservation because of the restaurant's growing popularity.
review_title: La Ciccia is one of our favorite

review: Their food is tasty and fresh, and the wine list compliments all of their menu options. We enjoy their food a great deal. However, the corkage fee of $25 is too high especially in today's economy, and our server seemed more concerned with "making a sale" than providing good service. She seemed to hold too strong of an opinion on certain menu items. In addition, we eat out frequently and don't need to be told to wait to order food before determining which wine to order. What? It's 2009, so why are we still using those antiquated tips for resturant novices from the 1970's? We will return but request a different server.
review_title: Their food is tasty and fresh,

review: If you love seafood and Italian food this is the place to try. Don't miss their spaghetti with bottarga and their fregula, two typical Sardinian dishes, and then go back another time to explore their second courses. Everything on the menu is interesting, very well prepared, and delicious. This restaurant seems to be very successful, and rightly so, therefore it can become a bit crowed. However the waiting staff is very good at taking care of the customers in a timely, way but without making you feel pressured. Another aspect that I like is that Massimo, the chef-owner, comes out of the kitchen often and engages with the customers in culinary and wine conversations. By far my favorite Italian place in the SF, and I am from Italy!
review_title: If you love seafood and Italian

review: We have been to La Cicctia several times, and each time it exceeds expectations. The food, wine and most of all service come together to make it a great experience.
review_title: We have been to La Cicctia

review: La Ciccia is a true find. The service and atmosphere were perfect, the only thing even better was the food!!!!
review_title: La Ciccia is a true find.

review: What excellent food! Wonderful service and very local. One of our favorite places in the city!

A quick trip to Italy! The best of Sardinian Cuisine prepared and served by the proprietors, make it an authentic delicious experience. A perfect restaurant, I highly recommend it,

!
review_title: A quick trip to Italy! The

review:
Not to be redundant and unoriginal, but I, like the rest of the world apparently, loved everything about this restaurant.  From the moment I walked in, it felt like home.  The service is warm and friendly, the ambience obviously family-created, and the food flavorful and beautifully-presented.  

I let our server (Antonio?) order my dishes and our wine, since I was a La Ciccia newbie, and he did a wonderful job.  [I highly recommend the Inzalaredda de Mari cun Ollu e Limoni, a warm seafood salad, which is abundant with perfectly sauteed calamari with some little delectables, such as mussels and prawns, hiding throughout as well.]

I will definitely be frequenting La Ciccia.
review_title: Not to be redundant and unoriginal,

review:
The food at La Ciccia was wonderful - vibrant flavors, very rich. This is not an every day restaurant, due to the highly stylized food, but I enjoyed every bite (especially the dessert, chocolate tartufo.)

The wait staff was outstanding - able to recommend wines, knowledgeably address questions about any menu item, and anticipate needs. Service was top rung.
review_title: The food at La Ciccia was

review: Excellent menu and service. The roasted brussel sprouts & carrot  carrot cake are both amazing. Mostly a quiet setting and atmosphere, busy bar though.
review_title: Excellent menu and service. The roasted ...

review: Thank you for the excellent service and excellent food.  Perfect!
review_title: Thank you for the excellent service and ...

review: Very interesting menu with a creative flair. Good selection of menu items and wine. Reasonably priced, considering it is in an upscale hotel.

We dined at Trace for our 10 year engagement anniversary. First time dining there since they refreshed the space and changed over from previous XYZ. Food and Service were truly Outstanding. In terms of ambiance, we both preferred the previous XPZ vibe better. Seems a bit too cool and austere for us. Doesn't quite match the warm you get from the staff and menu.
review_title: We dined at Trace for our

review: Cool spot for a fun, NYC style brunch. There is a DJ that plays upbeat electronic music. One of the best bloody Mary's I've ever had
review_title: Cool spot for a fun, NYC style

review:
We started with a flatbread. Just the right mix of the ingredients, ample for two as a starter, although a bit expensive for the size served. The cocktails were compelling, the well-named "Afternoon Delight."

The white corn soup was stellar--a summer delight! Our entree was the grilled albacore tuna salad. The Tuna was expertly prepared, and the salad perfect for a summer day. We weren't crazy about the crispy fries, expecting a restaurant with the talent shown on the other dishes to cut their own potatoes.

The staff works hard to please. Hearing that this was a birthday lunch, we were thrilled with the chocolate mousse "cake" with beer ice cream and chocolate--pure pleasure!

Located in the chic W Hotel, a Saturday evening table was easy to obtain, though the place was brimming with activity. Locals might reasonably eschew a hotel-based restaurant, but give this one a try. Braised lamb with crisp gnocchi was best of show, though the chicken liver pt was nicely presented with jellied orange and crostini. Regardless of politics, i hope they go back to the more-delicious fois gras. The lately-fashionable Red Velvet cake ended the meal, and it was superb.

Two quibbles: Service could have been slightly more attentive, and meal pacing was slightly long. But, hey, I'd go back. One minor menu change brought the manager to our table with apologies--and then she took those served items off our bill. Gracious.

Had a nice lunch at Trace - the food was very good and the service spot on. Only odd thing to mention is that the decor is so wrong for the concept. The food is local fresh ingredients and the menu itself is rather homey - but the decor is as my friend said modern almost nightclub shiny materials. Would improve the experience if the decor was less plastic.
review_title: Had a nice lunch at Trace

review: I used 1 star because that is the lowest one, otherwise would be 0. I dont know if the food is good or not, since I didnt get a chance to try it. I was travelling alone on a business trip, and decided for my last night in Sfo, to have a nice dinner. The conversation went something like this:M: Reservation for one.H: How many? One? But the reservation said TwoM: Yes I know, Opentable do not have one as on option.H: Well let me see what I can do .. (Sight and rolled her eyes)M: Im sorry but, was planning on reading my book. Can I change to that table (for 2) by the light? FYI: the restaurant was 50% empty.H: Whatever  (rolled her eyes one more time)  I have to attend other tables. SorryI just walked out of the place.

We booked this restaurant in celebration of my birthday and were told that they would make it a special evening. They seated us 45 minutes late. Our server barely acknowledged us and seemed extremely annoyed that we were seated in his section. No bread (and we were starving since the seating was late). They did not acknowledge the birthday (we were told there would be a cake). Very disappointing.

It was a great place to sit down and enjoy a wonderful lunch in the middle of the day, if you have time. The server was prompt and very entertaining. The food was good and fresh. I asked for veggie options and they more than accomodated me. It was my friend's special day and they comped her wine! How cool of them!
review_title: It was a great place to sit

review:
I hate to share my secret but XYZ is great for relaxed, intimate meals. It's one of the quietest restaurants in San Francisco, and the service is extremely attentive but unobtrusive. And consistently so! The management philosophy really shines through.

The food was great, of course, but the service and ambiance are so great that I'd probably go there for a lukewarm Happy Meal if that's all they served.
review_title: I hate to share my secret

review: I had made a note in my Open Table reservation that this was a business lunch. XYZ responded by saving me a cloistered padded booth that was perfect for semi-private conversation. The menu was small, but had a nice range from fancy scallops to everyday cheeseburgers. And our waiter seemed to know just when to show up.
review_title: I had made a note in my Open

review: This was our second trip to XYZ and as with the first, we were both very pleased. The food on the tasting menu was just right for the late night dining. A romantic booth setting was perfect and worth the extra wait. Staff took extra care to make use comfortable while we sat and did some people watching prior to dining. The wine pairing was perfect. We will be back!
review_title: This was our second trip to

review: Very nice atmosphere and excellent food. Good vibe and service. A good choice for anyone near Moscone Center, Westfield or the Metreon wanting something a bit special.
their kitchen has stepped-it-up-a-notch. Excellent creations and flavors.

I would give XYZ 4+ on average. For not being a Michelin star restaurant (I believe?), our dinner was a truly great experience. The food was very good, service was great, and we were provided with additional (no charge) surprise meals in between like "I saw that you had some champagne left, so we cooked something for you to finish that".
review_title: I would give XYZ 4+ on average.

review: Good food and good ambiance.  The staff clearly care about the customers.  The happy hour specials are good.  I was, however, surprised that they refused to give us happy hour specials on our dinner bill, and instead forced us to walk over to the bar (from our dinner table) and separately order the drinks there and carry them all back ourselves to our table.  Isn't that kind of what the "server" is for?  But a small inconvenience for an otherwise fine dining experience.
review_title: Good food and good ambiance.  The staff ...

review: Very quiet when we were there.. Food was amazing. Lobster Mac n cheese is a must
review_title: Very quiet when we were there..

review: Our table and those surrounding commiserated about the terrible service and SLOW kitchen. By the end of the evening it was almost laughable how horrible everything was.

Our food was very undercooked and took 40 minutes to come to the table. We waited for a very long time for our server to take our order after they brought out the bottomless mimosas. The hostesses we very sweet but the service and food were not congruent with the price tag. I'm sure I'll try this place again to give it a second chance because not only is it just super cute, hey! It's bottomless mimosas!

We visited CIRCA specifically to try the lobster truffle mac n' cheese (as we were craving it), and we were not disappointed. It was honestly one of the best we have ever tasted. We also tried the hummas appetizer, and it was outstanding as well. Great menu and very good food. The ambiance was very nice, very trendy however the restaurant was completely empty on the Tuesday night we visited, yet I struggled to find a reservation via OpenTable. Thus, we figured it would be packed. Kind of weird being the only ones there, but the food more than made up for it.
very good young person scene. something about the place just didn't connect for us. hard to explain. most food was good - some very good. The service was very acceptable but seemed indifferent.

When I arrived at the restaurant I was EXTREMELY disappointed to find that there was no valet service although it clearly states there is valet parking service on the opentable website. It took me nearly twenty minutes to find parking four blocks away from the restaurant. This put a damper on the whole start of the evening.
review_title: When I arrived at the restaurant

review: Circa served a truly excellent ceviche as a starter. It is fairly small, and should not be shared among many persons. As a main course we had the iron steak with asparagus and mashed potatoes. This was also excellent, could harly have been better. For desserts we tried one caramel creme brulee and one cheesecake. These were both disappointing. We do not really see the reason for adding flavors to a genuine creme brulee, and in particular, not for adding the caramel which changes its character completely. The baked chesecake was too heavy and sweet. If the desserts improve, we will recommend Cirka to anyone.
Eric the chef is very charming and actually comes to serve the food!The lobster mac and cheese is the best dish we tried.
review_title: Eric the chef is very charming

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: There are many steakhouses in SF.  I'd go there again for the ambiance of the bar and the great bay views.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: McCormick & Kuleto's never disappoints as a San Francisco showpiece.  It seems impossible not to have a great meal and a great time there.  We went for an early New Year's Eve dinner, which we combined with a walk from the Ferry Building and back.  The restaurant atmosphere was almost magical with hundreds of small shiny lights.  Our server, Stephen, was absolutely perfect - well versed in the menu, the cocktails, the wine list - and committed to making this a wonderful evening for his guests.   The view was magical, the lights sparkled, our food choices sparkled, our waiter sparkled - we've seldom had such a good time at a dinner for two.  We are actively recommending this restaurant to anyone, especially if they want to show out of town/country visitors why San Francisco is so special.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: This was our first time to McCormick and Kuleto's.  We booked the last remaining dinner reservation online for Thanksgiving dinner, and really did not know what to expect.  Quite frankly, we had lowered our expectations because of the holiday, knowing that the restaurant would be extremely busy.  We were greeted by the host staff with a friendly welcome and were seated immediately. The service was excellent despite the busy crowd.  Our server was not only professional and courteous, but extremely attentive. The food surpassed our expectations. We were very happy to be completely wrong with our original notion of lowered expectations, so much so, that we talked about making plans to return to the restaurant for Christmas dinner!
review_title: Great food and service... Simply wonderful!

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: While the Service in the Bar was great our waiter in the restaurant was non existent. I have eaten here many times, not sure I will be back. View is outstanding and we were happy to sit and chat but waiter was a phantom.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: Peter was our server. Good job. Attentive and polite.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: You can't beat the view of the bay from McCormick & Kuleto's at Ghiardelli Square. Their fresh Crab Omelette is a brunch must-have.  The Lobster Bisque could be a meal in itself along with the warm sourdough bread.
review_title: Best Bay View at Ghiardelli Square

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: We typically don't visit many tourist spots but thought this would be fun place to celebrate our sons 16th birthday. Nice touch with the personalized menu! The view was fantastic and did not disappoint. However the service was terrible: slow, inattentive. The waiter was under educated on the menu and wine list and seemed overwhelmed pouring a glass of wine into a full water glass! We had to ask to be compensated he did not offer. Dinners were very inconsistent ranging from Blah (scampi), salty (scallops), tasteless (ravioli). The pork chop was perfectly cooked and flavorful. Clearly this restaurant hangs on the view and captive audience of the tourists. GO FOR A COCKTAIL AND THE VIEW.  Then head to a local neighborhood restaurant.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review:
This restaurant has fabulous views of San Francisco Bay, it may not be mentioned very often because it is part of a chain. I have eaten here twice and always found the food well presented and tasty and the staff attentive. I have rated the ambience as average as we had a late lunch this may not be the case at peak times.
 
However to be able to sit at one of the window tables throughout lunch and look at the view adds so much more to the experience. I always pre book and ask for one of those tables.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review:
Great restaurant. The location is tops offering amazing views of the SF Bay, Golden Gate Bridge. In the heart of the tourist section of SF waterfront, the food is good, service for this visit was excellent. Anyone visiting the waterfront wishing to enjoy good food and a fabulous view, this is a great choice.
Feedback:
The menu offerings online are different than those offered at the table. Not a big deal but possibly. Menu offerings change for the weekends.
Wine offerings by the glass were a bit tight. Would have liked to see a few more local selections.
Local food offerings could also have been a bit more expansive.
Portions were good, food we ordered was presented well and very good.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: Although we waited a long time for our reserved table in a very crowded entry way, the food and service once we were finally seated made up for our initial discomfort. The waiter was friendly and knowledgeable and the wine list included a good variety if prices as well as types. All three of us enjoyed our entrees immensely.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review:
The booth, near the front (2nd row from the windows) was cramped and disliked by the ladies in the party.

The food was good, but no better than you would expect for its high price.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review:
Really about the view so get a water front table.

Otherwise, the seafood is well done but nothing special/impressive.
review_title: Really about the view so get

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: We picked a great restaurant for thanksgiving dinner. Everything was wonderful. Turkey dinner delicious and the view will never be forgotten!. This restaurant will always be on my top ten list.
review_title: Good Job to both of us!

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: We started out as just wanting to taste the food. But, we got there and the fireworks began (literally). It was my big brother's birthday and we had found the perfect place to celebrate! The food was outstanding! The wine was outstanding! The service was outstanding! McCormick's and Kuleto's is all Excellence. Our waiter was helpful, very nice yet professional. The restaurant printed "Happy Birthday" on the top of our menu's with my big brother's name/date. We were flabbergasted!! He's a gourmet chef by trade; so this was just really heaven for him ..:) We started into our dinner, looked out our window where we were seated...and there was fireworks. How perfect was that! What an awesome birthday celebration! I want to go back!
review_title: Best Restaurant in the Bay Area

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review:
great place to watch the America's Cup, and they installed big screen TVs for the races. Food is good.
Great service from Erin.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: This restaurant accommodated our special requests for a special occasion willingly and generously. We enjoyed our evening and would recommend this restaurant.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: This is a restaurant with a great view from almost every table. It's a tourist place on Ghirardelli Square but it's still good for dinner.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: What can I say ! Every bit about this experience was wonderful! Our waiter was amazing and so attentive! He came over and checked on us many times . He even offered to hold on putting out main dish in so we could visit and we took him up on it! My mother had never been to your restaurant and she's been talking about it since. Thank you for making her day so special : )

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: The lunch/bar menu was not very good. The tuna was the worst I've had, I have never seen so much gristle. It took forever to get our drinks and food, a refill, forget it. We were on vacation and thought it would be nice. Normally I dont like chains, I remember why.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: Was shocked to get an awesome table on a Saturday night with a view during Prime Time dining. Wine selections by glass are reasonable. Portions are on the larger side for appetizers. Loved the soudough served with our appetizers

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: Being one of the few places open on the Wharf on Christmas night, this place was PACKED. But, true to the McCormick's reputation, the remainder consistent and professional.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: First off, the Bay view here is easily the best in San Francisco. Our table wasn't ready so Mario nicely suggested we have drinks in the bar. Erin & Jake were patient and very helpful recommending wines even though they were crazy busy. We looked at the menu online but our server was so enthusiastic with his recommendations we decided to trust him - oysters, hamachi, crab cakes to start - delicious!! Steve seemed genuinely pleased we enjoyed our apps & we would have let him pick dinner too but on Thanksgiving it's all about the Turkey and Crab. Don't know what they put in the sauce but BEST CRAB EVER! We were stuffed but Steve said we had to get the banana cream pie and Irish coffee. So glad we did. Can't wait to go back at Christmas!
review_title: Delicious Dungeness Crab w/ a View!

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: Full of tourists on a Friday night. Food was good (fish was fresh and cooked well) and the setting great. Service was poor. They set up extra tables in overflow areas that are terrible and tried to sit us in a back room by a dance floor in front of a door. . The waiter was rushed and condescending. We work in SF, are foodies and dine all the time usually at smaller top restaurants, but this night were looking for a different dinner experience - lively and on the water - so we took a risk heading over to the fishermans wharf area because it is a kuletto restaurant that had a view. We would go to waterbar for dinner next time and would come back for lunch only with out of town guests and sit by the window.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: I have dined here every time I visit San Francisco and was terribly disappointed with the food and service this time. Nothing compared to my past experience! We took friends that had never been before and I had told them how great it was which added to my embarrassment. Although our waiter was very nice and attentive two in our party were served their dinner and had to wait more than 15minutes until the rest of us were served. Food was nothing compared to the dinners I've eaten there in the past.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review:
As with all McCormick restaurants the seafood was good - fresh and prepared nicely. However, the service was lacking with practically no interest in making sure you have a good overall experience. I suppose a lot of their business is tourist and not repeat, but it's still something you should focus on. Would probably go there again with a group, but there are too many other good seafood places in San Francisco.
I had already booked a dinner for 30 people a couple of days later and let the manager know there was a problem with the service tonight and expected a better experience with my big group - and it was.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: Great views of the Bay. Service and food were excellent.
review_title: Great views of the Bay. Service

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: We had a nice booth w/ view & had a very enjoyable eve. Our waiter was very helpful & attentive!
review_title: We had a nice booth w/ view

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: We had the specials for the evening and they were wonderful! Our waiter was very friendly and helpful.
review_title: We had the specials for the

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: The menu was very limited and offered very few options for anything besides fish. The was only one pasta choice and chicken option. The potions were small for the price. Our waiter was awful! I asked for suggestions on the. Tbest dishes and told me everything was good. As he took my order he scanned the restaurant as tough he was preoccupied and seemed impatient with any questions I had. He contined to forget items and when he finally showed up again (usually up to 10 minutes later),he would take offagainbefore Icould finish speaking. I even stopped a busboy to ask to speak with the manager,and that person never came. I still tipped him but definately didn't earn it.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: In this day when every striving chef seems to feel the need to deconstruct, cook with liquid nitrogen or water baths, it is refreshing to have a meal with great ingredients, simply but excellently prepared. A simple piece of fish, beautifully grilled---a fabulous meal. My only complaint is that the coffee is bad.
review_title: In this day when every striving

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: This is usually an annual dinner out for our family, but we are going to change locations next year. First of all we had a to wait for our reservation. Even though I had made the reservation weeks in advance our table looked like it was thrown together complete with folded chairs. When asked about the chairs and location of the table, we were completely blown off. Our waiter said he was experienced but decanted the wine by inverting the wine vertically into the decanter. The food was passable but not justifying the $350 price tag. Needless to say we will choose elsewhere for our holiday dinner. I really blame the management in the this situation. It seemed like they were under-staffed and overwhelmed.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: Second time at this restaurant and the service was even worse than before. The clam chowder is the piece de resistance but the rest of the food is mediocre if you are used to fine dining around the world. The scenic view and the layout and look of the restaurant is by far the best reason for a visit. Fantastic. Otherwise, do not expect the wonderful laid back service you will be used to around the rest of San Francisco as you will be sorely disappointed. Grumpy and quick to clear for the next sitting made for an overall expensive (for what we had) and poor dining experience.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: As always the food was good, the service was good and it was an excellent experience for a special out of town guest
review_title: As always the food was good,

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review:
Great food. The jumbo shrimp scampish is to die for!
The waiter was very nice.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: We had our year end department lunch here and it was delicious. The menu has many choices and is varied enough to please all sorts of palettes. I had fresh oysters and hamaichi sashimi (very good) and my co-worker had a chicken salad sandwich with fruit. It was a spectacular day in San Francisco, so the views from our window table were excellent. Service was very good, although I would not go here if you are were in a hurry. I would return and recommend to my friends.
review_title: We had our year end department

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: Had written in the special request to the maitre d' that it was our anniversary and that we wanted a nice table. Upon arrival the host had a special menu with our name and anniversary yr printed. They initially gave us a very nice table, then moved us to a romantic booth with a fantastic view. The manager greeted and congratulated us, then presented us with sparkling wine and took our picture which they presented to us before we left. The waiter was attentive, very pleasant and knowledgeable. What a wonder memorable night it was....

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: The view is gorgeous and the food is amazing but not cheap. Would like to go back again!It was a 21st birthday and they were kind enough to specialize our menus with happy 21st birthday at the top and the date. A nice touch to the special day!

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: McCormick & Kuleto's provided a great night out. It was very warm and comfortable, the service was attentive and friendly, the views are spectacular, and the scallops were prepared perfectly. I don't think there is a bad seat in the house. We arrived fairly early and were seated immediately but as we left the place was getting very packed.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: The service was outstanding, and the food was wonderful as usual, and you can't beat the view. I took my girls (19 & 7) after attending the Nutcracker Ballet, and McCormick and Kuleto's was a wonderful way to end a great day!

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: Clean, comfortable, tables not too crowded together. We sat at a window table on a very pretty day and the views were wonderful. Staff was attentive but not pesky. I would go back again. Food good and fresh, prices were probably fair for a SF restaurant.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: We have many lunch meetings at McCormick & Kuleto's.  It is a wonderful place with great food and service.  The Catering Department is wonderful.  Thank you all.
review_title: A Great Place in Fisherman's Wharf

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: Having eaten there several times I know food is usually very good however this time my fish had so many unexpected bones I sent it back. I was not charged for my order and my friends with me seemed pleased with their food.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: Reservation was for 7:45. Was seated at 8. Was served dinner at 9:45. Was told that the kitchen was "backed up". It was a business dinner whereby I was entertaining clients...quite embarrassing.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: From the second we had entered the restaurant and gave the host our names we experienced the professionalism and experience of what makes a restaurant successful. The waiter was friendly and knowledgable, the food was outstanding, the bartender was talented and made great mixed cocktails. The view of the bay just made a perfect night even better. I would strongly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting or living in the area. It's fine dinning in a very comfortable atmosphere.
review_title: From the second we had entered

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: We were there for our 29th wedding anniversary. When they gave us our menu, on the top was Happy 29th Wedding Anniversary. We brought the menu home with us to frame.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: We asked for a booth but weren't expecting to be seated near the bar without even a table cloth for Valentine's Day. The lady was served last at the table and the seared Hawaiian Ahi was over-spiced. (I've had the dish there several times before, and it was to die for.) However, our steamed crab was excellent and wish I had ordered that! I missed the chocolate cake dessert that used to be offered, finding the chocolate ganache pie far too dense and rich to eat.
review_title: We asked for a booth but weren't

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: My wife and I were entertaining four visitors from Australia. The restaurant accomodated our request for a window table for six. We were seated promptly upon arrival. Bread/butter and ice water with a dish of sliced lemmons were served immediately. Our waiter was very attentive and gracious. He explained the specials of the day as well as other questions from the guests about their choices. Food and drinks arrived promptly and in a timely fashion. Our appetizers and seafood entrees were fresh, well prepared and presented. Everyone enjoyed their meal, the ambiance. The heavy morning rains had cleared up and the sunny view of the San Franciso Bay was to die for! We will definetly come back.
review_title: My wife and I were entertaining

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review:
Unprofessional server - we each ordered two appetizers instead of a main course, and all 4 were brought out together. Had let them know it was my wife's birthday, but they ignored it. No big deal, but bad for PR.

Service was slow.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review:
We live in the East Bay and don't get to San Francisco much except with out-of-town visitors. It's great therefore to find a reliable restaurant in one of the popular tourist areas, one that's easy to find, has convenient parking, offers a good view, and has really good food. We were a table full of people who all like seafood but with widely varying preferences - fried/grilled, low fat/must have dessert, wine/doesn't drink wine, seafood pasta for the person who would really rather have had Italian....
I had requested a table with a good view,and it was waiting for us even though we were at least 45 minutes early. We dawdled over appetizers, dinner, dessert & coffee, but never felt that wait staff wanted to hurry us out.
review_title: We live in the East Bay and

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: We always come to this Restaurant when we are in San Francisco, and have done so since we first visited it in 1993. It never fails to please - the setting is superb, opposite the Bay (ask for a table near the window), the seafood fresh and expertly cooked. The service was outstanding. Highly recommended if you are in SF.
review_title: We always come to this Restaurant

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: I have been a frequent customer at McCormick & Kuleto's for many years. During the past year, I've noticed a gradual decline in the quality of the food and service. The last time my guest and I each had the appetizer clams and the broth was so salty we couldn't eat it. Also we paid for a lot of empty shells. Somehow the clams must have fallen out and we were served a bowl of several empty shells. I also ordered the heirloom tomato salad, which is usually very good but not last time. I suspect the plate was prepared way in advance and kept in the refrigerator because the sliced tomatoes were nearly frozen and somewhat dried up around the edges. Previously the parmesan crusted sole was overcooked. What's happening in the kitchen?
review_title: I have been a frequent customer

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: We went there on our anniversary and they printed Happy Anniversary with our name right on the menu. For a chain restaurant the food was great and the waitress was wonderful. We went for the view and was pleasantly surprised with the food and wine selection.
review_title: We went there on our anniversary

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: The food was delicious. The recommendations by our server was excellent. We all enjoyed the appetizers too, as well as the desserts. Perfect place to celebrate a Birthday.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: This was our 4th visit and second time to book through it through Open Table. We had requested a table next to the window and we did not get that; instead on the same level but at table where sat next to one another, looking past the people who got the table like we wanted,onto the Bay; others who were in line behind us got those tables. Our server, while "plesant,i.e smiled", didn't wow us a every other time we've been there and did the minimal amount in getting our food to us. The food was wonderful as always so that part was well worth it.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: This is a restaurant for tourists who want to look out onto the Bay while enjoying a meal. The prices are a bit too high for this economy but the food is passable. The view of course is spectacular! I would recommend this restaurant for drinks and appetizers only.
review_title: This is a restaurant for tourists

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: We had high hopes for our Valentine's Day evening out at McCormick & Kuleto's. There were six of us and all had been to a McCormick's restaurant before and were expecting good food and good service. When one of us asked the Manager to honor a special promotion he received by email, she agreed, even though the SF restaurant didn't send it out; we were pleased... but that ended soon. Food: Sirloins with the lobster tail special were bad--extremely chewy and flavorless (can you say A-1?); the lobster was great, though. The rest of the food was good. Service: Our water glasses were empty unless we asked; an ordered glass of wine never came; we were seated 50 minutes before salad/soups arrived.
review_title: We had high hopes for our

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: We had a wonderful dining experience!!! The view, waiter and food was GREAT!!!

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: I have been a devoted fan of this place for the past few years. I had my wedding reception there, my Dad's Surprise 70th Birthday Party there and spent many special events and holidays dinning at this establishment. The food is consistently good, the bar is excellent and the wait service is superb. It's not cheap, but for those special occasions, I do believe it can be reasonable (depending on what you order). Last night I had a mother and daughter night and I ordered the veggie penne pasta dish for $17.95 (one of the cheaper entree items) and it was the best pasta I ever had! This place is known for it's seafood, but I'm not a seafood fan, so that's just another testament of great all of the food is. Check it out once & fall in love!
review_title: I have been a devoted fan

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: The entrees were quite tasty. My friend had the steak, which was great, and I had the wonderful sturgeon (or was it monkfish), which went very well with the sliced apples on top. Who would have thought? The service wasn't nearly as rave worthy. The waitress, who was indifferent at best, brought us some stale, absolutely horrible bread. I actually had to spit it out as it tasted like it had been soaked with chemicals and then covered with lots of raw flour. When we told her it was bad, she said, "Well, that's all we have." What? However, about 10 minutes later, the busboy brought some bread that was actually edible. Not what I would expect from such an otherwise lovely restaurant.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: Very good experience. Food and service are not as good as at McCormick & Schmick in San Jose.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review: Excellent service at M&K. I had the salmon and it was as good as anywhere in the city. Service was very timely and friendly. Most tables have a great view of the Bay and Aquatic Park.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review:
Two of the items I wanted were sold out -- the catfish entree and the key lime pie for dessert. We were there for an early dinner so that was not cool.

We ordered appetizers and they showed up promptly, but the wait for the main course to be served was incredibly long. My kid ate lots of bread because he was hungry. By the time his entree finally arrived he was full of bread.
review_title: Two of the items I wanted

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review:
We had a lovely evening, so pleased we pre booked.  Looked after very well!  Hope to see you again in near future.

Jill & Glyn
England
review_title: We had a lovely evening, so

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review:
The front person was little rude.
I know that it was crowded but when I went to confirm the reservation, I was told that i HAVE to come back at that time.
And HE made a mistake on # of people on my reservation.
Anyway, overall, the food was good and waitress was nice.
I will go back for sure.

address: 900 North Point Streetat Ghirardelli SquareSan Francisco, CA  94109
review:
It started with management being mad at the hostess as we walked in for letting a table party step outside. 
 The waiter was arguing with management about taking our table. It was very clear he felt it was not in his station and he should not have to wait on us. Management was saying Lisa was too busy to take us on. We were shown to the table which was not set up and had to wait for it to be set. Our waiter was shaking quite a bit which was strage as well. I have been to this McCormick's before but this was defiantly not a good time. I also go often to both locations in Denver. In having gone to McCormick's since the 1980's I have felt a steady decline in service. This was just another example.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: I'm going back with another group of friends.  It was pricey, but well worth it!  Their wine choices were spectacular, I was with 2 others and they all agreed this place was well worth the visit!  And they serve late!  Kitchen closes at 11pm.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Had a nice dinner with good service.  The chicken was a bit dry, but the salmon was really tasty.  Scallops are wildly overpriced ($25 for 4 normal sized scallops), so I'd avoid those.  But the pumpkin gnocchi was spectacular! Nice small plates all the way around and salads were very tasty and beautifully displayed.  Plan on going back!

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: If you want alright food and particularly bad service this is the place for you.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: What a great find! The menu is excellent with a great variety of offerings. Local, sustainable, free-range meats. The duck appetizer was fall apart tender. The lobster ravioli was a perfect balance of all elements. Delectable wine flight choices. All of the wines are from California vineyards!
