We especially enjoyed the complimentary, house made focaccia bread with olive tapenade and green verde sauce.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: We split several small plates including a dessert and each had a flight of wine. Everything was delicious.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: I first came here as part of a group. I came back because of the great food and a fun wine list. We were all happy. A bit loud.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Food was not spectacular. Good service, good wine. Avoid the mixed drinks.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Valentine's Day reservations were limited to a Prix Fixe menu, however my boyfriend has specific dietary needs, being Gluten-Free Vegan. To ensure a good dining experience, I emailed Judy (Mktg & Events Mgr) beforehand, & she confirmed the chef could accommodate a GF/V diet. "Accommodating" ultimately meant choosing dishes on the PF menu without the meat & still getting charged full price without offering alternatives. Romantic, but cramped seating. The molten cake was phenomenal, but not enough to bring me back for another visit.
review_title: No Love for the Gluten Free Vegan

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: The worst part of this experience was the service. We waited for about 5 minutes before being greeted. Normally, I wouldn't think much of this as it gives time to review the drink list. But, the server shouldn't ask the neighboring table if they would like drink refills before greeting a newly sat table - we should have been greeted and then he should have attended the refills. After we were finally greeted, it felt like it took an atrocious amount of time to get our drinks (waters, diet coke, wine, and beer were ordered). The was only one girl working the bar which is why the alcohol beverages took a long time, but the server could have at least made the waters and diet coke.
review_title: The worst part of this experience

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Was in San Francisco for a birhday get away with my boyfriend and another couple. The hotel concierge made the recommendation and we were so lucky she did! We all loved our meals. Lots of vegetarian options. We got the watermelon/tomato salad, an Asian noodles dish and lobster mac and cheese for starters which were all to die for. For entrees we got the salmon dish, the halibut dish, a pesto pasta dish and a ribeye dish. Everyone left very full and pleased. I tried all of them and there wasnt one thing I didnt like. The service was friendly and attentive through out the meal.
review_title: Was in San Francisco for a

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: As usual, the food was spectacular, and the staff were friendly and attentive.
review_title: As usual, the food was spectacular,

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: I have never been so satisfied with everything all in one place. 5 stars for all! and the mac and cheese was amazing!!! as well as the rib eye!
review_title: I have never been so satisfied

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Fast service and great American-Cal food in SF. Wine list is also a good bet. Decor could use some improving but it's not bad.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Fabulous food, and the servers were extremely helpful in describing the various dishes and wines.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Went prior to theater - wife is vegetarian and they were very accommodating by tweaking the dishes for her. Linguini with prawns was an excellent dish - side salad had some thought put into it, not just a handful of lettuce and dressing. Wine flights were excellent.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: The waiter was very knowledgeable and was right on when he gave us his personal recommendations for the wine flights we selected (a flight = a trio of selected samplings of wine. Great concept because we had the opportunity to try 6 different wines. We got "robust" and "Pinot Noir" groupings. The lobster bisque was average, the prix fixe halibut wonderful, the dungeness salad worth ordering, even almost too pretty to eat!

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Lobster bisque ($8) was solid, lobster mac & cheese ($14) was decent, but if you had to choose one appetizer, I'd go with the bisque. We had the sole ($27) for entrees, which was delicious, but the bacon-wrapped pork tenderloins ($27) were just okay (the pork tasted more like salted ham). The food was pretty pricey IMHO for the quality. Tables are really really close together ( literally 1 inch apart), so good if you're not claustrophobic/don't care if others overhear every word you say! The service was wonderful...Water was always filled, plates cleared quickly, but no one hovered over you. Overall, maybe try it once if you've checked out most of the other fine dining scenes in the city--otherwise, keep this lower on your list.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: This was our first time at this restaurant and we thought we got better service at the dives we frequent. We were seated immediately even though we were 20 mins early. But as soon we sat down the table and wait staff were inattentive. We expected a restaurant with a notable wine list would come with more informed waitstaff that was apt to offer suggestions. When we needed an extra minute to look at the extensive wine list, we were met with a short attitude. Our food came out later than expected (folks seated after us got their food before us) and servers barely came back to ask how we were doing. We had higher expectations and were disappointed. Probably wont go back again.
review_title: This was our first time at

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: meal portions are of good size. Food preparation was just ok - fish was a little dry.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Love First Crush's menu, service and prices. How this restaurant isn't mentioned in Zagats with at least a 24 for food is beyond me.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: The food was good, but service was incredibly lax. We won't be back.
review_title: The food was good, but service

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Arrived at 5:30. Was immediatly seated. Ordered the beet salad and loved every bite. Then had the filet special and enjoyed every bite. The wine we chose was soso, but that was my fault. Overall, i really enjoyed my time and will recommend to others.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Second time dining here within a year.This is a perfect place for dinner w/friends prior to a theatre performance in the area.Wonderful wines.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: We had a nice dinner though we were seated in the bar area (on the main floor) and would have preferred to be in the dining room downstairs. Food was very good, service was attentive, but the waiter had NO personality at all. Good experience overall.
review_title: We had a nice dinner though

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Fantastic service food was creative an excellent, really enjoyed the evening!

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: I really like the small plate options they have. This way we can sample more dishes for the same amount.
review_title: I really like the small plate

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: This was a great spot near the Orpheum Theater, where good restaurants are not that common. My group of 5 was able to park right around the corner (Eddy and O'Farrell), walk to First Crush, then walk to the Theater. Food was great and we all took advantage of the flights of wine - a deal you can't beat! Highly recommend it. This was my third time eating there, but the rest of my group's first -and they all said they'd go back.
review_title: This was a great spot near

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Very enjoyable. We were allowed to 'dine' and take our time enjoying each course.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: We always love First Crush - perfect light dinner with a variety of great wines

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: I paid $70 for a bottle of wine that the waitress guaranteed we would like. It wasn't very good. The markup on the wine seemed excessive. We ordered from the special theatre menu and even at the special $30/person, everyone's food lacked flaovr.
review_title: I paid $70 for a bottle of

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: The place is a hip, upscale eatery with an amazing pre-fixe for those seeing Wicked. Dark room with very good wine list, and great cocktails. Food is delicous, and a great value for the price. Would go back.
review_title: The place is a hip, upscale

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: The dining was for New Year's Eve. The waiter was very attentive and kept our glasses filled; if it was water or wine, it didn't matter, the glass was refilled. My husband has a dietary restriction and I had sent an e-mail a couple of days prior to our arrival. Without my reminding the waiter, he asked us about the restriction, talked to my husband about it to understand it and then based on that knowledge made recommendations. He gave us space to spend time together and enjoy the dinner and at the same time was there when he was needed, it was the perfect balance. We would DEFINITELY go eat there again!
review_title: The dining was for New Year's

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: The menu selection was too limited. The lamb was bland and lacked flavor. The restaurant was so poorly lit it was difficult to see the menu. The variety of the flights were great, but I would not come back for a full meal again. Maybe an appetizer.

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: My husband and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary so, as you can imagine, we had high expectations. So here's how it stacked up: our food was really good, the wine flights were great, the deserts were very tasty and we enjoyed the complimentary champagne they sent us for the occasion. The service was fine - at first. But after our order was taken, we never saw our server again. The busboy filled our water and took away our plates, but someone else checked to see if we were happy with our food, another person offered us desert and when we were ready for our check, we had to ask a manager. By the end, we weren't sure who we were tipping. Not sure I would go there again unless someone I was with REALLY wanted to go.
review_title: My husband and I were celebrating

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Nice dinner including the best beet salad I have ever had in my life ... I have been trying to recreate it at home but no luck yet!!

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Danny and Terry went out of their way to make our anniversary very memorable. Thank you!
review_title: Danny and Terry went out of

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: the place is small, and tables are too closely arranged that you can hear what the people on the third table are talking about. Food was alright, but $26 for 2 pieces of scallop? $25 for a salmon piece that is approximately 4*4*2in. for the price i've paid, i could have gone to a better place.
review_title: the place is small, and tables

rest_name: First Crush Restaurant Wine Bar & Lounge
review: Small but decent menu.  Small entrees that were very tastily prepared.  A moderate-sized wine list that was disappointingly limited mainly to California wines (and worse, mainly Napa wines).  Wines from other countries and other areas of California would be nice.  Overall, though, good to very good.

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: Amazing views phenomenal food. Great experience. I stayed at the hotel a few years back and brought my girlfriend whilst in town on vacation. She loved it and I had forgotten how good it was.

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: service and food variety was well worth every penny.

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review:
Fantastic view of San Francisco, great food and service, what else could you ask for.
Do not leave San Franciso without visiting this fabulous place. The Brunch is pricy, but worth it. If you just want to see the veiw, come at night for a cocktail.

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: The Top of the Mark is an incomparable brunch - especially when the fog's not in ! Incredible 360 views of San Francisco. Best of the best food, champagne, and service. $79 per person, plus tax and tip. We're not rich, but to celebrate memorable occasions like birthdays, anniversaries, and Valentine's Day, its well worth it ! Don't forget to dress up ...
review_title: The Top of the Mark is an

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: Brunch was SUPERB! All the food was great and our server, Gloria, was so kind and made our brunch experience so wonderful! We had a wonderful window table in what was called the "Radio" room. They used to have radio broadcasts from this area of the restaurant during the "Big Band Era." We also enjoyed the beautiful music provided by pianist, Michael Athans! Everything was First Class!
review_title: Top of the Mark was Great!

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: service was poor for the price! expected average service but well below great view/area was excited for the first expereince rather poor and price of parking and food not justifed service
review_title: service was poor for the price!

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review:
Great views however the food really wasn't anything to rave about. Good variety of food choices but in terms of flavor, I was looking for a bit more.
Service was ok. Once again, I expected more given the location and reputation.

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: The draw to Top of the Mark is obviously its stunning views. We went there for lunch immediately following a cross-country flight, and we could not have been more delighted. The service was extremely attentive and even let us choose our own seat, the food was above-average, and the wine was some of the best we had during our vacation. The prices were a bit high for the lunchtime menu, but again, you pay for the views, and it is truly worth every penny. If you are looking to be blown away by panoramic views of the city and don't mind a few extra bucks for lunch- Top of the Mark is a MUST.
review_title: The draw to Top of the Mark

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: Great setting, but the food experience resembles the cafeteria days of my college years. What are the owners thinking letting this incredible venue go to waste like this. As a San Franciscan, I am ashamed to present this face to our tourists. To say this is a the top of premier hotel. The service was flawless, and everyone is kind and attentive. And the views breathtaking. But the menu is like a sports bar's, with a buffet in the middle. The wine list is like that of the Olive Garden. As for me, I wouldn't want something fancier. Just more tasteful and less dated.

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: Still asa great as we remembered, and few things are ! Service and food fabelous.
review_title: Still asa great as we remembered,

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: incredible ambiance and setting, the views were very very nice. the food was very good and the waiters were more than accomodating. A little on the pricey side but for a special occasion it is worth it.

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: We ate here for Thanksgiving dinner. Given the special occasion, it was set up buffet style. They were running a little late seating people -- we sat down 10 minutes late. The waiting room was PACKED. No place to sit and you had to constantly dance around so people could get to the elevators. Inside, the room was extremely crowded and the buffet in particular gave the impression the layout wasn't as carefully planned out as it should have been. Service was above average, but not outstanding. The view is excellent, day or night. Every plate I sampled was at least very good, most were excellent. I would return, but I hope the restaurant would put a little more effort into special occasion planning.

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: do not go there for the food. only go there for drinks and the view. the place is more geared for people in the late 40's or older.
review_title: do not go there for the food.

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: I had a friend visiting from out of town... so this was the perfect spot for a great view of san Francisco. We grabbed a quick lunch which was delicious! Salads and sandwiches were very fresh with great flavor. My only disappointment is that a single latte cost $6.50! I appreciate fantastic food, and professional service; however, their pricing is outrageous. Perhaps this is why they were not very busy on a weekday lunch service. I will not return...
review_title: I had a friend visiting from

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: the view was unmatchable, but it was clear the only redeeming quality of top of the mark was the history and the view. the food was unremarkable, my friend and i both left hungry. there wasn't much atmosphear but of course the view ws amazing. the service was outstanding. i would go again, but for a drink only. perhaps the dinner is more impressive. though the food was boring, the experience was not. go for a drink, not for lunch.

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: One of the best brunches that I have ever attended.
review_title: One of the best brunches that

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: We come from abroad, we have visited so many restaurants in the whole world. Your sunday brunch is a world class model of american cuisine. I am glad I chose Top of the Mark to celebrate my 79th birthday wuih my family here.
review_title: We come from abroad, we have

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: The only disappointment was the dessert - The Lobster bisque, salad, fish and pork were outstanding.  The service and atmosphere were as well.

address: Number One Nob HillSan Francisco, CA  94108
review:
Wonderful, romantic brunch for my girlfriend and me for her birthday!
Thank you!

L'Ardoise is exactly the type of restaurant you hope to find while on a vacation to France, and alas, you never seem find.  Delicious, traditional bistro fare with a cosmopolitan touch.  Friendly service and some delicious wines.  We had a wonderful time at L'Ardoise.
My girlfriend and I have shared several special occasions here and continue to love every minute of our experience.
really a gem restaurant and such great food! totally authentic too!

A few items were different than the counterparts actually cooked in France, but overall it was a great experience. The good was really good (get the tiger prawn ravioli, skip the escargot). The service was just the right balance of attentive and "leave you alone to enjoy your meal". In that way, a lot like brasseries. 

Be sure to bring your email confirmation. When we arrived, we apparently were not in their system. However, when I showed my email, all was fine.

Over all, go, get some food and wine and enjoy!

I had a fantastic birthday day dinner here with friends. The food was outstanding and service was warm and friendly. This will be a my new go to restaurant for any occasion. The duck confit is a must have!

This restaurant is to die for... just AMAZING! You feel so welcomed as soon as you walk in. You're greeted very kindly. The whole staff is from France and they all work as a team. The staff goes out of their way to make sure you have a good experience. We have been here many times and you never feel rushed by the waiters. The food is EXCELLENT... it makes you feel like you're in Paris (I'm not kidding). Prices are good and the service is OUTSTANDING!!! Olive was our waitress last week. She was very attentive and very personable. I would highly recommend this place.

L'Ardoise has become one of my favourite restaurants in the city. The staff is always warm and welcoming, very efficient and present without being obtrusive. I had the escargot, the Sea Bass and the Apple Tart. Everything was deliciously prepared and presented.

My boyfriend and I love this place! Every time we're here we feel like we were somehow transported to Paris. Walk through the doors at L'Ardoise, and you're no longer in San Francisco! The atmosphere is totally French. The waitstaff are charming, helpful, and friendly. The menu is excellent. Everything we've had here has been cooked to perfection (and the potatoes that come with the filet mignon are to die for!!). We need to visit more often as there are so many things on the menu that I want to try!

We love that whenever we feel the need to escape our normal lives, Paris is practically around the corner!
review_title: A touch of Paris right in S.F.

review: If you are looking for a wonderful neighborhood gem, go to L'Ardoise. Friendly and helpful staff. Great food and genuine french environment. I wish all the restaurants in Paris had a staff as nice as L'Ardoise.
review_title: Best confit de canard in SF!

review: Great french bistro food, great service. A little small and noisy but it's a part of their charm. Our waiter was very professional and had a beautiful french accent. The service could not have been better. I had Duck Confit and it was pefectly cooked and great flavor.

L'Ardoise is one of the best neighborhood restaurants in San Francisco. The staff also remember us when we come there and it is just a friendly, wonderful experience. The food is wonderful and they have the BEST Confit de Canard I've had in the US. If you go there once, you'll go there many times!
review_title: L'Ardoise is one of the best

review: One of the very best SF bistros. Duck confit and seafood cassoulet were lovely, striking a perfect balance between comfort food and haute cuisine. Despite being slammed (it was a weeknight but the place was more than full when we left at 8:30), the service was attentive and personal without being intrusive or smarmy. Our only even mild complaint is that because the space is so small, a full house makes the atmosphere slightly close. A bit more ventilation would help. Otherwise, terrific. We'll be back.
review_title: One of the very best SF bistros.

review:
The food was incredible! We cut right to the chase and ordered 2 filet's and they were probably some of the best steaks we have ever had.
Definately one of the best meals I have had since moving here and I already made my reservations for next time!

We were able to get the seat by the window. It was ber romantic. However, the 6 top next to us was totally obnoxious and it totally killed the mood. Thankfully they left just as our food came!

Don't come with more than 4 people and don't bring your children!

Superb Dining Experience
I would have given 5 stars for service except that our waiter was not as knowledgeable about the wines as I expected, when asked for a recommendation.

This is a great little spot for a romantic dinner -- it's a little cramped, but the food and (fairly expensive by the glass) wine is consistently excellent. The service is very good, and everyone working there seems to be happy working there. The portion sizes are reasonable, meaning that if you're accustomed to large plates, you will be disappointed. I wasn't, because I am always able to finish my food in the restaurant. The menu was slightly different both times I've been, which is refreshing, and everything we've tried has been wonderful.

It is intimate, meaning that you will probably be seated fairly close to other couples, but it is not too loud to have a quiet conversation.

Everything was absolutely perfect! The accommodated my request to not sit near the front door, we were in the very back, very cozy, warm and intimate. The food was beyond our expectations, and our server was incredibly attentive. I recommend L'Ardoise to anyone looking for authentic, fresh and unique French food.

Everything was great, with the exception being that it was a bit too warm. There are heavy curtains around the front door to keep the wind from rushing in on diners, but in the back of the restaurant there is nothing to keep the air circulating to move the heat away. The service is attentive, friendly, and engaging. The food is wonderful.
Cozy neighborhood restaurant with good, unpretentious bistro food and excellent, professional service.

What a great little neighborhood gem! Warm and welcoming, and gloriously good food, with just the right amount of casual French complexity. A step above the everyday, so a great spot for a special occasion (was my husband's birthday.) Will eat again there as soon as I can!

I really enjoyed this place. Everything from the wine, the meal and the dessert were excellent. It was my friend's Birthday, although she has been there before she was talking about how good it was the next day.
Very nice restaurant. Took my boyfriend for his birthday and he enjoyed it. Had a great time. The shrimp ravioli is amazing!

We celebrated my husbands 50th birthday and had a wonderful dinner. The restaurant is quaint, intimate, and charming. The service was very helpful and attentive. We had a lovely evening. Its in a nice quiet neighborhood which added to the charm. Our favorite dish was the brussel sprout salad. The Coq au Vin was excellent.
Excellent service, delicous food, great wine list...was a great evening and a cute location.

Excellent French bistro.

Great food, great service. Not pretentious. No BS.

Only regret is the extremely challenging parking situation.

Otherwise, I would love to dine there regularly.

It's nice to see that true amazing (and not overpriced) French food is resurfacing in San Francisco. It's also nice to get service from a staff who knows service.... very refreshing.
I would recommend this little gem to any foodies out there.
review_title: It's nice to see that true

review: Wow. What a gem!! Very intimate space; great spot for a date or small group. Food was outstanding- I ordered the coq au vin which was deliciously tender but the filet mignon stole the show. My dining partner and I agreed it was one of, if not the, best filet mignons we'd ever had!! Wine list was extensive with a limited offering of wine by the glass... but it's French, unlike us, most won't be ordering by the glass. Escargot was unlike anything I have tried before but the unique preparation was a great success. I'm a waitress (at another restaurant in SoMa) and the service here was without flaw- very professional and attentive without fawning. Price was very reasonable for SF; dinner for 2 came to $100 before tip. Highly recommended!!
review_title: Wow. What a gem!! Very intimate

review: Just great- L'Ardoise has been what I've been looking for since L'Avenue closed to become the expensive Boulevard -wonderful in evry aspect- food, service, ambience, neighborhood gem- you name it. We're looking forward to our next visit!

Romantic
cozy
Food was good ,not great , but away from the crowds
we had a nice time

Have been thee several times. We have had pleasant dining experience. The restaurant is small; tables for two are separated by 2 feet or less. One can easily hear conversation. The place has a comfortable "neighborhood" feel, albeit a little too noisy. The food has been very good, portions generous, the presentation unpretentious. Service is prompt but at times awkward because of the space problem. Overall very good. Will definitely return and recommend to friends.
Terrific restaurant. Great service, excellent food, reasonable prices. This restaurant is a definite find!!!
The atmosphere, food, and service are always exceptional. Our last visit was no different.

L'ardoise is a shining jewel of Parisian delight right in the Castro. The warm decor, professional and knowledgeable waitstaff, and superb menu transport you to another time and place. An EXCELLENT restaurant that I hope will be around for years to come.

I live in the neighborhood and it is a delight to have this restaurant within walking distance. The food is fantastic as are the service people. I highly recommend this restaurant for a wonderful dining experience.

I loved this restaurant!! I found it through the Neighborhood Gems listings. Can't figure out why I hadn't heard about it before. Perhaps the neighbors are trying to keep it a secret. I understand why. Everything about it was special, food, service, atmosphere, even a place to park close by.
Definitely a neighborhood gem. Little place serving mostly classic food, well executed and very good. An especially good value.
I've been to L'Ardoise 3 times since its opened and its consistently fantastc.

This was our second visit to L'Ardoise since they opened last week, both Fridays, and the experience went from good to great.  We're Francophiles so our expectations are high for a 'Bistro' and they are being met with L'Ardoise.  Service came completely together on our second trip.  Once the kitchen is operating at 100% ( my sauteed potatoes were steamed nicely but didn't see the inside of a sautee pan), I am sincerely looking forward to the menu expanding and many more "outstanding" evenings at L'Ardoise.

Doug Mylcraine  aka Ramon Douglass
72 Eureka Street
Started with the chickpea battered calamari appetizer - WOW - a wonderful combination of flavors and textures.  Our waitress recommended the hanger steak for dinner and it was indeed exceptional.

I was convening a business lunch, so choosing the Dogpatch neighborhood made for an easier commute from 280 for guests from the Peninsula as well as SF.  Unfortunately, parking was horrible - even on a Friday - so public transportation or a taxi is really a smarter way to get there. Out-of-towners will need to allow time for circling and for walking many blocks.  The music was quite loud upon arrival. They kindly turned it down, but it was still a bit of a challenge to have a conversation. Food was excellent, however, the server did forget someone's drink and needed to be reminded.  I will return to this restaurant, but will likely avoid it for future business lunches.

Was really impressed with this neighbourhood gem. Noted on the reservation that it was a birthday dinner and they saved a nice table for us. The cocktails were delicious and expertly prepared -- some of the best I've have in SF so far. Dinner was also excellent, with well sized (not enormous but not skimpy) portions of deliciousness. Reservations are a must, but well worth the planning.
review_title: Super place for dinner and drinks

review: Serpentine is exceeding expectations as this was my 4th visit. The service Monday evening was on par with my other visits to Serpentine. Every staff member we encountered was professional, warm and welcoming.
Beautiful high ceilings match a chatty yet intimate ambiance with tons of natural light. Excellent coffee, appetizers, and filling yet still healthy main dishes. Splendid!
Love the weekend brunch at serpentine - regular spot. Food is always solid, and the bloodies great.

I've usually gone here with one or two people and always had a great meal/experience. This time we had a group (of8). It worked very well.

One thing to note, not many vegetarian options.
Low key place with excellent food and wine. Nice grown up atmosphere with patient and helpful staff. We come back here again and again.
LOVED the Osso Bucco and the Chickpea Battered Calamari. We underestimated the portion sizes and were too full to try the desserts. Would love to come back for brunch to try the famous burger!
review_title: LOVED the Osso Bucco and the

review: We arrived about twenty minutes late due to parking issues but the hostess was really gracious and worked with us. The food was very yummy and my out of town guest was really impressed.
6 for 6 on dinner. An increasingly rate average for 2 people let alone 6. Kepp up the good work.

Salty Dishes. In fact, the beans under the calamari was too salty to even eat. The hanger Steak and Halibut used greens and sauces that were too earthy and grass-like in flavor. Not enhancing and not well paired. A little too salty too. I wanted to like it. Shame.
great neighborhood spot make sure you opentable reservations always busy

The food was fresh and beautifully prepared. For brunch, the crab benedict and the deconstructed red flannel hash had wonderful flavors and were well presented. Even something as mundane as fried potatoes were well seasoned, crisp and not greasy. Healthy portions, so no need to over-order. Interesting industrial but casual feel felt comfortable and service was very good.
review_title: The food was fresh and beautifully

review: Great salads. Good hamburger. But they use good, lean beef so order it medium rare rather than medium.
Went for lunch. It was very good. Service was excellent. It has an edgy, hip feel.
review_title: Went for lunch. It was very

review: Lot's of buzz but the food did not meet expectations: went over w/ several friends for new year's eve and tried several appetizers and entrees - the food lacked flavor and distinction. Could have had same food for less and a lot tastier.
review_title: Lot's of buzz but the food

review: Good food but the nicoise salad, though quite good, was extrmely small for $13. Service was spotty despite it being slow and there being plenty of waitpersons.
The food was excellent, with quite a range of different kinds of food. Every dish has it's own unique taste and stand out alone. Very nice.
Good eats, decent price, great service, nice people!
Food and drink are good (although the food menu is quite limited), but it is way too noisy and too expensive for what you get.
Good, but not blown away.  Shrimp pasta was beyond bland.  Duck confit sandwich was excellent.
despite a difficult person in our large group, our server was amazing and did one of the best jobs i have seen in a long time!
nice restaurant ..... just do not arrive early.   very busy but overall a great lunch spot for the busy south of market area.
review_title: The lobster roll was to die for!

review: Great seafood restaurant.  Does have a few selections for those that don't like seafood or don't wishes to eat it through the whole meal.  House Moules Frittes/delicious, good selection of oysters, crispy pork belly with octopus/tasty.  All staff are very friendly and attentive, but not overtly.  One of our favourite spots.
review_title: Great seafood restaurant.  Does have a f...

review:
The food was amazing.. the potato chips alone are almost worth going.  We shared three appetizers/small plates - calamari, salmon tartare, and summer squash.  Everything was a unique mix of flavors that was amazing.  Server was very nice, but slow.  Didn't seem that busy or any reason for the slow service.  Huge beer selection, no liquor, decent selection of wines.  Cool ambiance.
Would recommend, would return.

Met a friend there for lunch during the week.  Had the lobster roll, it was so good-the bread holding the lobster was toasted, soft, perfect. It was super loud but not unusual for a restaurant with such high ceilings.
The restaurant was busy but the service was outstanding anyway. Food is always good.

Best seafood dinner I have had in a long time!! Dustin out waiter was outstanding. All the staff were great. Vernon, the chef came out to greet us. Calamari, angels on horseback, cerviche, lobster roll and scallops were what we ordered. And we finished everything!! Can't wait to go back

Great seafood. Food is always delicious and the servers are friendly and helpful. They make great recommendations and never try to upsell you to the most expensive thing on the menu,

We also made a special request on opentable to have a table away from the front, where it would be a little more quiet (my parents are getting to the age where it is a little harder to hear) and they made the accommodation no issue and were super kind and aware of the request. Thank you!

In a city of wonderful seafood offerings, Anchor & Hope disappoints. The service was poor on the night we visited. Our server, although professional on those rare moments when we had her attention, was not attentive and was staffed on too many tables. The food wasn't stellar and simply missed the mark. The Bollywood mussels were tasty, but there was nothing special about them. A $7 upcharge for optional frites was ridiculous (and inconsistent with the $3 upcharge on the menu). The shrimp cocktail consisted of six flavorless boiled shrimp on a plate, resting next to a ramekin of cocktail sauce. I could've fixed this at home. The salmon sashimi dish brought an interesting presentation but didn't pack the punch expected from the menu.

Service was moderate. My Linguine was fantastic, but other's at my table had very small portions and the food didn't have the flavor it should have had. Very mixed reviews from a food standpoint. It was so freakin' loud we couldn't have a decent conversation. Not a great way to celebrate seeing a friend I hadn't seen in 20 years.
review_title: Don't go here if you want to talk

review:
While the food was very good, the service was extremely slow. Slow to take order, slow water and tea refills, slow to ask us how our food was, slow to bring check and extremely slow to process credit card. We had been done with our food for over 20 minutes before we even got asked if we wanted dessert. And -- it wasn't that busy. It was a Monday lunch.

I'd be willing to try it again, but I'd ask for a different server if I go the same one. Nice enough, but indifferent and SLOW.

Service was polite, but seemed to be "lunch rush" (we weren't asked if we had questions, just if we were ready to order, etc). Food was fine, but not amazing. Lobster roll didn't have much of a lobster taste, and was mostly smaller pieces, as opposed to thick, buttery pieces. It's a fine place for a work lunch, but I wouldn't try it for dinner.
However I reserved, Out table is just in front of kitchen. I don't like it.

Fit for Foodies ...Really?You can do better than that.
We have eaten here many times and keep going back. The other night our waitress was excellent. She was friendly(as in "Welcome back"), attentive, and offered just the right amount of knowledge about the food and wine with an expertise that suggested she had tried all of them. We let her know what we liked and she gave us suggestions. She was right on the mark!
The food was great. The seafood from the raw bar was fresh and the oysters were outstanding(not spawny). We always get Kalimari it is always good. The entres were inspired and tasty. This was the perfect birthday.
Great service and lively atmosphere - perfect for lunch with a friend.

Very nice dinner overall. Evolutionarily, we are descended from the ocean. It is awfully nice to return to it armed with a great wine list. Staff are charming.

However, the service was a bit slow. Dinner with colleagues was still collegial, and we had a good time, but we could probably have reduced our total time from almost 3 hours to 2 without losing much content.
Beer selection and our server were both excellent. Some of the best calamari and chili sauce we've had. Our entrees weren't great.

Very noisy - so prefare for that.  A decent menu - but a little pricy for what you get.  Everything here was WAAAAYYYY TOOO SALTY.  Put the sodium hack in the kitchen on notice.  Not at the top of my list to return to.
Outstanding food - great building. Enthusiastically recommend.

Honestly can't fairly rate the food all we had were parmesian fries.  Went there for lunch, while I am the fish person my wife does not each fish so was going to order the Kobe burger.  Unfortunately at 12:30pm they were already out of the Kobe burger.  Took the waitress about 15 minutes to come to our table after being seated and when when she did come over she said the just ran out of the Kobe. In the end we had drinks and an order of fries then went around the courner to another restaurant.
Tthe sea urchin rich and delectable served as a gumbo with crab was outstanding. The service was knowledgable, astute and friendly.
review_title: Tthe sea urchin rich and delectable

review: I have nothing but good things to say about Anchor and Hope. Go, and go now.
review_title: I have nothing but good things

review: Started the meal with the uni-crab appetizer and the salad with persimmons-both were excellent. The uni-crab appetizer was served in a hollowed out sea urchin shell and was a generous portion of both uni and crab. The salad was super fresh and not overdressed with lots of persimmons. We also had a few oysters-they were out of a few we wanted to try but the ones we had were shucked well and super fresh. We had the sole and the scallops for the main course-both were well prepared. We had a 6 mo old with us and they were very accomodating. Its definitely not a 'kid' restaurant but with ample ambient noise and a very friendly wait staff I could imagine taking slightly older children with adventourous palates here without problem.
Not only great food and service, but a fun atmosphere. Staff was friendly and very efficient. Great oysters!
review_title: Not only great food and service,

review: Really delicious food...but service was below average. VERY slow. Felt ignored at times. The ambiance there is terrific though....would give it another go just for the food.
Anchor and Hope scores on all counts.  I'll go back again and again.

I always like to dine at Anchor & Hope when I am in San Francisco. It is close to downtown, the staff is friendly and the food is good. I particularly like the clam chowder and the fish stew. The bread served is really good, and that is usually a good indication that the food will good too. I never tried their lobster or their ostrich, but they always seem to have a good selection of them. The wine list is nice and the bar always seem to satisfy the patrons.
review_title: I always like to dine at Anchor

review: From the time that I sat down at the bar and asked the bartender, Justin, about the difference between the Gavi di Gavi and the Chenin Blanc I had a very good experience. Justin was very well informed, articulate, opinionated. He brought a taste of the Chenin Blanc and our group enjoyed not one but two bottles of fabulous wine. Fiona, our server, was very friendly, efficient and helpful and knew her menu and her wines. She helped us make good choices throughout the meal and we all left with an excellent 4 1/2 star experience. I had been to Anchor & Hope once before for a "Friends & Family" preopening night event. I had an excellent impression then and an even better impression almost a year later. They get all of the details right.
review_title: From the time that I sat down

review: Anchor and Hope just gets better. Five of us recently went here, each ordered something different, and all absolutely loved the food and scene.

I had an all round great experience.
However I had 2 very bad Kushi Oysters ot of SIX that I ordered.
The Wine List is very limited.

The Host was amazing.
review_title: I had an all round great experience

review: Wow! I went for the sea urchin as seen on Food Network but that was actually the least of the great appetizers. If you like seafood in adventuresome presentations this place is for you. Our table of 7 had many of the apps and lots of the entrees and almost all of the desserts. Our selected wine was out of stock and the manager came over with a substitution of a higher quality and gave us the lower price. Atmosphere and service were really the best, never did we lack for bread, water, next course, wine poured just as we needed it. Would go back many times.
review_title: Wow! I went for the sea urchin

review: The oysters were very good; everything else was good, but not great. Nice selection of wines by the glass. A fun atmosphere, though.
Great food and cool atmosphere. I like the whole wherehouse sailor theme. Get the Angels on Hourseback if you like oysters!

Very good overall.  It was a bit loud.  Once a wine list is in place, I think the experience will be different.  Why linen on some tables and not on others?  Appetizer portions were a bit small.  Entrees were just right!  

Thanks for a good dinner!

very tasty food! must try the fish and chips and snapper ceviche! mmm mmm good!
drinks were on the pricey side, but beer and wine lists were very good. Would definitely come back again.
Our waitress was outstanding, but the manager (owner?) was rather awkward.
Food was excellent. Menu is briefer than expected, but all choices interesting and high quality. Quieter than expected. Expensive.

disappointed with the food. based on recommendations i expected better. me and my dining partners thought the dishes were over sauced. the uni was masked by too much dairy, the same sauce (thousand island?) seemed to accompany most dishes like the smelt and the angles on horseback. the smelt were fresh and good tasting despite the limp and soggy frying. the paella was greasy. good wine list. the service super friendly. the ambiance is terrific even if a little loud. fun place but wouldn't go back for the food.

Expensive for what you get--we paid $200 for 3 people. No drip coffee so you have to buy a coffee drink if you want coffee. Food was good but I actually prefer the place for lunch because it is more reasonable. Also only wine and beer bar.

Very good! Service was great and food was yummy! Loved everything from the shellfish platter, to crispy chips and fries, to little gem salad, to lobster roll and crab melt. Crab and shrimp Louie were beautifully presented. Shrimp Louie was a pleasant surprise with lots of bay shrimp (looked like Oregon Bay Shrimp - my favorite) with very little dressing - no mayo - which was great! Not sold on the fried pickle, though most at the table thought they were scrumptious. Great prices on bottles of vino. CWe had the c (which looked to have a chocolate grenache icing)chocolate cake and cheese plate for dessert. The cheeses were quite tasty. The chocolate lovers enjoyed the cake. Overall a fun experience!

Great lunch choise. Glad I made a reservation, as there was a waiting line when I left. The lobster roll was PERFECT, even though expensive. Home made chips weren't so good (overcooked), but their ribbon fries were excellent, with a hint of rosemary in them.

I had requested a quiet table (as I was there for a business lunch) and this was handled beautifully.  Also, the food came out quickly which was great since time is generally an issue for weekday lunches.  Thank you!
review_title: I had requested a quiet table

review: I think this is my second review.  If the place were a bus shelter, it would still be great for the food.
review_title: I think this is my second

review: Good seafood, well-prepared.  Solid but no wow-factor for us.  Our server seemed bored at best and told us that she didn't want to be there (it was the hottest night in SF in a long time so we couldn't blame her).  We're not strongly recommending this place to our friends yet but we'll give it another try in a few weeks/months.
the food is pricey, portions are small and not tastey - my fish chowder tasted like chicken soup!
The food was great and the service and atmosphere was amazing.  This is a great hide-away spot in a great neighborhood.  I will be returning here often.
Our server was excellent and very attentive, the courses were brought and taken away at a very good pace for our dinner
Took my girlfriend here for her 30th birthday. It was a girls luncheon. Had great food and great service.

Sociale is a hidden retreat with a tucked away neighborhood feel. There's a enclosed patio area with seating inside for more intimacy. Delicious food and engaging staff. The pear and endive salad was fresh and the pappardelle with braised duck was delicious with a wonderful sauce.

Wonderful little restaurant with really good food, very pleasant comfortable atmosphere, attentive waitstaff and quiet enough to hear table companions. Would have lunch ( and try dinner) there again definitely and dessert was fabulous.

I went for Dine About Town with some friends and ordered the pesce crudo salad (raw fish, watermelon, asparagus, herbs) and pork rigatoni. The pesce crudo was really refreshing! I overall was very pleased with my order. My friend got the bolognese which was average at best.

Service was okay....I felt the waitstaff didn't pay much attention to us even when we were the only people left in the restaurant.

While I don't go to fine dining restaurants often, I thought the experience was average at best. I probably wouldn't recommend the place to a friend. I was expecting to be blown away but you can find better food and service for cheaper.
review_title: OK service, depends on your order

review: Love this restaurant tucked off the street in it's own secret garden atmosphere. Hostess was gracious when we arrived early and did double duty as our sommelier and bartender with ease on a busy night until our reservation time rolled around. We have been here a few times and the food is always fabulous, service great but not suffocating and the wines are wonderful. And parking isn't a problem!
Absolutely one of the best meals we have had in years, including some of the Michelin starred restaurants.
Wonderful quality of food for the price. They serve an ample amount, too!

The night we dined there, the sommelier was somewhat snooty, which took some of the gloss off of their overall service. Otherwise, I highly recommend this neighborhood find to whoever enjoys fine dining without pretension.
We had a table of five, a wonderful front table, comfortable, with wall and window so it was relatively quiet for a San Francisco restaurant and we deeply appreciated that.
review_title: We had a table of five, a

review: Tucked back behind some other buildings, the walk down to Sociale was lmagical - a lovely, picturesque, European side street, replete with trees, plants, and brick walkway. Excellent service - friendly and attentive, never burdensome. Full of customers the night we were there, the background "buzz" was high energy but still quiet enough so we could thoroughly enjoy our table's conversation. The food, of course, was wonderful - subtle, intriguing flavors with no "fat hangovers" the next day! Of particular note, the pork chops were juicy and tender, the soup was exquisite, I loved my duck papardelle (sp?), and the chocolate chip ice cream sandwich stuffed with Italian chocolate ice cream was to die for! Found it on Check, pls, Bay Area.

This was a delightful experience for a group of five from beginning to end. The service was quietly efficient- we were never interupted but always well served. The food was delicious and satisfied the discriminating members of the group. Definitely a place where we will all return.

Wow - this was one of the most fantastic meals + romantic spots I've found in San Francisco. It was just a lovely experience and I'm still dreaming about the delicious summer corn & spinach gnocchi. Can't wait to go back!
review_title: Wow - this was one of the

review:
A definite little gem, discreetly tucked away nicely amidst residential and boutique stores on Sacramento Street. As I was walking down this short and narrow path, it quickly opened up to this small and quaint outdoor seating (w/ heat lamps), full of plants and potted flowers...reminds me of an English type garden on a warm spring day.

Food was awesome as well as the wine that accompanied our dinner.

Fried Olives (not an olive lover but when infused with fontina cheese...perfect on a bed of greens) and Seared Scallops (the watermelon and apple jelly complimented the taste of the scallops) were awesome starters.

For main event...
Wagyu Bavette Steak was great with fries and the 2 salsa type sides that came with it, possibly as d

Although I had indicated it was a birthday lunch, they did not acknowledge. However the food and service were excellent, so we did not mind. Both guests had never been there and both indicated they are eager to return.

This is a charming restaurant! You walk down a corridor/alley and at the end you see Sociale's patio seating - it's like going to a going to someone's house for dinner! It made me smile :) The food is tasty, fresh, and the bread is delicious. I came here for Dine About Town, and this is the first restaurant that I will frequent again on my own - no other DAT restaurant had made me want to do that!
Great food and atmosphere. We shared a few starters and tried the shrimp risotto and short ribs. Our server wasn't very helpful and seemed irritated that we didn't order more.
My favorite restaurant in the city.  I love their simple menu, good honest food not overly complicated.  Great flavors, great wine, great people

it was my first time there, and i had a wonderful experience. i've been telling as many people as i can about the delicious food, quint and romantic setting, and the stellar service. looking forward to my next visit.

Mimi Glumac, Esq.
review_title: it was my first time there,

review: The food at Sociale is very good (we had salads and pasta). The ambience is very very nice. And the service is stellar. The only negative for me is one of my pet peeves - outrageous mark ups on wine by the glass prices. Most restaurants feel comfortable charging $10 to $16 a glass. I do not like the markups.
review_title: The food at Sociale is very

review: We liked it alot. It had atmosphere, the servers were good, the service was good and the food was good. We especially liked it because it was small and we could hear each other talk.
review_title: We liked it alot. It had atmosphere

review: Fantastic dining experience. This place should be on OpenTable's Top-10 list.
Friendly staff and wine sommelier. Inventive menu with ample variety and interest.
A wonderful gem of a place. Makes you feel as though you are in the neighborhood bistro on New York's Upper East side. Delightful food and exemplary service, particularly in the wine department.
review_title: A wonderful gem of a place.

review: Great restaurant with top tier service. Very accomodating for large table and the patio is very quiet for romantic dinners.
Sociale just seems to get better - fresh ingredients, superb..
I dine at Sociale on a semi-regular basis and you have become one of my favorite restaurants in SF.  Keep up the great work!
review_title: I dine at Sociale on a semi-regular

review: A neighborhood favorite. The menu is always different, and the food is excellent.  Highly recommended.

This was a great hidden gem. The ambiance, the food and staff were great. Loved the 80's music that they were playing the nigh we were there. Great drink selection as well. Great place to have lunch or drinks and appetizers. The price was just right as well.

Absolutely love the food and drinks & in order to pay $16 for bottomless mimosas I would expect they would be a little stronger, which they were. 
Although, when we got there on Saturday morning, it was a ghost house. Mind you it was only 11 am so understandable. When we walked up to the host for our reservation, she told me that everyone in my party needed to be there before she would sit me. They had one other table that was sat and we were starving. She then "compromised" with us by saying we had to order right away and our time on mimosas started right when we sat down. Rude. The server himself was OK but not much better either.

If the service was better, it would be the ideal place to come every Saturday or Sunday for weekend brunch!

We had a fabulous time at Luna Park. We all came together on March 1st so that my bridal party can all meet one another and mingle while sipping on Mimosas :) Service, food, and ambience was amazing. Love coming to Luna Park.

What a pleasant surprise to dine here with our toddler. The entire wait staff were accommodating, patient and understanding if all the chaos that comes with eating out with a toddler. The food was very upscale and this was a great way for us to have a fine dining experience without the fine dining stress. I cannot express enough the great experience we had for dinner on a busy Friday night none the less!! Thank you Luna Park for being so awesome!!!

You've got to try the roasted squid. It was garlicky with red chili peppers to give it a nice kick. My husband had the burger and it was cooked to perfection. The fries were an added bonus! Drinks were slow on delivery, but delicious on consumption.

The noise level spoiled the experience for us.,. we enjoyed the food (especially the poke) but we had to yell across the table, and that's a deal-breaker for us.

Wish it were otherwise.

The food tasted great and they have healthy menu choices. We had to wait for our table FOREVER and the wait staff was super apologetic and ended up going above and beyond to make it up to us once we were seated. Would go back for the food. The place was just really hopping and full. Fun atmosphere and good drinks.

This used to be a foodie locale, but they've moved on. It's still very good, just not elaborate in the foodie world. Very good comfort food - although a little pricey for that. They should have some fabric on the walls or dampen the din - very noisy for older folk.
review_title: This used to be a foodie locale,

review: We got a booth which was very nice. Service was great, food was good and the cocktails were a killer. (Literally). I come to Luna Park since years and always love it.
review_title: We got a booth which was very

review: Really great food at Luna Park, especially the Hawaian Tuna Poke - absolutely delicious. Service was very friendly, only downside was my coffee when it came was stone cold - had obviously been sitting in the pot for hours. But it was replaced speedily and otherwise it was a great place, and good value for the quality of the food.
Food was disappointing. Pork cutlet stuffed with mushrooms and cheese was not stuffed with any thing and was simply a thin serving of pork overwhelmed by the fried coating.
Bottomless mimosas were fantastic and the food was delicious! Great service, too!
the beers were just a little too hot..but overall it was an excellent evening.
review_title: the beers were just a little

review: I really enjoyed my dinner at Luna Park! I went in with a group of 5 and we were able to sit in the back in a large booth. Our location was much quieter than the rest of the location, so I'd recommend asking for the back booth if you are a group of 5-7 people so you can hear each other well. 3 of us had the Dine About Town option and everyone really liked each of their courses. The 2 people who chose to eat off of the normal menu were also very satisfied. We shared a lot of food so I can safely say everything was delicious and we all enjoyed ourselves.

Started with Goat Cheese Fondue, I'm a sucker for anything cooking at my table. Very fresh croutons and crisp green apples for dipping, enough to share. We also had the Black Bean (puree) soup, I'm trying to mimick the recipe as I type this. Delish Burger and fries as well as was the Hanger Steak with Green Salsa and fries. Next time I might ask for light salt on fries. Dessert was Bananas Foster, which you rarely find on a menu anywhere. AMPLE serving for 2. Overall was a great dinner and worth the trip from WC
Uncomfotable and noisey. The staff were dressed like shelprocks and the table service was minimal-almost non existent. The food was good but the oveall experience bad.

Food is outstanding. Generous portions. Desserts are not to be missed. Service was professional and unobtrusive. In my party of two the discerning diner and the more simple diner were delighted by our meals.

I liked the dark, small, and cozy ambiance of this place. The food and service were very good. We were disappointed that the steak and fries entree was not as good as the other dishes ordered. Overall, I would recommend this restaurant.
review_title: I liked the dark, small, and

review: Bait and switch using an open table coupon. Cocktails are overpriced and could not make a pisco sour correctly. Too bad because the food is very good. I probably won't go back to Luna Park.
review_title: Bait and switch using an open

review:
we are older than the "in" crowd but hey, it's San Francisco and we LOVE, LOVE this
restaurant. The food is incredible..their 2 for 1 offers for appetizers and drinks during the
week are worth driving to...We discovered this gem of a place a few months ago and just keep going back. We know there are other places to dine in SF; but, why fix it if it ain't broke?
Reservations are a good idea, food is outstanding, and the service superb.
You cannot go wrong at Luna Park Restaurant...oh, we travel from the East Bay for this, too.

Went for a very late lunch/early dinner with a friend so it was not a busy time of day. She had the roast chicken and I had the Nisoise salad. Both were delicious! Would definitely recommend this place. The only problem we had was the parking but that's because we were there during rush hour when the meters are un-usable. We parked in a garage 2 blocks away though. We sat in the front area but I noticed there were private booths in the back which would be nice for a romantic dinner. We were not there late enough for the dinner menu, so I plan to go back sometime to try some other dishes. The wine list was sufficient and I enjoyed my pinot noir. My friend wanted a stout beer and there were none, so, no Guiness here.
review_title: Went for a very late lunch/early

review: We did the dine about the town special. It was amazing. The make your own s'mores were the perfect way to wrap up a fabulous dinner.
review_title: We did the dine about the

review: The noise level was WAY too loud for my liking.  I had a hoarse throat the next day from having to scream at my date.  Food was nothing spectacular.  The mac and cheese with ham was the best dish.
review_title: The noise level was WAY too

review: Food was fantastic. The Marinated Hawaiian Tuna Poke with Fried Wonton Chips is to die for and the sangria is great. We were a large party (10 people) with reservations at 9. The party who was occupying the only table large enough to accommodate our group would not leave. They had issues figuring out their bill etc. We were seated about 45 minutes later than our reservation. However, the staff at Luna Park did their best to keep us comfortable while we waited. We received complimentary appetizers (one of each item on the menu) and a round of drinks while we waited. The friendly folks at Luna Park went above and beyond the call of duty and we are sure to visit them again. Highly recommend it.
Good date place. Great service. Ciaoppino tasty but mostly broth; tiny portion. Fun crowd.

We were greeted promptly by the hostess. The tables were very close together and were uncomfortable. The server took quite awhile to greet us and get our beverage order. She brought our drinks and appetizers and we asked for some water,. The water never came. We had to ask the bus boy who then forgot. The server came back to check on us and I asked for another appetizer. We waited 20 minutes and I asked if she had our order and she said no. Then she was absent for the rest of the time. Once we asked for the check she was more on top of it.The food was well presented and had good flavor. This seemed to be a local spot and was very energetic and vibrant. I may give this place another try but not on a weekend.

It was my boyfriend's birthday and I had forgotten that I had mentioned that when making the online reservation. So we ordered dessert (make your own s'mores!) and they brought out this huuuuuge came with a sparkling candle and everything! I don't want to give it away but it was a great surprise for both of us.
We had a great experience! The Dine About Town menu was very tasty and perfect for a cold, rainy night.

I had a great experience. I was on a date with my girlfriend and even though it was busy for a thursday we still had a nice and romantic time. The food was amazing, fancy renditions of our favorite home-styled dishes, especially the Smores. Service was perfect: friendly and fast, and easily accesible if we needed something else. The staff recognized us as a couple on a date, asked if we would like a table a little more set off, which was great, and the ambiance just added to the nice evening we had.

Food much better this visit than previous trips, my filet was delicious, and desert was great - but service continues to be disorganized, we stood at a crowded bar holding our coats & drinks for 10 minutes while our table sat empty... Eventually someone wandered over and seated us. At least this was better than last time where they got confused & gave our table away. Luna Park needs to tighten up their service... But food appears to be better this time.

The food was wonderful but the desert was better! The make your own s'mores were delicious! The restaurant is small and a little loud the later in the evening it gets and the service is a tad slow. All in all it is a great experience and the ambiance was fun.

My only disappointment was that you have no whole wheat (or any multi-grain) bread. The only choices were different forms of white bread (English muffin, sourdough, etc.). Not good for health-conscious S.F. dining. Everything else was great!

The appetizers were terrific as were the main courses. Our waiter was very attentive, but by far the birthday "cake" that arrived for our daughter complete w/ candles and a giant sparkler was the best. It was a total surprise and since it was a dummy cake w/ the birthday girl's ordered dessert under it, it was even better. Have been telling everyone about that dummy cake. Perfect and so Valencia street. Luna Park has never disappointed.

I enjoy Luna Park's food (the braised short ribs are perfect for cold and rainy winter nights, but have always disliked the noise level. Now that I know they have the quieter booths in the back, I'll be going there more frequently. Moules frites, look out!!
Luna park is always a lot of fun. Good food, excellent cocktails, cool staff, and usually good tunes playing. I'd recommend it to anyone, especially for first date situations.
review_title: Luna park is always a lot

review: Our food did not seem to have received much attention in the kitchen before it arrived at our table...My steak was not cooked to order, fries seemed soggy in oil, and bread cold. Our waitress was superb though.
review_title: Our food did not seem to have

review: Make sure you have your party there at the time of the reservation, otherwise there will be drama! Even after I had all my people at Luna Park, I watched the maitre'd give away our booth and we had to stand in the impossibly crowded bar for an even longer wait. But once we were seated, the food and the service were good. Get ready to have to shout over the noise though. Great for birthday parties (there were 2 while we were there).
review_title: Make sure you have your party

review: The goat cheese fondu and french toast were both amazing and highly recommended.  The specialty drinks were also very good, especialy the crimson cosmo.

The only complaint is that we had to wait 15 minutes for our table for our 9:00 reservation which caused some tension for our party and the staff that was trying to help us. It would have been better if they had given us 3 free drinks instead of us standing in the front of the restaurant.

Overall, I enjoyed my experience at Luna Park. The highlight of the meal was the S'mores dessert. That was delicious and I really enjoyed the homemade graham crackers. The low light of the evening was the ahi tuna nicoise salad. I was really looking forward to that meal, but when it arrived, there was barely any ahi on it, and the salad was very very bland. I didn't enjoy eating it at all and I've had my fair share of tasty nicoise salads elsehwhere. HUGE disappointment with this salad. I think it needs a light, creamy vinaigrette to tie it all together and to give it some flavor, which it seriously lacked, despite the ingredients.

Bin38 is amazing. When you go, ask to have the wine pairings. Shared the dishes and the wine with another person and it works out great. Always have an even number in your group so you can do this. The place has great ambiance and the wait help is always always pleasant. They make you feel welcome.
Everything was great except they double charged my credit card and the manager is not getting back to me. C- for customer service.
Great food. Servers sometimes a bit confused but not dramatic. Very forthcoming when sharing dishes with another person. They put in on separate plates for you.
We were 3 adults with a toddler. Our waiter brought out food quickly to keep the youngster occupied and was attentive to our needs and wishes.
review_title: We were 3 adults with a toddler.

review: Very chic but food was not on par with environment. My boyfriend found a piece of plastic while eating the rabbit appetizer, risotto was very heavy in lemongrass flavor, the only decent thing was the parrardelle. service wasn't that great, took half an hour to get our order. Overpriced and wouldn't come again unless its happy hour.
review_title: Very chic but food was not

review: First of all found rock star parking! Hit Bin 38 after the Chronicle wine tasting event. Brought a couple of wines with us. Had a fantastic waiter (Jessie?) with whom we shared our bounty. Indulged in truffle popcorn, fries and bubbly to start. Then shared the pappardelle with the Cab. Perfect pairing. Next time we'll spend waaay more time on their wine list and enjoy a proper dinner.
review_title: First of all found rock star

review:
We both really enjoyed Bin 38. The beer list is excellent as well as the wine. The starters are fun: spicy chickpeas or truffle popcorn for example; butter lettuce salad and chicken roulade were exceptional. My partner said it was the best hamburger he's had in SF: big, juicy, cooked to order. We appreciate that they offer Naiman Ranch beef and Mary's chicken. Try the peach cobbler - big enough to share and not "gooey" with added thickener.
The back outdoor dining area is quiet and inviting.

It was too cold for the patio but on a warm night that would be great. Cool atmosphere and good for wine tasting. The bartender was a dud. Not very helpful with the huge wine list but table service was friendly and helpful. Be prepared for a big bill for little food. We split a starter, appetizer and small entre plus 2 glasses of wine for $107 before tip. Ouch!
review_title: Cool but pricy spot in Marina

review: Bin 38 is a great place to go for a date. Good food. Unpretentious feel. Great wine and beer list.
review_title: Bin 38 is a great place to

review: food was amazing! the duck is to die for! a little salty but I love me some salt!!! so it was just fine for me. everything we had was amazing. it was a tight fit and really crowded on a Tuesday but it's nothing you don't see at most places through out the city.

sorely disappointed. scallops were way overcooked and way too salty-- agreed upon by me and my friend. Menu was lacking. We struggled to find anything appetizing sounding for our main entrees so we just skipped it and ordered the appetizers for dinner. The one bright spot is the brussel salad was tasty. Everything else forget it.
I have to say if you are a single guy. This is the place to go on a Thursday Night. Food was great, and I would say there was about 40 beautiful woman in there with only two guys. Including me.
review_title: I have to say if you are a

review: I actually made this reservation for my mom and my stepdad as part of a "night out" gift. They had dinner before a show at the Masonic. I chose this restaurant without having been there because it had excellent reviews and was within walking distance of the theater. It didn't let me down! My mom called me the next day with absolutely glowing recommendations of the restaurant. She was extremely impressed the food, service and ambiance. I hope to visit one day when I am in town. Thank you opentable for helping me make a date night special for my parents.

Loved Big 4 !!!  We had a xmas weekend with son and his special lady. Went circ de soleil and then to Big 4. We were seated promptly to a nice table, quiet but not too much.   Service was prompt but rushed. Just leisurely.  Food was great.  Short ribs were enough for two and the other dishes were great too.  Would go back again!!

The Big 4 has always been and old time, clubby dining establishment with a faithful clientele, friendly wait staff and good food. Not really gourmet, but reliably tasty, good selection of wine, and nice ambiance.

If you want to know the "Real" S.F. - have dinner at the Big Four.  It is one of the last, great restaurants in the City by the Bay that has retained San Francisco's spirit.   Prices are very reasonable by today's standards and I think the food is far superior than what you pay.
If you want a late night nightcap, the bar is comfortable, inviting, romantic and fun all at the same time.  You will see lots of locals and hear some very good piano
review_title: Big Four-Still one of SF's best!

review:
Always LOVE returning here. It is one of the few historical gems of SF that remain.
The ambience is set in the past. Comfortable green leather booth seating accommodates small romantic tables or large groups. Historical art & artifacts of the history of Crocker, Huntington, Stanford, & Hopkins, the " Big 4", adorn the walls. The menu was interesting complete with daily specials. Although pricey, there is no disappointment with the quality or preparation of the food.
Sure hate to see this restaurant close in Jan for a major remodel.
Dean and his gang were on top as usual. My SF favorite restaurant and I'm addicted to the Chicken Pot Pie.

The Big 4 has a luxurious. romantic dining room and serves excellent food.

We had the lobster bisque, the wild boar, and the osso buco. All were excellent, but the bisque was outstanding.

Service was somewhat lacking: It took a while to get drinks refilled, and it took about 10 minutes to get our check after requesting it.

The food is not cheap but is worth the price. The drinks were a bit overpriced.

We ate here while staying in the hotel on business; primarily because it was convenient to do so. The food was nice, but nothing to write home about and spectacularly overpriced. My partner's steak was more 'medium' by UK standards than 'medium rare' so watch out for that. We liked the decor; old wood panelling and mirrors, but won't be eating here again during our stay in the hotel.
A San Francisco classic! For a romantic dinner or a business conversation, the Big 4 is among the very best San Francisco venues for upscale, civilized dining.

My husband and I have been going to the Big Four for over 20 years. I'm sorry to say that we won't be back. The food has changed, and maybe the brilliant chefs that use to work there are now gone. Actually, we felt like we were eating at a low-end restaurant. Is the economy promoting a different level of food? We are guessing that it is. What happened to the skilled men/women waiters who gave 5-star service. Our waitress was nice, but not of the same caliber. The only thing we enjoyed was Michael Parsons! We will miss you...

During the l950's and 60's I was a frequent customer. Now that I have returned, I will become a frequent customer again. It is a wonderful old style restaurant with great food and service. If you haven't been there, go.
Old traditional San Francisco setting with a great menu.

A wonderful lounge and restaurant with charm. The food is excellent, the service is over the top. We have always come here for a drink in the "English Club" lounge, but had never had dinner. It was everything we would have expected. You can actually have a conversation over dinner instead of shouting over the bar crowd! This is fine dining at it's best with old school charm!
The food was excellent, and the service quick and professional.
Delicious fare and great service make it worth the price.

After a long search for a quiet, classy, and intimate restaurant for our anniversary, I found those qualities superbly exceeded by The Big Four. A private entrance ushers you inside, where a fireplace gently illuminates small tables for pre-dinner drinks and the pianist sets the tone with quiet melodies. The matre d' soon took us to our reserved table, located (as requested) in a quiet corner of their dining room. Our meal was excellent, and the staff was discrete, yet attentive. The dessert arrived with white chocolate scrolls wishing us a "Happy Anniversary," and I am happy to say that we will be returning. You know the kind of place where you regret signing the check? Well, our only regret was having to leave for a show. Thank you Big 4
review_title: After a long search for a

review: Excellent, as always. The wait staff is particularly notable---true professionals, some of whom have been with the restaurant for years.

I had high expectations for Big 4 and it lived up to every one. The room is gorgeous, the staff professional and courteous, and the whole experience quite enjoyable. Every San Franciscan should make a trip to the restaurant.
Pricey but you get what you pay for. Outstanding food and an excellent wine list.
review_title: Pricey but you get what you

review: Food and ambiance was a 10 at this tucked away restaurant!
Hello - the food and service was not very good here. The food was not tasty and it took the server multiple asks to bring anything including water and hot sauce.

The food at Gitane is quite wonderful and beyond my normal experience.  I know it's supposed to be Spanish ... and it is but with a definite creative flair that puts it into the unusual and interesting to try.  The menu is somewhat limited but still has a lot of variety due to the creativity of the kitchen.  Do not go expecting a "normal" experience and I mean that in the most positive way.  The two starters -- bacon bon-bins and stuffed squash blossoms were delicious and there were enough to provide a nice appetizer while still leaving room for the main course.  The lamb chops were creatively spiced, done to perfection, and served with a nicely done starch and vegetable.

Easy walking distance from convention hotels. Nicely prepared and presented tapas sized appetizers. Interesting decor. Good wine list. Surprisingly no paella or also dogmas or flan on the menu but entrees looked good. Relatively expensive but worth the experience overall.

Hidden-away alley location 2 - 3 blocks from Union Square. Be sure to have directions. Once there, the food, service and ambiance were rewarding. Close enough to Geary Street for pre-theater dining. Creative cocktail list and delicious mostly Spanish-Morroccan faire.
