Great bar, fun place all was good, I had a great time the food was good but the beans were uncooked

I tried Gitane because Michael Bauer just added it to his Top 100 list. I agree that the food is great - creative Spanish food that does not lose traditional Spanish flavors. Our waiter Justin was also good - definitely working extra hard given the cramped space. Unfortunately the great food and good service was completely overshadowed by the noise and cramped space. It was too loud to hear my dinner companion and I was almost sitting atop the tables on either side of us. I would have forgiven this if the prices were cheaper but Gitane is definitely charging in the 5 star range for the entrees and for that, you need at least 4 star ambience.

Very expensive for the amount of food.
Quality was reasonably good.
Didn't like the rabbit. Other servings I could
see appeared larger. Too expensive for water, tea.

Service was attentive but food this time was not great. First, the menu is now very limited and smaller than in the past, you can't order individual items from the tasting menu - and why take the excellent tajine off the menu? A few items were excellent (artichoke app and canneloni app delicious - steak entree and quail also very good) but most other menu items were VERY greasy and not the WOW food I'm used to enjoying at Gitane. We were a party of 6 and I had the opportunity to taste the apps and entrees ordered by all. I'll be back because I've had great meals at Gitane, but this time was a miss. Beignets were great - as always.
Nice little restaurant, good food, good ambiance and friendly service.

I had high hopes for this restaurant and the decor and the attentiveness of the servers did not let me down. However, the music was too loud even after it was turned down after a request from another table. As far as the food went: The calamari was too salty; the portion size on the squash blossoms small. The Lamb tagine was OK, however. This is one of those places where you could walk away satisfied with your meal or you could walk away wondering why you paid so much when you've had better meals elsewhere for less money.
review_title: I had high hopes for this

review:
The food was really good. We had the bonbons as appetizer. Would go back just for these. Phenomenal. Our tenderloin was a bit too salty for my taste.

The waiters were attentive - but at the same time a little too attentive. My friend eats really slow so when there are just little pieces on her plate that she is fully intending on grazing on, they still tried to take her plate away from her and she had to swat them away - twice.

It's a little on the expensive side but there's a really nice atmosphere and the food is really creative.
For $12 a glass, the wine could have been more than 1/3 of a glass. The food was OK. Good energy at the bar.

Our party of four had a delightful experience; shared all that we ordered. Enjoyed the selections although a couple of choices were overpowering with spices/garlic that overshadowed some of the more delicate-tasting choices. The wines were new to our experience and very well-suited to the meal. Veryeuro-/chic decor and lighting. A funn spot to spend an evening together. Wonderful, attentive service.
review_title: Our party of four had a delightful

review: Amazing decor, I loved the atmosphere of this place, warm and cozy without feeling like the people next to you are on top of you. Tanjine Chicken and CousCous was awesome! I ordered the pork which was well cooked and seasoned and the zucchini were also grilled perfectly, however the tomato fondue and grilled peaches that was also served with the dish did not work well together. But don't let that deter you from Gitane, just from that dish.

We went here for drinks and appetizers. Both were creative and very good, did not disappoint. The ambiance was unexpected from the exterior .. sort of medieval cavee meets modern decorator. We spent a good amount of time just looking around in the low light, just trying to figure the place out. All-in-all, would go back again.
review_title: We went here for drinks and

review: Excellent service led by Kinson Lau -- Thanks! I will always bring my guests to Gitane.
Service was great and the food was nicely presented and flavorful. Given the size of the plates, the utensils seem to be over scaled. Smaller would be better, especially for the appetizers.
Celebrated Valentines Day, great place. I would recommend to a friend.
Had a delicious and enjoyable evening on a Friday night. Thank you.

great cocktail list and our waitress was very knowledgeable and advised us well throughout the meal; the pastilla was excellent, good to share as an appetizer; one of us had the chicken tagine and the other the quail---both were delicious

Must have the Bistilla appetizer, good to share. Portions are great for the moderate appetite. Big eaters can order the whole menu. One of us had the quail which was fantastic, (just 3 little bones) the other had the salmon which was excellent. Mostly imported wines. Enjoyed sharing the plum empanada. Go,enjoy, won't kill your budget. ( P.S. Starts to get noisy after 8:30 )
Start to finish a great dining experience! Food was superb and service was impeccable yet friendly. Can't wait to return.
review_title: Start to finish a great dining

review: Great food, very good service, good time good time!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Had a fabulous time. We had a 9:30PM reservation and a chance to visit the bar and have a drink before we were ushered upstairs to our table. The service was outstanding for us. Very friendly staff. Will recommend this to my friends looking for a cozy place to have dinner in the city. The food was super delicious. I had the lamb and could have cut it with my fork. Very tender and delicious. Yummy!
review_title: Had a fabulous time. We had

review: Food was good but did not live up to the expectations of what we've heard in the media. My lamb noisette was rubbery. Our waitress was absolutely wonderful. The wine list is the biggest disappointment. A lot of inexpensive wines for very high prices compared to what they are worth. It was a been there done that kind of thing. Too many other good restaurants in SF. Go for a drink at the bar.
review_title: Food was good but did not

review:
Gitane was fun. I must admit, I was a little irked that we had a table that was right next to the stairs to their kitchen/service area, but I understand that it's a small place and rent isn't cheap in San Francisco. Still, my girlfriend and I LOVED the atmosphere.
Our food was good, I wont say it was great but 3 stars wouldn't do it justice. I will admit, the Solomillo - pork tenderloin and braised pork belly - was very good, few places are brave enough to serve pork that's still pink.
I was a little disappointed in the Yelp! eats menu and the servings were small, I understand that it is a more upscale establishment but at some point, you simply have to serve more or charge less. All in all though, it was an enjoyable dining experienc
review_title: Gitane was fun. I must admit,

review: We enjoyed our dinning experience - the ambiance is great, interesting cocktails and the food/wine were tasty. We will return !
Food was wonderful. Wait staff were thoughtful and well trained. A real joy of a restaurant.

The food was disappointing. Having had authentic Moroccan food, the tagine was incomparable and over sweeten, not encompassing the correct flavors and spices. So for the price was definitely not worth it. The desserts were the best part, but the space was also ill-designed acoustically, in which you could overhear others conversation and hearing your own conversation was difficult.

I started with a great cocktail - the best Negroni I've ever had. The restaurant is pretty cozy (tables close together) but I liked the atmosphere and decor. The service was perfect, and everything was delicious (and reasonably priced considering the fairly large portions). The wine list is unique with lots of Spanish and Portuguese wines offered. My only compliant is that there is only one restroom so there was a bit of a wait for it, thought it was impeccably clean.
review_title: I started with a great cocktail

review: I loved the food, wine, and ambiance. However, the tables were way too close together. The waiter had to keep asking me to move so he could serve the table next to us. And I am a petite person! Although the waiter apologized more than once, it was bothersome.
review_title: I loved the food, wine, and

review: We were looking for something different and unique. Gitane was it! I didn't realize (before we went) it had only been open 5 weeks ... but the food was very good and the service was excellent. And yes, check out the bathroom.

I went here for Valentine's Day and was very happy with the food. We loved the dragon roll and spicy shrimp small plate. Prices are reasonable. The service could use some improvement. We had a feeling that our waitress didn't put in our rolls for a while since everyone around us who had been seated after us got their food before us. Other than that, we still had a great night.

Yuzu was yummy! Great staff! Super friendly, great (and trustworthy) suggestions.
We had a great meal.
food was pretty good; some fried flakes on the special rolls were unnecessary. pumpkin tempura was great. premium sake wasn't worth it--just get the regular hot sake.

When I arrived at Yuzu with my date, we really had no expectations. Sure, we had read good things about it on Yelp but we wanted to find out for ourselves. Once we were inside, the ambiance of the restaurant was very modern an very minimalist but still quite warm. Our server, Kendall was a total doll from the get go. She was very knowledgeable, attentive and had a very pleasant and warm personality. The food was outstanding. My date and I could not stop ordering. We were there for 2 1/2 hours. You could tell that the people who work at Yuzu have a great enthusiasm for the food which is probably what made it all taste so good. It had love. In short, this is the kind of place you don't tell your friends about because it's that much of a gem.
review_title: When I arrived at Yuzu with

review: The ambiance is a little dated but the food is fantastic. I have tried all of the restaurants at Fisherman's Wharf and by far this one has the best clam chowder.  Amazing calamari steak dore too. It was so tender it melted in my mouth.  It would be nice to see the dcor updated a bit maybe add some partitions to give it more of an intimate atmosphere.  It reminds me of a large cafeteria, but the view of the water is lovely and can be seen from any table in the restaurant.  Dcor aside the food is what will keep me coming back.  This was my 3rd visit within a year.
review_title: Best Clam Chowder at Fisherman's Wharf

review: When we went to the restaraunt it was closed. A person near the front saID THERE HAd been a fire upstairs.
The restaurant has seen better days. Decor was worn, the food was overpriced, and quality was just average. Service was good thought and the servers were helpful.

We tried this with groupon crab fair.
It was a good deal.

We've been coming to this restaurant for the last 33 years on our annual San Francisco trip. The whole Dungeness Crab is the best price/experience possible on the Pier. This is a very old-fashioned restaurant like one your grandparents might have gone to, which enhances the experience for me. The clam chowder is also good, but I NEVER have anything other than the crab so can't speak to the rest of the menu.

If you're in Fisherman's Wharf, I wouldn't necessarily recommend Grotto #9. The food was good, but not excellent. I had the Seafood Combo and was disappointed. It was definitely fresh - esp. the calamari & scallops - but it was heavily sauteed in butter (only other option was fried) and thrown on a plate with boiled veggies and fettuccine alfredo. For a $35 entree, I expected a higher quality meal. BUT - my brother's swordfish steak was delicious. Also, our waiter basically ignored us the first 15-20 minutes we were there (and it wasn't that busy).

On the plus side - the location is perfect. Amazing views of the Bay and right on the end of the Wharf. If you have friends in town, this is a good option for a fun & historical dinn
The service was friendly and quick and the food was wonderful. The chicken marsala was out of this world good.

After seeing this diner featured in Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives, I had quite lofty expectations and I was definitely not disappointed! The decor had my eyes wandering the entire restaurant and the food was superb. I watched as my linguine with clams and white cream sauce was prepared and it was like watching magic happen in front of my eyes. I loved being able to watch the food being prepared. The entire experience was amazing. I wish I could go back to SF just to eat there again!

I had been to Rocco's for lunch and loved the food. I suggested it to my co - workers for our annual holiday dinner. We all had a wonderful time. We usually go to the House of Prime Rib for this event. This was a very nice change.

My friends and I were in San Fran for the Diva's Half Marathon and needed a pasta place to carb up. I had seen Rocco's on Diner's, Drive-In's and Dive's and wanted to try it. The neighborhood wasn't great (I was glad to be in a pack walking to my car on 5th street afterward) but the food was A-MAZING! Some of the plates we had at our table were Eggplant Parm, Chicken Marsala, Gnocchi with pesto sauce. It was all great. Rocco even took time out to pose for a picture with us. Highly recommend.
Great Italian spot in SoMa with decently priced food. One note is they won't accept more than 2 credit cards so keep that in mind if you are with a large group.
You are NEVER disappointed with an evening at Rocco's
The owner very friendly and helpful...we will certainly go back

authentic italian cuisine. The closest I have found the my grandmother's marinara. The smell of the place feels like home. friendly chef and seasoned staff. The Marsalla, the meatballs, the grilled polenta. All exceptional and great...

I made the mistake of taking my mom there for brunch on Mother's Day. The food was horrible, the service was ridiculously inattentive, and I've never heard chefs so loud (clanking dishes). I was hoping for a neighborhood gem but was completely disappointed. My mom's chicken scallopini was so salty she couldn't eat it. My omelet was flavorless and dry. It took us fifteen minutes to get our waitress to ask for the check (and that was after asking another waiter to please let her know we wanted the check), and then it took another 15 minutes after asking for the check to get it. A total bummer experience.
wONDERFUL - WE ALWAYS GO TO rOCCO'S WHEN WE COME TO THE CITY.

SO accommodating! I asked for a table to watch the World Cup game and they game us the best seat in the house with a great view of their big screen TV, did not rush us, and breakfast was fantastic! Will definitely return!!
We came for lunch very good had the fillet of sole, with lemon caper and partner had the marsalla chicken that was better.
review_title: We came for lunch very good

review: Tiny place with fantastic food.  They were behind on the reservations but it didnt matter.  We watched all the hubbub in the kitchen and the owner bought us a glass of wine while we waited for our table.  The best Chicken Marsala i've ever eaten and the home berry pies were amazing.  Would definitely go again.  "Diners, Drive-ins and Dives" has made this a place that people go to and stay after they eat, according to the owner.  It's popularity is well-deserved.

58 years of dinning all over this great country of ours and finally we have found a resturant that puts the food ahead of everything else.
Hands down my wife and I agree that including several hundred dollar mills never did we ever have one that rose to the level of Rocc's
We are already scheduling and looking forward to our next visit

Thank you for the oppurtunity to develop another great memory
Food is prepare fresh and I have never seen so many clams in my pasta!!

address: 600 Stockton at California StreetSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: The service was impeccable. The food was was not good; felt like the chef was experimenting. Certainly not worth the price.
review_title: The service was impeccable. The food was...

address: 600 Stockton at California StreetSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: This restaurant is our yummy little secret.  We seem to have no problem getting a table; the restaurant is quiet enough to hold wonderful conversations in, the food is spectacular and the staff is wonderful.  It's like SPQR without the hassle!  What's not to like?

address: 600 Stockton at California StreetSan Francisco, CA  94108
review:
Not quite but my time on earth during the three-hour, eight-course tasting menu certainly was tasty! I enjoyed the two amuse bouche dishes, the fish course, and granita- grapefruit with ginger. It was refreshing and inspired. Cocktail selection was interesting and not overwhelming. We did not indulge in wine. I was quite full by the time the four-hoof course began, but we persevered. Dessert comprised two fun dishes both quite tasty. My friend was presented with a selection of brightly colored macaroons complete with a birthday candle.

Presentation was clean and pretty. Service was thoughtful and friendly. The $10 parking fee is a good incentive.

I had a definite food hangover the next day!
review_title: A slice of heaven at Parallel 37

address: 600 Stockton at California StreetSan Francisco, CA  94108
review:
My boyfriend and I just had a great meal here. We love the small plates format and share everything. The staff was AWESOME. Attentive, engaged, knowledgeable. Small plate portions were perfect for two to share.
Little gem salad with artichokes excellent. Carrot tortellini was the show stealer in my opinion - unique flavors - fabulous. Octopus had a shiso sorbet - novel and super tasty. Next up soft shell prawns - not my thing, but my boyfriend really enjoyed them. The flank steak made us want to sing. Boyfriend had the fig and lemon custard crme brulee and I had the nectarine crumble - both very good.
We love it and WILL be back - it's now "our place".
Will be great for business dinners and foodie friends as well.

address: 600 Stockton at California StreetSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: Kept waiting by hostess at arrival, who first failed to appear, then did and said she'd be with us in a moment, then reappeared after another few minutes and seemed displeased to see us still there. Very slow getting drinks once seated. Main courses arrived before first course was finished, no silverware or plates until we asked for them, by which time the food was cold. I'll never eat here again.

address: 600 Stockton at California StreetSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: What a big disappointment. We went for brunch expecting a fabulous treat as we have had in other Ritz Hotels. The menu consisted if a waffle and a hamburger. Menu service only.

address: 600 Stockton at California StreetSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: It is expensive but worth it for special occasions. Would definitely go again.

address: 600 Stockton at California StreetSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: Had to take our bill to bar to pay. Never saw the waiter again after bill dropped off. On reservations had indicated had theater tickets for 2pm play. Had planned on walking to theater but due to delay in payment process had to take a cab. Mgmt saw is at the bar paying and never approached us. Also delay in getting our wine after a 10 minute search to be told they did not have the wine but would bring another one which was more expensive.
review_title: Had to take our bill to bar

address: 600 Stockton at California StreetSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: Not bad overall, decently priced as well. Sparkling water is free so that was nice. Wish the bread selection was greater and was warm instead and perhaps the food portions a bit bigger.

address: 600 Stockton at California StreetSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: by far the most amazing meal. The food and presentation was like nothing I have experienced before and will not experience until I go back
review_title: by far the most amazing meal.

address: 600 Stockton at California StreetSan Francisco, CA  94108
review: The food was superb and the service flawless. Highly recommend!!!
review_title: The food was superb and the

review: Went on a date, the ambiance was great. Quiet, but alive. I thoroughly enjoyed my dinner.
review_title: Great for a Friday date night.

review: Barely makes for a quick lunch. Nothing to talk about. Dissappointed that I invited someone to eat there.
review_title: Barely makes for a quick lunch.

review: We ordered the yakitori moriawase deluxe, which was decent, but I recommend ordering the yakitori items individually as we only really liked the garlic pork, the rest of the items were okay, but some of them were overcooked/burnt. For the sushi items, the only real nigiri order that stood out was uni. VERY fresh and delicious. Well put together as well. I would come back just for that. It's a great spot for something local after shopping in Union Square or wanting not to steer too far away from BART, but I wouldn't consider it one of the best Japanese spots. The service and the uni, along with the variety of menu options on their menu is deserving of the 4 out of 5 stars for me.
Excellent food with a diverse menu including a number of grilled items (Yakitori and other meats). A little noisy than I would have liked. There are some quieter tables in the back.
This place is tops for Yakitori and for Sushi! The Bay Area really lack great Yakitori Restaurant -- here's one in our backyard!
review_title: This place is tops for Yakitori

review: I wanted to like this place based on the solid reviews and menu. The place is really pretty over rated. Nice friendly staff but it was fairly bohemian vibe and a bit tired feel when you walked in. I was looking forward to the trout deviled eggs but they were very average and nothing special. Wine list was very eclectic and did not have a basic Cabernet  Savignon from California. The food attempted to be thoughtful but on a Friday there wasn't any seafood entree. Really odd and disappointing  overall.
review_title: I wanted to like this place based on the...

review: Consistently excellent! Quite possibly the best fried chicken I've ever had. Everything on the menu is thoughtfully well-balanced and delicious!
Have never had a disappointing, or even "pretty good" meal - always excellent. Staff are always friendly and on top of all our needs.
Blue Plate is a neighborhood gem, that transcended with verve across the city, when it opened and still does today. Delicious!

Blue Plate continues to be a staple of mine since I moved to this city a year ago. I typically don't mention it to many because it's always reliably fantastic quality, fair prices & phenomenal service. What's better is that they're typically open for a last minute reservation too. My last experience, I was surprised that my meal was subpar. However, when the owner found out of my experience he contacted me directly to apologize, diagnose the problem (which happened to be the new chef forgot an important step in the basting process) and rectify the situation above and beyond my satisfaction.

Absolutely loved the food and place. Wish it was a tad quieter but maybe only if they got some sort of sound absorber. Otherwise top notch service and food. Make reservations and it's easy as pie... mmm pie. Outstanding fried chicken and meatloaf! Mashed potatoes were out of this world!
Fresh ingredients paired with excellent wine. The focaccia was very good but a tad too oily

Had a 7:30 reservation for 5. We were seated right away even though the entire party was not yet present. Hostess was very helpful and our waitress was great. The food was excellent and the service was attentive.

The slow cooked pork belly appetizer was one of the most amazing dishes we have ever had. Everything was amazing including the service. We loved all the seasonal fruits & veggies. Leave room for the key lime pie! Service & food is always better when the restaurant is not full (weeknights or early Fri/Sat.).
We will absolutely return!
We went there for a special occasion dinner. The food and service were fantastic. We were a party of 6 and the seating was a little tight, but other than that I would highly recommend this place.
review_title: We went there for a special

review: Main course outstanding. Dessert was poor. Ice cream was old and cake was average.
The bread was great and my friend and I both really enjoyed the meatloaf. The sorbets were divine. It's a very friendly atmosphere with terrific wait staff.
review_title: The bread was great and my

review: The food has generally been pretty good at Blue Plate. This time the peach salad was wonderful, but the meat loaf was just OK.

Went back to Blue Plate because last time was incredible. Fried chicken was amazing -juicy, tender, crispy and well-seasoned without too much breading. The housemade linguini with mushroom and arugula was so tasty I ate the whole bowl. The linguini was cooked al dent, the sauce rich without being too much and the tastes blended. This time, we were disappointed. My entire meal arrived lukewarm. The cod was flavorless and the accompanying greens and puree did nothing. The couscous was a green color, but that green (what was it?) did nothing to flavor the pearl. The crispy skin pieces were tasty, but that was the only memorable part. The fried chicken was tender and juicy but heaped with breading and a smaller portion than last. New chef?
review_title: Went back to Blue Plate because

review: Gorgeous interior.  You can tell it used to be a house the way it is set up and decorated is very cozy and intimate.  Delicious food too.
Every item was delicious and presented beautifully.
I really liked the house-made gnocchi and yellowtail.
Always top notch food. Seasonal, organic ingredients well prepared. Recommended, though parking can be tough.
i am not a big fan of mac and cheese, but the one here totally won me over! the meat loaf was also scrumptious!
review_title: i am not a big fan of mac

review:
Food was excellent. I love the decor also.
My only complaint was the seating was quite uncomfortable. This was in the booth in the front window. Next time I'll take a table with a real chair. The bench seating is not good!
But I love this place great food, great staff. Will definitely be back again and again.

Amazing meal, great service. Really interesting and affordable wine list - we had a red from the Republic of Georgia that was very good and something like $27 FOR THE WHOLE BOTTLE. I paid that for two glasses of something mediocre at RN74.
We enjoyed the food very much--the flavors were complex and satisfying. Our server was borderline rude however.
review_title: We enjoyed the food very much--the

review: We had a wonderful dinner from beginning to end. All the food was delicious- the "little lettuce gems" salad was surpisingly delightful. The ambiance was comfortable yet romantic and provided the perfect ambiance for a special date night.
I am a regular at the Blue Plate and love it! Excellent food, atmosphere and service. When the weather is nice, sitting in the backyard garden is magical!
review_title: I am a regular at the Blue

review: love sitting in the garden - makes it a terrific meal!

Might be quieter at 6:30pm if not for big conference crowd
Had hard time carrying on a conversation.  Found it very unpleasant.
Beef short ribs style wasn't mentioned - should have said boneless/marinated.  I prefer BBQ'd.
Steak was not very good either.

Our Annabelle's lunch experience was wonderful.  We brought a Client for lunch during the week.  The food was excellent.  The bacon wrapped prawns were a table favorite.  The staff was very in tune with what the table needed.  We were glad that we booked an early table, as the place filled quickly at noon.

They hit all the points that ,make a restaurant great. Speciality cocktails, local or hand made dishes and great service. KT was our server and made several good recommendations. T Vine zin was one of them. We ordered several appetizers and an entree. She split the entree without us asking her to. She kept our glasses filled and checked on us without being intrusive. Wonderful evening
review_title: Small place hums like a machine

review: Two of us were early for our table and were not allowed to sit down even though the table was ready and the others were en route. After 2 requests and ten minutes, we were shown to the table. It was very very close on one side to the table behind us. Several of us ordered the rigatoni with the homemade sausage which was delicious. Also enjoyed were the mushroom soup, the salad with beets, the ravioli, and the cioppino. We also waited a long time for a requested glass of wine. The food here is consistently tasty so it will remain on my list of go-to places.
review_title: Good food in a lively spot

review: This restaurant is one of my favorites in SF. Not pretentious, just great imaginative food in soothing yet festive atmosphere. I had the grilled asparagus salad the English short-rib, both of which were outstanding. My girlfriend had the tomato soup and the grilled salmon, which she liked very much. One of the great things about Annabelle's is the imaginative use of ingredients that one might not think of using. The asparagus salad used green olives as one of the ingredients, which added a distinctive, yet harmonious flavor to the dish. The bar is separate from the dining room and is quite energetic. The dining room is much calmer.
Decent place; certainly not spectacular. My cioppino was average, certainly not on the order of Tadich Grill's.
Very good food, friendly staff, overall very nice!
The service is great. My Nicoise salad was very good.
review_title: A bistro feel, with lots of variety

review: Greasy, pedestrian food. One can do so much better in San Francisco.
I didn't think it was correct for them to charge 18% service charge (tip) to a party of 4. The food and ambience was fair, definitely not worth the price.
review_title: I didn't think it was correct

review: A reliable go to spot. Cool retro decor. A good find for us who did not know San Francisco and where to go.
review_title: A reliable go to spot. Cool

review:
GREAT place to go when downtown ... it's just around the corner from WESTFIELD MALL (MOVIE THEATERS!) and they're open late.
nice range of food from starters to full entrees. Good wine and beer etc. Fun bar scene.
review_title: GREAT place to go when downtown

review: We had a window-side table and enjoyed people watching while we ate. We shared a few items and everything was very good.
Excellent quality entrees prepared in unpretentious simplicity. The ingredients really stand out.
We had a great dining experience. Cool place, good service, reasonable prices. Will definitely come back. Nice gem near Moscone.
review_title: We had a great dining experience.

review: Based on other reviews I read, I thought this place would be busy (and require reservations) and that the food would much better. The dining room was basically empty the entire time we were there (6-9:30 p.m.). The bar seemed busier and more lively. The food was very mediocre. The soup was very good, but the salad was basically tasteless. Everyone else at the table felt the food was just mediocre. Not bad, but nothing to rave about. It was a Monday night, so perhaps that's why it was so quiet. Also, it was convenient for meeting with a client who was staying at the Marriott. Next time I would just eat in the bar!
review_title: Based on other reviews I read,

review:
bar is the place to just meet and share a glass of wine or two.. and the fact that you are next door to a great b&b (Mosser)and near Market/Union Sq/Metreon/ATT and great shopping.. (and BART so you don't even need to worry about parking) .. makes it an ideal place for that romantic get away... and surprise her with not only a nice evening on the - if your partner knew of this gem and it's great location..
what a romance you've have on your hands...
review_title: bar is the place to just meet

review: mahi mahi was salty, beet salad was a mess, too acidic, not enough cheese, and not visually appealing

I'm still looking for that place where I can get a simple, classic cocktail, or a modest bottle of wine to share with friends for a fair price. The cocktail prices did not seem out of line here, but I  didn't find any appealing seasonal cocktails. Once the ingredient list exceeds four items, the bar is gilding the lily as far as I 'm concerned.  We found a couple of good bottles of wine, but the wine list seemed generally overpriced. 
I have to say our food was tasty, but the care in the kitchen did not extend to the service. Our small, cold plates arrived after the substantial warm dishes. The waitress warned us that the dishes "do not come out of the kitchen in any particular order." She was certainly right, and I can't blame her or the other servers for this inherently flawed concept of food service.
But while I am grousing about the service, I will also vent about "small plates." I don't understand why servers are trained to describe small plates as "sharable" if the food doesn't come served as finger food on tooth picks or cut into bite size pieces. The servers should just offer to bring extra silverware and plates if a guest inquires about dividing a serving.
So if you like overwrought cocktails and overpriced wine, this might be the place for you.  If you also like flavorful, innovative food and don't mind if it is served haphazardly, you will surely enjoy this place. The eardrum-battering music also adds spice to the atmosphere and makes it easy to avoid conversing with your guests.

Obviously I am not going back. I expect that only hapless tourist will bother going there soon and not many of those.
review_title: Good food. Too bad about the service.

review: Exceptionally serious and successful food with an unusual touch in nearly every dish.  Small servings, especially of first courses.  Expert and friendly service; one of the best wine lists (in all price ranges, tho very pricey at the top end) in SF.

The dinner beat our expectations!  Food was outstanding, services were excellent, and mood/atmosphere was perfect for our special dinner occasion.  The only disappointment we had was the valet parking after dinner.  It's closed already and we had to go downstairs to get our car by ourselves yet still paid the parking fee and tips for the valet person.  We appreciate if the hotel could extend their valet services until the restaurant closes - we understand the valet might be operated separately from the restaurant, but for guests it's still a part of our special night out.
excellent service, wonderful food, nice collection of different tastes and textures, knowledgeable wine staff, memorable evening.  Can see why they have 2 Michelin stars

The service here is light years ahead of many restaurants in San Francisco, the food is so tasteful, flavors on top of flavors. You can tell that chef tusk, sous chef black and the kitchen crew put their heart into the menu that was served. the desserts were amazing, The art in this restaurant is so beautiful. I will be returning to eat here one day, unfortunately I like in Orange county or I would be here every weekend.
review_title: The service here is light years ahead of...

review: We had the summer tasting menu with wine and it was all excellent!  Still thinking about many of the dishes.  Good service.  Very friendly and knowledgeable.  Noise level wasn't bad at all.  Lots of sound absorbing stuff in the dinning room.

I've been to dozens (hundreds?) of restaurants around the country. Nothing I mean nothing topped the 9-course meal I had at Quince. Describing my experience wouldn't to it justice - this is one of those things that you just need to experience for yourself. The wine list was extensive, and the service was impeccable - ask for Daniel Grossman to be your captain, he made the night more special with the service of him and his team. The food? WOW (that's all I can really say)

The bill is not for the faint of heart. But if you want to experience a top notch dining event then Quince is your place!
Absolutely excellent, but very expensive. Set menus, but accommodating of individual needs.

Quince exceeded expectations with its 9 courses with wine pairings, building to a crescendo. What could top the Maine lobster? The sweet Bay Scallops? But wait, time for the sweetbread. Surely that was the best. Not yet, the Squab tops the evening. Wonderful wines from France, Italy and one from California. Beautiful presentation. Great service, . Go early for a custom cocktail at the bar to start the evening.

we ordered the 14 course tasting menu with wine pairing. All of the dishes were inventive and fun; the wine pairings were also extremely well-chosen and wines that I ordinarily wouldn't have known anything about. The service was impeccable and choreographed. Our only criticism, echoed by other reviewers, was that the explanations of each item were mumbled, and we had to frequently request repeats, with even the repetitions being hard to understand. It was VERY expensive, with the total bill, with tip, for three of us, of $975. There better be a very special occasion for a trip to Quince! (we thought it was worth it!)
Quite a wonderful dining experience. The food was on another level. Very pricey but ultimately worth it.
The creativity was incredible. The sampling courses incredible. And the service, can't say enough. And the wine book...you need to think about choices outside Napa...but to the world....

For a great place to eat with an interesting wine list and fabulous service, try Quince. You will spend a bunch and won't eat a lot but you'll leave happy. It's what I would say is an experience restaurant. You have to do it and say you've been there - just know where the local pizza place so you can sate your appetite.
review_title: Great place but you'll leave hungry

review: Exquisite food; knowledgeable, friendly, attentive staff; elegant decor; wonderful presentation on plate and table; high quality drink options. Exactly what one expects from a Michelin starred restaurant.

My wife and I went here for our wedding anniversary. The greeters and waitress all congratulated us on our anniversary, and they brought out a small cake with a candle at the end of our dinner--very nice touch! I expected service to be outstanding, but there were a few glitches: getting the wrong dish delivered to our table and the waitress presenting the check without asking if we wanted coffee or after-dinner drinks. We both ordered the 4-course dinner menu, which is reasonably priced for this high level of cuisine. The food was outstanding, and we had 3 presentations of amuse-bouche!! The brioches are to die for, and the seafood dishes are so full of flavor. We will definitely go back!
review_title: My wife and I went here for

review: A very memorable and delicious dining experience. Clearly Quince has thought deeply about every aspect of cuisine and service. Meets or exceeds every expectation.

Quince had very good food as well as service. It was my husband's birthday, and they printed his name on our menu's, which I thought was very unique and special. I'm not sure if it was where we were sitting, but it was very difficult to hear one another at our small table. We were seated at the edge of the main dining room, so we thought it might have something to do with the rounded ceilings? Otherwise, it was a great experience.

We had the special chef's tasting menu on Friday night and it was hands down one of the best meals we have ever had - anywhere! Each dish was exquisitely prepared and beautifully presented and with each passing one, I couldn't imagine how the next could possibly be as good....but it was, and better! Can't wait for a special occasion or a good excuse to go back.

Overall, can't go wrong with Quince! Food was amazing, did the 11 courses with wine pairings. Would definetly recommend the wine pairings. We are knowledgable when it comes to wine, but feel it would have been hard to find one or two bottles which would have complimented the whole meal.

A few course favorites, condenced pea soup with Foam, salmon tartar with caviar, white asparagus with mushrooms, buttered halibut, chocolate dessert with the liquior was amazing. We couldn't have asked for a better meal, even the butter for the bread was amazing. Kutos to you Quince. We will be back!

The service and ambience were great. Very knowledgable staff and they did a great job of describing every course.

Quince seems to have gone a bit over the top tho the food is still delicious and setting beautiful. I am not focusing on a few of the delish courses we had and there were several. But... A starter of squab leg had the bird foot/ claw on it that was just wierd and a bit gross . An expensive additional glass of cab was very cold .. When pointing this out to the waiter, he said it was stored this way and correct temp. We know better-- and on this occasion the chenin blanc served was not nearly as cool as the can sav. In fact after holding it to warm up it was still too cold after the main was finished and never opened up to be enjoyed.
review_title: Bird claw a bit too much

review: Fabulous food! We had the chef's tasting menu; I saw something on the "regular" menu I wanted to try (the uni brulee) which they graciously swapped for one of the courses. They were very accommodating, all the courses were wonderful - especially the risotto with trumpet mushrooms - with the exception of the beef which was very tough, strangely. Lots of extras. Dinner was at a relatively slow pace, which irked my husband a bit. But it was relaxing to me. Beautiful decor, quiet. Great drinks and wine list. I'll definitely return!
A superb dining experience with exceptionally knowledgeable and attentive staff.

As usual the food was above and behond - I was the only one who had been there before and four and recently been to Gary Danko's and were interested to see how it compared. The four. All five of us gave the award to Quince - food, dinning room, noise factor. I was a bit disappointed this time (5th time). When the cources arrived there was at least one mishap each time. The food ordered was correct but the placement was not. We only had two deserts (others cheese). One desert was not the one ordered - as soon as we brought this to waiters attention, he was back within minute with correct one - must have been
prepared prior. Everyone else thought it was 100%. I was the one picking up tab and I
thought the mishaps (for every course)
review_title: As usual the food was above

review: 3rd time eating at Quince, 2nd at the new location. This time we were celebrating 3 birthdays, and it was a perfect evening.
The food was outstanding and the service and attention to detail was impressive!
My experiance at Quince was outstanding- the food, service and presentation where all characiteristic of a first class restaurant and what you would expect at a fine dining establishment.
The ambience was elegant, the service was superb, the wine list daunting. the food expensive.
The service could not have been better. I had many special requests and they performed them perfectly. David the manager is one of the best in the business.

Had a wonderful dinner for my wife and two sons celebrating her birthday. We decided to do the tasting menue (3 chef 1 seafood) and every single course was outstanding. Not to mention the amuse-bouche a mini tasting on its own. The adults also paired the wines which were excellent complements to the food, and with the waiters comments made for a true food/wine education. The food, and service and ambiance made this a very special evening. I must say the staff provided flawless service. This included serving an 11 year old. I have been to Quince many times now in both the original and current locations and very happy to report that they continue to make this a terrific dining experience. Let them know if it is a special occasion!!!

Quince was amazing!!! It was definitely one of the best places I've ever been to. The service was 5 stars all the way. The pasta, is one of the best in San Francisco. Quince is a romantic place for a date or for a special occasion.
Great ambiance, attentive and knowledgeable staff, excellent food! Wonderful dining experience...

First time since the move - food lovely. Hostess unwelcoming, no smiles. Wouldn't seat us until everyone was there, even though they were just parking. Server stuffy and unhelpful, no one checked back to see if food was okay. Expected better.
Very slow service, taking orders and getting the food from the kitchen to our table. Took almost 3 hours for 3 courses for dinner.

Quince must have changed management and perhaps ownership. Cuisine differs radically from previous Quince. Original Quince presented the best of Italian cuisine- distinct flavors, tasty. The new Quince gives formula expensive restaurant fare: Large plates with very small portions each loaded with butter or cream which drowns the flavor the food. Ridiculously few vegetables.

Feeding strategy: expensive, small portions enriched with excess butter to impart a feeling of fullness, depriving satisfaction.

Dessert: Most stingy, small portion of all. A scoop?: No, one tablespoon of ice cream with 3-4 tiny mandolin slices of peach on crepes. Fiscal miracle strategy: one Frog Hollow peach will feed a hundred people at new Quin
I loved this restaurant! We had a great experience. The staff was knowledgable and very kind. The food was amazing!!! Loved the pastas!!

The food just gets better and better every time we come here, one highlight after the other. This is the kind of moment where you take a bite and say 'wow, this is the best thing i ever had' and then the next course comes and you know you were wrong, because THIS is now the best thing you ever had. And so on.... The service staff is warm and attentive, and not too formal, which I prefer. All the right steps of service, always maintaining professional distance, but sincerely warm and welcoming. I love Quince!

The evening (which was a celebration of our first wedding anniversary) started off a bit bumpy. We were 45 minutes late (thanks to a shortage of cabs in the City) but Quince held our reservation. When we arrived, we were greeted by name and thanked for celebrating our anniversary with them. Our menus were personalized and Mark went out of his way to make us feel welcome. The food was spot on...the scallop starter was fantastic. As was the pasta, the sea bass and the lamb. I cannot say enough about the staff...thanks for helping to make our anniversary memorable.
I loved their original location but they have gone beyond it. The food was out of this world as was the service.
I have eaten at many fine restaurants in my 56 years, but this is the best I've ever eaten at, better than Campton Place, Rubicon, Boulevard, Chez Panisse, Farallon...!
review_title: I have eaten at many fine

review: For me, what made my dinner at Quince really special was the ambiance. A modern and cozy place, with excelent service and amazing food. Even though I went with my husband, Im sure this is a great place to have dinner with your friend. Specially with those who apreciate great food and wine. Ill definitelly recomend this restaurant for my brazilian friends who are going to San Francisco.
review_title: For me, what made my dinner

review: The food was very good and the service was attentive. The only problem I had was I felt that we were given poor seating thought I asked for one of the corner booths and was the first group to enter the restaurant. The servers were very pleasent and I enjoyed each entree, but having someone constantly behind me as I ate made me uncomfortable and it was hard to enjoy myself that evening.
review_title: The food was very good and

review: It is a great place to see a good Blues band and have some supper although some seating is better than others. On the main floor you could end up sitting behind and close to the next table. Lots of deep fried choices like "catfish bites" which were very tasty. My wife is a vegetarian and she didn't have a lot of choices but we went there for the music.
review_title: Great music venue and some tasty seafood treats.

review: Great music the night we were there.  Food was good: Catfish nuggets appetizer, fried chicken, jambalaya. Crowded, but pleasant.  Music volume was just right: loud but not deafening.

Every seat in the house - the best! Sound - awesome. Talent - off the hook. Service - couldn't be better. Suggestion for management, if not already in place - offer bar knapkins with iced drinks. Thanks - to performers for their personal touch to the performance

That about says it. Next time I go I will not be ordering food. This is not the first time I was dissatisfied with the food but I thought I would give it one more chance. Big mistake! I will definitely come back for the music and just have drinks, if that is even possible.

We really enjoyed the night - great blues, and overall a good experience. Jarekus Singleton and his band were
 fabulous - witty and good communicators. They played an exciting mix of southern blues and hip hop, with a hint 
of soul. The band made the place memorable for us - it was my first night in San Francisco, and we really
 lucked out.  I booked from Sydney, Australia, which was easy and convenient. Parking was convenient, too -  right next 
door.  Generally the food was very good, especially the jambalaya and the yam chips, but the salad was boring
(over-endowed with lettuce).
review_title: We really enjoyed the night - great blue...

review:
One of us ordered the "special" which was crabcakes. They were cold inside and glutinous, and obviously recycled from the night before. The fried chicken was very good, however.

The crabcakes were sent back. But they were on the bill.
review_title: Go for the music - eat elsewhere

review: We had a very positive, fun experience at Biscuits and Blues and would recommend this venue to anyone that loves Jazz, Blues and great food. The staff are very friendly and professional.

Biscuits continues to tweak the menu while staying with the Southern theme. New dishes, like the Green Goddess salad, were lighter and better than past alternatives. The dressing pleasingly highlighted tarragon. The music remains the main attraction but the food is amazingly good for a venue of this kind.
First time to Biscuits & Blues - was not disappointed! Visiting from Canada. Good music, good food, good service. Will be back next time in San Francisco !
Great place for good southern cooking and excellent blues. A true gem!

Second time trip, and disappointed this time. The fried chicken was burnt. Took three times before it was barely edible. Lots of grease. I was through with my meal before my friend even got hers. It is a very crowded place. Waitress was nice, just overworked. Wouldn't you think that a place called Biscuit and Blues would give you at least one biscuit with your meal? No, you pay about $5 for a small basket, and I mean like 4 small ones. Hey, biscuits are cheap. Worst of all, they were cold. I asked about it, and the waitress said, that's the way we serve them. Has anyone there ever eaten Southern food in the South? It's also time for revamping the ticketing to get rid of the wad of people at the door. Let us print our own ticket in advance.
great musical talent, and surprizenly good food for NIGHTCLUB. hIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

You go to Biscuits & Blues for the music, which was great. The food is good for a music place. The place was loud before the music started (because of the Giants game) and very loud after the band took the stage. I thought the music was great, although my wife thought the music was way too loud.

Overall a very nice evening. My mom was visiting from Florida and wanted a real SF jazz experience - I think she got it. She and my Aunt really enjoyed the evening. She needed special accessible assistance and was given personalized service from the curb to our seat. Great place for that special evening out on the town.
Music was AWESOME! food was edible.... take my advice... go for the show, two drink minimum... skip the meal....

The show was great and in a nice intimate venue. However service was not up to par. Ordered food an hour before show, appetizer came OK, although difficult for two to eat at tiny cocktail table. An hour later in middle of show when the place is hopping tried to bring dessert but we had never received our entree. The food was quite good with medium portions. Cocktails pretty weak, Refused the dessert as show was ending, but had to send bill back to get it removed. Will likely try again just for the good music but may not order dinner.

We paid 20 dollars each to get into the biscuit and blues bar and did not have any idea about what to expect but we were very pleasantly surprised. Not only did we get to see two outstanding blues artists (Sista Monica and Jessica Johnson) but also were amazed by the great food we got to eat. The waiter was very friendly and helped us with the food choice as well. The athe atmosphere was nice and the audience very agreeable.
We recommended the spot already and might come there again ebfore we leave San Francisco.
It was definitely worth the money.

Was specially surprised by the food. Usually music venues don't have good food. Nothing fancy, but good clean southern food. I was thankful for the acoustics, much better than other small venues I've been to. I suffer from Tunnitus (humming in the ears) and loud music can really aggravate it. Good acoustics make a difference, sound bounces off better.Service was prompt and friendly. My husband and I commented on the fact that they do not push the drinks on you, on the contrary they go around frequently serving lots of water. Went there for the music and really enjoyed the JC Smith band they gave a good and fun show.

Biscuit and Blues was AMAZING!!!! I was so impressed with the food and my Mom is the BEST Southern cook I know, so to have such SPANTABULOUS FOOD and DRINKS really made my night. My husband eats ANYTHING, but when he stops and goes That is off the HOOK, I know you have done a good job!!!
The show we saw was great, mostly because of the talent, but the setup and sound quality helped too. Nice place for dinner and a show.
review_title: The show we saw was great,

review: We were very pleased to find this gem. The food and music were equally awesome. Would have appreciated more attention from our server. She would stop at the tables adjacent to us and not say a word to us. I had to go to the bar myself to get us drinks. However, the bus staff was very attentive. Will definitely keep in mind for the next trip to San Francisco.
review_title: We were very pleased to find

review: The music was great! We had the pleasure of watching Kevin Russell perform and will definitely go back again. Food is good, but pricey. Go for the music :).
review_title: The music was great! We had

review: This place was disappointing. Dinner prices are expensive. The offer a show there and people either go to dinner the show or both. Even if you are having dinner they charge you an addtional 20.00 per person to see they show. I believe that if you are not having dinner that is fair but if you eating this should either be free or at a discounted price. We didn't pay for the show and we were still eating when it started and they sort of was pushing us out when toward the end. Not very nice after spending for food that was not that good. Would not recommend this place at all.

I was very disappointed with the outgrageous price of the wine. Two bottles of Mark West, which usually costs about $13-15 at Bevmo, ended up costing me and my party $150, which was almost as expensive as our dinner. I was very impressed with the food and the show, but very, very disappointed with the wine. I felt taken advantage of, and unfortunately spoiled my good time. I don't think I will be returning soon. And if I do, I'll make sure we DON'T buy any wine by the bottle.
Another thing that needs improvement is service. Our waitress was friendly, but she had way too many tables.
Hope this is helpful.
This was not a dissapointment. The harmonica player was awesome and his band was just as good. I would highly recommend this to locals as well as visitors!!

We always have a fabulous time!!! Keep Rod Piazza and the Mighty Flyers coming
back!! We're regulars.

I had a wonderful birthday party at Biscuits & Blues, and love this place!  Fifteen of my friends met me for drinks, dinner and fantastic live music by John Lee Hooker, Jr., who was the headliner that evening.  The owner, Steven Suen, assisted me graciously as I did the advance planning for this little party, and was friendly and accommodating (for ex., arranging for us to have separate checks, with only a 20% gratuity added for this effort by the server - who was also quite nice about it!)

Additionally, I love the southern food menu and intimate, 'funky' atmosphere, which is very 'user-friendly' while having its own sort of sophistication in this off-the-street, down-in-the-basement cool club and restaurant.  I strongly recommend it!

Obviously this restaurant has great potential and excellent food. They are however, trying to pack too many in without the skills and service to do so. 

Watch out for the tables between the front and main dining room- this is a high traffic area. And if you are combining appetizers and mains be very specific on how and when you want the food delivered. Service is not refined enough to ask these Important questions.

It is rare that I have a disappointing eating experience in San Francisco but this was one of them!
review_title: Felt like we were an afterthought.

review: This is my first review on Open Table. Although I've had plenty of good dining experiences, this place is the first one where I felt I owed it a review. This place is amazing. I literally went 3 times in one week. That's how good the food was. My last experience there included meeting someone that said every time they're in town they go at multiple times as well. Delicious flavors. Excellent food. Great service. Even those who aren't fans of Indian food should go.
Upscale Indian and delicious. Great Sevice and non-alcoholic drinks will return next time in SFO

This restaurant did not disappoint.  The menu was creative.  There were the dishes you expect (tikka masala, butter chicken, palak chaat), and some new additions that were odd and enjoyable.  There was a sprout side dish that was particularly curious.  I'd go back for sure.
Simply the best Indian cuisine. No wonder the place is packed ! It's too bad I have to wait for my next trip to San Fransisco.

The spinach chat has a flavor we've never experienced anywhere else, almost like a dessert.  Have been here at least six times in my trips to SF, definitely one of our regular restaurants we look forward to.

The food was really quite nice. After living in London for 7 years we developed high standards and enjoyed some of the finest indian food anywhere. The only real miss was the samosas that arrived st our table cold. We informed our waiter and he immediately whisked them away and a new plate of samosas arrived within seconds. The only problem was they were cold as well!! We ate them because we really weren't interested in making a scene. If you love room temperature Pre made samosas then you will love these.

The rest of the meal was excellent

Two times in four days tells it all. Rarely an Indian restaurant excels at every dish, and Amber India does. Everything was perfectly seasoned and cooked, in reasonably large but not huge portions and at reasonable prices.
A place to become a regular with great ambiance and look. Far beyond most other Indian restaurants.
review_title: Northern Indian food at its best

review: We all enjoyed this find. The food is Indian but unique enough not to be your typical Indian fare. Spices were delicious. This restaurant is on the pricey side though. You have to order everything separately including the naan and the rice. I've never had that happen at any other Indian restaurant I've been to. Not including rice with the dinner at an Indian restaurant is like making someone pay for ketchup with their fries at a burger joint. Just doesn't seem right.

The food was delightful, especially the ginger lemon fish and yellow curry stew. And the Butter Chicken and naan were lovely. My water glass never got empty and service was very attentive and pleasant.
Detached service and food that has, over time, become less distinguished.

I travel frequently and wherever I go I usually visit at least one Indian restaurant. During this visit everything at Amber India was truly outstanding, extraordinary. In my opinion Amber India at Yerba Buena Lane is one of the two best Indian restaurants in the US. Highly recommended.

The food at Amber is fantastic, by far the best butter chicken, not too creamy, perfectly spiced. The different types of Naan bread were very interesting and were a great compliment to the food. The tandoori sea bass is truly incredible. I would recommend Amber to all my friends.
review_title: The food at Amber is fantastic,

review: Outstanding Indian food. Our server was extremely helpful and even mentioned several dishes they could prepare that weren't on the menu.

AWESOME FOOD, service was a little slow, especially with cocktails, if you want to sell more cocktails, you've got to serve them faster, especially when we were there at 5:30 pm still early for dinner and was waiting 10-15 min for drinks.

Once again, the food was fantastic. This is our favorite Indian restaurant. It's hard to describe precisely, other than sheer perfection. The meat is always tender and full of flavor. The simmered dishes are alive with vibrant, fresh tasting ingredients and spices. I can taste individual components in the dishes, unlike other Indian places we've eaten at where everything starts to look and taste like mud. I highly recommend this restaurant for nearly any occasion.

I adore Amber India. They have amazingly good food.
Two people who have been before took two newbies, so we could see the expressions on their faces when they tasted Bharwan aloo (veggie) and buttered chicken (carnivore).
Bliss.
Well worth every penny. :-)
Good food and very nice surrounding. Helpful staff especially since most of need some help with Indian food. Lots of action in the place. Yerba Buena is happening.
review_title: Good food and very nice surrounding

review: The food was fantastic! But the service was rushed like their fast lunchtime service, would have liked a more leisurely experience between dishes! Will come back again.
Amber India was great for a business lunch with clients.
So great we went twice on a three-night visit to the city. We will make sure every trip to San Francisco includes Amber India!
review_title: So great we went twice on

review: The food presentation and taste was excellent. Service very professional and the restaurant environment well appointed. This is one of the best restaurants we have visited anywhere in the country and we are from Chicago and have visited most major cities.

Amber provides a safe bet to bring people in touch with a variety of Indian foods without having to worry about the level of spices or people with special dietary restrictions. I go there more with friends and family that I know would like to enjoy an Indian meal, without having to worry about it. They were serving appams on Sunday which were great but the sides left a little to be desired

Lunch at Amber is always great, except when everyone else thinks so too! :) The only bad side to getting lunch with a colleague this close to the holidays at Amber, is everyone else is doing the same thing and the buffet line gets REALLY long. Can be worth the wait, if you can afford the time.
review_title: Lunch at Amber is always great,

review:
I don't live in SF but whenever I'm up there I try to get to Amber and have introduced a number of friends to it as well. This is the first time I've been a bit disappointed in the food--I'm not a spice wimp, but I found the lamb biryani (which I always order) to be so hot it was almost inedible. The tandoori chicken also seemed to be extremely spiced. Everything else was great, and the service, as always, was impeccable--but I'm not sure I'm as enthusiastic as I was previously. Maybe I just need to ask for wimpy spicing...
Also, two of us we were seated with our back to the front windows and either the A/C was cranked or the windows were drafty-- we were uncomfortably chilled all evening and didn't linger for coffee or dessert.
review_title: I don't live in SF but whenever

review: I'd give it higher scores if my points counted on Open Table...

A salad of apple and feta was vibrant and very good. Seared shrimp under a sauce with pepper and star anise was also a winner. The butter chicken was a bit dry but again it was the saucing that made the dish.
review_title: A salad of apple and feta

review: We were just trolling for a good place within ealking distance to meet w/friends after watching Avatar on Imax 3D on opening night. The service was amazing -- friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, yet completely unobtrusive (if you've ever been to Asian restaurants of any kind other than Japanese, you'll know my comment is a big deal). All of us in the group were either foodies and food-restricted types--i.e., a picky group. Everyone was very happy with what they ordered, and based on that it was a no-brainer to go for dessert. Try everything.
Great food, great environment, great place for people love Indian food.............

A new part of the Amber chain. The original in Mountain View still is the best with its more extensive menu choices, but the San Francisco restaurant is very good just more limited. And the ambiance is beautiful.
review_title: A new part of the Amber chain.

review: It was a great dinner. Most of the food was outstanding, but the lamb was overcooked and on the dry side. Don't miss the eggplant dish or the dal, the are truly outstanding. The butter chicken was amazing as well.
review_title: It was a great dinner. Most

review:
"Truly a feast for both the mouth as well as the eyes."

I got a little lost getting to this place and so did quite a few people according to the staff on Valentines night. Directions are poor on Google maps so beware. It took me over the bay bridge. My luck it was in the heart of San Francisco. I was going the wrong way. I was an hour late for my reservation. The staff still accommodated me on arrival and we were seated very promptly. This place is a little expensive but well worth it. Service is great. The food was presented in a Picuris way. Very stimulating for the eyes and belly. This place truly offers top-notch modern ambience in a romantic setting. The wonderful music playing transports you away. The Amber Rose Drink allows you t

This is a very nice restaurant in all areas: food, ambiance, service. All the dishes were flavorful and made with good quality ingredients. Meats were cooked perfectly. I was a little disappointed in the Butter Chicken because the buttery flavor was missing; the resulting dish was very good but I expected something else. However, everything else was excellent.
review_title: This is a very nice restaurant

review: Very good food, ambiance except for the service. The waiter seemed overworked and we had to wait at least 20 minutes for our wine after we ordered it. But I would definitely recommend it for the food and atmosphere.
Enjoyed wonderful Italian food. Very nice ambiance. A bit loud on the weekends but still delightful.

This place was so wonderful.  We were on vacation and chose to go here for a romantic birthday dinner.  It could not have been more perfect.  The restaurant placed my promise ring on the dessert plate and my partner found it and was so overwhelmed by the thoughtfulness.

The hospitality at Poesia stands out. We had called earlier in the day to find out about parking. The owner was very helpful over the phone, then even checked in with us upon our arrival to follow up on the results. The food was exceptional, the entire table loved the home-made bread. I think my favorite was the ricotta gnocci, melt in your mouth delicious. For dessert, one person wanted more chocolate gelato in the tortufo but it was still extraordinary.

Special event at Castro. My wife and I w/ another East bay couple.
the service and genuine welcoming from owner to wait staff,
the unique, fresh ingredients of the servings, and a charming
Victorian 2nd level restaurant that put you above the street noise,
esp. a celebrating night in the Castro. Though I was somewhat on
restricted diet, and could only order two appetizers, and had to cancel
one, the owner was so gracious and accommodating in his response.
Would I recommend or return, Absolutely!!!
Please for my comments to the owner.

Poesia was recommended by a friend...she warned us that the parking was difficult in the area. We had a great dining experience. Great ambience, service and yummy food. We were a group of five and we all loved our food choices..everything went well until we went back to where we had parked and our car was gone. (Another car was parked there)Thinking it must have been stolen, since we were parked legally between two driveways....but it HAD been towed for blocking a driveway! We were shocked and it costs us $600 to retrieve our car. BE AWARE some residents want in front of there homes to be their private space so they call if a car might be 1 inch into the swale dip on the sidewalk! Next time we will park in a lot and take a taxi!

This is one of the best Italian restaurants not only in San Francisco, but in the Bay Area as well. It is like you are being welcome to the owner's house and being served authentic and gourmet Italian dishes. All staff are very warm and friendly.
review_title: One of the Best Italian Restaurants

review: Went there for a birthday dinner. Had a vegetarian in the group and they accommodated us perfectly. Food was very good, service was great and the ambience was energetic and cozy. Very good!

Great restaurant! It's in what used to be a house. How creative!!! =)
Food was delicious. Bigger portion sizes would have been nice, but I left happy anyways.
Love that they're on Opentable. Was a key in my decision making process for dinner that night!

Fresh and creative ingredients and presentation. We chose it blindly, remembering other restaurants in the same location. Poesia is the very best incarnation in the space. Start to finish, from a warm welcome from the host through a superb meal with exceptional service, we loved dinner at Poesia. A real find.
If you have three hours to spare and can put up with the server ignoring you, the food's actually pretty good. However, there are plenty of Italian restaurants that are pretty good.

I just love this restaurant. I only wish they would have a basic Napolitano red sauce (basil, tomatoes, chili flakes, garlic)with spaghetti. A nice basic pasta dish would be a great side. Sardines are great! Calimari also. And the ambience is gorgeous. The movies they show far surpass Foreign Cinema's too. It's warm and welcoming. Prices a bit high, but we love it anyway.
Always a wonderful meal at this Castro gem. Owner/maitre d' is so friendly and welcoming. Cool Fellini movies shown on wall. Consistently wonderful Northern Italian food.

I love that this restaurant is a converted victorian house/apartment. The atmosphere is so cozy and warm. The service is excellent, probably the best I've had in a long time. The salted cod dish is amazing, as well as the corkscrew pasta with baby pork ribs. Every dish has superb flavor. I would definitely eat here again. Great place to take a date. Be sure to make reservations, as it's a bit small.

Made reservations, but table was not available for 45 minutes. Sat at the bar and had a few drinks, so not so bad. The noise level is very high in the small dining area. Last time we were there, there was a party, and the group was exceptionally loud. The food is always good there. Never have been disappointed. The owner of the restaurant is always friendly and acknowledges us. This is is one of our favorite restaurants in San Francisco.
review_title: Great Food and Ambience albeit lou.

review: This was our second time at Poesia, and it was even better than the 1st time. Service was excellent; we were even offered a parking space in the garage if we couldn't find street partking. The food: antipasto and carpaccio delicious, branzino melt in your mouth lovely, and the lamb was 'the best I've ever had' (this from my husband). We will definitely go back, and highly recommend Poesia to our friends.
review_title: This was our second time at

review: As with my last meal at Poesia, the food is simply divine. Italian is near to last on my list of cuisine I'm ever craving, but Poesia - and its perfectly al dente homemade pasta - defines Italian like I never thought possible. The Fileji di Renato is exquisite - fall-off-the bone tender, with sauce that doesn't overpower or saturate - perfectly balanced. The grilled calamari is also delightful [grilled is the only way to go, as far as I'm concerned]. The space is quaint, adorned in warm fall-like colors. The staff are friendly. I was a little disappointed that our server didn't take more initiative in offering recommendations when we all clearly seemed to not know which to choose [for both food and wine]. Revisit(s) are definite.
review_title: As with my last meal at Poesia,

review:
I LOVE POESIA. You will too.
If ever you can have the risotto with sepia and scallops don't pass it up!
review_title:
I LOVE POESIA. You will too.
If

review:
Authentic honest loving food presented in an authentic honest loving environment. Absolutely great service. It's as good as it gets short of a flight 6250 mile flight.
Their pasta dishes are the stuff of literature, of memories.
The service is outstanding and the food is incredible. Nothing beats home made Italian food.

I almost hesitate to write this review as I don't want this wonderful restaurant to get too hard to get in to! Went for this first time and brought an out of town friend who proclaimed " this is about the best meal I have had in SF!" The food and service were both excellent. The restaurant is charming. We had trouble deciding which of our three different entrees were the best but the pork loin really stood out, the fillet mignon great (along with the gnocchi apps). Don't miss the chocolate chili pepper mousse.

The food was delightful. The owner himself told us the specials and fileted our fish. He explained that he goes to market everyday to find the freshest ingredients and then prepares the menu. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who delights in clean, authentic Italian cuisine.
P.S. Have the Barolo. Wonderful compliment to the food.
Excellent in every way. We LOVE Poesia! And, we return as often as possible. A true neighborhood gem!

Poesia was a really nice surprise. It is clear that the kitchen cares about what it delivers. All the food was good but especially try the carpaccio and the tomato bread soup. Our server started out a bit surly but we loved him by the end of the meal -- a real character and the other staff seemed helpful and efficient. That space has gone through several changes. I hope this one lasts. Nice to have a good restaurant in the Castro.
review_title: Poesia was a really nice surprise.

review: Simply phenomenal. Most inspired food and most friendly, personal service in the Castro. Great wine list - and they make excellent recommendations without pushing you up the price list (especially helpful for exploring the many European wine options). Short menu, but they usually add a few specials - and everything always sounds so good I have never had trouble finding more things to order than I could possibly eat in one sitting. I love going here with my partner and look for opportunities to take my out-of-town guests here as well...they never fail to impress!

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: We stayed at the Fairmont and decided to have dinner here based on the selection of the menu. We ordered calamari, lentil soup, and kung pao chicken. The calamari was not horrible (though a bit greasy). The soup was decent, but not great. Had the main course been good I would not have bothered writing this review. But the main course, which is supposed to be a spicy, flavorful dish, was terrible. It had no spiciness whatsoever. Even the red peppers served with it were not spicy. I'm not sure how they managed to so thoroughly remove all taste from this dish. It tasted a bit like somewhat sweet dish soap. Blech. The service was fine, though they never bothered to ask how our food was after serving. We would never go there again. It really seemed more like a place for people to go and drink than a place where people care what the food tastes like.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: We absolutely loved this spot!  Great food, atmosphere,  setting, and service!!

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: After seeing the Tong Room featured on an Anthony Bordane show, my husband and I flew to San Fran just to celebrate our anniversary here. We were not dissappointed. Great food in a fun atmosphere!

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: Our waiter was really slow to get back to our table but overall we were with a group of people and we all had fun.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: We were disappointed with the food. Reading the menu makes the food very interesting but when it got served it was just basically chinese food that taste all the same. Nothing exciting. It looks like nothing was freshly cooked. From aapetizer to dessert we were not happy.
review_title: We were disappointed with the food. Read...

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: I would highly recommend for a special occasion. The entertainment was Fantastic. A great place to take people from out of town.
review_title: I would highly recommend for a special o...

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review:
Beautiful space, filled with slow inattentive waiters, TERRIBLY overpriced, over seasoned, tiny portions.

A horrible experience and the worst food I have had in a very long time.

I will never go back.

Ever.
review_title: It's time to let it go...

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: For my 33rd birthday my girlfriend and I decided on a trip to San Francisco. Neither of us had spent much time there so we asked friends for recomendations. Upon hearing what the Tonga room was all about, we booked our reservations. This room was beautiful. The boat in the the pool was a great touch, the lightning, the rain, the service al great. I even got a candle in my ice cream. The cocktails were authentic and delicious. I would definitely come back.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
