review: Great place to celebrate a special occasion. Lots of fun and ambiance. Wait staff were wonderful.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review:
The tacky Tiki tonga Room!

This was a fun place to take an out of town friend for something totally different than a regular dining experience. Transports you to a tropical experience complete with rain, thunder and lightning. The food is average. Kid and birthday friendly as well. I hear they have a great happy hour. We went for dinner and just enjoyed the company and the fun ambience!
review_title: gotta check it out at least once

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: We attended the 4th of July Beach Party event at Tonga Room. It was not advertised as a buffet - we'd thought all meals were offered as courses and were impressed with the range. However it did turn out to be a buffet - there were very few options in the context of buffet dining and we felt misled about the kind of experience to expect from the event (we would not have paid $65 plus taxes each for a buffet with only about 10 different items in total). The food was poorly done overall (overcooked and a strange blend of Asian fusion). The DJ station was far too loud for the time of evening (7pm).

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: It is exactly what we expected . Very average overpriced food and drink but WOW what a scene inside! Great fun, dancing and kitschy environment . Had to go once just to say we were there.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: I saw this place on an Anthony Bourdain show. Its a rediculious place! We just had a couple appetizers (a good recommendation Nya local who warned us the food is about the level of Applebee's). The tiki drinks are so sugary your teeth will hurt! I laughed hysterically when the band came floating out on a boat in the pool! This place is certainly an experience!
review_title: I saw this place on an Anthony

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: It is the ultimate tiki experience! This place is classic, the service was great and it is just a really fun place to go.
review_title: It is the ultimate tiki experience!

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: Had a great time. Food was good, staff was extremely friendly. Free dessert was provided as a surprise in recognition of our anniversary special occasion.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: With its indoor rainstorms and boats with bands floating in the the dining hall, the Tonga Room is a memorable experience. Its "cheesy" tourist feel is intrinsically part of its charm. Definitely fun and definitely worth a visit. Lots of tropical drinks with paper umbrellas add to the experience. The food, however, is nothing special. Edible, but generally at the selection and quality of Chinese delivery. The waitstaff was concerned and attentive, overall a fun spot to hit on a special occassion or while on vacation.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: Loved it! Saw the Anthony Bourdain show and decided to make a reservation. This is one of our new favorite spots when visiting San Francisco. Excellent service, food and experience!!!

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: Fun place for out-of-towners like us! Took our grandchildren and they had a ball.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: The atmosphere and food was very good and lived up to the reviews. The service was indifferent. Staff gave the impression that they were doing you a favore to wait on you. All in all a place to go once for the food and cool environs.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: Great food!  Okay drinks, but definitely a place to visit once.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: The Tonga Room was a retro gem. Old school polynesian restaurant and bar. We had a great time. It's pricy, but it's the Fairmont, nuff said. The music was 60's and 70's and the band was good at what they did. We had a good meal and laughed a lot. It was fun.
review_title: The Tonga Room was a retro

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: What fun! arrived after 7 for dinner and stayed for the live music. One serving of butterfish was a little tough- the other was perfect. Our out-of-town company was enchanted by the rain and the lagoon. IT doesn't hurt that upstairs is the fabulous Fairmont lobby. Rum drinks were tasty, and I am not a rum drinker.
review_title: Enough to Make Us Drink Rum

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: I expected more from the ambiance because it looked so spectacular on t.v. or advertisement. The rainfall was nice our seating was good. Service was good. The bar area was dull. Good price for happy hour!
review_title: I expected more from the ambiance

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: The food was great. The service was okay. They kind of forgot about us at the end of the meal. If they would have come back to offer us another drink or the check it would have been better. The food was great! The atmosphere was really good. It was a little louder than I thought it would be, but that's because there was a live band playing. I thought it was great! So, overall I was pleased with the Tonga Room, and I would recommend it and i will be back.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: Fun place to experience. The food was okay, not great. It was expensive for the quality of food. You are paying for the experience.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: Dining at The Tonga Room is more about the fun than the food. Be sure to schedule dinner when the band is playing, or the experience will not be complete.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: Our evening at the Tonga Room was lots of fun. We enjoyed the live band very much, it was an unexpected surprise for us! The main courses (I had one of the specials of the day, the chicken, my husband had steak) we had were great, but the dessert was pretty awful. We had the Flaming Volcano...it tasted like it was from the frozen food section at the grocery store.
review_title: Our evening at the Tonga Room

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: Great Music!! Band plays super! Nice ambience and good food. Very special with rain and a lake in the restaurant.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: The flat steak was a little skimpy but very tender. The rib eye steak that son had was also very small. Pricey for what you get.
review_title: The flat steak was a little

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: One of my favorite places since high school (1949-1953)! Whenever I go to the Tonga Room, I remember the "good ole days." It's such a wonderful spot!

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: I had not been to the Tonga for almost 30 years and found that their food has improved a great deal. The scallops were fresh and tasty and done perfectly. The kalua pork though is not authentic. Those Hawaiian fast food places are better. I don't understand why they hire these rude chinatownish waiters though.
review_title: I had not been to the Tonga

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: It is the history of Tonga Room that holds this restaurant together. Live music on the night of our visit which made this O.G. Tiki bar sparkle. Honestly, food was not good at all and the price tag is insane for the quality of food. I would prefer happy hour vs. dinner.
review_title: It is the history of Tonga

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: Very little food for the money. Didn't like the entertainment from the boat.
review_title: Very little food for the money.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: This was a 13th birthday celebration for our daughter. None of her friends had been here before, and they all loved it. We'll be back!

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: This is our third visit to Tonga room. The food has improved since the last time ( aug 09). The songs/dance music was great, especially it is kids friendly.our friends had a great time and we will be back.
review_title: This is our third visit to

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review:
The food was good and the atmosphere was very fun! I took my two boys who are 6 and 9 and they had a great time.

If you are driving, be sure to leave a lot of time to find parking, especially on a Friday. We were almost an hour late for our dinner reservation, but the folks at The Tonga Room still managed to get us in on a busy night with a short wait.
review_title: The food was good and the

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: Really enjoyed the ambiance... great night out... laughed a lot.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review:
Returning after several years, we were pleasantly surprised by the quality and quantity of the food (dinner). Thunder and lightning and the new remodeled and improved interior
still gets you in the mood and reminds you of the charm of the islands, EXCEPT for the
type of music, the singer and his back-up: completely out of place -- not one Hawaiian song!!!!

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review:
I expect much more flavorful food with fresh ingredients when I dine in san francisco. Since the tonga room is a theme place I lowered my expectations and yet they still disappointed us. As a Polynesian bar they should at least have fresh juices, they had bad canned juices sweetened with corn syrup making their tropical drinks terrible!

If you want to check out the space be sure to make dinner resevations elsewhere.

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review: Always FUN! We took our children 10 to 14 and they all loved it. A must do if on Nob Hill. Music at 8pm, we miss the previous band that played there for years but, still all in all we had a good time.
review_title: Always FUN! We took our children

rest_name: Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar - Fairmont San Francisco
review:
We had awful service from Kenneth, our server. We were early for our reservation and it was 10 minutes before he got our drink order. The restaurant was virtually empty so this seemed like an unnecessarily long time.  We placed our order and not only was the service very slow but he disregarded our table.   
We had to remind him to remove the plates as we finished each course. He refilled my iced tea several times but never provided my husband with a coke refill.  We told him we had limited time for dessert, dessert arrived, we gave him our credit card which he  carried with him while he took other orders. We had to get someone to get him to bring our check and even then he disregarded our time constraint. 

Terrible dining experience.

My wife and I were in Boston and wanted a good Italian meal. We did a lot of research and decided on Nico. We were extremely happy. It is nice and small with tables on the main floor and also downstairs, which is where we ate . We both had one of the specials and the food really was amazing!  The portions were big and so well prepared.  All of their pasta was homemade.  Our waiter was very good and even though they did not have a kid's menu for our 4 year old, he said to tell him what we wanted for our son and they would make it.  Our waiter also knew the wine list very well and helped us make a good selection that we really enjoye .  I would highly recommend Nico's over any Italian restaurant on Hanover Street.  When we left we saw a huge line for Giacomo's and heard it was good, but not great . We loved how Nico's was a less "touristy" than some of the other places. It was an excellent dining experience and we can't wait to go back again.
review_title: a great restaurant with excellent food

review: The food and service was outstanding. Our waiter (didn't catch his name) was very helpful recommending dishes and went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied with our meals. I had the chicken parmigiana which was delicious! Would definitely recommend this place!
The service and the food were wonderful.  Would definitely return and recommend!
The food was so good! We felt like we were back in Tuscany. The porcini raviolis were so unbelievable.

I was in Boston for the evening, walked up to this cute restaurant and had an amazing dinner.  Our server, Bruno, was polite and he had extensive knowledge of both the menu and wine list.  He was especially sweet to my 10 year old daughter.  I ordered chicken parmesan and it was one of the best I've ever had.  Hand made pasta, delicate sauce, generous portion.  If I'm ever back in Boston, I'll be at Nico!  Enjoy!!!
My husband and I are new to the Boston area and have dined at several Italian restaurants in North End over the past few months but Nico's is our favorite.  Excellent service and food!

Nico accommodated 7 of us and all the food is free of MSG! The food was fantastic the people working there are just as fantastic. Everyone was friendly, funny and knowledgeable.
We will definitely be back!
Great service with an Italian flair. Delicious food. Nice atmosphere and quiet enough to be able to hear each other, but not so quiet that it didn't feel busy and fun.
Was very disappointed in the chicken masala The chicken was dry and tough. I could not eat it

After reading a few reviews, was a little nervous regarding the experience. Those fears were alleviated upon arrival. We were promptly greeted for our 7:00 pm reservation and immediately seated in what I consider one of the better tables away from the others overlooking the street. Was promptly greeted by the wait staff who were extremely personable and friendly. Our waiter was fantastic with a good sense of humor and great food recommendations. Appetizer of mozzarella and ricotta with arugula and tomatoes was splendid. Both veal dishes were done superbly. Wine list was adequate. Prices were reasonably fair for all items. Would definitely make this a return visit.
Went based on ratings and recommendations and was not dissappointed at all. I would definitely go back. Portion size is huge!
We showed up on time for our reservation only to find that our table was given away. We left and went somewhere else.
review_title: We showed up on time for our

review: Came to Nico for dinner last night. The Crespelle All'aragosta was great with chunks of lobster meat inside a light crepe with a creamy red sauce. The fresh mozzarella was to die for. The services was exceptional. I just wish I live closer to come here over and over again.
Espresso only. No other coffee drinks. Only three desert choices.

Went to Nico while visiting Boston. Had a great experience. The food was good. Definitely try the risotto balls. Service was great. Only issue i had was sitting us in the basement which lost a little of the ambiance other than that it was an authentic italian meal.

My wife and I both fully enjoyed our meals, as evident by the spotless plate left behind by me. Prices were very reasonable for quality and quantity of food presented. Service was on point, there when you needed and not hovering when you didn't. Definitely will revisit often
review_title: My wife and I both fully enjoyed

review: We arrived early and were offered the choice of going to the table or sitting at the bar. The entire staff was very attentive throughout the evening. The food was amazing. Ihad the shrimp and scallops with porcini and rigatoni. It was delicious and too much to finish. My wife had clams in a red sauce (fra Diavolo) which was great as well. Wine complimented the food very well. i was pleasantly surprised that the bill was lower than expected, and the two complimentary Lemoncellos sealed the evening very nicely. This is our 2nd time at Nico, and it was as consistently great as the first time.

There are a lot of italian restaurants in the north end. Nothing really stands out as special about Nico. The meatball is very good but the other dishes we tried we just average. We noted long line ups of what appeared to Bostonians at several other venues all afternoon and evening making me think that they know something that isn't being shared with the tourists on rating sites such as this o
review_title: There are a lot of italian

review:
Really good food, nice clean restaurant with excellent, efficient and friendly waitstaff.
We will most definitely return and suggest this restaurant to friends.

Food was great. Huge portions! We ordered the calamari appetizer and it was the size of 3 or 4 appetizers at another restaurant. World famous ravioli delivered. Ordered 2 of the many specials they offered and even though we wanted to eat more, just couldn't. Better than the food was the service. Very friendly beginning to end with no ridiculous wait or wondering where the waiter went. Place is a little further down than the other restaurants on Hanover. The crowd on the street was thinner there, but the restaurant was full with mix of tourists and locals with visitors in town.
review_title: Lots of food with fantastic service

review: AMAZING! Dopo 9 mesi lontani dall'Italia, ci e' sembrato di tornare a casa!

As a North End-er, Nico is my FAVORITE! I definitely recommend going for a pasta dish though it seems to be their specialty! Absolutely delicious!!! The wine is fantastic and the services in not only friendly but fun!!!
review_title: As a North End-er, Nico is

review: One of the best meals I've had for a long time. Excellent service and ambiance. There was a little bit of a wait but other than that, no complaints whatsoever. I will be back!
review_title: One of the best meals I've

review: Food was superb. Appetizers, pastas, main courses and desserts were all excellent. The meatball appetizer was truly outstanding. All homemde pastas were just as good! Service was also excellent. My only complaint is that you know you are underground in the downstairs part of the restaurant. It clearly lacks the ambiance of the main floor, although it is quieter if that is important to you. Insist on the main floor if you can.

When visiting Boston we ate at Nico, Cragie on Main and Sorellino. All were good but Nico was the best. And from a cost/value standpoint, Nico wins by a large amount. For example, a bottle of Cakebread chard was $65 at Nico and $110 at Sorellino.
Cragie took food preparation and presentation to another level. Wicked good.
Sorellino was as concerned about the color of the napkin clashing the outfits we were wearing as anything else. I guess that shows attention to detail. Perhaps they are trading on their location and it must be a place to be "seen." Whatever. But, don't misinterpret. Good food, good service. Just pricey.
Eaten here about a half-dozen times and service and food always excellent. Highly recommend!

Great spot in the crowded North end. We ate here on a Sat evening and it was bustling. Despite our reservation, we had to wait about 20 min to be seated. Given how crowded it was, I was expecting a long evening. However, the service was good. The wine list, although not extensive, did have a wide price range of mostly Italian wines and a few ones from California. The mark-up, though, was pretty steep - I figure around 100%. The food was very good which made the wait and frustration of driving into the North end worth it. Try the crispy calamari and excellent home made mozzarella tomato salad for starters. We had meat dishes, which were fair portioned and cooked well. I'll definitely be back.

The food was excellent!! Our appetizers and drinks came fast but dinner took a lot longer due to a large party downstairs. Overall my family and I enjoyed our experience and would absolutly recomend Nico. Just ask to be seated upstairs durring the spring/summer.

Nico's was a great recommendation from a co-worker. It can be hard to find the right place in the North End. The wait-staff was extremely polite and made great suggestions about the menu. The Sangria is made with Citron... and is soooo delicious! I loved the romantic atmosphere but was extra psyched about the big screen TVs! I could watch the basketball game and still have a nice dinner with my date.

We went to Nico with a group of 8. They were very attentive and the food was wonderful. Most of the group was running the Boston Marathon the following day and we were all rather particular about what we did and did not want to eat. The chef was very accomodating and basically cooked a dish to order for each of us. Everyone agreed that the food was excellent - fesh ingredients, home-made pastas, very flavorful. The service was also wonderful. The atmosphere is fun - 70's disco but it is very loud. We had a long table and I had a difficult time hearing friends at the other end. However, it was still very enjoyable. We would absolutely return again when in the area.
review_title: We went to Nico with a group

review: Creative cuisine set in the back drop of a beautiful restaurant in a chic neighborhood. This place educated me on southern Indian cuisine.  Previously the Indian cuisine I had been familiar with was quite different from Dosa's offerings.  The seasonings are the same that you would expect but the ways they put them together was quite different.  However it came together quite well and I had quite the cultural experience.

The food is great only complaint was the waitress we forgot we even had a waitress after we ordered since other staff had brought over all the different plates who all were great and each dish is great. Definelty not 5 star service but food makes up for it

We wanted a great dinner before seeing a show at Yoshi's - Dosa on Fillmore was perfect...! We sat in the bar section with views of the street scene and the restaurant scene too. Their themed drinks were delicious, the food came promptly and was wonderfully presented and with the help of our waiter everyone at our table had a grand time. We made our show on time feeling well cared for....
Loved the summer veggie dosa and the apricot dessert!
I've been to this restaurant three times and it gets better and better.  Great decor, amazing cocktails and great flavor as well.

I recently dined at DOSA with a group of four other people.  We had a very nice meal with decent service.  I felt like our server was friendly, but not very knowledgable about the food.  i was disappointed when the bill came and our server had added a 20% tip to our bill.  I am very accustomed to having a tip of 15 - 18% added in for a larger party.  But 20% seemed excessive.  I found out the next day that this is DOSA's policy.  I usually tip at least 20% for good service.  But I would have liked it to have been my choice.  This put me off and I would rethink taking a larger party to DOSA again.
Great, fun and high-energy place with delicious twists on classic indian food.

Loved the food, and the service was great, but the music choice and volume was bad. Didn't expect to eat fabulous South Indian food to the beat of heavy techno. We couldn't hear each other across our table, and when we asked if the music could be turned down, it was, but only slightly. A different type of music (something a little calmer perhaps) and a lower volume would work wonders.

Seated close to reservation time. Food spicy though very good.
Fun place to be on Divali.
If you love spicy Indian food, this is the place for you. The ambiance is lovely and the lunch service was excellent!
Really great place to go after a workday if you are up for a vibrant scene and exotic food.

I would not classify most Indian restaurants as "fancy" but DOSA on Fillmore is. We went during Dine About Town and they let one of us order off the pre-fixed menu and add an additional entree from the regular menu. The waitstaff warned that the duck vindaloo is their spiciest dish, but I thought the chicken and eggplant dish we ordered was spicier. The spice levels are perfect - makes you sweat a little, but doesn't make it unbearable to eat, and you can still taste the flavors. Only complaint is they forgot to give us our bread we ordered, however we were not charged for it when the bill showed up. Good food, nice waitstaff, good atmosphere. Also, I recommend you make a reservation for this place!!

Great time! I didn't quite take advantage, but the liquor selection at the bar is impressive. The Plymouth mixed drink I had from the menu was delicious as well.

Highly recommend the veggie sliders, but just ask your server, ours had great recommendations.
Much of the food - especially small plates -- is obviously pre-prepared at this point, given the size and business of this place. Mildly tasty still.
Great place with great food. Spiciness of food is a little inconsistent but it's okay with us since we like spicy. We like to eat here with a few friends so we can try as many dishes as possible.

When we are in the mood for spicy food we go to the Fillmore Dosa location because its convenient. Eating at the bar is the best way to go from our experience and as an added bonus you wont have to deal with the reservations staff who at best are too busy with themselves. During our last visit we ordered a Broccoli Rabe and a Paneer & Spinach dosa. They have changed, are now laden and served rolled up, as opposed to just folded over. The place was pretty empty but it was still early. Not sure if its just that evening or is it slowly showing signs of a restaurant that has fallen victim to its own success. I would not recommend it any more based on the last visit but will certainly give it another try sometime in the future.

I've been going to Dosa now for several years. The menu is dynamic, with consistently excellent, authentic southern Indian fare. The dishes are inventive and expertly seasoned. While personally I'm not a huge fan of dosas themselves, I strongly recommend sampling an array of small plates - you can't go wrong. Also the Uttapams are good. The seating downstairs can leave one feeling a little packed in with ones neighbors, so when possible I recommend the upstairs seating - which is also better for conversation.

Never disappointed at Dosa -- food, cocktails and service are all remarkable -- price point is reasonable, service is always friendly and accomodating. This last visit we had youngish kids in tow, and server was very helpful in finding and suggesting things for a less sophisticated palate.

Second visit, still enjoyable and leagues ahead of all of the dinosaurs of Indian cuisine who remain stuck in the old-style ::: The food featured here seems to be more Southern Indian style, therefore spicier and packed with more heat - but not necessarily on everything ::: In general we enjoyed Dosa but agreed it's a 2-3 times a year place, max - not the kind of food you fall in love with and crave ::: Service was borderline acceptable on our last visit, better on our first ::: The bar is still stupendously slow - or is it the servers? - in getting house speciality cocktails delivered: 20+ minutes?? ::: And ignore the host station rudeness, they're not graduates of charm school...
Have read all good things about DOSA for years. FINALLY made it in. Each dish was better than the last! From app's to salads to entrees: sublime!
We had wonderful meal, Service was excellent and food was very good.
Very tasty food and a very relaxed ambiance. The staff is absolutely wonderful.
review_title: Very tasty food and a very

review: Food was good but waitress was awful. She was unhelpful with the menu which had so many choices. She acted like she just wanted to make up our minds so she could on with other things. She is the waitress with the tattoo on her upper chest.
DOSA on Fillmore is special and always an ah-ha moment walking in. Elegant space, artistic, warm, colorful and elegant. If you think you don't like Indian food, stay open, DOSA will change your mind.
Excellent food and well prepared. Food was spicier than expected. Even my Indian guest was surprised how spicy it was.

Second visit to Dosa on Fillmore.It's really close to work and therefore a perfect walk for dinner and drinks. However this past visit was probably my last.service is very inconsistent. At the beginning of our meal, servers and bussers were around the table constantly asking us to order before we were ready. However, once we ordered and the food was on the table we couldn't find someone for the majority of our meal to get us more drinks.We had to raise our hands to ask for desert menu and again to the for check. Once our entrees arrived they basically forgot about us. This is unforunate as we were having a welcome dinner for an out of town friend and ready to keep the drinks going. gluten free menu a plus.
review_title: Second visit to Dosa on Fillmore.It

review:
Having moved from the UK a year ago I still get cravings for curry and having heard of Dosa I had to try it. The food in Dosa would not get any score in London. Unimaginative and very basic menu and presentation. The food is served so quickly that it has clearly been pre-prepared, and it shows.
But lots of buzz and clearly a popular meeting place.
review_title: Still looking for a good SF curry

review: absolutely fabulous--will be at dosa everytime i come to town!

Perfect for groups. The tasting menu for $44/person is reasonable, but probably more food than necessary. I took clients to Dosa for a more casual, neighborhood experience and they loved it. Cocktails were also a hit.

Some of the servers at Dosa were unable to elaborate on the dishes they were serving which was disappointing. They also got our drink order wrong on two occasions. The food is great which helps me to overlook the issues we had.
review_title: Some of the servers at Dosa

review: We sat upstairs and it was much quieter than downstairs.
review_title: We sat upstairs and it was

review: Servicer was outstanding: knowledgable and efficient. But food was so salty, we were up all night needing water!
Very courteous staff; even though 4 out of 5 guests for our table were a bit late on a very busy Friday night, did not "threaten" the give the table away to the mass of people waiting for one.

This restaurant is beautiful and the food excellent. We had a very knowledgeable server whose recommendations were great. That said, we had to ask for that interaction. Even though the place wasn't jam packed, the feeling was somewhat rushed. Plates weren't placed on our table, but almost thrown down. We had to ask for an explanation of what everything was...there was a lack of enthusiasm by the staff that was disappointing. I'd go back but would hope that it felt more like people were happy to work there and happy to have guests dining there.
Honestly I had a wonderful experience when I went there several months ago and had a wonderful experience. This past time the food was really disappointing.

Great food. But Please change your noise description so it's less coy and more accurate.
"Energetic"-- please. Is that code for noisy? Whatever, it was noisy. Very noisy, and the background music made it worse. If you can't make out the music in the overall din, why have it at all?
Good service, good ambience, I came for the food, can't say it was above 2 stars.

Tho I'm sure this is a very good Indian restaurant the food is much too spicy for me. We asked for the least spicy they could do, it was
still hot for me. Obviously I will not be returning, not the restaurants fault, but mine for being too adventurist.
review_title: Tho I'm sure this is a very

review: Dining at Dosa is always a pleasant experience. Unlike other restaurants where everything on the menu sounds good and is often disappointing, this restaurant has an exotic menus of South Indian specialties that sound somewhat foreign or intimidating, yet all are delicious and memorable. Their strong suit is the extensive vegetarian offerings, but the fish, shrimp, and chicken dishes are also excellent. The four course dinner menu is a relative bargain, and the staff is exceptionally helpful with suggestions and guide you through the fascinating menu. Lunch is very pleasant, with some offerings not noted on the dinner menu. The tangerine sorbet makes a refreshing dessert.
review_title: Dining at Dosa is always a

review: We like both the Mission Dosa and the Fillmore Dosa. The Fillmore Dosa is conveniently located across from the Kabuki theatre. It's much larger than the Mission Dosa, which I prefer slightly more than the one on Fillmore, though the food is good in both places. The appetizers aren't to be missed. The dosas with eggs are terrific.
review_title: We like both the Mission Dosa

review: This was my first time at the Fillmore location. I was in a group of 7 and they accommodated us nicely. It was my girlfriends birthday and they brought us a candle in her dessert at the end. I have to say I really like the ambiance of this place. The only downside I can really say is parking, which is a common problem in San Francisco. Another thing I'd say (if I was really knit-picking) is that as a place known for having unique and delicious cocktails (which they certainly do) I would try offering a few toned-down cocktails, that pair well with the already exotic and spicy food. While the cocktails are inventive and fun, there is so much going on; all the flavors seemed to get lost with each other while eating the amazing food.
review_title: This was my first time at

review: pretentious. playing dixie chicks music. very expensive. maybe just not a good lunch place. we didn't have an appointed waiter.

The only really good thing was our wonderful waitress. We sat upstairs.. maybe you can find out who it was... she was just excellent! Wasn't so happy with the food this time. Everything has the same level of spice heat... boring after awhile... and returned the dessert! Don't know if I will go again...

Very good and interesting cuisine. Our waitress was very good at explaining the menu and making recommendations for the group (6 people). It was a little pricey for the fare but the ambiance and location to the theatres was great.

DOSA is the BEST restaurant in San Francisco! The food and service are outstanding. Weve dined at both DOSA locations and for each of our six visits the experience has always been absolutely wonderful.

Nice for high-end Indian food with a different menu selection than most Indian restaurants. Lovely presentation, great flavors, very fresh. Our server was a bit too pushy at the beginning of our meal and then overcompensated by disappearing later. Dosa seems like a great place to linger over quality food, at the same time they seemed a bit caught up in turning the tables. It was also the first time that we have arrived for our OpenTable reservation and the restaurant was not ready. Still, we had a great meal and will definitely go back.

The place was abuzz with happy guests.
The food was fantastic and authentic with a modern twist.
My only complaint was being seated in a spot that EVERY guest and employee bumped
into (due to its position)EVERY TIME they passed. I guess they wanted me to feel like I was in mumbai (cramped and uncomfortable).
review_title: The place was abuzz with happy

review:
Overall everything was good. felt less crowded on fillmore than mission.
Service was good too.
taste in music was odd.
Too much techno (92.7 style music) which did not fit with the ambiance.
Very nice light indian food. Huge menu with lots of options. Very attentive staff. Definitely enjoyed the experience and would go back!
The food was truly outstanding. We loved everything we ordered. I can't wait to go back.
Great spot to go with friends so you can share as many different flavors as possible!
review_title: Great spot to go with friends

review: Previously we had eated at Dosa's smaller and original location in the Mission. And when we went to the new Fillmore hot spot I must say I was a little nervous. Was Dosa going to be too big? Too noisy? Would the service be rushed? But I am so happy to say that the meal was fantastic! The food was delicious. The service top notch. And even the bill was so reasonable. I would definitely go back. And the waitress seated us right away and the meal was just stress free! What a lovely place! Thank you for bringing Dosa to Fillmore street. I hope it stays as good as it is right now!!!

The food was very good. The front house staff is still working on seating people. there was only one person checking tables and seating when the place was really crowded.
The room is beautiful and we were given a good table near the bar. It is noisy but you can talk to each other without screaming.
review_title: The food was very good. The

review: The experience was quite disappointing. The service was not polished;in fact it was sloppy. The curry dishes were over spiced and heavy handed. The chutney masala dosa was very good, as was the Beet cumin soup. I think they need some more time to get their act together.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review:
We usually go to Butterfly to enjoy their Happy Hour specials (5-7pm).
This time we also ordered two entrees:
The lamb shank was excellent.
The whole fried fish was terrible.  (Presentation was good; fish was small and mostly bones.)

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: Our waitperson was very good..The food was good...The preparation time to serve the food took way to long (1.25 hrs)....Maybe a kitchen short staff that evening  New Years Day"

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review:
I love Butterfly. The food and view are both unique. The service is always super -- very attentive.  Easy parking in the area if you are a local. My favorite is the fried calamari and I just discovered the kiwi cucumber fix. A great drink for a non drinker.
I always take out of town guests there.  Its not so noisy that you can't have a good conversation but it is a lively atmosphere.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: For the price, the food was OK, but not great or even very good.  Service was OK and cocktails very good.  Ambiance was "energetic" leaning toward loud.  Overrated restaurant. We are locals and, given san francisco's great food scene, there are better choices at the same price.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: The food was very uneven. The chicken was very dry but the appetizers were outstanding. Some desserts were excellent (creme brulee and others were not (skillet cookie). Service was minimal.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: Delicious food and drinks. Attentive service. 3 couples had a great time without the kids. We absolutely had a wonderful time here. Recommended it to our family - they've already made reservations for next week!

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: I took my friend here to celebrate her birthday and it was a very delightful experience. She liked it so much that she plans to return with her beau. And I plan to return with my friends again and again.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: This was my third or fourth time at Butterfly. My first time was 8 years ago for a graduation party. The food was good then and it still is now. We went for Happy Hour before going on the night Alcatraz tour. Having lived in the Bay Area all my life, this was my first time to visit Alcatraz. Since it is right next to the ferry launch, this place was perfect. The service was excellent and they made sure we didn't miss our tour. I especially liked the Kahlua wraps, the Strawberry Rolls and the Garlic Noodles from the Happy Hour Menu. We also shared the Peking Duck entree. With a window seat overlooking the SF Bay, it was a beautiful meal. We will definitely be back.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: About a year and a half ago, we had an excellent meal at Butterfly. With guests visiting from out of town, we thought it would be great to go back. While dining in a mostly empty SF restaurant was delightfully quiet, the food was totally disappointing. Everything was lackluster and pretty much devoid of flavor. Elements were repeated in ways that didn't work--the same items that showed up in an appetizer appeared on various entree plates. Many plates seemed mismatched, for example, hoisin glazed ribs served with fried rice combined fatty and salty with oily and salty. A green vegetable would have helped. Service was fine, the setting is great, but we won't be back.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: Food was fantastic and nicely portioned. The chef came to our table to see if we liked our food. Wait staff was very attentive. We will be back.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: Beautiful view, wonderful interior, feels like it's been there forever. Nice, interesting menus with excellent food. I've been there for both lunch and dinner and have enjoyed both.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: The hostess was very friendly and the kahlua pig in lettuce cups was excellent. Unfortunately, the grilled chicken salad sandwich's ingredients were too chunky and slippery to eat as a sandwich--it fell apart and was a big mess. Also, our waiter disappeared for a long time between courses and we had to wait a long time to get the check even though the restaurant was only half full.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: the restaurant was great. the food was very good and interesting. not your normal fare. the one note of caution to diners who don't drive to the restaurant - arrange to have the taxi pick you up. we were visiting from out of town and had some trouble getting a taxi. the number of taxis in san francisco is alarmingly low and there are not many that drove by even on a friday night. i say that only in the most encouraging way. i will absolutely come back to the butterfly next time i come to the city

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: We weren't rushed, had plenty of time to talk, kobe burger delicious, steak fries different from all others -- really really good. Turmeric-seared snapper dish was innovative, delicious and healthy. We would go back.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: The food was very good and we'll go back for it again. However, the view was kind of ugly.
review_title: The food was very good and

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review:
Went here for lunch and food was good, but dinner menu is more delicious! Great happy hour menu and prices also for after-office stop.

Staff is always friendly, courteous and smiling.
review_title: Went here for lunch and food

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: We had a lovely Easter brunch here. The food was excellent, right down to the Kahlua pig lettuce leaf appetizer and the coriander coated fish and the flash fried whole red snapper entrees (The whole red snapper is TRULY a signature dish!). The menu has a wide range of interesting Asian fusion choices and the views of SF Bay can't be beat! Definitely worth a visit....
review_title: We had a lovely Easter brunch

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review:
Hostess wasn't the on her toes in that, she only gave the regular menu when there were three. We had to ask twice and we only got one each time. Even the waiter said to us that we shouldve gotten them all at once. Other than that we weren't in a hurry and so it was nice to site side by side and close on the couch like seating with a waterfront window. Tasty food - Kobe beef sliders and pulled pork lettuce cups were good. And, their drinks were yummy too. Their cherry blossom drink was good. Overall a good night.

Tip: park on Bay street in 2 hr parking if possible and walk across the street. Then you don't have to pay for parking.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: This food is TERRIFIC, as well as great ambiance! Sorry to say the waiter 'missed'!

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: Good view, good decor, nice enough staff, tasty cocktails - but for foodies, and for the price, the dishes just didn't stack up. Pretty poor form as well to bring out a dessert for someone's birthday unprompted - and then charge them for it later.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: even thought the date ended badly, the reservation i made, and the food we ate was lovely as always..and appreciated by both diners!

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: Came here with friends from Idaho, probably haven't had Asian fusion before and really enjoyed the meal. Went with the small plates vs. entree and love the variety. Too bad the smoked salmon rolls are somewhat seasonal, a very different and tasty take on Vietnamese spring rolls!
review_title: Great place for an intro to Asian F

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: beautiful spot but the booths face inward toward the restaurant and the entire interior set up fails to take advantage of the spectacular view-it's a bit cold rather than chic-they need a designer to enhance and maximize their space-that being said, spectacular scallops, great duck and certainly worth the trip-we had a really nice waiter but the service was slow-we enjoy leisurely dining but others might not find this appealing.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: Amazing food. Love the new additions to the menu. One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco, and I will continue to go there regularly!

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: We had an anniversary dinner at Butterfly and had a wonderful experience. Great food, great service, romantic table with a view of the bay. The food was delicious and bountiful. We took home about half of each portion. We will come back for sure.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review:
Near by parking cost more than brunch! Outrageous!

The hor'sdoevres were fabulous! Service very attentive. Ambience very interesting, smoky black and mirrors with open beams.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: Happy Hour Specials and special 3 course meal was perfect for our birthday celebration. Will be going back to share "Butterfly" experience with other friends !

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: It was a special occasion as we were celebrating one of our friend's birthdays. I had seen Butterfly Restaurant on Check Please and was very interested in trying it out. I and both of my friends (including the birthday girl) all enjoyed it very much. I will definitely go back with other friends.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: A private bay view gives the whole restaurant an intimate, hip vibe. The Duck Spring Rolls were crisp and delicious. The Shrimp and Mango Salad was exceptionally tasty, and the Salmon Roll was absolutely unique and a fantastic melding of flavors. Wines by the glass were of surprising quality and affordably priced. I will definitely be back to explore the menu further and enjoy the accommodating and friendly service.
review_title: A private bay view gives the

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: We had lunch at Butterfly last week and couldn't have been happier with their service, food and atmosphere. Due to the traffic on the Embarcadero, we were late for our reservation, but they found a table for us right away. The food was wonderful - each of us had something different from a Kobe beef hamberger, to crab cakes to the two kinds of clam chowder and smoked salmon with poached eggs. Every item was cooked perfectly and served by a waiter who actually seemed to enjoy what he was doing. The piece d'resistance was the chef who not only stopped by our table to see if we were happy or needed anything else, but who insisted on bringing us the most fabulous bread pudding we had ever had. All in all a GREAT experience.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: Dining experience was delightful. The infusion of subdued, yet exciting spices made each dish memorable. Loved the black cod with fresh tomato sauce. Sevice was outstanding. Attentive but not overbearing. Would definately recommend the restaurant to friends and family.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: Beautiful venue, to be sure, but service was a bit nonchalant.  Food was mostly quite good and nicely presented, but the vegetarian noodle dish was way too salty.  Will likely give it a try again... maybe with my husband, so service might improve.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: A very good dining experience. Ingredient were very fresh and prepared with a good amount of creativity. Service was attentive but not overbearing. We never had a need to find or ask for our waiter. Price was moderate and good value for what was offered. Wine list was as advertised and fairly priced.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: We were so pleased with our evening at Butterfly. Everything was excellent. Food was beautifully served and delicious, the service was outstanding.
review_title: We were so pleased with our

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review:
Had seen "Butterfly" on web & photos were representative of interior - interesting, modern yet inviting. Waterfront view (albeit of docking area, not close, open bay view) was still enjoyable. Food was straightforward, yet excellent - good combinations of flavors on standard fare (ribs, soup, spring rolls). Servers were a bit stiff, but nothing to complain about; hostess was friendly.

Perfect for after Alcatraz Island appetizers or dinner or for casual bar dining. Several groups also dining, some looked like friends, other business associates.

Very enjoyable, would go back again!

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: After a morning flight from NYC, we started our long weekend with Friday lunch at Butterfly. We could not have asked for a better start. We were celebrating an anniversary, and they could not have been nicer. A window table had been saved for us, and the food and service were outstanding. The snapper was incredible, as was the chocolate dessert. And, the wine was outstanding...the only challenge was selecting from such a great list. The whole experience was made all the better by a visit from Rob, the chef. We will be back on every visit to San Francisco.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: We had a wonderful business lunch. Service was great and so was the food. We left a notebook on the chair and they called us 5 minutes after we left to let us know. When the cab pulled back around they hand delviered it to us! Now that's service!

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review:
The dining experience was rather disappointing... I would rate the food and the service to be a little below average. The view was not even really worth us sitting near the windows. We were offered a table for the three of us to have the view during Sunday brunch, but we deicded not to take the table since we would all be sitting in a row!! That's kinda weird....

The server was also kinda out of it. We had to ask her 3 times to lower the blinds, 3 times to bring the ice bucket for our wine. Me and my friendgirl both ordered the poached eggs. I asked for no sauce, but it turned out to have EXTRA sauce.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: First time dinning at Butterfly for lunch. Good food and a great waitress.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: We were pleasantly surprised to have happened into Butterfly this past weekend. The food was amazing. The atmosphere was perfect-the window on the water was great. Prices were reasonable for great service, food and atmosphere. The staff from the hostess to the sommelier was fantastic. We had a great evening and will definitely go back.

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: Definitely expecting more. For the price you're better off going to the somewhat generic Houston's across the street. With no outside lighting the oceanside view so prominent on their website is wasted at night. Our server was very nice and attentive, but otherwise everything was meh. Food was overall bland. Decor was decent, except the chairs were plastic IKEA junk and totally out of place. Wasn't godawful but not worth the $$ at all. Won't be going back-

address: Pier 33, The Embarcadero at Bay StreetSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: Great Drinks, service staff were very attentive, appetizers were excellent. Food was excellent.

We had early reservations but didn't have a show to catch so we were patient, but at first our table-for-two was completely ignored in favor of the tables around us. No drink orders, no water, no bread, nothing. This went on for about 15 minutes. Since we were in no hurry we didn't make a fuss until the people seated after us had entrees and we still only had menus - no one had even taken our drinks order (and you don't go to Absinthe without something from their great bar). We tried signaling for attention but nothing worked until my companion literally reached out and touched someone to get some attention. The waiter was then extremely apologetic and took over our table from the waitress who'd greeted us. From there on out we were treated like kings and they even provided a free appetizer to make up for the earlier inattentiveness. The evening ended up being great, and the food was all amazing (steak for me, fettuccine for my friend, beet salad for both of us).
review_title: A stumble, but a great recovery.

review:
Had previously dined at this lovely and lively little spot in Hayes Valley so I was unpleasantly surprised by slow, erratic service.  Perhaps our server was having a bad day but when she did show up she was less than friendly or perhaps bored.

Food was adequate, nothing special. 

Sorry I won't be back.

As restaurants come and go in Hayes Valley it is consoling that Absinthe remains a destination spot offering a high level of cuisine, service and ambiance.  Even the valet service stands out.  The wine list is extensive, priced appropriately with fine sommelier assistance and recommendation.  The cuisine is excellent in this bustling place, but service can be challenged when the restaurant is full.  Convenient to the Symphony or the Opera House it is a fine choice for pre-event dining or any other time for that matter!
review_title: A high level of dining still exists at Absinthe.

review: Love the food.  Service is casual and really friendly.  Always a busy and good vibe.
Food prepared perfectly, every item! Cheese plate selections are top-shelf. Service is attentive, with a smile.

All ages can enjoy this scene. Great bar along with a very exciting menu plus dynamic desserts. Absinthe never disappoints whether for romance or to impress your friends. Also great for a burger lunch!  It's a place for all reasons and all seasons.

Regularly lunch at table 77 and love the croque mis. and pot au creme dessert.  This time with grandsons, burgers arrived incorrectly two different times... and were told it would be a long wait to redo.  The service was inept - not at all our usual experience.  We declined dessert fearing it would take forever.  Check arrives and to the charge for the burger, an added chg of $1.50 for cheese and 1.50 for tomato slice.  We are in shock.  How sad to have to give up going to a place we have loved!

The food was excellent: beef tatar, steak and lamb were all top notch.
We liked the cocktails too.
As for the service, all those items are kinda normal people make mistakes but there was just too much of them in a row. Also it was very unapologetic ! 
We ordered oysters to start, didn't tell us which were which.
Mixed up the wines (ok it happens but then see below)
I put a comment on the opentable reservation for my wife's birthday and it was ignored (I had to remind the waiter and the surprise was spoiled).
Charged 3 glasses of wine instead of 2.
After all that, not even a free coffee or an apology :(
review_title: The food was good not the service

review: We used to live in this neighbourhood and after we moved to Sunset district we keep coming here once in a while. And that's a big deal because we don't like to drive across town to eat.

I have season tickets to the SF ballet and also go to the symphony and opera on occasion. Absinthe is my go to place for pre show drinks and apps. Its great to be able to make a reservation and have the peace of mind that you have a guaranteed table at a certain time when you're trying to make a curtain call (just book early, as it does fill up on show nights). I have also found the waitstaff to be great at timing the meal if you let them know you have tickets to a show. They do a great job at getting you out on time without making you feel rushed. Its a close, easy walk to the symphony and opera house too, even in heels!
review_title: Grab a bite & a drink before a show

review: Absinthe is my favorite restaurant near the performing arts. Always a lovely atmosphere, outstanding service and exceptional cuisine!

Absinthe was the perfect spot to begin our New Year's Eve celebration. We were seated promptly and found the dcor to be warm, inviting, and romantic. All four persons in our party found the food to be fresh, delicious, and well-priced for the quality and quantity. I particularly enjoyed the pretzel appetizer and the salmon dinner. Unlike many other restaurants where I've ordered salmon, Absinthe's version was cooked to perfection. The service was impeccable and attentive without being obtrusive. I was particularly pleased that we were not rushed through our dinner as I had expected they might want to turn over tables very quickly on this busy New Year's Eve at the restaurant. I can't wait to return to Absinthe!
Our dinners were wonderful! The best coq au vin I've ever had anywhere. Desserts were unusual, creative and very delicious!
When I dine at Absinthe, whether it's before or after the Ballet or Opera, I always have a memorable dining experience. The food is always delicious and the service is outstanding.
review_title: When I dine at Absinthe, whether

review: Nice atmosphere and friendly service with OK but not memorable food. We were here last summer and thought the food was much better. We spoke with friends who happened to be at a nearby table who agreed with our assessment. Our bill for 2 was $184. We expect and are used to better at this price. Valet parking was $15 (plus tip.). I gave the benefit of the doubt at 4 stars.
PROFESSIONAL AND ATTENTIVE SERVICE. ONE OF THE BEST MEALS I HAVE HAD IN A WHILE.
I eat at Absinthe often, and it is always wonderful!
This place is always a good time with very good food and service -- and the lighting makes the ambiance just right, so don't miss the opportunity to go and enjoy!

Probably the best brunch/meal we have enjoyed in SF in a long time. My husband had the roast beef open faced sandwich and I had the duck ragout with poached eggs. The ingredients were incredible fresh and flavorful. The eggs tasted like farm fresh eggs, the tarragon on the bchamel sauce was vibrant and colorful. Try the Absinthe Lemonade or any of the specialty bar drinks - they are not "contrived", but rather a new take on old standards with only top shelf ingredients. Oh, and the service is great. My water glass was never empty, my husband's coffee cup topped off throughout our meal and the staff seemed to work together seamlessly and with enthusiasm. We will definitely be back!

Overall a very nice lunch... Waited a bit too long to order... Waited a bit too long for our desserts... Would recommend overall, but you might need extra time if the service is running behind...

Loved the Grilled Chedder Cheese Sandwich with Bacon... Yum...

This was our first time at Absinthe. The French onion soup was delicious. It was served piping hot with a rich, flavorful broth and gobs of melting cheese. Yum. Our salads were fine. They read better than they tasted. Since it was Sunday brunch the tables around us were indulging in tempting stuffed French toast, egg dishes and pastries. Next time we'll opt for breakfast fare. The only down side was the service. The bussers were hustling and quite attentive. Our server was merely going through the motions. Our second course showed up a couple minutes after the first course. We had to flag her down for refills of beverages. Overall unprofessional service put a damper on our meal.
Great time, will be referring it to anyone who wants a nice evening.
One of the best to get you through dinner & to your concert on time!
review_title: One of the best to get you

review: Perfecto way to start the "Go To The Opera" evening! From welcoming checkin to our superb wait staff to the incredulous 3 dishes 2 of us shared and had no room for a decadent dessert! My only "needs improvement comment" ... don't set a bottle of rose or white wine on the table, put it in ice please as we like it cold not luke warm and we sip on our bottle so don't get over zealous about pouring! 5 stars for: Steak Tartare, Muscles/Clams, frissee salad and WOWZA to that great bread!
Good choice before concerts or the opera, but somewhat crowded and noisy when we were there.
Absinthe never fails to delight; Lunch; brunch, dinner, after a concert. My go to place in the neighborhood

A mix if contemporary & reinvented traditional brunch options at reasonable prices. Attentive & friendly staff that enhance the upbeat and relaxing vibe. Great alcohol & alcohol free brunch cocktail options.

Attentive service - the wait staff could help us discern the different types of Absinthe at the table, water glasses were filled attentively, timing was excellent. Food was delicious - fresh ingredients prepared delicately and combined in innovative ways, very nice presentation. We were located in the furthest room away from the front door which made conversation very easy. It's one of our favorite restaurants to dine at before the opera or symphony concert.

The food was good but the service was seriously lacking. We were seated for almost 15 mins before the server ever even greeted us then it took another 20 mins just to get drinks. He never once cracked a smile or came back to check on us. We had to flag another server down just to get another drink. The food was good though so I would still recommend it. Hopefully our server was just having an off day and this experience isn't reflective of how service always is.
review_title: The food was good but the

review: Very convenient to Symphony and Opera, very good menu, the meal was excellent. Try to get a table away from the bar if you want to talk over dinner.

This has been a longtime reliable favorite, even after there have been changes in the kitchen. Staff has always been attentive and friendly. Comfortable atmosphere and a little fancier than the other restaurants in the area. Reasonable prices and tasty food.
review_title: This has been a longtime reliable

review: Fantastic drink menu, ambience and spectacular service made the night really special... food was only so-so.
have eaten there many times before but won't again.
Fabulous! So many wonderful choices on the menu, hard to decide what to order.
Love this restaurant! Great find for the Civic Center area. Great food. Great service. Ambiance fun! Looking forward to my next visit--which will be next month.

We had a great brunch at Absinthe. This is obviously a popular spot, but despite a large Sunday crowd, with walk-ins clamoring to get a table, we were seated on time. (Reservations definitely recommended!) Service was friendly and efficient and the food was lovely. It is noisy, but it's a pleasant buzz.
review_title: We had a great brunch at Absinthe.

review: the seafood small plate is wonderful as was the duck.....can't wait to try to coq au vin. Good spot for before an event or just for a lovely evening.
Enjoyed trying new flovors. The three cheese combo was great. The blue cheese with honey comb was fantastic.
Absinthe is one of our favorite restaurants. Always good.
review_title: Absinthe is one of our favorite

review: First time dining but not for lack of trying. Finally made reservations in advance and were very happy with the food (excellent halibut and perfect lamb, but perhaps the German chocolate cake just a tad too sweet), and service was perfect: friendly, efficient but not intrusive, and we didn't feel rushed: from seating to order to food service to plate removal and check, all was done well and when we were ready.
Went for lunch with friends, celebrating a birthday. Our waiter was outstanding and the food wonderful. Look forward to returning.
The service was great. Waitress was very attentive without smothering. Three of our four meals were excellent but my wife's risotto was awful. Great drinks. Great selection of wines by the glass.
Always a treat to go to Absinthe, which we do every time there is a theatre event at Civic Center. We love the good, service, and ambiance.
review_title: Always a treat to go to Absinthe,

review: Juan was the perfect waiter. So attentive, charming and helpful with the wine list. As was Aaron. And we needed help because the list is so impressive. Choices galore! We were also greeted by a friendly hostess and seated right away. Only issue was the accidental overcharge, but when we called to have it corrected, the woman was apologetic, friendly and efficient in returning the money.
Wonderful!! Our server was fantastic helpful friendly.. And so accommodating !! Food was delicious. It's not a matter of if I'll go back but when can I ?

As usual, a lovely dinner. Our waiter inquired whether we were going to the theater (we weren't) and was very attentive throughout dinner. The french onion soup was perfect and the chicken (which I don't usually order at restaurants)was cooked to perfection

After too many experiences with wildly inconsistent food and service we had moved Absinthe to the bottom of our rotation for pre-symphony dining, but after reading that it had changed we decided to try again. We are very glad we did. Every dish on the focused menu was well executed, from the classic French onion soup and country pate to the new and delicious wild mushroom pot pie. The service was stellar. If this is now the new normal for Absinthe it will return as our preferred choice when dining in the area.
Felt just like I was visiting France. Will definitely go back!
review_title: Felt just like I was visiting

review: The food was really good but I can't remember it very well since the service was one of the worst I have experienced in the city. Don't take kids here; the waiters have no clue how to take care of kids at a restaurant. Do not order ketchup for the kids since it is "fancy" and peppery. When we ordered a Shirley Temple, the cherry was forgotten; later we found out that the cherries are soaked in brandy but the waiter brought it out for our kids anyway. The waiter spilled a glass of wine on the table and didn't offer a refill nor a change of the soiled table cloth. I just don't think the food is worth this kind of service.
review_title: The food was really good but

review: We waited an hour for our hamburgers at 11:00 pm on a sat night. Kitchen was off. Waitress could not have been sweeter!
review_title: We waited an hour for our

review: Very busy on a concert night with service a bit slow but very good.
review_title: Very busy on a concert night

review: Our banquette was cozy. My wife raved loved the French onion soup, the best she has had; dark, hot & beefy. Very enjoyable & half the price we paid elsewhere (Harris', Epic Roasthouse & Fleur de Lys).

Our brunch was very delicious. The service allowed us to arrive at our opera on time without rushing. My only complaint was the noise level which made it very difficult to carry on a conversation. I realize that most restaurants today have an unacceptable noise level (Unacceptable to me and all of my friends) but why not provide a quiet area where folks can enjoy a conversation easily. In fact, that might be a strong selling point to set you apart form the crowd.
Susan Smernoff 650-861-0631

The atmosphere and service were great. The food portions, however, particularly our split, large caesar salad ($11) my friend's halibut ($29) and the desserts ($9) were disappointingly small. We did not feel it was value received.

Absinthe was superb - the food was outstanding, in particular we enjoyed the spicy fried chickpeas, oysters, melon salad, and duck confit - all phenomenal. The service was attentive and ambiance was intimate, yet the room had a nice constant energy level.

Absinthe is always a great place to go to catch a great late evening meal that you know will be fantastic. Sticking to the classic brasserie courses will never disappoint. The French onion soup is filling and made traditionally, a slightly tart broth with a wonderful mellowing flavor from the melted cheese. The escargot, served in shell, are firm, but tender, bathed in the wonderful and delicious garlic butter. The changing cheeses are worth trying as a few tend to not be the usual "safe" cheeses, lending to a wonderful adventure. Never to miss with a meal are the amazing cocktails, the Wonderlust and Ginger Rogers are two which should not be missed. Service is friendly and always willing to offer excellent suggestions in food and drink.

The food was very tasty; each of us in a party of 4 had an appetizer and entree and 2 glasses of wine plus coffee. The service was excellent. Yet (even as a SF resident for years) we felt that the cost of $175 per couple before tax and tip was excessive.
To keep noise low, ask for seating in the room farthest from the bar. It makes a big difference!
review_title: The food was very tasty; each

review: Nice quiet table. We thought food was good and a bit different, just not quite the tip top that it seems to portray. We had a nice time.

Our reservation was honored promptly, we were seated at a lovely table with space around it so we weren't leaning into others conversations, our waiter was knowledgeable, friendly and attentive, and the food was delicious. What's not to like? I had cauliflower soup, smooth, creamy and rich tasting, followed by pan roasted mussels, clams, gigante beans in the most flavorable sauce I've ever eaten. I practically licked the plate. Two had the goat cheese and green garlic pirogies on a bed of wild mushroom ragout, and another had sea bass. All were beautifully plated and delicious. We ordered a plate of cookies for dessert, and while they were pretty to look at, there was not much flavor.

We ate in the back room where it was roomy and quiet and lovely. And it was the right temperature, which is sometimes a problem for me if a seat is drafty. The staff was attentive, personal, without being intrusive. The wine guide helped us choose our drinks and, even tho one of us knows a lot about wines, especially French wines, this was welcome. The Irish waitperson was fun and knew the menu. We loved the oysters, escargot, salads and our main courses. The duck breast was voted the best. I think my cocktail, the wonderlust, was the best drink I've ever had. And the four of us shared a French absinthe to close out our stay and that was fun, too. We had a great time on my birthday.
review_title: We ate in the back room where

review: This was our third dinner at Absinthe and it was as fabulous as the first two. The food, wine and ambiance are top notch- it is like a little trip to Paris but the tables are spaced more comfortably! I always have oysters here- they are sweet and beautifully presented. The bar makes superb cocktails and the wine service is always top notch with lots of wonderful selections to choose from- if you don't know much about wine- this is the place to be adventurous as the staff is highly trained and can help choose that special bottle. We made a pact that we would never go to the city without stopping at Absinthe.

My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary by going out to dinner and seeing the show Wicked. We were running late and only had an hour to have dinner instead of the 2 hours that we had planned. We let the waitress know that we were running late. She said no worries and that she would accommodate us. We ordered the french onion soup, clam-scallop chowder, and a special bruschetta for an appetizer. Then had the beef cheek and lamb for the main. Had 6 drinks, mainly various drinks centered around Gin from their drinks list. And we were able to get out of there before the hour was up!! The food was amazing and drinks were great. Service was perfect. I'm a foodie and this is now one of my favorites. I wish we could have stayed more.
review_title: My wife and I were celebrating

review: Always impressed - Food, cocktails, & service are top notch. Try oysters, french fries, and champagne for brunch...it's spectacular! I Don't know what I'd do without this restaurant.
Great place! Loved the country pate with apricot and chantrelle pasta. Also terrific were the chowder and mussels with clams. Good wine list. Wonderful cocktail selection fun to read the bar menu.

With its great reputation, I was expecting a wonderful dining experience---did not happen. The food was mediocre and way over-priced. My salad contained wilted lettuce and was over-dressed. The scallop entree was a real disappointment--salty and unappetizing. Sadly, I cannot recommend this restaurant. The ambiance was nice and the bar scene looked mellow.
Everything from start to finish was absolutely amazing. The detail on presentation and the service was impecable. It was the perfect ending to a perfect birthday.
Overall, a good experience, but the food tends toward the heavier side.

Absinthe looks and feels fabulous. A little drop of Paris in Hayes Valley. Excellent wines, great menu, attentive service and a lot of style. Trying one of the absinthes (they have about a dozen different labels) is a must, if only for the fun of the ritual presentation of the drink:with sugar, water and ice so you may mix it to your personal taste. Food was good but not excellent. Steak tartare was tasty enough but not up to the heights this simple dish can reach; escargot were also underwhelming...underflavoured somehow. A favourite - the french onion soup - lacked the intensity of flavour that makes this dish so special. But the pea and heirloom carrot risotto was divine. Combined fresh, sweet, crunchy and smooth to perfection!

We've been going to Absinthe for eight years.While we love the ambience and the neighborhood,the food has been slowly going down hill. The lamb loin was excellent but the apricot/sage pate was dry and had no taste.A vanilla sorbet was colorless and was accompanied by what appeared to be shredded wheat.Inedible! Stick to the bar menu and have a wonderful drink from the list of house specialties.
Great pre- and/or post-performance restaurant close to the civic center.

I had brunch with my daughter and her college roommate. There was a long line but we had a reservation and were seated immediatley. The server was prompt, helpful and attentive.
The food was great and the experience memorable. I will be back in November, when I visit my daughter again.
review_title: I had brunch with my daughter

review: a fun and relaxed ambiance with an interesting menu. the cheese menu is wonderful.

We have gone to Absinthe a few times now..mainly on opera nights..on opera nights we find the food to be good but not great..i think it's mainly because they have to whip out so much food in such a short time period..the most recent time we went, there were no operas or symphonies that night..the food was the best we've ever had! the pork confit was out of this world as was the frisee salad..my husband had the steak and he said it was very good..the best part of the meal was the chocolate/cherry baked alaska..a real treat! we had very good cocktails too..definately should go when there are not events around the civic center..the food was excellent..my only complaint was the bar was really really noisy!
review_title: We have gone to Absinthe a

review: From the moment we walked into the restaurant, we were made to feel like special guests. The food was delicious, the cocktails absurdly amazing and the service exactly right.

Brunch was very good; the lemon presse is very good; surprisingly had to flag down the waitress to get attention several times. And also surprisingly, brunch did not take hours. Not very kid friendly at all.
had been waiting to visit absinthe for quite was some time and was not disappointed in any way. food was great. atmosphere was great. service was awesome. can't wait to go back

I thought the food was pretty good. I had the halibut and I really enjoyed the flavor however, I tried the potatoes in the steak dish and it tasted somewhat burnt. The pulled work was good and had great flavor. The chocolate dessert with the banana was a little too rich for me but the presentation was beautiful. The service was solid. We had many waiters serving us so it was hard for us to develop a relationship with just one person.
review_title: I thought the food was pretty

review:
The Sommelier and waitress were excellent and very attentive. They were very helpful with selecting Absinthe for newbies.

The food was terrific - halibut perfectly cooked, the spiced chickpeas are a treat.

There was an extensive wine list and we didn't know what to pick. They sent over a sommelier and I liked that he did not push a more expensive wine. He recommended a moderately priced wine and a little more expensive wine, but, again, did not push the more expensive. He actually really recommended the more moderate wine. It was absolutely delicious! The food was outstanding. The two of us shared 3 of the shared plates and a main entree and that was plenty for us! When they asked if we would like dessert, we mentioned it was his birthday and we had dessert at home. They still brought us a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream and a plate that read "Happy Birthday" in chocolate on it. VERY good service!
