I usually love this restaurant, but we had a very bad service experience last time we were there. We had a 5:45 reservation, ordered at 6pm, begged for our main courses at 7pm (!) and had to literally stand up and go find someone to ask for our check and were LATE for our ballet curtain at 7:30. I think a restaurant that serves the pre-theater crowd should be able to get a table out the door in an hour and 45 minutes! We were really disappointed and I don't think I'd go back before a performance. If you have time to linger it's a great place...

Wonderful ambience, very lively but also intimate and romantic (a rare combination). Service and all the details like great bread and hosts taking your coat are there. The drinks are great, all the starters and small plates ditto. Strangely, the entrees are the least compelling part, but we always find something we like, and return often.
Unbelievable meal from start to finish. Highlights were the pork confit, hamachi crudo, and mushroom risotto. Definitely really pricey but worth it for sure.

Food was excellent, a very inventive menu and the courses were prepared well. However, the hostess was snappish and didn't mask her mood well. The bartenders(3 of them) were not prompt. We had to flag one down, and the bar is not at all large! The server was excellent, but mid-way through the meal she went on break and our sub was sub-par at best. Ignored us and we had to flag her down, even though it appeared she had but tables. The food, though, was wonderful and I am hoping our poor service was an aberration.

I'd always wanted to eat at Absinthe and had occassion to do so on Saturday. I arrived and was seated immediately. The service all night was quite good. I enjoyed my wine and my meal, as did my guest. I thought this restaurant overall was a solid 4-star. I wish there had been just a few more entree selections - it's somewhat limited - though I would not recommend against eating here for that reason.
review_title: I'd always wanted to eat at

review: Really GREAT night scene. I went to lunch with my boyfriend and I wasn't impressed. Then I went with a friend one night around dinner time. I think waiting in line at night midst the restaurant/bar ambiance, enhanced the flavor. The drinks, the food, the dessert were exquisite. My favorite drink was the Sacred Heart. It was a memorable drink mixed with absinthe.

The atmosphere was warm romantic and delightful. I only wish the food had
been a bit better. They should really stick with traditional French bistro food -
which is what people seem to want when they go there. I have talked
to other friends who have said the same thing. But when they vere off path
and do beef cheeks instead of traditional steak and frites - I think people
end up being disappointed. I would go back - but I don't think for a sit
down dinner. At that price point I want more. But I would go back to have
a glass of wine and appetizer at the bar. The staff was not that friendly either.
Our waitress seemed realy huffy and the main courses took a long time to come out.

I have had dinner at Absinthe before but not in a couple of years...this was my first time for brunch. I had heard that things might have gone downhill but overall our experience was good, and worth the price. There were six of us so between the group we tried many of the items, and everything was tasty. My only complaint would be that we were a bit crowded at a slightly-too-small table (despite making a reservation), and because we arrived and sat down right when it opened but didn't order until after some of the smaller groups, it took too long for the food to come out.
review_title: I have had dinner at Absinthe

review: We've eaten at Absynthe many times and the food has been great. This time, though, the food was really boring, except for the pot-o-creme.

Terrific. Beautiful preparwd duck with a reduction sauce on a bed of perfectly sauteed spinach--everything exquisitely prepared. Way better than the usual Paris bistro. The sommelier recommended a perfect chateauneuf du pape to complement our meal. Divine. Highly recommended.

Absinthe was a huge disappointment. The waiter was very surly and had an attitude from the moment he arrived at our table. When we sat down we were given our dinner and cocktail/wine menus, within a few minutes the waiter came to take our drink order and was very put off because we hadn't made a decision yet. There are 3 pages of cocktails and many pages of wine selections. We all ordered cocktails and they were delicious and unique, unfortunately the food was very mediocre (with the exception of the dessert). I could deal with the wonderful cocktails and mediocre food, if the service was outstanding (or even just good), however with the combination of both I wouldn't go back to Absinthe. There are many other choices in the city.

The ambiance and french-i-ness about the place was lovely! The cheese platters were fantastic, as well, as the French onion soup. Then we got the duck as our entree and we both thought it to be waaaay to salty. But I did love the Absinthe drinks - it was an experience all its own!

Our server was excellent. Friendly, efficient, attentive and gave us some privacy.
Our dinner was not as impressive.The escargot was bland and seemed like it was a little undercooked. the cheese we had, I am sorry i cannot remember the name...
I think it was Spanish. The name began with Q..... A...... It was served with dried apricots and I didn't like the pairing and the thinly sliced bread had been over toasted and was very dry.
The beef jowels were tender and flavorful but there was too much liquid in the dish and it made the potatoes watery and diluted the flavor.
I don't think I would eat here again.
Once again I must say that the staff from bartender to matre'd were excellent.

your maitre'd accommodated us even if we were early. Your waiter Sam is exceptional. We enjoyed him so much
Keep up the good work.
Hint : my friend ordered a medium NY steak and it was very rare. Ooops
We were having a pre-symphony dinner, so we didn't linger.  The service was prompt, the food was really excellent, and we enjoyed the experience.

Overall, it was very nice. The only hiccup was when I made the reservation, I said we were celebrating an engagement and would appreciate the best available table. Since it was a week day lunch, I did not think this would be a big issue. When they called to confirm, I again stated it was an engagement luncheon and we would appreciate the best available table. When we arrived (exactly on the dot of noon for our reservation), the hostess took us to a table in back of the bar. When we asked if we could be seated in the main room, the hostess acted as though we were asking for the moon! The were many open tables in the other room & she did finally seat us there. But why initially Siberia? We were well dressed and polite. Left a bad taste.
Our favorite restaurant for dinner before the ballet.

We dine often at Absinthe, and generally enjoy it a lot.  However, on this occasion, the service was far below par:  The wait staff changed several times during our meal, and did not know what was going on.  They brought our entrees to the wrong table, while we were still eating our appetizer.  My guest's entree was severely undercooked, and then, we had trouble getting anyone's attention to order coffee or dessert.  We then ran out of time.  Needs improvement!

Our server, Samuel, was very nice and funny. I really enjoyed the appetizers. We got the Polpette: mini meatballs, polenta & Marinara. The flavor was excellent! The tomato bisque soup was also very tasty. 
Our entrees disappointed a bit. My husband got the Marsala, nice size portion and looked delicious. But he said it had a strong lemon flavor that wasn't pleasant. Almost as if someone thought it was supposed to be picatta. That was a bummer. I got the chicken cannellone. The flavors were really good, it was just pretty rich for me. I only ate half. But hey, something for later. 
The dessert was delicious! We shared the pomegranate chocolate chip gelato. They make it in house, please try it! :) 
Over all I would go again. Just trying different entrees. But I'd get the same apps and dessert!
I've dined at Bambino's several times. The food and service is always great. We requested Erin to br our server. She's awesome, friendly and consistent.  We live her.

We were looking for a place to eat a bite and we saw Bambino, i was not very hungry so i took an aperizer, a small plate of polenta with meat balls and tomato sauce "de la casa", it was delicious!! But their sandwiches looked amazing! (really big..)
Their mocha is huge and good. The sevice was very friendly and attentive.
Gret place for lunch in this neighborhood.
Very excellent and personalized service. The waitress had the Peroni waiting for my husbande, just as I had requested!

We were a party of 8 and it was just a perfect evening. Service, food, wine and desserts were just wonderful. Our waiter never rushed us but was there taking excellent care of all the details. Everyone just raved about the food. We had appetizers, salads, entrees and desserts and all were excellent. And a great wine list, we all love our wine.
review_title: We were a party of 8 and it

review: When we're looking for great food and terrific service, Bambino's always comes through.
Great service, delicious meal, we would definitely go there again. It appears to be a hot spot for take out pizza as well as an elegant Italian gourmet dinner.
Our server on Fri. 5/1 was exceptionally attentive and friendly. I was pleased with my fish salad, the fish was cooked perfectly and the vegetables were fresh and crisp.

...the food and cocktails ended up being pretty good.

We sat down, were given our menus and water, but nobody ever came to take our order.  Over 20 minutes later, I went to let the hostess know, but was luckily stopped by who I assume is the manager.  After that, everything went smoothly.  He recommended some great food (the octopus was our favorite!) and we ended up having a decent meal.

OK, so I've been here before and really enjoyed it. I enjoyed it even more this time!
I could live off of the fried garbanzo bean appetizer that is served at the table!!!
The food is wonderful and the service is great. I try to get there early as I like to eat early.
Don't know how crowded it gets later on but I would imagine it gets packed. Always a few tables filled when I get there.

Great food - was impressed with every dish that I sampled. My group was hit with a 20% gratuity charge for a party of six, even though this was not listed on the menu. While my standard tipping rate is 20% - I didn't appreciate this being added to the bill unexpectedly.
Lots of interesting, well prepared dishes. Service was helpful and well timed. A fun meal to share with several people so you can try a few new things.

I am surprised at an overall four star rating. Mochica is a nice quaint little restaurant with better than average service in a slightly less than average neighborhood. The restaurant has a lot of charm and server 001, a young short-haired lady with long eye lashes provided excellent service; however, the ambience of the restaurant and the service were not enough to take this restaurant above a grade of average.

First of all, the restaurant menu is completely different, and better than the restaurant currently on line. The Cebiche was excellent but unfortunately, most of the other dishes were average, at best. I would definitely shy away from the ribs. In short, the place looks better than the food tastes. I would try again only with
review_title: I did not see what others apparentl

review: Excellent food so full of flavor and great presentation. I've been several times and it's always consistent. Nice ambiance and great service. Highly recommended!

What a unique cuisine and a great place to boot- very fresh and well thought out selections;
I used a Bloomspot deal to discover the place but it is really a great find-Zagat rated and all kinds of awards for their Peruvian masterpieces--check it out!
One of the best renditions of Aji de Gallina we've ever sampled!
Food quality and price are quite good! Nice interior deco. Waitresses were friendly.

One single waiter taking care of seating, serving wine/food, billing and clearing tables...must appreciate he still can provide efficient and friendly service..
Seafood paella was tasty using fresh ingredients....Lamb shank was on the dry side...
Seating is tight....consider pricy for the type of food and setting...
Dishes were tasty, service fell off a bit as the restaurant got busy. very, very noisy, even for two people sitting across from each other. I will go again.

Amazing food! We had the "Palta rellena" as an appetizer, the combination of the avocado with the russian salad is delicious! For our entrees we had the "Chancho adobado" and the "Secado de res", both dishes, pork & beef, were really tender and flavorful, and the yuca fries that accompanied the pork dish were awesome! There's no complete dinner without dessert, so, we had the "alfajores" and the chocolate cake, as expected, they were out of this world!
If you're in San Fran, you need to experience the goodness in this restaurant!
Very nice atmosphere, service and food. I would definetly go back
My entree, the shrimp stuffed halibut was awesome. The prawn appetizer was just ok.
From the chickpeas to the dulce de leche pudding; each dish was very very good.
Such great food, very differnt from the normal.Great new flavors from any other kind of food. The Sangria was perfect not to sweet and not to much fruit.

The menu looked wonderful, but there was no consistency in the quality of the food. We had appetizers, entrees and dessert. Appetizers were just okay, as were most of the fish entrees. The Loma Saltado was the worst I've ever had...the meat was tough, the dish soggy...didn't have that pan seared smokiness that it needed. Plus, they added cumin. I have never had Lomo with cumin. The cream on the dessert tasted like it'd been sitting in frig awhile. I am very familiar with, and love, peruvian food...(married to a peruvian for 28 years). Only those not familiar with authentic peruvian will enjoy. Also, the fact that they only serve wine and beer didn't help. Pisco Sours were sorely missed by our group. Will not be eating there again.

Our server was quite helpful and attentive. His recommendation for the house Manhattan cocktail was spot-on! The food was amazing from the appetizers through the main courses. We arrived early, the restaurant was quiet and conducive for conversation. We particularly enjoyed the wood-fired pizza. I cannot speak to the desserts - as we didn't try any. I will certainly be heading back because there were so many tempting courses on the menu we weren't able to get to this trip.
review_title: May be one of new favorites

review: Space between tables, low noise level and attentive, prompt service make this a perfect place for doing business over lunch.
I thought the restaurant was just wonderful and our waitperson was the best. Food was delicious only comment a few crab shells in our pasta but the food was outstanding.

I went there one night with some co-workers and the food and service were great. They have some very authentic Italian dishes-the wild boar pasta was fantastic. It was so good I went back the next night with my wife. Food was even better but the waitress we had the first night provided better service than the waiter the second night which is why I marked the service down a little. Overall still a great place.
It was a most enjoyable evening at Palio D' Asti. Our party of 3 were treated to delicious finds at every course...
review_title: A bit of Italy in San Francisco...

review: I'm a 30-year San Francisco resident, one who values the excellence and diversity of our dining scene. My standards are very high ("ridiculously so" say some), and I'm often disappointed with restaurants fawned over in the media as being "extraordinary." In Palio d'Asti, owner Martino DiGrande has worked to polish a gem from a rough cut stone and has succeeded. The food is robust and rustic and executed with finesse (I could dine nightly on the Insalata Rossa). The service is warm and attentive but never cloying. I love the golden walls and mellow lighting. And presiding over it allwith unfailing grace, good humor, and genuine gratitudeMartino orchestrates a very satisfying dining experience. Bravo!

Service was impeccable and attentive but food left something to be desired. Given the value though of 4 courses at $44, it is hard to complain. Quality of seafood was not satisfactory. Both the fried calamari and the seafood risotto had really chewy calamari in it and the rest of the seafood didn't taste fresh at all. My lamb entree was fantastic, as was my boyfriend's gnocchi and beef tartare. However, his entree of steak used a really bad piece of steak rimmed by a layer of chewy and thick fat. Desserts were excellent, both the tiramisu and the cherry sorbet are worth having. Ultimately, the lack of consistency in the quality of meat and seafood was a sticking point.
Lamb was outstanding! They serve big portions and the prices are not high. Wait staff was excellent.

We arrived late to a reservation that was already late in the evening, with a large party of visitors from overseas who took a long time deciding what to eat. But even as the restaurant emptied, the kitchen turned out delicious dishes and our waiter was gracious and helpful long after all the other guests had left. We never felt rushed or unwelcome, right to the end. Thank you so much!
appreciated the quiet atmosphere...Caesar Romano was very tasty as was the Veal scalopine

We hosted a night out for 12 out of town guests. Good location - a nice walk from the Intercontiental. The restaurant looked warm and inviting. The food was very good. The down side to our evening was having to wait too long for our drink order to be taken. We had a private "talk" with the waiter. We received his attention but felt rushed from that point on. The staff wasn't well organized for a large group. Our drinks sat at the bar melting instead of being delivered as they were made. We should have had 2 waiters. It was not busy. We would return for another try but not with a large group.
review_title: We hosted a night out for

review: prices are within the moderate range. good selection. while good, not outstanding. good service in a nice room makes for easy dining.

after a long while of not dining at palio, i felt it was time to return. so glad i did! invited a friend who also had been out of the loop and he too was pleasantly surprised. very good food with moderate prices makes for a great change. service was amazing!
review_title: after a long while of not

review: Always a a treat with things you can't find on many other menus, like boar. Service has always been outstanding. Good spot for a group on a special occasion, but equally as good for an up-scale lunch for two.
review_title: Always a a treat with things

review: Our server was warm and welcoming which always adds to the enjoyment of the meal being served. I was nicely surprised with a birthday candle on top of the dessert as it was my birthday lunch with my female work associates. Food was fresh and done right. We shared the dessert which was the mousse cake surrounded with melted chocolate and topped with an vanilla/espresso gelato ice cream. Delicious!
review_title: Our server was warm and welcoming

review: the food was just amazing, the crab salad had a very delightful twist, and the desert for two was out of this world. The down side to all of this amazing food is that i arrived at 8:00pm with 8:15 reservations, The host was rude, or just impatient as she told me that there is no estimated time until a table will be available due to people paying and not getting up to leave. I sat at the bar and was seated around 8:30pm not to bad. However i was served around 9:20pm nearly 50 min after i had been seated and i only order a salad for an appetizer.

I have passed this place on the 1-California bus for years but never went in. The other night we stopped by and were very happy with the experience. From the moment you walk in you realize that you are in a very comfortable space. Casual business attire is the norm. Colors are warm and inviting. Our waiter was incredibly attentive and very knowledgeable about the menu. The menu is divided into four sections; appetizers, soups/salads, primi piatti and secondi piatti. Amazingly, the pricing is prix fixe and based on number of courses chosen; two, three or four and pricing is very reasonable, especially for the amount of food served. Dessert is on a separate menu and will count as a course. Highly recommended for a lovely dining experience.
review_title: I have passed this place on

review: Overall the expreince was wonderful. The food was fantastic (Highly recommend the veal) the service was first rate, the overall look of the restaurant was crisp and pleasing. I highly recommend Palio d'Asti for dinner.
Thought that the food was very good but it did take a long time for it to arrive.

I'm ready to write Palio d'Asti off of my list. Not for any one reason but the service is good but lacks sincerity (like eating at a Denny's...nice but distant as if there would be something else the waiter wants to be doing), the food is OK but overpriced ($21 for spaghetti? I spent $100 for 3 people and did not have wine!).
review_title: I'm ready to write Palio d'Asti

review: It is an excellent place to have a nice business lunch.  It is an excellent value for the quality of food and service.  You can talk and not have to shout.  Location is in the heart of the business district too.
review_title: It is an excellent place to

review: Love the half off on bottles of wine on Saturdays and Tuesdays.  Nice atmosphere. Great service. Comfort food.

Visit to SF from out of town. My sister & I wanted to see the Bay Bridge lights as I saw Perry's listed as a "great spot to view". Made early on-line reservations, then realized that with the time change it would not be dark when we were dining, so called & changed-they accommodated for a later time on a Friday night. Then running late due to traffic, called & they accommodated AGAIN. Got there, noticed an empty table by the window, asked if we could sit there-the head waiter said "certainly, follow me". Food was delicious with ample portions (I had the half chicken breast, sister had the pasta). Finished up wine & dessert while watching the lights of the bridge. Awesome. Prices decent for SF too. Minor issue: tables are close together.
review_title: Visit to SF from out of town.

review: I took my co-workers for a holiday lunch. Overall it was a nice lunch, but there were a couple of things I was very disappointed in. FIrst, even though we had a reservation, we still had to wait 10-15 minutes for the table. I feel when I make a reservation, the table should be waiting. Otherwise, how is it any different from a "walk-in"? Second, our waitperson was less than helpful. Granted, it was very busy, but again...we came there to eat and were paying customers. One person asked if they offered soup in a cup. She said no, just by the bowl and it was entree size. The soup was ordered and lo and behold....came in a cup.

Tried this place be ause we liked the description on open table. It was perfect. Staff was friendly and welcoming, even thought we were a bit late,, and the beer and entree selection suited us fine. We watched the Giants play, and engaged the next table in easy conversation. The lamb shanks were cooked to perfection, and the decontructed chicken pot pie was  nicely seasoned and delicious.

Good food with a fresh, American 'down home' emphasis. We enjoyed the whole lobster blue plate special with boiled red potatoes and corn on the cob. Using the table salt and pepper for flavor enhancement was a refreshing change. Garlic is not a staple here. The New England clam chowder was excellent - full of clam meat and just the right amount of zest. There is a comfortable, old San Francisco "establishment" atmosphere with a great view of the Bay on the Embarcadero. The wine list seemed a little pricey, but the service was great.
review_title: Good food with a fresh, American

review: We loved this atomosphere, always looking for reastaurants with good food but not stuffy where you can dress to impress or lay low in jeans and sweats. Hostess and servers were great, not too much attention and very genuine. The food was terriffic I had the chicken & biskets, my husband the lamb shank. Great portion size too!

Certainly not the Perry's of old. It's been 10 years since we left the City and we looked forward to Sunday brunch at Perry's, which we often enjoyed in the past. A lot less flexibility in ordering and some of the items were no where near as good as they once were (potato chips instead of the fresh made thick chips), no mixed combinations of eggs benedict/blackstone.

Perry's is a lunchtime favorite for us and we always order our "usual" (the ahi tuna burger which is great, and the pulled pork sandwich, which isn't the absolute best in the city but decent). Service this visit was efficient, quick and friendly.  We'll be back!
Great spot to have a casual dinner and the 1/2 price wine on Saturday night is a treat!
review_title: Great spot to have a casual

review: Really sub-standard food, very tried salad with inferior dressing, rubber band lobster and overtly sweet onion soup. Not one of our better nights out.

This was a perfect place for an east bay resident and a peninsula resident to meet for breakfast. It was near BART and has good parking close by. The food was good and the service terrific, no rushing us out. Since it is in a hotel, it is fun to see all the tourists planning with their maps, dressed in Bermuda shorts!!
review_title: This was a perfect place for

review: We have eaten here before and food is always good. This was a 1/2 price on wine Tuesday, so the bill was very with a bottle of wine was very reasonable.
I went for breakfast and the food was mediocre at best and prices a little higher than most breakfast places. The food quality and higher prices probably explain why the place is empty.
review_title: I went for breakfast and the

review: Been to all Perry's in all its incarnations.  Food is good, simple; waitstaff well-trained.
review_title: Been to all Perry's in all

review: Perry's is as "classic SF" as Northbeach. The best folks ever. ALways fun. A treasured family establishment..made with love.. It's been 40 years now (Union Street location) May it be with us forever.

There are many things to like at Perry's, but the New York strip is really a deal. The meat is tender and tasty, the portion generous (with two sides) and the price very fair. Add a glass of red (I loved the Tempranillo) and you've just bought yourself a terrific dinner. If you are really hungry, the buffalo chicken or grilled artichoke make good starters. Cocktails are a little disappointing, though. You'd think a bar this packed would have a more skillful bartender.
review_title: There are many things to like

review: I ate the cutest hamburger at Perry's. Delightfully delicious. Great service as well. Thank you.

Good comfort food and prices were reasonable, except for the extra charge for goat cheese on my salad. I was there about the time it was first launched. I gave the benefit of doubt, but service was even slooower on my second visit.

We were looking forward to enjoying what was described as the best Sunday Brunch Buffet in San Francisco.  But the moment we walked into the beautiful Garden Court, we realized that something was amiss.  First, there were very few customers there (at 12:00 on a Sunday), when we expected the place to be packed.  Second, there was NO BRUNCH BUFFET!!

The waiter told us that Management decided to stop offering the Sunday Brunch Buffet effective January 1, 2015, so we had to order off the menu.   The food we ate was mediocre at best.  And the waiter was clearly disgruntled at their Management for their decision, so his service was mediocre too.  The live jazz was nice and the room was beautiful, but all in all, not a good experience for a meal that cost us $50 per person.
review_title: Disappointed there's no more Sunday Brunch Buffet

review:
Everything is good here except the prices. You pay for the beauty, decor, and history of the hotel. The food was good, but nothing spectacular. My friend and I both had the crab salad. Priced at $35 apiece, it certainly didn't taste like $35 worth of food. We couldn't eat it all AND have a conversation in the time allotted for lunch. As soon as we were out on Market Street, my friend asked where he could buy a power bar. I ate a second lunch as soon as I got home. 

I would recommend it for special occasions if you can afford it and want to sit in a beautiful place. If your focus is on food, I would choose elsewhere.
review_title: Go for the ambiance, not the food

review: Great ambiance.  You're indoors, but you'll feel like you're outdoors.
review_title: Great ambiance.  You're indoors, but you...

review: Entertaining out of state visitors and with reservations for breakfast Buffett our wait was almost 20 minutes. The service was slow, our table location was bad, and the food was cold. I should mention that the place did not seem to be crowded or busy. This was a very pricy bad experience. I would not recommend it.
Something for everyone. I thought it was pricey, but found the Garden Court brunch to be worth every dollar. Would love to have Thanksgiving there again!!!!
We found the Garden Court to be a perfect place for a special occasion luncheon. The food and service was superb , and the setting is beyond compare

Perfect Easter Brunch. What you can't avoid is the outstanding design and nostalgia of the Palace- walked in off of Bart and this gorgeous atrium is filled with fine set tables and a professional jazz trio in the middle of it all. The adjacent ballroom is home to what I have called, "the nothing forgotten buffet to end all buffets". I might add that I have always hated buffets and would still consider the Palace every Sunday. Included champagne was a surprising couple steps above the bubbly vinegar most Brunch spots peddle.

I always believe in giving a fair rating when asked...

Don't bother to go to the Sunday brunch at The Palace.
Have a drink in the bar if you are in the area and want to see the Garden Court at the hotel.

This brunch is very over priced and offers very average food...our bill was $555.00 for 5 people and we did not order and alcohol.

I have had the pleasure of eating in many of the top rated restaurants in San Francisco and do not mind paying for a good meal but this was a real disappointment at best.

Take a drive to the Ritz Carlton in Half Moon Bay if you want to have a wonderful brunch with a view.

This place is amazing! Incredible ambience and clearly the best garlic fries I've ever had! The beautiful design of the room and it's. History is worth the price you'll pay. I will be going back again soon!!

Recently, my party of 4 had breakfast at the Garden Court. The food was good, although not as creative as other buffets. Poached eggs with sauce, french toast, mini pancakes, scrambled eggs, bacon, etc, all were nicely prepared and kept warm, and there was fresh fruit and small baked goods as well. When we were leaving, the hotel was setting up for their bruch, and it looked spectacular. So many delicious options, fresh sushi, crepe bar, omlet bar, oyster bar, shrimp, too many to name, and a plethera of desserts to choose from. Considering the price for the breakfast, I would much rather come back for the brunch buffet, a much larger selection and a better price.
My sister and I celebrated our birthdays with afternoon tea. The Garden Court is lovely and as usual the tea was wonderful.
Palace Hotel very old San Francisco and very elegant.  Unbelievable brunch buffet.  Very Very expensive.

The Garden Court is beautiful, the food is delicious and the service is great! The acoustics also great allow one to carry on a conversation without distractions from other patrons. What more can you ask for?
Outstanding experience! Both my wife and I were impressed with both the variety and quality of the food. The servers and other staff were extremely pleasant and very attentive to our needes.

Everything about the Garden Court is grand - its history, the decor and ambiance, the service and the food. The location is very convenient - the heart of the Financial District and close to all Bay Area transit lines (BART, Muni, SamTrans and others). We were welcomed graciously by both the hostess and our server. All 3 of us ordered from the breakfast menu, skipping the buffet which we hope to try at a later date. Everyone enjoyed their meal very much. Our only criticism was the "gaps" in service - our server seemed to disappear for long periods at a stretch, not to be found when we wanted something, but then intruding only when our (business) discussions reached intense levels.

The space itself was quite beautiful--the room is filled with light from the atrium, and the space is set up
in a way that is conducive to private converstation.
Overall, however, we had a poor experience. The service was incredibly slow and inattentive.
We ordered the chicken and pasta dish, as well as the pork dish. Neither were done tastefully,
and both were very expensive for what they were. The cauliflower soup was tasty, but I found 2
pine needles in the soup!?
I have no plans to return unless I want a simple cup of tea in the lovely room.

Very very disappointing, we traveled from the Peninsula in the rain on public transit for this??? For a Saturday breakfast, we were abruptly & rudely informed as we were seated-- which was not advertised properly by the way- "...due to the many reservations expected... sorry". The brunch was self-serve/buffet & extremely expensive & absolutely nothing more than items a low grade hotel would throw out.... would never recommend/never return. Awful coffee, awful service, over priced. No music, ho holiday ambiance. We would like our $100. back.

There is no doubt that the decor inside the Garden Court is breathtaking; however, for $69 per person for brunch - I expected the food to be spectacular. Honestly, I think Vegas brunch buffets were better for a fraction of the cost.
review_title: There is no doubt that the

review: Just to sit surrounded by such elegance was well worth the higher price we paid. The food was wonderful and the service first class. I will go back again.
Such a gorgeous setting! And such a rich history. Not to mention the great food and superb service. I seldom go to the city any more, but I would like to make this a special yearly event.

We had Christmas dinner here and feared a mediocre mass dinner, but were absolutely delighted at the excellence of the food and the marvelous ambiance of the hotel lobby. The display of a curtain of lights and the miniature town were outstanding

The history and tradition of the Garden Court make it a special and memorable place to dine. The service is fast (perhaps a tad rushed) and appropriately attentive. The food, however, is not as memorable as the setting being rather pedestrian. My lunch companion and I were disappointed that the pumpkin soup was flavored with curry, a spice neither of us enjoy, which was not noted on the menu. In short, it's a lovely location with very strong service just don't go for for the food.

We had Sunday brunch at the Garden Court. It was outstanding!! The selections were diverse and the food was well prepared and presented. Service was great - prompt and friendly. I highly recommend the Sunday Brunch event.
review_title: We had Sunday brunch at the

review: The Garden Court is a unique dining environment in SF. It evokes the elegance of the 1890's, with potted palms and a vast canopy of skylights. A very large interior makes it ideal for business meetings in the morning and lunches. Great location, walking distance to most offices downtown.
review_title: The Garden Court is a unique

review: The location for the brunch was absolutely gorgeous with amzing space and ambiance. Definitely a good place for that special occasion. We went with our entire family and had a wonderful time. Although it was a bit pricey, it is well worth the luxurious food and time. one thing we were a little disappointed was that the server did not come by often enough to make sure that our drinks were full. I'd go there again when in town.
In the Palace Hotel with a domed glass ceiling, the brunch was absolutely fabulous with much to choose from.  Romantic music and all you can drink champagne.
review_title: In the Palace Hotel with a

review: It's such a beautiful space, and quiet enough for conversation.  I would definitely go more often if the food were better.  last time my shrimp (or maybe it was crab) salad did not taste fresh.  it wasn't good.  the salad I ordered on this visit looked like it had been dressed and sitting in the refrigerator since before lunch time.  with far too much dressing to boot.

I was in Santa Monica for a long weekend visit. Found Catch on Open Table and gave it a shot with no previous knowledge of the place. We all were so happy with our selection! Situated in a lovely old beach club that has been totally renovated into a hotel called Casa del Mar and Catch restaurant - the decor was timeless but contemporary, elegant and swanky. The food at Catch was delicious, the service exceptionally friendly and attentive and the room inviting and sumptuous. A real find - I highly recommend.

Ask for a table by the window, this is a wonderful place for special occasions.  Service is outstanding, leisurely, cordial, and friendly.  Even a person eating alone will have a great time.  Sadly, the food was not the highlight, somewhat bland and uninspired fish course.

have had breakfast before here but wed made this for the lobby brunch. we'd called to reconfirm & then advised lobby was under a remodel but could go to Catch to eat which we did anyway, but disappointed we'd not been advised ahead. Also wed called ahead advising it was a birthday resevation,could have a window table as wed be there early. We were told no problem. On arrival was some new hostess, our reservation and requests were not located,the special table request ignored. The hostess walked us to a side table we turned down. locations cant guarantee table but didnt appear they were aware of it. disappointed also we'd not been called about the no brunch in lobby, not nice since its a pricey.
review_title: no one told us no champagne brunch

review: Casa Del Mar has always been a great local Santa Monica hangout. food is speculator, service awesome, scenery if breath taking.
The food was heavenly. It was one of the only times my daughter actually ate everything on her plate! And the room opens up to the ocean. A wonderful day.

My entree was disappointing. I ordered a Spanish omelet but it was really a scramble. Everything, including potatoes, was mixed together and cooked in an oven-proof pan. It was dry and needed salt. The major feature of this restaurant is the ocean view.
I'm staying at he hotel where CATCH is located and it's the perfect place for a simple breakfast or a special occasion. I love it

I so want to love Catch. The view is spectacular, the restaurant is comfortable and my girlfriend liked her dinner. Butter lettuce salad and cocktails were great. Unfortunately, i was served a very salty Monkfish which I sent back and was advised by the waiter to switch to Salmon which came well done despite my asking for it medium rare. So, my fish experience here was poor...the hotel had a great band in the atrium and service was good. I only wish my food had been as good as the atmosphere.
We were there for family Easter Brunch: Service was outstanding and the ambiance perfect. However, for the money, the food was ok but not great.
review_title: We were there for family Easter

review: The food was so-so and the service was sparse. The bouillabaisse, a signature disc, was watery and lacked flavor. The shortribs were good, but not for the price tag. I have had better at a corner bbq spot.
review_title: The food was so-so and the

review: Wonderful dining experience. The wait staff were awesome, the view was perfect and the food was cook to perfection.
In my estimate this is a 5 star restaurant and Hotel
review_title: In my estimate this is a 5

review: Wonderful experience, wonderful food and service. I can't wait to go back this summer so we can add the view to our experience. The only problem was the noise, which was intense.
i always enjoy my meal and the ambiance - it's very relaxing
review_title: i always enjoy my meal and

review: Presentation was poor, however it prepared me for the overcooked food...
Very lovely restaurant. It was my first time there. Beautiful view of the Pacific Ocean and good food. Only wish the menu was a little bigger.

Very nice place decked out with all the 5 star trimmings. Service was slow, snooty and over rated. Food...humm, Fries which was not on the menu that was ordered looked great. Sushi below par in quality, seafood which some of us had was over-salted and flavorless. Was even insulted checking in for dinner with reservations tnat I was not properly dressed wearing my tommy best but since I was a hotel guest they would somehow allow my pressence.

I had a delightful time at Catch. This experience was made all the better by the outstanding service from our waiter, the busboys and the runners. Our meals were all served promptly and changes were accommodated. Our waiter was upbeat, warm and still efficient. My only negative is that the seats are bulky which makes it hard to sit close to a loved one. In hindsight we should have availed ourselves of the seats at the sushi bar. By virtue of the food and the outstanding service, Catch made itself one of my favorite dining places in Santa Monica.

As for the ambience, Catch is mature not trendy. It is easy to have a conversation as there is no din. The crowd seems sophistcated and not too concerned about seeing and beeing seen.
review_title: I had a delightful time at

review: Catch accepted our reservation for Sunday lunch, but the regular dining room and menu were closed.  Instead, we were served in a different area with a standard brunch menu that did not include their regular items.  This was a disappointment that was not disclosed when we made our reservation.
animated service, good wine reco from steward, crudo apps fabulous, no matter what though, it is still a hotel scene.
Great specials. We had the hamachi sashimi and black cod. Gyoza was great and so was the tuna roll. I'll pass on the butterfish skewer next time. Nice place with good service.
review_title: Great specials. We had the hamachi sashi...

review: I saw a lot of good reviews for this place online so I thought I would give it a try. The food was awful, and at the end of the day that's all I care about. I tried the bacon wrapped mochi because that's what everyone was raving about online. It is really nothing special and if you don't eat it within 5 minutes, they become cold bacon cookies. The butterfish crudo was very good - tender and tasty. The spicy tuna roll was fishy. The meat skewer sampler wasn't good (stay away from the pork jowls). Service was very good. Ambience was nice but rather empty for a Saturday night.
Went for the ramen enjoyed some fine sake and awesome pork bellly as well. Our host was curtious and helpful. Overall I.enjoyed it and would recommend giving it a try. Don't forget the sake.

We went for the uni hotate and they did not have it sorr that already ruined it fo r us. The beef tongue was good, the ribs too sweet and the ramen just ok. Nothing to rave about. Also the portions were too small so when they say for sharing,it wont work. The price too expensive,service slow, food hit or miss. Wont go back again.
review_title: We went for the uni hotate

review: Very nice in all respects -- the food is high quality and well prepared.

This was our second time here. The food is screaming good! I normally hate tappas style small portions as I am a pig and am never able to get full of off them, but I left Chotto full and happy! The food is delicious, the staff extremely friendly, and the ambiance is just right.
review_title: This was our second time here.

review: We were surprised to find Chotto completely unprepared for a Sunday night before a Holiday. The service, although pleasant, was unbelievably slow. After reading an amazing review in the Chronicle we decided to give it a try. The squid was overcooked, some of the potatoes in their potato salad were undercooked. There really just wasn't anything that creatve and exciting on the menu to satisfy a foodie. The decor was nice but they have some work to do on the menu and the service. I would like to give them another try but I would need to know that some effort was put into training management (for better scheduling), service (for better timing) and kitchen (for better execution). Maybe Restaurant Impossible could get in there to help them.
review_title: Not What I Had Hoped For

review: I love Jardiniere for a pre-ballet meal.  The food is delicious, and the room is lovely.  On my last visit, the food was better than ever, but the service was disappointing.  We each had the duck, which was duck breast and confit. Both the breast and the confit were tender and tasty.  The brussels sprouts  were done to perfection and the s'mores dessert was beautifully presented as well as delicious.  I know it is busy before a ballet performance, but after we were seated we waited fifteen minutes before our drink order was taken and we had trouble getting the bill a the end of the meal   We were seated in the back and saw waiters going by with complimentary gougeres at the beginning of the meal and complimentary sweets after the meal but we were offered neither.   We felt left out!
The design & ambience draw you in and then the menu, food & service make for an extraordinary and pleasant meal. Great memories are made here!

We have been here many times. Most of the times we went on a whim and did not make rsvp and sat at the bar for dinner. Sad to say we received better service at the bar! My water cup was near empty and there was no refill and we bought the bottle water service too.

I had the halibut and pasta.
My husband had the risotto and chicken. Everything was cooked very well but very salty! 

We told the waitress that we are using open table with Apple pay and she has no idea what we meant. 

Need better training of the staff!
We had a great evening. From the ambiance, to the food and the service all went perfectly. We've been before and we will be back.

Dining at Jardiniere is a culinary adventure. From the appetizer through the dessert, the incredible flavors of each dish are to be savored. We have dined here before but this was the first time I tried the Risotto. It was simply the best that I have ever tasted, which did not surprise me. The service, as always, was superb: attentive and graciously friendly without being overbearing. When we received a confirmation call regarding our reservation, my wife mentioned that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. The shared desert plate we were served had "Happy Anniversary" inscribed very elegantly in chocolate. We simply love this place.

I eat out a fair amount and cannot remember having better service.  This was my first time a Jardiniere and while it is not inexpensive, it is definitely worth it.  I highly recommend it for special occasions.  Our server offer good suggestions, including wine pairing and cocktail that made our dining experience even more enjoyable.  While the restaurant was quite busy--Saturday night--it was not too noisy and we were not rushed at all.  Truly a great food experience!
It's always great: the food is excellent/the service is superb/the atmosphere is like NY City/they serve relatively late. We go there about twice a month.

It seems to be living on its reputation and proximity to symphony and opera.  It isn't quite what it used to be.  That said it is still a very nice restaurant.  It is just that it isn't Fleur de Lis or Acquerello but it is getting mighty close to the same price.

If you want to be stunned with great food, great service, and a romantic atmosphere then Jardinere is for you. Lovely, fresh selections were presented in an artful way. Wait staff was most attentive. Our food was truly gourmet, with an eye to presentation. A wonderful place for before or after an arts event at the nearby Davies Hall, or the Opera House, or ballet. Something for every foodie on the menu. We will definitely make it a favorite on our list of San Francisco eateries!
I was happy with the quality of the food and wine. It is a little pricey, which is why I liked the quiet atmosphere. Some of the best service I've had in years.

The first time we chose Jardiniere for its proximity to the WMOH/Nutcracker. This year, we chose Jardiniere for the same reason but wondered if it could possibly live up to last year's experience. We weren't disappointed. EVERYTHING you would hope for and more for a special celebration. The duck confit and the divers scallops are to die for. The ambience of the restaurant, from the gorgeous bar area to the luxurious and elegant upstairs dining, the service, and the attention to detail just top off the experience. What a treat!

I was very pleased by all aspects of our dinner at Jardiniere. It was our first experience and thought that they would try to push us thru quickly because of our opera performance. The service and level of food exceeded all of my expectations. Will definitely go there again before a performance.

Pricy but well worth it. The atmosphere was subdued, the lighting just right. The service was attentive and professional. The food was fresh and well prepared in the classic French style. I would highly recommend it to anyone considering dinner before the theatre, opera or symphony. We would definitely come back.
review_title: Pricy but well worth it. The

review: very disappointed, we have had dinner there few years ago... what a change! the only + is the proximity of the theaters.
Everything about our experience at Jardiniere was outstanding! It was one of the best meals we've ever had. The food was superb, as was the service and ambiance. We highly recommend this restaurant!

We went to dinner before the opera. The restaurant itself is gorgeous, modern and classic all at the same time. Our server was professional and personable. The meal was very good, lots of subtle flavored and beautiful presentation. Nothing seemed silly or over the top - just elegant.

This was perhaps our 10th visit to Jardiniere. They have always come through on the food and service, and have a very good wine list. Most patrons were doing some performance, so there was great activity, when we arrived. That slowed down, as the various venues started their performances. We went from 100% full, to nearly empty, as we were just dining, and had no theater times to worry about. As always, the food and wine (both service and from the cellar) were great.

Sorry that we drank all of the '05 white Burgundies, but all good things must come to an end.
Amazing experience !!! Loved it :) wish you offered more Cabs by the glass . Thanks

Eat here quite often since ballet, opera and symphony ticket holder. Usually everything is excellent. This is the first time the food was not up to the standard expected. Ordered the pork chop which arrived medium warm and grey in color since it had been very overcooked. Could not get waiter s attention early enough to redo with the time allowed for ballet. This should be a basic thing- grilling. Should have never left the kitchen.
The quality of the food was good, but the quantity was not adequate for the amount they charge. The service was not as good as I expected.
review_title: The quality of the food was

review:
Overall the experience was singularly unmemorable except for the sullen waiter. After the somelier opened our bottles the waiter never once poured us a glass the entire time we ate our meal. He seemed peeved that we actually wanted to order dinner.

The food was nothing particularly special either: the tiniest Kumamotos that I have ever seen, a chartcuterie plate that had 3 pieces of each item, making it awkward for a party of 4, the fish was truly boring, the lasagna was dry, and while the duck was the best thing offered it wasn't something I would return for.

All in all, simply not worth the price tag.
The food was wonderful. The duck was beautifully cooked. We also enjoyed the Swiss chard. The desserts were great without being too sweet.
We found that this visit was not up to par. FOOD WAS NOT THE SAME AS WITH OTHER VISITS SEEMS TO BEE SLIPPING
review_title: We found that this visit was

review: Very nice restaurant design with tables spaced a nice distance apart for privacy. The food was fantastic, nice selection to choose from, and everything was delicious! The service was mediocre. The waiter was friendly and knowledgeable enough but the restaurant seemed very busy and our waiter was handling several tables and therefore we experienced long gaps between him checking on us to take our order.
Went for Monday night prix fixe menu. Included wine pairings. Excellent service and scrumptious meal!
Very special experience and every dish was delicious and memorable.

It's a great restaurant. All the food was excellently prepared and the menu was rich with originality. The service was excellent with intelligent and accommodating waiters. Still, with all of that, I found the price to be troubling, with everything being expensive, not just the things with rare ingredients or surely difficult and exacting preparation requirements.

Overall, we had an excellent meal! The risotto was delicious as were the scallops. The wild boar special was a little disappointing, though. Service was outstanding but wine prices are very high which definitely discouraged consumption! The location was perfect for our before-concert dinner....it's just a hop across the street to the Davies Symphony Hall.
kitchen seemed very overwelmed. Had to wait almost an hour for first course. Second course took 45 minutes. Leisurely dining is one thing, this was ridiculous.
Nothing special. Good food, but not anxious to return. Not a good value........

THe waiter Courtney was superb. The courses came quickly I think because this restaurant is used to serving opera/symphony patrons in a rush. Bets to go after 8 and on a night when there is no performance. Portions were the right size (smaller) and really tasty. The crab salad was great and the nettle tagliatelle was superb. The Milky Way dessert was fantastic (nothing like the candy bar).

The wait staff was attentive without being overbearing. The sommelier was very helpful and provided an outstanding recommendation which we thoroughly enjoyed. The is a go-to place for pre-ballet dining. We have never had a bad experience at Jardiniere.
review_title: Alway a great place to dine.

review: Best restaurant in Hayes valley. Probably the best bar in Hayes valley.  A little pricy but worth it.
Food was delicious, however the service was unwelcoming and pretenious.

This was the second of two recent visits to Jardiniere and the food along with the service was impeccable in both instances. We were on the second floor during this most recent visit but both times our waiter was Keith. His level of service, attentiveness and genuine likability were all superb. The details in both presentation and preparation were excellent.

Jardiniere is quite expensive and even our relatively light meal our previous visit seemed quite high, but you leave with no buyer's remorse due to the overall fantastic experience.
My third visit to Jardiniere and it's always superb. From the moment you walk in the door, you are made to feel special. Excellent service, exceptional food.
Wonderful, intense flavors...but just a little too salty! Attentive waitstaff, not intrusive. Did not much care for the disco beat music...wouldn't a little jazz have been a better choice?

The food at Jardiniere was truly a disappointment. My escarole salad was acceptable, but looked downright anemic, helped only by a few dark currants for color. My halibut (expensive for the small size of the portion) was salty on the outside and bland on the inside. My husband ordered the paparadelle. Good thing the waitress advised him to order the entre size, not the appetizer size. The house-made papardelle were tender and flavorful but even the entre size was barely enough to cover the bottom of the bowl. For dessert we ordered a dish that was described as a sort of apple crisp. This had a few razor-thin apple slices, an odd "paste" and some tastless "crumbles." The location close to the Opera House was the single saving grace.

We both had the Boar...outstanding. And hard to find today--fond memories of the Blue Boar. Prices for salads are far too high...28 dollars for two simple, but delicious, green salads...Staff invited us back after the Opera for desert...not many places actually ask...service was outstanding. A go back place but we will watch what we order.
Food, service and wine selection all excellent. Too noisy for an intimate meal. Expensive, but good value.

As has been the case in three previous visits, Jardiniere provided great atmosphere, service and food for a special night out. I was very disappointed that our party of four was initially seated at the worst table in the restaurant despite it being 70% empty on our arrival - an unusual trait for some of the very best restaurants in the City. We were very cordially reseated upon request but why put any customer through that.
review_title: As has been the case in three

review: I was in town on business and I had my wife find a restaurant for us, Jardiniere was a great pick. I chose the Chef's pre-prix and the wine pairing...the seven course dinner was excellent from the first dish to the last. The place give you a very warm and relaxing feeling. Our waiter wasn't the only one laying down the dishes, so at times....it was hard to understand some of our dishes when they would explain what was what.
review_title: I was in town on business

review: Food was actual perfection. Service was prompt and proactive but too stuffy for our tastes. A smile or laugh would've really gone far. Extra effort was made to recognize my friend's birthday but it felt a little like going through the motions. Food was loved by everyone, every dish. Truly memorable, stellar food.

It's a wonderful restaurant for a special occasion. The pastas and entree's were expertly prepared and delicious. The salad, disappointingly average. The service, slow and inattentive. Overall, would probably not go back because it's just too expensive for such mixed results.

We all enjoyed our dinner at Jardiniere The dining room decor is a bit dated, but it is okay. Food was terrific - for everyone. Waiter knew his stuff, but was not particularly friendly. While we were not going to either the Opera or Symphony, this would be a great pre-dinner place for either since it is so close.

Great service and flexibility to tailor the food variation to our preference.
I still resent the additional "tax" this restaurant (and others in SF) impose on the diner to support their employees healthcare.
What an amazing dining experience! The food was superb. Can't say enough. Whatever your taste, the chefs at Jardiniere know how to do it right! And the customer service... second to none!

The short ribs are fall off the bone tender, goose done 3 ways amazing. Chiogga beet salad and squash soup delicious. Great way to start off a special evening at the Nutcracker. Restraunt was very crowded,but the nose level was not too crazy and we felt well cared for and not rushed.
review_title: The short ribs are fall off

review: Food was excellent, beautiful restaurant, attentive service. Scallops appetizer was great, duck and risotto main courses both delicious.
The waitstaff did a superior job but could not overcome problems in the kitchen, which resulted in unacceptable delays before and in between courses.
Right next door to San Francisco Opera House and Symphony Hall this provides a very enjoyable and upscale prelude. Well done!
review_title: Right next door to San Francisco

review: Hadn't been in awhile, and decided to investigate the special Monday night dinners with wine pairings. I think it is a fabulous idea, as well as an amazing value. Jardiniere will move back to the top of the special occasion, or posh drink at the bar, list.

We had visited Jardinere before and had a very nice dinner. With that in mind we chose Jardinere to share with my daughter and Godfather. The menu had no beef. Really? where's the beef? Maybe it was our fault not to ask. We ordered what was listed on the menu. At the next table we overheard the server offering short ribs or a perfectly grilled steak. We were never told we could make that kind of request. I asked our server about the short ribs and steak, she really gave us a really feeble answer. We felt like she just didn't really care. Very disappointing $500. dinner.

We love Jardiniere for its convenient location, elegant ambience, outstanding food and top rate service. When dining there on Friday, my husband asked if he could order the short ribs off the tasting menu. Our waiter was happy to provide it and suggested a different preparation to make it more complete and delicious.

Dining here before/after a performance makes the evening really feel like a special night out on the town.

We have been to this restaurant several times---the food only rarely is outstanding, the service sometimes is very good but occasionally bordering on poor, depending on where you are seated it can be way too noisy, and the prices are VERY high (only with a Passport card is it barely acceptable). Jardinere is only saved by its proximity to Davies and the Opera House.
review_title: We have been to this restaurant

review: We were a party of four and sat in the upstairs dining room. The food and service was fabulous. I had the scallop salad and the Alaskan halibut. Everything was delicious and beautifully prepared. The waitstaff was perfect. Professional, polite, not pretentious, and most of all, attentive. Well worth the splurge.
review_title: We were a party of four and

review: Jai the somalier was excellent as all the wait staff and the food prepared excellent
Solid food, but only OK for the price. Stay clear of desserts, just not up to snuff.
review_title: Solid food, but only OK for

review: Due to traffic, we arrived late and were rushed to get to the Theatre. The waitress was aware of this and made everything move quickly and smoothly. We wished we had not had to rush, but it was great that they accomodated our plans. The food was excellent!
We enjoyed the tasting menu, it was fabulous. I would return just have another Pony Express, yum.

Our experience was fantastic! My girlfriend and I arrived at 7 PM, and were taken upstairs to a table overlooking the bar area, which was great for people watching at the bar downstairs.

Our waiter was attentive, and made suggestions on the menu to order that would be expedited from the kitchen to keep us in time for the 8 PM Symphony performance at Davies Hall.

We will certainly come back, and appreciated the over all service and experience.

In order to fill the restaurant on non performance Mondays they are doing "food nights" We unfortunately got German Night. Food was cooked well, but the choices were very limited. A limited bar menu and the german meal with three glasses of beer for 45$ a bargain,but
not at all what we wanted. We did get the kitchen to make us a bread salad from the normal bar menu.

Very disappointing.
review_title: In order to fill the restaurant

review: Very good food, service, and ambience. Perfect for before or after symphony or opera -- right down the street.

truly a San Francisco treasure
outstanding food in a truly beautiful setting
review_title:
truly a San Francisco treasure
outs

review: By far one of our favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Wonderful food, great wine, awesome service, never fails to impress us. Great location for events at Davies or the Opera House.
review_title: By far one of our favorite

review: Food was greasy and terrible. I had the duck and had so much fat in it I could only have them wrap it up for my dog.

Gnocchi appetizer was spectacular, as was the panacotta dessert. The entrees were quite good but not as special as the appetizer. All in all, we enjoyed our meal and our dining experience and would return.
The food choices were limited. Prices were way too high for what was given.

As season ticket holders for the symphony, we almost always dine at Jardiniere before the performance. It is extremely convenient to Davies and the Opera House, but the food is perfectly prepared, of the highest quality, always interesting, beautifully presented, and delicious. The service is always outstanding, genuine, and the people that work there are very knowledgable and skilled in the art of service. They are there when you need them, very pleasant, aim to please, but very unobtrusive. The sommelier is amazing, and a wealth of information. We dine here 20-25 times a year, and never tire of it. The ambience is very special. Jardiniere is the epitome of "location, location", but unlike some venues, they dont take advantage.
The food and environment are very good. Service fell down a bit around dessert, but overall we think the restaurant is great and we would return.

The menu was full of interesting options. Everything we ordered was incredibly fresh, flavor-packed and tasty. The servers could not have been nicer -- unobtrusive service. This favorite spot never disappoints. If in the area for the ballet, symphony or other occasion, Jardiniere is always something special.
review_title: The menu was full of interesting

review: Very good...a little noisy as the bar funnels up to the upper floor. But very good food and great service.

Our dining experience was perfection. The staff was professional, thoughtful and unassuming. After verifying our concert time, they made menu suggestions which enabled us to leisurely enjoy our meal without being late for the show. The food was remarkable. Everything was delicious. Among other unique flavors, we loved the surprising use of pomegranate arils in the salad. The restaurant hosted a full-house of holiday diners and concert-goers. A good time was had by all. We can't wait for a return visit.

I have been to Jardiniere twice now, and both experiences leave me wanting to come back for more.  The ambiance is quiet and cozy with dim lighting.  This ended up being more romantic than I expected, and it made me look like I had it all planned.  The wine list was exceptional, and the food was sublime.  We told our waitstaff that we needed to be out by a certain time to catch a speaker, and they kept the meal goining smoothly, without us ever feeling rushed.  I would highly recommend this spot for a cozy get-together.  One regret: I found out later they have a cheese cave!  Had I known, I would have made more time for the cheese course, and possibly requested a fieldtrip.  (That could be why they kept quiet about the cave...)

Service was nowhere near up to the standard set by the very good and exceptionally pricey food. The servers mumbled in foreign accents so thick they couldn't be understood, so we missed the usual introductions to the tasting courses. Our waiter incorrectly asserted that one of the wine pairings, a Reisling, was dry. In fact, it was heavily sweet and detracted from its paired course. No offer was made to adjust the bill though we left the glasses untouched after the first sip. Why did we never see the sommelier? Our waiter went back to him several times to ask questions on our behalf. He should have been to our table, given both our interest in the wines in general, and our disappointment with one of them in particular.
A favorite location for celebration dinners--especially if connected with a Civic Center (performning arts) event.

We thought the wine list was fine, but way too expensive  They should have a better selection of medium priced and at least a few lower priced wines.  The somolier was very nice and helped us find a reasonably priced wine that we liked, however.

The food and everything was wonderful..  I would love to have the recipe for the risotto.  My friend and I loved it.  It had frothy stuff all around it and the flavors were fantastic.  And made from a different kind of rice.  Can you ask the chef to share the recipe?
Thank you.
Linda Golm
review_title: We thought the wine list was

review:
Service was outstanding. Loved the decor and design. It's very unique. 
The food was good, but not WOW!!
I love that they accept Passport memberships!! Good for them!

Everything fine but for the very small portion of an asparagus risotto, which was the main dish for a vegetarian member of our party. We were puzzled as to why the portion would be so small given that the ingredients were very inexpensive.

I have been there about 6 times over the last 18 months and find the food consistently excellent; however, I feel the service level is dropping off and not up to par.  This has been the case the last 3 times I was there.  I would still go back but the service should improve.
Great ambiance and service. Good but not great or memorable food. Simple and almost bland. Frankly, overpriced for the result.

I have been to Nordies Bistro many many times over the years.  My husband and I went last week.   The food, service, and the view were very good.
However, I do have a complaint about the servers' attire.  After these many years, they were all dressed in jeans.  Come on, this new dress code is unattractive.   
Please go back to black pants.   If we wanted servers in jeans, we would go to  Hard Rock Cafe.   This is unbecoming of Nordstrom.
This is always my preferred stop during a day of shopping - for a quiet place to grab something tasty.
After several hours of shopping with the family, this place hit the spot. Good drinks for mom and dad and great food for our teenagers.
Pleasant place, and very convenient location. Good and well-priced food. The servers were very nice, but somewhat neglectful - it may be that there are simply too few servers.
food was good albeit a little pricey - wonderful city views
review_title: food was good albeit a little

review: It was great! I came here for a double date before prom, and it was just perfect. Requested a window seat in my reservation, and it was fulfilled perfectly. The waiters were courteous and timely, and the food was excellent.
review_title: It was great! I came here

review: Love it. Hidden gem. Food and service is great - this is a perfect little hidden lunch spot. Not too expensive, and it's not to loud either since most people don't really know about it.
I enjoyed the seafood cioppino, as it was very well prepared and had a good selection of seafood. I definitely will return.

We had excellent service. Attentive waiter and very good food. Kid friendly./
A very nice spot for the family.
Enjoyed our lunch.
Thank you.
I love this place, they remembered that I love my diet coke with orange slices.
review_title: I love this place, they remembered

review: Seated directly on check in with the host. Busy lunch time crowd - I didn't get a coveted window table even though I made a reservation - best to come early or after 1pm. Bar area was empty except for a couple. Selection of pizzas, sandwiches and salads at reasonable prices. My crab bisque was a tad salty to taste but good. The goat cheese tart w/ herb salad was delicious and a perfect lite bite. The guests at the next table were raving about the pizza and sandwiches they ordered. Cocktails were wanting. Their mixologist should try the ones at Kuletos or Cheesecake Factory for inspiration. Service was swift and felt rushed at first but after the food arrived, the waiter checked in periodically, even so-so dessert menu w/o asking.
A very pleasant Thai place with good food.  My cocktail was excellent.
review_title: A very pleasant Thai place with good foo...

review: We had dinner at 7:30 on Thursday evening and had a wonderful meal. Waitress was very helpful. We enjoyed a nice variety of dishes including traditional favorite pad Thai and several curries. All were delicious. Very reasonable prices. Interesting building. Very few diners there that evening. We were a party of six and for about an hour we were the only ones there. Neighborhood was a little sketchy, so perhaps there is a larger lunch than dinner crowd. In any event, we had a very enjoyable evening.

Overall not very impressed. It feels like they're cutting some corners to save money when it comes to the food. Nothing was terrible, but it wasn't amazing either. The curries we had were fine, but a little wimpy on the vegetable, tofu, and shrimp content. The spinach leaf appetizer with shrimp and coconut was good  with a welcome spicy tanginess  but the portions were pretty small as things go.

The noise level was too high given how sparse the crowd was (it was maybe 30% full when we dined around 7pm on a Friday night).

Both the customer service and food seemed somewhat "average" to me, although I greatly enjoyed the room itself with raised/vaulted ceilings, brick walls, atmospheric lighting, and bar downstairs. Might be a decent place for a date or birthday celebration. Food was okay, but it did not move me.
Good but not notable among the plethora of Thai restaurants. The shrimp & pineapple special was good.

I organized a group of old friends to meet up, five of us in total. Service was great and forgiving, considering we couldn't focus enough on the menu to order in an organized fashion. The food was great for sharing and everyone had a good time, amongst ourselves and with the staff. They even allowed us to close out the restaurant! Overall, a great experience!
review_title: I organized a group of old

review: Kitschy, free valet & tasty foodmy kind of place, and the kind of place that reminds you of why San Francisco is so awesome. Will return for future occasions without a doubt.

Mussels are the biggest I have seen in the city...LOVE all the appetizers! We really enjoyed our meal. The bone in filet was delicious, along with the crab legs. Great for a special occasion or special date night!

I took to prospective clients here for what I had hoped would close the final deal.  Despite our reservation we still had to wait 30 minutes.  It put a huge damper on what would otherwise been a great evening.  I felt bad for the host.  The manager was actually a little rude.  Our waitress a young brunette girl was fantastic. 
Bone in filet was amazing.
The Steak.  The Crab.  That is what you need to know.  Bobo's is amazing and what surf and turf is all about.  The wine list is excellent, cocktails are well made, and the staff is wonderful.

I reserved for 8:30 Saturday 
Arrived 15 late due to difficult parking. The hostess was great, patient, and working very hard. We sat at the bar and had a glass of wine. Limited wine list and only slightly passable. 15 minute wait. 
Crowded place and we were seated in a crowded room. The waiter was slammed and forgot part of our order. He didn't make us feel very special. The menu is beef. We felt like lost tourists and steaks are $40 each. No vegetables and no sauce. An overbaked potato is $8.00.
There's better restaurants all over town in other neighborhoods.

First and foremost, this is the first time I've ever typed a review for a restaurant. Usually, I don't bother, I don't like being negative. In this case it's necessary. Secondly, I work for a meat company-I know quality meat and I'm into food. I know what a quality taste/meat is. I've seen Matt Cain recommend this place. I saw the reviews on Yelp. It boggles my mind how this place got so many great reviews. The shrimp ($31.95) double portion were sub par. Not high quality. The flavor wasn't there. I could have made them better myself. The New York bone in ($44) was tiny. It wasn't tender. It didn't taste dry aged. It was very disappointing.
My GF got a $13 mojito served in the same glass my $3.50 Shirley Temple. $125 for sub par quality.

Had a meal at Bobo's this past weekend and it was exceptional. We were seeking a night out with great steaks in a vibrant, unpretentious atmosphere. Each of the bone-in filet, bone-in NY and the 10 oz filet were prepared beautifully and were well received by all diners. Appetizers (shrimp, tuna carpacio) were also flavorful and well prepared. Unable to comment on the wine list as we brought our own bottle but the cocktails were are all expeptional. Lastly, I would be remiss if I did not note the service; nuanced, attentive to detail and a playful repartee that we were only too happy to indulge. If a great steak with careful service and a colorful ambiance is the goal, Bobo's delivers amply. We will be back soon!
review_title: Had a meal at Bobo's this

review: We've been to many other steak houses in SF, and really enjoyed Bobo's. Very good all around

In bone filet Steak is perfectly cooked and it just melts in your mouth. The mussels were precisely roasted and the butter drawn sauce are succulently delectable. I highly recommend them as I am a discerning diner when it comes to how the seafood and steak are done. Ask for Jennifer to attend your table: She's awesome!

Gigantic portions, so ladies should consider splitting an entree.. Love the filet mignon, with bone in. Consider ordering one side per couple because of he large portion. Recommend the excellent cauliflower with garlic. Over
Excellent steak restaurant: high quality and very good professional and courteous service.

My friend and I went for Dungeness crab and it was cooked with way too much garlic, severed with heavily garlic bread and garlic and oil veggies. Could not handle so much garlic and found myself with an upset stomach the next day. Dungeness Crab is so delicious, sweet and mellow that to overpower it with garlic is, in my estimation, a crime.
review_title: My friend and I went for Dungeness

review: One of the best steaks ever. Was in from out of town and ask where to get a good steak that wasn't a chain. Bobo's was a great spot.
review_title: One of the best steaks ever.

review: in short -- one of the best steak houses in the US!
Our reservation was at 8:45 and we did not get seated until 9:30. There was so much chaos that I wanted to leave immediately after seeing it but my friends convinced me to stay.
Excellent steak house, bone-in filet was mouth watering. Friendly service.
Bobo's is always great. My wife and I love to go, whether it is for a special occasion or for a night out with friends.
had a date night with my gf here and definitely made a great impression all the way around. highly recommend
review_title: had a date night with my gf

review: Filet mignon with the bone-in. Perfectly cooked, rich texture, tender, cured to perfection.10 points! Sides were great as well. Especially enjoyed the mac-n-cheese.

This was my second visit. The first was with a group who were regulars, and it was good and memorable, and raved about it.
