My husband and I went recently, and we were sat in a high traffic location, near a bus table and busy, narrow doorway. Also, my chair was so close to the next table that the wait staff had to brush up against my chair, several times during the evening, to get past me to serve other tables. We thought the place was just busy, and that we got the only open table, but we noticed when we left, that there were several open, and more private, tables throughout the place. The steak was very good, but the crab was greasy and a bit bland. The exta napkin and finger towels came after I splatterd crab grease on my front.
My husband & I loved our dinner at Bobo's! We really enjoyed the ambiance & the food was great!
Great hostess, waitress, sizzling mussels. Soup, salad and steak also first class.
Best steak I've had! This is a must visit restaurant for me when I am in the SF area.
The food is great, but the dining room is small and feels a bit crowded.
review_title: The food is great, but the

review: Bobo's food was amazing, the service however was lacking. After waiting 20-30 minutes past my reservation to get a table, I was disappointed that not only did the hostess not apologize for or even mention the delay, but that another table was open directly next to ours, making me question the source of the delay. We then remained seated for roughly 7-10 minutes before anyone greeted us/gave us water/asked for drink orders, even though members of the wait staff walked past our table 5 or 6 times. The waitress, after taking our order, had to come back to confirm part of it, because she didn't bother to write it down. With the caliber restaurant that this is, and the amount of money I pay for a meal, I definitely expect better service!
Dinner was excellent. The bone in filet was incredible.

The first time I went I had one of the best steaks of my life.... the second time I took a bunch of friends for a birthday, & discovered that you have to pay the price for the best steak ever.... don't waste your time on the smaller steaks that seem like a good deal, they're nowhere near as good.  I called a week ahead to request that the chef whip up some bearnaise sauce for us, & they flat out refused...  Not the kind of service you'd expect from such a fancy, pricey place.  Still, the restaurant is old & has character & the service is great.  Still looking for the restaurant that goes above & beyond, but this is a good solid steakhouse.
review_title: The first time I went I had

review: Great steak. The bone-in filet is HUGE. I think its more ounces than claimed on the menu.
it was ok, nothing to write home about, no real flavor in the food, overall C
review_title: it was ok, nothing to write

review: Just had the crab which was ok. Didn't try the steak, though. I liked the cucacabra marg, but you might not want it if you don't like cucumber.
review_title: Just had the crab which was

review: Our overall experience was excellent. The meal was superb from start to finish. We had the crabcakes with cranberry sauce, which were the best we've ever had. We both had the bone-in filet, which was one of the ten best steaks we've ever eaten, maybe one of the best five! The blood orange sorbet dessert was amazing; I've never had anything like it. The wine list was extensive, and we enjoyed our wine thoroughly. We highly recommend this restaurant to others.
OMG. This place is to die for. The food and service were both excellent. I highly recommend it.
review_title: OMG. This place is to die

review: A very charismatic restaurant w/superior food fair. The specialty is beef and crab, and clientele should remember that.

BOBO'S AS ALWAYS DID NOT FAIL TO PLEASE (ALL RESTAURANTS SHOULD HAVE A SERVER LIKE the one we had) ALWAYS ORDER YOUR STEAK MEDIUM RARE & PAIR IT WITH A DARK WINE,VERY DELICIOUS, PLEASE DO NOT SKIP DESSERT & THE COFFEE, THE APPETIZERS HAVE A WAY TO GO BOBO'S NEEDS TO LEARN PLEASE NOT TO MUCH LETTUCE,BUT DO ORDER THE FISH ENTREE AS AN APPETIZER AND SHARE IT OR THE THE INCREDIBLE ROASTED MUSSEL,CRAB,& SHRIMP SERVED ON A IRON PLATE THE SIZE OF A MONOPOLY GAME BOARD AS AN ENTREE BUT PLEASE BRING AN APPETITE. I DO RECOMMEND BOBO'S & WILL DEFINITELY SEE THEM AGAIN P.S. ALL THE GIRLS THERE ARE ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL & WONDERFUL & PLEASE ORDER A DRINK THAT NEEDS TO BE SHAKEN NOT STIRRED YOU WON'T BE DISSAPOINTED.
review_title: BOBO'S AS ALWAYS DID NOT FAIL

review: Overall a decent experience. We waited 15 minutes for our table after our reservation. The crab cakes were nothing special, not bad, but not great. The steaks were outstanding. Charging $39 for a steak and $8 for each side dish, we felt like being gouged on the sides. Decor needs updating.
I love Bobo's. The dry aged steak is amazing! As well as the yams, twice baked potatoes, sweet chard, dunce cones, lobster soup...
review_title: I love Bobo's. The dry aged

review: Outstanding Steak - truly exceptional - attentive friendly service

Bobo's was excellent.  Steaks were fantastic! The sourdough was unique and different in it's preparation and just so good.  Our waitress, Amber, was awesome!  We had a great secluded table upstairs.  Loved everything about the place.
The best steakhouse in SF, we have tried them all, and not one is as good as Bobo's
Everything we had was amazing! Our overall favorites were definitely the cornbread and the potato dumplings served with the Chipotle Pork Tenderloin. Five stars, we would definitely go back!
This place is always good. The service is top notch and the menu is broad and well executed. We've been here 3-4 time and never been disappointed.
review_title: This place is always good. The service i...

review: I've dreamed about the BBQ shrimp since we were there a few nights ago. And the fried chicken. And the seafood stew. And the cornmeal-fried oysters ... Town Hall is an absolute gem of a restaurant. The most comforting of comfort food. If you have not been there please remedy your situation immediately and make a reservation. Your soul will thank you for it.

Three out of four entrees were great.  The St. Louis ribs had no sauce and a strange seasoning. Even though the waitress raved that the ribs were very tender, they were tough and perhaps undercooked.  Fortunately, the rest of the group had a better experience.  The sea bass, salmon, and linguine were all delicious.  The desserts were a hit.  Butterscotch over chocolate pot de creme, plum cake, banana icebox cake and chocolate torte were all wonderful.  They were passed around and couln't decide which was the best.
Outstanding event at town hall. The food was great, the drinks were unique. Everything was top notch. Only observation- the front door to the resturant is positioned strange.
Great service. Interesting and yummy food. Great ambiance whether for lunch or dinner, work or pleasure. Would totally recommend Town Hall.

Honest, not overdone, menu choices. Everything we tried was flavorful and enjoyable. Some of the items would lead you to become a"regular". Many restaurants become "over" creative. Town Hall does a great job with foods you recognize.
Town Hall has become one of my favorite SF places for lunch meetings. It's warm and inviting and the food is always top notch!
review_title: Town Hall has become one of

review:
I picked this restaurant up while looking at the top 100. It was new and got nice reviews. I needed a Sunday night reservation and this place fit the need. We were all delighted with our food. My only modification would be more choice for non meat eaters.
I thought that the prices were quite fair and everyone very pleasant without overdoing it. Would be happy to go there again.

Made a special trip to from LA to SF for the weekend because I was craving a return to Town Hall. But was utterly disappointed when we arrived and they didn't have their Fried Chicken available. So we left.

Took a freind for fer birthday. Interesting space with exposed brick, high ceilings, windows, but could use table linens. Very loud & then fire alarm went off. Some kind of mix up about who had our table, so we had 2 waiters resulting in conflict. Waiter was bit flirtatious with my friend. We thought odd. Wine recommended was not what we discribed. They forgot to bring us bread until we asked, by then out salads were gone. Waiter not very helpful with selections. My freind got porkchops which were good & I got salmon which was tiny. Maybe we were there on an off night, but being an out of towner, I will not be rushing back. There are too many other great choices with great food & sevice in SF. Overall experience was disappointing.

We have been coming here for 9 years to celebrate our Anniversary. The food, staff and ambiance never keep us coming back for more years to come.... not to mention the chocolate butterscotch pot de creme. The special touch of an additional "congratulations" dessert is greatly appreciated. We tell everyone we know to go to Town Hall.
review_title: We have been coming here for

review: Four of us had dinner recently after a matinee theater performance. The food was delicious, and the service was excellent. I especially enjoyed the butterscotch and chocolate pot de creme for dessert.
review_title: Four of us had dinner recently

review: We returned to celebrate a friend's birthday. We all thoroughly enjoyed our delicous food and leisurely evening. Our waiter was knowledgable, attentive and friendly. The dining room's tables were filled with a variety of guests ranging from couples on dates, to families with children, to a large group and tables such as ours with two or three couples sharing an evening. All of us seemed to be equally enjoying the restaurant, our meals, and the night. We'll all highly recommend the restaurant and hope to return ourselves.
review_title: A Great Night at Town Hall

review: Been here many times. Food is terrific, I call it Cajun comfort food. Staff very friendly but the noise. Oh the noise. I'm certain they can do something to bring it down a bit without ruining the overall feel. Sometimes it seems easier to hear someone's conversation from across the room than the one you're having at you own table. Still a great place. We would go more often if the noise level was say more like Boulevard (which is also noisy but livable).
My "go to" restaurant everytime I am in San Francisco!

We arrived early for our reservation and sat at the bar until our table was ready, the house cocktails were excellent. We were seated promptly and our server was very helpful decanting the wine we had brought with us. All of our courses arrived in a timely manner and were very good. The oysters and tuna tartar was fresh, the veal meatballs were delicious. Our main courses of pork loin and duck breast were perfectly cooked and the desserts were excellent. We certainly will return!
review_title: We arrived early for our reservatio

review:
This was my second time coming to Town Hall and the food never disappoints! Just amazing! I had been craving their ribs which fall off the bone and are superb.

Service was great and our waitress was very attentive and outgoing. Definitely going to make this a regular dinner spot.
review_title: This was my second time coming

review:
The overall experience was very pleasant. While not a problem, service was somewhat on the slow side. My table had good conversation which made it less noticeable.
Will definitely return due to food, location and overall ambience.
Food, service,and restaurant was great. It was definitely one of the best birthday celebrations! Thank you Town Hall

Hillary is the best server. She is on point with her recommendations and knows how to create a special atmosphere and experience for her tables. I've been here for birthdays and I always ask to be sat In her section. She knows her stuff! She is also knowledgeable about other sf restaurants and is so patient and kind. She is a gem and just makes Town Hall even better. In terms of food I feel like I've never been disappointed with anything on their menu. I love their ribs, shrimp appetizer is a must and the Dr Louis cocktail is my favorite. The doughnuts are my favorite for dessert. Love, love, love!
The food and service are good, but overpriced.  They also made us wait 25 minutes for our table when over half the restaurant was empty.  Typical San Francisco nonsense.
review_title: The food and service are good,

review: Did the Dine about Menu and had a really nice meal. Pork Chop was one of the best I have ever had. Staff are friendly and attentive. Will be back for another Dinner on the regular menu which is surprisingly reasonable considering the quality of the food. If they have the Okra side try it - a really nice treat.

I love this restaurant but I have never heard it so loud. I have eaten there 8 - 10 times, but this time the noise was just too much. We came with our three children, and moving them outside during the meal seemed difficult, so we endured. But I have never been through anything like it. You could not hear each other across the table.
I Loved this place and will be back many many more times!
The food was overspiced. We felt that the corkage of $40 for two bottles of wine was unwarranted since the table of 4 purchased 3 glasses of wine and 2 cocktails.

First time dining there, it was fun and lively. We had the oysters and the salmon tartar as starters, oysters lovely but the tuna was a bit too spicey. The ribs were grand! And the coffee and donuts, and the butterscotch pudding were delicious! We would go again.

First time at Town Hall & it really delivered. The servers were friendly, the food was great. Had the BBQ shrimp & veal meatballs for appetizers. Both were excellent. For entrees, the four of us had the salmon, trout, ribs & fried chicken. Everyone enjoyed their dishes.

I have to take the time to boast about my experience at town hall. I had called the restaurant before my arrival to set a lovely romantic evening with my honey and when I arrive they superseded my expectations. I had the most romantic table, candle lit, wine in the decanter and after our meal different staff members wished my boyfriend a happy birthday. I had never been to the restaurant, I knew no one there, the fact they communicated as such left an amazing impression. My boyfriend and I were absolutely impressed. Veronica was our server and she did a stupendous job. I recommend the restaurant for any lovely occasion. I could have ate 5 orders of the bbq shrimp- so tasty. :)
review_title: I have to take the time to

review: Dinner was excellent. Every thing was served hot. Only complaint was time between ordering and each course was a little too slow. We had an early reservation and there were families with small children. The restaurant appeared to be very "kid friendly" and appropriate, that time of the evening.
Town Hall continues to impress us. The service was fantastic, the food always remarkable. The fish is always prepared to perfection, the desserts wonderful!
Great place to try new eats.  There is a communal table up front, but plenty of other seating arrangements spread around the rest of the restaurant.
review_title: Great place to try new eats.

review: I have been to Town Hall 3 times over the past few years and the food has been consistently good. The place is too noisy to have a conversation without shouting, but the food cannot be faulted.
review_title: I have been to Town Hall 3

review: Really delicious casual American food. The crab ravioli have generous amounts of crab in them and taste like dungeness crab (instead of drowning in some cloying cream sauce). Everything demonstrates attention to detail - where else can you find warm, sweet & savory corn bread in the shape of little ears of corn. The service is efficient and friendly. I only took one star off, for ambiance, because noise levels make conversation very difficult.

Sunday night 6:45 pm reservation. Hostess was great--I requested a quiet table,she gave us a lovely table-cloth covered private table in an alcove. Service was terrific-friendly, helpful, present just enough. Spectacular food. Highly recommend Circle'o'Goat, goat prepared 3 ways with a delicious dab of creamy soft goat cheese to the side. The goat shoulder prepared similar to pork belly, succulent and sweet. Goat leg grilled rare and complemented the small savory spicy goat sausage. Creative and fun dish. Dad's sea bass was cooked perfectly as well, with a lovely piquillo pepper sauce. We had the butterscotch chocolate pot de creme for dessert which would easily send 2 people to heaven. On weeknights, it can be noisy (food still great!)
The dinning experience for the four of us was very good. We had a very knowledgeable waiter with great food and wine recommendations.

The food at Town Hall is always delicious and surprising at the same time.  The unusual fondue appetizers are always a tasty choice.  However, the noise level is so loud that we don't often go there with friends, because it is so hard to have a conversation.  On the other hand, it has an energetic vibe, if you are in the mood for that.
review_title: The food at Town Hall is always

review: While the food was excellent and our service good, my credit card was swiped for not only my bill, but other diners, to the tune of 3x my tab. I have been informed by the bank that it will take 10 days or more to correct. When contacting the manager at Town Hall, I was told it was my bank's error, when clearly Town Hall made the error by swiping my card for another table's ticket. I would have been ok with a simple apology from the restaurant instead of a denial of responsibility. I won't return for this reason.
As usual, the food was delicious. The noise factor is a deterent, however.
review_title: As usual, the food was delicious.

review: Food and service was good. Noise level is somewhat high so hard to have a conversation.
Was a great spot for our business dinner. Our server was wonderful.
review_title: Was a great spot for our business

review: Superiorly attentive service, outstanding burger which I proudly ate in a non-meat-eater's world, tuna tartare app was simply delicious.
The food is outstanding and so was the service. I always make a stop at Town Hall when I am in San Francisco.
Tables are too close together. Too noisy. ambiance leaves a lot to be desired.

Very good upscale American cuisine (e.g., delicious fried chicken, injected with butter and seasonings, with mashed potatoes with bacon gravy). Very nice wine list, a bit pricey, but with enough bargains to make it okay if you're not afraid to try non-California, non-French wines. The chef is from New Orleans and it shows, with an accent on Louisiana and Southern cuisine. We had one small problem (the hot chocolate one of our group ordered for dessert came cold) and after one failed attempt they finally corrected it and didn't charge for the drink, which was appropriate. Our waitress was knowledgeable and nice.

Our server was very nice and not intrusive. She split both the salad and the soup for the two of us. The beet salad was yummy, but I still haven't found a beet salad that beats (no pun intended) the beet salad we ate at Olivos, the Italian restaurant at Bellagio in Las Vegas. The butternut squash soup had a surprising kick, but I'm glad I only had half of the soup, since towards the end it was getting overpowering and I was soaking pieces of bread on it to dilute the strong flavor. The salmon was tasty - but the brussel sprouts had their core removed, so there wasn't much of their little leafs there...
review_title: Our server was very nice and

review: We went for Dine About Town. The food was incredible. Their specialty dessert, the butterscotch chocolate pot de creme, is to die for. It's enough to share, but if you want your own, go for it! Would love to go back.
review_title: We went for Dine About Town.

review: First rate servvice: speedy, friendly, and professional. A very good place for lunch, but it is noisy and boisterous. I liked that.
Very attentive, non-snobby service with good recommendations on meals. Excellent, exquisitely prepared food.

combinations of ingredients that are unusual and incredible pleasing. airy dining room - tho the air conditioning whips around at great speed creating discomfort. the service is erratic. worth a visit in spite of this.
cool room, and decent food but it was so noisy, we couldn't talk.

We came here to celebrate our daughter's graduation from Stanford. What a great choice! The food can be described as upscale comfort food ( look at the menu! It's so creative and delicious). I was actually sad when my entree was gone! There was an excellent selection of wines, the place has a great ambiance, and I can say that it was one of the best neals of my life.( I also loved everyone elses choice).I heartily reccommend it.
We were stuck in traffic but they went out of their way to seat us promptly, even after being almost an hour late. They made us feel welcome, and they were very friendly.
review_title: We were stuck in traffic but

review: Very pleasant place, good service.  Delicious food.  I asked for and was given a quiet table, but otherwise it's pretty noisy.

The people who work at Town Hall were extraordinarily friendly and accommodating.  Actually, I had a mini-emergency at home just before we had to leave to walk over to the restaurant--in fact, I called from the car on my way to the emergency room to let them know that we most likely wouldn't be able to be there on time, and perhaps not at all--and they asked if we wanted to change our reservations for later that evening.  I said that would be great if it was possible--and we did show up an hour and 1/2 later. The hosts greeted us warmly,seated up promptly, and graciously treated each of us (my husband and myself) to a glass of champagne! The menu is very interesting and delicious. We will definitely go back. Thanks so much--
review_title: The people who work at Town

review: Very authentic Italian food, service, personality.  The emphasis is on the great food at reasonable prices.  Love the wiaiters and the whole ambiance of unpretentious but delicious Italian food.
Good, authentic Italian cuisine, but not a "lick the plate clean" quality. Very noisy and felt a bit rushed when taking our order.

I went on the recommendation of a friend. Lots of seafood options,  including grilled calamari - yummy.  The ricotta gnocchi were light, fluffy little pillows in a flavorful beef ragu.  The waitstaff was attentive and service was quick.
I've been in this restaurant 3 times and i absolutely love it!! Amazing food and service! !

The food was outstanding. Unfortunately the sevice did not match. Drinks came fast, even though the waiter seemed distracted. We ordered 3 courses, apetitizers came quickly, but the salad never did? Then our waiter brought our food, looked at a table with no salad and returned our main course to the warmer! Out came 4 great ceasar salads and when those finished out came the main course, clearly worse for the wait. It was still great, I can only imagine how fantastic it would have been if our waiter had been focused on ALL his tables. Then the same thing happen with desert. We got the coffee quickly. A while later a surprised waited apeared at our table only to dash off and return with our dessert.

We had such a great time the first night with our friends, we walked all the way back before dinner on our second night just to sit at the bar. We had a bottle of wine and shared the Fennel Salad. We ended up staying almost 2 hours just watching the staff set up for shift and greet the first guest. Wonderful experience, we will go back every time we visit North Beach!
review_title: Reminded my of being in Italy!

review: Wonderful service! We were warmly welcomed on what was our first visit. There are so many Italian restaurants in North Beach that it's difficult to choose. The food at Ideale was very good. The ambiance just was so-so, and lacking in charm, but that's my only criticism. We had a very nice experience.

Ideale is a true North Beach favorite, it is everything you think about when one wants to feast on authentic Italian food. The calamari e rughetta is grilled perfectly, the pastas are handmade, and each special for the evening is fresh and creatively prepared, I like to order the Pesce del giorno, fish of the day. The wait staff is charming, handsome, knowledgeable, and real Italians! My husband, friends, and I have been dining at Ideale for over a decade, it is always our first choice for an Italian dinner. A little added hint, the bar is a blast to have dinner at too. Bravo to Maurizio Bruschi chef and owner.
review_title: A Real North Beach Italian Place

review: Although the food was good, the service was BAD!  The waiter forgot to bring our appetizer even though we asked for it twice. My husband ordered lasagna and they were out of it. They offered a substitution that was mediocre. In an attempt to make the experience better the waiter brought us dessert. However he did not ask us to select a dessert and simply brought a dessert to us that we don't eat.
Wonderful place in a great neighborhood, first time there and would definitely return. The food is tasty, well prepared and has a homemade quality to it. Very good dining experience.
Winderful menu. I don't know how I have missed thia neighborhood gem all these years. A real find!
Loved the authentic Italian food and the waitstaff was very efficient. Owner very nice also.
We went to celebrate a birthday - two men and one woman - and had a wonderful time. The food was great as was the service. Very authentic Italian experience.
review_title: We went to celebrate a birthday

review: The food was the same - decent.  The price was increased by 50% since my last visit, which granted was a while ago, but I've eaten better food at their price.  No longer worth it for me.  Better places to check out in North Beach for the same or cheaper.  Recommendation to Bocce - drop the prices or put a little more heart into the meal.  Oh yeah, the kids ate spaghetti and meatballs.  The meatballs were pretty bad.
review_title: Bocce used to be decent Italian at a good price.

review: A secret that's been kept. A delightful, affordable hideaway tucked away in a quuet corner of North Beach.Valet parking, live jazz and an outdoor patio? Belissimo!
Had a great dinner after a day of shopping. Service was excellent and also had a 3 piece band playing which added to an enjoyable night.
review_title: Had a great dinner after a

review:
Although my dinner of chicken parm. was OK, my husband claims his - linguini and clams was the best he has had on the West Coast. Understandably this was not prime season for tomatoes, but the Caprese salad was tasteless.. I have trying to replicate dinner from Boston's North End since moving here 15 years ago. This definitely did not meet my expectations. The warm bread tasted like Pillsbury's and the dessert menu was bland...
I will keep on searching.....
We've eaten here many times. It's a good go-to place for your basic pasta dishes. Decent wines. Nice outdoor area to sit on a warm night.

Waiter suggested Manicotti and it was the best..
very energetic..a few large groups and overflowing bar scene.
a bit noisy and the waiter forgot about us..but
lots of youth all around

I picked infusion at the last minute because we missed our reservation to another place. It was nice and the food was actually tasty the drinks are good but the service wasn't the best, she was nice but not very attentive. We has to ask more than once for several items. On the better side you get to stay for the night as it turns into a lounge music is cool and crowd is diverse and fun, but the drinks at the bar at night are WAY to expensive!! $15 a piece. I would return though especially for a bday dinner or something it's a nice setting overall.

This is not a restaurant! This is a nightclub that puts tables on the dance floor and serves food taken from the freezer section at Costco. Was greatly disappointed in the quality of the food and the ambience. I assumed this would be a restaurant next to a club but I was wrong. While we were still eating (had to be Valentine's Day to boot), they were setting up for the club opening. Probably would be a great nightclub experience, but a terrible dining choice.
review_title: This club is NOT a restaurant!

review: The ambience is great and I love the interior. The service and food was super!! Can't wait to go back.

The food and drinks are oustanding, but keep in mind you are dining in a lounge / nightclub. The ambiance is a swanky cocktail lounge with decor, lighting and music to match if you dig that kind of scene. Check out their website for pictures. The food was actually very good all the way around (apps and dinner). Service was very attentive since they tend not to draw a big dinner crowd. You can dine in the lounge or in the restaurant. Make sure they check you in properly to recieve your dining points. They didn't for me, and it was a hassle to get my points since I didn't keep the receipt for dinner.
review_title: The food and drinks are oustanding,

review: Had an overall outstanding experience. Don't have ONE complaint! Will definitely go back. LOVE LOVE LOVE the ambiance.

My husband and I took a shot at this restaurant. We had a very early reservation -7:30 which was perfect for this 40-something married couple. The menus were very cool - light up. The food was really wonderful. Very flavorful and fun - spicy crab noodles, tuna tartare, sliders just to name a few. The portions were comparable to other fine dining places. The dessert -which we shared was small but mouth watering. We ordered the hazelnut donuts with sauce. Fresh and delightful. The bar crowd was very young and seemed a bit touristy (but that was at 7:30-9:00). The line outside was starting to form as we were leaving. Food -tasty and different, service- great, fun atmosphere.
review_title: My husband and I took a shot

review: Horrible service, had problems with the bill, the food was average at best!  And the party scene was extremely cheesy.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review:
They have free corkage on Mondays, so bring your own bottle. Unfortunately, it is for wine only, not beer. Not sure why 750ml of beer is different from 750ml of wine. 
The portions are large by SF standards. The food is very good, but it could use some improvements. My braised lamb shank was tough in portions where is all should be falling off the bone. 
Service was friendly. Did take a while for our bottle to get opened though. Server was very attentive otherwise, stopping by numerous times to see if all was going fine. 
I've been here three or four times and it is reliably good.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: As others have noted, Urban Tavern is basically a hotel restaurant.  The upholstered benches look and feel very shabby and I sank down so far on it that I felt like I should ask for a telephone book to sit on so I could join the height of the rest of the table.  The food is extremely basic. The hamburger was overdone and the fries were cold.  The pork shoulder with vegetable hash was fine but was really just a couple slices of pork roast with some sauteed vegetables.  There was nothing special about it at all and it was pretty expensive for such a mediocre dish.  Service was fine and they made sure we got out in time for the theater but that's the best thing I can say about it.  I won't be returning.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: It's hard to imagine this restaurant can survive in San Francisco -- no doubt unsuspecting Hilton hotel guests fill many of the seat or others like us - searching for a meal before theatre.  The quality of ingredients and cooking are seriously sub-standard.  Simple entrees like fish and chips and Mac and Cheese are $20+.  I cannot recall a worse dining experience EVER in our fair city.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: Our waiter was very courteous, down to earth and classy at the same time. Food was very good but not exquisite. I appreciated the menu, with such things as the seared scallops and stuffed trout that we ordered. However, for the money, I'd go at lunch next time and pay a little less.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: Although Urban Tavern is a little high-priced ($12 for a Bloody Mary), the food was really good. Our waiter was from Russia and very personable. The menu was small but everything on it sounded scrumptious. I can highly recommend the Peanut Butter Cup for dessert - the cup itself was not anything like the Reese's version - it had a very creamy, light peanut butter filling and was accompanied by a homemade piece of peanut brittle and a scoop of Fiorello peanut butter/chocolate swirl gelato which is the best ice cream I have ever had!

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: I went there for dinner, and I must say I was a bit disappointed at the lack of vegetarian options. Most modern places make a token effort. Having said that, the friendliness of the staff and the quality of the food I did get in the end was excellent. If there had been at lest a single vegetarian option on the menu I'd say I was headed back there.
review_title: Very nice place, with good food

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: The appetizers were good....had a limited time due to theater reservations...the mussels and the kale caesar salad were very good. It was difficult to get the attention of the waitstaff, including just to get menus, place an order and get bill.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review:
We had a birthday dinner with eight people in attendance for our first ever dinner at Urban Table. We were ALL pleasantly surprised at just how GOOD our evening turned out to be! Everything from the cocktails to the adorable dessert plate brought out for our birthday boy was top notch! Our waiter was very friendly but not overbearing and had a twinkle in his eye that everyone noticed--seemed that he enjoyed his job, and that really does make a difference.

We'll be recommending Urban Tavern to our friends, and eating there again soon!
review_title: We had a birthday dinner with

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: Drinks and bar are active - I've gone before for a quick drink. This time we went for drinks and dinner. Drinks were very good. Food variable - from just ok to good - if not outstanding. I had mussels - ordinary and small. Partner had sausage and pretzel - loved it. I had fish and chips - not the best I've ever had but better than many - good fish and nice chips. Partner had veal - very good - but it just comes with a mound of white rice - seems expensive for that. Ambiance is casual - noisy - energetic. Service was very good and attentive. Not a destination restaurant quality but ok and the BEST part - parking was free for 5 hours.
review_title: Not a destination restaurant but OK

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review:
Nice comfortable restaurant in the heart of SF- good place for families and visitors who want some good food in an unpretentious setting.
Also, they did a good job getting us to the theater on time.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: Third time going, the food was good as always, but this time the service was, well awkward. It was not necessarily bad but the waitress seemed new or just not good at her job, I couldn't really tell. Other than that I like this place and had no issues with service the other two times I was here.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: Enjoyed our dinner, Although burnt the roof of my mouth on the Shepards Pie. It was really tasty but could of used more peas.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: I have been at this restaurant twice before and enjoyed it. This time we found the fish dish quite oily and not tasty. The server was surly. it was not a good experience. Wine selection is good. Salad and dessert were good but left not feeling like we'd come back.
review_title: I have been at this restaurant

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review:
Overprice for mediocre food. Shrimp Scampi was found floating drowned in oil. Bread was the only decent item and that was free. Main course of steak with fries was lackluster while the pork shoulder was good but warm, not hot.

Dessert was a complete disappointment. We ordered the chocolate cake and it seems to have been made several days ago and re-refrigerated. Perhaps they thought Hilton hotel guests would be their primary patrons and not local San Franciscans used to a higher quality with more discriminating tastes.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: Food was mediocre, good, but nothing to brag about. Service was fair. Waitress asked if we could carry out our leftovers because she didnt have time to find us a bag. Highly doubt we would go back.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: A vibrant dining spot in Union Square, where you can take part in the social energy or tuck in to a more private spot. The menu is unsophisticated, but still hits the mark for the demographic here - business travelers and Union Sq. shoppers. This is comfort food with yet another personal twist, but executed with care. We enjoyed our selections - hangar steak frites and pork shoulder. Well-flavored, well-seasoned and cooked just right.
review_title: A vibrant dining spot in Union

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: When we got in, the decor threw us off but were welcomed and shown a wonderful time. Thank you for showing us a good time for my birthday. It was all wonderful and we will be back on our next visit.
review_title: When we got in, the decor

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: My wife had the fish of the day and it was overcooked. My food was pretty good. Beer list was not that great considering. Anchor was the only SF beer? That's not trying too hard!
review_title: My wife had the fish of the

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: Urban Tavern was a well-designed, good-looking modern restaurant space. The food, however, was bland and not nearly as good as expected. The short ribs were not particularly flavorful, and my dining companion said the same of the steak. The service was OK, but also not great. I'm usually very flexible and forgiving, and enjoy restaurants that others complain about, but Urban Tavern was a disappointment.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: Had a great lemonade (half off happy hour), the spare ribs were falling off the bone and the ginger cake was melt in your mouth. The service was amazing. Genuinely friendly waitstaff. So unusually and really appreciated.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: I was expecting a great meal and was surprised to find it almost completely tasteless. I had the prix fixe of soup, fish of the day and cheesecake parfait. The soup was the highlight of the entire meal - everything that followed was a letdown. The fish was dry and flavorless, accompanied by an equally tasteless grain and about 4 pieces of mushroom. My husband's chicken was completely plain - no sauce, no seasoning, nothing. The "fruit" in the parfait was Smucker's marmalade. All this for $100. We will not be going back.
review_title: I was expecting a great meal

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review:
Service was poor
our table and the two tables around us all had to ask for our waiter at some point
French dip meat and bread was good, au jus was horrible
the decor is very stylish and neat
I will probably not got back unless

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review:
Wow to the food and service. Monday late lunch so not much of a crowd.
Highly recommended. Need to check out happy hour.
review_title: Wow to the food and service.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: Nice atmosphere and design, beautiful bar and lighting. Wonderfully convenient for downtown theater--a nice addition to the Union Square area dining options. Food was good -- fish perfectly cooked, greens fresh, middle eastern dips well spiced. Nice wine by the glass list.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: Ate here for Thanksgiving. Expected better service and quality of food for the price. Cheese platter needed more pairings with fruit. Not enough variety of meats. Should have had chefs serve food onto plates. Ceviche shrimp gave me a stomach ache.

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review:
While the food was good, the service was poor.
-Forgotten drink order
-Took menus away before we ordered
-Didn't inform us that several items on menu were no longer available
-Brought entrees out while we were still eating our appetizers
-Told us that they didn't want the food to sit in the kitchen getting cold. We told her to take it back until we were finished with our appetizers and the plates had been cleared. Told her that the kitchen should not have fired our entrees yet.
-Server spilled wine on appetizer plates/cutlery during first pour. Apologized and replaced plate, but left utensils with wine on them. Not one server filled our wine glasses (just did it ourselves)
-Entrees later arrived warm
-Bill presented was not ours
review_title: While the food was good, the

address: Hilton San Francisco333 O'Farrell St.San Francisco, CA  94102
review: The restaurant will be closing at the end of the month and the space will be converted into a banquetting facility so anything I would say here would be moot.
Brussel sprouts, sliders, mac n cheese, mozzarella burrata, everything was so good.
review_title: Brussel sprouts, sliders, mac n cheese, ...

review:
We had a great brunch for six , sitting in the front room in a comfy booth.
As requested we had the window looking out to the street.
We will be back.
Thanks!

I was here with my friend last night and we had a great time eating, catching up as well as watching the game! The food was good, could be better. The S'mores was the best and the salad! Everything else like the prosciutto, risotto and pot pie was not that good, maybe is because there were a lot of people they needed to serve, so they were making the food quick style. In any case, if a restaurant cannot deliver their best every time then I believe some changes should be made to satisfy the customer every time they order the food items.
review_title: I was here with my friend

review: Great neighborhood bar and restaurant. The food is casual, good bar comfort food (pulled pork sandwich, burger(s), mac and cheese and plenty of salads to choose from). It tends to be a younger Marina District crowd and can get pretty loud at night, so I prefer lunchtime so I can talk (and hear) my meal companions. I've never been disappointed and a good time is had by all.

My cousin is a local. When I visited San Francisco he told me I'd like the Tipsy Pig. He was right. You feel comfortable right away. I brought my wife and teenage kids. We sat in the back, the libray room. We ordered 8 Appetizers to share because they all looked so great. Brie with Fresh Berries and sourdough was awesome. The Green Tomatoes were Fried just right. The Beers from the Tap were terrific. The busboys jumped on every used plate and whisked it away. We had 4 dinners in SF over a long weekend & spent $180 at other high end places. I think we spent $90 at The Tipsy Pig and enjoyed it tenfold more. I'll return to get to the entrees. I want that Hangar Steak with a glass of Red Wine. Or maybe that Chicken Pot Pie....Jeff Swartz
Tbe burger was great as was the Tipsy Pig bloody mary!
review_title: Tbe burger was great as was

review: Excellent food at reasonable prices. Not a huge menu, but what they had was consistently good. dining table in the back room are less noisy. The bar scene in front is very loud on the weekend.
It is a nice place, but I was surprised that it was one of the 100 best in the Bay Area. I had the tuna burger, and it was good, but didn't seem that special.
review_title: It is a nice place, but I

review: The food didn't live up to its hype. We ordered a variety of starters and entrees for a group of 5. Two crab cakes for $12 is ridiculous. The mac and cheese is good, but not great.
review_title: The food didn't live up to

review: great service, great hostess - I was late due to ridic street closure and it was no big deal - will definitely be back, love this place!

Found out about Tipsy Pig on Food Buddha, decided to give it a try. Tipsy Pig is an upscale pub with out of this world food. The service was friendly. In our group we ordered the burger, it was juicy, lean and delicious. The plate came with a choice of sweet potatoe fries, french fries or a salad. All were good, but the sweet potatoe fries were the best I've had. We also ordered the pulled pork sandwich with red cabbage. Again, it was outstanding. The sauce was not overly sweet or runny, it was perfect. The chicken sandwich was also fantastic. We were there for Sunday brunch and so some of the items they are known for were not on the menu. I can't wait to try their chicken pot pie. Their specialty bar drinks were also delicious.

What can I about The Tipsy Pig that has not been said before - it rocks! Food is good, drinks are deelish, service is always excellent - atmosphere fun and well just a great experience all around! Looking for good home cooked food, with a slight twist this is your spot! They pour a mean drink and never leave the coffee cup empty... Brunch was divine - many choices from the simple (eggs and bacon) to eggs with asparagus and prosciutto with fontina cheese! Great neighborhood spot without being so Marina... And you know what I mean on that one :-) Go enjoy and if it's a nice day or evening wait for back yard seating is so nice out there...
review_title: What can I about The Tipsy

review: Went for brunch, great bloody marys, average burgers and huevos rancheros. Fun scene, much better brunch to be had in the area.

The food and atmosphere were just what I was looking for. Great, everyday food. Our server was attentive and cheery. The drinks were good and the place was lively.

If I lived in this neighboorhood, this would be my regular bar.
I really wanted to love this place, but I'm too old (49) for it - it's even louder than Mamacita. The trendy, 30-something Marina crowd will undoubtedly love it.
review_title: I really wanted to love this

review: Excellent service and delicious food.  Had to adjust our reservation time several times because our friends were late arriving at SFO and the restaurant was very accommodating.  Our table was ready and waiting when we arrived.
review_title: Even better on the second visit

review:
Hi,

Had the steak and baby oct, very good.

Thanks to our server for arranging for the kitchen to recook the steak for rare. Awesome service.
Everything at Piqueos was delicious, especially the ever-reliable tequenos (fried wontons) - like dessert but for dinner. and viva sangria!
My wife and I have been coming here since it replaced Moki's in this location. But it's been a while since our last visit. Consistenly excellent and unique Peruvian food.
Staff was nice, friendly and accommodating. Everything we ordered tasted good but especially the beef Empanada.
Interesting menu. We are determined to try every single item on the menu. We like to sit at the bar and watch the chef in action.

We ordered 5 small plates and they were all fabulous. Don't recall specific descriptions but, shrimp pot stickers, stuffed calamari, crab cake, grilled scallops and pulled pork. All exceptionally well prepared and yummy,
Food is outstanding. Unique selection of dishes and outstanding preparation
Lovely little spot, attentive service and good food. Some dishes better than others, some just average. Desserts quite good, and sangria tasty! We will go back.

The service was attentive without being disruptive. The ambiance was hip without feeling obnoxious. The tuna ceviche was fantastic. As for the rest of the food, we were sharing small plates with non-seafood eaters so the rest of our selections involved cooked meats. I wasn't quite crazy about any of them. Overall, I felt these dishes relied too much on heavy sauces that somewhat overpowered the rest of the ingredients. If I were to go back, I would stick to the ceviches or try some of the fish entrees.

I normally love Piqueos, but last time was an off night. The waitress didn't follow through on our requests as to how the food was brought out. We specified that we were not sharing everything due to dietary needs so that more than one item came out at a time, but she did not bring out something for each of us to eat at the same time, so we ended up watching each other eat. I also ordered a hot tea when we sat down and it did not come until halfway through the two hour meal.

Piqueos was a great find! This small restaurant is one I can highly recommend. Not knowing anything about Peruvian food, we decided to try tapas. Besides being a great way to eat a meal, each one was amazing. Next time we may share and entree and have a couple more tapas. Overall, food was wonderful, location is a little out of the way but was easy to get to. There was not an abundance of available parking but we were able to finding parking very nearby on our first circle. We will definitley be back!

Overall, a very pleasant dining experience. The menu included a good mix of "well seasoned" choices (from the starters through the small plate choices. Everything we ordered (from the salad, seafood, lamb and beef) was very well prepared and the presentation was also special. It is a very cramped space (I think my chair was bumped at least seven times during the course of the meal). A very casual and high energy ambiance.

delicious. one tiny note re: the empanadas---the dough inside was wet/gooey in places, as if undercooked. when I pointed it out, the waiter took it away and said they;d bring another, then returned with a message from the kitchen that "that happens when the wet filling touches the dough". hmm. ok.

prawns were divine,sauces and plating beautifully done. looove the app they bring to the table right away ---fried chickpeas, chopped red onions and tomato, peruvian corn. fantastic.

will return!

The food was unbelievable, the everyone in our party of three loved the place, the food, the service. 5 out of 5 stars. My girlfriend and I loved this place, it's now on our top list of great places in the city to eat

We reserved a table on the second floor. I was glad to be up there as the first floor lounge was too loud for conversations. The Whiskey list as suggested by the name of the restaurant was quite long and varied. You have your choice of .75 ounce or 1.5 ounce glasses. Prices range from 8 to 35 plus a pour. We enjoyed the drinks and the food was tasty. I was disappointed by the rubbery and cold quail eggs and bitter pork belly. Hard to mess up pork belly! The Dr Octopus was exceptional and I enjoyed the yellow fin shiitake dish. Over all it was a decent but not exceptional restaurant.

The waiter was rude, pushed a $200 sake on us... brought the wrong food and pretty much ignored a table of 6 the entire time. I recommended to my friends that we try it. Their reaction was... "What's so great about this place?"  I was embarrassed. I would not go back
review_title: Not as good as my first time...

review: Great selection of whiskey, however they were out of two of our two three selections. The food was good, but not great. It's better as a bar than a restaurant.
Experience was spectacular. Whiskey coctails were delicious. Service was exccellent. Tuna tartar (Crudo) could have more tuna in it. Avocado was overpowering the whole dish.
Poor service due to a large party booking - I always think this is not the other customers fault, and a poor excuse for mismanagement...
review_title: Poor service due to a large

review: stick with the cocktails in the lounge, especially happy hour. Food was meh - and my stomache wasn't feeling too great after.
Happy hour here is great. Their whiskey selection is, as advertised, amazing. Came expecting good drinks and mediocre food but the food was a pleasant surprise.
Love the sushi and the bar here. Great ambiance. Service could be better.
review_title: Love the sushi and the bar

review: I've only been here twice.  However, every time the service has been exceptional.  This most recent experience was no exception.  The food was great, the saki is incomparable, and service was awesome.  I'll be coming again soon.

Great happy hour, until 7pm most nights.  If you get there early enough, there's a nice selection of both foods and drinks for the happy hour.  Note, communal seating for most, in case that's a turn off...  Sushi was good to very good with a number of novel choices for the vegetarian or those who avoid raw foods.

I took my mom and brother here and we all LOVED it!! Jess was our server, I don't think I've ever had better service! She was so friendly and accommodating, she made our experience great! She even brought out a DELICIOUS piece of green tea cheesecake, on the house - SO sweet! The food was simply amazing. Will be returning soon!!!
Waiting longer than normal for the food, it seems like they were under staff on making sushi.

I love the food and drink at Tsunami but the price is a bit hard to swallow. If they thought about a 20% reduction in pricing, I think they'd see a lot more business heading their way.

The roll are super dynamite tasting and beautiful!
review_title: I love the food and drink

review:
Food here is always great, with a good selection of cocktails and saki available.
I have recommended this restaurant to friends before and will definitely recommend it again.
I will be back, first for another round of wasabi-infused vodka cocktails, and then for the amazing fusion sushi! LOVE THIS PLACE! Not too pricey either.
review_title: I will be back, first for

review: Some of the best sushi (and sake) in the city bar none. Ive had more creative maki combinations, but sometimes, truly great food need only be simple, with very fresh ingredients, and that's just what they do here.
This was a fantastic steak and perfectly cooked - for a chain it over-delivered. Service was attentive and very professional as well.  Nice job.

Food was okay.  Table was loud and just not good.  At these prices everything SHOULD be excellent.  It was not.  We did not get the desert we expected, because the waiter wasn't listening.  I can't put my finger on what went wrong with the rest of the meal, but it just wasn't acceptable.  We got the feeling they tried too hard to turn the table and not give the experience I expected from a restaurant like Mortons.  We will not be back.

We were pretty disappointed with Morton's. For the cost, the food was average.  In comparison to Ruth's Chris, Morton's pales.  We went to Morton's for our son's birthday, and I will say that they really made him feel special. They took our picture at the table for us to bring home, and he received a free dessert.  But, we were seated by the kitchen door, the food arrived on cold plates (Ruth's Chris heats theirs), and we ordered asparagus as one of our sides and our waitress didn't bother to tell us that three of our meals came with asparagus already on the plate. The au gratin potatoes and mac and cheese were pretty greasy. After walking out having paid over $400 for a very average meal, we decided that we will not be going back.

I like to take my family out to eat at fine dining restraunts when we get a chance so I thought this would be the place since we were staying in the city. I've eaten at Mortons in Anaheim when I tool my family to Disneyland and this place was not the same by far. From the service to the food it was a huge disappointment. I ordered the filet medium and it came out well done and when I told the server he tried to tell me that it was medium. I know what had happened, we ( my wife, sister in law and myself) ordered the same plate and when they brought it out they didn't check. By the time we figured it out it was a little to late to swap plates so I dealt with it. 
It wasn't all that but the Morton's in Anaheim was fantastic.

This was the 2nd time we have chosen Mortons Steakhouse for our families College Graduation Party Dinners -- FABULOUS!!!
Service is outstanding, Food is excellent, Ambiance is perfect.........cannot find a better place to celebrate such a wonderful occasion.
We love Mortons for holidays, anniversaries and of course, GRADUATIONS!!

The atmosphere was a bit like a dining hall rather than a famous restaurant and not very inviting; I was disappointed. I would avoid the Onion Soup if your are going to dine there but the steaks were excellent all around.
Expensive! Food and service were equally poor. A disaster of a meal from beginning to end. And rude to boot.
Our waiter Luis was very attentive and made our experience delightful. Food was delicious and filling.

Steak done as ordered but cold. Sauce cold, as where potatoes.
Caesar dressing way to much in salad and soggie salad.
Service was fine.

One hour wait after food was ordered. Manager comped the meal which I appreciated, but we didn't go there for a free meal. Food was cold and shrimp overlooked. Very bad experience. Nothing about it was acceptable.
Great food and beverage. Manager followed up to make sure everything was perfect after dinner.

Morton's is always one of the best. We go to Morton's every time on travel to cities that have one. Excellent service and the food is top notch. Not cheap and all items are ala carte, but worth every penny.
We had an excellent meal along with great service and ambiance. Thank you very much!
review_title: We had an excellent meal along

review:
Steaks and salads were very good, but overall, overpriced!
Side dishes fair. Chocolate cake was rich, heavy and delicious.
I just don't think the food justifies the price.

Thank you Lisa and Phil. You are both great in what you do. Phil, thank for making this an enjoyable evening for our party. You were a lovely host. The service was superb! Thank you. We are forever grateful.

The overall experience was wonderful at Morton's. The birthday setup made us feel extra special, like we were really getting some special attention. Drinks and food were excellent. Would definitely recommend this restaurant and attend again.
As usual great steak and good wine list. Morton's is definitively a great steak place, highly recommended.

I conducted a business dinner with 8 people. Everything was excellent except the following two complaints,

1) the lighting was too low to read the dinner menu, we had people aged 1 - 70's, 3 - 50's, 1 - 40's, 2 - 30's, 1 - 20's, all had difficulty reading and an LED flashlight was used.

2) Three diners ordered Pork and 5 ordered beef. The pork had a charred top which negated the taste of the pork, because it was overwhelmed by the burnt carbon taste. On the other hand, all 5 beef dishes were complimented as tasting great.

The waiter helped me navigate through the menu offering suggestions for "family style" appetizers and narrowing a Merlot selection which was very helpful and appreciated.

Mortons-SAN FRANCISCO goofed big time, by closing the downstairs seating area to diners. I've dined regularly at Mortons in Honolulu, Las Vegas, Glendale, SF and San Jose. However, the San Francisco location may now claim the dubious distinction as the Mortons with the the Least Steakhouse Ambiance. The upstairs dining room looks like a slightly upscale Denny's. previously, the SF location rival Honolulu's for steakhouse ambiance. no more. Food was very good, though - if expensive. Come on - $48 for a ribeye with no adders?

Morton's never let's me down....however, I was sad to find out they are taking the prime rib off the menu. Other than that the crab cakes, steak, and raspberry souffl are to die for....actually all their food is to die for. My boyfriend had the double pork chop, grilled asparagus, mashed potatoes with a raspberry martini and new York cheese cake and I had the petite cut steak, Mac n cheese, raspberry souffle, and cinnamon and sugar rimmed apple martini and we both had a crab cake for starters and a glass of Perrier...all together we spent $256 after tax. I felt that the service and food was spectacular and worth it! Thank you to Camilla, our server for making our dining experience personable!

It was a great time....although we had to wait about an hour and a half for our table...the ambiance was great...the staff was great, and of course my company was AMAZING..we had a nice time over all.

The food was average at best; the waiter was more interested in speedy table turnover and the service and attention was not professional. Wines by the glass were overpriced. The dinning room was noisy and certainly did not offer anything close to being romantic. We`ve had better Morton`s experiences at other locations.
review_title: The food was average at best;

review: Morton's is an all American favorite. Great place to take a friend, business partner or spouse. It meets all your dining expectations. The food is fabulous, always prepared to order, the service is top-notch and the atmosphere is elegant, but not too feminine, sophisticated but not too snobby. I highly recommend Morton's!
The waiter was too busy and didn't take our order until after 45 minutes. The staff failed to keep wine poured or water glasses full. Food was great, service well below expectations.
review_title: The waiter was too busy and

review: I have eaten at Morton's several times. Awesome experience!
review_title: I have eaten at Morton's several

review: The food was excellent (as expected), and the service was truley outstanding. The Morton's staff went out of their way to make our dining experience special.

Went to Morton's for V-day, and got the 3 course special for 2. The service here was very good, but it better be for the price you're paying, lol. The food, on the other hand, was just ehhh.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good considering the price/quality ratio.
I got the filet mignon steak medium rare with crabcakes, and the meat came so rare that it could have been mooing.  I don't think I've ever had beef that raw before.  It tasted ok, but I've had much better steak at Cattlemen's. The crabcake, however, was delicious and probably the best part of the whole meal.  It was made up almost completely of big pieces of crab meat, with very little stuffing.  It didn't make up for everything else though, so no repeat visit for me.

My then-fiance (now husband) ate at Morton's the night before our wedding - just the 2 of us - and it was our first time. The service was outstanding, the food was absolutely savory and good, and the drinks were good too. It was super packed, so you will need a reservation. We were originally a walk-in, but we luckily snagged a 745p open table reservation cancellation while talking with the host. If we didn't have the reservation, we would have waited 1.5 hours. Nevertheless, they do have bar seating which wasjust as cozy. Loved it and hope to be back soon.

I personally think Morton's is overrated. Yes the steak is very good and they portions are huge, but they don't have a very refined menu. This is great if you are looked for a very fancy standard steakhouse. They even roll the meats cuts to your table for you to pick. Some people love this.... not really my thing.
It was wonderful. My wife was very excited to have the menu with Happy Birthday to her. thanks for the extra effort for making her day especially nice,

Food was just fair as my steak was not prepared as requested. I didn't feel we received the adequate service by our waitress as she didn't come back to checkup on us on. We need to take the initiative to call her over. Expectation was high as I've dine at the location in Beverly Hills. There are many chophouse so I do know if I will return. So sad!
review_title: Food was just fair as my steak

review: Food was good as usual. Service was attentive but a little slow. Waitress had quite a few tables, i think. But she did a good job explaning menu and choices. Brought a bottle of wine and also purchased one, did not waive corkage.
review_title: Food was good as usual. Service

review: What was once a quite, white tablecloth, classic steakhouse is now a loud, teflon, sports bar. steaks are still good but I found the ambiance and the noise level intolerable. What a shame.
review_title: What was once a quite, white

review: Me and my girlfriend went to Morton's for valentines day and it was an excellent experience. The preset 3 course meal had excellent, quality food for a great price! Our server Jay was very attentive and knowledgeable. Wine pairing's were fantastic! Portions of food were big we had left overs. I would recommend Morton's to anyone.

It was our first time dining there. We were celebrating our 4 year anniversary. Food was great. Ambiance was excellent. Service was freaking awesome!!! =)))) I was very happy with everything overall after dinner. I would go and eat here again.

Our server Jay even gave us a little free dessert which was just some whip cream and a couple pieces of fresh strawberries, blueberries and raspberries on a small dessert place. So nice of him to do that because we didn't order any dessert when he asked if we wanted to. Very unexpected and sweet of him to do for us. =) So thank you Jay for making our anniversary dinner extra special!
review_title: It was our first time dining

review: I am a fan of Morton's and have been to the SF location a few times. This was my first visit during lunch (and during the holidays to top it off). I will think twice before doing so again. While the food was excellent as always, the service was extremely slow. My group had a 12:30pm reservation and we were seated prompted. From there, we experienced long delays between each and every course (3 courses). We were not able to leave until 2:30pm.
review_title: I am a fan of Morton's and

review: Service was great, we loved the photos! Food was excellent!

the food was good, but our waiter was atrocious and ruined the overall dining experience.  He was slow, got our orders wrong, had to ask us several times what we wanted.  Fifteen minutes after we ordered instead of bringing our salads, he came back to repeat our order to us which he had gotten wrong.  He disappeared for 15-20 minutes at a time when we wanted to ask him for various things like water, the bill, cleaning up our table (We had dirty dishes on our table after we finished for at least 20 minutes).  Another thing we didn't like is that he shook each of our hands when he came to the table and we don't like to eat right after shaking the hands of strangers during flu season.
review_title: the food was good, but our

review: Mortons has always been a great spot for fine steaks and great service.  The night was made extra special with the unexpected touches for our 30th anniversary dinner with our children.  We arrived to a table decorated for our anniversary and a custom printed menu to mark the night.  A picture was also taken of our family and returned within minutes in an anniversary holder.  The entire evening was wonderful.  Great Job!!!

MOrton's had great steaks but the service was terrible. We told the waiter that we lived in San Francicso and that  my sister lived in New York City. That said we barely saw him the rest of the evening. I think  they are interestred in out of town business folks with expense accounts. I would never recomment Morton's.

Really enjoyed the new "upstairs" renovation. I will be coming there more often now to eat in the bar area and enjoy the view outside.
My server Jamie was a complete professional and made my dining experience that much more enjoyable. Lindsey the hostess was very engaging and made me feel like a friend at the neighborhood restaurant. I am a VIP from the Cincinnati store and will definately be back to this store for more dinners.

I took a friend out for her birthday, and it met (but didn't exceed) expectations.  Custom menu wishing her a happy b-day, but that was all that was special.  She had a glass of California chardonnay, which was $20!  I brought a wonderful bottle of cabarnet sauvignon.  We didn't order appetizers, and opted for fresh asparagus and a baked potato.  She had the petite filet mignon, and I had the ribeye.  Dinner came to $175 without appetizers or dessert!!  A bit on the pricey side since everything was a la carte.  There are better steakhouses in SF.
review_title: I took a friend out for her

review: The location and ambiance were very nice, but the food was unremarkable.  The steak was not very hot and cooled too quickly, and the bernaise sauce was mediocre.

12/11/08 

The meat was extremely disaaponiting - all of four different cuts we ordered but one (bone in filet mignon) had awful grainy consistency.
560 dollars later - I will not go back
We has a 9:45pm reservation.  The service was bad.  The steak was charred badly from the outside.  The dessert (supposedly hot) was served collapsed.  Complete waste of money and an evening.
Very busy weeknight evening with a roomful of convention diners making for a quite noisy room.

The Blue Mermaid is a great place where everything is just right - we had selection of chowders - each recipe is delicious to perfection, some cocktails, and entrees,  and that made our afternoon.

Impeccable service, too.

Located in the Argonaut Hotel across from the Hyde Street Pier, near the Maritime Museum, cable car turn-around and Fisherman's wharf. We enjoyed fresh Tilapia and Clams Linguine and salad for lunch. The service was good, and they even offered us a free appetizer or dessert because we made reservations on OpenTable. Parking in garages and at meters is expensive, but there is free 2 hour street parking a few blocks up the hill.
review_title: Nice surprise near Hyde Street Pier

review: Nice outdoor seating area but food was fair at best. The seafood trio was way overcooked and overpriced. When the waiter was alerted about the improperly cooked, he was unhelpful. Fish & chips were overly greasy, even for fried food. The only food that was worth the money was the ciopinno and the chowder (crab & corn and clam). Would not return here.
review_title: Nice outdoors but food only fair...

review: Excellent chowder. Waiter was a bit bored and didn't check on us often enough for my taste.

My bf and I went here for dinner while vacationing in san fran. We chose it because it wasn't located in the major touristy area of fisherman's wharf. It took about 20 mins before someone came over to even ask our drink order. It seemed that they were very understaffed, although I must say the place was not packed. Maybe things in the kitchen were just extremely slow? I do have to say that despite our frustrations, our waiter, was very sweet and was definitely doing his best. The crab and corn chowder was excellent, but our entrees were just ok (mahi mahi & crab sammie). I wish we had gone for lunch so I couldve just gotten the soup.
review_title: My bf and I went here for

review: screwed up on my bill and never gave me the refund when I called twice.
review_title: screwed up on my bill and

review: Very attentive service and great chowders . . . would come back

Though this was our first time at A16, we were warmly greeted like regulars. We just had a pizza and two pasta dishes which we found to be wonderfully flavorful with light sauces. Each tomato based sauce was surprisingly and deliciously different. Of significant note was  our server's suggested wine pairings for the pasta dishes. Each was new to us and while not sipping wines went perfectly with each dish. He warned us they were different from the usual palette but said our adventurousness would be rewarded. He was correct. Even though we travelled from the East Coast we have put it on our list to return to.
review_title: Though this was our first time at A16, w...

review: We had grabbed a last minute reservation at peak dining hours, so weren't surprised to be seated at the chef's counter.  We actually enjoyed watching the preparation to go along with our conversation and food.  Our server, Jessica, helped us make final selections since so many things sounded yummy.  Our favorite was the squash and smoked mozzarella pizza.  She also helped us find a wine that went with the range of items we ordered.
review_title: We had grabbed a last minute reservation...

review:
A16 offers acceptable takes on what they describe as southern Italian food, with fashionably long lists of diverse ingredients. The pizze are Neapolitan-ish, in a number of combinations. Pasta plates come in full- and half portions, so you can have pasta as a primo even if you don't eat like a Campanian wolf. I've heard A16 described as 'good  for the Marina'.

Good: firm black tonarelli  spicy duck salami (on an okay salumi plate)  sophisticated wine list 
Lackluster: bucatini more like flaccid fat spaghetti, barely hinting at the ostensible bottarga  very long wait to order, and overly fast delivery once we had

No surprises, but no real errors.
The best thing about A16 is the ability to pair unique (for the US) southern Italian and Sicilian wines with the great pizzas.

Went to A16 earlier this week while on vaca. Being a bit of a foodie and from Chicago was excited to check out A16. Could not have been more disappointed!  Although we made reservations several weeks out; we were shocked that they sat us in a tiny, undecorated room that had a party of 16 people. Being that the room was crazy small and the large party was having a lot of fun, the noise level was unbearable... We asked our server for bread when we ordered drinks, and again when she brought our cocktails and then when our food was served. 3x's a charm.We also asked if they could prepare the gnocchi without the goat segu. Had to ask a second time before getting a response. The food itself was fine, nothing special...just like the experience.

My wife and I had already planned to dine at A16, a long overdue visit. The food, wine and service all were well intended, quality unique ingredients and attentive earnest service, but somehow, our lofty expectations are not yet fulfilled. Perhaps we ordered the wrong things or maybe it was the heat. Items seem a little overwrought, flavors that did not hit 'vibrant freshness'. I set a high bar.
On the plus side there are authentic lovingly seasoned food, a wine list that merits attention (and more than a few glasses) and the service staff that aims to please and happy to accommodate.
Loved the super intense strawberry sorbetto. Seasonally fresh, optimum 'strawberriness'.
Must try to fall in love...again at A16.
review_title: A Warm Night in A Cool Night Resto

review: Great spot for a casual, fun and really delicious Italian food neighborhood meal. We love that the food is fresh, healthy and tasty. We like that the menu is different each time we come. We like the mix of people that frequent the place and we like the location. Service is so friendly yet very professional.
review_title: Great spot for a casual, fun

review: Great food, excellent service, terrible table. I made a reservation for a party of four several days in advance. We arrived a few moments early for our reservation and waited about 20-30 minutes before we were seated. The host led us to a table in the wine bar. Several other very noisy diners were also seated nearby.The noise level was beyond cacophonous. I have previously dined at this restaurant and was expecting a seat in the back area of the restaurant. I informed the host that the table was unacceptable and asked for a table in the back. The hostess told us that she did not have any tables in the back available. We were rudely brushed off and not offered any other options. Extremely disappointed at the way we were treated.

A16 is NOT worth the hassel to find parking. The food is underwhelming and I suspect the chefs have not ever tasted what is coming out of the kitchen as I suspect, if they had, it may taste better. The wine list is a representation of all the Italian regions, but the problem is..waiter has no clue regarding the wine...solution have a beer. This establishment seems popular with the 30-something's. If you have a more sophisticated palate skip A16 and you will not be disappointed.
Aside from our salad, none of the dishes were notable. . . . kind of a disappointment, actually.

Was looking for a great pizza place when I moved to SF, similar to my favorite pizza place in TO: pizza libretto.
And this is it, amazing pizza with great "energic ambiance"...

We were disappointed by the menu at A16, nothing spectacular.
I started with the scallops crudo which were OK. My husband had the bruschetta which was good.
We then had the halibut which was good but nothing special, although the vegetables on the side complemented well.
My husband had the corn which was delicious, rosted, salted and buttered.
I had the broccoli which I found to spicy with the chili. When I notified the waitress, she kindly brought another side of broccoli without the chili.
Then we had dessert! Oh my! The cheesecake was the highlight of our dinner! We never had a cheesecake this good, made in heaven!
I had the budino which had nothing spectacular.

I can't believe that SPQR and A16 are related! It took 15 minutes just to get our iced tea (not exaggerating here). The pizza crust was too thick and undercooked (soggy in the middle). My husband said it was the worst pizza he had ever had. The ricotta gnocchi with smoked mushrooms was meh. The mushrooms were tough (possibly reconsituted?) and the gnocchi were lackluster. So disappointing!
There are so many other great places to eat in San Francisco! This isn't one of them :(
The pizzas and pastas looked great, but since I can't eat gluten, there wasn't much to choose from.
We received exceptional service and the food was also very good :)
Fun and greattt food! Staff points you to what's great on the menu. Loved it!
Super wine list and help deciding, delicious food with friendly service, lots of menu options, challenging for the hearing impared. Definitely will return!
review_title: Super wine list and help deciding,

review: Given it was Christmas Eve and it was a prefixed meal but what would have helped was for the restaurant to have enough staff on a very busy night. Also there seemed confusion in the kitchen, people not get a course with the wine pairing and then not quite able to get back on track. With that said the dishes were interesting and the wine pairing were right on. Also there were a lot of children, maybe because of the holiday. It is not a place I feel I need to go back.
review_title: Maybe off a little for holiday

review:
