Great food and ambiance. Loved the buratta app, delicious... The macoronara pasta and poking gnocchi were also excellent.
I used a 30% off code from blackboard eats which helped keep the cost down as well.
Great food except. way below par desert ..too noisy and tables to close together .no romance in ambiance ..just loud

Their understated "side dish" of summer squash did not fully describe the delicious layered dish of thinly sliced multicolored squash, ricotta, browned leeks, lemon zest and toasted bread crumbs. My tripe was as good as ever. Tom's pork chop was huge and delicious with a crisped fatty layer and juicy meat, great peach/fig mustard topping. I had the oven roasted sole where the filet was doubled over before roasting so that the added thickness enabled perfect doneness. Very reliable restaurant with outstanding Italian wine list. We also order the Lacrima, a wine for the Marche that has an incredible aroma. Can't find this wine very often in SF.
We always enjoy A16. The food and service are wonderful.

All the flavors were so well put together. Reasonable prices for top notch food. The restaurant is a little cozy since they do try and fit in as many tables as possible. A group of 6 can fit in well. Everything we had was great!
review_title: All the flavors were so well

review:
Everything we had was delicious: farro soup, arugula salad with fresh strawberries, pizza romana and pizza margarita were all fantastic. Our favorite dish was the Macceronara al Ragu Napoletano and I cannot wait to go back for more.

My BEST part about our dining experience on a busy Saturday evening was that they did not discriminate in any way towards our kids (ages 8 and 9) who now claim A16 to be their favorite restaurant in SF. Kudos to restaurants and businesses which make our beautiful city a great place to raise a family; I am one lucky Mom who does not have to suffer at an Olive Garden in the burbs and our kids are growing to appreciate great food (at this age they don't need kiddie menus and crayons).
Had the pork chop that was very dry. Dry enough to send back but I didnt have the time. The rest of the mean was good.
review_title: Had the pork chop that was

review: Tremendous food. Everything we ate was delicious. They have great wood-fired pizzas, excellent pastas and meats, salads, etc. Everything on the menu seems to be delicious.

Food, wine, and our server were great...BUT we had to wait awhile for a table when we had a reservation and then got stuck in the overflow room in the back -- not a great table. This certainly detracted from the overall experience; there are other outstanding Italian spots that have much better ambiance. Also, the non-stop techno music was really annoying.
A very nice choice for an afternoon birthday lunch amongst before a dash to the cinema down the street!
review_title: A very nice choice for an

review:
Knowledgeable, friendly, personalized service. Excellent food--very authentically dressed salad; generous serving of delicious burrata.
Very Italian feel in terms of business groups, family groups and lone diners on a lunch break eating there at lunch.
The pasta was al dente which had I been advised, I would have told him I like my pasta thoroughly cooked. The wine was very good which was recommended by our server who did an excellent job.
review_title: The pasta was al dente which

review: Just eat here and you will know why A16 is so popular. Their Pizza is tops, could just be S F's best!. Lovely, friendly service and great Italian wines.
review_title: Just eat here and you will

review: Overrated with so many exciting and delicious options in the City.

Decided to try this place to celebrate our 10 yr anniversary. Booked a reservation for 6:30 but after fighting traffic we ended up showing up 45 minutes late. We tried to call to see if we could change the reservation time but no one answered. We were hoping it wouldn't be a problem since it was a Thursday night....well, in we walk and the place was packed with wall-to-wall people! This was definitely the place to be. The hostess said she will see what she could do. Well, after waiting 10 minutes she seated us in a prime location because it was our anniversary! That in itself was impressive, not to mention the meal and desserts were AMAZING! The only reason I gv 4 stars is bcus the pork chop was a little undercooked.

Well it was another long awaited Diva Nite. The girls & I were excited to try the cuisine @ A16. My friends ordered the Margherita & Salsiccia pizzas, which was devine.
The Macarronara was good, along w/ the Roasted anson mills palenta...hot & steamy. The Bellini was cool and sparkling, and the almond pound cake was great..just wish it was warmed up even if the cream would melt i would still ate it. The Ricotta cheesecake w/almond crumble & rhubarb compote was something to get use to. Once I put a forkful of cheesecake into the rhubarb compote w/ a little slide through the almond crust crumble I was hooked. My friend was disappointed that they didn't have tiramisu @ an italian restaurant. She was looking forward to that.But she still enjo

We thought the food was above average, but the prices a bit more than above average. Superb,
professional service, but as "older people" the noise level was difficult for us. Better for younger set. We did like the atmosphere, except for the noise level. Nice to see "neighborhood people" with a few children early in the evening. We stayed a long time , then became a big time bar scene.
review_title: We thought the food was above

review: Another standout dinner at A16! The wine list is always changing with hard to find Italian whites and reds tucked into the great California selections. The food could perhaps follow suite by mixing it up a bit more... the burrata and prosciutto are appetizer staples and the pizza's are a sure thing. The pasta was hit or miss this time around, so would encourage the kitchen to venture out a bit more in trying new pasta styles.

Go to San Francisco several times a year and mainly stay in the Union Square area. Love to get away to A-16 and mingle with the locals verus the tourist. The food here is amazing- the pizza is a must. This is my second time at the restaurant and everything here is great- Went on a Wednesday night and even at 9pm still crazy busy.
A16 has a great ambiance, but the food was not as great this time around as it had been in the past.
Good service. Gave us a complimentary plate of cookies for a birthday.
review_title: Good service. Gave us a complimenta

review: Good pizza and pasta dishes. Nice neighborhood restaurant. The tables are a little close together and tight but still a nice atmosphere.

The food is excellent, and the wine list unusual (all southern Italian) and very well suited to the food. The staff is very knowledgeable and helpful about matching wines with food, and the actual eating and drinking is superb. However, the noise level was uncomfortably loud, and there was a bad draft. Waiters could have been more attentive; it seemed to take a long time for anybody to come give us water, take our order, etc. Also it was so dark it was hard to read the menu.
Food was good. Service was great. We had my wife birthday, with family and kids. Would definately recommend. Nice job. ETM
Re-opening night was fabulous! Our server was knowledgeable and kind to our 5 year old! The duck was wonderfully prepared and was ever so delicious. I'm still dreaming about it.

The food here is always wonderful and usually the service is, too. This time, it was lacking. If a server can't remember orders she should write them down. Our server forgot to put in our pizza order and my husband and I were starving watching our friends eat theirs. When we finally asked about it, we got a blank stare. Then she came back and said that "somehow" the order didn't get put in. Which pizza was it? She had forgot. Did we still want it? Yes, we are starving. No apologies. We had to ask for some bread because there was no offer to bring anything else in the meantime. We finally got our pizza AFTER the entire meal was finished. At that point, we didn't even want it anymore. Irritating.
review_title: The food here is always wonderful

review: Fabulous food! Great for groups, for sharing and trying more of the fabulous food with each other. Wonderful Italian wines--open your mind to trying the wines recommended by Shelley (or any of the sommeliers) for each of your courses. The burrata is amazing, the prosciutto plate was great for tasting, the pizzas are perfection (funghi especially), the chocolate tart is phenomenal as is the crespelle. The flavor combinations are unique and simple in their ingredients (but complicated in their preparations) while very pleasing to the palate. A fabulous dining experience!

Spectacular dinner with 4 of us. We ordered a huge amount of food all at one time and it was so good we just kept on ordering. Fabulous pizzas, beet salad, calamari, burrata, cod....everything was great. Especially enjoyed the waiter's wine recommendation, we took the name with us to try to find it. The only thing I don't love about this restaurant is the patio seating, it is colder out there and the tables rickety.

This was our second time at A16, and we were disappointed by the menu and by the execution of some of our dishes. We love SPQR, and were excited by the posted menu for A16. While the wine list is superb with a great range of prices, the food wasn't special enough to us. None of the appetizers appealed, except the roasted octopus which was excellent. My tuna conserva was a tuna salad that, while good, was pedestrian with ingredients more appropriate for lunch than dinner. My lamb "riblettes" were a dish of tomato sauce with pieces of chewy lamb that tasted like shank meat; it was too salty and quite basic. Our two pastas were very good but we also had difficulty finding two that appealed. The sommelier is outstanding!
review_title: This was our second time at

review: A16 is consistently great. Few places can I order and then just trust the sommelier to pair with wine. They always get it right.

The food and the service were excellent. Our party didn't know much about Southern Italian wine, but our server was super helpful and led us to choosing an excellent wine. The food was spectacular, especially the mozzarella burrata and the gnocchi.
review_title: The food and the service were

review: too salty, too noisy. maybe I'm just too old. good service though.

Great food, great service and a great wine list! Had a very outstanding experience. One of my favorite restaurants! Will be back soon!

Thanks!

We had a fantastic experience as a group of 6. Seated in the atrium area which allows for better conversation. Nicole took great care with our reservation, and Nico was a fantastic waiter whose knowledge of food & wine pairings helped make the meal memorable. We loved ererything single thing put on the table!

The service was fantastic...loved our waiter. The food was good and we were enjoying a nice time until an incredibly loud group was seated next to us. They were loud enough that we could not hear each other across the table...suddenly the food was not tasting as good and we skipped dessert. Sad.

We love the food here at this cute little bistro ear the Palace of Fine Arts. Watch out for parking! On Chestnut the meters are only valid for 1/2 hour. The next block over there is two-hour free street parking, but they have street sweeping on 1st and 3rd Fridays (Mondays, whatever -- watch the signs). That's currently a $53 fine. Ouch.
review_title: We love the food here at this

review: The food at A16 was beyond what I expected. I was in San Francisco for a long holiday weekend and while doing my restaurant research came across this place. Not only because of the James Beard award, but A16 had Marisa Cuomo wines on the menu and I had just toured that winery in Furore, Italy in April and I knew I had to eat there. The food, the wine, and the service were all spectacular!
review_title: The food at A16 was beyond

review: I've been to A-16 a few times and have never been disappointed. This visit was an exception. The steak and salads were wonderful. The halibut ciopinno was good, but a bit salty. The pizzas were the biggest disappointment. Usually the crusts are thin and crispy, but this time they were soggy and a bit too thick at the edges. Perhaps this was just an off-night; I hope so!
review_title: I've been to A-16 a few times

review: I loved it! I took my girlfriend to celebrate our two year anniversary and the food was excellent and the scene was perfect. I can't wait to go back!
review_title: I loved it! I took my girlfriend

review: Fabulous, and some of the most delicious and creative food I have ever eaten!!
One of the best experiences my wife and I had in a long time. Great food, great service, great wine. A-16 is on our short list of the best restaurants we have been to.

A16 is a fantastic restaurant, by far one of my San Francisco favorites. They take great care to match the wine to the food, and the menu is such that you can graze on pizzas at the bar, or full out splurge on a three or four course meal. The service is warm and professional and the staff is genuinely responsive.

Always reliably great
First restaurant of choice afte being gone for weeks at a time.!

A16 has been a favorite of mine since it has opened. The food is always great and I love the atmosphere. I am never disappointed, often pleasantly surprised. Impatiently waiting for the A16 cookbook I ordered online!
review_title: A16 has been a favorite of

review: Food was great... side dishes were amazing! Very vibrant scene.

I had high hopes for this place and for the most part was not disappointed. The reason for the mediocre rating is that their menu is a minefield, something I find inexcusable. Some things are very good, others are so-so and some are just downright bad. Considering the hype, I expected a much more consistent dining experience. There were two bright spots: the mozzarella burrata was fabulous as was the butter bean soup (the best I've ever had). Everthing else was forgettable and/or disappointing. Pizza: OK/bland. Salumi: easily bested by Columbo. Lamb: overdone. Lamb sausage: magnificent. Chicken meatballs: bland. Desserts: too challenging (peaches with black pepper?) but the pear parfait was perfect. Wine list: good if you know Italian wines
review_title: I had high hopes for this

review: WOW! Fabulous food, great, friendly atmosphere. Reasonably priced considering how good it is. Exciting
First timer. Enjoyed it - food was good. It was very warm outside and it made the interior a bit uncomfortable. Will definitely return and recommend.

Very good food and service. Wine person was very knowledgable and fun. She was great and had wonderful suggestions. Restaurant was very busy and noisy but that is what we expected. Homemade salumi was highlight of meal. Only minor hiccup was in service, waiter must have forgot toput in the Burrata order. It came out late, our entrees came out right after. Waiter said he would take off the check but it was there on the check at the end of the meal. Other than that it was very enjoyable

We really enjoyed the food, (pizzas were great, calamari and true find) but service was ok.  We had to move tables because the tables on the patio were cold and we couldn't talk over the couple at the table next to us.  Staff seemed bothered by the move. Kevin was fantastic giving us great wine recommendations for that evening and our trip into Sonoma the next day. The rest of the staff was rather abrupt.

Have been to A16 many times.  Dined early last Thursday evening.  This experience was way off for this restaurant--food was tasteless (a fish dish served in parchment paper came to the table about 5 minutes after order and had no flavor;  paper was greasy and waiter just left it on the table and dashed off after telling me it wasn't edible (dud) and mad no move to remove it--always great to be on a date taking apart parchment that is hot and getting your hands coated with grease...).  Overall service was unfriendly, distant and uncomfortable.  Big disappointment this time.
review_title: Have been to A16 many times.

review: Still a good restaurant, but just not as good as when they first open~ compare to the same level dinning restaurant, wine is over price!!

50 minutes to get a sandwich and small bowl of soup. Tables arriving after us were served first. Waiters are trying and bus boys are there but crazy long wait for simple food. Great location for drinks.
review_title: They try hard but kitchen can't handle lunch time

review: Great location, especially for the Bridge-light view in the evening. Food is always a winner- Fresh and expertly prepared and beautifully served. The staff is attentive and intuitive.I have eaten here many time for lunch, drinks and occasionally dinner. Easy access from BART and great location in the SF Ferry building.
MarketBar is the best go-to spot near the water. It's easy to get in, great food, the service is spectacular, and the overall mood of the restaurant is purely classy and fun.
We had early lunch. I had the cod sandwich and my friend had the Dungeness crab appetizer. We enjoyed the food outdoors on a sunny late morning.
review_title: We had early lunch. I had

review: This place always has interesting starters - and many change frequently. The deviled eggs with crab are a constant however, and are delicious. Tried the prix fixe menu tonight and really enjoyed the house-made Italian sausage with risotto, and the eye of round. The mushroom flatbread was also very good. In warmer weather the outside seating is very pleasant, and the bar is a good place to hang out at any time of the year while waiting for the ferry.
Still one of the best views in town and great food. The starters are amazing, especially the deviled eggs.
review_title: Still one of the best views

review: Restaurant was ok, nothing special. Service was great but the food wasn't anything that stood out. I was there on a date and staff was fairly observant and wasn't very intrusive. Thanks!

MarketBar has a vibrant ambiance, an attentive staff and very good food I enjoyed a wonderful cream of mushroom soup and followed that with perfectly cooked scallops on a bed of perfectly prepared, creamy polenta. The only negative was that the scallops were a bit over-salted.

The wait staff were quick, efficient, helpful, and friendly.

I suspect the restaurant might be noisy when crowded, but on a Thursday night with only a dozen tables occupied the feel was relaxed and not overly loud.

Attentive, knowledgable staff. Food was well prepared, though main courses were a little light on the sides - not much outside of the entree, which was surprising, considering prices were on the high end. But an enjoyable experience overall, with great views of the Embarcadero night strollers and activity. Will be back

I was a bit dissapointed with Market Bar. I ate there before and always enjoyed the food. This time, it was just an ok. The waitress recommended the burger as restaurant's special. My colleague order the dish, medium. Burger arrived cooked fully cooked, burned actually. It was not good at all. He ended up returning it and ordering soup instead. They still charged him for the soup, which I thought wasn't cool.Anyways. I am not sure I'll be rushing back anytime soon. There are so many nice and yummy places to eat in this city, this experience was dissapointing.
review_title: I was a bit dissapointed with

review: Loved the MarketBar! I met my daughter there for lunch; the weather was perfect, so we were able to dine out on the patio. The service was wonderful, and the ahi salads that we had (along with a carafe of sauvignon blanc) were awesome! We will definitely be back again.

Good place for a dinner near ferries and financial district crowd. Service was quite good. They could offer more wines by the glass. Food was fine, but watch out for the range of spiciness quotient in the salted peppers appetizer.
review_title: Good place for a dinner near

review: Good food - good service - prix fixe on a Friday . . .cool!
We sampled 4 different items, 3 of which were not very good. Would be willing to try again because the service was excellent and our server very welcoming.

Overall it's a bit pricey for the food, and mainly for the service, although the food is definitely good. What was a bit over the board was that they wanted to charge when we asked for some olive oil for our smoked salmon bruschetta...

The MarketBar was a nice surprise with the selections of food which arrived in a timely manner. We did not have to ask for service at our table, the server was very attentive and helpful with selections from the menu. The location was also convenient as we were on our way to enjoy the play Peter Pan.
review_title: The MarketBar was a nice surprise

review: The portions for some dishes are small and huge on others. I could have used a few more veggies in my greek salad while my mom's salad was huge. The other entrees at the table seemed to be of good size but I was left starving!!! The service is good. Great view and location....which seems to be what you pay for!

Something was seriously wrong at MarketBar on Sunday night. We were seated immediately but there did not seem to be a waiter assigned to our table. We observed one working waiter and a man who appeared to be a manager who was delivering food to tables. The waiter carefully avoided us, taking orders from parties that arrived after we did. He refused to acknowledge our presence, no apology, nothing. When we pointed this out to the hostess she poured water and brought bread. Then a busboy was sent to take our order. Unfortunately, we had a question about the menu. He went away to get an answer and never returned! The waiter and manager continued to ignore us. Eventually, a young woman, dressed in a waiter's uniform, arrived and took our order.
Everything was good; however, it was not outstanding enough for a return visit EXCEPT for a warm day for outdoor dining.
Even on a wintry day, it is like being in France - epi bread on the table, raw oysters and othe rseafood available, large outdoor area/view of Hyat Regecny and sqare behind it.
review_title: Even on a wintry day, it is

review: The chicken salad lacked any character at all, including flavor. And the portion size was quite small relative to the price. I was at this restaraunt in may for dinner and I was not thrilled that time either.
too noisy, couldn't even hear the waiter over the background noise. Won't go again, a shame because the food is wonderful.

The food at Catch was excellent. The flavours were decadent and the portions were just right. Sitting by the fireplace was created a romantic atmosphere. The service was very attentive and welcoming. It was a wonderful, sensually abundant and fulfilling dining experience.

We had dinner at Catch before going to a show downtown - and for our 30th anniversary!  It was very quiet at 6 p.m. but gets busier later.  We were seated immediately and had no trouble picking a bottle of wine and our dinner selections.  The Oysters Rockefeller were outstanding, and new to the menu in our experience.  Perfectly done and delicious.  The pork belly and clams was a hit, too.  The butternut squash ravioli were delicious but overwhelmed by the tomato sauce they were swimming it, so the flavor was compromised.  They would be better in a simple butter or other light sauce, which I said to the waiter, and he told me I was not the first to say so!  The mushroom side dish seemed overdone and not very interesting.  We finished off with a delicious fruit cobbler.  With the Castro MUNI underground across the street, we made it to the Orpheum Theatre in plenty of time.  Thank you for another enjoyable dinner!

Everything about our experience was outstanding: the gracious host. The congenial, attentive and conscious waiter (Tyler) knew we had a performance to make and kept the food courses flowing. The food was artistically displayed. Every bite was savored and delicious. We raved to family of the wonderful experience. We will be dining with you again, and again.

Had a lovely dinner this past Saturday night.  

Great place to take that someone special!

Food was ok, but a bit over priced.

All the food we ordered was very good, with a large variety of fish available.The vibe was lively but not too loud for conversation. Nice mix of people. Terrific waiter with a big welcoming smile. Have been here several times and will return.

Sat at the bar for dinner

Swordfish was great drinks were awesome

Randy was a great bartender made sure our dinner was paced between courses

Highly recommend Catch

Been going to Catch for years..always great food (fish cooked perfectly) the risotto is out of this world! The sushi roll yummy!
The staff is charming and poised, always professional. We just love Catch!

While I live in the neighborhood, I have only been to Catch a few times. I went with a party of six for brunch...the service was flat out poor, disorganized and seemingly erratic. There were not that many customers but.... The NOISE level was loud in the outside -- and perhaps we should have sat inside. The food was OK -- but nothing to rave about. It was disappointing.

Our first time at Catch, and it won't be our last. Primarily fish, but interesting other items, such as short ribs, too. Try the artichoke heart and Dungeness crab tempura appetizer -- amazing. Mixed seafood grill was excellent. It was busy the night we were there and service was perfect. A very modest corkage fee for the wine we brought and a quick taxi ride from our Union Square hotel. Great place.
review_title: Great place. Catch it if you can.

review: The dishes were mediocre in taste and were overpriced.

My daughter and I started our delightful Sunday lunch with the freshest Hama Hama oysters and tuna tartare. Then we both had mussels served in a spicy Chorizo, harissa and coconut broth, and topped with french fries. The mussels were cooked perfectly and the spicy broth provided an interesting background. I would recommend ordering the fries as a side rather than on top of the mussels. The service (Robert) was very friendly and efficient, just as it should be. We'll certainly go back.
consistently delicious food, same friendly waiter,very knowledgeable of menu, perfect timing on everything and good value in the City where none of us can afford to live anymore. We'll be back

Crab cake appetizer: 2 small crab cakes for $14 is a little overpriced, but I could live with it if they were good. They were the worst crab cakes I have ever had. Just flavorless mush in a patty. The sushi roll appetizer was pretty good.
I ordered the mixed grill seafood entree - the sea bass bite was fine, the Mahi Mahi was inedible - just a slice of gristle, couldn't eat it. The salmon piece was overcooked. All three pieces were very small, like 2 or 3 bites. The beans they were served with were way too salty, in a sauce that had zero character except salt. Overall VERY disappointing. What happened to Catch? We have been there multiple times in the past, will NOT return.
The best dining experience in The Castro, hands down! We love CATCH!

We are from Palm Springs, and we wanted a fish restaurant that was NOT in the Fisherman's Wharf district. This place was perfect! Great fish, Nice ambiance-someone played show tunes on the piano-which was located above the dining room so that it filtered through the crowd rather than take over the conversation.
And, thanks to Open Table! we were able to walk right in and sit down. The walk-in/s were lined up outside. They obviously felt it was worth the wait-and Hubby and I have to agree!
Wonderful seafood plus other great dishes.  Warm friendly service in a comfortable atmosphere.  We will definitely return. Thank you.

Catch is a good restaurant for the Castro. I think they need to concentrate on the amount of oil, butter and salt that is put in their dishes..especially the oil. Many items are not properly cooked and come out very greasy. The combination of ingredients is great and they should continue the course they are on but train their chefs on grease!
I loved our waitstaff, he was so kind and make it a really great experience.

I went there for lunch and sat in the front by the street. I enjoyed the ambiance, the sun and the fresh air (as the front was open), but the food was very disappointing. I had a ceasar salad and lobster bisque. The lettuce was fine, but the salad dressing was really pretty awful -- obviously from a bottle, weet, gummy, no anchovy flavor, not at all what a ceasar dressing should be. The croutons were made from some very airy uninteresting kind of bread and had no flavor whatsoever. The lobster bisque had decent flavor, but it was pretty thin and watery, not thick and creamy as a bisque should be. The service was fine, but no bread? I was very disappointed with the food. I live close by, but I definitely won't go there again.
Catch is a wonderful restaurant, great ambiance, food and the service it outstanding!
review_title: Catch restaruant is a great catch!

review: I bring people to Catch that want to see another part of the city. Tourists love the change of scenery and it is always good solid food.
review_title: I bring people to Catch that

review: We had a lovely dinner. The service was excellent, and we were extremely well treated. Especially liked our entrees and the trio of sorbets for dessert. Would defininitely go back, but we've been there before. It never fails.
review_title: We had a lovely dinner. The

review:
To be honest, I as a bit worried when I read most recent reviews but I was pleasantly relieved once we got seated. (Based on the breadth of negative feedback lately, clearly some people giving reviews are just embittered).
This restaurant was very good! The service was friendly, timely and attentive and the food also very good. Don't know why I waited so long to try it. (.....I will keep quiet about the Tuesday wine special though).
review_title: To be honest, I as a bit worried

review: a true delight....Cathleen, our waitress, was a delight.
The food was delicious. The lighting was a dark made it very hard to read the menu. The wait staff was very courteous. I would return to Catch for another good meal.
Requested a location near fireplace and was accomodated. Must dine early!!! Really appreciated the ambiance and warmth. Food and service was good.

Always one of my favorite places in the city. Casual but still trendy and always friendly service, great food. Had their scallop special, absolutely delicious. Waitress paired the wine well, glasses were never empty, warm bread, nice seats next to the fire place on the patio, no wait... What else could I ask for?

I admit after reading some posts about this place I was a bit skeptical on what we would get for service, but I was pleasantly surprised on how good it was. My GF had the salmon and I had the halibut. Both were well prepared and tasty but seemed to be lacking some punch. I did like the Tuesday 50% off a bottle or wine discount.
Great feel and good food. Extremely well done all around. Will definitely recommend to others.

Gnocchi with broccolini and red peppers in marinara were heavy, glue-y little balls in an unremarkable sauce. Pear salad with walnuts was large, with lots of interesting greens (purslane) but overall bland and not well balanced. Service was pleasant and friendly but uneven -- too long a wait for drinks, pacing of courses was iffy. Waiter didn't seem to understand which dish belonged to which diner, brought sharing plates for everyone to eat one person's dish. Overall, not a great experience. Noise level was comfortable until a table of 7 or 8 older men was seated nearby, when the noise became bothersome.

We always have a great meal at Catch...sometimes sit at the bar and dine..love that energy at the bar and attention from the staff.love the bar design and great lighting behind it. the servers are always friendly and available....great place in the Castro.
review_title: We always have a great meal

review: absolutely fabulous location for seafood. great mixed drinks and wine list. no better location to eat at
All the food was great. There was plenty of variety on the menu and wait staff was excellent happy and proffessional. I will return. Thank you Catch for a great experience.
review_title: All the food was great. There

review:
The food is good, but not impressive. The presentation of one of our friend's entree was nearly impossible to eat. Our server was well-informed about the menu and practically begged us to ask questions about it. Very friendly service. The bar has improved greatly, and the strawberry-kiwi cosmo, while a bit subtle, is definitely worth a sip.

Avoid the oysters. I can't resist oysters, so I make the same mistake everytime I eat at Catch. I've never received a properly shucked oyster, and quite a few that were full of shell and grit.
review_title: The food is good, but not

review: Catch is adorable and we very much enjoyed our fish. However, the choices of fish, expected of a place named "catch", were a bit slim. About 1/2 fish, and 1/2 other meats. I say to Catch, stick with the fish! The Mahi Mahi was sooo good that I actually cleaned my plate!
review_title: Catch is adorable and we very

review: Food was good, not great. Pacing was far too quick. We were in and out on a Friday night in 55 minutes and that was with cocktails and fries, starters, and entrees. The piano is there, but no longer has a player. The customer doesn't seem to come first at Catch. Food that's ready will sit in the kitchen, left until your server happens to walk by and see that it belongs to one of their tables. There are no food runners and a server will look at the food and leave it there if it doesn't belong to one of their tables. The hosts don't seem to care if you are there or not, not even bothering to utter a simple "thanks" on your way out, even when half their tables are empty on a Friday night. I won't go back anytime soon.

I got there about ten minutes before my reservation and was able to get a table right away and our server was very friendly. It was a nice, romantic environment. It was one of the best restaurants I've ever been to and I would definitely go again.
review_title: I got there about ten minutes

review: Catch has been a consistently good restaurant since I started coming 2+ years ago. The food is always good, the decor is quite nice, and the service is friendly, competent and attentive. All in all a great neighborhood restaurant!
I had the salmon with risotto and it was PERFECTLY prepared, a really surprising lunch, and honestly priced, I felt.  I always like Catch, but this was my first lunch visit.  Great job.
review_title: I had the salmon with risotto

review: Despite the fact that San Francisco is a coastal city, it's incredibly challenging to find actual seafood restaurants in a town obsessed with sushi.  That alone makes Catch a rare and welcome find.
Tim was a wonderful waitperson.  So genuine and personable and noninvasive at the same time.  Great service. Thanks

rest_name: India Clay Oven Restaurant and Bar - Richmond District
review: If you have a craving for Indian food this is the place to go. All the appetizers are tasty, and our favorite main dishes are the tikka masala, palak paneer, and vegetable biryani. All washed down with a good Indian beer.
review_title: Place to go for Indian food fix

rest_name: India Clay Oven Restaurant and Bar - Richmond District
review:
This Indian Food restaurant is excellent. Friendly service and outstanding food.
Not much parking on the street.

The owners Pino and Antonio are  always welcoming and gracious! They make you feel like family.
The service from Dominico was extraordinary...food is beautiful and delicious! Definitely one of our favorite downtown restaurants!
Predictably good experience, everytime. One of my favorite go-to meeting places.

Overall, good food and good service. Had the dine-about-town menu for lunch, specifically the mussells as appetizers and bake trout with risotto for main entree, and they were delicious! The portions were just right as well. Will definitely go back!

We loved it. Wish the near-by parking garage had stayed open beyond 9 PM. Brindisi is a small and very cute restaurant that reminded us of Europe. Our waiter was attentive, patient and knowledgeable. The food was very good -- even by SF standards.
review_title: We loved it. Wish the near-by

review: A fantastic restaurant that makes you feel like you're on vacation, not in the financial district. Friendly, delicious, romantic - just wonderful!

Waiter was able to convince the manager to let me order a food item that was not being offered that night. only one waiter was serving all the tables inside the restaurant although the person who seemed like the manager was helping out a little. The linguine had lots of seafood compared to other restaurants that serve seafood linguine. The steak was average.

We returned to this restaurant because we had enjoyed the food a few years ago but that same quality does not seem to have been maintained. Given the many other restaurants available, I will likely not return to this one.
Very enjoyable. Pasta's delicious. Very friendly service.
Restaurant was empty but service was still slow, and disinterested. We were actually the only table.

As we approached Brindisi on Belden Place, I should have taken the fact that there were tons of people sitting outside at all the other restaurants and none sitting outside Brindisi as a warning sign. Service was a major issue at this restaurant. We had to wait 10 minutes for the last person in our party to get her meal, had to ask multiple waiters for our check that took a good 15 minutes, and finally when someone in our party left something at the restaurant, the people were extremely rude and not willing to help. Food was ok but drink lots of water as we all found our meals extremely salty.
Great restaurant and a nice ambience. Tight fit inside though. Might not be the best for large groups. Great food and wait service.

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review: Based on our experience in Four Season Restaurants both here and in Europe, this was a very disappointing experience. We thought the decode lacked the pizzaz we associate with Four Seasons and although the food was good it was not anything special. The service was spotty. Having said that, I appreciated the complimentary dessert they presented to my partner on his birthday. A thoughtful touch.

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review: Met with a friend for breakfast to catch up on events at this firm.  Oatmeal with lots of beautiful berries for him and decaf coffee in a pitcher, and eggs for me with regular coffee.  Everything was nicely presented, food was delicious, and I love the fact we had individual pitchers of coffee.  Didn't have a problem with the old restaurant - this one is fine as well.

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review: it took 25 minutes to get the beer we ordered - flakey, subpar service -

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review:
It is very sad. The Seasons, well it was good, in the past.

I am disappointed by the menu and the service. It seemed that they down graded the menu, and the service. why?

With so many other great restaurants near by, if I were staying at the 4 Seasons, I'd go for a walk and not stay at the hotel.

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review: Wonderful setting, in a vibrant part of town. Somewhat limited menu, but the items on it were very tasty. Would recommend and return again!

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review: Based on our experience in Four Season Restaurants both here and in Europe, this was a very disappointing experience. We thought the decode lacked the pizzaz we associate with Four Seasons and although the food was good it was not anything special. The service was spotty. Having said that, I appreciated the complimentary dessert they presented to my partner on his birthday. A thoughtful touch.

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review: LOVED IT! LUIS OUR SERVER FIVE STAR FIRST CLASS! THANK YOU! KEVIN V.WONG

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review: We went to Seasons at the Four Seasons to celebrate a 50th birthday. I did not mention the birthday when I made the reservations. However, during our lunch, our server quietly inquired whether we were celebrating something special (we had given the "birthday girl" a bouquet of flowers), and she brought our guest of honor a piece of chocolate cake, with "Happy Birthday" written in chocolate on the plate. A really nice touch!
review_title: We went to Seasons at the

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review: Whenever we require a quiet, elegant location for a luncheon with friends the Seasons Restaurant has never failed to meet our expectations. Their Crab Louis salad is surely among the very best in San Francisco. As always, Four Season's service sets the standard for all others to meet.
review_title: After all, it is a Four Seasons

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review: The turkey entree dressing was too salty. Enjoyed the beet salad.

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review: Eating at the Seasons is a delightful, elegant dining experience. Superb service, outstanding food combined with a quiet and romantic ambiance makes the Seasons the perfect location for celebrating a special occasion. I let them know that we were celebrating our 1 year anniversary when I made the reservation and they gifted us with delightful desserts inscribed with chocolate "happy anniversary" scrolling on the plates. They get a 5* from me.
review_title: Eating at the Seasons is a

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review: I was looking for a quiet restaurant for lunch with an out-of-town guest. My requirements were good food, comfortable surroundings, tables far enough apart to facilitate conversation, good service and all at a fair price. Seasons fufilled all of these expectations beautifully.
review_title: I was looking for a quiet

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review: very pleasant surroundings with excellent service. great place for a birthday lunch.

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review:
We stumbled upon Seasons searching for a last-minute reservation for Easter brunch. We were out-of-town visitors and used the Open Table site to get to the restaurant site.

We arrived to discover that rather than a typical Easter brunch, we could have an appetizer and seafood buffet, and one of four entrees. This was fine, although not what we had planned and primed ourselves for. The entree choices included butter-poached monkfish, lamb, squab and a vegetarian choice. All a bit heavy for noon.

The service was lovely, and food carefully prepared. We were shocked at the price - $98 per person - which was mentioned nowhere on the website or the menu that day. "If you have to ask..."

It was lovely but a bit disappointing.

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review: I was tasked with finding a special occasion restaurant for the 20th anniversary of my father's retirement. He wanted a nice room with quality service and a menu that was simple. Seasons was absolutely perfect. He had the veal chop, which was cooked to perfection and served with his choice of sides. I wanted something that required a little more skill and went for the duck breast. It came with a selection of accompaniments that combined to make an elegant plate. The waiter helped us all select delicious wines by the glass. And the tables were nicely spaced so we weren't interrupted by our neighbors. Next time I want to try Windows, the piano bar.

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review: We had a wonderful table by the window looking over Market and Grant.  The food was wonderful.  We had the crab louie salad.  Very San Francisco.  The service was perfect.
review_title: We had a wonderful table by

address: 757 Market St.Four Seasons HotelSan Francisco, CA  94103
review:
please  check the LAST  TWO   REVIEWS  I gave that you sent  me  for more info.
 thanks

There were six of us so we required to choice between a pre-fixe 3 course menu and the 5 course tasting menu.  There were plenty of choices to accommodate everyone on the 3-course, so we went that direction.  No disappointments with the more limited menu and the Indian/French fusion worked beautifully.  Some creative amuses were much appreciated.

The Hors d'oeuvres were great. Just a Great balance. if you have the wine or champagne, they will pour you some to taste if you like it. That was a great gesture.
The bread was good. The service was also very attentive
The chairs my  sat on have a cut of the leather. They need to follow more details of some of the chairs wear or tear.
The main course was a bit weak.
review_title: Special Occasion for a great experience

review: I wish we had known when we made a booking that the weekend had a limited set of options in terms of the menu. Other than a Prix Fix menu there was nothing else. The options were also limited for vegetarians, but the food we had was good.

We dined here during Dine About Town.  The special menu was a value.  First course corn veloute was exceptional in taste and presentation.  Salmon second course was ordinary.  Panna cotta dessert was very nice.  Service was inconsistent.  The dining room is beautiful with very nice ambiance.  Let's hope the staff was having an "off" day.
The dine about town was a great way to get to have some great food at this restauraunt, a restaurant that I would not normally visit. I enjoyed all of the dishes!

On 30th of September we had amazing dinner experience at Campton Place restaurant in San Francisco, California. It is our family tradition to celebrate our Birthdays at lovely eating-places. Campton Place happened to be a marvelous venue to enjoy delicious menu and to celebrate my wifes birthday. We took three dishes menu and every plate carried an example of great taste. It was wine pairing that struck and impressed us most. The stunning revelation is the best words to describe our feelings rising with every glass of precisely chosen wine. Wed like to say a lot of thanks to every person at Campton Place who helped us to feel happy on 30th of September 2013. Anna and Oleg Paralyush, Moscow, Russia.
Great place for lunch or dinner. The venue is lovely and quiet for conversation. We enjoy the dining room for lunch when shopping at Union Square.
review_title: Great place for lunch or dinner.

review:
Very quiet and I was only one of 3 diners in the restaurant (it was early on a Tuesday which may have explained it).
Food and wine pairings were wonderful and very well presented. Would definitely recommend and will revisit next time I'm in SF
review_title: Very quiet and I was only

review: Magnificent! Went here for a spectacular birthday lunch and each dish was perfect. The service was professional, warm and friendly, didn't miss a beat. We hadn't been here in a few years but based on the waiter (a recent Boston transplant) and the amazing food, we will be back soon. Everything was perfect.
PERFECT Dinner, tried the 11 course sampler was the best food of our trip
Delicious and interesting food. Fabulous and gigantic cocktails!

Had the Dine About Town 2012 lunch. Simply superb! I had only 2 courses, appetizer and entree. The Sunchoke veloute (a puree soup made from artichoke root) was the most delicious thing I have had and was perfectly balanced with wild mushrooms and bits of roasted rice. The beef short-rib was so tender, perfectly done, and packed with flavor served over pureed potatoes. It's the best deal I have ever had in all the Dine About Town meals over the many years. Service was impeccable. Highly recommend!
The special pork entree that was recommended fromt he server was disappointing. Was quite dry and not moist.

We had the tasting menu. All 6 courses plus the muse and the "pallet cleanser" between courses were excellent in terms of taste and my wife and I were both full at the end of the evening. The pace of the service was measured to allow for a relaxing evening. They were also very accomodating in swapping out one item due to a dietary restriction. This is one of the best tasting menu's I've had in a while and quite reasonable at $85/person. There was also a good selection of wines with bottles at a variety of price points.

did the dine around menu nothing impressive. Food is what you could get in another restaurant for half the price if you go on a regular day. service was rushed. good for a promotion but never coming back for regular lunch.
review_title: did the dine around menu nothing

review:
Small portions,salty food, very pricy and our server paul was nice but a complete disaster.
will give it another try when they not doing the dine around menu.
wonderful food: well prepared and presented. Small dining space. Service was slow, though.
Food has always been great for us there but the last visit somehow wasn't all that, maybe the head chef left by the time we were having lunch at 2:00 pm.
Food & wine were excellent. Ambience perfect. Great service.

"We were extremely disappointed with the food. The Asparagus Apetiser was just two stems split and grilled no taste at all, carbonara was like eating in a hospital bland, tasteless. However the chicken curry was mindblowing. I dont think American cuisine is the chefs speciality.

Despite being there for DAT, the service was exceptional. The restaurant was cute and classy at the same time. I have to admit that my favorite part was the savory chocolate cake with peanut mousse. The starter and main course were delicious, but not mind boggling. Overall, from when we stepped into the restaurant until we had our last sip of wine, the experience was great.

We had Christmas luncheon here, which featured a prix fixe menu and wine pairing, so I did not see the usual menu and wine list. The meal, however, was spectacular, and the wine pairing excellent. Service was perfect-friendly, but not too much so, and quite professional and anticipatory. Definitely a special-occasion place for us (total for two, including wines, champagne, coffee = close to $500), but I'm sure we'll be back.

This was a great dinning experience. Over the years Campton Place has had its greta food and at times not worth it, but thi chef has been very successful in raising the standards. Every dish was outstanding. Service was great, unobtrusive but very attentive when needed.
review_title: This was a great dinning experience

review: Never going back to that restaurant was given the regular brunch menu for mothers day brunch at triple the price. For a special occasion chefs talent if any could have been appreciated.
review_title: Never going back to that restaurant

review: We went for a birthday celebration and the birthday girl loved it.
review_title: We went for a birthday celebration

review: The restaurant is beautiful and soothing - sorry I can't say that about the food. I ordered the chicken curry expecting something wonderful considering the chef is Indian and the hotel is under Indian ownership. The dish was the most bland, rubbery cubed chicken/tomato sauce concoction ever. Most disappointing. My friend had the sea bass which she said was also so-so. However, we did enjoy the key lime parfait dessert. It was more ample than the lunch and very tasty. We would not return to this restaurant.

Can't flaunt the food - very delicious. Waiters were very pleasant.
The surroundings were soft and well-decorated ... but next time I might want to choose a window-side table - a bit dark in there.
More vibrant/kinetic music can always help an already pleasant place to have brunch.

We were celebrating a birthday and a rare visit with an out-of-town friend.  Wine and champagne were two of our favorites.  We were very happy with the food and service.  A perfect spot for a special occasion.
Beautiful little restaurant with great food. I've been coming here for 20 years. It's my fave Indian restaurant in the city.
review_title: Beautiful little restaurant with great f...

review: I love Wexler's -- food and cocktails are divine.  They smoke their own bourbon and cherries, so their Manhattan is incredible.  The food is creative, prepared and served with care and pride.  Took two of our foodiest (should be an adjective here in SF if it's not) friends on Sat night and they adored it.
review_title: Fabulous Food and the BEST Manhattan on the Planet

review: We had the po boy and the chicken-fried portobello sandwiches. Both were amazing. Nice place for a late lunch to catch up with a friend. I'll be back.
review_title: We had the po boy and the

review: Small, spare decor, but the food is outstanding, and just that little bit different; a little taste of the South, New Orleans variety.

I don't normally write a whole lot of reviews but not only was my date awesome, and she suggested wexlers, but the food was excellent as well. If anything I wanted more. I cleaned my plate too quickly. I would highly recommend. Small restaurant so I encourage reservations.

I get it that it is an upscale BBQ with a twist but the food presentation was the best part of the meal. The pork plate was tasteless. Some of the other dishes were better but not worth the trip. The wine by the glass is very expensive for a small pour.
review_title: I get it that it is an upscale

review: Great food and ambiance. Our group thoroughly enjoyed our experience at the restaurant.
A great experience: The food was wonderful, our server was fantastic..the restaurant had a intimate feel to it.. We will definitely return again!
rockin high end BBQ in cool, cozy, downtown setting
review_title: rockin high end BBQ in cool,

review: We love this place so so much! There were 5 of us so we were able to try nearly all the entree and none were short of spectacular! Scotch eggs, cauliflower apps = delish! Skate, pork plate, short ribs, even the chicken which I would typically skip at a restaurant, all so yummy! And finally I had room to try the bourbon banana creme pie - OMG! When can we go back?
review_title: We love this place so so much!

review: We were pleasantly surprised by just about everything. Will definitely be back and woth more friends!
The guy behind the bar told me he is the owner. He is always there, and pays good attention to all the customers. Food is remarkably creative and tasty.
review_title: The guy behind the bar told

review: First time and was blown away. Superb, knowledgeable service and creative food that everyone raved about at the table.
review_title: First time and was blown away.

review: Fantastic experience! The skate, although a punch too salty, was outstanding! We also enjoyed the Scotch eggs and Monterey Salad. My favorite desserts were the Asian Pear and Banana Cream pies!

The food was excellent. Don't come here expecting Memphis or Southern style BBQ. If you don't have that expectation, the food is really great. All the apps and entres have a smoked flavor and are all well conceived and prepared. Even the salad had smoked onions and corn bread croutons.

The service can be a little slow between courses as the kitchen is pretty small.

The deserts are pretty inexpensive ($6) and are good. I had the chocolate fudge pie and it had the right combonation of sweet and savory.

We started with the tuna tartare and seared foie gras.  Then a filet mignon and aged sirloin steak served with two sauces.  Also, the complimentary three variations of fries and a side of brussel sprouts.  We ended with the chocolate peanut butter panna.  

All the food was very fresh and the steaks and sauces were outstanding!  Additionally, the fries and brussel sprouts were delicious.  A very fine wine list was offered.  A great cocktails.  Unfortunately, the rest of our dishes fell flat.  There wasn't much flavor to the tartare despite it supposedly being a signature dish.  The foie gras was seared perfectly, but should have come to us hotter.  And the complimenting food was an odd choice and we didn't eat.  Finally, the dessert fell flat.  The cake was slightly too dry and somewhat bland.  

We'd come back for the steaks, but it wouldn't be our first choice given the mixture of good but less than dishes.

The is a very expensive restaurant.  The food was good but not exceptional, especially for the price.  Our steak was good, but not extraordinary.  I expected a really good dinner and I walked out dissatisfied and frustrated .

Never a disappointment. The steaks are well seasoned and perfectly cooked. The scallops are fresh tasting and again perfectly cooked. As I have eaten the scallops here many times before, my only negative comment is sometimes the scallops are a bit too salty. Service is flawless and very welcoming.

Definitely pricey, but worth it. My wife and I visited SF for our first wedding anniversary and were fortunate enough to stay at the Westin St. Frances. We had our anniversary dinner here and loved every aspect of it. All total, we had an appetizer, a salad, two steaks(8oz fillet and 18oz ribeye) and the truffle mac n' cheese, I had two bourbons, and the wife had two glasses of wine and we got out for $270 including 20% tip rounded up. This is definitely in the top 3 most expensive dinners we've enjoyed together, but we budgeted for a wonderful trip and didn't regret it one bit. If you have the means, I highly recommend this restaurant.

Thank you for taking such good care of the group of girlfriends.... Fabulous wine, food & service (A+++)
Between Noah (Sommelier) & the talented kitchen team nothing can compare for fine steak in SF.

Very impressed with the staff and the meal was extraordinary. We frequent steakhouses monthly and although we didn't get steak this time the meal represented the chef's flexibility well. Ginger Ahi Tartar, Duck Fat Fries, Brussel Sprouts, Stuffed Quail and Halibut. We brought a friends Pino and the sommelier helped us with the tasting notes. Great time.

Bourbon Steak food and service were not the premier experience we were expecting. The staff was very courteous, but we often found ourselves waiting, as if the restaurant was understaffed. We were seated at a 2-person table that was spacious, but also very close to the tables to our right/left - we easily could hear the other couples and found our conversation difficult due to the noise level. My wife had the Angus Filet Mignon and found it tender but chewy. My sirloin was overly lean. The Yukon mashed potatoes and spinach were quite good and the desserts were the best food of the night. We paid top dollar (>$250) for a special evening and were disappointed, having experienced "average." Strange that the steaks were the least-good food.

I like a good steak. And their steaks are pretty good - I shared my wife's filet. I had salmon - which was supposed to be "just the fish" so we ordered sides... turned out it came with vegetables and garnish. Annoying. Just be clear on the menu, can't be that hard!

That said, I was exceptionally disappointed by the unacceptable behavior of the "sommelier" who proceeded to taste my wine before me and open the bottle away from the table. It wasn't even an especially old bottle... it was only a half bottle of 2007 Darioush Cab.

Overall, it was a cold restaurant that's way too touristy. Somewhat expected so close to Union Square, but I thought Michael Mina would have insisted on better process.

Great place for before heading out to a play. We ate at 5:30 and we enjoyed a full 3 course meal with 2bottles of wine (pricey but good) and left by 7:30. Service was not great for such an expensive place. Wine Somm seemed a bit too serious and waiters were not too amiable. So we might return but mainly for convenience to Curran theater. Food was good - filet was very good, scallops were nice. Dessert was average. total bill was 400 plus tip so we really expected service to be more attentive and friendlier , oh well .
review_title: Hi class place, not great service

review: The duck fat fried french fries were fabulous! It is expensive, but worth the splurge.

Service and food were superb until the very end when one of the managers brought our take-home boxes and put them all in one bag when it was fairly clear that we weren't all one family and likely not going home to same place. But the biggest faux pas was that after paying our rather hefty bill with 20% tip included for party of 6, that same manager asked us to leave as they had someone waiting on the table. First of all there were a number of empty tables, second of all, we were getting ready to leave anyway and it was rude to be rushed on Christmas Eve no less. Ruined the end of a very lovely dinner.

The food is very good but not worth the prices. The ahi starter was divine and the salads were outstanding; the side dishes were excellent. The steaks were good but not special enough to warrant $45-50.

Service was not good. Long wait for someone to take drink orders. Waiter told us about an assortment of complementary fries that would come as an amuse bouche. 20 minutes later we asked about them and 10 minutes after that they arrived....after we finished our starters. They were outstanding, however. We had to ask three times for salt (which my steak desperately needed), refills on water were spotty and the waiter seemed put out to refill my coffee. My friend ordered espresso, which was never delivered.

Food 4 stars, service 1
review_title: The food is very good but

review: Great location and amazing service made paying a little extra worth it for a special occasion. It's a beautiful spot and perfect location to stroll around union square. Even as a native San Franciscan it's a nice way to spend a night. Highly recommend the truffle Mac n cheese and the marrow. Overall two of us easily spent $320 + tip for dinner with cocktails. Whoops!
Great cocktails, excellent wine list. Knowledgeable wait staff were attentive but didn't hover. A very lovely evening.

So I love love love this restaurant! I have been coming to it for years when it was the "Michael Mina." The service is amazing without being stuffy. The food is top notch. The only negative thing I could say is that I think they have played around with some of the recipes and I am a creature of habit so I was a little bummed that the dessert I ordered wasn't just like I remembered. We did order one of each desserts for the table to share and the beignets were out of this world!!! I seriously think I am going to go back this weekend with my hubby and just order desserts...who am I kidding? I'll get a steak too!
review_title: So I love love love this restaurant

review: We went to Bourbon for a Valentine's Dinner, & they had a special tasting menu with wine pairings, which we both chose. Michael Minna's interest in pan-Asian flavors shows even in this bastion of red meat, providing a compelling contrast of flavors and textures: hamachi crudo and lobster "purses" reminscent of delicate steamed wontons. Portions were just right and we both felt sated vs. stuffed. The wine pairings were on the mark, and I especially enjoyed the Riesling with the 2nd course. Atmosphere was dark and romantic, inside the lobby of the Westin St. Francis. We could hear each other easily without shouting. And just like MM's eponymous restaurant in the Financial District, service was attentive, knowledgeable, & warm. A great night!

Our appetizers, sides and dessert were amazing: foie gras terrine, wild mushrooms, beignets. Also the complimentary fries are the best ever. Surprisingly, the steak was good but not exceptional. We have had better steak elsewhere and not as expensive. We also were not wild about the ambiance. It was very noisy and as the space is one big room if felt a bit inhospitable. The waiter was superb; the bussers could use some work--didn't fill water glasses, tried to take the plates away when we were not done. The wine list is incredible, over 60 pages, but beware you will be hard pressed to find a wine under $100. Given the high price point of the restaurant and all the incredible restaurants in SF, we are not sure if we would go back.

After such a mix of diverse reviews, I was anxious to get on with our dinner at Bourbon Steak. I, like others had high expectations for what is a decidedly pricey steakhouse.
Arriving early to enjoy a cocktail and bite at the bar at 7:00 on Black Friday, the space was packed. We were able to shuffle up to the bar after a few minutes and enjoyed our drinks with the perfunctory Lobster Corn Dogs. They are wonderful bites, no doubt, but at $16 for four - two bite snacks, the game was on. Cocktails were spot on, and the bartender pleasant.
Seated 30 minutes early was a treat for us. I had brought wine, which was taken when we checked in with the hostess, and presented again when we sat. This set the tone for service that was impeccable all e
review_title: After such a mix of diverse

review: The complimentary french fries, which were always perfect, was delivered cold. We had a new batch brought to us. The mushroom gratin as a side dish came in a small cast iron dish but it was also cold - room temperature cold. Gratin is not supposed to be cold. They offered to bring a new one, but we did not really want it as it was a bit bland and needed more flavors added, maybe just salt. We had our "usual" tuna tartare, lobster potpie and a ribeye steak. The overall experience was good but we felt all of the food slipped a bit in taste. Service was impeccable.

I was very pleased with the menu selection-ordered way too much!-the service was perfect- my Ahi Tuna tartare was mixed on the plate by the excellent server-the bourbon flight and glass of cabernet were excellent-the gift from the chef of fries 3 ways was generous and superb. Very nice relaxed time, much better than I expected, yet it was Michael Mina so I should have known!
review_title: I was very pleased with the

review: The  butter poach steak is tender and flavorful.  I just wish their decor was as nice as the food.
Nothing to write home about. Service was outstandingly good but the quality of food did not correspond with its service.

We were sat at a table where we literally could not read the menu - it was too dark. The waiter actually had a flashlight. We got up and moved. For the price, the ambiance is poor. The service, however, and the food were excellent.
review_title: We were sat at a table where

review: We had a great time at Bourbon Steak. The cocktails are expertly crafted. The wine list is extensive and comes with a friendly guide who will help you find the right wine for your meal and your budget. The appetizers and main course were timed perfectly. Noise: while our waiter was giving us the introduction to food, the music in the restaurant was so loud I could barely hear. I glared at the speaker and after the waiter left, the music quieted down so we could have a conversation without shouting.
review_title: We had a great time at Bourbon

review: VERY expensive ($68. for a porterhouse steak!), but the food was wonderful!

While Michael Mina is great, Aqua still blows it out of the water. Always a few ahhhhhs; i just wish every dish made me swoon. We did find mixing some of the food on each course with other sauces made things better....

The menu "Trio of" concept is a bit gimmick-y and tired now.  But the quality of the food and its presentation are excellent, and the main courses provide more food than you expect.  

The noise level is high, and the tables for two are wide, so it is not a place for a romantic chat or a confidential business dinner.

The waitstaff is young and knowledgable, without any pretensions.  Oh, except for the silly new ritual of "seasoning the glass" with 6 drops of wine prior to pouring for the taster.  If you just chuckle about it, the sommelier will chuckle along with you!
way too expensive!!  I've had some pricey meals, but this out did the french laundry, which was beond over priced.

We were celebrating our first anniversary at this restaurant and it was the perfect setting.  We had a wonderful food server who helped us make the best decisions for our meals.  The drinks were very tasty, the food was spectacular, and the view of Union Square at sunset was beautiful.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone I know and we will definately be dining there again.
Food, service and ambiance are among the best anywhere!
I simply could not get over the feeling of being in a hotel.
review_title: I simply could not get over

review: That was not 2 star Michelin. The server was(doug). The food was not. We did the tasting menu and the wine pairings. I was severly disapointed. A big flaw in every dish except the amuse and desert. If you want AMAZING food go to Manresa.
This was truly a surprise dining experience that is still memorable to this date.  The quality of the food was incredible and the preparation and presentation was outstanding.
Been going to the restaurant for years, you must try the wagu!

It was the second time my wife and I have ate here it's never a disappointment. Our favorite meal to order is the truffle Mac and cheese. We decided to order the Wagyu 100% steak and it was the best steak we ever had.

service was excellent, wait staff was very friendly. The 50% wagyu filet was very tender but not a tasty as the ribeye. Brussel sprouts were a little overcooked. Great place to go on a special ocasion

Okay...it's not cheap.  But, frankly, we didn't know beef could taste like this.  And it was worth the price to experience it.  As a matter of fact, we shared the "5A5 Experience".  Everything was really outstanding.  The service, the salad, the side dish, even our table neighbors who became our new best friends when our entree arrived!  And Wagyu beef is the most amazing food on the planet.  Our server was friendly and helpful with suggestions, and we enjoyed the ambiance too.  Not super loud, but not what you would call a private romantic environment.  Overall, we enjoyed it immensely and we look forward to visiting again.
Everything we ordered was great. Over server was very attentive, but it was a little loud. But all and all, a great place for steak.

It is always such a pleasure to go to 5A5. The service here is just as exquisite as the food is.  I took my boyfriend here for a surprise birthday dinner, every staff member made sure to wish him a happy birthday. They also brought him out a special dessert, a mini strawberry short cake, with "Happy Birthday Josh" written out it chocolate. It was really special.  The meal was great as well.  We had a feast of brussel sprouts, lobster mac n' cheese, half and half wagyu steak and a filet.  Everything was mouth watering.  Three days later, I am still thinking about the lobster mac and bacon bread.  If you are looking for a great dining experience, with great food with powerful flavors, and a place with great ambiance and service - go to 5A5.
The food here is just good, plain and simple. Great steaks, appetizers and sides. Delicious!

My friend and I take each other out for birthday dinners. We both like a good steak twice per year. Ruth Chris', Alfred's, Boulevard(fillet), Alexander's etc. Fillet Mignon has been the usual choice. 5A5 tops them all for flavor and tenderness. However, I would not want to take, to the restaurant, a friend I hadn't seen in a while. The noise level at 7:00 on a Thursday night calls for nearly shouting to one another during the most excellent meal. This is not the place for a quiet, romantic special occasion dinner.

Many reviewers have commented about how good the food is and I can only agree with the positive reviews. However, I need to make a special comment about how professional the waitstaff are, from folks bringing bread and water, to the server to the maitre 'd. In many restaurants today, the waitstaff are either almost non-existent, or too "in your face." Here, they wade sure to take care of you while allowing you to fully enjoy your dining companions and the excellent food at your own pace. Outstanding service!

It was the perfect blend for my graduation night dinner with my parents.

Memorable moments:
1. excellent service: the waiter was friendly & knowledgable & took the time to answer ALL our questions
2. learning about the Japanese meat was quite fun & great visual experience having the samples in front of you
3. the atmosphere: lighted ceiling and projected burning fireplace was a nice touch

My friends just moved here from London and I knew they really liked steak. For three we got seated in the back where the tables can be extended. The snooty hostess only open one side of the table. It wasn't like the place was packed. A waiter came later to extend the other side of the table. We ended up getting the Dine about Town meals. The clam chowder was over salted and my steak was cooked unevenly, however, it was a large portion. My friend did return her medium rare steak which came out medium. Our waitress was extremely accommodating and very concern about our degree of happiness. My other friend tried the wine pairing which he enjoyed quite a bit. Overall, I wasn't that impressed with the food.

I wasn't sure how to "score" this place, so it's best to read this instead of focusing on the actual scores. The menu did not have enough options for me in terms of the non-entrees. The food was very good but our experience was definitely soured by the CONSTANT interruptions from the wait staff. It was over the top. Too much attention. Great restaurants know how to service you without making you feel like they are on top of you every 5 minutes. Nuff said.
I did find the bartender to be super friendly and warm. And as I said, the actual food was very good. Lobster appetizer is amazing and the meats are excellent. Will go back again but I will warn the waiter in advance to give us some space.

It's a girl night out for me and my friend. The food is great except I think the chef forgot to put sauce in my steak, I have a few drops while my friend (same dish) has a normal amount. The service is great and the food is great. We were seated by a pillar which feels a bit strange to us, we asked to be seated in the other table, the receptionist told us that will be used as a table for 5 later, but it turned out not, just another couple, I wished she had just told me it was reserved. Now I felt like either she lied to us or she just didn't want to go through the little trouble to walk us 3 more steps to that table.
review_title: It's a girl night out for

review: My husband and I ate here for second seating on New Year's Eve 2012. This is where the question East Coast vs West Coast rears its ugly head. The food was good, the drinks were fair, the service was rushed, and there was no dining entertainment to entice you to hang out until the Midnight Toast. This was our most expensive dining experience in San Fran, and the most disappointing because of the lack of New Year's Eve experience we're used to. It seems expensive dining was rushed so attention could be given to those who bought "After Party" tickets, which was a DJ in a small dance area. Even in D.C. dining establishments do not put you in a vice grip like this. No worries though, our lack of tip reflected our disappointment.

We went for our 5 year anniversary and the food was phenomenal. Truly fantastic. Nice ambiance but, the acoustics lend towards a really loud room. It was like having a fantastic meal in a crowded bar.
review_title: We went for our 5 year anniversary

review:
As far as a San Fran steakhouse, I would rate this place average. Nothing in particular made it stand out. Although the food was good and the service was great, it was normal.

The chef did supply us with complimentary treats for palette cleansing and other reasons which was nice, and I would recommend going at least once since the other steakhouses in the area are much more expensive and fill up quickly.
review_title: As far as a San Fran steakhouse,

review: I have high expectation about having steak but the rib-eye was not so good. Disappointed!
It was a hip and modern take on a steakhouse. The decor was definitely nightclub inspired. The food was good, the portions very generous. The service was excellent.
review_title: It was a hip and modern take

review: This place was amazing we went on Valentines day and they had a fixed menu at 95 per persionfor 4 courses. The choises were great and the portions were just right didn't go home hungry and not super stuffed. And let me tell you this was one of the best steaks I've ever had it was like butter and they was just the regular steak Yumm. I plan on going back just to see the real menu. If you want to treat yourself to SF fine dineing and still be able to have fun wile there then 5A5 is the place to go.

The steaks we order deserve 5 stars, how ever, the side dish we had: "Sautee Swiss lark" was too salty. Staffs are friendly.
Nice ambiance and dinning room layout.

Was given. $250 gift certificate from a friend had a chance to try a lot of things. Everything was way over priced and portions were small. Wagyu beef prices were exorbitant. Steak and prime rib were very fatty. Not worth the money - glad I didn't ave to pay.

Most diners came in dressed too casual so it doesn't make the experience special.

We celebrating our anniversary at 5A5 and we
we had a lovely evening! The food was delicious
and we had wonderful service thanks to
Jim! I would highly recommend it!

Food was excellent, especially the 7" Chocolate. The one thing we did not like was when one of us arrived, they will not seat you at the table even though it was empty at the restaurant and I was only a few mins early, instead they want you to seat by the bar area which you will look weird sitting alone if you dont want to order drink. So, I ended up waiting for my friend outside.
it was delicious!!!! LOved the edamame and kobe beef sliders.

I was craving a good steak but not keen to eat at typical steakhouse in shorts. I wondered if there was a place that served great steak in a more relaxed and contemporary interior. 5A5 is just that. Everything about this place made for a great evening. From our speedy seating by the smiling hostess to our wonderful server Daniel. And then the amazing food- the Himachi shooter was amazing, I had the filet mignon. The mashed potatoes are to die for (bacon on the side as it's good but quite big chunks and sweet). The steak was melt in your mouth good, the sauces great but not overpowering and did I mention the Himachi shooter?! Tuna with avocado and a bunch of flavors served in a shot glass. The perfect appetizer for the perfect meal.
This steakhouse is perfect for those that want a romantic dinner at an affordable price. Try the Hamachi, filet and desserts. And the service was exceptional!!
Food is pretty good, but over priced. The ambiance is a little too flashy, at the expense of being tasteful (including the clientel).
review_title: Food is pretty good, but over
