review: We were there doing Dine About Town. I really like the selection and it is worth the money. I tried the filet mignon for the main course. Boy... it's really tasty. Highly recommend this restaurant to all my friends who wanna do Dine About Town.
review_title: We were there doing Dine About

review: I love the relaxed feel of this place - modern, upscale  like a hipsters steakhouse. I definitely would return to try more steak. The table was split on the bread with bacon  one person thought was great, but the other thought the tastes didnt quite mesh. Everyone loved their steak. Service was well-timed and friendly, but drinks were expensive.
review_title: I love the relaxed feel of

review: Wow, this restaurant is quite a gem. Went for my birthday didn't know anything about it and now have raved to all my friends. I liked the fact that the portions were small but very adequate. The flavor outstanding,decor and ambiance very different from your mundane steak houses in San Francisco. In all a must dine!!!!!
Excellent food and great service. Great variety as well.

We went there for business dinner. Surprisingly, there are bunch of people who looked like business people (30s and 40s) and not many young people hanging out/dating. Probably because it was Monday night. Food was decent, but nothing spectacular (though we didn't try their expensive Wagu). Food-wise, you probably get much better experience at Morton's. The waiter forgot to bring our coffee, btw, so we left without drinking coffee. Atmosphere-wise, it's a good restaurant with cool interior. It's always good that you go out on Monday and see the restaurant full.

everything was wonderful. My only complaint is that we had a member of our party join late, just after our food was served. It took a long time for him to get his entree. Other than that, it was great.
Everything was wonderful at 5A5 from the outstanding service to the fabulous food. The best meal I have had in a long time.
Food was great, but unfortunately it took more than two hours to get the food!

We enjoyed the food, especially the steaks. The service was very good. Unfortunately, the noise level was too high and it was difficult to carry on a conversation with friends we hadn't seen in a while. The prices are high, so although the meal was good, we would only return if someone else were footing the bill!
The steak was excellent, the selection of wines by the glass were disappointing.

The appetizers were fantastic. I had the beef carpaccio roll which had jicama and avocado in a tangy ponzu sauce. This was quite tasty however i think that it would taste better if there was another thing besides the jicama in the roll. The truffle fries are an absolute must. I had the 12 oz NY strip which was too big for me as I was totally stuffed afterwards. Other things at our table was the bone in ribeye which was huge!!! the dessert was also very good. I think that the sides and bites were more tasty than the entrees though.

I have been to this restaurant a number of times and have enjoyed the scenery and food.   One small suggestion I have is that the staff who are professional, become little bit more knowledgeable about special needs and help make dining a bit more memorable by not rushing so much.

We went for the view and were surprised to have a absolutely delicious dinner.
( the only con : I ordered scallops and although the whole dish was delicious I only had THREE scallops on my plate ! Come on! Put one or two more )
But I still give it a 5 for food . Everything we had was really good (4 of us there)
I would definitely go back.
Service was great.

As local diners living in Outer Sunset/Ocean Beach area, choices are slim for late evening dining venues with nice ambiance, quality & fresh food, full bar and professional, attentive service.  This was our 3rd time dining at Beach Chalet late on Friday evening. Our appetizer (smoked salmon with potato pancakes), fresh & tasty mushroom soup, main entrees (special corvina sea bass & bacon wrapped pork chop) were all consistently delicious.  My significant other enjoyed his tasty draft beer and I savored my aromatic Svedka lemon-infused vodka.
Highlight of dinner was our server, who was courteous, attentive and paced our meal well - no rushing, despite the late hour!  Thanks, Beach Chalet!

A friend and I meet here midway between our homes.  It's a convenient location, in SF, but easy to park.  Last time (2013) was not the best.  Food was not good and service lackluster.  This time, it was much improved in both categories.  Even on a foggy day, the view is spectacular.

We went to the beach Chalet with my son and his wife. It was a special occasion for us. We were very pleased that it was easy to find, right across from ocean beach. There was plenty of free parking. We were not dressed super fancy and my husband was wearing a baseball Hat. But we fit right in. 

Each table had a fantastic ocean view. It could only be better if they figured out a way to light up the ocean at night. 

Did I say the food was fantastic?

Yeah. We had a nice time. I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

This is a wonderful location and the view is wonderful. I planned on being there for sunset, but the manager insisted on having the shades down even after I requested raising them. Food was ok, service was ok.

Beach Chalet is my favorite lunch spot to take out of town visitors. The view is incomparable, food is very good and service is attentive but not hovering. It never disappoints. I love to take guests to enjoy a leisurely lunch and see beautiful Ocean Beach.

The pcutre on the website doesn't do this place justice. The inside is much better than the outside. The entrance hall before going upstairs is very inpressive with fantastic frescos of San Fran and california in an art deco style. Upstairs is mre modern but the best part is the view over the pacific and the wonderful large breakfast !! We had a a great time, it was early in the morning, the service was great. In the evening the bar looked well stocked and there was plenty of seating so could imagine that its very good to go there for drinks and look out over the sea.

My friend and I do an annual lunch at the Beach Chalet to celebrate her birthday. Often, we haven't talked in months, and we want to just sit and talk without being interrupted. Our waiter seemed to sense this, and let us talk as long as we wanted. We didn't feel rushed at all, and he was careful to leave and pick up the check again without disturbing our conversation. I was grateful, too, that I was able to reserve a table next to the window, as I have done in other years. It was a gorgeous, sunny (!) day, and we watched the ocean and i enjoyed the freighters passing by.
review_title: My friend and I do an annual

review: Had a reservation made 3 weeks in advance for a party of 8. We all arrived 15 minutes early and waited an additional 20 minutes to be seated. Then, the 2 hour lunch began, and we had all planned on an hour lunch and an hour outdoor hike. Had to skip the hike, waiting for an entry served incorrectly. Not to mention, we never were offered water or iced tea refills. And then waited some more for the check to arrive. After lunch I pulled the Manager aside and told her how awful the dining experience was and she said shed talk to the kitchen and the waitress. This was our third and final outing to TBC. Never again.

I've been to Beach Chalet several times and had good experiences. However our most recent visit on 6/16/13 was not as good of an experience as previous visits. At our reservation time of 10am, the server said the table was being set and we would be seated, however we were not seated until 20 minutes later when I asked again. After we were seated it took another twenty minutes or so to place our order with the waitress. Our breakfast was served after 11:10am, with no recognition of the delay from anyone in the restaurant. Before our food arrived we were starving and asked for some bread, which was promptly delivered, so that was one good aspect of the service.
Otherwise, the food was of good quality and was served hot.

I have been going to the Beach Chalet for 10+ years. I was very disappointed on our last visit. I had brought two friends with me, one who had been there before, the other, a new comer. The service was slow and inept. We had to ask for bread, our water glasses to be re-filled, more dressing for the crab salad (after the waitress said that the salad had been dressed.) My calamari portion was not as I had remembered. The steak was tough. After we had finished, our waitress came to our table with our check in hand, asked us if we wanted to see a dessert menu. Even if the answer had been yes, we wold have declined, as we did. I will visit again, hoping for a better experience.
they went above and beyond to hold our window table as we were late from the airport...they were so gracious and we really appreciated it.
Got the seat that I requested from open table reservation.

The view is beautiful and the building has some great history and displays. The food was pretty good, but not great. The waitstaff was friendly but the service was incredibly slow - we were there for over 2 hours for lunch. The view and our company were a nice distraction, but based on my experience, I wouldn't recommend the beach chalet if you are in any kind of hurry.
Food was good but the noise level was off the charts! Very very loud!!
review_title: Food was good but the noise

review: This was my first time going to Beach Chalet. My fiance and I were celebrating our anniversary. I did not have to wait too long for the food, but did have to wait ~ 15 minutes to get my change back from my server. Another server came by to give us water, and I had to tell her that we had been waiting ~ 15 minutes for our change. A different server comes by and asks us for the total, how much we gave, and what we had ordered. Finally, our server comes by and tells us that she didn't know we had been waiting for our change. This is unacceptable for this kind of restaurant. If they want to keep their reputation, they need to better train their staff on customer service. Overall the ambiance was good. The view is beautiful.
review_title: This was my first time going

review: I have eaten at the BC many times. It was quite a delight to see a little band with a xylophone (!!) set up to play as we were eating on a Tuesday evening! The style of music (Lionel Hampton) was very relaxing and the band was very cordial and charming. What struck me was that there was a 90 year old woman with her caretaker enjoying the band and next to them was young father who brought his little 3 yr. old son to listen and watch the xylophone player!.... All in all, it was a very enjoyable evening!.... we always come back! :)
review_title: I have eaten at the BC many

review: I was very disappointed with my experience at this restaurant. The food was not good, overally priced

While we miss the original fried calamari, the dinner we had was lovely and a good place for a business dinner. We go for a romantic evening out as well. The service was a bit perfunctory but aside from that, our usual great dinner in a great location.
Great food, impeccable service and fabulous view of wonderful ocean waves....
This restaurant has become the favorite meeting place for our quarterly luncheon with former classmates. Great beer, great food, great service, great views, free parking. What's not to like?

When we arrived at the time of our reservations around 8:00 pm, we waited at least 15 minutes to be seated (5 guests).  It took another 10 to 15 minutes before we saw our server and another 20 mins before our order was taken.  Most of the restaurant diners had left by then so why was service lacking?  After placing our order, it was about 40 minutes before our meal arrived and the server did not stay in touch with updates on our order.  Again, why poor service?  It was a dual birthday celebration and needless to say, by the time we finished our meal, we no longer wanted to celebrate and no longer wanted our birthday cake served.  It was almost 10 pm when we left.

Even with the fog, the view is spectacular. We were impressed with the service as we changed our group size a few times. The staff was incredibly accommodating (which we understood might not happen on a weekend night) and also never let on that we were being an inconvenience, even though we thought we were. The food was good but not amazing. The scallops entree and ribs appetizer were the favorites. The beer on the other had was great. Try them all!

We will return for the beer, the view and the wonderful service.
LOVELY location to watch the sunset or fog set over the ocean!

We went here for the view which is amazing.  I have been here a lot over the years and they have been consistently a good place to eat.  The food is always good, not over the top but good quality with fresh ingredients.  When I am just looking for a fun friday night environment near the water this is the place I enjoy.
Loved it. Good, friendly service. Burgers were great; pasta was "adequate."

I had the nicoise salad, found the portion of tuna a little small (approximately 2oz.) for the price although perfectly cooked, the haricot verts were too raw, a tad more blanching for al dente as opposed to not raw nor al dente so i could not really enjoy them. The dressing was perfectly applied a set off the salad while not being overpowering.
My friend had the grilled salmon nice portion and large portion of the accompanying risotto and brocolini. Although the risotto looked overcooked and again with the broccolini not blanched enough so my friend hardly ate any which is such a waste of food.
She did not want to send back, so there was not an opportunity for the kitchen to address.
The house brew was very good and a nice pint.
review_title: I had the nicoise salad, found

review: Good food, great beer, and one of the best views in San Francisco.

Our server, Tim, was excellent (pleasant, efficient & knowledgable). At no fault of the resaurant, there was a large group with 4 kids who were very loud at the table beside us. The food was delicious except the fries were a bit overcooked for me (my fianc liked them though). Overall, a great place for a brew (or any other drink), a burger (or just about anything on the menu), & catching the sunset (or just people watching on the beach).

We had a late lunch on a foggy summer day, but the view was still outstanding. The food was very good (fresh American), and the service pleasant and unobtrusive. We enjoyed not feeling rushed. It was like a mini vacation. We'll be back!
review_title: We had a late lunch on a foggy

review: The filet was the best i've had. menu is erratic in terms of what is good, but the good things are really really good and the mixed with the view it's a great romantic spot.
review_title: The filet was the best i've

review: The location of the restaurant is its greatest asset.
Not the place to go for valentines day but a goood place to go for a evening meal
review_title: Not the place to go for valentines

review: The Beach Chalet outdid themselves in taking care of our party of ten which included four children. Service was friendly and efficient, the food was great and we loved our table with a view.

I love this place because of it's location and view. The food isn't bad at all, but a little pricey for what you get. It can be romantic at night, yet great for kids during the day, which is really nice.
I love this place for the beautiful view, but the food can be up and down. The service has always been good.
review_title: I love this place for the

review: I invited seven friends and two of their children for brunch. We had a fantastic time. The food was delicious, the view was spectacular. Three of my buddies tried the stout. They loved it.
Terrible! Do not go to this restaurant if you are planning on eating your meal. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone and I am from San Francisco. Tourists beware.
review_title: Terrible! Do not go to this

review: The restaraunt is beautiful and what better view than Ocean Beach, although it's hard to see at night. We had a great booth. The food was hit and miss. The salmon was overcooked and salty but the filet was great. The service was spotty also. They were very nice and sometimes very helpfull but, the next minute they disappearred and you couldn't get help. It was very busy due to the holiday so it was difficult to critisize the service. The waiter made a great choice from the wine list. His service could have been better, maybe a personality would help. When I have to ask for my water to be refilled it's usually an indication the service is a little weak. No bussers I think, so the waiters were doing everything.
Food was good. Beautiful view and historic setting. Would go back again and would tell visitors to SF Bay area to check it out.
The Beach Chalet is ALWAYS a great spot, with food quality always consistent. As San Franciscans, we go often, but love taking out-of-town guests there, as we did this week.
My first time there and it was very nice.  There are some great looking items on the menu that will definitely bring me back to try.  Lovely view and ample parking were a big plus as well.
review_title: My first time there and it

review:
I always have a good time when going to the Beach Chalet.  The service has always been very friendly, warm and inviting.  It's nice place for both adults and children.
Of course, the beach view cannot be beat!!  Its great for taking out of town people for brunch, to enjoy the ocean view.  It will continue to be one of my favorite neighborhood places.
review_title: I always have a good time

review:
I went upstairs restaurant. (Downstairs has a pub-bar-restaurant setup with live music at night.)
The direct view to the ocean from the almost every table was just gorgeous.
The service was fine, but the food was not too great. Its own beer selection was fun to choose.
I will take my college kids there someday.

Was leery about eating here as my husband and I are vegans but the server was fantastic and made great suggestions and even on Valentine's Day had awesome service, food, cocktails and the tables around us were social and fun. Will definitely be going back.
review_title: Fun, loud, vibrant, great restaurant and bar

review: I've had a lot of Mediterranean food in my life and Ziryab does it right.
review_title: I've had a lot of Mediterranean

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: The food and service were great.  We will definitely be going back in the future.
review_title: The food and service were great.  We wil...

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Nothing special  my $49 steak was full of nerves and hard to cut. Food lacked presentation
review_title: Nothing special  my $49 steak was full o...

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Ruth Chris never disappoints!!! The spicy lobster appetizer was to die for, the Poterhouse for 2 was perfect for my daughter and I and we both got lunch for the next day!! The creamed spinach and stuffed mushrooms were just amazing!!! The drinks were perfect, the Pre Fixx my daughters boyfriend ordered was delish and a perfect amount of food even for a big boy!!!! I just love this place!!!!

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: From the beginning to the end of my experience, my server was a rare sighting. He never stopped by and asked "how's everything" or if we needed anything else.  My parents and I were out of water for most of the dinner. It wasn't until I asked another waiter who was passing by that apologized on my server's behalf saying "you should never be out of water, I'm so sorry." Even getting the check at the end of the meal was impossible. When we did get it, I put my credit card in and he didn't come get it until 20 minutes later (it probably would have taken longer if I had not waved him down) and apologized that he had forgotten that he gave us the check. I definitely wasn't expecting this type of service from high rated, popular restaurant.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: I took my wife here for our date night, and we really enjoyed it. The food was great, the service was wonderful, and the time was enjoyed. I recommend this to any steak lover. The steaks were great and when I said medium rare, boy was it medium rare! Great spot, great food, great service.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: The ambient is great, classic American steak restaurant. The service is good, they pay attention detail. The starter was great, but the main course, the filet, well there was a lot of room for improvement. Ppt was cooked accordingly, but the meat quality was about average. The wine list is great though and offers a large selection of wines.
review_title: Good steaks, but not the best

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Great Evening. Waiter was terrific! Food excellent!

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: i always celebrate my bday here, they have one of the best rib eyes because it is so buttery and flavorful. my friend dropped part of her steak on the floor and was really sad about it and the matron dee happen to walk by and gave her back a fresh peice, classy. the drinks are a bit pricey but soooo good. their blue cheese olive vodka martini is my go to, my bestie loves thier moscow mule which other restaurants cannot make in the same way. t heir sides are delicious such as the sweet potato casserole, to die for, sweet. we love their blue cheese wedge salad and caeser salad. always great ! love this place.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review:
Seared tuna and porterhouse for 2 was a great choice. Our waitress was wonderful, even asking the kitchen if they would prepare the wedge fries for us, we miss those!
Spectacular piece of meat, cooked perfectly. Enjoyable evening

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Probably one of my best visits to Ruth's Chris. Our server Nicholas was wonderful, came by the table at just the right times, very friendly, knowledgeable of the menu and treated us as if we were the only couple in the restaurant. 2 thumbs up!!
review_title: Probably one of my best visits

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Again this restarurant excelled with their "Dine About Town" offerings. Neither the food nor the service were compromised from their normal excellent levels. Their standard menu is a bit pricey for us, so we'll look forward to the next "Dine About Town" special for another visit.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: We had a group of 6 and ordered 6 steaks (different cuts). They all came out very good and we were very satisfied, other than the heavy butter/oil on the steaks. Hoever, this is an EXPENSIVE restaurant so it was not a great value - $388 (including tax) for 6 steaks before alcohol.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: This time the restaurant was a bit disappointing. There were some very noisy groups around us that made it difficult to concentrate on a romantic dinner. The food was just not quite up to the level it's been in the past. Both of our steaks (filet and New York Strip done medium and medium rare) were tough with some ribbons of almost uncutable fat running through. The calamari appetizer was pretty soggy and the chocolate cake dessert was dry. The servers seemed either to be overly eager in clearing things or to forget us. As well they forgot to replace utensils taken cleared which had to be asked for. It was overall an ok experience, but not what I've come to expect from Ruth's Chris, hopefully just an off night for them.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Another good experience; however, on this particular night, they ran out of bread. I'd suggest that no high-end steakhouse in a popular city like SF should ever run out of anything, as it was a busy week w/ US Open, Dine About Town, and the Giants playing at home. Those are things to think about when running a super hot restaurant. Also, I'd suggest a kid-friendly menu to allow kids w/ families to also enjoy their meals and not obligated to order steak, seafood or chicken.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review:
Service was the worst ever. We have been regular guests in this Ruth's Chris Steak House in San Francisco but we will never come back again because the waiter was rude and incompetent.
We order Champagne and got the bottle but no glasses. Ok, fine! He opened the red wine but forgot to pour and eventually I had to pour our glasses - Not acceptable for such a steak house. We also did not get the necessary attention throughout the dinner (where is the water!!!). On top of it the waiter did argue with us what to order and how our meat should be - FYI we know what we want and do not need your incompetent advice. RUDE!

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: We ordered the Dine About Town menu which included a 6-oz filet that was absolutely out of this world! Great food, very courteous service. We have been to Ruth Chris' in other cities and the San Francisco location did not disappoint.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Ruth's Chris always gets my business when I want a great steak in San Francisco. I have been so often I always have the Filet, cooked perfectly in that 1800 degree oven. I've eaten in Ruth's Chris when ever I travel and find myself in a city with one. It's always been a good choice.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review:
Wine list outragously expensive as well as the entress.

The RC in Walnut Creek, CA is much better.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Excellent service and food. We visited for dine about town.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: I had to send my steak back twice and it still came back over cooked. What a shame!!!

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: As always, their steak was done to perfection and the server staff was personable and professional. Side dishes have become smaller over the years and prices have gone up as well. Still, for a very good steak and quality sides, salads and desserts, this is a great place for a very good meal.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: The SF Ruth Chris restaurant has good food and service, they treated well on our anniversary.  I would return when I am in SF again.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: I have been in the past and had great steak, but the previous 2 times I have gone my steak was too chewy with veins. I love to go, but it seems that the prices is getting higher and the steak quality isnt as good.
review_title: I have been in the past and

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Our waitress Gabby was exceptionally GREAT!!! She made every effort to make our dining experience great.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: My son and I split the Porterhouse for 2, and it was great. It was carved into 8 pieces 3 from filet and 5 from New York) and brought out on a platter with the T-bone. The server placed a piece of New York and a piece of filet on each our our sizzling small plates. We helped ourselves to the rest. The shoestrings are a fine accompaniment.
review_title: My son and I split the Porterhouse

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: It was terrific but noticed unless you ask for it you are not given Dine about town menu.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: One word: Delicious!!!! I'm not a big meat eater.. but.. I can live off their steak. I went there for their dine about town menu and it was WORTH it!!! I got so full that I ended up bringing more than half of my steak, creamed spinach and dessert home for another meal. All for only $35? Can't beat that. The steak alone (on their normal a la carte menu) was $35. So basically, the dine about town deal gave you free salad, side, and dessert. YUMMY!!! Even their bread and whipped (yup... I said whipped) butter is to die for. One person in my group kept eating bread and butter cause she couldn't put it down.. lol... Dine about town ends soon so you may wanna go try it for the experience at a reasonable price.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: We had a great time and the food was just amazing!
review_title: We had a great time and the

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Went here with my wife and almost 2 year old daughter.  Steaks were awesome. Service was great.  It is pretty high end and I felt a little uncomfortable having my daughter there as we seemed to get looks from some of the patrons.  Seemed a bit noisy for an upscale place.  Would have enjoyed more if it were just my wife and me so we could take our time.  As it were when you have kids that young, you can't stay long in one place.
review_title: Went here with my wife and

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Manager is outstanding and the entire dining experience was excellent!

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Oh how I love the 12 oz. ribeye. Try it if you haven't yet, it's the best...it'll keep you coming back for more =)
review_title: Oh how I love the 12 oz. ribeye.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Food was great, service was not so good. This might be due to a single event though because the last two times I was there, service was great.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: The best steakhouse we've been to and the side dishes are great as well.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Food was excellent, but portions were SMALL for the price. If you're hungry, go with a very full wallet!

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: The food and service were very good. Not Gary Danko good, but still good. The prices are high, but the quality is high too, so you get what you pay for. The Dine About Town menu is a good value, with a nice selection of entrees. We were late for our reservation due to traffic, but we called ahead and they were very nice about holding our table, in spite of the fact the restaurant was completeley booked!

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Big portions and VERY BIG prices. With no drinks, 2 appetizers, 2 dinners and one dessert, cost was $200 out the door. Steaks are tasty and tender, but they use lots of butter. Definitely try the crab cakes-- only crab and no fillers there. Try other steakhouses first.

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: The meal this time was much better than the last time I went there. The 2 for $89 special is a good deal, which makes it even better. It's too bad the sweet potato casserole was not included in the special menu. I will be returning to this restaurant in the future.
review_title: The meal this time was much

rest_name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Francisco
review: Our Server Christy was great, everything was perfect.

It was really disappointing - the server ignored us for the first 20 minutes (his excuse was because we were in the middle of a conversation).  There were 3 gals for a business dinner.  One of us had to get up to ask for someone to take our order.  The food was lovely, however, they screwed up one of our orders and we had to wait for the replacement to arrive.  The wine that we requested had been sold out and honestly, the price points for the wines was more than double what the cost of the bottles are retail.  I won't be back.there are far too many other amazing places in SF to eat.

I was interested by the idea of traveling along RN74 and loved the dcor, which evokes a train station, inviting you to try every wine along the road. The cocktail list was interesting and the bar tender very creative is making special and tasty ones for you. However, the food menu was a bit disappointing. I actually preferred the appetizers and table fares (notably the souffl with its "sauce au vin jaune") to the main course and desert. The sea bass was a bit blend and expensive for what it was. The texture of the raspberry clafoutis was closer to a "financier" (not surprisingly as it comes in a very thin dish), which could have been still yummy if it had the nutty flavor of the financier. Here, it lacked both moisture and flavor.
The food was very good but service lacked a bit. they did not have the wine I requested and offered a substitution that was poor.
... as well as under-portioned.  We all expect sky-high prices here, but a little more food  on the plates -- from appetizers through entrees -- would make me come here more often than I do.

Everything we ordered from the bread to appetizers to salads and entrees were hearty portions and bursting with flavor. The bread was so soft and tasty that I regret I filled up before my entree arrived. I highly recommend the chicken. I typically go for more adventurous proteins but this was the best chicken I've ever tasted - tender and juicy with a seared crispy finish. And the side of macaroni could have been the main entree it was so delicious. We appreciated the help from the sommelier in choosing our wine as their wine list is so long it is impossible to navigate. Few options under $100 per bottle however and mostly Burgundy region.

Our fourth visit to RN74 and first in 2014, this time for special occasion--Valentine's Day. The evening was amazing. Great menu, superb service and attention to detail. It's tough to find a reasonably priced bottle of wine at RN, but their list is sensational.
Everything was much improved from our previous visits. We're delighted to have another consistently great restaurant within walking distance of our home.
Great food but take too long to order drinks from the bar, and waitted forever to be seated even with a reservation. Otherwise services and food are good.

Food was wonderful and wine list was appealing but the service, while pleasant and knowledgable was disinterested. Nobody returned to our table to ask about our food or wine, They had to be reminded to bring bread. The wine we ordered was an old burgundy (1996) and was corked. The Sommelier appropriately substituted a similar wine at the same price but then never returned to see if his substitution was a good one (it was, but a followip visit would've been nice). At this level of restaurant and from this particular chef, the disinterested service detracts from the otherwise excellent cuisine. I would return, but I would sit at the bar next time.

bottled pate from casino supermarkets tastes better than country pate in this place and at a sixth of the price. bouillabaise? please! fancy enough but without the depth of taste. grilled sausage over barley and tart artichokes in tomato sauce was hard to swallow. house wine was like two-buck chuck.
review_title: boring food trying to be different

review: The food is truly remarkable and creative. The service is outstanding. This is a winner in every way. Highly recommended!

Fun place to grab a drink after work. Food was just ok. Ordered the Wagyu beef for $38, got 4 slices of beef, 2 were cooked rare (which I ordered) the other 2 slices were WAY over cooked and tasted like they picked it out of a stew. They certainly weren't cut from the same chop. Wine list was 95% international with a minimum price of $200. The Red from Chile was a terrible recommendation. My wife ordered the scallops and those were just ok. It was served on a green pea sauce that tasted like something I'd feed a toddler. A for effort, B- for food, B+ for service.
Second time atRN74 and had a great meal both times.

Our first time there. Was New Year's Eve. Each bite was delicious. Portions nice size, didn't feel overwhelmed. Was a set menu. Looking forward to going back and trying the regular menu. The wine list or book is huge, but the sommelier was very friendly, helpful and relaxed.
I really enjoyed dining here for lunch and look forward to returning for dinner. I love the theme and decor of the restaurant. Very impressive.

Excellent for a lunch to splurge! RN74 has a very extensive wine by the glass list, and I was happy to indulge in champagne and white burgundy. The sea bass entree packed a real wow - delicious and memorable.
review_title: Great place to splurge and indulge

review: The food was beautiful and delicious. Appropriately portioned too. The services was also excelletn - a little slower than I would usually like for a lunch, but he could tell that we were catching up and needed some time. I was not as big a fan of the fired mushrooms as i wanted to be thoguh. They were a bit dry. But the stone fruit and beet salad was awesome and my guest's scallops looked wonderful. Definitley would recommend and go back.

Quantities were small.
No wide selection of entrees

Definitely caters towards the building residents, not the neighborhood lunch crowd; if you live in the building, you probably don't care how much you pay for a salad and a glass of water. Not much room either; felt like I was sitting at the same table as those next to us. Typical foofoo San Francisco restaurant. Fancy decor, fancy food, overpriced and left hungry.
Really disappointed in the cocktails and food quality. Would def not go back.

Our party started with the Roasted Beet Salad, which was fantastic. We also had the Maitake Mushroom Tempura, which were also excellent. We ordered the Tageliatelle as an appetizer and that was quite a disappointment. The portion was small and the artichoke chips added nothing to the dish.

Main Course: The pork loib was satisfactory. The flat iron steak was excellent and cooked to perfection. The Grilled Mediterranean Sea Bass was agan only satisfactory. Dessert: The devil's food cake in the Milk Chocolate Pot de Creme was smaller than a cube of sugar and the salted toffee was way too salty. Beignets were the salvation.

excellent food as always from any Michael Mina establishment. This was a unique experience with Mina in order to get an authentic French dinner complete with bone marrow and head cheese. The server was very knowledgeable regarding the food and the wine. I wouldn't have changed a thing and can't wait to go back!

Waiter was really cool. Food was excellent though for some reason you have to ask kitchen staff for some items listed on the bar menu that aren't on the dinner menu (ie the sausage and hamachi kama). Everything we had was excellent though the romaine lettuce for my arctic char was excessively charred.
Great food, drinks, service and atmosphere but really expensive. My friend ordered a salad and the salmon tar tar with a glass of wine. I ordered the lamb burger with a martini. We spent over $100.
Stunning restaurant, excellent food, very expensive wine list. Bar scene looks fun as well.

We have eaten at RN74 several times and always order a bottle of wine with our meal, always off of the wine list overlooking the north end of the restaurant. Great wines, great values. Friday night, however, all the selections on that list were reislings and we wanted a red. When I looked at the regular wine list, however, I could not find any reasonably priced wines ($100 - $150) to accompany our meals. I must say I was surprised at the wine list prices - I wasn't alone, as the majority of occupied tables had wine by the glass (as we did) rather than bottles. If I had any criticism of RN74, it was that the wine list was not geared to multiple prices points and that if it were, there might have been more diners ordering bottles.
review_title: We have eaten at RN74 several

review:
AS always - one of my favorites for lunch and for after work drinks
Burger is great and so are the bone marrows
review_title: AS always - one of my favorites

review: We all enjoyed our food and would definitely return, great kitchen and very personable service.
review_title: We all enjoyed our food and

review: I candidly expected more from the food since it is a Michael Mina-owned outlet. I'd only recommend RN74 to a serious Burgundy or Pinot Noir aficionado. It's quite interesting that I had dinner a couple of evenings later at Perbacco and in essence they were serving relatively the same main courses (beef short ribs, Liberty Farmn duch, halibut, etc.) and the food at the Northern Italian-inspired restaurant blew me away.

I love RN74 for happy hour or for lunch, but have been really disappointed as of late with their dinner. The service during our last visit was atrocious - we were completely ignored for a while, and were eventually served throughout the evening by about 4 different people (not in a good way - none of them knew where the person who should have been serving us was). While the food is good, it's overpriced. We'll be going elsewhere for dinner from now on (but will be back for happy hour).

INTERESTING SCENARIO HERE. WE MADE A 10:00 RESERVATION, AND UPON SEATING WERE ADVISED THE KITCHEN CLOSES AT 10:30. I WAS ENTERTAINING FRIENDS VISITING FROM EUROPE AND THOUGHT A 10 PM RESERVATION WAS A PHENOMENAL FIND--TURNED OUT TO BE A RUSHED JUGGLING ACT. THE WINE LIST WAS A BIT HUMOROUS. WINES THAT COST $3,400 DON'T MATCH WITH WAITRESSES DRESSED IN GINGHAM, AND A WELCOMING STATEMENT OF, "THE KITCHEN CLOSES IN 30 MINUTES." WE DID ORDER A SPECTACULAR WINE, A MAGNUM OF CHABLIS, BUT IT CAME CHILLED TO ABOUT 60 DEGREES AND WAS OPENED IN THE BACK. VERY STRANGE. GRANTED, IT WAS ONLY $300, BUT CHILL IT TO 45 DEGREES SO WE CAN SEE IT SWEAT, AND OPEN IT AT THE TABLE. THEY'RE STRIVING TO BE HIGH-END, BUT MISSING THE MARK.
food was pretty good but service was slow and unorganized. sommelier was junior at best.
review_title: food was pretty good but service

review: We thought the food was excellent. I had the roasted chicken which took 30 minutes. It was well worth the wait. Our reservation was on Friday and it was very busy, but the service was great. They have a very extensive wine list.(We tried to go to Michael Mina's other restaurant [Bourbon Steak] but they were full. We were able to sit in the lounge which offered the same menu. It was good too.)
review_title: We thought the food was excellent.

review: This was our favorite food experience on our honeymoon. I really liked the "train station" feel of the restaurant and the wine board. Each course was perfect....Butter Lettuce with a Lemon Vinaigrette, Center Cut Rib eye with chanterelles, and the most amazing beignets for dessert. Service was a little awkward due to the closeness of the 2-tops along the wall. Additionally, the table next to us was obnoxiously loud the entire evening. Overall, well-seasoned, well-presented food in a great location.

I thought the food was good but very overpriced. A meal for 2 people including a $50 bottle of wine was $230 (2 entrees, 2 appetizers, and 1 side). The waiter forgot to bring us our desert but after waiting for a long time we just decided to leave without it.
review_title: I thought the food was good

review: Usually don't write reviews, but the service was very poor. Took 25 minutes to get our server at the beginning of the meal. Then our side orders dud not show up until we were done with our main course. I normally wouldn't notice this, but they put gave every one of our drinks and main courses to the wrong person on our table. Nit a big deal, but just added to our negative service experience.

Food was 'ok' - enjoyed the Halibut dish which was cooked precisely although the sauces were a bit bland. The appetizers (mushroom tempura) were light/tasty although the dipping sauce was served sloppily and the flavors felt a bit wharf-like. the Wine list was gigantic and frankly overwhelmingly expensive once you made your way into the euro-collection. Dessert was disappointing. A bit noisy and the serving staff gave off the classic we can't wait till you order and leave attitude.

I have been to a number of top 100 restaurants and RN74 is at the top of my list... Ambiance was trendy but cozy and the service was impeccable! Food was outstanding too with perfect accompanying sides and sauces. The sauteed pork belly was cooked perfectly and the halibut was excellent.
review_title: I have been to a number of

review: Not worth it, especially for the price. Comes off boasting; little to back up the roar. Oily flavorless tempure and soft shell crab. Great halibut. It sat on inconsistently prepared unmentionables. Dessert good. The main server was good; the team forgettable. We eat out for biz and pleasure a couple of times a week in upscale restaurants. Even have a chef in the family, who's in love with each detail. This place has a loooong way to go as a restaurant. Fun bar scene, though we weren't into that this eve. Feel free to pass this to them.
we enjoyed the ambience,reasonable price,but creative menu choices and will definitely retrun.

The Sunday Wine special was a fabulous value for $30 a bottle and the food was memorable. However as noted above via ratings that does not complete the entire dining experience.

We had a party of five and I was placed at the head of the table meant for four. Unfortunately, it was in the main walkway from kitchen to the dining room. I was bumped by every single waiter in the resturant every time they walked by with minimal apologies. I was clearly in the way and I couldnt see why they would ever put anyone there. As delicious as your food is, being bumped between every other bite is unappetizing. Other annoyances included being charged for drinks and food that were not ours.

This was a fabulous experience! Lovely room, great ambience. The food was delicious, and beautifully presented. We came because of it's nomination as one of the 3 best restaurants from San Francisco in the James Beard Awards, and we could understand its inclusion. It is also the only one serving lunch, which is great for people who don't like traveling at night. One of the diners is a vegan and the kitchen was most accomodating in preparing an all veggie plate.

Great food, attentive service, phenomenal wine list - if overpriced. My biggest complaint was that it was quite noisy, but the space does not lend itself to intimacy, so as long as you know what you're in for, no biggie.
We had a perfect dining experience. Absolutely perfect in every way. The food, the wine, the ambiance, the staff - all amazing. Go as soon and as often as you can.
review_title: We had a perfect dining experience.

review: Amazing, energetic ambiance, like a restaurant in SoHo. Very cool, unique interiors, great lighting, the theme of the restaurant is carried well throughout. Great drink menu and wine list. Least impressive was the food. It wasn't bad - the fish entree was great, beef appetizer was great, cauliflower appetizer was a bomb - do not order. Service was great. All in all, not cheap, but a fun, energetic experience highlighted with great drinks and good but not great food.
While the food menu is limited, the quality was A+, as was the wine list and service.
review_title: While the food menu is limited,

review: Bar area great. The rest of the experience was mediocre.
review_title: Bar area great. The rest of

review:
Amazing dinner. We were greeted warmly by the hostess and seated promptly. The hamachi, the beef tartare were good starters, but the loup de mer and the ribeye were the shining stars of the evening. The pork loin and the cassoulet were good too. Ahhhh, and the pumpkin beignets! Wish i can have that every morning! Loved the panna cotta and the pot de creme also.
Intensive list of wine by the glass, we got to try many.
Excellent service by Matt, we asked him to pair the wine with the food we ordered.
Restaurant filled up quickly, but we were able to carry on a conversation.
Have to come back, we saw every other table have the mushroom tempura (?) so we will definitely go back and try the other dishes.
Really fantastic food, service and atmosphere. Amazingly good.
This is a great restaurant. The brisket for lunch was delicious. The corn soup was mouth watering. Our waitress was attentive and lunch was very prompt. You can't go wrong with RN74.
We were celebrating our Anniversary in San Francisco and decided on going to RN74. I'm so glad we did it was outstanding. The tempura mushrooms are not to be missed!

The Food? Absolutely fabulous. The service was first rate. The space was an excellent, well done, Modern Design, the Wine "Board" was a great piece. The Corn Chowder was incredible, as was the Little Gem salad. The Halibut and Porkloin were Excellent. The wine list was extensive and while some reviewers were critical of the prices, we found a wide selection and some very reasonable prices. The "By The Glass" list was also good. Overall - our new "Go to" upscale/ casual resturant in San Francisco.

Loved it! Server advised us on the wine selection based upon our preferences and he made the perfect selection. Excellent lunch: Hamachi Sashimi, Gem Salad and Halibut. Service was very good and attentive. Ambiance and setting were unique and fun. Will definitely return for drinks and/or dinner!
the food is excellent - great flavors, well executed. portions of some of the entrees were a little lite.

One of the best meals we had,food and service. It was very late 10 pm and still energetic.
Only small complaint" the grilled mushrooms should be warm not almost cool. But still a great dish. Have to try it again with an earlier reservation.
review_title: One of the best meals we had,food

review: The pricing of the menu doesnt match the quality or portion size comparable to other restaurants in the city.
review_title: The pricing of the menu doesnt

review: The hotel at which I was staying for a conference had a printed sheer of restaurants in the area. Fringale was one of them. Looked it up on Open Table and my wife and I liked the menu, so decided to give it a shot. The most difficult part of the evening was getting there - street closure routed our cab to a roundabout arrival. Once there, all was great. Our greeting was immediate and friendly, our waiter took attentive care of us from the moment we arrived until the moment we left, including calling us a cab. The food was excellent, though it did take a little while for the entre to arrive. No matter - we were loving the atmosphere. The onion soup was tasty though a teeny bit watery; but the main courses were fantastic. My wife had the lamb chops, and I the pork tenderloin. Both were well-prepared, served at proper temperature, and just the right proportions, too. Saved room for dessert, and the homemade vanilla ice cream with chocolate sauce and slivered almonds was an unexpected treat. We'll go again, next time we're in the City.

had a recent business lunch at the cozy little Fringale. it turned out to the be perfect choice on a rainy day. i lucked out in picking this place as my client had recently been in Paris and was still high from the experience. he had the duck confit. i had the frisee salad with warm bacon dressing and the braised lamb shank (special). we washed it down with a couple of glasses of cab. the staff was fantastic with the suggestions and service throughout the meal and I losed an exciting deal over the highly recommended gateau basque.
review_title: had a recent business lunch at the cozy ...

review:
Again the dinner was great because of the food. Our young server had a slight " attitude". But for that, I'd again give the A+.

Ed

friendly staff, nice ambiance, food was fair ok, price was over priced compared to Chez Mama and Isa (they are cheaper and food are good to awesome upon the dishes you order).  Seafood dishes was plenty plain according to my friends.  Chicken, pork, desserts, appertizers (Ravioli, squid, salad) were average compared to other restaurants.  If you live close by, you can go there.  But by the price and the food quality, I can go Chez Mama, Isa, Chou Chou, Chez Papa for better food and cheaper price.
Overall, have never found a better restaurant for just about any occasion. They have always given us a wonderful experience, even in the earlier years, with our kids in tow.

The first time we went it was wonderful, great atmosphere and food and service. The second time we went there was an extremely loud and obnoxious large group next to us which made us not enjoy the atmosphere. Service and food was still excellent though
review_title: The first time we went it

review:
A great place for dinner before a SF Giants game.
This time, however, the veal short ribs were way too fatty.

With each of three courses, one dish was great and one was good. Particularly enjoyeud the squid appetizer. Overall, a very good experience: the food mostly delicious, the ambience French and very welcoming, the service professional.
Our French server was very good at his job and also was extremely attractive.
The rack of lamb was te best we have ever tasted. The entire dinner was a "10."
review_title: The rack of lamb was te best

review: the food was really good, and it would have gotten another star but for one item that was a bit odd to my taste. the deserts were perfect and on of the nicest desert menus we have seen. Interesting items rather than the usual, but still basic flavors
As usual, great French food, wonderful wine list and oh, so friendly staff. Tres bien!
Excellent French bistro food at amazingly low prices for both food and wine.

We have been going to Fringale for over 20 years. It is always a fresh, but timeless experience. We can always find a few old favorites on the menu, along with some interesting new selections (It's always a good trick to decide what to actually order.) The service is friendly and attentive (but not TOO attentive), and the food always very good to excellent. All in all, Fringale affords a dependably consistent and very pleasant dining experience.
review_title: We have been going to Fringale

review:
i've always enjoyed the food at fringale so when my family
decided to dine out on christmas eve, i suggested fringale.
the appetizers and entrees were excellent: the rack of lamb
was enjoyed by my sister and niece, the poached black cod
which i and my son's girlfriend had was
cooked to perfection.
the one black mark though was the service. granted that my son and
his girlfriend came 20 minutes late and that they ordered appetizers
when we were done with ours, the entrees arrived when they were still
eating the appetizers. the waiter literally pushed the plates of appetizers
away to give room for the entrees. a terrible sight especially on a special
occasion as christmas eve.
We travel a bit, and we'd compare the food here, as very comparable to the food we had in Montreal and Quebec City. Excellent! Looking forward to coming back.
review_title: We travel a bit, and we'd

review: I have eaten here many times and they never disappoint. The most recent experience was one of the best!
review_title: I have eaten here many times

review: Excellent food. Great service; both courteous and unobtrusive. The check, in typical French fashion, took a long while after dessert to arrive. What a great restaurant, just a few blocks from the 4th & King Caltrain stop.

Gem in the South of Market area. Walking distance from the train. Food fit for foodies, always fresh and service is excellent. A long time favorite for 20 years...Duck special was wonderful and the shredded brussel sprouts tasted like no other sprouts I have ever eaten - loved them. Reservations highly recommended as it is a small and very popular place.
review_title: Gem in the South of Market

review: Our party of 17 had a tight squeeze and seated right by the kitchen. In/out kitchen traffic was disruptive. Service felt rushed.
review_title: Our party of 17 had a tight

review: Small and charming space. I ordered the filet mignon with pomme frites and greens. The two latter items were very good. I was disappointed with the filet. The quality of the meat was not wonderful -- not as tender as the filet that I've had at Epic Roasthouse. My server was very good. She was very familiar with the menu and was great at describing the various dishes.

Very consistent dining - Crowded after so many years tell the story. Fringales has been in the same location and busy nightly for many years. The food is wonderful.

Time for Jean Marie to invest in air conditioning - It does get hot on warm nights.

It was marvelous, my father is quite the picky eater, which was why I was a little bit apprehensive about bringing him to a restaurant (any restaurant at all, really). However, the food at Fringale's was wonderful (as per usual, of course) and although it took 45 minutes to arrive (it was half an hour the previous two times), the taste was still exquisite; I love the way the chef(s?) at Fringale manage to cook the meat. We all ordered different meals (seafood, beef, lamb, and pork), and each of them turned out delicious! As a plus - the waiters (the ones that served us) actually spoke more French than just their accent, and the Blood Mary they served was delicious on the rocks (non-virgin, of course). Would definitely recommend this!

We had a good meal at Fringale, as we have, many time before. Our only complaint was the lukewarm coffee we were served with dessert, a function of the late hour (9:30 Pm) which we chose to get the 2000 points offered by the restaurant for diners at that hour. When we complained, however, the charge for the cool coffee was removed. We hope next time to have hot coffee whatever the hour; we will happily pay for it.
review_title: We had a good meal at Fringale,

review: Excellent food, good service. However the coffee was cold (server said he needed to make a new pot; I ate dessert without the coffee, unfortunately, and the coffee never came.
Food was delicious, and is consistently updated with new selections. Service supurb. Excellent San Francisco contemporary fresh French cuisine.
Fabulous! Your palate will be wonderfully pampered.
One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Always a good experience.
best prawns i've ever had! delicious hazelnut mousse cake and creme brule!

Small warm cosy feeling with a small bar and waiting area, a lively bistro atmosphere, the service and food were very good; french-inspired menu was not exactly inventive but the food was tasty and satisfying. A charming neighborhood dining experience in the big city.
I have been dining at Fringale for a number of years and the food remains well prepared and presented with regular entrees and new treats to try regularly.
review_title: I have been dining at Fringale

review: Excellent fish, great lamb and, of course, the best duck confit in town...
It is always a memorable meal. They make all efforts to accomodate their customers. andre, the host is charming and always amiable.
review_title: It is always a memorable meal.

review: Extremely pleasant restaurant, with able and friendly staff.

The food was incredible! The service the BEST! However the seating was cramp, they could loose some of their tables. The restaurant was hot due to no A/C and the open front door the only source of fresh air. With to many tables the noise was above a comfort level. Overall we will go back for the FOOD, the dessert course was off the scale.

The meal (except for dessert) and service were outstanding. We arrived on time and were seated immediately--a real plus. Also, we were thanked at least twice as we left. It's nice to be appreciated. I had profiteroles for dessert. Adding espresso to the choux turned it an unappetizing brown color. The pastry was also tough and tasted like cardboard. Plain, fresh profiteroles with plenty of chocolate sauce would have been much better. The crab napoleon was awesome.

I brought business guests from New York and Canada and they thought the food was outstanding.  I feel like I should not complain because the service and food was so good but my guests did say that they were getting too warm and that hot air was blowing on their feet.  Overall I would revisit your restaurant and thanks for the great service.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: My friend and I took a rare night away from families to enjoy the lush, flavorful offerings at Greens.  Always delicious, it did not disappoint this time either.  Carnivores won't miss the meat - too many other complex tastes textures hitting your mouth.  Vegetarians already know this is an SF go-to spot, non-vegetarians should know it is a special place for special occasions - or just the spot to celebrate during Lent.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Nice to find a vegetarian restaurant with good food and wine that is pleasing to vegetarian and non.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Great veggie food, not matched by the service sat at our table for almost 10 minutes before a waiter showed up. Had to work at getting server's attention, and I had to take him my credit card to pay our bill as he left the bill and didn't return.  Also had to wave him dome to get a coffee refill.
review_title: Great veggie food, not matched by the service.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Greens never disappoints.  All six of us loved our respective meals, which were splendid.  We couldn't resist, and ordered several desserts to share.   The pomegranate ginger sparkling drink was delightful.  I always look forward to eating at Greens.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Having been a customer of Green's for many years, this visit I felt the food, overall, uninspired. I hated the pile of tasteless grains with my dry Brochettes meal, and the slaw was way too spicy for me.  The grains/slaw part of the plate wasn't attractive in any way.  A friend ordered the linguini, and thought it was tasteless.  Another friend ordered the pizza. She shared it with me, and that salvaged the entre portion of the meal for me. I loved that pizza.  We ordered 2 desserts to share, and our server was wonderful about making the cookie substitution I requested. ... An old-friends' get-together, we were not hurried at all by Green's staff.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Great but not amazing food, wonderful staff, and an amazing view of the bay. It loses points for an inconvenient location and a less than stellar value.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Everything was scrumptious!!! I enjoyed it thoroughly, and would recommend it to anyone who loves good food, regardless of whether you are a meat eater or not.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Greens at Fort Mason does not only have a fantastice view on Golden Gate Bridge. The food was fantastic, service very good! Highly recommended to everybody who appreciates vegetarian food. Very friendly service.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: I had the linguine which was yummy.  Flavor was mild and I tend to like more bold flavors. I also had the butterscotch pot d'creme and I could have licked the bowl. It was excellent. The view is awesome. It does tend to get a little noisey but it is such a pleasant experience overall you tend to forget about it.  We went to lunch a little later so it wasn't as loud.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Even though we're not vegetarians, we love coming to this restaurant and seeing how they make such wonderful dishes without the addition of meat and meat products.  It's always so good, tasty and definitely innovative with the way in which they combine various vegetable ingredients to make one believe that it is all possible in the vegetarian world.  Definitely worth coming here every time.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
We arrived on tim at this lovely restaurant and were offered a table for 2 in the noisier Min room, or the quieter and smaller rear room. We took the rear, but the view is better from the front. Service and wine was fantastic. My wife's selections of two salads were both fresh and good. I chose the double brochettes and they too were nice. I am a meat lover and my wife is a vegetarian. We were both happy.

It was foggy, so there was no view of the Golden Gate, but the marina had plenty to keep us occupied, including dogs with life jackets on sail boats. I can only imagine how beautiful it is on a clear day. It is a 10 minute walk to the trolley station (Taylor-Powell).

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: You don't need to be a vegetarian to love the food here.  There's a zero in "bacon" for a reason.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: The selection of appetizing options was terrific...and the food matched our high expectations.  We had an amazing brunch and there was something tasty for everyone. I loved that I could have eaten everything on the menu. Being a vegetarian,  that was a first for me.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Wonderful first time experience! Thoroughly enjoyed the wine pairing with the meal. Meal was substantial! Almost went into a food induced coma!

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: From the moment we walked through the door we were totally impressed with this little gem of a restaurant. Housed in Fort Mason, it doesn't look much from the outside, but as you enter, it's like traveling to another world - clean, modern and totally zen. We were early for our reservation, so we sat at the bar and had a few pre-dinner drinks. Kyle, the bartender was so friendly and made us feel right at home as we waited. Our server had the most jovial and enjoyable accent. We dined on the prix fixe menu with the wine pairings and were not disappointed in the least. I am vegan and my sister is vegetarian and it's so hard to find a quality restaurant dedicated to veg fair. The food was unbelievable and I can't recommend it highly enough!

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: GREENS HAS BEEN A LONG TIME FAVORITE OF OURS. WE DON'T LIVE CLOSE BY BUT MAKE A POINT OF GOING BACK TO GREENS. IT IS SUCH A CONSISTENTLY GREAT DINING EXPERIENCE!
review_title: I HOPE GREENS GOES ON FOREVER

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: If I could eat at Green's every day, I would be a vegetarian. Food is always SOOOOOO good, never disappoints.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: We make a point to eat at Green's every time we are in San Francisco, which is not often enough. We dream about it. We look forward to it. And we are always thrilled with the food, the surroundings and the memories that linger on and on.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: I have heard about this restaurant for years. They are known for their creative vegetarian cuisine. I was pleased with my experience there. I thought it was going to be more "upscale" in ambiance. But, was happy to see it casual/nice with the beautiful view of the San Francisco Bay. I brought my friend that was visiting from LA and we both enjoyed our brunch. The service was good as well as our meals. Loved the free parking too! I look forward to returning to Greens in the near future.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Late Saturday brunch. It was busy but not crowded, so we were seated at one of the "window tables." This was the first time dining here for my companion and he loved the view. We shared two delicious dishes in which the portions were generous. The hostess was friendly and our waiter was delightful.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Good food, good wine, good presentation. Service was very welcome, warm, friendly. The ambience was perfect. The wait for food was optimum, not too long, neither too short. Overall, a great experience, made our evening very special and memorable.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: The ambiance was great and the food was interesting. The appetizer we got was so tiny, it was hard to even obtain a taste! The entrees were very creative with lots of good veges, but somewhat bland in taste. I did like the curry. The service was good up until we were done and then we waited quite a while for our check.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Always a great experience, dining at Greens. Such a feel good place - healthy, delicious, well presented food and beautiful ambience. Thanks again!

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: We love this restaurant with its great location, food and easy parking. Many vegetarian and some vegan options which are very fresh and tasty. The view is nice at any time of the day and the service is friendly and professional.
review_title: Great food in a great location

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
The food was was good, with a couple of dishes getting an "excellent" from us. My daughter is vegan and all of the dishes that we asked for no dairy came just as described in the menu...big dollop of cream on top, parmesan cheese,etc. Nothing came as ordered, everything had to be sent back and modified per our dairy requests. Don't know if the server didn't give clear instructions or the kitchen wasn't paying attention. It seemed odd that a vegetarian restaurant would have such a hard time modifying to vegan.

The view is amazing. Service is okay, kind of laid back, but not in your face.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Our daughter has been performing at Fort Mason this summer so we have gone to Green's three times in the last two months. Our first experience was great and the food excellent. Our second was on a Saturday ,and it was a prix fixe menu. Again our food was quite good. We returned this weekend, also on a Sat., knowing this time it was a prix fixe menu, but we never imagined it would be the same selections. This time the preparation was seriously deficient...different chef?? bad day??? My suggestion would be to go on a day when you get a full menu of choices and avoid going on Sat. nights that are too close together.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
Food was excellent for brunch - and the blackberry cobbler for dessert was yummy.
Gorgeous view of Golden Gate Bridge...
and we also got to see part of the America's Cup (Vuiton Series) race from our table.
Nice place to go for Sunday brunch.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Fantastic, fresh, food, excellent service, great ambiance, wonderful location! We always enjoy Greens, whatever the occasion, from a casual lunch or brunch to a celebration. And parking. Tried a new dish - poached eggs with chanterelle mushrooms and Polenta. Unbelievable. Friend was wowed by omelet with ricotta. Love Greens!

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: We're never disappointed when dining at Greens. The wait staff is always friendly and knowledgeable. The food is creative and well prepared. It's a pleasure as a vegetarian to have the entire menu to choose from. Our carnivorous friends love to join us and always leave happy.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: I don't know how Annie Sommerville continues to outdo herself but we all are blessed that she does. When not enjoying conversation, savoring the food and wine the sea liona were particularly entertaining. The evening was a perfect delight.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: This is the place to go for creative and delicious vegetarian choices. Great wine list and teas. Really beautiful location, but very noisy.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: My son and I had a wonderful brunch at Greens this past Saturday. The space is beautiful ; the view spectacular . Our server was so helpful and charming ,and the food was delicious. I look forward to a return visit.
review_title: My son and I had a wonderful

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: We were introduced to Greens through The Greens Cook Book (1987) but didn't get a chance to eat there until years later. Both the cookbook (along with two successors) and the restaurant itself are exceptional, more proof (if any were needed at this point) that vegetarians can eat very, very well. Whenever we are in San Francisco, we make a pilgrimage to Greens for dinner and have never been disappointed. There are always new and inspired dishes on the menu -- and if you are lucky enough to be seated at the window, you can look out over the Ft. Mason marina to the Golden Gate as the sun sets.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Greens does not disappoint. One of the best restaurants in California. Phenomenally tasty food, not just for vegetarians.Even though I was 45 min late and just 15 min before close I was fully served with no hurry or compromise in quality. A must for me when I am in San Francisco.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Beautiful but simplistic decor. Food was excellent. Service was a little slow and inattentive.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Fantastic Vegetarian Restaurant, fantastic views, great food, and their desert menu was amazing. Could be a great place just dessert as well. highly recommend

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: I was a little unsure of what to expect of a vegetarian restaurant, but the brunch selection that I had (egg over potato griddle cake) was extremely delicious - perfect over easy, and melt in your mouth full of flavor potatoe cakes) - as were the dishes for my other brunch companions. One of the best egg dishes I have had.
review_title: I was a little unsure of what

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Always wonderful and tonight was no exception Brought out of town guests who had never been there and they were enchanted as we were. Delicious and memorable evening. Perfect in all ways.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
Birthday celebration/vegetarian guests/enthusiastic anticipation! But it was disappointing.
Four of the five guests would rate their entrees as okay, but not excellent. The servings were small, the presentation was underwhelming. My entree, Mesquite Grilled Brochettes, looked more like a cheap cafeteria plate - two brochettes smothered in brown too spicy sauce, a pile of rice and a stack of shredded carrots. The potatoes and mushrooms were dry and the onion was undercooked.

We support the idea of Greens and hope that the quality will improve but doubt that we will go again.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Very Knowledgable waitress, food that have wonderful layers of flavor. Ingredients carefully chosen, the attention to detail plating the food. Av true paradise for people with food allergies or restricted diets and a delight for the rest.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Great food as ever, and a great view of the boats and bay. Good advice on wine. But please don't hustle the diner! A waiter tried to clear our table while one of our group was still eating, and removed my wine glass before I had finished drinking.. That's unacceptable.
review_title: Great food, but we were hustled

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
Went to Greens for a saturday morning brunch while on holiday in San Francisco. 2 of the party were vegetarians which is one of the reasons we chose Greens.
The menu was excellent, lots of lovely choices, the waiter (I think his name was Michael) was most helpful and explained many things on the menu that we were unsure of.
Overall we had a lovely experience, great food, beautiful location and great ambience.
Thank you Greens. :)

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Finally found a restaurant where we could enjoy EVERYTHING on the menu without any concern about sugar, carbs, fats, and processed food. Best to arrive early before the place fills. Much quieter then. View of the marina and bay is special. Enjoyed our anniversary there. Portions could have been a bit larger. Left feeling comfortably full in a healthy way. Good service.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Excellent food and service. Fruit and vegetables couldn't have been more fresh or well prepared.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: The atmosphere isn't very special but the food was very tasty. Take the description of "small" plate very literally. Seemed a bit pricey for the serving. Flourless Chocolate Cake was Extraordinary but the Peach/Ginger/Blueberry ice cream sandwich was a disappointment and a bit of a mess to eat - would have been better if the ice cream was creamy and the flavors more vibrant. We might take friends back who wanted to go there but we probably won't return ourselves as it would not be worth the hour drive.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: I have wanted to eat at Greens for years and I wasn't disappointed.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: It all started with the proposed pre-fixe menu.    When we arrived, there was what seemed like a normal menu.  We made our decisions, regretfully since we were duefully excited for the sans-decision evening.  The server was quite happy and knowledgeble about all that he was serving us, which I appreaciate.  Our plates were presented with class, however not entirely inventive on the plating; just the usual garnish for a curry soup, the over-sized portion of roasted vegetables sitting next to my hot rattatouille terrine.  The party could have been saved with desert, it the waiter hadn't turned so slow.  I Enjoyed so much of the food, but it isn't worth what a buch of vegetables could be for that much money.
review_title: Could have been saved by desert

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Never disappoints. A good way to go out & still eat healthy.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: I had very high hopes for Greens based on their reputation and the excellent food I have gotten at the take out restaurant. Unfortunately, I was disappointed. The portions were small and for the price, I would have expected more. We did not even get any bread with our meal. The service was OK, but we were celebrating my friends birthday (which they knew) and there was not any effort to acknowledge this. The setting is lovely so they do get high marks for that.
review_title: I had very high hopes for

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
Four people shared 4 appetizers including the Sampler. The most outstanding first course was the baked mushroom dish.
We also shared 2 excellent main courses, brochettes & risotto, & 2 excellent desserts, berry & rhubarb crisp & chocolate flourless cake.
We have enjoyed Greens over the years & took friends from out of town who remembered Greens from 20 years ago. Maybe thanks to Open Table or our own past history we also had an excellent window table & watched the sun set.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: A really delicious meal today on a perfect day for bridge-gazing from the expansive dining room. Our sever was polite and friendly and attentive.
