The spring menu is fabulous; Greens' great tradition of local food simply and expertly prepared continues to dazzle. You will find it difficult to make a choice from all the great menu items. Fantastic potato/leek/manchego griddle cakes, beautiful veggie stir fry, super-delicious huckleberry/pear/walnut crisp with cinnamon soy ice cream. Did I mention the potato/leek/manchego griddle cakes? Why not five stars? Perhaps it's a bit more expensive than it has to be. But if you want to bring folks from out of town to experience real California cuisine with an only in SF view, this is the place.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: This was my first experience with a more upscale vegetarian restaurant. I have to admit I didn't miss the meat at all. There were plenty of interesting and satisfying flavors and at the end of the night we didn't feel "over fed" like you can feel after a steak dinner. We will definitely eat here again. Perhaps in another season to see what they do with fall/ winter produce.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Great food, good service and we appreciated the attention they paid to one of our party who is gluten-intolerant.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: As a Vegan, it is great to find a restaurant that caters to vegetarians. The food was excellent! The only difficulty was deciding what to order.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: The vegetarian menu is special, not for a regular basis, yet never is comfort food

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Delicious brunch menu, despite us being two dedicated carnivores. Husband & I split the Ferry Plaza Sampler as an appetizer, and we both loved our entrees (mesquite grilled brochettes and and yellow finn potato griddle cakes. I'd love to try their luncha nd dinner menus also.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Very good food, nice atmosphere, beautiful day, wonderful server.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: I love love love it. It was my third time at Green's. Every time I visit San Francisco, Green's is on my list. The meals are unique.
review_title: I love love love it. It was

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Only one complaint. Too much vinegar on the salad, which accompanied the mushroom sandwich.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Wonderful vegetarian and vegan offerings with great favors. Satisfying to non-vegetarians, in fact a friend of a friend ate there, recommended it, and didn't even realize it was vegetarian!

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: The bread and olive oil served in the first appetizer were superb. Everything else was good, but the opening plate was stellar. Dessert was excellent too

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: One of my favorites.  Fine dining and vegetarian--even my meat-eating friends can love this place because the food is amazingly delicious and unique.  Desserts are also well-worth it.  Wine list is extensive.  Ask for a window table to get a beautiful view of the Bay.  After dinner, take a walk along the Fort Mason Green path on the hill behind the port buildings--former site of the World's Fair.  Take this wooded path down to the promenade that stretches into the Bay for a beautiful view of the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, and Ghirardelli Square.  A must.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Wonderful creative and delicious. Shows non vegetarians like me how great vegetarian food can be. We didn't have dessert, instead opted for cookies and coffee to accompany a walk back across the marina and the cookies were so good I'd go back just for that.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: I have been to Greens several times and the food was always amazing.  In particular, I loved the corn fritters and the stuffed chili.  Getting our table and the food was just a tad slow, but in the end the food was well worth the wait.
review_title: I have been to Greens several

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: LOvely setting, interesting menu. A little pricey!

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: The food was excellent, although having lived in the Bay Area for awhile now I'm not as impressed by fresh food cooked well as I once was. Call me spoiled. This was a great spot though for a romantic evening out. We really enjoyed watching the harbor and the seals swimming around and the service was excellent.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: My husband and I had a wonderful dinner and date night. No matter where you sit in the restaurant the windows are so large you will have a great view of the harbor and Golden Gate bridge. The food was incredibly fresh and quite tasty. Our waitress was so nice and helpful with the menu and wine list. I especially loved that you carry Navarro wines, the Chenin Blanc is supurb.
review_title: My husband and I had a wonderful

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Returned to Greens for the first time since I lived in the Bay Area in the late 1990s. I think it's actually improved. An excellent meal, with a main of wild mushroom ravioli with porcini and chanterelle mushrooms, English peas, spring onions, herb butter and grana padano, paired with Stubbs Pinot Noir 2006, Marin County. Great service. Overall excellent. I wish Vancouver (where I live) had something half as good.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Had a vegan friend in from Los Angeles and he couldn't have been more impressed from the selection of food to the amazing view. Just a great experience.
review_title: Had a vegan friend in from

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Great spot for Veggies. We shared a Mimosa, Fruit, Blueberry Coffee Cake, and a Brochette. Splitting everything, we had enough, not stuffed. Other egg dishes; breakfast pizza looked tasty as well. View toward the GG was very nice & Sunday Brunch is a good time to catch the Races & Regattas on the Bay. A larger private room in the back will seat probably 40 for a private event. It's nice to visit a busy sizable restaurant where there was such variety for Vegetarians - We are not alone.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Knowledgeable staff. We made a note on our reservation that one of our party is gluten-intolerant and the wait person was ready to point out what was OK to eat. (In most of even the best restaurants, we usually have to explain the restrictions and the wait person usually has to consult with the chef -- it's a ritual -- but it was nice not to have to do that here!)

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: The fixed price meal was good, the weekday menu is awesome!
review_title: The fixed price meal was good,

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: We had a lovely dinner, with very attentive staff.
review_title: We had a lovely dinner, with

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: The food was good but we felt overpriced. They ran out of certain food and instead of letting us know in advance we'd get substitutes, we were just give different items and got an explanation after we asked.
review_title: The food was good but we felt

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: very interesting menu and they did for the most part excellent job!

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: food was excellent. You could really taste the freshness.Service was also very good.I love to go there during day light hours, as the view and sun shining in is really nice.Best Vegeterian Restaurant I have dined at.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: IT was a vegetarian food spot. We knew this when we made our reservation, but the it seemed like a fancy high end vegetarian spot. The food was not very good...it made us crave meat. I had the linguini, it was tasteless. My girl had the pizza, it just tasted bad. The appetizers were fine, but nothing special. We went at night, it has a nice view of the water. But the carpeting and chairs made the place seem like a hotel restaurant.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Greens is consistently magnificent throughout the years. Visited my home town San Francisco this past weekend and I made sure to include a dining experience at Greens. I introduced Greens to a friend of mine this weekend who then sent a text to a friend in Sweden raving about Greens! His Swedish friend will be there in March! Thank you all for being a part of my birthday weekend celebration! Stephany

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Service is slow but the view is so great it is nice to not be rushed. The food is scrumptious.
review_title: Service is slow but the view

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: This is vegetarian food at its best with a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge. Food tastes incredibly fresh and the service is friendly and efficient.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: very pricey. if not for my 30% blackboard eats discount, i'm not sure i would ever have eaten here. certainly i enjoyed my meal, but i think if i had to pay full price, the sticker shock would've put a damper on the enjoyment factor. a good but not great meal. when it comes to vegetarian/vegan, Ubuntu is still the best my dining mates and I have ever experienced -- you do NOT miss the meat there (at Ubuntu), but a couple of my dining mates did miss it here at Greens.
review_title: very pricey. if not for my

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: The harbor view is wonderful, and the service is attentive w/o being intrusive. It was a loud Friday night, which was tiring, but everyone was happy so it was forgivable. The fresh OJ was great -- better than starting with cocktails. The roasted pepper and corn soup was quite good, though it could have been a bit more pungent/savory, and I'm not sure I'd put raw corn in unless it was ultrasweet baby kernels. The sourdough is really good. The spring rolls were attractive but uninspired. The roasted poblano was very good -- just enough heat and greenness. The berry/pear upside down cake was fantastic, it's only flaw being the need for more raspberry sauce and ice cream, which could have been a headliner by themselves. Skip the latte.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: This restaurant was beautiful as always with friendly service and high-quality produce. Still thinking about the perfect figs.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: best brunch in the Bay Area; don't miss the french toast; can't beat the view
review_title: best brunch in the Bay Area;

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: On a recent trip to San Francisco, I made a tour of vegetarian restaurants, trying only vegan dishes. Several of them were good, but Greens was excellent. At the top of my list, from appetizer through dessert.
review_title: On a recent trip to San Francisco,

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Greens is consistently excellent and I always look forward to enjoying a great meal there.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Yet another enjoyable meal at Greens. Flavors pop from the incredibly fresh ingredients. always satisfying.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: The Happy Quail Farm Pimientos de Padron was a delight to the toung. The crust of Maldon salt was perfect with the spiciness of the peppers.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: The food was exceptional! The dining experience was so very pleasant and the view of the Bay on a sunny day was breath-taking. We walked right out to a Farmer's Market and bought our dinner!

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: There were three of us dining. One person's order was submitted incorrectly and we were told her order would take another 15 minutes. The waitress apologised and brought an appetizer for the person waiting while the other two ate their meal. That was ok with us but for the fact that the sever come to our table twice and told the two that were eating that they should share their food with the person waiting. We all felt that was highly inappropriate.
review_title: There were three of us dining.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: A gorgeous view overlooking the Marina and food that had my companion saying WOW throughout her meal. Greens is a Most Special place for an extraordinary dining experience.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Went there on a date. The service was great! The ambiance was very nice, although you get the sense that everybody is a tourist that is in the know or with a local. Parking is very easy. Having said that, I was a bit disappointed with the food. It looked very nice but was a bland. (Except for the flourless chocolate cake which was excellent!) San Francisco has lots of vegetarian restaurants with amazing food. Unfortunately this is not one of them. Considering the price and Greens reputation, I think the food was merely okay. Too bad.
review_title: Went there on a date. The

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
Amazing veg food. Love knowing comes from green gulch. They had read my requests and addressed!

Always have fab food and wonderful experience.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: portions are small for the price, disappointing. good service!

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: The food was good as usual, but Greens seems to have lost some of its culinary magic. Maybe it's just that more restaurants focus on organic veggies now so it doesn't seem as unique. The service wasn't so great -- plates whisked away before we were quite finished, forgot something we ordered, coffee was cold. Nothing egregious, but a little off-putting. It's a beautiful space, though, and a lovely place to take out of town guests. The rhubarb dessert was outstanding.
review_title: The food was good as usual,

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: If you are going to Ft Mason, a visit to Greens is a must. It has wonderful views of boats in the harbor and the menu is totally unique.
review_title: If you are going to Ft Mason,

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: As always, Sunday brunch at Greens was yummy. We don't get there very often; however we have never been disappointed. Our reservation was for 10:30 a.m., and we were seated immediately at a window. The food and service were great. No complaints.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
Food was good, but have had better at other Bay Area vegetarian spots. Surprised at how few vegan meals were offered, but upon discussion with our great server received mains sans cheese.
Decor seems random and does not link together cohesively.
Overall a pleasant experience, but it just lacked that final touch to bring it up to 41/2 or 5 stars.
review_title: Food was good, but have had

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Exceptionally fresh food with a wonderful selection of appetizers and entrees sunday brunch. Portions are a generous size. Service was excellent and if you are a coffee drinker your cup will never be less than half full. Our party of four ordered different entrees and appetizers and everyone was very pleased. The only regret is that we were too full to try the deserts but we did purchase pastries at the counter which we ate later and were delicious. We have been to this restaurant several times and really like that menu items are always changing.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: It was a special celebration for a small group of us (6) and the staff couldn't have been more accommodating. A truly magical night, with wonderful food and wine as well. The signature brochette dish was really spectacular, with the Moroccan sauce.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
Remains one of my favorite restaurants. I know they are planning to close for a week or so in January to freshen it up - which is great - it is looking pretty shabby which interferes with it being a place for special occasions.

Virginia

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: I've been a Greens fan for years, but the last few visits have been disappointing. The food is now only mediocre vegetarian fare. When it was top notch, I didn't mind the prices. But the other day, the salads we ordered were so paltry (three slices of the advertised special fruit -- persimmon and a few pieces of pomegranate) and the flavors so bland, well, I was embarrassed to have brought out of town friends there after raving about the place. The restaurant was busy as usual for lunch (Friday after Thanksgiving). But the service was awful. We had to wait 1/2 for our table that had been reserved for over a week. Our waitress seemed bothered to take care of us and completely forgot our coffee at the end. When it arrived it was luke warm.
review_title: I've been a Greens fan for

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Generally the food at Greens is fabulous. I was dissappointed in the service on my most recent visit. The server seemed overwhelmed, and when he brought us an extra dessert, his mistake, we mentioned it to him, and instead of just leaving it for us to eat, which we would have done happily, he took it away. That's just wasteful.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Oh my god oh my god oh my god the food at Greens is so good it actually hurts thinking about it... because nothing else compares. Nothing. It's THAT good. Taste explosion. Everything fitting together perfectly yet each bite an surprise.
review_title: Oh my god oh my god oh my

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: After all these decades, still fresh and surprising.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Great atposphere. The food, however, was actually not memorable. I ordered corn and potato griddle cakes with eggs and everything was quite over-salted. At the end of the meal, I mentioned to the server that he might want to tell the chef that this menu item was too salty. He took note, but did not apologize or offer a replacement to the unsatisfactory food.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: This is a very special place, my daughter and I make regular pilgrimages to Green's - and have been for decades. I am not a vegetarian but I could easily convert if I could eat at Green's everyday! The wait staff is also wonderful. You feel like a guest.
review_title: This is a very special place,

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Lovely location and delicious food. The grilled peach appetizer was delicious and the chanterelle pie or tart was excellent.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
The view does not override the careful preparation of the simple, but elegant vegetarian
fare. A real treasure...

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Green's has gone from great to good to OK. Our appetizer sampler was just OK, hummus, tomato jam (very good), farro, pita and a filo piece for $17 didn't seem a great value. The Indian Summer Vegetables has minimal greens, lots of potatoes and rice! The brochette was the best of the bunch. Most dishes have cheeses to get the fat and taste desired by customers, or so we think. Overall, OK, but no longer the top of the list.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
We were planning a visit to San Francisco, and a friend's daughter who lives in the area
recommended Greens to us. It was wonderful. The food was excellent, and the view from our window table was just lovely.
review_title: We were planning a visit to

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Had heard so much hipe about the atmosphere and food, but to be honest was alittle disappointed!! Came all the way from GA and the food was not worth the price. I have had so many tastier vegetarian meals in San Fran. The server was quite snotty as well.
review_title: Had heard so much hipe about

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
/We have been eating at Greens for many years, since they opened , and we had a disappointing dining experience Sunday night. Although we had the reservation we were kept waiting, then our server was very slow and not friendly, the first course was fair, my dining partner had a salad which he said tasted wilted rather than crisp (not fresh) and I had the soup , it was good..But we had the same entre, probably a mistake, the brochette and it was very mediocre. The dish seemed to be mushy and over sauced.
We find that GREENS is inconsistant , sometimes it is wonderful and others a disappoint.
We go there partly because of the ease of parking and because it is vegetarian.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Exceptionally delightful vegetarian cuisine. Would highly recommend to vegetarians as well as non vegetarians.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: A lovely space, wine list - excellent, waitstaff - knowledgeable, attentive, and friendly. We had a 7:30 reservation on a Saturday night (booked a week in advance - good idea) and the energy in the place was terrific -- bustling, happy, excited. My guest -- a meat eater, super foodie, and wine afficionado -- had never been to Greens -- or San Francisco. She was impressed. And that's saying something. We were lucky enough to get a window table. The food was terrific, presentation very nice. We loved every minute! If you've not been - GO.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
THIS PLACE IS HARD TO FIND!!!

Okay, now that I have THAT out of the way.... Greens was FANTASTIC! From the service, to the candlelit view looking out on the water, the stunning interior and of course... the fantastic (and shockingly vegetarian) food. My meal at Greens was superior to a lot of top notch (non-veg) spots in the city.

I had the risotto cakes, and they were seriously to die for. Everything on everyone's plate looked and tasted phenomenal!!

I would go here again in a heartbeat -- but if you're a first timer, make sure you really know where this place is before you try to find it in the dark (because typing "Fort Mason" into Google Maps won't get you here!!).
review_title:
THIS PLACE IS HARD TO FIND!!!

Okay

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Heaven for vegetarians - and delicious for everyone.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Last week's Indian Sampler was perfect! So much better than the Sampler Plate served most of the winter. The rice with cashews and garbanzos was not overly seasoned, and the lentils went very well with the chutney-type jam. Greens' tsatziki is the best...very fresh.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: We went to Greens on Valentine's Day and the food was incredibly delicious. We thoroughly enjoyed our evening. I would recommend it highly.
review_title: We went to Greens on Valentine's

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: We started with a reservation for about 8 persons. But it later changed to 6. Since 2 of our group failed to show at the appointed time, we had to wait for a downsized table for 4. This took some time and we were treated rather perfunctorily. The service was satisfactory and the food was very good. Our two guests arrived late and had to sit by themselves at a remote table. Considering the high price of dinner, I expected better treatment.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: In my opinion the entree, Winter Sampler Plate, was not up to Greens excellent standard.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: My daughter and I were shown to a table with the most fabulous view of the marina and the Goldern Gatee Bridge. The service was prompt but not rushed and the food was wonderful. I'm a vegetarian and my daughter is severely allergic to shellfish so we were both so relieved to have a menu we could peruse without restrictions. And the selection was not predictable, but varied and imaginative. Thank you for a wonderful experience!
review_title: My daughter and I were shown

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: My favorite place in the city to eat! Wonderful food, great service, attentive staff, delightful and seasonal menu....killer view, great wine list....Even my meat eating friends love it!
review_title: My favorite place in the city

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: We have been to Greens many times. This time the dinner offering was not great. The four of us tried different combinations and were not impressed. The service and ambience were outstanding. SOme what disappointed in the food.
review_title: We have been to Greens many

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Superb! One of my all-time favorites. I try to eat at Green's whenever I visit San Francisco. This is one of the all-time greats and it just keeps getting better. an experience not to be missed. Best time to go is at early evening to watch the sun set over the Golden Gate Bridge.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: The food was so amazing. Unfortunately the service was pretty slow and non-attentive, but the food totally made up for that!
review_title: The food was so amazing. Unfortunat

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: High-quality vegetarian food that is worth the price. The flavors are stupendous. So much food out there is boring, but not Greens. The food also did not make me feel bloated, tired, and run-down. It was energizing. Amazing service--very nice people, very responsive, smiles, they seem to be working as a team.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: I have been to Greens restaurant four or five times, and have never been disappointed. Meat-eaters shouldn't be put off by its vegetarian status. This is vegetarian fare like you'll rarely find it. Greens uses the best of seasonal, sustainably produced vegetables to produce amazing food. Our entrees included an eggplant and squash gratin accompanied by grilled polenta, and a filo pasty with fresh spinach, leek and a creamy, cheesey filling; both were amazing. And one of their appetizers-- grilled peaches with watercress and baby radicchio that were drizzled with sage honey and topped with mascarpone-- also works extremely well as a dessert. And the space is warm, with views of the bobbing oats, all making for a wonderful evening.
review_title: I have been to Greens restaurant

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: The sunset view over the bay was idyllic, as always. The food elicited "ohs" and "ahs" especially from a group of sceptical non-vegetarians. It was pretty expensive for us, even though we did not order much in the drink department. We enjoyed it, but defintely could not afford to do often.
review_title: The sunset view over the bay

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: TOOOO noisy! Get some kind of sound baffles. And we really don't need to be asked, on the day of our reservation, if we're going to be there or not, or if we've forgotten ... or whatever reason you have for treating customers as children. (Children have to be reminded; adults cancel if they have to, or, more often, show up.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Gourmet vegetarian fare in a great room. I try to dine there whenever I'm in San Francisco.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Food had NO TASTE!  Server snapped at my friend and then apologized  I will not return.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
Very poorly paired ingredients (e.g., olives and mint in a spinach salad; Asian tofu and baguette). 
We both got quite sick after (possibly mild food poisoning).

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Food and views are wonderful, the back room is freeing at night.  They need a heater in there with all the windows, some of which don't close completely.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: We had a very enjoyable dinner before a performance at the Cowell Theatre. Every course was delicious, and the wine pairings were especially fine.  I like the back room addition to the restaurant, where it is a little quieter and less bustling. The produce quality at Green is always top-flight, which makes the cuisine shine.
review_title: We had a very enjoyable dinner

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: Appreciate the time and effort made to accommodate allergies and request for a somewhat quiet space.   Extremely friendly staff.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review:
NOTE to OpenTable:  

Your map for this restaurant INCORRECTLY places it in the middle of Fort Mason. You have the correct address but wrong location mapwise.

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: They were very good about making sure we had a nice dinner at a special table and were still able to make the play, despite the being pretty busy.  That's not something many places do well, but our server (and the hostess) had it down.  That will make it hard to go anywhere else when we're in the neighborhood!

address: Bld. A, Fort MasonSan Francisco, CA  94123
review: When ever I take someone new to Greens, they become the next addicts!
review_title: When ever I take someone new

review: We had a great take looking down the street, the service was to notch and the food was very good. It was quiet enough for a business conversation. I would highly recommend this place.

They lost our Opentable reservation for Thanksgiving. After a wait, they found us a small table in the corner, then served us a $75 buffet dinner.

Never again.
review_title: Too pricey for the food and service

review: We were able to stay for awhile and visit with our friends from London.
review_title: We were able to stay for awhile

review: Valentines day gone bad.... apparently the bartender, who seemed to start her serving career as she was walking to our table, was helping out that night as the restaurant was booked solid with 6 tables taken... The hard part of writing a bad review is the food was pretty darn good. We came here for filet.Our interm server told us they were out of filet after we sat, ordered wine to go with the steak, and spent 30 min waiting for an app.  After I got up and called 3 other restaurants that were full, we decided to stay.We finally had one of the other servers take our table and he explained they were out of the larger filet.The food was good no doubt, the kicker was as we were having desert and brandy the staff fully cleared dining room tables

We did the tasting menu and it was excellent.  The waitstaff was well versed in the food we were served and explained each course -- of which there were twelve!  It's a long leisurely dinner with a variety of tastes and textures -- too many to mention here but well worth it.  We sat in the front and the ambiance wasn't great the and booths were tired and worn.  The back two rooms seem much nicer. Absolutely go for the food!!

My fiance and I celebrated our recent engagement here earlier this month. As we were celebrating we decided to do the tasting menu with pairings and did not regret it!

Every course was delicious. There were a couple courses that included items that we do not normally enjoy, for me trout and for him squash. In this case they ended up being some of our favorite courses!

The atmosphere was a little lacking. We were in a back room and I think it would have been much nicer to be in the main dinning area but that was pretty minor considering the out of this world food.

Highly recommend this tasting menu if you are celebrating something and want to eat food that is different than anything else you have ever had and don't mind the price tag. So worth the splurge!! :)

Found this restaurant, when it was suggested to me by some young friends in Chicago. They were right! The food was flavored in ways I never would have considered, and the results were excellent and memorable. My only critique is that there are too many menus, that cover the table, producing a sort of...administrative task to ordering.
review_title: A great find off the hill

review: This is our first time trying Morocco food and it surpass our expectation! It taste excellent. We very much appreciate the combination of different flavor there. It surprise us and make us very happy. Besides, always good service.

Slow service, and very average food that doesn't live up to menu descriptors, or price tag.
We started with their "spreads"  appetizer, which was delicious, but wasn't served with enough flatbread to even finish half of the spreads, and there was a charge for extra flatbread (which I refused to pay as the appetizer already cost $15.) The entrees are all between $25-$35, and while the presentation was beautiful the food was very AVERAGE. My quail was simply too salty, dry, and had no other perceptable seasoning. The beef cheeks were good, but not great and needed more acid or some other sauce (again a bit dry.) for $30 / entree and the cost of everything else in this restaurant I expect more (better food and better service.)
review_title: Doesn't live up to the hype or $!

review:
One word: Amazeballs. 

Absolutely fantastic food, great drinks, and excellent service. I love this place.

Went to Aziza for valentine's dinner. Chef's tasting menu was the set course for the evening. Everything was incredible! I can't believe it's only rated 1 Michelin star- it should be at least 2. I highly recommend this place. You definitely get your money's worth here.
Aziza could not handle the volume of customers for the special occasion. It seems that the menu was too ambitious, the 16 courses where hit or miss.

The meal began with excellent cocktails made from local fresh ingredients; fruits, herbs, and spices. We added the spreads and breads which are house made and delicious. For appetizers we chose the mackerel and the duck confit basteeya, the flavors were distinct and amazing! For the main course we shared the couscous, neiman ranch lamb shank, Paine farm squab, and the special fish entree that evening. All the dishes were perfectly seasoned to create a special Moroccan experience! I would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends visiting he Bay Area looking for a Moroccan experience and especially vegetarian friends who often lack true gourmet options when dining out!

I have been to Aziza many times over the years, and it seems to just get better and better. Not only is the food excellent and interesting, but the presentation is always beautiful. The tasting menu is especially terrific.

Our party of four was very pleased. We all felt that attention to food detail, food presentation, and food selection variety were of high quality and that these aspects had much improved since our last visit of several years ago. An excellent dining experience. Very nice ambience.

Made a special trip to Aziza after reading and trying the recipes in New Moroccan. The food and service was outstanding. I would go back over and over again. The drinks are completely different than any place you would go to and the food was unbelievable. The Lamb Shank is a must have. And the spreads with the flatbread are amazingly good.

I took my wife here for our wedding anniversary and we had an amazing experience. The tasting menu was unreal, the cocktails are strong and tasty, and the service was outstanding. We spent several hours enjoying our meal and drinks. Love this place, can't wait to go back.

Fantastic food, service and atmosphere. But ridiculously over-priced, especially given the tiny portion sizes. (I actually finished my entree in 5 or 6 bites.) We are OK with paying too much for great food, but it would be nice not to walk out hungry after spending $100+ on dinner.

This was an amazing and indulgent dining experience. The cocktails are ingenious, the menu leaves you wanting more and the desserts are sinfully good. Highly recommend this place for a special dinner in SF. Service was impeccable. My only critique would be that it was a bit chilly in the back room.
review_title: This was an amazing and indulgent

review: I dined at Aziza's with three other people who enjoyed the food, the incredible flavors, and the impeccable service as much as I did. Our unobtrusive waiter eagerly shared his knowledge about items on the menu, including the ingredients as well as the procedures involved in the preparation and presentation of specific items we asked about. We vowed to return soon to enjoy once again the muddled drinks and a fuller array of dishes on the Tasters Menu. Chef Lahlou and his staff clearly deserve major kudos; the tastes and textures of the food are simply devine.

excellent service; a bit noisy; needs more vegetarian options; flat bread too salty
fish and meat dishes quite good
a bit pricey

We've been going to Aziza for almost as long as it has been open (since there were belly dancers!), and have been huge fans. On this last visit, although it was enjoyable, I think that Chef has gone a bit too far in moving away from his Moroccan roots. The new menu is really just California cuisine with some moroccan spicing. Which is wonderful, but there are lots of California Cuisine restaurants in the City, and very few high-end Moroccan ones.

Please bring some of the more traditional menu items back!
Exceptional food and this is the reason that we will come next time aswell
Aziza is one of the very best restaurants in SF. Fresh, unique, and delicious Cal-Moroccan cuisine at its finest. Chef Mourad Lahlou is a genius.

Chose from the tasting menu, but the whole meal took close to 3 hours. Everything was very good, very flavorful, but it felt more like contemporary Californian than Moroccan cuisine. Enjoyed the evening very much and would like to return to try the regular menu.

I love Aziza and it never disappoints. The drinks are always spectacular and refreshing. The service is always outstanding. The pita bread, OMG, just thinking about it makes me wish I was there now. Honestly I love this place and have never ever had anything resembling a bad meal or bad service there.
A true gem. Do not miss this incredibly inventive and refreshing take on Morroccan cuisine. The bar program is a revelation.
review_title: A true gem. Do not miss this

review: Fabulous! I could eat there every day for a month and still not fully satiate my appetite. Every item on the menu has its own culinary draw. You can play with different meal combinations endlessly in creating a memorable dining experience even if you only dine here and nowhere else. Michael Mina...Quince...get out of town! Don't waste money going to overrated mass oriented commercial restaurants Like Mina or Quince. Dedicate yourself to spending your money at Aziza for an extended period of dining outs and experience how fine dining can be elevated to such normalcy and finesse that you will become as ultra critical as I when I am being asked to fork over $20 for appetizers and $35 for an entree. The bonus...Aziza is less expensive.
Haven't had such a wonderful meal in many years of dining in San Francisco. My sweetbread appetizer was excellent.

Had a fantastic dinner at Aziza the other night with friends who had never been there. They will be back for sure and so will we! Very professional service, great food/wines and lovely ambiance. Highly recommend this little gem!
Very different to what I was expecting for Moroccan food. Excellent taste.
review_title: Very different to what I was

review: We did the tasting menu. The food was excellent but the pacing was slow - I wasn't sure if this was intentional or if they were just understaffed but by the end of the meal, I just wanted to go home.
review_title: We did the tasting menu. The

review: My husband and I went for our anniversary and were not disappointed. We had the tasting menu and from start to finish we loved everything. We also each had one of their hand mixed cocktails, mind blowing!!!! We can't wait to go back, sit at the bar and enjoy another of their cocktails and off the menu items. It was a wonderful evening and we were not disappointed with anything.
review_title: My husband and I went for

review: The food is excellent and looks gorgeous. The setting is both romantic and hip. There's valet parking, which makes it stress-free. The mixed drinks at the bar are the best I've ever tasted, especially the one with fennel and dill.
review_title: A treat not to be missed!

review: While the food here is always getting even better, the service from reception to the wait staff is also improving. On this visit, I noticed the famous "spreads" are not only more attractively displayed but even more exotic in flavor. The waiter suggested I order the couscous as a side dish with my halibut entree and the two combined were quite a bit more than the sum of their parts. A lavender cake with lemon semifreddo and boysenberry merringue was as obsessive as everything else, but after all, food has to look good and not just taste good. The only item I would take exception to is the tasting menu that requires "participation of the entire table." Depending on who else is on the table that could be coercive.
review_title: While the food here is always

review: We loved the food.  It was the best Morrocan restaurant we have been to.  The soups, a lentil and a carrot soup were outstanding.  We loved the appetizers and the entrees.  This was a great experience.  It is a bit far for us to come from the East Bay but the food was worth it.
food didn't live up to michelin star, but the waitress was super friendly
review_title: food didn't live up to michelin

review: had been wanting to try this place for quite a while and wasn't disappointed! loved the duck confit in filo!!
review_title: had been wanting to try this

review: Took a while to get us seated (even with reservations). Our waiter was awesome. The food was fabulous. We had the beet sorbet for dessert - if you like beets, this is beet heaven. Drinks were tasty! Overall definitely worth it.
review_title: Took a while to get us seated

review: Overall great experience, our service was attentive without passing by too often. The food was prepared outstanding. We had the meatballs/grape skewers over the jicama salad which was devine. Also, the quail was cooked perfectly. We were also very impressed with the crispy kale. I love the vibrant colors on the walls; they feel so warm. I also appreciate that the decor is not stuffy, nor is the service. I like great food but don't need fine dining. We were also excited to sit in a huge booth, just the two of us! :)

Aziza used to be a very favorite dining spot, but aside from a terrific rum and tamarind cocktail, my last meal here was just plain lousy. Service was inept, despite the restaurant being virtually empty on a Monday evening; maybe the 20% tip inflicted upon a party of seven eliminated any incentive for the waitress to do her job well.
The mackerel appetizer offered four tiny (3"x1/4"x1/4") strips of fish plus some nondescript garnish for $13; the $18 couscous entree had maybe a handful of couscous and a few bland carrots and what I think were turnips, with a pathetic dab of foam instead of a real sauce. To call that food Moroccan is an insult to a country I've visited on several occasions. It will be a long time before we return here.

The food and ambiance are exceptional at Aziza. I would especially recommend the basteyda (sp?), the lamb shank, the spreads, and the cauliflower cous cows. Prices are on the high side but the tastes and quality are high.

Outstanding food. Service knowledgeable and very friendly but slow at times. No bread offered- may not fit with the menu, but many people would enjoy getting some anyway to mop up juices - they are that good - and nibble on.

Bar service, in particular, was very slow. Ordered a muddled drink before ordering from the dinner menu, had appetizers and we're half way into the entrees when the drink finally arrived. Waiter kept saying that the bartenders were very busy. We were not offered compensation. I had brought friends there for their first experience, indicating that it is one of my favorite restaruants and it was somewhat disappointing.

Aziza is like watching a fine foreign film. It is a totally transporting experience. It is a very large venue with lots of different rooms and while the back room can be the one that seems the most romantic and chill, you are still at the mercy of other diners so I suggest going on the early side to avoid the louder diners who are not as sensitive about the experience. The food is such that you want to acknowledge each flavor in your mouth with a calm appreciation. It lends itself for a more pensive and quieter envoronment. A loud party near you can totally disrupt the experience. This place is amazing but should not Rock.
review_title: Aziza is like watching a fine

review: An exceptionally high quality restaurant in all respects except, perhaps, for the ambient noise, which never drowned out conversation although it became at times difficult. Still, the extraordinary quality of the food (every dish we had was first-rate) and the knowledgeable, professional but friendly staff, combine to make this a place to which to return for occasions which merit quality and respect.

Aziza is a delightful experience in Mediterranean cuisine. Highly recommend it for a date night for two or for a small group of intimate friends. Get the whole table to go for the 5 course tasting menu  you can taste so many of the chef's wonderful creations this way, especially if the table orders unique dishes for a few of the courses.

I went once last year and it was amazing, and was very excited to come back to celebrate my dad's 65th birthday. This time it was good, but not great. The dished were good a couple were spectacular, but it was not on par with what it was last time. The table we were at was cramped and the service was slow. We ordered a lot of dishes, and had to wait around 10 minutes between them. The ambiance was amazing and it felt incredible peaceful once I walked in. The water service was also excellent. I've All in all it was good, but for the prices, the food and service should have been better.
review_title: I went once last year and

review:
Having lived in Morocco, we were underwhelmed.
Nothing authentic whatsoever.

My boyfriend and I came here to celebrate and anniversary and were duly impressed. We splurged for the tasting menu with the wine pairings and had a wonderful and delicious time. I hope all the best for this restaurant as it truly is a gem.
review_title: My boyfriend and I came here

review: The attention to detail in the prep of food was outstanding. It was a great evening. We did their pairing food and wine. The only issue I had with this choice was that the wine tastes were much to small. While I realize that 4 normal glasses of wine would be a great deal of wine, I felt that the wine tastings were more like tastings rather than pairings. Otherwise, a great time was had by all but my comment regarding the amount of wine served was unanimous. I hope that this will change in the future and that this comment gets back to the restaurant.
There is no better dining experience in San Francisco - excellent as always.

We love this restaurant. The food is consistently good and the pastry one of the more amazing ones in the City. Even though they are very popular and very busy they were awesome in still holding our reservation when we arrived 22 minutes late due to bad trafffic. Highly recommended.
Roughly what I expect from a high end place. The food was good but not so outstanding that I'd go back. I have several dozen other high end places to try out instead.
Attentive and professional service, nice ambiance, and creative, well balanced dishes combine to yield a special dining experience. MARVELOUS duck!

AZIZA is a gem - excellent food in right size servings, to share; great, knowledgeable, friendly people providing the right paced service; wonderful atmosphere and superb pastries by Melissa - save room for those; all combine to give an ambience of Morocco without being over-powering.
One of the few places to get Moroccan food in SF.  We really enjoyed our meal here.  We'll return.
review_title: One of the few places to get

review: We had out of town guests and wanted to take them someplace special for dinner. Our dining experience could not have been more perfect. From the moment we walked in the front door, everything flowed. The food was excellent, wine was matched to our dinner choices, and desserts were interesting and delicious. Very attentive wait-staff. We were not rushed through our dinner, but, left to enjoy our food and conversation. Definitely, Aziza is now one of our favorite dining spots.
review_title: We had out of town guests

review:
Dining at this Moroccan food restaurant was a real treat for us. Unlike other "touristy" Moroccan restaurnts in this city, we didn't have to sit on floor cushions, eat with our hands, eat alot of red meat, and be subjected to a belly dance. Wow, this Aziza is definitely a cut above the rest. We will want to dine here again.

I wish the second dining room (the interior one) could be as gorgeous and thematic as the front dining room. That is my only negative here: the second dining room's decor is a real letdown after you pass through the first dining room.

Food was very good but I wouldn't say great. The meatballs (on 7x7's 100 Things To Try Before You Die list) was a bit overrated but the lamb entree was fantastic. I had ordered the scallops and found the portion and sides to be extremely small, almost humorous. Everyone there was very polite and welcoming. Our waiter even offered us a free dessert after the bar had forgotten our drink and it was my friend's birthday. I would recommend checking out once, but I don't know if I would be a repeat customer.
review_title: Food was very good but I wouldn't

review: I will definitely return to Aziza especially when entertaining out-of-town guests. The server was knowledgeable and friendly. The spreads (starter) were delicious. The riblets were also excellent, but I probably would not order when having the lamb shank which was also excellent (too much meat).
Fantastic food and drinks, with extremely fresh ingredients and multilayered tastes. A real gem.
Absolutely wonderful in every way. Outstanding, creative, fresh & flavorful foods and cocktails. A real gem.
The drinks were so interesting and so much fun! Try the passionfruit! But this place is def not your traditional morroccan flavor.

Still the best in town for a modern interpretation of Maroccan cuisine (alas no belly dancer). the local is dark but romantic and the service is always friendly. It's not too noise but loud enough that your neighbors can't overhear your tte--tte conversation. You'll never go wrong with the Basteeya and the Cous Cous. The seaonal avocado and blood orange salad is quite refreshing and delicious. We could have done without the Lima Beans - kind of a Lasagne with, well, beans loaded with backed cheese. The hare was juice and very flavourful. The amazing selection of beers from around the world goes well with the mild, spicy flavors of the chef. Try the Belgian Honey Ale - It's refreshing, and only has a hint of sweetness.
review_title: Still the best in town for

review:
Loved the food and the service---a special treat for us!

However, the restaurant called us after dinner to say they did not get the signed credit slip (which all four of us saw my husband leave). We made a copy of our receipt and made a special trip the next day to give it to the restaurant.
A follow up call of thanks for our effort (especially since it was not our fault)would have been a nice gesture.

But we would still go back.....
review_title: Loved the food and the service---a

review:
beef was just butter on couscous - quite bland except for overwhelming taste of butter

honey mousse was just plain weird/bad, we did not finish it

squid salad and artichoke appetizers were good and prawns were good - very clean complicated flavors

downside is that the strong flavors often do not mix well and the waiter was not helpful, he blew us off when we asked for DAT menu and told us "everything on the menu is excellent" but spent 10 minutes at adjacent table describing the best dishes in detail

would not go back esp. at these prices
review_title: beef was just butter on couscous

review: Aziza has a good menu with local ingredients, and our entrees (quail, cod and a lamb chop) were all extremely well done. THe service was friendly and efficient, and we enjoyed the ambience. It was a great meal!
review_title: Aziza has a good menu with

review: The food was wonderful and different. The cocktails were so good. The only problem was that the service was a little slow. There were alot of people and it was very busy. But the overall experience was wonderful and I would love to eat at Aziza again!

As soon as you enter Aziza, you are taken to a different place. It is a beautifully designed restaurant. Barring and off night by the bar staff, our party enjoyed the prix fixe meal. Every dish of the 5 course meal was excellent. I will definitely be back.
review_title: As soon as you enter Aziza,

review: Great and perfect restaurant for locals and even tourists!
We had an excellent meal and were well cared for by the staff. We'll be back!
review_title: We had an excellent meal and

review: Service was at first way too fast then very very slow.  The bill was a whopping $100.00 and the food was equal to about $40.00.  The drinks were good though.
review_title: Service was at first way too

review: Everything is fantastic. Food is consistently delicious. Even with certain dishes I know to be good, I'm always surprised at just how good they are when I have them again. And even certain meats I don't tend to like are fantastic here. The menu is simple and straightfoward but somehow simultaneously inventive. The staff is super accommodating and always know what they're talking about. Really couldn't ask for much more.

The food -- that we got -- was good. We were seated promptly at 6 p.m., had "starter'' plates wserved within 15 minutes but by 7:50 p.m. we still hadn't been served our main courses so we asked for the check and left. The waiter kept saying "soon, soon'' when we asked three different times about where our food was. Soon soon never came. And, there was a hair in the water, When we asked for a replacement glass, we had to ask twice. That said, the food we did get was very good. But the ultra slow pace from the kitchen was maddening and made our experience at Aziza a disappointment.

I loved that the bar was open and I could observe while I waited and that you could choose to sit there and enjoy watching the 3 cooks... very clean, organized and smooth running.  A simple menu, well executed.   I thought it was a little expensive for what it was, but I didn't regret paying... still delicious.

This is my second time there..... both times on a coupon of some sort. First time.. I initiated the trip and this time it was a friend. Both times I found the food to be mediocre and overpriced.   The dessert (churros dipped in a cup of instant cocoa) was blah.
They have the right formula. Delicious, homemade food. Small menu with a perfect assortment of choices. Great service.
Second visit and it's been pretty tasty both times and the staff are very attentive. Little too bright, otherwise completely enjoyable.

We had a lovely evening at Regalito's. It was a brisk night, but we chose to eat outside and were kept toasty warm by the outdoor heaters. The staff were very nice, and the food was tasty. We will definitely return.
review_title: We had a lovely evening at

review: Way too expensive! Small portions. Would not return.

We walked to the restaurant after seeing a movie at the Roxie. This is really good Mexican food, a nice upgrade from the many taquerias in the neighborhood when you want something more upscale. It's fun watching as the tortillas are being made! The ingredients in our dinner were fresh and delicious, the wine was yummy, and the service very attentive but not intrusive.

The food was good. I wanted a margarita and they said they were "out." I didn't look too much into it but I am wondering if they only have beer and wine because we ended up with Sangria. I ordered the enchiladas verdes and they were good! And I definitely recommend the churros for dessert!! I would recommend this place. It is not in the greatest part of the Mission, but I could have been extra sensitive because I am a woman and I was walking alone after dark. Fortunately I got a ride back afterward :-)

I definitely would recommend this restaurant!
review_title: The food was good. I wanted

review: Not your basic Mexican fare - definitely check the menu before you go there -- they do NOT have "comfort" foods. Food was good, but eclectic.
Always enjoy this restaurant and frequent it often. The food is very good and the ambiance is relaxed and enjoyable.

Food is as good as it always is at Flour + Water, but this time the service was slow and took a long time for the food to come.  We waited for over 40 minutes for the first pasta course to come.  I don't remember their service / kitchen so slow before.
I definitely recommend the pasta tasting menu as it showcases the true star of Flour + Water's menu- the pasta.
review_title: I definitely recommend the pasta tasting...

review: Early table in an empty restaurant.   Food came out fast fast fast.   Flavors were nothing special.  The pasta dishes that were amazing in the past were nothing special at all - the kind of food you'd expect from an ok dinner.   The fact that the food was only warm when it was served didn't help a bit.   Service was slip shod at best.   They offered a spoon to eat a meat terrine (pate') with and were clearing plates that still had food on them without asking if we were finished.   Expensive, uncaring, ok food from a kitchen that has lost it's luster.  Place was still empty when we left - could find no reason they wanted us in and out so quickly.

The staff are super friendly and the waiter helped us to pick what we should order.  He also appreciated that I am a Lambrusco fan.  The food was very good and very interesting.  We had the caponata (sp?) and the stone fruit salad.  Both were delicious - ask for bread to go with the caponata.  We had a pizza margarita, also very good.  Then we had the corn pasta with the chocolate mint and holy moly.  It was very unique and I'm glad we got it, even though I think we ordered the duck pasta!  But sometimes it's good to just go with it.  The peach gelato for dessert was a nice ending to the dinner.  I'd really give it a 4.5 - almost perfect except for the music level and the slight delay in getting another glass of wine.  But I'll be back!

If you like pasta, this is the place to go. We ordered four different pastas to share among the table (four of us). We should have ordered one of each of the six on the menu. They were all great, but the favorites were the oxtail and rabbit pastas. The portions were a little small, but we could always order more. Besides, we opted to try a pizza which was excellent as well.

We were 20 minutes late for our reservation because our son decided to throw a tantrum as we were leaving the door and we hit traffic. The restaurant only holds reservations for minutes, so we lost our reservation. They were very accommodating, and we got the next available table about 15-20 minutes later.
review_title: If you like pasta, this is

review: Celebrated my GF's birthday and it was great. We had the fall tasting menu and it did not disappoint. I'd put all the reasons why I like it but you should experience it for yourself. I've read a lot of reviews on this place, good and bad but I wanted to try it for myself. I had no expectations and was blown away by the flavor of the food. They even put a candle on her dessert. Such a little thing makes the whole experience better. We'll definitely come back.
F&W is the place to dine. Simple food that is over the top with perfection.

Loved everything about the restaurant, we ordered the tasting menu and had a really difficult time choosing the best dishes. Great atmosphere and service. After going to Central Kitchen the previous day, this place just validated their great dishes and ambiance.

Loved Flour + Water, great cozy atmosphere with creative decor, dim lighting and moderate noise level. The autumn tasting menu was well paced, delicious and with great wine pairings. Service was engaging, friendly and accommodating.
review_title: Great for a weekend dinner night!

review: We booked the only reservation available --- 1045 pm. When we arrived I noticed that the sign said the restaurant closed at 11 pm. I asked the hostess whether this was going to be a problem. She was very snarly and said, "we wouldn't take the reservation if we weren't going to do it.". Fine. But then when we were seated, the server wanted all the food order right away because the kitchen was closing. This restaurant is a significant cab ride from downtown and we were kind of stuck. So leaving was a bit awkward. We should have left. The food was bland and nothing special. We were very disapointed that we had squandered a precious night out in SF on this highly overrated place. We would not recommend it and will not be returning.

We went for the Pasta Tasting and it was spectacular. The pairings were correctly done as well. We thought service was nice and accommodating, but lacking on the professional side, forgetting to bring some water bottles and other minor items.

Had the pasta sampler. The pasta was really good but it did cost $60 per person. We had to wait 15 minutes or more between each sample. May go back and order off the regular menu and hope for better service.
Great food but trying to get a reservation is a bit ridiculous
review_title: Great food but trying to get

review: Fabulous, authentic regional Italian in a hip setting. Try the Chocolate dessert. To die for!
The most AMAZING food with the most TERRIBLE music. Just wear earplugs so you don't have to listen to the music because this is probably one of the best, if not the best, restaurants in the city.
Lives up to the hype, amazing and inventive appetizers, pasta with multiple layers of flavors. Pizza had great crust though the toppings were not as tasty as as the other dishes
review_title: Lives up to the hype, amazing

review: The food wasn't as great as all the press made me think it would be, and one dish (crab chitarra) was super salty, we like salty things but it was almost at our limit, it was very small too for the price. Pizza was disappointing, other dishes (crispy trotter app, sea bass) were good but not worth the effort -- won't bother to make the effort to go back (made a reservation weeks in advance). Service wasn't very friendly or helpful. An expensive, mediocre dinner.
review_title: The food wasn't as great as

review:
Food was very good. Although the menu could be expanded a bit more to be vegetarian friendly.

The Staff is very friendly and knowledgeable
Everything was good expect the food was a bit salty this time

Wonderful, wonderful food. We love to dine at great restaurants and are willing to pay a little extra. However, we were delighted that this top-notch meal was so well priced. It's tough to get in but well worth it.

Abysmal experience. Very loud music, the servers could not hear us properly and mangled our orders, when they were interested in taking them in the first place.

I had the Brodetto di parmigiana with black trumpets. It was fine, but the quantity was ridiculously small for the price. I also ordered the seafood tortellini. They were a bit on the firm side, with a grainy halibut filling a far cry from the promised mousse. The lemon butter sauce was heavy and not a good pairing - simple olive oil and lemon would have done much better. Our pizzas, funghi and osso (marrow) were ridiculously oversalted, slathered with an overpowering dose of garlic. The crust was fine, but the toppings clashed.

Ignore the hype. F+W is third-rate rustic Italia
Definitely not worth the two month wait for the reservation. And in my humble opinion, Flour & Water, is a carbon copy of Starbelly and Beretta.
The food is fantastic and consistently good; the food servers are charming.

The "laid back" vibe is real but superficial. They are deadly serious and earnest about food, service, wine, you name it. It all may seem very casual, but there is much thought, understanding and expertise that goes into EVERYTHING. I've not had a meal here that didn't have one or two dishes that were beyond excellent...they were memorable. And they do it all with a friendly/trendy charm that is not artifice. I leave happy.

My friends and I had a great time at Four+Water. The food was great and the atmosphere was lively to say the least. A great place to go with friend and have a good time. The Margarita pizza is amazing!
review_title: My friends and I had a great

review: we ahd a terrific dinner - first time there - too bad it was the last night - closing for new owners and new name.  Too bad - chefs going elsewhere!

We had an absolutely fabulous post theater dinner at George! The place is lively but we were able to talk at our table without screaming--so rare these days. Every dish we ordered was beautifully presented and exceptionally delicious. The service was outstanding. It couldn't have been better and I'll be returning often!

We went to Georges before a performance at the Eureka Theatre.  Service was outstanding, and the wild King salmon and the scallops for our two entrees were delicious, as was our Caesar salad to start.  Easy walking distance from Embarcadero BART and the theater.

George's is a wonderful, warm place for dinner, drinks or lunch. Our dinner was for six people, and fabulous evening chef Kyle Fong started us out with a little homemade tomato soup and grilled cheese on a rainy night to warm us up. We had two dozen oysters and I had the trout, which is a favorite (and a huge plate of food). Valharona chocolate gelato? OMG delicious. Go there. You won't be disappointed.

Great lunch. I brought a group of people but did not realize that we had a vegetarian in the group. He asked for one of the dishes to be modified by just taking out the fish. The server told him that it would not be a problem. When the food arrived I was pleasantly surprised that the vegie dish looked better than anyone elses. They had substituted the fish for a a variety of vegetables. The dish was not on the menu but it should be. It looked beautiful and he noted that it tasted better. All of the food was great and everyone had empty plates.
Met a candidate here for lunch had a great waiter that knew we were discussing work and allowed us the time to talk while we dined.

On business trip and found this spot on open table. Host and staff were good and welcoming. Food was average and not memorable. It was just ok. Not awful but I probably will not come back. Seemed to have a regular crowd for happy hour after work.
Another great meal - a bit noisy but service was great!

the calamari was one of the best i have ever had, crusted in polenta. my prosciutto pizza actually had full strips of proscuitto, not just small pieces here and there. 4 stars. my husband's cioppino and ahi tuna he rated as a nine out of ten. they might have been a little understaffed. we adjusted and we never felt rushed.
The food is always wonderful. I had the pizza this time and it was fantastic. Perfet for lunch and a afternoon snack. Its one of my favorite lunch places.

it was bomb loud, but quieted down as the lunch hour passed. the petrale sole sandwich was good, but the parmesan garlic fries had no garlic taste. my dining partner's request to substitute fries for potato chips with the dungeness crab roll was graciously done.

it's really nice to find a reasonably price seafood restaurant in the financial district that takes reservations. georges is a good back up for the days you don't want to wait at tadich.
review_title: it was bomb loud, but quieted

review: The second time at a "good" restaurant is always a true test. Georges did not dissappoint! Great selection of fresh seafood and other goodies.

Wonderful New Restaurant. A friend and I had our Christmas lunch there and the food was just wonderful. I had the warm, Spinach & Shrimp Salad and for lunch this was the perfect size and the flavors were wonderful. My friend had the Linguini with prawns and raved about her food also. The staff was warm,friendly and you didn't feel rushed. The tables are a little close together where we sat across from the bar, but for lunch that was OK.

Our party really enjoyed the dinner at Georges. We were particularly pleased to meet both the restaurant manager AND the chef when they came to the table to introduce themselves and check on our needs. All the dishes we chose were great! The weakest part of the evening was our server who seemed too busy to provide the service we felt would've made the dining experience exceptional.

I totally like the renovations done in the space from the previous occupent London Wine Bar. The food was good, but I'm sure with time and tweaking the food would increase in their food rating. The pleasant surprise was the dessert!! YUM!! I'm keeping this restaurant on my radar I feel it has LOTS of potential.
The food was very good. Good IPA on tap. The service at the bar was excellent.
review_title: The food was very good. Good IPA on tap....

review:
So I went here for a friend's birthday dinner. We ordered the grilled spiced nann & summer spreads-DELISH! So fresh & light! We also ordered the meatballs & the pomegranate sauce was AMAZING! Additionally, added an order of fries & dipped them in the pomegranate sauce (recommended by the waiter) & the fries were devoured! 
So my friends ordered the grilled lamb & hated it!!! When clearing the table the waiter noticed that my friends didn't touch the lamb & was soooooo apologetic about it--he took both meals off our bill without us even asking! GREAT SERVICE!!!
I ordered the seafood stew & it was hearty and rich in flavors. Overall, we still had a great experience! The service is definitely a reason to return!
I liked the food very much. I found the portions small especially for the price. Other than that, we all enjoyed ourselves.
review_title: I liked the food very much.

review: Took a first date to this place on a recommendation and we both loved it. The food is very good but it's the staff who make this place very special and make everyone feel welcome. I will definitely be going back.

very loud however the food was very good also I do not love the walk to get there however I am from a very busy city where none of the street corners are is quiet as this is so I think that most people May fibd actually pretty busy

We come here often because the food is so good and because Hoss Zare is such a fine host. He is the warmest, friendliest chef I know.

The chicken fesenjon was excellent; not as sweet as some places make it, and the green walnuts really make the dish. My friend had salmon which was moist and flavorful. And we love the goat cheese cake!

Small menu, 6 or 7 entrees. We all ordered something different and everyone loved their choice. I had salmon, which is not very exciting but was prepared perfect and had great accompaniments. The menus on line in not the menu we had.

The food is surprising and wonderfully delicious -- flavors and ingredients you won't sample elsewhere. And beautifully presented. The service is exceptional -- everyone is in the fact, very warm and solicitous and professional. Our one quibble, we had never eater at Zare on a Friday night. The din from the bar crowd is deafening -- even in the far back room. We'll avoid the after-work crowd in the future. Otherwise, this is the perfect place for dinner before events at Yerba Buena.
Every bite was a delight. We wanted an elegabt setting where we could hear each other talk, and the Flytrap was it.
Our main course was delicious, however, all the other courses were average.

I've been here before for drinks and appetizers and always had a good time. But this time around, I sat for dinner and have to say my cod was, unfortunately, flavorless. Pros: beer selection, ambiance, service, and food came out fast. But I need to eat a lot of fries to make up for how bland my dinner was. Thus I cannot rate this particular evening higher than 3 stars.
It was comfortable, and the service was very friendly. The food is good - the steak was tender.
Food with flavor! Standouts include the burrata, ravioli, meatballs

First-rate food and service. Extraordinary attention to detail in both areas. Warm, knowledgeable, efficient staff at all levels, Check out the menu online for clues about the chef's imagination and rangeeverything we've tried has been both new to us and scrumptious.

Went last week for the first time, had to return this week. We had a 6-year-old with us the first time; she was given the royal treatmentkitchen tour by the chef himself, with the opportunity to help him make her a special dessert. All in a low-key, relaxed, we're still in a grown-up restaurant way. The chef/child rapport was something to see!

Can't speak to the wine list; don't drink the stuff. Cocktails brilliant, though: as imaginative as the food. Top marks.
Unique menu and wine list, friendly service, great food - excellent combination. One of our favorite eating places when in SF.

After a somewhat disappointing experience at the bar before dinner, I was pleasantly surprised by our waitress who made an excellent wine recommendation. I also appreciated the array of vegetarian options and thought the risotto was fantastic. My dining partner loved his meal as well.
Nearby group was a bit rowdy. Otherwise, a solid, well-lit, and satisfying dining experience. The wine list could be improved.
review_title: Nearby group was a bit rowdy.

review: First time I went under new management. Very creative menu, nicely served. Gotta try the marrow appetizer! Definitely a notch up from the former incarnation of Fly Trap.
review_title: First time I went under new

review:
They were delayed in providing our table-- and after sitting there I can see why-- no hurry, complete comfort, no tension-- our dinner (four of us) lasted about two hours and we never felt pressure to leave...
The chef personally served us free appetizers at the bar while we were waiting...and by the way, the bar is very nice and comfortable and we could've waited all night and not noticed...as it was they were only about 15-20minutes behind and we actually didn't take our table for another 15 minutes as we were enjoying the whole scene.
Zare is an old pro and his food is excellent. My one complaint is that the prices are too high, so I will have to have a special occasion to go.
review_title: Zare is an old pro and his

review: Always good always fresh and the service is professional and friendly

3 of us went to dinner at Bar Crudo.  The wine list was good, and the oysters were fresh and delicious.  Their raw offerings were all tasty.  They were out of the buttterfish, which is something we really wanted to try.  After all the hype of their seafood chowder, we decided to order that.  It tasted burned and was almost too rich to eat...lots of cream.  The waitress was average and the atmosphere was comfortable but not stellar.  I would return, but it is not somewhere I'd rush back to.
Bar Crudo remains my favorite restaurant in the city! Such an awesome spot!

Whenever we visit San Francisco, maybe 6 times a year, we always try to make a booking (which you must do), in order to experience the simple, delicious freshness that is Bar Crudo. The menu is not elaborate, the wine list is very good. The crudo specials often include Arctic Char which is a favourite. This time we particularly loved the burratta and lobster salad (melt in the mouth) and the pan fried trout with succotash. This is not a Japanese place, the food however has a simplicity and the fresh raw bar offerings hint to Japanese sensibility though mostly use very western trimmings. We discovered that Happy Hour prices on this Saturday included $1 Pickering oysters!
Highly recommended.

Bar Crudo still rocks out tasty seafood combinations. Love the happy hour special. And the service is great. Only minus is the really noisy space on the 2nd floor. the noise reverbs off the ceiling up there.
Great raw bar food. Great distinct flavors on each dish.
We ate from the Raw menu and the plating and food was delicious. The actual restaurant itself was a little tight, and extremely warm (we sat on the 2nd floor). The service was on point and attentive.
review_title: We ate from the Raw menu and

review: Bar Crudo Oh yum. Seafood simply prepared, clean and unfussy. Delicious. The lobster was sweet and perfectly cooked. The chowder was heady and intense, perfect for sharing. Our waiter, Drew, was charming and funny and helpful with the menu and wine. Great food and great service We'll be back!

The Ono crudo was delicious. The grapefruit gave it a bright flavor and paired nicely with the fish. Everyone at the table ordered seconds. They have a nice beer and wine selection and will assist with pairings so your drink compliments each fish crudo. The cheese plate was also quite good and was a nice dessert.

The crudo at Bar Crudo is everything you could ask for -- fresh, interesting, delicious. But the rest of the menu is meh, the new space is cold (atmosphere not thermostat), the waitstaff are aloof, and the kitchen is very very slow. Hit the bar for a surgical crudo strike, but skip the sit-down meal.
review_title: It's called Bar Crudo for a reason

review: The food we ordered was very good. They brought bread, but only when we asked. No coffee on the menu for afters. Wish there had been a few more cooked options.
review_title: The food we ordered was very

review: We have always loved this place-the food is awesome. The freshness of the food comes through. The chowder is the best we've had. We appreciate the "early specials" that are available until 6:30 Tuesday - Saturday. Parking isn't bad either.

Great raw bar and finely-crafted raw appetizer selection. Dishes are perfectly portioned for two to share. Extensive and distinctive selection of beer, both on tap and bottled. Bar Crudo is a great addition to NOPA's growing selection of good restaurants.

The seafood was simply delicious. Everything that we ordered was flavorful but not overwhelming at all, the chowder was by far the most delicious I've ever had.
