All the crudo was perfectly handled and melt in your mouth, I had the sampler because I wanted to try it all. The lobster salad was my favorite. I will be back for more.
Seafood soup and lobster and beat salad was delicious!!! I'd go back again for those dishes!

If you're ever craving seafood, this is the place to go! They care about it all as every superb restaurant should. The seafood was high quality and the presentation was delightful. We enjoyed the service a great deal and our waiter was very informed- he made the ordering process fun for us and we learned a great deal as well!
Fabulous food & great service! Little loud, but fantastic seafood.

We arrived hungry at 8:15 and waited 30 minutes before we were even given a bite of bread! Food delivery was abysmally slow with everyone around us also waiting! Four staffers (manager?host,two servers)were obviously disorganized and ineffectual. What in the world was going on with the service? We never found out. Raw dishes came fastest, but that wasn't saying much. However, the oysters were fresh and delicious, the raw tuna chunks glistened like jewels, the fish soup was outstanding and the tweak on the traditional tomato and mozzarella salad(with lobster & lambs lettuce)was creative and delicious. Good wine and a killer beer list. We can't wait to go back for the food and we'll probably bring reading material to survive the poor service.

As this was another in a series of well researched dining options for our anniversary celebration, it was also another platinum selection. Our reservations were for 11:30am and when we arrived at 11:15 we were promptly seated. Connie and I had previewed the menu online and both knew what we wanted: She got the Brioche French Toast with apples and lots of yumminess, I got the Buckwheat Huckleberry Pancakes...more yumminess and a huge stack. The quality was outstanding and they had Pink Grapefruit Juice.  Our waiter, Russell was another example of someone who excels at his profession, gave us ample opportunity to enjoy our meal and each other without inundating us with appearances (yes, this increases tips as I hate...HATE being over attended to and especially being asked if my meal is ok. Wait staff should have confidence in their chefs, not make me wonder why they're asking about my food. If I have an issue, I will definitely address and send it back to be prepared properly by the professional). At the end of this excellent experience, I invited Russell to sit down and take  selfie. We conversed about his career choice and his schedule so I could recommend him to others. He explained that he is usually off on Fri. and Sat. but was covering this particular Sat. in trade for another day off. He gets his son on those days and spends the whole time with him. How can you not just love a good parent with limited child time who spends it properly. The trade off ? A long weekend with his son...very cool.  When I brought up our reservation to Ivar's brunch on Sunday, he shared that he had worked at Ivar's on the waterfront for 6 yrs but they closed for remodeling due to the construction along Alaskan Way. He recommended Ivar's brunch and asked us to tell his former GM, Brian, hi...if he was working.  This was another great dining choice and is definitely on our return list.
Excellent location for Thanksgiving! Three generations of our family thoroughly enjoyed our meal - great service and excellent food, which included traditional items and a few twists.

We went to Trace for Dine Around Seattle and were very pleased with the food quality, the service, and the ambience. We arrived at 6:15 and the dining room was pretty empty, but it was rather lively by the time we left around 9:30. The kale soup had a great texture and taste; the crispy egg with asparagus and potatoes was like nothing I'd had before - poached egg with a tempura-like halo, delish!; and the Theo chocolate pot de creme was velvety, spicy, and a great way to cap the meal. The service was helpful and attentive without being overbearing. Neither of us was thrilled with our first wine selection, but I'm guessing other options were better. Definitely looking forward to going back.
review_title: We went to Trace for Dine

review: Fantastic service and exceptional food quality. The wine list has hard to find Washington wines, so that was an extra benefit to a wonderful evening at Trace. Will definitely go back again soon.
The service was horrible. The restuarant was npt even busy and it took over an hour to get our food. I cannot imagine how long it would take if the place was busy.
The fries w/ White Truffle salt and herbs were the best! Great tuna tartare appetizer.

We were underwhelmed by Earth & Ocean. The food was just okay, not wonderful. Our server was clumsy, constantly bumping the backs of tables or even members of our party. Was he on something? we wondered. If not for the desserts--which were spectacular--it would have been a real disaster.

We go to ACT across the often, so the location is perfect. Everything we ordered was unusual and excellent. We started with the guacamole, which was perfectly spiced and came with these unbelievable house made tortillas. Then we had three different epimades and each was unique and a joy to eat.. Our entrants were shredded pork and abolado chicken. Both were unique taste treats. I can't wait to go back again. Oh, and don't get me started on the great margaritas.

If you are going to a show at the Curran, this is a very convenient place accross the street. Nice atmosphere, good dishes and OK service.
Carnitas were good and chile relleno also. Guacamole was the star of this meal. Waiter bungoled our order so the food came much later than it should have...but he apologized many times and comped us a dessert.
I would go back...just make sure your order is not lost in the shuffle.
Reliably good. This was my second time here. The four of us had a very nice lunch.

Third trip to Colibri, and it gets better every time.  I had a chili relleno stuffed with carnitas - unusual and delicioso.  My spouse had the special - short ribs enchiladas.  Even better than mine.  Add to that their famous guac, lots of chips and warm tortillas and a couple of margaritas and you have a meal fit for royalty.  

Not to mention it's across the street from the Geary and Curran theaters.  Just go early.  Colibri gets packed!

A bit pricey, but it's really for special occasions.  Everyday Mexican will still be at my neighborhood taqueria

We were visiting from the east coast looking for restaurants close to our hotel. The service and ambience were very nice. The appetizers were great however the chips were horrible! The entrees were very poor in fact we both left our plates barely touched. I have had much better mexican food on the east coast!! We will be back in the San Fran area but I will skip this place.

I can't say enough good about this gem. I entertained a group of 6, on business recently, The food was outstanding, the service perfect, and the drinks were excellent. This isn't your "standard" Mexican fare. Truly great food!
Service was very sporadic. We made it clear that we had to make a performance and they didn't pay much attention to that.
Had a local recommend this place and we were not impressed. Food was bland and the pork was way overcooked. Not coming back.

We visited twice in one week, and everything was so delicious and well crafted that I asked the wait staff if they sold a cookbook. I'd gladly buy it. The servers were very attentive and friendly without being at all intrusive. It's a bit noisy but the food makes it worthwhile, and a corner seat on our second visit helped us hear each other better.

From when we were greeted by the hostess until we left that night, the service was impeccable, the food was delicious, and the drinks were amazing. This visit reminded me of why Colibri is one of my favorite dining spots!
review_title: One of my favorite dining spots!

review: The food was really good but the tables are very close and for large people such as ourselves it was a bit difficult to get in and out of our seats. Background noise was high also.
review_title: The food was really good but

review: Great guacamole, chicken enchiladas, and mango creme brulee! The corn tortillas and salsa to start with were very good as well. Colibri will be my go-to place for great mexican food if I'm around the Union Square area!
Took a client and her daughter to dinner and had a fabulous dinner.  The waitstaff was terrific, the margaritas were well liquored and tasty.  Had my favorite fish tacos and was not disappointed.
review_title: Took a client and her daughter

review: Colibri is convenient to the theaters on Geary, just off Union Square. It is Mexican, but with a menu that includes great Mexican dishes you don't usually find at the "typical" California Mexican restaurant. Our two favorites are Tingas and Pozole. Tingas is a herbed and spiced chicken dish served on fried tortillas or in a casadilla. Pozole is a hominy soup with pork base and usually includes a variety of bits to add as you like -- including cabbage, radishes, fried tortillas, peppers and other vegetables. Both dishes are delicious. We don't understand why they are so rarely on the menu in Mexican restaurants. Churros with ice cream is an excellent dessert. These are not like what you get at the ball park.

Forgot to give us our main course. Offered to comp it. Service slow, or spotty. Sauce on camarones/shrimp so heavy that obscured taste of shrimp...appeared to be a heavy mole sauce, not the lighter tamarind sauce. Corn cake dry, as though had been prepared day before. When it initially opened, enjoyed this restaurant and the food. Success has changed it; they don't accommodate the crowds well and seem to have taken short cuts with food preparation.
review_title: Forgot to give us our main

review: Not your average Mexican restaurant. Great guacamole. Drinks are excellent.

Ordered a dish I had not tried before. It was presently beautifully and also delicious, except that the menu described it as including pork, chicken and fish, and there was no fish, but cheese instead.

I actually had to tell the fellow cleaning the door that it was opening time.

Colibri is one of our all-time favorites. Great guacamole, tasty cerviche, potent drinks! Sometimes it's hard to even get to the dinner menu because there are so many starters we like. The cinnamon sugared churros with dulce de leche ice cream for dessert - need I say more! We also love the quirky black and white, 1960's, Mexican, B-rated movies that run silently above the bar.
review_title: Colibri is one of our all-time

review: I love Colibri. I live in Los Angeles, but often travel to S.F. and each time I am in town I go to Colibri. I had the pleasure of having dinner there on New Years Eve and it was amazing. The food was great especially the guacamole and tortillas; I even bought tortillas to take home. The service was great, very attentive but not overbearing. If you haven't tried this place, you really should, you won't be disappointed.
review_title: I love Colibri. I live in

review: Food was beautifully prepared and very flavorful. Service was very good and friendly. The lamb shank was wonderful. The table side guacamole was fantastic. This restaurant is a keeper!!!

The food and service were excellent, especially for the location. We were going to see a show at the Curran Theater across the street, and didn't have high expectations Colibri, but were pleasantly surprised.

Second time there all was good except one entre of special Chili relleno it was cooked too long and burnt. We complained and they were nice enough to take off the bill but I felt bad one of my guest did not have a great dining experience. Everything else was great
"Noise: Energetic" means "really, really loud" around 6:30 PM.
The food was awesome! The service was amazing. I hope to go back jnext time i'm in San Francisco!
This continues to be one of our go-to restaurants.. Food is innovative and well prepared.
review_title: This continues to be one of

review: We really enjoyed our dinner. The combination of ingredients was exciting and taste bud friendly. The quacamole was superior.

My third time here. Food is always excellent with unique seasonings. We like the fish and vegetable dishes. Great white fish cerviche. Service was unattentive. We were more aggressive in getting someone's attention and then everything happened as it should.
review_title: My third time here. Food is

review: The entrees made the night. However, the tableside guacamole app fell short of expectations and the service was average at best.

Great as always. We always get the guacamole with those mini tortillas....Faulous! My husband had shrimp in mole sauce which he always enjoys. It did not disappoint this time. I had the fish special: a perfectly seared ahi tuna. It was packed as usual. This our restaurant of choice when going to the theatre on Geary.
Food was great, but the portions were a little too small. My friend and I still liked the restaurant, but we left not feeling quite satisfied. There are better restaurants for the money.
review_title: Food was great, but the portions

review: My mother and I very much enjoyed our experience at Colibri. The waiter and hostess were very friendly. The handmade tortillas were to die for. The tables are a little close together so I wouldn't recommend it as a romantic spot. Definitely a place to go for as a party scene. We were dining before watching a show at the Curran Theater so the location of the restaurant was superb. I would go again even if I wasn't going to a show.
review_title: My mother and I very much

review: Love this place!! A bit close and crowded but good atmosphere. Great for pre-theater dinning.
review_title: Love this place!! A bit close

review: I had been there for dinner recently, so went there for lunch this time. The difference this time is that i was surprised by the light lunch crowd, but the food was still good.
review_title: I had been there for dinner

review:
Colibri was fabulous as usual! Delicious and unusual food, great service, and so convenient to be right across the
street from the theater!

The good was absolutely terrific here! I had a great time with my friends! The only thing that prevented me from giving the overall score a 5 star rating was the fact I left a note for the staff on my reservation that it was my friend's birthday and no one followed through. As a restaurant manager myself, this is the difference that makes a good restaurant a great one.

Colibri wasn't anything special. Aside from the guacamole I wasn't too excited about anything else. The service was less than ideal and the atmosphere left something to be desired. Don't think I will be eating here again.

A pleasant find when visiting San Francisco. While the food was great overall, the best was the tableside guacamole. Unlike most places that serve it, Colibri serves it with small soft tortillas that melt in your mouth. Tasty!
I was so pleased to have my rush schedule met with quick service. THANKS
review_title: I was so pleased to have my

review: Our favorite go-to spot in the theatre district for fantastic, always innovative Mexican (this is no taqueria!) and great tequilas.

The food was good...not great. Four of us had the filet mignon, and it was a little tough. The service wasn't up to par....entrees arrived in shifts. It was ok. I'll probably try it again, hoping that this was just an "off" night.
The food is incredible. The homemade tortillas and guacamole. The Mole. Everything there is good. The service is also wonderful.

This is a great place to meet for drinks and festive dining before the theater. Food is served "tapas" style and perfect for sharing and light dining. It would be expensive if you ordered the equivalent of a full meal at a "regular" Mexican restaurant. Everything we ordered was very good and the vibe is lively.
review_title: This is a great place to meet

review: Colibri offers excellent food, drinks, and service. The pato en pipian is always cooked exactly right and the mole poblano (chicken in a smoky chile sauce) is outstanding. As sides, the hongos (mushrooms) are a standout, perfectly smoky and spicy. More substantial are the potatoes with poblano cream sauce -- decadent and delicious. The house margarita is decent, but their tequilito (tequila, lime, mint, and pomegranate syrup) is a unique alternative. The only downside of this place is that one of their tables is positioned adjacent to the kitchen and storage area (high foot traffic for staff) -- but if you ask for a booth you should be all set.
Very authentic.  The mole poblanos was outstanding!  We will put it on our list for favorite restaurants in San Francisco.

This place is not worth the hype it has received. They try to be creative with Mexican food and some dishes are good but nothing special. Service is fair, at best. And a tip if you dine there alone...insist on a seat a the bar. Don't let them seat at the two round tables near the maitre'd's station. The seats are uncomfortable and you'll have other guests bumping into you as you walk by.

Would I eat there again? Probably not.
review_title: This place is not worth the

review: After my second visit, this is my new favorite restaurant.  The addition of Dan Wagner is a definite plus !!!!!
review_title: After my second visit, this is my new fa...

review: Not easy to find...in a odd neighborhood, this restaurant is a quiet sanctuary serving better than average Italian food
I've been here many times but this time the food was not as good as I remember.  The ravioli was not as chewy and the sauce did not add enough flavor
I enjoyed the lunch we had at La Briciola. The grilled squid appetizer was fantastic! I definately would recommend to others as it was a nice, uncrowded location for a business lunch.
review_title: I enjoyed the lunch we had

review: We had an early dinner before heading to a concert downtown and tried La Briciola. Our food was good, really tasty homemade pastas are probably the highlight. The only downside here is location, underneath I-80 in a pretty industrial part of SoMa. If you are willing to trek down to it, it's a great value and really nice folks who take care of you.
Service was a little slow for a workday lunch, but the food and ambiance were both great.
A cute little Italian restaurant with very nice service and mediocre food.
Fantastic experience. Best authentic Italian we've had in years.

This was our second visit to this restaurant. The first time we were completely impressed with everything about it, and were therefore really looking forward to a return visit. Our second visit was a belated Valentines Dinner, and I was hoping for another fine experience. As before, the food was excellent, as was the service. Unfortunately, there was a large obnoxious group of perhaps 25 people present who seemed to regard the whole restuarant as their private party. It was virtually impossible to hold a conversation over their earsplitting yelling and shouting. I will likely return, but hope that such a group doesn't show up, or better that the restaurant decides that this kind of noisy mob is inappropriate for their establishment.

One of the truly authentic Italian restaurants this side of the boot. It's like walking in a neighborhood in Rome, Florence of Sienna and stopping for a meal at a local eatery. I have recommended it to four friends already

I went there on a business trip, and we all really enjoyed the restaurant.  The staff was extremely friendly, and there appeared to be all locals, and no tourists.  We were satisfied with the food and service!
review_title: I went there on a business

review: We dined at La Briciola for a Post-Holiday/Farewell to the boss luncheon. The restaurant is small, but easily accommodated a large party of 12. The service and food were excellent. The atmosphere was pleasant and not too loud. We could easily talk and be heard. I will definitely recommend this restaurant and come back with my family! It is truly a Neighborhood Gem.
review_title: We dined at La Briciola for

review: After reading the reviews on Yelp which were quite positive (four stars, I believe) I was disappointed to say the least. The restaurant itself was attractive, and the service was very good. Loved the bread and olive tamponade, and the wine that was recommended was also very nice. The caesar salad was very mediocre, on paar with Olive Garden or another chain restaurant. My dinner guest had the mixed seafood grill which was dry and over-cooked. I ordered the gnocci with duck ragu. The gnocci was big and doughy. The sauce was very rich and heavy, and overpowering. Perhaps wine and appetizers at the bar would have been a fine experience, but as for dinner, I won't be going back or recommending it to friends.

A very special small, authentic, Northern Italian restaurant. The quality and freshness of the food is exceptional. The service was attentive, but not intrusive. I had the Scaloppina di limone veal in a white wine lemon sauce, and the veal was tender and succulent, and the sauce was light. We were given a complementary Bruschette for a starter and a Tiramisu for dessert, which was puzzling, since it my first visit to the restaurant, then I remembered that about 6-8 months ago, I had made a lunch reservation which was canceled. I called the restaurant and the owner told me that they had had a fire in the kitchen and was unable to serve that day. The amazing thing was he had remembered, how many restaurants would have such a long memory.
Wonderful food, great service and one of the friendliest staffs ever. A marvelous restaurant that will have you coming back for more.

I chose this restaurant because it was one of the top-rated Italian places in the SOMA district on Yelp! The food was very good, the prices were reasonable, and the decor was very lovely and charming. I had the mushroom and truffle tagliatelle, which was excellent, but the salmon pasta was very creamy -- much more a northern Italian style while I prefer more southern Italian cooking which is heavy on the tomato and light on the cream and butter. The house salad was nothing to write home about, a bit small and rather standard, but they have an interesting take on bruschetta (they include eggplant and zucchini). Their fried calamari was absolutely fantastic. Vegan and vegetarian diners will not find enough options to warrant a second visit.

Great place to go if you're in the Filmore. They're classified as French, but there's some pinches of other European countries in the flavors here as well. Great wine list, and the service was on it. The food took a while, but the restaurant itself was very busy. Nonetheless, great experience and I would recommend to anyone to try.

The food here is excellent.  It's quality bistro food with a French twist.  The chef knows what he's doing, and any of the pates is good when one is on the menu. The service is by career wait staff who are friendly and competent, and the ambiance is classic San Francisco bistro.  And with a full bar, what's not to like?!  :o)

Restaurant is one of our favorites. John, the maitre d, is always very accommodating and was able to get us in earlier than our reservation and we were given a choice of tables. Doug, the owner, is often there to welcome his diners. Food is always delicious and we often see friends there which adds to the energy.
It was excellent! Tara, the Bar Tender, Brad, and John were excellent hosts. Very easy to meet people at the bar, friendly!
A dimly lit, romantic space with tasty, inventive food, attentive, friendly service. We'll be back.

I had heard about this restaurant from a friend who is French, and lives in France, but had never been here. Saturday night was the right time, as I was going to a movie at the Kabuki, and it is not far to walk.

The food was excellent, and the service, as just terriric.

They were prepared for us, and the food, as my friend from France said, the best!

I will definitely go again.
review_title: I had heard about this restaurant

review: Wine list is a bit sparse and disproportionately pricey. Otherwise, a great meal: duck confit cassoulet and sweetbreads with mushroom and pancetta were perfect, and the service excellent, as always.
review_title: Wine list is a bit sparse

review: Excellent New Fillmore bourbon cocktail. Nice selection of delicately nuanced pasta dishes (not too large, but just right). Server was friendly and attentive; she split a tasty arugula salad for us. Crowded on a Saturday night with voices raised. A fine place to laugh out loud comfortably and enjoy well prepared food in a relaxed atmosphere. We liked the cute little straight-up glassware, too.

I had not heard of Florio; I it based upon location and the Open Table write-up and reviews. Wow - what great find. It is quite tiny (maybe 15 tables) but doesn't feel crowded - more intimate. The bar is a beautiful old-fashioned French work which is gorgeous. The ambience, decor, open-air kitchen all work together. In terms of the food, every dish the 3 of us tried we liked. The menu is diverse but not so large to be overwhelming. The service is very good - our service offered true opinions, and was well aware of our needs. I loved having cheese as an option - esp. the very well priced Cowgirl Creamery changes. Lastly, the valet parking option is awesome - Fillmore St. can be a nightmare. I will FOR SURE be back.
review_title: I had not heard of Florio;

review: We came after work during the holidays. Food & service was excellent. It was close to our office. Will definitely come again.

Our first dining experience here was so wretched that we vowed never to go again! Then I made a mistake and made an OpenTable reservation here, believing it was a different restaurant. When we arrived I realized to my horror what I had done. Rather than risk an OpenTable demerit for being a non-show, we submitted to our reservation with great distress...it was even our anniversary. But in one of those inexplicable happy miracles, the food this time was actually edible. I enjoyed my pasta and antipasta and the fish of the day was quite good, according to my husband and son, who reminded me that food critics are wise to eat in a place three times before rendering judgment. It's not Canteen or SPQR, but it is a solid, pleasant place to eat.
Florio is always excellent. The service is attentive and professional, and the food is delicious.
Eclectic dining experience with fantastic food. The tables are a little close to one another, but I think it adds to the cozy, romantic feel to the restaurant.
I love this small, atmospheric restaurant but our waiter's attitude was less than congenial this time.
Great place, always reliable, good comfort food in the chicken. Excellent fries. We really enjoy Floria each time we go.
Great food and very kid friendly (although not many kids around).
review_title: Great food and very kid friendly

review: we had a great table by the window. Super cozy. Staff was very nice too.
review_title: we had a great table by the

review: Alegrias is a good place to go for a variety of tapas and paella. The menu offers vegetarian options and everything is delicious!  The hosts and wait staff are friendly and attentive and the dining area is lively without being overly loud.

This place is a little run down in its decor and you can tell when you walk in that it's been that way for awhile... but don't let that fool you. Their tapas are incredible. They have AMAZING dishes so choose a variety of them and you'll enjoy them all. Not joking.
review_title: Nothing to look at but the food!!

review:
Went with a girlfriend. It was a MONDAY at 7:30; about 5 table occupied when we arrived, and when we left at 9:30 we were the only ones there.

Food quite good, but very weird to be so alone in a relatively large space
We love Alegrias! Alegrias is always our choice for Valentine's Day dinner. Never disappoints! :)

This was our first time. The service was amazing, was able to get reservation very easy. Food was ok, but we only tried 6 tapas. I'll go back to try more. Great place to go with friends and visit. Perfect little place compared to newer louder restaurants in the area for actual dinner conversation. The sangria was fantastic. I would recommend to friends and will update review when I've tried more of the menu.
review_title: This was our first time. The

review: We went with previous reviews for this dinner and they were spot on. The atmosphere was relaxed- good mood lighting, not too loud- cute European decor. The tapas were tasty and the service was prompt (we didn't get paella which takes longer and is indicated on the menu). We asked the waiter his favorites and they were spot on-- especially liked the goat cheese and the tortilla Espanola with chorizo.

I came here to celebrate my graduation with my family, it was delicious , great ambiance, good service, and really good prices.
WE were 7 , and paid only $260 not bad for a group
Amazing place! Definitively a MUST DO for anyone looking for great Spanish Food.

What a great place! So nice to find a Lombard st restaurant that's not a chain.
This is a great place for Tapas. Sangria is fantastic for $5 a glass.
review_title: What a great place! So nice

review: This restaurant was very good. The portions were not as large as some of the other reviews had stated, but they were sufficient. The Paella was very tasty and the Rabbit stew dish was wonderful...The staff were very accomodating and attentative. I would recommend this restaurant to my family and friends, and suggest that they try all of the different items on the menu. Oh, by the way, the price was very good for the meal and service!

This is the second time I have eaten at Alegrias and I came away as satisfied this time as the first. While it took some time for the server to acknowledge us after we sat down, his attention to our needs was excellent from that point on.
Food was delicious-great flavors, cooked perfectly.
If you enjoy tapas, the food at alegrias will hit the spot.
review_title: This is the second time I

review:
Food was excellent. We had to wait for 15 minutes before someone attended
to us. The person apologized profusely and after that the service was
good.
Took my family from Japan there.  They were very impressed!  We had a fantastic time there.  Would definitely go back!

It was the perfect weather for a perfect lunch at Sutro's Restaurant at the Cliff House! 
My friend and I arrived a bit early for our reservation, but it afforded us the time to walk around a little to enjoy the lovely breathtaking views from different vantage points while appreciating the historic value and structure of the building.
 At the restaurant, we were greeted warmly and lead to a table by a window which was exactly what we were hoping for, but I believe there is not one table that you could sit and not enjoy the spectacular view.
We started with a Bloody Mary with just the correct amount of heat made from their own house Bloody Mary mix, dressed with their own marinated olives and chiles, and accompanied by a long celery stick. "It was like having an appetizer!" 
Next, my friend ordered the artichoke bisque soup and I ordered a salad perfectly dressed with a vinaigrette dressing. Both were beautifully presented and made with fresh locally grown greens and fall vegetables.
For our entrees, my friend had the dungeonus crab-cakes, that looked wonderful, and I had the pan seared scallops with prawn scampi on a bed of Israeli couscous that was simply delicious! We were too full for dessert but I have no doubt that it would have been as equally satisfying. 
 Last but not least, our waiter attended us perfectly and in a timely way, not to rush us or withdraw too long between dishes. 
Thank you all for a memorable experience!
Appetizers were very good; grilled scallops sweet wonderful taste; grilled sea bass not recommended; sorbet to cleanse the palate highly recommended.
We love eating at Sutro's.  It is pricey, but we go when we want a relaxing, wonderful meal.  We recommend it.
review_title: Great Meal at Sutro's at Cliff House

review: The food was exotic and delicious. There were beautiful views of the wonderful coastline from the floor to ceiling windows of the restaurant.. The restaurant also has some deep rooted history with San Francisco - so it is a great place to impress visitors. I loved the rack of lamb-very tender with amazing flavors. They showcase wines and beers from California. -Truly great for tourists to California!

You watch the ocean and the cormorants on the rocky island, surfers and container ships coming to the Golden Gate.  You may fall in love with the mussels or steak frite. Try something new each time, or order your favorite each time you come here.  Maybe it's the hot roll with the salted butter.   Great place.

very nice restaurant and romantic, just make sure you have reserved your cap before you leave restaurant otherwise have to wait 30 min or so for rid if don't drive your own car!
I definitely recommend this restaurant.
review_title: very nice restaurant and romantic, just ...

review: The room, view, wait staff, food & drinks at lunchtime are 5 star. The patrons are SF tourists, dressed like farm hands, and ladies who lunch, who look like charity league supporters. The meal isn't inexpensive but the mix works, probably because everyone who's there can afford it.

Outstanding in every way. My Crab Louie was the best I have ever had...4 different dressings hidden throughout the salad. Beautiful display. My friend had the steak and fries and was very pleased with both. Service was impeccable. Would highly recommend
review_title: Outstanding in every way. My Crab Louie ...

review: In this case the meal is secondary. We've had wonderful food off the menu. This time we had the prefix lunch and it was fine, delicious, not your run out and tell everyone to go there meal. It was a fair value. They were busy service was slow and not unfriendly, just business. Don't let this review stop you from going. GO, just adjust your expectations.

What an incredible dining experience! The food was great. Their wine list of 30 wines in the $30s was great. A gorgeous view and we saw dolphins and whales right off shore swimming amongst the surfers. Sunset was gorgeous and never gets old from this spot. I assumed with the great view that the food would be mediocre but it wasn't. The duck was great, my dinner companions had the pork chop and it was the best they had ever had. The bacon crusted salmon was amazing.
Even when raining, the view is amazing.   I had an excellent crab salad sandwich; my husband had lamb.  Highly recommend.  Oh, and they serve the best Bloody Mary!
review_title: Even when raining, the view is amazing. ...

review: The waiter we had wasn't friendly and presented us with attitude.
review_title: The waiter we had wasn't friendly

review: We had a great table overlooking the ocean, huge waves crashing on the rocks and a spectacular sunset. The food was outstanding, service was prompt and very good. I'm a home wine maker and brought my own wine. There was a $18:00 per bottle corkage fee but no slip in service levels. We had a 20 month old with us, high chairs and booster seats were available as well as a nice kids menu.

Sutro's is a little pricey, but worth every penny, especially for a special occasion. Each dish ordered by our party of nine, was delectable. They even prepared one dish to order - made it vegan, and it was great. Will definitely return,

I even here multiple times and each time is the same thing. The service takes unusually long for getting drinks, and getting our meals. The waiter rarely comes by to check on us and at times it's not that busy.

Plan for a longer time for dinner because of this. Other than that, it is a lovely place for a nice romantic dinner. :)
Make a reservation when they open, and get a table at one of the floor to ceiling windows facing the ocean. Good food, but the view steals the show.

We had been told that this restaurant was one of the places we had to go on our trip to San Francisco! They were right! We were in town for a conference and had many nice dinners and great food. This restaurant was by far the best! The service was amazing the view was amazing, although I'm sure it's even more amazing during the day, when you can see the full view. We felt like we were Richard's only table. He was so attentive, so knowledgeable and not pushy. He knew every detail of every item on the menu and we appreciated his suggestions, they turned out to be great. Our experience was memorable to say the least.

We had lunch at Sutro's, with a table side view of the ocean, and everything was superb! The service was friendly, unrushed and helpful for navigating the menu. The food was top notch, with artistic presentation and and excellent quality. We had such a good time, enjoying the view and the cuisine, that it was hard to leave! A stroll along side the ocean makes a fitting conclusion to the experience.

Great Romantic location, service was slow and unattentive, food was fatastic,
DON'T TAKE A CAB, DIFFICULT GETTING CAB BACK TO RESTAURANT TO PICK PEOPLE UP, RELY ON A CAR SERVICE
Restaurant has own car service, may have to wait
This is the second time I have dined here in the last six months--it has everything! A great place for special occasions.

Long time ans but our dinner this week was incosistent. The crab cake appetizer...why do they keep reinventing this dish? It used to be wonderful but is now a shadow of its' former incarnation...not nearly as tasty although the deep fried slice of avocado was interesting. Then the wonderful medium rare duck breast (the skin should have been crispier) was accompanied by sweet potato latkes. The latkes were worse than terrible. Not only were the exteriors almost black, but there was a strange herb that detracted from the taste. We had guests for dinner and I noticed one of them didn't finish the halibut, nor did he say it was good. So,maybe the chef was not around on Tuesday evening. For $200+ for a meal, we expected a LOT better.

First time here since the grand remodel years ago. The service was great, four stars! However the food just didn't really match up to the price point. Husband had the tuna tartare, the fish was fresh and the portion was decent but for $20 I was hoping for fireworks on my taste buds. Entrees were the seared scallops and the bouillabaisse, again seafood was fresh, but not worth the price point. View was nice even on a gloomy day. If I go back, i'd probably try the Bistro Menu instead.

Me and my husband had a romantic wonderful dinner, saw the sun come down beautiful view , food delicious , atmosphere so perfect , we had the best ime while we was in San Francisco dining  at your restaurant

We knew Cliff House catered to tourists and didn't have super high expectations but even at that it was very disappointing. My daughter and I had the corn chowder and it tasted like someone had opened up a can of corn, pureed it and added some water and a bit of cream. When we found ourselves reaching for the salt shaker we knew things were bad. Service, while pleasant, was sketchy, entrees arriving while appetizer plates were still on the table, server never checking back to pour more wine or see how things were going. We primarily went for the view which was spectacular but considering the prices they charge customers deserve more.

The menu is very limited but there is enough choice to make ordering easy and the preparation of everything is done very well.. This is the second time we have been to Sutro in the last year and everything on the menu was the same. There were two specials and one of our party was very pleased with it. You just can't beat Sutro for the view and the restaurant inside is beautiful. It is a very dramatic and beautiful place to dine.
review_title: The menu is very limited but

review: We arrived ten minutes early and were promptly seated for our lunch reservation. I requested a window table, and it was fulfilled. Gorgeous view, even though we came on a cloudy day. There were a couple of piano songs played during our time there. We had the crab cakes, oysters, bacon-encrusted salmon, bouillabaisse, and butterscotch pots de creme. They split the appetizers onto two separate plates for us without us asking, which I found very nice. Everything was delicious. The tequila-lime mignonette really made the oysters shine. Service was attentive and professional. I've read that this is the place to dine during sunset. Maybe next time...

I have been going to San Francisco all my life, but this was the first time I ever made the trip out to Cliff House. It was a beautiful stormy night and the view could not have been more spectacular. Our food was so delicious and there were many other things on the menu I would have liked to try. And the best cocktail I have ever had (the Sutro's version of a tequila sunrise). Terrific in every way!
review_title: I have been going to San Francisco

review:
My husband and I went there to celebrate our 22nd annivesary. The food was decent we waited for more than 45 mins for our main dish. The duck I ordered was done just right but my husband's ravioli came lukewarm to cold. The waitress offered to get it reheated but after waiting so long to get our dinner, he was in no mood to wait any longer for them to heat it up again. We finished our dinner and left, never to return. Too pricey for poor service.
One would have thought the kitchen had warming drawers or something to keep food really warm while making the other dishes but I guess, that would be too much to ask.
Really good food and service in a fantastic setting with a view of Seal rock and the Sutro Baths. A little pricy, but worth a slplurge

A super scenic place to go and be treated by awesome food and service. This is an upscale restaurant so dress appropriately. Food was awesome, as was the service. This is a great place for a romantic date, causal brunch or lunch with friends. I would recommend going for brunch/lunch so you can see the gorgeous views of the ocean and coastline. Definitely make a reservation. And then sit back and be waited upon in style and elegance.

Really wish they would bring the shark dish back,
Was trying to impress my family but they said they have had better (duck dish n bousilini soup)
Not a fan of the guy passing out bread and butter one by one
Still my favorite place though

Excellent service. Dana the manager was so very attentive and charming. Dusti our waitress also very attentive and never once forgot about us. Super friendly and great personality. Very knowledgable of the menu. Had a wonderful experience and would take any friend here.

The view is worth the trip. We had clear skies and a beautiful sunset to celebrate a family birthday. Unfortunately, we placed our meal order after a party of 40 placed theirs. Needless to say, the food was very slow coming out and some of it was not hot. The food was decent but pricey. I would recommend going to the Cliff House for a drink at one of the three bars and enjoy the view.
review_title: The view is worth the trip.

review: I found out about the Cliff House while browsing a website that features photos of vintage vehicles and classic Americana. Some of the more picturesque images that kept popping up were shots of the Cliff House over the years. I looked it up and found out where it was. Knowing that I would be traveling to San Francisco, I wanted to make it a stop on my trip. Boy, am I ever glad that I did. It was truly one of the best dining experiences I've ever had. This place had everything: the staff was friendly, the food was incredible and the view is indescribable. I will very definitely be back!
review_title: I found out about the Cliff

review: We live in the Richmond, and we've enjoyed eating here regularly. However, the service seems to be slipping a bit. The last couple of times that we've eaten here, our server has been elusive. And we decided not to have dessert last night because we found the behavior of the other diners near our table disruptive and rude (snapping way, way too many flash photos). We still enjoy the food, but the service and the dining environment left something to be desired last night.
review_title: We live in the Richmond, and

review: The go-to Bay Area restaurant for our family's special occasions - and it never disappoints.  The view is fabulous - with a window seat you look out onto the ocean below, Ocean beach to the south and the Golden Gate bridge and Marin headlands to the north.  Service was great, the cocktail selections superb, and the food absolutely delicious. Tourist-influenced pricing, no doubt, but well worth it!

We had a wonderful time for dinner.  It added to a beautiful vacation experience.
We thank them whole heartedly.

View over the Pacific and the reefs is always great, especially at sunset
Service was disappointing : cold greeting upon arrival, waiters did not know anything about the wine list
Scallops were fresh and excellent
Desert was not good at all (sour greek yogurt, poor composition)

I felt the clearing of the table (take my plate away BEFORE I was finished) was on going and not necessary. I also sat next to a heater vent that was on and it was 80 degrees outside. I was sweating. The dessert took a very long time to receive.

Good news our waitress was wonderful and the food was delicious!
review_title: I felt the clearing of the

review: The Dine Around Town menu was just OK. Felt we would have enjoyed our experience more if we just ordered ala carte. Volume in producing the special "pre-fix" menu seems to have lowered quality.

Mother's Day was very busy, but seating and service quite smooth. Excellent view. Meal was uneven: excellent crab cakes for appetizers, excellent halibut on the main but poorly constructed risotto base over-powered by garlic, also very nice Scottish trout. For dessert the Lemon cake was exquisite, but the sorbet array disappointing. Overall, a great afternoon mother's Day.
Appetizers never arrived, although main course was delicious. Service took extremely long.

A beautiful restaurant for tourists and locals, alike. As a local San Franciscan, I'm always a bit skeptical about restaurants that have stunning views and cater to mostly tourists. Though, a dear friend and I dined last night and enjoyed the views, ambiance, service and food a great deal. The portions are fair-sized, all ingredients fresh and presentation aesthetically-pleasing. I would recommend Sutro's to both tourists and locals, alike, especially for a special occasion, where a view is desired.

I have never been disappointed at the Cliff House. Quality dinning, friendly staff, and a view that is world-class. Every time I go to San Francisco I go to the Cliff House and bring my friends and business associates. They are always impressed and pleased.

I love the beautiful Ocean Beach-side view of this place. The ambiance was quite romantic, set off by candle-light and the sound of the waves crashing against the shore. My date had a perfectly done proscuitto wrapped beef shoulder. The shoulder was very tender and the proscuitto added intense flavor. I had the bouillabase with a very delicious broth, not too fishy. The soft-shelled crab was something I am not used to in bouillabase, but the addition of it was very welcome. For dessert with had a lemon souffle which was a good balance of sweet and tart. I would come back here for any special occasion.
We had a very nice dinner at Sutro's last Sunday. The view is fantastic and the food was very good!. We will definitely go back.
review_title: We had a very nice dinner

review: I recently took my girlfriend to the Cliff House for her birthday dinner and was pleased to find that the food and service now more than live up to the amazing view. We had an incredible meal, were more than pleased in every way and plan to go back again soon.
We had a wonderful time! The staff was SO thoughtful with a birthday dessert prepared for our table!! The food was beautiful and tasty and the service was perfect:-)

We took out of town guests for lunch & everyone enjoyed the location, history, modern building, & service. We are foodies so the local ingredients & creative menu were right up our alley. The sausage trio was super tasty & ample serving size. We even saw some of the surfing contest. We will come again & again!
Warm and welcoming staff, great service, excellent food, fabulous setting!

This is a lovely restaurant with a beautiful view, good service and good food. The food presentation is lovely, but they need to work on some "taste flaws" in order to elevate their food to the next level.

This is a beautiful restaurant that is perfect if you want to "Wow" someone on a special occasion, that is of course, if you bring your own food and server. The food was not horrible; however, it was no memorable. The server came by twice to check on us, but did not offer us wine nor did he inquire as to how the meal was going. For such a gorgeous location, we were hoping for the food and service to match.

The Cliff House is a fabulous restaurant with an incredible view.
Minimal decor adds to the beauty of the room, impeccable service and delicious,
beautifully presented food, what else could we ask for.
review_title: The Cliff House is a fabulous

review: Definitely a great restaurant to go to if you are celebrating something special or need a little bit of a classic touch to your dining experience. The restaurant oversees a great scenic view of the ocean, especially around sunset. They sat us right next to the window with an ocean view and it was just gorgeous. The food was amazing and it paired very well with the sake I was drinking. I went with my husband and we had a romantic, "just-us" time and it was great!

The view is great, but the windows need to be cleaned! We made a reservation at Sutro's because we had a great meal in the upstairs restaurant a few months ago, but unfortunately the menu is different and we weren't able to get the great clam chowder that we had been craving after our previous visit upstairs.
review_title: The view is great, but the

review: Such an amazing view and lovely space. Food was decent. Great place to take visitors to sf
review_title: Such an amazing view and lovely

review: A lot of times restaurants with great views or famous locations don't live up the standards food-wise. That was not the case at Sutro's. The locale was gorgeous and we enjoyed a nice sunset. On top of that, though, we enjoyed a terrific dinner. We were there for my wife's birthday and they gave us half off any bottle of wine and a complimentary dessert. The service was also stupendous. They split our soup and salad into departs servings without even asking when I mentioned that we would share. I really enjoyed the asparagus soup and the duck. My wife had the chicken with tater tots to die for. We will definitely be back with special out of town guests.
Wonderful expierience. The food and service were excellent and the ocean views and scenery were awsome. I have already recomended the Sutro's to many friends and will continue to do so.

This is a good restaurant for tourists simply because of the location. If you want locals to choose Sutro's as a regular dining establishment then the waiter we had would have to kick it up a bit. Our evening would have been better if the waiter paid attention while serving us rather than always being distracted. He would set a plate down over my arm while I was in the middle of reaching for bread from my bread plate, he always looked away when serving us, he filled my husband's coffee cup 3/4 full and placed our dinner check down without a word of thanks. This made a bad impression for us and we probably won't return given the higher price for a restaurant in our neighborhood. The food presentation was good, but sauces were a little thick.

Reserved a table here for sundown on my 26th birthday.  My mother, father, and grandmother were visiting from Connecticut.  My grandmother had never been to San Francisco before, so I wanted everything to be very special for her while she was here.  We had such a lovely dinner experience.  Everything was exceptional from the food, the wine, to the service, and the amazing view!  I wil have the memory of visiting here for a lifetime, and so will my family.  A must see if you are a local and have never been, or if you are visiting San Francisco.
Good food, nice view, not too loud. Only negative is the high prices
Amazing view, fantastic wine list, great service, amazing food. I love the look of this place, and I would go back in an instant.

Overall good. But not as nice as we remember. We did get a window seat and was seated immediately, but we were seated next to a large party that had children. Eventually the noise level went down when the large party left.

We were there for a birthday, and had requested a lemon dessert for our daughter (seemed annoyed when reminded). Our waiter was nice, but seemed disappointed when only 2 members of our party had wine, and 1 dessert. 2 got the special (prime rib), 1 filet and the halibut. All the dishes were good, but the accompaning dish (potatoes?) with the halibut, was so salty it could not be eaten.

Will try again, but the updated renovations makes is more family (non special) occasion and somewhat over priced.
review_title: Overall good. But not as nice

review: We had a wonderful experience, the only negative, was waiting an hour for a taxi. This had nothing to do with the restaurant, but it put a damper on the entire evening. We did not have a rental car, were staying downtown, and it really took the sparkle off what was a super dining experience.
The Cliff House was recommended as a MUST while celebrating our 10yr wedding anniversary. It was well worth it. The food was second only to the wonderful scenic view.

As noted above we enjoyed our dining experience (with Sutros at The Cliff House) immensely.
My wife and I went for our anniversary and it was as exciting, tasteful and romantic as we hoped.We will most certainly return when in The City

Mike Chappell
Sonora, Calofornia
The food and the view were great. The service was incredibly slow (took an hour after sitting down to get our appetizer) and the waitress was not very attentive.
review_title: The food and the view were

review: The restaurant was beautiful, and the food was fantastic!

I loved the scenic view. We were seated right away, even though we were 15 minutes late and we called to notify them. We ordered a chicken dish and it was very flavorful. Dessert was recommended by the waiter, strawberry short cake, very yummy. We seen the waiter maybe twice, we weren't too happy with him. Overall, nice restaurant.
review_title: I loved the scenic view. We

review: They were willing & able to meet my needs for a gluten free dinner!

The crabcake appetizers were excellent. The swordfish BLTs were very tasty and not too filling. The tri-color gnocchi was excellent and quite filling. The Caesar salad, which one of our party ordered as her lunch, didn't really satisfy. Lunch for four w/o dessert, and with only one person having one glass of wine, plus a generous tip, was $150. Not something I'd do ordinarily, but it was worth it to show the view to our out-of-town guests, and the ability to make a reservation was pretty much mandatory since we went on a holiday and didn't want to get stuck with a long wait at the Bistro or Beach Chalet.

The food was great, however I was not very impressed with being seated in front of the waiters station. This location made my daughter (a disabled teen) very uncomfortable and when moved to a booth; this was very disappointing for my mother's day. I did ask for a comparable location by the window, but was denied. This was not very good service to someone who has never been to this establishment.

For the price you'd think the experience would be memorable.  At least for the good reasons.  The views were breathtaking and the rest of the ambiance was very pleasant/romantic.  The food, however, did not deliver.  What I can say is that our waitress was pleasant and recommended a nice red for the Mrs. and I.  Sat rt near the window at sunset.  Perfect.  Don't see us returning anytime soon, but if so, we will not order the duck and gnocchi.
WOW! The food and service were awesome. I expected the view but this was amazing. Since it's relatively expensive it's best for special occasions. Book your reservations WAY in advance.
Had a really enjoyable time, the view was amazing, the staff were friendly, but unfortunately the food was disappointing. That said, I would certainly go again...

No DAT menu served on week-ends although we had DAT reservations for Saturday . A mild disappointment.
It was a beautiful afternoon and the views from our window table were spectacular. If only the food and service were equally stellar we would have been very happy. Four in our party, three adults one teen-ager. I ordered crab cakes which tasted only like fried something and the cod. Cod was OK but nothing wonderful. My wife ordered the shrimp soup and steak fritte. Steak was tough with over carmelize onion on top, fries were not hot. Little gem ceasar was over-dressed and tasted strongly of mayo.
Desserts were OK but lacked imagination. Service was lack luster. I had to go looking for my wait-person to place our order.
review_title: No DAT menu served on week-ends

review: The restaurant is a hidden treasure! Loved the ambiance, food, and the host who had a smile on him every time he came to our table. The place is perfect to go all season. I guess Summer would be the best season as you can see sunset. Great place which I would recommend to all if you wanna experience what it is like to dine in NorCal =)
Though the food at this historic landmark was outstanding, the service was so slow that it ruined the overall experience. We will not be returning to the Cliff House.
review_title: Though the food at this historic

review: We enjoyed a wonderful dinner. I was pleasantly surprised. I expected a tourist attraction type of menu and Sutro's so much more. I really enjoyed the Roasted Beet Salad and Crab Cakes. I enjoyed the scallops, however felt that the pearl pasta needed a bit more flavor. The atmosphere, architecture and overall space is fantastic. The service was exemplary and Monday night is the night to go for locals!

We absolutely enjoyed our lunch at the Cliff House. Our server was excellent; professional, and gregarious without being intrusive, we really enjoyed talking to him about the history of the restaurant and the Sutro Baths. How many restaurants can boast servers that have been with them for 30 years through thick and thin?

The lunch menu was limited, but varied and the dishes were very creative. Everything that we had was prepared to perfection and plated very attractively.

If we lived closer, we would be regulars!

This was our first visit since the renovation of the Cliff House. The restaurant space is superb with fabulous ocean and headlands views. We dined for lunch and had the scallops and brick chicken selections. Both were excellent in preparation and presentation. The service was attentive without being fussy. It's a welcome change to see a restaurant whose food quality is equal to the ocean views. That said, Sutro's is VERY expensive and we definitely paid for the view. This is a great spot for special occasions or to take out of town guests.
review_title: This was our first visit since

review:
It was Labor Day weekend so the restaurant was crowded. That being said, the restaurant should have been prepared. The service was very slow, but the worst was that each person's dish came at a different time. My husband sat for almost 15 minutes waiting for his appetizer while the rest of us sat with our soup getting cold. The main course also each came a long time apart.

The food was only OK. Not as good as when we ate at the restaurant back in May, so we are not sure we would go back as its expensive to risk a not that great meal.
review_title: It was Labor Day weekend so

review:
It was a birthday celebration for 3 women and selected for the location as a San Francisco gem. I did not check the menu or realize there was an upstairs bistro so was quite surprised at the menu and prices. HOWEVER, we shared one appetizer and then each ordered an appetizer. ALL WERE BEYOND EXCELLENT in terms of quality, flavor and presentation; particularly the mussels. The portions were quite small. A dessert was gien in recognition of the birthday and it too was outstanding.

We would return for dinner for a special occasion. The service was top level.

Would have been a near perfect experience (quality of food has improved a hundred-fold with new chef), except for the non-existing service provided by our waiter. Forgot our wine and he NEVER brought it. We had to ask two other staff people to bring it before it landed on our table, which was near the end of finishing our entrees. He never checked in with us; was never in the area to do so. I've never been left waiting for so long and so often by a waiter before. Just taking our orders (servers brought out the food/bread/etc) and bringing our check (even for this task, we had to get a server to "get our waiter") doesn't constitute service.
review_title: Would have been a near perfect

review: The food was good and well presented. The menu is somewhat limited. The service was very good, the server was pleasant and accomodating. Since we made a reservation we had a table by the window with a great view. All in all it was a pleasant experience.
review_title: The food was good and well

review: Prices were less than I expected, especially in the wine list (with many choices $30-36)
review_title: Prices were less than I expected,

review: Absolutely the best scenic, food and service in San Francisco!
Healthy and light, great dining event, location. Overall excellent.

The service and staff at this restuarant were terrible. We made reservations at this restaurant for our wedding anniversary. They made it memorable but not in a good way. The food was average at best. I would not recommend this restaurant.
review_title: The service and staff at this

review: Not a bad table in the house! Even though we were not at a window table, we still had a great view! Food was great, service was too. We loved it!
review_title: Not a bad table in the house!

review: The food was great, however the service was not the best. It took over an hour for us to get our food, while 3-4 other tables around us ordered after and they were done eating before we even got our main dishes.
The Cliff House lived up to its reputation with great food, service and outstanding views.
review_title: The Cliff House lived up to

review: Worst experience. Would not recommend or eat there again.

Even though it is not exactly a kid friendly restaurant (no coloring or similar thing to keep them busy), the staff was very accommodating. The view was fantastic. Steak frites was very good. The oyster sandwich was just ok. The chocolate mousse was very good.
review_title: Even though it is not exactly

review: I took my nieces to the Cliff House to celebrate the end of 2008. We had a wonderful meal and the service was excellent. One of the best meals of my life.
review_title: I took my nieces to the Cliff

review: Beautiful location with high quality food that you do pay for, but worth it. The view is outstanding. The history intriguing. I probably would not go after dark. A great place to take out of town guests. Reservations strongly recommended.

It was our annaversary and it was fantastic. It was the best food we have had since I don't know when. And the view, Oh my god! There was a big storm that evening that was making the waves huge and view was spectacular. Absolutly memorable and wonderful annaversary.

We were seated right away. The waiter was good overall...but had to wait about 20 minutes for him to get back to us to order dessert after he had already given us the dessert menu. Loved the view of the Pacific ocean...enjoyed the low lighting...the food was really good. Overall, it is a wonderful choice for someone who wants to relax in a pieceful setting, enjoy the moment, and have some great food. We went Friday b/c we heard that they have a live jazz band every Friday night from 7pm to 10pm. The light jazz gave the setting an even more romantic feel.
Unexpected pleasure. Haven't been to the Cliff House in years, because it was never good. The food was great, the service spot on and the wine prices really good. I will go back soon.
Great scene of the Pacific Ocean, but only during daytime.  Food and Service are both good.
Perfect place, good food, very good vine list (although you were out of my first choice vine :(). Nice music and very good service. Deserves a place among world-class restaurants.
WE HAD A GREAT MEAL WITH GREAT SERVICE AT A GREAT PLACE.
review_title: WE HAD A GREAT MEAL WITH GREAT

review: Disappointed with the lobster bisque Saturday afternoon.  We ordered some from Fisherman's Wharf that evening at half the price that was twice as good.
For such a small restaurant, service was hard to come by.  My server did not take my order (party of 2) until 10 minutes after we sat down.

We had been to the Cliff House before and truly enjoyed it. What a gift to spend time in this location. This visit was accompanied with high winds, chilly temps, que sera,sera! No warm fuzzies, but not Cliff Houses's fault!
review_title: We had been to the Cliff House

review: We were excited to have a window seat below at Sutro's.  In  a very short amount of time we were "cooking" from the sun. Blinds for the windows came down at our request.  The blinds need to be updated. The blinds cast strips of light onto the table as well as some of our table companion's faces.  It really didn't solve the problem.  Some of us had to wear sunglasses throughout the meal.  As a replacement transparent soft shades or the like would be a nice addition.  Sun would be diffused, but the fantastic view saved.
review_title: We were excited to have a

review: Fabulous location, food and service.  We took clients there and were thoroughly impressed.  If I ever get back to SF...I will definately go back.

We arrived in San Fransisco early so after wasting some time at the antique arcade, we headed to the restaurant. Promptly seated and given water + bread. When ordering, our waiter Juan was very helpful and informed us of smallish details regarding the food, like the tortellini contained veal.  Everyone in our party got the crab cakes which were awesome. We all got a canoli as well. Overall, wait staff was helpful, attentive and welcoming. The view was great and the food was tasty.
A good restaurant in the very busy Fisherman's Wharf - great evening views and good meal.

We had a delicious dinner looking out over the harbor in San Francisco. My combination seafood salad was fresh and tasty; my friend's poached sole was also very good. We shared a bottle of reasonably priced sauvignon blanc and a rum-soaked sponge cake for dessert. All in all, a very pleasant experience. Our server was prompt and pleasant. A fun experience for first-time San Francisco visitors.
On a clear night, we had wonderful views of the Bay.  A nice find for out-of-town guests and romantic evening.

I was hoping for a fantastic dinner but just got ok. I do not mind paying for a great meal but this was over priced for the quality we received. Great view of the wharf and a fairly nice setting. The prices were just too high for the quality we received. I would not go back.
Always love going to Alioto's during crab season when I'm in San Francisco. Fresh crab and great service. Love it.
Alioto's is a long standing restaurant right on the wharf that has maintained quality food and service.
review_title: Good food for a Tourist spot

review: The food was not good at all. I had the fish and chips that I had to send back. The fries were cold and the batter on the fish was soggy. My husband had a trio of fish that would have been fair priced if the portions would have been normal size and not so small. Food was not worth the price!!! After talking to some locals the also shared their discuss for this establishment.

Great dinner. The shrimps and calamari were so tasty and my husband loved his mussels. The view was beautiful. We went there Mothers Day evening so the restaurant was very busy but we will served in a timely mannner. We look forward to going back.
Alioto's is a classic restaurant that is pricey but performs. You get what you pay for and that is quality.

Gorgeous views, great food, we had Cioppino and it was one of the best we've ever had. There are negative reviews out there
And they are unwarranted for this gem. We highly recommend it. I told the General Manager Matt that we couldn't understand the poor reviews
And that we would give him 5 stars after a great experience. the service was outstanding too. Great choice by Fisherman's Whatf as there are not too many quality restaurant's there.
Great ambience and good food. Beautiful view of the Fisherman's Wharf. Highly recommend it to take people from out of town.
The dinner, the setting, the service were all spectacular. We watched the sun set behind a tall mast ship and the Golden Gate Bridge.

Our first dinner on our first trip to San Francisco was at Alioto's and it helped set the scene and pace for the week ahead...fabulous!!!! I highly recommend Alioto's and do make reservations. We had a window seat and it was fabulous! The food was exceptional!
review_title: Our first dinner on our first

review: This place was much more expensive than I was expecting. It had a wonderful view of san francisco and Fishermen's Wharf but expensive.
review_title: This place was much more expensive

review: Went there for a business lunch Sunday. A super professional host greeted me and a great waiter served me. Both were flexible as my guest was late. Food was good, place is nice with table cloths, great views, well dressed staff etc. I live in San Francisco and don't normally go to Fisherman's wharf, but I was positively surprised.
A San Francisco classic. View of Fisherman's grotto and the Golden Gate bridge in the distance (with no fog). Must have the trademark seafood chowder in a bread bowl.
I have enjoyed Alioto's for more than 25 years! Dinner is wonderful but I love having lunch here and taking in the gorgeous view's. Thank you for many, many years of great memories!
Very good classic at Fisherman's Wharf, enjoyed the food a lot.

We were seated at a messy table with items missing and had to ask for them several times. The food was fair, but at the price one could have had a significantly better meal elsewhere in town. At Alioto's you essentially pay for the location and the view. Only go here if you are willing to pay a high premium for that view at the expense of the food and the service.
review_title: Nice view - so-so food and service

review: Alioto's is one of San Francisco's special restaurants on Fisherman's Wharf. Its seafood is always fresh, its meals always succulunt, it service supurb and its ambiance great (especially if you can get a table overlooking the fishing boats). It is always a treat for me, a native of San Francisco, who now only visits the city occasionally. But I always will include Alioto's on my restaurant list when I am in the city!
review_title: Alioto's is one of San Francisco's

review: Food was great. However, the service was very poor. The waiter after taking our order did not return to check on us. It took over 40 minutes to get out dinner. The restaurant was not full, individuals who ordered just before us received their dinner quickly. This would not have been bad if the waiter would have stopped by to tell us there would be a wait.

Have always loved going to Scoma's when in SF and wanting Seafood. But did not want to have to wait to get in, and had always been curious about Alioto's. Curiousity over. Food was not that great, poor choices for kids. The clam chowder was good, my steamed crab was good, but everything else was mediocre at best. Waiter was nice, but not very helpful. Felt like a tourist trap rather than a neighborhood classic.

San Francisco is known for their crab and you won't be dissapointed! The food was amazing, ambience and view perfect, and even though the restaurant is very busy we felt like we had privacy and were able to enjoy the meal together.

We were at Alioto's 8 .
If you like seefood you will like it.
We were 2 persons .
We got a really good view of the Bay food
Was good.
But sometimes we felt like they were
So busy and they forgot about us .

Should have known better, with its location on the Wharf that this had tourist trap written all over it. Food was mediocre at best, was truly a well oiled machine to move people in and out quickly. Was most annoyed with what appeared to be the owners/family that runs this place. As we are leaving the restaurant their were about 5 people/employees sitting at the entrance, do you think a one of them could say thank you, have a nice evening...not a ONE! Completely rude. This was 50 minutes of my life I won't get back...I am so dissapointed we spent our money and time here. If you are visiting San Fran, I urge you to check out many of the GREAT restaurants off the Wharf tucked away in the communities -- we did find many great ones!

The experience at Alioto's is top-notch. The food is incredible, and the service is excellent. This restaurant has so much history, and it's truly a great experience to dine at a place owned and run by the same family for so many generations. My wife and I will always remember our experience there.

Consistently good, decent food. Nice views of water and fishing boats.
Our favorite restaurant at Fisherman's Wharf.

Although the food was good, it would be nicer if the restaurant would include a simple salad or cup of soup with the meal.
We also had to wait for 15 minutes despite the fact that we had made reservation a week in advance. Some guests, without making advanced reservation, got seated right away. We think they are the friends of the host. Anyway, I think the reservation does not really matter at Alioto's!

Past its best I'm afraid. Food was ordinary and overcooked. Some of it defied description or recognition. Despite having booked had quite a long wait for a table. The whole experience was less than satisfactory.
Alioto's is a good choice in the Fisherman's Wharf area for good food and good service at reasonable prices. The view of the Golden Gate Bridge isn't too bad either.

Overall, a great seafood restaurant.  Best tuna tartare I have had.  With those prices however, I would expect to not have to unwrap my own butter, bread should be warmed and served in a linen napkin -- not on paper, and with the number of waitstaff I would expect more attentive service.
The appetizers, entrees and sangria were the bomb!! and the service was excellent!!  I would definitely recommend this place and plan on coming back really soon!
review_title: The food and sangria was absolutely delicious!!

review: I have never gone wrong here and we have been going to this restaurant for twenty years.  It has gone through several transformations...from a casual wrap place to a "white table cloth place" from bread  to chips to NEITHER ! The Peruvian dishes are mouth-wateringly delicious.  One of my favorites stand-bys is the Toro salad with steak or chicken.  It is perfect.  The ceviche is outstanding.  Try the sampler.  I love Rocky, the lovely waiter with the warm smile, and the other people there too.  Everyone is warm and friendly and the food is delicious.  What more could you ask for?   Oh drinks, you say ? How about some of their delicious sangria?  And don't even get me going on the desserts...Oooooh they make delicious little cookies...
Fresca West Portal is my family's favorite birthday celebration dinner spot.

We received a warm welcome as we checked in, seated immediately. The staff was friendly and attentive. We ordered the
El Toro Steak Salad which was delicious along with Sauvignon Blanc. For dessert, the flourless chocolate cake was wonderful.
We always come back to Fresca because the food is consistent and deliciously prepared.

A friend recommended Fresca and we decided to give it a try. We had Ceviche de Coco, Ceviche Chino and Anticuchos (beef heart skewers). All 3 dishes were delicious. The ceviche dishes were fresh with just the right amount of acidity to complement the flavors. The beef heart skewers were also very tasty as long as you can forget what part of the body you are eating. Make sure you wash it all down with their Sangria, it definitely hit the spot.

Atmosphere is casual and the noise level is acceptable. The prices are middle of the road (not cheap and not expensive) basically right on par with other Peruvian restaurants Ive visited. Not a bad place for a date or a small group. Good neighborhood restaurant.
I would definitely recommend this restaurant for its freshness of its food and excellent presentation. The service is excellent.

The food was excellent, including the best quesadilla I've ever had. Sevice was polite, but slow, probably because the restaurant was under-staffed for the volume of patrons. We were there 1:30-2:45 PM on a Monday (holiday) and it was full the whole time. My only complaint is the noise level which made it difficult to have a conversation over lunch. Admittedly, I find 90% of restaurants too noisy.
Great food and fast service. There was no wait for a table and the aroma of the food was exquisite. I recommend coming here again for brunch and I also love their dinner menu.
very disappointed...no flavor in the food, very bland, boring...nothing compared to its sister restaurant on 24th...i won't be back

Excellent Ceviche selections, the Mixto and Mojito in particular. The seafood stew was terrific, but the halibut was dry.Overall, food was great, would definitely go back. Bring an appetite, though, as the portions are huge!

I have been to Fresca numerous times, and I will continue to dine there. The food is exceptional, and the service is very attentive.
It's a definite neighborhood gem, and I always enjoy bringing first-timers there.
review_title: I have been to Fresca numerous

review: Great place, the food is great. Staff is very friendly and kind.
review_title: Great place, the food is great.

review: Great flavors, but limited for vegetarians. Luckily our vegetarian is crazy about the quinoa-stuffed pepper
We really loved the food. Waiter's recommendation was delicious. Only drawback was the difficulty of having a conversation across the table because of the noise level.

We ate at UVA when it first opened and were impressed. Decided to take our out of town foodie guests last Saturday and it had improved!  Great wine list and the wait staff bent over backwards to make sure we had the right wine.  Our guests loved it, we loved it so a home run all round.
Lots of good cured meats and cheeses to mix and match.   Good wines too.

We have been several times, for brunch and dinner. Reliably great. We went early (5:30pm) with our one month old baby and it worked out great. The service is a little relaxed, so if you're in a rush you should tell them otherwise things happen slowly.

What a great find. Just when you thought you've tried them all, you find this place tucked away in Lower Haight.
