Fantastic tapa food, extensive wine list, great service, and fun-filled ambiance in a great neighborhood. The dinning room is bigger than what it looks outside, and it has a great bar as well. Worth checking out.
review_title: What a great find. Just when

review: Great Italian pastas and desserts. Cute small restaurant in the hip Haight area.

This was my first time to this restaurant. My friend said that she liked it and I was in the mood for Italian food. The atmosphere was welcoming and the wait staff was nice. I had beer and a pizza and the pizza was great! My friend liked her meal as well.
This was a nice dining experience.
Thank you!
review_title: This was my first time to

review: service is always an issue with us here; this time the waitress was quite nice but one of the servers was surly and ruined our overall impression (in the past, it's been the waitress); the food was quite good though.

The food was very tasty. The only thing that really bothered me was the lack of energy our server had. He just didn't seem like he wanted to be there and/or serving us. However, I'd still recommend this place.
review_title: The food was very tasty. The

review: the service was terrible - the waiter barely acknowledged our presence, even when taking our orders. the food was totally mediocre. i know it's hard to find decent, inexpensive restaurants in SF, but this one is overrated.
Had brunch here a few months ago and it was great. This time the service was slow and the food just ok,

Slow Club, they sure know how to entertain. Wonderful space (wonderful photos), servers and chefs. It was a pleasure to have the opportunity to thank the folks behind the stove for the magic they put together for us to savor. The food is prepared with love and kindness, to nourish both body and soul.
Thank you Slow Club!
I had the spinach salad with Yellowtail - but 3 hours later I was starving. I guess some bread would have helped (or a bigger piece of yellowtail).

Slow club has wonderful food, great service, but the room is SOOOO loud that you almost have to yell at each other to be heard. I left the place with a sore throat!

Not recommended for a romantic dinner..

Enjoyed my dinner last night and everything they ha to offer on the food side.
The bar menu was ambitious but in a unnessasary direction.
Delicious drinks, food, service. A bit too loud for our group of 8... I was only able to chat with the people on either side of me, but still a great vibe, easy parking, amazing bread pudding! ;)
Everything about the place is of good quality, but overall it's overpriced, especially the wine.
The flat bread was far too sweet. The halibut was overcooked and served on a sweet succotash. We pushed our food around the plates and left as soon as we could. Avoid at all costs.
review_title: The flat bread was far too

review: I have frequented Slow Club many times over the last 5 years. It is amazing how consistent they are in delivering a great menu with some of the best service in SF. If you are entertaining guests from out of town, and you want to give them an SF restaurant experience, Slow Club is a must!

Another great meal at Slow Club! We brought three guests, ordered varied items - flatbread, pork loin, fish - preceded by the very nice charcuterie plate. Wine list had many temptations at good price points.
My husband and I had a great first time experience. Will definitely become regulars.
review_title: My husband and I had a great

review: Hadn't eaten here since the mid-'90s. As good an all-around place as I remember it being then. Still also has distinctive ambiance that I recall.
Great food and service. The lighting was just a bit dark but still had great ambience.

I had a nice birthday dinner. We dined early so it was not too loud but by the time we left the place was busy. A menu that should please anyone. We had the pasta with mushrooms and really enjoyed it.
review_title: I had a nice birthday dinner.

review: It's a highly energetic place with very good food. Not much in the way of ambiance but the good prices and the professional service make up for that. We'll be going back.

The best burger in San Francisco (and possibly the world...) The rest of the menu is good too. Try their 'bicyclette' cocktail made with elderflower liqueur and a twist of orange - delicious. A great night out and easy to park nearby.
review_title: The best burger in San Francisco

review: The Slow Club has remained cool longer than most.... The food was good this last visit, but not as notable as probably a year or so ago. Good drinks; cute if not the friendliest barstaff. Great parking! Loud, so best for two people (even a convo of four was difficult!).
Absolutely great, FRESH, food!! We were pleasantly surprised with the quality of food. Service was wonderful and we will definitely return!
Food was wonderful. Service was very slow. Worth the wait if you have the time.
The food is excellent, I go there every time I come to San Francisco. Service is good and you get a great value for the price. The original on Columbus is the one I go to every time.
review_title: The food is excellent, I go

review: After reading on their website about their tradition I was very excited to go there. It was extremely disapointing. The restaurant is very small, was very dirty and poorly decorated, The food was not fresh and the emplyees did not speak enough english to make for a good enough conversation to change anything. Overall, absolutely disapointing !

We went to Asia SF for its special valentine day show at 9:15.   Wow what a disappointment.  The food was "Denny's quality".    They also hit you up for extra charges on you bill for service.   We were really looking forward to the drag show being that it was in San Francisco we thought it would be entertaining and high quality.   However, it was truly a "Drag".   Old worn out performers that lip synched some songs along with a skit.   They even bragged about having one of the 'original" SF performers that night.  Nothing to brag about.   High dollar drinks at $10 a pop are needed to ease the pain of poor food and poor entertainment.   San Francisco is a wonderful city with plenty of great restaurants and shows - no need to waste you time and money on this one!

The show was fine but I was disappointed in the food. My first course was the crab cake appetizer which had 4 tiny cakes - each the size of a Reese Peanut cup. It was so-so and nothing to write home about. My main entre was the lamb in orange sauce - the lamb bits were tough like in rubber-chicken swimming in a heavy orange sauce...not so good. The entree was accompanied by a small scoop of rice and some sliced cucumbers. My dessert was banana beignets - too sweet. I was hoping the reviews on the food being mediocre-at-best would be wrong but I'm afraid they were correct...sigh.
Good times had by all! The "entertainment" is great and even funny at times.
review_title: Good times had by all! The

review: We went to Asia SF to celebrate a birthday while in town visiting relatives. I had been told to go here but had no idea what to expect. What a great evening. Thanks to the fabulous ladies of Asia SF.
review_title: We went to Asia SF to celebrate

review: The food was pretty good (the dessert was very good) but definitely not great as it lacked distinctive tastes. The entertainment was all right; don't expect great dancing or singing (it's all lip sync). The bartenders/servers were great, and the drink I had--a mojito--was tasty. Noise level is high.

I didn't really know what to expect when I came here. All I saw were pictures of a vibrant restaurant that looked like a nightclub on the inside and women dancing on the countertops. Apparently those women were actually men and they are also your servers! When they dance on the countertops they are lipsynching to songs and performing a routine that was amazing. My server had the best routine with the song "I Need A Hero" as she had a storyline to go with the song. It was very energetic and fun. I highly recommend it especially for large groups of people celebrating an occassion.
Most fun I've ever had at a San Trancisco (oops) restaurant! The ladies are lovely and the food and drinks are great. Watch out for the tab - only doable for occasions!
review_title: Most fun I've ever had at

review:
The overall all good and services was great but make sure you are dressed for fine dinning or the hostist will give you the up and down dress code scan. I guess it didn't help both me and my wife were in jeans. 
Make sure you have 3 to 5 hours for dinner to fully enjoy. Almost everything we had was a little bit of a surprise or cook very different. 
If you are going to get the tasting menu, make sure you go hungry.
review_title: Tasting menu with wine pairing is great

review: Very quiet restaurant, disappointing as no licence for proper drinks, and therefore couldn't order a gin and tonic to start, nor a cognac to finish, formal dining room, lacking atmosphere, ok menu, but very small portions, service very good and attentive, overall not a patch on Gary Danko, and more expensive, in overall terms very disappointing, both in ambiance, and the very small portions, albeit what was served was nice, but at these prices, nice is simply not good enough

Acquerello is a great find. the food is exceptional! tasty, inventive with beautiful presentation. the sommelier recommended a great white chardonny from northern Italy to start and we found a lovely red from Howell mountain in Napa that went well with everything. The rissoto and gnocchi were wonderful as were all the other dishes. not a miss in the lot. service was very professional yet warm and informative without being intrusive. The owner is on the floor participating with the service which is probably why it is so excellent. all the little treats before, during and at the end of the meal were super.  Highly recommended!
review_title: Acquerello is a great find. the food is ...

review: The ambiance was poor . it was too sedate  the menu was very limited and truthfully I expected more options   the food quality was good but not that tasty. overall I was disappointed

Although the ambience, service and food preparation were all top notch, we left feeling we'd just eaten at a restaurant from the past. Every course including the "palate cleanser" presented before the main course was incredibly rich. Unfortunately our food did not arrive piping hot as would be expected. We sent our main course back after a couple bites of lukewarm veal and barely warm potatoes By the time the cheese course and desert arrived we were ready for alkaselzer. Pluses for all the extras - 3 chef surprises before the meal and a nice selection of sweets at the end as well as a little box of biscoti to take home. Great wine list - but $50 corkage was an unpleasant surprise. We would not return.

If you have no problem spending $700 for three people with only one bottle of wine then this may be the place for you. The food is very good but is no justification for the prices charged. The service is in a class of it's own but too pretentious for my taste.

If you just want to impress someone with how much money you can spend, make a reservation. Otherwise you can find much better values in San Francisco.
As good as ever. Looking forward to their new restaurant on Polk Street.
review_title: As good as ever. Looking forward

review: Not much to sY other than "fantastic" dining.....everything is exceptional, food, wine, service, atmosphere....even their flower arrangements are wonderful. The best SF dining!6

My wife and I ordered the "Seasonal Tasting Menu" with wine pairing. This menu consisted of 11 items, including the "chef's surprise for the evening." At first, we were wondering how we can handle all this food. We should not have worried about that. The servings for each course were so tiny that we could not actually taste the food. And, as amazing as it sound, that was the biggest problem. The only item in the menu that we both enjoyed was an Ocean Scallop Carpaccio and one of the deserts "dark chocolate crmeux with pistachio". The wine pairings were also mediocre, given the lofty price of $95 per person. Despite the small servings, we did go home filling full but completely disappointed with our dining experience.
An outstanding restaurant. Impeccable service, excellent food. Pricy, but well worth it. Management of this restaurant should be a model for others!

Acquerello is my favorite special occasion restaurant. The food and wine is wonderful, the service is exceptional, and the atmosphere is perfect. The restaurant is set up in a way that diners can converse with one another easily. Unlike many restaurants in the city, noise is not an issue at Acquerello. It is obvious that Acquerello is a labor of love for the owner and chef. Given the quality of the food and wine and the service, Acquerello is expensive but not unreasonably priced.

Great food. Atmosphere was a little "compressed" if you will. Maybe great for septuagenarians or groups. Not really a younger couple place. That said, food was great (although not amazing) and staff were extremely polite and professional.

Went there to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. Can't say enough about the food and service imppecable. Everyone should try it once in there life. Had the seasonal menu with the wine pairing each course better than the last. Just know going in it isn't cheap
Third visit. Never fails to impress. One of three restaurants in SF to rate my highest scores.

Spectacular dining experience with superb service! Loved my pear raviolo stuffed with a foie gras torchon while the red trout with pancetta jam was pretty special too. Wait staff is knowledgeable, personable and attentive without overdoing it. The amuse bouches and the treats at the end of the meal are a nice bonus. Good wine recommendations also. An expensive, but worth it, special occasion place.

I was blown away from the moment I stepped into the restaurant. The intimate dining area was a nice touch for a romantic evening out. The 93 page wine list is also something that sets it apart from other reataurants I have been to. The service, starting at the complimentary drinks and ending with the home made truffles was simply magnificent. The food definitely reflects attitude of the staff and the chef. Truly a one of a kind place I would without a doubt recommend.
review_title: I was blown away from the

review: Wonderful meal, had the tasting menu and it made me smile.
Service was very slow. Almost 3hours for 4 course meal
Outstanding in every way. This was one of the finest dining experiences I have ever had.
Disappointed in the service. Felt unwelcome being there with my 17 year old children. They are very well behaved, but the staff was not welcoming of them.
Absolutely fantastic Italian meal. Great, extensive wine list paired with culinary excellence. Take your wife here for her birthday.

Acquerello is consistently ranked as one of the best restaurants in San Francisco on opentable for a reason. They know how to treat their customers well and the food is amazing. The foie gras pasta stands out as one of the best plates that I've ever eaten (I've been here three times and get it every time). The wine list is great. I dream about the cheese cart for weeks after dining at Acquerello.

I chose Acquerello on the basis of its high rating with Zagat, and I would thoroughly agree with their assessment. This was one of the best meals I have had while on holiday in America. Delicious food, knowledgeable sommelier and slick service across their staff. Fresh colourful salad to start, a flavoursome sea bass and delectable chocolate ganache to finish; accompanied by a rose selected with the sommelier's assistance.

Superb experience, mean choices,food, wines, service.
Acquerello gets even better with time.

This was, without a doubt, one of the best dining experiences that I've ever had. The food was superb, the ambiance was perfect, and the level of service was second to none. So often my wife and I are disappointed when we go to a supposedly high end restaurant. Acquerello did not disappoint us. Acquerello and La Grenouille in New York still understand what it takes to be a "big time" restaurant. I strongly encourage anyone to experience it; it's worth the expense.
This was our fifth visit, and despite the fact that every meal has been perfect, each one also seems better than the last.

We were disappointed. We found the service a bit stuffy( Offered a black napkin because we were wearing black!! Holy Molely!) Wine steward describe our sparking rose as though he wished to impress us rather than serve us. The Bundino was excellent as was the pasta with Fois Gras, the duck was over brined I think - just a bit strange in texture. The wine was wonderful - I'm happy i researched the list in advance, because it is extensive and filled with wonderful wines at wonderful prices. We found the interior over wrought - the ceiling remains wonderful.

Dining room crew was great, particularly the wine director. The kitchen was shakey at times; one dish returned. Others were overly fussy. The meal was the best I've had in SF since a long ago meal at Masa.
Acquerello continues to shine, my group of six enjoyed the tasting menu very much. The waiters were very helpful without fawning. We'll save up and go back!

Acquerello is, in a word, perfect. Everything, from the first amouse bouche to the coffee, truffles, and biscotti at the end of the meal, was excellent and made more so by the attentive and attuned service. I highly recommend the guinea hen while it remains on the menu, and a seafood carpaccio with sea urchin roe was an unexpected delight. Acquerello handily deserves its Michelin star, and remains the standard for Italian elegant dining in Northern California. If you have the opportunity to dine there, don't miss your chance.

The service and food exceeded my expectations! We were a party of 4 and each of us had our own waiter. All dishes of each course the 4 course menu arrived perfectly. Wine was always refilled. I felt very spoiled from the upholstered stool for the ladies' purses to the the "amuse bouches" to the option of a black napkin. I selected Acquarello because of the noise level and atmosphere; I wanted to be able to have a conversation with my guests. It did not disappoint.

5 ladies chose Acquerello for a birthday celebration. 2 of us had been to Acquerello before. The food was fabulous beautifully presented and they brought the birthday lady a wonderful desert with candle which was requested via Open Table. One of the reasons we chose this restaurant was it was quiet enough to have conversations without shouting to be heard. The only difficulty was that it was dimly lit which added to the ambiance but made it hard to read the menu. We asked the waiter to review the signature dishes and highlights of the menu items from each course which helped.
Acquerello did everything right! A truly wonderful experience.

By far the best two meals I have had in the City in the past decade. Superb in all ways!

A++
review_title: By far the best two meals

review: Food was great. Service exceptional. Was recommended by a long-time friend who lives in the area, and it was a wonderful recommendation. Hope to return frequently.

Old school Italian restaurant in the best sense of the word. Reminded my wife and I of the fine dining experiences we've had in Rome. The food and the service were wonderful.
We'll be back.

I thought Acquerello was excellent in every regard. The food and service were excellent. It was not noisy. The decor was not especially attractive in my opinion, but that did not detract from what I found to be an exceptional dining experience. I would highly recommend it.

The most memorable dining experience we have ever had. We had the chef's choice menu with wine pairings. A great chance to try several different wines we have never had. Each course was special. Service unlike any I have ever had before.
Excellent high-end dining. Note it is prix-fixe only. The three-course (with one as desert) is a reasonable dinner for older diners.
Truly a dining experience. Giancarlo is a most gracious host and entire staff wonderful!
Best haut-Italian in S.F.  Better known in Europe and NY than in SF
Fine dining without being stuffy. The staff is knowledgeable and efficient - friendly without being obtrusive. The wine list could use a few less-expensive choices.

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review: Love the food and ambiance.  However, it is too LOUD in the restaurant to enjoy being with more than one other person, as group conversation is nearly impossible.  It's too bad because everything else about the restaurant is excellent!

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review: If you can't get into Slanted Door, why hassle and instead go here. The food is outstanding and the service matches the food. It is hard to get a reservation, but there is counter seating and a big communal table, so give it a chance. You won't regret it. Also the lunch menu is different and just as good, so sneak away and catch a superb lunch as well. We go at least once a month, would go more, but want to savior the time in between. Outstanding.......

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review:
OTD serves good Vietnamese (Americanized) food. Plenty of
variety.  Noise level is too loud.  A very conveninent place for
lunch.  Ambience isn't good enough for a quiet, relaxing dinner.

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review: This was our 5th time at Out the Door, and it may be the last. The food and staff are very nice and service is good. But the noise level is getting out of control. We were a party of four and I could barely hear the guys across the table from me, and I am not hard of hearing. High pitched voices seem to reverberate off the stark walls and floor. We arrived at 5:30 and the noise from the table to our right went louder than our table starting at 5:45, so we suffered through almost our entire time there.

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review: It was our anniversary...we were running late as the movie let out later than expected, and the hostess called to verify if she should hold our table. Truly unexpected, and made our evening experience that much better! The salmon was prepared just right. The staff were so pleasant. We had a wonderful time!

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review: Excellent! Food was fantastic. Good wine. Good people. Really nice space.

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review: The food here is as good as at The Slanted Door, and the location is wonderful. I have eaten here many times and everything I have ordered is delicious. My only complaint is the noise level when the restaurant is full - it would really benefit from having some acoustical work done to reduce the noise level.
review_title: The food here is as good as

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review: Second time at this place and it still rocks! Very nice ambiance without being pretentious. Just has a warm energy that's due to the open kitchen setup, and the people behind the food: from the host to the servers, to the manager. Will highly recommend to friends and family. The food is very good, nothing to shi-shi, but complex enough to tease the palette....:0 Definitely liked the wine selection, well thought out and open-minded enough to encourage to try on "new" things...Can't wait to go back...:)

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review: I tried a new dish with beef, ginger and lemon grass. The beef was delicious, but overall the dish was bland. Quite a surprise! Also, the place is just too noisy to have a decent conversation with your lunch companion.
review_title: I tried a new dish with beef,

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review: Food was great, wait staff was clearly wanting to get home on a Sunday night.

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review: Always an excellent meal and a great value. Love it.

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review: Love OTD! My favorite is the crab with cellophane noodles, and the green papaya salad to start. I think the menu is even better than the Slanted Door. Food is delicious, service has always been great. My one complaint is that at the Bush location the acoustics are terrible. It's super-loud even when it's not crowded so you really have to shout to have a conversation. The bar is better for this, because you can sit closer to your companions. SF Center location doesn't have this problem, so might be better for an intimate meal. Overall, not to be missed.
review_title: Love OTD! My favorite is the

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review: Excellent food and service. Menu is imaginative and changes just enough to keep it interesting.

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review: I love everything on the menu. It's a neighborhood gem. Tastes are original. Portion size is perfect (not too large.) Great menu for sharing selections. Service the best.
review_title: I love everything on the menu.

rest_name: OTD (aka Out the Door - Bush St.)
review: This is just a knock off of Slanted Door, a vastly over-rated restaurant that has evolved into a tourist trap after hardly changing its menu at all in the past 11 years. You get pretty much the same stuff here without having to travel to the Ferry Building. The food is good, but hardly exciting anymore.
review_title: This is just a knock off of

review: Ran out of iced tea. Really? My dish was too too spicy whereas my friends fish was too, too bland. Would not go back. Would not recommend. Sorry.

Outstanding Gourmet Thai food. Beautifully presented. Wonderful bar, great drinks. Pricy for Thai food, however, some of the best I've tasted. This place was busy on a Tuesday night. Service was very good, however it took ages to get my cocktail. Beer arrived quickly. From former reviews we ordered the starters.telling our waitress to come back later for the entrees, as the food can come out quickly.
I found the restaurant to be quite cold, granted it was about 45F outside, they still kept the door open! We ate wearing our jackets. Don't think this would be a problem if it wasn't so cold outside.

We had an 8:00 reservation. We were taken to our table promptly and given a menu. We ordered. Our appetizer came about 20 minutes later. Our other food did not arrive until we had been in the restaurant for one hour and 45 minutes. Water glasses were refilled but never any mention about why it was taking so long. Finally after an hour when we asked they said they had a big party in the back No apology, no complementary drink or anything.

Food was mostly flavorful and well presented except for the scallops with noodles. The squid ink noodles were very flavorful, but the scallops which were deep fried and served on top, were flavorless except for a slight soapy taste. This dish was initially brought out (with our other two entrees) 1 hr after ordering and was cold so we sent it back to be refired.

This was a busy night due to the Giants game and the last night of their Groupon deal so service was very slow. The waitress never came back to our table between the appetizer and dinner which was 30-40 minutes. Having been in the restaurant biz for 20 years, this is a big no no. Service is lacking, but in general, the food is good, however, on the expensive side for Thai.

Decent food, priced more than the average Thai restaurant, due to creative plating and flourishes. The sea bass curry was our favorite. The grilled pork was too gristly but came with a delicious green mango salad. Something about the dining room makes it noisy as all heck, so I would not suggest this place for a quiet dinner.
This restaurant, while good, is unexceptional. For the price, I would expect more ambiance adn more inventive dishes. The drinks are excellent, however.
Worse service I ever experienced but the food was tasty. Don't think I will be going back though.

Went there on a Monday for lunch, so was quiet and perfect for conversation. The food was great, staff was friendly and attentive. Not sure how it is for dinner, but will definitely consider going there for same based on our lunch experience.
review_title: Went there on a Monday for

review: Nice atmosphere and altho the food was very good, the entree could have been hotter. The staff was very friendly and I'll be back.

The presentation was excellent for this level of restaurant and the best part. The service was good also. The food itself, aside from presentation, did not wow but the portions were definitely good size for the dishes we ordered - we couldn't even finish all of our food.
Food and service is great that is why we recommend this restaurant to friends.

Consistently excellent food at reasonable prices. Good mix of meat and vegetarian dishes all well prepared. Great cocktails too! We dine there every few months and have always been more than satisfied with the experience.
Outstandingly conceived and expertly prepared food. A relaxed environment in which to enjoy great food. Thanks to Chris for his relaxed and informative service.

I had been to SPQR a couple months ago with my girlfriends and left with a too notch memory of mouthwatering foods (though we felt the host was rude and the server was unfriendly).  I thought it was the best Italian I had found in San Francisco (most comparable to my favorite places in NYC) - and raved about it to my friends.
I couldn't wait to bring my boyfriend for his birthday, but could not have been more let down. We ordered the special truffle, egg and ricotta ravioli dish that was bland (the first time I've had truffle anything that could be described as 'bland'") and not well balanced. We didn't even finish it and it was our least favorite of all. The rest of our meal was mediocre at best. I am not sure if we just ordered wrong or were there on an off night, but we will not be returning.
For mediocre food I felt it was also overpriced, 2 appetizers, 2 pasta primis, 1 dessert and an average bottle of wine came to $300; I have had much, much better meals in this range.  Though, the service this time was very friendly, helpful and attentive. Mostly I was just sad to have had such a bad experience on a special occasion, when SF has so many great dining options.
review_title: Overrated, overpriced, mediocre meal, off night?

review: Enjoyed a lunch a dinner visit to SPQR and both were awesome. The food is simply out of this world.  We visit a lot of restaurants around the world during our travels and this is one of our favorites now.  Emily, the hostess is a gem!
If in San Francisco this is a must!  The service was terrific; the food over the top!

I have heard nothing but good things about this restaurant. However, after trying it twice, the reality is that is just not all that. Fish was over salted. Appetizer's were bland. Overall, nothing had a wow factor, even the highest priced items on the menu didn't stand out in any way. They sat us side by side with another couple, (which is fine, its SF) but it was so close that we were actually in each others conversation. I don't think i'll be going back for dinner anytime soon.
My only complaint about SPQR is how difficult it is to get a reservation.  The food is imaginative and always remarkable.  Love it.

Been wanting to try this place for a while, but I gotta say - food wasn't as good as the price would have you believe. Certainly some interesting dishes on the menu, but lacks flavor in execution. Seems complex without the payoff. Wouldn't go back here again probably.

Although we had a table reservation, we prefer to sit at bars to eat, and so we did at SPQR. Bar lady was well-schooled in wines (we drink mostly California wines so we needed help through the Italian wine selection), and she knew the menu inside and out, and was able to give excellent descriptions of the dishes offered. One of us had the 5-course pasta tasting menu ... utterly wonderful ... and the other picked a couple of appetizers and a main from the regular menu. It all worked out just perfectly. Unctious mouthfuls all the way through. Like the way SPQR recommends a dessert wine to compliment each dessert.

After deciding we needed to have an Italian lunch while in San Fran, some online research listed SPQR as among the cities to restaurants. Superb food, with each course topping the previous. Chose the tasting menu of entrees and each flavor was superb. Suckling pig confit and chicken liver mousse to start. Squid ink chittara, guinea fowl ragu and blood sausage were all great choices with Italian Chianti! Tiramisu and espressos to finish. With kitchen open onto the dining area made for a great atmosphere. Thanks to Executive Chef Matthew for taking the time to talk at the end of service. Highly recommended.

Was there at SPQR for dinner on a Thursday night. As usual, the place was bustling and really energetic. We arrived promptly at 1800 hrs to have dinner before a movie at the nearby Sundance cinema. We made known to our server that we had plans after dinner. He did his utmost best to ensure that we had our meal in the quickest time possible. The food was great and so was the service. Wait staff were extremely attentive to our whims and fancies. Would recommend that the table share a couple of mains as they tend to run a little small.
review_title: Wonderful food and an amazing crew

review: An intimate and non pretentious dining space, SPQR turns out Italian classics with provoking and unique twists. Extensive wine list fit for enophiles. Pasta well crafted, however some heavier recipies appeared slightly dry past the first few bites. Portions are large enough to sample and share but not too much to be stuffed. Dessert options less plentiful and intriguing, but crafted excellently. Quality ingredients for all preparations.
Dishes had lots of flavors and uniquely made. Glad we tried it even though was expensive.
Outstanding food, the best ravioli, season food, .need reservation, the place is small which is part of the charm. expensive i will go for special occasions only.
Good food but terrible value. The portions are tiny and we left hungry, despite dropping $150 on the meal. Just not worth the price.
Try to avoid the kitchen counter seats...the draft makes it quite chilly. Food was good but perhaps my expectations were too high.
review_title: Try to avoid the kitchen counter

review: As is typical in Pacific Heights, the concept of personal space does not exist at SPQR. Even on a Monday night, the restaurant was full. However, we were seated right away even though we arrived early for our reservation and we enjoyed a lovely meal with excellent wine recommendations by our server. We'll definitely return to SPQR.
review_title: As is typical in Pacific Heights,

review:
This is a packed-out neighborhood spot in Pacific Heights that serves great modern Italian fare. It wasn't a perfect experience, but there were a number of wonderful dishes that make it stand out. We got the pork terrine and crab salad to start, then followed it up with two pasta dishes, one significantly better than the other.

The pork terrine was wonderful. Sitting below a long piece of buttered toast that complements the terrine's texture perfectly, it was balanced and simple. The crab salad was a bit of a mess visually - quinoa, tomatoes, crab, lots of wild sprigs of salad - but the elements made for a nice palate cleanser. The recommended pasta - pork belly linguini - was not a strong candidate but the sea urchin pasta was wonderfu

I moved back to San Francisco after a 5yr run in NYC. I have now ate at the top 10 best restaurants in the city and SPQR is by far my favorite. The food is amazing, the wine is delicious and I leave wanting more. I already have another reservation next month.
review_title: I moved back to San Francisco

review: Everything was amazing, from the food to the service and attitude of staff. Super interesting, thoughtful and excitingly atypical menu, served in a relaxed, upbeat and friendly space.

We went for our 4th wedding anniversary and it was a great experience. The food is incredible; inventive, fresh flavors, even on what I would call "standards" like kampachi crudo. Service was the right amount of friendly and never rushed, though there is no easy spot in which to wait for your table if you aren't going to stand outside. I'm completely un-knowledgeable about Italian wines and they are experts on their extensive list. Trust them and you won't be disappointed. I would definitely go again for another special occasion.

Food was fantastic. I had tempura salmon belly with trout & potato fritters, veal tongue pastrami, and sweet corn agnolotti. I would have given it 5 stars except I thought the chocolate coconut earl grey dessert was disappointing. The chocolate portion was too sweet and that overwhelmed the chocolate. The coconut foam was marvelous and the earl grey had the tea flavor one would want withiout being too vegetative as it often is with desserts. But, being an admitted chocolate snob, I can't hand out that last star! Service was friendly without being too familiar, prompt but not rushed. This is the type of place where you end up having conversations with the strangers at the next table because everyone is excited about the food.
Chef swings for the fences, but doesn't always hit homers.
Very different menu (in a great way) since our last visits to SPQR

Went to SPQR for brunch on Easter Sunday, and couldn't have had a more civilized and delightful experience. Staff was accomodating and sweet, food was more sophisticated than typical brunch fare and best of all, it wasn't a total circus. No holiday rifraff and only one perfectly behaved child in the place -- but not snooty at all (i.e. lighthearted soundtrack).
review_title: Went to SPQR for brunch on

review: The pasta tasting menu was outstanding. The service was great, and our server was especially helpful with her knowledge of Italian wines. She was spot on each time we told her what kind of wine we'd like with our food.

I returned to SPQR for the first time in over 1 year. Although the food was still good, 1) the portions were smaller and 2) prices were much higher. I therefore reluctantly do not recommend it anymore because it is not a good value for the price.
Amazing place for a special occasion. A little pricey, but worth every penny. Our meal was amazing and our server was super knowledgeable. Her wine recommendations were spot on.
excellent food and wine, pretty room. Tables are a bit too close to call it romantic.
Excellent food and service. Table for two far too close to the next table.

We have eaten at this restaurant twice and the food and service were outstanding on both occasions. The chef uses only the freshest market ingredients so the menu changes daily. The waiters are knowledgeable about ingredients and very helpful in navigating the list of mainly Italian wines. Best of all the prices are reasonable and the cuisine is very innovative (we had never tried blood pasta but it was outstanding with blood sausage.) Don't miss the Tiramisu and make sure to reserve in advance - this place fills up quickly!
review_title: We have eaten at this restaurant

review: I would eat here everyday if I lived in San Francisco. Amazing!

The food is pretty good overall. My biggest complaint is based on an assumption I made about the structure of the first page of their wine menu. I figured those were the wines where they would be the most reasonably priced and the area all way to the right would be the listed price for a bottle, unfortunately my assumption was incorrect and it was the carafe price instead, so a $28 became a $50 bottle. My complaint but also my fault for not being thorough on evaluating the pricing.
review_title: Wine on First Page Not Bottle Price

review:
I'm sure that some people (like Michael Bauer) think that this is cats' meow. We found the portions too small. The dishes were needlessly complex. Too many ingredients all competing with each other. Since when did foam become a food group? To be sure there were wonderful entities on each dish, but not enough of each.
The wine list was way too big. Trying to find a bottle of wine was agonizing. I finally asked the waitress to pick something. She even had a difficult time.
It is unfortunate that the space is so small. This is not a place to go for quiet and intimacy. Lots of people brushing past you table constantly. We were across from the bar. Maybe not the best seat in the house.
I did enjoy the olive oil pound cake.

The food was great, but the service was the star. Our server was very attentive and helpful when we had questions. All of the waitstaff were willing to help if there was a question for our quite demanding 4-person dinner. The 80s music playing on the radio was pretty awesome as well. I would definitely go here again.
review_title: The food was great, but the

review: This was my second visit to SPQR and as with the first visit the second was quite memorable. The food, wine and service were great and the atmosphere was buzzing. This is a great place that everyone should try over and over again!
Outstanding! Food was sensational and Italian wines, recommended by staff, where excellent and paired perfectly with the food. Couldn't recommend more highly.
The best dish we had was the crostini with buratta, decadent! Also, the homemade Tagliateli with Uni was so fresh, it melted in your mouth.
review_title: The best dish we had was the

review: Service was excellent, and menu is very interesting. The food was mixed in terms of execution. For example the roasted carrot salad had well cooked carrots and still quite hard carrots and undercooked lentils, though the flavor was excellent. But the other appetizer we had was excellent. The noise level is particularly high and the tables are spaced very tightly. It was so loud that my husband and I had a hard time having a conversation.

I was hoping for a more authentic Roman dining experience. The room was crowded and the ambiance suggested nothing befitting the name of this restaurant. I believe the new chef has put his own spin on the classic cuisine, and I don't recognize it. However, the pastas were amazing. The chicken liver appetizer with jam was memorable, as were the beef cheek pyramids. The main course of sweetbreads with suckling pig was delicious, but for $33 we were left wanting more.
And for dessert, the Tiramisu gives our favorite at Della Stelle some stiff competition.
review_title: I was hoping for a more authentic

review: This was the third time we've been. First meal was outstanding, second mediocre (even though we ordered almost exactly the same thing). This was the tiebreaker, and sorry to say it did not hold up. We were seated 25 minutes after our reservation- no apology, glass of wine or anything. The food was good but not great at prices that really add up. Nice looking crowd, decent vibe but if you're in it for the food, i can think of at least 10 places where you're better off spending the money.
review_title: This was the third time we've

review: Not to be missed, SPQR was one of the best meals we have had, probably ever. Every single thing we ate was superb. Marvelous flavor combinations and ingenious pairings. The service was excellent and we only wished we had time to go again during our short visit in the Bay Area. Thank you for such a wonderful evening.
review_title: Not to be missed, SPQR was

review: Food is top notch with the new chef. He has a unique talent finishing pllates akip the entree... Focus on the amazing pasta. It's the only places that competes with Quince in that territory!
review_title: Food is top notch with the

review: The overall experience was great! Food was interesting and fabulous; amazingly executed. Great little place and amazing service. Servers were extremely knowledgeable about both food and wine, and extremely proud of what they served/recommended.
We love this restaurant. The food is creative, delicious and not too expensive. Service is casual but attentive. The wine list extensive.

I go to SPQR regularly and love the food, but we ordered some things this time that just didn't work for me. The pigs ears are just crunchy oil and the toppings on the Burrata didn't work as a combo for me - too much going on with the flavors. Was disappointed htat the grilled/melted pecorino w/quince wasn't on the lunch menu. Otherwise, I love the place and especially the interesting wine selections and the salads and pastas.
review_title: I go to SPQR regularly and

review: SPQR is great. The food is robust, refined and hearty and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The ambiance is noisy, energetic and lively. You may not want to go to there celebrate your anniversary, but go for a great night out. The tables are so close together that both times I've been there, I've gotten into a conversation with the twosome next to us. You can't help it. It is just that kind of place.
review_title: SPQR is great. The food is

review: Service, wine, and flavor of food---top notch very overpriced, and VERY small portions

I loved SPQR before and was worried when I heard they got a new chef. I shouldn't have been worried, if anything the food was even better then before and now that they take reservations it is not a hassle to eat there. The wine list is spectacular and it seems like most of them are available by the glass.
review_title: I loved SPQR before and was

review: Why would anyone do that?  I had a reservation, there were plenty of tables... why?   Then to put at a table where the lighting was bad made reading the menu difficult for our 50 and over guest.  The maitre d was clueless and that's not the experience I was expecting.
review_title: You want us at the table by the kitchen?

review:
Well, the quality of the food could have been better considering we paid $50 per person for the dinner excluding wine. Moreover, the seating was really uncomfortable as there was just not enough space to stretch legs and quite crowded as well for two people to sit by one side. Though the noise and the ambiance is quite nice, I'd say the seats really made a bad case for the restaurant.

One good thing is that the service is indeed very good. The waiters are very helpful and attentive, and make informative and thoughtful recommendations for us.
review_title: Decent but not necessarily worth the price paid

review: Delicious escargots; wish we has had the bread earlier so we could dip in sauce.  Special of day petralle sole was well prepared, not over cooked.  Flat iron steak was cooked just right, tho sauce over it was rather vinegary.  Desserts: crime brle and lemon tart outstanding.
review_title: Delicious escargots; wish we has had the...

review: Nested inside a small alley, the location is convenient, but hard to find. The foods are very good, escargots with puff pastry tops are excellent, so is the pate sampler. The rotisserie chickens very good as well. The service is very nice. Definitely recommended!
Cafe Claude never fails to give me "a bit of Paris" when I need it.

I've been wanting to come to this place forever because of the live music. At first, it looked very weird as we walked into the door with the band in the little corner besides the bar. But we were seated in the far end of the restaurant and still could've heard the band play clearly. I was very impressed.
The service was great, our server was very attentive and accommodating. The food was good but I was not super impressed by it. I had the duck confit. It's a little bit dry which is to my taste.
Food is typical bistro faire. Pretty average all around...not bad at all, just not stellar. Very noisy inside. Jazz trio was great!

Perfect for a 6pm early dinner, quiet not empty, just right for a personal business get together. Service was friendly, efficient, gracious - just the right amount of added info without any hard up-sell. Other staff were equally professional. Food was outstanding cafe fare (for those who know the difference between cafe, bistro and restaurant). Civil, well-behaved guests at adjacent tables, even a few small families with properly behaved children. Just the right amount of festive atmosphere for a between Christmas and New Year table. By the time we left around 8pm it became more "energetic" in a happy way but not deafening. When the live trio started, the ambiance turned more mellow and a bit quieter, nicer than during recorded music.

We visit San Francisco probably three to four times a year and always head to Cafe Claude for either lunch and/or dinner. Having just returned from spending Thanksgiving this past week, we wound up having lunch at Cafe Claude and then returned the next night for dinner! LOVE the cuisine, delicious wines and always terrific service with personable waiters and waitresses. If you are staying in Union Square, it's an easy walk from any hotel in the area!

What a fantastic trip to Paris, without leaving the Bay Area! The duck liver patte was smooth, flavorful and delicious; the onion soup was bursting with flavor, perfect temperature, and perfect! The creme brulee was the best ever!!!!

Had a late lunch here on a Friday afternoon. The service was PHENOMENAL. Had the pea soup with mint oil - YUM! Very impressed. Salad nicoise was perfect for a late lunch. Great wine list. Will definitely be back.

Even the hostess! How often do you ever feel completely welcomed by everyone? Even the hostess. And the food was good. We'll be coming back to try the Coq au vin, the people next to us ordered it and it smelled so good. Our server Marina was very helpful and attentive, but gave us plenty of space. The live jazz inside was enjoyable on the outside patio.

We returned to Cafe Claude because they offered their pan bagnat sandwich as a special on Tuesday. We had this sandwich a year ago and it was fantastic. It's a great tuna sandwich with capers, olives, sliced hard boiled egg and served on a French roll. I was a bit disappointed to find they changed the recipe. The sandwich was served on a round roll, like a hamburger bun and the tuna salad was not made the same way. Just rather disappointing. However, the frites and the little gem salad were outstanding.

Great food and service. They were able to accomidate a late change in the reservation. Claude Lane is a funky alley and I don't think I would enjoy eating at the outside tables which are in the alley.

This was our second time to Cafe Claude near Union Square. As before the food was well prepared and presented. The wait staff was very knowledgeable on the food and wine choices. The atmosphere was lively. I did miss the reduced presence of the "French" atmosphere since our last visit. Our food was served by a fellow who seemed to be the only "French Guy" in the place. The portions were substantial.

Great service. Ambiance enjoyable. Great food serving portions perfect. Really enjoyed the fresh produce especially the brussel sprouts. I had a couple join us and it was the first time and everyone said we have to come back to try other items on the menu.

We had a foodie vacation in SF, and Cafe Claude came highly recommended by friends, for which we are glad. It was one of the highlights, even in the face of visits to Yank Sing, Kokkari, and the Zuni. My wife had the gnocchi, I had the cassoulet, plus various extras. Very tasty, with great wine accompaniments. What made it special, what made it seem as if we were back in Paris, was the music -- Trio Garufa, playing Argentinian jazz and lots of tango. It's hidden in an alley between Union Sq and the financial district.
review_title: Jazzy visit to Paris in SF alley

review: I love Cafe Claude and have gone there many times to have a late "wine lunch" with friends. This most recent time our service was rather spotty, but that is unusual. The food is great and the ambiance sublime
review_title: I love Cafe Claude and have

review: Had a wonderful evening with fabulous food, wonderful ambiance, and great service!

The live music at 7:45 was ridiculously loud, and made the indoor ining experience a most unpleasant one. The waitress herself was challenged to speak loud enough to tell us the day's specials. Twice we requested it be toned down. At that hour it should be background music, which can then kick into high gear around nine-ish.
The food however was divine, and the service exceptional.

Made a last minute reservation for a colleague's farewell lunch. Experienced some snafus online while trying to do so but we decided just to go ahead to the restaurant. The hostess was more than gracious in getting us a table despite the fact we showed up early. Food was really great and the service was too. Thank you! Can't wait to go back!
Server was excellent. We waited way too long for our meal. Music billed as jazz, but was not; it was horrible. Noise level was way too loud. Would not return or recommend to anyone.

We made repeated attempts to dine here but were unable to because a reservation is a must before 9:00pm. I would say our expectations were quite high and that the experience fell a little short. Everything was good, but definitely not exceptional by any means. Additionally, using the open table reservation system did not benefit us in the least, we still ended up waiting over a half an hour for a table while watching groups with later reservations being seated before us. With so many restaurant opportunities in SF, we will add Cafe Claude to the 'Been there, Done that' list and move on.

Great place for lunch while shopping near Union Square or even for a business lunch. Love sitting outside as it does have the feel of  Paris cafe. Good food and a good variety. Love the wines. I also like it for a glass of wine and appetizer before a show or right after work.  Know they have music many times but not taken advantage of that yet.
review_title: Good Off Union Square Lunch Spot

review: Any time we are in San Fran we eat here - sometimes multiple visits in one weekend :-) Everything on the menu is good, I can't pick one thing to mention!
review_title: Any time we are in San Fran

review: The frise aux lardons was excellent but the saumon entree was just ok. My girlfriend's pork chop entree was ok as well but not great. Taste our friend's pommes frites and they were very good.
The service, both bar and restaurant, was exceptional.  Loved it.

I was hoping for more old world European charm, but instead found dated modern decor, a cocktail list that lacked imagination or attention to detail, live music best suited for an elevator ride, curt humorless service, and overcooked meat. The best part of my dining experience was my company.
review_title: I was hoping for more old

review: Outstanding experience. Incredible food, great service and wonderful staff. Restaurant manager, Cinzia, is fantastic.

Luckily we ate early (6pm reservations). Business was good and the place filled up in a short time with people waiting. When the live music started, it added to the noise level which was a bomb!! So we enjoyed our meal in the quiet (early) until we couldn't stand it any longer. The dimness of the restaurant was a bit annoying because one could not see the food on the plate. It all looked the same, dark. A bit more lighting would not harm the atmosphere/ambiance of this casual bistro. I would return to eat, only if I feel up to the noise level.

Chic surrounding. Somewhat crowded, the sitting is very close. It was quite noisy and not because of the jazz band. I had to yell at times to the people dining with me. I had the escargot petit plats--it was excellent! I had as a main dish the coq au vin. It was good, very tender. It tasted more like turkey than chicken--interesting. Overall it was a nice experience.
Went for a work lunch so found it a little uncomfortable that we were sitting within inches of the neighbor's table. May have been more open inside?
review_title: Went for a work lunch so found

review: Charming spot with a great menu and service. Nicely "tucked away" feel. Had that European Bistro feel. Great crowd of patrons, good bar with some great different choices from the usual fair...French vodka's, etc. Knowledgeable waiters.

Overall, we had a good dinner, but service was rushed. This was due, in part, to the fact that our waiter put in the order for our main dishes at the same time as our salad. He was very apologetic but we thought it would be okay. About 15 minutes after we sat down all our food arrived. We would have liked a slower pace.
We really liked the beet salad, which was generous enough to share. My half chicken entree was quite good, moist and served with kale. The pork medaillons with apple seemed a bit too sweet--kind of like eating pork with tarte tatin. The chocolate mousse we shared was unremarkable. Wines by the glass seemed reasonably priced.
review_title: Overall, we had a good dinner,

review: Very pleased as always. I consider this a ~4 star place, but a few little extras at the time of my last visit make me bump up to 5. Came ~30 min early for our reservation on a busy night, were seated in 10 min. My date and I got a comfy "booth," you could hear the music and see the band, but it was not loud. The service was very friendly and the duck breast special was delicious. As a possible negative - the bar was full of people dining, no way to get a drink before dinner.

It's worth the trip to San Francisco just to eat here! Everything is wonderful - super fresh and artfully prepared without being pretentious. My favorites include - Beaterave (beet) salad, Pan Poulet (elevates chicken to a whole new level), and Porc au Miel. Both the chocolate deserts are incredible as well.
review_title: It's worth the trip to San

review: My mom and i always come to Cafe Claude when we have our seasonal shopping sprees in San Francisco. I always drive past the cafe on my way home from work and it was always packed, so i thought why not give it a try. The server we had the other day, Joshua, was attentive, polite and had a great sense of humor..not your typical "uppity" San Fran waiter. He also was able to give great reccomendations. We have never had a bad experience there. The Steak Tartar and the half chicken are to die for..along with the Onion Soup. My mom always gets the steak and frites. The environement is quiet, serene and relaxing. We always talk about trying another establishment for our lunches, but we always wind up back at Cafe Claude, and probably always will!
review_title: My mom and i always come to

review: We had a perfect evening at Cafe Claude, located down an alley near Union Square in San Francisco! Food was excellent, great wait staff, fun and unique ambiance in this French cafe. And the jazz trio was a perfect complement and not too loud, though Cafe Aude is definitely energetic! Can't wait to return!
review_title: We had a perfect evening at

review: Small but interesting menu. Everything cooked and spiced to perfection. Steak, coq au vin and trout. Wine list was small, but a wide range of options from light to full bodied and all very good selections. Highly recommend.

Our waiter was attentive but not overbearing--he was very good. I appreciate the fact that he asked me if i wanted to sample a certain wine before ordering a glass--which i did!

Also, the staff at the front desk was very pleasant and accomodating.

Good place for lunch as the food is good and reasonably priced. I've eaten here on several occasions--the lasagna is delicious as well as the quiche. Will definitely return if i'm in the area.
Alex took very good care of us. We always make Cafe Claude a stop on our visits to San Francisco.
review_title: Alex took very good care of

review:
the location is very nice and unique in a large city like San Francisco.
inside, the noise from near tables was too close, we had to raise our voice to talk.

Been here many, many times and always have a good experience. At a business lunch recently, I didn't pay much attention to the menu, and thus ordered the "chicken sandwich". It's not bad, but it's not very good either. It's just plain, uh, plain...boring, dull, unexciting...my $0.02 -- it should be taken off the menu. Ok, maybe that's a little harsh. But I won't order it again nor would I recommend it. Other than that, Cafe Claude is a wonderful restaurant.
Our waiter was all smiles - looked like he enjoyed his job - host and servers looked happy - we got each a free glass of champagne for the New year - that was a nice treat!
Great service, lovely atmosphere and really good food.

Our first dinner at Cafe Claude was super - the moules. But last night, the coq au vin was lackluster and the sauce too much of a reduction, the beets lacked beet flavor, and we were underwhelmed by the food while the amped music overwhelmed us and we left in a hurry.
review_title: Our first dinner at Cafe Claude

review: How we've missed this place in all the trips to SF, I don't know. Wonderful food with flavors one just doesn't get at all the other so-called French Restaurants. We walked the 5 blocks from our hotel and back. I had the flat iron steak which comes with beans and wonderful au-gratin potatoes. No need for a salad unless you must. We shared some foie-gras. My wife had a small plate of pasta and various mushrooms in a veal reduction sauce. Heaven. Split a creme brulle'. Great service, jazz singer, no faults at all.

Great ambience; felt like we could have been in a French bistro in Paris, really. Our server was knowledgeable and friendly and down-to-earth real. Refreshing. One special was not as good as promoted. I would try traditional menu items first. The music was wonderful; added so much to the scene.
Absolutely the best experience. Friendly staff AND patrons, superb food. For our one and only night dining experience in San Fran. it was anight we won't forget!

lobster bisque was great but the pasta special with ahi tuna didn't have much tuna so it was a bit of a disappointment. There was a lot of pasta and just a few vegetables in the dish. But I supposed you can't expect much for $14. I would have been willing to pay more to get a more generous helping of tuna.
The food and service were excellent. The atmosphere is very European. I had lunch with two other friends and everyone enjoyed the experience.
very good ... nicely placed in a small alley and makes you think of Paris
This place is great. Cozy, romantic, and non-pretentious, with great food, drinks, and music. One of my favorite San Francisco restaurants!!

I must admit that I was disappointed. It was much better before.
Maybe I am harsh because I am French.

Anyways, First it's a French restaurant but nobody speaks French anymore. The new management is Italian. It's kinda funny to hear them pronounce French words from their menu the wrong way.

The food was good, not exceptional but good. It wasn't typically French though. Service was good and fast. It's not too expensive compared to huge majority of restaurants that charge a lot for crappy "french" food.

It's a good restaurant but don't go there if you are really into French food or a real French experience.
review_title: I must admit that I was disappointe

review: The food was decent. I would return. The service, however, can improve. Although I had a reservation, I stood around and had to find someone myself to help me get my table. Our waitress, however, was quite pleasant. The atmosphere is cozy, but for some it might be tight. Not a place to go to if you want to have a somewhat private conversation, but a good place to go if you want to have a good social gathering.
review_title: The food was decent. I would

review: Had a great experience, if you're French (or like FR food), you will like the food, it looks and tasts the same. Lots of great little dishes! Will, definitively, be back. The music is also a+.

I had to increase the reservation from 4 to 6 and it became a very difficult negotiation.  There were tables available when I arrived that were not covered by reservations...so this should not have become such a huge issue.
review_title: I had to increase the reservation

review: Cafe Claude is the kind of hidden find you just want to love. Romantic, fun, very good food. But be forewarned. I've had excellent meals there but just last week one of the worst experiences in SFO dining. 6:30 Saturday night reservations and the food arrived at 8. Chipped water glass. The kitchen was way off on this night. Very disappointing in that they usually do so well. However, to his credit, the manager realized the situation and adjusted the bill accordingly. The sign of real professionals who want to make sure that you come back. I expect a lot out of San Francisco dining; had this happened at another restaurant, I would not be back. But when you love a certain place, you're willing to forgive the inevitable bad night.
review_title: Cafe Claude is the kind of

review: The outdoor table was quiet, not too sunny or too cold, not crowded for lunch, and the service was great!  I'd have to eat there more to say whether the food was really over the top - that's a high standard in SF.  But everything was really, really good.

We keep going back to MoMo's. We had out-of-town family in town and thought it would be fun to take them to China Basin and show them ATT Park.  We were not disappointed.  Great prix fixe menu  in addition to the regular menu. Amazing lava cake and ceviche and bloody marts.  Great place for a group of mixed ages.
We have been here before but had to come back. The brunch is delicious.

Changed our reservation to 45 minutes earlier because the baseball game ended earlier.  Hostess who answered was very nice and friendly.  She was e same person who seated us.  Very good person to have on the front line. The waiters and busboys were also friendly and courteous.  Will definitely come back!  Food was good too!
review_title: Changed our reservation to 45 minutes ea...

review: I've had a number of very good lunch and dinners here.  This one was somewhat disappointing.   The seafood was over cooked and the veggies were slightly salty.  It wasn't a game night, but there were a number of large parties and this may have impacted the kitchen.  It certainly backed up the bar.   Given its location, this place should hum even when busy.
review_title: I've had a number of very good lunch and...

review:
Having gone by Momo's hundreds of times, I finally decided to go on Sunday afternoon with my family. The 49ers were on and we decided to have the Sunday brunch. The food was no better than cafeteria style. We also had a flighty waiter who got us our drinks, then we didn't see him for a half hr.

With all the fabulous places to eat in SF, I'm surprised that Momo's is still in business if this is what they present to customers. I won't be back.

They did not show my reservation even though they sent me a confirmation that worries me a little about booking on line

My guests had a great time
The waiter appeared that we were an inconvenience for his time to be on schedule being the server to that section!

Went on New Year's Eve and really enjoyed the experience. We were looking for a nice place that wouldn't break the bank with a prix-fixe menu and found it here at Momo's. I ordered the shrimp and polenta dish and thought it was outstanding. Portions were awesome! I got about 6-7 large prawns in my dish--plenty to keep me full for a long night of dancing! The decor was also nicer than expected based off of Yelp! reviews. Overall, very very pleased with the experience and would definitely come back!
review_title: Went on New Year's Eve and

review: Been to MoMo's several times.  Usually very good, although we were a little disappointed this time.  looks like the menu had some changes since our last visit.

Momo's was the perfect spot for my very special business lunch. The tables are far enough apart that we were comfortable speaking about any topic, the service was attentive adn prompt, adn the food was incredible. Very nice room.

This was my 2nd time at Momo's, and I have to say I was a little disappointed. The food was okay, but not as good as my 1st visit; and I practically had the same thing. The steak skewers were way too salty. There were 4 of us and we originally ordered 2 servings. When we mentioned to the waitress the steak was overly salty, they offered to replace them; well they only brought 1 serving back which only serves 3; there were 4 of us!
1 menber in our party ordered a cocktail (Gingy I think) and did not care for it. The waitress politely replaced it wtih a Strawberry Fields which I had ordered. It came back a light lemony yellow color and was different than mine. The waitress just said, "oh,
it's just not as pink as hers."

Disappointing
The service was outstanding! Food was very good, less expensive than i though.

The food is actually quite good and nicely portioned. My table enjoyed the steak squeezers and calamari as starters and we had a wedge salad, hamburger, pork chop and chicken for mains. All very tasty and well prepared. Service was ok, and my one complaint was that the delivery of food required us to rearrange the table every time, and the server never helped. The bus service was aggressive trying to take plates before they were completed as well.
Enjoyed the Mahi Mahi. My guest really liked the Crab cioppino. Service was very good. Prices were on the high side.

MoMo's exceeded my expectations. I've been here 2 times before when it first opened and it seemed to have gotten better? The portions were excellent for the price. I had the crab louis salad (dungeoness crab in season) and it was perfect. The mussel appetizer was Super Good. The Pot Pie and carrot cake were light, but satisfying. The apple tartitan was perfect!

Momo's makes the best Bloody Mary. Very spicy. The Cesar Salad was ridiculously huge for a starter and it was a bit underdressed. My NY Steak was great, cooked exactly as I ordered it.
I valet parked and paid $13 to the valet when he took the car. After dinner the valet was gone for the night and we had to walk to the car. So much for valet service.
I do like Momo's so yes I will go back.

Menu is uninspired. Very basic choices. Ceaser salad chopped Romain with decent, but basic dressing. Good , but not great. Pork Sliders excellent. Shredded pork, cabbage on a buttermilk like biscuit. Differnet, but delicious. Sea Bass special also very good. Service was friendly, but not as attentive as it could have been. A good place to come before a game, but wouldn't come here for a dinning experience.
Great place to eat before a Giants ballgame. Better than average food, good wine list, full bar, lots of beer on tap.
Thoroughly enjoyed. Will go back and have already recommended!

The atmosphere is outstanding, especially at Christmas since they decorate the restaurant so beautifully. The food was outstanding and the wine selection was perfect. I would highly recommend it! One thing.....the menu is small and could include more choices.
Great server...good food and we made first pitch. What else do you ask for at MoMo;s on game day?

Momo's was perfect! As was OpenTable.com. Our reservation was correct and our table was ready when we arrived. As we were going to the giantsgame afterwars, there were a lot of pre-game diners, but the service was prompt and the waiter was very attntitve of our timing. The food was perfect for lunch, and i would imagine ewually as good for dinner. The bar and patio were both crowded and looked like everyone was enjoying themselves.

Food and service was excellent. We went for an early dinner after an afternoon Giants' game. The dining room was practically empty (probably due to the early time of day), however, the bar and outside patio was packed with drinkers who were very loud. They also would walk through the dining room to use the restroom, which was OK except some were a little loud.

The hostess promptly seated us and the waiter was very helpful with the specials of the day. The pace of the food was also good in that we were able to finish a plate before the next plate arrived. The waiter's recommendations for dessert (the apple tarte!) were also spot on and delicious! My wife and I had a great romantic dinner!
Lots of good food choices. Great place to go before the ball game.  Love the valet parking!

I would be interested to see what it would be like when it isn't a game night too.  Our waitress was good but not great, although as a former (long ago!) server myself, my standards are high.  I did leave her a fat tip though because it was crazy busy.

~Monica
review_title: I would be interested to see

review:
I've eaten in Bisous before and had a fantastic meal. I love the restaurant, the service is always good and attentive, but this last time the food was... off.

I had the Duck Confit, which I have had here before and loved. This time it was overcooked, as were the potatoes that come with it. One of my friends had the Halibut, the food was fantastic but the portion was beyond ridiculous, it looked like maybe half of the portion had been left behind in the kitchen (tail end of the fish, two inch squares - not even cubes).  Another person had the veal, this was a huge portion and was apparently very tasty.

Food service was a bit slow but we were a big group and not in a hurry.

Just an off night, I'd go back there again and i do recommend it...
review_title: Disappointed, have had outstanding meals here...

review: Love this place.  Yes, the noise can be really loud, especially in the weekends, and if you get seated upstairs.   But the food is always great, the service very warm and price is always reasonable.
review_title: One of my fav french bistros

review: Good presentation and service,cheff was helpful and shared his experience, wine selection was good and most important, the food was really good.
Friends and I had another wonderful meal. And the waiter/owner is so pleasant. We love this place.
Except for my hot food being served on an ice cold plate, the meal was very good. Service was professional and right on.
review_title: Except for my hot food being

review:
We love this place. The food is fantastic and the service is excellent. More often than not we are greeted by the owner himself, and always received warmly.

Recently my fiance and I toured Paris. We were somewhat surprised that the steak tartare at Le 114 Faubourg left us wishing we were here...and this happened at more than one venue!

As long as we aim for the earlier part of the evening, we generally can get a table same-day...but don't be fooled, the venue is a Castro favorite and gets jumping by mid-evening, so don't plan on hushed conversation.

Bisou is one of our favorites and remains a "go-to" spot. Whenever we are feeling lively and want some excellent food, we head here straight away. You should too.

See you there!

A small space, with tables close set, and ultra modern hard surfaces create an "energetic" noise level. Difficult for 4 diners to chat at normal voice range, since others were talking very loudly to be heard. The service is attentive. The food well represented a French bistro, was well prepared, and delicious. A great addition to the Castro area.
Very friendly staff. Convenient to Castro Theater.

The menu was so great it was hard to pick! I will definitely be going back to try more dishes if I can stop myself from reordering what I got the first time. Cocktails were also really good! Our waiter Pierre was very helpful and had great suggestions. I've already recommended to friends.
review_title: The menu was so great it was

review: Consistently good. From service to plate, I will come again to expect something well prepared and served with a cute french accent.

Good service. Excellent food. Loved everything that came out of the kitchen.
The filet was so very tender and full of flavor.
The chef/owner Nick is a genius! The bartender Gabriel makes the best cocktails! The food is of the highest quality and the staff is always friendly. This is my favorite restaurant in SF!!

When you enter Bisou, you will be greeted like an old friend coming for a family meal. Forget about the noise, the challenging parking situation, the very tight seating and lack of white tablecloths. If you're a real "foodie" - the food is the star at this restaurant!

Our group of four all agreed the escargo&mushroom and foie gras 5 spice appetizers.....were our zen moment. Wow!

Nick came by our table to welcome us and help us select and uncork our second bottle of wine. He is personable and loving with a true passion for food. The NY steak, duck leg confit and beef bourguignon were all winners.

We cannot wait to come back and try every thing on his menu.

Bisou has excellent french food, tasty tasty, fresh ingredients (try the hierloom tower) beautifully presented. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. They make it a fun experience. A great place find.

The Castro has few food options so maybe that's why people have embraced this place. The food is average; the interiors are awful (unless you like bad kitschy bar-type interiors); LOUD, bad house music; and LOUD people pretending to have a good time. I'd call it a bar with a full menu. I had a bland, beet salad followed by overdone and flavorless pork tenderloin. The portion sizes were fine. I took a pass on dessert. Service (by Joshua) was outstanding: friendly, attentive, knowledgeable, and responsive. Dine upstairs if you want to get away from the noisy crowd and bad music, but honestly, it was like being at any trendy bar on a Fri or Sat night. Maybe it was specifically designed for and caters to the Castro crowd?

Great french food at reasonable prices. Large portions and wonderful flavors. The staff, lead by Chef Nick, are charming. Just what the Castro badly needed - a good, well priced neighborhood restaurant.
Good food, not fantastic. Everyone was very friendly. Worth the visit, just don't know that I'd return.

Bisou has a very limited menu. They had about eight entrees and half dozen appetizer, salads. I appreciated that they had $5 side plates, so you needn't order a $8 or $9 salad to get your veggies. The Brussel Sprouts were quite good, sliced and sauteed - earthy! The food was quite tasty, but the service was scattered even though they were not crowded on the day after xmas.
review_title: Bisou has a very limited menu.

review: Bisou is a local place for us. The menu is interesting and there were lots of dishes I could have selected. We shared the foie gras and I had the fish while my partner had the steak. The portions were big but my fish was too salty and i had problems enjoying it. The meat was very salty too. great service
review_title: Bisou is a local place for

review: Perfect as usual. Great food, reasonable prices and impeccable service.

If you're a fan of Chef Nick's other restaurant ChouChou, then you'll like this place too.  Good, non pretentious french food.  If you've never tried escargot, I highly recommend being adventurous and giving it a shot.
Classic French restaurant in the Castro! Staff was very friendly and food was great.

Only thing I would criticize it that the food came out very Slowwwww   We ordered a salad and it took about 45 mins to come out. The french fries took awhile to come out also.  I thought the waitress forgot about it but she said she didnt.  hmmmmm  45 mins for a salad.  doesnt sound right but the food was good.
review_title: Only thing I would criticize it that the...
