review: B44 took me back to my wonderful travels of Spain.  The first positive impression occurred as I walked down the alley way which housed multiple choices of restaurants.  It reminded me of the alley ways in Spain and other areas in Europe.  The first plate of cheeses was a delicacy.  The plates were not too small and not too big for the happy hour price.  I will return to this restaurant as often as possible to bring back my memories of Spain and make new memories at this eatery.
Fabulous food. Will return many times. Took 2 friends who didn't want to go to the city but now can't wait to go back.
B44 paella was very good. We also recommend peppers stuffed with crab.

The service and ambiance was great!!! Unfortunately, I was not too impressed with the food.I guess I expected more. The prices were high for the quality and amount of food you received. My boyfriend and I LOVE Belden street so we will probably return and try a different restaurant the next time we return. I would suggest going for Happy Hour!
One of the best food from Spain in the bay area. It's like eating in Barcelona!
The food was great. It is clear that the owner is proud of his establishment. He visits each table to make sure that the diners are taken care of.
review_title: The food was great. It is

review: Fabulous experience - We have been to B44 several times (we are from out of town) and enjoyed it each time, but this best of all. After a slight delay in getting out initial drink orders, service was good. The food was interesting and well-prepared. We were particularly delighted to find a particular Spanish wine on the list that we see rarely and really love - it was a gem. We will be back.

The best! B44 is the best place in SF for people looking to land themselves in the heart of the city, have a great meal and a great time! Can't wait for more of the brisket tappa. And thanks to Gabriela for her warm smile and hospitality. :)
Yves ...the waiter...was a delight as was the food.

Tapas & dessert were super awesome -- entrees -- I will not entree recommend except the the Paellas & the Pork Loin -- the steask was har super dry not exciting / sfish were a dud/PLease improve your entree

The service was awful. I wanted to show my boyfriend how much I loved the restaurant, but the whole evening was ruined by the horrible service. I've waited tables before and I know how hard it can be, but it should never take 30+ minutes to get drinks or the bill. The food is great, but I honestly don't think I'll be back again.
review_title: The service was awful. I wanted

review: We had a very fine dinner but had to leave just as a flamenco performance was beginning. If only we had known in advance, we'd have changed our plans for the evening. We'll be back. Perhaps B44 could advertise their flamenco Thursdays in their Open Table listing.
review_title: We had a very fine dinner

review: Food was fantastic. Ordered the flavorful seafood paella and the smoked trout which was cooked perfectly. Red wine was excellent. Service was 5 star!

The best paella in town! My favorite dish was the arroz negre. Very good price for the quality of the food! There was a flamenco show that we did not pay much attention to because my friends and I had so much to talk about. It made the atmosphere very festive and a loud but lively place to be at on a Thursday evening. I am definitely coming back.
review_title: The best paella in town! My

review: We got there early & had our pick of outdoor seating under a heater. Booking ahead helped, as we saw a reservation-less couple sent indoors despite the plethora of open tables. Belden Place as others have noted is European in its concentration of sidewalk dining along a side street between Union Square and the Financial District. I thought the food wasn't quite as spectacular as I had previously -- our paellas, while hot and savory and chockful of seafood and (in my case) Spanish chorizo, were a little dried out, maybe? Anyway, the equal of what you'd get in 90% of the joints along the Ramblas. and a showpiece dessert. Have the Muga rioja. Great people watching, and lively indeed by the time we left at a little past 7.
This place is located in a cute street. A gem in the City. The food was good but had better paella yet it's the atmosphere that makes this restaurant so great.
review_title: A taste of Spain in Sf

review: Lovely place - really nice people, altho the bartender was not very attentive and service over all was a little slow. Food was excellent.
One of the BEST Spanish restaurants in town. A favorite. Still dreaming of the paella!
review_title: One of the BEST Spanish restaurants

review: The tapas is so good that we never seem to make it to the paella. Usually the service is good but last time left a little to be desired!
review_title: The tapas is so good that

review: Dined here for the Dine About Town lunch deal. So loud inside we had to sit outside. I wanted the Paella, but they said all the burners were full, and it would be 45 minutes to cook it. The sandwich I got instead was just fair. Service outside wasn't the greatest. Nothing was bad, but nothing was great. Overall, I was a bit disappointed.
review_title: Dined here for the Dine About

review: While the paellas were not very exciting, the tapas really shined. The extensive wine list is full of both well-known and lesser known selections from most of Spain's growing regions, which is another plus.
We had a party of seven and ALL the dishes we ordered were delicious. The service was very attentive but not intrusive. The noise level was quite high making it a bit difficult for conversation.
review_title: We had a party of seven and

review:
We had about 8 tapas plates for four of us - they were all very good if simple
Wait staff was very good - frinedly but not intrusuve
Spanish wine list is excellent- we had 2 great bottles under $45

It was truly memorable. All the different tastes and wonderful presentations added with the smells it was exciting. The service was over the top they were so much on top of it that once they took my martini away before I had a chance to finish my olive.
This was our first time at B44 and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Our waiter was particularly nice and helpful. We will definitely go back. Love the small plates.
review_title: This was our first time at

review: Always a nice place to have lunch especially on a nice sunny day. Good Paella (especially B44 paella). Service is very good and always warm and friendly
review_title: Always a nice place to have

review: I thought paella was supposed to be baked, not seem like a stir fry?
There's a European feel to dining at this restaurant.  The oil dip for the bread is fantastic.

Every year I go because I demand it every year. Belden Place is my favorite place in the city to get food, Bastille being the flagship. The Boudin Noir was a tad over cooked and the crepe suzette uses marmalade which I'm not to big on. But the frois gras was the best. The ambience is always nice there too.

We probably should've known better than to go to Caf Bastille on Bastille Day. The food was as good as ever. I really loved my house salad with grilled shrimp. However, they were overcrowded and the servers completely lost their rhythm. Our entres were served at completely different times, iced tea was bored into my Diet Coke, and they took so long to get dessert menus to us that my friend had to go back to work. Add to that that The people next to us kept banging into our table. I would certainly go back especially for the delightful lunch outside. I just wouldn't do it on a day when they attract so much attention.

Always loved this place until now...what happened? Irregular service nice people but not up to job... Food has gone downhill ...just ok...the French bread and butter is still great! Hope things improve.
The food was very good. This is a real French Restaurant with french staff that is reasonably priced.
What a gem away within the city. The food and service was excellent. When my wife likes it, it must be good.
We enjoyed our evening and the food -- fun to be in the city and on Belden. But it was just a "nice to do" not a "will do it again."

We had a party of 7 and were seated in the basement level -initially we were the only people seated down there. Service was slow to average but was slower towards the end due to it being busier and most people were seated on the street level. The menu selections had a nice variety. The frisee salad was delicious - the poached egg was wonderful in it. The cassoulet, however, needed salt - all the ingredients were there but lacked flavor. The chocolate mousse was very nice and light and had a smooth consistency. Other members in our party had grilled salmon which was very good. I would return but would be sure to have a table on the street level otherwise you feel like the forgotten table in the basement.
review_title: We had a party of 7 and were

review: Located in a 'Foodie Alley' this is a great spot for lunch with girlfriends!
Cassoulet very good, Beef Bergenon overcooked with a burnt taste and more acidic than needed to be, very poor. Onion soup fantastic!
roasted salmon was excellent - but save room for dessert!!

mediocre service, waiter only interested in his friends at the restaurant. Food okay but definitely not "real" french as they claim. We have eaten in France and have gone to much better french restaurants in North America. Much better restaurants in San Francisco!

We had an early suppor that spanned a shift change, both servers wer attentive and knew the menu and wine list thoroughly. Friendly, engaging, great. Portions were just right, house salad dressing was wonderful - a dijon type.
review_title: We had an early suppor that

review: We visited Cafe Bastille at 4pm on a Saturday and they were transitioning between lunch and dinner. It's one of the few restaurants open at this time on this quaint street. There were only a few people eating when we arrived and just a few more tables seated when we left so the noise level was low. We both had fish dishes and also the flourless chocolate cake. It was all tasty, but not memorable. Also, the service was okay.
Upstairs ambiance is nothing special. But food and service are great.
Very unique experience in San Francisco. Will go again.
The seating was too crowded.  The place was not busy, but they still packed us in too tight.  But other than that, it was fine.
This is a great place but with the prices, it has to be a special event, not just a desire for French food.  The escargots were better when served in the shell.
review_title: Excellent food and service as usual.

review: We had a nice dinner at Chou Chou.  For appetizers we tried the shrimp in pastis sauce and the onion soup and both were good.  For entrees, we tried the steak and the duck wellington and both were very good.  We had never seen duck wellington on a menu but really enjoyed it.  Service was somewhat slow.
review_title: We had a nice dinner at Chou Chou.  For ...

review: Wonderful dining experience. Best service I have had in years. Waiters are charming and wonderful. Did not care for the crab-avocado salad, but everything else was terrific.

My husband and I arrived on a Sunday evening and the restaurant was only one-third full. The host put us at a table near the door that looked out on the parking lot. We asked for another table and they accommodated us. It took an extremely long time for the waiter to take our order and more time to get the bread basket, and additionally a long time to get our food. The food was only fair. My crab and avocado salad only had a few bites of crab. The French onion soup my husband thought was excellent. His hanger steak was also good, but my braised beef was only fair, and tasted more like stew. Desserts were good. We do not plan on visiting this restaurant in the future.
I love this kind of French bistro! They had all my favorite classic French fare. The mussels were tender, the sauces delicious and the wine paired perfectly!
Food was delicious and service was great. Duck leg was huge. Crab salad portion was big and tasty.
The restaurant was busy that night and we felt as if we were being ignored. Had to ask for our bread, ran out of water, and wait was too long to get our check. Will likely not return.

Chouchou used to be one of my favorite restaurants, unfortunately not anymore. It's just not what it used to be. The change in chef is very obvious, food definitely needs improvement, the bread was hard, the desserts well the main flavor was lots of sugar, and the service left much to be desired. To cap the night we got our bill without asking for it, however they had forgotten to serve us our desserts! For the price not worth it.
review_title: Not what it used to be at all

review: The restaurant is quite beautiful. The colors and the layout work wonderfully. The food was okay, but the wait staff was rather unprofessional. I was disappointed.
A very good choice, close to West Portal where we were headed after dinner to a movie.

Have been passing this restaurant for over a decade and really wanted to try it. My friend and I sat upstairs, but regretted it as it felt a little cramped. Next time we'll sit downstairs. Our waiter was so friendly, knowledgable, and attentive. The food offered on the menu were great basics (meaning very French) with some inventive touches here and there. I'm going to come back with my husband and see what he thinks- him loving French food more than me.
THIS IS A REALLY NICE RESTAURANT WITH DECENT PRICES AND VERY GOOD FOOD. WHAT MORE CAN YOU ASK ?
review_title: THIS IS A REALLY NICE RESTAURANT

review: Nice people. Decent food. But there are dozens of better French restaurants in the city. If you live nearby and want to take a night off from cooking, give them a try. But this is not a destination restaurant.
The menu for the Dine About Town was from the main menu and selection was excellent.
review_title: The menu for the Dine About

review: Excellent Garlic Fries and T-Bone Veal Chop. Shrimps are not freshed.
Too noisey, placed near a family with 2 small children, asked to leave so the next party could be seated.

"This is the first time that I felt disappointed with my main course. The veal chop was over cooked and hence dry. The dessert tarts, as usual, were simply delicious and our soups were very good. The restaurant was packed and therefore the noise level was quite high making it very hard for the four of us to carry on a conversation. Given that this is the first time in years that we have been disappointed, I feel certain that we will go there again. I love the ambiance of the restaurant as it makes me feel like I am in Paris.

Chouchou is a small, neighbourhood French Restaurant, which seemed to be popular on a Wednesday evening, though at no point, were all of the tables taken.

With regards to layout, our table of four was rather close to the next, especially considering the space available throughout. Overall, it was extremely noisy, to the point of not being able to maintain a conversation; it does not help that no thought has been given to sound dampening, and every surface is hard and reflective of noise.

Despite the decent wines available, we found the food inconsistent, and not outstanding. Perhaps the best entree was the pork chop, properly cooked with a pleasant sauce, though the accompanying vegetables were significantly over oily; the souffl,

I love(d) Chouchou - Been going every 2-3 months for last 6 years. Food was always good and value excellent. Not so anymore. The food has gone WAY down in quality. Service isn't as crisp and continental as it used to be either. I started with an order of Escargot - they showed up unshelled which is OK but there were no Escargot spoons to be had - I had to use my fingers to hold the greasy shells in order to get at the not very pretty interior meat. The $22 New York Strip steak was closer to well done than medium rare and hard to cut and chew due to all the gristle and fat on it. Service was meh as well, a bit too intrusive and not very speedy. We waited for a salt/pepper combo for 10+ minutes. I may be back, but not for a while.

While the menu was limited, all we had was excellent, welll-prepared and well-presented. Service was attentive without being obsequious. Noise level at times distractingly high, even up in the more private balcony area. Thursday night free corkage is a remarkable boon!

We had a wonderful time. We were warmly welcomed and seated immediately (even though we were 15 minutes early for our reservations). Everything we had was fantastic, and the wine list had a great mix of domestic and foreign wines. We loved the atmosphere too; great wall colors, and the French vibe is understated and authentic. They also brought us complimentary kir royales with dessert (it was my wife's birthday).

The mix of people was nice too; from students to families to couples dressed for a night out. And we heard French spoken at several tables, which is a great endorsement for the authenticity and quality of Chou Chou.

We'll be back!
review_title: We had a wonderful time. We

review: Nick is such a gracious host and good food and fun!!
review_title: Nick is such a gracious host

review: We thought to check this place out by having brunch on a beautiful spring-like morning and were quite impressed with the food. Although the tables are set very closely, requiring most to raise our voices to carry on our conversation, I actually didn't mind the cheery, busy atmosphere, as the food was so flavorful and fresh. The French toast, made with brioche came with a lovely creme anglaise, so it was not overly sweet and had a lovely fluffy texture. The salmon benedict, with smoked salmon, lended a perfect saltiness that complemented the perfectly poached eggs, and served with nice sides of garlic roasted potatoes and a lightly dressed salad. They were out of tarts, but the creme brulee really satisfied. We can't wait to return!
review_title: We thought to check this place

review: Loved the meal and the experience.  Great small neighborhood restaurant, very friendly and fun.
review_title: Loved the meal and the experience.

review: We arrived on time for at 7:30 reservation for Christmas Eve. We waited 10 minutes and were seated at the small, unappealing, 5 seat bar. After a complaint and a further five minute delay, we were seated at a table, although one right next to the front door, with no light, so reading the menu was a challange. After that our experience definitely improved: they wait santa's-helper dressed wait staff was very friendly, the Pere Noel wonder was very friendly and expertly worked the room. The food was very good for the price. We had the fois gras, lamb, and duck, all well prepared and presented. Overall, a wonderful holiday experience, in a very friendly environment, with above average food. We would go there again.
review_title: We arrived on time for at

review: A charming host, good food and wine, and Parking!!!!
Love this place! So people are friendly and warm, Food is amazing and thoughtfully prepared, and the price is unbeatable for the kind of quality you get.

The food was prepared well. Neighborhood charm. The ambiance was simple and noise level was loud. We were seated cramped between two parties that made it difficult to hear our own conversation. Dining out you expect certain service to compliment your dining experience and ours fell short with ChouChou service. Probably since the waiter took our order and didn't really return until desert. Then when we decided not to have desert he just brought us a check rather than asking if we wished coffee etc..

Was there on Bastille Day, and they did a great job of making it a really fun evening. Of course, on a night like that they would be really busy, thus service a 3 star, but I'd expect to normally give it a 4. I have been once before when not a special holiday. Food was excellent, as was the wine recommendation (which was very moderately priced). This is really a nice French bistro experience in San Francisco. I would recommend this restaurant, and will go again. P.S. I only give 5 stars to restaurants trying to be top of the line restaurants, and priced accordingly, such as French Laundry, Cyrus, Gary Danko, etc., so don't take 5 as a slight to Chou, Chou.
Don't leave ChouChou without having a chocolate walnut tart and getting some kisses from Nick Ronan, the chef/owner.

From the owner greeting us to him saying goodbye this was a great evening. With our two teenage boys we all found something that we loved. The mussels, steak tartare, and foie gras all were great as was the pork loin, sea bass and chicken. A great neighborhood restaurant, we would definitely go again.

We had never been to this West Portal French Restaurant and decided to give it a try.

We were impressed with the restaurant when we walked in and found the atmosphere warm and convivial, then we were escorted to the tiny upstairs mezzanine through the staging area dressed in pink table cloths. The Mezzanine is way too small, constrictive and dankly lit to compare with the atmosphere on the first floor.
The food, in comparison to several other San Francisco French Restaurants was a disappointment. The escargots were really not a good idea, not sure why escargots were sweet with tomatoes. In addition, the music was a little too loud. Dessert tart was lovely.
review_title: We had never been to this

review: I took my husband here for a quick weeknight birthday dinner and wished we could have lingered all night long. This is a true French bistro, complete with families with well-behaved children dining, the chef/owner greeting the tables, and a super-fresh French bistro menu served at a casual pace. My husband's French onion soup was to die for. My endive salad with a blue cheese dressing was light yet satisfying. My husband had the best steak I've tasted in a long time. My seared duck breast was moist and was complemented by a cheese cherry studded polenta. Dessert stars are the homemade tarts. The staff even threw in two complimentary Kir Royales to celebrate my husband's birthday. I can't wait to dine here again!
review_title: I took my husband here for

review: This was our first visit to ChouChou with friends that we were treating for dinner. Everyone had a great meal and the welcome by the owner and his attention throughout was a nice change from other restaurants. The duck confit and petrale sole were big hits at our table.
review_title: This was our first visit to

review:
I have been here several times previously. Obviously, I like it! However, this time I had some new observations. For one thing, everyone at my table (4 of us) complained that the food was much too salty. Very tasty and nicely prepared but overly salted.

Secondly, I either forgot or just realized that the wine list is very overpriced. For example, we noticed that a bottle of Veuve Cliquot champagne which retails for about $40, was priced at $100 on the list! We had a bottle of Sancerre at $52, which was one of the less expensive offerings. The service was excellent, the ambiance very friendly. BUT we are in a deep recession guys! Do something about your wine prices.
review_title: I have been here several times

review: Dinner at Chouchou was fabulous! The food was great, wine at just the right temperature and the desserts were excellent! Would highly recommend!
Fun menu at a very good value. Romantic enough for a date (dark and cozy) and casual enough for anytime.
review_title: Fun menu at a very good value.

review: For a great French experience; definitely worth it!
phenomenal. simply perfect. they make you feel like royalty and feed you accordingly, with masterful culinary delicacies.
Thought it to be a bit expensive but then that is happening to many SF restaurants. That's one reason I'm planning to leave the City.
review_title: Thought it to be a bit expensive

review: Overall, the experience was very good and the food took me back to France.  The downside, service could be sped up a bit.  For example, we wanted dessert and coffee after our meal and after waiting to receive the dessert menu a while [it wasn't like the restaurant was to full capacity--maybe 12 patrons]it took the waiter nearly 15 minutes to come by again.  At that point we decided to simply pay the bill and leave.  Unfortunate because we've heard that their tarts were delicious and frankly a big draw for me.  Although the Euro approach to service was appreciated, I think finding a balance between European and American service would've made my experience in the outstanding category.
Food is delicious. Loved the mussels and beef tartare. Drinks are pretty good. Great vibe. Reminded me of being in Paris or Italy with the outdoor seating.

We were so disappointed.  Like many others, Plouf has been the "go to" place for mussels.  We have been going there since they opened.  What happened?  Small, chewy mussels, smaller portion than it used to be, poor quality of sauce.  The bacon in the "poulette" was RAW and all fat! It used to be pancetta. The mussels were tasteless.  Even the mueniere sauce was flat.  The wait staff and management could care less and never checked back with us until time for the bill.  We will not be going back again.

If you love high quality mussels with a range of sauce options, Plouf is the place.  In the middle of a great restaurant alley, Belden Place, being there is part of the fun, but the food is the most important draw.  Al fresco dining, if you wish, although the patio is more noisy.

Loved the Plouf mussels and one of my dining companions was similarly sold on the curry mussels. Had to restrain myself from lapping up the rest of the sauce. Mussels could have been a tad larger and more tender. Are they precooked and then reheated in the sauce? The silky duck pate was divine and we finished off with the profiteroles. Very nice!

I hadn't been here in years but I remembered the Plouf mussels being quite tasty and there were. The oysters on the half shell were fresh too, but the cooked fish items weren't as tasty (fish & chips and the grilled white fish) as they were quite under seasoned and lacked any real flavor. We also never got the 2nd fish & chips brought to our table but once we tried the plate we did get we were thankful =) Waitress seemed distracted and rarely stopped by, thus she was unaware we never got our 3rd entree (3 people dining so that would be a good assumption). I would go back for the mussels and oysters and a glass of wine only.

This is my third visit. This time for Bastille Day. But not wise because the place was crushed with folks, and we had to wait a bit to get in -- even though we had reservations. However, I will say the service and kitchen staff were amazing. With so many folks to serve, we felt service was excellent and the food came out in a timely way. Mussels with roasted garlic were outstanding.
The food was excellent, but it took almost a half hour to get the check. The desserts were extremely good.
Loved it ... it was a week day night, gray and rainy, service and food could not have been better.
review_title: Loved it ... it was a week

review:
I was looking for a restaurant in the Financial District where I could take anew customer to lunch; her preference was Seafood so after looking at the menu for Plouf I had a hunch that this would be a great choice for us. Everything about our experience was great. The service, the menu selection, the food....all great!

I 've already told several friends about Plouf and were planning a night out so that I can get my mussel/clam fix!
Excellent across the board- food, service, ambience, vibe- LOVED IT!
Great mussels, great ambiance, great energy. Stellar experience for Bastille Day!
It's a favorite of mine and Plouf always delivers a great experience.
review_title: It's a favorite of mine and

review: Yum! I had the steak frites (medium rare). The steak was very tender and tasty. The frites were good, too! My hubby had the moules. He was in heaven. They were some of the best he's ever had! For dessert we had one scoop each of rasperry and mango, even though we didn't really have room for dessert. We're glad we did. Both were so fresh and tasty. This wasn't our first time dining at Plouf and definitely won't be our last!
review_title: Yum! I had the steak frites

review: this restaurant COULD be great for outdoor dining, good for groups,romantic, neighborhood gem, special occasion,or fit for foodies. Sadly it has deteriorated significantly in past couple of years. The menu is reduced and the seafood that is offered seems to be previously frozen. The calamari and the fish and chips just tastes oily. Our waiter brought a lesser bottle of wine than we ordered and just started to open it - as if we wouldn't notice - or it wouldn't matter. Used to love this place. WHaT HAPPENED?

I was very disappointed because I made a reservation for an outdoor table near the heater and when we got there they did not have the table available. We ended up sitting inside. The food was very good. Both the salman and sea bass were excellent.
Started with the Oysters Rockerfeller. Chose the coconut broth mussels; wonderful. The crepes for dessert was equally good.
We had a large group of 14, and they were most accomodating to our needs. The mussels are my favorite!
review_title: We had a large group of 14,

review: We got lucky with the weather and sat outside for dinner. Loved the ambiance! You would never guess we were in San Francisco. The mussels were fresh and I wanted to slurp up the broth with bread. The addition of truffle oil and parmesan cheese to the fries added the perfect touch of uniqueness and deliciousness!
review_title: We got lucky with the weather

review: The mussels are delicious. The outdoor seating had several tables close together to others from Plouf and neighboring restaurants. This made for great people watching, but pretty close quarters. The service was good, not great. Belden Alley is a fun little area.
Good restaurant in the midst of a row of restaurants, but nothing special. Would try somewhere else before I go back.

The bartender at Fiddler's Green recommended Plouf. We are very glad we stopped in for a pint at the Green because her recommendation was top notch. We are from out of town so we had no idea where to go. We were staying at the Serrano so Plouf was walkable. As soon as we rounded the corner to the ally we knew we had found the perfect spot. To be quite honest it looked as if any of the restaurants with outdoor seating there would have been great. The tables were almost full and every table looked like they were enjoying themselves. I went for the Prix Fixe dinner - Mussels with coconut broth. Loved it! My husband opted for the Sable entree and was pleased. Our service was wonderful and we will be back in the future.

The moules Marinires are the best and the main reason we go to Plouf. The servers are professional, salads fresh (and French-influenced) and the frites as good as any you find in Belgium. That's why we return over and over.

This time, we sat outdoors in the alley. They have heaters overhead, so even on a chilly day, it's pleasant outside. The servers seem to all be french, which is a bonus. :-)
The food was great, but got the prefix menu, and the mussels were offered as a main entree, but it was a size of an appetizer that a group would share, and that was not enough as an entree... Of course it was good though. They seem to always have new things on their menu, which is great, but some of their stuff is so good that you want to get it again, and it's not always there the next time!
Food is delicious. Loved the mussels and beef tartare. Drinks are pretty good. Great vibe. Reminded me of being in Paris or Italy with the outdoor seating.
we arrived at 5:30 pm and were probably one of the first to be there. we found the music a little loud which interferred with conversation. other than that the service and food were good.

Plouf is one of several little gems on Belden Place, just a couple blocks off Union Square. It is a French seafood place with a great value in its $25 three-course prix fixe dinner menu: $25 dollars for soup or salad, a huge bowl of mussels in your choice of 6 broths, and a dessert. The same menu is available for $19 at lunchtime.

Five stars for service: the French waiters will take great care of you.
Five stars for ambiance: Belden Lane is a diamond in the rough of downtown San Francisco, and Plouf is a standout among the few restaurants there.
review_title: Plouf is one of several little

review: It's a fun/casual place with friends(no more than 6) for a night out, gethering, but not for special occasion with your love ones. Tables were very small and too close, not much privacy. The food was good though. A nice place for lunch, I wouldn't go there for dinner again.

Plouf was a great find. The food was amazing. We had steak and fish, and I normally don't like fish because it's too bland, but this one was one of the best I've had. We'd definitely go back here, and we recommend this restaurant to everyone.
review_title: Plouf was a great find. The

review: Took a friend from Seattle (who is a hardcore foodie!) to dinner last week to Plouf and she was very impressed.  We had an extraordinary fish dish and a bottle of wine that was completely sublime!  While Plouf has been one of my favorites for a long time, I think that my friend is a newly converted "friend of Plouf"!

This is our second visit this year.   The menu choice for Dine Around Town pre fix menu was disappointing and did not represent the restaurant very well.  Our last visit was great and we  had three choices that represented the menu and the restaurant.  That is why we came back and invited friends to join us .  We could have  ordered off the regular menu but the whole purpose of the Dine around town is to order off the Pre Fix menu.
review_title: This is our second visit this

review: Always pleased when I have the chance to dine there.

rest_name: Jeanne D'Arc - Cornell Hotel De France
review: We met friends from the East Bay there for dinner on our recommendation, since it is one of our favorite places in the city.  They loved it as much as we do.  Everyone's food was outstanding and the service was perfect.  We weren't rushed and had a lovely night in the city.  Plus, their wine list is so reasonably priced it is not worth bringing your own.  We had the Bandol and it was perfect to accompany everyone's entree.

rest_name: Jeanne D'Arc - Cornell Hotel De France
review: How the hell did we miss this place for the last 30 years?  They have been here for 45+ and family run the whole time.  Excellent traditional French.  Best pre-ACT-play place we've found in over 20 years of being subscribers.  Terrific !!

rest_name: Jeanne D'Arc - Cornell Hotel De France
review: The restaurant is hidden in the basement of the Cornell Hotel. It doesnt feel like a basement. Nice meal. Well prepared but not a wow. Great souffle for dessert.

rest_name: Jeanne D'Arc - Cornell Hotel De France
review: Absolutely loved the room itself. Food was great, but the server made us feel very hurried.

rest_name: Jeanne D'Arc - Cornell Hotel De France
review: A taste of France tucked in a small Hotel in San Francisco. The decor and setting is right out of an elegant Bistro, the food and service is outstanding and the price is very reasonable.
review_title: A taste of France tucked in

rest_name: Jeanne D'Arc - Cornell Hotel De France
review: Based on the mixed reviews we'd read online, we had to wonder if we were in the same restaurant as some of those reviewers. The food was outstanding, and the service was excellent. My wife had the duck (succulent) and I had the scallops and prawns (amazing champagne sauce). Hats off to any restaurant brave enough to offer steamed brussels sprouts and a tip of that hat to one that pulls it off this well. Next time (and there WILL be a next time - probably many), I'd like to try the lamb shank, for which they're known. From the looks on other diners' faces, it must be fantastic! My wife enjoyed the souffle for dessert and I loved the cherries jubilee. The owner came by our table and chatted with us, adding a special touch to the evening.

A fun & vibrant atmosphere. The pork & ricotta meatball starter and the scallops on  black rice risotto were outstanding.  Our waiter recommended two fantastic  wine pairings by the glass and provided excellent and friendly service. We'll be back.
review_title: A fun & vibrant atmosphere. The pork & r...

review: We had a great time and the food was diverse enough to accomodate a large work-party group. We will be returning. Good job.
review_title: Good for the Friday Work lunch set

review: My wife and I had to catch an early evening flight and wanted to catch an early dinner before taking off to the airport.  Credo is one of the few quality restaurants in the financial district that could accommodate a 4pm dinner reservation.  Despite the early time, the food was excellent and service outstanding.  We will be back on our next trip.

I took clients on a business lunch.  The restaurant was very accommodating, and seated us downstairs where it wasn't quite as noisy without us even having to ask.  The only thing that could have been improved upon was the size of the portions.  I actually prefer smaller, more European portion sizes, but the amount of food in the gnocchi dish was a little lacking.  Otherwise, I would recommend the restaurant.
What a fantastic find! Great food. Definitely order the cauliflower appetizer. One of the best items on the menu. Great ambiance and easy parking in the financial district.
review_title: A gem in the financial district

review: We booked a table for dinner at Credo because we wanted a place walking distance from our hotel off Union square and we wanted Italian. First the food -- outstanding. Raviolis were spectacular. We shared meatball appetizer and chopped salad. Both unique. Superb service began when we walked in and saw that this was a noisy place. Hostess directed us to a table by by a group of people simply having a good time. Somehow she saw my husband and I exchange looks and she was over in an instant to offer to move us to the back of the restaurant. Waiter super attentive -- we asked his advice between two bottles of wine and suggestion which was spot on! This restaurant is lots of fun and so good. We shall return!
Second time I took a group here and again to great success. Lots of vegetarian options and a wine menu to please even the discerning guests. Awesome knowledgeable staff.
Great for downtown work day lunch. Delicious food and doesn't take too long.
I ate here for lunch with a client and it was fabulous. Everything we had was excellent. I will return with clients and friends. Loved it.
review_title: Great first time! WILL go back...

review:
Clients like the food & presentation.
Service was good but not stellar.
cost was pricy, but quality was above average.
Nothing special...pizza Luke warm...glad someone else was paying
Excellent Italian food with a modern twist in a modern space.
Great atmosphere and great food. Service was a little distracted, but overall was very good.

This was my first visit to this wonderfully designed and well crafted menu of cucina di povero. Representing flavors of Tuscany. It was shared with an friend from my High School days and close to his hotel. Dreamy, creamy, and worth your visit and time!!!

Credo is right across from my office so it would be great to report that it's perfect for business lunches. Unfortunately, while the food is decent and the service very friendly, the noise level in the main room is off the charts loud and requires you to almost shout your conversations during peak lunch hours. By the end of the lunch, I felt physically worn from the constant din. The one time I dined in the downstairs, which is not always available due to private bookings, the noise level was fine. While the service was generally attentive, the check contained an appetizer that I had cancelled and never received. The waitress was appropriately apologetic but this is the kind of mistake one remembers the next time, if there is one.
Service was a bit slow and not on top of it. Food was good as usual. I dislike the fish smell since they have an open kitchen style.
review_title: Service was a bit slow and

review: On a recent visit with a guest who has some trouble hearing, I discovered the downstairs dining room which is much quieter and more pleasant than the street level room. I think the food shows imagination and high quality. Worth the visit.
review_title: On a recent visit with a guest

review: It was just okay. Our waiter was terrible and very rude.
review_title: It was just okay. Our waiter

review:
This restaurant is easy to walk to from any hotel in San Francisco. The decor and location are great.
We had excellent service and our meal was wonderful. Our server even took the time to bring a special bottle of wine that wasn't on the wine list, after asking us about what we were looking for in a good wine.

I would definitely dine at Credo again!

Felt like they judged my friend and I right off the bat. Very pretentious. Skimped on the Dine About Town menu. Only reason to participate is to bring in customers. If you do well then people will come back. Would not be returning.
review_title: Felt like they judged my friend

review: The food was pretty good. Beef shortribs ravioli were a bit dry in the filling (just beef) but still tasty. The pizzas were good and reasonably priced. The services wa not so great. We arrived a bit early for our reservation and there was an available table, but rather than seat us immediately the hostess said that we had to wait 5-10 minutes at the bar. And then she forgot about us. The available table sat open and ready the whole time, and we finally had to get up to ask if we could be seated. She asked if we had a reservation and acted surprised and then sat us at that table. Food service was quick but it took awhile for them to take our order and then bring the bill. They need to be more attentive.
This place is consistently good. Good business lunch spot.
Great service, friendly staff, good food and wine.
great food, great location in financial district and great service.

The originality of the food left something to be desired at Credo. Seeing that better prices are just a few blocks away at Perbacco and Barbacco, Credo should also be considered about offering an uninspired menu at its price point.

I went on Monday night and had fish special - should not have done it.  Mussels were as fishy as it can be, the fish must have been frozen becuase it was soggy and watery.  My bf had pizza which was not that great.  I would not go back to this restaurant to eat food.
review_title: I went on Monday night and

review: The moment we walked in, the feeling of 'welcome' overwhelmed us. The food prepared was simply put delightful; all hats off to the chef!!!
review_title: The moment we walked in, the

review:
The food and service were decent and the waiter was cordial and competent. Two appetizers, while tasty, arrived in what we both agreed were comically small portions, especially considering the price. Entrees (swordfish and pork chops) were both quite flavorful, though not showstoppers. The one exceptional item was a dessert, cheesecake broul, which -- as we were properly warned -- looks nothing like a cheescake.

But it was hard to enjoy any of the food, because the place was so RIDICULOUSLY loud. We were upstairs, at almost the absolute furthest point from the piano and singer, but still could barely hear each other speak. This was a weeknight and well after the peak dinner hour, so the place wasn't anywhere near capacity. I'd hate to think what it's like on a packed Saturday. I'm at a loss to see how anyone could categorize this as a romantic spot.

I've been in high-energy dance bars where I could hear better than at Bix. Why pay for fine food when you can't even have a relaxed conversation while eating it?

I have been here for two work dinners and it is a lovely place to bring out of towners.  (they have a coat/bag check which is especially great if you are leaving the office then headed to the hotel because you don't have to stop in between to drop the luggage off!) 

Great menu selections, wonderful service and beautiful decor. The music is the icing on the cake!

The 2nd floor overlooking the live jazz trio band was a great addition to the dinner.  Although there is a lot of people and with the band playing in the background, our dinner was still intimate and very enjoyable.  Their cocktail menu is perfect for the setting, as well as their wine offerings.  Be sure to make reservations early in advance because this place is packed!

My wife and I came here on our honeymoon and could not be happier! It all started with the service. Our waiter took the time to explain the entire menu to us, and also made a special cocktail for my wife based on what she described she liked. Her drink was exactly what she wanted. I had the Elixer No. 3 to drink and it was unlike anything I've ever had. It was wonderful. We had a couple appetizers which were very good, and my wife had a couple great glasses of wine. For our meals, my wife had the duck and I had lobster spaghetti, both of which were outstanding. It was an overall great experience!

Dined at Bix last month and again Friday night for client dinners. Three of five of my clients ran late for our 6pm reservation. The short haired, older female hostess proudly/rudely told me in front of my guest we were going to lose our reservation.  I assured her they'd be there within 5 minutes and they were. Dinner was great, server was great. We were having dessert and the mgr stopped in briefly to check on us and discreetly delivered our bill. We all split the Bananas Foster for dessert. It was delicious but not enough so one of my guests asked the mgr for a second one. He said no the 8:30 reservation needed the table. It was 8:37pm. Embarrassed and disappointed me in front of my clients after I bragged on Bix so much!

Bix is a cool spot, and the food is great. However we waited 20 minutes for our reservation and were given a corner table (good) right next to the kitchen door (bad). This wouldn't have been such a bad thing if the same size table set unoccupied on the opposite side of the restaurant for the duration of our meal.

Our waiter was rather aloof and at times inappropriate. It's close to being an awesome place but the experience this time was sub-par.

I had some visitors from overseas visit and it was their birthday as well. I wanted to show them a classic SF style restaurant and Bix did not let me down!. The service and food were all wonderful. We had a great table and the overseas visitors left having a sensational experience all round. Thank you Bix!

This is a very comfortable place and the food is great.
The piano and singer work beautifully together and make the evening very special.
Food was good with great presentation. Freshly baked rolls before dinner were a nice touch. Service was a bit inattentive after we were finished with our entrees.

our server just did not seem to have his act together. I'm unsure whether he was just incompetent or if the restaurant was understaffed and the server overworked. The food though, was excellent, better than I remember even from previous times -- but I'd hope for better service next time.
And, a restaurant of this style, with an old feel, and somewhat "bar-centric" needs REAL martini glasses, not little frou-frou champagne-like bowls on stems.
Great pianist and we were there a night that Mary Stallings dropped in to sing -- she is one of the best!
review_title: A Very Lovely Evening, even if

review: Wow... alleyway entrance into a 40's nightclub atmosphere, jazz piano and all. And oh yeah, the food is excellent too!!

I always feel like I'm transported to the Gold Rush Era whenever I eat in BiX. The atmosphere is the best part of this restaurant: the bar scene is very vibrant and the tiered level elegance of the entire dining room makes me feel like I'm in a scene for the Great Gatsby. The food is very good as well. Be warned, however: it is excruciatingly noisy in this place. This is NOT for dinner parties that want to have nice conversations. There is a jazz trio on the weekends, which actually brings the noise level down one decibel, but they don't start playing until 8:30 PM.
Bix is situated in an alley which adds to its old jazz club feel. The ambiance and music are exceptional. Service was outstanding. The lobster spaghetti is fabulous.
Really good food and great wine list in a very lively atmosphere.
Wonderful as always....Bix continues to deliver a wonderful offering regardless of the meal,or the occasion...thanks for making it a great treat for my best friends birthday,,,
We had an 8:30 PM reservation, but had to wait about 20-30 minutes before we could be seated. We sat for an hour before our dinner came. Slow service. Portions were small.

My friends and I have enjoyed Bix several times and have never been disappointed. It has a wonderful ambiance and we really enjoy the mixture of a good restaurant with entertainment. It reminds us of a "supper club" from a long-ago era. Really a wonderful place!
review_title: My friends and I have enjoyed

review: Pleasantly surprised about the location, service and especially about the food. Good for its price. Fancy yet not pretentious.
Great restaurant and excellent service! I will be back again soon.
Really interesting menu, really good food, really good service and a fun atmosphere - if a bit noisy.

Always terrific. Had been a few years since I had been to Bix, so I jumped at the chance to go back. With lofty memories of the last visit, it had a lot to live up to. But the mystique and attention to detail were still there. Really terrific experience from food to service to ambiance. Will certainly not let it be years before my next time back! Thanks!

The food was excellent. Very creative. Wonderful array of tastes and beautifully presented. The only thing I would change is the simple salad that two of our party ordered, including myself. I would remove that from the menu. It is unremarkable, with a dressing that is bland. Your limit on the number of bottles of wine one can bring from one's private collection (i.e., 2) is unreasonable and unnecessary.

Great food, ambience and service!
Chicken hash and Bix burger...awesome!

Bix is a throw back to the 40's. If you find yourself dreaming of how Joe Dimaggio and Norma Jean ate in style, this is the place. Live music, great food and Stew is by far the greatest waiter in SF. It's definitely the place to be to celebrate in style.
review_title: Bix is a throw back to the

review: This is a favorite and never disappoints. Food, service and ambiance are perfect. Love the music, especially when Mary Stallings sings. She is world class and makes every visit special.
review_title: This is a favorite and never

review: Excellent food and service! The Kobe beef is outstanding! A San Francisco favorite!
This is a classic restaurant where food is good, service is good, ambience is very good. In a city with many great restaurants, this was special mainly in the beauty of the room.
I love the Friday lunch service at Bix. It's hard to find better prepared food that is so, so tasty.
review_title: I love the Friday lunch service

review: Delicious meal. Understaffed lunch staff. Could barely get the server's attention.
Consistent after all of these years. BIX still makes a great cocktail and serves up no fuss food with seamless service.

a bit too expensive for the overall experience.
soup was good.
Appetizers were borderline good and therefore expensive for what they were.
Any one on second floor will not really benefit from the live Jazz due to dilution of sound.
Service was fine but waitress too pushy and selling hard.
review_title: a bit too expensive for the

review: I go to Bix for well done classics like roasted bone marrow and steak tartar. The caprese salad special was really good. We also had porkchops and another salad. The rolls are warm (as they should be) and the wait staff is extremely professional. It's the type of service from a bygone era. The waitstaff is excellent but the reason I only gave the "service" three stars is because the food was very slow to come out from the kitchen at my most recent meal. I think of Bix as an old school San Francisco restaurant (someone plays piano during dinner, the tables/booths are perfectly lit (dim but not too dim) and there's a sedate and refined atmosphere to the place). You can bring your parents here, but it will also appeal to foodies.
review_title: I go to Bix for well done

review: Service was very good. Wine list is reasonably priced. Food was very good but not memorable. beautiful, comfortable restaurant. Can even have a conversation until the bar/music starts rolling.

This was a return to Bix after going there 4 years ago for a special occasion. We went again for a special occasion. Our waiter was very knowledgable and helpful. Food was excellent. Only complaint is when you are not a customer who is or they is going to be dropping at least $300 on dinner, you do feel a though you are an inconvenience or the waiter is bummed he/she got your table.

I love the bar, the decor and the band. I ate pork chops which i would never order at a restaurant and they were to die for. We had a great time even though we felt at times a little bit like a fish out of water.
review_title: This was a return to Bix after

review: We had a great evening for GF's birthday. Lovely service and setting (nice segue from the Cartier exhibit at the Legion of Honor to the 1920's ambience of Bix.)
review_title: We had a great evening for

review: Great room, fantastic jazz trio. The food didn't live up to our expectations, and the bartenders can do a bit of work on their mixing and ingredients (my Old Fashioned at another bar just prior to Bix was wonderful, mixed with orange bitters and Buffalo Trace bourbon; I couldn't believe Bix bartenders actually used Jim Beam in theirs. Really? In a $10 drink, that's the best you can do? Great appetizers--these were the highlight. The NY Strip was ok, but hardly exciting; potatoes far too salty. Overpriced wine list. Such great potential here...but the food didn't blow me away.

Food was good but I've had better including service and ambience at restaurants costing much less. Don't think I'll go back. Nothing really memorable about it except how much you'll be paying at the end. Next time I'll head back to Perbacco and have some of the most delicious food for a lot less not to mention more attentive service and always a memorable evening.
review_title: Food was good but I've had

review:
We completely enjoyed our visit. The staff could not have been more welcoming and attentive.
To start:a singularly superb Manhattan! Wines by the glass were well chosen and beautifully crafted. The potato pillow appetizers were light,delicate and just uniquely special. Delightful Crab cakes! Our salads each had just the right chill and freshness. Evening specials - Scallops and Braised short ribs were each perfectly done, again with vegetable sides that screamed "fresh from the farm." We couldn't resist the Bananas Foster... All at the right temperature even without the fire - Delicious. Our evening at BIX will be treasured as one of the most memorable and special dinner evenings we have had. BIX is a truly delightful experience.

great space and hip style bar but too expensive. The Bix fix was a good idea 3 courses for $36, The tomato soup and cheese sand were good as were the chocolate brioche and the strawberries with mascarpone but the chicken hash (patties) were dry and uninteresting. The albacore with white beans was good but nothing shined, especially for the money.Wine was $50, second cheapest cab, martini with tip $10.I hope Mary Stallings gets a big chunk of the dough but I doubt it.

Another year, another dinner at Bix for my wife's birthday. We started off with drinks at the bar which were expertly made, then dinner at our table next to the trio playing music. Overall it was a wonderful night. We love Bix.

Superb use of seasonal ingredients, highly professional and friendly staff and a fun bistro atmosphere (with a great bar) made our visit highly enjoyable. BIX impresses me every time I go by consistently providing an excellent dining experience. The ceviche was out of this world great! Really a superb dish.
This place is in it's own class. Feels like a supper club in the 40's must have been but with food fit for 2009.
review_title: This place is in it's own

review:
Very likely the best luncheon place in The City with a spuperior chef. Chicken hash is the house speciality with a magnificent, enticing taste.

A very competent and friendly staff, includes Blake, the general manager, Ginelle, the hostess and such superstar servers as Jackie and Cristen.

Jim

What a surprise! Elegant, sumptuous food, fine service, perfect music, and a "satin smooth" overall experince. The place is hard to find... but worth the search; a hole in a wall, down a back alley, underneath a small simple neon sign ("BIX") that opens into a magical realm of culinary reward. If finding those special places, like hidden treasures, is one of your joys, or if you simply enjoy fine dining in fun places... check this place out!
Bix has been, and remains, one of our fevorite restaurants -- anywhere. The ambiance, service and quality of food and wine are incomparable. Thanks to open table for helping us with the reservation.

Decent appetizers--mini lamb burgers, crab sandwiches and tuna tartare on toast points. Rack of lamb was really charred, burnt on the exterior and consequently, the meat was dry. Accompanying mini quiche was not even warm. At $39 for this entree,the most expensive entree on the menu, the kitchen's inattentiveness in preparing the dish was unexpected in a restaurant of this caliber. 

Our waiter was curt and unfriendly and marred what was a celebratory evening.

We will not be returning to Bix.

We love Bix... a very nice combination of good food and great ambiance. However, Friday was a hot day and the lack of air conditioning made for a unpleasantly warm room that night. Not conducive to enjoying dining.
review_title: We love Bix... a very nice

review: The food was amazing, the service was friendly and professional.  From the moment we walked in, we were treated like royalty.  Even the pianist said hi and asked if there was anything we wanted to hear.  This was a late Mother's Day dinner and they pulled out all the stops to make it a memorable evening for me and my Mom, and they succeeded with flying colors.
great service...and the food was very good.  Lovely spot

The Stone bowl bi-bim-bap is excellent. It's filled with all kinds of delicious goodies. The fried green beans are oh-so-fantastic. I highly recommend it. I do wish the pricing was a little more economical, but for special occasions, it's great.
review_title: The Stone bowl bi-bim-bap is excellent. ...

review: Wonderful service great food. Simple yet great for a nice evening out with your significant other.
The service and the food and the whole vibe of Frances is exactly what one wants in a neighborhood restaurant. I only wish that it wasn't as difficult to get a table! Highly recommended.

The menu offerings were yummy and interesting enough that I'd recommend anyone try it. My only item reservation, in terms of not liking the food item, was that I found the red trout too undercooked and very "fishy", not like regular trout....so really did not like it; although the accompanying food with it was very good. But we did very much enjoy the interesting, innovative, and tasty side dishes, soup, and salads.
review_title: The menu offerings were yummy and intere...

review: The food and service are consistently on point. Nothing is presumptuous; from the flavors to the prices, what you get is honest and entirely worth the effort to snag a seat.
One of the finest restaurants in the Bay Area.  Food and service excellent.
review_title: One of the finest restaurants in the Bay...

review:
We have not been here for around 9 month, but all is still as we remember it: great food with some new seasonal updates, nice service. 
Keep going!
Everything was done very well if not wholly exciting. Small restaurant, practically communal table!  Excellent service.

We went to Frances for dinner.

We started off with the Bacon Beignets. This was fabulous. It was so light and airy. The flavor was outstanding. Next we had the Duck Liver Mousse. It also had pickled onions that complemented the Duck Liver and crispy bread.

Next we had the Squid Ink Linguine. It was very nice and the squid ink really came through. We had the Duck Breast as an entree. The duck was cooked perfectly. But, I really didn't care for the spices that were on the duck and there were too much citrus for my liking.

We had the Lumberjack Cake and the Toasted Poppy Seed Genoise. They were both great. The Lumberjack Cake was the better desert and it was full of flavor. The Poppy Seed was more subtle and light.

Great food, great evening. Perfect foodie experience. There is one waiter here in particular, a roughly 50 year ish year old server, who made the evening of perfect food, great ambience, wonderful art, tasteful dining, he made it all even more extraordinary. I wish we had gotten his name.

Each visit finds new inventions of superb flavor profiles -Melissa Perello is a master at combining texture and unexpected components in each dish-absolutely the finest experience in the city. Carrots with avocado and Indian spice was unforgettable,all served by the nicest staff you can imagine. And all very affordable.
it is always a special and lucky treat to dine at Frances
Great, great food! Loved the house wine by the ounce option. Ambiance is a bit dull. . romantic, special occasion type of place.

Frances is a great restaurant in the Castro district that offers fresh, delicious cuisine. The wait staff is friendly and courteous, however could have been more attentive. The ambience has moderate level of noise, but the tables are very close together. This does not offer alot of room to move or table space for the food and tableware. The justification for the high price is definitely in the food. All the dishes were savory and fresh.
Frances is my wife's favorite restaurant. They really went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The food was fantastic and the overall experience was perfect.

The preparations are simple with very fresh seasonal ingredients that stand out including subtle use of spices and herbs. The wine list is exciting with selections from many small California wineries. I wish I could eat there everyday.

We had the Bacon beignets they were OK. The Salad with anchovy dressing was good. The meal fell apart at the next step with the stripped bass way over cooked and the lamb tough, tasteless and drowning in a runny broth. Our side, Gnocchi was not edible.We had looked forward to Frances and were surprised and disappointed.
Absolutely amazing food. Loved the menu and the option to be able to share each dish. Only downsize is the noise level in the restaurant.

We were blown away on Saturday night by the food and service at Frances. Each dish was unique, flavorful and well-prepared. We had a 9:45 pm reservation which was honored with a very short wait but had a chance to talk with folks leaving the restaurant who said "it is a 10".... They were right.

All of the restaurant servers are personable and attentive giving the place an even more welcoming feel. Yes, I am telling ALL of my friends.
review_title: We were blown away on Saturday

review: Food was outstanding. Great understanding of flavors and what pairs well with what. Seasonal dining at its best. The server, however, was arrogant and inattentive. I would go back if I could be assured of a different server.

Ambiance and quality of a top of the line restaurant at an extremely reasonable price. In my opinion, its one of the best values in the city. The only downside is that its extremely difficult to get a reservation between 6 and 8 PM.
This was a great find! Hard to get a reservation, but worth a try. Staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful.

With a new spring menu and new additions to the wines by glass once more this magical place delivers seamless service and cooking-the steak bavette was superb and i've had this dish many times-the soups are always very tasty and the cheese covered toast that sits atop the bowl is a nice accompaniment-I thought I was wearing out my welcome mat yet was told that I hadn't been back in a while! I get there by bus and foot from Mill Valley and I plan to return soon! Excellent!
review_title: With a new spring menu and

review: Second time we have gone there and the food was fantastic both the times as was the service.
review_title: Second time we have gone there

review: I expected more by all of the reviews I have read but the service was rushed and fragmented.  For a restaurant that is supposed to always be busy, the staff seemed disjointed at the height of service.  Food was good but not worth the wait.
Great food, great service, great venue. Celery root soup, wonderful. Duck confit salad, wonderful. Seared scallops, wonderful. Cheese plate, wonderful. Frances is wonderful.

This is our third time at Frances, and we have had an exceptional dining experience every time. This time, we requested a quiet table as we were celebrating our anniversary. As Frances is a relatively small restaurant with mostly banquette seating, there are no truly quiet tables, but they seated us at the end of banquette with corner seating, as romantic an option as possible. The food was delicious, as always, and the service impeccable. The experience was capped by the candle on our dessert, a very nice touch.
review_title: This is our third time at

review: The corn soup and chick pea frites were outstanding but my chicken was mediocre. I sort of expect organic chicken to look like a chicken, not rolled up in medallions. Great space and dessert was delicious. Not sure I'd be back though.
review_title: The corn soup and chick pea

review: Tiny, tiny place. Don't go there if you have large group. Not possible. Food is delicious. Service was tentative and accommodating.
Excellent food It was so noisy, one couldn't really talk.
review_title: Excellent food It was so noisy,

review: One of the best places in San Francisco, for sure. Wonderful soup. Whatever you do, always get the soup here. Grilled asparagus salad was lovely and the crisp shallots added a touch of the sublime. The braised lamb on this visit wasn't my favorite but the polenta and onions that came with the meat were perfection.
review_title: One of the best places in

review: Always amazing and is last dinner was more of the same. Whatever you do, order the soup. The chef's soups are absolutely sublime.
Never disappointing. The chef is outstanding! Excellent dining!

After all the positive reviews about this restaurant I was expecting a fabulous evening. Was I wrong. Frances was a huge disappointment. Beet salad=ordinary with too much salt. Crab salad=uggh. I hate creamy dressing. Black cod=do not order this fish - it was awful! Oily with unpleasant texture. Fish was on a bed of leeks and squash (I think) and both of these were delicious. Chocolate dessert with pears and salted caramel dressing was unpleasant.
To make matters worse, service was dreadful and when we asked, after over two hours of waiting, when our entrees would be coming, waiter was snippy. He did backtrack, though, after he thought about what he said I guess.
Overall, this was a very disappointing evening.
The only downside is that thanks to all the press its hard to get in on a moment's notice -- but worth the struggle to get in.

This is a small, popular restaurant and like most small popular restaurants it is quite noisy. Not a good spot for romance, but not bad for a night out with the girls.

The food, though fresh and appealing, was salty. This was not a mistake in seasoning and moreso the addition of pork, I think. My pear salad was so salty it practically turned my mouth inside out. On the way home my husband and I kept smacking our dry, dry lips. Eventually we had to stop and grab bottles of water.
review_title: This is a small, popular restaurant

review: My lanb was very chewy and greasy and the squash salad was very tangy with too much lemon zest
review_title: My lanb was very chewy and

review: We had a fabulous meal, food was great, service was great. Wish it weren't so hard to get in! House wine by the ounce is a great idea.
review_title: We had a fabulous meal, food

review: Absolutely fabulous! We heard about Frances through a friend who had seen it mentioned in a magazine. We couldn't get an apprpriate time table for two months but it was well worth the wait :-)

After much hype we were wildly disappointed with Frances. It took us 3 months to get a table. Our next door neighbors were so close they joked we were on a double date. This might be better for groups or heavier drinking evenings, but for a 'date' we found it very challenging. The food was fine, service was infrequent and uninterested (it took 15 minutes to get a drink order in), and the tables are overly crowded. The table wine is nice, but we won't be returning.
review_title: After much hype we were wildly

review: Was excited to try Frances - had heard great reviews both from critics & friends. Perhaps expectations were too high. The food was good, not exceptional. My favorite thing was the roasted asparagus salad. I also had the scallops which were good, but a little bland. I was there w/a friend who ordered the duck & did not particularly like it - she had it before & said it was excellent, but not this time. Everyone that worked there was VERY nice, although the service was extremely slow & there were no apologies. We did not stay to try what looked like great desserts because we didn't want to stay what we thought might be another 30 min. Perhaps an off night - but not what I'd expect from a James Beard nominee. But I'd give them another shot.

The food and service were way beyond our expectations! We could not wait to get there and now we cannot wait to return. What a fantastic chef -- she will go far! And too, the server was outstanding -- friendly and attentive. The only downside is parking and noice which we were able to overcome with an early reservation. Of our many dining experiences, this is tops!

Yum! While the menu is small and many choices have a meat or meat base, there are plenty of vegetarian (not vegan) options and they aren't second thoughts! The amuse of roasted almonds was surprisingly addictive. The gnocchi was a stand-out, and I was tempted to give up 30 years of vegetarian eating to taste one of the bacon beignets! And the desserts--I'm not usually a fan of panna cotta yet the buttermilk version of it was heavenly!

Service was fun--slightly flirty, very competent and attentive.
review_title: Yum! While the menu is small

review: My new neighborhood fave!! I've been three times in the last few weeks and have been more impressed each time.

Worth the parking hassle for sure! First rate food and surprisingly well orchestrated service for such a recently-opened gem of a restaurant. If you're a group consider sharing: everything we tried on the interesting/inventive menu was perfectly prepared and delicious. Very clever starters.

The mole chicken omelette was delicious, but the eggs benny was ok. the english muffin was not toasted, and the potatoes were dry. The sunrise juice was delicious.  Views were of the bay, and the heating lamps created a warm place to enjoy them.
review_title: Healthy but more to be desired

review: The varied menu pleased 4 people with different dining desires.  I love to watch the colors change on the water when I sit outside.
review_title: The varied menu pleased 4 people with di...

review: Great food. Especially the vegan brownie. Looking for organic restaurant and this was the place to go. Many people ordering take out.
I spent a lovely evening with friends who are eating Paleo.   The food fit the bill and it was a lovely evening with great food.

I loved the fresh juices. I had a small immunity builder and it was delicious. I wish I would have gotten a medium but they are a little pricey. Breakfast was really good. There wasn't anything extraordinary about it but I was definitely satisfied and would go back again.
All in all a pretty good place. Great views of the bay and the food was above average. The service was poor to average.
review_title: good food, not so good service

review: My friend and I tried The Plant-Cafe Organic on the Embarcadero. First night of the October, 2013 Bart Strike so it was a little quieter than usual. The view from the deck at The Plant is really wonderful, and we started there, but it was a bit chilly so moved inside. Everyone on staff was very friendly and helpful. The cocktail menu is a bit limited, but the ones we ordered were excellent. We really liked the ginger rum cocktail. We just ordered small plates -- so we ordered from the appetizer and salad portions of the menu. Including fresh oysters and a great oyster sauce, we shared four appetizers and a kale salad. Everything was great. Desert: have the Tcho Chocolate cake made with locally made Tcho chocolate, right up the Embarcadero.
Delicious, healthful, organic food. Terrific organic (!) vodka. Friendly, attentive and knowledgeable waitstaff. Win-win! Check it out.

We came here right at 10 for a brunch. Service, food, and ambiance were all good and we had a nice time. Each main plate came with a small bowl of cut fruit. The bowls were already very small but they still skimped on the fruit. It almost appeared like a mistake, or leftover after a meal! For a place of this quality (with organic theme) I would have expected more, but instead they cheapened their presentation by trying to save money on fruit salad. I rather they offered it for extra on the side, vs. this. We enjoyed ourselves but there are plenty of other great brunch places in SF!
As always very good, but would like to see a menu change after almost a year going there! I am vegan and glutenfree.
review_title: As always very good, but would

review:
Arrived early for NYE and host was very welcoming.
Food was excellent and came in time. Our server was really attentive and provided us with excellent service.

We are happy diners! The menu was delicious! Will definitely come back again.

My daughter, a vegan, and I dined together and both found fabulous food options. Usually dining with a vegan is a challenge but not at Plant--there were lots of options and they all sounded so wonderful that it was hard to choose. For me, there were fish and meat options all of which were infused with interesting flavors and sides. I chose the duck and was not disappointed. Our server was attentive but did not hover. I would recommend this to anyone interested in a great meal with a fabulous view.

Great service and food with plenty of enticing healthy options. A great place to take that vegan friend or go with a few people who have different dietary needs or preferences. Amazing appetizer (chef's special) of four seasonal vegetables. My halibut was slightly overlooked bit still quite good. My friend loved her miso bowl and chocolate cake for her birthday treat.

The service has gone from marginal to occasionally rude.  This is my "go to" meeting spot because I love the food and the concept.  Sadly, the service is spotty and disorganized.  I have taken guests there twice now and they have gotten an attitude when the food did not come out the way they had asked.  Dressing on the side and simple instructions have been overlooked and met with an attitude when asked to fix it.  I keep going back in the hopes the staff will get it together.  Some of them are great but too many are marginal.

I am not sure how good the rest of the food is at the Plant Cafe, but I really enjoyed my Huevos Rancheros and my Blue Bottle latte. It was a very cold day, but we sat under the covered outside with heaters and it was warm enough. It would be great to be sitting out there on a warm , sunny day.
review_title: I am not sure how good the

review:
It is a very good place for vegan. I had vegan soup and burger which are just delicious.
I strongly recommend this place for vegan people.
review_title: It is a very good place for

review:
As a vegetarian, my food was GREAT. I had the California lentil burger & it was AWESOME, very tasty & definitely filling. My husband is NOT a vegetarian - he really liked his Chicken skewer appetizer, but his main meal chicken was the smallest portion of chicken I've ever seen & quite bland.
The service was mediocre, slow and the waiter was a bit confused, although our orders were very simple.
The ambiance was great! We sat outside on a beautiful evening that wasn't windy, the view of the black ocean, the lights of East Bay & the Bay Bridge.
Overall, this restaurant had been hyped-up too much for me, however it was a GREAT, different & flavorful lentil burger, I wouldn't recommend it to non-vegetarians or people that hate slow service.

The beet salad was bitter and the dressing was not perfect with it. The lime mango chicken sandwich was flavorless. I felt the food was not as a great the second time around. They were although accommodating.

I have been to Plant twice and really enjoyed the experience both times. The seating on the deck overlooking the water is lovely, but the heaters and clear plastic tarps keep you from getting chilly while dining. The food and drinks are great and the prices are actually quite low relative to the quality and the dining atmosphere. Plant has some wonderful salads and the entrees will please both vegetarians and carnivores alike. I really enjoyed both the halibut and the duck confit pizza that I had on my visits. The TCHO chocolate cake is a great dessert option. Plant has some unique cocktail offerings and I love that they use real ingredients instead of syrups in their drinks. The service was also great both times I've been to Plant.

So pleased to find this restaurant! Great view, friendly service, and best of all, lots of veggie/vegan offerings in a city where that is oddly difficult to find.
The Plant veggie burger is not to be missed. We'll be back again soon.
Soup and salads very good. Entrees very good. Desert was weak.

I went there for an informal business meeting after the lunch hour. Our server was very considerate of the fact that we were having a meeting and didn't interrupt us unnecessarily. The dining room had a fresh, uncluttered look and feel. Even though the kitchen is open to the dining area, we were able to easliy hear each other and focus on our tasks.

I would like to go again for a social event.
review_title: I went there for an informal

review: Great view of the bay when sitting outside. We had breakfast and the food was so-so. (I can make a better omelette). Service was lacking--had to request our drinks a couple of times, waitress was never around, busboy needs to be taught how to clear dishes,...) We will not be going back to this restaurant with so many better restaurants in the area.
review_title: Great view of the bay when
