review: The Plant Cafe offered a great selection of vegan options and the food was great. The plant burger was more like a pate but the other selections were superior.
review_title: The Plant Cafe offered a great

review: Great atmosphere, beautiful views, organic ingredients and a lovely host don't make up for the mediocre food. All the dishes tend to taste the same - yes, from the green curry to the quinoa to the chicken tikka masala to even the plant burger -they are all fairly bland and somehow taste the same. Go for the views, get a glass of wine, but skip the food. It's not worth it.
Wonderful food beautifully prepared. Vegetarian dining the way it should be!
It was a wonderful thanksgiving meal, not pretentious but delicious food and great service and the kids' plate was perfect. Would definitely go back!

We frequent Le Colonial for special occasions and dinners that are a real treat. This was an anniversary. Our table was great, we knew we wanted our favorite the sea bass steamed in banana leaves so the only thing that took forever was our server. 15-20 min to bring our Boyle of wine, another 40+ to get our dinner. We didn't want to rush, but didn't want to be ignored either.

Every year my husband and I have a special day that the two of us spend together doing something to celebrate the holidays before we get together with our families.  This year we decided on an early dinner at Le Colonial followed by Handel's Messiah at Grace Cathedral.  The whole evening was fabulous, but what really started if off well was the superb dinner at Le Colonial.  The service was very attentive, professional, and there when we needed it.  The food was absolutely delicious - everything we tried was wonderfully executed.  I can't wait to go back.  My husband had never been, but had mentioned a few times that he wanted to go and he was very happy with the choice.  I know we'll be back!

we were a party of 8. Big round table made it hard to pass all the dishes around.  Dishes are heavy.
But everyone liked it but me.  I don't care for family style...don't like passing the plates. 
Food was good, but I don't think it would be a place where I would say...oh let's go to the Colonial.
I just don't like that kind of eating. But I think I was the only one
review_title: we were a party of 8. Big round table ma...

review: Must try the brussels sprout dish... Could not decide the best dish... all always taste great...

eat here once or twice a year for past 10 years- the quality of menu items the last two times has disappointed-- over cooked and less flavorful- even one of their signature drinks was not noteworthy.  add to this the unclean and messy state of womens restroom- also no paper towels.
We had a great time celebrating my daughter-in-law's birthday at Le Colonial and the food was wonderful!
review_title: We had a great time celebrating

review: We had a great time at this restaurant! We had read some reviews that complained of service, but we had absolutely no issues. Our service was wonderful, as was the food! Along with the must have brussel sprouts, I would recommend the duck rolls and the lamb. The wine list has a nice array of prices and I highly suggest pairing a bottle with your dinner. I wish I lived closer so I could go more often.
Food as in HCMC - and all in walking distance from all major hotels!
This restaurant was awesome! I had the wok seared filet and my wife had the lamb chops. Delicious! The Brussels sprouts were the best ever! Great ambience

This 'hard to find' location opened up into a beautiful setting fit for our 25th wedding anniversary. Service was more than outstanding. Couldn't try everything on the menu but what we did try was exceptional. Would recommend this to anyone desiring a special place to celebrate a special event, or just a great dining opportunity.

Straight away, my husband and I were really impressed with the look and feel of this restaurant. It had old world charm and elegance all wrapped up in one, when I booked the table over a month ago I had requested a "nice" table as it was our wedding anniversary and sure enough when we were led to our table it was obvious we had been given one of the nicest tables in the restaurant and there was also a little card on the table wishing us a Happy Anniversary!!! This was a lovely touch!!
The food was fantastic and the service was discreet and professional, overall it was a great dining experience, one which I would hope to repeat every time we return to San Fran!! Well done Le Colonial, keep up the good work!

This was our second time at Le Colonial. The food and service were as great as last time. The only issue we had was that we continually had to flag down the server to get our drinks refilled. However, they were very busy. Otherwise everything was wonderful. Save room for dessert. The banana split was wonderful. Four of us shared it.
review_title: This was our second time at

review:
We went to dinner on Valentine's Day. The food was very good, even if it was expensive.
The service, however, was poor, perhaps because they reconfigured the dining room to accommodate many more small parties. Our waitress was friendly, but the servers brought our appetizers and our main courses to the table next to ours. When they took the neighboring tables entrees back, they came to us with them so quickly that we weren't even convinced they replated them. All that said, it took 30 minutes from the time we finished our appetizer until we were served our main courses.

Finally, they held my credit card for 20 minutes, without explanation, as I way paying. We assumed the manager was comping us for the poor service, but nothing.
review_title: We went to dinner on Valentine's

review: The food and service at le colonial is impeccable. Always. My only problem is that we went on New Years Eve and parking was $40 (we only were there for an hour at 6pm). I think it is normally $12. Also, the lobster (which is the best dish ever!) was $67. I ate there LAST WEEK and it was $59 for the SAME dish. I think it is terrible that the prices were jacked up for NYE but the food was still great as was the service
review_title: The food and service at le colonial

review: The food was very good but service was snail's pace even though we went there pre-theater at 5:30pm and it was hardly packed but was full when we left. They seem to have a lot of staff but what do they all do other than hang around??The tables are crammed closed together so you can't speak to your partner / dining companions without other's hearing what you're saying, which also means you're stuck listening to unwanted blabbing by other's around you all the time, so it's not suitable for a romantic night or a business meal. The building is beautiful and has original tiled floors and beautiful walls etc. Apparently there's a rowdy bar scene upstairs with music but didn't visit that so can't comment - isn't old age a drag!
review_title: The food was very good but

review: I've found Le Colonial to be a perfect accompaniment to a beautiful woman.
Never a bad meal. Always a big treat with great service and attention to all details.
review_title: Never a bad meal. Always a

review: Great atmosphere and a well crafted and interesting menu. The servers were attentive and the food delicious.
Our reservation was for 9:30pm and they close at 10:00pm, so as soon as we sat down they let us know that, so we have to eat in kind of a hurry.

Our group of three came early (5:30pm) so the retaurant was still empty. It very quickly filled-up after 6 pm with no open tables left. It takes a while to "digest" the colonial ("dusty") atmosphere, but then you find it very appealing.
The reason for the popularity of Le Colonial is very simple: the excellent food.
Definnitely a Come Back!

Wonderful food and wonderful service, especially impressive since we were a group of 18 people. I would recommend Le Colonial to anyone anytime. Very creative Vietnamese food with a slight French influence. Everything was delicious. The service was impeccable, the decor and building unique and warm.
The atmosphere makes this seem like a quick getaway from the city. Excellent and unique dishes that are fun to share.

Went because they advertised 3-course pre-theater meal. Advertised for 30.00, but when we arrived, it was $35.00. Deceitful. Portions were tiny. Food pretty bad. One thing came with "shrimp." It was 1 shrimp cut in 4 tiny slices. The main course - curry, was overly hot, no taste of the advertised coconut, and all potatoes with 1 tiny piece of tofu or chix (depending which you ordered). They should be ashamed. THey knew we had to get to theater, meals came quickly, but we had to ask 2 times for the check to get out of there in time.

This was our second visit to LeColonial. The first was sooooo outstanding we couldn't pass it up on our return to San Francisco! The appetizers, salads, and desert was wonderful! However, the entree wasn't as good as We remembered. It was an enjoyable evening! Service was outstanding!

What a great restaurant!  Everything was perfect - the atmosphere, service, menu, food and drinks!  We ate outside in the courtyard area and had the most amazing meal.  We had the sampler appetizer platter and a couple of their specialty dinners.  Everything was so delicious!  We will be back again for sure!!

There is nothing like sharing a big ceramic bowl of alcoholic punch with your whole table with long straws! this in itself made the evening wondering. The food was also incredibly delicious (EVERYTHING!) and the waiters were wonderful, friendly, and attentive. The swing dancing upstairs is also a must experience!

The setting is "old world" and authentic, the food is very well prepared and presented well, and the experience is of a "grown up" food establishment that knows what it is doing. The service was attentive, with excellent front desk demeanor - helpful, inviting, smooth. The wait staff at the table was also polished, though it did slip into a slightly "commercial" feel in exhorting the waiters "favorites," but this is not a new experience with restaurants. Overall, we think this is a great place to take friends and celebrate.

The M'd attempted to have the 2 of us seated at a table for 4 just beyond his podium in spite of a nearly empty room and our OT rez. The young seater defended that the restaurant was overbooked, hence, the poor initial seating. The waiter was professionaland informative as was the rest of the wait staff. The food was very tasty and the room was lovely. It would have been nice to have a red rose on the table.

Our waiter was very nice, service was good, but we were really rather disappointed with the food, after a fabulous first course of pork belly, our chicken two ways and tiger prawn dish were rather boring and the prawns were severely lacking in substance. A serving of rice would have been nice. My husband and I consider ourselves foodies, and while our visit here was prompted by the "Dine about town" promotion, we had heard good things and had been looking forward to our dinner. For our first date night out since we had a baby, I had higher hopes and I could not in good faith recommend this restaurant to anyone of our more knowledgeable friends.

It was perfection. The Le Colonial cocktail with passion fruit and an orchid was made perfectly. Each dish was delicious and absolutely perfect. Came hot each accompanying sauce was perfect for the dish. It has become my favorite restaurant. Good for any occasion. I just wish they were open for lunch more often. The service was outstanding. I cannot say anything better than it was perfect.

Outdoor dining is contingent on the weather but the inside is also very nice. We had the traditional spring roll to start as well as their beef carpachio and some mini Dungeness crab cakes, all were good. Then an order of the lamb chops, the seared beef salad and the slow roasted short ribs which were heavenly with a sticky sweet glaze.

Inventive French/Vietnamese menu, delicious food, beautifully presented, interesting tropical themed decor and reasonably priced. A pleasant exotic experience in an upscale, tourist oriented neighborhood. Very convenient to theaters on Geary with a pre-fixe $35 dinner for theater goers with tickets for the evening's performance. Just be sure to book prior to 6:30 for the dinner special. If it's a nice evening, ask for outdoor seating on the secluded patio. The restaurant is quite large and can accommodate groups and meet theater deadlines with ease. Be sure to try the basby brussel sprouts. I usually hate them, but could have eaten the entire serving dish for my main course! A definite winner that rates a return visit.
Very touristy, food is ok, but not great. Service slow and spotty at times.
food was very good as well as the drinks and wine list. very good atmosphere. great service
review_title: food was very good as well

review: We have dined at Le Colonial in SF, Chicago and NYC over the years. The SF location is definitely the most disappointing. While we liked the food and had a great server, the host sat us in a smsll corner booth and then sat another table of 3 directly next to us (6 inches away) -- in an empty restaurant. This was a special occasion, which the restaurant was notified of in advance. Even after the restaurant started to fill in, there were empty tables where our neighbors could have been comfortable.
review_title: We have dined at Le Colonial

review: Wonderful food, romantic atmosphere, we only wish we it would have been warm enough to eat in the outdoor garden. Of course, if it had been, we wouldn't have experienced the unbelievably charming interior. A must.

Our Valentine's Day dinner was perfect in every way. The food was superb, the staff extremely knowledgeable and helpful, the wine was a terrific find (2002 Bordeaux). The sommelier recommended a great pairing of Tokaji with the desert as well. Amazing special occasion restaurant, with a wonderful ambiance.

We've been dining at Le Colonial a couple of times a year for the past several years. Each time we have a better time than the last. However, this time we spent New Years Eve with them and I have to say that it has been one of the nicest New Years that we ever had.

The food was perfect, the drinks were great! And the after party had a fun friendly and festive welcoming environment. No one felt out of place there.
review_title: We've been dining at Le Colonial

review: While the sea bass was perfect, the filet mignon was too salty and over cooked. Overall it was an ok experience.
review_title: While the sea bass was perfect,

review: There was a very, very noisy group celebrating a birthday. The group was disrupting everyone sitting near them. Three tables complained to management; the manager, thankfully, asked them to quiet down. Once the group left, the ambiance improved 10 fold.
review_title: There was a very, very noisy

review: A fabulous experience all around: superb food, attentive staff, and lovely dining room. Was tempted to book a table for the very next night!

I've been here before, but the food choices I made this time around really blew me away. The crispy pork bellies are to die for, even though they always come only in a group of four. The lamb was incredible. The waitress was just fantastic as well. So overall quite an enjoyable experience. Oh last but definitely not least, the Pura Vida cocktail was sourishly GOOD!!!
Some food items are amazing, others were good. The restaurant was very responsive with making our anniversary dinner great (I mentioned it when I made the reservation.)

I got married there a few years ago and each time I go back, I know why I picked this restaurant in the first place: food, atmosphere, decor, staff... I am never disappointed. I like to come for special occasion but because of its central location, it's proved to work very well for business dinners.
review_title: I got married there a few

review: the experience was poor. it was extremely noisy from the bar music above the restaurant. the service was ridiculously slow. glasses went unfilled for excessive amounts of time and remained unfilled until a request was made. cocktails and wine were impossible to order during dinner as the waiter was rarely by the table to check on our group of 7. the food was luke-warm. one of my dinner guests had to send back her meal upon receipt, as it was steak that was brought out cold. everyone had finished eating and her steak had still not come so we canceled the order. very disappointing.

The restaurant and food was great. Nice ambiance, but once the place got crowded, it became difficult to hear. It was not impossible, just noisy. The food was excellent, even though they had run out of a dish early in the evening and forgot to tell us. The wine list was also good. The setting is lovely and the location is great. I would definitely return.

i LOVED how quiet it was in the dining room. it made conversation very easy and im so tired of really loud restaurants where you have to yell to be heard. our server was great too, and so were the bartenders upstairs!
review_title: i LOVED how quiet it was in

review: Le Colonial was amazing: from the food, to the atmosphere, to the staff.  Our waited, Jorge, took excellent care of us.  The food was pricey, but well worth every penny.  Specifically we enjoyed a few of the rolls, the filet mignon dinner, and both the green bean and noodle sides.  Also, the desserts were all decadent (we ordered a little bit of everything).  Excellent place for special occasion or night on the town.  Towards the end of the evening the dining room gets loud due to thebar upstairs, but retreating up there allowed us to cap off the evening with a little dancing and mingling.  This place comes highly recommended!
Everything we ordered was superb.  Cubed filet mignon dish and crab cakes were out of this world.
Le Colonial continues to impress.  Food, ambiance and service always top notch.  One of my favorites for a warm afternoon and ice cold mojitos.
Wonderful experience! Our server was superb, food was delicious, atmosphere was great!

Apparently Aperto has hired a "floor manager" to assist with the busy brunch crowd.  Unfortunately for the customers and it seemed the regular waitstaff, this is a very BAD idea.  First of all, it was confusing.  We didn't know if the person was a bus boy, waiter or kitchen staff.  His energy level was frenetic and off-putting and he interfered with the waitstaff and ruined our meal.  My guest was so put off by this person's behavior and constant interruption and edginess, that she didn't finish her meal and we left early.  He hovered constantly, his command of English was poor, so we didn't understand what he was asking us, he didn't know our orders, but brought the food and couldn't figure out who to give it to, and grunted at us when we didn't understand what he was doing.  We had to constantly check in with our waiter to ask what was going on and to clarify our orders.  This person dashed around the very small space and in between our table and the counter so often it was truly disruptive.  He also darted in and out of the restaurant.  Fire this person, do away with the position, let the waitstaff do their jobs or find someone who is intuitive and understands how to work with the waitstaff, customers and the kitchen.  Truly horrible, stressful experience.  Will not return unless I know this person and the way the restaurant is managed has changed.

I've eaten at Aperto several times.  (It is three blocks from my home.)  This time I had brunch and left just as happy.  The offerings were anything but run-of-the-mill.  They also aren't all that Italian.  I had chilaquiles with hangar steak, which was hearty and delicious.  The green salsa really made the dish.  We also had lamb sausage hash.  It was manly as hell, and tasted great.

Second visit - better this time out. The fennel salad was good; fresh ingredients and the vinaigrette wasn't overwhelming. The roasted chicken was actually moist and hot - not warm or room temperature, but hot. It also had good flavor. My companion had the short ribs and judged them as OK (they didn't fall of the bone and he thought the taste was just OK). Service was spotty, but the more irritating aspect is the tightness of the space. I'm fine with small places, but not when the tables are on top of each and you can easily hear (or participate) in the conversation next to you. This night the place was very crowded, hot, and loud. It's one of those (too) energetic neighborhood places which will prevent me from returning any time soon.
review_title: OK food; tight space, loud, hot

review: This is overall one of the best restaurants we have eaten at in SF. The most notable thing is how wonderful the staff is. They even comped us dessert because we were nice customers and it was our first time there. Will definitely go back! The price was also amazingly affordable for San Francisco.
review_title: So far one of the best..

review: We have been customers of Aperto for many years and had always look forward to enjoying lunches, brunches, and dinners here. However, we had the worst experience when we lunched there yesterday. Although the wait person did her job of correctly taking our order and bringing us our food, she seem bored with her job, was distant, and performed her duties mechanically. The food was a disappointment. I had the smoked salmon panini - it was on the bland side, something I could have put together at home myself, overpriced. My husband had the tagliolini repati. Although the flavor was fine, the pasta was drowned in its sauce. We had the apple tart for dessert - the crust was hard and the apples were bland. No plans to return anytime soon.

Service was excellent but the food was hit or miss. We had the califlour apitizer and the bean salad which were both excellent. We finished with the mussels which were cooked perfectly but the sauce was redolent of boiled orange juice.
Outstanding meal priced reasonably--friendly service!

Aperto's is a great restaurant. The staff is friendly, food delicious and a great atmosphere. The pastas are delicious. The smoked salmon ravioli and linguini with prawns was delicious. The ceasar salad was also very good. We look forward to dining with Aperto's again...

This is in our hood so we end up eating here once a week on average and it never disappoints.  Food is consistently delicious (chicken amazing) and the service couldn't be better.  We are lucky to have this restaurant a couple of blocks away.

As always the food and service is consistently delicious. We love the mussels and ravioli dish. We brought our children and they also enjoyed themselves even coveting the dishes on the next table. It feels good that we can always bring family and friends to Aperto and impress them.
review_title: As always the food and service

review: This is a perfect - great food, professional service, and pleasantly unpretentious -

MY husband an i went there last night to celebrate our 2nd anniversary!
The place is small but yet very welcoming. We loved the atmosphere inside. The waiter was attentive and polite. For appetizer we ordered BRUSCHETTA- ROASTED FIGS, PROSCIUTTO, TELEME FONDUTA, BALSAMIC REDUCTION, which was so delicious. Great combination of salty prosciutto and sweet juicy figs. For main course i ordered HOUSE MADE ROASTED EGGPLANT-GOAT CHEESE RAVIOLI, it satisfied all of my expectations. My husband ordered the famous lam shank. It melted on our tongues. The meat was so tender we didn't need a knife to cut it in to bite pieces. We will definitely go back for great food and excellent service.
review_title: MY husband an i went there

review: Aperto was a wonderful experience. Great neighborhood place, both our meals were delicious, service was solid, not too expensive . . . all around a good experience.
Beautifully executed food. The souffl was particularly good. Service excellent. A perfect way to wrap up a day.
A nice neighborhood place.  The food is good if not noteworthy.  The people are friendly.  There's a lovely large patio for backyard dining.

I was very excited to go to Magic Flute, it had great reviews and I love brunch! I was pretty disappointed, my food was COLD! Not luke warm, but COLD! I ordered eggs benedict with avocado, and everything from the avocado to the hollandaise, to the english muffin was ice cold, and the egg was pretty cold too! My husband's egg scramble was pretty cold as well! Probably won't be going back, but the patio is very cute!
review_title: I was very excited to go to Magic Flute,...

review: What a disappointment. Food and service good as usual. If the owners have turned the place into a brunch place for misbehaved children at the weekends, they should let diners in the neighborhood know?

We love this place even though it requires us to take 3 busses to get there

The food is terrific, the service is perfect and Phil always makes us feel like special friends

Ambience was very nice with outdoor seating area but our waiter neglected us throughout our meal and ignored our requests multiple times for: request for warm water, bread and butter, separate bowl for shells (seafood dish). The busboy/server would ultimate be the one to ask if we needed anything so we repeated our requests to him. Imagine - the busboy provided better service than the waiter! We noticed our waiter happily chatting with other guests at the next table. It took from almost an hour before even our soup and appetizer appeared. And on top of that, they reneged on our opentable points even though I gave our name when we first arrived and again as we were being seated. This was resolved after we sent in our receipt for the night.
Small but lovely, wonderful food, attentive service , cute neighborhood area

Our entire experience from beginning to end was perfect. Was greeted very warmly by the host who was more than accommodating with our request to sit outside. Patio seating was comfortable and tables spaced far enough apart where you didn't feel crowded. I had a egg scramble special that has avocado and salsa, friend had the Hunters Scramble. Both were delicious. Coffee had good flavor and was always refilled. Had to skip dessert though the offerings on the tray looked well prepared. Will go back.
review_title: Makes top brunch lists for a reason

review: One of my go-to restaurants when I have out of town guests. Consistly good, and one can actually have a conversation without shouting. Great brunch!

We went around 9pm on a Saturday and were basically the only ones there. The food was really great. The server was nice but it was a little strange because servers were leaving and they were sort of cleaning the restaurant around us. I know they wanted to go home but it was weird. I'd go back at a busier time for a better ambiance because the food was delicious!!
review_title: We went around 9pm on a Saturday

review: Wonderful experience - the brunch items were delicious, and the desserts were spectacular. Our waiter, who was also the pastry chef (family-owned business), was absolutely charming and accommodated our every need. We liked it so much that we went back later in the week, even with all the options that San Francisisco has to offer.

This was such a fantastic find. Cozy atmosphere, great food, stellar service from smiling and very patient server who kept smiling as friends and I caught up and kept forgetting to look at the menu. Wonderful enclosed back space with heaters. We went to early brunch and enjoyed the pre-crowd quiet. Kid friendly, too!

Birthday celebration. Thought it'd be quiet but there was a large group in the room. Certainly is a neighborhood kind of place and filled up during the evening. So noise level was quite loud. Food was OK, but not exceptionally good. Don't need to return for a while, but is a good neighborhood spot if you can't get in anywhere else.
Delicious food, great service - we love the patio. Our waitperson remembered us, which is nice.
fabulous... a gorgeous day so we ate outside and were sheltered from the wind. one of my favorite brunch spots...
Very warm and inviting ambience and stellar service.  Friendly, adaptive, personal.  A place I'll go back to as often as I can.

Saison is an experience that challenges all of your senses. From the tasteful decor,  the superb and youthful yet respectful service staff, to the exquisite talents of their sommelier and the food that floats to your table, the Saison restaurant is one that deserves stars...lots of stars! It is a work of art that is vibrant, fun loving, yet provocative. It is original yet familiar and the wine pairings take the food into the stratosphere! We enjoyed the flight and are planning our next trip back. A thank you to all of the hard work, research, talent, creativity, and tenacity that went into dinner.

Wow! Wow! Wow! This meal was extraordinary. I'll admit, I was intimidated when they said the prix fixe tasting menu did not have a set price as the chef was making it up as he went along. But this meal was exquisite, delicate, refined and worth every penny - more pennies than even the French Laundry BTW. The sommelier did a lovely job pairing beautiful wines for us while respecting that we wanted to sip on a budget, and the bartender did a lovely job reinventing classic cocktails like his lovely white negroni. And having the chefs bring out their dishes personally made it both classy and unstuffy somehow. Loved watch them make their magic in the open kitchen and if you're lucky, you might get a tour. If I were doling out Michelin stars - 3!

Two tasting menus, 16 course or 25 course. Many small courses primary fish some of which is fresh from Japan. A wonderful journey of unique flavors. Excellent wine paring. Outstanding service. With wine paring, cost is about $500 per person and worth every penny. A fabulous experience I highly recommend.
review_title: Two tasting menus, 16 course or 25 cours...

review: We have done many tasting menus and really enjoy the experience. However, the food was below the level of the cost. We did one wine pairing and we thought that the chosen wine was far below standards for $248. Not one wine stood out. The food was clever and beautifully presented, but vastly over priced for our experience. The wait staff, ambience, atmosphere was brilliant! Bar was exceptional! Just needed "more," in food area for the price. Maybe order from the menu and enjoy the experience that way. Respectfully, Mark
Hands down Saison is the best restaurant in the Bay Area. The food is creative and innovative, yet delicious. Everything cooked over fire -- love it.

The twenty or so tiny courses of the tasting menu were absolutely delicious. Watching the team of chefs and sous-chefs prepare these many dishes in the open kitchen within view of some of the diners was an additional treat - a bit of gastronomic theater! An unforgettable dining experience for the adventuresome gourmet...with an unforgettable price tag!
Food was mote a showcase of what the could do as opposed to what might actually taste good. Chef was also very rude.
review_title: Food was mote a showcase of

review: Just behind PerSe as the best meal I have had in the US.
review_title: Just behind PerSe as the best

review: Interior dining room left exposed to outside air, so it is chilly. Light shawls draped over chairs.

The way I see it, if a couple is going to spend $320 (w/out wine pairing) to $500 (w/wine) on a dining experience, the food, atmosphere and service should be outstanding--this was not my experience at Saison. 1) Food: Ingredients were good, but common. The style of preparation was lovingly time-intensive, but I wasn't wowed. We did not opt for the wine pairing since my boyfriend can not drink wine--I hope that the pairings elevate the experience for some. 2)Service: Friendly, but painfully slow. After a long work day I want to be further into dinner than the second course by the second hour of a meal. 3)Ambiance: The courtyard is super drafty and cold, even with heat lamps--diners inside appeared cozy.
review_title: The way I see it, if a couple

review: Wonderful and diverse preparations on a set menu. Wine pairing was fabulous and generous. Highly recommended for a great experience.
My experience at Saison was extremely memorable and intriguing. I will be sure to go back.

Lovely place, but a lamb sandwich at lunch was thick soggy white bread filled with a small amount of fatty overcooked lamb, worse than any inespensive shwarma shop; mixed with more oil and olives and peppers. Unappetizing. Freind's shrimp sandwich eaqually poor, with undercooked onion rings on the side. Waiter inattentive, ignored empty water glasses. 
The gorgeous, elegant ambiance ( and prices) call for quality food at least.
Come back, Rose Pistola! You can do it!
review_title: bad lunch in a beautful place

review: Group of 9, they were ready right on time and prompt with getting drinks. They had good timing on appetizers and meals as well. The salmon was a little dry but the corn with it was delicious. We sat in the back at a long table and it wasn't as noisy as it was closer to the bar.
Good restaurant--not sure if I would return after being reported as a no show--too many other good options in SF
review_title: Good restaurant--not sure if I would ret...

review: Decided to give this place a try because I love the North Beach neighborhood feel and the prior ratings were overall positive.  The service was quite poor and the overall meal experience suffered because of it.  The food was mediocre and was certainly not worth the $30+ entree cost.  If your looking for a nice spot to dine tonight in North Beach keep looking around.

Best meal of our weekend trip. Everything was made with fresh ingredients and cooked to perfection. Order the Caponata salad the tuna is so tender and flaky..they poach it themselves instead of out of the canfabulous!
Food was amazing. Service was great. You will enjoy it.

Three of us enjoyed outdoor lunch early afternoon. Waiter very nice, even brought us a few
bread sticks to go with the yummy bread. Nice meal.

Had a cozy round booth for our party of 6. Fabulous Italian wine list-- the waiter was v knowledgeable about the wine. Shared appetizers-- don't miss the zucchini chips! And salads as well as several pizzas. The service was fantastic. Loved the food, really cant be beat for a nice leisurely lunch. The menu features seasonal items.
Our waitress was knowledgeable and provided timely and friendly service. The food was fresh and delicious. We sat by the window, watching San Francisco go by as we dined. Outstanding!

I have eaten at Rose Pistola perhaps 10 times over ten years. It is usually crowded and quite loud, but was only about 3/4 full this visit. The food was very good as usual. We started with an appetizer of risotto fritters which were OK (I usually get the grilled octupus which is much better but my dining companions recoiled at eating octopus). My salad was generous in size and very fresh. For entrees, we had three pastas and a pizza. The pastas were all good, the best being the braised short rib ragout (with penne). I didn't try the pizza; it looked good. Desserts were very good; I had a chocolate bombe which was excellent. Our bottle of wine (Sangiovese) was reasonably priced and very tasty. Service was just great.
review_title: I have eaten at Rose Pistola

review: there were 4 of us, we ordered 4 appitizer and 4 2nd, for the amount of money I paid for the food, I don't think is worth it, the Pasta is good, but for $20, you don't get much, so is the Lobster Resoto, we also order the Truffle Cheese, it did not have any truffle in it, I think it was just Brie, over all, it was ok, not great!The wine were good, I guess for $50 a bottle, it should be excellent!
review_title: there were 4 of us, we ordered

review: Nice place but it is hard to drive to. Allow plenty of time to make a bunch of U-turns. Best plan is park somewhere away from North Beach and cab it. With an $11 plus tips charge for valet parking you'll break even.
review_title: Nice place but it is hard

review: Great Sunday evening dining experience! Varied menu gave everyone in our group numerous options. We had a wonderful dinner from appetizers (try the zucchini chips!) through dessert. Live jazz added a great backdrop to a very special evening.

The service was great! The wine menu was huge, and the waiter was great in helping to choose the best wine with our food. The food was great as well. It was a little over priced for the quality, but the overall experience was worth it.

Best new restaurant of 1996 tells you what you need to know. Pleasant service in a chain restaurant sort of way but there is nothing remarkable about the food - Pasta Pomodoro at three times the price. San Francisco dining has come a long way in the fifteen years since RP opened. leave this one to the convention visitors to meet their dated stereotype image on what to expect in SF.
We love the location, atmosphere and service, but the food is the actual piece de resistance! They happily timed our dinner to accommodate our theater call.
They sat us in the circle booth at the front, which was great. Great music, excellent chow. I love this place, been going for years.
review_title: They sat us in the circle

review: Visit every time I get to San Francisco. Have been going since 2008. Just keeps getting better. Great open views of North Beach Broadway scene. superb, inventive, healthy food that is totally satisfying. Very nice wine list that totally complements the food and is fairly priced with a very good selection by the glass. Service is very professional, but friendly and unobtrusive. Sunday Brunch is exceptional.
Wonderful early dinner on Christmas Eve. Happy that we have come back here again!

We went a little early for the San Francisco crowd (around 7:00) so when we arrived the restaurant was fairly empty. By our departure at 9:00, there was a lively and energetic crowd. We loved both the quiet and the energy that we experienced that night. The bread was outstanding. Be sure to ask them to warm it up and ask for olive oil instead of butter. The rest of our meal was very good as well. We shared a couple of things and as usual, I wish I could have eaten more.Whatever I saw being served looked wonderful and my temptation to ask for a taste had to be squelched.
review_title: We went a little early for

review: Service started off very good, but quickly went downhill. Our table was ignored after drinks were served, which affected our overall dining experience.

favorite dish has been the chopped salad, which wasn't as good this time as we recalled.

server didn't get order right, but did fix it promptly.

would go back.

Calamari was rubbery and sent back for replacement, so I sat and waited while my 7 companions ate. Waiter also forgot my order of mashed tomatoes. 18% gratuity included a percentage of the 15% corkage fee, even though we only ordered 1 glass of wine! Arrgh!

I'll never go there again!!!
Good traditional Italian restaurant in North Beach, short walk from our hotel in Fisherman's Wharf.

Food was very good and unique menu made for a very enjoyable evening. Waiter was friendly and knowledgeable, but he was not present. We had to find him more than once just to get basic service. I rated the service fair because the folks backing him were quite good. We'll likely return, but hope for a different server.
review_title: Food was very good and unique

review: Outsanding service, great food and interesting menu

The beet and roasted treviso salad and the chopped salad were excellent. The prawns with polenta were pretty good, though I didn't like the puttanesca sauce much. It was very noisy, what with the open kitchen and all.
Way too expensive for the quality of food (good but nothing special) and service (very slow).
we ordered two margaritas- $52.00 was the charge- way too much.The food was very good, and our server was great.

We went for my wife's birthday, a fact that I mentioned on the reservation and to the person who called to confirm the day before.  Sadly, no acknowledgment of this was made at any point during our dinner - even a candle on her dessert would have been nice.
review_title: We went for my wife's birthday,

review: We used Christmas Eve dining.  What a treat to discover the cafe at Hotel Majestic. It was quiet, elegant and lent just the right touch to a memorable evening dining with our college aged son. It was wonderful not to fight the crowds, nore to be overwhelmed by loud music.  The food was good, not great. But, a nice tradeoff on food to have such an atmosphere!  The service was also outstanding, particularly given that the ONE waiter was not prepared for such a crowd.
review_title: We used Christmas Eve dining.  What a tr...

review: No, no,no,no, never again and they will be closing soon.

The Presidio Caf has much to offer in terms of ambience and location. Our waiter was excellent. Unfortunately the food was not good and bad enough that we would not return. The hamburger was greasy, the fries tasted frozen and reheated, they were out of pita bread for the pita and chips appetizer,if the food were as good as the Presidio social club, I believe they would have an outstanding business
review_title: The Presidio Caf has much to offer in t...

review: Presidio Cafe is still one of my favorite places for lunch (or brunch), and they still make one of the best Cobb Salads in town. They have been working on the menu in recent months, and it seems like they have finally tweaked it to their satisfaction. The daily special menu seems more sparse than before, but it still offers good options and the main lunch menu more than makes up for it with a generous number of options in all categories. There is not a lot of ambience (unless you get seated near the fireplace) and the conversation around can get a little loud depending on the number of people. However, it is a great place to connect for lunch and enjoy a meal and good conversation.

I really liked our first experience at the Presidio Cafe. Great place to meet with friends and have lunch. I'd like to rate a 3+ as the food was just a little bit off. Our grilled chicken was a bit overdone. The chicken pot pie could have had a little more chicken and a lighter white sauce. I love them to try a homemade pie crust on top of the pot pie and not the puff pastry as the 'old school' approach would be great in this wonderful setting. But all in all ..... its worth it. Go.
review_title: I really liked our first experience

review: The chicken pot pie was particularly good and I'd go back for that alone. The decor is also very nice. I've been there several times and have always liked the ambiance. It's an especially nice place to have lunch with old friends because it isn't noisy, like a lot of other restaurants.
review_title: The chicken pot pie was particularl

review: Everything was good except that the brunch food was average. The brunch menu could be a bit larger without taxing the kitchen too much, and the ingredients were not as fresh as I would have expected. The personnel and service were excellent.

Comfortable environment which wasn't too busy on a Saturday afternoon. Atmosphere was relaxing overlooking hedges onto the golfing greens. Rated the food as "fair" because it wasn't as well made as expected. Eggs benedict were overcooked and egg yolks were barely runny. Side of roasted potato weren't crispy as if they were pre-cooked and kept warm. Cantaloupe in fruit bowl didn't appear freshly cut (edges were rounded and soft with slight translucency). Will Presidio Cafe give another chance for lunch because previous experience with lunch menu was great.

Making a reservation for Jai Yun was easy on OpenTable, but if you need to contact the restaurant with question and make changes was a bit hard if you don't speak Mandarin Chinese.  The chef speaks very little english, but tries very hard to communicate and accommendate.  We had a group of 11 people and everyone had a great time.  I loved the 8 - 10 small cold dishes as starters.  It is fresh, unique and delicious.  I lost count on how many hot items we received, but I like the concept that it started small and get larger as the dishes progresses.  IMHO, everything was expertly prepared and flavor was well balanced.  A good advice someone gave me is to let the chef know what price you are paying when making a reservation(if it is not just the minimum), it will help him plan your meal better.
review_title: Making a reservation for Jai Yun was eas...

review: One of the most unique places to dine. Daily menu & an array of dishes keeps the suspense on. We got 8 appetizers and 8-9 entres for the $98/ p menu. The portions are smaller, the variety is fascinating (its all very, very savory though) and the chef is a master with the knife. They were able to accommodate special requests easily - I am vegetarian and my husband does not eat beef and pork - nice! I never realized chinese cooking can be so delicate and I have never tasted such unique mushroom, bean curd and eggplant dishes. Don't bother dressing up, as its a very casual place, which btw, is odd for the $ you are spending, but the food is still unique. Tip - go hungry, its still a lot of food! And, no dessert btw. Will go again in a group
review_title: One of the most unique places

review: I've been here for lunch 3 times now, and it gets better.  The pastas are great.  I absolutely love the risotto.  And don't forget to order a side of  polenta.

Great place, excellent italian confort food. Staff was friendly and accomodating. The brussel sprouts and polenta side dishes were excellent. The meatballs were excellent. In all it was an excellent dining experience.
review_title: Great place, excellent italian confort f...

review: Delicious food - especially the various bruschetta options - peach and prosciutto is my favorite.  Busy but attentive service (they helpfully leave a water carafe, though, so you needn't worry about an empty glass).  Good energy.  At least at lunch, private tables are limited - mostly shared tables or bar seating.  Not necessarily a bad thing, but worth knowing going in!
Used to have better executed dishes and bigger too.  Brussel sprouts are still amazing, desert was great, but other than that all forgettable.  Still a nice spot, but not as outstanding as once was.
We enjoyed the overall dcor and the service, bright and cheerful.

Love the ambiance, great service and wait staff. Food was disappointing. Great efforts - but overly salty and not well explained on the menu. I ordered the salad with tuna and it was literally an overly salted, oily tuna salad on a bed of greens. Disappointed. In the past I've had great experiences here though... Perhaps it was an off day?..
The cheaper sibling resto to Perbacco. The food is reasonably priced and really good.
review_title: Nice, Casual Place with Great Food

review: The food and the service are great. But the need to speak loudly constantly in order to be heard by friends who are dining with me is very tiring.
Barbacco makes dining a pleasure with knowledgable staff, comfortable modern interior in bright fun colors and consistent dishes with variety.

Immediately following our appetizers the server asked if we wanted dessert. We reminded him that we had ordered entrees. The entrees did not arrive for another 45 minutes. No apology. Upon leaving the restaurant we realized that we never received the side dishes we had ordered. We reviewed the details of the bill to discover that we were indeed charged for them but decided it was not worth the effort to return to Barbaxxo to voice the discrepancy.

Food was delicious and service friendly and efficient -- a little too efficient. We felt like we were being rushed when our mains came at the same time as our apps were cleared. I understand needing the table, but our reservations were at 5pm and there were plenty of seats still available when we left. It would have been nice to linger a bit and have time to digest.

Table was not ready for a 11:30am reservation. Given that I had an early lunch reservation, felt rushed. Also was confused on who was our server since multiple individuals approached our table for drinks and bill.

Shrimp sandwich was a bit salty and shrimp was sparingly spread on the bread.
review_title: Table was not ready for a

review: Food was good, service, although nice people was really sub par. Orders messed up repeatedly at our table. Never quite sure who out server was as we had four of them... Won't go back.
Casual, Trendy and Yummy small plates. Good vibes.

Akways fun, reservation recommended or expect at least a 2 drink wait. Last couple of times were seated at bar area, will try to remember to request a table. Have sat at communal tables before and these can be fun and sociaable with other patrons. Food is seasonal. Gnocchi bread is served with the prosciutto, would recommend this. Nice size plates, good for sharing.
Exceptional food; great service and moderate prices - excellent value.
Great service, delicious food, and outstanding location. Perfect!

We had reservations and were seated at the bar. Initially I cared, but my dining companion and I able to have a private conversation. Service was outstanding as was the pork sandwich. Portions just right. Would not recommend for a business lunch.

I'm over this place. Clueless service - always wait for ages even with a reservation. Odd offset tables that put your neighbour closer to you than your dining companion. It's not so great that you want to go out of your way.
review_title: Not as good as they think they are

review: Another Diva Nite (minus one). We enjoyed ourselves from the scenery, to the decor, to the food. We would love to come again & bring our other friend (the minus one). We ordered: flat iron steak tagliata w/ roasted sweet onions rucola, parmigiano reggiano & a side of fried palenta w/ parmigiano reggiano. Bruschette: peperonata, basil & olive oil. Lasagna Bolognese w/ spinach pasta, meat ragu, balsamella sauce. Dessert: chocolate nemesis cake. The meal was delicioso!!! The pricing is very reasonable..... Service....great!
I always enjoy this restaurant. One minor complaint: some of their smaller plates like crostini and risotto balls are kind of pricey. Better off going to salads or pastas for a better value.
One of my all time favorate go to places. Barbacco never fails to impress. The menu is carefully crafted to wow you one bite at a time.
Though crowded, service was still good. Had the shaved asparagus salad and it was REALLY GREAT!!!

Barbacco always delivers on food and service. I've come to like Barbacco more than Perbacco because the atmosphere is fun and vibrant and the service is fantastic. The small plates are very unique, tasty, and fun to share. The burrata dish is lovely, as are the Bruschettas. The service is outstanding from being greeted by the manager when I walked in, to having the hostess work with me on a table when I booked the wrong night, to our waiter always having the best wine recommendations. The only disappointment about this restaurant is the communal and counter seating. If you're looking for a table for two that is a bit more private, then this is not the right restaurant. I've had to book elsewhere several times for this reason.

Some stellar dishes (pork ragu, farro risotto, bruschettes) and some average dishes (minestrone soup, apple - celery salad). Great italian wine selection. Many of the same wines you'll find at A16 and Flour + Water. I'll be back...
review_title: Great wine, good food, OK service

review: Ventilation could be improved. It was rather warm in the restaurant.
Very good food at very reasonable prices. So much fun to share plates and have a variety of tastes. It's my second time eating here while visiting SF, and I look forward to returning.
review_title: Very good food at very reasonable

review: Food is great, service is very good, interesting wine selections, noisy with close tables, Ipad wine list is fun.

I've been here before for some great dinners, but this was the 1st lunch.
Great lunch menu. Had the pork shoulder sandwich with a small salad and a fish soup on the side. For $16 it was an amazing deal and a very tasty meal.
I love this place. The menu is great and everything is terrific. It was a wonderful choice for a sorta special lunch.
review_title: I love this place. The menu

review: I love this place. After 2 visits, Barbacco is turning into my favorite spot pre-movies at Embarcadero. The food is delicious. Highly recommend the bruscetta, meatballs, brussel sprouts, chicken thighs, farro (if you are a mushroom lover), and more. The wine list comes on an ipad, which is novel and fun. The service is attentive, helpful and very professional. And when the check arrives, it surprisingly low!

Very unique, Super ingredients. Warm friendly service. The 'nduja (smoked Calabrian salame pinne e conchiglie) an awesome app...Essentially a charcuterie blended into a topping for crostina. Delicious. Sicilian meatballs with raisins and pine nuts / braised chard / tomato sugo also amazing. Another not to miss is the fried Brussels sprouts / capers / anchovy shallot-red wine vinaigrette. Add these items with a pasta, a brushetta and you've got a great dinner.
Pasta is so good here and prices are good, too. I love Perbacco but this is a nice alternative depending on who you are with and the occasion.
review_title: Pasta is so good here and

review: I'm kind of boring and keep ordering the meatballs. They are so good with the pine nuts and the amazing sauce (third time). I've tried different appetizers and the fried artichokes are to die for. The place is great and the wait staff is very knowledgeable and friendly.
review_title: I'm kind of boring and keep

review: This was our first time at Barbacco and we were delighted! The restaurant is beautiful, the food outstanding and the service was superb! We will definitely be back!
review_title: This was our first time at

review: Our waiter had someone training with him and I loved his rcommendations. Our food was unique and so yummy!!!

Food was good. Hate the fact that even if you make a reservation, you are seated at a communal table - whether or not you want to be. AND, the hostesses are some of the least friendly in the financial district!!! I would go back for the food on a take out basis.
review_title: Food was good. Hate the fact

review: Some of the meat was extremely delicious.  The salads were excellent.  The cost was out of this world.  It is all you can eat, so if you have a very large appetite this is the place for you and the cost may seem more appropriate.  We don't eat large portions so the final bill was pretty unreasonable.
review_title: Some of the meat was extremely delicious...

review: We went here for a birthday dinner. The food was disappointing, there was a wide variety of meats, but not much flavor and at times a little dry. The same goes for the little cheese puffs, polenta and bananas served as a side, they weren't really bad, but not really good either. Lots of choices at the salad bar, and everything was nice and fresh and well laid out, and I did find some delicious greens and such to eat there. But you don't go to a place like this for the salad bar. For four people the total bill was $300 and I would say it was not worth the money.

Excellent food. Meat just kept coming and kept my husband happy!! Excellent service- love the uniforms by the way. Love the building and decor. Can't say I was disats with anything!! Def returning with my family.
A delicious selection of meats, sides and drinks! A little pricey, but totally worth it.

Being on a restricted Paleo diet I always seem to have to compromise in restaurants---not here!  Not only is the meat delicious and varied, from lamb to chicken hearts, but I could spend the entire time at the salad bar. Everything is so fresh and so well prepared and so delicious. This was my sixth visit to Espetus and I am from out of town!  I am already planning my next trip.

Each time we choose to have a good time with friends we come to this restaurant.
The service is great and the food is always a treat. We enjoyed the wine, too. Thank you.

Just fantastic all around! The pineapple mint limeade was delicious (non-alcoholic)! The meat was really tasty and tender. Great salad bar with lots of fresh selections. Really loved the fried plantains/polenta/bread.
Good stop in the Civic Center to fill up before the performance.

A night at this restaurant will leave you more than satisfied. Great variety of juicy meats, an enormous salad bar, yummy deserts and outstanding cocktails! The staff was genuinely friendly and very attentive. I definitely wish this restaurant was in my city Gteborg, Sweden.

I took my date here for his birthday and the food was amazing. All of the different types of meats had soooo much flavor to them. If you are anything like me who uses steak sauce and tobasco, it is not needed when you come. Using any sauces would be an insult! All of their meats are very tender and juicy & their sangria is a must try. The salad bar is amazing and I would suggest you go light on the salad bar because the buffet of meats will get overwhelming. One thing I did not enjoy as much was that the shrimp was a little too cooked which made it a little hard to peel but other than that, it was a great experience and I will definitely be back!

I consider myself as a person who loves eating meat, but it has to be a good one which I can be able to enjoy no matter the price.
The salad buffet was incredible, all the food was rich in flavor and fresh, but the reason I went to the restaurant was for the meat. I have been to other brazilian restaurants which serve the meat as you do, all the meat was cook perfectly but it was lacking of flavor... it needed rock salt to make it richer! .. but everything else was pretty good, but i dont think i would come back.
Great service, ample amt of food, great selection.
Amazing service and food. I dropped my fork and had a new one in five seconds. Impeccable! Thank you for making my husbands birthday so special!

We have been going to Espetus since it opened. While the service is wonderful, the clientele and the food have gone downhill. It has always been a very lively atmosphere which my husband and I love, but now it almost resembles going to very loud bar. This would be great if you are not paying $55 for the all you can eat meat service. When you include drinks and tip, you are at $200. Just not worth it as because the clientele has gone downhill, so has the quality of the food. Fogo de Chao is coming to SF and they are nationwide, and the locations in Vegas and South Beach are stellar. I am almost certain the same will occur here. We will be going there when it opens
Amazing service, great food. What more could you ask for!
Very nice and clean location. Service was outstanding and the food was good.

Excellent service, very good meats though not much choice in terms of how rare or well done. The salad bar was somewhat disappointing, especially when my companion had only the salad bar and it was only $10 less than the $50 full dinner.
Our first time there and definately won't be the last!! My husband and I really enjoyed it!!! Wonderful food and great atmosphere!!
review_title: Our first time there and definately

review: Delicious!!!!!! Everyone is super friendly. The food is very good and the meat brings water to your mouth.....

As far as Brazilian Steakhouses go, i thought that the foot was sub-par. Many of the dishes were dry and almost inedible. i.e the pork and bacon wrapped chicken, and the only flavoring on some was parmessean cheese. Not the best food at all. The salad bar was nice, but the warm dishes were barely warm. The service of the waiter was fantastic, yet the demeanor of the guys that bring around the food left something to be desired.

We had planned on going to the City for the opera and to have dinner. By the end of the night, top billing went to the dinner. The opera just couldn't out-do the experience we had at Espetus. This was the first time we had been to a brazilian steakhouse, and the wait staff were very helpful walking us through it. The "salad bar" was amazing. EVERYTHING was delicious. They were serving 14 different cuts of meat. I think we only got through about 6 or so before our stomaches began to cry "uncle!" We did save room for dessert and we were so glad we did. We can't wait to go back!
we had a lovely evening. service: superb. attention to detail: great. food: delicious! our anniversary: made more special by a complimentary glass of champagne!! a lovely way to celebrate

Wow! A bit pricey but worth it. We had a great time; the staff was friendly, helpful and very attentive. At the end our waiter even went back to get some more ribs brought around even though all I wanted was just a taste. Top notch service!
review_title: Wow! A bit pricey but worth

review:
I and my friends loved Espetus. The meats were all tastey and just kept on coming and the food on the salad bar was all standout excellent.

Desserts were delicious.
review_title: I and my friends loved Espetus.

review: This place was amazing. The food was delicious, the service flowed, a great cocktail list and, even with a hearing problem, I could actually hear my dinner companion; something I can rarely do.

It's everything I expected from a Brazilian BBQ place and more. Lots of variety in food choices including the self serve buffet. Food servers were friendly and educating. Great experience and will return with a larger appetite.

This is a nice gem that is much nicer on the inside than on the outside. The salad/hot bary is amazing. One caveat is that this place is really all about meat - so not such a great choice for non meat eaters. Desserts are also great!
review_title: This is a nice gem that is

review: Food was awesome. Staff was very attentive. They also asked us if we wanted a particular cut of meat that we had tried. Great salad bar with different varieties. Paella was awesome. Reasonable corkage free.

This is a steak house - if you are a vegetarian, go somewhere else. The one exception was the mango salad - exceptionally good. Go hungry - there is an abundance of meat - the best was the fillet mignon wrapped in bacon and the chicken - the shrimp was overcooked
review_title: This is a steak house - if

review: Having been to several Brazilian steakhouses I can't say that I am overly impressed nor am I terribly disappointed. It simply is what it is... the only Brazilian steakhouse in San Francisco.

The food was awesome. My husband who is very hard to please, enjoyed himself . We all had a very good time trying out the 12-14 different kinds of meats . WE especailly enjoyed the Bacon wrapped chicken and the paramesan steak The BEST. We defintely will be going back
review_title: The food was awesome. My husband

review: The setting was perfect as well as the service. Meat was great especially the parmesian pork. Its a great price for all the food you get. Would definitly go back again.
Great experience, food keeps coming. Very attentive staff.

I've been to other Brazilian BBQ's in the past and I would have to say I wasn't that impressed with this one. The different types of meat came out slower then expected. The beef's, chickens were good but the pork's seemed to be dry. The chicken hearts were all that bad. I was a bit disappointed they wouldn't let me use a coupon I received by joining their mailing list because instead of printing it out I had it on my mobile phone as an email. They refused and said it must be printed (I was just trying to be eco-friendly lol)

Overall it wasn't anything I was thrilled about.

We had a great dining experience here. The meats were unbelievable! You lived up to your moto "you won't leave hungry". The wine was an excellent recommendation from your staff. Desserts were fantastic and service was prompt and friendly. This was one of the most memorable dinners I've had. I have been telling my friends and family about how good it was.
My only suggestion is the loudness of the room, it was very loud and made it hard to converse at our table and with the staff.
Keep up the great work. I can't wait to come back!
review_title: We had a great dining experience

review: It was fun. We got a bad table back in the corner, but the food tastes the same no matter where you sit and it very good.
review_title: It was fun. We got a bad table

review: The food was wonderful. I enjoyed my dinner with my husband. There was an over abundance of foods. Delicious! I highly reccomed this restraunt!

A lot of meat, with ribs and top sirloin being the best. The grilled pineapple was especially good. Otherwise, I have experienced better churrascuria places before, and the high price ($50 pp) does not make it as good a deal as it could be...
review_title: A lot of meat, with ribs and

review: On January fourth I and two friends calebrated my birthday at on of my favorite restaraunts, Espetus Churascaria. The ambiance was very nice and seemed to be recently remodeled. The restaraunt was excaptionally clean and pleasant. Our Service was fantastic. The only glitch in the entire experience was the outrageous $30 a bottle corkage fee! I have worked and dined at many fine restaurants in San Francisco and have never come across such a high corkage fee. I feel that this information should be listed on the restaurants web site somewhere as to lessen the shock we felt when we were told of the fee. Other than the corkage, our experience was excellent and I will definately return.
review_title: On January fourth I and two

review: This was an amazing experience. From the wonderful food, the diverse wine selection, to the prompt and attentive service we were thrilled! I would recomend this to anyone who loves food. It was easy to have good converstaion as it was never too loud or unbalanced. Everything exceeded our expectations!
Espetus is a relaxed and very friendly place with very good "energy".  Good for groups, birthdays etc if you like meat because it's a set price and no one has to order.
review_title: Espetus is a relaxed and very

review: I have been there a few times and really loved it but the last time we went, most of the meats were overcooked! :-(
review_title: I have been there a few times

review: Food was really good, but it was Valentine's Day and it was WAY to expensive for what you got. We were sat at a table on the patio that was not sturdy and felt like it was going to fall apart. When we sat, we had no napkins or silverware. We had to ask for water 3 different times, and our first waiter didn't know what was in a certain dish and had to go ask someone. Needless to say, they sent us a different waiter who was great. When you only have 3 dishes on the menu for a set menu for Valentine's Day, it was hard to believe that our first waiter didn't know what 1 out of 3 dishes were.
review_title: Food was really good, but it was Valenti...

review: I've always come at lunch, and lunch is always a treat. Even when the room is full, the noise level is decent, the service is excellent, and the food is delicious. I always encourage my lunch-mates to start with the artichoke and brussel sprout "fritti", which is perfectly seasoned and perfectly cooked. Just the right taste to start a meal. I love the steak salad, because I can get the meat cooked just the way I like it, and it's moist and flavorful, on top of crisp lettuce with fresh and flavorful lemon vinaigrette. The hamburgers are also great - plump and moist and obviously not pre-frozen, with a soft fresh bun. The pasta of the day is also a good bet because there are always interesting combinations.

If the weather is nice, this could be my new goto for Brunch in the city.
Great service, food, selection for multiple food issues (low sodium, vegan, etc.)

Loved our brunch here on New Year's Day! The staff was very friendly; the brunch was decent for the price. I was especially thankful that the management accommodated my vegan daughter's meal request, in spite of it being a buffet brunch. I would return here in the future!
review_title: Loved our brunch here on New

review:
Chadwick was the best
Great food, Bravo to the chef

We ate here a year ago and had a great meal. The food this time was average. The service was terrible, we literally had to wave our arms and stand up to get the attention of our waiter. He walked by frequently but never seemed to look at hus. It was not a busy night, it rather ruined an evening we were bringing out-of-town friends to.
review_title: We ate here a year ago and

review: I visited the restaurant with a group of girlfriends and the bar scene is amazing. There is a nice mix of people and there is room to sit and stand. The bar is noisy so if you ar trying to catch up, stay for dinner after because the restaurant is more intimate and quieter. While the service is great and the menu is pretty diverse, the food itself was not great. Overall a good experience but I wouldn't just go for the food
I took business guests here for lunch. Everyone was pleased with the food and I've been craving the fries ever since. I'll be back soon!

Food is okay,good but too pricy for a small appetizer. The server was very upbeat with happy face the whole time.I dined with my boss who is a big/tall guy (6'7") and the receptionist seated us in a squeezy little table next to the kitchen. I don't think it is not quite thought of by the reception person you got. Just a recommendation, to train your staff to be aware of this types of people and needs before seating them.Thank you,

We decided to dine here after our spa treatments upstairs. When I made the reservations, I was worried for my partner who is vegan. But I just gave the maitre d a heads up and they actually listened. My partner was extremely happy about it. I love the flat iron steak I ordered. The food was excellent. Service was excellent. I would go back here again and recommend it to others.
review_title: We decided to dine here after

review: great location (the view's incredible from the patio). poor service. not sure if our waitress simply had a tough day (which will all have from time to time) or if it is the routine. simply noted, we won't be going back any time soon as there are ample other choices wihtin 2 blocks.
The arugula, asparagus, artichoke, truffle salad was outstanding!!! We had a great evening; we highly recommend it!

Outstanding: emphasis on local, organic ingredients; attentive, unobtrusive service (our most recent server went beyond the call, comping us a side that she felt would complete both of our entree selections); well-executed, creative menu. This restaurant has gradually evolved into a bar destination for younger, upscale urban execs and tech workers in the SOMA neighborhood, so it's a bit louder than it once was. But the kitchen has remained consistent and the foodie qualities haven't suffered from this new dimension.
very nice... we ate inside but felt outside. Quite enough for a business lunch
As always, it was a great experience after having an evening at the Spa Vitale.
review_title: As always, it was a great

review: My first thought was to bring my guest to the waterfront. Then I came to my senses and went with what I feel is a less fleeting and more classic, Embarcadero staple at One Market.

Major mistake.  Having eaten there several years ago often and enjoyed the food, this dinner was a major mistake.  Had friends from another country visiting.  30 minutes late in seating us; when I tried to cancel the reservation because we had other obligations, I was told they could not cancel and had to "honor" the reservation...made no sense since they were not honoring the time of our reservation.   First course took 45 minutes to get; food was mediocre;  waited 40 minutes for the second course, which ranged from over cooked to mediocre;  asked for a fast desert after being there nearly three hours, we got it.  In summary:  over priced, and mediocre food; service very slow.  Don't go!

People were removing items from our table before we were even done eating them. They didn't ask if we were done, just started removing them. They filled water glasses over people's food. And there was glass in my boss' either wine glass or water glass. He was bleeding but tried to hide it because of the guests we were with, CEO's and execs. Very poor overall but the waiter was very good and personable. The wine list was good. I won't be going back though.
review_title: Felt like we were being rushed and there was glass

review: Food was very good, server was knowledgable and friendly.
Thought this was a great meal, goat was the beast this week. Selection of the dish was first rate, Goat is not a common meat, so the opportunity to try it made this meal memorable.

We tried the famous chickpea fries, lamb, pork shoulder ..... and we left so disappointed. The lamb was gamey, the sauce on the pork shoulder was too over powering, and the chickpea fries were too mushy. However the beet salad was very tasty,  the service was perfect, and we could actually hear each other ..... which unfortunately is so hard to find.
review_title: We tried the famous chickpea fries, lamb...

review:
We were a family celebrating a college graduation. Everyone enjoyed the food and the company. One Market did a great job making this a memorable occasion for all of us.

We especially enjoyed the great desserts.
had good food, great service, not too loud, didn't feel rushed even though it was Saturday night- would recommend to friends- local or visitors.
Delicious crab cakes and red snapper cakes. A "cakey" kind of experience with a $2 martini thrown in. Great food and very fair prices for a restaurant of this high statute.

my mom's birthday - a booth, great view, great service and great food. we had: champagne, sweet potato soup, crab salad, mahi mahi, scallops, pork chops, brussel sprouts, spinach, hummus fries, tater tots, almond cake, ice cream sandwich and butterscotch pudding. it was all super tasty and everyone was happy!! :)

I was really underwhelmed by the dishes. The rabbit didn't captivate me and the scallops were too buttery. The sides we fine but again for a restaurant of this caliber and in a city like San Francisco, buttered carrots and tater tots? Again not bad but kinda blah..."one note", the menu lacked overall appeal. When I dine I find it hard to choose based on wanting all the entrees but here it was hard to make a selection due to not being all that impressed. The silver lining was the portion of pate...

The presentation was beautiful and the service was great but the menu itself lacked appeal...the ambiance was also lovely. I would come here again for drinks and pate but not for dinner.

I will say your salted caramel was delicious :)
Great place for a business lunch. Food and service are always very consistent.

I've been to One Market many times. This particular time, the service was bad. The waiter didn't want to answer our questions. He tried to sell at every conversation. He tried to get us to order apps for the table even though we each had a starter. He tried to convince us to order desserts even after we declined. He offered 3xs lemonade. He wasn't nice until we each ordered cappuccinos. He tossed at us rather than lay it down. No eye contact was made until he handed me the bill. Over sold the strawberry lemonade. It turned out more like syrup in sparking water than lemonade with crushed strawberry like he insisted. The lamb tonge was good, cavatelli sauce too tart (orange sauce), and lemonade too sweet. But the cappuccino was good.
review_title: This Time, It was Just Bad Service

review: Had a great birthday dinner and used DAR....great server....food...everything....

We received a voucher for One Market San Fran as a wedding present. We were very impressed with the food, ambience and service at One Market. Our server Miki was very attentive and made sure our every request was catered for. We were after a particular style of wine and when she wasn't 100% sure herself she made an enquiry to the restaurant's sommelier and found a perfectly suited wine for us. The Dungeness Crab salad was the most delicious salad I've ever had - just so fresh and so many complex, delicate flavours. I can see why this place has a Michelin star - well deserved.

We were looking for a place convenient for two couples, one staying in a hotel in the financial district and the other commuting from the Peninsula. We checked out the website and were impressed. The food, service, and location were perfect. We'll be back!
review_title: We were looking for a place

review: Decent food but did not meet our expectations given the high prices. Ordered the crab cake appetizers which were actually 3 crab cake bites which were a big disappointment given the $15 price. With all of the great dining alternatives in the area, we won't be going back.
review_title: Decent food but did not meet

review: All three of us ordered the 'Dine About Town' menu. Two of us ordered the hangar steak which was really good. Dale ordered the pollack which was crispy on the outside and flaky inside. Both dishes were delicious. The mint Arnold Palmer was excellent!
review_title: All three of us ordered the

review: This was my second time there and the food is definitely something to come back for. The service was much better and the service was not hurried and uncaring.
review_title: This was my second time there

review: The perfect restaurant for a special Thanksgiving dinner! The food was great, and we liked having a few choices beyond the traditional Thanksgiving offerings. The mushroom appetizer really stood out, but the turkey was very moist and lovely as well. The specialty cocktails went well with the festive feeling. Having a view of the Ferry Building as the early evening came on was another bonus. Hope they offer other holiday meals in the future.
Food was quite good but the service was very slow!!
review_title: Food was quite good but the

review: Great meal, good service. Excellent lemonade, with mynt! Could have done without the blender running behind our table, but overall it was good.

Can't say enough about my dining experience here as it was wonderful to sit at the kitchen bar and watch Chef Dommen and his team do a fantastic job. I love to cook and enjoyed having a seat where all the action takes place. I'm definitely looking forward to coming back when I'm in San Francisco!

Great non-alcoholic refreshing drinks, appetizers and desserts, but the pea risotto was terrible - gummy and very bland.The waiter was touting it as the best thing on the menu, and three people at our table ordered it. We are all mystified as to why he would have led us astray, or even why such a poor dish would have been served at all.
DAT wasn't as great as I expected, will come another time to try regular menu.
review_title: DAT wasn't as great as I expected,

review: Contrary to some on-line reviews, everything was we exceptional--food, service, ambiance. Definitely a special experience.

Excellent braised lamb shank with an amazing wine list, this restaurant will not disappoint! The sommelier assisted us with selecting the perfect glass of wine; she possesses an extraordinary gift for knowing her trade!
Hostess was very rude, impolite to the guess. Otherwise I would give this restaurant a high rating.
