The food was good, well presented, and we were happy with the portion sizes. Our hot food was served hot. The wines chosen for our first and second courses suited the food well. The service was great, from offering to take our coats to the coat check to the wonderful smile on our server's face. She looked like she was enjoying her job, and she had time to check on all of her tables frequently. We plan to return.
review_title: The food was good, well presented,

review: I have worked as a fine dining chef, which I mention to reveal a bias and maybe unfair depiction. I was surprisingly disappointed with the food for a Michelin star restaurant. The amuse bouche was a twice baked potato with caviar. Well, caviar is great, but really, a twice baked potato? My grandmother makes these better than One Market. My app was a slightly smoked trout on a crispy potato cake: definitely the best plate of food all night and the best fish I can remember eating. Loved it. I had duck for the second course. It was slightly overcooked even though I asked (explicitly requested) it be mid-rare. The sauce was tasteless and runny (no viscosity) and the chestnut-polenta was inedible. My companion had the same experience.

My cousin and I had a delicious lunch at One Market. we both chose the Businessman's Lunch, which consists of three courses for $26. The food was exceptional and so was the value. I will be going back with my daughter very soon.

Over the years the food at One Market has been consistently very good,
and right for the level of 1 Michelin Star. However, I would caution the restaurant
about the changes in the service. I visited last Saturday night, and it was
busy but not as busy as it used to be (back when one would have to wait 10 mins for
a table with a reservation) Despite this, the staff was not at the level of my
previous visits to One Market. The hostess didn't take our coats nor offer to
help us. Our waiter kept forgetting things, brought us the bill without asking
if we needed anything else. Still a nice place to go if you need to be in the
financial district..

Oh, Wow! What a place. The food was simply divine! The service was impeccable! I LOVE this restaurant, and will come back again and again. The braised short rib was TO DIE FOR! My friend and I sighed with utter delight between each bite of every single dish!
review_title: Oh, Wow! What a place. The

review: The halibut was very fishy. Two of us ordered it and we both didn't eat much. Too bad.

just wanted to say that our waitress - showed a keen understanding for children's palate. Our little 6 year old knew she wasn't tasting "ketchup" like she knows it and insisted it wasn't ketchup. We asked our waitress to bring another helping of ketchup knowing we already had one on the table, she was intuitive enough to figure out the child wanted "heinz" or ketchup of that ilk. Thanks for being sensitive to her needs and respectful as well. The wait staff was polite and attentive. The food was great.
review_title: just wanted to say that our

review: We picked this restaurant without previous knowledge, and were very pleasantly surprised. The food was wonderful, beautifully presented and very tasty. The survice was very good, attentive but not overbearing.
Consistent. Professional. Good quality and innovative menus. What you would expect from a top notch SF restaurant in both service and food. A bit expensive.
Great for a business lunch. Wonderful food without too much noise.
Excellent Duck Brest with sweet potato and fryer kale. My partners steak was perfect. The server was attentive without being bothersome. Excellent night out.
Great food. Wine is a bit pricey, but I suppose that's what you're signing up for.
review_title: Great food. Wine is a bit

review: Our waiter, Amanda (?) was exceptional. The sturgeon on lentils was outstanding and the smoked trout appetizer was perfect and divine.

Much anticipated and slightly disappointed. Our food was very good, though the timing of the courses was erratic with a prolonged interval between the appetizer and entree of thirty minutes. Attentive service was feigned but not delivered. It was not a Michelin moment for us.

On the strength of 3 previous dinners here this year, we chose to return for Thanksgiving. The dinner was truly excellent, with very generous servings of well-prepared food (we all got the turkey) from a thoughtfully conceived menu. Our service was pleasant and unhurried, and we left feeling entirely satisfied. The next-best thing to a home-cooked dinner.

Have been here many times but this time took the tasting menu with the flight of wines. While the regular menu is excellent, the tasting menu is very special. Great selection of matched wines and terrific service.
A consistently good restaurant appropriate for business entertaining. Thank you.
Never disappointing. Our Chicago friends were most pleased with the experienced.

I was surprised that the food wasn't better. I go to One Market often but rarely for dinner. I ate there 2-3 years ago and sat at the chef's table and everything was great. This time, I felt like the steak was tough with a lot of unchewable portions...Not a very good cut of meat (All 3 of us ordered the steak). And the sides were not very good either; I was surprised like I said. But I will still go there and I will even try dinner again. 1/2 price on wine in July is a great deal at a nice establishment. It brings the price of most selections to lower than retail. As a result I drink a lot of wine in July!
review_title: I was surprised that the food

review: It was a wonderful experience, the food was excellent and our server was very knowledgable. She engaged us with some great conversation and was very nice. She made our night out outstanding. I'll return and recommend it to our friends.

Absolutely delicious! We stopped here before seeing Peter Pan and wish we could have stayed longer and actually considered showing up late to our show because we wanted to order more! This is a place where the staff are proud of their food and it shows. The chef is amazing and I cannot wait to come back.
Very nice facility. Good menu, great drink list, great location. I recommend requesting a window seat.

I had read a number of reviews prior to reserving a reservation for three -- in many of those, at least the more recent ones, there was reference to very poor or confused hostess/host reception / check-in process. Sure enough, this is exactly what we experienced. No eye contact, same woman asked my last name at least three times in 10 minutes looking up for a split second each time as if I just had walked in the door. But more troubling is that all of the staff at the desk was like this. Singlehandedly the most poor greeting I have ever experienced. I was there for a business meeting with clients and this was lousy. I say replace the entire front staff. OK, so that said, I would rate the food as basically OK, and prob not worth the $.
review_title: I had read a number of reviews

review: We were very pleased with the whole meal. We had a late lunch which meant that it was pleasantly quiet - might be noisy during peak hours but it wasn't during our visit. Very attentive wait staff. Good menu with a nice variety of choices and all the dishes were well presented. Only complaint was that we were astounded at how expensive it was to park the car. That was our bad - next time we'll take Bart which has a stop right there. I would recommend this restaurant to my friends.

I took 4 members of my staff to a holiday luncheon (at my own expense)at 1 Market In the past year, we have workewd long and hared hours to get to a good place in our project. So my invitation was very well received. The entire experience starting with the primary server's greetings, followed by a warm and unobtrusive welcome to the restaurant's offerings and specials was very positive. We were all smiles. They liked the appetizers (good job on the oysters on a half shell!) and main menu of steaks; the chicken with the grits with jalapenos, and I especially enjoyed my choice of grilled fish with spinach side. On top of that our server presented me a bill with a discount! This was the most fun I have had at 1 Market for awhile.
review_title: I took 4 members of my staff

review: Everything was outstanding! The food, the service and the wine! We will absolutely be back and recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for amazing food with outstanding service.

Food was very good, recommend the crab cakes (more like meatballs). Only complaint is that service was slow. We were a business group of 5 and waited about 40 minutes for food to arrive at lunch time. Considering we were part of the first lunch seating I was surprised by the wait.

I have read some of the reviews posted here and here is my take for lunch: We were met immediately at the front and presented to our table. Menus arrived and drinks were ordered and delivered haphazardly. The 8 oysters ordered arrived in two plates since only 4 arrived first. Appetizers: smoked trout on a potato pancake was like smoked salmon and the crab cakes were mushy! Entres: the Halibut Cheeks I ordered were fair at best, the Ahi Tuna Burger was tasteless, and the Sausage was okay. All and all, not the ultimate dining experience and not at all economical. But the service was not as bad as others experienced. Try Boulevard on the next block over.
review_title: I have read some of the reviews

review: We had a great night. Everything worked. Food was great and service outstanding.
review_title: We had a great night. Everything

review: Great food mismatched with very un-Michelin star rush service. Need to change waiters.

Not enough wait staff. Had to flag down an alternate waiter to be able to place order (after 20 minutes). No acknowledgement of presence for about 10 or 15 minutes. Bottle of wine came about 20 minutes after ordering. If you're very patient and not too hungry I guess it's OK. This was a Wednesday evening at 7:30pm.
great to make a meal f appetizers and salad. the three small desserts were exquisite and the best part of the meal.
review_title: great to make a meal f appetizers

review: Went for Dine About Town - did the wine pairing - and it was phenomenal. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. The food was superb. No complaints!
Outstanding service and very good food. Good value for one's dining dollar. Excellent desserts.
We had a nice holiday dinner. Appreciated that the waiter told us the beef would take a while to cook, we were really hungry and opted for other dishes. Great sundae
review_title: We had a nice holiday dinner.

review: My overall experience was disappointing. I had requested a booth as we were dining for a birthday. This was confirmed by phone. When we arrived, we were seated at a table at the back near the chef's prep station although there were empty booths at the front of restaurant. It was a busy corner with the servers going back and forth. No one every acknowledged that we were there for a birthday. We were visiting SF and for the price of the evening, would choose another restaurant.

Outstanding food, service, ambiance, and location. 5 of us ordered 4 different entrees -- all terrific. Service was fasntastic - always there when needed, but not overbearing. We were coming in from outside the city and didn't want to deal with driving and parking - took BART to Embarcadero stop, and One Market was steps away at a great location - couldn't have been easier.

We always go to One Market during July becuase of the GREAT wine deals.  This year we have reservations twice at One Market and once at Lark Creek Steak during the month of July.  

On our July 9 visit, we brought friends who had been to One Market before and were not overly impressed with their first visit.  I can say all four of us LOVED the food and wine during this visit.  Menu selections were fantastic and the service has really improved.  Food presentation was also superb.  Wines are aways great and its nice to see One Market has many of the smaller boutique wines such as Scarecrow and Anamoly.  We all commented on arriving that we were surprised by the Michelien Star, but after the meal One Market has definitely earned its star.
review_title: We always go to One Market

review: Excellent food.  Relatively expensive for what you get.  The overall experience has no charm or pizzazz.  Feels like an expense account restaurant with very good food.
Crab salad was outstanding.  Definitely worth a trip back.

Spoke to manager (in dress shirt and tie) about our entrees and complained about too much salt etc.  He said he was sorry - that's it!  We won't be back - 3 of us having a business lunch.  Would rather go to Boulevard.
I was there for a business lunch.  The roasted chicken was excellent.  Very efficient service too.  I'd definitely recommend and go back myself.
review_title: I was there for a business

review: The fixed Valentine menu was OK. I wanted to return for the daily menu.
review_title: The fixed Valentine menu was OK. I wante...

review: Good spot for a business or personal lunch. Quality Italian food at reasonable prices in the FIDi. Don't expect fancy surroundings - simple old school charm. Good service....
review_title: Good spot for a business or

review: Kind of off the beaten track, but worth it. We found great bars to meet at (Hidden Vine, Elephant and Castle, Harringtons) then walk a minor few blocks to here. Also can park in Embarcadero. Food was really good too. Service was outstanding and we were a party of 7. Would definitely go here again.

My boyfriend & I had a nice Christmas dinner at this restaurant. This place is very nicely decorated and has a nice ambience. Some tables are a bit too close together so there's not too much privacy but it wasn't a big deal. We still had a comfortable and pleasant meal. You get the whole Italian treatment here including the friendly staff who all appear to speak Italian. They have an extensive wine list and a decent menu. Be ready to spend though. We spent $104 not including tip and all we got was the antipasti per due (appetizer for two)($14), an entree each($22 x 2), and a bottle of wine($28). We got a few complimentary slices of bread with olive oil. The food was delicious! Would definitely go back but only for another special ocassion.
Very authenic Italian. Loved the whole atmosphere. Nothing fancy schmancy, just wonderful food, wonderful wine and wonderful friendly people!

Not at all impressed with this restaurant. We went there for New Year's Eve and for over an hour were the only patrons in the restaurant. The waiter was pleasant but did not get our orders correct for both dinner and dessert. Food was just OK, nothing special. Would not return or recommend this restaurant. Did not feel it was worth the price of $45 per person.
Great value for the area.  Authentic Italian, with good seafood (although limited in number)

Outstanding food to share.  Could make a meal of appetizers and sides.  Service is a little spotty.  Well located , if you don't mind walking to the Orpheum, Davie's or Opera House.  We were going to the Orpheum, it worked out well for us.

we love the small sharing plates, just wish they wo0uld bring back the lettuce wraps.  but.,  we had bacon aggs(devilled eggs with bacon..yuum)  wontons and crab cakes, nice wines and cocktails. we will be back.
Good wine list. Beef wellington was delicious! Server was nice, but not super attentive.
Small plates were generous, innovative and delicious.  The location is walkable to Davies or Opera House
review_title: Small plates were generous, innovative a...

review: Birthday feast for 8. Devoured every crumb. Friendly, helpful. Duke Ellington's perfect soundtrack for soulful dining. Good brew and cocktails too

creative, tasty, priced right,

hope to return soon

We did our research, and discovered this gem of a restaurant simply because the menu suited our tastes, and was convenient to Davies Symphony Hall! What a find - we were thrilled, and will visit this restaurant again - and not because we have symphony tickets, but because it was such a find! Especially because we consider ourselves "foodies" who transplanted here from NYC...Bravo to Sauce!
Delicious food, good wine, convenient location to the Symphony, Opera, Ballet and traveling Broadway venues.

terrific spot with a great 3 course under $40. enjoyed the creative dishes, preparation and presentation. wasn't rushed, felt welcomed, definitely give it a try, especially before concerts at Herbst/Symphony Hall.

My wife and I brought her brother and his family here to thank them for their help at our wedding.

For a party of six we ordered 4 social plates, 2 entrees, 1 soup, 1 salad and the sauce sampler. It was more than enough portion wise and the taste was excellent. I don't pretend to understand all the nuances of cooking but I do know that everyone was happy at the end of the night.

The staff was very nice and quite patient as we tried narrow down our choices. All of it sounded so good.
review_title: My wife and I brought her

review:
we usually go with a larger group, prior to a jazz performance. Our experience has been just great every time. Inventive dishes, beautifully prepared, and they are cognizant of our need to be outta there at a particular time.

As they say, "We'll be back"!!
review_title: we usually go with a larger

review: Wow. Great food. Everything -- from starters to desserts -- was different, unique -- in a good way. Really well prepared. Generous portions, too. Small, neighborhood place. Very welcoming and very good service.

we went prior to the opera. we had brussels sprout salad and portobello mushroom bisque which are standouts that i would gravitate to again and again. my husband had the fried chicken which he likes to have as a repeat entree. i had the salmon as my entree which my husband likes and wants to try the next time he goes. we had a peach cobbler for dessert which was also very good. they always do a seasonal cobbler. most of their entrees are regular items on the menu which they don't vary very much so if you're looking for variety it's good but not necessarily stand out food. but if you like to get reliably delicious food made simply and you like to get the same items over and over this is a great restaurant. also good for opera crowd.
review_title: we went prior to the opera.

review: Great food and lovely presentation.  We came back late night for the dessert service and loved it.  If you are in teh neighborhood (or at City Hall, the Opera, the Symphony) check the restaurant out.  You won't be dissapointed!

it was excellent food - comfy place - not a fancy spot but good food / good location / great prices - maybe a bit more wine choices. SF tends to over do it on the California only wines we need to remember the rest of the world makes some pretty good stuff too - but overall a nice little gem
I first heard about this on "Check Please". I was very impressed by the quality of food, the price, and the excellent service. I will return.
review_title: I first heard about this on

review: Great restaurant to go to with a group who likes to share food. Delicious and reasonably priced. Highly recommend checking it out....I will definitely go back.

The food at Sauce isn't very good, and for a $70 meal for two, you are better of anywhere else. The food isn't very tasty. I woudl so it's very rich, but lacks a lot of balance or flavor.

Example:
The tater tots are little more than deep fried mash potatoes, very mush in the middle but it did have a nice crunch.

The mac'n'cheese had LITTLE cheese flavor, although creamy, but little flavor.

The meatloaf had a very off sour flavor, and was overcooked. Very difficult and messy to eat despite the neat presentation.

capaccio was pretty bland, all i could taste was capers and no beef flavor that is signature of most capaccios.

FOod is pretty bleh. I honestly feel flavor is probably better anywhere else.

We made a meal out of the "Social Plates." Everything was delicious and the restaurant was great about adjusting the size of the plate to accomodate our party (e.g. giving us 5 sliders so we could each have one.) The calimari and chorizo was awesome, and the mini doughnut holes with vanilla bourbon dipping sauce are not to be missed. The wine list is small, but good and well-priced. Many of the wines are organic and/or biodynamic. Definitely recommend Sauce.
review_title: We made a meal out of the

review:
We were initially seated in the back room which was so noisy we couldn't hear each other or the waitress. I asked to be reseated and was immediately accomodated in the front room which was much better for us.

Food was terrific and we all had a good time.

I've taken several friends to eat at Sauce and all of them have enjoyed the food. This is a great restaurant for a before theater meal as it is a 15 minute walk to the opera house and symphony hall. I've combined the appetizers previously to make a complete meal. I've had the vegetarian entree twice, which is quite delightful.

I brought a friend to sauce visiting from new orleans. He had been craving some good food and hadn't been satisfied in san francisco all summer. Sauce hit the spot. Everything was too good, and I definitely ate too much.

We were pleasantly surprised how good the food was. It's not a very extensive menu, but nice choices; there should be something for anyone. We were due at a performance in the area, so couldn't stay for dessert. Next time we will definitely allow more time. It was us tardy, not the service.
Excellent dishes...the butterfish was particularly delicious. Wonderful array of desserts.
Had a great time! It was fun to create a dinner out of 4 of their Social Plates. Service was friendly and attentive.
review_title: Had a great time! It was fun

review: Good food prepared in interesting ways and reasonably priced.

We enjoyed our food very much. When we first arrived the noise level was low but by the time we left and it was more crowded it was pretty loud. But the food was very tasty .. we sampled three of the small plates and a salad and it worked out just fine for the three of us.
review_title: We enjoyed our food very much.

review:
One meal was good and the other terrible. I ordered the Salmon. It was so overdone it was like eating hay. It was on cold greens that were tangy and unappealing and totally did not compliment the salmon, even if it had been cooked properly.
Dessert was also disappointing. Smashed ice cream sunday...or some sort. Really disappointing.
I will not be back for some time!
review_title: One meal was good and the

review: Had our first meal at Sauce last night. The restuarant was pleasant enough, and the food was well presented, but there was nothing that really thrilled me. Shared plate food tasted like passed appetizers at a big corporate party, tomato soup had a funny sweet taste, maybe too many red peppers not enough tomato. I didn't try any of the meat dishes but my companions did and thier one comment was that if you add ham to the mac and cheese is it really necessary to add bacon to the green beans served with it, or maybe not so much bacon. Also, bread served was very disappointing, didn't taste fresh and was too heavy. I don't think that we will be returning to Sauce any time soon. Wait staff were very pleasant and atmosphere was nice however.
review_title: Had our first meal at Sauce

review: Fantastic food and spectacular service. Meatloaf wrapped in bacon, Mac n' Cheese, and mini donuts for dessert... we loved every dish! Also, the mixed drinks were unique and delicious! Definitely going again.

Five of us on the other side of 60 dined here before the symphony on our first visit. The crowd was younger and we loved the energy. The owner was very friendly and attentive and our servers were incredible. The menu was eclectic to say the least and we had a hard time choosing what to have. We loved our choices. Having gone to the symphony for 25 years, we were tired of the same-o same o choices. We'll be back to Sauce!
review_title: Five of us on the other side

review: Best overrall dining experience we had while in San Francisco.
We LOVE "Sauce" and will come here before the Opera whenever we can. The food is fun to share,and very tasty. Service is friendly and helpful
nice special menu; good service. tables too close for us elders

We had a Thursday 7:30 reservation and when we walked in the place was empty...not a single table was filled. Was this an omen of what was to come? No! Not at all. It turns out that they get a big theatre crowd and August is a quiet theatre month. Phew! What was wonderful is we had the place all to ourselves for at least one hour. The staff was attentive, but definitely let us have our space which we wanted. They didn't rush us in any way. We had a wonderful bottle of Syrah and split two appetizers.....Sesame Shrimp and Heirloom tomatoes with fresh mozzarella and a balsamic reduction. Both were incredibly delicious. It made me wish we ordered more of the menu because I have a feeling everything would have been good.
Walking distance to opera, symphony, et al. Nice alternative.

Great find in Hayes Valley. Reasonable dining before or after symphony/opera/ballet.
Caring and efficient service - they actually ask if you have theatre plans! We really enjoyed Sauce.
Everything was great from the drinks (have the starwberry vanilla mojito), appitizers, dinner, and the desserts! Be sure to have the donuts.
The food was very good except it was extremely salty.
review_title: The food was very good except

review: We were having a mom-daughter night out to the Nutcracker. Our waitress was particularly aware that we needed to be out on time, was extremely helpful and outgoing in answering all questions we had. We had a really great experience. What blew me away the most were the outstanding desserts. Their PBJ is absolutely to die for. I would not have ordered it without the waitress having encouraged us and we were so thankful. It really was one of the most unique and delicious desserts I've ever had. I had the Butterfish for my entree. I had never tried it before and I really liked the flavor, but have decided it's much too rich of a fish for me. Very good though. Thank you!!!
A very nice place to go to before the Symphony. Sharing small plates is the best idea as you get lots of different flavors.
review_title: A very nice place to go to

review: Our group of 4 all raved at the food and appreciated the friendly, attentive service. A real plus was finding out that they're open late enough that we could have a leisurely and exceptional dessert there after the opera, symphony or ballet. All this, and reasonable prices, too! A winner!
review_title: Our group of 4 all raved at

review: We went for Dine About Town and some portions were huge (main courses) and others were REALLY small (starters and desserts).  While everything was delicious, I wish the portion sizes had been more balanced.
review_title: We went for Dine About Town

review: Food was tasteless, lacking flavor, and poor quality. NO taste and seemed like it was Costco bulk cheap food...even the mashed potatoes were bad!!! My husband and I didn't even eat half of our entrees.We couldn't eat anymore.Disgusting!!! To add to this, the fizzy water they served appears to come from their bar rather than imported bottled water...at $6 a bottle they are robbing you! What a huge rip off!!!! I would have rather eaten at Chevys or Chili's. To add to this, it was hot and stuffy. No air circulation.

Sauce is a great place when you want very good food, a great ambiance and a place to be able to have a conversation.  I love that it is small and you feel like you are in someone's house.  Really great place.
review_title: Sauce is a great place when

review: My friend and I were there for a birthday brunch, and we both had a lovely experience. The restaurant is pretty, we had a great table by the windows. The morning light was beautiful, it was fun watching life on Columbus Street, the food was delicious, and our server was friendly and attentive. We left feeling very happy and appreciative. You made it a pleasure -- thank you everybody!  Ive already recommended Caffe Delucchi to another friend.
review_title: A lovely place, great food, a real pleasure!

review: Loved he food. Great outdoor seating. We're coming back when it's warm. Comfortable seats.
Everyone had a wonderful meal. The waitress was energetic and attentive. The interior is an extension of the outdoors with all windows open. You fell the energy of North Beach.
Food and service was exceptionally good. Was a great experience eating outside.
Nice, basic North Beach Italian restaurant delivering quality food for a decent price. It's a small place and keeps reasonably busy at peak evening dining times.

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: We were seated quickly which was night and the room where we were had a nice view. There was one waiter for the 4 tables that were in our seating area. I think he was very stressed out and overwhelmed because his visits to the table were few and far between.  The pizza was very good, so we're the fish and chips. Someone ordered the herb shrimp pasta dish and it was very underwhelming. It needed copious amounts of salt to bring any flavor out. We were mostly excited for the bread pudding dessert but they were out, which is odd since they bake bread directly downstairs. The food was substantial, nothing to write home about. The shop downstairs was more interesting than the food and the dining experience.

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: The service was the main issue here.  Sat at the bar a half an hour before our reservation time, it was about half full at the bar, with two bartenders, yet it took (and I timed it) 14 minutes to get a drink.  The food was just alright, not nearly as fresh as it should be being on the Wharf.

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: During our four day trip to sanfran this place was our hands down favorite.  Great food, atmosphere and you have got to check out the museum on the 2nd floor.  So cool!

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: everything we had was amazing! Especially the famous bread!!!! Your servers were very sweet and accomodating and was not at all bothered when i asked for a candle for my husband's dessert for his bday nor when we asked about all the different items on the menu. We also had an amazing time making our own bread! we cant wait to visit again!

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: The entrees we had were amazing, and the bartender made an amazing version of a drink I mostly made up. But hands down, the beignets were to die for.

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: We had friends in town for a day and wanted to give them a taste of San Francisco. We were not disappointed. The food and scene were great but our server made the experience exceptional!

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: We were happy with our choice for late lunch. Had a bread bowl with soup. Yum. A little loud but a great meal and a nice view if you book your table on line. We were seated immediately. Treated very well.

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Very good all the way around! One of my favorite restaurants in SF!
review_title: Very good all the way around!

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review:
Went to lunch before a 49ers game. Fair prices, great bread, very nice atmosphere.
Good place to be take a break if you are walking the wharves.

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: The fresh sourdough bread was awesome. The waiter was nice, but the food took forever. I think the servers were confused because they brought a salad to our table that nobody ordered. The view is nice and I liked the food. The lava cake was a little overcooked. It needed more lava.

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: The food is good, and service was attentive (we appreciated tourism tips from waiter), but be forewarned of the Fisherman's Wharf tourist-raking prices. Hard to get out of here with a family of four (2 adults, 2 teens) for less than $90 (tax/tip inclusive). We were down the street at the Argonaut so it was a choice of convenience. My daughter found her mac & cheese to be kind of gross -- more like pasta in a milk bath than cheese. They did not have a separate gluten-free menu or designate items as GF. In retrospect I regret not getting a cab somewhere better and out of the way.

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: This is a good restaurant with good food and good ambiance. However they desperately need some more vegetarian friendly options.

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Decent food for price in in a tourist area. Great views, service was a bit uneven.
review_title: Decent food for price in in

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Very over priced and hard to get servers attention when I asked for a round of waters I got one water they skipped my wife and mother I think it was just a miss communication but I couldn't find a server for another 10 minutes so we had to share one water

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review:
If you're entertaining out of town guests in the Fisherman's Wharf area, then I would recommend Bistro Boudin. There is an area on the ground floor with a simple menu and some tables if you don't want to spend quite as much. However, the Bistro upstairs has good food and table service. Reservations are a must - it's crowded.

The food is basic, but good and the service is fine. It's in a touristy area, so it's way over priced.

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Very good food...great location....great service....

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: Love their Dungeness carb louis, it is my must have everytime.

address: 160 Jefferson St, Upper LevelSan Francisco, CA  94133
review: The service was very good, and attentive.The prices on the menu were a little more than I felt the food was worth, but considering the location and I can imagine the rent.I guess it's necessary.Presentation was great, food came out in a nice timely fashion, not overly rushed but we didn't find our selves twiddling our thumbs either.We ordered quite a bit of food, the calamari which came with tartar sauce and cocktail sauce which was nice and spicy.We also had garlic fries, they were the shoe string type, tasty but didn't really taste like GARLIC fries, we had garlic mashed potatoes which was my favourite, crab mac and cheese was great,beef stew was tender,flavorful but small portioned, Their bread, their specialty, really was excellent!

When looking for a good New American restaurant in SOMA, I stumbled upon this place, heard it was closing and decided to check it out. Too bad I didn't come across it sooner!

The menu focuses on fresh, locally sourced ingredients. Most appetizers and desserts are under under $10 and entrees in the $20s, but I ordered from the "Neighborhood Menu"...a starter, main, and dessert for $37. Not bad. I picked the Cauliflower soup, Braised Lamb Shoulder (normally a separate menu item, but added to the set menu during their last few weeks) and Vanilla Cheesecake. 

All of them were good, but OMG the Lamb Shoulder...it's up there with the best lamb I've had. It was presented in two boneless bricks and was tender and juicy, perfectly spiced with very subtle gaminess. The garnishes had a mediterranean flair...jam, baba ghanoush, squash and watercress. The portion of lamb was generous, too -- oddly, I think there was actually more lamb than vegetables!

The bartender was telling me they weren't actually closing per se, but they were changing to a tapas-style restaurant with an expanded bar. So I'll be back to check out the new place, but I'm glad I got to visit the former incarnation once!

Four us ordered four different entrees and they are we're all underwhelming. The fried chicken lacked seasoning and flavor, the pork was average at best, and the trout was ordinary. To top it off, the chocolate mousse dessert had a horrible sour taste that seemed to indicate that the cream had turned (and not just from the sour taste of the blueberries as they insisted---I think we all know what blueberries taste like). We won't be returning given how many better restaurants there are in Soma.
Good concept, but some dishes were not executed properly. Quality control needs improvement .

The cheese plate is a good choice to start off with. Or even the bone marrow. This restaurant uses a touch of sweetness in each entree dish to find a balance between the salt and savory. Some people may like this and others not, watch out.
review_title: The cheese plate is a good

review: Radius is a special treat to discover in SoMa. There are actually two Radius (Radii) there, the Restaurant and the Cafe. The Restaurant is top drawer, especially for the early pre-show dinner. Later the place gets very busy, and at least that night the service staff was stretched but not broken. Next door the Cafe is SoMA rustic, the food is just as great, but the bus station ambiance is the opposite of the fine dining room. The eggplant veggie dish was excellent, perfect blend of flavors and textures, I loved it and I'm a carnivore. My wife had the ricotta gnudi, perfect pasta cheese balls with complex flavors. The restaurant is highly recommended, I have yet ventured into the Cafe however - perhaps for lunch.

Your Review:

Was there for Dine Out For Life to support Team Radius - Johnnie Thompson, Ian Hunter, and Larry McGrew. It was a fun evening for a wonderful cause and a perfect choice for their fundraiser. Will definitely go back. Raven, next door, is a perfect place to front-load!

My date and I shared the lamb and pork dishes... ah-maz-ing! Both dishes. And I don't like brussel sprouts. Even those rocked! The only "issue" I had with the place... really hard to hear the person sitting across the table from you. They need to lay down rugs to deafen the noise the cement floors create.
review_title: My date and I shared the lamb

review:
I have had two experiences at Radius, one great and one not so great.

The first time I was there I ordered their fig and arugula salad and the lamb. The lamb was served in a skillet with vegetables and was fantastic.

The second time I ordered the same thing more or less. Yet this time the lamb came on a bed of polenta mixed with corn and a side of carrots, onions and peas. The lamb had a big piece of fat in it and the polenta and corn and peas made the dish too sweet. The polenta and corn was also more like mushy oatmeal. Very disappointing after having had such a good first experience.

A bit disappointing. I used to love this place and would recommend this place to friends. Both the appetizers and entrees arrived warm and not HOT. Maybe it was because we had the Prix-fixed menu. But that was your opportunity to showcase your dishes so your customers will return here. It will be awhile before I will come back. It's a shame because I had so much hopes for this neighborhood spot!

Another great restaurant in the neighborhood!! We've been wanting to try Radius since they opened a few months ago and finally did it.... The restaurant has a very friendly and welcoming staff and the service was prompt and attentive. The food was very tasty. I had the flat iron steak and my partner had the pork dish. We also ordered the polenta with goat cheese which was delicious! And also a side of broccolini with garlic chips... YUMMY!! The restaurant still has that new kind of figuring things out feel to it... But we will definitely go back!

Absolutely amazing. The wild mushroom ravioli was tasty and earthy and perfectly cooked. The braised kale and parsnip chips added an extra depth. And the broth was amazing. I shamelessly soaked it all up with the delicious bread provided. The sole was perfectly cooked with a crunchy crust on top. The risotto was soft and creamy and the sauce ravigote added the perfect amount of acidity.
review_title: Absolutely amazing. The wild mushroom ra...

review: The staff and service were impecilbe.  The evening was relaxed and staff very attentive.  I found the prices to be a good value.
review_title: The food quality and seervice werre impecible.

review: This is where my boyfriend experienced his first spiritual experience with food; he didn't realize he could enjoy seafood so much. From the caviar, to the Dungeness crabs, to the sole... it was all incredibly delicious. The only slight disappointment was the dessert menu. Cocktails were great. Loved the seascape dcor.
We make it a point to eat at Farallon multiple times each time we visit San Francisco.. the food is always innovative and deeply satisfying. The service is great....

Farallon has a nice atmosphere, but the food was just okay, the service was inadequate, and overall not on par with the very high prices.   Waiter had an attitude and the service was very slow, missing at key times, and definitely not up to the standard you should expect for a restaurant in this price range.   There are better options available in San Francisco.
Food was excellent.  The waitress, Layla, was tremendous, knowledgeable and personable.  Some of the best seafood in SF!

Aside from the fact that the dcor is lovely, this is a foodie  paradise. Most notably for us was the gazpacho. The color was rich, the flavor sublime and lovely. I highly recommend this restaurant for a wonderful meal with quality staff in magnificent surroundings.
Mariposa Okie
review_title: Aside from the fact that the dcor is lo...

review: Can't say enough about Farallon! Spouse and I had the 5 course tasting with wine pairing. OMG! this place rocks, exceeds all expectations and hopes! The food and service were stellar. Our waiter/host Joseph, was considerate and genuine. He explained the individual courses and wines, and answered questions with ease and pleasure... the guy has style! This was an exceptional evening for us; and, staying at The Kensington Park Hotel in the same building made for a romantic, stress-free night! You have to try this!
Order the tasting menu with the wine pairings. You won't be disappointed.

The location is great and the interior of the restaurant is amazing! We waited at the bar while our reservation was to be called, bar tender was very knowledgeable with the wine list and very friendly. Once we sat for dinner our waiter had seemed as if he was having a bad day. Had an annoyed tone in his voice during our dining experience and at the end of our meal we had asked to for to go boxes and his response  seemed irritated and annoyed with us which I really did not like. The food however was amazing.

Last week my friend & I stumbled on this beautiful place & took a chance on it. Reviews were good. What a surprise. Unbelievable decor. Sea creature lights are worth a visit but food was impeccably served and beautifully presented. We both cook and found no fault which is rare, well maybe a little too much salt for me on one thing, but I use hardly any at home. I would highly recommend this place for lunch alone in the bar to marriage proposal site. We enjoyed every minute.

We went to Farallon on recommendation. The oysters were horrible. My fish was OK- but nothing to write home about- The bread and flavored butter was the best thing.

Small portions- our scallop appetizer for $20 was one scallop. The dessert was ice cream and a dallop of hot fudge.
We enjoyed the mussels, rock shrimp, scallops and lobster. All was fresh and prepared perfectly. Wine list was good as was our table service. Reservations highly recommended.

The setting is truly spectacular at this restaurant and the food matched the setting. While none of the dishes is earth-shattering in its creativity, everything was delicious and the fish was properly cooked (ie- not overcooked, as happens so often) The service was attentive but not intrusive.

We went to "The Book of Mormon" matinee and then made our way to the restaurant. I had planned it so that we would be able to wander around Union Square to see the Christmas lights and feel the ambience. The dinner was just wonderful. My kids, age 21 & 15 can be sort of picky, but both ordered the seafood bisque/chowder and were all but licking the bowl. Our fish entrees were each very unique and delicious. My son had the NY steak and he loved it. It was nice to have one beef entree available. Daughter had the mint ice cream dessert and loved it. The service was excellent and professional. It is what you would expect when spending over $400 for 4 people (only 2 of us had cocktail/wine). A very nice way to celebrate the holiday with family.

If you enjoy fine dining, the Farallon is one of the best experiences you will have in the San Francisco Bay Area. The wine list is excellent. The presentation of the meal by the chef is spectacular. Service is friendly and efficient. Waiters and bus people are engaging when you speak to them and provide stealth service at the table when appropriate and not interrupt. Somehow the wine was always adequately filled in the glass, never wanting. The menu is excellent. It caters to the seafood fans, multiple types of caviar, lobster, oysters on the half shell (6 different types to choose from, mix and match), fresh fish of the day, etc, but also has excellent choices for us non-fish lovers (Has a crab bar for those crab lovers, which I'm not)

Of the six dinners that our group ordered, three were outstanding, however three of the group ordered salmon which was over cooked and too salty. One of our guests had to return the salmon, while the others were too polite to do so. All three of my guests were disappointed with their meal, especially considering the reputation of Farallon.

I love the ambiance of the main dining room with the under the sea theme and the sea urchin light fixtures and the cozy booth seating. The seafood is fresh and the presentation beautiful. I had the heirloom tomato and burrata cheese salad and the king salmon with tomato minestrone and the little handmade twisted pasta. The service from the wait staff was really attentive, an excellent experience.

My husband and I were very impressed with Farallon - from the moment we stepped in the restaurant, we were taken in by the tasteful undersea decor. The food was really delicious, and service was absolutely top-notch. Thank you for such an enjoyable experience! We can't wait to come back.

The food at Farallon is very expensive - we paid over $200 for 2 people, including a small bottle of sake. Nothing really stood out as being exceptionally delicious. Oysters didn't seem that fresh, salmon wasn't memorable and the crab legs were small.
A wonderful place to enjoy each other and have a delicious meal.

Farallon is top 100 restaurant that offers sophisticated culinary delights and service of utmost high quality. The range of offerings displays their culinary diversity with seafood. We enjoyed an appetizer of Tartare of Hawaiian Ono, a pleasant cerivche-like mix of tuna and fruitie seasonings along with thin hand-made yukon potato chips. The flavor is not strong so you will be able to appreciate the actual flavor of the fish. For entrees, we enjoyed the Seared Mediterranean Branzino, which was a safisfactory sized fish in an interesting broth with onions and other vegetables. We also ordered the Pan-seared California White Bass, which was tasty but was the size of an appetizer, even TINY for a girl! Blueberry pie had suprise b-day cheers!

We had a good, not great dinner, diminished in part by the lack of reasonably priced wines. The least expensive white was $16/glass, or $58/bottle. For people who don't consider themselves wine connoisseurs and are comfortable with their deficiency, this is somewhat irritating. The food itself was fine, but none of the 4 of us thought is was especially memorable.
review_title: We had a good, not great dinner,

review: Everything was wonderful! Will come back when back in town!!! Already recommended to friends.

Farallon is an outstanding restaurant; highly recommended. Your experience begins upon entering the spectacular dining room, which is about the most beautiful and interesting I've ever seen. Vaulted ceiling, jelly fish chandeliers, open kitchen with wood fired grill, cozy booths and a back room like a Roman grotto. The food is equally impressive. We feasted on oysters and dungeness crab from the cold bar, exquisite squid with smoked paprika, and my ono main course was the best I've ever eaten. The desserts and cheese course were also excellent. The wine list caters to seafood (but you will find beef and chicken entrees). Service was friendly and attentive. I will return like the tide.
Dhali inspired ambiance with view of an open kitchen. Some of our meal (crab bisque and tuna entre) were bland.

Wonderful ambience especially if you are tucked away in the grotto area of this restaurant! The fish is creatively done and wonderfully presented. A great wine list! Great attentive staff! We usually frequent this restaurant at least once during the yearly season of A.C.T. Farallon is a bit 'pricey' but worth it for special ocassions! We always come back at least once or twice a year!

Don't know why Farallon served me 1/2 Maine lobster. It would only cost them an extra $5 for the other half, and I would definitely pay extra for that. Otherwise, my dining experience was superlative in every other way.
review_title: Under The Sea W/ Only 1/2 Lobster

review: We needed to have a fairly quick dinner in order to get to a concert at 7:30. Farallon took us a few minutes early, even though our reservation was for 6:00. Our waiter asked if we needed to get to a show, and he was very attentive all evening to make sure our meal was leisurely yet timely. The food was outstanding. I'd always wanted to try arctic char, and it was fabulous. We didn't have time for dessert, but our waiter brought us each a delicious, bite-sized gel, a burst of mango or tropical fruit flavor. Yumm.
review_title: We needed to have a fairly

review: We Love Farallon! The food, service and Ambiance is first class. A bit pricy, but so worth it.
My wife and I love the Farallon. We always get there early for happy hour. And they always keep gluten out of my food, which is important to me as I have celiac disease.
review_title: My wife and I love the Farallon.

review: Service and food were both awesome! Wines were great!
Food was excellent. Service was adequate but not attentive. Interesting rooms. Definitely not a special occasion or romantic dinner spot.

Loved the decor and the uniqueness of old San Francisco at its best.
The group LOVED the ambiance and I will definitely go back. The food was high quality and the wine list long!

Restaurant was accommodating as we increased our party size and delayed going to the table by 1 hour waiting for a couple more... Fabulous!
review_title: Loved the decor and the uniqueness

review: Great food with excellent service. Ask to sit in the ballroom area - it's a beautiful area.

Excellent restaurant. Portions a little on the small size, but seemed ample if appetizers had beforehand. Seafood sampler a hit!! Noise level high, but acceptable. Good somalier, enjoyed his recommendations.

Good, not great. Probably not worth the price. They were out of the first two wines we chose from their list, and were not very concerned about it. Servers did not know ingredients on the plate. Every thing here is pretty (the room is beautiful), but ultimately it is more show than substance.
Very satisfied. Gorgeous interior. Food was good. Service was attentive.

The food and atmosphere are amazing. Our waitress was extremely knowledgable about the menu and the wine by the glass. I would return again.
I understand now how this place makes many lists for best seafood and romantic atmosphere.
review_title: Great seafood in a cozy atmosphere

review: Great spot for a special occasion dinner or nice drinks. Great interior decorating
review_title: Great spot for a special occasion

review: Food was great as was service. Servings were very small. My husband and I do not have big appetites, but we were still hungry after drinks, salad and entree.
review_title: Food was great as was service.

review: This is a favorite restaurant of our for special occasions. The food is fantastic and the service is exemplary. All the meals arrive at once, delivered by several members of the staff if necessary. It makes for quite a show.

Each course was a work of art-- both visually amazing and absolutely delicious. Our party ordered the sole and the beef, along with a lobster bisque and mushroom bisque. We loved and savored every bite! For dessert we had the velvet cake and sorbet. (yum) The service was exemplary: attentive, yet unobtrusive. We found the ambiance to be extraordinary: from the undersea light fixtures. the the nautical forms to the mosaic designs on the ceiling. This was a dining experience that we will never forget.
review_title: Each course was a work of

review: What a dissappointment! Very slow and inattentive service. My main dish was so overpowering that the fish was almost indistinguishable.

Food ingredient quality, presentation, originality -- all great.
However, nothing in my meal was truly SAVORY -- the way it simply
SO often IS in so many restaurants, for example, in France
(and often for a far lower price). I'll definitely go back
to Farallon -- but I'd ask the wait staff what items are SAVORY
as well as "subtle." Portion sizes were on the small size,
which I definitely LIKE, especially in a multi-course meal. The
service -- from A to Z -- was marvelous, fun, attentive and yet
never intrusive). If there were more "savor" Farallon's food
would be closer to tremendous and further away from borderline-precious.

Great food but extremely small portions. I ordered ahi appetizer and it contained 3 small pieces. It was delicious but not worth the $$$. Halibut was beautifully prepared but was more the size of an appetizer than an entree. I was unaware of the 4% tax (in addition to the sales tax) for employees health insurance. This was added to my check. That's quite a statement to make. Bury the cost in the price of the food and raise the prices. The obvious would occur. May not return.

The last time we were at Farallon was over 5 years ago, so we were interested in checking it out again.  Turns out the food was great, but the service not so much.

The shellfish appetizer was fresh and tasty, and our fish entrees were really excellent.  The desserts (esp the blueberry pie) were superb.  Enjoyed the food immensely.  Our server, unfortunately, seemed distracted and/or drunk, and so our service was really subpar.  Also, we noticed that place seems to be in need of some TLC on the maintenance and decor side -- carpets looked old and worn, and the ceilings looked grey and faded. 

Overall,  still a great spot for seafood and worth a visit (at least every 5 years).
review_title: The last time we were at Farallon

review: Superb seafood in a unique setting right off Union Square. A must for any seafood lover.

My wife and I have heard about Farallon for about a year now and were just able to make an event of it and dine there. The decor was fascinating with an Under the Sea item in every direction. Our waiter was attentive and polite without being over the top. The food was the freshest seafood we've had in years. Go, explore the sea and eat fresh!
review_title: My wife and I have heard about

review:
For those who perpetually dredge SF for the finest of the fine and the tastiest of the tasty - your search can fairly end here. Expect your greatest disappointment to be that you cannot fit more in your belly - because otherwise, you'd do well to order the entire menu. The lobster appetizer with avocado mousse should be served in heaven, or I'm not interested. Their wine menu is exceptional (and the servers surprised me with their thoughtful bottle suggestions"). I do wish they would bring back their heirloom tomato soup - I could eat it every day for the rest of my life. 

And don't even get me started on the internal decor - playful blown glass jellyfish keep company with the finely tiled, sensitive bath-house ceiling of the main room.

Farallon is absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in SF. The food is spectacular, the presentation is always great, and the service is second to none. Have been here multiple times over the years and enjoyed it every single time.
Wonderful ambiance, great food, great service. Outstanding!
Fantastic service, wonderful food, and a very romantic Valentines and 8th Anniversary Day!
Great ambience, service, first and desert, but main fish dishes nothing really special. We had dorado and black bass.

Overall restaurant and food is great .. nothing to complain about ..... only issue(s) are reception and reservations .... people there very inexperienced...which does impact the overall dining experience ....
Heard about it for years, finally got a chance to eat here. It met all expectations!

VERY DISAPPOINTED.

This place is terribly awful. I can't fathom why this place costs so pricey. I also don't think the compulsory 18% service charge deserve to the service.

The seafood appetizer takes way too long to be served(over 45 mins), waitress never came to the table to see what we need & explain appropriately to every dishes. Food was awful(which is also not taking the balance with the price). Server kept coming to our table to pick up dishes as we were obviously still working on it. We got a very rude attitude given by the manager when we were trying to complain about the terrible service, and the manager didn't apologize but only states that the 18% service charge is compulsory.

If you wanna spend your dollar wisely
D
One of the best restaurants in San Francisco. Always go there when I'm in town.

very pleased with all aspects of our dinner. portions were the right size, server was very accomodating and anticipatory to our needs (split dishes and wine when she knew we wanted to) already recommended the restaurant to friends

The food was good, but not outstanding. For the price (bill with tip came to $180) and caliber of restaurant, we expected more, but we had a pleasant evening. The decor was over the top for us; we felt as if we were in an upscale Rainforest Cafe. The highlight of the meal sadly was not the seafood, but the very good peach/blackberry pie.
review_title: The food was good, but not

review: Pristine seafood that is not just well prepared but stylishly prepared as well.

We loved Farallon. The food and service were outstanding. We couldn't tell if the aquarium-like decor was supposed to be serious or funny -- we thought it was kinda funny in a good way -- but it is very nice and ironically elegant. The food and service are top-notch. We started with a selection of oysters, which were great; then the yellowtail app., dungeness crab salad starter, and a beet salad for a mid-course. We chose main courses from the second course menu, which was sufficient for us (2 people) given the oysters and three appetizers. The braised short ribs were phenomenal as was the truffle pasta, which is reminiscient of buttered noodles you eat at home on a rainy day, but cranked up with fresh pasta and truffles - dee-lish!
the food was way too overpriced for the quality of food served. the taste was just average.
review_title: the food was way too overpriced

review: Had been wanting to dine at Farallon for many years and took the opportunity while I was traveling back to San Francisco on business and staying in the area. It was worth waiting all those years. Great atmosphere (not stuffy) and service was wonderful! Food was thoughtully prepared with great flavor but most of my selections were nothing that created a "memorable" experience ... except the dessert. Chocolate Gateau made the meal. Hats off to the pastry chef!
review_title: Had been wanting to dine at

review: Dining at Farallon was a wonderful splurge. It is visually sumptuous with exquisite attention to detail. The service was attentive without being cloying. The food was very good, portions a bit small for the price. I felt special and pampered. An evening of feeling wealthy even though I'm not. My girlfriend and I shared three dishes and each had a glass of wine, which left us satisfied for a little over $100. with tip.
review_title: Dining at Farallon was a wonderful

review: I was excited to visit Farralon on our trip to the city because they seemed to be very conscientious of those with food allergies. I have Celiac's disease and can't have any gluten . I discussed with the server my allergies and they made a very basic mistake with my dish. I realized that what I was eating might have gluten in it and when I ask they confirmed that it did. The manager was very apologetic and wanted to make things better for us but it put a damper on our evening.
review_title: I was excited to visit Farralon

review: Exceptional dining experience, exceeded my wildest expectations.

I have always loved this restaurant, it remains one of my favorites to impress guests. You must get the right table, however, as I have also had a bad dining experience amid the great food. The ambiance generally is to die for and the seafood, especially scallops, remains one of the best of San Francisco. Always dine in the main dining area under the vaults, not the front or upstairs, regardless of what anyone says. Wine selection is tops. You can never go wrong. Take it from someone who lived a block away for many, many years. I still return to find the quality remains a constant!
review_title: I have always loved this restaurant

review: Once again, another outstanding dining experinece. Special mention to your Executive Wine Director, whose name I believe is Peter Palmer. He is unquestionably one of the best, most knowledgeable and totally approachable wine experts in San Francisco. Without a doubt, we're coming back.........

We had a lovely time and the food was excellent. What I liked especially was that the staff took the time to help us pick a good, affordable bottle of wine, and everyone was very friendly which isn't always the norm at fancier restaurants.
review_title: We had a lovely time and the

review:
The whole experience was fantastic. My wife and I went for dinner before a show at a local theater, which began a perfect night. Our waiter suggested a appetizer and it was excellent, along with the wine pairing he suggested for our entries. My fish was cooked perfectly and my wife's lobster was exactly to her liking. Service was impeccable, and the restaurant itself is beautiful, with different dining rooms to choose from (we dined in the main dining room).
Was it expensive? Yes. Did I get what I paid for? Yes. I would definitely return next time I am in the area for a perfect dinner.
Like dining inside a giant aquarium.  Excellent food, excellent ambiance.
Absolutely fabulous! The food was magnificent, service impeccable, and memories wonderful. A super experience from start to finish...
One of our 3 favorite restaurants in San Francisco!
I LOVE the Farallon. Excellent food, service and the atmosphere is fantastic.

I went to Open Table to find a nice restaurant in the San Francisco area. After reading the great reviews about Farallon I booked a party of 14 for a client dinner. It is risky taking clients to a place you have never been but the restaurant lived up to it's reviews. The food, service and atmosphere were spectacular. I will definitely dine at Farallon when in San Francisco in the future.
review_title: I went to Open Table to find

review: Bisque was not great the stock had been over cooked, but the chef redeemed himself with everything else we ate. The service was impecable.
review_title: Bisque was not great the stock

review:
Excellent dining experience. A beautiful and rather romantic locale. It all made for a memorable holiday occasion.

We were surprised at how many people were there given the economy.

While the food was excellent, we were a bit disappointed in the menu. The last time we were there, the menu was a bit more extensive. The menu consisted for four fish, a beef and a lamb choice, and the fish were all unknown quantities.
Farallon was excellent. My wife said it was the best restaurant she has ever experienced. We highly recommend Farallon.

Service people were not too friendly. They tried to seat us next to the kitchen. The food was very good but not at the price they charged. They did not acknowledge our special occasion (45th wedding anniversary). Overall the evening was not that special.

Certainly not your average restaurant. Many have written about the jelly-fish lamps. Sounds quirky, but it really works. The restaurant looks interesting and pleasing - the design simply works. Our food was heavenly, the staff was friendly and reasonably attentive (not perfect, though). Great wine selection and an amazing vintage port...

Definitely worth a visit.

One of the most interesting and visually pleasing restaurants I have experienced.  We had a wonderful table - it felt very private - with good service and great food.  We had only one night in San Francisco and were delighted with our choice of restaurants!

Truly exceptional food and service.  Food is fresh, creative and flavorful revealing a highly talented kitchen staff.  Service was spot on with a knowledgeable staff.  Staff balanced being formal with friendly; not stuffy.  A great place to take people you to please or impress.

The decor was amazing.  Our server was wonderful--attentive and unpretentious.  I had to pass on the fabulous oyster selection by the appeal of another appetizer, which turned out to be fabulous.  My husband and I were both disappointed by the braised beef cheeks--wish I had made a different choice.  When I asked if I could photograph some of the interior decor, the staff was not only delightfully accommodating, but even pointed out the best vantage points for photos.  I would definitely return and give the food another shot.
This is a place that my daughter and I enjoy as a mother/daughter special occasion get-together!  Very expensive--but worth every penny for a special occasion.
review_title: This is a place that my daughter

review: You have to see the design of this place! Good food and atmosphere.
review_title: You have to see the design

review: I found myself in San Francisco on Valentine's day and a Saturday night! The trip was last minute to connect with a friend in from out of town. We were worried about getting a table somewhere for dinner and so I used my opentable app to see what was nearby with availability. Ristobar popped up and we decided on going due to its proximity and being Italian.  We were all pleasantly surprised! The food was delicious, the wine was divine. The floor plan makes the room get very loud which was a bit overwhelming but easily overlooked when enjoying such a good meal. I highly recommend the Papardelle with hens of the woods mushrooms. We took some business cards on the way out so we could pass along the restaurant for recommendation to our friends.

Nice decor and small but cute street side dining too. BUT..No parking anywhere. I waited 30 minutes for my husband to find a spot. Then we both walked a long way when we left to get the car. Not too many wines unless you like Italian wine. Food list was short as well. Taste great for what we had.
Nice dining experience. Two items - the burrata appetizer and the chantrelle side dish - were too salty!

When you walk into RistoBar the atmosphere and surroundings create expectations of fine Italian cuisine. So the disappointment
is the greater when offerings come to the table. The disappointment about the preparations that come from the kitchen Is heightened
on my third visit.

I foudn this place a random on Open table and had a nice time. Our Waiter (Forgot to get his name but cute guy in Hipster glasses) went above and byond and really made the afternoon out enjoyable.

Good brunch, very tasty. There was a small issue that even though I gave the host my name and said we had a reservation, there was debate on OpenTable if I had gone. That bothered me.
review_title: I foudn this place a random

review: pasta dishes are a must here. great variety with fresh ingredients throughout the menu. the meat dishes are also great as they are fall-off-the-bone tender when it comes to ossobuco and veal cheek. i also like the extensive list for wine and cocktail selection. overall this is a great restaurant and i would love to come back in the future to try more of the great food i came to enjoy this time around
review_title: pasta dishes are a must here.

review: I have been to ristobar twice in the last couple of months. I like their new chef and think he has great potential. his specialty is a great type of small ravioli. it was outstanding. their meats and cheese is always good. service was the weak point (as it has always been since it first opened).
Have had good food on other occasions but it was mediocre this time.
review_title: Have had good food on other

review: First, the space is beautiful -- ornate but light-filled. The high ceilings give an airy, open feel. The food was good. My endive salad, shrimp risotto, and chocolate trio were all excellent. My dining partner's beet dish was good but the sauce was a little too sweet. She enjoyed the branzino (sp?) fish very much; said it was perfectly cooked, with a delicious broth. The server was friendly and helpful, if slightly awkward at times.

The food and service were very good. The wine list, dominated by Italian wines was nicely chosen. Many food options: they have a pizza oven, pastas, salads and main coarses. Desserts stood up to the regualar menu and their cheese selection was quite good too. I will go back; if you haven't yet; you should check it out too.

"We open at 530pm. Can you come back at that time?", our hostess said at 5pm when we walked into the unlocked door.
Other than waiting outside in the cold for 30 minutes and having to feed the parking meter again. We had a good experience.
Excellent restaurant! Service a bit slow. The desserts were excellent, but I wish they also offered their fantastic pastries!
very disappointed in the food. seafood dishes have very small portions of seafood. Will not go back for dinner.

We were there for the special valentine's day dinner yesterday at Choquet's and I really had to write the review. The service was pathetic, we had a reservation at 9 and from 9 to 9.30 we were standing in a line where no one attended to us to have us seated. We were the first and then followed 3-4 other couples and we were all frustrated. The restaurant wasnt even crowded and there were tables but they just left us standing. After a very bad beginning, we were served a supposedly 4 course menu which we thought included the wine/champagne but no it had to be billed separately. The food was just average and very very little in quantity. And as usual an enormous amount of dinner was just  in waiting for the dishes. I really didnt know what they were thinking. We paid a whoomping 187$ for the dinner and it was so not worth even half the money. We were relieved to get out of the restaurant and we were still super hungry that we went into a Mels Drive in for a second dinner. If I had known, I just would have avoided this costly mistake.:(

this is one of our "go to" places when we want to have a nice meal and good service . We love the food and Vincent is a great waiter!! I had the special (Cod) and my friend had the Filet. I highly recommend the Scallops and on Thursday nights they Mussel bar is fantastic!!

We started with chicken liver pate served with brioche, which was very good, and we definitely needed more bread. For the main, we had the scallops and salmon. The scallops were perfect, but the risotto that came with the scallops had little flavor so we scraped the surrounding sauce onto it. The salmon entree was much better, but I felt the salmon was a bit overcooked and slightly dry. For dessert, we split a chocolate hazelnut and banana crumble which was a pleasant ending to the meal.

Overall, a good place for dinner, but we probably won't returm.

We ate at Chouquet's after seeing a film at The Clay. Great to have a restaurant that stays open past mid afternnon with more than a bar menu. Both of us had a french wine and the salmon with fennel & spinach. It was the perfect amount of food and well priced.
We were in the mood for a good steak. Service was efficient and very pleasant.
review_title: We were in the mood for a

review: Accommodating and friendly service but the food took forever & two of the three entrees had mistakes/problems.  Had to send food back & resulted in us eating a different times.  The food was not extraordinary or special in any way.
It is terrible noisy in the restaurant, but that doesn't keep me away from the great food!!!
review_title: It is terrible noisy in the

review: For the money I think there are better options in SF. A little overpriced for what it is, food is mediocre and service is lacking.
I am very impressed with the service. The food is good. The menu is limited. But that didn't bother us that much. We are happy with our experience and will go back there in the future.
review_title: I am very impressed with the

review: Choquet's is a fun small restaurant with great food and wonderful service. We ate outside after work and thoroughly enjoyed the food and the atmosphere. Our server was very knowledgeable and provided helpful hints on delicious dishes. Choquet's is a neighborhood gem!
review_title: Choquet's is a fun small restaurant

review: A cute, cozy, sophisticated restaurant located on a relatively quiet corner in Pacific Heights. Warm, inviting, and not too loud or crowded atmosphere. Excellent for couples or people looking for the relaxing ambience on a Friday night after work.

I live in the neighborhood and have had many meals at Chouquet's, usually lunch. The food is consistently good, even if you simply have a burger. Service is sometimes slow as there's a limited waitstaff, but they are always pleasant. Outdoor seating is nice when the weather's right.
We very much enjoyed the food but the restaurant was very cold. I recommend it for brunch, in the summer.
review_title: We very much enjoyed the food

review: We had made a reservation through Open Table, but when we arrived we were told that people without reservations who had their names on  a waiting list were being seated first. Tables were very close together and loud conversations on either side made talking difficult. The eggs florentine had a watery, tasteless sauce on top.

My best friends dad was in town and since she and I trade parental dinners, I was on the hook for Tuba. I wasn't sure about Turkish but that's what dad wanted so that's what we were having. I should not have worried, yummy puffy bread for the dips (the garlic yogurt, the walnut with a little spice and dolmas). I had the garlic shrimp which was delicious, my friend had the lamb/eggplant and her dad had the dumpling thing that was amazing! It's rich but next time I'm getting that.

Our innkeeper recommended that we go to Tuba at least once during our family's week-long stay in San Francisco, and thank heaven we were able to get a reservation on Monday night.  The sampler appetizer platter is absolutely outstanding.  Everyone was very happy with his or her main course as well.  We would definitely go again.

Hello,

We reserved at the last minute and found the host to be most accommodating, as well as charming and helpful when ordering.  This place is definitely the best Turkish food in San Francisco and would be enjoyed by anyone who likes fresh Mediterranean flavors, whether they knew Turkish food or not.  
Go here!
Great experience! Very flavorful and great service!

The falafels were light and just the right crunchiness. Baked rice pudding the best I've ever tasted. The mousaka showed a deft touch wth eggplant. Servers were friendly and interested in how we liked the meal. Would return.
Came here to try something different and we were glad that we did. Enjoyed the kizatma and adana kebabi. The cevizli ezme was also great.

I took my friend here for his 50th Birthday and the food and staff were both amazing. We had the cold appetizer plate, which was a great balance of delicious flavors and textures. The zucchini appetizers were also quite tasty. We both had the Moussaka and savored every bite. The staff was very attentive and quite generous in the recognition of my friend's birthday. Overall it was an awesome and delicious experience. I would highly recommend this spot for lovers of Turkish food!
review_title: I took my friend here for

review: Great ethnic food prepared with flare. I really enjoyed the Manti! It reminded me of food found in the Latin Quarter of Paris.
3rd time we've been, fantastic every time, looking forward to more.
Great food, great service, great place. Need I say more?

Tuba is a first-rate Mediterranean/Greek/Turkish restaurant. Very authentic and delicious food that is very reasonably priced. The atmosphere is much more elegant than I'd anticipated. Overall, a real find.

This was my 2nd time at Tuba and I liked it just as much as the first. My sister is vegetarian but I am not so there were lots of options for both of us. I got the shrimp kebabs and liked them. We also tried the hot appetizer sampler plate which was great. The hummus that we ordered was the only disappointment as it was runny. Service was great though and I thought it was very classy of the chef to come out and say hello. We'll definitely be back!
review_title: This was my 2nd time at Tuba

review: The worst Turkish/Mediterranean food I have even eaten!!

My Table service was excellent. The only reason I didn't give an excellent for overall and service was because of the person who sat us. I had a reservation and the person who sat me and my guest didn't look at me for 10 min as I stood next to the door. She sat everyone else, including people who came in after me. I was glad I put in a reservation. I may not have gotten a seat.
Good food although nothing on the menu for a vegan diet. The booths are perfect for business conversation.

Range is a great, reliable foodie's fantasy located in food-nirvana AKA The Mission District.  Everything was great, and to me, they do fresh fish about as well as anyplace I have ever been to!  Excellent , creative cocktails also... Only downside is the space is somewhat cramped, and it can be pretty noisy.  Parking is a nightmare in that area...take public transport (you can walk here from 16th St. BART sta.) or a cab or allow plenty of extra time to find a spot...
Great meal! inventive, yummy deserts always.  Impeccable service.  Moderate noise levels.  Comfortable in all regards.  A real pleasure!
review_title: Great meal! inventive, yummy deserts alw...

review: Server was outstanding and atmosphere was interesting and intriguing cocktail selection. However, food was over spiced, especially with salt.
review_title: Server was outstanding and atmosphere wa...
