review: Whats to say- the menu online looks delicious and the dishes were excellent and tasty.  great ambience for date night or a few friends. we did nto get to try the cocktails as we brought own wine.  We maybe should have ordered a few more appetizers than one per person. My only complaint is they could have provided a bit more bread. otherwise great spot to try.

It seems as if Range has slipped. We have enjoyed it for quite a few years. This is a destination restaurant, and after the hassle of driving in circles to finally land a parking spot, one really expects the food to knock your socks off. It used to.
Oh, and with all the excellent Pinot Noirs we have in CA, why pick a French one that is soooo light and tasteless.
Our main courses were good - the trout and the halibut. However, I would not order either one again.
review_title: It seems as if Range has slipped.

review: Had a delicious dinner here on Friday night. The beet salad was great, and the short rib entree was melt in your mouth good. I'd just been to French Laundry a few days earlier (I know that my shame should be high for going out to eat so much in one week, but it was a confluence of birthday dinners), so I'd had the best in the area and this restaurant held it's own right next to that experience. The service was great, the wine was really good. The dessert was not great, but, I could have chosen something else. It's just really loud, is the only negative I have about the place. So loud, I was leaning across the table to hear my companion. But, highly recommend.
The steak I ordered was a little bit too salty but my friend's pork dish was super yummy....super soft and sweet.
Outstanding food and drinks. First rate service. Always an enjoyable experience. One of the very best San Francisco restaurants.
It was highly recommended so when I went I liked it but it was not unbelievable. Its still a great place to go because its got vibe.

Range was ok, but disappointing. To begin with the waiter described how rose was made authoritatively and inaccurately. We got the cod and pork shoulder. Cod was pretty fishy, pork shoulder very fatty and salty. For the price and reputation I'd expect a lot more. It's fine overall, but Don't think I'll be back.

I booked the morning of our dining experience.A cc was required to hold the res in case of a no-show ($10/diner).I could have cancelled the res by 5pm the day BEFORE the dinner date...We 3 arrived together-the hostess looked right at us and said is everyone here? ... We were promptly seated (6pm) in a visually lovely corner table.Unfortunately there was no leg space under the table. Two women were seated at the table adjacent to us.The hostess came to their table & asked rather loudly, 'did you seat yourself?!'.No, another staff person seated them.The hostess quite obviously circled the room frequently noting each and every table's status.Not a relaxing dinner.The hostess experience dulled the anticipated culinary experience.
review_title: If you're in a hurry, eat here!

review: Loved the food, loved the service, loved the drinks. The vegetarian options were inspired!

While the food is still outstanding, I feel like the value at Range has decreased since the last time we dined there. Portions had shrunk significantly. A couple of dishes had such tiny portions it was an embarrassment. Service was fine, but not incredible. Price point is high. We've dined at Range at least a half dozen times in the last 5 years but I wonder if we'd go back after our recent experience.
review_title: While the food is still outstanding

review: Our meal at Range may be one of our families top meals of all time. The restaurant feel was casual but chic. The staff was lovely, attentive and friendly. We had two children with us, and Range made up a couple really unique and tasty non-alcoholic drinks for them to enjoy while the adults had, equally delicious, cocktails. The food was great, really fresh with nice combinations of flavors. A pork dish with peppers and cabbage slaw blew us away with the depth of flavor. A starter salad that looked to have about 3 ingredients (lettuce, radishes...), was also vibrant and delicious beyond expectation. We just wish we lived closer, this would be a go-to special occasion place.

The food at Range was very average but relative to other San Francisco restaurants in the same price range it is poor. I had the chicken, which is fine but nothing to write home about. We also got the Ahi and chicken liver spread. The ahi was a tiny portion and probably only good for 1-2 people. The chicken liver was good. The portions in general are small with the exception of the chicken. Overall I'd say this is not a place worth going to especially when there are so many better restaurants in the neighborhood.
review_title: The food at Range was very

review: My husband and I took family here, who were traveling from out of state. We had an amazing time. I really liked the vibe of the restaurant. It's small, but cute, in a not overdone way. Our waitress was amazing. She knew the menu inside and out. She described every meal and answered all of our questions with patience. She gave great recos for wine too. The entrees and apps were nicely spread apart. Everything was so tasty and beautifully done. You can't go wrong, but both fish entrees and the ribs were excellent. The ravioli and chicken pate for the apps were so yummy too. It was a really high quality restaurant and I would recommend going if you want a nice, long, un-rushed meal.
review_title: My husband and I took family

review: Great place, very good food, but salty. The menu is not that distinctive.

The starter of the stuffed pasta was excellent and its accompanying sauce was outstanding. The chicory salad was judged good (me) and very good (companion). I had the beef loin with the barley; hearty and earthy - great winter dish; good mix of textures and flavors. My companions had the roasted chicken (deemed excellent) and pork (very good). While the better tables are in the back, the down-side is that it gets stuffy and the place is LOUD - one reason I go early. Service was outstanding and I forgot to ask the waitperson her name.
Very welcoming, gorgeous decor, excellent service and delicious food - perfect night out!

From the moment we entered, to when we left, this was an exceptional experience. Wonderful cocktails, exceptional service including wine recommendations for our entrees, and the food... superb! Well seasoned, with a beautiful combination of flavors & textures. W e will be back, and will highly recommend to our friends & family. Thanks!

We've tried Range a few times now and still not sure what the fuss is about. Food was good to average. Menu selection is quite small. Roast chicken main course was very bland with not much of interest. In general the flavors are very muted. Chef needs to bump up the flavor. Probably will not return anytime soon. I really wanted to like this place but it just hasn't delivered for the price and hype.
review_title: We've tried Range a few times

review: The food was absolutely impeccable. Uncomplicated but incredibly savory and flavorful. Each ingredient really shone through, and every bite was amazing! The service was excellent--it was so good we never caught ourselves wondering "Where's our server? Could we get fresh drinks? Where's our food?" like we usually do at most restaurants.
The cocktails were very interesting but the chicken was boring and a little dry.

Simple but very inventive menu, fresh ingredients, amazing flavor combos, super friendly highly efficient service, buzzy ambiance. Signature coffee rubbed pork dish justly famous. Our first time and we bravely took overseas visitors. We were rewarded with high praise for choosing Range.

Service was exceptional. Attentive, respectful, non-invasive. Really appreciated the fact that they didn't come up to us every two minutes and ask how our food or experience was. We were able to have a wonderful dinner and a wonderful conversation with minimal interruption. Besides the great food, I would return for the service alone.

Food here is top notch. Every dish we had was excellent except for the steak. The steak is not to be ordered, nothing special or stand out about it. The flounder was excellent, the chicken had amazing flavor and the pork was very original and deliscous. We also really enjoyed the chicken liver appetizer.

However food is not all the experience and unfortunately we did not have a waitress that shared the same enthuthiasm for the food as we had. We pushed passed this and asked a different server for some reccomendations but the service from our waitress definetely left something to be desired.

We will try again and request a different waitress because the food was out standing.
review_title: Food here is top notch. Every

review: On a recent visit to San Francisco, a salesperson in a clothing store recommended Range as a place to try -- and I am very glad he did. The atmosphere was hip and fresh, the service was spectactular, and the food was simply outstanding. Everyone in my party was thrilled with the entire experience, and I will be sure to visit the restaurant again the next time I am in town.
review_title: On a recent visit to San Francisco,

review: The food was delicious and service was outstanding. We felt as though we were treated very well. The only complaint is that the space is too crowded. For a high quality restaurant, losing about two or three tables to free up a few inches around each table would be appreciated. The table next to us (a corner) had a diner who's back was literally against our table at no fault to the diner.
Great food and service. Very friendly, casual and the food was spectacular. Good wine too.

I live in the Mission and have gone to Range a couple of times a year since it opened. Love it; casual well-prepared food walking distance from my house. I've been commuting to an East Coast job the past year and a half, and haven't made the rounds in SF as much as I'd like, so my recent visit to Range was my first in 18 months. I thought it had lost a bit of its luster. Food was great, service so-so. The only rezzie we could get was early, and it felt like the place wasn't quite ready for business when we arrived, wait staff couldn't get the timing quite right on the table service. Nothing catastrophic, just rougher around the edges than I'd remembered. Plus, I wanted a single malt scotch after dinner, and wasn't impressed with the list
review_title: I live in the Mission and

review: The server was very patient with us considering we took forever to look at the menu and order. We were too busy chatting but never felt rushed. The food was outstanding. We shared the best pasta I have ever had that featured artichokes with meyer lemons. The little gem salad was refreshing. I had the lamb, both chop and brisket and it was done to perfection with spaetzle and baby turnips. I tasted the steeltrout and it was seasoned well. The rose geranium chocolates at the end were a nice compliment to a very good meal.
We were in heaven. The meals were superb, creative and delicious. Our servers were so attentive and made us feel at home. We are impressed. We will return again soon !
review_title: We were in heaven. The meals

review: We had an absolutely wonderful meal. The small menu is well crafted, and every dish was excellent. Service couldn't be better. An excellent value.
Very good food! Moderately priced. Fun/louder atmosphere!

The food was good but not worth the money. There was 4 of us at the table. You couldn't hear the people talking across the table from you. We were disappointed. Not what I expected for a Michelein one star.
review_title: The food was good but not

review:
Food was excellent and a very good value. Interesting, tasty, well presented with a nice staff to make it all go even more smoothly. Pleasant ambiance without being overdone or trying too hard.

One ding is the wine list. They had a fairly large selection of interesting and off beat wines, but at least for me, they didn't cover the basics. No decent Chardonnay (only two on the list, one of which they didn't have), and only two Cabernet Sauv's, one of which was $210. It took some of the fun away from the good food value to pay $70 for a third choice wine. Others who are more adventurous may do well with their "zenato lugana san benedetto (trebbiano) 2007" or "weingut schloss gobelsburg grner veltliner steinsetz 2006" whatever those are.
review_title: Food was excellent and a very

review: Range never disappoints. Thanks again for a fantastic meal for my best girlfriend's birthday!

From the moment we walked in, the evening was perfect. We were immediately greeted and shown our table. It was continued smooth sailing from that point on. The cocktails, the food and ESPECIALLY the service were all outstanding. It has been a long time since I dined out and left without one major disappointment. I heartily recommend RANGE to anyone and will certainly return again.
As always the food is first rate. The noise however seems to me to be worse.
review_title: As always the food is first

review: To say that Range is a bargain does not do it justice. It's among the best places in San Francisco but is priced well down the scale. The service is unpretentious and thoughtful. There are affordable wine choices and capable help pairing them with their frequently changing menu. Get there a bit early to have one of their specialty cocktails at the bar.
review_title: To say that Range is a bargain

review:
Spent Christmas weekend in San Francisco, one of my favorite cities, and this was a highlight of our trip. It was definetly the best meal we had during the weekend, and since we were in San Francisco, we had many very good meals.

I had the following and would recommend both: Marinated Leeks with poached egg and bread crumbs and Roasted Chicken with bread salad.

Our first time there. Seemed to have a happy vibe, though the tables are very close together so not the place for secrets to be divulged. Cocktai menu looked good though I didn't partake. Service was fine, though had to ask our server about specials we overheard from another waiter. Food was very good. I was especially impressed by the dessert of pomegranate granita with cardamom ice cream and crushed rose meringue. Inventive, though working with a Persian/Middle Eastern flavor palate, it was both tasty and beautiful. If I lived in the neighborhood, I would be back a lot. I live outside of the city but would definitely go back because Range offered very good value for the level of food.

Fresh, delicious and attractively presented food. Making a rich flavorful vegetarian mushroom soup is no small task and the mushroom aroma preceded the soup to the table. Would love to know how they did it! The upsidedown plum tart was so good I may just go back for dessert and an after dinner drink.

I particularly liked my starter salad of little gem lettuces. All the food options looked like they would be delicious, but most were not what I'd usually pick for a warm summer evening, I'm sure I'd enjoy it even more if I came in cold weather for hearty comfort food. 

I also appreciated the wait staff. Even when I thought our server might be annoyed with us (or just very busy perhaps) we received polite service and just the right amount of attention. A rarity for us in the Mission.
My favorite place in SF, at the moment. I've yet to have a bad (or even mediocre) experience there.
review_title: My favorite place in SF, at

review: Wonderful, as always. One of our favorite SF restuarants - and we eat out a lot.
great food but unbearably noisy.  Needs to soften surfaces to damp down sound.  might not return because of it.

I really liked the urban chic, minimalist-simple decor because it gave the place a modern, clean feel.  However, the noise level was incredibly high in the back dining room, so it felt like we were shouting at each other during dinner, and it was difficult to hear our dining companions just across the table.  The food was enjoyable, but I had such high expectations that I was a little let down.  Nothing was bad - it just wasn't as inventive as I thought it would be.  Service was great - very attentive and friendly without being obtrusive.
review_title: I really liked the urban chic,

review:
My opinion about bread: Their is no excuse for bad bread. Bacco got it perfect. Some heft to the bread with slightly more chewy than crispy crust. It came with some olive oil and pesto. We ate too much. 
My wife and I shared two appetizers: Barbirtole - Beet salad, goat cheese, orange, honey citrus dressing, and Impepeta - Sauteed clams and mussels, olive oil, garlic and tomato. The Barbirtole was a nice portion after splitting in two (which they did for us). It was very fresh, simple and tasty. The Impepeta would be a large appetizer for one. Very nice and the save some bread (or get more) to dip in the sauce.
Main Courses were awesome and the lasagna was awesome. Friendly and efficient service with a nice personal feel. We will go back.
review_title: REAL Italian Food, Best Lasagna I have ever had!

review: Haven't been to this venue in some time.  Previous visits were very enjoyable: food, service and ambience.  This time however, was disappointing: new menu, higher prices and curt service.  We asked to split an order of meatballs as an appetizer; they were delicious however, there were only 3 SMALL meatballs (for two grown men) and priced at $10.00 -- that is $3.33 per meatball!  The main course (veal scallopini) was tasteless and the ravioli as a main course were meager.  Overall, a very disappointing dinner for the price. This restaurant is currently off of my radar for future outings.
My husband and I were thrilled to find this place! We will go back frequently. What a perfect night.
They appreciate how to make gluten-free Italian food. They are warm and friendly, too.

Dined here with neighbors for a holiday get together. We love our Noe Valley and are pleased there are quality places to dine. The Prix Fix had very nice choices, I chose the chicken prosciutto - excellent flavor and cooked very well. Dessert a simple but excellent vanilla ice cream/gelato with espresso. A great evening.

We have been here many times through the years and always enjoy this establishment. One thing we have noticed though is the service is always rushed. This visit it was even more so. Plates were taken away before food was finished. We felt like we were being really hurried. To bad because the food as always was very good.
review_title: We have been here many times

review: Excellent neighborhood restaurant worth a trip from any part of San Francisco or the Bay Area.
OK for dinner. Nice ambiance. We tried some pasta dish and the stuffed calamari. Food was good but pricey for what we got. Service was very spotty especially towards the end of our meal.

I have been there many times and the menu keeps the same quality every time.
Great restaurant!
Excellent, authentic food served by friendly professionals in a lovely atmosphere.
Excellent evening with out of town guests who enjoyed the food and the atmosphere of this intimate establishment. We were not rushed and the last to leave.
One of my all time favorite restaurants. I've been many times over the years and have always had the greatest of experiences. It always impresses first time quests.
review_title: One of my all time favorite

review: This is our second to visit Bacco's and we most certainly will return. We were greeted like old friends. We even had the same waiter as the prior time and he remembered us. The food was delicious and we felt so cared for.
review_title: This is our second to visit

review: I always enjoy my dining experiences at Bacco. The decor evokes an old-world aura with tiled floors and large ceramic pots and platters adorning the walls. Even when it's busy the noise level isn't bad, though we usually go early on a week night. The wait staff is attentive and helpful with both food and wine selections. We have had the fillet of sole and the salmon, which were impeccably prepared, moist, and very fresh. The entrees come with a helping of potatoes and a green vegetable. The salads are fresh and dressed just enough to enhance the greens without overwhelming them. The bread is delicious, as are the refreshing sorbetti, and the luscious buttermilk panna cotta.
review_title: I always enjoy my dining experience

review: Quite expensive for what you get. Food is great, the servings are ok, but the prices are really bad!
Pasta was wonderful. Staff very attentive. Although I enjoyed my dining experience, I felt it was a bit pricy. I would go back again with a friend(s)for perhaps their first experience.
Food taste really fresh. I had ink squid pasta with mussels and clams (a special) and the mussels were the plumpest I ever had.

Notwithstanding consistent praise from the Chron, Michelin, Zagat's, etc. and the recent rave review on KQED's Check Please!, it is still relatively easy to get a table at Bacco on weeknights.  Diners on those evenings get to enjoy the great food, professional service and attractive room in an environment that is more relaxed than during the busy weekend nights.  People should take advantage of that opportunity.

A short drive off the beaten path and well worth it.  Service was friendly, but not fawning.  Food was authentic, fresh Italian cuisine.  I would recommend it to locals and visitors as a refreshing change from the North Beach scene.  Ravioli special of the day was delightful, as were the two veal dishes our group ordered.  Wines were a tad pricey, but we brought our own.  We're going back.
review_title: A short drive off the beaten

review: The buffet and endless drinks were amazing! Loved the do it yourself bloody mary bar. Only complaint is that there were too many young loud people and the staff did not ask them to quiet down. Won't stop me from going back though!

Found this place while looking for an alternative to pricey and stuff SF brunch buffets. Food was good, hand made sausage patties and yummy cheese grits. It's small enough that the food is still made in small enough batches to be fresh. Bottomless mimosas were a hit. Definetely try this for a casual brunch buffet.

I'll start by saying the food at Ironside isn't going to blow your mind. I think for someone to assume so would unfairly level high expectations against them. It is a brunch buffet that serves its purpose of being decent quality, fresh breakfast/brunch food with a southern twist. Add to that the interchangeable bottomless bloody marys (which are not made with vodka, unfortunately; I assume they are with Soju) and mimosas (of which there are 4-5 different flavors), and you have a recipe for a great time with a good group of friends. It is definitely affordable and I am a fan.

We return here often, so I think that speaks for itself.
Great weekend brunch!
Love the endless mimosa and bloody Mary bar.
review_title: We return here often, so I

review: It's hard to pass up bottomless brunch, mimosas, and bloody Marys. The food was buffet-style, so come hungry to get your $17 worth. Our server was attentive & kept the drinks flowing. The only negative was the fact that although I arrived 20 minutes early (fluke of transport), it was 40 minutes past our reservation time when we were finally seated. The number of walk-ins the hostess sat at tables that could have accommodated our party was unacceptable. I've worked as a hostess in fine dining (using OpenTable), so the fact that she refused to make adjustments based on how tables were looking really bothered me. But overall we still had a great time - I'll definitely go back, just might not make a reservation next time. ;)
review_title: It's hard to pass up bottomless

review: we went on saturday and didn't realize it was brunch only. it was okay
review_title: we went on saturday and didn't

review: Bottomless mimosa's & brunch. The oatmeal is delicious! Great place to pre-game before Giant's day games!
Nice addition to SOMA, fairly eclectic menu, food well-prepared, attractive interior. Waiter indifferent and bordering on surly at times, but overall a good experience.

Great food and ambiance. Casual atmosphere yet still sophisticated. Drink selection and cocktails were great and the bartenders were helpful with their recommendations. The steak and burger we ordered were made perfectly. Would definitely come back!
Extremely attentive waiters and waitresses, impressively great food, no wonder you have to book this place weeks in advance!

I enjoyed the food and so did my guests, but really, a corkage fee of $20 even though we also purchased two of your bottles of wine? So...until that moment I enjoyed the evening. I asked our server, and she replied it is the "establishment's policy." Fortunately, there are other wonderful restaurants in town who don't feel the need to ask for corkage especially when also buying a wine or two from the wine list. I liked the flavors of the food but the snobby young man at the entrance desk and the corkage fee will probably keep me from returning, since I had to wait a full 30 days for the honor anyway.

Arles Tooker

Brunch at Nopa should be on everyone's must-do list. Our party of six was seated promptly (they didn't require that our entire party was present, which was appreciated). The custard french toast with blueberries is amazing, as are the egg dishes. Cocktails and mocktails are very well executed. The only criticism is that they stop brunch service at 2:30 and asked us for "last call" on food before we received our orders, so seconds were not an option.

Our daughter goes to USF and we found this restaurant in the neighborhood and could not have been more pleased. The Food was excellent the first time and every time afterwards. We have had Brunch ( get the French Toast ) Lunch and Dinner there numerous times and have never been disappointed. The only downfall is parking, but that's all over San Francisco. Also make sure you make reservations in plenty of time, there is always a line out the door, come rain or shine.

Went for a birthday got a complementary amuse bouche. Wine server was very informative. Food was beautiful and perfectly cooked. Our favorite was the goat cheese with beets and crostini. Nopa lives up to its name.

I enjoyed everything here at Nopa the food and the service.  I made a reservation a month in advance for my husbands birthday.  Prices were good not to pricey like some San Francisco restaurants.  Will definitely be back again.! If you get there right when they open up I hear from other reviews you can sit at the bar or at the communal table without having a reservation.

We made a reservation a month ago for a double date. The restaurant ambience is really romantic and spacious. Our server was attentative and patient b/c we were so busy chatting we could not decide on what to get. The corn and hazelnut salad was delicious as was the flatbread. I had the pappardelle with lamb ragout and it was suberb. Rich and flavorful, but not too heavy. The desserts looked amazing, but it was so warm in there we had to hit the street for some Bi-Rite.
You're looking at long lines and a bigger bill, but it's always worth it if you're into food and atmosphere.
NOPA never disappoints and this time was no different. Still one of my favorite spots in SF.
Delicious and unique food. We also loved the cocktails. Reasonably priced. Definitely try the tagine!

This was our first visit after wanting to come here for over a year. Everything that we ordered was fantastic. We started with the warm goat cheese which had asian pear, kiwi & crostini. The 4 entress were the lamb, the pork chop, rotissere chicken & the grass fed hamburger with bleu cheese. We shared 2 desserts which were also well received, we had the date & walnut ckae & the chocolate cake. We look forward to our return visit.
review_title: This was our first visit after

review: Nopa is always top notch on all accounts. Drinks, food, service...it's the perfect storm.
review_title: Nopa is always top notch on

review: Our waiter was outstanding. He waived the bottle fee of $15 for us and the service was excellent.
Best ever!!! I travel to sf every year just to eat here for my bday!
review_title: Best ever!!! I travel to sf

review:
Tasty salad to start, then rotisserie chicken, which was succulent. Given the size of the courses, suggest sharing appetizer and dessert.
Reasonably priced wines by the glass, e.g., cava for $7.
Lively atmosphere without being deafening.

Impeccable service and amazing food in an unpretentious and relaxed way. A place I can bring my family for graduation dinner and everyone's content - from me, the extremely picky local/organic proponent who is constantly disappointed by restaurant service - to my brother's friend who is still raving about the KFC Double Down he had for dinner the night before.
Superb food, knowledgeable service. The chicken was outstanding, the salads different and wonderful.

We started with the goat cheese crostini and soup. The crostini starter was good. The bread was not tough in your mouth so you can enjoy eating & tasting everything. The broth the soup had was probably one of the 2 best I've ever had in my life. I finished her bowl.

I had the pork, she had the crab pasta. Both had great flavor profiles. She noted her dish had a lot of crab, which is to say the portion was proportionally balanced. The pork entree is something they are noted for. My piece was a tad on the dry side, but still passable. The kitchen knows what its doing 9.9 times out of 10.

Went with coffee & the cookies for dessert. Cookies: Good, but not wow-ing. Their espresso, I'd come back just to have a cup.

Server was on point.
review_title: It's all it's cracked up to be.

review: My boyfriend and i are complete night owls so we are always looking for some late night dinners. Nopa has been wonderful because not only is the food amazing, but its open LATE and the service is always wonderful. The atmosphere is very vibrant no matter how late we arrive and we usually close down the place- AND since we are usually last ones out-- I am very thankful and impressed to report that never have we once felt like we were getting kicked out of the place. We always feel incredibly welcome.
review_title: My boyfriend and i are complete

review: One of the best dining experiences we've ever had. We had the best seats in the house (upstairs above the kitchen) and seeing how the food was being prepared was extra. The kitchen staff seemed like they liked what they were doing and you tasted it in the food. Our server was super-knowledgeable with the food/wine pairings. Dessert was of course a gem! Although a very popular place now, it still maintained its neighborhood restaurant feel. Bravo!

From the moment we were seated to the final bite NOPA was wonderful! I took my college student daughter for brunch and everything was delicious. We are still talking about the goat cheese bread pudding appetizer. The custard apple French Toast was so good and thanks to the server who recommended the smaller portion with a bacon side. The chile rubbed pork with hominy and black eye peas was comfort food at it's best. The sorbet trio included pink pearl apple-what a delicious finish. NOPA gives me another reason to return to San Francisco (as if I need one). Also, the space is beautiful!

The flatbread appetizer was the best part of out meal and it was very good. For entree I ordered the roasted chicken and it was good but not great.
She ordered the popular pork chop and it was also just ok. The pork had a smokey taste to it. I have had the pork chop at Boulevard and it's really hard to compare any other pork chop to the boulevard one.
In all honesty, I was hoping for better flavor out of the food.
This is an amazing restaurant!! We loved it and will come back again and again. We have told all our friends about it also. The staff were wonderful to us as it was our anniversary.

Service a bit on the slow side, but friendly and knowledgeable. Food was very good and i was full after splitting a salad and an entree (pork chops live up to the hype). A tad on the expensive side for what it is. The place was full, as was the bar area.
review_title: Service a bit on the slow

review:
Service - inviting, warm, attentive, knowledgeable = 5 stars.

Food - super fresh ingredients, interesting preparations, perfect execution = 5 stars

My highest recommendation.
You won't find another meal this good in San Francisco after 11pm.
Overall very good as usual. Chicken breast was just a little dry or would have gone 4 stars for food. Great service, waiter was knowledgable and helpful as well as on top of things.
GR-R-E-A-T... we love nopa, we can walk from our house, food is fantastic, service is professional and friendly. Consistently excellent.

nopa knocked our socks off, and we've been doing the NW-fresh, farm-to-table thing for years. Everything was stellar with no flat notes (even the coffee was perfect). We can't wait to come back, it was the highlight of our week.
Best pork chop EVER! Perfectly cooked, seasoned, and juicy!

The food and the waiter was excellent, BUT their kitchen was backed up or something that it took them 1.5 hour to bring our entree after the appetizer. We had 7pm reservation, but we got out of there at 9:30pm. We loved the food, but no, we will not go back!
review_title: The food and the waiter was

review: I love the indoor/outdoor ambiance. Very cool and hip. Service was great. Waiter was helpful and good sense of humor. Perry's food is always good.
review_title: I love the indoor/outdoor ambiance. Very...

review: I was surprised that the restaurant was not full on a Saturday night in San Francisco.  The place is close to the Embarcadero with a beautiful scene of the bay bridge.  I had ordered the only steak (NY) on the menu.  They gave me this huge knife so my anticipation was whetted.  However when my main dish came the steak was covered with gravy, potatoes and some veggies.  The thickness of the steak was that of a pancake.  This was not the right cut of steak. My huge knife was laughable at the thinness of this pancake beef thing.  Highly disappointing, but now I know why the restaurant was dead on a Saturday night.  Won't go back.

Sens offers something unique in terms of French-inspired restaurants in America -  the ambience of Marseilles - a mix of the food of the Pays d'Oc and the more exotic elements of the Maghreb. Whether you like more traditional French Mediterranean cuisine or high quality Moroccan/ Algerian dishes such as Harissa, falafel, babaghanoush and the like, there is much to like here. The outside terrace is a treat on a sunny day and the bar is good as the week draws to a close.

I thought that Sens had great food, stellar views, and a fun ambiance. However, I also thought that portion sizes were small, and that the food was pretty overpriced. The service could have been better and more attentive, but was fine. It was a decent spot for a date.

I come here for lunch almost every week. The Paella is excellent and the Fatoush with chicken is a perfect lunchtime meal. Not too heavy, and teh chicken is cooked to perfection. Stuffed olives are always a great starter. The service is good but not quite great, sometimes I end up waiting unnecessarily long for someone to grab the check or check in on drinks. The view to the Bay and Embarcadero is great. the outdoor Patio is also a great option when the weather is nice. There are not many restaurants in this part of downtown, so Sens is a reasonably priced, reasonably quiet place for a business lunch. Decent wine list as well.

I have eaten here many times. The chef is very creative and the food is always very fresh and tasty. There's something for every taste. Service is always very professional and friendly. The Blood Orange drink is especially fantastic. Both thumbs up!

Dining at Sens is always an absolute delight. It's very spacious and the food is
always delicious. It's a real treat to introduce anyone who's not been here or
for someone who wants to come again. I have never been disappointd with a meal.
review_title: Dining at Sens is always an

review: Great appetizers except the spreads, which were a disappointment. Bronzino entree was fantastic: charred skin and light meat. First rate! But beware the Friday night happy hour crowd if you actually want to hear what your friends next to you are saying.
I've now eaten there several times over the past 5 years. While they have some good, standby dishes, the new ones have been uniformly disappointing.
Excellent lunch. Portions were perfect for a lunch. Gourmet quality.

I've eaten at Sens several times and have always loved it. The food this time was as wonderful as always, but the service was below par compared to my previous experiences. This won't, however, stop me from eating there again!

We had a great table right near the window, overlooking the Embarcadero, Ferry Building and Bay Bridge. But more importantly, the food was good! I went with 2 other girlfriends and we decided to eat family style. The meal started with delicious warm bread and a heavenly garlicky hummus olive oil spread. Probably our favorite starter was warm goat cheese with a nutty crust, drizzled in honey and accompanied by a mache salad with citrus and dates. We also really enjoyed the eggplant flatbread. The baby green salad was good, but a little overdressed. The big surprise of the night was the ravioli (an entree that we shared). Unusual, but delicious mix of sweet and sour. I would highly recommend it. The service was attentive, without hovering.
review_title: We had a great table right

review: Excellent food and service. Always a pleasure to visit.

I went for "Dine Around Town" event. I had Caramelized Eggplant Agrodulce with Garlic Croutons for appetizer, Seared Tombo Tuna, Vinaigrette Nioise, Orzo, Haricots Verts for main course, and Banana Crepe, Chocolate Sauce, Toasted Almonds for desert. Each one is delicious and comes with good presentation. This is quality food for $21.95+tax+tip, very worthwhile. It also has a very nice view overlooking Ferry Building.

It was a first date. I appreciated how our server was attentive, but not intrusive. We were talking with each other so much. There was obvious teamwork because they were quick to take away empty plates and make sure we were good on drinks. This is all on top of great dishes.

I would come back and show people this place and their menu.
review_title: It was a first date. I appreciated

review: Went to Sens for a business lunch. There was a huge group next to us, but we didn't notice any noise. The restaurants beautiful decor must suck up the surrounding noise. The place is gorgeous, huge, great location, and the food is delicious to boot. Staff was also very friendly and helpful.
review_title: Went to Sens for a business

review: Our party of four visited Sens on a Friday night. The service was awkward. Our waiter seemed flustered or perhaps just over-worked, constantly apologizing for things that really didn't matter. He left us for over fifteen minutes to look over the menu. I ordered the rack of lamb medium and received it rare. The setting is pretty, with lots of stone walls and nice tables, but it seems like it should be quieter than it is. We had to speak loudly to hear each other across the table. Overall, the experience could have been great but turned out to be just fair.

It was a quiet Monday, but the entire staff was prepared to show us a good time.  On our reservation form, I mentioned it was our 24th anniversary.  Everyone from the hostess to the manager wished us a happy celebration, and they made it very special.

The food is just a bit exotic with its northern African and southern European elements.  But nothing was so exotic that I would hesitate to recommend it to fairly sophisticated diners.  The wine list is exceptional, and the glasses (Schott Zweisel) are outstanding.  Service was quite good as well, warm without being intrusive.
review_title: It was a quiet Monday, but

review: We loved our evening at Cafe Milano: it was transporting.  We felt as if we were in Italy: great food, no nonsense, genuine service and great food.
Tight, cozy, & busy - sure. East Bay resident enjoys finding the SF nbhd gems. Very, very good ravioli, gnocchi, brussel sprout soup, bruschetta. Will return.
review_title: Tight, cozy, & busy - sure. East Bay res...

review: This place is my favorite Italian restaurant in SF.  It is authentic Italian with the owners and servers all from Italy.  It's cozy, comfortable and the service and wine list are great.

What a great find Ristorante Milano is! Especially appreciated our waiter, Raphael's advice on the menu and the wine. I'll be back. Wish they had real bread. Instead, serve a sweet, soft yeast bread. I always like a hard italian roll with my pasta.
If you like Italian food , this is the place. Authentic cuisine and great wines from Italy.

One of the best Italian restaurants I've experienced. Thoroughly enjoyed the evening. Food and service unsurpassed. Parking is a challenge, but is available at the corner of Polk & Pacific (one block from restaurant) for a flat fee of $10.00.
Outstanding food in a beautiful out of the way Russian Hill neighborhood.

If you plan a cozy, romantic an unforgettable evening with your beloved one(s) then Ristorante Milano at Pacific Street is definitively a spot you want to take into consideration! Fantastic food (had the Bresaola as a starter, mixed grill plate and Linguine Frutti di Mare - all 'delizioso'!) astounding wine-list (many top wines - some in single glass available!), excellent service in a warm and friendly atmosphere make your dinner a memorable event. The restaurant provides mostly tables for two or four. However, also bigger groups get the possibility to enjoy this neighborhood gem. Make sure to make a reservation ahead (especially for bigger groups)! Ristorante Milano is definitively a place to come back and back and back again...!
Wonderful appetizers and delicious. The best thing about this restaurant is the warmth of their staff -- you really feel like family there!
Food was amazing, service was wonderful...but there seems to be a ventilation problem with the kitchen. Smokey! Other then that...just a gem!!

We had a corked bottle of wine and the owner made us feel like we were exaggerating and being ridiculous. They did replace it begrudgingly in the end but it soured me on the whole dining experience. We drink a lot wine and I know a corked bottle when I smell/taste one. It had a musty wet paper smell, though subtle. It was my father's birthday and he didn't want drama so I tried not to get too mad or consider leaving. Though the food was easily 5 stars I will not be returning. There are simply too many other dining options for that price to deal with poor service.
review_title: Pray you don't get a corked wine.

review: Small but not cramped, pleasant helpful engaging staff
Excellent dinner and great dessert (their poached pear is a favorite).
The place is very small, but that gives it a family-like atmosphere. The food was delicious and the service was great. Would definitely return.
review_title: The place is very small, but

review: Excellent food and service! Can't wait to come back!
Second fabulous experience. Great menu selections, incredibly prepared delicious food, and service that was welcoming, professional and attentive.

We made reservations for 6 p.m., but when we arrived, the hostess seemed oblivious when I mentioned it to her. I had requested seating in a special area, but since we were the second party to arrive, it ended up not being a big deal. Also, they did not seem to have their "specials" ready for the waiter to announce to us. He came back about 10 minutes later with that information. It has been at least 6 years since I've been back, but the food is still consistently good. And the waiter who served our table was very accommodating and friendly.
It has gotten a little pricier and the corkage fee was $20!
review_title: It has gotten a little pricier

review: Too noisy, tables very close together. Fried sardine appetizer was served over a bed of sauteed onions which just makes it soggy and not crispy. Homemade pastas were very good but as so often happens in the states served with way too much sauce.
Had heard about Milano for years and had a chance to try. It's a nice neighborhood spot with a friendly staff.

Ristorante Milano was a wonderful experience. They were amazingly helpful and gracious. After I learned I had booked my dinner on the wrong night they quickly remedied the mistake. In all aspects the restaurant was incredibly accomidating. When helping me decide on wine, our server gave wonderful, and spot-on descriptions of the two he would reccommend, and even went so far as to bring us tastes to ensure we would like his selection. The menu was wonderful and authentic. Every dish we received was a success. The homemade pasta was incredible, the fish was perfectly prepared, and the veal ravioli was light and satisfying. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves italian food, in a casual and inviting setting.
Cole Valley is a great neighborhood. Zazie was very good. We plan to return.
review_title: Cole Valley is a great neighborhood. Zaz...

review: Our meal was well executed! We particularly liked the beet arugula salad, chicken liver brandy pate, fettuccini portabella mushroom dishes.

Reliably good food. Cousins from Sacramento had heard about restaurant, which my husband and i had been to before. Table ready on time. Good selection and everything seemed very fresh. One person had the "hot chocolate" dessert and thought it was fabulous. She also enjoyed the trout, and is normally very fussy!

I have found brunch and dinner to be the best meals at Zazie. Lunch is a little underwhelming and there are competitive local spots that have more variety and more interesting lunch fare. Their dinner selection is nice. It's a cosy place where you can hear yourself talk, which is a bonus!

This was my first time going here for dinner and I was not that pleased. The food was horrible. My friend ordered the rabbit and I had the duck and both dishes were bland, lacking, and soooo not worth the price.
They do has a great breakfast. I think I'll stick with the things they do right.
review_title: This was my first time going

review: This was our first time there, a Monday evening. We had seen a great review on "Check Please Bay Area" and our visit confirmed that review. The food was inspired and beautifully prepared. Servers were attentive and very helpful without being overbearing. Notably the restaurant adds $1.25 per person to the bill for health and other benefits for its employees. We were delighted to know this, and believe that all restaurants should do the same. We will certainly return.
review_title: This was our first time there,

review: The restaurant is really like two. The outdoor dining room is lovely with flowering vines, well placed heating lamps, and on Mondays, many well behaved dogs. Inside, the place is like a warm tiny European bistro. The food is delicious, local and beautifully presented. Prices are moderate. The wine list small but with plenty of variety. Service is friendly and professional.
First time, will definitely return soon, delicious food, nice quaint atmosphere, knowledgeable, friendly and fun waiter!
Grilled pork chop and onion soup were delicious. Friends who ordered the duck confit said it wasn't good. Monday nights, one can bring a dog and sit in the back outdoor patio.

We were delighted w/birthday dinner, after a visit to the deYoung. Zazies is a cute, neighborhood French bistro. The wait staff was friendly and informative, and the menu offered enough choices and combinations to satisfy all of us. We loved the fish soup and lemon raviloli. We look forward to returning for breakfast or lunch, and I would heartily recommend Zazies for an enjoyable get together.

Food: A+, Service: A++, Overall Experience: A+++!

It was definitely a great experience. Food was really fresh, and was melting on my tongue like butter on warm bread. Wine selection was good, but I was surprised for low prices as I expected more pricier list. You have to try their soup, it is so tasty with good texture. Good thing is they have patio, some area in the front for couple of tables, good for brunch and for kids during the day and romantic during the evening, perfect balance!
perfect. lived up to expectations. would definitely go again.

We were there for an early dinner in the neighborhood. My $23 prix fixe dinner was such a great value! Even though the menu stated that the appetizer and desserts would be half portions, it did seem like it to me. We thoroughly enjoyed our mid-week meal.
review_title: We were there for an early

review: Without fail, Zazie's has provided unrushed, first rate dining. The service matched the quality of the food. Zazie's is a winner.

Simply put  this was one of the best meals I've had in recent memory. The service was absolutely outstanding. We felt that our server give us a lot of special attention and instruction about Piesco, which was a very new beverage experience for us. The food was remarkable, delicious, and well-balanced. All thebetter was the very reasonable price tag. We would certainly go back anytime!

I believe Destino and Pisco have the same kitchen. I've eaten at Pisco and thought everything was good. At Destino on 12/05/13 the Quinoa Balls were good, nothing special, everything on the menu has quinoa in it. The meatballs were pretty grisly and not that flavorful. The kale was decent, again nothing special. We ordered the Sirloin Relleno, unfortunately it had corn in it, which I can NOT eat and was not listed in the menu. My b/f said it was just ok also. The yucca fries were good - hot and crispy.
review_title: Destino was not as good as Pisco

review: I love this place. Easy to share dishes with a group or date. Love the ambiance and Latin music playing in the background. It's a fun spot.
review_title: I love this place. Easy to

review:
Great food, nice small place, but hard surfaces made it waaaay too loud on a Friday night for any conversation below the level of a shriek -
and halfway through the very tasty meal the restaurant made it worse by turning up the music.
I'd recommend it for the food, but not on a weekend. Perhaps going earlier would be better.
Wonderful ambience, excellent food and "real" Sangria. Always a good time!!

I decided to try 'Destino' because they offered a tantalizing and exotic vegetarian option on their 'SF Dine about Town' menu. The ambiance was stylish and intimate, and the Acorn Squash was absolutely amazing. The chocolate buneullos were possibly the most sinfully decadent chocolate dessert I've ever had .... ever. The best dessert in the city for chocolate lovers.
Service was really good and the ambiance was nice but the food could have been better. It wasnt bad but it wasnt anything to rave about and/or recommend.
Amazing food. Unique drinks. Amazing service! You must check this place out!
Excellent food, service, and ambiance! I will definitely return!

The food was disappointing. We had a variety of small plates and shared the sea bass entree. The tuna ceveche is probably the only thing I would order again. If I go back, I'll go to the bar next door - which was hopping on a Wednesday night. The drinks were great, though the sangria could have been a little stronger.
Very enjoyable experience and interesting tapas choices. We enjoyed this meal and the different food choices available.

It was fun!  The food was great, especially the Peruvian ceviche, and the Tempanillo-Cab wine was delicious.  The music they played was not fitting at all, though, and was detrimental to the environment.  Still, I will definitely go back!
review_title: It was fun!  The food was

review: We went here for the "dine about town" week, there was a set meal, we liked it overall but thought we would get more authentic argentinian food as we had just returned from there...overall food was served hot, it was tasty and there was a good atmosphere.

Absolutely incredible meal on Saturday.  Fantastic service, atmosphere and food was to die for.  The only thing I was disappointed by was that I had made reservations about 8 or 9 days ahead of time and we ended up being seated by the kitchen and the busboys table with a large post on one side of the table. I found it very distracting and very noisy.  Apart from that the food was amazing and the waiters incredibly friendly.  Thank you!
Consistently good...on all levels:  food, staff, ambience, etc.  Def. a repeat.
everyone said their dish was very tasty and it was a crowd pleaser for carnivores, vegetarians, the lactose intolerant and the foodie alike.
I've been coming here for years and always enjoy. Great staff, service. A bit on the noisy side.
Everything was great. I would definitely recommend this place to friends and family. My large group of 9 had a wonderful meal with great wine. Our server was friendly and attentive.

I've been here twice and it was great both times. The tables are set up so that you feel like you can actually talk to your dinner companions, the service is great and the food wonderful. It's a great go-to place whenever you want to go out.
review_title: I've been here twice and it

review: LOVE LUPA!!! amazing hospitality, divine food, perfect service!
Food was very good. Service was slow, although staff was polite. Very noisy.

I've had lunches and dinners at Zuni many times over the years.  It is a wonderful restaurant in terms of food, service, ambience.  This time, a lunch to celebrate a friend's birthday, was the first time I've ever eaten outside.  I'm not sure that I would do it again.  The friend's licensed service dog was very disturbed by some of the people who passed by on the sidewalk on Market Street, particularly the skateboarders.  The noise on Market Street meant that we had to raise our voices to be heard.  The people sitting at the next table, whose conversation we could, and did, easily overhear, asked us to lower our voices!  It was however a beautiful afternoon and sitting outside, even with the down sides to it, was much more fun that sitting inside, as lovely as the interior of Zuni is.

I brought my Father and sister here and we had a thoroughly enjoyable afternoon.  it seems to me that Zuni is part of the old (soon to be lost) San Francisco.  The food is good and reliable, the wine list is good, the service is excellent, the prices are reasonable the atmosphere is a bit like Harrods in the 1970's: it's smart and full of well healed people having a nice time!
Nice meal but very late seating with no consideration given to my elderly mother. Hard to get thru to them too to confirm my reservation ( their requirement.)
review_title: Nice meal but very late seating with no ...

review: Get the chicken - it takes an hour to cook so get other items to eat while you wait.  The chicken definitely feeds 3 people probably 4 or 5 if you get some apps beforehand.  The bread salad that comes with the chicken is equally amazing.  The wine list is wonderful, lots of choices and reasonably priced bottles.  If you are visiting SF it's definitely worth a trip for dinner.  Enjoy!
Love the new daily menu.  Keeps the place exciting and the servers excited about their work.  We went pre-symphony and they accommodated our timeline perfectly.
A wonderful experience every time we visit.  Very consistent and a very predictable outcome.  The chicken is a unique dish.

I really liked the food here, well prepared, varied menu (and we did not order the renowned chicken given the expected wait time).  What we didn't love was the ridiculously long time it took to get each course (even after telling the waiter that we needed to be out in less than 90 minutes and we're talking relatively early on a Sunday evening.  The downstairs window seats offer a lovely view, but the adjacent bar does make it a more noisy area, and you're packed in so neighboring tables can't help but hear the conversations.

One of the better meals we have had in our dining experiences in the Bay Area.  The chicken was the best we had ever eaten.  Superb!!!  All the other courses we ordered were very good.  We definitely will be back.  Service attentive and knowledgeable, but not overbearing.
We could only get a 9:00 pm reservation & wanted to have the roast chicken which takes about an hour to prepare. We were a little concerned but it was really worth the wait. So glad we did it.
Loved it. Great service, greaaat spring vegetable soup, and the chicken was amazing.
review_title: Came for the chicken. Left so happy

review: This place is pretty darn good. Go there. Eat. Enjoy.
Great meal. Service was attentive and mindful of our need to be finished in time for the ballet. Wonderful, flavorful dishes. Good recommendation from the wine list. Would definitely return.

Zuni has a great reputation amongst my friends and colleagues in SF. I expected to be blown away when I decided to go for my first dinner there. That's not exactly what happened.

Upon arriving, I was greeted by a hosted who was looking at her phone and never looked up at us until and offered her a good evening and ask how she was. She said 'good' and then simply asked 'what is your name?'. What?!? Really? I'm fine, thanks for asking

After asking to be seated at a different table (the first was the worst on the upper level that was mainly empty). We were happy with our food and our server was good. The food was, indeed, very good but the staff just didn't cut it. Strange looks, egos, and a feel like everyone was still hungover from NYE
This was my second time at Zuni and it was very mediocre both times. Nice interior, pizza was not good.

Zuni - is a very consistent restaurant serving excellent food in a wonderful building with lots of atmosphere. The staff are friendly, knowledgeable and professional - offering good advice on food or wine. We return time and again for old favorites on the menu, but are always delighted when trying something new.
chicken for 2 seems to be their signature dish and is the cheapest item !
Food was terrific and our server was extremely helpful pointing out that their famous chicken could indeed serve 3 people! The chicken is completely worth a second and third visit!!

We ordered the chicken which was phenomenal - as we had heard. The ambience was really wonderful as well - upscale but not at all stuffy. I would definitely recommend to anyone interested in a delicious meal.

If you are visiting San Francisco and looking to go with either a partner or a group of friends, I recommend this place. Make sure you make a reservation. I was lucky enough to reserve the same day. Some of the portions are small, make sure you order a full appetizer and entree just for yourself.
The place is clean, walking distance from the metro station and has a nice ambiance.

We needed to choose a lunch spot where two vegans and two omnivores could enjoy an afternoon lunch and catch up on life's rich pageantry. Zuni was the perfect spot. The server was totally amenable to requesting the kitchen put together vegan salads and entree plates for us. The Bandol Rose was perfect to go with the delicious vegetables cooked numerous ways and the juicy delectable burgers our fiends enjoyed. Apricot sorbet with roasted cherries made the perfect vegan dessert. The convivial atmosphere is one of Zuni's greatest assets. Looking forward to visiting againsoon!

I am shocked this restaurant is so often talked about. I was completely disappointed. Limited, uninteresting menu, very overpriced, average food, and poor service. We will not go back when there are so many better restaurants in the city. This is a really poor value.

Our friends from Anchorage thought this was the cat's meow!
The fresh mushroom fettucine and housemade smoky sausage pizza were awesome!

Although I've been to Zuni many times I always love bringing someone there for their first time. I know no matter who I bring Zuni will always delight them. I ordered the chicken for two to give my date a proper introduction to Zuni and it was spectacular as always. We started with a wonderful arugula and blood orange salad and a chickpea soup with Harissa that was wonderful. Thanks again to Zuni, I "let" my date take me there for my birthday and it was a wonderful celebration.

Our party of four arrived 15 minutes early and the hostess said the following YOU'RE TOO EARLY. WE DON'T SERVE FOOD UNTIL 6.YOU CAN STAND AT THE BAR OR DO WHATEVER YOU WANT. We ordered a bottle of wine scrunched at a small table for two near the piano and were in everyone's way. No one told us where to go and when 6 arrived and we asked about being seated the same hostess told us the menus were not printed yet. When some people who came after us were seated and we went a third time to the hostess she was really angry with us. A very bad start to the evening when we were finally seated.

I would not return although we've been here several times before. We're from Toronto area and come to S.F. yearly in the winter.
quite good, love the ambience, but as our friends' favorite SF retaurant, we were a little dissapointed
We went here for Sunday brunch. While food was good, service can do better. We had to ask for everything multiple times - bread, water etc.
review_title: We went here for Sunday brunch.

review: Zuni is always fabulous. Rob and crew are the absolute best in the business. Food and wine excellent!
Exceptional food and service. We went mainly for their famous chicken, but had other appetizers which were also very good. We visit this restaurant every time we are in SF.
Zuni is like an old friend. It's a reliable standby with pleasant surprises, warm, welcoming and always great quality.
review_title: Zuni is like an old friend.

review: We really enjoyed our dinner at Zuni. The overall experience was excellent. We ordered the Salmon but wished that we would of ordered the chicken that everyone else was ordering. Salmon was good but it seemed like the chicken was the hot item.

Zuni Cafe is one of my all-time favorite restaurants. The food is delicious, the space is warm and convivial, but unpretentious. It's so steady and so good, year after year--there's something inviting about that, something reassuring. 

On this last visit, the food was terrific as always, and my guests, who were visiting for the first time, were thrilled. The only issue is that the room seemed to get louder and louder; by the end of the meal, it was a challenge to continue our conversation.
review_title: Zuni Cafe is one of my all-time

review: This is the best little restaurant. They are famous for a roasted chicken dish served with bread salad (prepared for 2 people). The chef did a wonderful plate for a vegetarian in our group. The wild salmon with an assortment of baby vegetables was fresh and perfectly prepared. The wine list was good and the desserts were delicious. I have never had such a delicious and flavor saturated strawberry sorbet! Obviously due to the fact that strawberries were in prime season at the time, this restaurant prides itself on farm to table freshness and the chef is quite talented. Their bread is fantastic too. Don't miss this place. A real gem for people know and love good food.
review_title: This is the best little restaurant.

review: The food was great but the portions are very small for the price.
review_title: The food was great but the

review: I have NEVER had a bad meal at Zuni. Our meal last night was superb - the best in oysters (great selection), another fabulous roasted chicken, a good cheese selection, and espresso granita. Perfection. Nice wines and the wait staff know what they are talking about!

Most of my experience with Zuni has been at dinner before a preformance and while always excellent sometimes due to my schedul a little rushed.

I had lunch there the other day and as always the food was excellent. In addition the ambience at lunch is terrific very relaxed and pleasant. I have never had a bad meal at Zuni. I am going back next week.

We haven't been to Zuni for years, but we were heartened to find that the quality and ambience have not changed over time. Although there was no special menu for our children--ages 8 and 10--we detected no discomfort or irritation from the staff at seeing and serving our young diners.
review_title: We haven't been to Zuni for

review: Zuni Cafe provides a friendly, open kitchen environment, plenty of good food to go around, especially the chicken!
Excellent food and service. The waitress happily accommodated our special requests. A great experience.
Had a wonderful lunch here! Top quality food and well-educated chef for knowing and serving some unique options. Service was perfect every moment of the time.

First time here after many years of wanting to go. It didn't quite live up to my expectations but want to go back again to try other items on the menu. The hamburger considered by the waitress as "amazing" was very good but NOT AMAZING! Be prepared to spend the bucks on what I thought was something less than spectacular. The ambience and service was very good. Worth another try.

We're from out of town and go to Zuni a couple of times a year when we attend concerts nearby. This time we had the time to wait for the house specialty of roast chicken for two. Good, not great. Brined, hence quite salty. Underlying bread pudding rather soggy. Oysters great as always. Nice experience overall, but quite pricey. We're no longer sure sure it's worth it.
Very tasty food but annoyingly small portions. Went there on a Saturday lunchtime, service took for ever.
One of my all time favorite restaurants anywhere. The chicken is unbelievable as is everything else on the menu. Always looking forward to my next visit. I do miss the raw seafood bar selection.
review_title: One of my all time favorite

review: We went becausse a friend of mine recommended it, and it was a wonderful experience of taste!
Excellent dining in a beautiful high ceiling building that creates space. international food selection and great accompanying wine list. Attentive staff that makes the dining experience wonderful.
A modest menu and wine list, but appropriate for its size. Food is very well-prepared, and the service attentive and friendly. A laid-back, casual atmosphere. A big plus is the valet parking.
review_title: A modest menu and wine list,

review: We thoroughly enjoyed our first visit to Zuni Cafe. We were seated in the small loft area that overlooks the bar so the experience felt very intimate. Our server was attentive but not intrusive and very helpful in making menu choices and wine selection. The clams and shrimp in cream, fennel and breadcrumbs starter was outstanding!
We thoroughly enjoyed Zuni - would go back again and for sure recommend it!
Awesome.  The oysters were terrific. Everything we ordered was great and the atmosphere and service were top notch.

As always, Zuni delivers. First with a special cocktail at the bar--although I wouldn't mind bar stools. Upstairs dinning was great...white bean appetizer; flat iron steak & halibut; all good. Solid; not spectacular. The portion size is down while the the prices are up. It's rare that I don't take home half my meal--but not here. All in all--once a year or so works for me. Wish they'd bring back the "special request" for the burger for dinner.
As good as it was five years ago, maybe better, but definitely consistent! Bravo!!!
review_title: As good as it was five years

review: Atmospheric location with excellent, excellent service. Roast chicken is a must. Really appreciate the down-to-earth and accommodating wait staff.

Zuni is one of those places that has been around for a very long time, but it doesn't live up to it's long term reputation. Yes the food is good, but not great. The main problems are the very limited menu, just four choices the night we were there. The place seems more like a place the locals in the Castro go for a drink and something to eat. We were told it was very important to be on time or we would loose our table, we were 15 minutes early and ended up waiting 45 minutes to be sat. Upsides are the chicken for two is very good, and the wine list has some good choices. All in all just okay to good, not at all what I was expecting from a quality, food, or service standpoint.
review_title: Zuni is one of those places

review: Why would anyone write a review about Zuni for maybe their 100th visit? Maybe because it's one reason I've loved living in San Francisco the past 20 years. The level of professionalism and dedication to excellence is deeply embedded at every level of the Zuni organization. The food which arrives at your table is drama free- and bursting with flavor. Oysters are icy cold and taste like the sea. The martinis, bloody marys and champagne never disappoint. While other restaurants and "celebrity" chefs work trends and angles, Zuni delights us by staying just they way they are. Don't change, baby.
review_title: Why would anyone write a review

review:
Excellent example of California cuisine showcasing the best in local, seasonal ingredients.
Efficient, friendly service and a nice vibe - not too noisy but not too quiet.
The restaurant is noisy with lots of reflective surfaces - glass. The service was very good. Food was pricey in relation to quality.

The menue changes pretty much on a daily basis depending on seasonal ingredients. Shared an entree of braised chicken leg/thigh in fennel with saffron aioli, black-eyed peas with serrano ham and a frisee salad with heritage tomatoes. We paired this with a half bottle of Bandol from 2005. To finish off dinner we shared one of my favs which is espresso granita.

Our waitstaff was seamlessly efficient; everyone did a fine job of making us feel well cared for and comfortable; our food was presented with a flourish that made us feel like special guests even though we were really only one of the cast of thousands in the restaurant at that time. When we left to walk to the Opera House, there was a positive energy in our steps.

Merci,

L Osterman
A great choice for San Francisco! The signature chicken dish is outstanding!
review_title: A great choice for San Francisco!

review: A fantastic spot with a consistent level of service and impeccably prepared food. I ordered the iconic burger and talked my sister into doing the same. The waitress noticed on her own that our burgers were not the temperature we ordered as they were overcooked. Without us saying a word the manager visited us and insisted that he replace them with the medium temperature we had requested. Upon the arrival of the new burgers he brought fresh, piping hot, shoestring fries and through in a complimentary dessert at the end of the meal. Par for the course - Zuni is the best in elevated food, service, atmosphere and overall experience.
review_title: A fantastic spot with a consistent

review:
I was very excited to eat at Zuni for the first time, after having read glowing reviews of it and enjoying Judy Rodgers's masterful cookbook.

Unfortunately my dinner was merely ok--the Caesar salad, squab, and lamb were unremarkable, dessert was good. It felt as if the kitchen had phoned the evening in. It appears as if the space itself has expanded in inelegant ways over the years--some of the seating is just plain awkward, including, alas, ours. Despite having made a reservation in advance, my party of three was seated at a table with two chairs and a backless bench-like contraption which left me back to back with another poor soul seated at an equally awkward table behind us. I would gladly overlook this if the food were spectacular.
review_title: I was very excited to eat

review: I still love the balsamic bloody mary, and the Pacific oysters are grand
Always an interesting meal never bad.  There is really no other place like it.  For locals it is a must visit. For visitors lunch is incredible and dinner is very good but not a 5 star experience.
Excellent food. Outstanding blue nose bass entree. Great martini. Excellent, efficient service for our table with some difficult people. Waiter was attentive, informative and totally pleasant.
The menu is limited. But the real issue is service. They reception and wait staff don't seem to care or "connect". I used to love Zuni (for their bread and chicken).
review_title: The menu is limited. But the

review: The chicken is of course very good and I absolutely recommend it.  Parking can be a bit of an issue if you don't opt for valet parking.
review_title: The chicken is of course very

review: I have been going to Zuni for many years and I continue to enjoy their food. It is always 'on point' and there is usually some new surprise depending upon the seasons. The quality of food has remained high and the service remains prompt and friendly.
review_title: I have been going to Zuni

review: I've been going to Zuni's since it opened. It's always been our favorite SF restaurant. Others come and go...Zuni's is always good, if not great. I love the oysters, the chicken, the polenta, the pot de creme and just about anything else.

I remember the Zuni as being a hip, happening place with people thick at the bar, enjoying the ambiance of the space. That was not the experience that I had on 12/23. When we left their was no one at the bar. It looked like many of the patrons were tourists.
We were very disappointed with the service. We asked our waiter to recommend a French wine to go with our meal and he had to leave the table a couple of times to find out the answers to our questions.The servers cleared our wine glasses from the table just as we were thinking of have some more.
But the food was a stand out as always. Of course we had the chicken and it was spectacular!
The food did not stand out enough to make us return. What a disappointment!
review_title: I remember the Zuni as being

review: We loved everything except the tiny portions. I ordered a pork dish because of the many vegetables that were supposed to accompany it, and I had only two small bites of brussel sprouts, two mini carrots, one small parsnip. The three of us loved the food but I don't think we'll go back there because it was quite expensive for such a small amount of food.
The roasted chicken is well worth the hour wait (and the wine list helps to pass the time).
Awesome San Francisco dining experience. The menu is full of wonderful choices and the wine list complements the menu very nicely.
As always fabulous food though dissapointed in the deserts
The roast chicken is a must. Don't forget dessert.
review_title: The roast chicken is a must.

review: The burrata appetizer was out of this world! Staff was wonderful. As expected, the Roasted chicken was delicious.

The server was clueless, English was limited. Service here has always been a problem and it ruins the meal in the end. How can you ask a guest would you like your salad before your entree. Wine was never refreshed, one of the guests had to pour for the table. Table was never crumbed. water glasses went empty. It seemed that there was no floor manager.The table next to us had the same problem. Food was OK. We have given up on this spot. Never again.

Excited very much because of fantastic recommendation found at internet. Thought that this could be one of good memories of San Francisco trip. Service was excellent but food did not meet expectation.

This was our first time at the Zuni, although we had heard of it for years. There were three of us for a birthday lunch, and literally everything each of us ate was outstanding (oysters, anchovy appetizer,flat iron steak, grouper, hamburger, beet salad and shoestring potatoes.) Even the drinks seemed unusually good. (We all had the balsamic bloody mary's). For dessert we would recommend the Gateau Victoire. We enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere. The decor and environment were very pleasant-light, airy and well decorated. The waitstaff was also very attentive. I would definitely return for another special occasion, as the food was a little too expensive for everyday dining.
review_title: This was our first time at

review: OK overall experience but was disappointed with wine list and availability of some wines - also main choice on menu not available. Book an early time to avoid disappointment as this is not a cheap experience.

After passing this place numerous times and talking about going there we finally made a reservation for lunch. Squeezed into a table along a wall. Close enough to diners on both sides that it wasn't worth trying to hold a conversation over the other conversation going on around us. Fortunately I don't mind eavesdropping and heard all about an upcoming trip over seas. Must be nice. But that's not the most important part. The food. The food was amazing. I was a little worried because of the small menu but I shouldn't have been. I got a pizza and my companion ordered their burger and we split a side of fries because they looked so delicious. And it was, simple, well put together flavors that made us happy. Will return.

as usual, Zuni was wonderful - the duck alone was worth the trip! And the oysters ...
our table on second floor was not great as lots of people walking by - I prefer dining on first floor and will remember that next time. But our service was excellent - and we made it out in time for our concert. Wonderful food.

One couple's squab was raw, the signature dish - roast chicken which took the full hour to cook was warm - not piping hot direct from the oven. Also, there was no heat in the restaurant and our waiter could not explain to us why that was the case. I couldn't feel my feet or nose, halfway through dinner and ended up wrapping my wool coat around my shoulders and legs. It was an unfortunate and disappointing experience, particularly since this used to be one of our favorite restaurants.

For many years Zuni had a reputation for bad service with a major dollop of attitude. That was my experience some years ago. I am delighted to report that such is no longer the case. We had a very pleasant upscale meal there, with appropriate, friendly, service. Wonderful food, though a bit overpriced at $175 for two, including tip.
review_title: For many years Zuni had a

review: The food was very good, we had a great table upstairs in a quiet nook overlooking the more bustling main room below, and our server could not have been more helpful, competent and charming. However, when we arrived there was no room at the bar and we were 15 minutes early for a 6:30 reservation. Even though the restaurant had only just begun dinner service we were told that our table "wasn't ready yet", nobody offered us drinks, and we stood in the drafty doorway, dodging waitstaff and other entering patrons who were all seated immediately. 6:30 came and went and we finally re-approached the host stand and they seemed surprised to see us--all three of them. I was glad I was with a friend and not a date, it left a sour taste for the meal.
review_title: The food was very good, we

review: A favorite that we nearly always visit when we get to San Francisco. Lunch menu somewhat limited, but good choices. Our reservation was for 12:15 p.m., but we had to wait about 20 minutes for our table.
The roast chicken is the best chicken I've ever had, delivered as advertised.
review_title: The roast chicken is the best
