review: I'm a native of the area and have seen the Zuni Cafe listed on the "Best of.." lists for years. I tend to shy away from places that appear on those lists, but some out of town guests wanted to go there. I must say, I was very pleasantly surprised and can see why the Zuni gets such high ratings. We were about 15 minutes early for our reservation. They were very accommodating and sat us quickly. The menu was original, interesting and delicious. Each of the four of us selected something different, and all of the dishes were winners. All of the staff were warm, friendly and knowledgeable. All in all, the Zuni exceeded my expectations.
review_title: I'm a native of the area and

review: It was hard to get too psyched about our evening and dinner at Zuni --even though overall it was a nice evening -- because the bartender set a downer tone at the bar. We arrived a little early for our reservation so decided to have a drink while we waited. Bartender took our drink order and then disappeared. When he came back to the bar, he waited on a bunch of other people first. Then he didn't get my drink right. So much time had elapsed that it was a wonder he even remembered what we ordered.
review_title: It was hard to get too psyched

review:
scenic view was checked as Market Street is always interesting with the addition of nude bikers passing by that day
This has been one of my most favorite restaurants since it opened
Zuni's a San Francisco classic for a reason.  Our waiter was great...very professional and knowledgeable.  One of my favorite restaurants in the world.  Can't wait to go back.
as it has for many years, zuni cafe continues to shine.
review_title: as it has for many years,

review: as always, the food was outstanding; however, our request for a quiet, corner table was not honored; and for an hour management chose not to ask five women at the bar to exercise any restraint at all--they continued to shout for an hour...  not simply talk loudly, but shout continuously, while those of us sitting above them suffered...
review_title: as always, the food was outstanding

review: An exceptional experience, as always.  We were particularly pleased with our server and assistant service staff.

I love Zuni and have been going there from the beginning.  It is a San Francisco icon, I think, and no one should fail to have had the Zuni Roast  Chicken w/bread salad, Caesar Salad and shoe strings for at least one meal - closing with an Espresso Granita.  To me, a perfect meal to share with friends.  Ada Beth Harris
review_title: I love Zuni and have been

review: Wonderful atmosphere with a smartly decorated dinning room that provides a fresh, yet complimentary distinction to the characteristic decor of the Jerome hotel.  The menu was well balanced and the food was very tasty with fresh and nicely paired ingredients. The service was friendly and attentive.
review_title: Wonderful atmosphere with a smartly deco...

review: Excellent food and service. The Columbia river salmon and kale salads were standouts at our table of four. The coconut cream pie was the best any of us could recall. The wine steward made excellent, cost conscious suggestions based on our tastes, allowing us to sample several suggestions before making a selection. Overall an outstanding dining experience.

rest_name: Clay Oven Indian Restaurant - West Portal
review: We went as a group of six with a toddler after visiting the SF Zoo. They didn't have crayons for the little one but were otherwise completely accommodating even though the atmosphere is somewhat fancy. The pakora to start was delicious. The saag paneer is always my test dish for a restaurant and it was excellent here -- creamy and spicy. Their medium spicy is definitely spicy! Would recommend to others.

rest_name: Clay Oven Indian Restaurant - West Portal
review: The service continues to be excellent. I called requesting that I table be setup up in a quiet area and not only was the table lovely but we received complimentary desserts. We have eaten at the Westportal and Church St. and both are excellent.

I'm a frequent diner at the Indian Clay Oven restaurant on Clement St., SF, the original restaurant from the chain which Tandoori Mahal belongs to. Unfortunately the quality of food in these two places is totally different - while India Clay Oven is a food quality benchmark on my scale of Indian restaurants in SF, Tandoori Mahal is just an eatery, the food quality is average at best. Besides the food quality improvements the place needs remodeling or at least general cleanup.

My partner and I received a gift certificate to this restaurant and we used it to celebrate the anniversary of our one year living together.  It was a great choice!  We had a wonderful meal and even better service from Vanessa who couldn't have been nicer.   We loved the restaurant set up, with two different bar areas and a variety of dining spaces, including a patio area.  Even though the restaurant was quite full when we left, we didn't have trouble hearing each other.   Vanessa guided us through the menu and when we asked if we were ordering too much food, she suggested that we order half portions of two of the plates, which turned out to be perfect for us.  We had a potato dish, meatballs, squid, short ribs, and asparagus.  All were delicious and perfectly cooked.  The only other remark I have about the food is that the short rib dish was overpriced.  It was fantastic, but for $26, far too small.  Otherwise, it was a great meal and we felt so fortunate to have Vanessa as our server.
This place is one of the great neighborhood restaurants in San Francisco. The food is amazing and just gets better with each visit. Wonderful staff.
This was a wonderful neighborhood Tapas restaurant.  The food was very good, the selection of tapas was diverse and delicious.  Definitely recommended if you are in the neighborhood.
What I love about this restaurant is that the tapas are very special and composed of wonderful ingredients but they don't make a big deal about it, they just throw the plates down. Eat and enjoy!

Brought my daughter a chef who was visiting from MI and we took her here as a child and continued to go after she moved. She wanted to go back and found the food outstanding. Her discussion with the waiter, owner, former chef seemed to naturally materialize once she started to ask "beyond foodie" questions. Every knew the answers to her "grilling" and we had one of our many excellent meals at this hidden gem. Don't tell others about it, just go!
have been several times...hope to go several more in the coming months...food is marvelous and varied...constantly changing menu

I have been here 3 times now and what makes this place difficult to rate is the menu is constantly changing. Some of my favorite items I have only had once since they never come back on the menu. With that in mind, it is very good food and an overall nice tapas bar. I intend to continue visiting from time to time.
review_title: I have been here 3 times now

review: This is my third time at Contigo, and it has always been great. This time we had the tasting menu, which was truly excellent. I want to commend the staff for going "above and beyond" in accommodating one of my guests who is gluten and lactose intolerant; the servers graciously and cheerfully helped her choose a special, suitable version of the tasting menu for her, thus making the dinner an enjoyable and delicious one for all. My out-of-the-country, well-traveled guests were so impressed with, and so enjoyed, the food and service. And I have to say a special word about the incredible hot chocolate, which I now have every time I go to Contigo, and which was a bit hit with my guests as well.
review_title: This is my third time at Contigo,

review: We've been to Spain many times, consider ourselves foodies, and my sister is married to a man from Bacelona and they recommended this restaurant. The food here is very authentic and every bit as good as some of our favorite restaurants in Barcelona! Great to go with at least 4 people to share many different dishes. We will be back!

This was my third visit to Contigo over a couple years and they have been consistently enjoyable. Once I went with a group of 7, once two of us sat at the counter, and this time I enjoyed a romantic dinner for two. Each time the service has been excellent, both friendly and attentive, without interfering with our dining experience. The sommelier was attuned to our preferences in making his recommendations. The food was delicious. The standouts included the "one bite" homemade cheese with anchovy on a crostini, the mashed pea crostini, the quail, and the hot chocolate combined with ice cream over olivie oil with specks of salt.
review_title: This was my third visit to

review: delicious. several memorable dishes. chocolate dessert outstanding.
We felt we had an unattentive/rude waitress however the food was great and we really enjoyed our evening.
review_title: We felt we had an unattentive/rude

review: I went to Contigo with a friend a month ago and really loved everything about the place. On Friday, I went back with my husband and, although we loved the interior, we were not happy with the seats we got. We arrived at 6:15 and the restaurant was empty but the nicer seats appeared to have been reserved for people who did not make an opentable reservations. The food was good but not spectacular. The menu was completely different from the one a month ago and many of the dishes seemed more Californian than Catalan. The bus boys and waitress kept coming to the table to take our plates and we felt pressured to hurry to get out because the next shift of diners was waiting at the door even though we stayed only a little over an hour.
review_title: I went to Contigo with a friend

review: I usually find tapas too little food for too much money, but at least this place is great food for too much money!
review_title: I usually find tapas too little

review: We have been to this restaurant many times, and it is always wonderful. The food is amazing. We had guests in town and they absolutely loved it. We live in the neighborhood and frequent this restaurant. I always recommend it to friends
review_title: We have been to this restaurant

review: We tried 1/2 dozen small plates. We had the shrimp,pork belly, lamb tagine, and the flatbread. I cant even remember the other two. They were good, just not great. The restaurant is agreable. It is a bit noisy, and you sit very close to your neighbors. Overall a pleasnt evening, just not a memorable one.
The food was impeccable. Such a comfortable environment - casual yet still special. The food was divine. I will definitely return... soon and often

Loved the food, really liked the ambience - but was not too thrilled with the [rather hipster, not so professional] service:
with a confirmed reservation for an 8pm table, we were made to wait almost 30 minutes, without any apologies from either of the two hosts.

This is usually not too big a deal, but when there is no area to accommodate waiting guests - and you are being shooed from one spot to the next by rather attitude-y staff, the experience makes for a not so great a start into an otherwise amazing meal ...

Once seated, the food and wines were amazing, but again, the service left a bad taste: from the second we sat down, we felt hurried into ordering and worst of all, were presented the bill along with our dessert delivery -ou

Have been to John's a number of times (including my retirement party a few years ago), and this lunch visit was excellent, as usual. Veggie raviolis fantastic. Martinis as only John's makes them--totally yummy! Really, they have the best gin martinis anywhere. Server was completely excellent in every way. She (sorry I don't remember her name) was sensitive that I hadn't seen friend in a long time and we needed to talk...delivered drinks, watched, didn't hassle us to order right away. Just the kind of service you expect at a great restaurant. Thanks!!
review_title: Excellent food, service & drinks- as usual!!

review:
I had a business dinner and of course I chose John's Grill. San Francisco has more than one great restaurant but it is very hard to find GREAT food, GREAT service, and GREAT ambience in a GREAT and convenient location. Every one of the people I had to meet were downtown so John's Grill was the best and only choice. 

The server noticed it was a business dinner and wasn't over bearing. We were able to talk the whole dinner, not get interrupted, and have everything we needed. Water glasses and wine glasses were always full, we always had clean plates in front of us, and new delicious sour dough bread. The dinner was excellently paced. 

Thank you John's Grill for being so dependable time and time again. Whether I am on a date or have to pick a place for a meeting, you are always the best choice.
We were not able to keep the date. Due to the storm our relatives had their flights cancelled and we went home.

This is a classic spot in San Francisco.  Be ready for a wait during Dinner time for sure.  They also cram you in pretty tightly.  We sat on the second floor and right next to the great piano player, but it sure was hard to have a conversation.   We both had steaks and they were great.  Food was wonderful.
review_title: This is a classic spot in San Francisco....

review:
There was a group of six of us for supper. We were all from Canada. I have to say it was a great place to eat.

I would defintely recommend it to anyone who goes there to visit.

John's Grill is a famous spot, and it knows it. It knows it so much that it thinks it can get away with fairly poor service and just okay food. It's worth it to say that you went to the place that Hammett used to drink (and where he had his character Sam Spade eat), but I would not go back for the food, and would actively avoid the prissy, fussy, and mostly-inattentive waiter. It's a problem that is not unique to John's: why try hard when you have a steady stream of tourists?

7/10
In town for quick pursuit of hot tip. Checked all leads without hitting pay dirt. Dog tired and grumpy from wasted effort, met an old flame at the scene of our initial encounter. Not much has changed over the years...at least with the joint. Candor - and a cheap mirror - made me admit to myself that the time (thirty-two years) has not graced me as favorably. Was thankful that the excellent wine and perfect steaks seemed to deflect my companion's attention...unless, possibly, she was just being kind. Humm, maybe there is a chance tonight will improve...
S. Slade

Had only been here for dinner previously so tried for lunch.  My rib eye was excellent; my dining companion had the mix grill and the oysters were so bad he left them on the plate after a bite.  This may have been a bad experience so will try again in the future.
review_title: Had only been here for dinner previously...

review: John's Grill has been in S.F. since 1908 and is proud of it. They have one of 2 Maltese Falcons that were used for the Humphrey Bogart movie, on display. Even if the food was mediocre, it would be a fun place to go just for the above reasons. But with very good food, it's even better. The atmosphere is "70s steak house," with dark paneling. The wait staff is attentive and the service is actually a little too good. Including a glass of wine, salad course and main, we were done and out in an hour. We were a little surprised that the food is as 70s as the decor. As an example, the halibut came with a sauce reminiscent of past days, as opposed to lemon butter or some such. Good, but not quite what we expected.

I surprised my bf with a last-minute trip to San Francisco. I was able to make reservations the night before at the exact time that I preferred, which was nice. It's not the absolute best restaurant I've ever been to, but really I was just looking for a place with good food and a relaxing and romantic atmosphere, and John's Grill definitely fit that criteria. The service was great... everyone was very polite, helpful, and attentive. The food wasn't fantastic, but it was pretty good. Especially the desserts (we got the cheesecake and vanilla bean ice cream). Overall, we had a great experience at this restaurant and I'm glad we picked it.

Both the melt in your mouth ribeye and seabass were perfectly prepared. The place was really busy but the service was professional and detailed. Always a celebrity siting this time it was the former mayor.
High energy, exciting, historic restaurant. Excellent knowledgeable staff. Outstanding steaks!

Our reservation was honored to the minute even though the restaurant was busy. Food and service were outstanding.
We will go again.
My wife is wheat intolerant and the server was knowledgeable and helpful.

We were late for our reservation, so we had to wait a bit but it was our fault. They were very willing to work with us. We even increased the number in our party. I love this place! Their clam chowder is the best.

John's Grill was recommended to us by friends. We have been dining in SF for many years and never found this place. Sure glad we did. John's Grill is filled with old time San Francisco charm, with great food and even better service. The menu offers much to satisfy all palettes, from fish to beef & fowl. The choices were many. My husband and I split both a salad and the dinner. Our plates were more than ample and we had no room for dessert. I can't wait until we can go back again.
review_title: Great food with old time experience

review: a bit of history with a taste of modernity. classic Martinis, Negroni, and a Manhattan started of a meal of classic appetizers like Dungeness crab cocktail, lobster ravioli, and a Roquefort salad, followed by rib-eye, Filet Mignon, snapper, and sole from the grill. A fun time, delicious food, attentive service, and a great scene - for locals and tourists alike - in the heart of downtown San Francisco.

Our steaks were cooked to perfection. Filet melted in your mouth. The lobster ravioli was also excellent. Great martini's by a pro bartender. Our server was over the top. The ambiance is unique, very old school but super clean.

This place hase been around for +70 years and it shows. Old style steak joint, inflexible menu; stuffy wait staff; and poor quality/prepared food.
The worst place in SF!!!!
review_title: An Institution Who's Time Has Past

review: We booked a table, assuming we'd need to on a friday evening. We arrived a few minutes early and initially were treated as walk-ins - shown to a large area upstairs with only one other table occupied. Bad sign. The Martinis were large and spot on. The Sonoma wine was excellent and not that expensive ($55) compared to what we'd paid previously. The 'dinner salad' was little more than a bag of leaves you could buy in any supermarket, with tiny frozen prawns added (not shrimp as advertised) and a vinaigrette that probably came out of a bottle. A huge disappointment compared to some of the salads we'd had elsewhere. My partner's grilled sea bass was 'OK'. My filet mignon was dry, tasteless and chewy. We cut our losses & skipped desert .

Great steaks and fabulous oysters. the service at John's is impeccable. We were 8, then 9 then 10 people (people kept joining us.. even someone at the bar who turned out to be a friend of a friend) and the wait staff handled this chaos seamlessly. The steaks are cooked to perfect temperature and the side dishes are excellent. The house oysters are especially delicious and even the bread that they serve is classic san francisco sour dough. Highly recommended even if this is a touristy spot ... only issue is the tables are very close together and somewhat cramped. But this was also partly our fault for having a group that kept growing out of control!
The historic building was wonderful. Food was average.

Food competently prepared but uninspired. Didn't feel any love at all.
Staff was merely checking the boxes, filling in the time. Just after the
food was delivered (by a stranger), the waiter asked how it tasted.
I hadn't yet had time to pick up a fork. Anyone paying attention to the customer?
The most professional staff was the mature hispanic bus person; why he puts
up with the young slackers, I don't know. Hopefully, they can learn from him.
Doubt it. Too bad.
review_title: Next Gen Screws Up Traditional Gem

review: We were extremely disappointed in our experience as John's Grill was one of my favorite restaurants when I lived in San Francisco. My clam chowder and lobster ravioli (if there was indeed any lobster in the filling) were extremely salty. My husband ordered seafood and spinach cannelloni which was stuffed with spinach and no seafood. My son ordered swordfish which he said was extremely dry and tasteless. With the price points so high we expected decent food. Service was prompt but not friendly. Will NEVER go there again.
Had a wonderful time in a lovely setting filled with past memories of famous people, delicious food and excellent service!!
review_title: Had a wonderful time in a

review: Thoroughly enjoyed it. Best broiled salmon I've ever had!

This was our first trip to San Francisco,and John's Grill was near our hotel. After reading many mixed reviews, we decided to try it and make up our own minds. We're glad we did! The waitress was pleasant and helpful. We brought our own bottle of vino from Napa Valley, and the corkage fee was quoted as $20. (She later waived it because of our first time visitor status.) The medium-rare Ribeye was excellent and reasonablly priced. I was a smaller cut than one would expect at the high doller steak houses, but it was very tender and flavorful. This was a very pleasent dining experience.
review_title: This was our first trip to

review: John's is close to tourist central near both Union Square and Chinatown just off Market. It is famous for being mentioned in the Maltese Falcon. It's a traditional steak and seafood house, dark and comfortable. Nightly live music starts around 7. If you want basic seafood or steaks, it's fine, and the ambience is right out of a detective novel. The waitresses/waiters are professionals. But that's about all there is to recommend it. ;

John's Grill is fantastic Neighborhood gem where all the serious politicians and Movie Stars hang out. It feels like a scene from the Casablanca, the 1942 American romantic drama film directed by Michael Curtiz, starring Humphrey Bogart, Ingrid Bergman. And yes, the food and service is EXCELLENT! p.s. It's also cool to see the Facebook and Twitter crowd enjoying classic American Dining, how cool is that?
My absolute favorite place to eat when I want to feel San Francisco in my bones. If you have friends from out of town who want to see the real city, you must take them here.
Wanted a good dinner in a short time before going to a club. Well done! Good meal, prepared and delivered quickly. Reasonably attentive staff even though the place was packed!
review_title: Wanted a good dinner in a

review: nice historic restaurant that we had never heard of or dined at before. too tiny of a bar to have a cocktail beforehand. appetizer was good (crab cocktail), dinners good except both of our vegetables and potatoes were barely room temperature and had to be sent back to be re-heated. it was as if they plated the potato and veggies before they cooked the meat. after re-heating everything was good.

Early dinner with family and children. Waitperson pleasant. Menu uninteresting. Food mediocre for all items (soup, salads, steak, pasta and fish (very fishy). A bit of a tourist trap and would not recommend.
Walking distance to the theatre district makes this a great spot before, or after, performance. Seating is tight - only thing improved that would have made this a better experience.
Reminiscent of a midwestern supper club or steakhouse but had plenty of west coast charm. Chicago portions with San Francisco flavor.

We love John's Grill and always visit at least once while in the City.  Love the music.  Food and service are always great.  We will continue to dine there.  In fact, we have already made reservations for when we return to SF in December.
review_title: We love John's Grill and always

review: A truly old-time San Francisco restaurant with authentic old-time atmosphere. Very good, unpretentious food. Good service. Only a block from BART.
Excellent food and service! We came on our honeymoon and had a wonderful time!

Avoid by all means to be placed on the second floor - you are better off in a canteen than in the cramped space there. The place lives off its reputation, the downstairs bit seemed to have some atmosphere but upstairs we were cramped into a stuffy room where you had the impression that volume and turnover was the only thing that mattered. The food ( steak and lamb chops) was passable - leaving aside overcooked Idaho potatoes and tasteless vegs- and the rest was pretty awful.
review_title: Avoid by all means to be placed

review: I had the dungeness crab and shrimp filled sole - awesome. The fish and filling were fresh. My husband had the liver. It was done exactly as he ordered. The only drawback I noted was the lack of space between tables. We did go upstairs to look at the Maltese Falcon Room - I was a little disappointed as there is only a lit case with the statue, an Oscar (not sure if that's real), and books by Hammett. I thought the "lunch" prices were a little steep. The only dishes that included potato were the meat dishes. The fish plates only included vegetables. I was pleased to see that the side dishes were not outrageously priced. I would recommend John's Grill - good food and a piece of San Francisco history.
review_title: I had the dungeness crab and

review: This restaurant has true "Character". The food is great; the prices are very reasonable; the staff is well coordinated and appropriately friendy; and it's located near everything in city center.It's wise to make reservations, and (when the city is crowded) to schedule an early dinner.John's Grill is a big "Thumbs Up". I'm becoming a "regular":D

John's Grill treated our party with care and tried to find us a spot where we could talk, as requested. But the holiday scene ruled out much quiet. Still, the service was excellent and the woman at the front desk dealing with our reservation handled our situation with care and cheer. I was impressed! Plus I love the ambiance of Sam Spade and Dashiell Hammett and San Francisco. So glad there is a John's Grill to keep part of old San Francisco alive.

Enjoyed our evening at John's Grill! Requested good seating for a my cousin and we received it!!! The service was great, as was the atmosphere!! Enjoyed a drink at the
bar and enjoyed reminicy of old SF and north Beach in the 60's-70's era!
Waitress was great! I could have eatedn more ciopponie,but flavor/fish very good!
Would not hesitate to go again, but do recommend reservations; this was a Wed. evening and was packed by the time we left!! Enjoy!

We were in San Francisco for the Day to see 'Wicked' at the Orpheum Theater. We made reservations at John's Grill, and found it quaint, and the food delicious. We vowed after the show to return for dessert. Upon our return, I commented to the host we were returning for dessert, and he rudely told us that they were a meal place, and had a $20 minimum per table. Well I told him we had just been there, and we saw a lot of empty tables. But he did not appear to want to be accommodating, after I approached my inquiry in several manners. We left disgruntled, putting a damper on the pleasant day we were having. We found ourselves at the Nordstrom Cafe around the corner, where upon smelling the delicious food, decided to have dinner & dessert.
review_title: We were in San Francisco for

review: The service was excellent and the food was great. We were on the 3rd floor and the room was a bit warm. Our server opened a window near us which helped but she did this towards the end of our meal. The Favorite salad was fantastic. I had it as my entree and the size was perfect. Prices were as expected.

Let me start with the positives:
-The ambiance at John's was fun
-The service was attentive (didn't have to wait for more water or to pour wine)
-The appetizers that our group had were very good (crab salad, chowder)

Negatives:
-Our steaks (all three) were way overcooked! Everyone in my group ordered medium-rare and we all commented on how "not remotely pink" the center of the meat was. I am not one to complain often about a meal but it really ruined a much anticipated steak meal. At a steak restaurant, I feel that cooking the meat to specifications is the one thing you should always do right.

I did let the waitress know but did not ask her to take it back. In retrospect, I should have as I ended up not eating it and still paying
review_title:
Let me start with the positives:
-T

review: Very solid steak house. Food is excellent, service is even better. Great for a business dinner.
The food at John's Grill is very good but the noise and crowded rooms make it difficult to enjoy.
review_title: The food at John's Grill is

review: This was our first experience with John's Grill and we went for lunch. We each had a different seafood, scallops and calamari steak. Both dishes were delicious! The vegetables were perfection. We would definitely try this retaurant again. Service was as good as it gets.

We celebrated my son's 21st birthday and had a remarkable experience. Our waiter was attentive and started him off with the signature cocktail in the souvenier glass. The place was cozy on a rainy night with the paneled wood and christmas lights. Classic old San Francisco with great steakhouse food. It was a wonderful experience and I really appreciated our waiter helping to make the occasion special and memorable.

John's Grill is an outstanding restaurant for good food prepared well. No playfull food at John's, just steaks, seafood, and chops carefully prepared and presented. Service was great, and the live entertainment was pleasant and unobtrusive. It continues to be one of our favorite restaurants. I highly recommend the restaurant.

I am a local and wanted to eat at this old SF Establishment. The food was horrible, my dining companions and I sent the food back, the fish was inedible. We then ordered steaks medium well. They came rare or well done. The server was nice, understanding and the only bright spot along with the Maltese Falcon memorabilia. This really was a poor dining experience and it felt like a tourist trap. I would not go back nor recommend. What a shame, this SF establishment adn its memories deserve better, new chef and a restoration are in order.
review_title: I am a local and wanted to

review: A must for any Dashiell Hammet fan; it has the ambiance of the 30s and 40s. The Bloody Bridget is a fun drink to try and to get a souvenir glass. The food was very good and the service was excellent.
review_title: A must for any Dashiell Hammet

review:
The food was OK - but not good enough for the price.

I would not bother to go back.
review_title: The food was OK - but not

review: Made reservations for 7. The restaurant was so busy, we didn't get sat until almost 7:30. Not a big deal, but then make our reservation for 7:30!
We had a corporate group of 13 and although the restaurant was busy we were very comfortable and had a great time. The food and service was awesome. Very convenient to BART travelers.
review_title: We had a corporate group of

review: This a historic downtown San Francisco restaurant. Absolutely charming and all the things that say Old time S.F. We go there a couple times a year and especially Christmas. Wouldn't miss it. Most charming 8 stool bar, pictures and service and food are fantastic. Thank you "John's"

This is not the first time I ate at John's. We were 6 and all had steaks. They were prepared properly, but not as hot as they should be. Also all the steaks were rather dry without real flavor. I would give them another chance, but only one more!!
review_title: This is not the first time

review: John's Grill is filled with great history and the food, while not exceptional, was good. It's quite basic, nothing really original, but you won't walk out feeling disappointed either.  The service was excellent, the wine list decent.

Only great things to say. Wine list is exceptional. The menu was incredible; so hard deciding what to order! The staff was great. Incredibly friendly and helpful. Made the whole experience for us. We had the best time. Would definitely recommend to any interested parties!
Service driven and a MUST REPEAT as a special pleasure!
review_title: Amazing! The popovers are to "die for"!

review: I went with my girlfriend for our anniversary dinner. I had heard a lot of good things about this place from many people so expectations were a bit high. The ambiance is really cool and it's perfect for dinner. The food was pretty good although I have to say nothing really blew us away except for the Mac-n-cheese starter which was excellent. The service was terrible. After we ordered drinks and some starters our dinner took about 45 minutes to arrive. There were people that sat after us who started eating before we did. Our server said there was some mix up in the kitchen and did apologize. However we weren't even offered some thing to snack on or even a drink as we continued to wait. We had plans after dinner and truly felt rushed to eat our food after it eventually arrived. This was a real disappointment and I'm not sure if I will return.
review_title: You should valet when you come to this restaurant.

review: The entire staff is attentive to delivering superb service from the second you come in the door:  the folks at the front of the house who are working hard to get you seated on an ultra busy evening; the attentive and expert bartenders; the highly professional and engaging wait staff (ask for Ricky, although we're sure you would have a similarly excellent experience with other servers); and oh my oh my, the food the kitchen delivers.  Luscious oysters and cold lobster from the raw bar.  Possibly the best salmon I've had anyplace ever?  Can't remember better, anyhow.  You already know about the fried chicken.  Popovers.  Pear sorbet.  And share a glass of moscato d'Asti after the meal.  So great we came back twice on a 2-day trip!

I was very excited for an evening out with my sister at Wayfare Tavern.  For a bill over $100 dollars for two people without drinks I had expected good food and good service as is standard for this type of restaurant.  The server was not very friendly and only really engaged when he brought the check and it was time to tip.  I am in sales and dine all over the city in nice restaurants with clients and while I am young- I was taken aback how he acted like we were not important diners.  Also, we ordered the steak medium.  It came back pink and when the waiter never came to check on us- my sister ate the parts of it that were cooked enough.  Overall, the experience was underwhelming and wouldn't go back.
We had a great dinner.  The cocktails were spot on and so was the food.  The fried chicken, as always, is off the hook.  Our waitress was attentive and very pleasant.

Service and ambience were very good. I wanted to like Wayfare Tavern. Decor is cool and ratings were really good. And a friend suggested it. But the food was pedestrian, especially when you consider the prices. Wayfare Tavern is living off the hype. Don't buy the hype. It is just not that great. You will feel like a sucker after paying the check.

From the wine pick to the perfectly seasoned pasta, this eatery is abosute heaven.  The pop-overs were warm and tender served with black salted butter were the perfect accompaniment.  Service was jovial and attentive.  Will certainly add this to my SF favs list.
Everything, from the popovers to the fried chicken and burger, was delicious.
review_title: Everything, from the popovers to the fri...

review: food is everything you hear about and more! So worth it! We already want to go back and order everything we didn't get this time! So good!!
Service could not be better. Food is straight forward delicious. We recommend Wayfare Tavern.
Food was not as good as my past visits.  Nothing made us feel "WOW".  We were seated in front of the fireplace and it was too warm.
Great service, very attentive. Food was OK...very salty. I was dining with a coworker and both of our entrees were over salted- hamburger and fried chicken!

We had a really great night out, with our reservation we were seated right away. The food was excellent, service was good, slightly transactional and impersonal, but the waiters were very attentive, my water glass was always full! We actually had fun getting to know the couple next to us, as were crammed in very close, but it was great chatting with them!

They screwed up our reservation, but fitted us in after a 20min delay. The food was mixed quality, the hamburger & chicken v good, the liver pate' was great. Octopus expensive & average. Pork loin was dry. Service very good. Atmosphere good, but noisy.

the corkage charge is outrageous, $25!

Overall a pleasant experience but not special.
Enjoyed our dining experience and will definitely return in the future.

Food Selection was limited, and the quality of the meals was mediocre at best, and over cooked. Even upstairs the volume was VERY loud, could not even conduct a 2 person conversation without raising voices. Service was ok but not what you expect from high end eatery, especially for a Wednesday evening. Wine selection was extensive but overpriced.
If you are looking for a romantic atmosphere this is NOT it.
For the price you pay I would expect better quality food and service.
I personally would not recommend this restaurant, and will never go there again.

The salmon BLT wonderful!
Great service and our lunch experience was a great as the last two visits!!

Very happy that we finally got to this restaurant. The menu was fantastic, offering something for everybody in our group. And each dish was prepared expertly and there wasn't a complaint to be found.

Besides the food living up to the hype, the cocktails were on par. I would recommend this spot to anybody who's either local or in town for a few nights
The Deviled Eggs and Deep Fried Oysters were delicious. In fact starters and salad are almost just enough for lunch. By the time the entree came, I was kind of full!!
Great restaurant, very consistent. Must-haves include burrata, deviled eggs, and seared day boat scallops.

I made a 1 o'clock reservation on opentable for 2 people. At 1:05 I was told it would be 10 minutes until we would be seated. We did not actually sit down at our table until 1:30 and did not place our order until 2.

We had the brussel spouts and mac & cheese to start, both delicious. Then the burger and fried chicken for our entrees. I asked for the burger to be cooked medium and it was very rare (which I actually like, so that was ok). But had I really wanted it medium I would have had to send it back. Fried chicken was fabulous.

Moral of the story, a 1 o'clock reservation means 1:30 and you will not get out of there until 245. And they want you to eat their burgers rare.

I've been there twice.  Wonderful place.  One food item, the veal schnitzel, on our second visit wasn't perfect.  Three people ordered it.  Two of the three orders were undercooked.  They were very gracious and they received new orders that they thoroughly enjoyed.  Our server handled it wonderfully.  We still love this place.

Loved this "English" pub! If it weren't for the poor service we experienced at the little bar upstairs it would have been fabulous. We spoke to the manager and he comped one round of Gin and Jelly signature drinks which were excellent.

Food was very good. However,thought the corkage fee was excessive. Would recommend reducing the amount. My wife and I were celebrating and saved a special bottle of wine to drink during this celebration. With the $25 corkage fee, we felt we were being punished by wanting to enjoy our wine at this fine dining establishment. After all, it should be about the food, not the wine...That being said, we would go back and would recommend to to others.

Have been waiting for a special occasion to come here and i was not disappointed! The oxtail poutine was great and very flavorful. Also ordered the fried chicken, although it could probably have been split between two people it was so big! Great ambiance, good music and generally good service. I also liked the casual atmosphere as well.
review_title: Have been waiting for a special

review: The food was excellent, but it is a NYC restaurant with the tables very close together and the noise level quite high.
We enjoyed everything about this restaurant, from the best "bread" ever to the perfect table by the fireplace!
Wayfare Tavern has become our 'go to' place when we crave fried chicken. It's so good!

they were running behind so our reservations was delayed for over a half hour. if i didn't tell them our party had a plane to catch it would have probably taken longer. they should call if a reservation is going to be delayed more than 15 minutes. then people have a choice not to come or come later.
Excellent otherwise!

We drove 100 miles to eat here. It was worth it! We had the famous fried chicken, house burger, and two sides. The flavor of the chicken was impressive. The burger is as full of flavor as you think it will be when you look at the picture on the website. The Marin brie cheese was unusual and delicious.

Wayfare Tavern specializes in comfort food. If you are dieting or prefer to avoid foods with a high fat and calorie content, this is not the restaurant for you. I dined with 3 friends, and we shared two orders of fried chicken plus the mac-n-cheese, summer squash, and green beans. We also shared one slice of the chocolate cream pie. We ordered these dishes based on all of the previous reviews, and every dish met or exceeded expectations. I am local to San Francisco but the other 3 people in our party are from out of state, and we all thought it was a great choice for dinner. Wine list is excellent, and I highly recommend the Mary Edwards Pinot Noir with the fried chicken. The only disappointment for me was the service.

This is one of my very favorite restaurants in the City! Especially if you get a chance to see Tyler Florence, like I did. The fried chicken is to die for! And make room for desert for the chocolate pudding cake. Topped with whip cream and itty bitty malt balls. Delicious! I can't wait to go back!
Food is above average tavern fare however the noise is deafening

Wayfare Tavern never disappoints! The Darlene Peach Pie was incredible, the pie crust was probably one of the best pie crusts I've had, and the brown butter ice cream and rosemary were great pairings with the peaches.

We knew the food would be outstanding at this Tyler Florence eatery, but it was the service that really impressed us. We were on a mini-honeymoon just across the bay to SF and were treated with such care. It wasn't just good service, there was a personality to it that made Wayfare stand out. We can't wait to go back!

I had seen Tyler Florence at Pebble Beach Food and Wine and couldn't wait to try one of his restaurants. No doubt Wayfare has tremendous energy and the service was great. But my meal and wine were just so-so. I don't think I'd go back.

Over-rated. I am not paying $23 to eat fried chicken, are you kidding me? And you salads, the twigs and branches or whatever it's called... some nerve to charge $12 for a bunch of greens and beets with olive oil... at least put some salt on it for me. Just another new(ish), busy, crowded place in SF. Par for the course

I really like Wayfare Tavern but, for some reason, it didn't hold true for this visit. Everything seemed a little off - from the food to the waiter. We will definitely go back but I was not impressed this time around.
We had a party of 4 for a late weekend lunch and it was lovely. The ambiance is very comfortable, the food was so suited to our comfort mood and excellently prepared. I can't wait to return!
review_title: We had a party of 4 for a

review: food is very good although generally very heavy. It would be a much more pleasant evening if something could be done to control the noise levels.

The setting is splendid, the service as attentive and helpful as one could ask. But our visit disappointed for the most basic reason: the food. A warm spinach salad came with a "honey black pepper" dressing of one-dimensional sweetness; no tang or saltiness to make flavors come alive - and whole black peppercorns. How can one eat a salad with whole peppercorns? One bite: an overpowering explosion of pepper, obliterating what little other flavor there was; the next: nothing. This is why we have pepper grinders. The french fries with Steak Frites were crisp and flavorful, but the steak (a tri tip for this?) was chewy and tough. To Wayfare's wonderful chef: fresh takes are great; but not at the price of serving food that misses on the basics.
Rich, hearty fare. The cauliflower soup was AMAZING! Also, loved the popovers and I never eat the bread brought to the table. Also, the bar made a mean Sidecar.

For some reason there is always a back-up at the hostess stand so don't expect to be seated until 10 minutes after your scheduled reservation. However the service is excellent and while I find some of the food to be hit or miss, the burgers are most excellent!
review_title: For some reason there is always

review: I always have a wonderful dinning experience at WayFare. Their food is great as is the staff.
Very good. I would send all my foodie friends here.
review_title: Very good. I would send all

review: Go here for dinner! The food is amazing and the service is excellent. The lunch service lacks that same feel. The service is slow and its seems like they have their B team at lunch.
review_title: Go here for dinner! The food

review: We enjoyed our meals and sitting at the chef's table was a wonderful experience. We got to see all the action and at lunch time in the financial district there was a lot of action! the food was great except for the "fries" which were very ordinary. the decor was very old San Francisco, charming and warm. I look forward to my next visit!
review_title: We enjoyed our meals and sitting

review: Fantastic food, fantastic decor, terrific service.  No downside to this restaurant

An overall good dining experience. We were seated quickly. The main dining room is up stair with a long and a bit steep staircase, a somewhat arduous climb. We had a corner table but the next table is only 5 feet away. The noise level is deafening. We had difficulty hearing one another without leaning forward. The first course came promptly. The beef tartar had good flavor and proper amount of spiciness. The fried chicken sans skin was rather bland. The pieces had good taste of freshness albeit the white meat was a bit dry. My scallops ($30) was far from substantial with 5 only mildly seared pieces of moderate size. They were supported by scantily dressed slivers of vegetable and small cubes of watermelon. All in all, hardly memorable.

Much better than expected. Fried Chicken, burger, tomato soup were all enjoyable. Standouts were the VEAL CHOP and rabbit terrine. The chop was so juicy, tender and bursting with flavor. Shisito peppers were a bit disappointing. Appeared to be deep fried instead of seared in cast iron skillet. Corn side was very good. Mac n cheese was average. We did not find the food salty as many others have commented. Service was fine. You are packed in the dining room and the noise level is OFF THE CHART. We would return.

Wayfare's Organic Fried Chicken was sooo good. I will definitely keep coming back for it. I have yet to try the other food but so far I've had a good experience having lunch at this restaurant. Staff was very friendly & attentive as well.

Met friends visiting from San Diego. Tyler florence was in attendance, and affable. Veal Chop was excellent, as was the Marrow Bones. The Fried Chicken (which was excellent on my last visit) was mediocre; first batch overcooked, next batch lacked crispy skin which "makes" fried chicken. Overall, ambiance and other dishes served, make for a repeat for us.

The portions are enormous - I wish they were smaller. They couldn't find the wine we ordered for some time - that's very odd. I refused water twice, yet they came back and filled my glass. Loved the popovers. Prices are a bit high...
computers were down ..no mention until we asked for the bill which was long overdue..not very professional aproach..but very polite when we did ask

First off the bartender did not know how to make an Aviation. But they did replace it with a sidecar which was very good. But most of all, the timing seemed to be off. While the waiter was excellent the rest of the staff was not. We had to ask 3 times for the popovers. And the entrees arrived before the appetizer causing them to be sent back. On the good side, we did receive the table he had requested.

We were staying in San Francisco for 3 nights and ate here 2 times. Pop overs are great, fried chicken is awesome but the Pot roast takes the cake. 2nd night we split the burger, the blue wedge and shared the pineapple upside down cake for dessert. I have no complaints all the food rocked and service was on top of everything. Trust me you'll love their comfort food. Also if you're a fan of Tyler Florence, he was running the kitchen.

I took my husband there for his birthday and noted in the reservation that it was his birthday. They gave us a really great table and had a signed birthday card from Tyler Florence waiting for him when we got to the table. Nice touch!

I'm only giving it a 4 star rating on food because I would like to see a few more mains on the menu. But, my burger was outstanding and my husband loved the pot roast.
review_title: I took my husband there for

review: The food is absolutely divine and among the best in the Bay Area. Comfort food done in a new and interesting way that will appeal to everyone. The interior design is also excellent, like a high end hunting lodge that could be anywhere. Unfortunately the service was awful - unattentive and disorganized, even when there were only 2 tables besides ours that had guests at that early time of the evening! The management needs to learn about excellent service standards such as is the norm at: Prospect, RN74, Grand Cafe, Cosmopolitan, Roy's and Tommy Toy's.
After three visits here, I've come to love Wayfare Tavern. From the food to the ambience, this is truly a winner.

Second time around was great! I gor the fried chicken the first time I went & recommended it to my friend this time was extremely salty. But other then that they hit it out of the park. Tri-tip was awesome!
A beautiful space with delicious but way too salty food.

I made a dinner reservation for my mother's b-day 2 months prior to the event. The reservation was at 8:30pm, on a Monday night. We were only seated by 9:10pm, and didn't get food until 9:30pm. In my mind, I would expect drinks or smth to be on the house, for such a long wait. But that was not the case, only a polite "we apologize". But the time we were seated, they had ran out of the foie gras- something i was looking for, this is when we got a complimentary appetizer, which was nice of the restaurant.

Nonetheless, the food is amazing. I love their steak tartar, and think it's one of the best I ever had. Ceasar salad, tuna carpaccio, short ribs are all delicious. I have yet to try their chicken for which they are famous. We'll be back!!

We had a great dinner hosting out-of-town guests. Our waiter, Sam, was a delight in enthusiasm and attentiveness. The food was very good, not outstanding. Entrees were better than starters. Major demerit--there was nothing to tempt any of us on the dessert menu and we are all dessert lovers. I would go back and try again. I did love the atmosphere altho conversation across a table is challenging.
review_title: We had a great dinner hosting

review: Wayfare Tavern - what a wonderful dining experience! It brings comfort food to a whole new level with a mix of victorian & old SF flavor and feel. I loved it and will go back again! However, they have a system of leaving your leftovers at the host station instead of bringing it back to your table. I initially thought the system was fine, but I found it to be unfortunate when I gave my ticket to the host and there were no leftovers to be found. The awkward thing was that the host was barely communicating & probrably too emabarresed to say anything. The floor manager rushed to get my car in valet but I sensed that they wanted me to leave without having to explain where my food had gone. This was not the best feeling - but I'll go back again
Waited 59 mins before bread was brought over, in a half empty restaurant. Unacceptable service.

Steak tartare outstanding; fried chicken oversalted and left me thirsty. Excellent cocktails and attentive service. The decor (modern hunter's lodge) is much improved than when the space was Rubicon. Earsplittingly loud, but overall I enjoyed our meal.
Nice experience - portions are huge - had to take food home. It's a true Hot Spot - I would go there again and take friends -
Food is ok but not great; not a good value overall because portions are very small and they expect you to order a la carte for sides (vegetables, etc.). Overhyped place.
review_title: Food is ok but not great;

review: I like this place so much I have been back 4 times. I wish the hostesses would figure out a way to get guests drinks or find a place for people to stand. There is a bar upstairs and a pool room that's open to the public when not reserved. Why can't they let us know this? Not every one wants to sit and eat at the bar. Give cocktailers a place to enjoy their end-of day libations. After being seated, I was reminded why we like this place so much. It's fun, it's convivial and everyone seems to be having a good time. The food is really good and really fun to share. I wish the courses would come a little faster. Waiters never seem to be 100% engaged. But it's always a unique SF experience in a tastefully done space with real charm.
review_title: I like this place so much

review: I loved Wayfare Tavern. And while I appreciate and the fame and fortune Tyler has garnered my new found love affair is not based on his looks or personality - it's about the FOOD, the service, the environment, the pace, tone, and feel... Wayfare fills a true need / oppty in San Francisco - a comfortable yet elegant establishment where we can feel equally at home no matter who we choose to drink / dine with. The MENU is refreshingly unique, the portions are hefty, the FOH is friendly, and the place just FEELS COMFORTABLE, WARM, AND AUTHENTIC. This place has legs - I could eat here once a week. It feels familiar, like family. So way to go Wayfare - you have much to be proud of and we locals welcome you (and appreciate what you are offering us

Chef Tyler and Co. have done themselves proud. I waited a couple of weeks out of respect but I suspect things were near perfect from the first night. During my luncheon with a friend, Chef inspected EVERY single dish sent from the kitche, with his cute wife sitting nearby and yet being very discreet. West coast oysters, deviled eggs re-discovered, Fois Gras which was perfect, amazing mac and cheese, and fried chicken. Who on earth manages to get steaming popovers to the table TWICE during the meal? Nicely nailed - and as Tyler himself would say, "off the hook". Hats off to phone staff, front desk and servers, as well. One hint: Go now before Chef figures out he's being too generous with the Fois Gras! Don't worry - I took it home!
review_title: Chef Tyler and Co. have done

review: Arrived slight;y early but was seated immediately. Food was delicious and I was not able to finish my dinner because of the hearty serving size. My water glass never went empty due to the attentive wait staff. Tyler was kind enough to pose for a picture with my wife. I believe he personally checked every plate that left the kitchen,

Up to date Nostalgia. The atmosphere and experience was reminiscent dining held to the highest standard. The atmosphere made me feel like a nice restaurant from Vito Corelone's hey day, the food was definitely up to the task of pleasing our tastes in the new melenium. It's gen Y appeal with your grand father's class. Don't miss this San Francisco secret.

I used your online reservation service to make a reservation on December 30th. When I arrived at the restaurant the host stated that they were not honoring reservations made through your website that evening. He stated there was a miscommunication between the owner and OpenTable. It seems to me that good customer service dictates that the customer be taken care of and miscommunications between a vendor be taken care of behind the scenes. Score zero for customer service.
Excellent service and food but disappointed that they no longer have a liquor license only beer and wine.the restaurant upstairs now has the license but it does not warrant it.
We had a wonderful dinner here. The food was served quickly and the staff was attentive. Our entrees and dessert were delicious.

I've been to Sear's several times for brunch, and I swear they have the best Eggs Benedict I've ever tasted! Thursday evening was my first time trying Sear's for dinner, however, and I have to say I was just as impressed with dinner as I always am with brunch! The dinner menu has a bunch of classic American dishes (lamb chops, ribs, steak) as well as great local seafood. Also, we had a terrific waiter -- friendly, attentive & quick to get out our meals.

The only warning I would give about Sear's is simply that it does get pretty packed in the mornings, especially weekend mornings, for brunch, so sometimes the earlier the better in order to avoid the throng of tourists from Union Square.

The ambience was festive. but unfortunately our birthday celebration had some glitches with most entrees not serviced hot and although service was friendly, it wasn't very attentive.  Out of 3 steak dinners only one was hot and the other 3 entrees  were not anything special nor served hot either.  Dining was slow but that  isn't an issue if food is hot & enjoyable, so maybe entrees sat awhile before serving. We had higher hopes based on recent reviews.  One reviewer mentioned upon receiving the menu, the top read "Happy Birthday," which would have been a nice touch, but that didn't occur for us.  I had contracted reservations in advance and thought everything would be memorable  in a good way.
review_title: Not the special birthday celebration we hoped

review: Great special occasion or date night dining! The scallops were tremendous, some of the best I have ever eaten. The burrata and tomato appetizer was excellent as well. Loved the streak for main course, portions very generous. Others at our table raved about the pork chop. Desserts are quite varied and delicious, the best being the popcorn!

This place is a hit.  Been here several times and each time everyone in my party enjoyed the food.  They have a slim menu but enough for a good variety, and the food is just tasty, fresh, and made with care by the chefs.  We tried most of the appetizers and several entrees and we all left satisfied.  I recommend the chicken for lunch - so tasty.  Been here for dinner as well and recommend the duck breast.  And, the service is great.   They make sure you are taken cared of the whole time during your meal.  Will be back soon

My wife and I had our wedding rehearsal dinner at Prospect 2 years ago, and the food and service were phenomenal.  We decided to go back there last week to celebrate our anniversary.  This time; however, the experience was not as great.  We both ordered the strip steak, which was cooked perfectly, but it was extremely gristly.  We both commented that this is is the type if steak you get at Ponderosa or Sizzler back when we were kids and not what we expect from such a trendy place.  It was $45 and the most expensive entree on the menu, and we expected a much better quality of steak. Our server was very attentive and friendly.  We would definitely go back but hope that this slip is not a permanent spiral and only a fluke.
Delicious food, attentive service, and reasonable prices make Prospect a better value than other options.
We had awesome time celebrating my daddy's birthday. The service was spectacular; the food.... I'm speechless. We will definitely goback again.
Best roast chicken ever. Other lunch dishes equally good.

Given how much we like Boulevard, we've been wanting to try Prospect. With New York foodie friends visiting and staying nearby, we decided to give it a go. The cocktails and bartenders boded well -- unfortunately the food that followed was quite ordinary. While meat and fish were cooked well, the sauces and accompaniments were indifferent. The menu also reads as if the food is more creative than it is -- which seems counter to our experience at other great San Francisco restaurants. We were a bit chagrined we hadn't shown them a better dining experience. Now we understand why the restaurant was so quiet. For these prices, the restaurant needs maor attention.
Great food, ambiance, and nice to have the wine special on a Sunday night

Creative, interesting and fresh menu selections. Appeared to be the spot for after work dinner meetings and large groups. Service was very slow and seemed too rushed to ever feel welcome. Disappointing evening.

What a disappointment. The service was terrible!!!! They brought the wrong dinner to me and I waited for 10 minutes for them to bring me the correct dinner. My friends were half way throughout their meal. And...Prospect never offered anything to me to apologize.
Food was great! Sat a table with two large partys close by that talked very loudly!
review_title: Food was great! Sat a table

review: Great for and service. Definitely worth a repeat visit

One of the best high end restaurant in town. Classy and stylish decor, and a very acceptable noise level (on a Friday night) are among the things you'll notice upon getting there. Food is class A, we had heirloom tomatoes with burrata, seared scallops and kobe short ribs - everything was extremely good.
The wine selection is one of the most complete I've ever seen, and I was really glad I could have a bottle of "Rosso di Montalcino", coming from one of my favorites Italian wineries (yup I'm from there, born and raised). Service is what you would expect from this class of restaurant, professional and timely. All of this doesn't come cheap of course, but you pay for what you get, and you'll get a lot.
review_title: One of the best high end restaurant

review:
Great relax spacious place for brunch. You can have a conversation with friends & families. The table is far enough , you don't feel crowded like many other brunch places.
Of course, the food is delicious & well presented, the service is well attentive & friendly. Parking is not too hard. Excellent experience !

Outstanding menu and wine list
Exceptional service
Worth trying more than once!
The food was excellent, the service was superb and the atmosphere was acceptable for our business dinner.

I had to rate the service poor because from the minute we showed up to the time I checked in with someone (I think she ended up being the manager on duty), we had terrible service. They did have a big group ahead of us, but I have not had such poor service anywhere in San Francisco. The manager redeemed Prospect a bit by totally taking over and saving the night, so it wasn't all a wash, and the food was good. Just don't think I would go back with so many other options available in the city.
Our first visit and we were very impressed and satisfied. The menu was creative and well executed. the service was attentive, but not overbearing.
review_title: Our first visit and we were

review: The food is delicious and inventive. We did a good bit on waiting on service -- cocktails took 20 minutes to arrive. Waiter disappeared for 30 minutes between entree and dessert.

Our waitress said if i liked lamb i would like goat. WRONG! I should have got the duck.

I will never order goat again, it isn't like lamb at all and was chewy.
review_title: Our waitress said if i liked

review:
We loved the seasonal food, especially the fig salad and the chef's combination of flavors!
The servers were friendly, helpful & very knowledgeable. The pork chop entree was fabulous!
A very contemporary & chic dining spot! We look forward to returning!

I'm not a fan of quail. It's a lot of work for not much meat and the quail is usually overcooked. Not so at Prospect. Partially deboned, juicy and full of flavor. It was almost my favorite dish. My favorite was the duck which was done perfectly (I had mine medium rare) with crispy skin and a juiciness which was inherent and not due to sauce.

In general I was very impressed by the presentation of the food and the fact that I could discern the distinct flavors of each dishes components. The components complemented each other beautifully.

The service was attentive but not intrusive. The ambience was comfortable but elegant. Prospect was exactly the kind of restaurant I think of when I think of fine dining in San Francisco
review_title: I'm not a fan of quail. It's

review:
Excellent food and service. Nice dining room and bar. Pricey drinks w/un-generous
liquor pours. Not as wonderful as boulevard, in variety and ambiance.
Fabulous food. The appetizers were all great but the beets with burrata were particularly memorable. As was the goat main course.

In a grand space, Prospect is sophisticated urbanity at its best. From the complimentary amuse bouche to the delectable sea bass, the food was wonderful. Minor note was the less than creamy burrata in the arugula and radicchio salad.

Based on some of the negative reviews, I hesitated to try Prospect. My experience was very good from the food to the service, and I will definitely go back. Unlike some of the reviewers, I found the food to be creative and tasty, and the portions to be in an amount that I expect and like at a "fine dining" type restaurant.
review_title: Based on some of the negative

review: Overall experience was very good -- lively environment, although able to have a conversation without shouting. Food is terrific and service excellent....did not have the sense that they were trying to turn the table quickly. Very relaxing and nice experience, overall.
Excellent food. Service was also extremely good. Really enjoyed the meal.

Outstanding, imaginative food, great buzz, good service, this place has it all. The food was well executed and beautifully presented. This place has come into it's own. The menu choices were great across the board.

Overall a great spot - but I was disappointed in the service. Our server was half asleep and really looked like he would have rather been somewhere else. No energy, no opinions on specialties, etc - should be excited to work at a great new spot, not bored with it.

We went after an early opera for a light meal. Two of us started with the reconstructed pied de cochon. It was excellent though if there was some way to include a bit of crispy pig skin it would be even more amazing. Then we had 2 more appetizers: black cod for me & quail for him, both were beautifully presented & thoroughly delicious. Our friend had a lovely seafood risotto type dish. Again, excellent. I had some ricotta beignet type things for dessert that were wonderful. They had ice cream sandwiches - these were good but I thought the cookie was too thick & chewy. They liked it though. Good wines. My only negative was the oppressive throbbing techno music - it may be hip but I found it intrusive. I like Jazz, classical or quiet.
review_title: We went after an early opera

review: The food was delicious and the service was high level. We enjoyed the shrimp appetizer tremendously and each of our entrees was well prepared.

We really enjoyed our dinner at Prospect. The room is lovely, airy, with a nice uncrowded feeling. Despite a couple of small errors, quickly corrected, the service was very good. The food was very good and interesting; a nice menu with many attractive choices.

The service here is outstanding, however there's something lacking about this place that's hard to pin down. While they've spent lot of money on the decor, the space is like any number of high end hotel restaurants----totally forgettable. The food, while good, is not exciting and highly generic. Nothing stands out except the service, which is terrific. But there are so many other wonderful restaurants in San Francisco it's hard to make a case for going back here. The bar is lively so that's probably the biggest draw, if that's what you're looking for.

For a restaurant that has only been open 4 days (at the time of this review), the service at Prospect was spot-on. The restaurant is lively and the bar scene here is vibrant. Notable food to order are the "Day Boat Scallops with White Summer Truffles" and the "Lamb Loin and Rib."
As good as or better than French Laundry.  Mind-blowing. Creative, outstanding food. Really special.  18 courses and each one incredible.  Service perfect.  Corey Lee is a genius.

The service and ambiance were exceptional. Every aspect of detail was taken into consideration and handled perfectly. The menu was thoughtfully put together. Unfortunately my girlfriend and I don't care for eggs and the first course was a thousand year old quail egg. We both decided to eat everything we were given, so we ate them. It was not our favorite part of the meal but eating it enhanced our experience. We loved our meal and would certainly return the next time we are in San Francisco. Our party had a food allergy which was handled perfectly, and some of the substitutions were better than the original

As an Asian, I would say that the attempt here at Asian fusion cuisine was rather disappointing after all the hype I received. For a start, there are just too many courses and inevitably, flavours will clash rather than complement. I would have much preferred 8-9 courses which would deliver a much more memorable and pleasant experience. Secondly, the ingredients in the food served is nothing fantastic for somewhere charging over $200 for a meal; anchovies and peanuts are everyday staples where I come from as was the prawn crackers.

Wish I hadn't cancelled my reservations at Quince....
Ingredients, presentation, taste, pairings ... all were fantastic. Service was exceptional.
review_title: Food and service were equally great

review: Es una gran experiencia, que todo persona debe vivir, las sensaciones que produce tan maravillosa comida envuelto en un ambiente mgico hace de esta ocasin una cena inolvidable
Food is really good but not worth the price. Definite a fit for foodies who don't find a $250 tasting menu ridiculous l
review_title: Food is really good but not

review: We went to Benu to try the tasting menu after reading about it in Food and Wine magazine. We were treated to one of the best meals of our lives. The unique ingredients, variety of courses, cleaver use of serving ware, and attentive, knowledgable servers made it an experience to remember. The price of the tasting menu is high, but we appreciated its worth once we saw all of the hard work that went I to it. The decor is pleasant but non-descript, allowing the food to provide the true flavor for the evening. It you are looking for a truly special meal, Benu will not disappoint!

The taste of the food are so unique. However, it seems like they use the same kind of sauces over again (the white one, which is too creamy for me), and cause I personally don't like that sauce so much, so..ya... but overall is really good! thumbs up!
review_title: The taste of the food are

review: Benu is worth every penny. Anyone given the opportunity to go there should seize it
Just way to much money for the food. Food was good but not $200 for a single diner Add the wine pairing it's $300. Food and wine were not worth that kind of money. I would not come again

Loved the decor. Corey and his staff do a wonderful job. The waiters are extremely knowledgeable and happy to answer questions. Corey's cuisine is innovative and fun. We enjoyed the tasting menu. Too many courses, but a handful were quite memorable.

I was bummed to get a reservation confirmation telling me that Fri/Sat was Prix Fixe only. I am glad they told me, but OpenTable should add a feature to confirm this when booking a spot for Fri/Sat. My best friend could not come because it was $$. So, we had an odd number at the table, and he still could not come to even it out unless he had the PF. I know it's meant to be just for one and they swore the portions were small, but I was full halfway through and really felt like I wasted half my money. I didn't eat a lot of it and really wish given half my dishes to a friend. The food was so-so based on my experience having amazing Asian food all over Asia and having great dining all over the Bay Area.
review_title: I was bummed to get a reservation

review: just perfect / fantastic food and perfect wine pairing
They are just trying way to hard! The food was good but only 2 or three of the 15+ dishes on the tasting menu really worked and 6 or 7 were just downright wired and unpleasant.
review_title: They are just trying way to

review: Innovative and gastronomically creative. A true celebration of the magic of food chemistry.

The display kitchen is apparently more important to the owners than the dining room. Service was attentive and tried to please, but could not make up for the insultingly tiny amount of food served as a vegetarian entree, and the fact that it was just not that special. My girlfriend did not finish her lobster entree either. Based on our experience, we don't understand the popularity/acclaim.
splendid and a gem. for foodies who will appreciate it.
review_title: splendid and a gem. for foodies

review:
Benu is one of the most spectacular dining experiences in San Francisco. I once saw a t-shirt that said, "Harvard: the Harvard of the East"... in response to Stanford t-shirt reading, "Stanford: the Harvard of the West." Looking for a place to celebrate a birthday, we realized that the question we were asking was, "What would be as good as Benu?" Glad we had another visit!

Chilled cucumber pistachio olive oil amuse-bouche, uni risotto, lobster, stuffed sea cucumber with pork belly, truffled acorn pasta with pancetta, sea snails, almond brioche with apricot medallions, gelee and sorbet... Sommelier recommended Mendocino Farms Grenache, which was amazing... Perfect evening from the Kwangjuyo ceramics to the last drop of coffee.

The 18 course tasting menu was incredible. If you want a sample of the various different levels of ability the chef is capable of, then the tasting menu is the way to go. Most of the dishes take only a few bites, but don't worry, it will fill you up at the end. The best part is, you get to try and taste alot of different levels of dishes made by Chef Lee.
My personal favorites were the horseradish, trout roe crispy air chip, the jasmine chicken with dates, monkfish liver torchon on a brioche, beef, lily bulb with cherry espagnole sauce, passionfruit, white chocolate powder and chili sorbet, and the peach, matcha, elderflower dessert(it felt like a fragrance of fresh flowers in your mouth).

The service was also outstanding and impeccab

Really wonderfully executed, interesting food. French basis with Asian seasoning and ingredients. Would definitely go again and highly recommend. The food was rich and flavorful--although a bit heavy but not in a bad way.
Overated and overpriced and very pretentious. Not a good recipe for a winning restaurant. But to give some credit, the acorn pasta with the Iberico ham was tasty, but my serving had no Iberico ham.

Benu is one of the best restaurants in the Bay Area!
Wonderful service and exquisite dishes.
We ordered the Chef's Tasting Menu.
The whole experience was just SPLENDID!!
review_title: Benu is one of the best restaurants

review: Great dinner. Food, service, atmosphere all top notch. Expensive but worth it for a special occassion. I believe it will get even better over time.
The food was superb and the right portions for the richness, etc. Great wine list and great service. If Hawthorne Lane was going to be replaced by anything, this is it.
review_title: The food was superb and the

review: Our dinner was an exceptional experience. The tasting menu did not disappoint, with notable favorites being the tomato in the opening dish, thousand year old quail egg, and the eel. A different experience to previous haute gastronomie dinners, thanks to the asian influence in the menu. The wine pairing provided equal surprise and excitement as each dish - despite some wines being particular on their own, they were all a treat when coupled with the dish. A pleasant relaxed ambiance in the restaurant, with a warm homy feel to the place. Som, waiter, and maitre d' made the occasion feel special.
It took 20 minutes after i was seated before i had to ask the waiter to bring me water and a glass of wine. There was only 2 other tables. I found this weird. Food is good.

I went with my boyfriend and a couple of friends. First off, the space is very intimate and warm with great lighting. Unfortunately, we couldn't give it 5 stars for ambiance or service because we had to wait 20 minutes for a table (despite our having a reservation) and the place is a bit cramped if you're not seated. After we were eventually seated, we were met with an incredibly knowledgeable and friendly waiter who offered us food and great wine recommendations throughout the night. About the food: very good, very small portions and a bit overpriced for SF. About the wine: most of the wines are atypical / new-world in style and a few of us didn't like them. I'll definitely come back here but only for special occasions due to the prices.

It was a good experience. Nice atmosphere in this small scale restaurant. Romantic. Kind service. Good food quality but not super special. The salad I had was small, plain and a little boring. The octopus way to spicy! Not bad but just not convincing.
I would go there again just to have the delicious focaccia bread and a glass of wine.
review_title: Can one resist this focaccia bread?

review:
The menu is limited, but everything we tasted was four-star. The kale salad, the terrine
of chicken liver, the sirloin, side dishes and desert were perfect. The service was
prompt and courteous. The only disadvantage was lack of heating, which is a problem
at cold San Francisco nights.
review_title: The menu is limited, but everything

review: Once agin my favorite restaurant in the city did not fail to amaze me.
Service was great, food wonderful, good portions for price, excellent wine by the glass. I will be back!

I really like Local Mission but I don't love it. The service was fantastic and I love the room, the ethos, the quality, the wines, the desserts, and the fair prices. But there were some misses. I've ordered soup there on 2 occasions (this time it was a comforting potato-apple soup) and it arrived lukewarm both times. And the flavors in my wife's squid with butternut squash romesco were just strange.
