My lamb meatballs with butter beans were fantastic, though, and the portion was big enough for 2 (which was good since my wife ate half). The beans were the best part -- they could be an entree by themselves. We shared a lemon tart for dessert. It was kinda small for two people to share, but perfect in every other way.
review_title: Really like it, but I don't love it

review: The food was outstanding - the beef tongue was perfectly tender, falling off the bone, and the pork belly had a deliciously crisp outside with a tender fatty, but flavorful inside.
Food was outstanding!  Loved the fried short rib and sesame chicken.  We had a reservation and waited for 10 minutes to be greeted at door.  Waitstaff not friendly.  Food arrived quickly.

While the food was good and very inexpensive it did not make up for the total and utter lack of service. I am always willing to give an establishment the benefit of the doubt, we all have an off evening, but the folks we sat next to ate there often and said the service is consistently lacking. It was one of those experiences where patrons bonded over the bad service, we were all in it together!!! If you are a practicing Buddhist and want to practice intense patience by all means go. If you want to focus on your dinner conversation and not flagging down your waiter all evening pick one of the many other fabulous restaurants in the beautiful city.

The dishes are very unusual Chinese fare. The flavors are assertive and the portions very ample. We always have to remember to order less than in other Chinese restaurants. The short ribs and the spare ribs and the crispy chicken with sweet potatoes are outstanding.
It was a decent enough lunch. Wouldn't take out of towners to wow them or anything
The Sesame Chicken was wonderful but T=the Shanghai soup dumplings were disappointing. The sauce was too sweet and they were heavy, not delicate. Service wasn't the best. But will try it again.

An SF favorite of ours. We sat next to a couple of guys well into their fourth or fifth bottle of saki - loud but friendly. They shared each course of the many they ordered with their immediate neighbors ( including us ) and poured a drink for anyone who'd take it - certainly entertaining! The food excellent as usual, soup dumplings hot and spicy, duck buns luscious, spare ribs thick and meaty and Szechuan shrimp cracklingly hot. Mr Fang is everywhere - taking orders, adding final touches in the kitchen, cooking entire dishes and making sure everything runs smoothly. We will keep Fang on our go to list!
Turn the decision making over to the owner - he'll bring you the most delicious dishes! We do this every year for a company team dinner. We've loved everything he has offered us!

My group and I had a very good experience here. The man who took our order (I believe he was the manager/owner) took the liberty to order some appetizers, per our request, and he made some great choices.

All in all, it was a good place.

FANG was swamped when my party of 4, which grew to 5, was arriving. At first, we thought the service was a little harried and rude. But the owner came over and, waving his hands, said "You talk business; I bring food!" He and his staff brought us the most delectable dishes!! Notable were the sesame-crusted and fried tofu, the fish in a delicate sauce, the spicy pork belly, and the delightful appetizers! I highly recommend FANG for business lunches, and will definitely visit again on my next trip to San Francisco!

Poor service from Mr. Fang himself.
Took my order, repeated it to me, yet looked right through me.
Showed up as the wrong dish 10 minutes before the rest.
Sent it back, same dish back w/ "beef" added to it - on top of the now cold dish.

Thanks for almost acting like you care about your customers - all this while you have one eye on the dining room, yelling at your servers while you are taking an order - micro-managing gets you NOWHERE with your employees, and it looks really bad in your (full) dining room.
I know you've been in the business forever, but my dining experience tonight was enough for me to warrant not coming back for another visit. Maybe you shouldn't work the floor any more - the others servers were top notch, and h
review_title: I hate to say this, but...

review: I think House of Nanking chefs are better, it doesn't seem the quality is consistent at Fang.
review_title: I think House of Nanking chefs

review: We had the best service which was above and beyond expectation! Definitely will recommend to friends and family to go here.
review_title: We had the best service which

review: The Chef got to pick our entrees for the evening. I've forgotten how good this place is for 30 dollars a person.
review_title: The Chef got to pick our entrees

review:
The food was okay, but the service was terrible. We made an OpenTable reservation, noting in the res that it was a special occasion. When we arrived at the restaurant, we were given a crummy table in the back corner on the far side of the bar. There were other tables available, but the restaurant said we'd have to sit there since they had other reservations. Other reservations? What about ours?

Throughout the night we were forgotten. We watched others who arrived after us receive and eat their meals before we were served, and had to beg our waiter for water and tea. I spoke to the owner (Peter) about the experience, and his reply was "oh,.. sorry".

With hundreds of great restaurants in San Francisco, there's just no reason to visit F
review_title: The food was okay, but the

review:
Had 6 dishes, all ordered by the chef/owner. BTW, the chef/owner doesn't actually do any of the cooking that I can observed. The dishes were on either ends of the spectrum from very heavily spiced/salted/MSG'ed to kind of bland. They did attempt to use different
flavors as accent to standard dishes. For instance, the typical "black bean clams" used
preserved olives as the black bean which gave the dish a different flavor profile. However, the dish was still too salty. The fish soup had a slight spicy/hot flavor kick which again made the soup's flavor profile unexpected and interesting. Pricing is higher than the average chinese restaurant, but the with setting/location/decor, that would have been the expectation.
meh. The first few bites of each dish were okay, any more and you realized the food was pretty greasy.
We let the owner just bring us food until we were stuffed and it was amazing!
review_title: We let the owner just bring

review: Food was alright, but their sister restaurant, House of Nanking, has better flavors.

Very nice Chinese food. Very clean place that has a lot of energy to it. Overall, a good experience. Get the green tea its flower based tea that is awesome. The service is ok, but does not hurt the experience.

Even better than the original House of Nanking, which I love. Peter and his daugther do an outstanding job of odering food for any size group, and the food is FANTASTIC! The ambiance is very nice, the service is excellent, and the experience is just top notch.

We're not accustomed to staff practically insisting that we order as instructed. Food was both too salty and too sweet--unlike any Chinese food we're accustomed to eating, but then we didn't see any Asian customers.

OK for those who don't care about authenticity, but, those sensitive to salt should alert staff. Food was also unnecessarily oily.

All that said, dishes were tasty and colorful, often with a caramelized element. Bok choy salad would have been really good if not for sweetness.

At least it offers brown rice! And great, warm, complimentary almond cookies!

My husband and I visited L'Olivier for Valentine's Day for the $58 pp fixed price dinner.  I will start with the positive: the service was okay.  Our main waiter was attentive and friendly. 

Clientele was very mature...we felt like we were in a nice nursing home dining hall.  This was the first clue that our meal would not be good.

The meal started with carrot soup, which was on par with something you would get at a cafeteria.  Next course we both ordered a spinach salad with Gorgonzola cheese which was actually warm (and not on purpose).  I could not eat it.  The worst part of all was the main course. I had ordered a chicken with prosciutto and swiss.  I took one bite and could not eat any more. My husband, seeing that I did not like it, switched with me. He had the mushroom risotto, which I unfortunately did not like it either. Since my husband could not eat the chicken either I gave him back the risotto. 

Surprisingly, the woman who came to take my plate did not ask if I did not care for my meal as I clearly did not eat any of my food.  Nor did she ask if I wanted to wrap it (my entire food minus 2 tastes was still on my plate).

For dessert, there was a choice of a chocolate trio or raspberry creme brulee. We both opted for chocolate trio, which was presented very nicely; however, the presentation was deceiving. One item was a white gelatin which we could not figure out what it was  The moose was watery and tasted like hospital food.  The heart shaped chocolate cake tasted like a Tasty Cake. 

We did order a bottle of BV Cabernet.  It came very warm and was not drinkable until we  put it in a ice bucket for 30 minutes.

Sadly, this evening was a major let-down.  I was very upset to pay almost $200 for a meal I could not even eat. I would never go back and am very annoyed that we wasted all that money on an inedible meal.

We went for a team lunch. The food was good as was the atmosphere. It was VERY slow service in a mostly empty late lunch restaurant. Go if you have plenty of time and enjoy a nice leisurely lunch that has a good prie fix menu.
review_title: We went for a team lunch.

review: Had a great dinner and amazing service. While there was big event going on in main dining room, you couldn't tell in the adjacent dining area. Very attentive wait staff who made a difference in making it a lovely dinner.

L'Olivier is an odd mix of fine dining on one side and smaller and larger group parties on the other side. Ambiance on the dining side is a bit drab but the food is surprisingly good and the service is excellent. If you like good food and don't worry much about the atmosphere, this is a good, reasonably priced choice.
review_title: L'Olivier is an odd mix of

review: My dinner companion is getting on in years, and his frailty is noticeable, using a walker as he does. Every one on the staff that greeted us and directed us to our table and helped from his walker to his chair, and putting the walker aside, were all, incredibly, extremely warm and worked to accommodate my friend's disability throughout the meal, including our departure. It wasn't just my friend, I noticed an equally frail woman who was walking on her own, a bit unsteady, and I saw one of your folks give her his arm to hold onto, as he escorted her, gallantly, to her table. It was really ennobling to see - only two words can capture it all: well done!

Had great meal with guests up from LA. Two big parties had the whole restuarant, we were seated in a very quite side room. With the big groups we were wondering if our food orders and our service would suffer, they didn't. Food was outstanding and service was great. Our friends loved it.
They were extremely accommodating and did not rush us even though we were the last ones there! The server was wonderful and the food was outstanding. We love it there!

I've been to L'Olivier 5-6 times now (only at lunch), and had a pleasant enough time given the ambience and food quality, but the service the last couple of times has gone downhill. Not from a fill up your water/take your finished plate away perspective, but from a lack of warmth and professionalism from the waiter who was more of an order taker than a host attending to his guests. As a former waiter at a high end restaurant in my youth, I am particular to these kinds of things. I would suggest Kokkari which is across the street as a more refined business lunch experience, although L'Olivier does have a nice fixed price lunch menu, if cost is a primary concern. I will probably go back, but not as frequently.

prix fixe luncheon is good value at $17.50 but the pork chop was tough. classically prepared French cuisine. the beet salad with tomatoes, and cucumber on a vinagrette olive dressing was very good. Desserts are excellent. overall, a nice restaurant and consistent. Have not tried dinner but the menu looks good and the kitchen can prepare good cuisine.
If you like well-prepared delicious food that beats the Four Seasons in quality and price, come here!!!!! The service is very wonderful, too, and big bashes are perfect here!

When we got there, the sign said the car can only be parked by valet, but there was no one there. As I was waiting for a few good minutes, a waiter was just looking at me from inside the restaurant. Another one finally came out and parked my car (I appologise for not driving a Benz). There was a dinner party for a wedding (I wish I knew ahead of time) and so we were seated in a different room with no windows and decorated 1970's style.
The food was ok, not what one would expect of a french restaurant (Great mashed potatoes though). 
Our waiter (I can't remember his name but he had a french accent) was outstaning and that made things ok.
I could eat there again if I needed to but I wouldn't make plans to go there.
review_title: When we got there, the sign

review:
Nice restaurant. Beautiful food. Small portions and expensive. Ist and 2nds better that than entree.
Very noisy.
review_title: Nice restaurant. Beautiful food. Small p...

review: I went with a friend and had an early dinner. We both had the tasting menu, but both asked to sub out one of the dishes due to allergies/preferences. The chef accomodated and switched around the order of the tasting menu dishes to make sure that we get the best experience. Yes, the portions are small for each individual dish, but we were plenty full when we finished the meal. Flavors are definitely interesting in a very good way, and we felt like we were eating works of art. Atmosphere was casual and not stuffy at all.
The food was texturally spot-on, and the flavors complemented each other quite well. However, our dishes were pretty underseasoned; a bit disappointing, since everything else was so well-executed.
review_title: The food was texturally spot-on, and the...

review: Wonderful combinations of tastes & textures presented like a painting on canvas. Service was excellent! Terrific wine list.
review_title: Food looks like a work of art!

review: Commonwealth exemplifies what fine dining restaurants should strive for: gracious but casual service, knowledgeable but but non-pretentious wine service, and beautiful but also tasty and accessible plates of accessible food. The smoked sablefish was a huge hit, the crispy sprouting broccoli epitomized what every broccoli dish tries to be. We all loved the fromage blanc and chicory salad, which was probably the best salad I have had anywhere, ever. Every time I have eaten there I have left extremely happy, and ultimately that is all you can ask of a restaurant of any caliber. If you want a relaxed but luxurious evening commonwealth will deliver.
Michelin star quality food without all the fussiness of some other actual michelin star restaurants. Would definitely go back!
Portions are very tiny, smaller than tapas would normally be and expensive.
OMG, could you possibly have smaller portions? Unreal, each item is like 2 bites

peanut butter semifreddo is my favorite dessert of all time... except don't call it a semifreddo! it's more like a cross between reese's peanut butter cup and a snickers bar (minus the whole peanuts) but much much better!

Lovely experience throughout. We'd noted that one of us was a pescatarian and they had a special pescatarian menu brought to the table without us asking. When one dish on the menu included something that I didn't like they quickly agreed to substitute. Service was flawless. This was a splurge for us but we'll be back on another special occasion.
Delicious and creative dishes, well presented. Very accommodating to vegetarians.
Food was amazing. The unique menu made me feel like I was eating food from one of those Food Network shows. Very reasonably priced for the quality. Everything was cooked perfectly.

I was pleasantly surprised by our experience at Commonwealth. I'd heard the hype and read the mixed reviewed, so I went in with tempered expectations. We opted to not get the tasting menu, as I thought it was a little limited, but we got the arancini, the terrine, the Jerusalem artichokes, the citrus salad, the sole, and two desserts (the peanut butter semifreddo and the bananas brulee). The arancini was just meh, good, but nothing special. The terrine was... interesting, but I wouldn't say it was great. We did really like the citrus salad, the artichokes, and the sole -- inventive flavors but not overwhelming. And the desserts were really great-- probably the best part of the meal. I probably wouldn't go back, but I'd recommend it!
review_title: Solid dining with a few highlights

review: Solid tasting menu. Excellent service and thoughtful wine pairings. These guys all work hard and really are behind the program!
My husband has the mackerel and it was very fishy. They kept dropping the knives because they were bottom heavy.

Food didn't wow me. I think it is better to order tasting menu otherwise ordering a la carte even though they say the entrees are medium size left you wanting for more. Quality of food was good but not memorable. Place is small & charming & very attentive. Didn't see the big deal on the food.
Without a doubt, the best dinner experience in years. Thoughtful, flavorful and creative food served by highly trained servers. Can't recommend commonwealth strongly enough!!!! Great restaurant!
Commonwealth is a gem. Outstanding and creative dishes, friendly service, and amazing prices for the quality and nature of the food.
It was all good, but not outstanding. The space is beautifully minimal and the service top notch, but the food wasn't the sublime experience I was hoping for.
review_title: It was all good, but not outstandin

review: Amazing use of ingredients. Fabulous innovative menu. Delicious evening for our table of three. Efficient, frindly and excellent waitstaff.
Loved the beet salad, chickent livers, wines were affordable by the glass.
Crearively prepared small plates served by a wonderfully engaging and non-pretaentious staff in a nicely done space.. A well priced wine list and PARKING!!!

I am so impressed with the tasting menu, and the wine pairings were so perfect for each course.
I have not been so happy about a dinner out in a while. Will definitely go back soon.
review_title: I am so impressed with the

review: We ate at Commonwealth on the third day that it was open so were expecting a little roughness around the edges. However, we were really pleasantly surprised by how friendly and efficient the service was and we thought the food delicious. We liked the way the concept was translated onto the plates although the ordering of the menu along protein lines seemed a little confusing and we still just went for what we liked. We liked the ambiance and definitely would visit again to see how it develops. It's a pretty small restaurant (which is nice and makes it a good place for a date), and the prices were remarkably affordable - I hope that they can survive at that level.

The food here is fantastic, a little pricey, but delicious.  We ordered the bimbibap, the pork belly and the rib eye.  Loved the wasabi turnip to wrap the pork belly!  As we were the only ones in the restaurant, the service was very attentive.  We also ordered the cucumber soju, and loved it.  Will be back!
Astonish menu, almost a riddle to discover. Dishes made meticulous and with the best ingredients. Plus fresh bread from The Mill. Everything I tried was a festival of flavors in my mouth.
review_title: Everything is fresh and local, bravo!

review: This is a great place if you need to catch up with friends. I would definitely recommend sitting outside since you can have conversations without having to shout over each other. The service is not up to the mark. We had to keep inquiring about our drinks from our waitress. Their cocktails are good and they can cater it to your tastes. Food was great but the portions were relatively small. Overall a great place to catch up with friends.

The hostess (short, glasses, tattoo on shoulder) brought us to the outdoor section, which we always request, then left us standing there for over 5 minutes.  Eventually a server explained, apologetically, that the section wasn't quite ready (7:15) because a private party in the outdoor section had recently ended and they needed to reconnect the computer system.  Fine....but it was the hostess's job to explain that to us instead of just dumping us in that section and leaving us to wait and wonder.

We had a great dinner on the outdoor patio. The heat lamps and complimentary blankets made it more than cozy. The drinks were of course awesome but the food was excellent as well! Enjoyed the Falafel with yogurt, the flat bread with pureed beets and goat cheese, and the pork loin and shoulder dishes very much!
A great place to meet a friend for a drink and bite at the bar. But also great for a special occasion dinner. Excellent drinks and food. Friendly service. Highly recommended.

We arrived at Bar Agricole on a Sunday night with a 7:15 reservation. After frustratingly being told by the host that there was no outdoor seating, my date and I decided to set up camp at the bar...and it turned out arguably better than sitting on the beautiful patio!

Our bartender, Craig Lane, was as caring as he was knowledgeable.

The cocktail we both had was the Sleepyhead, which had initially jumped out at me (Passion Pit references tend to do that). The ginger cocktail was not overly sweet, had a great mouthfeel, & refreshing all at the same time.

The food was incredible as well, to match our cocktail.

Overall, despite the seemingly rocky beginning, our experience at Bar Agricole was fantastic, and definitely warrants more trips!

the food was hit or miss - the agricole drinks were...ok - and the noise level was awful! the music was good, but way too loud and reverb was a problem - very popular and full bar but tables were left in peace (except for the music)
The portions are small and the prices are high...Their dinner menu is a better value and frankly also tastes better

Our recent dinner at Bar Agricole was a little disappointing. Some of the dishes felt like they were trying to hard to be different and the flavors didn't really harmonize. The waiter described the menu as all share plates and when we ordered the soup they were perplexed at having to split the servings since there were four of us. The drinks were yummy but small sizes and a little pricey. The ambiance was very cool and the service was good. But I'm not dying to go back soon.
review_title: Our recent dinner at Bar Agricole

review: Great food ! Wines by the glass are very good and I saw interesting cocktail list.
Excellent food and service. Bartender (Craig) mixed up some amazing drinks.

Please Pasta with clam sauce mixed with seaweed and spinach? Without a doubt the worst meal we had in four days in San Francisco. The service was ify- had to ask for water, they served the wrong water....basics were failing.
The salmon was terribly overcooked- truly could double for dried out salmon. The duck was the only semi edible dish.

I wold have given 5 stars for service, except the people at the bar seem to be afraid to acknowledege you even if, just to let you know they will be right with you.... we can see your busy... Our waiter once we sat down was teriffic!

Bar Agricole is in our top five list. The atmosphere is modern yet warm and the service excellent. Each plate is both beautifully presented and tastes wonderful. The waiter even helped us choose a wine by providing tastes of three of them before we finalized on one. Definitely try out Bar Agricole!
review_title: Bar Agricole is in our top

review: Fantastic cocktails and charcuterie. Perfectly executed plates - not fussy, just done right. Top notch service. A little pricey for what you get. Very sleek hip spot if a little loud. Need to go back and try more dishes.

Beautiful decor however our server seemed to be in a state of confusion as to what drinks were available as well my chicken was terribly salty!
Would not recommend it.

My first time in the restaurant for a post holiday dinner with my coworker. It was really good, from the appetizers to the dessert. Try the pat, nuts, the pork. The cocktail list is very surprising with absinthe in many cocktails.
Plus the place is beautiful, fancy wood everywhere, a beautiful patio for summertime. Don't hesitate and go to try it
review_title: My first time in the restaurant

review: Excellent food and cocktails, and excellent ambience. Service was not as good as on previous visits.

The menu is full of exotic items, and each dish we had was a gem. The whole petrale sole was excellent as was the eggplant. The wine selection is eclectic, and somewhat obscure, but provides good variety. The pricing of both bottles and glasses is too high. $13 for a 5 oz. glass of Zinfandel is a bit too pricey. Dinner for three with two drinks apiece and one dessert was $237, which included the tip. Great space and the service was excellent.
review_title: Bar Agricole? Give it a try

review:
Very creative menu and informed wait staff. Lively and fun atmoshpere. Wine pairs nicely, a bit pricey but well thought out and unique selections. Love the changing menu.
Clearly a winner. Incredible interior design

Restaurant is beautifully designed---loved the layout and design.
Service was very good.
Food was excellent....one of the best brunches ever.
Corned beef hash and bacon beignets were out of this world---couldn't wait to tell fellow foodies about the great food, and cannot wait to come back before others discover what a great brunch place this is....

Creative food, focus on seasonal. Rather stunning wine list. A few of the dishes were way oversalted, and when we commented on it, the waiter gave us a free, wonderful dessert, which was very nice. Will have to come back to sit on the patio when the weather is warmer!
Quirky menu; self described "family style" yet mostly tapas sized plates and presentation. Great flavors. Can't get enough of the pate. Very accomodating and attentive service.
Too too noisy. Would not hurry to go back. It is okay to have a noisy bar but we do not like shouting during dinner.
review_title: Too too noisy. Would not hurry

review: Very chic not over-thought interior that while contemporary is not cold. Very welcoming. The drinks were great and the food was a big surprise. Often in SF new places open up relying on decor and becoming the new "hot spot" and the quality of the food is secondary. Not at Bar Agricole, the food was so delicious. I had the sea bass and it was melt-in-your-mouth yummy. A great experience. I will recommend it and go back after the New Year.

Very cool space and with nice weather the outdoor dining might be one of the top options in SF. Great cocktails and the menu is "unique" to say the least. Every dish we had was great and the service was good as well.

Recommend highly.
review_title: Very cool space and with nice

review:
This is a great new place, wonderful architecture, they took time with every detail. Cocktails were great. Agricole, a type of rum, was different, but once we got used to its flavor, really liked it. Great mixologists there.
They change their menu every day depending on what local stuff they get which leads to very fresh flavors. Amongst four of us, we split several dishes. Everything was salted, seasoned and cooked to perfection. The quail was our favorite and the spaghetti was different but out of this world.
Though very tasty, the portions were so SMALL to a point where we spent 90 dollars each for drinks and food ... just need to bump up the portions a little. We still needed to ask for bread (tasty) and went out for cheesesteaks
review_title: This is a great new place,

review: Bar Agricole has one of the most stunning interiors in San Francisco: industrial chic, high ceilings, lots of light and air. The food is best described as small plates to be shared, Mediterranean influenced, and very delicious. Most people come for the cocktails which are fantastic and reasonably priced $8. The appetizers cost about $6-$8; small plates $10-$16. The crowd is young, fashionable (artsy-architecture-design types).
review_title: Bar Agricole has one of the

review: Food was good quality but served cold. Service was mediocre - had to keep asking for utensils, salt and pepper, etc.
It wasn't what I expected at all - it's more like a sports bar.

We took our visiting friend from New York's Upper East Side to Limn. She is very particular and gluten-free. She loved her paella. "These people know how to cook," she said. "Can you hear me moaning with pleasure or is the noise level is drowning me out?"  It was.  Although noisy, food and service were very good.  A Valencia St. gem.
Our server was fantastic, very friendly and he made great recommendations from their menu.
Really good chicken and the dipping sauces are delicious

Came on a Tue evening, and was seated right away. My girlfriend and I asked to move to a corner booth and were accommodated right away. Drinks were very good, especially the Pisco Sour, though fairly expensive. The lomito saltado and chicken were very good and arrived quickly. Service was efficient and friendly. Dessert menu was a little disappointing and we ended up not having any.

The food was very good. We had ceviche de pescada, empanadas, lomito saltado, panna cotta de mango and the chocolate bandido along with pisco sours. We enjoyed every dish, especially the panna cotta. We had three different waiters during the meal and there wasn't very good transferring of information from one to the next. The biggest issue is we were initially told we could get separate checks (for expense reimbursement), but at check out time were told that was not possible.
review_title: Very good food, missteps in service

review: I would eat here every night if I can afford it ... So good!
review_title: The best roasted chicken in SF!

review: Just delicious! Fantastic value for the food you get. Very, very reasonably priced. I will come back here anytime again.
perfect for a casual get-together with friends and family. Great food, great service, great price. What more can you ask? Highly recommended.
Service was terrible. After waiter took our order never came back once to check on us or refill our drinks. Place was not that busy. Will not be going back
Was overall impressed with this popular eatery. First time tasting 'PERUVIAN' cuisine and enjoyed my experience doing so.

the hostess made sure to tell us they closed at 10:30, several times when we called. So we made a rese online. Once we arrived they were very accomodating, and the server was very good. My wife and I are both industry people and appreciate solid dining experiences and this was one of those. We had the ceviche with a few coctails to start, very nice. A few smaller plates instead of just one large at the servers suggestion, which was a great idea. Their rotisserie chicken was fantastic, the accompanying sauces were just okay. Had profiteroles for dessert, no ice cream more like a pawstry cream or anglaise which was nice. The menu listed walnuts but it came with almonds, which i preferred. Overall very nice and we'll return. Viva Limon
review_title: the hostess made sure to tell

review: The ceviche was delicious and a nice selection of small plates.
Decent food, multiple selections, moderate wait time, friendly staff, interesting and unique environment. good for dinner with friends, special occasions, or date night.
When I got there, they told me I didn't have a reservation. For some reason your reservation did not take. I had to wait 1 hr. to be seated.
review_title: When I got there, they told

review:
After reading so many great reviews of this restaurant, I was a little surprised that I was not blown away. Food was good but not extraordinary. There are a few Peruvian restaurants in the area that meet or surpass this kitchen at less price.

Come on Limon! You're getting the critical love now step up your game.
Groupon packed the house with last-day diners; the food/service satisfied all expectations. We especially enjoyed the empanadas, ceviche mixto and the calamares rellenos stuffed with tacu tacu.
While one of the most expensive Peruivan restaurants in San Francisco, it's the least delicious.
review_title: While one of the most expensive

review: I loved the pescado limon, the salad and EVERYTHING else.
I'd been to the Limon Rotisserie a few times, so had high expectations. These were met. Seriously tasty meal. The cookies with desert were amazing, and I usually don't have much of a sweet tooth.
review_title: I'd been to the Limon Rotisserie

review: Limon specializes in ceviche and so this menu staple should not be missed. Service is attentive and knowledgeable. The wine list, which goes beyond latin American options, is small, but delightfully diverse.

The food and the service was excellent! I would definitely go back, and also tell others about this great Restaurant. I had been waiting for them to re-open after their re-design. I finally made it there..and they really did a beautiful job in the whole new design of their restaurant.
review_title: The food and the service was

review: We are visiting from out of town and Colosseo was a recommendation. Food was plenty and flavourful. Nice presentation and servers were all nice. Just a little slow to come over and actually acknowledge our table. Definitely needed a few more bodies on the floor. Overall a decent experience.
review_title: We are visiting from out of town and Col...

review: We picked Colosseo because it was close to our hotel and the reviews all seemed good. We each liked our dishes of Lasagna and Seafood Ravioli. Both reminded me of Italy and there were in North Beach. Everything about Colosseo reminds one of Italy from the decor to the outdoor dining out front.

In busy Italian neighborhood, very pleasing decor, food average, but could reflect our selection. Stella was very personable, made you feel welcome and comfortable. Overall enjoyed the dining experience, and made second trip for luncheon coffee and sweet. Would recommend.

Loved this place. The food was excellent and unique- with loads of gluten free options. Wait staff was incredibly knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. Atmosphere was wonderful and perfect for our Anniversary dinner.
review_title: Wonderful, charming restaurant with excellent food

review: Firefly is a charming restaurant tucked in adorable Noe Valley. It's a popular spot, so reservations are recommended. It's a bit noisy, but the ambiance is romantic so it's not boisterous. The food was very good, with a couple good vegetarian options. I'd recommend Firefly to anyone in a heartbeat.
We loved it again, food service and space, even a pretty view of the neighborhood in front

We had a great dinner here last week. The Shrimp and Sea scallop appetizer and English pea appetizers were great. The trout and coconut corn was delicious. The staff were very personable and efficient.

Great food, awesome service, and a special menu reflecting the Jewish holiday Passover, allowing folks to observe dietary restrictions in a lovely setting.  Matzo ball soup, gefilte fish, et al.  Yum!

The menu was very creative and tempting. The bread was served with a pea spread that was excellent. The onion and green garlic soup with chile oil had the perfect amount of smoky and hot. The steak was cooked a perfect medium rare and the chicken was very flavorful. We will need to go back to try the other items!
I like the food. I like the servers. Parking is not impossible. The noise level is reasonable. It makes me feel go to have gone to Firefly for dinner.

The food here is delicious. We wanted a night out with some of our favorite friends and it was delightful. Good food, good atmosphere and good service. We love coming here for a casual night out with a guaranteed good meal.

We were originals when the restaurant had first opened. Hadn't been back in years since moving away. They sent a complimentary desert to our table to thank us for coming...how cool is that. I was nervous to go, how many restaurants can keep their charm going and the good food coming...they have!!

Thank you to Firefly for letting our group stay way past closing. We were celebrating a dear friend's passing and Firefly was her favorite restaurant, notably one of the reasons -besides the amazing food--was because of their warm hospitality.
review_title: Thank you to Firefly for letting

review: Nice spot for a romantic dinner. The menu seemed to lack a little cohesion, but the food was really good. Service was attentive.
review_title: Nice spot for a romantic dinner.

review: Second try for this restaurant. Atmosphere and service were commendable but the food fell into a no man's land between comfort food and trying-too-hard-to-be-comfort-food-with-a-culinary-edge. The pea and curry spread for the bread nails the problem for Firefly on the head. It was, well, pea and curry spread. Different, in a vegetarian way, but why bother? There are many more, and more flavorful, options to that sort of thing. If it was different and "better," great. But it was just different. And that's the way the food went for the evening.
It is impossible to have a bad dish here--pure genius in the kitchen.
review_title: It is impossible to have a

review: We decided to get out of our neighborhood in the City and try Firefly and the Fried Chicken Tuesday special. The location, the food, and the service were all excellent (agreement among our 5 diners). We will definitely return!
review_title: We decided to get out of our

review: Went for ladies night and we were allowed to chat and visit and enjoy the meal. Our waiter provided just the right amount of attention. We brought our own bottle of wine so I don't know about the wine list. We decided to share each meal, appetizers and dessert (each of which was amazing) and we were graciously accommodated. No problems "having it your way" at Firefly. I have never had a disappointing meal there and it is a consistent go to restaurant for me. Always a great dining experience.
The food was delicious and the desserts were amazing.......The favorite thing we ordered were the scallop and shrimp pot stickers! Sooo delicious!
Amazing and remarkable ..complex interesting food with comfort in mind. Portions were perfect!!!!!

We've been going to Firefly for many years, and it never fails to be a great dining experience. We go for date nights and with small groups of family or a few couples. The food is innovative yet leans towards the comfort food category. It's always delicious!

Food was nicely presented but only fair. The rabbit appetizer was overcooked. The sturgeon was far too salty as was the "chowder". The chowder tasted solely of the bacon. Waitstaff were very attentive and friendly.

The desserts were the highlight. The chocolate torte was exactly what it should be; cheesecake light and tasty as was banana cream pie. The "decaf"coffee was very good...but not decaf! We were up all night.
You better like who you are going with to Firefly because seating is tight. Nice fixed price dinners.
review_title: You better like who you are

review: I wanted to show some French friends some quality "American" cuisine - and Firefly was a perfect place to meet and eat. The food was excellent (tri tip, pork, quail, trout) and the server hit a perfect pitch.
review_title: I wanted to show some French

review: As always great food and good service. However, on this last visit, the value just wasn't there. The portions were a lot smaller. We ordered the watermelon salad, and it was literally just a few lettuce leafs and a few watermelon balls. They charged $9.50 for this. How expensive is watermelon and lettuce?? The fettuccine plate was delicious but again $19.50 for pasta. And it was vegetarian! I was tempted to complain but didn't want to ruin a special evening with my family. My family and I like this place alot but the prices just aren't worth it anymore.
review_title: Good food but not worth it anymore

review: Have been before, but this was very special. Firefly's menu during Passover is geared to traditional holiday foods and we went with friends to celebrate the holiday. Everything was homemade, authentic and delicious! Will become our tradition!

My husband and I enjoyed dining at Firefly. It was cozy and the staff was friendly and attentive without being intrusive. I liked the low-key atmosphere and the food was yummy. I enjoyed the shrimp and scallop potstickers so much that I made an extra order to bring for my mother. I think the prix fixe menu is a great deal. In a nutshell, Firefly is a place I would like to come back to with good friends because it is such a comfortable environment with comforting food.
We had a wonderful dining experience, food, service and wine all excellent,

Really innovative but of course very edible food... I'd heard about the Brussel sprouts. WOWWWWW! Loved the fried chicken. Pre-fixe was lovely. I don't think they skimped at all. Corkage a mere $18 per bottle. Service attentive but not intrusive. Could have used a bit more light (I know they want to sell the little jars but really?) to read the dessert menu. Desserts = yummy, too.

Definitely going back!
Food was very good. Service was quick and our server was very knowledgeable.
A great neighborhood spot, friendly staff, fun atmosphere, creative menus, wonderful deserts.

Have eaten here off and on over the past 4 decades. We feel the restaurant needs an infusion
of excitement in the menu and the ambiance. In past years it was one of the best in the neighborhood.
Not any more.
The cost of items is a tad high.
Will look elsewhere when in the neighborhood.

Fish portion was small. Fish was under cooked and considering this is their specialty, it is a bit disappointing.  Sent back meal to be cooked more.

Fabulous location for War Memorial Opera House of Davies Symphony Hall pre or post event dining. I would go back again just for the location.
review_title: Great location for pre-event dining War Memorial

review: A good reliable dining experience near the Jazz Center etc.  Our waiter was great.  Attentive, and a good sense of humor.  Food was good, my salmon was cooked just the way I liked it and the scallops my dining companion had were good too.  I have eaten here many times over the years and always find this restaurant to be a fun experience.
Their specialty, the fish in papiollete is great. Light, aromatic. Lobster Bisque was wonderfully meaty. Ahi was great. All around classic fish joint with a classic Nob Hill feel.

Excellent fresh seafood, exquisitely prepared, in a relaxed clean setting. The wait staff asked if we had tickets to the 8:00 show and clearly moved our order to the front of the queue. Each of our dishes was unique and worth coming back for.

Perfect location before ballet performances or any other shows near Civic Center. Hayes Street Grill is known for their fish and fries, and they delivered on both accounts. However their Meyer lemon torte was a show stopper. Luckily our fabulous waiter snagged us the last one.
Very simple presentation of wonderful seafood. Several sauces to choose from and the hottest crispest fries ever. All very delicious

The Hayes Street Grill is dependable in every way. The food is unpretentious, yet delicious, creative and of excellent quality. Portions are perfect. Service is, without exception, exceptional!
An extra: if you are going to the Symphony or Opera House, the staff will get you out of the restaurant on time, without exception.

Warm, receptive staff and consistent quality of food make this restaurant a wonderful long term asset to the San Francisco restaurant scene. The fact that this restaurant is still a popular place amidst the huge expansion of new trendy restaurants in the area reflects the delicious menu and respect given to the customers.

Arriving as HSG opened we could place our order before the crowd. Waiters always ask if we are attending an event which we were-sympny lecture. While we were not rushed, the waiter was ttentive and moved us through so we had time for dessert and coffee. Fish was great as always. Salads are basic but the lettuce is always tender. Staff is willing to substitute a vegetable for French fries.

HSG could vary the vegetable options

We had a good experience overall. There was a wedding reception that evening with Brazilian music and added a great feel overall. Our waiter was wonderful and I could see that all waiters were experienced and knew how to make everyone feel good. The only let down was that the fish was not as flavorful as it should be for that price. Given they claim to be a "fish restaurant" I expected better, maybe my expectations were to high. Will I come back, certainly, there are many other dishes to try. Oh, make sure you try their fries, they are very good!
Sand dabs perfectly done and in goodly quantity. Very professional in all respects.
Womderful///Only one negative note. My wife didn't like the Navarro chardonay.

Hayes St Grill has been one of my "go-to" places for decades. It's predictable, not too adventurous, but consistently good. The seafood is ALWAYS fresh. It took a bit of time to find our waiter for the check (just before ballet performance, so it was busy) but he was pleasant and we were on time for our show. I wish the ambiance was a bit better, but I guess it's fine for what it is.

Specializing in fish the Hayes Street Grill provides sauces of your choice. There is a slight tendency to under-cook relative to the request, which is better than overcooking since you still have the option of having them cook it more. The Meyer Lemon dessert is quite nice as an ending to the meal. Not too heavy and a palette cleanser. As the restaurant fills up the noise level rises but you can still hold a conversation.
review_title: Hayes Street for Pre Concert Meal

review: We were all pleased with our salads and entrees, the fish entree were cooked perfectly, with wonderful sauces. All arriverd in a timely manner We enjoyed our experience at the restaurant very much.
review_title: We were all pleased with our

review: Service was slow. The waiter gave preference to regular customers. Main course order was not taken until after we finished our salad. He appeared to be in a terrific hurry when he waited on us.

Great seafood spot. Nice lunch and has been around a long time. Generally the service is good but sometimes is a little slow. The decor is old but depending on your taste you might like that it hasn't been remodeled. Personally I think it needs a design overhaul.
Delicious grilled fish and the best French fries in town.
An old standard-that really never goes out of style. Best place to eat fish in SF.
Great place to go before the symphony or ballet. Food excellent. Found it a bit loud but would go back again without hesitation.
review_title: Great place to go before the

review: The waiters are the best! They actually seem to enjoy working there which can't be said for many restaurants these days.

Appealing, fresh ingredients, Alice Waters-like menu. Casual but sophisticated atmosphere. Waiter was wonderful, fun, and great with our grandsons ages 5 and 7. He immediately brought crayons and invited them to color on the paper tablecloth, which they loved doing, and it kept them occupied during the meal so we adults could talk. Simple menu for children, lovely sophisticated menu for adults. Everything works well on both levels. My daughters' shrimp, avocado and grapefruit salad was delightful. Her scallops were also very nice. My mahi mahi was surprisingly undercooked, and my warm goat cheese salad was not as divine as expected. I suspect that was just bad luck. Overall, I give the Hayes Street Grill an A+ and I'll go back.
review_title: Hayes Street Grill gets an A+

review: This is a solid pre- opera, ballet or symphony choice. Food is fantastic and interesting..that is the big plus to the competition.
review_title: This is a solid pre- opera,

review: This has been good as long as I can remember, maybe 30 years? We come for pre-theater, pre-theater and pre-concerts often. The price is right and the food always right on.

This restaurant hasn't changed in years - and that's good. The food is high quality, the fish excellent, the signature french fries wonderful. The service is exceptional, though low key and friendly. Of course the only reason to go here is for the sea food.
I hadn't been here in years and was surprised to find the food to be far more excellent than remembered. I will return soon and often.
review_title: I hadn't been here in years

review: Seems to be resting on its laurels, but hey, they're great laurels!  Not very inventive, but good fresh fish in a somewhat clubby atmosphere.  Very good for pre-theater.  More expensive than it should be.
review_title: Seems to be resting on its

review: Hayes Street Grill has been a good solid restaurant for the Civic Center Area for years. The food is consistently well prepared and presented and of excellent quality. The service is really very good and so efficient. The staff is faced with the challenge of the Symphony/Ballet crowd arriving all and once and leaving all at once. The staff manages this flawlessly. This will always be a go-to spot for me.

One of the great seafood restaurants and a favorite. We eat at Hayes 2-3x per year. The food is usually outstanding as is the service. Hayes has a great wine selection! This last visit my sandabs were overcooked, which is unusual for Hayes.
review_title: One of the great seafood restaurant

review: The  ambiance made us feel like we were in a tropical country. We had the restaurant week dinner and the choices were fine . The food was very good and so was the service.

There has been a significant change at the top and it impacts your experience at LeColonial. When you change the maitre d' and the chef and the prices on your wine list, it can be jolting to the regulars. The new maitre d' seems friendly enough, eager to please. You could see and taste the subtle differences in the menu and the appearance and taste of the food. The classic pho for example: the broth was thinner, less flavorful, the noodles carelessly stuck together. The seared salmon was fine, but it was lonely on the plate. Our waiter had a tough time explaining the shrimp in rice paper appetizer and it arrived looking like sushi and heavy on the basil, not one of my wife's favorite ingredients. The wine list was seriously over-priced.

We've been to Le Colonial before, and each time has been very nice. Tonight we ordered from the a la carte menu, and were very pleased. The kitchen prepares its food meticulously, and the dishes are very elegant. The flavors are authentic but subtle. It's the subtlety that disappoints me a bit. I would prefer bolder flavors, bolder dishes, food that would be more "alive." Nevertheless, this is a good choice for Vietnamese in Manhattan. It's a hot spot at night, the decor is definitely reminiscent of Vietnam, and service is sharp.

I have been going to Le Colonial for years and the food and flavors of herbs and spices were fresh and made the palate sing.  No more. The food is fresh but the the flavors and sauces that were so special are gone.  The soft summer tools were fresh but served with a peanut sauce that was blah.  The crispy spring rolls had no taste and the sauce not good.  The seafood medly with noodles was extremely bland .  The only dish we enjoyed was the spiced duck which was well flavored and very good. What a great culinary loss overall.
review_title: It's NOT what it used to be!

review: We have been dining at Le Colonial for many years and never been disappointed. We love the food and the ambience and service is always good. We will keep going!

The food and service at Le Colonial was outstanding. My friend and I shared an eggplant seafood appetizer that was very tasty. I particularly liked a chocolate dessert with peanuts and ice cream. The main negative is that prices are a bit high. Entrees do not include rice which must be ordered separately at extra cost. With a shared appetizer and dessert, wine for my friend but not for me and two main courses, the check before tip came to more than $110.
Great ambiance, quiet and unique. The food could be so much better.
Very good food with helpful waiters. Great for a business lunch, a meeting with friends or just about any occasion.

Great place for legit Vietnamese - not the pan fusion stuff you get at a lot of the typical Vietnamese places in nyc. There is a nice lounge/bar area upstairs if you wish to skip the downstairs scene.

My 2nd trip to Le Colonial, and this time I knew what I would get before going. The Snapper there is one of the best fishes I've ever had, and I couldn't wait to have it again. It didn't disappoint at all. Highly recommend
Exceptional selection of entrees. Fresh, delicious and always elegant.
The food is excellent and interesting (French - Asian). Restaurant is quietish and service is efficient. Excellent value for money and we will definitely go each time we visit NY.

Never disappoints. Everything here is wonderful - from the host when you walk in, to the amazing and delicious menu to the minute you walk out the door. It's perfect for business dinners and dates. Just a great restaurant!

The Restaurant Week options were very disappointing. Appetizers were good, but the main courses were not up to the normal Le Colonial standard.

The regular menu is normally wonderful.
It was a mistake to opt for the special menu.

This was truly a gem to find in Midtown. The service was absolutely outstanding - attentive staff and seamless presentation. We loved the lemongrass scallops although the duck left a little to be desired. Great wine selection. Overall this made for just a lovely Friday night date. We'll be back!
review_title: This was truly a gem to find

review: My usually favorite place seems to have changed it's staples: the duck, the ox-tail soup and the usually incredible sticky rice were not so incredible. Excellent service and ambiance as usual - but unfortunately the food was not up to par: duck was dry, soup didn't have as many pieces of meat and the sticky rice was also dry and crumbly. What a pity!
Have been eating in this restaurant for MANY years...always great!! Food is absolutely fabulous as is the service. Enjoy!

The place is a classic. lLovely as always but this time the food was not great. Well, all was good except for a salad with seared beef that we had to send back to the kitchen because the meat was awful! cold (as in defrosted cold) and it tasted like freezer. At least they were gracious enough to take note and compliment us with dessert mango/vanila icecream which was very good.
review_title: The place is a classic. lLovely

review: We enjoyed the restaurant week menu, a nice introduction to a new style of cooking. I wasn't prepared for just how pretty this restaurant is! The setting contributed greatly to the ambiance, and the bar/lounge upstairs is lovely as well. Entering this restaurant is like stepping into another era. The hostess said they have music in the evenings. I would like to go back and try some of the other things on the menu.
A restaurant for grown-ups - good food and service and a tolerable noise level.

I came here for restaurant week with a friend. We're both young, so I suppose that means we deserve the worst table in the house. The back of my chair was directly in the front of the kitchen so waiters ran in and out, hitting my chair continuously throughout the night. My friend's view (who was facing me) was of the kitchen itself, which made for a pretty bad overall impression as you might imagine. I had the salad rolls, shrimp + scallops curry, and the "mixed sorbets" (which apparently translates to 2 scoops of coconut ice cream)- all very unmemorable. The food was good, just not exceptional, and therefore not something I'd voluntarily revisit given my particular experience.
Very good! Great ginger martinis and wonderful ambiance.
While the food was good it was way overpriced for both the amount and the quality.
review_title: While the food was good it

review: Nice ambiance, very good food, service was good from the assistant servers, but main server was aloof and not very attentive. Table was across dining room from kitchen but faced entrance to kitchen, from which I heard offensive language in Spanish from the kitchen staff.

Great experience! The food was delicious and the environment was cozy. The drinks were memorable (especially the signature drink) and even the sherbet dessert was tasty and delightful. A quaint rendition of what a restaurant in the Casablanca movie would be like.
Service could have been better- a long wait for the food and difficulties with the bill; but, overall, it was enjoyable.
I always enjoy Le Colonial; the food is consistently good; the Maitre D is one of the best in the city.

This was the second time we had dinner the restaurant Le Colonial, on both occasions we enjoyed it very much. The food is interesting and excellent, the service is kind and thoughtful, the cocktails were fantastic.
We had a great celebration of my daughter's birthday. We will be back again
review_title: This was the second time we

review:
This is the pleasantest dinner place I know. Combination of a particularly nice clientelle - not super chic, often a quiet family party, intelligent seeming folk - with exceptionally reliable menu and successfully realized exotic/colonial atmosphere.
I have become a regular.

I like Le Colonial when I want to have a good and relaxing time with some friend or my husband. The food is good, but very different to the authentique Vietnamise food. I visited Vietnan two months ago, and I can not compare. Anyway, I like Le Colonial.
review_title: I like Le Colonial when I

review: As many reviews about this restaurant available on Internet says, service level is not consistent even between tables next to each other. Our table had great service but next table had unacceptable length of waiting time and their frustration makes us a little bit nervous. Food is always good part and it was the true this time. They can improve wine list but it was good enough. The restaurant is busy and noisy but it might be matching with concept of this restaurant, so I won't complaint. Overall, it is great choice for couple or group who love Asian food. Expensive but normal in NYC. I'll visit there again, for sure.

We went as a party of 6 people for karaoke. We made reservations ahead of time and everything was ready by the time we arrived. The food is great...amazing for karaoke food standards. They have an iPad for song selection. The rooms were clean. The sound-proofing could use some work, but it's pretty standard for karaoke here. Worth the extra cost compared with other karaoke joints in San Francisco.
Great service and great food for a price. Also a nice karaoke spot with plenty of rooms.

Service was great, no complaints at all! The food was really good and the fish was fresh. They have a nice assortment of Sake to choose from, and there are private karaoke rooms as well if you're into that kind of thing.

Our waiter took our drink order, brought our drinks, then disappeared.  After a long wait, maybe 15-20 minutes, we asked the lady at the bar to find him.  When he arrived, we ordered our food, but when he brought mine, it was wrong (I had clearly asked for no bacon).  We sent it back, but it came out wrong again.  I had clearly ordered my egg over easy, but he apparently did not know the difference between a sunnyside-up and an over-easy egg, because he thought it was correct.  So I just kept the runny, underdone egg the second time, but must say the whole experience was not ideal.  I had not expected fabulous food at this hotel cafe, but I had expected the high level of service we have always had from other hotel staff.

We had a wonderful lunch. The food was delicious and fresh, the service was superb, and the atmosphere delightful. It was refreshing to be able to have a conversation with each other without needing to shout thus making the meal more relaxing. We will definitely go back again.

I'm a foodie and with 25 years in the hospitality business.This was not a mission for fine cuisine. I brought my 2 grandchildren to the Hyatt Regency to see the Christmas lights and display and for lunch . I started my hotel career with Hyatt and have taken my children there as well . To my disappointment the restaurant appears to be a last thought I know its been in that space for some time but it visually looks like a Denny's placed in a lovely atrium lobby. The host was not friendly our waiter nice but not trained. I ordered a Dungeness crab salad for myself and pasta for my grandchildren. My salad was brought to the table while the children's pasta came 5 minutes later. Will not return

We went there for New Year Eve's but we just walked out coz It was extreamly loud there with very bad sound system. Moreover the set up for the party was so low class with the stage next to the dinning section at the lobby. How could people eat like that? How ur guests will sleep that night? We were so disappointed and left. We went to Perry's instead and it was lovely.
review_title: We went there for New Year

review: The re-engineering of the room seems to be working. The tables are comfortable, the menu is easier to navigate, and there's something almost resembling a crowd at lunchtime. It's a lovely setting and i wish them well.

Well-prepared food, excellent service and an interesting experience. Owner is one of the Sherpa clan and has climbed Everest 5 times. Moved to US, saved his $ and opened his restaurant. The American dream. Enjoyed this local find.

We've been meaning to try The Richmond for a very long time. Shame on us for waiting. This is a simply delightful finer cuisine neighborhood gem, family run, family served and family feeling. When they found out my husband and I were celebrating our anniversary, they put us in a private curtained window table and treated us like royalty. The lamb and steak were delicious - prepared exactly as we requested. The short rib-scallop appetizer should not be missed!  What a delightful dining experience.  We will go back again soon.

John and company are the tops. Food always interesting, clean, and good.  One of the best wine lists in town. We just keep going back, again and again.  I am so proud to have such a fine dining establishment in our neighborhood. A gem indeed.

Nice cozy restaurant where you can have a quiet conversation and not have to elbow the person at the next table every time you move.
The entrees are very good and service was attentive. We had the steak and the salmon. Both are very good.

Try the chicken - it's fantastic. Or the duck, which is cooked perfectly in a great sauce. Or the squash soup. Or the brie combination. Or the coffee semifreddo. Service was attentive but not annoying and the timing of the dishes was perfect. They even accommodated a friend's request for a surprise birthday dessert for us! Unfortunately, even on a Thursday evening, parking was a real challenge!

Wow. This unassuming establishment has no bells and whistles, just unique art, low lights and a quiet sophistication, a great wait staff, and consistently excellent fare. And, everyone's right about the wine list ... many great bottles for a bargain! This place is small, yet the mise en scene is not cramped, so one can instantly inhabit the space as their own. I selfishly hope The Richmond will not move to a larger, high-end space with which this dining experience could deservedly pair. I love it that it is truly a "neighborhood gem", rather undiscovered and low-key. The Richmond is a worthwhile exercise from the spare decore, to the kitchen, to the billet (tab) that should please everyone.

An all too rare find in the Richmond, an excellent American bistro. The food and service are excellent and on top of that they have a great wine selection at reasonable prices. The Richmond is now one of my first choices for high-quality dining. It has an upscale feel without being too formal or overly expensive.

Our favorite SF restaurant, bonus that it is located in our neighborhood! Just had the tasting menu with 'foodie' friends visiting from out of town and the food was amazing!One of our friends has special diet requirements and his meal was adjusted to not just meet his needs but to provide a superlative food experience. Cannot recommend highly enough.
Just a great experience all around. Fabulous wines, incredible food, attentive service. Don't miss this place!

This is a TERRIFIC neighborhood restaurant. Small, charming, friendly and absolutely wonderful food........creative, flavorful, beautifully presented. We enjoyed everything about our evening here and recommend it highly.

Go!!!! You will thank me.

We live in the area but had never been to this restaurant. We were generally very pleased
with our dinner. The food was presented very nicely and portions were very generous. We split a salad and my vegetarian entree and my dessert each would have been sufficient for
two people. The deviled egg and the excellent bread with several spreads were pleasant
additions.Some of the food could have been a bit more exciting. Service was very friendly,helpful, and efficient.There are some super bargains on wine. Prices range from
$15 - $200 a bottle. We ordered a $15 bottle Torrentes which went very well with our food. There were other good, inexpensive choices. Markup is 2X retail. More choices of
appetizers and entrees are needed.
The service at The Richmond was outstanding. The food was very good as well and very reasonably priced. I would definitely dine there again!
The food at the Richmond is superb. The service is perfect--by which I mean prompt, courteous, informative, and not intrusive.
review_title: The food at the Richmond is

review: The Richmond was excellent. There was a long wait after our order was taken and we noted that to the wait staff. They apologized and the chef came out to explain that there were several tables ahead of us and everything is prepared currently. The chef sent out 3 outstanding desserts (compliments of the house)!! We certainly would go back - the halibut and the lamb chops were outstanding!!
Lovely dining experience. Great way to celebrate a birthday. Good feeling and delicious food. A gem.
This is our second time dining at The Richmond and the food was again wonderful. The atmosphere is quiet and romantic and the beer/wine was excellent.
review_title: This is our second time dining

review: The Richmond is a reasonably priced restaurant with very good food. I liked the wine list. Good food; good value; nice atmosphere.
It was great to see the chef/owner visiting tables several times during the evening.
review_title: It was great to see the chef/owner

review: What a wonderful meal! Meeting an old friend while visiting from out of town, I had asked for a quiet table and we were perfectly accommodated. Reviews on either ChowHound or Yelp had indicated that the food was excellent and it certainly was. While we were not looking for a "Romantic" spot, I would think this restaurant offers that feature as well.
It's been good food, good service both times we've been to the Richmond. We'll keep going. Great for the neighborhood.

We enjoyed every bite, and service was attentive and perfectly paced. The chef personally delivered a complimentary salad to my father who had not ordered appetizers with the rest of us, and a beautiful panna cotta, also complimentary, was delivered after dinner for my mother's 75th birthday. We will most certainly return.

An excellent neighborhood restaurant in a storefront setting. Interesting blend of fine dining and comfort food. Small, but well conceived wine list. Quiet, with a romantic appeal. Difficult street parking can be a drawback.

Our chicken thighs were a bit small and over-breaded, but still good.  Our server was a bit spaced out and kept bringing us the wrong table's things, but it was a busy night with GDC conference people in town, which could be why.
Great food, happening crowd, a little loud.  Try the brunch pizzas

My parents were visiting, so I took them out to dinner at this fine Italian restaurant. It was a little cramped and very loud, but the food was great. The waiter recommended "family style," ordering two appetizers, an entree, and a pizza, all to share. Everything was great, and that was just enough for all three of us to be full. We had a bit of a hard time hearing each other, though.

I was looking for a spot to have a quick lunch near my office with my husband, i'v read great reviews about zero zero and i liked their website and their menu so, i've booked a table!
The room upstairs is dark, curtains to block the light at noon?!?!...
Anyway, the atmosphere was not really good, the service was not bad but very slow (even the room was half empty..) so not a good deal if you're looking a spot for a quick lunch!
We shared the crudo of the day, fresh tuna with lime and avocado puree (only one bite each, good but not very tasty)
The avocado bruchetta and the slow cooked pork was ok but disappointing..
Maybe it's a better place for pizzas on a diner night! The big oven downstairs and the pizzas looked nice..
review_title: Not a good place for lunch

review: One of our party of 8 ordered a Reuben sandwich, but was not served until the rest of us had already finished eating 4 pizzas and 3 salads. She had to take most of it home in a doggy bag.

You can close your eyes and pick from the menu and you won't be disappointed. Complex flavor profiles fit for foodies and comfort food lovers alike. Personally love the arancini, squash blossoms, pork dumplings, they had this asparagus and egg thing once that was amazing. Get the duck pasta, but beware it has a little heat. Pairs perfectly with...

The pizza is just about as good as it can get (neapolitan style). Usually just get a simple margherita and the special (which is often a bit more wild but always excellent).

Wine and beer selection are terrific as well.
Really enjoyed dinner, dessert, and drinks. The service couldn't have been better.

The good service here, interesting favors, diverse patronage and lounge like atmosphere make this a cool place to eat. I wasn't crazy over the food here but this was only my first time and I would try it again.

This was my first time here after all the hype I have been hearing. Overall, the place is at most at par with it hype. My friends and I had the meat pizza (starts with the C but forgot what it was called), the Margarita extra pizza, the broccoli anti pasta, the fried Brussels sprouts, oxtail pasta, and the build it yourself sundae.

Brussels sprouts was very interesting. It taste more like soggy/ oily vegetables, which wasn't the way I like my vegetables. However, eating it with the pear gives the bite an interesting contrast. Would I order it again? Yes. The nest thing was simply the Margarita. But I feel like I didn't get the fun experience of a napoleon style pizza because I thought it should he doughy-er in the center.
We had a good pizza but it was so noisy we could've talk.
review_title: We had a good pizza but it

review:
After mediocre, aloof bar service and "host attitude" on visits # 1 and # 2...I HAD to go again for the amazing food.

Big wins - fried risotto balls with black olive mayo, both bruchetta's, the spicy clam pizza, pasta with ham & bread crumbs (I dream about this dish) and make your own soft serve ice cream with the warm chocolate cake and cherries.

Try the bourbon cocktail with tobacco bitters and lemon. Our server was SUPER professional, made personal reccomendations and asked about who we are. Often, servers who only care who they are.

Tell the bussers and food runners to stop over managing the table. Every time they bring something or clear, they move everything with a "sigh" like you had something in the wrong place. OMG !
Lively atmosphere. Excellent food. Known for its pizza but we had two wonderful pasta dishes. And don't miss the ricotta doughnuts! It was fairly noisy but a baby at the next table slept through it.

I have dined at Zero Zero several times for dinner and enjoyed it. However, I had never thought of going there for brunch until I saw a recent Facebook status update from the restaurant describing its chicken and waffle dish, so i decided to give it a try. OMG! The chicken and waffles were the best I've ever had. My husband had the crispy duck with polenta. It was also divine. There were so many incredible sounding dishes on the brunch menu that we had difficulty ordering. In short, we're going back for brunch this weekend too.
review_title: I have dined at Zero Zero

review: Some of the best pizza I've ever had and reasonable prices considering the quality!
review_title: Some of the best pizza I've

review: Our second time here, excellent pizza and pasta per usual.  Service was professional and friendly.
review_title: 10's across the board for Zero Zero

review: Food was phenomenal. Arancini with taleggio cheese was out of this universe. The pizza would rival NYC. The fried chicken appetizer was great, but it did not need the tomato sauce it was sitting on.
Had a great dinner , just wish that our waitress told us the specials for the evening.

The service was perfect from beginning to end -- attentive but not intrusive. Why is this so hard to master at other restaurants? Some of the food was outstanding -- the cheese-stuffed squash blossoms were amazing -- and other was a little disappointing, but overall it was very good. Tables are a bit close together so it's sometimes hard to stick to your own conversation, and noise levels are definitely on the high side. Definitely a place I plan to return to.

The food exceeded my expectations. The food was very, very good, with creative/innovative presentation and good size portions. We went for the menu selections, not the pizza this time and everything we had was delicious. The noise level was quite "energetic" sparked by a young business crowd at lunch time. We asked for and were given a quiter table in the corner and were happy with that. The service was great
Will definately come back, for lunch and for dinner.
Pizza is fabulous! Everything was very enjoyable. It will only get better!

I have been here on two occasions. Once at night without a reservation and during the day for lunch. At night the restaurant was packed and noisy. I could only get a seat at the bar. The food was good, but I was not comfortable.

I enjoyed the lunch more. For an appetizer we ordered the risotto filled balls. These were good. We then ordered the special, a meatball pizza and the clams pizza. Both were good, but nor great. I have had better pizza at Delfina. We also ordered the sundae. I had the donuts with vanilla ice cream and fudge. While I enjoyed the donuts, I did not love the soft serve ice cream. It reminded me a little of McDonalds. The service was excellent. The waitress was attentive and friendly, I highly recommend.
review_title: I have been here on two occasions.

review: Lived up to my very high expectations. Great pizza, killer handmade pasta, great service. Go!
review_title: Lived up to my very high expectatio

review: Excellent food and service that never disappoint. Seasonally varying menu is full of invention and surprise. Romantic food and lighting, but noise level is very high.

Overall, a nice experience. The desserts were wonderful! As was our pizza. The service, however, was disappointing. Each of our entrees (4) were brought out individually... easily 5 min. apart. It was 20 minutes before we could all dine together.
Amazing food. Come with a group so you can try a variety of things.

The food was delicious - I went with a friend and we had a great time, but it would also be a great date-spot. Server seems over-extended and we had to wait close to 10 minutes to have a server come see us for a drink order and water, but after that it was smooth sailing. One of my new favorite spots!
This a wonderful Bistro, just like you would find in Paris!  The food is actually better than in some of the bistros of Paris!  It is a lively place with a great atmosphere!  We will be back!
loved it and our chat with the owner   A real secret find and now I know its the sib;ing of L'Ardoise

We wanted to try something different for a celebratory group outing, and wanted to give Le Charm a try. Many of us live or work in the area, and had no idea it was there, despite going by it all the time! The service was super slow at times, but great at others (we ended up being almost an hour late to Part 2 of our outing due to the slowness). It took almost 20 minutes for us to get the bday boy a glass of wine as they didn't notice others had joined the group, and it took a long time to place our dessert order. Food was delicious though, and the setting is pretty nice/romantic. Restroom situation is a little janky (why is there a chair in front of the toilet, facing the toilet?). Had a great time, but not sure if we'll return.
Le Charm was great, they were very accommodating in changing my reservations from 2 to 4 at the last minute. Service and food was wonderful on a very busy New Years Eve.
very good country French food. Service for a large party takes a little time. But I guess the French do take a while to enjoy their dinner.

Great ambiance in an authentic Parisian bistro setting w/ lovely decor and wonderful, live music. The onion soup was a dream come true as were the coq au vin, tarte tatin and creme brle. The owner couldn't have been nicer and surprised my partner with a candle on his dessert to help celebrate his birthday. To cap off the evening she also brought us each a complimentary glass of dessert wine. I'm seriously considering having my 60th birthday celebration in the back garden. Even if I don't we look forward to returning there to dine in the future.

Once you step into le charm, it's like An escape from the outside world. Cozy & romantic, the restaurant had great ambiance for a quiet romantic dinner. Food selection was excellent. Love the fact that Le charm offered a few selections within the pre fixe menu. We will definitely be back.
Bonus: live music.
review_title: Once you step into le charm,

review: We enjoyed everything about Le Charm! The food was excellent and the portions were very generous. The atmosphere was warm and inviting and cozy. The service was exquisite, they did a wonderful job. This was our first visit, but we'll definitely go back!
Loved the food and thought the prices were really good. Next time I'll request the patio.

A wonderful find in the city, romantic, intimate, yet great for just a very nice dinner out with friends. Quiet dining, excellent food and the price fixed menu is a bargain. You will feel like you are in Paris. The terrine foie gras is superb and a must!
review_title: A wonderful find in the city,
