review: This was one of the best little French restaurants we have gone to in San Francisco. The service was flawless and professional while friendly. The food was exquisite and perfectly done; the menu had a wide variety of dishes in all categories and the wine list was fine (finally, a restaurant that realizes the wines of Alsace are a treasure). And the setting is such that one can actually converse without shouting while the decor lends itself to a quiet,homey atmosphere.
Food and service were excellent. We had the onion soup, trout, scallops and Tarte Tatain for dessert. Great all around.

This was a celebration for Bastille Day with a Prixfix menu, but the food was outstanding! I can not say enough! Makes us wonder why we hadn't gone back sooner, but too we cannot wait to go again. It is a small restaurant, and the tables are very close to each other, but all of those around us seemed to be enjoying the feast!
Price fixed menu is a real deal. More food than most french restaurants provide. Excellent dishes and service. Charming in every way.
review_title: Price fixed menu is a real

review: We had to search many listings on Open Table to find a restaurant that served Cassoulet this winter, and this was a great find. They serve some great country French food. The restaurant is a little cramped but it was well worth it.

we love le Charm. We have been there as a couple and as a group. The service is wonderful. You can eat leisurely, or they get you in and out for the theatre. The food is delicious. The set menu is a wonderful deal. Go and enjoy!
review_title: we love le Charm. We have

review: food was fair nothing special. my lamb was overcook! i try their prefix dinner, you get what you pay for!

Very friendly staff. Delightful waitstaff, with minor mis-steps. Excellent wine suggestion. Thoroughly enjoyed our meal, which was consistent with previous visits. It is always a pleasure to return. Next time I will remember to be specific about seating on the covered/heated patio/courtyard, as it gets very loud inside and we could not talk without raising our voices.

Great Place to bring a date. It was warm and they had outside seating in the back of the restaurant. The food was very good. I had a delicious rib eye and ordered the halibut special. The Steak was great. The Halibut special was good but the best part of the dish was the bed of seasoned tomatoes(Best I ever had)
review_title: Great Place to bring a date.

review: We had a very nice experience with wonderful food and pleasant staff. Would recommend it to all. Will return again.
review_title: We had a very nice experience

review: excellent value- prix fixe menu has good choices. Service friendly, attentive, and not obsequious. Food very good - goat cheese souffle light as a feather, pommes frites lukewarm but crispy.

A "SUPERB" neighborhood gem that just keeps on improving with age...
One of the VERY BEST French Bistro's in the Bay Area...

Upon entry into this quaint and cozy restaurant the wonderful smell of good food greets you. Anytime you enter a restaurantand and your mouth starts watering says something about expectations. The appetizers are a feast. The french onion soup is traditional and excellent. It was hot and ample and could easily have satisfied in its own right. I shared dinner tastes with my guest so I had the opportunity to sample more than just one entree. The entrees on the prixe fixe menu were good but not remarkable. The desserts were superb. I intend to revisit this restaurant to sample more items from their menu
We had not been here for a few years. It was nice to see not much had changed in terms of quality, ambiance and wait staff. We will return again.
review_title: We had not been here for a

review:
Have been to Le Charm many times. Food is
consistently good and the price is right.
Lovely service.
review_title: Have been to Le Charm many

review: food was wonderfully served. the lamb for one of us was very red and unfortunately it was not brought to your attention because we were hosting guests. service was very friendly and professional. merci!

This was my second visit to Le Charm and it won't be my last. The food is delicious. THe goat cheese souffle is outstanding, as were all of the desserts. I like the change in fixe prix menu. It is an excellent value for your money.
review_title: This was my second visit to

review: I was very happy with my dinner. The prix fixe was very reasonable & the portions were generous. I was actually uncomfortably over-stuffed after dinner for a few hours. I'm not suggesting that they serve smaller portions but just that I was very full at the end of my meal. Nice ambience, friendly service, good food.
review_title: I was very happy with my dinner.

review: You've got to try their Tart Tatan.  We will make sure to make a reservation next time we are in San Francisco.
review_title: You've got to try their Tart

review: food was good, but they seriously need to improve their wine list.
review_title: food was good, but they seriously

review: Stopped in for a quick weeknight dinner with my sister - was pretty empty on a Thursday night at 6, but the food and service was great. Our server was attentive in refilling our water and getting food out to us nice and hot. We split the sriracha shrimp for an appetizer - really good heat on this and I eat a lot of spicy foods! My sister had the paleo burger (which she loved!) and I had the paleo bowl with chicken instead of steak. Delicious! Everything was cooked and seasoned well so I enjoyed our meal very much. I also highly recommend the Moscow Mule. Very tasty and refreshing!

Restaurant was short staffed, took a long time for the drink orders to be taken and arrive, and my cold drink was Luke warm and tasteless....
The owner kept reminding me I need to tip according to menu price instead of the coupon discounted rate, that was quite annoying.
Food was so so, nothing memorable.
Need a solution for the front tables that can be very cold and windy.
I really enjoyed this restaurant. It's pretty reasonably priced, and the food was really good. Nice, quiet atmosphere. Intimate and calming.

I had heard that this restaurant was a hidden gem but there is nothing gem like about it. The menu and wine list are boring and the food was so bland! Even the hanger steak had no flavor and that is almost impossible to do. The French onion soup was also ho hum. My husband enjoyed his trout but that was really all that we liked. The servers were friendly. But we won't be back.

The food was no more than mediocre, meat quality was not good for the price, and although we don't expect or want a huge portion, the filet mignon was very small. We were sat in the middle of the room, reallly an aisle (we had a reservation), literally bumping elbows with staff. There was one waitperson, although a few other staff on the floor, and they were friendly enough. Clearly, our waitperson was slammed, we felt for her, but she barely made eye contact or cracked a smile, a bit gruff. We made the best of it, but overall, it was a disappointing dinner.
Good food and friendly staff. I recommend this place. The food is very good and the dessert is awsomeeeeeeeeeeee
This was one of my favorite meals in SF in the last year.
review_title: This was one of my favorite

review: great neighborhood place. have been there 4 times now. The food is very good and reasonably priced.

Outstanding appetizers--nicely-sauced sweetbreads as crispy and tender as I've had, tasty composed crab salad, killer Chassagne Montrachet, moderately priced--but the entrees, good if not superb, were served lukewarm, and the wait between courses totally unacceptable (15-20 mins. minimum), with no apology or explanation at all until we mentioned it. (It appears they may have too many dishes and specials for a small kitchen to handle.) Subsequently, several apologies and complimentary dessert wine--but without asking if we'd like dessert or coffee instead. A very promising, attractive local bistro; we'll try one more time, but a second dose of poor service will kill it for us.
The joy of discovering Bistro Central Parc was akin to discovering a Bugatti in a barn. A totally unexpected treasure snuggled into a quite neighborhood. Don't miss it!

No question this a great place.
We were celebrating our 25th anniversary.
Great food, wine, service. The tenderest sweetbreads we'd ever eaten.
Excellent duck breast and quail, too.
Our waiter was friendly and very attentive without being overly so.
He helped us match wine with food and it was wonderful.
thank you.

Bistro Central Parc is the perfect neighborhood bistro - cozy and friendly with dependably delicious food. They greet you as if you're a long awaited friend. The wait staff are attentive yet unobtrusive. Everything we've tried has been amazing. They also know how to make a special occasion extra special. Our last visit was for a birthday celebration and when the lights went out and the entire room sang "Happy Birthday," it was like our extended family was part of the celebration. (Go a little early so you have time to find a parking space. Or, take a taxi.)

Last Saturday was my first experience at Bistro Parc Central and I will absolutely return. The food, service and atmosphere were outstanding. No pretension - just great food and a wonderful staff in a smallish but very relaxed and comfortable corner restaurant.

First of all, we were very pleased with the easy parking in the neighborhood. The restaurant was nice and quiet. Good for romantic dinners and also great for casual dinners. We felt very comfortable there. The duck confit was perfect. Not dry and easily falling off of the bone. French onion soup was delicious. It is always fun wrestling with the gooey melted cheese that sits on top. Love that stuff. The escargot was good but a little lacking in flavor. I've had an "out of this world" escargot at a french restaurant that is no longer open and unfortunately I haven't found one to match. For dessert we ordered the profiteroles. I am sorry to say that they were a major disappointment. The pastry filled with the ice cream was dry and very tough. Not tender at all as I would expect it. That would not stop me from coming back, however. Just from ordering this particular dessert again. Overall we had a great time, good food, and would definitely recommend it to others (I already have!). I just wish it were closer to our neighborhood!

We had tickets for the Smuin Ballet and I was looking for a restaurant that wasn't too far from the venue. Unless you live in this neighborhood or unless someone recommends this restaurant, it is off the beaten path. The food was fabulous, and the waiter needed roller skates! He was everywhere, serving food, clearing plates, checking in with patrons...I was exhausted watching him! I will definitely return to this adorable and authentic restaurant.
Overall a wonderful experience! A slice of Paris in San Francisco.
If you want authentic French bistro atmosphere and cuisine, you must try Baker Street Bistro. The staff is great and the dishes wonderful!
Very mediocre food. Service was pleasant and not rushed; allowed plenty of time to chat with friends. Just wish the food and wine were better. I would not come back and do not recommend this place.

I'm really glad I chose this place. The food was great and the staff was really nice. We got there late, but they were still very friendly and didn't rush us out. I would highly recommend this restaurant because the food and service were both so good. The place is very nice also - it has a sweet, homey sort of feel.
review_title: I'm really glad I chose this

review:
I had the seafood stew and my companion had the mussels ~ both of which were excellent.

There was only one server for the lunch service and no bus staff. So, while the server was very cordial, the service was overall was inattentive at best. However, this has always been the case with this establishment with both owners. So, just prepared for a "leisurely" paced meal.
review_title: I had the seafood stew and

review: Baker Street Bistro is always a great choice for small groups or couples. It really is a gem and the close seating is part of the charm. The food is excellent, the servers are friendly. It's classic French cuisine that won't break your budget...too badly! :)

Food has certainly improved over the last couple of years from good to very good! The quality is there even though there is a wide variety of dishes on the menu. Our party of four had scallops, lamb, duck, and chicken...and we liked them all!

Small, pleasant neighborhood restaurant. Tables are close together so conversations are overheard, but the atmosphere is nice, the menu and food are way above average and we would go back. Some of the red wines by the glass tend to be a little thin, but its nice to have some different BTG options instead of the usual names.

Good Mexican food with lots of variety.  The Camarones with peppers and onions were very good and light - perfect for Mexican on a diet.  Good guacamole.  So so Margaritas.  Fun, but very loud.  Valet parking convenient and costs less than nearby parking garages.

Served cold food on cold plates (yeah it's a Mexican restaurant that doesn't use hot plates)...the only thing colder was the service. The orders arrived at different times, our server misquoted a shrimp menu item and we questioned it, so she eventually offered to bring a side of rice or beans at no charge. Someone missed one of our cocktail orders so we had to keep asking people for it. We thought it would be fun place after a Giants game but won't ever go back, even if the late margarita was good...by the way everything is a la carte (menu items are not really an entree) so its a pricey meal. Ouch! Too many other great places to choose.
great spot, great food, great ambiance, great location - Fantastic Teqilia selection!

I've been going to Tres pretty regularly for a few years now. The house margaritas are great, but if you're feeling like a big shot, try the 1942 Margarita made with Don Julio 1942 Aejo. It's ridiculously good. On the food side, the tacos are great and the empanandas are the perfect way to get things going. The atmosphere here is usually fairly loud and energetic, especially during a ballgame.
We had a great time yet again. We had drinks in the bar the day before and that was great too.
review_title: We had a great time yet again.

review: I've been to Tres several times and it's always consistently good authentic Mexican food. The portions aren't too large like it some Mexican restaurants, which is good. Everything is good here. And I love their guacamole!

First of all the hostess was this tiny blond girl who seemed overwhelmed, and talked on the phone making reservations not acknowledging my party and myself patiently waiting and rudely shoved 3 menus (without drink menu) into a waitress' hand to seat us. When the waitress said "I can seat them" the hostess let out a bland "Oh thank god." (isnt that her job?) She then proceeded called me twice on my cell (I ignored both times) and then I was sent a cancellation via Open Table for my reservations AS we were awaiting drinks. My margarita was served room temp and none of us finished our food because it was assembled so poorly and the fries were so spicy they were practically inedible. Terrible everything and won't be returning!

This is I guess my 20th time eating here, and likely my last. It has basically become a Tex mex tgif. Food was poor. Carnitas were greasy and fatty. Not pleasant. Service was extremely slow. Sports bar/convention center atmosphere. A shame, it used to be good.
review_title: This is I guess my 20th time

review: Great before a Giant's game.  Good tequila's and great food.

Everything was fine, except for the food. With San Francisco having some many inexpensive Mexican restaurants to choose from, Tres Agaves should lower their prices or hire a new chef.

Everything else was fine. Their drinks were amazing and the staff was friendly. However, I won't be coming back because of the food.
Very bright food, fresh ingredients, clean tastes - unusually good for Mexican food.

Great fres Mexican food with a flair for originality.
Drinks are good but on the small side. Service is average, takes awhile to get a drink at your table during dinner time or before eve ballgame.

Great high-end Mexican food, friendly and professional service, tequila list that goes on forever... the Don Julio 1942 Anejo margaritas are unbelieveable (and justifiably pricey!) My continued SOMA favorite for Mexican and Tequila. Get noisy before and after Giants games...
Tres Agaves never fails. Outstanding food, great margaritas (they use their own Agave Nectar, no sweet and sour mix). Lively, fun.

Again, great food, and the worst service in the city.  Every time I go there, I say I will never come back, because the service is so bad (I always get the same blond female server) But, then I do.

It's getting to be a joke.
I am bummed that for some reason, I did not get dining points for this restaurant. I had asked you guys WHY and got no response. So I am rating OPEN TABLE FOR CUSTOMER SERVICE --D-
review_title: I am bummed that for some

review: It was my first time at Tres Agaves, and I do have to admit that the food is very good, the plate of "Carnitas" was great.  My friends really enjoyed the food and the place, although I do have to say that it is a bit pricey for being Mexican Food.  But overall, it was a good experience, though I wouldn't go there for dinner again, but just for drinks and an appetizer.
review_title: It was my first time at Tres

review:
Isa was amazing.  I had the Cab Franc - incredible - (3 glasses - shared)  I had the crab salad appetizer and my love had the oysters.  Both very tasty.
I had the Bass wrapped in potato - it was incredible.  We also had the Paella - very good.
I would definitely go there again.
The wait staff was great and they put us in a romantic corner just like I asked.
All in all it gets an A+ from me!!
Great food.  Wonderful atmosphere.  The risotto was to die for.  Flatiron steak was perfectly cooked.

We planned a dinner party for my husband's birthday. The waiter was very attentive and took very good care of all of us. The food was wonderful an the ambience in the back dining area was lively to say the least. We were in a party mood so it suited us perfectly. We will be back!
No deixe de ir. Comida em pequenas pores, todas saborosas, e atendimento  sensacional.

Dine about town introduced my fiance and myself to Isa! We enjoyed every moment of our experience. The waiter (Justin) was extremely attentive along with his helpers; I was impressed...I never had to remind what I requested! More importantly, our waiter allowed us to enjoy our date night..this was so nice as we've all experienced the pushy waiters/waitresses.

We were able to secure an intimate table in the corner by the window...we enjoyed the people watching and our meal with great ambiance! Food was delicious! We brought our own wine and paid the corkage fee which was worth it to us. Overall, a great experience. I lived near the Marina for 5 years and didn't take advantage of cute places like this. Definitely worth a try! Bon Appetite!

Food is very consistent and good as usual but service needs to be improved and better training of the staff, waiters are too fast cleaning the dishes to serve the entree. Should look more carefully and communicate with the kitchen until all the guests at the table are done with their current dishes, clean up the table and wait 5 minutes before serving the next dish. Most of the time the next dish is served while still eating the first ones, It would not hurt to give time to digest the first course before starting the next course.

ISA serves all food family style, which means a single serving plate is placed in the center of the table for all to taste if so chose.
The food is very good with special seasoning and presentation. Corkage fee is $20. Price fixed dinner is a very good deal but portions are not large which may be a benefit to some.This does not apply to the deserts which were both large and excellent.

My husband and I loved the food (honestly - what's not to love) but the noise on the outside terrace was awful. We could hardly carry on a conversation with each other. Bottom line - go for the food but don't expect expect great atmosphere.
Great food and service. Hosted my family from out of town and they loved it. I'll be back soon.
Service is great. Food was delicious. Server Dean was awesome.

The food was very good, the room is pleasant, the service was not good. Not sure if it was her first night or just clueless. Others who came in after us were attended to before us. She brought one of the entrees before we finished our soup. the second entree did not come out for another 5 minutes after the first. I gave her my credit card at the beginning of the meal so that there was no discussion at the table about who would pay. She did not understand what I was doing and asked if I wanted my check even though we just ordered. The host brought the check without ringing up my credit card so had to wait for the waitress to get the card.
review_title: The food was very good, the

review: An amazing restaurant, amazing cuisine, but too noisy!
This French tapas restaurant is a delight - an inspired menu with excellent food and service.

Brilliant! What a find amongst a sea of Marina restaurants. Place was packed on a Monday night, and the food was stupendous! Our table of four even ordered seconds on the scallops.
Service was impeccable, lively crowd, and we thoroughly enjoyed the crab salad, the risotto and the steak. Don't miss it. Worth the drive down from Sonoma

The food is served Tapas style with smaller plates meant to be shared by the table. We were a party of 4 and had 8 different dishes -- we thoroughly enjoyed every one. The Tuna carpaccio was notable as was the duck salad, lamb chops and arugala salad. There was nothing fussy about the food preparation or presentation. The chef focuses on fresh and tasty ingredients and simple, yet beautiful, presentation. A refreshing change from the plethora of overly fussed dishes that so many restaurants serve these days. Dilning here was a first for all four of us and we could not have been happier. I picked the restaurant, so that was a relief. Truly worth trying if you really enjoy variety and excellently prepared food. I know I'll be back!
review_title: The food is served Tapas style

review:
It's larger than it looks, and felt comfortable. We both like sweetbreads and these are excellent. I appreciate their maintaining a dish that is not for everyone. Three items stand out: the rack of lamb is a good as any we have ever eaten, just perfectly prepared. The mussels, and especially the sauce are better than any other SF restaurant. And the duck was wonderful.
We lived in San Francisco for 33 years, now in Oregon. Whenever we return maybe every other month) we dine at Isa first night and at least one other. Although the food is first rate, the place feels very comfortable, casual. Unusual and excellent wine selection with a staff that's helpful is a plus.
We have never been disappointed at Isa. Great food and service.

I returned to Isa for the first time in years. The seafood dishes - such as butterfish cooked in paper(a daily special), seared scallops with brussel sprouts/mashed potatos, and halibut - were very good. We also liked the small plate of squid with beans. We sat in the heated patio area covered with a tent in the back, and we dined with our 2 children. Service was prompt and the staff were accomodating to our children.
review_title: I returned to Isa for the

review: I always enjoy ISA and like their "share plate" policy.
review_title: I always enjoy ISA and like

review: Food on the prix fixe was very good, but the service would deserve to be improved: we had to wait a long time despite having booked our table. Our table was not very well located. Isa could have been a romantic place, but packing so many people in this small spot removed the charm.
review_title: Food on the prix fixe was

review: The only complaint is that they squeeze tables everywhere they possibly can, we were sitting practically in the walkway and everyone kept bumping into us, including waitors.
Fun restaurant with terrific food. Waitstaff was exceptional. Best ahi appetizer ever and the seabass was amazing. Prices were surprisingly reasonable.

+ outstanding foie gras
+ very good food overall (dishes tried: salmon carpaccio, foie gras, duck breast, seafood paella)
+ great for sharing

- a little on the cramped side
- service wasn't too great - long wait to order and be served at various stages and servers mixed up our dishes with that of another table a couple of times
The food had great flavor and was nicely prepared. In addition, the staff was very attentive and made sure to always refill our waters and bread basket. We would go back again!

I was a little disappointed that there was only a pasta option on the menu for vegetarians. This is 2010 in San Fransisco - restaurants should have a little more creativity than that!! With that being said, my pasta was delicious!!

It was a loely experience. The special 3 course prix fixe meal was especially good.
I highly recommend this place!!

We love Isa! This is our 3rd time there and, although we live in Marin and don't eat in SF all that often, when we do, Isa is one of our favorite spots. The food is terrific, but what really sets Isa apart is the service. The staff is extremely enthusiastic and helpful.
review_title: We love Isa! This is our 3rd

review:
The waiter recommended that each of our party guest (4 of us) get two things from the menu (appetizer and and entree) and said that plates are to be served as family style. Having said that I knew the portions were going to be large.

We opted for 2 appetizer and 1 each entree. It was way too much. The waiter could give a suggested, but not recommended that everyone does that.

The mushrooms were great!

We came on Valentine's Day night, and were concerned that it would affect the service or quality, but our experience was great. We were seated within five minutes. Our table was in a bit of an odd location on the outside patio, probably set up temporarily to handle the night's traffic, but it was comfortable and fine. We had two courses and a dessert from their prix fixe menu, and they were all delicious. The service was great as well - when my girlfriend's duck was a bit rare, they gladly brought it back better done quickly and with no attitude. We were kept well-stocked with water and delicious bread. It was a romantic evening and we stuffed ourselves with delectable food.
the food was fantastic! the place was naturally packed for a saturday night. Luckily, we were nestled in a corner table, away from the madness. the server was attentive and personable.
This is not my first time to come here the food here is not as good as before everything is okay now. I was really like the foie gras here but not anymore.
review_title: This is not my first time

review: excellent food but a noisy back room...sit in the front for a quieter dinner or in the back for vibrance
Great food and wine. Crowd was vibrant and service was great.

I was pretty disappointed with this restaurant. Here are the reasons:
-They have a degustation system where they suggest each person to order two dishes to share among all people. The prices, however, are not within the same range as you would find in a tapas restaurant. In addition, the dishes are not the kind of dishes one would share. Example, I ordered a risotto. I wouldn't want 4 people eating from the same plate.
-We asked if we could have our dinner in regular style,(the waiter said we could do that) and ordered a dish for each and plus 2 appetizers to share. The dishes arrived at table one at a time with a 15 min. delay between the first and last.
They serve small plates meant to be shared so make sure that you go with a group that is willing to share.
Isa is now one of my top 10 favorite restaurants of all time. The food and service are outstanding! Can't wait to return to San Francisco and Isa.
review_title: Isa is now one of my top 10

review: Love sitting in the covered patio...The food is always wonderful!

I am new to the city and a friend recommended Isa to me. This has become one of my favorite restaurants in SF. Our waiter was extremely knowledgable about the plate sizes and recommended some excellent dishes. Great ambiance on the outdoor patio with the white lights. Especially loved the scallop dish!
review_title: I am new to the city and a

review: The Fried Chicken was undercooked, which really detracted from the whole dish.  My friend had the rack of lamb special, which they said the chef would be serving rare to medium rare.  My friend was like great!  And then he also seemed to think the lamb was undercooked.  I don't think he enjoyed it.  Overall, our main entrees were disappointments.

25 Lusk hides at the rear of a short alley awaiting diners to venture within.  Those who do stop by will find themselves drawn to its inner warmth and passion for fine dining.  Taking your leave is the hardest part.

The atmosphere was good and the food had great presentation, but many of the dishes had too much salt and definitely not worry the money. Wanted a fun night with the girls and this place did not deliver.
Overall, had a great time! Wonderful food, great service and atmosphere. Would recommend for a special dinner or outing.
review_title: Great Place for a Great Meal

review: I had been into 25 Lusk for drinks before and the space is absolutely amazing. I knew I wanted to make a return trip. When we were looking for a spot to do brunch on a friend's birthday weekend, I immediately thought of Lusk. The food was incredible! The service was top-notch and the whole experience was great. I really appreciated the little touches - like sending out coffee cake, cheddar biscuits and smoothie samples. I would definitely recommend this spot.
review_title: Amazing meal from start to finish

review: We have been going to 25 Lusk since it first opened a few years ago and it is a delight every time we go. The food is superlative, with the most creative combinations of tastes. They source locally and the wines are excellent, though a bit pricey. The decor is one of our favorites, very modern and sleek but still warm and inviting. There are many booths and the tables are well spaced. Service is always well done by experienced wait staff. We recommend 25 Lusk highly!

I loved the design and decorations of the restaurant. The food was good, but not great. For the price I would have expected it to be a bit better tasting and presented. It seemed like a mostly touristy crowd and I prefer to dine a the place the locals eat when I travel.
The food was fine, but not great, and it was expensive. With so many other great options in our Baghdad-by-the-Bay, I won't be going back.
I love the relaxed feel of this place - like a comfortable dining room in a friends home. I definitely would return to try more dishes. Service was well-timed and friendly in SoMa/AT&T Park area.
The menu is somewhat limited and although the food was good, it was not great based on the price point.
Staff were extremely helpful an accommodating of our large group with kids. They fixed our incorrect order quickly and comped us. Very good experience.
Not worth the time...Too much fuzz for what it is...Doormen attitude is rude..Will never go back!!

I had gotten a gift certificate from work. We loved it and would go back. Great servers. Great Bartender. Friendly staff. Though the restaurant was filled primarily with young professionals my partner and I both over 60 felt completely welcomed.
review_title: I had gotten a gift certificate

review: a bit pricey but original and thoughtful menu. Two thumbs up.
Beautiful place, pricey, worth every penny. Food outstanding.
Great locale. Interior is exceptional. Great food and service. My Easter bunch with the family was made very enjoyable in this upscale restaurant.
The food speaks for itself! It is delicious and decadent! Go for the arctic char! It was mouthwatering!

Enjoyed drinking wine in the lounge prior to dinner. The architecture was outstanding, the service during dinner was outstanding and the meal was beyond our expectations. Highly recommend this as a place for fine dining, either with friends or as a romantic evening. I had the BlueNose Bass and it was delicious.
Our prawns and sturgeon were both outstanding. The ambience at 25 Lusk is very different -- GOOD different! Classy, serene, very San Francisco with its historical notes.

It's a young-ish scene in the downstairs bar but more sedate upstairs. The bar is mostly sofa style and we found it a bit awkward upon entry to locate and feel comfortable. There was no greeting and no guidance to a location. The dinner was extraordinary. Our waiter knew a great deal about not only the dishes on the menu but even the history of some of the food items. It's pricey but worth it.

25 Lusk was a lot of fun! I had read some reviews on another site that the crowd can be a little bridge-and-tunnel and that after 10pm the vibe changes significantly. I can agree with the first statement for sure, but the food was really good. My husband and I loved the cauliflower creme brulee (and I don't even like cauliflower!). I had the Grilled Hawaiian Opah, which was delicious. The restaurant is really cool and the lounge downstairs is gorgeous. Architecturally, it's a sight as well - we had a great time!
review_title: 25 Lusk was a lot of fun!

review: We had a great time from the cocktails to the dessert. Services was excellent and all the food was delicious. Be aware that the spicy spice they use for the fries in the bar area is the same that they use for the grits served as a side for dinner -- the waiter did not know so we decided to try it anyway. Wine was excellent. My brownie with mint choc chip ice cream was very good but much too rich for after a big dinner -- my fault for ordering it. I would definitely recommend this place to friends with the caveat that it is so loud it is hard to hear friends at the dinner table.
review_title: We had a great time from the

review:
Outstanding restaurant with great decor and even better food. Expensive, but worth the trip especially on a special occasion.
Loved the grilled shrimp and the chocolate mint chip desert.

Lusk has a great lounge and dining motif. I went there to dinner for a friends birthday. In addition to having a very relaxed atmosphere, the food was excellent. I enjoyed the duck confit along a nicely pair pinot. However, the service left something to be desired as our order and delivery of food took more than an hour (pretty sure this was done to get us to drink more). I am not a fan of that technique some restaurants apply to larger parties. I would still recommend the Lusk to anyone as it is a great place for multiple occasions.
review_title: Great for drink and a bite to eat

review: Fun atmosphere with excellent but the portions are very small.

Early Monday dinner with out-of-town coworkers. Stunning space. Service was wonderful. Food was very good. Menu was way too pretentious - almost took the fun out of it. I appreciate accurate, precise terms, but by the time we translated each item, it was more like describing a medical procedure than a meal. The meal was well executed, but the lingering memory was "Oh, so THAT'S what I ordered..."
Would go again if invited; would likely pick some place else if it were up to me.

25 Lusk has a lot of buzz, and it's deserved. I spent a little bit of time with my friend downstairs checking out the bar/lounge area prior to going upstairs for dinner, and it's a bit scene-y with the usual FiDi types. Dinner upstairs was excellent. We shared the ginger oxtail ravioli and the smoked sturgeon for starters, and the hanger steak and duck as entrees. I keep dreaming about the duck confit dumpling. Dessert was a layered date cake that was very good. Aside from the food, I am drooling over the design elements for that place. It's visually stunning.
review_title: 25 Lusk has a lot of buzz,

review: !st visit was wonderfull...SERVICE FOOD AMBIANCE COULD NOT HAVE BEEN BETTER
First time everything impressed but the main courses missed.  The starters were amazing, however.  Love the location, atmosphere, vibe, service, etc., but will give main courses another try.
convenient location, friendly staff, limited menu options, modest portions, good (not great) fare.
Enjoyed a very warm, cozy family dinner. Food was definitely very good and tasty. Recommend trying this place.

This charming little French restaurant is a great find. 

I had my first croque- Monsieur here years ago and loved it! I then began to try others across the city. I was surprised at how they differed.  Cafe de la Presse wins hands down! There is something to the cruspiness of the bread and cheese combo that just is delicious. Try it and you'll see!

I am now a regular there and turn people on to my obsession often.

We asked friends that know San Francisco for a good place for dinner. This is the one they recommended and we're glad they did.
It's in an area close to some pretty highbrow shopping so fellas, get a map and maybe you can figure out a way to avoid them.
  There were 4 of us and we all came out with the promise that we'd be back again.
Creme Brulee and Cappuccino for dessert were the best.
review_title: A Great Place in a Great Town

review: I have been to the restaurant numerous times with friends when we come to the city on vacation. My husband and I went together this time for the first time, and we weren't disappointed. The chicken and beef were tasty as usual. The warm croissant pudding was heavenly. This place is a treat and a part of every trip to San Francisco.

Cafe de la Presse is smack in the heart of the Union Square/Chinatown area making it well situated both for visitors and for locals who can park in the Sutter/Stockton garage a block away. The restaurant has a warm ambiance, attentive waitstaff and good food.

Have been to Cafe de Presse before and have enjoyed all aspects of the experience, but this time everything was just off. Our disappointment started at the front desk and continued with the food and service. We will be back and hope this time is the exception and all will be right again at Cafe de Presse.
Classic French food, simple but tasty. Tables are very close together.

Has a real Parisian bistro feel and atmosphere transported to San Francisco. Dinner for two with fresh salmon and seared tuna was well prepared. Our first visit made a very good impression. We'll be back.

Food was excellent and good attentive service . Everything done without delays but not rushed - as we had a theater date it was important for it all to be served on time . Also very reasonable cost considering the quality .

The food was excellent, but the service was a disaster. 10 minutes wait for water to first be put on the table. Another 10 minutes before the waitress come to take our order. Food same promptly after that.

The food was very good, tasted French indeed.
Baguettes were wonderful. Good wine service. Attentive service.
review_title: The food was very good, tasted

review: Simple fare but good in a nice "Parisian" style cafe atmosphere. We like it and go a few times a year.

Very very busy and even with their best attempts to stay on top of things, it was hectic. Cocktails arrived after our food order (though had been spefically requested to come before the meal). Food was good and hot and to order - kitchen seemed to be able to keep up, but bartender and waitstaff slipped behind into a frenzy.
review_title: Very very busy and even with

review: While the food is okay, the service needs work. The hosts were rude to us and our friends who met us for dinner and we had to ask for steak knives and water. Twice.
review_title: While the food is okay, the

review: Loved this place for a romantic brunch after a night in the city. Like going to Paris for a couple of hours. Also, making a reservation on open table seemed to get us a nicer table than walk-ins!

The food and service were good but the "hostess" (a woman employed at a restaurant to WELCOME and seat customers) was as pleasant and welcoming as a prison door. A restaurant is judged by its food, but the role of the welcoming committee is almost as important as the food itself. IfI was the restaurant manager, I would have a very serious talk with this woman and her attitude!
I joined friends for lunch and had the duck. It was the best duck I've ever had at a restaurant! I will look for an excuse to return to Cafe de la Presse so I can try it again.

We had a great experience the duck confit was superb---with many, many delicious mushrooms. The oysters superbly fresh and meaty and the macaroon--well who can beat a French macaroon? But the most outstanding was the woman who waited on us. She was by far one of the best waiters/waitresses I've ever had in the bay area. Attentive but not obtrusive, extremely helpful but not overbearing, charming and a definite plus to our evening.

Cafe de la Presse is a high quality French brasserie in the heart of San Francisco. The food is excellent and the wait staff are very professional. The dining room is beautiful and the Cafe section is very charming. I would happily come here for a special meal, or for a casual coffee date.
review_title: Cafe de la Presse is a high

review: I have dined at Cafe de la Presse on several occasions and I have never been disappointed. The service is superb, the atmosphere comfortable and quiet (one can actually converse with his companions without having to shout). The food is top drawer and affordable (not pretentious). The staff are knowledgeable about the food and wine selections and pairings. For this last dining experience, we (group of 5) celebrated my mother's 90th birthday. Although we were not able to arrange for a special cake, the chef made certain that my mother's selected dessert was spectacularly presented. My mother was so impressed with her dining experience that she asked to return the next evening to experience more of Cafe de la Presse. Again she was delighted.
review_title: I have dined at Cafe de la

review: Very charming and the people are so nice. And l love that you can talk -- tables not too close and noise level is moderate at most
Wonderful food the sole and the duck were fantastic! WE went for Christmas dinner and it was fabulous

The quintessential French bistro. Traditional fare such as cassoulet, duck confit, escargots and foie gras mesh well with more interesting creations like potato wrapped ahi. The food is consistently excellent with a decent wine list and good service. Located on the corner across the street from the Chinatown gates. The restaurant is quite large and walk-ins can usually get a seat but it can get busy so if you don't like to wait get reservations.
The service was very inconsistent.  Food quite good.  We've made several visits and on all occasions it was way too hot inside.  It's hard to have an enjoyable meal when one is drenched in sweat.

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: They accommodated a group of eight.  The service was very good and the food was excellent.
review_title: They accommodated a group of eight.  The...

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: Met a friend for lunch and as always it was great.  We both had the crab cobb...yum!

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: Joined visiting friends who were staying at the hotel on a Thursday evening for dinner, just to make it easy for them. Noise level was anominable and unavoidable throughout the restaurant, despite the fact that the bar is not even physically attached to the restaurant. Service was great and servers were very attentive and knowledgable about wine and food. Blew cheese salad as were described as OK and asparagus and mozzarella with tomato salads were bland and non-descript. Salmon and shrimp were nicely prepared, but the ribeye steak, and afterall this is a steak house, was thin and without flavor. Wildly expensive to boot. We would never return and I think our guests would hoof it to another restaurant should they stay at the hotel again.

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: The tables are not too close together so that it's easy to have a conversation. The service is efficient and attentive. And the ffod is good. It's all you can ask for when having a business lunch where the restaurant does not detract from the focus of your meeting.

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review:
I had dinner here last week while I was in San Francisco. Even though I was expensing the meal for a business trip, I definitely had sticker shock when I looked at the menu. My bill for a glass of wine, the chopped salad, and a 9oz filet was $90 with the tip.

The food was really good. The bread served with dinner is amazing. My only complaint about the food was that the smashed potatoes had way too much butter/cream in them. The steak was cooked perfectly.

The service was good. I rated it 3 stars because I definitely felt that I wasn't getting the same level of service as the tables who weren't dining alone. I rarely saw my server and was instead taken care of primarily by the support staff; this was not the case with other tables.

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: Server Mitch was very gracious and accommodating. Also, Bob's allowed us to use a side room with privacy; it was a client meeting and we discussed a number of topics which would have been very difficult in a more open setting.

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: Had the lunch special; seafood with palenta . Prepared well and had good flavor.

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: The steak was really good. It was well seasoned and cooked just the way I like. Love the fries!!!!!

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: For a Steak and Chop house it was very disappointing. I had to send my steak back as I ordered rare and I got medium. The steak was not very flavourful, and the menu was very limited. The bar food has been nice, but I don't see the point for the amount of money that the restaurant charges. I would just stick with the bar.

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: Below Average service. Waitress brought out wrong entree and I had to wait for my companions order and we also had to wait for a steak knife. MR was closer to MW. May have been a bad day as is has been better but the place was not crowded and the service should have been better.

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: I don't go here often because it's too expensive for what you get. The food is very good, but it does not justify the price. Interior decor is not interesting. Seems like a typical hotel where they overprice their food.
review_title: I don't go here often because

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review:
I have been to Bob's before in Dallas and had a great experience. I have also been to Bob's SF for lunch before and the food has always been reliable. But dinner was not a good experience. The food was solid and I had a great steak (although the asparagus side order was very bland). The meat was seasoned great and cooked perfectly. The side dishes were average to good.

However, the service was so bad that it ruined my experience. After my water was refilled for the third time by the bread and water guy, I finally had to ask the host to get us a waiter. Once he arrived he was friendly but he only appeared to take our order and bring our food. We ate early and it wasn't busy so I started to wonder if our waiter was also the cook.

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: Bob's is a reliable, if not spectacular Steakhouse. The location is great in the Omni Hotel downtown S.F. It has a very clubby steakhouse atmosphere - lots of wood and leather. Prices are typical steakhouse - high. But they do execute with large portions of very good food, stiff drinks, and good service - you get what you pay for!
review_title: Bob's is a reliable, if not

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: Despite the name, Bob's is also perfect for an executive breakfast!

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: I was on a lunch with a potential client. I ordered a steak medium rear but what they brought me was a steak that was well done. Given the situation, I did not think it was appropriate for me to make a fuss and send it back. When a steak house can't cook a steak properly, that's not a good thing!
review_title: I was on a lunch with a potential

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: A pleasant restaurant with friendly, accommodating service. Prices are higher than comparable steak restaurants. Both of our entrees were extremely oversalted.

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: I have to say, I took my family here for a birthday dinner after reading all the great reviews of Bob's Steak house. We unfortunately did not have the same great service or food as others may have previously. The Porterhouse for one being priced at $50 plus dollars does not even compare to what you can get at Morton's or Epic here in S.F. I was really shocked. On top of just a so-so meal I have to say what did it for me and why I am actually posting a review was the service. We got to there restaurant at 5:30 pm for dinner. We were the second group in the restaurant. They had 2 servers working and 2 wait staff. We did not get out of there until 8:20. We waited for a long time to receive dinner and dessert. In conclusion, I would not go back
review_title: I have to say, I took my family

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: I've never gone wrong at Bob's. Top quality, good value!
review_title: I've never gone wrong at Bob's.

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review:
The entire event at Bob's was exceptional and first class. Greeted graciously and had the best waiter San Francisco has ever produced; he saw to all our needs. The dinner was exquisite, starting with the ceasar salad, the tender rib eye steak, to the creamy creme brulee. And let's not forget that bread to die for... used to to sop up all those delicious juices from the steak.
This is one place I will visit again and again and highly recommend it to anyone and everyone.

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: Your restaurant is reliable and the service is probably the best in SF.  But, the menu could use some surprises.  It is dull. You might some clues from Aqua.  A little after dinner chocolate or a surprise from the kitchen just rounds out their pleasant dining experience.  But, having said this, your staff is the best - warm friendly and remarkably attentive.

rest_name: Bob's Steak & Chop House - San Francisco
review: The overall atmosphere at the restaurant is romantic and the steak is good.  The waiter has recommended their best steak but not the most expensive one - I was impressed.  I will certainly return to the restaurant again.

Set tasting menu with 7 dishes. We got the excellent wine pairings.
The first three dishes seemed to get better and better from a very good start, culminating in the wonderful cauliflower soup with mushroom and sweetbreads. 
The two meat dishes filled us up while keeping the high standard.
The deserts were a perfect finish with the rich French press coffee and tawny port.
Service was on point, with the team working together smoothly.
We had a 9 pm table (booked the same afternoon) and left very happy just before midnight.
$500 bill for two diners.

Requested for a salt free meal ( because of health issue ) for myself, request was sent when I make the booking on Opentable, then follow by email reply on the confirmation from the restaurant, and again when we arrived at the restaurant, the waiter said they have received the request. However, I don't think the meal was prepared salt free or at least low salt, very disappointed. If the restaurant do not prepare salt free meal, would be nice at least they can inform me they can't accommodate to special need or request.
review_title: Requested for a salt free meal ( because...

review: My daughter and I enjoyed their 7-course tasting menu last week.   Everything was very nicely prepared and presented, with most courses featuring fresh ingredients from their garden.  The service was excellent.  Plan for a long dining experience (2-3 hrs).

Came here for a birthday dinner. They were very accommodating with my request for gluten free dining. Seemingly simple dishes were packed with a plethora of favors. You could tell they took preparation.

The entire evening was delightful. The care that is demonstrated in every detail, leads to a truly memorable dining experience. The wine pairings enhance the experience and the server nicely explains the intent behind each selection. From the time the restaurant called to confirm and asked for any food allergies, to the moment we left, we felt pampered for my husband's birthday. The 7 course tasting menu is varied, with portions sized for you to be full, but not stuffed. Every ingredient offers texture and flavor and is clearly not one you would not make at home. This place is great for special occasions and for slow enjoyment.
We celebrated our anniversary there last week and had a very memorable meal. The food was amazing. We also did the wine pairing which was outstanding. Highly recommend it !
we had a great time at the restaurant, food and presentation are superb, outstanding service, attention to each and every detail
review_title: we had a great time at the

review: My expectations were high, and Sons & Daughters exceeded them! The special touches for the Birthday guest was much appreciated. Staff knowledge of the menu items, garden facts and wine was exceptional. Service was the quality of some of my favorite 3Michelin Stars venues in France. The execution of the top shelf ingredients was too wonderful to put into words. Many thanks to all there.

Definitely a place to try out for a special occasion or if one is feeling generous. Thoroughly enjoyable dinner, from the kitchen in the middle of the dining room, to the creative serving plates. Must try at least once, now time for me to save money again so I can take the rest of my family here.

This was our first experience with Sons & Daughters, having been recommended by friends who said it would be an extraordinary food experience. They did not disappoint! Of all the fine dining we have done over many years in many countries and in some of the biggest cities in the world, this ranks as one of our very top food experiences. The individual dishes are prepared meticulously, also an art form, and the tastes are fabulous. Plan on a few hours to sit, absorb and enjoy the cuisine. The wait staff were wonderful, the food preparations are great and the Chef de Cuisine, Duncan Holmes, has made a mark on the SF dining scene at an early age, with well deserved kudos from all who have dined here. We highly recommend Sons & Daughters!

LOVED the restaurant! Such great food and a great experience! Some of the reviews say that you will not be full at the end but we were stuffed! We had more than enough and thought everything was amazing!
Right up the next to Gary Danko for me. Vegetarian tasting menu option, with the flexibility to switch things out. Everything grown in a local garden in Los Gatos. One of my favorite meals ever.
Prix fixe menu (5 courses, only two choices per course), eclectic wine list, good service, small venue. It was a long (3.5 hours) but very pleasant evening.
Take your date to Sons and Daughters if you want to have a perfect evening.
review_title: Take your date to Sons and

review: This place blew our socks off...so to speak. A wonderful prix fix with some of the most inventive plates and imaginative taste combinations. Superb wines, thoughtfully selected to complement the exquisite food. The portions are small, but even these two big eaters were amply satisfied.

Fantastic little place with great food and friendly and prompt service....a bit pricey, and with wine it all adds up, but it's a wonderful place to enjoy creative cuisine, to be catered to, and to take your time in a comfortable setting.

This was the most outstanding new restaurant I've been to in a long time. Service was excellent. Food was creative, delicious and beautifully presented. For that level of quality, the prices were extremely reasonable. My only criticism was the noise level. Very difficult to hear my dining companions when the restaurant was full.
Fabulous. The food is similar to Gary Danko's - unexpected flavors paired with the perfect wine. We enjoyed every bite.

Excellent, inventive food beautifully presented, and the wine pairing was well-done (only one miss). Our server, however, was cold, dismissive, unsmiling, unenthusiastic and lazy. He clearly did not want to be there, and did not share info about the food that we heard other servers share. Our wine server was knowledgable though, and she was far more present. Our assessment was that Sons & Daughters will be great once they find servers who want to work in a place where the service is important.

Get a seat near the open kitchen to watch the action in a tiny space. Portions are small, but flavorful and intriguing. This is not for the meant and potato crowd. I would compare it to Saison or Coi but more affordable and casual.
review_title: Get a seat near the open kitchen

review:
Food is good, allmost excellent, but  everything else is not as good.

Arrive at the time you reserved your table, wait for half an hour, arrive at your table, wait for a further half hour to get the menu, wait for a further half hour to get the starter. Now one might think the wait is over, wrong, wait for a further half hour to get the second starter, then wait for a further half hour to get the entre,  now (the restaurant is allmost empty now) things speed up, the dessert is served without delay.

A dinner, supposed to start at 8, lasts until 11:30 just by having the mandatory four course menu.
review_title: Slowfood its not, but it is certainly slow.

review: When I first walked into the restaurant I was greeted with a friendly smile. We had reservations for 5:30 which was perfect for us because we're not the type who loves crowds. Because of the quality of this restaurant, the place fills pretty quickly. The food was delicious, the staff was knowledgeable and friendly as well as professional. It was our anniversary. The front desk wished us Happy Anniversary when we arrived and we received a hand written note at out table which I thought was very nice.

Not much of a creative, innovative-chef presence here anymore.  Good food.  Way overpriced because of the name.  Service was oddly slow and inattentive.  It is a shame to see a great chef cash it in to collect royalty checks.
Service was a bit inattentive for three men in suits and were willing to spend much more money than we did but service left us not wanting to stay longer.

I went to Michael Mina for the first time for my birthday this year. I told them ahead of time it was my birthday, and they had a card waiting for me signed by the GM thanking me for spending my birthday day there. I thought that was a nice touch. My date is a vegetarian, and they don't have any vegetarian options, so they put a pasta dish together for him anyway! The server was extremely accommodating. I asked for his suggestion, which was the duck. I've had duck before and while I like the flavor, it tends to be too fatty for me. This duck was different. The skin was perfectly crispy, with a thin layer of fat that wasn't slimy or chewy. Just perfectly cook and absolutely delicious. We also had a table by the window which was nice.

One of the best dining experiences I have had in SF. Great food, service and beautiful. Service is a combination of formal and friendly. It is a special occasion please that you could eat at twice a week. From the Maitre'D to the busboys it was top notch.
Very pretty, very friendly, very good food beautifully presented. And of course very expensive, but worth it

I treated my husband this holiday to a special evening of great food. Both he and I were in awe of the ambiance, food of course and the service. I appreciate the care and attention Michael Mina and his staff puts into the menu and the serving vessels that complimented each creation. Each course was timed just right and our waiter made many great suggestions to make our dining experience one that we will remember for a long time!
This place amazes me at how well they do everything flawlessly. Great food, great service. Perfect! We will never travel to SF without a stop here.

Love 5 star dining, but it is a challenge to get the experience and be able to please my two kids (11 & 15). Michael Mina was a fantastic dining experience, but didn't overwhelm the kids with inaccessible flavors nor a long drawn out service. The service was absolutely perfect. The food was fantastic, the kids said their steaks were the best they've ever had and they enjoyed all the dishes and tastes. The wine menu was excellent, the server recommended what turned out to be a perfect wine match. We were disappointed by the desserts. We had the dessert tasting menu, a little serving of each dessert offered, none were exceptional or even particularly enjoyable.

The food was very good, not excellent. Wine list was outrageous and outrageously expensive, clearly more than 100% mark up on some bottles. Food was very good, service was extremely knowledgeable but we did think we had been forgotten about at one point. May have been better as a date night, this was a business dinner.
review_title: Long wait between courses and wine

review: Food was excellent . Enjoyed our dining experience. Would recommend ( highly) to anyone.
Sure wish the waiter had told us the option for sparkling water - one glass for each of us (2) - would result in a $16 charge. Ridiculous. The food was good but not great.

The wagyu beef was definitely the highlight of the night: super rich, delicious flavour (very pricey, but worth it). Also enjoyed the oyesters and impressive accompanying dressings. Suckling pig was ok, have had better else where. Complimentary favoursome soup with mini cheese toast took comfort food to a whole new level whilst the complimentary desert delivered a party of flavours in my mouth. Also enjoyed the wine. Great table service: friendly and knowledgable waiter.

Great experience. Service was excellent and meal was outstanding.

Did not feel rushed during meal and pace of food delivery was great!

Would recommend any of the seafood dishes.
Great meal. Balanced flavors. Dessert flight was fantastic.
Excellent food. Great ambiance. I would highly recommend.
Just great. Food and service deserve top marks. Really interesting ingredients and combination. We loved it all and the tasting menu with paired wines was well worth it.
Great food, although not inexpensive. Would go back, would recommend it to a friend.

This review is a long time coming. I just had lunch there last month with my two daughters and it was as good as ever. The service is always very professional and friendly at the same time. The three of us had a relaxing time accompanied by great food!

Good experience. Waitservice was terrific. Professional and pleasant. Food is a little precious but certainly very good. However, like so many places, it is very LOUD. Difficult to hold a conversation without shouting. High ceilings need some sort of sound baffling.
I was underimpressed with the food overall. For the price there are many other places in the city I would recommend checking out.
A great dinning experience complimented with professional service.
Sevice was outstanding and decor stunning. Portions were very small.

We went to celebrate our anniversary there this past weekend and it was the perfect setting. The staff were very attentive and made us feel very special and welcomed. We were pleasantly surprised to find a "Happy Anniversary" card from the restaurant at our table when we arrived. I don't eat seafood so there weren't too many options but what I did have was still very good. The dessert sampler was well worth the money. Overall, we had a great experience.
New Year's eve 5 course dinner was fabulous!! Food and service excelled... attentive and friendly but not inrtrusive. Wine pairings were also outstanding.

This was our second trip to MM in the past couple months, first time for a spectacular dinner and this time for a late lunch. It excelled both times. The lunch menu is a bit more limited but every dish was terrific.
review_title: This was our second trip to

review: The chef's tasting menu was a winner - my favorites included the seared divers scallop (awesome presentation), the john dory (usually a mild and uninspired fish but at Michael Mina the tastes transformed this to a real wow! fish) and the sasparilla dessert. My tablemates loved the venison! Although it's a bit noisy for such a high end room, it's possible to carry on a conversation.

Had an absolutely wonderful time with my sister who was visiting from out of town. Seated a bit late but overall amazing food, great service, lively non-stuffy environment and great overall atmosphere

Together we had the:
grilled cheese/tomato soup amuse bouche - excellent
hors d oeuvres plate: crab tartlet was my favorite
Cherry Blossom Hamachi - quite good
Scallops - best scallops I've had
Lobster Risotto's - complimentary for the wait
bacon wrapped sturgeon - done perfectly according to sis
Lobster Pot Pie - Fantastic. well worth the hype/price!
Chef's Tasting Menu paired with wine was incredible.
Everything was amazing! From wine, starters, main courses, desserts and service. I wish I can eat here everyday.

Great food! We had the wagyu shabu shabu (props for presentation!) and the melon+prosciutto starters - both were wonderful. For the main courses we had the salmon and the lobster pot pie. Both were masterfully executed! I found the salmon to be a bit on the smaller size (they were probably 3x3in squares) though. The lobster pot pie is definitely highly recommended - I can see why it got all the rave reviews on various sites. We had the dessert sampler and loved the crisps! We went to Michael Mina for our first wedding anniversary and they definitely made us feel special! The little tastings were great too. We were joking that we had to celebrate little stuff more often, so we'd have an excuse to come back!
review_title: Great food! We had the wagyu

review: Food and ambiance was okay. For the amount of money for lunch for two($125.00), the food was ordinary.
We went on our anniversary and had an outstanding dining experience. I would highly recommend Michael Mina. They were very attentive to every detail and the food was over the top good.

We tried their tasting menu with wine pairings. The food and service were very good. They are making a comeback at their new location. The only problem is the noise level. With the high ceilings, brick walls, and the bar adjacent to the dining area, the noise level was too high. It was difficult at times to hear the waiters explain the menu items. This was the same problem when Aqua was there. They need an acoustical engineer to install appropriate interior decorations to reduce the noise level. I will probably dine here occassionally.

Michael Mina, the restaurant on California Street, deserves to be considered, among the best places to eat in San Francisco. Each plate demonstrates thought and preparation without attempting to be too clever. We trusted our server Jack Kopulsky and I wish I'd trusted the sommelier sooner. When the plates were presented the runners took the time to explain each part and ingredient.

Even though we like trying new restaurants it will be difficult not to return to Michael Mina whenever we're in San Francisco. It was, most likely, taken as a whole, in terms of the quality of food and service, the single most memorial evening of dining my wife and I have ever had.
A stellar dining experience, except for failure on the part of the waitstaff to notify us that they were ordering double orders and charging us accordingly.

The food was outstanding. The wine is very reasonably priced for an restaurant in this price range. The new location is a large open space which makes it a little more noisy than the previous location. Not a quiet romantic spot but the meal could not have been better

the restaurant is simply spectacular.....the updating to the space was down tastefully,,,its a warmer ambiance.....the food is exquisite,,,,great wine list,,,,,and there is poetic justice in Michael Mina taking up residence in the space that its namesake first made his reputation.

Food, presentation, and service were great, however everything we ordered and sampled was extremely salty (and I like salt!). Price was in the ballpark, considering the quality, variety, and preparation of ingredients.

I missed some of the dishes from Michael Mina's at the St. Francis (beef trio!) but thoroughly enjoyed our meal anyway. Particularly the crudo, the crispy skin fish and the passionfruit panna cotta and chicharon!
review_title: I missed some of the dishes

review:
Fantastic food coupled with superior service by the staff. The foie grois PB&J was phenonmenal as was the Braised Short Rib entree.
It was a wonderful evening and a perfect place to celebrate a special occasion.
the food is top quality, the presentation of the dishes, the fish is fresh. A unique experience if you like Japanese food. I would recommend it for special ocassions, as it is not cheap
Absolutely delicious. Some of the best sushi I've had in this city!
I almost don't want to review this because this is a small place and I will definitely be back many times! Incredible sushi, great sake, and absolutely fantastic service.

I am just visiting so I was not sure of the timing. I came 10 minutes early. My appointment was 11:30 - when they open. I was tired from the walk and would just like to sit. They will not allow it. A lady was sitting at the bar. I thought she was a cusotmer. Their reason of not letting me sit down is they are not ready and people will see if I sat down and think they are open. The hostess is sitting down like she is a customer. The hostess is snooty. She asked if I have reservation and from her reaction she wished I did not. The wait staff is nicer.

The shrimp tempura is ordinary but the sushi and sashimi are top quality.
Fish was impeccable, the sauces were delicate and delicious. Prices were reasonable for the quality of the sushi!
Amazing salmon, ikura, tuna, hamachi, hotate! Everything is great here. Just come for the fish. You're missing out if you order anything else.

It was OK. It took a little while to get a table even though we had a reservation. Service was OK, we had to remind them of two of the things we ordered, he was ready to give us the check before that.
review_title: It was OK. It took a little

review: Great food - some of the best sushi / sashimi you will find near the financial district.
review_title: Great food - some of the best

review: One of the best Sushi Restaurants I know. The food was exzellent and the service was very frendly.
review_title: One of the best Sushi Restaurants

review: We had a wonderful meal. We just told the waiter the general parameters of what we liked and told him to keep bringing food....and he did. It was a fantastic meal.
Had a fantastic NYE dinner at Akiko's... just tried it on a whim as we had a hotel room nearby and are SO glad we did. Service was outstanding and so was the food! We'll definitely be back.

What a great find!!! Best sushi ever!!! I discovered this restaurant on yelp and read the reviews. Based on those reviews I decided to give it a try. So glad I did. I was celebrating my bachlorette party and there was 6 of us. The accomadations were great. They were friendly and gave great suggestions on what to order and how much to order for our group size. The only thing that this restaurant can improve on is service. I read this in other reviews on yelp. I was hoping to be proved wrong. Our server was knowledgable and friendly but just not the most efficient. Definitely an area to improve upon.
We went to Max's before the ballet.  They did not have our reservation but seated us anyway.  Dinner was good and service was good.  We did not get to sit near the piano, though.
My husband enjoyed a delicious Reuben, loaded with corned beef and I had the ultimate grilled cheese. Nothing fancy, just delicious! Easy walk to the SF Jazz Center. Free parking in Sunday.
review_title: Can't beat Max's for pre-concert meal.

review: Food OK but feel the quality has gone down a bit.  For instance, the Guy's chicken salad is FILLED with cardboard tasting, chow mein type  crunchy noddles, so much so that you can't taste the lettuce. Chicken is fried to the point of being too dry.  This is the 3rd time I"ve ordered this dish, so it is not just a fluke, and someone at the table who ordered this salad was annoyed by the same observation. A comment from two other persons at our table said the mushroom fettucchini had too much herbs, "it was like having tough tree branches in the dish".  They too had noticed the same thing  the last time they ate at Max's.  Time for who ever is in charge in the kitchen, to sample at least these two dishes and make some adjustments.

We know we can count on Max's for a delicious meal before the symphony with time for coffee and dessert and still maker the ore symphony talk. It's hard to pass up the Prime rib special on Saturdays with a glass of Alexander valley Cabernet. Not an elegant place, but good food and quick service.

The hamburger was tasteless. I asked for a pickle, but it never came. The waitress forgot my cabbage soup, then brought it with the hamburger. The soup was good but greasy. It took a long time to get the bill. It was a busy night and they seemed understaffed. I should have ordered the Rueben,

This spot is only one block away from the war memorial opera house which makes it convenient for opera lovers to have a quick bite before indulging into their favorite music. Staff was friendly and efficient. The food is pretty average, nothing really special. We had the tagliatelle Alfredo with mushrooms. They were a little too dry and the mushrooms had no taste. The baby burger we ordered were in fact three baby burgers and much more than we'd expected. We ordered Espresso since we had seen they have a huge professional Espresso machine. But unfortunately, the coffee came without the mandatory crema on top and was only a little more than lukewarm.
We liked the overall atmosphere with life piano music and the floor to ceiling windows.

Max's Opera Caf in San Francisco is the perfect spot for pre-performance dining. The service is friendly, the food is great, and the piano player and singing waiters are a wonderful addition to an overall lovely experience.

Three of us met at Max's on Mother's day. It was packed!

I warned my out of town guests the portions are generous and to be prepared to share.

We all ordered something different and were satisfied.

Very nice brunch.

Great service and live music from a jazz pianist who can play almost any classic jazz piece off the top of his head. The hostess sang "Sway" for us upon request and made it look so easy! Desserts were so-so... the baked goods weren't very fresh and overly sweet. I'd go back for the ambiance, service, and entertainment. Maybe we'll try the appetizers next time.

While I've had some good food at other Max's locations over the years, this one was a real disappointment. The matzo ball soup was tiny and tasted like Campbell's soup from a can! The caesar salad was okay, the salmon not so great. Good service though. I will probably not return - especially since the prices were high relative to quality of food.
review_title: While I've had some good food

review:
Perfect for before ballet, symphony, etc. not what
it used to be, but still totally acceptable.
A pleasant place with good service following a busy "civic" center performances arena.
Great food, excellent service. A favorite place to dine before the opera, ballet or symphony.
Max's is a local favorite. Food is good, especially salads and sandwiches, but not gourmet. We go when on our way to evening events like theater.

when i worked in the city we used to love to come to Max's. however, their menu has changed. Food is not as good anymore. the side are soggy and old, fries are soggy (used to be soooo crispy and thin and delicious), bread was soggy. i was also told that they would not make me a 1/2 sandwich at dinner time. really wasted food never seems like a good idea but ok. The singing was fun and our waiter was great. Seems like there has been management changes. too bad.
review_title: when i worked in the city

review: Great place for $1 house oysters on weekends! I've had the best French toast here yet. I'm excited because they change up their menu from time to time.  Seasonal ones as well! Highly recommended.

I ordered the Saba filet sandwich as part of the lunchbox special which I did not care for. It was very fishy. The soup that came before was absolutely delicious - a potato cauliflower blend. My friends both loved their choices - the tuna melt and the veggie patty. Definitely want to go back and try something different.
review_title: Wish I had ordered something else

review:
This place was a hit. I would say I had a similar experience with Saison in terms of refined dishes. As I am Japanese from Japan, I could tell they used the ingredients only Japanese chef would use, like Nikki (Japanese cinnamon) in the Coconut milk panna cotta.

The ambiance was good. Although I was surprised by some groups who brought their infants. Luckily they didn't cry to break the mood.

The location was actually a little sketchy, yet easy to park.

Skool is a great spot tucked away in a corner of the Design District. The Blowfish heritage is clearly there but this is no cookie-cutter repeat, with more emphasis on cooked Japanese fare and a selection of more westernized staples such as the great Kobe burger. With a choice of indoor and outdoor seating, it's a great spot for weekday lunches but also for weekend brunches.

Skool is a delicious addition to San Francisco's food scene. We were impressed with the Inventive dishes that were presented beautifully in a aesthetically pleasing environment. Our waitress was friendly and informative and the vibe of the place was inviting
to guests of all ages - from hipsters to oldsters. My compliments to the design team who met the challenge of creating an inviting spot in the midst of a desolate area at night.
The noise level was the only distraction, too loud for two people to easily talk across the table.
review_title: The noise level was the only

review: wonderful, inventive food. Excellent service. Much too noisy, taking away from the enjoyment of the food. On a cold night the room can be chilly; note the heater at the entrance; didn't help the rest of the room.
