What a beautiful restaurant! The ambiance created was very sensual and chic. As for food, the chef appears to be very texture-oriented. The strongest dishes were the creamy ones - the uni flan and scallop risotto. The flan had moments of delight from the way the roe burst on the tongue in contrast to the velvety flan. The halibut dish was southern themed, arriving with okra and polenta. From the moist, flaky fish to the firm okra to the yummy, starchiness of the polenta, the textures shone. However, the flavors of the dish were incredibly bland. The honey lavender panna cotta is an initial jolt to the senses but then the lavendar overpowers and recalls potpourri. Nevertheless, Skool makes for a fun, special night out!
Japanese? Italian (two pastas and two risottos)? Funky school-house theme? This restaurant feels and tastes confusing.

A cozy and chic restaurant, that serves food that is prepared and presented so beautifully. The atmosphere is very warm. Our waiter was top notch, friendly and funny. A rare combination. This little gem will be on our fav. list.

Took my partner and two of our friends here for New Year's Eve dinner. Skool is in our neighborhood and we had been wanting to try it for quite sometime. While the price for the 5 course fixed menu was high the food and service were excellent. There was a choice between seaweed crusted turbot and sirloin tips for the main course. The atmosphere is small and cozy. Perfect for a couples night out. There is also a nice outdoor seating area, but it was not being utilized for New Year's Eve. The patio would be great fun on a warmer San Francisco Evening. Overall, good experience.

The food here is phenomenal and enjoyed in a relaxed romantic setting. Following a delicious half dozen oysters on the half shell and the sake flight, I had the Alaskan Black Cod and my date had the Chef's Rock Shrimp Risotto. As I haven't had Black Cod in a while, so this was especially a treat that did not disappoint. Perfectly cooked, the Cod was moist and tender and skin was seasoned to perfection. I tried my date's risotto and it was outstanding as well with a bold flavor, more so than than the more subtle Cod. Service was good with a cheery maitre d' and waiter, though the waiter disappeared at the tail end of the meal. The maitre d' was more than helpful and took care of everything.

Love the food, creative and delightful taste sensations! A bit loud due to the floors, etc., normal for most restaurants of this nature. Cool, hip and contemporary. Loved the ability to park! Nice service, beautiful presentations, everything we were looking for.
Loved the ambience and decor. Very modern yet comfortable. The "Skool" theme was clever and cute. The service was wonderful and so was the food. Gotta get the fries to share!

The menu items sounded so exotic and flavorful but I was disappointed that they didn't live up to their promise. Everything actually tasted quite bland and was in need of a lot more seasoning. The atmosphere was great. I'd come back her for a drink but I'm not too excited to try the food again.

Service was great from our waitress who helped us explain the different menu selections. She even recommended the squid ink past for my daughter who has to eat soft food due to braces. The pasta was delicious. The rest of us enjoyed the salmon sandwich, mushroom fries, red snapper crudo, crab sandwich and nicoise salad. The ambiance is lovely. I will definitely recommend this new restaurant to my friends for its fresh and delightfully tasty dishes.

address: One Embarcadero Center, Promenade LevelSan Francisco, CA  94111
review:
loved it 10 years ago. still great today
their tikka marsala is the benchmark! 

many othrr great dishs as well

address: One Embarcadero Center, Promenade LevelSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: The food was OK but the ambiance have dropped quite a bit from the late eighties when it was at the Ghiradelli Square.
review_title: The food was OK but the ambiance

address: One Embarcadero Center, Promenade LevelSan Francisco, CA  94111
review: Nice food. Not greasy like regular main stream Indian Restaurant. Can improve on service a lot. Drink menu is okay but I would go to Elephant Bar if I have go out for drinks before dinner. Pricey.
review_title: Good Food. High Price. Avg Service

review: The service and whole experience seemed a bit rushed, though it was very busy for Valentine's Day.  The food was not as good as it normally is; the potatos in particular are normally incredible but blas this time.
I've been to Spiazzo many times and have never been disappointed.  Good food, price and service.
Intersting menu, excellent food, great waitstaff. I will go back.
A wonderful addition to West Portal. Consistently good, great daily specials and caring service. Well run by owners who are on site always.
Our table (booth) was ready exactly on time. The service was great as was the food. It was New Year's and they were efficent

We are regulars at Spiazzo now after two years. The food at our most recent outing was as good as the previous occasions. However, I need to make note of a couple issues. Firstly we (obviously) made Open Table reservations and requested a booth as usual. When we arrived before our reserved time to a packed restaurant there was no booth that was on reserve for us. We had to wait at least 20 minutes. On previous occasions the staff really did have our table waiting for us. We were thanked for waiting but that was all. Another thing was upon seating one of the servers (not our main server) asked if we'd like bread which was weird. We know that all diners get bread upon being seated, and we've never been asked before.

Overall, the food was quite good. A minor note -- the two items we ordered that contained fresh tomatoes (a roasted veg appetizer and the fettucini with shrimp) suffered from pale, bland, underripe tomatoes, and this at the end of September, when tomatoes are still in season! Heirlooms, or any better quality tomato, would have elevated the dishes. The servers race through the dining room, making it hard not to feel rushed. Oh, and the restaurant had no record of our Open Table reservation (though a table was available) and did not offer dining points.

This is a neighborhood gem - we frequent this place for many years because we work and live in the neighborhood.  The food is always excellent, service friendly - the owner knows my husband by name and always comes by to say hi.  Stay away from the dessert though - I haven't had anything worth the while.

I have enjoyed this restaurant for many years. The food is consistently good, and there are choices for light meals to feasts. I particularly like the fish and pasta meals. The service is very attentive, and I always feel welcomed back. Also a good choice for dessert after a movie.

Good menu choices, fish is wild (not farmed), pleasant and knowledgeable service, amazing pumpkin cheesecake, very convenient to SF city hall public (safe) parking garage across street....and an easy walk to Opera, Symphony, etc.
Mostly used by theater patrons however should not be kept just for them.

How could a place that calls itself a "Lounge" be out of Bombay Sapphire at 6pm on a Saturday? Walk to the nearest store and buy a couple bottles, bartender!! Food was very average.  The only saving grace was our helpful, apologetic server.
Great food, nice place to dine before going to the theater.

We chose this restaurant for its proximity to the theater with a 7pm show. We arrived 15 minutes earlier than reservation to an empty restaurant;bar was lively. Seated immediately with smiling service. We waited until our 4th person arrived to order. Service went downhill immediately. Our drinks were slow to arrive. Salads arrived without dressing (but were tasty once we got the dressing). We asked about 4 times for our hamburgers. Finally at 6:20 they arrived. The waiter offered 20% off the meal with apologies. I asked for another 20% which was declined. Our burgers, while really good, were gulped down in 10 minutes. They offered to comp a taxi for us but said it probably wouldn't arrive in time. Stay away!

Once again, the service is pretty lousy. Usually the food ranges from good to excellent, but in this case it was decent but not great. As has happened before, we have to get up from the table to fetch a waiter to get what we needed. They also didn't bring everyone's order at once, they brought someone's drink halfway through the meal. They are pleasant when they come to the table but they just don't come to the table, and if they do they are usually very slow and forgetful. I only go there for business lunches because it's the only place around.

We had dinner here before a performance. Fortunately we had a reservation. Very crowded as there are so few restaurants that open at 5:30 near the Opera House. Service was ok, but fairly slow. Food was hearty and good.

The food was very good but service was uneven. We ordered drinks and after a while they did not arrive. The manager came by asking if we needed anything and when we said we had already ordered drinks they finally arrived. Also, one item ordered didn't appear until we received our check.

I will give them another chance.
review_title: The food was very good but

review: Overall, good experience. We would go back for the food & wine, delicious food & good portion size, but hope we get a different server. She was friendly when we saw her, but didn't see her much and didn't get the water we asked for upon sitting down until after we were done eating our entrees(and asked for it two more times).
Reliable choice for dinner before going to the theatre.

We have been here several times. It is our "go to" place when we have tickets to events in the area. Each time we have the same experience. This is a fabulous place. The food is always exceptional, and the service is equally phenomenal. Lea has helped us a couple of times and is gracious, warm and checks in appropriately taking care of every need. We look forward to returning soon.
We had a wonderful lunch and a great experience - food and service were wonderful.
review_title: We had a wonderful lunch and

review:
First problem was when we arrived BEFORE our reservation at 6pm - and the restaurant was empty - they put our party of 4 right next to the service entrance where the water, etc. was held. We asked to be moved immediately (since the entire restaurant was empty) and the service person said there were "other" reservations. Huh? I said, I'd made the reservation 6 weeks ago, and that doesn't count?
They did finally move us away from the bar and service route... but I thought that was NOT a good way to begin our evening.
Food was fine. Very small menu. And the waiter did finally give in to our request for 2 free desserts with our 4 opera tickets - instead of the one she said they allowed. Opera websites says free dessert with opera ticket.
Great place for dinner if you're going to the Orpheum Theater.

I came here with two friends for dinner before going to the ballet. We had a nice experience but nothing exceptional. The hostess, bartender and waitress were all friendly and attentive and provided good service. The atmosphere was cozy and intimate and an appropriate setting for a dress up girls' night. The food was good though standard. Our table ordered the vegetarian risotto, the fish and chips which were good. The only disappointment was the hamburger that had an off flavor that reminded us of hotdog.... Overall it was a good pre-show option and I would go back, but not in itself a destination restaurant.

First time for our varied group at Soluna. Food was very good indeed, and our waiter was a gem. Everyone was impressed and planned to come again to try other items on the menu, as every person's dish was a winner.

The food was both interesting and tasty. Lots of different combinations that were well done. Catered to my special dietary needs with no fuss and extra care. Did the prefix which was lots of food. The only thing lacking was the dessert (fried apple pie) was interesting but just "okay" otherwise it would have been an outstanding on the food.
Tight tables but the fabric draping and soft furnishings really helped keep the noise level down.
Easy to get a reservation before the opera. Fast and good.

Amazing! The staff took time to actually talk to us and see what we were doing in town tonight, which happened to be seeing Wicked a few blocks down from the restaurant. The cheese plate was wonderful, my mom enjoyed the grilled romaine and the generous mushroom raviolis, even my picky sister was able to get something that she licked the plate, the poached ahi was great along with the desserts paired with the great service made our trip memorable.
lunch service is ridiculously slow... food's good, but we didn't have time to enjoy it

My wife and I went here before Wicked and, for us, it was a great choice and would definately return if in the area. It's just a nice, romantic, comfortable, quiet, friendly restaurant with reasonable prices and good service. Isn't that what we're all looking for in a pre-event venue???
review_title: My wife and I went here before

review:
My five cousins and I had a girls night out on a Saturday. The food was wonderful, prompt and hot. We all tasted each others dishes and the phrase, "Oh my God, that's incredible" were used more often than not.
The wait staff was efficient and friendly, even though we were probably making a bit more noise than they're used too!
The restaurant is smallish and the decor is classy so I can see this being the perfect spot for romantic meal.
We will most definitely be returning.
review_title: My five cousins and I had

review: Great eggs benedict!! Service was A+ with fresh coffee, a smile, and fast service.
We were a little apprehensive when we found the restaurant. From the outside it looks a little run down but inside it is a gem. Great food and wonderful service. We would definitely return.

The food was very good. I would call it bistro fare, with a fresh, local/sustainable bent. I had pecan encrusted chicken with watermelon poblano relish, and it was amazing. My husband had the lamb chop with blue cheese risotto, which was very good but rich. My kids (14 and 10) shared a caesar salad and each ordered the mac & cheese appetizer as an entree, and both loved it. Good, unusual drinks, too. They made some of their alcohol drinks nonalcoholic, e.g. a strawberry mint spritzer that tasted like crushed strawberries, and a lemon/basil one that was refreshing. Good locations right across from the Asian Art Museum and Civic Center Park. I would go back.
review_title: The food was very good. I

review: Nice place to go when headed to the orpheum. Dependably good food and service. Didn't reel rushed getting to the theater. Service is friendly.
review_title: Nice place to go when headed

review: We have been to Soluna at least half a dozen times over the past 3 years or so.  This time nothing shone.
review_title: We have been to Soluna at

review: The night were ate there the diners were mostly very young.
review_title: The night were ate there the

review: We went to the restaurant after seeing Wicked. The service was great and so was to food. I would go back again.
Enjoyed Crab BLT and Chicken Breast sandwiches with garlic french fries and tossed greens. Service was very good and enjoyed the convenience to the Asian Art Museum.

It was an unusually warm evening in San Francisco and there was no a/c available.  There was no attempt made to circulate the air with any type of fan or cooling system.
The service was extremely slow and virtually nonresponsive w/o prompting from our party.
Will not patronize this establishment in the future.  Very disappointing.
review_title: It was an unusually warm evening

review: the tables were way too small for the size plates that were used, my salad plate took up at least half the table. the waiter put the bread basket down on top of my tablemate's plate. the service was waaaaay toooo slow. we even let them know that we had an 8 pm event. they did not put correct charges on the bill (we were so late we just let it go!)food was warm but not hot like you would like. the noise level was too high, but we were very close to the speakers overhead, and the bar tender did lower the volume at one point. sorry but we won't be back.
review_title: the tables were way too small

review:
Great wine recommendations.  Food was delicious, but small portions.
Great cocktails too.

Very small place and yet the hostess was confused in locating my reservation. Server acted as if we had never eaten out and talked down to us. He was put out and being asked how the lamb was prepared. Really? The lamb was very fatty and below expectations. The risotto with shaved white truffle was only so-so. We enjoyed the salad with the almonds but you didn't get to taste the pear since they had cut it into such small pieces. The wine WE selected was good but overall the food was nothing special.

We dined at 54 Mint on Saturday evening on a last minute decision, having just finished a wine tasting at another location. Our service was very good as was our pasta and wine. We were seated in the lower dining area. It was a quite warm there as it was very warm in SF that evening. I would recommend this restaurant for fun, casual dining.

I am local to SF and love 54 Mint.  What I especially love is the relaxed pace of dining where you do not feel like you are rushed.  The food is very fresh and I will be back again and again.  I had the truffle pasta
Excellent food and easy to get a table. Great for business meetings. Went there two days in a row. The fish was wonderful.
review_title: Quiet and off the beaten track

review: Good food but service a little lacking. I had the fettuccine with mushrooms and it was tasty, though nothing spectacular. But from the minute we walked in the door we got a little cold shoulder. Not rude but a little off. I probably wouldn't recommend.

We arrived on time but needed to use the elevator for my mom, so the host was immediately annoyed. He seated us without giving us menus. The waiter was more friendly. He was knowledgeable about the menu but seemed a bit harried and impatient. The food was fine, appetizers delicious. However, the husband had ordered a cappuccino before the appetizers but it never arrived. When I ordered a coffee drink, later, we mentioned it. The waiter didn't seem to believe us and went and spoke to the busboy, twice. Strange to be questioned a couple of times, as if we wouldn't remember whether the drink arrived or not. The busboy finally realized that he had to delivered it to the wrong table--so the two coffees were taken off the bill. Just a bit odd.
review_title: We arrived on time but needed

review:
I had high hopes for this place. Good was good but lazy, my lardons weren't rendered and squishy
Bacon is just gross.
The waiter seemed annoyed that we were even there.
Owner was charming and engaged with his customers, but we felt like we were stuck in the middle of the room
In everybody's way. (Our table was dead in the middle and wasn't cozy)
review_title: I had high hopes for this

review: Food and service were excellent but we were seated at a table at the bottom of the stairs, on the way to the rest rooms.

I found the overall experience at 54 Mint poor. The service was really bad, our waiter completely forgot about us and also some of our dishes. The pasta was undercooked however the flavors were decent not bland. The watermelon salad was the highlight of our chosen dishes. The prices are high and so is the noise level. There seemed to be mostly tourist and the atmosphere was boring. I think if you want Italian food there are much better options in SF.
Went at lunch. Nice place. Staff Courteous and atentive. Good food. It was a little noisy.

Excellent food. If you don't know Italian wines, our
server Omar was very helpful in our choice.
Had lunch with my coworkers. They have a great 2 course menu for $15. Order the ginger ale! It is so good.

Great food as always!! Just Superb.
Service seemed to be a little flustered this time.
Our Server was knowledgable and good but he'd disappear for periods of time....and did not take our order. once our order was placed, the food came quickly so no problem there.
Overall a good experience.
Really bad service, if you would even call it that. The menu looked great but the food was awful. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. I will never eat there again.

The gnocchi were ethereal, light as air, and the rich but very light ragu was superb. Some of the best in the City. Fantastic octopus carpaccio. Outside dining area leaves a lot to be desired, a bit bare, uninviting and sterile. They could take a few pointers from their neighbor Chez Papa in creating some al fresco ambience

My girlfriend and I decided to have our New Year's Eve dinner at 54 Mint and were very pleasantly surprised with everything. We definitely recommend this as a date restaurant because of its casual atmosphere and chic appearance. We dined upstairs and the tables were close quarters but we didn't mind because we ended up chatting with our neighbors. Service wise, we were seated immediately and Sabrina, our server was a pleasure to talk to. She made excellent wine recommendations and made sure we were satisfied through the entire night. The food was terrific. My lamb skewers had the perfect amount of char with a nice little kick. The risotto was moist and tender. The filet mingon was absolutely delicious. We will definitely be back!

We had lunch at 54 Mint and it was great. It's a small and cozy restaurant with a great staff and wonderful food. It was very quiet when we were there; only one other table filled. I highly recommend 54 Mint and would most definately eat there again.
review_title: We had lunch at 54 Mint and

review: The food was mediocre at best. My salmon was flavorless, my girlfriend's lobster ravioli was underspiced and my girlfriend's mother's Osso Bucco was flavorless, and not gluten free as it was billed. Beyond that, the service was poor. The waitress made it to our table three times during the meal, didn't refill water until we were leaving despite being asked three times and took close to 20 min to get us the check. I don't recommend it.
Food was OK. Too many choices. Everything missed the mark a little.
review_title: Food was OK. Too many choices. Everythin...

review: The food was super good and you definitely get your moneys worth with the bottomless mimosas. However, the service was very slow and mediocre. The waitress was kind of rude half of the time and we had to wait 30 minutes before anyone came to take our food orders. We were there an hour before we got anything to eat and then the owner had the nerve to try and rush us out the door! It was quite unfortunate considering I loved the ambience of the place and, like I said, the food was quite yummy.
review_title: Great food, not so great service

review: the restaurant's menu is to die for.. you dont want to finish it yet because you want to savor each bite; plus our server Nolan was amazing and friendly!

We had a reservation for 6 people at 12pm for brunch on Sunday. When we arrived, the hostess informed us that a few reservations had arrived 30 minutes late that morning, and as a result everything was backed up. What she didn't indicate was that we would need to wait an hour. She didn't even bother taking down the name under which the reservation had been made because that's how little a reservation mattered that day. When we would occasionally check in to find out how much longer we had to wait, she would always say, "Let me get rid of that table and you can be next." The food definitely helped redeem the overall experience. They have a good brunch menu with lots of variety. Too bad all of us had been soured by the reservation debacle.

Slipped in for an early NYE dinner; good menu and the prix fixe dinner was attractive and fairly priced but we opted for a la carte. Food was delicious and the wines we ordered were good. Only mild complaint was the service was a bit erratic but then it was a very busy evening for them.
We will go back.
review_title: Slipped in for an early NYE

review: Excellent food and service, and reasonably priced. What a treat! Food looks beautiful on the plate, and tastes as good as it looks. My new fave restaurant.

We had such a great time here. Wait staff was so attentive but not aggressively so...it was just the right amount. It was our first time there and they were always happy to give a recommendation when asked or to answer a question.
Every course was so delicious and flavorful. Definitely recommending to friends and will be back!
review_title: We had such a great time here.

review: Food was good, service was a little slow considering there were only 1 other couple when we went. It was a early dinner

I made reservations at Triptych for my birthday brunch last Sunday. I had never been before but was recommended by a friend who had been a few months ago. They were able to fit in a party of 10 at noon and I will be honest, the featured special of bottomless mimosas did influence my decision to pick this restaurant. I loved that they feature all local art on the walls and local organic ingredients in their dishes. We were greeted by a very friendly staff and immediately ordered mimosas when we sat down while we waited for the rest of the group to arrive. They have 4 flavors...traditional OJ, raspberry, mango and grapefruit. The ambiance was perfect and the food was delicious. Oh try the beignets! Overall a great experience, thanks Triptych!

Went with a large group for my fiancee's birthday, late on a Sunday evening; practically had the place to ourselves. Great service, good drinks, excellent food. I hadn't had the buffalo drumsticks appetizer before; very tasty. Although the consensus at the table was that folks were too full for dessert, the owner wouldn't let us escape without a free birthday cake (a single-serve chocolate lava cake, which got passed around the table so everyone could have a bite or two).
review_title: Went with a large group for

review: We had a great meal on a Wednesday night. Food is fresh with an interesting twist - try the grilled octopus salad for example. Only one other couple the night we went so try going during the week if you don't like crowds.
review_title: We had a great meal on a Wednesday

review: A nice brunch option in SOMA/San Francisco, Tryptych offers a variety of brunch items on the weekend. Definitely start off with sharing some beignet or crab cakes over some mimosa. The french toast was not bad, I liked their creme fraiche topping the most. Check out their quinoa & tofu based vegan dish that is surprisingly tasty even to a person like myself who loves to eat steak/BBQ/meat dishes. Outdoors seating is covered by an overhang and limited to about 6 tables of 2-4 people, but it's definitely worth to try especially on a sunny day. Inside decor has some interesting artwork. Street parking is fairly easy on Sunday, will definitely keep this place in mind for brunch in the city!
review_title: A nice brunch option in SOMA/San

review: Velantine's day meal. Beet salad flavors seemed to clash. Can't quite put my finger on it, but neither my girlfriend or I cared for it. We were already sitting down when the couple next to us came in. Even though we ordered before they did, and got our first course before they did, they got their main courses, deserts and check before we got our respective service. My duck was quite fatty (and not melt-in-your-mouth or crispy-fatty...just rubbery fatty) and was uncomfortably underdone. I've cooked duck before and know that it will have a different appearance that chicken even though it's "done" but ths was underdone for me. I cooked it further in a skillet the next day and it was fine. Her beef was tasty and nicely cooked.

We enjoyed this restaurant participating in Dine Out America to feed hungry children! A nice evening on the patio, great food, great service, and overall a positive outcome. Great music too!

We will go back!

First negative restaurant review in 6 months of great Open Table dining!!! A fun day was spoiled (temporarily) by walking into Triptych and being completely ignored for about 10 minutes. Sullen guy waited on people to our left and people to our right (who we moved over to make room for, because they walked in later). Heard disgruntled comments like "Sorry, it's too late" spoken by a group who was leaving, to a waiter holding a dish. A loud argument heard in the kitchen. A woman to the left of my husband looked at him and at the waiter and said "I need a drink!"----By contrast, we then went to a busy, chaotic AT&T store and caught the eye of a staff person who IMMEDIATELY gestured where to go to sign in. The food was better, too!

The restaurant was empty when we walked in, but had early reservations. By the time we left, the place was hopping. The food was great, although the fennel salad was kind of gritty, almost like the lettuce wasn't completely washed. The bacon wrapped dates were awesome. I had the oso buco, which the meat fell right off the bone. The food was delicious and nicely presented. It was a nice find for a new dining experience.

I was visiting from out of town and we picked this restaurant because one of our guests said that two of their friends are regulars.

We enjoyed the food, but the waiter was lackadaisical. He apologized, saying he was back after not working there for two years. It was hard to catch his eye and we constantly had to remind him about our order.
review_title: I was visiting from out of

review: When I first arrived, I had to wait over 5 minutes for someone to say "hello" and acknowledge me.  I was told that the restaurant was running behind.  After being seated and placing our order, we waited for one hour before our food was served.  It wasn't until 45 minutes before our waitress mentioned anything and provided a complimentary appetizer.  Overall, I was very disappointed with the service and wait!
review_title: When I first arrived, I had

review: Had the French onion soup - mmm - as a starter, then the pot roast with mashed potatoes. Service was great. Would definitely recommend this restaurant to others.

This tiny restaurant on California Street is a lovely little gem. I had the chicken picatta, and it was delightful. The lemon caper sauce really made the dish. My wife had the risotto and it was excellent. The coffers at the end of the metal was strong and the cup a generous sized vessel. The peace is very relaxed. I wouldn't recommend it for the hurried.

I always order the same thing when I go here, but they make the best chicken and mushroom risotto in town. The array of desserts is incredible and their pear salad with candied walnuts always hits the spit. They also make delicious French onion soup.
review_title: Best chicken and mushroom risotto i

review: Best omelets..the ricotta spinach scallion as well as the pesto are the ones I always order..great potatoes as well....a feel good kind of place

The owner is still trying to do everything by himself and when the restaurant is full (and it was) he CAN'T keep up. He didn't even get around to taking our order until more than 15 minutes had passed. Our bottle of wine came AFTER our food. We used to marvel at how he was able to keep up but that is no longer the case. He needs to hire a professional waiter.

I brought a date to the Curbside Cafe on a Saturday night and found the Curbside Cafe to be the perfect setting for a great dinner. The restaurant is small but well organized to offer comfortable privacy and an enjoyable atmosphere. We ordered appetizers, entrees and wine and were extremely satisfied by all. The wait-staff was prompt and attentive and even allowed us to switch tables when another couple left. The Curbside Cafe is a great Fillmore restaurant and I look forward to going back.
review_title: I brought a date to the Curbside

review: We loved Curbside Cafe! Great ambiance, excellent service, delicious food, superb wine list. Outstanding experience.

We went to this restaurant after a local concert. There were very few people at the restaurant which was a surprise given the excellent service and the tasty dinner we had. Entree choices are good for both carnivores and vegetarians. The tables are very nicely appointed, and the decor charming. We certainly would go to this restaurant above nearby SPQR which is so noisy you cannot have a conversation with your table partner unless you shout.

Most dishes were just okay, the risotto with truffle emulsion, the duck liver pate, and the pamplemousse cocktail were the best dishes/cocktail. Our server was nice, but in retrospect, we would not go back.
review_title: Most dishes were just okay, the risotto ...

review:
Good food and very friendly service. 
Loved French onion soup.....
Highly recommended of you are looking for fun eveving with freinds

We returned to Garcon after a long gap since our last visit. We were very pleased with our experience. If not for Open Table, we probably would not have gotten a table on such short notice. The menu was very extensive, and we had no trouble finding good things to eat.
Everything that we ordered was well prepared and delicious: Duck Liver Pate, Crab Salad, Sweetbreads and Petrale Sole. I was impressed with the presentation of the Duck Liver Plate with cheeries, pistachio and white wine gelee. However, the Cherry Beer Malt and Cherry Pie,
was unbelievably unique and delicious. We will return soon
Loved the food overall! Great daily specials with a unique approach.
Arthur rocks the taste sensations with fennel and lemongrass. Don't miss the mussels and chocolate fondant. Please open one in Nevada!

I had the sweetbreads appetizer, hanger steak (rare) and cauliflower. Sweetbreads were very good (but I've had better); steak and vegetable were outstanding. I dined alone in the back room, which was very quiet. Passing through the main room (which includes the bar), tables appeared uncomfortably close. Service was outstanding but not bothersome, with several staff checking with me, including the chef. I will return and I recommend Garcon highly!

This is a classic French restaurant in the heart of the mission. Excellent food, great service, noisy in avoid way and plenty of on street parking. Reasonably priced. If you are looking for a great restaurant you have found it.
review_title: Classic French in the heart of the

review: If you want to feel you are in Paris without the attitude, Garcon is the place to dine.
review_title: If you want to feel you are

review: Everything went well except the fact that we were sitting by an HVAC duct in the restaurant and there was the smell of marijuana coming out of those vents. Other than that, it was a pleasant experience.
Quick trip to Paris....... very enjoyable ......no jet lag
Rushed service. Expensive yet mediocre food. Eat appetizers at the bar for some good schmoozing, but not a place for dinner at $80 each.

Food was excellent albeit my entree was small. The hostess, who also took our desert order was rude (not patient nor helpful).All others who waited on use were just fine. This was my first visit. I will go back.
As always, delicious food and great cocktails. Very personal service. We're so glad to have such a lovely restaurant in our neighborhood.
All in all a very satisfactory experience. Manager and waiters were attentive despite a full house on a Tuesday evening. Food was recognizably French. Will defintely return.
review_title: All in all a very satisfactory

review: It shouldn't take 40 minutes to receive a dessert. The check came out with one price then they gave us another one that was even more expensive than the first.
I love this place. The food is wonderful, the service professional, the prices reasonable, and, there's a bar.
review_title: I love this place. The food

review: Had a wonderful Friday night dinner with 2 friends at Garcon. Great cocktails, great food, and good service. Dining experience was superb and the bistro vibe is energetic --- made for the perfect Friday night.
We've dined at Garcon before and love it and was not disappointed the 2nd time around. The food was delicious and for a good price. Staff was fantastic too.
Great everything, you can,t go wrong, we will go back for sure, cannot beat the steak and fries...

It was a great meal! The prix fixe dinner is a real bargain. The Tuesday night free corkage was also a draw for us. The potato leek truffle soup was outstanding. The desserts were also memorable - creme brulee, chocolate ganache and cherry root beer float! My only criticism is that some of the food arrived close to room temperature, but the dishes, such as the pappardelle pasta and steak frites, still tasted great. The service was pleasant and efficient. If babysitters were easier for us to find, we would return regularly!
review_title: It was a great meal! The prix

review: Excellent; Chef Andrew canvassed each table. Always a good experience.
Food was great, intimate dining, quiet enough to talk!

Fabulous restaurant with really great French food. Ambiance is romantic and inviting. Very friendly staff and great place if you want to practice your French :) Valentine's menu had a great selection featuring tasty food especially the duck confit and the braised lamb shank, wine pairing option was also very good and overall price is affordable for the great quality you get. The wine selection is also quite extensive and excellent. We didn't feel rushed even on Valentine's day. It was our second time eating there and we know we found our favorite French restaurant. It was also a pleasure to be remembered by the owner. A definite "Must Try" for all food fanatics.

I found this restaurant on Yelp and wasn't disappointed. The food was exceptional--especially the French onion soup gratinee, the Coq au Vin, and the warm apple tart. My only "complaint" would be the over-attentive, ever-present waitstaff. Normally, this wouldn't have bothered us, but we were celebrating our anniversary and would have preferred slightly less attention on this particular occasion. We plan to return, however, and would definitely recommend this little gem to others.
happy we gave it a try - a very nice french bistro, great cocktails - ia had the Garcon 75 cocktail, yum!
review_title: happy we gave it a try - a

review: What was suppose to be a Bastille Day Celebration turned into a horrific endurance test. The food was bland. This is one of the worst experiences I've had at a restaurant in SF.
review_title: What was suppose to be a Bastille

review: Apps were very good. We had the goat cheese w/beets and the mussels. Mains were only okay: monkfish and coq au vin.
review_title: Apps were very good. We had

review: My New Year's Eve plans fell through at the last minute, I checked open table and there happened to be one reservation left for Garcon, so I took it (and I am glad that I did). I walked into a warm, well lit (I hate glaring, bright lighting) room filled with amazing music and laughter. From the host, to the bartender, to our server, the staff was fantastic and the food was even better! This is a great spot for a date, a special occasion, or just grab a drink and hang out- or even eat at the bar. I learned that the live music they had for New Year's Eve was a special thing, but I hope that they make this trio a regular act- they were fantastic! If you're in the neighborhood, this is definitely a place to check out!
review_title: My New Year's Eve plans fell

review: This understated restaurant does it all...great service, first class food and wine list, and that touch of Paris we all need at times.

We were quite disappointed. This is a restaurant we used to go to for their traditional French bistro food, but they have changed their menu and moved away from true bistro cuisine. The people were not as friendly or helpful as at our previous visits. We will not be returning.

My wife and I walked by the place a couple times.  It is a very small corner spot next to a nightclub.  The windows are marked with graffiti, and the walls are covered with stapled postcards.  However, the tables are clean and set nicely.  Service was great, and the food was terrific.

We got there early in order to see a show later, and we were among the first there.  By the time we left, the place was packed and noisy.  They must be doing something right.

Fried chicken and hambergers are excellent and always on the menu. Other entries are just as good, but regularly change. The overall style is American with touches of southern and dollops of comfort food. E.g., had the grits and shrimp a while back which was wonderful and the mac and cheese is always amazing. Salads are good to for lunch or with dinner. Desserts are probably good as they are made at Pinky's Bakery, an affiliate located next door. Lastly, the wine selection is reasonable and eclectic. They also carry my favorite beer: Jamaica Red Ale by Mad River Brewing.

We started with a delicious wedge salad that had pickled squash and carrots. Veggie special was great--unusual combination of quinoa and stone fruit was delicious. My husband's burger was perfectly done; it's difficult to get an actual medium rare burger these days. The service was impeccable. The menu may be short but it seems that they make sure each item is executed well. We'll be back to try the fried chicken and Mac n' cheese!
review_title: Short but amazing and creative menu

review:
5th time here, and will still keep coming back. The food is really good. They just made some menu changes, adding roast beef and potato's. The fried chicken is the very best you will find in SF and the burger outstanding. Great friendly service and the desserts are a
must.

Citizens Band is always fantastic. I love how they switch up the menu items so you can try something new and innovative on every visit. Thank goodness they keep the Mac & Cheese, though. I don't know what I would do if they ever removed it. If you think you're over Mac & Cheese at this point, did I mention they serve it topped with onion rings. It's to die for! Don't let the casual environment fool you. The food is over the top good for how casual and reasonably priced the place is. Everyone is very friendly, as well. It's always a treat to eat there.

This may be a good place if you only have a vague notion of what Moroccan food is like and you want a bit of fun for a group as there is a cute Arabian decor and belly dancing during dinner. For dinner they have 2 set menus to choose from, where you pick your entree and the rest (soup, starters, bread, dessert, etc) is standard for everyone. Although the food was decent, I was disappointed with the lack of authenticity, and the flavors were way too tame for Moroccan food. The starters (mezze style) tasted nice (they were probably the closest to what I expect in terms of seasoning) and the chicken bastela (stuffed filo pastry) was perfectly crispy but unfortunately lacked seasoning. For main I had the chicken with prunes. It was not bad but seriously lacked flavor and came on its own on a sad white plate whereas I expected it to be served in a tajine with some couscous or at least some garnish. I would gladly have just eaten the prunes stew which tasted good but unfortunately there was only a tiny quantity accompanying the chicken (which by the way is 2 thighs so served on the bone, good to know if you don't like anything that's not boneless). My boyfriend had the chicken and lamb kobab which was ok but again was sad looking on a white plate with a tiny serving of couscous (this is Moroccan food, couscous need to be served in mounds!) and a few veggies, nothing to remember. The service was friendly but because everyone in the room gets the same dishes except for the entrees, they forgot a couple times which step we were at ("have you had your soup already?" - Yes we have. "Have you had your bastela already?" - No we haven't, etc), not a big deal but not super pro. 

In one word, if you're looking for authentic Moroccan food (especially if you've experienced it in Morocco or Europe before), this is not your place.
review_title: Ok but lacks authenticity and flavors

review: This is our new favorite restaurant! We originally came out for a girls night, and were shocked to see how our expectations were met over and over again throughout the night here. We were amazed by the food, they were so welcoming we felt like family, and we can't wait to go back soon.
first time here.. great service.. food was delicious. .plenty well served for price.... fun dining with friends.... great show!! .. definitely will return :-)

Went with another couple for Valentines Day. The food was really good and the staff was very nice. The real downer was that it was way way too bright in the dining room. What could have been a romantic and lavish ambiance with low lighting felt a little "circus-like" instead. I wouldn't be opposed to returning but wouldn't go out of my way either.

Everything was fine, service, food, ambience until the music blasted on for the inevitable belly dancer which ended the conversation with my friend. I would not have gone if I had known (even though she was good). 15 minutes would have been enough.

The food is good, the ambience fun - but the fixed-priced menu is crazy expensive for a Middle Eastern restaurant in the far Richmond. The belly dancing is a nice plus, but overall this dinner wasn't worth the $100 for 2.

The atmosphere at El Mansour was excellent. The food was delicious. All of it has so much flavor. The service was friendly, staff was very attentive. They did not rush us at all. In fact we were there a total of two hours, which allowed us to enjoy the belly dancing show!
A friend and I took our families to El Mansour over the holiday break - 9 of us total. Food and service was great and the belly dancer was very entertaining! Definitely a different dining experience!
review_title: A friend and I took our families

review: Our server , very pretty girl, was very helpful especially with choosing wines and attentive all night. Please send her our thanks.The dessert was good.

Aix has been a favorite of mine for several years now and I often send out of towners there as the restaurant always does well on so many levels.  On this last visit (mid Feb)  the appetizers seemed a bit stayed so I'm looking forward to the new garden veggie plates they will add to menu come spring.   To my headlines points: the service is never lacking, the food is always prepared carefully with the freshest ingredients, there's a great low alcohol inexpensive white Bordeaux on the menu which lets the group enjoy a few bottles and still remember the night, and the atmosphere is pleasant - not too quiet or loud. I think it's one of the best places in SF at this price point and was glad to see Bib Goumand thought so too.

This was the first dinner my wife and I had in San Francisco and may have been our favorite.  The neighborhood is far from downtown so it is not touristy at all.  It was a very low key and relaxed atmosphere with great food.  Can't wait to return to this place next time we're in town!
We made reservations based on the location and reviews and had a great meal with great service. We'll be back.

Although classified as French, there is nothing French about this restaurant. It should be called Italian.

The food however, was exceptionl. We were three for dinner and two of us had fish and I had lamb. Both dishes were excellent. We also had three appetizers, beet salad, cured salmon and egg plant, and two desserts; all very good.

I was very pleasantly surprised by this place. Needing a great place for a date night I found this place and was able to get a reservation for Wednesday for Saturday Night. Not only is the food very affordable, it was delicious. Started out with a butter lettuce salad with crispy fried goat cheese (melted in your mouth). Crispy fried calamari was amazing. The entrees however were the star of the show. I had a leg of lamb, wonderfully seasoned and cooked perfectly. My friend had seared ahi tuna, that was the best tuna I have ever had. The service was attentive and friendly, and more than happy to accommodate requests. I can't recommend this place enough, perfect for a date night, or just a great dinner with friends.

This was our first time at Bistro Aix, but it certainly won't be our last! The food was amazing! All three of us ordered something different and we were all delighted. The service was perfect - just enough and not too much. We were on our way to a presentation at the Palace of Fine Arts and this was a very convenient location to park once and have a leisurely stroll after dinner to the Palace. We're looking forward to our next meal at Bistro Aix.
review_title: This was our first time at

review: Fresh ingredients,dishes prepared with care, varied menu, great wine list - and always leave room for dessert. We've not been there when there is not a line waiting for a table, so we always make sure we make a reservation. Even when all tables were full, we've never felt rushed. Whether it's chicken, fish, pasta or the wonderfully prepared lamb, any choice is sure to be the right one. Let's face it, we all have friends with questionable palates, but here even picky eaters have ample selections from which to choose. We return again and again.
review_title: A Star in the Marina District

review: Bistro is hands down my very favorite neighborhood restaurant in the world. From the interesting and wonderful people you'll meet at the bar having dinner to the remarkable staff and food, Bistro will capture your heart. The food is consistently delicious, fresh and seasonal ~ changing just enough to keep it interesting for weekly diners but not too much that you never see your favorites again. I think their hamburger is the best burger I've ever had! The wines are reasonably priced and in the 15+ years I've been dining here, I have never once been disappointed. The recent remodel freshened up the decor and I love the rustic chic vibe! Enjoy!
Very pleasant, though I wouldn't have put it (as Michael Bauer did) on the Top 100 SF restaurants, for though the food was good, it was not shockingly good, nor unusual in any particular way.

I love this place. My girlfriend and I used to frequent La Terrasse, and after a menu change, and now no longer open for dinner we were looking for a new local French restaurant that always delivers. This is the place. The flat bread pizzas are the best. The menu is right on and every dish, including the bread with olive oil they place on your table when you first arrive, all have an abundance of flavor, yet are very simple. My favorites are the steak frites, and don't miss ordering a side of brussel sprouts! Although the wines by the glass list is small, each one I've ordered is really good and there is at least two options for each dish you might order.

Finally the tarte tatin is just amazing. Order with a glass of Vin Santo!
The Ahi dish is extraordinary. Extremely thoughtful service. Will come again and again.

Attentive, friendly, knowledgeable service from the moment one enters through the selection of dinner, the pairing of wine, and the inevitable questions about food preparation. Food is clearly sourced from high quality producers and prepared simply and masterfully. Although busy, the noise level was modest. We've long wanted to visit Aix - and now consider it a 'must visit' dining experience. Special mention of the extensive and well selected wine list. And while all restaurant wine lists are pricey, the list at Aix seems reasonable in comparison to many.

Parking is difficult and I called to ask for advice but wasn't told any. (They could've mentioned the garage a block away we didn't know about).The soup and salads were delicious. Entrees mostly very good. Our waiter seemed distracted.Took a long time between salads and entree. Coffee served when dessert was 3/4 finished.
Good food, pleasant outdoor eating. Probably would have been too loud inside. Good service and knowledgeable wait staff.

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: We arrived a bit earlier than our reservation was booked, but were still seated promptly. The wait staff were very attentive and the food was excellent. Not to mention, there was a lot of it. I don't think we were the first people to get the chicken couscous to go and skip straight to desert.

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: We come here every year when we are in Vegas for a convention and it never lets us down. Great food and generous portions. Fabulous atmosphere with talented and friendly belly dancers. Plus, the best service we get anywhere in Vegas.

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: My colleague and I enjoyed our experience. Only a fixed menu is offered but it's good, including shrimp, beef and chicken plates, each nicely prepared. Service was good and the only gripe was a weak wine list and the wine served too warm, requiring a nice bucket to be made drinkable. We'd gladly return knowing a beer would have gone well with our food. Dessert was kinda a Moroccan tiramisu concoction - good.

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: Lots of great food and great entertainment. The servers are friendly and you are treated as though you are the only people in the restaurant. The atmosphere is very unique. It is a must to dine at Marrakech whether a visitor to Las Vegas or this is home.

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review:
I was very impressed as soon as I entered
the restaurant, the atmosphere made you feel like you
were actually in Morocco. The service is friendle and quick,
you are not rushed and the live entertainment,(belly dancers) a really liven the place up.

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: We had an excellent experience! The waiter was so helpful and quickly asked if we had food allergies. I do and they modified the dinner for me. The drinks were great. We both enjoyed the bellydancing! It was super fun and beautiful to watch! She even encouraged us to dance and take pictures:) we are coming back when we come to vegas again!

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: Had a wonderful time. Thank you!! Everything was perfect and that is very hard to come by.

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: Their 6 meal course was amazing and the portions were very reasonable for two. Enjoyed the ambiance. Really did feel like a tent setting. The only thing I did expect more of was to see more than one belly dancer. I thought it would be various dancers putting on a great dance but only one.

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: Everything about this place was amazing. From the food to the belly dancers, they made our senior prom unforgettable.

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review:
My partner and I love marrakech we go tthere every year for her bday....great service and def worth the money for as much food as u
Get the belly dancers get you going and get the whole crowd involved u will not be disspaointed
review_title: My partner and I love marrakech

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: The food was great and we had a great time overall. However. The service started out strong, but dropped the ball towards the end. We sat with empty glasses for 35 minutes while trying to order more drinks. It was my husbands birthday. We weren't expecting anything, but AFTER we ate our desert and were waiting for the check, a server came by and stuck a candle in the couple bites we didn't finish. Then his lighter wouldn't work so he ran back and forth trying to get the candle lit. We were already done eating when this occurred. Like I said, we were waiting for the check. We then had to wait an additional 45minutes for someone to come by. They also forgot the included mint tea. The service should have stayed as strong as it started
review_title: The food was great and we

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: I loved the energetic ambiance in this place. The food was great and the dancers were just wonderful. I would definetly come back again.

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: Excellent food and the dancer was great, service is also excellent

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: This place was excellent! For $40 you get a six course meal with amazing foods that you mostly eat with your hands! Its definitely quite and experience and something everyone should do a least once in their life. Such a great atmosphere and the belly dancers were amazing. Remember to bring some tip money for them and they'll even let you dance with them if you want! The kids in the audience were even getting into the act and having fun too. The manager and servers here were extremely friendly and its a top notch place to go! I would highly recommend coming.

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: We had a great cultural experience and a lot of fun!
review_title: We had a great cultural experience

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: Amazing food, belly dancers and a genie bottle experience...Oh My!!! Absolutely adore this place and have literally treated everyone of my friends for their birthdays. I truly love the food but, it would be nice if they switched it up every now and then. The hummus and steak skewers are my favorite part of this meal and the scenery makes for a romantic night out.

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: This is a unique dining experience. Good food and good service. Reservations required.
review_title: This is a unique dining experience.

address: 3900 Paradise Road, Suite YLas Vegas, NV  89169
review: Amazing! Don't go there unless you are hungry though!!! 6 courses and they're fairly large! Aradia (bellydancer) is amazing and the staff are friendly.

The best Northern Italian cuisine covering the regions of Piedmont and Lombardy.  The wine list is excellent.  The food is to die for and the service is perfect.  The ambience is welcoming and comfortable.  I highly recommend Cotogna.  Chef and owner Michael Tusk has yet again achieved the culinary gold standard.

Sunday night supper was fantastic.  The chestnut soup was delicious; the pasta was melt-in-your-mouth awesome; the beef was perfectly cooked and seasoned; and the cheese plate was quite tasty.  I would go back in a heartbeat!

I took clients to Cotogna on a Tuesday night.  We had Open Table reservations for five people at 7:45 pm but didn't get seated until 8:35 pm.  The hostess was nice and bought us an appetizer but there isn't much space at the restaurant to mingle with five people (it is fairly small with one room, a small bar, and some sidewalk tables).  The place was obviously full with great energy but that same energy created a very loud dining environment.  In the end, the food, including the pasta and pizza was very good and my clients had a nice time.  I wish the wine list was more inviting - too many very high priced California wines.  We have so much great wine in California, a restaurant of this type should be offering more lower priced wines.

Took a friend for her 30th birthday for lunch.  I felt the menu was small.  We shared a pizza (there were 2 choices), and a pasta dish.  Again, good but not great.  But, I am a critical in the Italian food area.

Great salad small main courses.
Had to ask for Bread and for the wine to be cooled .
Away went the wine.Took too long to be back

A good balance between getting as many customers into a room and yet not feel over crowded. The menu has a good variety of items to choose from and the wine list was quite amazing. Service was great, food was great, place is great.
Cool room, really good cocktails and nicely done food. The menu is somewhat limited but the two pastas we tried were quite good.

Like any resturant, you can easily run up a bill, but with reasonable ordering and a extensive wine list priced at $40 you can enjoy a fabulous dinner. We did go over the top with the $28 pork chop but it was well worth every bite. We had 2 pastas, a pizza plus the pork chop ( we planned on leftovers) and every dish was exceptional presented with perfect service

I've had a couple of visits to Cotogna and the pasta dishes are special.
Today's standout dish was the "Agnolotti dal plin"-- a lovely tiny stuffed pasta with chicken and veal served with a very light sauce and top drawer grated parm. So savory! We enjoyed the fig tart for dessert.

They don't offer bread automatically-- you have to request it, which is a little odd. Maybe it's for the low-carb crowd...

We were there for brunch and were very impressed with both the food and the staff. They were welcoming, efficient and even provided my wife with a taste of a dish that she saw on another table. The pasta dish with crab was outstanding. We're returning four days after our initial visit.
Very good restaurant. Excellent quality ingredients. I will go back often.
Delicious meal and wonderful ambiance! Can't wait to go again.

took a great friend here for lunch, it was FABULOUS! bread is so good - you have to ask for it! food is super fresh. you have to get pasta! Chestnut tagliatelle with porcini mushroom was amazing. Tortelly di zucca delicious and delicate. rapini with hot pepper & lemon was really good and fresh. very attentive wait staff, and a really beautiful space. would bring good friends who love great food here.

This is my favorite restaurant. Everything I have ever eaten here is just perfect. Great combinations, subtle tastes, and very fair prices. The staff are friendly and knowledgable about what they are serving. All around a very pleasant meal.

We started our 'Weekend in the City' with a late lunch; we knew of Quince, it's sophisticated sister next door, and were delighted by the ambience, service, food and wine. Really outstanding dishes, from pork belly to figs, pasta to squash blossom pizza, cherry & pistachio trifle to espresso! It's a new favorite...we will most definitely return!

We had outstandingly fresh food and attentive service. The chilled avocado and little gem lettuce soup, rainbow carrots, fried chicken and flaky biscuits, cherry pancakes and the chocolate pudding were all prepared and presented with great care and taste. This is a destination restaurant. Definitely request the bread.

Our meals were cooked to perfection and made with love. The crew at Cotogna is raising the bar in a city that already has extremely highly standards for palatable savory food.

Thanks for being fresh and creative.
review_title: Our meals were cooked to perfection

review: We had a 1:45 lunch date and we were seated promptly. Halfway thru our wonderful meal a couple of friends from the neighborhood saw us and came in to join us. The staff was so kind to fix them up and make us all feel so comfortable. ( mind you it was late in the afternoon). At no time did we feel rushed , And believe me, 4 women can talk a lot over a great meal and some red wine.
review_title: We had a 1:45 lunch date and

review: If you want to talk, good luck. After trying the food, who would want to talk anyways. Food and falovors top notch... If only the service matched the supreme quality of the food.
review_title: If you want to talk, good

review: This is a great place. So, I brought a very distinguised French foodie here last Saturday. We both ordered the fish. But when we cut into it ... which was very hard to do ... it was clear it had not been hardly cooked. It was almost frozen hard on the inside. Though they said they don't serve frozen fish, it was hard and cold inside. But what surprised me was their reaction. Sure, they fixed the issue. But nobody came over to apologize or offer us free dessert or take care of the situation. The maitre d' and the waiter checked in on us but that was it. I wonder if the B or C team runs the place for Saturday lunch. It was not the type of service response I would expect from Quince or Cotogna. I'm still a bit perplexed.
review_title: This is a great place. So,

review: Their sourcing and consequently their food is top-tier. Love the place.

Reception at front very cold and unwelcoming. Our table wasn't ready so we walked over to sister restaurant Quince, next door - what a poor front of house staff which didn't offer look at the menu or a seat for a cocktail at the EMPTY bar. Further with a less than half filled restaurant you would think they would welcome a few paying bodies!
Cotogna- Food not distinguished or memorable, overly oily, some dishes barely edible, heirloom tomatos with tuna crudo had no character or visual appeal. We will not return and can't understand all the hype. There are far better choices in our foodie city.

The $24 prixe fixe menu simply cannot be beaten. The $40 wine menu is a brilliant idea, but sadly we were disappointed by our selection. The ambiance was nice and not-intrusive, but not particularly notable.

Way overrated for what you get. We had snap peas with burrata and the peas had not been strung! Inexcusable for a restaurant that pretends to be more than it is. Our server told us the asparagus were cold. They were not. They were served hot. All in all, we left scratching our heads and muttering (This is one of the up and coming restaurants in SFO? From the chef of Quince?) There are many better places to eat in San Francisco.
Came away in awe of the food (scrumptious) and the excellent advice/service provided by our waitpreson. "Wow!!!!!"
review_title: Came away in awe of the food

review:
Nice, casual atmosphere. Our server was attentive and extremely helpful with the menu.
Every course was delicious. Shared several dishes--each one delicious...warm riccota and wild mushroom crostini, little gem salad, agnolotti stuffed with 3 braised meat, the roast pork, and a side of raosted sunchokes with cippolini onions. Every bite delicious.

Food was good. Service was excellent. Neighborhood charming.

Made a reservation for six, weeks before. Restaurant contacted me three times by email, and called to confirm asking for a return call. Given all its angst in our showing up, I was surprised that to see that they weren't ready for us, and we had to wait some 20 minutes.
Fantastic brunch. And some of the best bloody mary's I've ever had.

address: 1130 Market Street, 10 UN Plaza, 6th FloorSan Francisco, CA  94102
review: We love the idea of up and coming student chefs preparing and serving creative and delicious food. Great place to try out different dishes at a very reasonable price.  Reservations are not required but it is a small place open on Thursday and Fridays. I would recommend reservations. Food and service was very good and seating was comfortable. Look forward to going again. Favorite dishes was Duck confit croquette for appetizer ( although butternut squash was delicious-as was the salad), Salmon for main dish and pumpkin souffle for dessert.
review_title: Yummy Gourmet Food at a Reasonable Price

address: 1130 Market Street, 10 UN Plaza, 6th FloorSan Francisco, CA  94102
review: In the five days we spent in San Fran this was by far the best and cheapest meal we had. Other restaurants we ate at, even those recommended on Trip Adviser, were disappointing. We would certainly recommend this little training restaurant to anyone staying in or near Market Street.

address: 1130 Market Street, 10 UN Plaza, 6th FloorSan Francisco, CA  94102
review: Excellent value, fun and friendly staff, bright and cheery venue. There were 10 of us, and everyone was very happy with their selections. Very professional, without being somber and serious. We had a great time.
